We ordered the French toast scrambler as well as the shrimp omelette.  The chocolate crumble was amazing and was given to asked for free after we told them it was our anniversary.

So overall prices are reasonable, food is worth the wait, but definitely expect a wait.
author: Jon C.

description: This is probably my favorite place for breakfast. The crazy long lines is like that all the time. Everything on the menu is awesome. Just make sure you come on an empty stomach because portions are huge. Bring a jacket and be prepared to wait outside in the cold.
author: Thien T.

description: Great small breakfast spot! Quality ingredients, friendly service and yummy food. Be prepared to wait...the restaurant fits about 32 customers. We arrived at 8am and waited an hour to be seated. Must have is the monte Cristo! FYI- they do not accept credit cards; only cash or debit.
author: Choe N.

description:
One of my favorite brunch spots in the city! I used to live close by so I would be able to roll out of bed early and stop by in line. Once I even came on a weekday before work! 

They have really delicious home made jams here that you can spread on your toast on the side. I usually get some type of omelet or egg scramble and also get a pastry to go as well. Since you order before you sit you have plenty of time to look at all the delicious pastries. 

I recommend coming on a rainy day as the line is significantly shorter. Also I believe the line starts around 7AM on weekends. The restaurant is fairly small and can probably only fit about 20-30 guests total.
author: Jeanette S.

description:
Stood in line for a hour and decided to order take away so we wouldn't miss our ferry.  Then said they don't do takeaway on holidays.  It was July 4th ‍‍‍‍
Walked away empty handed.
author: Kelly W.

description:
I can see how this place has such great reviews! Came on a Saturday maybe around 12:40/1 pm surprisingly the line wasn't too long and we got seated within the hour! I asked what was the most popular item and the owner said it was the monte cristo. He said that his brother makes this special jam that makes the whole dish so unique. He basically told me without the jam it would just be a regular grilled cheese ham sandwich and a waste so you HAVE TO dip the sandwich in the jam to get the whole experience of the dish. With him telling me all this  I automatically chose the monte Cristo to order! 

It was my friends birthday so the whole staff actually sang happy birthday to her. It was so cute and sweet. The guy at the register asked my friend if she got easily embarrassed because she was about to be. After the song they also said they would give her a free mimosa on the house. We got seated near the window on a spacious table. They btw don't accept credit cards just debit and cash!!! The food came promotly my friend also ordered the north beach eggs Benedict that we shared. 

For the food: Yes. Get the monte cristo. The jam like the owner said makes the whole dish!!!!! It was so good!! I'm in love with sweet and savory dishes and this dish hit that spot quite perfectly. I would eat the jam everyday if I could! I honestly would want to know the secret specialness that makes this jam because it's perfect. The sandwich seems like it's deep fried/ French toast and the inside is the meat and cheese. All these flavors together with the jam made the dish one of my favorite I would say for brunch! For my friends north beach eggs Benedict it was really delicious as well. One of my favorite eggs Benedict not being too salty and not too messy. 

For parking: this place is near coit tower so just be prepared to park on hills! 

Overall: great customer service and food! Would recommend this place just be prepared to wait!
author: Leslie F.

description: Very good food! We got there early and only waited for about 45 minutes. We were a party of five and there were maybe around 20 people ahead of us. Was worth the wait, but like I said get there early! Great service, very friendly owners as well. Family owned business.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: The hype is real. Had breakfast here with the hubby on our last morning in SFO. It was recommended to us by our Uber driver the night before saying that it always has a line out the door. True enough, at 8:45am on a Tuesday morning, wait time was around 30-40mins. I ordered the Monte Cristo sandwich while my husband ordered the Northwest omelette. I absolutely loved my sandwich! Didn't get the chance to try the omelette as he finished it quickly. Our drinks were the fresh lemonade for me -- it was okay and Mama's smoothie for him -- he enjoyed it, tried it but it was too fruity and heavy for me in the morning. Will try to come back when we're in SFO again.
author: Angelica A.

description:
Mama's on Washington Square ALWAYS has a line. Even on a weekday. Even if you arrive at 7am when they don't even open until 8am. It's that serious folks because when you're in the city of San Francisco, you treat breakfast as a competitive sport and must get up at aggressive hours in  to snatch a coveted place in line. 

Truthfully I've only paid Mama's a visit once in my lifetime but waiting in line once was enough to deter me from coming again despite my decent experience with the food.

I had come to Mama's because this place is a famous North Beach institution and any place that's cash only must be good, right? 

Ordered the classic Benedict which comes with house potatoes. To be honest, I didn't quite grasp what all the commotion was about when I laid my palate on this dish. It was tasty don't get me wrong but it didn't light my world on fire. 

If you order a side of fruit don't be alarmed. For around $5 a pop the portions are tiny! The OJ here is also quite tasty but pricier than other spots I've paid.

I will say the one outstanding thing I had here was their jams! Not sure what kind of fruit they used but the jam is here is to die for and I would totally come back just to buy the jam because it's my jam!

Note: the restaurant itself is quite small with a limited amount of seating. I opted for a view near the windows so I can people watch people behind the kitchen and also waiting in line. You order first and then sit down. There's usually staff manning the queue.
author: Connie M.

description:
Worth the hype? Not in my opinion. 
The food is still great! Especially the huge variety of brioche buns. My friends and I tried out the infamous Our Famous Monte Cristo, Bay Shrimp Benedict, Crab Cake Benedict, Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast and Blueberry Lemon French Toast. Everything was good and the service was great, but it just did not exceed our expectation. 

The line wasn't super long when we arrived at around 1pm on a Sunday, but it still took almost an hour. Surely waiting in line for brunch on a Sunday is a given, but personally I think there are other brunch locations that are just as good with a much shorter wait.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Not going to lie, the wait is freaking LONG!!  But here are my thought on the food 
Carrot cake: moist, the cream cheese topping it was light and not to sweet
Original Eggs Benedict: good sauce, eggs well pouched, and Canadian bacon was thicker than what you usually have! 
Monte Cristo:  If you wants a lil savory n sweet get this!  Basically you have French toast, and on the inside you have the delicious ham and roast turkey slices, then two different cheeses!  Then there the sweet (but not to sweet) raspberry jam!  This jam doesn't have the tart taste but nor does it that over sweetness that some jams have to hide the tartness.  And put together with the Monte Cristo you get a fantastic blend of savory n sweet, when you don't know which way to go for breakfast!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Waited an hour and a half in line to just try this place and it was well worth it!! I got their famous Monte Cristo and it's to die for!!! I dnt even like ham but this sandwich was amazing! The homemade jam is out of this world.  I wish they would sell it at their store. Would just fly to SF to have breakfast at Mama's on Washington Square!!
author: Anul Z.

description: Sunday morning, we got in line about 7:40, they open 8am. There was already a large line outside and we ended up waiting 1.5 hours to get in. 1.5 hours that was well worth it. My fiancé and I decided to split their famous monte Christo and a northern island omelet, with a side of one orange and cranberry French toast. Their homemade jam was absolutely fabulous, it was raspberry and we literally dipped everything in it. I don't even like omelettes but this one was so light, fluffy, and well stuffed with panchetta, mushrooms, and cheese. The monte christo was like a fried grilled cheese but lighter. Super super super tasty. We didn't really care for the French toast though.  Service was great and I'm really glad we decided to wait in this line.
author: Karolina T.

description: I am so sorry to have written there are no prices displayed on the menu. I see now they are easily seen. I am a longtime resident of S.F. I must admit I haven't been for a long time. I remember the food being very good. Please accept my apology.
author: Judith Z.

description:
Bookmarked for a while! This was worth the 1.5 hour wait on a Sunday!

Ordered:
- Dungeness Crab Benedict with fresh baby spinach $27.95
- Monte Cristo $13.95
- Orange Juice $4.95 L
- Mama's Smoothie $6.75

Tina's Travels and Tabloid
- So let me tell you about my adventure, I ran to the BofA ATM since the window says "No credit cards," technically, they aren't lying, but apparently when we got to the front of the line. We come to find that they take debit cards. Boo, but yay for my morning 0.60 miles work out. ;) On another board, it did state debit cards. Oh well. 
- Early AM, one of the workers were passing out water since it got hot real quick! Pretty considerate to care for us! Hahah. 
- How does this work? So they open 8AM and close at 3PM. Wait in line, old fashioned way. 
- You get to the front is when the gentleman asks how many? You tell him how many people are in your party then you proceed to another line next to the front of kitchen. 
- The lady at the register was really nice - she's in charge of taking your order, charging you, and relaying the message to either the staff/waitress of how many people you have or telling you where to sit.
- One gender neutral restroom in the back through the washing station down the stairs, super tiny one single stall. 
- The wait wasn't too long for our food, but when it came. All eyes on the monte cristo and benedict! 
- One taste of the Dungeness crab, it melts in your mouth with the buttery taste. 
- I cannot say that they aren't popular with the monte cristo, but that dish is well made and I can see why! I was tempted to order a French toast order as well. Glad I didn't since this is like a fusion of i with the delicious roasted turkey breast, honey baked ham, apples (which I couldn't taste), Havarti and cheddar cheese served with homemade jam! The jam with the toast was perfecto! Not overselling here, but this made me full and I only had two pieces along with one egg benedict that I shared. 
- Can I get another order though?
author: Tina N.

description:
I've been here a couple times and the wait is ALWAYS long. HOWEVER, the food is sooo bomb. Omelette, sandwiches, french toast, pancakes....orange juice!! Everything is a must try here. I also really like looking at them make the food when you're in line. The display of the food is so aesthetically pleasing that I forget that I just waited for two hours for brunch. Haha! 

If you're visiting SF and you are only going to have brunch only once... this is where you should go. I know the wait is horrible, but the food is really good. Also, after eating you can walk around Washington Square park and North Beach to walk off the food.
author: Joyce S.

description: French toast. 7/10 Monte carlo sandwich:7/10. Omelet:7/10. The restaurant had a really nice atmosphere and a good location. The food was in general good but not especially good. The Monte Carlo sandwich, which was the recommended plate didnt meet my expectations
author: Maria O.

description: Arrived at 7:25 on a Friday morning and we were first in line! I was happy about that. I ordered the French Toast Sampler Platter and my Wife ordered the Monte Cristo. I enjoyed my Sampler. The bread was not thick but it was dense which is good cause it wouldn't flatten while cutting it with your fork. My wife and I enjoyed the Monte Cristo. I like how it's lightly battered. I've been to a few spots that had Monte Cristo's thickly battered. Service was really good. Ladies remembered if I wanted to order something else and they kept coming back to fill up our water. I would come back ONLY if there is no wait. Not sure if it's worth a 2 hour wait.
author: Maikell B.

description:
I was thoroughly enjoying my breakfast, despite the wait, until I noticed a poster celebrating Christopher Columbus staring down at me. As somebody who has native ancestry, I liken his image to other despots like Hitler. It's 2018, why do you risk offending your patrons with such an image? 

I won't be returning to Mama's ever again.
author: Frank S.

description: Great food nice atmosphere and a bit of a line to get in. The menu is very welcoming and the service is good
author: Ben W.

description: Worth the wait, even if we waited for 2 hours for a table.  Great service, the staffs were very nice and attentive.  One of my great experiences during my weekend getaway in SF.
author: Chat A.

description:
There is always a long, long wait outside of this brunch spot for good reason. It's one of best places (if not the best place for brunch) in the city (and Bay Area in general). No reservations. Either show up super early before opening to beat the crowd or really late right before closing. We started waiting for a table for 2 at 2pm today for brunch on a Saturday and had our food on our table at about 3pm. For comparison, I've showed up closer to prime brunch time before and have had to wait closer to two hours before. Be prepared for a wait. 

The brunch is unique and unparalleled quality. I also love that it's a family owned place (homemade jam, fresh picked berries and fruits from the farm). They even make fresh pancake batter every 30 minutes! 

As for food, you must try the Monte Cristo sandwich. This is the most popular item on the menu and they serve about 80 of these a day out of 260 or so total orders. I also love the French toast sampler. I think the ones that are included changes each time, but today I had the cinnamon, lemon berry, and the banana nut. The cinnamon was closest to the traditional French toast, while the lemon berry and banana nut were more like the thicker baked breads turned into French toast. Smoothies are great here. Mimosas are made with fresh squeezed orange juice. You just can't go wrong!
author: Sally C.

description:
Mama's! SO GOOD. The place is cute, their system of waiting outside before you are allowed in to order at the counter makes you anticipate the food just enough without getting hangry. 
There are so many choices; I had a hard time deciding! I ordered the huevos rancheros and a blueberry bakery treat. Both were delicious. Great presentation, great taste, portion- it was all so good. We sat near the door where the San Fran breeze blew in while we sipped our coffee. The waiters were all friendly. Loved it.
author: Ashley A.

description:
I've been to Mama's only twice.  If you're going to brave the line, you better be in a brunch and waiting mood.  

My husband and I moseyed on over at 10 am and waited for 2 hours, which is pretty standard for Mama's.  So do not go on a fully empty stomach because you will regret it, give up, and feel hangry.  But if you do survive the 2 hours of looking inside wistfully like the little match girl, you will feel quite accomplished just to place an order and settle down.

The French toast sampler and crab benedict were pretty good.  I highly recommend the peach bellini.  Not knowing when we'd be back (the stars have to align: mood for brunch and willingness to wait 2 hours), we took a slice of carrot cake to go.  The guy in charge of the line grinned very warmly, as if he approved: "You will not regret it, my friends."  

And we did not.  Surprisingly, the carrot cake was the best part the second time we went to Mamas.  You know they made it from scratch that morning.  The frosting was unreal -- even though the butter was real.  The sugar was real.  I'm sitting back right now, just thinking of that slice of cake...
author: Miran C.

description: I want to say the service is awesome and the atmosphere is so nice and the food is fantastic.  My brother and I have gone here last year when we came to San Francisco for breakfast and we came again this year again.  We are planning to go before we leave.  I highly recommend this place you do need to get there early or if you are not in a hurry then you will need to wait.  But it is worth the wait.
author: Roxanne S.

description:
Breakfast all day long, what more can I ask for? Portions are fairly generous, we got two dishes and split with the kids. Omelets are tender, and French toast was delicious. Topped it off with a Bellini, we left energized to climb the Nob Hill. 

Make sure to bring cash, as you order and pay at the cash register, but there will be some table service that you might want to leave a tip for. 

One star off for high price, location premium?
author: Katherine G.

description:
Getting to sit down and eat here was totally a journey...being from out of town, we weren't sure where to park. Confession: we first parked illegally at the gorgeous church next door but soon moved because of Catholic guilt. We ended up valet parking somewhere nearby. 

Mama's is a small restaurant and there is apparently a wait just about anytime you come. Honestly, waiting outside the restaurant for more than an hour in the sun while tired, hungry, and slightly hungover is not very fun. It was my first time here but my friends had been before and raved about it, so I kept my complaints to myself. Now, although there is a long wait, the family who owns the restaurant is super friendly and will come out and chat with the people in line, explain the menu, answer questions, etc. When you get inside, you can place your order but then, at least in our case, you may still have to wait for a table. Thankfully, the cashier (also a member of the family) chatted us up and helped pass the time. So... customer service is a huge plus! 

FINALLY, we got a table and relaxed to wait for our food. It came and it was AMAZING. I had an incredible French Toast that was lemony and sweet and perfectly cooked. It 99% made up for waiting. I was still thinking about that French Toast days later. 

I would LOVE to go back and hopefully will...I feel like it would be a good idea to bring along a packable chair (only half joking)!
author: Megan L.

description:
Their Monte Cristo is some next level shit! It was so damn good, I can't believe my SF native ass never tried this place. 

Service is definitely off the charts. Everyone who works there knows you've been waiting long and genuinely appreciates your business. They take time to explain their menu and make conversation. Great little brunch place to be if you ain't in a hurry and got time to wait. 

My friends and I came here around 12:20PM on a Saturday, and we managed to order about an hour later. So not awful, could be worst. 

Onto the food - highly recommend the Monte Cristo. I don't even know what a Monte Cristo is supposed to taste like but I can't imagine any other places making it as good as Mama's. We also ordered the Crab Cake Benedict and Cranberry Orange French Toast. I ain't a fan of fruits so the French Toast was a no go for me, though my fruit loving friends did seem to enjoy it. Very tart and every bite you take is bursting with orange hinted cranberries. The crab cake benedict had their egg perfectly poached. Got food porn written all over it and their hollandaise is yummmm. I would recommend as well though a bit pricey. 

Also please note they DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARD. Debit card okay. I think the couple who waited in front of us didn't realize until they got to the front. Yikes. 

Restroom is a bit tricky. Near the exit, through the kitchen and out the door. It's the large white box looking thing immediately to your left. When in use, you won't even notice its a door because it doesn't have a knob. 

Would love to go Mama's again though I think I'd wanna come right when it opens. No more 1 hour waits por favor.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
Oh my word... what to say about this place... everything is amazing! From the service to the food!!! 

The downfall is the wait to be seated which is normally a minimum of an hour but it is totally worth it! 

You must get the monte Cristo sandwich... It is mouth watering! The omelettes are good but I prefer their sandwiches. 

And you can't go and not try out their buttermilk pancakes... light, fluffy and so tasty! My new favorite brunch spot :)
author: Damain S.

description:
Get the Monte Cristo!  Enough said.  This is by far the best and most unique dish I've had.  Just be prepared to wait 45min+ in line on a regular weekend.  You may get better luck to get in if it's a rainy day.  Also bring enough cash on you as well.  This place is cash only or debit card if you order +$15, which you probably would since most dishes are around that price anyways.

The Monte Cristo's cheese, turkey and ham just melts in your mouth in between a french toast like bread.  The savory treat is balanced with a slightly sweet homemade jam that just melts in your mouth.  It's a really rich breakfast, so be prepared for some food coma afterwards.  I've tried to get the Mama's cristo, which is their variation, but they only make a limited amount.  The regular MOnte Cristo is one of their most popular dishes though. 

I've tried their crab and Blackstone (bacon) omelettes.  However they were just average.  Tastes good, but just average.  Maybe I'll have to come back and try their salmon (recommended by the cashier) and/or their lobster omelette as well.

Another thing I like about this place is surprisingly their special bloody mary.  It was super hearty.  I feel just drinking that made me full.  Their special mix is pretty spicy.  I would say spicier than many of the other restaurants I've tried.  You can't even taste the alcohol when your'e drinking it.  Though you'll definitely feel it afterwards.  

Overall, get the Monte Cristo and wash it down with some hearty bloody mary for a good start of the day!
author: Shirley C.

description: We visit Mamas every time we visit SF from Texas. This was the first time we made it in line for the first group entering the restaurant at opening which was a lot of fun! The food was delicious as always and we left stuffed and ready to conquer our last morning in the city. The crumb bun was as good as we remembered and all the food was cooked perfectly. Our only suggestion on omelettes with bacon is to cook the bacon well like you normally-it was a little under cooked in the omelette and we ended up picking it out. The OJ is the best anywhere and the service was excellent. Great job as always!  See you next time!
author: Nanci G.

description:
The food here is so good and it's worth to wait!
I went there alone on a Friday noon. First, I waited outside to get in. And after I got in, I had to wait in another line to order. And then be seated. Although there was much people there and before me, I still spent half an hour to get my brunch 
But there won't be anything else to say after I got mine! That was amazing! It's like franch toast with ham and egg inside. It teases so good so milky so cheesy. There are four pieces of them with some potato , fruit and a I am not sure what kind of jam. When I had it with the jam, it teases totally different. It is so fresh! That's really amazing!
But the only problem is I can't finish all four of them by myself. I was so full with three. I definitely will be there next time and with friends so that I can try more.
author: Yantong Z.

description: Came to SF from LA and my cousin really wanted to come and eat here (despite the long line that kept us waiting for over an hour). This place is one of the best breakfast restaurants I have ever been too!!! Everything is fresh!! Including the bread!!! (They bake their own bread here) absolutely outstanding !!! I need to find a place like this one back home. I had French toast and it was the best I ever had!!! I do wish the place was bigger .. the tables are small and they are placed very close to each other. It's very hard to walk between tables to reach your seat but of course it is easy to understand that this is in SanFrancisco and this place was opened as a family owned restaurant back in the 60s. Put it this way, you don't have breakfast at Mama's, you are simply missing out !
author: Claudia T.

description:
I came on a Friday morning and waited around an hour, but the food was worth the wait.

Food ordered:
-Famous Monte Cristo: 5/5
I am in love. Warm gooey cheese and sliced ham, hugged by thick slices of French toast. And with a side of Mama's potatoes, yum. 

The interior seating is sort of small but people are in and out quite quickly. Also, the servers are so friendly and nice! I'll be back.
author: Alice W.

description:
Love, love, love this place. Went here on a Saturday morning and waited 2hr 45mins in line. My friends warned me so I was prepared to wait. Not really lasted 1.5 hrs then took a break in a near by church even crashed a wedding... Focus

The aroma was amazing. I felt a little overwhelmed by the menu but I got a preview in the line. You have to order then you will be seated. I was worried bc of my indecisiveness that I would have to make the awkward journey to the front. Luckily my waiter said he could make modifications and add one. 

The food took a bit to come out but when it did it was amazing. The French toast is on my top 5 best of the best. Chicken apple sausage was amazing... Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection.

The restaurant is quite cozy and small but it has a family vibe. I would probably not go on a Saturday again but on a less busy day like Tuesday.
author: Shahira S.

description:
I came here for brunch about 2 years ago and it was worth the 2 hour wait. Two years later, and I still have fond memories of the food here. I came with a group of 5 friends on a weekend and we took turns standing in line. Since the wait is so long, half of us split off to go walk into Chinatown to shop and go to the bakeries there since it's right next door.

The actual restaurant itself is very small, which probably contributes to the long wait. You order when you walk up and then you're seated afterwards. I had to Norwegian benedict and it was delicious. My friends had the french toast, and it was also very good. You probably can't go wrong with anything you find on the menu. It's a long wait  for a reason but worth it. I highly recommend trying this place while in SF.
author: Latonia L.

description: My family and I arrived at around 8:15 am on Friday morning and only waited an hour for a table. The manager was out letting parties in and was very cordial and nice to talk to. Service was fast and food was incredible. Definitely a top 5 place to take the family for breakfast in the city.
author: Ben G.

description: This place was worth the hour and 20 minute wait to get in.  I didn't get the owners name that waited at the door welcoming guests but he was funny and delightful!  He made everyone feel welcome and talked to us about their menu.  Now the food was OUTSTANDING.  Fresh and yummy!  Our senses went wild when the food was delivered that we actually forgot to photograph our food!  LOL!  My family loves food porn so we love posting photos on social media.  I had a California omelet that was to die for and Oh the potatoes were fantastic.  French toast and pancakes will rock your senses!  We will definitely be back!
author: Buffy F.

description:
Fresh food 
Frsh juices
Comfortable 
Dirty bathroom
Cashier and waiter were really nice
Clean table and chair
author: Jisue C.

description: French toast heaven! Also loved the Mama Cristo Sandwich! We waited in line for around 90 minutes to claim one of the 35 +/- seats. Enjoyed visiting with the founder's son the last 10 minutes or so in our wait in line. Learned this restaurant has no walk in refrigerator, they have deliveries each morning and make everything fresh. They've been able to refine operations over the years and can time how they run out of product. We actually went back for more carrot cake and they were out ;'( We pacified ourselves with delicious coffee cake! :)
author: Sheila N.

description:
It is not often that I can give a 5 star review after waiting in line for an hour... but I am! Despite the long line, this place lived up to all expectations. The inside has a cute and cozy feeling, with bright colored decor that really makes you feel like you're in someone's Mama's house. I came here with my Mom during a quick trip to San Francisco and we were both hesitant at first, due to the long line, but once we got inside we were happy with our decision to wait it out. Staff didn't make us feel rushed like many other busy places often do.

I am not a frequent visitor of San Francisco, but if I was, I would be waking up early to get in that line at least once a month. That's how 
good the pancakes were!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Everything was perfect!
Delicious food, kind watiress and nice view! 
I want to re-visit there!
author: Hyun Jin K.

description: The best breakfast place in SF! There is always a line but it's worth it. You have so many types of French toast, eggs Benedict.... ok so it's not the place to have a boring egg white omelette but if you are in the mood to have a great filling breakfast, this is the place! Just standing in line as you see them make the food is a treat!
author: PM L.

description:
Expect like a 45- hour minute wait!! This place gets crowded

Got the Monte Cristo. It was nice because it wasn't super greasy. tasted so good especially since it came out warm. Nice gooey cheese and ham and every bite, with side of potatoes. The dish was so plentiful and the presentation was beautiful.

 Probably wouldn't come back because of the wait. And wasn't anything I'd go out of my way for.

Good experience though.
author: Kimberly T.

description:
Let me start off with this: I don't like breakfast or brunch.  With that said, Mama's gets 5 stars for tickling my taste buds!

If you don't like waiting in line for food, stay away.  But If you (like me) are curious if the food is worth the wait, then you best wait in this line!  I waited about a 1-1.5hrs but everything was amazing.

From the workers at Mama's who make you feel welcome and part of the family, to the quaint and adorable setup, to the food itself, Mama's is the place to be for breakfast/brunch.

(review written in October 2014)
author: Angela V.

description:
Booooo!!!! Hate hate the stingy bad attitude owner. The rest of the staff was ok and the cooks were great! 
The owner was just lousy! Food was ok but after waiting for over an hr in line it's not worth the wait and definitely not worth dealing with the horrible manager taking your order.
author: Lynnette V.

description:
This place was really really yummy, but honestly not the best I've ever had. I ordered the veg Benedict and it was good. The poached eggs were done well, but the sauce was kind of thin and the muffins got super mushy, to the point of no return. It wasn't the worst, it wasn't the best. The potatoes were alright, but I like mine crispy and these were just cooked. The hubby really liked his scrambled eggs and bacon.  We are very spoiled because we have Katy's Korner in our town and it's truly the best breakfast I've ever had. 

What I liked: fresh squeezed OJ and the pancake batter, it produced a really tasty cake! 

What I didn't like: the line outside that led to a line inside (I get it thou, many ppl in SF think this is the best so everyone wants to eat here). Also the bathroom was a little shady but at least there was a bathroom. 

Overall, it was a fun and tasty experience, but I don think I'll be back because I have something better closer to me. Also, note: they only accept CASH OR DEBIT.
author: Alex W.

description:
Best things in life are worth the wait- Mama's is no exception!!

I arrived a little after 9 and waited almost 2 hours but I have no regrets. Sure-I was skeptical like you all- however once I saw the chefs cooking fresh ingredients, sat alongside award lined walls that had family, and celebrity photos, and tried the food, I knew why it was a truly cherished spot. 

The coffee came in hot, and the carrot cake I ordered to-go was quickly eaten while waiting on my food. I couldn't wait to try something, and also I was starving - after all we waited a couple hours and it was pushing lunch time! The cream cheese icing was so thick and creamy -and there were bits of carrot and spice goodness inside! I saw two other couples who sat after us who either copied us with carrot cake dessert prior to their meal or thought the same thing we did!! It's that good guys!! 

We tried the French Toast Sampler and The Californian Omelette. 
The French Toast was good- super rich- I couldn't finish it all.
The Californian Omelette was great too.

I really loved the house made raspberry jam and bread- it was so sweet and tangy and fresh- unlike anything back home! 

Moral of the story- or ramble is go here! Wait in line! It may just change your life!
author: Tina L.

description:
I didn't think Mama's was all that great the first time I came here. I ordered one of the french toasts selections and felt that it was just average, definitely not worth the lengthy wait (~1.5 hours) on a chilly morning in San Francisco. However, I decided to give it another shot since my friend wanted to try for the first time .. and I have concluded that Mama's is now my FAVORITE brunch spot in the city. We came around 2pm on a Saturday (they close at 3pm) and only had to wait for about 30 minutes!!! We ordered:

Monte Cristo - This was the dish that made me change my mind! It was a delicious savory ham, turkey, and cheese sandwich with the fluffy and crunchy texture of a french toast. I am drooling while trying to describe it. The homemade jam adds a wonderful kick of flavor! 

Dungeness Crab Benedict w/ Spinach - I'm not really a fan of crab meat but my friend liked it a lot! It was also kinda pricey, almost $25! 

I am excited to come back (some time around 2pm of course) and try the omelettes that everyone else is raving about!!
author: Nancy C.

description: The food was pretty good, but it was quite expensive and the wait was quite long. I ordered 4 things and it cost me 73 dollars! The stuff there was overall pretty mediocre, but I did like it, and had a nice enjoyable time there.
author: Fanny S.

description:
Since there's such a long line I ordered two dishes to make the most of my experience (so I don't have to stand in line again). I got the vegetarian Benedict and the cranberry orange French toast. I love that it's a family business. The guy outside was super friendly, I always like to ask what they recommend and he was really helpful in steering me in the right direction. I knew I wanted to try an egg dish and a french toast dish. He recommended the Benedict over the omelettes and the hollandaise sauce was one of the best I've had. For the french toast he said that the classic was the cranberry orange, the Kugelhopf was the heaviest (lots of butter) and the chocolate cinnamon was the sweetest. He also said he picked up the berries that day from the market down the street.
The only thing I have to nitpick about is that there's no hook in the bathroom to hold your purse but I'm still giving it 5 stars.
author: Louise M.

description:
I came on a Wednesday morning ~10:10am and finished my food here at noon. The wait (outside line and inside line for register) was about an hour total. It was worth it considering the high quality to price (easily under 20 per person) ratio here. 
1. Staff was super friendly and willing to chat with you about recommendations, most popular stuff to try, history of the place, etc
2. The French toast was amazing! I had a single piece of the cranberry-orange. It was not excessively sweet. Tart, refreshing, soft.
3. The northern Italian omelette has a huge amount of prosciutto, tomatoes, and cheese. It was very rich and savory! 
Would love to come back and try their crab cake egg Benedict and monte cristo
author: Alex L.

description:
Do not let the size of this tiny brunch spot fool you. If the coiling line outside doesn't speak for itself the food at Mama's will.  One bite of their Monte Cristo sandwich and I swear I heard singing. Ok, it was me.. but seriously. It is delicious and you have to try it. I never knew perfection was possible with a ham and cheese sandwich but smoother it in homemade jam and apparently it is.  

Pro tip: Bring friends and steal from their plates. If you are feeling generous you may feel inclined to let them taste some from yours. 

My boyfriends eggs benedict  on smoked salmon was to die for. And luckily one order gets you two eggs. Perfect for stealing..I mean..sharing.
author: Renee S.

description:
Monte Cristo. Blows Disneyland's Blue Bayou Monte Cristo out of the water according to hubby.  And that was our favorite for decades! 

Got in line at 2pm on a Sunday.  Got our food by 4pm. 

*Note: They don't sell the double decker club sandwich in weekends.
author: Keriena T.

description: Long lines but definitely worth the wait. Staff is great and the pancakes were very delicious.
author: Judi H.

description: Love love love this place. This place is the only place other than Brenda's that I will actually wait in line for. Their original Monte Cristo is THE thing to order here, their benedicts are also pretty good. I always make it a point to stop by this joint when I'm in sf. Love supporting this local business that makes out of this world food!!!
author: Sarah C.

description:
3 years ago today I introduced two of my friends at Mama's for brunch and now they're getting married. If that's not a great brunch, I don't know what is. 
Get ready to stand in line if you want to eat here, we waited almost two hours and started cannibalizing the other people standing in line to hold ourselves over. The food was delicious but 2 hours is a long time for anything.
author: Daira R.

description:
I went on Saturday around 1 pm and wait for approx 2.5 hours. This is my 2nd time to Mamas and still in love with the Monte Cristo!! We also order the apple crumble, it was super delicious!!
Ordered french toast and the egg benedict, both were okay, but definitely for sure you should get the Monte Cristo 10/10!!
If you don't want to wait that long, come around 2.30pm. The line was shorter!
author: Amabel S.

description: OVERRATED!! Waited more than 2 hours, was expecting to be worth it but highly disappointed! Food was ordinary, service ok - payment in advance? Ridiculous!!
author: Bastian F.

description:
Mama's is one of the most popular breakfast spots in the city and for good reasons. Just about every item is spot on with taste and presentation. Had a great experience dining here on a Saturday morning but the wait can get insane so COME EARLY!

I ordered the chocolate cinnamon French toast which was delicious and I loved how it came with fresh fruit. My only complaint is that it wasn't filling. 

The waitresses and regular breakfast-goers are very friendly here. This place is a must try experience, but I wouldn't visit frequently due to the long line. 

Food: 5/5
Value: 3.5/5
Service: 5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
Omg what can I saw about Mamas ?!?! Everything and anything is always delicious here ! 
Come on a weekend expect an hour wait! My boyfriend and I think it's worth the wait! 
Our #1 go to for us is the monte Cristo! 
If you can't decide on which French toast , get the sample platter where it gives you one of each one ! Can share that with 2 people ! 
Eggs Benedict are delicious ! 
Best part is their home made jam ! 
Def recommend !
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Yes there is a wait, expect it, get over it or get out of line. Once inside you stand in front of the kitchen and get your last minute to decide what you want to order and pay in cash, NO CREDIT CARDS. 

We started with smoothies, one banana and one mamas berry. Both were very good and served in mason jars so they aren't small. We also had a blueberry sour cream crumb cake that was warm and delightful. 

Following that we had the crab Benedict and monte cristo. Both were incredible! It was totally worth the wait and we can't wait to come back!
author: Michael D.

description:
I am living in Orange County now but used to live in SF and love to spend time near DT San Francisco. As we know, Mamas is already favorite place for local people. 

Expect to wait in a long line, we waited 45 minutes before it opens for breakfast, the wait was fun we get to Chat with others in line and learned what was good here. Almost everything according to some 

The owner or guy at the door was super friendly and informative, he told us what was their specials for the day and what fresh/seasonal  ingredients just got delivered, he suggested dungeoness crab Benedict and it was as good as he say it was, chunky crab meat in a light crepe and sauce. If you don't know what you want they will be happy to recommend what fresh. For us they suggested too many items, that's a problem we can handle. :-)

I will be back here again, when I visit SF!

Food : 4/5

Employees : 4/5

Atmosphere : 5/5

Waiting time : 3/5

Location : 4/5
author: James K.

description:
It was a long wait as everyone says but we arrived at 7:45am and there was already a lineup and to top it off they were late opening too, 15 mins late! I know they're a hot spot but that's a little unprofessional. They only let about 15 customers in at first as there is limited seating, once inside you line up to order and pay. If no tables are available you wait until the cashier asks for your order. It's a system I've never experienced before but seems to work ok for them. Plus the lineup adds to the hype! So was it worth it?? 
I ordered the Farmers omelette and my husby ordered the French toast sampler special. Both were very generous proportions, mine also came with potatoes and a choice of toast with homemade raspberry jam. Everything was fresh and fillings were enough, nothing super special but the combination of fillings is what makes them good. 
The French toast is superb! The bread is basically decadent 'loaves!' Dipped in egg and topped with fresh fruits and maple syrup. If you love French toast this is the place to go! The eggs bennies also looked really good. Next time I'm skipping the omelette. The coffee was also a good medium roast and service was basic but also good.
author: Shirley C.

description:
If you don't mind waiting 2 hours, if you don't mind being rushed to order, if you don't mind getting whatever table is available (even the tiny one by the exit) you will not mind dining here. We were DISAPPOINTED with quality also, since we waited 2 hours. We expected the best french toast in the country (all bread versions were dry and bland), Monte Cristo was decent, moist, yummy (not exactly rich on Ham and Turkey) Read: it was missing some meat. 
We expected much more. I mean, 2 hours outside on a frigid Saturday morning and they manage to sell us 4$ coffees outside as thank you for our patience. 
When we ordered I asked for ONE SLICE OF TOAST, yes ONE REGULAR SLICE OF BREAD.....and I was charged 3.95! Wow.
Health department score of 76 didn't make me excited to give this place another chance. Come on maaaaaan! 76? Really? Out of 100? 
The guy in the kitchen is making Monte Cristos right next to the backdoor, (check the photo) on my way to the restroom which is OUTSIDE, like we're in some rural part of Oklahoma. This is North Beach, San Francisco. This place needs some major improvements. Overpriced and mediocre. One star for service and atmosphere 3-4 stars for Monte Cristo, NO STAR for health score!
author: Milan V.

description: Loved the monte cristo! The banana walnut French toast was somewhat misleading: it was banana bread slightly dipped in eggs. It was just okay.
author: Grace D.

description: Too long lines for something fairly overrated. Worst part is you have to stand in line as they don't have a waiting list system. Too much effort for fairly okay food. Sf has way better options!  I would not recommend this if you are looking for top notch flavors. This is diner style touristy attraction. I am not going back!
author: Kirti K.

description:
This place was really something else. Try to beat the line that is about twenty people long around 10:30 am. 

We got breakfast and there is a lot of fresh baked goods to choose. I got the Washington omelette. First thing on the menu and it was really good, very fresh. Try to get something with toast and jam (again all homemade stuff). Don't get the Bloody Mary... expensive for tomato juice and vodka. My friend's banana pancakes were a lot but very good as well. This place is without a doubt worth getting up early for.
author: Ryan D.

description: I have the answer to beating the long lines! We went at 2:30 on a Wednesday afternoon and there were 7 tables available. Breakfast or lunch with no lines whatsoever! Had the Crab Benedict and the Monte Cristo sandwich. Both were delicious, but for the price ($26 before tip or tax for just the crab) I would have expected more lump meat.
author: LuRhe S.

description:
The food is good. Is it better than most other* similar brunch places? Not really. Don't fall for the "famous" this or that. That's marketing.

Tourists - please know that there are plenty of brunch places in SF that are just as good as Mamas, and you won't have to wait for 1+ hours to be seated. Yelp brunch in your neighborhood and go there. Bonus: other places probably accept credit cards. Mama's is cash only.

*Not chain restaurants.
author: David S.

description:
This is a very nice place and the food is amaizing! The monte cristo sandwich is a must try when you come to this place.  

The waiting time is worth it.
author: Ana L.

description: Despite the long line and waiting... this place is awesome. I love the food and warm service with different kind of environment. It feels like I'm in Italia the simple summer design of the restaurant.
author: Suzanne J.

description: Good food and offerings. I am not going to say you should wait in the lines to eat here, but if you can get there prior to 7:45am on weekdays, the line is not too long. It was my first time here and I ordered the French Toast Sampler and the Shrimp Benedict. The sampler was ok, the Shrimp Benedict was delicious! Would I come back? Probably not. Reasons being I came to try this place after going to SFO and I was on the way home when I wanted to eat breakfast somewhere in the city, which I did. There are other places I would try before going back to Mama's.
author: Candace C.

description:
Was really excited to try this place and they did not disappoint. Its in the cutest location. Right in front of a park in little italy, facing outwards towards the street. We came at the right time because there was no line at all. I love the old school vibes this place had. All the decor and seating made it all feel home and cozy. 

What we got: 
French toast sampler: had fresh berries and bananas with a side of syrup. Oh my goodness it was delicious!! Fluffy and flavor was great. The best part was the berries because they were so fresh!

Their famous monte cristo: absolutely loved it. Devoured it all. The jam went really well with the sandwich. Really complimented it well. 

Coffee
Fresh squeezed lemonade

Everything was great. The only thing i would say that sucked bout the experience was the seating. Fairly small and limited. But everything else was awesome. 

One thing to add, if you want to tip and don't have cash, you can tell the lady at the front as you pay you would like to add a tip so she can incorporate it into your total. Thats the only way. They don't accept credit card and only debit card with a $15 purchase. But you're obviously going to buy more than $15 anyways, so its no biggie.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
The line for this place is always long and not completely sure if it's worth the wait but if you have some good buds with you then the time just flies by! 

You'll mainly find typical brunch foods here at Mamas, some dishes they are known for are the fresh toast, benedict, and pastries they make in house. The portions are massive, service is fast, and the food is good.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I honestly don't think this place is worthy waiting waiting. The crab omelette is not bad but obviously not as good as the ones I had in South Bay before. The French toast is not fluffy at all and kinda soggy. Pretty disappointed after 80 mins wait.
author: Stephanie F.

description: This is a great foodie experience if your willing to wait!  No reservations and always a line!  But as far as we are concerned the BEST breakfast in the city.  Benedict's, omelette, sandwiches, fruit, bagels and incredible baked breads!!  Service is attentive and the Cappuccino is tasty!
author: Marie S.

description:
Party size: 2
Occassion: Friends Brunch
When: Breakfast on a Saturday (Arrived at 0815, Sat at 0915)
Weather: Cold (this matters due to wait times)
From: Peninsula
Staff: Efficient and Friendly 
Pricing: Fair

**They accept debit cards but def no credit.  (per the signs on the outside)

Ordered:
1) French Toast Sampler (4/5)
2) Northbeach Benedict with bacon (5/5)

Place did not get a full 5/5 because of the wait but what can you do in SF other than wait.   

Staff:
Attentive, informative and friendly.

Food:
Orange cranberry french toast (BOMB.com), hollandaise from the Benedict (I want this on everything I eat) 

Overall -- waiting sucks but I suppose good things come to those who do.  If you're up for an hour or so wait, go.  Would I wait again? Probably but I'd time it to be there before it opens if I want to get in before 9.
author: Noey A.

description: Yummy! Must eats don't miss it. Very big plates to eat. Next time will come again. Love pancake and breads
author: Jennifer L.

description: Absolutely worth the wait. Chocolate French toast was my favorite. Recommend arriving in an Uber or by foot being that all street parking in the area was metered (you can pay the meter by the app).
author: Melissa A.

description:
It was good, but not knock my socks wait in line for 2 hours, best breakfast I've ever had. 

I got the Northpoint omelet with Italian hot sausage. It was good, but so is the omelet at IHOP with out all the wait. 

I also got the carrot cake, because multiple reviewers mentioned it, Again it was good, but so it the single slice of carrot cake they sell at Safeway.

I'm starting to think people in San Francisco like waiting in line for food because of hype not taste.
author: melisa w.

description:
The lines are always out the door no matter what time you come, but the food is worth it if you can wait! No credit cards, cash or debit (over $15) only. You pay at the cash register for the food, be sure to have cash on hand to tip your server before you leave. 

Most people get their famous Monte Cristo: turkey + ham + cheddar + gruyere cheese in egg battered white bread, with homemade jam and a side of potatoes. The homemade jam makes it extra special! The dish is not cheap at almost $15, but it sure is yummy. 

I love this place and I love the food, but I really hate the way they manage the seating of guests. You're only seated after you order and pay. There was a party of 5 in front of us (party of 2), and we had to stand in line and couldn't order until they were seated even though there were plenty of small tables available (that had no way of seating the party of 5 even if they were moved around). The wait is expected and understandable, but I felt we were penalized just because a larger party was in line in front of us.
author: Joanna T.

description:
Not sure if the line is worth the wait, but I would definitely come back for the cranberry orange French toast! You can get one piece for $4.95 if the sweetness seems too overwhelming. Pairs up well with something savory like their omelettes- a big thumbs up for their portions!! 

I would suggest coming with a party or no more than 5, since the place is small and the wait might take longer to accommodate your group. The food also took a fairly long time to get (~20 mins), so make sure to set ample time aside for your mamas experience!
author: Esther K.

description: My fourth straight year visiting San Francisco. Each year, I have to...no, I cherish the opportunity, to visit Mamas. The absolute best breakfast. You have to arrive early to beat the long lines. Mike, the owner, is so gracious. Each year I am usually the first one waiting. He has always allowed me to sit inside prior to opening. The food, waitresses, atmosphere all deserve 10 stars out of 5....it is that good. Also, always love seeing Alice. She has waited on us each year. Note---why anyone would rate this place anything but 5 Stars is baffling to me. Perhaps they got caught in the long line but that is only due to the popularity of this place. Keep going strong Mike!
author: Dan J.

description: This is by far the BEST breakfast/brunch place in the Bay Area. Hands down!!! :) Although there will be a long line before getting seated (because the place is pretty popular and the the dining area is kinda small), the owner's brother makes an effort to talk to the customers in line and is very attentive. He made several recommendations, but everything on the menu sounded good. I had the South of the Border omelette and also tried the cinnamon chocolate toast. Food here is homemade and very impressive! Everything was delicious!!! Their fresh squeezed OJ is also a must get. I will definitely come back here (earlier)!
author: Maria V.

description:
My honest rating for this place is s 3.5. I honestly think it's overhyped because the food and service fell a bit flat for me. 

Dropped in on a random weekday around 1:30 pm. Thank god there was no ridiculous line out the door at this point. However, there was still a line at the register. So at this place you basically go in, order at the counter, and then wait for a table to clear up while your food is being made. When I first walked in, no one greeted me or even told me how this set up worked. The waitress at the door began talking to the next party and I had to wave someone else down to ask how this worked since it was my first time here. She explained the process to me and I went ahead and got in line. Their menu is displayed on the wall, but you can ask for a menu card if you'd like. Getting a menu card also proved to be difficult because I had to flail around until someone saw that I needed help. Once we did order, the food took SO long to come out. And this is when the place wasn't even crowded. I'm pretty sure waited at least 35 minutes for food. 

Vegetarian options (if you eat eggs) included omelettes, benedicts, french toast, pancakes, quiche, the california sandwich, and the quesdilla. Foodwise I had the quesadilla without sour cream because I was not feeling any of the sweet options. It came with avocado and salsa on the side both of which were good, but not really anything special. I also had a side of the roasted potatoes. So the quesadilla was good, but was it great? Nope. I know, I know. I decided to get a quesadilla and they can only be so good. But if I'm paying $11.50 for a quesadilla, I expect it to be amazing. I was most sad about the roasted potatoes. They were lukewarm, under salted, and just a bit flavorless. I love potatoes and I wanted to love these, but alas they were just sad imitations of real breakfast taters. 

The confusing ordering style and service combined with the lackluster food move me to give it a 3.5/5 rating.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
This is a classic breakfast/ brunch place. The location is great, but the downside is the wait was terrible. I had the North beach omelette and it was yummy and Instagram-worthy. I would come back if I have time to spare waiting.

The place itself is not that big, and they don't accept credit card, so I would recommend only if you are really craving some breakfast food!
author: Sandra H.

description:
Only debit or cash!! 

Plan to come here when you are not hungry still because it is an hour + wait. However don't let that stop you, the Monte Cristo at Mama's is the best I have yet tried! Great costumer service, clean and welcoming little stop! 

Totally recommend if you are in the area!
author: Alejandra M.

description: First time to Sanfran, came to this place right after we landed...Came on a Sunday around 11:30? A friend recommend we eat here.. we waited online outside for over an hour then we went inside and wait in another line for maybe 20 mins.. the restaurant is tiny so that's why you wait a while... we ordered a lot cause there waa 4 of us.. the French toast flight, Italian omelette, corn beef hash and eggs, Monte Cristo (soo good) staff is pretty is pretty friendly. I don't think i would wait that long for a table again, but it is a def must try if you're in San Fran! Probably recommend you come early! We left and there was still a line outside
author: Andrea F.

description:
The best and always worth the wait.  Got there at 7 am on a Saturday and was first in line.  Mike Sanchez, the owner, invited me inside to sit and then we had a great conversation.  He said his favorite are the pancakes because of the recipe he uses and I agree completely.  Also had the omelette and enjoyed it too.  

When I lived in the area, I never got up early enough to go there expect when I had family in town.  This time, we were visiting and staid across the street in a B&B, but passed up their breakfast for Mamas and so glad we did.

Get there early!!  Be prepared to wait, but it is worth it.
author: David J.

description: BEST eggs Benedict I've ever had. Really recommend the Blackstone Benedict. Perfect poached egg and the entire dish was packed with flavor. Be sure to leave room for pastries. They don't accept credit cards but Debit is ok.
author: Kristen L.

description:
Mama's is the best breakfast place in San Francisco!! There's almost always a 30-45 minute wait but it is worth it (I hate lines with a passion and it is still worth it). The best time to go is right before they open or later in the afternoon (2:30ish - they serve breakfast all day). My favorite thing to get is the Benedict Paissano (yes it's a secret off the menu item) and it is glorious!! Also their fresh squeeze orange juice and jam (for toast) are incredible as well :) 

Mama I love you
author: Jorgen A.

description:
Made it to Mamas!
This place is a great little spot to eat breakfast or brunch/lunch as it is only open from 8am to 3pm. All our food was yummy. Only reason why it gets 4 stars and not 5 is because I think it is a little over priced, but service and food is on point.
author: Realize B.

description:
Heard about this gem on Yelp and could not wait to try! Went on a Friday at about 1:00pm and had a reasonably short wait of a half hour to get to order. The Monte Cristo was beyond amazing and definitely one of the best meals I have ever had. The French toast sampler was so delicious! The portions were perfect - not massive and not too small.

We loved it so much, that we tried to go back the next day (a Saturday) at about the same time. The line was massive and we decided not to wait. But it was definitely worth it if you've never been!
author: Ashley G.

description: Cute little place. The Choc Cinnamon French toast  was amazing. I also had OJ and that was yummy and fresh. The coffee was a bit strong. But service was great friendly staff and so glad to have Home during the weekday and not wait whatsoever. Pancakes were...just pancakes. Nice and fluffy. But loved their house made jam.
author: Hana A.

description: Such a quaint brunch spot with amazing food. We got to Mama's on a Thursday morning, and there was a line formed along the side of the restaurant. Luckily, it went quick and the food was truly amazing. I would highly recommend trying the French toast.
author: Emily R.

description: Monte cristo was insane!  I loved it and they gave it to me for free when I asked about a military discount.  The place has a long wait, I suggest showing up before it opens
author: Kristen B.

description: Best breakfast place I've been to but the wait is atrocious.. we waited close to two hours when there were only 25 people in line! It has delicious home made food of high quality and the servers are helpful and friendly. I overall really liked the place but would really have to think twice about returning because of the wait.
author: Nicola G.

description: Great shit. They mistook my order (for a lower price one with no refund), came a hair in French Toast all this after a wait of about 1 hour. The line to enter is long, the time for ordering is too long, they uses cash register yet for ordering. There are many other places with better food, price and service in San Francisco, inexplicable to the fame of this place. Not worth your time, go to Sweet Mapple, they are beat in every aspect. Worst place I've had breakfast in all the days of my stay here!
author: Luiz Paulo L.

description:
Stay in the line!!! It's worth the wait!!!! I recommend going to the liquor store in the corner for a light snack / water if you feel like dropping out. 

Food is excellent. Order the French toast!!!
author: Renee A.

description: The food was mediocre, and the wait was ridiculous. We waited in line outside for about and hour, then we went inside and had to eat even longer. Once we got to the register to order one of the workers said that we had to wait more time because here were no tables available. Once we finally got our food it wasn't very good, and it was definitely not worth the wait. Don't waist your time here. I would not recommend it.
author: Makena H.

description:
1.5 hours later and we've moved 50 feet by foot. Was it worth the wait? To be honest, no. I  didn't like being confined in a line for such a long time! I really felt like I was waiting to ride the Space Mountain in Disneyland. Why can't there be a Fast Pass system? Just kidding. To the say the least, i think Mama's can find a solution to this ridiculous line. Whether that would be patrons receive a buzzer or get a courtesy text when the table is ready. 

Do youself a favor and skip this place.
author: Briana H.

description:
My friend and I arrived on a Wednesday at 11:50am and were seated in half an hour. Since we came on a weekday, I unfortunately couldn't order the Dungeness Crab Benedict that I was really looking forward to. I didn't realize that it was only served on weekends. Derp.

To me, out of all the the popular brunch spots in the city, Mama's vibe is the most inviting and homely. Anyone's frown will surely turn upside down upon gazing at all the breads, fruits, and pastries on display. More importantly, the restaurant's logo has hearts on it and its name reminds me of my mom. Call it an unfair advantage. I will surely take mother dearest here next time she's having a bad day.

// Crab Cake Benedict ($22.95) - 4 stars
Since I couldn't order my Dungeness Crab Benedict, this dish was the logical fallback. It was featured on their specials menu, and I'm definitely glad I ordered it. The crab cake was delicious and the muffin had a nice crispiness to it. Yummy!

// Our Famous Monte Cristo ($13.95) - 4 stars
I didn't expect the bread to be so soft and chewy when I took my first bite, but I actually kinda liked that it wasn't really crunchy. Came with homemade jam that added a hint of sweetness.

ProTip: No credit cards. Debit cards accepted with a $15 minimum.
author: Miko B.

description: Love this place!! Their eggs Benedict is so delicious as they offer different versions. Also their bread delicious soft and so flavorful. The 1 hour wait was so worth it! It's so cute inside and homie. Can wait until we visit San Francisco this will be one of the first stops.
author: Nanies G.

description:
Bottom Line:  High quality ingredients make the difference at this small, cozy cafe that is known to have a long wait. 

When it comes to Mama's On Washington Square in the North Beach neighborhood there are really only two things to talk about - the line/wait time and the food.  

One of my fellow Yelp Elite friends and I will sometimes express how much we like a restaurant based on how long we are willing to wait in line.  I think this strategy works well in SF since lines for breakfast seem to be common.  As far as Mama's go, I would be willing to wait 45 minutes, 60 minutes maximum.  Lucky for me, I was fortunate to be able to go to Mama's on an October Tuesday Morning.  BF and I got there at 7:45am and we were 5th and 6th in line.  The doors opened shortly after 8am and we had ordered and been seated by about 8:10am. I think it took ten minutes or so for our entrees to come out. Our brief wait was totally worth the deliciousness that followed.

At first I was disappointed to learn that there is only a partial waitress service here - diners order at the counter and seat themselves. When the food is up on the pass, a runner will deliver it to the table.  But, while waiting to place my order I got to see the ingredients Mama's was using.  Everything looked super fresh, hand picked and high quality.  Something else that looked good was the chocolate drizzle coffee cake so on an impulse I added that to my order.   Come to find out, that coffee cake was absolutely, positively delicious!  

BF has been reading Yelp reviews so he knew to try the Monte Cristo sandwich, which is listed on the lunch menu but it actually served all day. Imagine slices of turkey, ham, cheddar and gruyere sandwiched between two pieces of bread that have been encased in battered egg and grilled.  Once battered, it is hard to tell where one slice of bread ends and the other begins.  The bread was slightly sweet but the inside was pure savory.  For additional sweetness, the sandwich is served with a side of jam.  I thought the bite of sandwich was good but for me there was too much going on for me to make a meal of it.

As usual, I went for a protein packed eggs benedict.  I ordered the North Beach which consisted of prosciutto and tomatoes.  It was tasty and the presentation was beautiful.  It was served with a side of breakfast tomatoes.  In general I think breakfast potatoes are just meh but I was glad to use them to sop up the yolky and hollandaise goodness from my benny.

A few other notes - the décor here is homey and cute.  I can't decide if its Italian countryside, French countryside, rustic sheik or some other décor but I did like it.  Also, the restaurant is small so I don't recommend it for parties larger than four.  Finally, the wait staff was very attentive and friendly.  At the table next to me there was a mix up/miscommunication about what the lads had ordered and the waitress was super friendly and accommodating about it. 

I would definitely return to Mama's again on a weekday but I can't foresee myself hanging out on Stockton St. for two hours on a weekend morning.
author: Courtney K.

description: Excellent breakfast, as usual. Stood on line over an hour. Previous time the ppl ahead of me in line were working for a task rabbit job and their customer skipped the line all together... it's something to consider if you avoid mamas because of the line.
author: Adriana B.

description: If you want to eat here make sure to bring a fold out chair to sit in while waiting in line on the sidewalk. We waited 1.5 hours to eat here. Needless to say my back was killing me by the time we sat down to eat. I will say the views are nice as there are older Asian women doing their daily dance exercises while you wait (if you're there for breakfast). The restaurant has been around for a while and the owner spends time visiting with folks waiting outside. He is extremely kind. I will say all of the food looks great. I tried to be adventurous and try the orange, cranberry french toast. It was not my favorite as it was made from heavy bread (similar in texture and weight to banana bread).  I probably wouldn't return if we visited San Fran again but I will say it is a nice establishment with an extremely nice owner.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Great breakfast place! Good variety of food. The portions are a good size. Only drawback, was the wait in line but it wasn't too bad since we got here after 10am.
author: Mrs. B.

description: A delicious breakfast spot. You can easily wait 1-2 hours if you aren't in line about an hour before opening. We shared the french toast sampler which was very good - the lemon blueberry french toast is not on the menu, but was in the special sampler and was the most delicious. We also shared a special breakfast sandwich with egg, arugula, a basil aioli, cheese, etc that was outstanding. Tables turn over quickly, but still... get there early!
author: Nicole M.

description:
The best part of my trip to San Francisco. Yes the wait is very long, but it's worth it. 

Monte cristo. This is a must. Drooling already. 
The French toast sampler was also a great choice. 

It's a good idea to buy a couple of dishes and share because it was all just so good.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Worth every penny. 

I mean yeah, you've gotta wait in line but isn't that the case everywhere in San Francisco ‍

I went on a Thursday around 1pm and I called beforehand to see how long the wait was. The person told me that it was about a 25 minutes wait. 

I head on over and although there was a line outside of the door, we did managed to get into the door in 25 minutes, then proceed to order and sit at a table in another 15minutes. 

I had a lot of tip money this past week so I decided to go for the #1 on the special board- the crab benedict. It was $25.95 so believe me, I had high expectations for the dish. 

It was AMAZING. Loved the fact that the poached egg was not extremely runny, the English muffin was perfected toasted so it was crunchy and dude, the crab, just, you gotta just order it and you'll see what I'm talking about. 

Almost licked the plate at the end but I'm pretty sure that people judge you when you do that.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Got there around 8 and waited an hour. Overpriced and decent. I've had better breakfast for less of a hassle. It's seems like more people come here for the novelty than they do for insanely good food.
author: T V.

description: A wonderful location and option for brunch any day of the week! Mamas on Washington square was hyped up to be the best brunch spot by my friend but unfortunately I didn't share the same opinion - hence the four stars instead of five. Furthermore, the wait was expectedly long, almost an hour and a half for going at 9 am. The coffee crumble cake is apparently a local favorite and it was certainly mouthwatering delicious. However, I don't remember much of the omelette or the sampler French toast I had. I was extremely content in the moment, but mamas didn't deliver a brunch-to-remember. I think it is feasible to find similar quality brunch in the city without having to wait for so long. However, if the wait isn't an issue then certainly head over to mamas. It is an iconic brunch destination for a reason - its homely environment and unique brunch offerings create an experience that is worth the wait at least once for both tourists and locals alike.
author: Jein P.

description: Very rude staff. They make you wait outside, then you wait inside. Then you order. Then and only then will they let you sit down at one of the dozen or more tables that are available. All along you must endure the very rude staff. But you can experience all this BS only if you have cash. Don't be a sheep, eat somewhere else.
author: MIchael J.

description:
My friend and I woke up at 730 AM and decided we were determined to eat here. We scurry over around the corner and surprise, surprise, there is a GIANT LIZARD line already formed at the door. The concept is easy: wait in line for an hour or two, order at the counter, be seated, and the food is brought to you. I have noticed that people are mindful of the lines so they don't linger longer than necessary. 

It happened to be my birthday and the guy at the counter happened to catch wind of that fact, so of course the entire restaurant sang to me. Humiliated or not, I ate it right up! We ordered the salmon benedict and the Monte Cristo. The salmon benny was delicious but the Monte Cristo was out of this world! The man at the counter also sent over free French Toast on the house in honor of my birthday. 

So. So. Delicious! I understand why the lines are so long even at 745AM on a Saturday! Go check it out!
author: Julianne S.

description: This place has great breakfast. Their pancakes and French toast are absolutely delicious. I would definitely come here again for another breakfast. I recommend this to absolutely everyone.
author: TropicalNights ..

description: I can not recommend this place to anyone. My son and I walked here, waited over an hour in direct sunlight (on a Wednesday) to get inside and have to wait longer. We were starving, hot and irritated. Even more irritated when I saw the cooks in the back goofing around taking their sweet time. No sense of urgency whatsoever! Eventually we got our order in, food came out and was mediocre. Nothing special. All that wait for mediocre food?! NOT worth it. I spent a little over $35 for French toast and an omelette which I didn't mind before my food came out. Worst part about the experience here was that the ppl next to me ended up with a staple in their food probably due to the fact that the cooks were having a little too much fun in the back. It made me sick and wondered what was in my food. I will not come back
author: Dominic And Ganina H.

description:
The wait to get in is always long, they accept cash and debit cards only, and it's touristy as hell, HOWEVER, I read a meme on Instagram that read: it takes 2 years to build a Bently and 6 months to build a Toyota. Whether or not that's true, some things are worth the wait.  Granted, I've only been to Mama's twice in my life, separated by 5 years, but I can tell you that I refuse to eat a Monte Cristo anywhere else. 

The first time I had ever had a Monte Cristo was in 2012 at Mama's.  I wasn't sure if it was the cheese or the jam that made it so delightful, but this Monte Cristo is the only one I'll eat.  I've tried a Monte Cristo once somewhere other than Mama's and was so disappointed with it, that I vowed only to order Monte Cristo's at Mama's.  Mama's Cristo isn't greasy and what really makes it special is that jaaaaaaaam!

It is very cozy inside with limited space for large groups. This place is best for those who enjoy eating alone or those who enjoy intimate one-on-one brunches.  I hope you're friendly because you will be seated very closely to your neighbor.  It doesn't matter what day or time you go to Mama's, there will be a wait. Accept it. You're in a large metropolis city. Get over it. If you don't want to wait in lines, go to a rual area in Oregon or something. Stop complaining, support local businesses, and be happy that you're able to afford to wait in line to eat in San Francisco.

If you happen to live in the immediate bay area, take a day off of work and try to go to Mama's during the week, perhaps two hours before they close.  On my last visit there, I was able to treat my sister to a birthday lunch and we were in and out in under 2 hours, with a parking spot half a block down.  It was the best day of our lives.
author: Christine A.

description:
Arrived for Sunday breakfast at 7:30 for an 8 am opening. There was already a line forming on the side of the building for the doors to open. Make sure you get there early!

Food was amazing. I ordered the Northern Italian omelette and it was very filling! My wife ordered the Cranberry Orange and it was very sweet. Recommend ordering one slice instead of the regular plate which is 3 large pieces.

When we left, the line was longer and a 2 hour wait. We left around 8:30-8:45.
author: David E.

description:
Line's really lone. Arrived 10am and it took 1.5 hours until finally seated. There's really nothing to complain about other than the line. 
Food is terrific. Had a Northern Italian Omelet (just watched "Call Me By Your Name" the night before) with a grape juice - what I can say? - I was in heaven~
author: Bilbo L.

description:
After numerous recommendations, I finally willed my way to waking up at an ungodly hour in order to have a chance at eating breakfast at 'Mama's'. Every weekend morning before the restaurant opens, a huge lineup forms right outside. 

As mentioned, the process is interesting: everyone lines up and orders before being seated. The restaurant itself feels very home-y, albeit, the furniture and decor feels kind of old I came here with a group of five others. The seating lacks some leg room, and the chairs are fairly uncomfortable, but that may also be due to a sore back from a lack of sleep. The food itself was amazing; I ordered the Classic Benedict and shared the French toast sampler with 3 others. The Benedict came with slightly too much hollandaise sauce for my liking, but besides that it was made to perfection; the egg yolk was a perfect combination with the hollandaise sauce, and was topped off perfectly with the english muffin and ham. The French toast was also very enjoyable; there were three separate flavors: cinnamon, blueberry, and cranberry. 

Overall, this was a good experience, but one that should be reserved for occasion, it was truly a huge effort to get up early enough, and I will look back on this moment with a smile.
author: Peter W.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said already. Hands down the best breakfast place I have ever been too. Get here early with a coffee in hand to drink while waiting in line. The line moves fast and the service is speedy as well. I had the pancakes and the kids had the French toast. Everything is made from scratch and with love and care. 
This is a must do if you are in the city. Right up there with seeing the Golden Gate Bridge, Coit Tower, or riding the cable cars. Momma's is a right of passage for any one visiting this amazing city.
author: Doug D.

description:
Very much worth going for breakfast or brunch. It's an experience but plan to be very early if you don't like waiting.
First you have to find parking. Be careful if you're new to the city because the towed signs are easily missed on the side of the pavements. There is an old brick building parking garbage one block south of this corner joint. Second, you wait VERY long in line. ( you most likely would meet a new friend or 2) 
The food portions are filling but not too big. My wife and I shared a meal actually. 
Everything is said to be delicious!!!!! We had the California egg special.
author: Phil L.

description:
