Comes with house potatoes and choice of bread:  (highly recommend the sourdough--it's like 1/4 of a baguette, toasted perfectly with butter) Make sure you ask for their house made jam--it's fabulous!  

The side ham was just "ok," stick with the Canadian bacon.  And the "fresh squeezed" OJ did not taste "fresh." Daughter had the fluffy pancakes (which she rated a "10") with fresh fruit and potatoes.  Another awesome choice is the chocolate cinnamon toast with fresh berries.  We ordered one for the road, which my daughter ate for dinner.  The service is super friendly and quick!

IMPORTANT NOTE:  which I should have listed first, but I was too blinded by the awesome food memory:  Mama's only accepts CASH or DEBIT CARDS, NO CREDIT CARDS!  They should probably post this in huge print toward the back of the long line outside.  Can you imagine waiting 2 hours with no cash/ATM on hand only to find out they don't accept credit cards??
author: Rose G.

description: This place was amazing! We got there about 10 AM and waited about 40 mins. I ordered the crab eggs Benedict and my hubby got the north beach Benedict and both were amazing! The mimosas are fresh squeezed and have a plethora of champagne! Definitely worth the wait in line. Oh FYI: they don't accept credit card on debit and cash! I didn't know that, but had our debit card on us!
author: Mandi W.

description:
**Cash or Debit Card** ONLY.  And it is a minimum of $15 for debit card, which shouldn't be hard since most items are over $10.
After reading the reviews, I decided to head to this place.  The line outside was not too long, only 3 groups of 2 and 3 in front of me.  After about 20 minutes I was able to go in, and there you make the other line, that one was about another 20 minutes.  This is where you place your order and pay.  Once a table opens up, you are seated.  I ordered the cranberry orange french toast with a side of potatoes, a small fruit cup and a large Fresh squeezed orange juice.  This ended up being $28 before tip.  Once seated I waited for my items about 10 minutes.  My french toast was very good, the potatoes were nicely roasted, I just wished my orange juice was colder, it was just room temperature.  I couldn't finish my french toast, I ate only two of the three slices.  There are so many items that look so good, the cooks are hard at work in front of everyone, so you can see how they make the meals.  It is pretty neat.  I will definitely come back another time.
author: Marisa S.

description: Sampler was worth the wait plus the Monte Cristo!! Amazing!! Waitress was polite and always checked up! Couldn't ask for better service from a busy place like this one.
author: Manuel A.

description:
The Monte Cristo takes me to another place and back- it melts in your mouth and the texture is just soooo right; not to mention the homemade jam that makes you close your eyes because it's just that good.
This place is popular, so prepare to wait or go during non-prime hours! I only waited about 20 minutes after getting there at 1:30 or so on a Tuesday! The environment is very homey and they still have their menus from 60 years ago (wow!).
After all these reviews, if you haven't gone... this is your sign to go.
author: Crystal N.

description: This place was extremely dissatisfying. The bacon was under cooked and the food was mediocre. I definitely will puke this recommend this place to anyone. No one in my party finished or really ate their food.
author: ReallyTrilly S.

description:
Unique menu, at least for out of towners. Monte Cristo and Salmon scramble were delicious. Large portions, may be want to take some home. 

Cool atmosphere, and creative waiting line- order while waiting for a seat allows this cozy place to serve a large crowd without feeling cramped. The outside waiting line could use some shade though, can get pretty hot.
author: Albina O.

description: What can I say about this place that hasn't been said already? The line is long, the place is small, the food is delicious. It'll be exactly as you expect! I would 10/10 recommend the monte cristo. I probably won't be coming back here, simply because I don't live in SF so I'd probably want to spend my 2 hours waiting for some other hyped up restaurant...haha. But definitely worth trying out!
author: Erin K.

description: The food was fine. Your usual bfast food, omelettes, egg dishes a few types of Benedict, even sammies. You wait in a line outside to come in and wait in line to order at a cashier then you take a seat of one of their few tables, and you get semi-service (they bring your food to the table, but I wouldn't call it full service). Pretty overpriced for the hassle and the food was fine, nothing extraordinary. What's all the hype about?? I came on a weekday when there wasn't a line outside so it was okay but I would not wait in line for this bfast spot. I do love the park across the street though!
author: Piper W.

description:
This place is always busy. Expect to wait about an hour or more. So if you don't like to wait I suggest to really come really early even before they open.

But this place is worth the wait... the food is really good and freshly made when order. So much flavor on every bite of the food. If you come in san francisco I suggest and recommend to really trying this place. You wouldn't wanna miss this opportunity to try 1 of the yummy food in san francisco. 

The wait is so long I remember when we get in the long was long and when we are done it seems like the line never ending that's how good the food is. People are welling to wait just to try this place. That says alot of this place. 

It's a small place but it has a good and nice feel of the place. The staff is really nice.
author: Mojica A.

description: Got here 4min after they opened and there's already a line (it was a wk day too), but thank goodness the wait wasn't too long. Basically, you order at the counter, find a table and the wait staff will bring the food to your table.  The wait for food was a bit longer than expected,  about 20mins... we were hungry and it was so hard watching others eat next to us!  We tried the french toast sampler, chorizo benedict, and a slice of carrot cake. The carrot cakewas a bit dry and the icing needed to be more creamy, the French toast sampler was just OK as well, nothing special. However, the chorizo benedict was amazing!! super tasty! Overall, cute place with OK food.
author: Jenny Z.

description: Family business with touch restaurant. We waited more than one hour. I know it sound ridiculous but we did. And didn't regretted this. Benedict's egg with salmon were premium. The Samplers French toasts are delightful.
author: Anuta B.

description:
Mama's keeps the tradition & quality going.  The food is just a delicious as I remember.  Yes, there was a 30 min wait for a table on a Tuesday @ 11am.  Our food arrived in a timely manner after ordering.  

The decadent French toast sampler is still to die for!  My favorite slice is the French toast made out of cran-orange bread.  You can taste the citrus in the bread that compliments the berry jam.

My +1 ordered the North Beach bene with prosciutto and grilled tomato.  He loved it & I was lucky to get a taste before it was devoured.

Of course I ordered a hunk of chocolate crumb cake to enjoy later.

TIP 1 - CASH or debit ONLY

TIP 2 - forget about syrup, use the homemade jam on the table.
author: Kim S.

description: Awesome breakfast, huge omelettes, and fresh baked bread used in the French toast.  Didn't have the pancakes but I'm sure it's great! Long wait but so worth it.
author: Lawrence G.

description: I gave it a 3 because of the 1-1/2 wait.   Food was still good not sure it's worth an 1-1/2 wait.   It's a little pricey but the food is delicious.   They were a little thin on the potatoes that something that had changed. The orange juice is fresh which is really nice. And the homemade blackberry jelly is also delightful.   Not sure if I would go back because of the long wait. Make sure you have plenty of time!
author: Sherri M.

description: The bf raved about this place as a local and felt that I would enjoy it. He ordered the Norwegian eggs Benedict. It was good but nothing spectacular. I got the our famous monte cristo. I was enjoying it until I pulled out a 1 1/12 inch white hair from the cheesy part of my sandwich. I was so saddened to not have been able to finish my meal. Our waitress immediately offered to bring another plate or refund my meal. I opted to refund my meal as I was almost done with my plate anyhow. The fresh squeeze orange juice was good too but again nothing I'd have to come back for. My 9yr old picky eater ordered a large bowl of fruit (small was $7.95 and large was a dollar or two more, about $10?) and she mostly enjoyed it but the strawberries were a little unripe and too tart for her liking. For the cost, you'd think the serving size or taste would make up for it but it just didn't. It was just strawberries, cantaloupe, honey dew melon and pineapple. No blueberries! We came at 11:53a and got in to order in 45 min. But then waited another 30min for our food to come out. The big guy in a niners beanie and white t shirt was seen outside sitting on the next door pavement or steps smoking a cigarette. When he took or order he had no smile, no enthusiasm, and no sense of humor and looked really grungy.  I want to even say he seemed a bit hungover or just out of it. He had the "why am I here right now" type of look. I don't normally care about big, not happy type of people taking my orders but I'm slowly realizing it does make a difference in the dining experience with happy vs not so happy employees. Overall, I would come back but only with people who "have to" come to try this establishment. On my own though, I wouldn't bother. As a foodie, I'm glad I got to check this place off as a "must try" spot. Minus one start for the hair, unhappy employee taking our order, and prices to portion ratio.
author: Nance_ E.

description: Went here for my birthday brunch while visiting the city. About a 30 minute wait outside for two people on a Wednesday morning. Interesting set up with the way you wait in line outside, then go into the restaurant, wait in line to order and pay (no credit cards, but they do take debit) and THEN you're seated.  I had the two eggs with white toast and potatoes as well as a mimosa and a bellini. OJ in the mimosa was not very good but the bellini was perfect. My friend is gluten free and was fully accommodated and satisfied. Nice staff, very tight seating so I don't recommend for more than 4 people at a time. Definitely go if you find yourself in this neighborhood!
author: Casey L.

description:
Tasty food! 
Worth the wait?   That's debatable.    They only have 38 seats inside so there is a constant wait time.   
We waited quite a long time and felt like the food was a little hyped up and maybe not really worth the wait time.   But it was good none the less.
author: Greg T.

description:
I read this place takes about 1 hour wait... NO, it about 2 hours and 20 mins. After you line up outside you have to line up inside. The food was good, but the service was not so much. If you have a party of 4 or less, come and you will find a place to sit. BUT you will have to wait for a table available. It's super small/tiny and it's find your own seat.

We were a party of 6, quite a big group for a tiny place, and there was a booth that would of hold the 6 of us. The people was leaving and one of our friends were about to sit but the man that watches the door stop her for saving the booth because we have not order yet (Even though we were next in line or in the process of ordering). There was a party of 2 before us, took the table after the lady at the cash registered said that table will be reserved for us since we are such a big group... It took us another 30 mins to get a table to sit. I would never come here again even if the food is good. Once was enough.
author: Christina H.

description:
Waited more than 2 hours in line...
My husband and I got the Norwegian, Cranberry orange french toast, carrot cake and chocolate crumble.
Everything was good bit my favorite was the carrot cake!
We spent less than U$50 (my husband also ordered a lemonade). Was worth it.
author: Rita S.

description:
Boyfriend heard about this place so we decided to check it out. After reading a few reviews, it made me curious about their famous monte Cristo. We got lucky with street parking, it was a Thursday morning and the line was out the back door. We waited in the heat for almost an hour. Finally we got inside the restaurant with another line...we ordered our food and then another wait to get seated. 
:(. Not that big of a deal since our food wasn't ready anyway. 

I was so eager to try the Monte Cristo, took the first bite and it was just awesomely delicious! The presentation looks like it'd be sweet but it wasn't. The turkey breast was perfectly cooked - not dry at all! I'm glad I decided to try it, one of the best breakfast item I've ever tried. Yummy yum-yum!!  I'd like to come back here and try the Dungeness Crab Benedict. 

pros:
*good food
*good service 

cons:
*Long wait, but worth it
*Very small restaurant 

FYI:
*cash or debit only
*breakfast served until 11am, except monte Cristo is served all day
author: Keycee D.

description:
Wow....


Wow wow wow wow! Worth the wait in line! Super friendly staff! Line does move fairly fast for how small the place is! The monte cristo is to die for!
author: clayton h.

description: WOW, LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  All 6 of us enjoyed every bite. Amazingly friendly staff and the food is just out of this world!! We waited for an hour and half this past Sunday.... worth every min!!!
author: Suruchi R.

description: One of my all time favorite brunch places to go in San Francisco! I always get their bay shrimp Benedict, I personally think its the best one of all the Benedicts that I tried from their menu. But yes, I love benedicts and I definitely recommend getting it when you come here! Also I advise coming the last hour before closing for those of you who don't like to wait in the long line, since the line usually dies down around that time.
author: Christopher G.

description: As most other comments already mentioned, even we had to wait in an hour long queue to get in. The food was pretty good, no complaints. But, not worth the wait, it's a little over hyped and I've been to other breakfast joins as good which haven't had that wait. The crab benedict and chocolate crumble were the best dished we tried, we also had the salmon scramble, papa's omelette, mama's smoothie and chocolate cinnamon French toast. About $25/head for a good breakfast.
author: Sreekanth V.

description:
When time is of the essence, waiting 90 minutes in line may not workout for everybody; otherwise, the wait is well worth it. The food is amazing and may even bring back some childhood memories.

So the process starts by standing in line for 90 minutes (from the blue awning). Once you are inside, you will form another line to order and have your table assigned. This takes about 10 minutes and you'll get a glimpse of the hardworking staff preparing the food.

I had the Famous Monte Cristo which offered a great combination of salt and sweet but had very little protein. Mama's buttermilk pancakes made up for it: their pancakes are a fluffy piece of heaven. If that wasn't enough to satisfy my sweet tooth, the carrot cake made my day: its consistency and level of moistness coupled with a soft and creamy icing were absolutely incredible.

So again, if you have time to spare, you will enjoy a decadent meal and freshly squeezed juice.
author: German M.

description: I came around 1:15pm and there was a short line outside that took around 35 minutes till we ordered. Inside the restaurant was small and charming, there was a nice display of baked goods behind the class of the kitchen. You first wait in line to order your food, then you get seated. It took 15 minutes till our food was there.  I ordered the Swedish French Toast and added berries, the California omelet, and a latte. The food was delicious and the fruit was fresh. Food wise I loved the place, but price wise I didn't really like. I can see myself coming back to this place if I'm near the location. Try it out!
author: Sam T.

description:
As the Dos Equis dude would say, "There's a time to seek interesting. That time is always."  

Stay hungry, my friends. 

There seems to be an idolization of their breakfast menu here. Not only was I intrigued by Mama's popularity, but I was also charmed by the Mama's Cristo sandwich $11.95, served here (Roasted turkey breast, honey baked ham, apples, Havarti and cheddar battered in egg and grilled, served with their homemade jam).  The Mama's Cristo is essentially the savory and sweet version of their Famous Monte Cristo sandwich. 

I made sure to blanket each bite of my Mama's Cristo with Tabasco and their homemade jam. In regards to their homemade jam, I have to admit that I appreciated its delicate sweetness. I generally stay away from jams due to overwhelming sweetness, but I highly recommend slathering on the homemade jam from here, because it's not too sweet. 

Though the famed Mama's Cristo was pretty interesting, I wasn't blown away. I also had the opportunity to try the Smoked Salmon Scramble $13.25 that my fiancé ordered (smoked salmon, red onion, capers, and roasted tomatoes).  There was a generous amount of salmon in the scramble, which was really nice. The cream cheese served with the bagel that comes with this dish, could have been incorporated in the scramble for additional flavor dimension---but that's just a preference. 

Overall, we agreed that our experience was satisfactory, but nothing would urge us to visit again, by choice, especially since their lines can get unbearably long. Ultimately, it's one of those places you don't love, but you don't hate.
author: Merica S.

description: I had an amazing experience at Mama's On Washington Square. We went around 10am and there was long but the line moved quickly. The food was very good. I got the Washington Square Omelet and loved every bite! The coffee was good and the wait staff was attentive our needs. I would recommend and go again hands down.
author: Myette S.

description:
I had very high expectations for this place because I've heard so much about it and have been wanting to try it for years. Given that, my review of this place is probably skewed. 

Mama's Cristo- 7.5/10 it was good but I didn't see what the hype was about
Salmon olmelette- 5/10 wasn't the best because it was open faced and not stuffed like their other omelettes. It was a little dry and the portion was also small.
author: Allison L.

description:
We Loved it! I took my husband out for Breakfast this morning for his birthday. Reading reviews we knew in advance the wait would be 1-2 hours we tried to get here sooner. We ended up waiting 1hr 45min. Was worth it? Yes! I prepared myself had a cup of coffee in one hand and smile on face. Some things are really worth the wait. To better help your self be Happy about it! Come with anticipation Enjoy your food! 
Food was Amazing!
author: Hannah P.

description: Wow, wow, wow! We checked this place out, finally! We waited about 45 minutes and it was so worth it. I ordered the famous monte cristo and it was to die for!! The orange juice was also sooo fresh and delicious. Go here, today. You will love it. Thank you mama's!!
author: Steph L.

description: I brought my sister and my 1 year old daughter here. The best customer service from Alice and Lily! My daughter was crying because she was hungry and Alice and lily were so accommodating to me and my daughter and her needs while waiting in line. They gave her a small bowl of fruit to keep her occupied. It's the little things that count. I appreciate it more then you know! Thank you
author: Maria N.

description: Waiting outside for 30 mins to eat was just the beginning,  as we approached the front door to  enter the Restaurant we were kindly greeted by a friendly gentlemen, and he gave us a quick rundown of the menu and what choices of breads that were used for there french toast. I ordered the omlet with banana pancakes to wash it down,  which hit the spot to say the least. I can go on and on, but in the end this spot is a gem in it's self. I love visiting Frisco and hopefully in the future I'll return and get to sample the rest of there eclectic menu...
author: Rich G.

description:
Very unorthodox how their process is.. you have to stand in line outside in order to get into the restaurant, then they let you in to stand in another line to order food. After we ordered, they told us they would seat us when they had a table available... after having been standing for 15 minutes, we finally got seated. 
Despite this odd process, I would have to say that the food was WELL worth it! Everyone in my party was super satisfied with their selection and we each sampled a bit of everything that was ordered. Everything was very delicious. I had the crab cakes Benedict which was perfect. They had a homemade raspberry jam that was to die for. My fiancé had the south of the border omelet with chorizo and black beans and all I have to say is.. OMG!!! The fresh squeezed orange juice was really refreshing. And a member of our party got the carrot cake that we all picked off of.. it was delightfully moist and the frosting was very sweet and creamy.
The ambience of this place is very "Grandma's kitchen"; an incredibly cozy and "feel good" atmosphere. I love the big windows and how bright it is in the restaurant. I'll remember this little gem the next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Leah L.

description:
I'm salivating just thinking about mama's cristo. There's always a wait here, but it's totally worth it. It also gives you sometime to chat with whoever you're with as you're waiting. Or spend some time in your phone. Whatever you're into. 

I actually thought the wait wasn't too bad on a Saturday morning (about 45 mins). But their monte cristo is worth a 2 hour wait in my opinion. Such good food and great service.
author: Andy H.

description:
3 words. Worth. The. Hype.
Actually, worth the 90 minutes from when we joined the line to getting our food too.

I've wanted to visit Mama's for what feels like a lifetime with 2 failed attempts already I wasn't going to leave San Francisco after my most recent visit without getting something, anything from Mama's and 1:20pm After a Sunday Morning at the Escape from Alcatraz Triathlon I hauled ass with my Husband and a Girlfriend in tow to wait in line eagerly looking in through the window drooling. The wait outside actually went fairly quickly then we moved inside where we could see the food being prepared a little better and time seemed to stand still, I was mesmerized by the Chefs working away making delicious creations of epic food porn proportions. 

The place is small, with an open glass kitchen and all of the food lined up for you to see, my friend was pretty excited to see a huge bowl of fresh Crab which they use to make the Crab Cakes for the Benedict (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=dXuyUxEWojp46j-Iu-YTMg&userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA), there is also a very impressive selection of Breads and Fruits which pleased me greatly. Anyhow, you order at the register then are seated once a table becomes available and no sooner had we been seated our food arrived.

I opted for the  Egg's Benedict and an additional slice of French Toast (yes, I'm greedy like that) and I love that they will do individual slices for you, you just need to ask. My Egg's were cooked perfectly with a rich creamy Hollandaise sauce  and House Potatoes. The only thing I wasn't so keen on was that the Muffin was on the hard side, down to the fact hat it is toasted on the grill. It wasn't so hard that it wasn't edible but should I return I will ask to have it not toasted. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=zI-dTYkNdc5-KhucO6fmJA&userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA)

My French Toast was also delicious, more like Cake than Toast, very soft with great flavors and there is also Jam on the table to add to it if you wish (something I recommend) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=fJcUIJhULrcefXsRJoTelg&userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA)

Both of my dining companions both enjoyed their meal too, My Husband ordered the Burger with a Fried Egg (I know, a Burger at a Breakfast place) and was about 80% eaten by the time I finished taking pictures so I guess that means He was either really hungry or it was really good. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=8fWtpYQnUuDmXSSckeBCvQ&userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA) My friend also agree'd when I mentioned I was glad I choose to go. Truly a San Francisco gem.
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
OMG the line here is RIDICULOUS and the parking is even worse (took us 30mins to find parking). Avoid driving in this area! I've been wanting to try Mama's for the longest time and whenever I pass by there's always a long line. Once you're at the front of the line outside, you think you'll be seated, NOPE the line continues inside. I'm not sure why but they leave the tip at the table even though they seated a new group. I noticed that they consistently do it and they take the tip when the waitress takes your order. 

I ordered the Monte Cristo, which is the most popular here for $12.95. I was skeptical about the strawberry jam with this but was pleasantly surprised that it went really well together! Don't be fooled! This is quiet heavy so it will fill you up! Definitely a must try! The line and parking here is just too painful so it will be awhile til I come back here.
author: Sherry Y.

description: Amazing food! The portions are huge and delicious. I strongly recommend you come early though because the wait is extremely long. If you want to come when it opens you need to be there an hour before they open to get a seat immediately. Worth the wait though.
author: Julian S.

description:
Yelp users weren't kidding about the wait and hype of this place! Our party of six arrived on a Tuesday at 10:30AM and the line was stretched up half the block. We ended up waiting close to two hours before finally getting seated. 

The venue is teeny tiny but very cute! Homey and clean, they make anything from pastries to full on breakfast sandwiches. A menu is passed around to guests while they wait in line so decide what you want! They take your order before they seat you. The MUST to get is the Monte Cristo. They make it perfectly that it will melt in your mouth when you take a bite out of it and their homemade jam is absolutely delicious! 

Service is quick and staff are very friendly, checking on you enough times where it doesn't feel like they've abandoned your table but not too much were you feel overwhelmed. Venue is definitely a must try! I would highly suggest getting there super early- even before they open if you want to out beat the ridiculous line.
author: Cendy C.

description: Long wait but DEFINITELY worth it . This is a must place to go to when hitting up San Francisco. Give them a try and you won't regret it.
author: Michael C.

description:
4 1/2 rating for the food.

1 rating for extremely long wait, the tiny bathroom, no credit cards taken, dirty kichen floor, tight sitting arrangements.

Waitress was nice and the owner friendly.

Cristo "sandwich" (tasted like deluxe French toast), the chicken sandwich and potato salad were tasty.

Prices (for San Francisco) were fair.

Is the extremely long wait worth it? Depends on you and your personality. Some see Mama's as a San Fran "experience."

Me? Although the food was good Mamas is in an area of many excellent restaurants (especially Italian) and so I'll not come here again unless my wife insists (it was her 2nd time here).
author: Vic M.

description: Finally had the chance to come here without waiting in the line from hell. I got the shrimp omelette special. When I got it I think they thought the shrimp  where out to Sea, My plate was swimming in water.   Over all the place was clean service was professional and polite.
author: Tosh H.

description: The line looks extremely long but it goes quicker than expected and so worth it. Efficient service and good drinks. 10/10 recommend but try and get there early.
author: Emilee R.

description:
Nothing else can be added that hasn't been said. A MUST see in SF. Enjoy! 

Btw- grab a lemonade and a crumb cake while you wait!
author: Erdal A.

description: Amazing breakfast! Great quality food and wonderful service! Had the Dungeness Crab Benedict
author: Davey A.

description: The customer service is terrible. Their food is good but that does not make up for a 1 hour 45 minute wait that is met by another 30 minutes because the cashier chose to flirt with a group of 18 year old girls rather than prioritize people who could have been accommodated right away. They need better management and more organization. I will not be returning. There are so many other amazing brunch places in San Francisco you're much better off going to.
author: Nicole Y.

description:
Mama's is a solid breakfast place, but go early... or later!

Mama's is a cute little mom and pop shop located right in the middle of historic North Beach. The decor is classic and feels authentic. The food is solid and is easily some of the better breakfast in SF! However, the facilities are on the smaller side so there is typically a line to eat. The line moves quickly, but if you are going between the hours of 9-11 ish, expect to wait about an hour. I would recommend getting out early or going late. The food is a mix of classic American breakfast comfort with a dash of North Beach originality! The Monte Cristo is one of the more famous dishes here, but I also recommend the chocolate banana French toast! 

Overall, check this place out, but try not to stand in line.
author: Mitchell B.

description: BEST BREAKFAST EVER! We got the French toast and the monte cristo. It was all great but the monte cristo is to die for. Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had, if you're going there it's a must to try
author: Melissa M.

description:
I really don't think that I would ever get in line again for this place. I waited an hour to get in the restaurant and another 30 minutes to get seated because they were unorganized. After that I had to wait another 30 minutes for my food, although, I already ordered while waiting for our table. I ordered:

The Classic Benedict ($12.95): Very disappointing and the potato tasted like it was undercook. The ham had a really weird texture, but the egg and english muffin was good.

Blackstone Benedict ($12.95): If you want to order the Benedict, I would recommend this one. The bacon was really crispy and was perfect with the Benedict. Potato was still horrible tho.

Our Famous Monte Cristo ($12.95): THIS IS AMAZING. The first bite was like meh, its okay. Then you take another bite and OMG it is so good. The jam was so good with it. The bread was sweet and the inside was savory. Went really well together.

Finally, the question is, would I get in line again? HECK NO. Maybe, unless I really want the Monte Cristo, but besides that HELL NO. Not worth it. The place is super unorganized and a waste of my time.
author: Irene Z.

description: Service was ok - cashier didn't look at our faces until she had to take our order. Also, they don't take credit cards - definitely lost points with us. The food was good, but not great. Lucky us that we went there late, so we didn't have to wait for too long. I honestly didn't understand what is the big deal about this place.
author: Sue V.

description: I don't know we're to begin - came this morning at 7:30 and waited an house and half to get my seat. Initially I started to wonder why the hell all this wait for egg and toast. However, when I put the first piece of French toast in my mount, I just did not know what I really did  where the hell the flavors are coming from? Do they add CRACK? I will definitely come again.
author: The Food L.

description: Excellent breakfast. I had the French roasts, very fluffy. All ingredients are fresh. Be prepared to wait in line. We waited almost an hour. Worth it.
author: Sai L.

description: Like every other reviewer we waited for about an hour & were really excited for our food! I ordered the salmon Benedict and the French toast sampler. The Benedict was good but not the best I've had, the hollandaise had a bit to much lemon but nothing to complain about. Also sadly, the potatoes that came with it were undercooked. The vanilla latte was spot on with taste & presentation. The French toast sampler was delicious, but the banana nut was the best one! The server was super sweet & helpful. Overall, it was a great breakfast but not one worth waiting an hour in the rain for.
author: Vera L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday around 9:30am and still had to wait about 1 hour and 15 mins to get in. Please note there is also a line inside so its not just what you see outside! The place is small and it seems SUPER touristy ( but maybe thats because I came here on a Tuesday morning. 

Things we ordered:
Monte Cristo - This was a solid dish; bread, ham, cheese. I mean what is there not to like about it?! I wouldn't say anything stood about it but I would order again 
Banana Pancakes- I got the Banana Pancakes with the seasonal berries. Probably the best pancakes I have had in a while they were perfect!
Piaso Benedict- The Benedict had pancetta and red and yellow bell peppers. We could have definitely done with out this dish. Eggs was cooked to perfection but besides that everything else was just whatever. Also potatoes on the side were good not great they had a tad bit of a burnt flavor to them.

Overall i wasn't mad about the meal but is the wait worth it? I really don't think so you can go else where but I would recommend going once!
author: Eileen H.

description:
In resolve food and VERY friendly service. the
Monte cristo sandwich was amazing because the jam was incredible!!! Worth the wait, get there early!
author: Danielle C.

description: Believe all the hype, because this place is AWESOME. The line of course isn't great, but it shows that people are willing to wait 1-2 hours for amazing breakfast/brunch/lunch and that it's worth it. I am so glad we waited an hour on a Tuesday morning to eat at mama's because it was my favorite meal while in San Fran on vacation. Sampler French toast was on point, monte cristo was delicious, and the apple pan dore was to die for. Not much more to say except you need to eat here!
author: Liz J.

description: Its been a bit since I have been here. Its just as good as I remembered . Cant go wrong with anything on the menu, but be prepared to wait for a table
author: Cyndi L.

description: I spent $50 on brunch here for myself to test out the raving reviews. The Dungeness Crab egg dishes are definitely over rated. However their famous Monte Cristo is SUPERB. I'd get that again and again. Unfortunately the long lines in the mornings are ridiculous and not worth the wait if it's over 45 minutes. I arrived on a Saturday at 7:30am and was the last one to make it in their first "rush" of ordering/seating.
author: Eden W.

description:
I'm not the first to point out that the ingredients that make up french toast, pancakes, omelettes, and eggs Benedict do not add up to $$-$$$, and yet people still pay it, and line up for about an hour prior to forking over said $$. It is delicious and when you make your own, the results usually are not restaurant quality. Even if yours are restaurant quality, it is still a pain to wash all the dishes.
I'm not one to line up for brunch or breakfast. I'm not a morning person. So Mr. Joy had the brilliant idea to dine at Mama's close to closing time, around 3PM, in hopes that we wouldn't have to compete with the brunch crowd. We still had to wait about 40 minutes, but it was a nice day, so it wasn't too bad hanging out under the green awning. Once you step into the cozy little diner, you order at the counter where all the fresh baked goods are lined up. They only take cash or debit card.
The thing about Mama's is you pay before you are seated. Some leave a cash tip on the table on their way out. So when we sat down at our table, there was a $10 tip, which I handed to the waitress. What would you do if you found cash just lying around on the table? Honestly, I was tempted to use it as my own tip.

$6.25 Mama's Smoothie - bananas, berries, orange juice, yogurt, honey:
Mr. Joy heard good things about the smoothie, and wanted to give it a try. It was sweet, a little thick, with some seed texture throughout, so it was not a bad smoothie. But I thought the ingredients were very simple, and easy to make with a blender, so the price is too steep for me.

$12.95 Monte Cristo - roasted turkey breast, honey baked ham, cheddar & gruyere cheese battered in egg, grilled, served w/ homemade jam:
Of course I had to try the the amazing Monte Cristo sandwich as I am a fan of French sandwiches. It was beautifully plated with 4 thick triangle sandwiches, each one made up of 3 slices of battered bread. The middle slice in each sandwich makes the Monte Cristo. The plate was dusted with a little powdered sugar and accompanied with potatoes and fresh fruit. The sandwich was so fluffy and lightly crisped up on the outside. I actually thought it could have used more turkey, to balance out the carb to protein ratio, but I'm always in favor of more meat. After finishing that sandwich, I definitely felt like I had consumed enough carbs for the whole day. The jam helped me chew through all the bread, while also adding a sweet component.

$11.95 Blueberry Pancakes:
I'm not a huge fan of pancakes, but these are some very moist and fluffy pancakes. It was satisfying to cut into the fresh blueberries embedded in the pancakes.

$4.95 Spicy Italian Sausage:
This sausage was halved and flattened out, almost looking like a sausage patty. Delicious.

The prices at Mama's are not bad compared to most brunch places with long waits. I'd still like to try the crab Benedict or pick up some freshly baked items from the Bake Shop. So perhaps one day I'll return for brunch in the afternoon, which is when I usually have my first meal on weekends.
author: Joy W.

description:
Omg the lines on the weekends are about the same as weekdays. What are people doing to wait this long for the food? 

Oh yeah, it's pretty good food. I mean I wouldn't lie and say that this isn't a tourist location because it is. 

This time around since we came on the weekend we had to get the actual crab instead of the crab cakes like I had last time. 

It's expensive but worth. I love crab and they definitely piled it on. For $30 dish, they made sure I felt like I got $30 worth of crab. The Benedict which I ordered was great! The omelette which one of the people I came with got, was also great with avocado and crab yum!  The other people in our groups got other omlettes also looked great! 

It's like you can't go wrong here. 

Pro tip: just be ready to wait but the food is pretty worth it. And the wait isn't bad with some awesome friends.
author: Nina Y.

description:
First I should say, this is definitely a touristy spot. That being said, I am a San Francisco tourist and this place was worth it.

We had to arrive before the restaurant opened to get on line. The line was already half way down the block. Luckily we got in when it opened and had such a fantastic meal.

The French toast sampler was amazing and so were the eggs. They make jam homemade which was also out of this world. If I lived in San Francisco and if the line wasn't so long this would definitely be in my regular brunch rotation.
author: Gina M.

description:
Please come to LA!
I always have to stop by Mama's on Washington Square every time I come up to the Bay Area.  I'm always recommending this spot to my friends whenever they come up to SF. MUST ORDER their famous Monte Cristo, it is by far the best Monte Cristo EVER. It's fluffy and packed full of flavor! French Toast Sampler was perfection too (& I usually don't like french toast) And you can never go wrong with their Omelettes or Benedicts! Benedicts have a goood and creamy hollandaise sauce with a side of potatoes too!

The wait is terrifying, however once you order, been seated, and took a bite of their food - you will know it was all worth it. I've waited 1.5 hours everytime I came and I don't regret it at all. The place is small and has a home-y feeling. A true gem with great service!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Terrible experience encountering a very disrespectful individual who's suppose to be working as a host, but in reality treating people definitely not the way they may like to be treated.  I have taken a picture and I hope someone take responsibility and do something if you still care about the reputation of this place!

The reason I wrote this because I truly love this place and wants it to be always great as its menu!

Regards
author: Samuel M.

description:
They weren't joking when they said there's a line. We skipped this place two days in a row because the line was so long (hours). If you want to experience breakfast at Mama's, plan on arriving 30 minutes before they open and you'll be seated with the first "group" allowed in the restaurant.

The food is fantastic and the portions are huge. I recommend sharing an omelette and ordering a slice of any one of their delicious freshly baked speciality breads (banana, blueberry, lemon and berry... the list goes on).
author: Brooks A.

description: Be sure to order something you like. I'm not a patient person, and I refuse to stand in line for restaurants (especially when the sun is beating on me), but WOW. The wait was about an hour, arrive early to try to beat the long line as much as possible. I ordered the breakfast sandwich with bacon instead of ham and it was amazing. The Orange juice was fresh and added a good touch to the sandwich. Def worth the wait.
author: Christopher K.

description: It's worth the wait! Every time I come to sf I make sure to pick a day to get up and come here, I've had the benedict, french toast, monte cristo, and amazing fresh squeezed oj. It's small inside but it makes you feel so exclusive!
author: Mariah R.

description: Amazing food and sweet little place with great service and clean staff. Wait if about 1.5 hrs was worth it !
author: Nimmi M.

description:
Crazy-long wait!  Tuesday at 10:40 - an hour wait in line outside, to finally be let in thru the front door ... and then stand in another line to order our food?  Twenty minutes later we reach the cashier only to find out that they are out of their famous house-made brioche for the Klugelhopf (french toast)!  Devastating!! 

Shared the "Washington Square M'omelette" instead (Spicy Italian Sausage, Bell Pepper, Tomatoes and allegedly some Hot Pepper Jack Cheese, which was largely absent until the very last bite), with a side of bacon and a tiny slice of coffee cake ... but the excitement of our mid-week dining foray had been killed by the extremely long wait and the lack of any warning that they were out of the item we came for.  Don't get me wrong - the food was very very good - fresh and tasty ... but the bottom line is that, for us, the wait simply wasn't worth it.  It was still only breakfast.

Hint:  Have someone from the restaurant talk to the line once in awhile, maybe offer coffee or juice while waiting???
author: Brian B.

description: Get here at least 30 mins before they open to be one of the first people seated, they only have seating for 36 people. Everything that I have had here has been amazing and made from scratch. Definitely worth the wait outside. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Have been going here for years and will continue to.
author: Hailey S.

description:
After reading all the positive reviews for Mama's, I knew I couldn't leave SF without trying it!  I was drooling over all the pictures and knew we had to order the Famous Monte Cristo!  It was unbelievably good!!!  I loved dipping it in the homemade jam with real fruit pieces!  I couldn't decide between the French Toast sampler or the Dungeness Crab Benedict.  I settled on the French Toast Sampler.  It came with a regular piece of french toast, cranberry-orange and I think a banana french toast.  All of them were good but I liked the banana one the most.  

The wait on a Saturday morning was 1.5 hour!  The Monte Cristo is worth the wait!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Very good place to eat came here with my family enjoyed our food. The servers are great
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Definitely great service and delicious food!

Always get the orange juice! I got the Scrambled Florentine and my boyfriend got their famous Monte Cristo and oh my! It was extremely satisfying! Get there early to beat the long lines!

The only unsettling thing was the bugs flying around the exposed bread.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I had a delicious breakfast, I was there before the restaurant opened, you let me in the side door to use the restroom I waited for the current occupant to leave as they have one bathroom a man in employee came out of the bathroom and went downstairs under the restaurant that employee pissed all over the toilet seat !! What kind of brand asshole employee would piss on the only toilet seat in the restaurant it was pretty disgusting
author: Gordon M.

description: Delicious, but long line with little room inside. Waited thirty minutes like they said we would, however we still had to wait another thirty inside. We ate the cinnamon chocolate french toast. They were the best! Orange juice was watery though. Lots of waitresses and eyes on deck, but hardly any place to sit and dine. I didn't like eating and feeling like a fish while the line stares in hunger. Great breads. Try the apple crumble . So so good.
author: N R.

description: Homey feel, small space, excellent food. The monte cristo special was to die for! Definitely get this if you come here- it's what they're known for. Worth the two hour wait on a Sunday? Maybe not. But I'd come back very early on a weekend just to get this. The French toast sampler was solid as well- I liked the cranberry orange French toast because it was just the right amount of tangy without being sickeningly sweet.
author: S W.

description:
I was visiting from Miami and a friend told me this was the place to go for breakfast/brunch as I sort of live for that, LOL. 

I was warned about having to make a line outside and when we called we were told it was 1.5 hrs - I said absolutely not, no breakfast (even at The Ritz) is worth that wait. 

Well, my hotel's (The Palace) concierge recommended it and called for us and was told only 25 min wait so we decided to go - it turned out to be a 1 hour wait. 

The place is the size of a large bedroom and it only accommodates about 40 ppl. After 20 minutes in line, I asked my friend to go check bc I didn't want to wait another 40 mins since the line (12-14 ppl in front of us) had barely moved in those 20 mins - restaurant staff assured him it'd be another 20, so to be a good friend I stayed. However, the 20 mins turned into 40 for a total of 60 to just to GET INSIDE the place. 

At this point I think my wait is over but NOPE, now we were afforded the opportunity to make the INSIDE LINE in front of register to ORDER the FOOD before u are even able to get a table (they close by 3pm BTW). 

They had a selection of scrambles & omelettes but none included a simple ham, cheese and mushrooms omelette/scramble. However, upon request they said sure, no problem, except no American cheese, it had to be cheddar. 

I asked for my omelette SOFT and so did my friend - it's a big deal to me; I hate omelettes that are so overcooked that they are literally a sponge you can use as a cushion - for a place that ONLY makes breakfast you'd think this be a simple and run of the mill request - well, it wasn't; we had about another 10 people after us while we were making the line, and half of them got served their food before our, apparently very complicated, order was brought over. 

Guess what? The omelette was so OVERCOOKED and hard we could have used it as a frisbee. Instead though, they used it as a Mexican tortilla and inside of it I had what seemed like a 'tumor' of leg ham and mushrooms - disproportionately big - they had made burritos out of our omelettes - And it was swimming in ham and mushroom juices. At this point the 'server' asks if it's OK, to which I said: I asked for a soft omelette and you gave me a burrito, so no, it's not OK.

Because I figured they wouldn't be able to do a decent soft omelette again, I told him to turn it into a SOFT scramble. 

Well, that took another 15 minutes, and which by then they had ensured to serve everyone in the restaurant, before my apparently OVERLY COMPLEX SOFT SCRAMBLE showed up. 

For shock factor, they had separated all ingredients, because apparently it's unheard of that if you ask for scrambled eggs with ham, cheese and mushrooms, they are not to be scrambled and cooked together. 

Sever asked if that's what I meant, and I blew a gasket (internally) so I said no, but that I'd work with it because I didn't have another 15 minutes to wait for scrambled eggs. It came with a baguette that I'm guessing was supposed to be toasted, but they did it in the grill and it tasted of animal fat, because the ham they use is leg ham, not deli ham - yuck - I'm Cuban, so I know all about leg ham, and it's always disgusting. It's not something you want in your breakfast. 

By this point the OVERLY PACKED little restaurant was pretty much empty. 

The food was, at best, standard in flavor and texture. I don't know what is everyone's effing drama about going to the place and putting up with such ridiculous waits to get an average breakfast at best - are the standards that low in San Fran? It's just a freaking run-of-the-mill breakfast place. 

I honestly would have enjoyed ANYTHING from Denny's WAAAYYYY more - their stuff, is better crafted, has more texture and flavor - and I'm a discerning eater - and I wouldn't hesitate choosing Denny's over this place a 100 times over. 

So to summarize I'd say: Save yourself the MAMA DRAMA and leave the mommy issues for your real mama, LOL.
author: Carlos P.

description:
This place is great! I was recommended trying this place out by a friend and I am so glad that I did! The wait does get pretty long, but luckily we got there before there was any line...when we left, the line was down the street (eeks!). 

The food here is delicious! I still think about the homemade jam they give out on every table...I wish I could have bought some to take back to Chicago with me (yummm!). The place itself is very small, cute, and homey. I got the huevos rancheros and we got a side of pancakes to share between my friend and I. I left very satisfied and craving more! Can't wait to go back to this place :) Also - there are quite a few vegetarian options, so can keep going back and trying different things!!
author: Priya S.

description:
Not worth the 1 hr wait time in line along w/ the additional 30 minutes for the food to hit the table.

The French toast was pure hype. We ordered the sampler which comprised of 3 slices of battered toast. In short, only the cinnamon bread was decent. Didn't care for the cranberry orange nor the banana nut...they were soggy. My breakfast sandwich was ok. The yolk was perfectly runny but the potatoes were somewhat underdone. The hot links plate was meh. Typical but nothing extraordinary. I originally wanted to get the Spanish Eggs Benedict as pictured by another review but they advised it was a special and couldn't make it.

Their bathroom is located in the back. It's cramped but clean. The water was scalding hot not matter which way you turned the handle. Jeez.

3 items and a juice totaled $45. They don't accept credit cards. Only cash or debit over the amount of $15.
author: Julie L.

description: We came to visit San Francisco for memorial weekend as a gift to my girlfriend and brothers, we use to live here and enjoyed all the activities and food culture here but other than wanting to be in the city and visit pier 39 we stumbled upon Mama's on Washington square. And just like everyone says....expect a wait. It's not one of those waits were you get in and it wasn't great, but a wait where you get there, eat, then realize the wait was well worth. I had the French toast cinnamon swirl and that was complimented with some nice fruits on top, all I can say is this was by far a good highlight for our trip back home.
author: Stephen P.

description: When I used to live in SF about 5 years ago, I was aware of how popular this place was for breakfast. Since then I recently went to Mama's on Tuesday morning and even my foodie brother recommended coming here. It's definitely over-hyped but with that being said, everything about the place is charming and the food is good. The Chocolate French Toast was very delicious and nicely presented. My boyfriend's poached eggs were a bit watery but he did enjoy his meal. Overall, it's not worth waiting in line for 1 hour for unless you don't mind and we didn't mind doing so because we weren't starving and we knew how long to expect before committing to this place for brunch. Are there other places in SF that are just as good or better? Yes! But now I can say I ate at Mama's and the service was on point even though they are non-stop busy. I do feel like by the time I ate my breakfast I was done within 5 minutes and felt guilty for staying longer to digest because more people were in line eager to eat. This sense of urgency kind of ruined the experience for me. Much respect for the BOH and FOH for keeping the environment cheery and on point. And don't forget to bring a debit card or cash!
author: Tere V.

description: Went to Mama's on a September Saturday at 7:50am - only had to wait until about 8:45 to get in.  The classic eggs and salmon scramble were solid, not the best, not the worst.  The Cranberry Orange French Toast is what stood out at Mama's - I would highly recommend the French toasts options as they are worth the wait, not the classic breakfast options.  Enjoy!
author: Kel V.

description:
We waited in line for a solid hour and half (Saturday at 10:45) in unusually hot weather for San Francisco. The wait staff were nice and checked on the queue pretty often; you can order coffee, juice, or a smoothie while waiting in line as well as browse the menu to expedite the process (not that it really helps).

Once we ordered and were seated, our food came pretty quickly. The iced lattes were the best part, IMO. I have never tasted anything so delicious. I'm a huge coffee fan, could live off cappuccinos, but I'm not big on drinking milk cold. This was phenomenal.

I had the Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict, and it was pretty "meh." I'd give this 2 stars. My friend loved his Smoked Salmon Scramble. He actually chose it from a yelp picture while we were in line and was dead-set on it, even with all the other menu options.

If there was an option to just pop in for an iced latte, I'd come back, but there isn't. Bummer.
author: Nic Z.

description:
With an average wait time of an hour or more, I was recommended to try Mama's on Washington Square. With cool spring breezes and good company, the 45 minute wait went by quickly. I found myself at the cashier, ready to order my Dungeness Crab Benedict and Monte Cristo sandwich.

I loved the Benedict, the crab was fresh, perfect amount of blanched spinach with house made hollandaise sauce.  

The Monte Cristo is made with turkey breast, ham, gruyere and cheddar cheeses. The sandwich is then dipped in an egg batter and toasted to deliciousness. Both dishes came with herbed potatoes, yum.

To tie it all together, fresh squeezed orange juice!

In my opinion, not worth waiting 30 minutes or more, but yummy nonetheless. 

TIP: a second Mama's to open in October 2015! Keep your eyes out for that!
author: Celina Q.

description:
Very disappointed. Yes, the food was quite good as we had some unique dishes. HOWEVER, we chose it as our out-of-town friends had a mid-afternoon flight to catch and the reviews (on their website and here) spoke about waiting up to a half hour for brunch. Reality alert! After waiting in line on the sidewalk in the hot sun for about 20 minutes I counted about 25 others in front of us and asked the Maitre D how long we should expect to wait: "30 minutes" he said very politely. 

20 minutes later he came out, looked at the line and said "oh no, that's more than 25 so it'll be 45 minutes". Very sincere, nice guy. Charming even. Bottom line? 1-1/2 hours standing out there till we got in the door. And then? Wait again!! You stand in front of the food prep area--for us about 30 more minutes--then finally order. Then they find you a table. 

Brunch came about 20 minutes after we ordered (and were seated).  So it took about TWO HOURS from the time we arrived to get our food. Again, the staff was very polite; the Maitre D was more of an MC as he kept us all entertained some of the time we were waiting. His charm, however, was not what we came for. 

And after all the wait? We noticed a $10 tip left on the table as we were in the inside line. Guess what?  It was a plant!  The bill is moved from vacant table to vacant table, prompting guilt trips for anyone leaving anything less. Yes, the service was good, the food great and we gave them a $10 tip. 

Will never go back; not worth the wait.
author: Laurence K.

description:
Roach alert!!!

So, today, I was in the area with my mom and sister and we decided to grab something to eat. We passed by mama's and there's always a long line at mama's and today there was no line, so I thought perfect! Went inside, third in line and There was no clear direction on seating so I told my mom to sit at an empty table in the corner while I was next to order. About a minute passed, and came up to my mom and told her if she didn't order yet she needed to get out of the seat and told her that she can move to the other side of the store where there's another table that was just about to be cleaned. The approach of the waitress was very rude, and didn't really explain why and told my mom to move. I get that they want people to sit after they order, but there was a lot of open tables so I didn't understand why she forced my mom to move out of this table. I was pretty pissed after this but since we paid for meter, I let it slide. So we ordered the Monte Christo and a French toast sampler. 

The food was alright. Not great. Not bad. It's definitely not worth the wait if there's a line. The Monte Christo was a lot better than the French toast sampler. Flavorful. Pretty good. The French toast was dry, but edible, not the best I've had. Just as we were gonna end our meal, I took a sip of my water and, "BAM", the biggest cockroach I've ever seen. Just crawling on the walls. I was pretty grossed out. I informed my waitress, she told the people behind the register but no one really did anything or apologize to their customers. Overall, it was a pretty disappointing experience for something that's supposedly so good and 4 stars worth. Hope a health inspector comes check this place out again cause I've been to dirtier places but I've never seen a cockroach that big, probably feeding of their food!
author: Clarissa O.

description: The food was great! We got the famous monte cristo, the crab Benedict, and a side of the cranberry orange French toast. All three dishes were fantastic- loved the crunch of the French toast. We got there at 8:30 on Saturday. Only one star off due to the reaaaaalllly long wait (1.5 hours) so come prepared with a fully charged phone to distract yourself while you wait.
author: Jenny D.

description: Excellent long wait, well worth it. Will go every single time I'm in San Fransisco The crumbles are like none other.....yummy 2 the tummy!
author: C V.

description:
San Francisco, CA (NB/Little Italy)

The Tartine Bakery of breakfast joints.

* Monte Cristo - Good, light outside as in not a ton of batter.  Amazing, memorable, no and no.

I'd think if they would pair it with some incredible jam/preserves vs. what it comes with.

Potatoes served with MC are legit.  Not full of gristle/fried bits as some breakfast potatoes end up being too often.

*  Blueberry Crumb Cake - the crumb topping awesome but prefer the blueberry coffee cake from Dotties True Blue Cafe, the "other" breakfast joint in SF.

* Carrot cake with cream cheese frosting/icing - again the topping is the standout.  The cake itself good but not great.

* Drink - Water 

* Second visit in 5 years.  First review.

* Staff - Super friendly.  

* Plain Pancakes - Look fluffy n light but underwhelming.  Pass.

Note:  Get here FIRST Thing in the morning as in 7:30 - 8:00 am.  Today we planned to get there at 10, knowing we would have a wait... Seated 12:24 PM.  

Is it worth the wait - 100% no.  If you can get your behind there first thing in the morning because you're already up, give it a try.  

Overall the food is average at best.  Generous 3 stars from the Tourist in me.  

2.5 rounded up.
author: John C.

description:
This place was amazing!! Worth the wait? Debatable. The wait is reaaaally long. They do try to serve you drinks to pass the time, but we still ended up waiting an hour and a half. 

For breakfast, this place is pretty pricey. However, you have to keep in mind that you are ordering crab and that this place is GREAT. I got the crab benedict, but I have to say that the real highlight of the meal was the blueberry pancakes which were seriously the best I've ever had! 

Overall, I'm glad that I tried this place and it was amazing, but I don't know if I will ever return.
author: Elise K.

description:
Finally got to try this famous breakfast place in the neighborhood. My Bf and I arrived at 7:30 and we were 2nd in line and then the crowd started to build up. 
We ordered Huevos Ranchero and Smoke Salmon scrambled, 2 coffe and a slice of Carrot cake. Food was delicious overall. Total was around $42. They only accept Cash and  debit cards with  min. purchase of $15. 
Will definitely go back again.
author: Kath S.

description:
I came here around 12:30pm on a Tuesday, and the wait for to order and be seated was around an 1hr and 15min wait. Personally, I thought the food was decent/good, but I don't think it was worth the wait.

1. Apple/peach bellini - I really liked the fruitiness of the drink, and I wished they gave refills! I was kind of expecting a bigger drink, but it came in a champagne glass. It's worth a try though.
2. Pancake stack with fresh berries - I really liked the fluffiness of the pancakes, as well as the freshness of the mixed berries. I've been craving pancakes for a while now, and this definitely satisfied it.
3. Northwest omelette - The omelette contains smoked salmon and grilled leeks and is served open faced. I personally thought the omelette was okay and was expecting a lot more. The eggs itself was more flattened than fluffy.

The atmosphere was very cozy and welcoming - it reminded of having breakfast at a relative's house. The staff was friendly.

If I were to come here again, I would definitely try the apple pan dore, Mama's cristo, and the egg benedicts. All in all, it was a better than average brunch place, but I don't think I can justify the long wait in line.
author: Tricia N.

description: Ordered the eggs Benedict with Dungeness crab combo since it's in season. (No.2 on the special menu) It was great. Generous portion of crab meat along with a very well presented eggs Benedict cooked to perfection. Portion was very filling as it came along with potatoes as well. We share the french toast as well which was pretty gd as well. Washed down with a latte. Service was prompt and gd. The down side is the long queue and it's pricey. So if u don't mind to wait and willing to splurge please try it.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
Oh Mama's. More like oh brother. What is the hype of this San Francisco staple? Yes, I understand, show up before 8:00 AM to be the first round getting in or else you'll wait an hour. My experience was poor and overall, the food did not wow me nor disappoint. 

FOOD: I got the Monte Cristo sandwich here with all of these wonderful reviews on yelp. Yes, the sandwich with meat, cheese, with fresh fruit, and homemade jam. All of those things can build to a great brunch, and the food was solid. Nothing superb, but solid. I will say the food is not bad. 

SERVICE: I wondered why I even tipped now looking back. I did not mind the hour and a half wait. We were told in advanced of the wait when my friend and I showed up at 8:15. I get that it is popular, written in travel magazines, what not. I found my service experience to be extremely diminished when I was bullied by the cashier. He asked me where I was from and I told him that I lived in Oakland, only to get a smirky comment about hoping I lived in a "safe part of Oakland". Sorry I can't afford to live in San Francisco! I don't appreciate the ignorance, and left a sour taste in my mouth and into my meal after waiting well over an hour. 

Tl;dr: The food is solid. Only worth it if you're in the first round. My service experience was poor. Not going to subject myself to Mama's again. There are other great brunch places in San Francisco.
author: Albert H.

description:
I've been wanting to try Mama's for a while now, but never went because of the long wait. My friend talked me into going and the wait actually wasn't as long as we thought it would be. Probably because we came on a Wednesday. But the line moved pretty quick. We waited 30-45 min before we were seated.

When you walk in, you go straight to their counter to order & pay. Then choose a table, and they will bring your food and drinks over to you. Service was great so it's always nice to leave a little tip before you leave. Keep in mind they only take cash or debit cards. NO credit cards.

After my friend and I finished our lunch, we both agreed that it was good. But don't understand what the big hype is. I can see that this is a neighborhood gem, but unfortunately I feel it's overrated. The food was good, fresh. But nothing that blew me away. It felt like a casual lunch at a neighborhood cafe. Not worth the wait in my opinion. 

We ordered: 
- Kugelhopf: We heard this is a popular item on their menu so we wanted to try it. It's a big slice of brioche bread so we shared one. It's a thick slice, and fluffy, and served with their homemade jam. It was good, simple. That's about as excited as we felt about it.
- Egg White Scramble: This was our favorite dish. The scramble was very flavorful from the mushrooms and green onions. On the side were slices of tomato and wheat toast. The dish was fresh, tasty, and healthy. 
- The Californian Omlette: This omlette was good, but it was massive and full of cheese. My friend and I had a hard time finishing it because it was pretty heavy from all the cheese, bacon, and avocado. We were happy to try it though. On the side were their grilled potatoes and wheat toast. If you like hearty breakfasts, this is a good dish to get. 

Service was wonderful and the restaurant itself is very cozy and bright. However it wouldn't be my first place to go back to for brunch. Too long of a wait for a simple menu. The food was good, but nothing incredible or memorable.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
No line 2:15 Tuesday.

Was surprisingly unimpressed with my Monte cristo. Tons of tasty bread, pretty tasty ham, but 1 slice each of paper thin turkey and ham were totally lost inside.
author: Tommy G.

description:
Well worth the wait... We waited about 1/2 hr before ordering, food came pretty fast. . Even though there is a wait, there is a method to their madness and it works. 
We ordered the Famous Monte Cristo, The Washington Omelet, carrot cake, latte and oh yeh the Italian sausage .... Glutinous brunch but hopefully won't eat for the rest of the day as we are stuffed. The monte cristo was light, airy and when dipped in blackberry jam was absolutely divine. The omelet was spot on and the potatoes were nice and crispy.  So glad we tried this little gem.
The wait staff very attentive and just great. 
Will definitely return when in the area.
author: Pantea K.

description:
This place has really good brunch.

Came at 11 am on a Friday and waited 1.5 hours to get to the cash register. The staff inside are so welcoming and helpful! We got the french toast sampler, Monte Cristo, dungeness crab benedict, orange juice, and a smoothie. 

The french toast sampler is I think the most unique with different flavors of bread. I loved the crab benedict! I like that they use real crab rather than some processed crab cake. The potatoes were delicious too! Monte Cristo was pretty good. The waiter suggested dipping the french toast in jam. The jam is homemade and uses real fruit! It's fresh and delicious. The orange juice and smoothie were also good and fresh, but not a must-have in my opinion.

I liked the atmosphere in the store. The kitchen display by the cashier is like eye candy that sets you up and makes you look forward to the meal. The lighting is nice and the restaurant is cute and cozy.

I was lucky and found street parking right in front that was valid for two hours. We finished eating just in time.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Lindsey is an asshole, she's the cashier for this place, 3 tables that were behind us sat first when we told her what what's going on she replied, I know what I'm doing and you were not next, even one of the tables told us she can have some attitude because you guys were right you were before us we even told the server when she sat us. She looks unhappy working here, I mean at least do you're job right you're the first face we see. Wouldn't came here again at least whiles she works there.
author: Karla J.

description: Food was the most delicious I've ever had! On top of that, everyone was so nice, pleasant, and efficient.  Just a wonderful experience altogether. Will definitely come back during my next SF visit!
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Believe the hype my friends, because Mama's definitely lives up to it all. As expected, there was a huge line out the door when we visited, but thankfully we had friends who reserved a spot for us on the line so our wait time wasn't too bad. On a regular day however, expect to wait an hour to get in the door, and another 15-30 minutes to order and get a seat. Huge props to the cashier for the killer service. While we were waiting for seats to open up, he kept us entertained with stories and interesting facts about Mama's. We had a fun conversation with him and he made sure we weren't bored the whole time.  

I'm OK waiting for good food, cause all of it just adds to the excitement, anticipation and the experience. If you're looking for a quick bite to eat, this isn't the place for you. 

The place has a very quaint feel to it, as it has been around for a very long time. The selection they have is crazy! A lot of their menu also involves fresh seafood, which I'm looking to try next time I return. Also heard they have great benedicts. We visited in the morning, so initially we were worried they wouldn't serve the Monte Cristo (the menu says they only start serving the sandwiches at 11), but thankfully they were serving it at the time.

----
*Mama's Famous Monte Cristo - I gotta say, this sandwich is honestly one of the tastiest meals I have ever eaten in my entire life. I have never tasted anything like it before. It's the kind of sandwich that makes you ponder life and wonder what you've been missing out on all this time. They make it so that the turkey, honey glazed ham and Gruyere cheese are sealed inside the French toast bread. The sandwich is divided into four and comes with a side of jam (freshly made jam, none of that packet stuff). Every bite is fluffy and soft, until you get to the center of the sandwich and feel the gooey cheese and savory ham and turkey melt in your mouth. The jam adds a whole other level of tartness to the sandwich. Together, the whole thing is just a perfect blend of flavors. 
-----

I also tried some of Mama's Breakfast Burger, which was a daily special on the menu, but I don't think I've had enough of it to write a remember much or write a review about it. I do remember it being very delicious though.

Overall, I love this place. It definitely gives off a quaint and home-like atmosphere, and serves great brunch food without sacrificing its integrity. Mama's dishes feel like they've been made with care, and their service is awesome. I was happy to wait for my awesome experience at Mama's and I'll do it again given the chance.
author: Mari U.

description:
SO I have never heard of this place until yesterday morning when my man wanted some good breakfast spot so we yelped few places and decided to go here. We got here at 1145am on Saturday and were not seated until 230pm so if math is not your strong side that is 2 hours and 45min in line. Just like people have mentioned you wait in line, you go inside and wait more in line to order, you get seated and the food gets brought to you, after that you will need to ask for water, coffee and tea refill because it will not happen on its own. Service needs to step up its game. 
The food...we ordered the scrambled salmon for $12 or so it was ok and the bagel that it came with was dense and not all that good, the monte cristo for $15 was good but the raspberry jam that it was brought with was the bomb, my banana walnut toast that was $12 was ok, the banana bread was on a dry side and it could have been more moist. I was under the impression that the baked goods were baked there but they are not, they come in a package. 
The prices are high, for 3 items, tea, ice tea and 2 to go crumb cakes we paid $60. 
The old fashion crumb cake, small I might ad  for $4.50 was dry but the apple crumb cake was off the hook - super moist and just incredible. 

Would I come back for the food - no
Would I come back for the prices - no way 
Would I come back for the line - hells no.

First and the last time.
author: Magda G.

description: Honestly, not a fan. This place is so hyped up I really wanted to try it while we were in town. We walked here from our hotel, only to find a GIANT line. By then, I was already committed since we had walked from our hotel. The line took TWO HOURS. Seriously, two hours. For two hours, I was expecting the most amazing breakfast I've ever put in my mouth, which it was not. It was pretty good, but nowhere near close to two hours good. Little overpriced due to the hype. Items we tried were hot chocolate, French Toast sampler, Blackstone Benedict, and Silver Dollar pancakes. All of it was just average. If the line were 15 minutes, I might eat here again. Overall, just completely and totally average and therefore a little disappointing.
author: Lauren E.

description:
DISCLAIMER: I did not have to wait at all for a table. 

It's crazy reading these reviews and seeing all the pictures of the wait you have to get in this place, If it was me, I don't think I'd have the patience or even feel the want to eat here if it was like that.  But I came to Mama's on a Wednesday at maybe 1p or 2p.

I took an uber here, so parking wasn't really an issue, but since how it's just mainly residential, I can see how it can be a pain. 

The ordering process is done in a window, then you are sat at a table where a server is assigned to you.  It sure does streamline the process of getting your food prepared and also having a table ready for you as soon as your food is done. The first bite of my breakfast sandwich, I though it was WELL worth it, even if there were an hour long wait.  The Bloody Mary's here are also well made.  I'd definitely come back again, but maybe not when I'm too hungry, since I will be anticipating a line next time.
author: Scottie G.

description: If I could leave a 6. This would be it.  the food was great.  The cranberry orange French toast is a must.  The California omelet was perfect.  Remember to bring CASH. They don't accept credit.  The best breakfast is SF for sure.  I hate coming back to the same place twice, BUT, I will for Mama's breakfast !
author: Teresa C.

description: I was sulking yesterday for having brunch at a different place since Mama's closed on Mondays, only to find out that my breakfast here isn't much better than where we went yesterday.  See, that's the power of vox populi. I'm only one little voice among many who whispers, "contrary to popular belief,  food here is just ok". The Californian omelette,  Mama Cristo and Kugelhupf French toast, all left me unimpressed.  The freshly squeezed orange juice was most refreshing. But that's not enough to fall in line for.  By the way, bring cash.
author: Penelope M.

description:
This place is the "go-to" spot for a delicious brunch! My husband and I loves coming here to eat, however when we're really hungry we have to try a different brunch restaurant, which ends up not as being as amazing as Mama's because of Mama's long lines! It just shows how great this place is because the line is always about more than an hour long!

The staff is always so nice! It just amazes me because we have to order at the counter and sit down once a table opens up. How do these waitress always know which food belongs to who? 

My plan was to get the Mama's breakfast sandwich. I got the twice already and I really loved it. It comes with Turkey, 2 eggs, and cheese with a side of house potatoes. However, my husband raved about the Monte Cristo. I decided to give that a try. So we ordered 2 Famous Monte Cristos, lemon and blue berry French toast, one sunny side up egg, and a Bellini. Everything was amazing, however we weren't too excited about the French toast. They used a pound cake instead of regular bread and it made it too sweet. The Monte Cristos on the other hand! Too perfect!! It was sooo delicious!! 

I had to walk out with my pants unbutton, but it was well worth it!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Love this restaurant! There's always a long line, but it's worth the wait. Every single menu item is delicious!!!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Worth the wait... get there early... family owned... portions are quite large... 

If you are not the type of person to wait for 2 hrs then don't come, but if you don't mind trying new local spots that EVERYONE knows then come. 
I'd come back over and over its the place to be and must visit in SF.
author: Alexis N Jesse H.

description: The wait is very much worth it. The line looks long when you first get there but for the patient one's it eventually goes by fast. The place is cozy and staff super nice. The food, words won't do it justice.
author: Douala H.

description: Mama's was definitely worth the wait.  We came in on Saturday morning during Fleet Week with another couple.  We waited about 90 minutes to get in and get a table.  We had the Washington Square Omelet and Apple Dore Pan.  Our friends had one of the Eggs Benedict dishes and the Southwest Omelet.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meals!  The ingredients were fresh and well-seasoned.  The staff was attentive and kept the coffee coming.  We received a tip that they may be opening another location.  That would be soooo awesome!  Will come again to sample more from this tasty menu.
author: Lourdes D.
