description:
We waited for 1:40  minutes,  we arrived atound 12 PM and we were seated at 1;40 pm , I was not so happy about that .

We ordered french toast with bananas,  I think it was overrated. 

We also ordered Monte cresto, it was nice and I think it's their signature , also ordered scrumbled eggs with Italian sausage and mushroom,  was really nice , was that that worth the  hour wait,  I am not sure
author: Katerina M.

description: This place was phenomenal and completely worth the hour wait. The chocolate crumble was heavenly and the environment something out of a storybook. I can't wait for my next visit to San Francisco!
author: MK ..

description: We stood in line for an hour, 50 min outside and 10 once inside to order at the counter. The service was good and food came out quickly. If you want salsa make sure you order it when you place your order and not as an after thought as it confuses the whole routine of the restaurant and oh for a 1oz container of salsa it was $2.  though the food was good, it was just that good, not worth the hour wait. The restaurant is very small and a little tight with the seating, you can hear the conversations going on at all tables around you as you are very close to others. This reminded me a little of the "soup kitchen" episode from Seinfeld
author: Kim W.

description:
I was in town and decided to give this place a try. I was aiming to get there by 7:30am to be able to get in during the first round of seating. I actually got there at 7:40am and luckily made the cut for the first group. I was the last one on the list, but I shared a table with another patron (the restaurant was filled). At 8am, they slowly let 2-3 parties in at a time, and inside is where you stand in line to order and pay. After paying, they direct you to a table. I got inside around 8:15am to order, sat down, and the food came at about 8:45am. I ate and got out of there by 9:15am. By then, the line was down the street.

Now, on to the food. I ordered the monte cristo, and it was life changing! I am usually not a fan of mixing savory with sweets (i.e. bacon donuts, savory crepes, etc.), but the monte cristo just worked! In this case, the sandwich is savory, and the homemade jam is sweet. I don't know how, but they worked well together. I devoured 2, and I think that's where I should have stopped. After the 3rd piece, I started feeling sick. The 4th went to waste. I offered the other patron, but he was stuffed so he only took a bite of one of the slices. If you have people to share dishes with, it would be great. In my case, no one wanted to get up early on vacay. I also ordered a cup of grapefruit juice, and it was refreshing. The other patron ordered a northern italian omelette and he loved every single bite of it.

I agree that the food is incredible. The way they run things is efficient and organized. Obviously, it's been working out for them for decades. I wouldn't wait for 2-3 hours, but I would go early before it opens.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place was great. My husband and I got here at 7:50am on a Sunday Morning and there were already about 20 people in line. We both had the French toast with berries and it was amazing. The one less star is for the inefficiency of the standing in line, paying and then being seated. I felt this process could have been improved greatly, but honestly we were there a total of two hours with waiting in line, eating and leaving. The line doesn't take too long If you are there early enough and the staff was very nice. Great food!
author: Melonie M.

description:
I honestly have a huge problem with this place because they have literally ruined me for all other breakfast foods. I live in LA and we really don't have any breakfast joints as good as Mama's, so now whenever I eat out for breakfast I'm always sadly disappointed. Mama's just set the bar way too high and now everything falls flat for my newfound expectations. Thanks a lot, Mama's.

In all seriousness, I came here with my girlfriend over the winter and we fell in love with this place. Sure, the wait is sometimes long but it honestly isn't that bad, we only waited like 30 minutes and it was WORTH IT (we got there at 8 AM). Once you finally get inside, there's yet another line that you need to wait in. This one is a lot better because you wait right in front of chefs and you get to watch them cook, it's amazing. You also get to see the insanely FRESH ingredients they make their food with, FRESH FRUIT, FRESH BREAD, FROM SCRATCH, IT'S BEAUTIFUL. The menu is huge and they have a bunch of delicious options for everybody. 

The service here is just as good as the food, which is saying a lot. They gave us a larger table because we ordered food for four people even though there was only two of us haha. Every waitress/worker here was so incredibly nice, not just to us either but to everyone in there (it's a small restaurant, you can see everyone). 

NOW FOR THE FOOD:
I ordered the Washington Omelette. Excuse my language but it was fucking magically delicious. It gave me this weird feeling of wanting to eat it and wanting to smear it on my chest at the same time. Eggs were perfectly cooked and it was STUFFED with ingredients. Side of potatoes were awesome too, i normally hate potatoes but I ate all of them (ask for some hot sauce).

My girlfriend ordered one of their Benedicts, I forgot which one it was but she said it was one of the best she's ever had. Based on all their other food, I'm sure you'll be safe in ordering any of their Benedicts.

Our third plate was the French Toast Sampler, three flavors of incredible magical french toast with fresh fruit all over it. Our favorite was the Cranberry Orange but the other two were also freaking good too. wow. SO GOOD.

Finally, we also ordered the Monte Cristo. LISTEN TO ME. PLEASE. YOU MUST ORDER THIS. YOU HAVE NOT LIVED UNTIL YOU HAVE TRIED THE MONTE CRISTO HERE. I can't even string together the right words to describe how good it is to you people, it's incredible. It's like having sex on top of a flying unicorn. I don't know how they ever managed to make a sandwich taste this good but they did, and with the jam they give you....wow, I am not worthy. 



*********
For all the people who are giving this magical place only 2 or 3 stars and then having the nerve to say that it is subpar to other breakfast places. TELL ME WHERE THE HELL YOU PEOPLE ARE EATING BREAKFAST BECAUSE I WANNA KNOW. 


IN CONCLUSION = EAT HERE. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
author: Kyle L.

description:
This is my favorite brunch place in SF. I know, I know, the wait is long and it is touristy, but they have my favorite eggs benedict here. Just look at it like a catch up session with your friends and a part of the SF brunch experience. Also, if you go around 1-2, the line isn't as bad. 

I love the eggs florentine that has spinach and mushrooms in it. I'm not a vegetarian, but I just love this thing. I would recommend everyone getting their own entree, then getting a Monte Cristo on the side because it is ahhhhmazing. That house made jam? you just can't get that anywhere else. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! 

Pro tip: They have alcoholic beverages there! yay, mimosas and wine mmm. Debit card/cash only.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Came here with my husband and mother in law. Don't really know what the big deal is. I think it's just the line out the door to get in and order your meal which can make this lunch spot seem really good from the outside. 

However, I thought it was interesting that you get in line outside to get in line again inside to order your food. You don't get a table unless you order food at the register first. So weird. I didn't find my omelette very good. There was way too much cheese. My husband didn't find this place spectacular or anything and my mother in law thought it was good. 

My mother in law had to sit while in line so one of the bus boys was very accommodating to her and gave her a seat which was really nice.
author: Reese E.

description: This place is alright... I got the French toast it was pretty good however was a little on the cold side and my husband got the Washington omelette it was alright but not enough cheese... the service was good considering how busy they were I just don't get the hype of this place cuz it was not worth the wait
author: Rene V.

description:
Waited an hour on line for breakfast from what i could hear with mostly other out of town tourists. People who would probably never wait this long back home for an overpriced decent but not great breakfast. Felt like I was in an episode of Seinfeld. If I had to do it over again probably wouldn't. Breakfast and coffee for three was $55, $10- $20 too much if you ask me. Omelet was just ok...those cheap tiny shrimp along with some mostly unmelted cheese and overcooked vegetables...the few potatoes were tasteless...toasted french bread with omelet was good...the banana pancakes were very good, good flavor texture and consistency...I also liked the coffee...I probably would have given the restaurant 4 stars if I didn't use their bathroom which was awful...restaurants in San Francisco beginning to remind me of new Orleans when it comes to lack of cleanliness...
I'm a Yankee but I've spent the last half of my life living in the south...folks in the south know how to make breakfast especially in Tennessee, North Carolina and Georgia...
author: Ian G.

description:
I would work here just to have breakfast everyday without the wait in the long lines...sounds like a dream come true to me. 

But seriously this place is delicious and yes there is always a wait. We went on a Sunday morning and got there at 8 am and were inside seated until 1030 am   

I recommend coming before they open so you don't have to wait as long. However we honestly had fun waiting...we would take turns exploring the area around. One of us went and picked up coffee from an Italian shop down the street. So we had coffee in line to hold us off until we got real food. Call me crazy but I didn't mind waiting around. 

Anyways we finally get to the front and oh my goodness what a cute little restaurant it is. The door is so cute, I was obsessed. You wait until they let you in to wait in a shorter line to order. Which was cool because you can see them cooking everything. 

I ordered the French Toast Sampler with berries and coffee...my goodness what a huge proportion it was. I was literally dying with every bite I was taking of my French toast one after the other tasting better. The server even asked if I would like to try their homemade jam....Who little old me??? WELL OF COURSE I WOULD BE  HONORED. 

My goodness just everything was out of this world. I don't know how else to describe our experience and food but to stay that they were out of this world. 

Will be back with a bigger appetite!!
author: Batul A.

description:
When Gary H. and I saw the line wrap around the corner (on a rainy day!!), my head said "Nope. No way Jose. It ain't happening. Never in a million years. Not a chance. Don't even think about it." 

However, my heart and my tummy think alike and dragged me into that insane line. What is it about restaurants in SF that convince people that it's okay to wait an hour or two just to eat some food? I guess the hunger is real. 

After standing an hour in line, outside and inside, on a weekday (don't people have work!?), we finally made it to the front to order. They have menus on the windows outside and a huge menu board on the inside. Trust me, you'll have enough time in line to pick what you want to eat.

- Washington Square Omelet (Spicy Italian Sausage, Bell Pepper, Tomatoes and Hot Pepper Jack Cheese): huge portions and they don't skimp on the ingredients inside. It comes with toast that tastes delicious with their homemade jam.
- Corned Beef Eggs Benedict: I normally don't like corned beef because it's too salty for me, but these were flavorful and just salty enough. The egg and hollandaise sauce were awesome.
- Monte Cristo: French toast ham and cheese sandwich. So delicious! If you look on Yelp, this is probably the most popular item. 

After Gary and I finished splitting the omelet and Eggs Benedict, we began to eat the Monte Cristo. If we weren't so stuffed, we would've been able to finish the whole thing because it is AMAZING. (Don't worry, it still tasted amazing as leftovers the next day.)

Looking on the bright side of the Great-Wall-of-China-length line, you can bond with your friend or friends and make sure your tummy is completely ready to eat while you wait. Once you get seated, you'll know the wait was worth it.
author: Christine S.

description:
Finally made it here after living in SF for 6 years! The wait sucks but the employees were nice, and the food came out fast! 

Ordered two specials, a crab Benedict and a shrimp Benedict- both very good it the poached eggs were like hard boiled eggs so that sucked. Otherwise everything was great. 

It's amazing that only 3 guys make all the food that comes out. Like a well oiled machine- efficiency at its best.

Talked to one of the owners and they're opening another restaurant a few blocks away called Little Mamas. Said they're planned to open around September so that'll be fun to try out.
author: Mandi W.

description: Get there early with cash or a debit card handy! I had the crab cake Benedict, so good! Huevos rancheros were good too! The wait is long but worth it! Great views of Washington park while you eat. Super friendly greeter who guides you on food choices before you walk in the door. He is attentive to any food restrictions so when you walk on to order, you are confident it's what you want and need. Loved this place and neighborhood
author: Abby F.

description:
Located at the northeast corner of Filbert and Stockton, right across from Washington Square Park, lies a small breakfast/brunch place that my friends and I were eager to try. We were visiting the Bay Area over Memorial Day weekend. We waited for a little over an hour.... was it worth it? Not really :( 

Not sure why we were still surprise by the line but yes, there was a line out the door on this Saturday morning. As we tried to entertain ourselves for a little over an hour, we finally got in! Once you are in, you first order your food and then the waitress will direct you to your table. Mama's is known for their brunch and breakfast foods. From benedicts to toasts to to pancakes to omelettes, they got it all. They also have their specials (not on the menu). I ordered the North Beach Benedict ($13.25) which consisted of two poached eggs, prosciutto and grilled tomato served on top of toasted english muffin with homemade Hollandaise Sauce with a side of potatoes. The food tasted good but I didn't think it was great!! After waiting an hour and a half, I expected the food to be AMAZING. But it did not blow my mind. My friends got the Norwegian Benedict ($14.75) which came with smoked salmon on top of everything else. Again, it was alright. We also shared a Swedish Cinnamon French Toast ($9.50) which actually tasted better than I expected it. I thought it may have just been an overpriced bougie French Toast but it actually tasted like a really really good, moist, fluffy french toast. Other than that, I didn't leave the restaurant feeling satisfied. 

After we left in the late morning, there was still a very long line out. It was crazy!

Parking: Street meter parking on Flibert and Stockton! Good luck.

Note: No credit cards are accepted. Debit cards are accepted $15 or over.
author: Vivian W.

description: Totalllllly worth the long lines, I have never waited 2 hrs before but I'm glad I did! Ordered the monticristo delicious! And ordered the crab eggs Benedict OMG BEST EVER! Will definitely be a place to visit every time I go to sf
author: Raiza B.

description:
My friend and I came Sunday 12:30 pm. I was expecting a long wait since it's a popular time for brunch. It ended up taking 2 hours just to get in the restaurant to order at the counter. We grabbed a table and didn't get our food until 2:45 pm. The restaurant was starting to close for the day shortly after! The staff is all very friendly and the place is pretty cute.

I ordered the famous Monte Cristo - interesting dish of savory meat/cheese and jam and my friend ordered the French Toast Sampler which seem to be some of the most popular items. They were both good but I've definitely had better and with much less of a wait time. The total with tax and tip for our meal ended up being $30 (ONLY cash or debit with $1 fee) so it was reasonably priced.

I was really hoping the food would be out of this world since it was so popular but it is just not worth the wait.
author: Linda X.

description:
First off, I'd suggest coming on a weekday for brunch. My girlfriend and I came on Friday and we had to wait a little over an hour so I can't imagine what the weekend would look like.

I had the North Beach Benedict which was delicious. The eggs weren't too runny and the side of potatoes were soft and tasty. Minus 1 star for dirty dishes - my girlfriend's juice cup had lipstick stains on it! The germophobe in me also noticed the creamer was kept in an open container on each table which made me think about the number of people who probably sneezed or coughed into it. We also had to ask twice for water.

Overall it was a good meal in a cozy atmosphere with friendly staff.
author: Josh L.

description: Definately do not come here if you need to be somewhere soon. We got here at 8 am on the dot, and were not seated until 9. I guess be there by 7:30 next time? There are a variety of options. I got the vegetarian omelette, and I am wondering if the pancakes would have been a better choice. The omlettes were definately fluffy and a huge amount of food, but the taste gets a little boring after a while. There were potatoes as the side, but that seems rather heavy as a breakfast option. Furthermore, being not a native of San Francisco, I notice that chefs do not use gloves for meal prep in a couple of restaurants, this being one of them. That makes me really uncomfortable. I think this could be a wonderful restaurant if the seating capacity was more than 30 people, but I am not willing to wait in line for another hour for my food here.
author: Sabryna L.

description: Not bad for brunch spot in the city! I came here with a friend of mines that lives in the city and it was both of our first time there. The wait was about 1 hour or less for us, but it was fine since the weather was nice and we had soo much to catch up on. There is no reservations, you walk in and stand in line. They call you in by who was there first. The line at the door is usually long, but as you are near the front you can see the menu clear and gives you an idea of what you want to order. Once you are at the front they ask you how big your party is ask you to wait then let you enter. As you walk in they tell you to stand in another line along the register to order your food and pay first. After you pay they seat you at the appropriate table for your party. My friend and I sat in the booth. We ordered an omelette, chocolate chip french toast, and monte cristo sandwich. The portions were huge and shockingly I was able to finish my food. The omelette my friend ordered tasted like combination pizza so it was ok, the monte cristo was pretty small, but with the housemade jam it was delicious, and the chocolate chip french toast was delicious. I think the french toast was my favorite meal there. The staff we had was friendly and very attentive. She came by frequently to check how we were doing and refilled our waters. If you need to use the restroom while you are there it is a small unisex bathroom. You have to wait by the kitchen incase someone is down there already and walk through the kitchen to go down to the back to use the bathroom. Their bathroom is pretty much in a small shed. Over all the food was filling and decent. I would come back, but probably only for french toast. I do recommend folks to try this place because of the location, but if you cannot wait then avoid this place.
author: Danika P.

description:
We went here around 7:20 am and waited because of long line supposedly. About 7:40, there was a very long line. So come early, especially for the weekends! So this is how it works. You order first in the front register and then choose a place to sit. I got the classic Benedict and oh my gosh, it was so good!!! It was a good breakfast that I've had in a while. The pricing was a bit expensive for a breakfast/brunch but if you don't care about that, then pricing doesn't matter! The service was good also. I forgot to ask her name but she had short hair and looked fairly young.

 If i wasn't on a budget, I would order a few things on the menu to try out. I will come back here for sure! 

Btw, the bathroom is all the way in the back of their "kitchen"
author: Tilia L.

description:
Loved the crab cake eggs Benedict, so much crab!
Loved the warm blueberry sour cream coffee cake.
Loved the friendly staff.

Hated the 1.5 hour wait.

If you don't mind waiting, then by all means. But be warned, probably coming after 1pm is better. Got there around 11:30, didn't sit down till 1pm.
author: Jenna L.

description:
The food was really really really good and fresh but the wait in line was ridiculous. We waited 3 hours just to get a seat and at the point I was starving beyond belief. However the experience is a great and exclusive for a few reasons.

This place is one of the #1 rated places to eat in SF
There is NO take out, so only those in line get to eat
The ingredients are all fresh and service is amazing

I'm sure depending on the day you can get a seat faster but overall this place is a must for anyone who visits SF.
author: Jamie C.

description: I got the monte Christo sandwich and crab cake Benedict. Both were average dishes not worth the wait. Eggs on the Benedict were overcooked .
author: Sifin K.

description: While the food is very good, it's become a little over hyped. I mean it's hard to make orange cranberry French toast that isn't good.  For the wait and the overwhelming reviews, I would expect the French toast to be special.... it was heavy (dense) and not exceptional. Good food and great service but after a 30min wait in the rain, it wasn't worth it
author: Stacy H.

description: I just called to see what the wait was and whoever picked up told me that he couldn't give me an answer because I wasn't there and my best option was to go somewhere else. Gotcha.
author: Ashley S.

description: Amazing food and service, family oriented well worth the wait breakfast was on point !
author: Jarret B.

description: This place was amazing, but definitely pricey. I recommend coming here, but I would also HIGHLY recommend that you just wake up as early as possible if you want to go. We went around 10:30am and waited THREE HOURS. Normally I would never wait that long, but the line didn't look like it would take 3 hours to wait through. By the time we got inside I ordered everything that sounded good. I don't have a picture because we were STARVING and I didn't think about it. I think the food was delicious, but I also might have been so hangry that I would have eaten dirt. I would love to go back and NOT wait for hours. It's worth it to just get there early. So insane. Complete insanity. The people in front of us were taking turns waiting in line with people NAPPING in a near by car. I can't believe I waited 3 hours to eat ANYWHERE. So embarrassing the things we do for brunch. The fresh orange juice was delicious and so are the pancakes-a family secret recipe. Literally everything looked delicious. Everything was super fresh too. Just try not to drool while you're waiting in line to order.
author: Brittany S.

description:
This might be the quickest turnaround for a review by me on this site. I've walked by this place a few times, seeing the lines just like everyone else. Luckily, today I woke up early and managed to snag a place in line as it was opening. A couple of things....

1. You will wait, probably for at least 30 minutes.
2. Once you do get your food, you will get stared down by hungry souls scheming to take your seat.
3. Bring cash, and a good amount of it. My meal cost over 20 bucks.

Still, totally freaking worth it. I ordered the french toast with chocolate cinnamon (whatever that genius spice is) and it exceeded my already high expectations. The side of an egg was kind of normal, but that is the worst I could say about it. Throw in some fresh pressed OJ and I had a breakfast that will stand out in memory for a long time.
author: Eric W.

description: Slightly underwhelming considering the hype and the long lines to get in. But beautiful cafe with a really great location! Worth a visit though!
author: Aditi S.

description: WHY WAIT!!! I'll tell you why.. The food and service was amazing! I had Mama's Christo.. by the end of my sandwich I was calling for Mama and Christ!!! Ooooo.  Absolutely amazing...
author: Tovorris P.

description:
1. There's a wait to get in the door.


2. There's then a wait to order your food. (You stand in a line to place your order.)

3. They then direct you to your table and you get your drinks delivered, pastry (if you order one), then you food.

My point is, just expect a wait so you don't wonder what is going on.

The food is pricey, breakfast for 2 was $47 not including tip. The food was good, better than places around the area. I have really good breakfast places in Arizona, so the breakfast was comparable to them. Nothing special or out of this world, must go back. The service was excellent. Tables are close together, so you will hear everything the people on either side of you have to say!

I would eat here again and continue to explore the menu.
author: Lacey G.

description:
Came here on a Friday morning and waited about one hour and 15 minutes. While waiting have someone hold your place and go next door to get some fresh focaccia bread or down the street for some salami and all that little Italy has to offer. 

Everyone is super friendly and the food is well worth the wait. Must try the Paisano Benedict.. Oh.. My... Gosh!! So flavorful. Also ask to try their homemade jam. 

Will come back here again and again! Make sure you take home some delicious apple crumble.
author: Jo B.

description:
The only reason they don't get 5 stars is the LOOOONG line! We came here on a Saturday at 9:45 and after standing in line for 1.5 hours, we were seated around 11:15...:(

The food and service though make up for the long wait. We ordered the French toast sampler which had three different types of French toast and came with fresh fruits and homemade raspberry jam (which is amazing!) and the crab Benedict. Both the dishes were amazing...freshly made, flavorful and hit the right spot in the stomach. 

I just wish they had a board where you would leave your name and come back in an hour or so. I'm lucky my toddler and baby are patient when it comes to eating good food but even then waiting so long gets a bit tiring after the first time. If you live in SF, just come around 2 pm or better still on weekdays. Weekend brunch seems like the perfect horrid thing to do for tourists.
author: Ratika N.

description: It was nice but not worth the hype as much. Maybe we need to go back and order something besides the eggs.
author: Kassa K.

description: We stood in line for 1 hr 5 minutes and then waited inside for another 15. Food took 15 more minutes to come out. As we stood in line inside, there were fruit flies on the stacked bread. The chefs were also touching food with their bare hands and multiple items that weren't food kept being placed on the cooking surface. The bathroom line also goes directly through the kitchen which cannot be sanitary. The food was pretty good but I'm uncertain that it was worth the wait or very steep price ($60 for 2 adults and a child). My husband got the eggs Benedict and the eggs were overlooked - not runny. The waitress did get him more but his food was cold and everyone else was finished eating by the time she returned. I'm glad I tried it once but I probably wouldn't recommend or return.
author: Meg R.

description:
Came around 10:20 on a Sunday morning & waited ~1 hour and 45 mins. We knew beforehand we were going to have to wait a while so it wasn't too bad (until the very end when the hunger was REAL). About halfway through our wait, we were able to order coffee from a server who came outside to take drink orders, so bring cash! Even if you don't want a drink outside, you'll need cash to tip for your meal. 
My roommate and I were surprised that once you get inside, you order at a register and they bring the food to your table. It definitely speeds the process up once you're actually inside the building. 
We both got French toast, and... It was worth the wait. I inhaled my meal in like 5 minutes flat. 
While waiting, we were told that a second location will be opening in late summer with to-go options and even reservations. If/when that happens, I'll definitely opt for that over burning 3 hours of my weekend!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Am I missing something?  A San Francisco icon where the in thing is to wait two hours in line for breakfast. My daughter took us to breakfast. Eggs Benedict ok, cool and not hot. Egg omelette with egg whites was
disappointing for the money. The egg whites tasted like they came out of a carton, not real cracked egg whites, which I would expect for the price. Omelette consisted of folding undercooked egg whites around shrimp. I could make a better omelette by mixing the shrimp in the eggs and grilling to slightly brown the egg omelette. I don't understand how this place can stay in business. Not worth the wait or the high prices.
author: Gary M.

description: I have been here twice now and waited in line for 30+ minutes and every time it's worth it! The eggs benedicts are amazing and their crumb cakes are outstanding. The servers are fun and always happy. It's such an amazing atmosphere especially after waiting in line and becoming a little hangry. There's always a line even during the week, but I would wait in line every time!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Line one to get in: 45 minutes.
Line two to get your order taken: 25 minutes.
Wait time for seating: 15 minutes.

(Inner thought: Wait a second, am I at the DMV?!) 

Time it took to eat all my food once it was placed in front of me: Approximately 13 minutes.

Altogether, the experience was PRICELESS.

Would I make my way back here again? Hmmm. Let's just say the wait really makes you question if the food was totally worth it. In this case I'm not sure it was, but Mike (grandson of the owner of Mama's) genuinely appreciated our patience and gave us a brush up on the history of this family owned restaurant while we waited. This lil' breakfast hub really makes you appreciate the old San Francisco, and I'm a fan of supporting any establishment that was able to withstand the dot com crash AND the techie boom. SOOO, long story short, if you've got half your morning to spare - a cup of coffee, a snack, and some emails to catch up on - line up for their one-of-a-kind menu and see what's cookin' for yourself.
author: Flor K.

description: Cute little brunch spot. Different then your typicals... you wait in line, once your in, you place an order, wait for your food and then you get seated. Service and food is excellent. Another win for yelp hype!
author: C K.

description: After walking by the line wrapped around the block several times, I figured there was something special about this place I need to look into. I read a lot of very positive reviews and decided to test the buzz. I went at  230 so my wait was just 15 minutes. I ordered the French toast sampler so I could try several varieties and can best describe it as "meh". I would have been extremely disappointed if I had waited in line much longer. Since they close at 3, my waitress was more concerned with her closing duties than paying any attention to me. I heard several other patrons comment their food was delicious as I waited, so perhaps the other meals make it worth what's normally a 1-2 hour wait.
author: Matt L.

description:
Expect to wait! After almost 2 hours my mom and I finally were able to enjoy this little restaurant that everyone kept telling me about. 

The food was definitely delicious, we ordered the Californian omelette and the cinnamon chocolate French toast!! So so yummy! I still couldn't decide at the end if I thought it was worth that long wait however, I almost ate that whole omelette and usually I take 3-4 bites and I'm done, so I think my taste buds would have to say it was worth the wait! 

The staff was very friendly, I just wish they would put a better awning on the side of the building since it's known to have a long line it'd be nice if there was shade to wait in.  Overall would recommend but not if you are limited with time.
author: Devon G.

description:
An excellent choice for breakfast if you are willing to endure the line. A bright yet cozy spot at the corner of the beautiful Washington Square.
The staff is great. The food although a little pricey, doesn't compromise quality. You won't be disappointed
author: Erik K.

description: Pancakes and French Toast---all 3 flavors!! All I have to say.....soooo sooo good and not your typical. Everything else on the menu seemed like everyday items you'd see on any brunch menu so went with the house made dishes instead and did NOT disappoint. I will definitely be back....and will wait in line because it was that good.
author: Helen M.

description: The waiting is looooooooloooooooong. They offer good service. I ordered the weekend special "Dungness Crab Benedict" not bad at all but nothing impressive . Might give it a second chance.
author: Roberto Z.

description: went two days in a row! thats all mornings while i was at SF! had cranberry walnut and monte christo. I enjoyed them both. Great breakfast spot!
author: Byung K.

description: Finally made it into Mama's after a couple of fails. Very unusual method of seating. When you are ushered inside you expect a seat only to be directed another line in front of the kitchen leading to the register. As you near the register you hope you know what you want by looking at the multiple boards containing the menus. Upon ordering, you wait to be seated while trying to avoid blocking the servers and guests as they pass. Once you are seated it is heavenly with delicious food and drinks. The restroom is another adventure, be prepared to step down some very steep steps outside the back of the building in what is like an afterthought restroom. Overall was fun. We did have an opportunity to speak to owner Vince and discovered they are the same Mama's I used to dine at in the 80s. I still remember their veal piccata.
author: Michael A.

description: Had to wait about an hour out in the hot blazing sun.  Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.  The food is OUT OF SIGHT.  Soooooo good.  Big helpings and great service.  The orange juice tasted freshly squeezed (I'm sure it was).  Delicious mocha coffee with cinnamon french toast.  Worth the wait!
author: Susan M.

description:
This place has a lot of flies inside the kitchen and in the dining area. Especially on the bread display (used for French toast)

Waited for more than an hour to get in, witnessed the flies! Sad!!
author: Sindhu R.

description: This was such an amazing breakfast to start our day!! Granted we experienced no wait because we got there 30 min early on a Thursday morning and were first in line... glad we had a coffee in hand while we waited! But a line did start to heavily form at about 15 til 8. Ordered quickly. Cash or debit only. Monte Cristo is a MUST, grapefruit mimosa husband got the Blackstone eggs Benedict. Perfect. Got a carrot cake to go and that didn't make it very long in the car ride to Muir Woods. Go here.
author: Katrina M.

description:
2 things you should know about me:
1: I look forward to Saturday brunch all week. It is my favorite thing about Saturday. 
2: I eat eggs Benedict everywhere, every week.

I feel like I can give an accurate and experienced review because of these things.

Everyone and their dog has either heard of, or already eaten at, Mamas. With about a million referrals and getting tired of the same, "Oh you haven't had brunch until you've had Mama's. BEST IN THE CITY!" comments I figured to give it a try. 

Maybe this was a rookie mistake, but although I had heard a line was eminent I didn't believe it would be THAT BAD. Oh man. Never have I ever waited an hour and a half for eggs Benedict on the curb. 

Once inside, I loved the environment and culture. You can see staff working on delicious food in front of you before you place your order, making you second guess every decision about this meal you thought was right. (At least that's how my wife felt. Like I said, I always get Eggs Benedict).

We were seated and our food came out much more quickly than I expected, which was good because after waiting in the sun we were both getting a little hangry. I ordered eggs Bene' and my wife ordered the vegetarian omelette, with bacon. (The staff found that hilarious but I thought the funniest part was an omelette that is vegetarian?!?)

Both dishes were great! The eggs Benedict was delicious but not LIFE CHANGING like it is painted to be. It was a well done and delicious meal!

So why only 3 stars? I don't feel like the food matches the reputation or wait. I would go again, definitely, if I only had to wait 20 minutes. But 1.5 hours? Guys.... I should be blown away (which shouldn't be very hard to do if I am RAVENOUS) if I wait that long for brunch.
author: Austin H.

description: This place was worth the wait, went around 12PM and it was worth a wait. The place is not expensive at all. The lemonade taste amazing. Breakfast in SFO taste amazing, the services was great and friendly.  The grilled potatoes taste really good.
author: Michelle J.

description:
Had the Washington Square, and I am highly satisfied! Only regret was not getting orange juice - my friend ordered - because it was so fresh! We got there before it opened with ~15 people ahead of us, and we were the first batch to be seated. Thus, I suggest eating at Mama's during breakfast time rather than brunch time if you want to avoid the wait. 

Tip: they take debit card, but the tip isn't on the receipt so make sure to bring some cash with you! The staff is very friendly

PS: I love the raspberry jelly.
author: Denny H.

description:
The food is pretty good! I ordered the norweigan eggs benedict two days in a row, and it was excellent both times.

The smoked salmon was fresh, the holondaise sauce was creamy and tart. The english muffins were also delightful.

5 stars for the food.

The service is lousy. I won't take off points for the wait in line -- can't blame a restaurant for being popular. But they are understaffed for how busy they are. The servers are always rushing and forgetting things, and it feels like you're inconveniencing them when you ask for something.

Cash only -- aw, man. Minus 5 million stars for this, but I am trying to be objective. There is simply no reason why this restaurant should only accept cash other than being too cheap to pay the transaction fee associated with cards. The prices are higher than average, leaving plenty of room for those transaction fees. Plus, every other restaurant accepts cards. Maybe I am being too fussy, but I am just not going to stop at an ATM just so I can eat here. 

It's also very shady that they are cash only and don't keep solid records of their transactions! I needed a receipt from my visit a day earlier and they were unable to produce one. I even emailed them about it later and they never replied. Makes you wonder whether they accurately report their transactions to the IRS...
author: Omar A.

description: I love this place! Would go much more often if it was a bit less successful... Problem is: if you show up at 9, you need to queue at least 2 hours. Only way to avoid waiting in line is to arrive at 7:20, 40min before the opening. Don't miss the berry smoothie, the French toast sampler & the eggs Benedict.
author: Clémentine C.

description:
The Wait is worth it.


Montecristo and northern Italian omelette are supreme


Definitely will come back
author: Ricardo F.

description: We got here on a Tuesday mid morning and waited for about 50 minutes. We ordered and out food came within 15 minutes. The staff and service were friendly and hardworking. I ordered the Montecristo and omg what a huge surprise of how flavorful and amazing this meal was. It is a must order when you are in town. My husband got the French toast sampler which was banana nut, cranberry and cinnamon. The banana nut was his favorite. Cinnamon was great and the cranberry was good. One of my favorite places yet and worth the wait!!
author: Claudia M.

description: This place was so good! I ordered the cranberry walnuts French toast. The wait was VERY long (over an hour and we got there before it opened) but it was so, so worth it.
author: Dana T.

description:
Got there at about 830 and saw the line as expected from the reviews. Not a big line, (20-25) however, it still took about 40 minutes to finally get in (bring a book, I did). Once I finally made it inside, I was able quickly place my order and also, to my surprise, quickly got my food. I realized that people just like to linger and enjoy the vibe once their in. I was guilty of it too, I sat there for about 35-40 minutes.  

The food? I had the Monte Cristo and it did not disappointment. Best thing I'v had since staying in SF. Another good detail, is the staff is pretty well customer service oriented, which probably only makes the wait a little longer at no fault to anyone. Also, Mama's decor was cozy with warm colors.

Going to Mama's is, in and of itself, its own event. Enjoy, I hope this helped. 

:)
author: Juan G.

description: Best Monte Cristo Sandwich ever.  No wonder it's served all day. You must try it if you like ham and cheese sammys. The omelettes are huge and the Gourmet French toast is wonderful.   Be prepared for long waits during tourist season.
author: Blair G.

description: I waited outside in line for about 30 minutes. When they let me inside, I had to wait another 15 minutes before ordering at the counter. Then I had to wait another 15 minutes for a table. I was a party of 1! After being seated, it took about 10 minutes to receive my food. I ordered the Monte Cristo, underwhelming to say the least, very thin slice of turkey and ham, very little cheese and not dipped in egg wash. It was more like a grilled cheese sandwich made with French toast. The homemade jam was just okay. I am puzzled to why this place is included in the top twenty places to eat in San Francisco. Don't wast your time and money, it's not worth it. The staff is very friendly.
author: Rich G.

description:
My friend recommended this place and we waited an hour and a half for this. I like how they serve drinks while you're waiting in line because it was pretty sunny. I got a white mocha ice latte and it made time feel faster while I was chattering away with my friends. 

I got the smoked salmon scramble and it was sooooo good! It was filling and I thought it was worth the wait. I love the environment here because everyone seem so happy. You can tell the workers really love their job from the way the connect with each other. It was one of the waitress's birthday and everyone starting singing happy birthday to her. You get a family feel  in the restaurant which I like.
author: Michelle T.

description: Service is still amazing, food was better last year and the line is just the same - long.
author: Isabel S.

description: The food is good, but I don't think it's worth the wait. Whenever we walked by Mama's, we would see a long line wrapped around the building. We knew there would be a big crowd trying to get brunch here on a Saturday, so we decided to go extra early and try to get a spot at the front of the line. We arrived at 7:40 and there were probably 10-15 people already waiting in line. Mama's doesn't open until 8am. The line moved very slowly and I don't think we got seated until 8:15 or 8:30. We ordered the Washington Square Omelette, Cranberry-Orange French Toast, and Blueberry Pancakes. While I really enjoyed the food, I don't think I will be waiting in line for Mama's again.
author: Helen P.

description: Expect a very long wait and just ok food. We waited for two hours and had Eggs Benedict.   I had the same entree at Perry's the day before which was just as good if not better. My drink order was messed up and I was still charged for the wrong drink after I had pointed it out to the waitress. The carrot cake was very good. They don't take credit cards so beware. The sign that says this is right on the front of the building so if you've been in line around the corner you won't see it until it's too late.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Not bad, but not worth the hype either. 

A girl friend and I stopped in at around 2:30pm on a Saturday afternoon... Since Mama's closes at 3, we didn't have a long wait as long (only around 30 minutes before we ordered & got seated), which was great - I've heard that the wait can be hours if you get here at peak times. The menu items all sounded mouthwateringly delicious, and it was so tough to make a decision. I like how you can watch the kitchen staff make and assemble all of the dishes while you wait in line, which adds to the salivation that I was developing in my mouth. One thing that I did notice though was that the blueberries to top the french toast were frozen, not fresh, and there were some bugs flying around the bread that's used for the french toast... hm not the most ideal. Nevertheless, my friend and I were so excited to order, and we wound up choosing the Famous Monte Cristo & the special Lemon Blueberry French Toast. 

MONTE CRISTO: this dish was pretty good. Made our trip here worth it. It's basically a sandwich embedded within french toast - creative dish and very visually appealing. The blend of cheeses is perfect, and the taste, overall, was very on point. Super satisfying to my taste buds. I ate it by itself, without dipping in the jam.

LEMON BLUEBERRY FRENCH TOAST: very ehh. Pretty bland, honestly. The lemon and blueberry flavors were both not prominent. Workers forgot to add berries on our french toast, so it didn't look as good as the other french toast dishes that we saw leaving the kitchen when we were waiting in line.

THE FAMOUS JAM... tasted just like normal jam. Nothing too special, especially since I'm not the greatest fan of jam.

Overall, it was a good brunch, but not life-changing. If I were you, I'd come to try it out if the wait is less than an hour. Come around closing time for that.
author: Sheila D.

description:
Mama's on Washington is well known to tourists and locals. They offer an array delicious breakfast/brunch items. The wait here can be pretty long so don't come here when you are starving since you are most likely looking at a 30 minute to a 1.5 hour wait. I came here on a Friday around 11am. The line was around the corner by the time we arrived, but luckily we picked up some dim sum before heading over here. The line went by fairly fast and we only waited around 45 minutes. I also thought the employees were very nice since one of them started to walk outside and hand out waters to everyone in line since it was a pretty warm day (which is unusual for SF).

Once inside you have a few minutes to look at the menu before ordering and eventually being seated. 

// FOOD //
Classic benedict: Canadian bacon served with two poached eggs, hollandaise sauce and grilled potatoes. This is your typical benedict that you would expect. 3.5/5

Monte Cristo: Roasted turkey, ham, cheddar and gruyere cheese in egg and grilled and served with homemade jam and potatoes. This was freaking delicious!!! Amazing flavor and the perfect balance of sweet and salty! 4.5/5

Northwest omelette: Smoked salmon, grilled leeks, capers, and homemade crème fraiche. DELICIOUS! I would definitely come back for this. Great flavor and the smoked salmon just melts in your mouth! 4.5/5

Overall, I thought Mama's lived up to its hype and the food was pretty damn amazing! I would highly recommend the Monte Cristo and the Northwest omelette! I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in the bay.
author: Ryan W.

description:
In the early 70's, people were probably stunned to see a Hispanic family-run in this area, and with the Sanchez family actually there, just like in many of the local Chinese establishments. Many people also thought that the lack of a bathroom added to the charm of the place, something unheard of these days. Then the franchising came, a disastrous attempt in the Macy's basement among them, and the gloss wore off as one came to realize that commercial market-place breads and cheeses just won't do in the City. That was in the late 80's, but I am happy to say that things have been upgraded tremendously, although the wait is interminable.

Everything was quite nice. Perhaps not superb, but nice. The wait is the killer. Even at the venerable Doidge's, the wait was never more than 30 minutes. I guess everyone wants to try this place, which in fact has changed positively with the advent of the new century, unlike Sear's.
author: George T.

description:
My grandma lives 3 doors down from Mama's  and the line will literally block the front entrance to her apartment. I've seen this line for  30+ years every time I visit SF and have always wanted to  eat breakfast here but was intimidated by the long lines. On our last visit, we finally got to stop in and try the food! It was a rainy Thursday morning at 10:30 and there was no line outside.

 When you step inside, there is a short line but it moves pretty quickly.  The place is very small. And if you have a party of more than 3 or 4 people, there are only a couple of tables to accommodate you. The customers seem to be very mindful of the people waiting though and do not linger too long after their meals. 

While standing in line waiting to order, you can watch the food being prepared. All the ingredients are spread out on the counters and their famous crumb cake is on display for everyone to see. I was very disappointed to see quite a few gnats/small flies buzzing around and landing on the crumb cakes.  I was going to order some crumb cakes to go but quickly changed my mind. I never saw any flies on the food being prepped. Just the crumb cakes. 

Mama's is famous for their Monte Cristo sandwich, which looks amazing!  but I don't  eat meat so I opted for the banana pancakes. They were served with plenty of fresh banana slices and whipped cream on top. Beautiful presentation. They were good but nothing earth shattering. Definitely not worth waiting in a long line for.

Would I eat here again? Probably not. There are many places to go for breakfast in the area. (I preferred Pat's Cafe on Taylor St.) The food was good at Mama's  but the flies and the line are a total turn off.
author: Jill B.

description:
Call this a tourist attraction or whatever you want. The food is just so good that people always stand in line for hours. 

I stood in the line like 8 times for hours and was never disappointed after having food. People complain that they had to stood but nobody asked them to. When you want something delightful sometimes have to wait.

I dont want to pick something from the menu and say its good bcoz every item in the menu is awesome. Take time, go through the entire menu and then choose. Dont forget to check the specials. 

My all time favorite place in SF to have a brunch.
author: Sharan N.

description:
We waited for 2 hours and 4 mins in the afternoon of sunny Saturday. The place is very small. We ordered 2 dishes of egg Benedict which were Smoked Salmon and Bay shrimp with avocado and tomato. They both just so so (Sorry mama). The shrimp dish didn't taste any shrimp and English muffin was toasted like a rock. The egg Benedict made us disappointed. 
We ordered Famous Monte Cristo which super amazing. This dish was our favourite and much better than egg Benedict. I also ordered Mama's smoothie, only banana taste in my smoothie even it was purple from the berry without honey flavor. 

Overall I gave 4 stars because Famous Monte Cristo. I like the decoration of the restaurant and staff are nice.
author: Orange S.

description:
I would rate this place more of a 3.5. 

I was in San Fran for Yelp's 10 year anniversary parties and the place I happen to be staying at was right next to Mama's. 

Everyday me and my bf would see an insane line for this little restaurant. We had to try it. You would think since we're literally 3 doors down from the place we would wake up extra early and plan to not wait in the insane line....wrong we're lazy tourist and woke up what I thought was early, around 8am to wait in line. We waited over 2 hours!

By the time I sat down I was a bit cranky and tired from waiting. We ordered the salmon eggs Benedict, the famous Monte Cristo, French Toast Sampler, and fresh squeezed Mama juice. 

My favorite hands down was the salmon eggs Benedict. Boy, was it tasty! The sauce was perfectly delicious and smoked salmon is my fav. 

The monte cristo was tasty, don't get me wrong, but I'm not a huge fan of mixing sweet and savory. It was good though. 

The French toast sampler was good, but by the time I got to it, I was stuffed! I loved the different French toasts and the berry one was my fav. 

The juice was refreshing and nice, but it was a bit pricy. 

Overall the food is good, but to wait over 2 hours for it was a bit much. It's good, but not OMG I have to have this or I'll die good. 

Had I been able to sit down after a 1/2 to 45 min wait, then I would rate this place 4 stars. Food is good, but the wait was too crucial for me. If I ever go back to San Fran this place would not be a must for me. It's a fun "yay I got to try it once" place.
author: Annie T.

description:
In short: 4.5 stars, this place is delcious, highly recommend the Dungeness Crab Benedict with spinach, be prepared to wait in line but its worth it.

I finally got to try this place this past weekend and I have to say, it was delicious and I will definitely be back. A group of friends and I wanted to do breakfast. We met up with him at his apartment in North Beach and walked 3 blocks to see how bad the line was at Mama's and it wasn't very bad. At 9:30am on a Sunday, The back of the line was near the exit door near the rear of the restaurant. We were told it would be about a 30-40 minute wait from this point. As we waited in line, one of the waitresses came outside and was taking orders for hot beverages (cash only). We ordered some cappuccino to keep us warm. This was my first time being here and the cappuccino was delicious.

about 45 minutes later, we finally made it to the front of other line and made it inside. This isn't like your typical restaurant. When you walk in, you head to the cashier and order your food and then you are seated afterward. This was the first time a few of us had been there so we decided to split the french toast sampler to go along with whatever we decided to order. I ordered the Dungeness Crab Benedict and a mimosa to enjoy with my meal. 

By the time we were finally seated, we had been there for about an hour. I've heard friends say they've waited 2 hours before so I guess we got lucky on a Sunday morning. Our food quickly came out a few minutes later. I quickly dug into the three different french toast offerings on the sampler. They were all delicious but my favorite of all was the crab benedict. It was so flavorful and you could taste the fresh crab used. I would highly highly recommend this dish ... just be warned its not cheap.

Overall, I'd be back here. I would just recommend coming here early so you don't have to wait in line so long.
author: Robert S.

description: Lovely place for breakfast but beware; long long lines and CASH ONLY. Only found out about this after waiting hungrily in line for 15 minutes. Luckily we had enough to see us through a couple of breakfast cocktails, coffee and benefits. Had a wobbly moment when we saw the wonderful different kinds of French toast. Come hungry.
author: Gillian T.

description:
To be honest, I expected Mama's to blow my mind after waiting more than two hours in line for food. Sadly that was not the case.

Don't get me wrong, my eggs benedict was delicious, but I just didn't think it was worth the money or the wait outside.
author: Connie X.

description: Yeah long line. The food is good and service is great. Street parking only. Location is nice you can walk around the neighborhood.
author: Jami F.

description:
Not that this place needs anymore rave reviews, but yes, I'm a fan! Where do I even start? Despite the hour-long wait, our actual dining experience ensued flawlessly. Servers were on point, food came out fast, and our actual meals? ON POINT. My bf and I ordered the famous monte cristo sandwich, the veggie eggs benedict and the french toast sampler. The monte cristo definitely stole the show. The fluffy sourdough bread was grilled to perfection and stuffed generously with amazing melted guyere/ delicious meat. The homemade jam they served with it was also mouthwatering. 

The eggs benedict was also good, but there are brunch spots in NY that can do it just as good, if not better. Though my poached egg was slightly overcooked, all of the ingredients worked great together (warm/toasted english muffin topped with grilled tomatoes, spinach, mushrooms, avocados, and of course the hollandaise). 

Btw, understand that the city's green initiatives are top-notch, but dude, AC needs to come on when it's 80 degrees out. It was really warm in there. Just a thought...
author: Jane N.

description: Best breakfast I have ever had, had to wait 30 minutes in a que outside and it was only 8:20 just proves how good this place is, the wait was worth every minute
author: Anthony J.

description:
Worth the hype, cash or debit only payment, the line, and the early wake up time to eat here.

My friend and I got here before opening time and were able to sit in the first batch of seats. Not waiting longer than we already did was worth waking up and getting there early.

Mama's Cristo - My friend debated over the Monte Cristo and this one all the way until we ordered. I think it's the same except for the cheese they use and that the Mama's Cristo has addition of apple. The apple really made the dish and added a brightness and a crunch. It was great dipping it in the jam.

Corned Beef Benedict -  It was a special the day I went. They made the corned beef themselves and you could tell. It was richer and more flavorful than corned beef you'll get at other places.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly, and so were the potatoes. I cleaned the plate 

Mama's Smoothie - So good! Despite being a smoothie, it was light and fresh. I loved that the yogurt was added to the drink. 

We ordered a few crumb cakes for the way out, and they were all good. I guess you can say we were greedy ordering so much, but hey, why not?
author: Jeanne K.

description:
Cannot agree.  I still don't understand why it gets many stars from many reviews.  Food is ok ok.  Their food is what you can make on your own.   No special at all.  My feeling is - waiting a long line makes everyone think this restaurant must be special.  Also, there are a few Yelp reviewers that point out one thing - it is possible that this restaurant purposely makes a long line - average 2 hours! - and thus people can be so so hungry.  once they get tables, they feel food is so damn good!  

Go to somewhere that you eat food which you cannot make on your own.  Brenda's soul food cafe is one example - many food are super champ and are what many people cannot make on our own.   

hope this helps!  Make your food spendings worth! :)
author: Clara L.

description: 5 Stars! I loved everything about this place-besides the long wait of course! I had never had a Benedict, but they looked so good here I decided to give it a try. It was SO GOOD. I ordered the salmon benedict, the cinnamon french toast, and a mimosa with fresh squeezed OJ. Everything was cooked perfect and 100% worth the wait. I would definitely make another trip back here.
author: Audrey M.

description: Absolute gem. Food was delicious and service was great. Make sure you try the homemade jam. Waited for about 20 minutes on a Wednesday at 8:30. I'd wait for an hour if I had to.
author: Paul P.

description:
Can we please talk about the crumb cake for a moment? There are plenty of reviews,  thousands actually,  talking about the most popular things to order so I'm going to skip all that. 

Let me tell you how is going to go when you visit.  There will be a line,  you'll wait a long time and probably meet  people from all over the world while doing it,  it will be worth it. You'll read reviews and know what you just have to order. You might have anxiety when you're ushered into the restaurant because you just can't decide. 

Don't worry about it.  You'll have at least 20 minutes more inside watching the line. That is going to make you change your mind on what to order more times than you can count. Just when you're settled on what to get you'll near the cash register. Right there at eye level you'll see plates of a variety of crumb cake flavors. These were not even a consideration in my ordering until now and under pressure I caved. Yes, I'll take one! 

Then came the freshly warmed square of chocolate crumb cake to our table. One of those perfect pieces with 50/50 cake to crumb ratio. Warmed just enough to where the crumb turns into almost a thin layer of frosting where the crumb meets cake. It's moist, not overly sweet perfection a plate. I considered waiting in line again just to leave with a few more pieces to go.

Bottom line - yes the food is worth the wait. Listen to everyone else about what to order for your main entrée or just be inspired by what you see on the line but start with the crumb cake.
author: Sarah S.

description: Had their vegetarian Benedict, my husband got the Mama Cristina sandwich both very delicious and worth the wait
author: Emily O.

description: Would love to give a good rating but we weren't even able to eat here. We arrived at 8:00 on the dot on a Tuesday morning and the line was already wrapped around the corner. Waited til about 8:15 when a woman came outside and told us they were "running behind" today and wouldn't even be opening until at least 8:30. The place was pretty small so we knew we wouldn't be seated for a long time since we were near the end of the line. Bummer cuz we're only visiting for 2 days and Uber'd all the way over there to eat at Mama's. Maybe next time...
author: Jenelle C.

description:
I think this place is great, but not really worth that 2 hour wait. The two things that stood out to me were the Cristo sandwich and their jam. 

I wouldn't mind waiting 20-30 minutes for it, but probably not the 1-2 hour long lines I see on the weekends. I think if I'm going to wait that long, the food better make me cry tears of joy.

Btw, If you come on a week day, there's MUCH LESS of a line.
author: Angela W.

description: The bill was $38.01 and give him a $40 cash. Never returned my change. I mean I was going to tip him 20% like I always do with all the servers. I still tip him he's 20% even though they kept my change. I don't think that was the right thing todo.
author: Luis L.

description:
I love brunch! What I don't love is waiting. Standing in line and waiting for a table anywhere, especially when I'm hungry is typically a bad mix. But if I want brunch in SF, ultimately, I have to wait for it. On the Wed before Thanksgiving break last year, I decided to try my luck at Mama's. We did a drive by and the line didn't look too bad, so we decided to give it a shot! Yay for getting off work early! Sadly, the line moved really slowly. Once I got close to the door, I realized there was another line inside! WTF?! More waiting?! By this time, it was too late to give up. Finally after an hour we were inside and at the cash register! We decided on:

-Mimosa ($7) - Cuz I always need a little alcohol with every meal! Lol!
-Classic corn beef hash and eggs, over easy with whole grain toast ($12.25) - The roommate's plate.
-Mama's sampler french toast plate: Banana nut, Chocolate brioche, Cranberry orange walnut covered w/berries and bananas ($10.95) - Yum! Who doesn't love a french toast buffet on a plate?!
-Washington square omelette with sourdough baguette ($10.95) - Filled with spicy sausage and melty pepperjack cheese! One of my favorite combos in an omelette! 
-Side of bacon ($3.75) - Cuz brunch isn't complete without a side of bacon!

We ended up at a table right by the front entrance which was uncomfy for the roommate. He doesn't like it when people watch him eat. I was fine since I was facing the other direction, but I do understand where he was coming from. Basically everyone in line is watching you have breakfast while trying to pass time. So instead of a solid 5 stars based on just the food, I'm giving Mama's a 4!
author: Elena N.

description: This restaurant had bad attitudes and even told me to get out of the way(I was waiting in line for the bathroom) because the chef needed to use the bathroom and that the chef was more important than me. I also found some dust or ash on the milk( for the coffee ) and found an unwashed spoon on my table. They also forgot an order and if I didn't ask for it AGAIN, they wouldn't have given it to me. When the food go t on the table, it was disgusting (I pressed the Northwest salmon omelet) , the salmon was stinky and very poor( probably in the kitchen for 2 months).The omelet had no taste at all and I was very disappointed because they put a lot of dried leeks which they call "fresh".
author: Allen H.

description:
Stop looking at the menu. Monte Cristo, OBVIOUSLY.

About 20 mins wait for us on a weekday morning. There aren't many tables inside so I can see how weekends can be a problem. I would just avoid the weekends altogether.
author: Yad L.

description:
Came here on a weekday around 10am and had to wait 1.5 hours. Not bad considering sometimes people wait anywhere from 2-3... But with the sun shining down on you, the wait can seem very tedious! When we got to the front of the line, we were so excited. This was my first time at Mama's and I knew it was super popular from all the pictures and yelp reviews.

After debating internally for quite a while in line, I finally decided on getting the Norwegian benedict, which included smoked salmon and capers over an english muffin, topped with two poached eggs and hollandaise with a side of potatoes. I also added avocado for I think $1 or $1.50? The smoked salmon tasted really fresh, and not salty at all which was great! It complemented the hollandaise really well because the hollandaise was very rich. The eggs were poached perfectly which I was so happy about because when I get benedicts with eggs cooked too long... I don't enjoy it. I like those runny yolks!!! 

I definitely want to come back and try the monte cristo... or the crab benedict when I have mo money hahaha. If the monte cristo here compares to the one at Disneyland in Cafe Orleans, i'm sure i'll be very impressed! 

The service is really nice here, everyone is super friendly and accommodating. I honestly feel like the only downside about this restaurant is the wait. They have such a vast selection of breakfast food, that there's a menu item for everyone! But not everyone wants to wait for over an hour for breakfast.. lol
author: Tara A.

description: So good, we're back a second morning in a row. So many things to try and they all look, and tasted, amazing. Eggs Benedict is my marker for a memorable breakfast, and Mama's did not disappoint. Importantly, the coffee, regular and decaf, was hot and plentiful. At 8:00 am, our only wait was being seated after ordering.
author: Ilene T.

description: Tasty and filling. Tried their salmon benedict, apple crumbs, and chocolate crumbs. My favorite was the apple crumbs. The hollandaise sauce and the eggs were on point, the potato sides were ok.
author: Sui N.

description:
So... After reading the hype about Mama's, I decided to go during my first trip to San Fran. My boyfriend and I got there at about 7:45am on a Saturday. We were seated around 9am after waiting in the line. The decorations were pretty and the staff was very friendly and helpful but the food was a little basic for the hype. I got the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend got an omelet, with mimosas all around.  The food was fresh and probably organic but it is the same quality you could get just about anywhere. 
All in all, I'm glad I went once to say that I did, but I wouldn't go again or recommend it.
author: Paige J.

description:
It's a long wait, but worth it especially if your a brunch or Monte Cristo connoisseur.

I'm a huge advocate of brunch and this is one of most my favorite brunch spots. 

Make sure you bring cash and order a few of their fresh baked goods.
author: Nichole K.

description: The line may seem long, but believe me it is worth the wait. We have been several times and never visit without going to mamas. We really love all of the crab specials but I've also had a number of the lunch items as well. Such a quaint lovely place and wonderful service!
author: Jessica J.

description: I went on Saturday 8:40am, thinking that would be early enough to avoid the crowd. Well, i waited for almost two hrs.. What time did those people arrive? Geez! I was getting little impatient, but lovely staffs and amazing Monte Cristo with a glass of mimosa paid it off for all that wait. Definitely try their Monte Cristo..I keep on thinking about it and drooling..french toast on the other hand, it was good but not surprising. I personally liked sweet maple/blackwood's french toast better. But, Monte Cristo! One of the best i had..OHHH! And their carrot cake is amazing too. Make sure to to go that when you order before getting seated since the portions are quite big.
author: Sm Y.

description: We queue for 40 mins and finally get inside. The food was ok but definitely not worth the 40 minute wait.
author: Julissa I.

description:
Writing based on my second experience at Mama's, which was my boyfriend's first taste of San Francisco. Hahaha... He now knows why I made him wake up hella early to leave the hotel about 30 minutes before their opening time (aka before a line starts forming). 
I had their Scrambled Florentine with Uncle Cy's Bloody. As usual, I liked their main dish and it paired really well with their Bloody Mary. Hahaha... Their Bloody give you more than just a kick to wake up, so beware of the serious spice you're going to get from 1 sip. 
The boyfriend ordered their Carrot Cake and 2 Petaluma Farms Eggs. He was seriously enjoying that cake - only shared 1 bite of it with me. Also mentioned how fresh everything tasted and liked the presentation of their dishes and the restaurant. He also thought it was a unique experience on how the staff took orders and seated people (if there was a spot for large groups).
author: Agnes S.

description:
Honestly I'm a little disappointed that this place didn't live up to the hype. We waited for 1:55 minutes for mediocre breakfast food. The one thing this place has going for them is that their food is original. I had never heard of banana nut bread French toast before. We ordered the monte cristo, French toast sampler, and two large orange juices. When we were finally allowed to enter the building, we had to wait in line again to place our order. While in line inside, you can watch the chefs cook the food. That's only if you can look past the multiple fruit flies hovering over all their breads and cakes.  

The fresh-squeezed orange juice was fresh-tasting but room temperature. Once the food arrived, the French toast sampler, which included Swedish cinnamon, lemon berry, and banana nut bread, had a nice flavor but seemed like it had been sitting for a bit. The Swedish cinnamon was hard to cut through but the lemon berry was nice and fresh. I liked the monte cristo better than the French toast. The ham was yummy and the cheese was a nice pairing in the sandwich. 

One of the main reasons I wanted to go to Mama's was to try their homemade jam. It had a nice fresh flavor but I felt like there were more seeds than jam so it would be hard to eat for me. 

I feel like the wait was not justified. I have had much better breakfast food for a much shorter wait.
author: Sara L.

description: The line is worth the wait here. You meet great peeps who are waiting as well and so hard to pick what you want to eat. Best to come with a friend so you can share your meals.
author: Ingrid O.

description: Okay so I first started reading all the other reviews and knew this was a must try place in SF! Within reading all the previous reviews I noticed I definitely had to be there early so I didn't have a long wait. I went on a Sunday morning got there around 7:20 and was about the 6th person in line (not bad at all). I had a party of 3 they opened up at 8am. I couldn't help but over hear him giving wait times and already at 8am the wait was 1 hour 45mins (I'm so glad I got there early). I ordered the Florentine scramble and oh my goodness it was delicious! To this day it has been by far the best breakfast I've had! My family still talks about how great all of our food was. Every time I come back I will definitely visit. The decor was adorable and the staff was so friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend Mamas
author: Marie S.

description: Something for everyone from pancakes, French toast, omelettes, and eggs Benedict. There is always a line so come with a good conversational partner or reading material as you inch toward the delicious aromas. Service is quick once you get through the door and the hurdle of ordering. A good place to practice your delay of gratification.
author: Ann K.

description:
There is no logical reason for the long wait for this place. It was about a 1.5 hr wait for this place on Saturday at 1:30pm. First you wait in a long line outside and then you have false hope when you finally get inside only to wait again to place your order even before you get a table. Then you wait again after u have placed and paid for your order. The servers were pleasant and the main reason this place got a 3 instead of 2. 

Ambience - the restaurant is cute but if you get seated in the back like we did you'll be right next to the kitchen where the dishes are done so you'll receive the nice dirty dish soap aroma to accompany your meal 

Food - I don't get it. The food isn't that good and expensive. I got the crab omelet. It was $27 plus $2 to substitute 3 slices of tomatoes instead of potatoes. The egg on the omelet was overcooked and a bit rubbery and the tomatoes that I paid an additional $2 for wasn't even ripe. And the crab w the omelet was not a good pairing and needed a sauce. My bf got the monte cristo which was a lot better but still not worth waiting in that line 

Overall food is a 2. Not worth it even if there's no wait.
author: Mai C.

description:
Food is good.

But cashier is very bad.
(we order the meal with her)

Waitress told me they can choose the kind of bread. 

But the cashier ignored  our request.

Even if I repeat many times.

I really don't know whats wrong with her.

WTF
author: Tan W.

description: Nothing bad to say at all! This perfect corner breakfast place is amazing! I was the 10th person in line and I got in at 8am when they opened! Recommend getting in line no later than 730am but aim for 7am! The famous Monte Cristo is amazing! The cheese mixture with the jam is a party in your mouth! The coffee is perfect for the dark roast lovers too! Chocolate crumb cake is a whole lot of fun with that coffee! Overall love the place and the people are extremely happy to be here and serve you! My kind of pace :-)
author: Qween B.

description: This place is totally worth the wait, I recommend going early 20 min before they open. Their breakfast menu is amazing, I love their French toast and crab Benedict. Oh and their Jam is soooo good. The worker are all so friendly. You have to try their French toast, they have different flavors and when you eat it with the jam it melts in your mouth.
author: Shannon L.

description:
The wait took quite some time although our group of four was only behind three other small groups outside.

Then when you get inside, you wait a bit more.

All the food is made-to-order and exactly that.

The food:
The French bread is pretty good.   Stick to original or banana unless you really love cranberries to try their sampler.

The omelette, we chose crab, was light on flavor so that you can actually taste the crab.

We also got shrimp Benedict, same applies as the omelette.   

Unless you have the time, you can definitely find good flavorful eats elsewhere.
author: Terry P.

description:
Mama's has been on my go to list since moving to San Francisco. I went with a friend who was visiting on a Thursday around 10am. Line wasn't too bad, it took about 30 minutes to get inside. Once inside you wait on another line to order your food and then are seated.

The ambiance is very cute inside and you feel like you are at an institution. We ordered the Monte Cristo and the french toast sampler as well as bloody mary's. The bloody mary was definitely spicy so make sure you can handle heat before ordering. The food was good, but I thought comparable to any standard brunch fare. Our server was very nice and it was a fun experience. I think I will check Mama's off of my to do list moving forward but it's worth checking out at least once.
author: Tracy S.

description:
Seriously the best breakfast I ever had in my entire life. Such simple dishes come out so wonderful... it's amazing how mama does it! 

As you may have already read, be in line an hour before it opens. I started lining up here at 7 am and soon after people started showing up. I was the second person in line. By 7:30 am the line wrapped to the other door. Once the doors open, they only allow a certain number of people inside so they aren't standing next to you while you eat.

I ordered the salmon and egg dish with bagel. As simple as it sounds, it was one of the most delicious breakfast item I ever had! The salmon was cooked right and paired well with the eggs. The potatoes were awesome. I'm not sure how they cooked it but it was crispy and seasoned right. I also ordered blue berry pancakes. They were really fluffy and fresh blueberries were everywhere. The waiter recommend me this berry sauce that is left on the table and it was superb. The best dish though, was the dungeonous crab, avocado, egg dish that my friend ordered. I didn't know dungeon crab can pair so well with egg and avocado!!! Well worth the price of ~$23 for that dish! 

I'll definitely come back here again next time I'm in SF!

Also, bring quarters for metered parking!!! I think the meter starts at 9:00 so it's well worth coming early.

Also.... THEY DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT CARD!!! MAKE SURE YOU HAVE CASH OR DEBIT CARD!!! Don't wait in line and end up hungry lol
author: Danny L.

description:
I have four words...it's worth the wait.
