We came here this past Friday around 12:30pm and the line was quite long.  But, we didn't mind waiting with a few cups of java in our hands. We waited in line 1 hour before placing our order.  For two people to share, we ordered the Monte Cristo, Fresh Crab Sandwich Special, and Blueberry Pancakes.  

Once we were seated, my bf and I were sitting anxiously, but patiently as if we were two kids waiting to be served treats by our parents.  It seemed like a lot of food, but once it was brought out to us, it wasn't so bad.  

The Monte Cristo
It was the lightest Monte Cristo I've ever had and that is a great thing.  It wasn't greasy by any means, but the bread was moist enough to appreciate the perfect amount of butter that got the sandwich to grill just right.  The Monte Cristo was so good that I almost didn't want to dip it into the deliciously looking, burgundy jam that accompanied it, but I am so glad that I did dip it every other time.  The jam was fruity and florescent, with a calmly sweet taste to it.  This dish was  my favorite.

Fresh Crab Sandwich Special
The crab was quite fresh to the taste and was seasoned so nicely.  The crab really did compliment the scrambled eggs, tucked nicely in the buttery bun.  It was truly delicious. 

Blueberry Pancakes
The pancakes were light and fluffy.  They would definitely rank in the top 5 pancakes that I've ever had.

I would come to this place again and again if I could.  I highly recommend it for anyone who has a few hours to spare!
author: Lily M.

description:
First time in San Francisco and was exciting to come try this place. After doing my research I heard great things about this place and was dreading the long wait I would encounter. Luckily for me I had no line and no wait. I got to order immediately and be seated. 

First you'll order at the counter, takes debit and cash only, then you wait to be seated. I got the famous montecristo recommended by Yelp and the cashier. It was a French toast sandwich with cheese turkey and ham. SO GOOD. Comes with a side of homemade jam. 

Totally recommend this place. Def worth to come again and try something different.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Food tastes great and the ingredients used are so tasty and wholesome. The omelettes are to die for. We ordered two out of the many items on their menu, all which I'd like to come back and try each one every day. Just hands down some of the best breakfast in the Bay Area. There are a couple precautionary warnings I have to give, though. One is the painfully long line you have to wait in to get a seat at the restaurant. We got lucky because we arrived on a day where the area is quieter and less crazy than usual. Another thing I need to address is that once the waiters see your plate emptying, they begin to hover over you and try to rush you to finish your meal and leave so they can seat the next person waiting in line. Other than that, it's really worth it and a must for any resident or traveller in North Beach.
author: Elliot F.

description: Food is great, especially the breads and muffins. Love the little homey feeling inside, but down side I had to wait 2 1/2 hours in order to be seated.
author: Jaime M.

description:
One of the best brunch place!! 
I would say the wait is worth it!
I got the Monte Cristo and Eggs Benedict!
Everything here seems fresh!
Being one of the busiest restaurant, one would expect rude service, but nope, this place has one of the friendliest staff. They're willing to help and please the customers.
The parking here is pretty bad though, but that doesn't hold me back.
author: Candice L.

description: So I was recommended this restaurant by many people and I'm very glad I took the advice. Went on a weekday at about 11 am and had an hour wait. Had great conversation with one of the owners and again with the cashier. It seems they love their job and it shows. We had the crab eggs Benedict which was worth the wait. Fresh crab and the sauce was the best part of it. Can't wait to visit again.
author: Mohammed A.

description:
Well we finally made it here after walking by many times We stayed as the line wasn't bad
I have to say. I don't get it. We waited over half hour to get it. Then wait in line to order food then wait in line to get a table.  When a table is ready we sat down.  I ordered the famous monte cristo sandwich and the home fries were huge pieces of potato. Totally not impressed there was hardly any meat or cheese inside. I would not order this again.   Not a fan of this place I will be heading to Hollywood Cafe tomorrow
author: P S.

description:
This is probably the most famous brunch place in know in SF. Going for brunch during the weekday to beat the line? Ha! Jokes on you! There's a line every day of the week! It's partially because of all the tourists. Half the people in line were tourists. Actually, the best time to go is around 2:15PM. There's usually no line at all. They do close at 3:00PM so make sure you time it out.

 I showed up around 12:45AM and didn't get seating till 1:30PM. So you line up outside and when you get inside, you are still in a line to order. My friend and I ordered the Monte Cristo (which I mistakenly called the Monte Carlo) and the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict, which is pretty expensive ($22.00). We also got the carrot cake for dessert. It is cash or debit only with a fee. No credit cards.

The Monte Cristo was very good. It came with potatoes, which were just as good. They were so freaking crispy! I do wish they put more ham in the bread, but regardless the dish was still delicious. It comes with jam, which is different day by day. It was soooo good. I liked it with the jam but my friend liked it without. 

If I come back, I would try the French toast sampler and the crumb cake. 

The Eggs Benedict was very surprising. The crab was cooked so well. It was nice a crispy. The poached egg was prepared perfectly too. 

The carrot cake was very moist and topped with cream cheese froasting. It was a solid cake but nothing super special. 

I don't know which was my favorite dish. They were both very good in their own way so I would suggest trying both. And don't be afraid to go by yourself too! There were quite a few people I saw who were dining alone. I would not wait 2 hours to eat here, but I think everyone needs to try this place at least once. You won't regret it.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
This place probably doesn't need another review since it's thriving with its long lines, however I had such a great dining experience here I have to share! The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because of the very very very long lines. 

I've always wanted to come here , being a SF native and all I can't believe I took so long to finally eat here but the long lines have always deterred me. However, I decided it was the day I would commit myself to the long line. Happened to be an extremely hot day as well so it was a little tough roasting in the sun for 45-60 minutes. 

Was very excited when we finally made it in ! Relief from the heat and One step closer to trying Mamas for the first time. There is another line at the counter to order once you get in but it went by pretty quickly inside. I ordered a vegetarian omelette and split a French toast sampler with the hubby. Everything was deeeeelicous ! My omelette as cooked perfectly and well seasoned. It also came piping hot which was great because it's so unappealing to have luke warm food. 

The French toast sampler was delicious and a perfect way to try a couple of different ones ! Their homemade jam is also yummy and great to add on your toast.

I would love to come back soon but will have to strategically time it so I don't have to wait in line so long !
author: Nancy T.

description:
Mama's has been on my list of places to try FOREVERRRRRR now. It's always a bit of a trek to get up there on the weekends...especially because San Franciscans LOOOVE their BRUNCH.

We showed up here shortly before closing and just made the cut-off. The good part of that was that the line was only a 30 minute wait...

You step inside, order at the counter, and then they seat you. Food comes out rather quickly and you are left to enjoy your brunch without too much interference. :)

We ordered:
1. Monte Cristo - Think about a moons over my hammie but lux-ified, less greasy, and way more high-end classy. This is pretty much it. The bread is perfect, the egg batter is fluffy, and you don't walk away feeling like you ate a cup of lard. This lots of the charts in my all time favorite breakfast items and could probably eat it every day for the rest of my life..

2. French Toast Sampler - So this wasn't my favorite. I can't help it. I'm not usually a fan of orange zest or fancy fruity toast...so this was already on the "less favored" team when I ordered it. It was alright, but probably wouldn't ever order it again.

3. Pancakes - EVERYONE says the order the french toast, but when we asked the cashier..he said PANCAKES. So we ordered both. and man...pancakes is freakin' right. I would pick them over the french toast any day. yummm. Super fluffy..and you HAVE to try it with the homemade jam. It is soooooo clutch.

4. Crab Benny - B LOVED this one...he liked the big chunks of crab in it and thought the ratio was perfect. I'm pretty sure he ate all the crab off of the other one (aka my half), because I didn't get much of the crab and had mostly greens. lol! Either way..I liked it well enough, just not as much as HE liked it. 

Would definitely be back if the wait is decent. They have a huge selection of coffee cakes as well...will have to try ALL OF THEM next time :)
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Been to this place twice during visits to SF and I've left fulfilled each time.

The problem with this place is the wait. Both times I have gone, I've waited 1.5-2 hours in line to be seated. I understand that this place is one of a kind, so the wait will be expected.

Other than the wait, I have zero complaints about this brunch spot. The food is unreal and everything is so fresh. It is truly the "perfect" brunch spot and worth the hype, in my opinion.

Go take a look at my picture and it explains why Mama's brunch is usually a must for SF visitors. If you can get over the tediously long wait, then definitely go to Mama's. You won't regret it. =)
author: Rupa P.

description:
Delicious. I used to live in SF for 7 years, and recently returned for a short visit. Before I left, I had to make sure that I ate breakfast at Mama's. Unlike most of the reviewers. I cannot complain about the wait because we arrived 15 minutes before they opened and were the 7th party into the restaurant. The doorman/bouncer was really nice and people are really nice during the wait, too. 

We ordered Mama's Breakfast Sandwich, which was the special that day, and a Monte Cristo. I originally wanted to try Mama's Cristo, but they substituted with the Monte Cristo because they were out of some of the ingredients. We also had two Soju-based bloody marys, which hit the spot for our immense jetlag. The bloody marys were fresh and had spicy horseradish and were not too salty. The food was amazing, not greasy at all, and really one of the best breakfasts that I have ever had. 

You should try it if you are visiting San Francisco.
author: Airin M.

description:
This place is to die for! Best breakfast place in my opinion! Yummy! 

Although I waited close to 2 hours in line before I even got to order, it was totally with it. Good customer service and great food.
author: Shirley G.

description:
It was a long wait...an hour plus wait, the wait was hard because of the see-through window of all the wonderful food that you still waiting for. It was all worth it at last, as I walk into the store I felt like a champion on the finish line in a race being awarded. My awards were Crab Cake Benedict, Monte Cristo and Fresh fruits on French Toast. 

I loved the Crab Cake Benedict the most, it was basically a crab meat pattie (many places offer crab cake that consist mostly anything but crab meat) so this was a pleasant surprise. Monte Cristo was very good as well, the savory (sandwich/french toast) plus sweet (the berry sauce) was a blast of flavors. My least favorite was the french toast, it doesn't have any wow-factor or unique taste to it but it was alright.

Staff are very friendly and seating was very comfortable, I walk out very happy and full! Only cons to this place are the long wait time and not-so-pretty washroom (that's just me being fussy, it should be more about the food!).
author: Vanessa C.

description:
The wait is an hour or more and the food is good. Is it worth the wait?
After your outside wait you are cautiously let into the place where you wait in another line to order your food. At the counter you are told no credit cards just cash. Two for breakfast was close to $50 bucks.
You then are told what table to sit at. At one point my friend thought we were going to have to go to the counter to get our food. No that was not the case. A very pleasant lady brought them over. I had two run ins with the Napolenic bus boy. The reason for no credit card is that cash is king and creates a nice vacation kitty. Overall the tourists and millennials can have this place. I will find a good counter breakfast place that smiles at me when they take my money.
author: Timothy D.

description: We got here around 930am on a Thursday and was seated around 1045am....it was totally worth the wait! I highly recommend the monte cristo and I think it was a banana bread French toast type thing that was also very delicious!! If you're looking for an amazing brunch place in SF and have time to wait, you won't be disappointed! The staff was also very kind/friendly!
author: Ashley R.

description: I really don't know why people will wait 2 hours to go here. Is it like on some tourist attraction pamphlet or something that you have to try this place? There's a ton of breakfast and brunch places in the city. I live in the neighborhood and I can name at least 3 other breakfast places in the area that I would rather go too than wait in line....don't wait in line for breakfast people, don't do it, theres better things to do than takes pics of you breakfast and post it on instagram.
author: L N.

description:
Posting a review after my 2nd visit here!

The first time I came was on a Sunday ~ 9. The wait was about 30min to 1 hour, but time passed quickly as I had good company. The restaurant looked very cute, homely, and very inviting! I was excited thinking that we made it as we got to the door, and then my heart dropped when I saw the line INSIDE. WHHYYYYYYYYYYYY. Mama's was really clever to have us line up along the kicthen- we got a full view of all the dishes that were being made and served. Not only was it torturous to see and smell all the food while we lined up, but it was just as agonizing to change my mind over and over everytime I saw a dish being prepped. "I want this- no wait I wan't- but that- OMGGGG". Being the big eaters that we were, my +1 and I ordered:

Washington Square omelette
South of the Border omelette
 Orange and Cranberry mimosas, 
fruit bowl
 French toast sampler ~

The food + vibe + staff friendliness made it a 5 star place, but it wasn't until my second visit that I found the "thing" that put Mama's on my list of favorite brunches

During my second visit on a Saturday (around 11) with some friends we waited ~2 hours (I've never waited that long for food before...). Again, good company made the time fly, but the staff member selling beverages to those lining up made things better. Be advised that any beverages ordered have to be paid in line and in cash.
This time I decided to try the salmon benedict, which was good (who doesn't love benedicts??) but I couldn't help but eye my friend's salmon scramble. I was fed but not completely satisfied and decided to order a stack of pancakes with berries. I need to remind myself that my stomach can't take in as much food as my eyes do... needless to say I was very full and couldn't finish the pancakes. No regrets though, as I discovered how yummy the pancakes were there! The french toasts from my first visit were delicious, but OMG those pancakes were the fluffiest, most perfecrly buttered pancakes that I've ever had. Gotta give them a try to understand what I mean. I don't usually order sweet dishes as my main course but Mama's may be that exception.
author: Sherry Y.

description:
Yup - there was a line, but all things considering, it went pretty fast. Maybe stood in line for around 45min-1hour?

Once inside, yes, there is another line, but to order food. Then, they bring the plates to you. Honestly, not sure how you can do brunch foods wrong so not sure what the hype is all about. Our table ordered the usual fan-fare of pancakes and eggs.

Glad I tried Mama's though as I'm not the one to line up for places, but if this is one of the places to go, than at least I can check it off as having eaten here.

Fast and efficient service.
author: Charlotte W.

description:
Ok as a San Francisco native I have been wanting to come here for years but was always turned off by the long line. We thought the line would be shorter because it was a weekday but we were wrong. The owner mentioned there is always a line in the summer regardless what day of the week. 

When we were finally able to order, we met the owner. He was very nice and gave us se tips to avoid  the long lines but I'll keep that info for SF natives. 

All the French toast seemed amazing and I was excited to hear you could order a combo of the French toast. It was amazing and the raspberry jam on the side was great although I still prefer the toast with maple syrup.  

My friend ordered the monte Cristo which looked like  a combination on fresh toast and grilled cheese. It was great especially with the side of potatoes. We ended up splitting our plates so I was able to get it all.  

I highly recommend this spot. Great brunch food but just expect to wait.  I would also not go with a group bigger than four because there is very limited space. But the owner did mention they would be opening a 2nd spot which is great.  Overall, a great experience with friendly service and delicious food
author: Eduardo G.

description:
Great place for brunch!  But make sure to GET THERE EARLY.  My friends that were visiting the city for the weekend wanted to meet at 10:30am to stand in line.  We didn't eat until close to 1:00pm.  Also, buffer some time to find parking.  It's best to drop someone off to hold your place in line while you spend the next 20-30 minutes searching for street parking.  

Once you get into the restaurant, start studying the menu on the board because you will order & pay at the counter before you are seated.  

Things to try:
- Monte Cristo
- French Toast
- Waffles
- Crab Benedict (seasonal)

Service is quick and pleasant.  Once you ordered your food, they will find a table to seat your group.  They bring your food out when it's ready and collect your plates when you're done.  Nothing fancy.
author: Sophie L.

description:
The big question: will Mama's live up to the hype and will the food be worth the agonizing wait. Magic 8 Ball says: It's very possible!!

We arrived on a Wednesday morning around 10am and fell into the line outside. Luckily, it was a mild and comfortable day and the folks in line were very friendly. It seemed to take quite a while, giving the the people waiting plenty of time to peruse the menu posted in the window. 

When we finally arrived at the door (after around 45 min.), a waitperson quizzed us on how many people, then closed the door on our faces - you must wait to be summoned a few minutes later. We stood in line in the tiny space between the tables and the display case in front of the kitchen. Only then did we discover what the day's specials were and had to make the agonizing decision to go with what we'd already decided on, or change to a special (I changed to the Dungeness crab omelet). 

It was more than an hour before we completed the preliminaries, paid (cash only - don't forget!) and were seated. The food was very good, though, no complaints - lots of it, too. The pancakes looked heavenly and all the other choices, both breakfast and lunch, seemed very appetizing. The server who brought our food was nice and refilled coffee frequently. 

After such a decidedly good meal, a walk up to Coit Tower afterward is definitely in order!
author: Tina S.

description:
Great food! Woke up really early. Drove from Hayward to Daly City BART station. Took BART from Daly City to the Embarcadero Station. Walked from Embarcadero to MAMA'S.
I then waited in line for about an hour before I ordered.
I ordered the Chocolate Crumv and the Northern Italian omelet. You have to be really hungry to finish the whole plate. Yes it was good.
The draw back, time! Either you have the day off from work or on vacation, you still need to sacrifice 2-3 hours of your life to eat here.  I recommend that you try this at least once in your life.
author: Francisco F.

description: Been here several times... very good breakfast place. This past time, the eggs Benedict weren't as good as I remembered (did not love the homemade Hollandaise sauce). The pancakes were excellent though. The wait is long, and they only take cash.
author: Bobby K.

description: Order one of the Famous Monte Cristo sandwiches. You'll know why it's not uncommon for people to wait in line for an hour to eat here.
author: Ann M.

description: The nicest people and best food you will ever eat. What a privilege to eat here. Something you would read about in a magazine and our favorite restaurant in SF by far!!
author: RodneyandPatty A.

description: This is probably one of the best breakfast places I've been to.  French toast and eggs are really good. Wait was about 45 mins but it was def worth it. Service was great. Def would go back here again!!
author: Chandni P.

description:
If Mama's offered its coffee cake on the list of baked goods you can order from their bake shop, I'd say skip the line and just get a coffee cake.

But they don't. And that line-up really was worth it, for that coffee cake....whoops, I'm salivating again.

The rest of our breakfast was delicious too: the french toast (though not as good as what we had at the line-up free Il Fornaio, on the Embarcadero), the crab benedict (really good) and the omelette (which my husband had to order because I was outraged at the idea he'd order basic bacon-and-eggs after I lined up for an hour). 

But that coffee cake -- along with my son's carrot cake (which you CAN order from the bake shop)  -- was life-changing. Honestly, just thinking about being 950 miles away from it makes me want to cry. Maybe I can email the bake shop and see if they will let me order one for delivery. But then I'd eat the whole thing in one sitting.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
This is a small restaurant that normally has a long line. We waited about 1.5 hours.  The wait allowed us to make friends with patient diners, eagerly waiting their turn.  Coffee can be secured for your wait in line if desired.  You order first and then seat yourself.  Mamas controls the crowd by controlling entry to the restaurant. 

We had the special crab Benedict containing spinach.  The Hollandaise sauce was spiked with a touch of pepper, possibly Tabasco sauce. This gave the sauce a unique surprising punch, making the entrée unique.  

For French toast, we selected the cranberry homemade bread topped with berries including strawberries and blueberries. The restaurant makes the cranberry bread giving the entrée a unique flair.  On top of that, the server suggested we try the homemade raspberry jam which excellently mixed with the maple syrup.

If you want an elegant, stuffy restaurant with a standoffish maître d' then his place is not for you.  Consider starting your adventure with a positive attitude and you should have fun.  If the long wait puts you in the mood for the best breakfast you have ever had, then you may be disappointed -- not because the food isn't great, but because you may find one thing that surprises you.  Instead, you should savor the experience and get acquainted with the staff and your neighbors.
author: Allen S.

description:
12.29.13

The food is good and all, especially the Monte Cristo. The Dungeness Crab Egg Benedict and French Toast Sampler Plate were good too. However, sorry to say, but to me, it wasn't worth a 2+hr wait. 

9:10am-11:10am wait in line
11:11am-11:30am wait to order

Our order took approximately another 30mins...

I understand the wait was due to the limited space of the restaurant but I'll most likely won't return because of the wait, not the food.
author: Emily L.

description:
I love this place!!!  The wait is really long-over 45 mins...30 if you are lucky! :( BUT it is definitely worth the wait.  Both the food and the service definitely make up for the long wait. 

My husband and I absolutely love the Monte Cristo...a must have!!!

Overall, a nice clean restaurant, good service and great food... a definite 5-star.  We will be back. :D
author: Stephanie T.

description: After queuing in the standby line for Alacatraz at 6:30am, you bet I was ready to feast at Mamas to kill time before our ferry ride. I walked 15 minutes from Pier 33 to get here, and was willing to queue for more SF treasures. It's definitely worth the wait, but not during the weekend. The whole two hours in line I was debating between the Cranberry Orange French toast, Mamas Monte Cristo and Veggie Eggs Benedict. I finally decided on the Monte Cristo and half an order of the French toast. I order my meal and they they tell me that they are out of both items. I WAS HEARTBROKEN. Hard to accept, I went with the veggie eggs benedict and banana walnut French toast.  Both were bomb, but sadly not out of this world. Hollandaise sauce didn't wow me. If you're going to visit on the weekends, go early cause the dish you're drooling over may run out!
author: Iona N.

description:
Mama's is undoubtedly my favorite breakfast / brunch place. The food here might sound and look simple, but they're simply breathtaking! 

Northern Italian ($10.95) - Pancetta (Italian Cured Bacon), Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomatoes and Garlic Jack Cheese. This was delicious

French Toast Sampler ($9.75 ) - Swedish Cinnamon, Banana Bread & Cranberry-Orange w/ Fresh Fruits. I highly recommend their french toast, they're simply THE BEST. I usually don't like french toast, but these babies're heavenly. They're also not greasy so you won't feel gross after finishing the sampler.

Old Fashioned Buttermilk Pancakes ($8.25) - 3 Light Buttermilk Recipe made fresh each morning. 1 of my favorite pancakes of all time. Once again, they don't feel as heavy as most pancakes yet they pack a lot of flavors. 

Overall - Amazing place to go for breakfast or brunch. You gotta get their French Toast Sampler before leaving this place! This small place's usually packed, so get ready to wait for 30+ mins. However, this place's definitely worth the wait!
author: Robert C.

description: This restaurant should have a flat out 5 star review. Although we did have to wait outside for over an hour, the man out front gave us a very accurate estimate for how long the wait would be. The food was absolutely incredible and the drinks were just as good. A++++
author: Will P.

description:
30 minute wait, maybe more... but it's WORTH IT!  We got the Dungeness Crab Benedict, Bacon, a Bellina, and a Bloody Mary.  The Dungeness Crab Bennedict was delicious.  Egg was poached perfectly, and the crab lumps were abundant.  It is made with spinach similar to a florentine, but that's not an issue.  Hollaindaise sauce was light and creamy.  Served with perfectly cooked potatos.

The bacon on the side was very thick and crispy.  I recommend a side of this no matter what dish you get.

The bloody mary was spicy and one of the best ones I've had in a very long time.  They know what they're doing.  The Bellina was very refreshing.

I would love to come back here sometime.
author: Duy N.

description:
Thanks YELP for the recommendation bc this place was delicious! Hype or not, they delivered on good food and good but fast service.

My group of 3 got here around 9AM and Mamas was already packed and a line out the door! Since I was visiting I made it a point to wait and it wasn't too bad about an hour on a Thursday.

We ordered the French Toast Sampler- sweet but not too sweet like you're eating dessert. 
Mama's Children's Favorite with ham and baguette- savory and fresh. Homemade jam with the baguette is simple but soooooo good. 
Side order of potatoes- Average
Mamma's Smoothie- thick and sweet, but a bit pricey
Chocolate loaf from their baked goods that day- Average. Wish I got the carrot cake instead.

Like some other reviewers said come early to beat the long wait!
author: D.J. K.

description: If you are in the area stop at my Mamas. It is well worth the wait. Everything that new tried was delicious. But I have to say the monte cristo was fantastic!!
author: Teresa D.

description:
THREE HOUR WAITTTTTTT. yeah i waited three hours for food.

We arrived at 8:30 (it opens at 8) and there was a huggeeeeeeeeeee line already. It's probably because the restaurant is pretty small and also because it was labor day weekend so there was a bunch of tourists like us D:
After two and half hours later, we finally got to order our food. Thirty more minutes later, we got our food.

Here is a list of all the amazing food we ordered:
Mama's Benedicts: Two Poached Petaluma Farms Eggs served on a Toasted English Muffin with Hollandaise Sauce and Mama's Grilled Potatoes

Norwegian ($13.50)- Smoked Salmon
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#5C-_EXo6YLgV4CjjXrW4PA

Vegetarian ($10.95)- Sauteed Mushrooms, Avocado, Baby Spinach and Grilled Tomato
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=l6aKFdUEbq4dhVqPLr4r3A#NiAhie1snMkiiHRD0D_rZQ

North Beach (10.75)- Prosciutto and Grilled Tomato
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=l6aKFdUEbq4dhVqPLr4r3A#l6aKFdUEbq4dhVqPLr4r3A

Blackstone ($10.75) - Crispy Bacon and Grilled Tomato
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#PSuL7_mx9VRyHSxrg2Xi2g


M'Omelette's
Served with Mama's Grilled Potatoes and Your Choice of Toast: White, Whole Grain, Rye, English Muffin or Sourdough Baguette

Northwest
Smoked Salmon, Capers, Grilled Leeks and Homemade Creme Fraiche served open faced
$10.95
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#UnxZ2pdTlsN-RdvBkGae5Q

S.O.B. (South of the Border)
Spanish Chorizo, Black Beans, Homemade Salsa and Pepper Jack Cheese
$9.50
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#IVFjopgGJXrZICJsOCTXpQ

Farmers
Smoked Bacon, Baby Spinach, Grilled Leeks and Sonoma Goat Cheese
$10.50
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#dJsHzXiRrH-UgKxD6p1z5w

Mama's French Toast Sampler  (in the restaurant, not on menu)- Blueberry, Strawberry, and Banana french toast with assorted fruits on top
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#OxGP0TamzJkjs6mxirX0yw

Our Famous Monte Cristo (10.50)
Roasted Turkey Breast, Honey Baked Ham, Cheddar and Gruyere Cheese battered in Egg and grilled, served with Homemade Jam
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mamas-on-washington-square-san-francisco?select=cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw#cIX5gckuegkoE5M21O7pIw


Now onto the critiques: 
1. The poached eggs from the eggs benedict were the most perfect poached eggs I've ever eaten in my life. THEY WERE PERFECTION ON A PLATE.

2. The hollandaise sauce on these egg benedicts were soo good. You can tell right away it's not going to be too rich due the color of the sauce. If it's too yellow, it's too rich and overwhelming. But the light yellow hollandaise sauce was amazing and I finished all of it.

3. I normally don't like french toast, but these were pretty good. Also, it was the most prettiest plate I have ever seen in my life. I MEAN LOOK AT THE COLORS OF THAT PLATE.

4. MONTEEEEEEEEEE CRISTOOOOOOOOOO. need i say more? This isn't your average monte cristo. It's not oily at all. Its crispy on the outside and gooey and cheesy on the inside. And that raspberry jam it comes with oh my god. Remember this is an ALL DAY food item so you can order this for breakfast too! I wish I would have just ordered this as my main dish. Damn it was good. 

5. You know the chefs there are perfectionist because everything was perfectly made and delicious! The waiters there are so kind and they kept refilling our drinks and they smiled a lot which is always a plus because I know they love what they're doing :)

WORTH THE WAIT. Seriously one of the best restaurants I've ever been in my life. 

SF citizens, I am so jealous of you.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Only been here once a few days ago and spent nearly an hour in the sun waiting to be seated. But it was totally worth it! I cannot stress it enough, but this place had made my day. I tried three items with my girlfriend from three categories, and they were all so good! To make it even better, you've got to see your food prepared with the finest ingredients, by the best staff.

This is what I called "restaurant with a conscience" 良心饭店
author: Jiacheng W.

description:
Well I guess it pays to wake up early, but today my bf and I needed to sleep in after a late night. We arrived at the end of the Mama's line around 11:00am and were seated around 1:30pm. Yes this was quite the wait. Luckily we brought books with us to read while we waited (I highly recommend this!). 

We ordered the crab benedict, Washington square omelet, and french toast sampler.  

I am a fan of crab and thought the benedict was the bee's knees. Delish. I ate half and passed the rest off to the bf.

The Washington Square omelet is a hit if you like sausage. I tend to fair on the side of not liking sausage so the bf enjoyed most of that. 

The french toast sampler was tasty! My favorite was the challah... great texture to the bread with the perfect smidge of cinnamon. 

Tip: Ask for jam for the toast... the berry jam is AMAZING!

When we come back we will: 

a) Get in line wayyyy earlier.
b) Order the Monte Cristo and Coffee Cake. 

Last note that they only accept cash or debit cards. Happy Brunching!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Love me some Mamas!! Last time in town my
Mom, sis and I decided to trek down there at 7:40am. Thank goodness, as the line was already forming! They don't open til 8, but it's always good to get there early. One thing if you haven't been there before: there's no waiting inside. The place is adorably tiny and they only let you in the door as space becomes available. Not a place to bring a double stroller or screaming starving toddlers. We were lucky enough to be one of the last tables seated before it was full and the wait began outside. Ordered 3 different types of Benedict, plus plain old scrumptious coffee cake. So good! We should've gotten a piece of cake each, but were behaving ourselves?! Anyway, great breakfast spot!
author: Gretta B.

description: If your in sfo then plan to have breakfast from here..be there before 7:30 am in line otherwise you are up in a long queue..as soon as it opened at 8am the service was pretty fast.. no cards accepted.. carry cash!
author: Raf M.

description:
We were told this was a must go spot in SF. If you're going for breakfast you have to get there early cause this place has a line out of the door. 

$15 Minimum for credit cards 

I got a specialty item -- Spanish Eggs Benedict it was pretty good. I also got silver dollar pancakes that were ok. I didn't like their smoothie or their orange juice. The smoothie has honey in it which is fine. I just think they use too much honey so it basically cancelled out the taste of all the fruits in the smoothie. 

My girlfriend got the the Eggs Benedict but with pancetta. She also got French toast and she fell in love with both. 

All in all its a good place to try for breakfast or brunch.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Mind blown by their French toast sampler 

Got the Swedish cinnamon , lemon berry and orange cranberry I think . All three were awesome . 

The holandaise sauce over the Benedict was a bit on the tarty side but I like that so worked for me !!!
author: Vasini G.

description: Good food, but I would be surprised if they could find a way to be any less innovative or efficient at serving guests. Small minded business owner sitting on a gold mine of demand and redefining what it means to underachieve.
author: Kameron W.

description:
Was guided here thanks to Time Magazine's article on the top 10 things to do in SF.  This came in #2.

The Dungeness Crab and Shrimp Benedict's were scrumptious.  The crab was surprisingly light, tasty, and not dry.  The shrimp was even more amazing for 1/2 the price!  Potatoes were above average and completed the dish.  The Orange Juice was freshly squeezed, sweet, with the perfect amount of tang, and no additives.  We finished off the meal with a Cinnamon Walnut & Sour Cream Coffee Cake.  It's the definitive coffee cake with the amount of sweetness, lightly crispy on the edges, and just so darn good!

Note: If you're horizontally and/or vertically large, go to the bathroom beforehand and avoid the diminutive bathroom.
author: Jeremy D.

description: This is the second time I have come since I've been here in San Francisco. First the pancakes and now the chocolate cinnamon French Toast. Delicious. There was a line both days I came. It's very popular so get here early or towards closing time and even then might be a bit of wait. Place is small, cozy and non stop movement. The menu is pretty good and service was good both days. You walk in after being in line outside if there is a line and order at the counter then you are seated. Food is brought to you. Most of the people that came in were ordering the French toast. It seems the top 3 is the sampler, cranberry orange and chocolate toast.
author: Jesse V.

description:
Waited in line for 2 hours, it was about 35 degrees outside. Finally make it in, still waited to order and get seated by the door, where the cold wind was blowing in. 
Servers were really friendly. Got an apple juice, that was freshly made. Got the Mama's Cristo, it was good.
Overall it is a great place, I just do not think it's worth waiting 2+ hours for.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I was warned that there would be a really long wait. Didn't realize that it was going to be nearly 2 hours! The line outside moves very slowly because you have to wait for table seating. Once you get through the front door, there is a smaller line that you have to wait in to order. While you're in the shorter line, you can watch the kitchen staff cook and look at the wonderful selection of bread they use for their french toast.

I had the Washington Square Omelette (not memorable, but very good sausage inside). I would recommend getting something more specialized to this location since the wait is so long! So you should try to order something that you can't get anywhere else. We also got the French Toast Sampler with the blueberry, lemon berry, and banana nut bread. My favorites were the blueberry and lemon berry.

I had good company and wasn't starving. So the wait in line wasn't miserable. But I don't think I would wait in line to eat it again. Glad to be able to say that I've tried Mama's in SF though!
author: Pauline T.

description: Ate here last May. We waited in line for about an hour. Got to mingle with other tourists and take pics. I was super excited to try the mamas cristo as it was a hot item on yelp. We were seated by the waitress who was a Seattle native, she was awesome! I loved the atmosphere, really enjoyed the meal, it was worth the wait. Can't wait to return.
author: Christina P.

description: This is the best breakfast since I came here. I ordered Mama's cristo and coffee. I didn't want to have sweets like pancakes, waffles for breakfast, so this was a good choice for me!! The toast included cheddar cheese and roasted turkey or honey baked ham, tasted very yammy Besides, it served with some fruits. Fruits go with the toast(*^^*) I recommend you going‼
author: 美衣

description: Great food. If you go 7:30am then you will only wait for 30 mins to get seated during the busy season. Staffs are awesome too.
author: Emily W.

description: Absolutely love this place. The breakfast was amazing they definitely give breakfast food their own twist and it works. Standing in line sucks it does. I rarely will do it but for this place I would stand in their two hour lines. I had the pan dore and california omelette (yes I am a fatty). The omelette was amazing it had full strips of bacon running through the middle of it like a bed of bacon topped with a layer of avocado. The potatoes were amazing crispy on the edges but cooked well on the inside. The pan dore was something I wanted to try since it was not something I would typically order. Sourdough french toast who does that? with sauteed apples  and a lemon sauce. It was mind blowing completely amazing I also couldn't finish everything. I am planning another trip to San Francisco just to see this place again.
author: Reynaldo R.

description:
Let's be honest here, this is NOT worth the one hour wait.  It was good, but not mind-blowingly good enough for me to wait an hour. 

I got the vegetarian benedict and the hollandaise sauce was actually pretty good.  You can tell that they add a lot of lemon in their sauce.  But like I said, it wasn't mind blowing, wet my panties kind of good.  Maybe I would've been more content if they gave me more hollandaise sauce or potatoes - I mean I did wait for an hour... with the sun burning my eyes. 

I couldn't get a grip on how this place worked at first... You wait outside for a while and then get in another line inside.  That's where you order from a board, pay, and then wait for a table to become available.  They seat you and then there's a server to help you out if you need them.  Our server was a grumpy cat.  She didn't say anything to us even when we said please or thank you.  Blank stare and super quiet.  How awkward...............  Also I wont forget to mention that they don't accept credit cards, but they do accept debit cards with a $1 charge.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
Everyone should come to Mamas at some point in your life. The food is solid breakfast cooking with a dose of Classic SF flare. 
I hear the monte cristo is a must but I can't bring myself to skip the eggs Benedict. My kids get the French toast so I'm guaranteed to have a bite of sweet satisfaction.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Giant portions, great service.  Make sure you bring cash.  And plan to wait in line.  Even on a weekday, there was a line before it opened.  Steep prices, but maybe it's just San Francisco?  And definitely try their jam.
author: T D.

description:
I swear brunch places in San Francisco are like Korean restaurants in Los Angeles, people would wait forever just to sit and eat for an hour or so. But of course, the lines are only there because the food is good! The same applies for Mama's. My friend and I thought we went "late" enough that the line would die down a bit...nope! We waited a little over an hour even though we went at like 1:30ish. I heard one hour wait is no biggie at this place by the way, many wait way longer. Anyhow, is it worth it? I guess so. Just a note, prepare to circle around and around for meter parking!

Anyhow, I had the French Toast Sampler with Fresh Fruits, which is great for a newbie like me who never tried any of their bread before. My sampler of French toasts were made with the Swedish Cinnamon, the Cranberry-Orange, and the Banana Nuts bread. The presentation was amazing--very appetizing and colorful. My favorite was the Cranberry-orange one because it has a tang to the sweet maple syrup. I also had a bite of my friend's Egg Benedict, which tasted typical enough. 

Ohhh, I highly recommend the carrot cake here though. I ordered one and had a bite despite how full I was from brunch. I kept waiting for my food to digest in my belly so I could eat more of that cake. I would definitely walk in just to order a slice to go. So good!
author: Mandy C.

description: Long lines but worth trying at least once if you are visiting SF. No credit cards so make sure you have cash. Family owned business and very friendly staff.
author: Stan C.

description:
4 stars because the line. Yes, the huge line, be ready for it! 
I've waited outside for 1h and 30 minutes on a Saturday morning during Chrismas holidays... but the staff was taking orders outside for hot drinks which I thought was really nice (first time that I see that happening).

The food is really good, and the price is reasonnable for what you get in the plate. 
I definitely recommend the place, and I can't wait to go back!
author: Marion K.

description: Best place ever to visit when in San Francisco! Great food and very friendly customer service. It's a must go to breakfast/ brunch place when visiting. The wait is definitely worth it. Overall just amazing!
author: Rachel M.

description:
We just ate here Sunday and loved it. We arrived at 740 and there was already a line of about 20 people. We got in and seated by 835 though so not a terrible wait. Just go in knowing it's a wait. You order upon entering at he counter so I'd look up a menu before hand or look at the one posted outside. 

I literally don't think anything could be bad. They also have amazing looking pastries up front. Our waiter was great and even brought me some jam and told me to try it on my French toast which was delicious. He also helped us after with suggestions for a coffee shop and even went outside to show us where to go. 

The food was fabulous and makes sense why people wait. Very good breakfast for the value.
author: Daley D.

description:
***Long waiting time***

I suggest to eat a piece of fruit and maybe a little bit of coffee or orange juice (if that is your morning ritual).

This is a small restaurant with everything made fresh. Everything on the menu sounded delicious. I ordered the Kugelhopf French Toast because of their house-baked brioche. Of course I had to go with something I wouldn't or couldn't get where I live. It was delicious! :)
I love my french toast a bit crispy and that's how I got it. Heaven in my belly. :)

Below is a summary of what my friends ordered.
1. California Omelette: big portion of deliciousness.
2. Pancetta Eggs Benedict: it's the creamy Hollandaise sauce that makes this place different than any other breakfast restaurant.
3. Monte Cristo: worth every bite and is a specialty item. The brioche was nicely toasted and a perfect match with the jam.

I would definitely recommend this place to eat but remember there will be a long line just to get in. Do not come completely starving because the sun can get the best of you and you may get a headache. That's just an FYI. 

The restroom is past the kitchen area and down a few steep steps. Be careful when walking there.

The prices are overall reasonable for what you get. Per person, the average price without a drink is $11.00. They do offer fresh baked goods which we did try and again delicious. :)

I hope this helps you when deciding to eat here. Enjoy! :)
author: Tricia S.

description:
This place gets ridiculously crowded!! If u don't want to wait you better start lining up around 6:30 in the morning! The food however is amazing and totally worth it if you decide to wait in the two hour line.

We tried the croque Madame, crab Benedict, blueberry and coffee cake, pancakes, and French toast. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. 

Service was pleasant and fairly quick with our orders. The only down side is how small this place is. You might have to get quite cozy with your neighboring table and you might not be able to have a conversation with your guests or even in your own head as it gets noisy
author: Linz C.

description: This was recommended by our "home away rental​ agent". I am so glad.  There was a wait ( about 20 minutes) but they get you in and out without making you feel rushed.  More importantly, the food was fantastic.  We went for breakfast and the French toast was delicious.
author: Suzan C.

description: we waited for over an hour outside in the rain. I can't believe it but it was well worth it! the banana pancakes with chocolate chips were amazing. along with the cheeeeeeese omelette with goat cheese, cheddar and garlic jack. love this place! the chocolate cinnamon French toast was just ok.
author: Dina K.

description:
Great Restaurant!
love how comfy and cozy it is, just be prepared to wait for a while but in the end is all worth it !

We had Monte Crist which is like a French toast and a sandwich together! The Crag Dungeness was amazing, the flavor of the crab incredible.To top it off the French toast sampler with their homemade breads just wonderful, the quality of all ingredients definitely worth it. 

Pros: quality ingredients
Cons: wait time and they only take Debit cards
author: Valente O.

description: The best breakfast I've had in San Francisco. The food was fresh and tasty . I had the Cranberry Orange French toast and they were to die for. We arrived at 7:20am and we were the 16th person in line so make sure you arrive before 7:30am otherwise you will be waiting in line for over 1hr. What I also like is that I didn't feel rush after being seated. I usually go to Dottie's and I always feel rush after being seated. The customer service was wonderful they kept on asking us if we wanted more coffee. It's worth the wait!
author: Noah V.

description: Small little place with a huge menu! We waited in line for a good 30-45 minutes before we were able to order/pay/be seated. It was just crowded for brunch but it was well worth the wait! They have really great fresh squeezed juice. I got pancakes with fruits and scrambled eggs and it was all delicious. My husband got their club sandwich with a side of potato salad and it was also really good! Aside from the wait it was a good experience! I'd definitely come back :)
author: Jessica M.

description:
Oh Mama's. I was determined to try you so I woke up at 6am for you. Given that I hit the snooze button a few times. My friend picked me up at around 6:50 and arrived approximately at 7:30 (more like drove by first) and to our surprise there was not a single person in line yet. We parked and decided to wait in the car for a few minutes because we weren't expecting a line. But being kind of paranoid, we left the car and found ourselves already the 4th/5th party in line. I swore the line only increased exponentially as time passed. 


I didn't expect to order immediately and pay before we choose our seats. Because of that, if we wanted more food.... well, I don't know what you would do. 

We got the French toast sampler and Monti Cristo to share. 

French toast sampler - Very fresh fruits. The one with the cinnamon bread was my favorite, then the cranberry orange. The banana nut wasn't as impressive, it tasted like any regular banana nut bread. 

Monti Cristo sandwich - smaller than I expected, but it was absolutely delicious. Gave me a better impression, since the one I had at Disneyland wasn't that great. 

Personally, the dishes filled me up, given that I may have a smaller appetite than most. I think my friend was still just content. So in this situation, the ordering process was not in our favor.   I'd say order another dish if you're here just to be safe.
author: Harriet W.

description:
Waited an hour and a half in line to try out Mama's. Basically you wait outside in line to be let into the restaurant. Then you wait in line inside to order.  Then you wait to be seated.  Then you wait to be served your food. Oh the anticipation!

Love that you can see the chefs through the glass. Everything that they plated out looked so yummy.  We had the southwest omelette and Mama's Christo (which was huge!). The Mama's Christo was served with a delicious marionberry jam that I definitely doused everywhere. I get the hype! Mama's is darn good but only the wait deters me.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
3.5 stars? 4 if you discount the wait.

Back in 2010, I waited in line for this. It was good. I have since had many more brunches in my life. I don't remember this being so good that I'd want to wait in that line again.

Maybe that's my taste buds maturing or maybe that's me outgrowing lines. If you go with a few friends and you all love lines. Because otherwise, you'll have to make sure everyone stays patient.

Liguria bakery across the street is amazing.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Mama's on Washington Square

Blackstone Benedict (bacon and tomato)

Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast
author: Paul S.

description:
I came here twice in a month (thats what he said?!), once at 7:30 am on a Friday and I was the 11th guy in line and the once at 2:30 pm on a Friday with no line. THEY DO TAKE DEBIT CARDS, just not credit. 

Both times my friends and I ordered pancakes and the crab cakes egg benedict and it was amazing. You may wait 15 mins max for your breakfast which isn't bad at all especially at 8 am in the morning. The crab cake eggs benedict was $22, and standard pancake stack is $10. When it gets busy the asian lady cashier will walk away from the register until a few people leave which is kinda meh but whatever. This is the best breakfast place I've eaten at in California, stamped!
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
Father's Day 2013...  No better way to celebrate Papa's Day than going to Mama's on Washington Square!  Special thanks to my wife and daughters for planning this one.  Although we arrived about 30 minutes before the doors opened at 8am, we didn't get inside until it was maybe 8:15am.  Another line greeted us as we made our way to the cashier to order and pay.  From the line, we got a good look at the kitchen crew in action.  Half hour later, we were finally seated.

We ordered a couple of their specials - the Dungeness Crab Benedict with Sauteed Baby Spinach and the Dungeness Crab Omelette with Tomato, Avocado, and Havarti Cheese.  Prices were a bit steep at $21.50 / $21.95, but the taste was absolutely delightful.  Plenty of Dungeness crab to enjoy in both dishes.

We also had the Pan Dore, which was so splendid with those thinly sliced sourdough bread with sautéed apples in lemon-butter sauce.  Guaranteed to give you your sugar rush!  The last item we had was their Famous Monte Cristo and I think this is what everyone should try from their menu.  It had turkey, ham, cheddar, and gruyere cheese; grilled and served with homemade jam.  This more than made up for the long wait we had to endure both outside and inside combined.  Definitely a must try!
author: John L.

description: Disappointing. The food here is good but the service has been poor and unfriendly. Personally, I don't think it's worth the 2 hours queue. Credit cards are not accepted, only cash. And that's all only for breakfast. Unacceptable.
author: Lily C.

description:
Worth the wait! At first i thought all brunches taste the same but I was so wrongg. On Tuesday, we went to Mama's at around 11 and there was already a long line. After about an hour or so, we were finally seated for brunch. 

- Monte Cristo: must have!! Flavor was well balanced and special.

- French toast sampler w/ berries: fruits were fresh and the French toast wasn't too heavy. Didn't feel guilty after having it.

Berry smoothie and grapefruit: they don't add sugar to grapefruit juice, and the smoothie was refreshing!

Normally I won't give a 5 but.. Mama's deserves it.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
First, this breakfast is worth the wait. We arrived around 9am on a Saturday and we were sitting down with food in front of us just over an hour later. (Several people in the restaurant mentioned that a two hour or longer wait isn't uncommon, so be prepared for that.)

The Northern Italian Omelet was truly spectacular. The blend of flavors from the pancetta and mushrooms along with the creamy blend of cheeses was just amazing. We also ordered the huevos rancheros and the Washington Omelet, both of which were excellent. Ordered a slice of carrot cake (because we spied it on another table) and it was every bit as delicious as it looked. 

We also tried a simple buttermilk pancake, because the pancakes were much raved about online. The pancake was beyond perfect. I am very picky about pancakes and theirs was one of the best. Every single thing on the menu looked wonderful as we watched things come out of the kitchen. 

I'd be back in a heartbeat, if we had more time to spend in the city!
author: Mary Y.

description:
OMG I DIE! My hubby and I waited an hour and 20 minutes and let me tell you it was so totally worth it! 

We ordered their Our Famous monte cristo with homemade strawberry jam --- damn I didn't think it could be that good. With the saltiness of the cheese and turkey with the sweetness of strawberry jam--- so damn tasty!!! We also got their special Dungeness crab Benedict--- I'm obsessed with benefits and this one definitely did not disappoint. So yummy and the crab was so fresh! We also tried their French toast sampler with three different French toast flavors--- I'm not a French toast fan but the banana walnut was very good and all the bread is made fresh in the restaurant!! We seriously loved it. Definitely recommend trying this place out and don't be scared of the line! It's not too bad and the food is so WORTH it!!!!
author: Stephani P.

description:
It's not free money, it's not Jordan's and heck, it's not even the DMV. So why are people lining up for 2.5 hours at the corner of North Beach? Because Mama's Brunch. There are three big reasons why Mama's is such a consistently popular place.

Reason Numero Uno: THE MONTE CRISTO
The Monte Cristo is the crown jewel of this popular brunch place. It is basically a french toast ham and cheese sandwich served beautifully on a powder sugared plate. You can choose to bite right into the crispy exterior of the french toast and let the warm ham and cheese slowly fill into your taste buds, OR you can choose to cut the sandwich up into tiny pieces and dip them into a sweet syrup before your epic indulgence. 

Reason Number Two: CRAB BENEDICT
The Dungeness Crab Benedict is so delicious that it would make Benedict Arnold come back over to the U.S. Army. It's pretty hard to turn your back on fresh-tasting crab engulfed in egg yolk and hollandaise sauce. You can betray your country Mr. Arnold, but you can't betray your tummy!

Reason Number Three: HYPE
As good as Mama's is, the wait is 2.5 hours no joke on a bloke. So if you go consistently, you must either be a very patient grasshopper or simply a bonafide hypebeast. Let's be real, we are only talking about breakfast food. I don't care how organic the eggs are or how much powdered sugar they put on the plate, no brunch should be worth waiting 2.5 hours for under the heat of the blazing North Beach sun.

With that being said, I'll probably still go to Mama's if I know of a friend that hasn't been here before. It's just so famous now that I think everybody ought to go at least once and judge for themselves. But OTHERWISE, I won't be waiting for 2.5 hours here unless they're attaching a pair of Space Jams to my order of Monte Cristo.
author: Ringo M.

description:
This place was ok. Yes, you'll have to wait. Either get over that part & try it or don't. Hate the reviews who whine over this...deal.

The food is pretty good. Place gets a lot of hype, which may allow for disappointment in the end.

Ordered the monte cristo, it was good, too bready, not enough meat, but cheese was delicious. The French toast sampler was fine. The toast was too thick, not fluffy & light as I would expect it to be. 

Also ordered the huevos rancheros, no flavor, very bland.

The most fantastic thing out of all the food we ordered was the cole slaw, a dill creamy base, just wonderful.

The service was good, very friendly, prompt & helpful.

Because of the hype, I guess you should try it, but if you don't have the time to wait in line or miss a chance to go, don't be heart broken. Try Dotties...
author: Stacie R.

description:
Pretty good place. Aririve early. We got there at 730am (they open at 8) and we were 2nd in line. I've heard waits can take 2+ hours. 

Order at the register and then find a seat. Definitely known for their Monte Cristo. I would definitely recommend if ordering the sweet stuff if you do t have a preference.
author: John G.

description:
I finally got to try the famous Mama's on Washington Square! And yep, I did have to wait in that infamous 1.5 hour long line before I got seated like the rest of the folks. Lined up at 8AM, got in at approximately 9:30AM. In order to eat here, you must have patience, persistence, and a tolerable hunger level. With the amount of waiting, I felt like I was going to die from starvation before I got in, but luckily I made it in and out alive. Also, it's really nice of Mama's to have a waitress come outside and offer coffee to waiting customers in line.

The line leads to a hanging menu above and eventually, the cashier who rings up your order. You pretty much order what you've been eyeing on the menu before you get led to your assigned table. The workers are all hard-working and nice, but are definitely busy so it may be hard to get one's attention right away. My boyfriend and I ordered the French Toast Sampler, The Californian Omelette, Northern Italian Omelette, Freshly Squeezed Orange Juice, and a smoothie.

Californian Omelette - Prepared very well with crispy bacon, avocado, and Monterey Jack Cheese. Not too burnt or watery, and very fluffy. Delicious, but I would not recommend it because it is a bit on the plainer side (I'd suggest an omelette with more ingredients in it).

Northern Italian Omelette - Includes Italian Cured Bacon, mushroom, fresh basil, tomatoes, and garlic jack cheese. My boyfriend loved this one; me not so much. I thought it was a bit too pepper-y or too many spices in a bite for my taste. But try it for yourself, I'm sure it's delicious :)

Freshly Squeezed Orange Juice - Very freshtasting and delicious. Quenches your thirst perfectly on a hot day. Recommended.

Smoothie - Delicious and fresh tasting as well. You can taste the blended texture of fresh fruits and not something artificial at all. Recommended.

French Toast Sampler - Very good, and I would recommend it for everybody to try! It features three different types/flavors of toasts, and I enjoyed the one that tasted like cinnamon the most. Comes with syrup and fruits such as blueberries, strawberries, and bananas. Definitely big enough to split too.

I hope my recommendations help you with your first or returning visit, but this place is definitely a must-try to check off of your foodie bucketlist!
author: Michelle S.

description: This place was definitely worth the wait!! Do yourself a favor and order the Monte Cristo
author: Gen P.

description:
Holy Brunch Gods this line was horrifying. I stood in the November sun for over 1.5 hours for a hallowed seat at Mama's. Why is a question I will continue to ask myself for another year. This was further reinforced by the collective sigh I head once the line I was standing in let us inside to wait even further. Like wtf. 

Food was not instagrammable, I am sorry to report so I didn't even get bragging rights and I bet ppl are questioning whether I have even BEEN to the sacred grounds of a routine top-tenner in the SF brunch scene. Well my little haters, I have, and yes, therefore I am better than you. 

Food was still yum. I dug into some of my friend's Kugelhopf and excusing how it sounds like kegel, it was very good. I also enjoyed Chocolate Cinnamon. Unfortunately, the 2.5 hours I had reserved for brunch were largely eaten by this line so by the time my freshly prepared food made it to the table I had 20 mins to scarf down and have convo with friends so I took my dish to go. 

Word to wise - Chocolate cinnamon looks unsightly after 2 hours in the box. And unless you're really craving some shit or you have a starving brother on hand or you are morally inclined to eat anything that costs you over $15 and 2.5 hours of your life, will probs end up in trash.
author: Radhika P.

description:
I've heard so much about this place, I HAD to come here for breakfast. My boyfriend and I got in line thirty minutes before opening on a Tuesday morning and we were still pretty far back in line. It took us around 45 minutes to get in, so it would be advantageous for you to come on an early morning weekday so you can find parking and avoid standing in line 5ever.
Once you get in, you stand in another short line to order and wait around until a server finds an empty table for you. It's a very staggered system for maximum efficiency. Luckily, your eyes will have many things to ogle while you wait. Watch the cooks through the glass doing their thing. Read the articles about Mama on the wall. Stare at the beautiful pastries.
We decided on the Monte Cristo ($13) and the vegetarian omelette ($12). The vegetarian omelette was DELICIOUS. It had such a generous serving of creamy goat cheese inside. The omelette comes with potatoes and your choice of bread. I chose the sourdough. There are glasses of homemade strawberry jam at every table, which I used for my bread. I also asked for butter and I think that's homemade too. 
My boyfriend loved his Monte Cristo and the apple crumble he ordered. They heat the crumble up for you and bring it out before your meal so you have something to snack on while you wait.
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description:
Although the food here is good, I don't think it's worth the long wait. I went to Mama's thinking that I could put my name down on a waiting list with a host/hostess & then find a Starbucks to get coffee & visit some cute shops while I waited, since I'd heard Mama's always has a long wait. But no, there is no host/hostess, & there is no waiting list. You literally have to stand in line the entire time you're waiting (over an hour on weekends). 

When we finally got in, we got the Dungeness crab eggs benedict & the french toast sampler. Both of them were really good, but like I said, not worth the wait. The french toast sampler came with 3 pieces - cinnamon, cranberry-orange, & banana walnut. My favorite was the banana walnut, which is especially good when you eat it with the banana slices it comes with. As for the crab benedict, I loved that it came with a ton of spinach. 

Overall, I would come again, but not on the weekend. I definitely want to try their famous monte cristo or pancakes the next time I'm back.
author: Cici A.

description:
Yes, there is always AT LEAST an hour and a half wait, even on weedays (so I could only imagine weekends..)

But once you get through the 2 lines (one outside and the one inside) you have all this built up anticipation (similar to an amusement park ride). 

We tried the dungeness crab benedict and the shrimp omelet. Were they good? Yes. BUT was it worth the longest wait I've ever had in my life for food? ehhhhh debatable.

I think once you go here once though, it loses its appeal. You can at least say you've been there, waited, tried it, and then move on.

And I wasn't blown away by the orange juice everyone keeps raving about, but then again I'm a Floridian so I guess I can be picky when it comes to that =P
author: Noelle H.

description:
We went to mama's yesterday! We lined up for one and half hours but it is worth! 
The restaurant and food are all good and delicious ! However, we felt uncomfortable with the cashier 's attitude. We paid cash with some one dollar coins. First time she return one of the dollar coin and said that it's not one dollar ! Then we double check , it is one dollar. Then gave it back to her , the cashier's face just like "oh come on I don't want to accept coins" ! As a foreign tourist we came here for its famous food, and we enjoy it, but I just felt very uncomfortable with the cashier's service attitude !
author: Nina L.

description:
We arrived at 8:15am.  We ordered at 9:25am and were seated at 9:30am. We didn't mind the wait because we knew there was going to be a line. At about 8:40am staff came out and asked us if we wanted anything to drink which was nice, we passed on the drinks but the couple behind us ordered a coffee and it was cash only. She mentioned you get free refills once you are seated. 

I ordered the Norwegian Benedict and the french toast sampler, my wife ordered the Dungeness Crab omelet with avocado. For drinks we both ordered mimosas. 

The portions aren't big which is ok if the flavor makes up for it, but sadly the flavor was just ok, nothing to brag home about. The potatoes were average, didn't have much flavor.  My wife said her omelet was good but not amazing. 

The star of the morning was the french toast sampler,it was very good! The sampler included three flavors: blueberry, cranberry, and cinnamon swirl, they also came with sliced bananas and blueberries. The flavor of each was distinct and rich, my favorite was the blueberry.

The mimosas were below average, no thought went into the presentation just a glass with champagne and juice. Not worth it. 

This place is expensive, total came out to $75. 

-Long wait times
-Average Dungeness Crab omelet & Norwegian Benedict 
-Delicious french toast
-Below average mimosas 
-Pricey

Glad I went to cross it off my list but I am not going back.
author: Jose R.

description:
I am so bummed that this place did not live up to the hype.

We've waited in line for almost an hour and half on a Tuesday morning.  I can't imagine how packed it is on the weekend.

Overall, it tasted like any other brunch place. Sort of like a bills café in the South Bay. I rather go there an wait for 20-30 minutes for a table while sipping on some refreshing mimosa than wait in line in the cold here for some benedicts. While standing in line we decided to order all most of the popular dishes since we probably won't every go back due to the long wait.

Monte Cristo: It's a cross between a grilled cheese sandwich and French toast served with their special jam. The jam was REALLY good.

Norwegian (smoked salmon benedict): I am usually not smoked salmon kind of person since its always taste salty. However, the smoked salmon served here was fresh and tasty.

Northern Italian (omelet): It was on the saltier side but still good.

North Beach (prosciutto benedict): Skip. it was also very salty.

Corn hash benedict (I don't remember the name): It was my favorite one out of all the dishes we had.  

Overall the food was good. The quality of the food here is excellent. Even though it's just brunch food you are tell the food was prepare well and the ingredients was very fresh. However, I don't think I would come back because the wait was ridiculous even on a Tuesday morning!
author: Judy V.

description: Stopped here for the first time. I was told that this place was pretty good but there would be a wait. Little did i know there were 2 lines. After waiting for an hour outside and another 10 minutes inside we finally ordered and made it to our seats. The food was pretty good. I recommend the mama cristo and the regular French toast. Stay clear of the banana nut and the orange cranberry French toast. Sometimes less is more. If you're willing to wait in line for an hour plus, check this place out. If not there are plenty of other places to eat.
author: Anthony R.

description: We came to Mama's last year and we enjoyed their French toasts and pancakes. They make really good breakfast. The downside was the wait was 45 minutes+ as there are a lot of tourists and locals visiting.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
We waited in line for an hour because this place is supposed to be phenomenal... It was great, the food was fantastic but not worth waiting in line for more than 20 minutes. My absolute favorite part was ordering the carrot cake while waiting for our order! Took awhile for our breakfast to be served, the carrot cake is phenomenal! Great to have a few bites and take the rest home!

While waiting in line, this genius of a man, walked right in and picked up his to go order! MUCH better idea! Call in your order, pick it up and have breakfast in the cute park across the street!
author: Rebecca A.

description:
We waited a little over an hour on a weekday for a table for six at Mama's.  When it was our turn in the front of the line, we were ushered in to form another line by the cash register so we could place and pay for our order.  Once inside, the place was run like a well-oiled machine.  

I ordered the Crabs Eggs Benedict and diet soda while hubby ordered the Crab omelet and orange mimosa.  We also shared a plate of French Toast Sampler.  Our bill without tip was over $70, pretty expensive for brunch.

I liked the Crabs Eggs Benedict because it did not scrimp on crab meat, but at $22.75 per order, it's kind of expected.  My husband's Crab Omelet was just as expensive.  He liked his omelet, but he said he preferred my order.  Our group liked the French Toast Sampler but I didn't care much for it because I'm more of a pancakes kind of gal.    

One of our friends ordered the Monte Cristo to share and I must say it's the best of its kind.  I should have just ordered my own plate.  

Service was actually five stars and food was four stars.  But the wait time was just plain ridiculous given that there are other brunch places that serve just as good (if not better) Eggs Benedict.  The only reason I would return to Mama's is for their Monte Cristo.
author: Janice T.

description:
Im sorry folks. But after coming here for 9 years a couple times a year mainly with visiting out of Towners this place has officially jumped the damn shark.  Much better breakfasts to be found close by. Sorry I won't say which ones because I don't want to see a long line of Asians with their cameras taking pictures. 
Notes:  seems run by all Asians now too someone bought this place and and now skimps on the quality of the ingredients and product. It's very obvious!  Service is awful - Asian style now. Chorizo was grizzely mess disgusting. Putting black beans in an omelette ?? Are you kidding me?  I will never go back to mamas as its really changed and neither should you!!! This is only a 2 or 3 star place at best peoples and anyone who reads this then waits on that long ass line is simply an idiot.
Also no credit cards LMAO. what legitimate business doesn't take credit cards in 2016??
author: Kyle K.

description:
Must pay with cash or debit card. Apparently always a line. We waited for about 45 min. 

I got the sampler with French toast and a side of bacon. It was AMAZING!!! 

Great place to eat if you don't mind the wait.
author: Guy W.

description:
I can't believe I have not reviewed this place before !!! Wow my bad !
Great great breakfast when your in SF , a must stop , I guess that's why the line is always around the corner . We usually go late am , line much shorter .  You can not go wrong with the many egg dishes , but they have great pancakes too . ... I need to add a pick next time I'm in SF
author: Debra S.

description:
I've been to Mama's on two occasions. The first time I ate here was about two years ago and my friend and I waited for two hours in line before being seated. 

I was not going to make the same mistake twice so, today I arrived at 7:30am (30 minutes before opening) and we were seated when the doors opened. We ordered the Dungeness crab omelet, Dungeness crab cake Benedict, cinnamon French toast, pancakes and orange juice. Oh, and we also ordered the crumb cake and carrot cake to go :) 

The omelet and crab cake Benedict were pretty good. The ingredients were fresh but when I opened up the omelet, there was really more egg and cheese than anything else; not a whole lot of crab. I didn't care for the cinnamon French toast as there wasn't much flavor, kind of just tasted like bread with a hint of cinnamon. The crab cake Benedict was pretty good and orange juice was fresh squeezed.

The pancakes were my favorite. Sweet, fluffy and fresh, but pretty small, (definitely not enough to share with another person). The homemade jam is delicious.

Crumb cake and carrot cake were decent, not great.

Our total was $94.00 (not including tip). A little pricey considering the portions but an OK breakfast nonetheless.
author: Andreea M.

description: It was an hour wait on Thursday morning. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was really nice but the food itself wasn't particularly memorable. We had the bay shrimp omelet and eggs benedict and both were okay.
author: Jihyun K.

description:
Mama's, I wish I could make your breakfasts in my own home. I'd be fat and happy every morning, full of buttery, sugary goodness, balanced well with the fresh taste of your orange juice. Beware, reader, Mama's is the kind of place you daydream about and drool over. 

I was dying to try the food, having read about how good it was. We got in line at 8:25 on a Saturday morning and were told approximately an hour wait from the nice man who kept coming out to keep tabs on the ever-growing line. I was hoping he'd bring out cups of coffee, as I'd read in previous reviews, but that didn't happen. Listening to the chatter around us from other die-hard "I must eat at Mama's this morning" customers, it was apparent that there were some locals in line. When a local is willing to wait, you know you're onto something good. All in all, we sat down at 10:10, after a 20 minute wait once we were actually inside the restaurant. I get that it's an extra line to wait in, but you get to ogle the breads and pastries and wake up your sleepy stomach. We had a lovely chat with the cashier, who said this was his family's business and he knew the answers to all our questions like the back of his hand. 

All in all, we waited 2 1/2 hours from the moment we were in line before we got to taste the delicious morsels Mama's offers! Order everything you want, even if it sounds like a little much. Because come on, how often are you going to wait in a line like that? We got the Mama's Monte Cristo (11.95), French Toast Sampler (11.25), Mama's Berry Smoothie (5.50), large OJ (4.50), side of scrambled eggs, and a coffee (2.50). It was all perfection. Sublime, exquisite bliss. The waiters were smiling and quickly gave us water and coffee refills as we needed them. I was surprised they were so jovial under such a stressful situation, but I guess that's their everyday work. The berry smoothie was sweet, fruity, and smooth. The breads were fluffy, flavorful, and buttery. The OJ tasted like someone had literally crushed the oranges while they were still on the tree. The scrambled eggs were soft and light without a hint of brown, exactly how I like my eggs!

Talk to any of those happy people stumbling out of the door after their meal, plump and blissful, and they'll totally tell you it was worth the wait...if they're able to speak through their food coma.
author: Carlye M.

description:
I loved eating brunch here. It is probably the best place I've had brunch ever!
