Unfortunately, because the line is SO long I've only gotten to enjoy it once but I dream about the day I will go back and order another plate of their French Toast and Benedict. 

I really need to make another trip here soon and so should you - you won't regret it.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Food is FANTASTIC

Be prepared to wait an hour or more 

DOES NOT ACCEPT CARDS. Bring cash. This would be a company that would do better with square or a similar app. Disappointed couldn't use my card. 

Cakes are delicious!!!
author: Casey J.

description: Cyrus is such a nice guy and the food is amazing. They were super kind about my allergies. Love it!!!!
author: Christine L.

description:
I don't need to write any review about their food! Get everything and anything! The food here is amazing. One thing that stands out the most if I had to make a suggestion is the Monte Carlo! The toast was just amazing mixed with their home made raspberry jam! 

And the apple pandori was really good a bit buttery but really good! I think I've been to this place too many time. But beware it's so good that if you come there may be a long wait. I usually recommend going when they open or alittle towards when they close. But anytime between then. I would say there would be a wait atleast 30 min if you're lucky. But def worth the wait!!!
author: Herman L.

description:
Why is there no option for extra stars?! This place is WORTH THE WAIT! I promise. When I was told that the line is usually around the block, I laughed. Boy was I wrong! My friend and I arrived at 7:15 am (they open at 8 am) and there were already a few people in line. When we left, the line went down the street. And several hours later, I happened to drive by around 1 pm and there was still a line, just as long. 

But the food.. Omg the food is PHENOMENAL. Literally every bite was better than the last. We ordered the bay shrimp Benedict, Dungeness crab Benedict, French toast sampler, side of bacon, Bloody Mary, mimosa with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, and coffee. I would literally order everything all over again if I wasn't so full! I don't think you can go wrong with anything you choose off of that menu.
author: ella k.

description:
I've been here a few months back when my best friend took me here for a late Saturday birthday brunch since I've been dying to try this place. We arrived maybe around 9am. The line was fairly long, but it didn't seem too bad. Until after an hour passed where I was practically looking into the windows from outside at all the good looking items that people were ordering. Normally, I'm not a very patient person when it comes to my stomach needing food and not having it at that exact moment. My friend's were practically laughing at me because all i was doing for about 3 hours; was starring at everyone's food. sigh.

BUT, after 3 hours. Finally got to the front. The cashier was actually the grandson of the owner, "mama" herself. He was extremely nice! My friend recommended me getting the french toast, so i did. And I got a side of blueberry cake too. As we were chatting with him. He ended up throwing in a crumb cake for free since it was my late birthday. He got the WHOLE restaurant to sing it to me too, how embarrassing but really friendly of him. Also, my best friend's girlfriend recently graduated from college, so he threw in a monte cristo in for free. Haha double wins!

once we were seated at the giant table in the back, we got our food within 15 minutes I believe. the cakes were so warm and moist. I pretty much devoured my french toast within 10 minutes. It was so yummy. 

I would definitely come back again, but ONLY when the line isn't that long because it was torturing just looking at the food on an empty stomach. very satisfied indeed.
author: Audrey K.

description: It was simply okay! My husband and I are foodies. We travel to explore different cultures food. Service was great but I personally don't think it was worth the wait and $$
author: Tika R.

description: We got there around 8:10 so the weight was only like 30 min and that was mostly waiting for a table to open up. After we ordered we chatted with the cashier who happened to be the grandson of Mama's! Really cool getting to talk to him he recommend me the Monte Cresto which was out of this world! The jam was excellent along with the roasted potatoes! It would of been worth an hour wait hands down!
author: Austin W.

description: Extremely overrated place. Food below average (The Californian Omelette), insane waiting time (get ready to stand in two lines!) around 9 a.m. Very disappointed. Bad start of my day here.
author: Sergey S.

description:
My FAVORITE breakfast/brunch place in the WORLD!  I been coming here for years but not too often because of wait.  But when I can, I do go and its worth the wait.  I always get the dollar pancakes. OOoo my, so good.  I like going with 3-4 people because we can order more.  I just love everything!!  

I bring all my friends here and they love it just as much as I do.  

The only reason I am not giving it a 5 star is because of the wait.  But this place is super super yummy!!!  Excellent services too.
author: Sandy B.

description: Place is delicious! The only thing that sucked was the line, especially because people were holding spots in for almost 8 family member or 10, no exaggerating there. But overall a great place to try out when going to SF.
author: Lauren B.

description: Very delicious food! However, the line is crazy long, and the bathroom is extremely tiny and dirty. I'm not sure why they don't update the bathroom, especially since the restaurant is so cute! I would give it 5 stars but the bathroom was scary. When you do come here to eat, order the shrimp omelet, it was yummy, and make sure you don't have to go to the bathroom.
author: Ellie B.

description:
Food was really good.  Anticipate a long line and do yourself a favor and get there 30mins early.  Also bring cash or debit as they don't accept CCs.

Grill potatoes and bacon were the best.
author: D H.

description:
Finally tried Mama's after passing because of the line in favor of Park Tavern or Don Pisto's. Best way to deal with the line is to bring coffee and pastries to munch on while you're waiting. The lattes and Kouign Amanns we brought with us from B. Patisserie really helped us get through the 1hr and 15min wait on a Sunday morning. The line wrapped around the block and extended past the kitchen steps that lead into the basement on the side of the restaurant. We got in line around 11:30 and were finally seated with our food after ordering at the counter by 1:00.

When I usually do brunch, it's with a large group. Fortunately I only went this time with my mom because the location is so small. I ordered the one of the specials of the day, the Bay Shrimp Benedict, and was very happy with my choice. I was also excited to try the grapefruit mimosa which was refreshing. Service here was great! Our waitress was very attentive. Papa, the owner, even helped me put my jacket as we were getting up to leave the restaurant!

Mama's is a good option for classic brunch choices and a must if you've never been here before, but for the price and wait I would much rather enjoy brunch at Nopa where I can hang out at the bar while I'm waiting and enjoy a delicious beverage.
author: Taryn S.

description: This was my second time to Mama's. The line was much shorter than the first time. We probably waited for 15 minutes but I would have waited longer. I love this place. But, carve some time out for a wait just in case you have to. I don't know how everything tastes so magical at Mama's but I promise it does. Once you are inside you order your meal at the counter. It's hard to make a choice because there are so many options. I asked the waitress what her favorite was and she said the Mama's french toast sampler or the Monte Cristo. My daughter got the Mama's sampler and i got the California omelet. The sampler comes with 3 different breads (Cranberry Orange Bread, Banana Bread, Cinnamon Sugar Bread) with fresh strawberries and bananas on top. Our plan was to split the two dishes in half so we could try it all. Seriously do this!The omelet comes with your choice of bread and country style potatoes. You'll need to pay with cash and it's a little pricey (but worth it). Then they will seat you. The omelet was perfection. Perfectly crisp bacon, avocado and monterey jack cheese. They bring this homemade jam to the table which is heavenly on the toast. The potatoes were good but super filling. Next time, I'll get fruit instead. My daughter's sampler was so good. Of the three breads, the cinnamon was my favorite but i also enjoyed the cranberry orange. My daughter got the banana smoothie which was one of the best I've ever tried. I got the fresh squeezed orange juice which was perfect. Leave a tip at the table for the friendly service. We also got the apple crumb cake and the chocolate crumb cake. Both were delicious. We were all sad when we were too full to eat any more.
author: M H.

description:
So wierd that SF breakfast spots don't open til 8? In San Diego I swear most open by 6:30 or at least 7 at the latest. Shit when you gotta make it to work who has time to come eat after 8? You gotta be at work by 8 lol
I think this place is s total tourist trap and since I am a tourist I got trapped in by all the good yelp reviews. I compare all French toast to my beloved Brockton villa in San Diego and this spot did not live up to it at all. Just average, and I'm sure glad since I came at 8 I didn't have to wait in the crazy lines u read about!
author: serina c.

description:
My goodness, almost 3000 reviews? Does it really need another one.

At some point, I think some look for something to give a lower rating. I mean I can do that too. I can remove 1-2 stars simply by saying the wait SUCKS. And you aggressively have to try and come early so your wait is not too long, or come twoards the end of the day so the wait isn't too long. Also add, that hype made this place so popular. Sure I can say all that and instantly mark the rating down.

But I won't. I look at places differently when I review it. Regardless of the hype, the food is legit. The vibe and atmosphere once you are "IN" definitely adds to the entire experience. A real quaint and intimate experience while eating---if you can ignore the many outside peering in the window looking at you. 

You can see the staff hard at work when you walk in to order. You can see all the fresh ingredients they use. The wait staff is very nice, sincere, and attentive without being intrusive as you eat. They don't try to rush you in anyway despite knowing the crazy line.

On this occasion we had of course the Monte Cristo and an omelette. The Monte Cristo here won't leave you feeling like you are about to get a heart attack, like a Monte Cristo should. So can we really say this is an authentic Monte Cristo? HA! It was good though. Clean and fresh tasting. Same goes for my omelette. 

There is not much else to say about the food. I've ate at so many hyped and touted breakfast places. Yes you can tell when a place uses high quality ingredients, but most breakfast items are not complex and most places can cook a pretty good breakfast. This place is indeed much superior than most, but I have a handful I consider on the same level as Mama's. Using fresh ingredients, sometimes bread freshly made in house, etc. If you are a fellow foodie, of course you have to try this place. Get it under your belt. Despite the hype and popularity, the place does not seem to have degraded in quality. The price also does not seem overly inflated compared to other highly ranked breakfast places in the city. 

I would definitely go again, but won't go out of the way or put forth the effort to do so. Meaning, if it just happens that we're in the city 30mins to an hour before the place opens, lets go. But won't bother waiting in line if its a 1.5+ hr wait.
author: Eugene N.

description: best breakfast love it  only reason its not a 5 star because the line is extremely long & you feel rushed while your eating but the food makes up for it
author: Ashley M.

description:
San Francisco staple. Excellent breakfast but only if you get up early to avoid the line. But it is fun meeting people in line. 

Standard breakfast food done well. Not five stars just because they don't have anything unique to them. 

Eggs Benedict is always good, as well as the coffee cake. French toast sampler is good too. 

The greeter at the door is always fun.  Talk to him/her. 

Family owned. 

Service is always decent since you order at the counter and they just bring it out to you and refill your drinks.
author: Charles F.

description: Still amazing. Didn't have to wait long on my last trip, which was amazing. eggs benedict still on point. Tried the monte cristo - really delicious. Could've used more meat and cheese if I'm being picky but it was really great with the fresh jam.
author: David H.

description: Excellent brunch!!! Had the veggie Benedict and shared the original French toast with hubby! Both were very delicious.. Line was long, we waited for about 40 minutes and that's on a Wednesday morning!!!!
author: Natalia M.

description:
I came here with my brother (We went there already knowing the line gets long) arrived to the line at 2:07 (we spent about 20mins looking for a parking spot) The clock was ticking & it got to 2:58 &there was still 8 ppl ahead of us.. Thank GOD they stayed open. They accomadated and sat everyone eventually. We were so thankful..

The place itself is very small..you order first,then wait to get seated. Due to the crowding i HIGHLY recommend while youre in line look up the menu on your phone or look it up before at home so you know what to order once you walk in! Saves soo much time & less confusion.

Food: i had the buttermilk pancake platter. I asked for a plate of 2 scrambled eggs on the side (4.30$)  Cooked to perfection. brother had the monte cristo and potatoes were AMAZING!!

overall; come early lol its what i learned. You wont regret it though. The food is amaZing,the place makes me feel like im going to a tea party, very cute spot :) picture attached
author: Debbie L.

description:
Mama's is a run of the mill name and this phrase describes the food as well. The restaurant is indeed quite cute and in a nice part of town, close to Coit Tower in Pioneer Park. But this doesn't cut a one to four hour wait on my feet outside for toast, fruit, or eggs. 

Now I did not try the most glorified dishes, the monte cristo or crab benedict, but nevertheless, this place is still overhyped. I went because it's a famous place and one of those places to try once and judge for yourself. 

It's all about the cute atmosphere, neighborhood, and visually stimulating food. But nothing about it is remarkable, other than how many rave reviews it boasts.
author: Ashley E.

description:
Hitting one of the most popular breakfast joints in San Fransisco and this place delivered. I came when it was around 10am and there wasn't a wait at all on a Wednesday morning. 

The menu was a little confusing for me. Honestly I am pretty simple with my breakfast foods: pancakes, bacon, hash browns, etc but they didn't have anything like that. I simply got the "two eggs anyway" and added bacon because that seemed to be the closest I could get. My boyfriend ordered the Monte Cristo and it looked and tasted great. To be honest, I wish I got the Monte Cristo. It was the most delicious breakfast plate I ever had. 

The reason for the four stars is that the seating was incredibly small and the waitresses seemed to have forgotten my coffee after I asked about it twice. The concept of ordering first and then having a seat was confusing to me, but I guess if that's how they work then so be it. Third, the menu seemed to lack a traditional breakfast for people like me so we would have to get out of our comfort zone and order something unfamiliar with us.
author: Heather N.

description: By far highlight of my girls weekend. The pancake trio was delicious and the overall wait was worth it. The ambiance was nice and the staff was so sweet and accommodating.
author: Roxanne K.

description:
The wait is crazy!! We waited in line for 2 hours and once we ordered our food we had to wait another 45 minutes.
None of the waitresses checked back on us until our food came. We ordered the monte cristo and the original pancake with berries. 
I really did like the fact that everything was fresh. 
The pancakes were good, the potatoes needed a little more seasoning and the monte crisco was def not up to its hype. 
It's basically a ham and cheese sandwich.  If you're wanting something sweet than don't order this. 
Its basically made with french toast bread that's unsweetened and ham and cheese served with strawberry jam. 
Idk, everyone has a different opinion but I personally didn't care for it.
author: Lani M.

description:
Like the rest of these yelpers:
Parking was a pain
Waited over an hour in line
Food took a while to come out

BUT IT WAS SOOOO WORTH IT!
The servers were so delightful and our meal was delicious! Thanks ma!
author: Jaddis H.

description: Got here on a Tuesday around 7:45am (they open at 8) and got seated at 8:15am. This place is good, it's really good, but I don't know if it's worth the wait to be honest. I got the Norwegian Benedict and the Monte Cristo and both were solid. The hollandaise sauce on the Benedict was nice and creamy and the eggs were perfectly poached. The Monte Cristo is the perfect dish to satisfy your sweet and savory cravings. Since this restaurant is featured on many shows and publications and has been around in SF since the 1960's, this place draws a lot of tourist. Even with the crowd, service is excellent and would refill our coffee every 15 minutes.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I dont know, I feel bad after I read all these reviews write mine... I have to admit I had really high expectations, I was visiting SF and it was my to do list. The place looks lovely, its smaller than I expected but really cosy, we came around 2pm and there were still a lot of people waiting! 

I got eggs benedict, I, didn't like hollandaise sauce.. Potatoes were almost burn, they had that funny oily taste..  it was okay but I just expexted more
author: Hanka J.

description:
The first time I went to Mama's:

We waited for 40 minutes after getting there ~10am, then we were led to queue in front of the register to order our meals. We then had to wait another 10 mins inside the shack after paying at the cashier. That was a bit confusing. However, service was awesome and the food was pretty good--but not worth a 50 minute wait though. I had the Washington Square omelet for $10.99 (this was in 2013), which is pretty decent. The omelet was large and the home made raspberry jam was great. 

The second visit to Mama's:

We waited for 15 minutes after getting there ~12pm. Our buddy came to visit SF and we wanted to give him the full SF experience. Harking back to my very good first visit, I decide that this place would be worth the premium price that they charge (most of the prices have gone up). I had a hard time deciding what to get this time since I had the omelet two years ago. I was really worried that I would be disappointed if I chose a sandwich versus breakfast item. But, summoning my courage, I decided to go with a sandwich: The Famous Monte Cristo for $12.95. 

The presentation was very nice, complete with cute little triangle sandwiches, slices oranges topped with strawberries, their famous jam in the middle, and a side of your choosing. You can choose between potato salad, a regular mixed salad, or roasted potatoes. In my case, I told the cashier roasted potatoes, but I was served potato salad. I immediately told the waiter that I asked for roasted potatoes. She then proceed to ask the kitchen to get a free side plate of roasted potatoes compliments of the staff! All was going too well. 

But after the first bite, I immediately regretted my decision in choosing the sandwich over the other breakfast items. The sandwich consisted of ham, turkey, melted cheese nestled in two bread slices that were dipped in egg and pan fried. The taste was underwhelming and each bite was drier than the last. Eating the first piece was ok, but by the time I got to the third piece I was overcome with boredom and dreaded consuming the last piece. The only savior to my dish was, ironically enough, the potato salad. The moisture was a good complement to the dry and boring sandwich. I was still hungry by the time I devoured the sandwich and potato salad, so thankfully I had the free side of roasted potatoes. After consuming the orange slices and the strawberries (none of which were in season, mind you), I was left a bit disappointed with my experience. If only I ordered the omelet like I did two years ago... 

Bottom Line: Get there around noon to avoid the wait. Don't get the sandwiches; it's a breakfast place so treat yourself to an omelet or something. This is a place you need to try just once, since it's a premium price for decent, but not extraordinarily amazing food. Finally, it's cash only.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Made several attempt during weekend try to try this place out and didn't had success.But try again  on Saturday morning had a success. Wait 45min to get inside the restaurants then another 15min to be seated. Owner was friendly outside greeting customer and informing them the wait, Small little place. Once inside the restaurants you will place your order with staff and paid. Then be seating. 

Our waitress was friendly and periodic check to see if we need anything. We order their butter milk pancake. It was moist and fluffy, Also we try their Chocolate Cinnamon french toast They give you 3 big slices top with powder sugar, chocolate syrup and berry. Good mixture. We had their mocha for beverage it was a good size cup served and tasty,    

Fresh cook when order and fresh ingredients. Price was not expensive for the good quality food and portion served. It was worth the wait time.  Would come back here again to dine again. Would recommend people to try this place.
author: Gruber T.

description:
Meh. I wish after waiting in line for 2 hours in the cold, I could say it was worth it. Unfortunately, I did not love Mama's. We ordered the specials of the house: the Monte Cristo and the French Toast Sampler, but they felt flat. The Monte Cristo just tasted like big hunks of bread and the only thing that made it better was jam. But then it just tasted like jam....

The French Toast Sampler was one note as well. Per another Yelper's suggestion, I asked to subsitute the cinnamon bread with chocolate cinnamon, but they refused. 

I did like my friend's blueberry pancakes, but I could get those at another brunch place without a wait. The orange juice was warm and the carrot cake was too light, not rich enough. 

Even without a wait, I would not return. Sorry.
author: Jane H.

description:
4.5 stars!

My boyfriend and I arrived at Mama's around 10:30am on a Monday. We waited about an hour and a half to be seated and yes, it was worth it.

I got the Eggs Benedict with Dungeness crab and sorry, but I was extremely disappointed. I thought it was just okay and I didn't think the spinach went well with it. I kind of had to force myself to finish my share because it was ~$25.

Thankfully my boyfriend and I were sharing and he ordered the Monte Cristo. The Monte Cristo saved my experience at Mama's entirely! I was more than happy when he took the second half of the Eggs Benedict off my plate and replaced it with the Monte Cristo. If I could've dumped the entire Eggs Benedict dish for another Monte Cristo, I would've! I hate that this is the only place I know of that serves this dish because now every time I visit SF, I have to come back. They also don't open on Mondays because otherwise, I think we would've stayed an extra night in SF just to eat here again.

The fresh squeezed orange juice was one of the best I've ever had. The waitresses are so sweet. I wonder if they could add a table or two outside to help with the amount of customers because this place is so tiny.
author: Diana C.

description: this place is amazing. Waited an hour in line and that always means its good. It is an absolute joke that Yelper Rosalie G. deducts a star because of wait! LOL like the fault of Mama's. It only means its great! I recommend
author: Lucas C.

description: Definitely must try if visiting San Francisco. Impressed by the quality of service. We had to wait in line but it was totally worth it.  Small place full of fresh/sweet fruits and excellent menu choices. A friend recommended this place for my trip to SF and I now recommend it to all of you reading this review. Went there with my family and tried one of each from the breakfast menu. (Pancakes, omelette, eggs Benedict & French toast) we couldn't vote on a favorite because everything was done to perfection.  Hope to go back someday and visit again.
author: Demetri P.

description:
Mama's is one the breakfast places to try in SF. Honestly, I think it's a bit overhyped. If you think about it, how good can breakfast food honestly taste?!  It is solid breakfast food and they do their own twist of the Monte Cristo with a jam sauce. Their omelette and eggs benny are also great. But I think you can get breakfast foods nearby that are of the same caliber. 

One of the biggest cons is the long wait in line. No matter when you go, be prepared to wait at least a good half hour. Also, the seating of tables is very inefficient. It makes sense they don't want to seat people behind you if there is a table large enough for their party, but that slows up the line and probably adds to the never dying line out the door. 

The service of the staff is questionable at times. The owner is friendly. And the cleanliness of the cook staff comes into question when you see them prepare the foods with the open kitchen like design.
author: Jennifer L.

description: So I came here at 8 am on Friday determined to chow down Dungeness crab omelette since I messaged the business to make sure which days they serve and their reply was its in season and I can come any day. I waited 1 HR in line to find out that they only serve on the weekends!!! I drove all the way from OC to SF for this!! So disappointed!!! I ended up eating Washington square which was good but not satisfied!!!
author: Zar N.

description:
I have an unhealthy obsession with brunch. I will mindlessly wait 1hr and 30 minutes just to order my food -- food that takes a mere 10 minutes to consume. 

I think it's the eggs. I really really really like the eggs cooked here...whether they're scrambled, caramelized or mixed with bacon. My brunch buddy raved about his Monte Cristo. I enjoyed my fresh squeezed grapefruit juice. But do take into consideration that $3 worth of juice is only good for about 8 sips. 

To top everything else, their exquisite strawberry jam that comes in a homely little jar makes the wait worth its while. I recommend everyone trying brunch here at least once in their lives. 

Waiting in long lines for breakfast food is part of our culture now, even if you want to give up, you have this nagging suspicious everyone will snicker behind your back if you leave. But don't admit defeat, a huge component of brunch is the mental&physical stamina from waiting in ridiculously long lines.
author: Emily T.

description:
When I first tried Mama's I was soooo in love with it because I hadn't been to many brunch places. After trying several brunch places in the city, I have to say Mama's is just okay. The food is definitely overpriced, and the wait is ridiculous. There are days were I'd only have to wait 30 mins, but that was on a weekday near closing time.
As for the food, its alright. I've ordered the blackstone benedict and the monte cristo. I felt that the english muffin for the benedict was too crispy and tough. Trying to cut through it was time consuming and didn't taste that great. However, the monte cristo was pretty good. Their homemade jam really made it stand out.
Overall really great customer service, but for the price and wait time I'd rather go somewhere else in the city.
author: Kelly S.

description:
The lineeeeee, why is it soooo long?!? Well, because the food was so incredible. We waited outside in line for over an hour at 11:30am, it was hot and sunny but at least there was a crazy dude playing guitar to help us pass the time.

But once inside it was a dream. A very cramped dream with amazing food. My wife and I went half and half in two things: the bacon eggs Benedict and the chocolate French toast with a bunch of fruit. So good. Maybe my favorite meal of our entire vacation.
author: Kenny C.

description: Food was excellent, service very good, but better be ready for a long wait outside. It was worth the wait, but budget the time.
author: Chicken L.

description:
Service. Presentation. Taste. Quality.

Mama's ranks exceptionally highly in all categories, and for good reason. The line outside is long, so get here early, but the experience is worth the wait!

Your only concern will be that your appetite can't sustain getting everything that Mama's offers. The Benedicts are to die for. The French Toast is to kill for. And the rest of their menu is equally stellar.

Mama's reputation is well-deserved, so park yourself in line and let the anticipation build!

You won't leave disappointed.
author: Rem P.

description: Had the Washington square omelette. The potatoes were good, but in my opinion it's not worth the long wait.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Over 2000 reviews and I can't believe I never came to this place during one of my many visits to SF, until my last trip. My friend had heard about Mama's from her friend (who actually hasn't tried Mama's yet) and we decided to try it out. We came to find a long line, but thought that if people were willing to wait, it MUST be good, so we found ourselves at the back of the line doing just the same. When we finally got in the restaurant, EVERYTHING looked good. Everything on the menu, everything that was being cooked, all the fresh ingredients displayed, all the pastries and desserts, everything I laid my eyes on was saliva-inducing. It was tough to make a decision on what to order and with just 2 of there, we were limited. We decided to stick with what we had decided while waiting in line despite being tempted to change our minds because everything looked and sounded SO good! 

In the end, we ordered the Apple Yogurt Cinnamon French Toast (it was a special) and the Monte Cristo (very popular! and righteously so!). Both were SO delicious and Mama's instantly became my favorite brunch place in the world. It was just perfect. I really want to pay SF a visit again and Mama's will be my first stop. When I came to Mama's it was January and I was ranting and raving about it to everybody I knew. They thought I was getting paid, but no, it is just that good. It is now June and I am STILL telling people about it! You can't go wrong with Mama's!

And the service was great!
author: Christina T.

description:
Two words: tourist trap. Hoards of tourists flock to this place and wait in a 2 hour line outside for mediocre breakfast food (I'm not saying it's bad, but if I have to wait 2 hours for something, it better be mind blowingly out of this world good). Mama's has sustained it's insane popularity and ridiculously long lines because it got lucky enough to be featured in tourist books, touting it as a "local favorite". Despite what the tourist books say, no local in their right mind would wait in a line like that for basic breakfast food. I would know because I am a local (for the record, I have been to Mama's twice just out of curiosity, and have only gone on rare weekday mornings when the line was short enough to tolerate).

I can get eggs Benedict anywhere. This place is NOT special. I have lived around the corner from Mama's for years and every time I walk by and see the line of tourists, I chuckle. Why would you waste 2 hours of your vacation standing on a street corner? Makes no sense. Please spare yourself and head somewhere else -8am on Columbus is also delicious and so is Mo's on Grant.
author: Sarah M.

description:
This rating is given after taking into consideration the freaking long queues and rather high prices here. 

TLDR: it's really not worth it. Only the carrot cake was good. Eggs benedict and their "famous" Monte Cristo were passable at best. 

EGGS BENEDICT WITH SMOKED SALMON
I'm not sure whether it was meant to be like that, but the salmon was sour. It kinda ruined the whole dish for me, and honestly, Original Joe's (which is just around the corner) eggs benedict were better! 

MONTE CRISTO
Without the jam, this tasted salty with a sour aftertaste (the icing sugar was more for decor than taste), mainly because the cheese inside the toast was sour. Again, I'm not sure whether it's meant to be sour, but I didn't like the sour aftertaste anyway. With the jam, this tasted like jam. 

MAMA'S POTATOES
This is served as a side for both the eggs benedict and toast. And it was only passable, to be honest. Some of the potatoes weren't soft enough, and they lacked flavour. The potatoes at Cafe Rain Tree (which is just a neighbourhood cafe near West Portal) were way better. 

CARROT CAKE
This was the only yummy food that we ordered. And it's really quite yummy!
author: Yu Sheng T.

description:
Mama died for me this past Sunday.  I loved going here for the Apple Pan Dore and not minding the wait for hours because Mama was the only place that serves Apple Pan Dore that you write home about.  This Sunday was the nail in the coffin for Mama's for me.  Well maybe just for Apple Pan Dore.  

I loved Mama's Apple Pan Dore for its simplicity and clean taste which was always consistent for the umpteenth time I have been going here.  I have never sent a plate back to the kitchen and was hesitant but this plate deserved it.  Sad to say that it will go down in my book as a first.  It  was so heavy on the lemon that I couldn't get halfway through the first slice.  What came back was even worst than what I sent back.  It was topped with berries (strawberries and blueberries) cooked in the lemon butter.  I don't mind having berries on the side but never with my Apple Pan Dore, hence the name.  The hint of lemon was lost in the lemon butter berry mix that drenched my french toast.  I just didn't have the heart to send it back for a third plate.  Like the first, the apples were not even caramelized.  Disappointing to say the least.

I am still mournful at the lost of my dear old friend Apple Pan Dore.  I feel like she was disrespected by being overly dressed and cheapened by adding extra accessories that she didn't need because she was a classic.

Sad to say with the countless options for breakfast/brunch, Mama's will no longer be a go to spot for me.
author: Naty D.

description:
Why 4 stars? Because it was good, but not worth the wait.

   ---   ---   ---

Mama's was not in the original plans for my last trip to SF. I can't remember where it was, but we were actually going to eat somewhere else, that ended up being closed. After not as much research as I'd like, we decided on Mama's.

Here's the thing - maybe we were bummed because it wasn't our first choice... but I have to say that I would never stand in that line again. It truly was really good, but not OMG SEAUX EPIC.

For reference, I had the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast. My dining partners got eggs benedict and a monte cristo. Everything was the same for me - good, not phenomenal. That makes me sound like an entitled prick, but when you wait an hour during a down time just to order your food, you kind of want it to taste like a combination of Fergie and Jesus.

Once inside, you are squished between other people in line, customers already at their tables, and servers hustling around. It's the definition of stuffy, and the servers are far from super-friendly.

Bottom line: I did it... and I'll never do it again. Probably my least favorite 4-star experience ever.
author: Brett N.

description:
Ok, so don't get me wrong, this place is delicious. The French toast I ordered was on point, and I loved the house-made berry jam. The coffee cake was freshly made and really good.

That being said...a 2.5 hr wait for brunch is just ridiculous! I don't know that there's many restaurants out there, no matter how delicious, that I would wait for that long outdoors.

Just my experience! YMMV.
author: Quyen V.

description:
Ok, so just to be clear it's a 2.5 hour wait at best on the weekend! My friend and arrived at 10am and the line was as we expected, about 50 people deep, not too bad. I typically don't like to be negative about service and reserve my reviews to talk about the food, but I have to make an exception for this experience. The line moves slowly mainly because the staff doesn't understand how to prioritize guests based on their party size, i.e. they made us wait behind a group of 4 to be seated before seating us at an open two top table...WTF. It was that kind of nonsense that created unnecessary waiting, whereas most restaurants will try to seat people as tables become available based on the size of their party. 

Other than that the food is good, not great. Oh I should mention once you make it inside you have to order at the counter, so take that time in line to make your meal decisions. 

Last tip. Bring snacks and coffee and an sunscreen for the line, Bon appetite.
author: Michael W.

description:
Was in San Fran for a business trip and was looking for a place to dine for breakfast with the co-worker. We both got onto yelp and foursquare to look up spots nearby to eat and Mama's was the most popular and their food pics looked ridiculously amazeballs.

By the time we walked over, there was a line already forming (this was around 10 AM) but not so ridiculous that we wouldn't wait. We were only in line for about 15 minutes and you pretty much order at the counter and then are seated afterwards. While you're in the line to order, you can easily look at the assembly of food being put together!

I ordered the open-faced salmon omelet and it was heaven on a plate. It looked and tasted exactly how I imagined. It had smoked salmon, capers, leeks and some kind of creamy sauce drizzled on it. I wish the salmon pieces were a little bigger but that's just the fatass in me speaking. Co-worker had the french toast sampler and she devoured that shiz, dessert for breakfast! I was being an eye creep and looked over at our neighbor's monte cristo and I semi-wished I had gotten it. Next time...next time....

Talked to some SF natives and this place is indeed a hotspot!
author: Lisa K.

description: We waited in line for 1 hour and 40 minutes. They have a small space with great service. Although their egg benedict was good it is not worth the wait. I ordered the North Beach Benedict. The presentation of the plate was marvelous. The hollandaise sauce was quite sour to my taste, but then again this was my first time having hollandaise sauce. The shredded ham was also sour and it was more or less used as garnish. I was disappointed that one potato piece was severely undercooked - it was crunchy on the inside.
author: James S.

description:
Dining a Mama's is nothing short of a breakfast experience. Serious brunch goers will wait the hour and a half on a Sunday and won't be disappointed. There is a reason breakfast is spouted to be the most important meal of the day and Mama's takes that very seriously. Watching the kitchen staff cook while you order is half the fun too. The atmosphere is chaotic and completely engrossing. 

I decided after waiting in line for an hour and a half I couldn't get anything basic. Who waits an hour for a couple of scrambled eggs? I went with the chocolate cinnamon French toast topped with seasonal berries and bananas and a side of bacon. The food is stellar. There isn't a doubt about that. It was the kind of breakfast I'll be dreaming about throughout the work week until I can make it to another Sunday brunch at mama's.
author: Sarah M.

description: After a 1.5 hour waiting on a Sunday morning, finally we got a table for two! Dungeness Crab Benedict and Monte Cristo seem like must for every table
author: Yikai L.

description:
Good food, great service, long wait
Not sure it's worth the hype, but go if you have the time! The food was tasty and I'm happy that I decided to check it out.

I was in SF for the weekend traveling alone and had to check out Mama's, given the hype. I got in line at 7:45am (15 min before opening) and waited until 8:45am. I ordered and got seated by 9am. I ordered the bay shrimp omelette and a piece of carrot cake. I really wanted to try one of the crab specials, but I didn't feel that it would be worth the $30 or so for that one dish. I would have ordered the monte carlo but I thought that it wouldn't be served until 11am (according to their website), but saw the table next to mine having some. The carrot cake came out immediately and I ate that right away. It was very delicate, moist, borderline too rich/sweet, but delicious. My omelette was good, but nothing mind-blowing. I appreciated the combination of asparagus, brie, and shrimp. My omelette came with toast, which I paired with the freshly-made jam that they had that day. The jam was a bit watery but very good.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Although we wait for near one hour in the line. It was definitely worth of it!
We ate the famous Mama's cristo and Crab egg Bennedict. The cristo was creamy, juicy, and yummy. Not too sweet or oily. All of it was just perfect.
The egg Bennedict with crab and baby spinachwas was extremely tasty. You can watch semi-roasted egg spilled out. 
The atmosphere of the restaurant is relax and home-like. 
I will go for second and triple times.
author: 璧蓉

description: As mentioned in the reviews below, the wait is extremely long- 2 hours on a rainy Sunday morning. The Monte Cristo however was amazing, made me forget how long I stood on line for it. The mimosa was pretty strong, don't like that you have to pre pay at a register before you're seated - makes it difficult to order additional items at the table. I think I'd stand on line again for that Monte Cristo though :) Patience is the key word here!
author: Sarita P.

description:
(-) Not worth the 1hour ish wait.
It is a normal brunch place. Honestly with soo many people coming in and out all the Italian atmosphere that may have had in the past is gone. 
I couldn't feel nor see the charm of this place. 

(+)waiters are nice. Food price is reasonable.
I got the mamas breakfast sandwich (in specials)...it was good except the side potatoes.
author: An C.

description:
Easy Question and Answer:

Would I come back to Mama's?   No

No complaints at all about the line and wait. I read the reviews and expected it.  Got there around 8:15 and about an hour later I was inside and 15 minutes later I was seated at around 9:30.  This was on a Tuesday morning after Christmas.

Nice waitress. Greeted with a smile.  Restaurant is clean.  Had a good table.

However, the food was not worth the wait.  I ordered the French Toast Sampler.  That included regular french toast, the cranberry/orange french toast and the bananna nut french toast.  The banana nut french toast was my least favorite. I've had better french toast.

My girlfriend ordered the omelette.  It was a nice sized portion.  It was okay she said.  The toast she received was burnt. No jelly or butter was given for the toast.

We wanted to try it. We did try it. We will go elsewhere for breakfast next time that we are in the city.
Cash only.    Total bill for 2 people with OJ was about $32.00
author: William T.

description:
Worth the wait!  Clearly the number of reviews validate this longstanding San Francisco establishment.  We waited about an hour forty five this beautiful Saturday morning after a fun cable ride down from Union Square.  My wife ordered the Monte Cristo and I the Northern Italian omelette with a Bloody Mary.  It was all great!  Make sure you order the Monte Cristo for sure. 

A little note - while waiting you can run across the street and grab focaccia bread and then across the park for an espresso.  This is the Italian District and amazing food is everywhere!
author: Jeff W.

description:
Waited about 40 minutes to be able to order food and sit. 

Food is really tasty and worth the wait. The Monte Cristo and Eggs Benedict Crab Cake were the best I've had ever. Also, staff is very attentive and just work in sync. Love, love the place, we'll definitely come by again whenever we're in town.
author: Joanne V.

description: Corned beef eggs benedict was a delightful dish. Home fries were properly seasoned and I left full and feeling great!
author: Brandon K.

description:
Well, after many, many years of living in San Francisco, I finally made it to Mama's. 

I normally wouldn't even think to go over to Mama's because of the legendary long lines, but we happened to be by the restaurant on a day when there was no line, so we went in.

It was a treat. They have a winning combination: good food, large selection of nice breakfast options, and friendly service. We only had to wait a few minutes before we reached the front of the line, and we were seated immediately after that.

There was only one misstep, and that's the coffee. It is inexcusably bad, especially since Mama's is so close to Caffe Trieste. It's utterly undrinkable. So, 4 stars instead of 5. I'd pick up a cup of coffee elsewhere and smuggle it into Mama's, it's that bad!
author: David G.

description:
ABSOLUTELY FIVE STARS!!! 

This place just warms my heart. The waiting is a bit extensive but I don't mind it one bit. I came to visit for my birthday. I LOVE THE everything on the menu you can't go wrong. From the freshly squeezed orange juice to the apple juice it's all phenomenal and FRESH. Love love love this place.
author: Loe M.

description:
Wait Time: walked up around 9:00ish, seated around 10:30ish.

Order: veggie egg benedict, friend ordered salmon benedict, and we split the french toast sampler.  I also ordered a coffee.

Pros: food and ambiance are both really top notch.  Once inside you feel like you have escaped North Beach and transported to a cafe somewhere in the French countryside.  It's just a really quaint place with a lot of charm.  Food was also really good, some of the better breakfast food i've ever had.

Cons: the wait obviously is a bit daunting.  Two tourists in front of us bailed when they realized just how long the wait might be, but if you're with good company it goes by pretty quick.  Also the drip coffee is garbage, like I'm sorry it's not good at all.  It's insanely dark/strong with no real flavor.  Thankfully my friend and I hit up a nice coffee spot on the walk to Mama's before waiting in line.  I'm sure the espresso is better but steer clear of the drip.
author: Brice H.

description: This place is like 500 ft from where I live- and ALWAYS has a line down the building. Definitely a place you should go at least once if you live in SF. Great food and great service! The manager even bought us an extra free stack of pancakes on the house because my friend and I just moved to the city.
author: Christina M.

description:
Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast: Includes seasonal berries (strawberries and blueberries) and bananas plus chocolate syrup for $9.50. A tiny, glass cup of maple syrup is also included. 3 Slices of French Toast. Very filling. I would have liked the French Toast to be thicker/fluffier and strawberries to be sweeter, but overall, the presentation was amazing and it tasted great!

I also tried some of their carrot cake with cream cheese frosting, which tasted impressively fresh (the carrots and the bread itself) and homemade. In addition, I sampled some Dungeness Crab Benedict (a weekend special, about $22) from a friend, and it was absolutely delicious, especially the crab. It comes with homefries and a slice of orange, but I only tried the benedict.

This small place on the corner opens at 8am, but a line starts as early as 7:30am, maybe even earlier! I have never woken up so early, not just to try an eatery, but also to beat the crazy line before it even opens! It is unbelievable how popular this place can get so early in the morning. By the time it was finally 8am, I saw about 50 people in line!
author: Christina L.

description:
This place was very delicious!! Our wait wasn't quite an hour but it was longer than I expected for a Wednesday morning. 
      
     First impression is that it was quite small and I was scared because we ordered food before we sat down and the last thing I wanted was an half hour wait and cold food. But that's where my fears ended, we got really good comfortable seating. The food took a bit long but on arrival it was burning hot, full of flavor and good on portions.

       I ordered the Blackstone Benedict, this dish was one of my favorite Benedicts I've ever ordered. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise had a unique flavor not blan and not average it was my favorite hollandaise to date, had a tangy kick to it. The bacon was crisp and tomato fresh as well as that fresh baked English muffin. The potatoes were seasoned and crisped to perfection definitely an A1 dish. The French toast was very average the single item that saved this dish was the homemade raspberry jam, I wanted to pack up jar and take it home. I also had the smoothie, fresh and full of berries but a bit too much ice that made it watery.

    Overall I would definitely reccomended this place! It has unique and signature flavors that you just can't get anywhere else. The wait is the lack of seating, I don't doubt that people think this place is delicious but if there was more seating it will be less of an wait. I would definitely return although waiting in the sun outside is a bummer, but the satisfaction you get from this food makes it worth it!
author: Kionna W.

description: The wait was modest compared to some reviews arrived 25 before 8 fourth in line. Opened 10 minutes late. But the food  was awesome eggs Benedict with crab is my new favorite food . French toast sampler was a great treat to sample at the end of the meal. My husband got corn beef hash which he ate every bite. Yummy
author: Tara M.

description:
Long long long long long... wait did I say long line?

Once inside that's not done, you have another line :-).

When you start eating you forget about all the long waiting because the food is very good and compared with San Francisco prices is not very expensive!

This is definitively an experience to try.
author: Federico B.

description:
I will stand outside of a hyped up restaurant once just to experience it, but it is rare that I will want to do it again....Mama's is different. Everything was fantastic. Food. Drinks. Service. Drool-worthy.

If you like spice, the bloody mary is where it's at. I had the special Shrimp Benedict and every bite was fabulous. 

If you have time to kill in SF I would highly suggest checking this place out.
author: Kelly M.

description: This place is overrated we waited in  line for 45 minutes and the food was really average nothing special, there are many better places to eat breakfast and brunch in San Francisco I will definitely not be back and unfortunately it wasn't worth it, I am really doing them a favor by giving them three stars
author: Mo Yasin Y.

description: To start. The wait of very worth it. Food is very freshly made n the berries are the most amazing I had ever tasted. The French Toast Sampler is a must.
author: Ramiro M.

description: It was okay and the hype wasn't worth the wait. We saw the usual long line and decided we would give it a shot (wife and I). Eventually we sat down ordered our food (eggs Benedict, monte cristo) and I thought it was just okay. I wouldn't come back for the long wait for food that was just ok. Just my opinion but I lived in the city my whole life and a lot of people would recommend this place so I would say you should definitely give it a shot to see for yourself how you feel.
author: Justin W.

description: After two years I finally got the chance to go to this restaurant and let me say it met all my expectations and more! The staff is extremely friendly and the food is fantastic!
author: Alfredo L.

description:
So delicious. The orange cranberry walnut French toast was amazing. No need to pay for extra fruit, just ask for their homemade jam and smother it on top. The order comes with 3 slices and I was only able to eat two. I saved the extra slice and ate it the next day and it was still heavenly! 
My son got the California omelette which was yummy and came with a side of potatoes. 
They are a little pricey but everything in San Francisco is. Each plate is around $14.00. We waited almost 2 hours. Would I wait again? No! However I would definitely go back and just plan to arrive at an earlier time closer to 8am or after 12:00pm the line seemed to die down. We arrived at 9:30am and ordered our food at 11:30am. Arrive early and enjoy breakfast!
author: Jessica L.

description: Great food! Delicious breakfast Sandwich and the customer service is awesome. It's a very small place, so we waited almost two house in line outside before we got in.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Cash only!

First and foremost - yes, you will have to wait a ridiculous amount of time if you come during peak brunch hours. The nice part is that the staff is so used to a long line that they can accurately predict how long you will wait for. We got here at 11:30am on a Saturday, the waitress said it would be about 1.5 hours, and we were seated exactly at 1pm. 

The waiters/waitresses here were super friendly, and it's fun to get a glimpse at the kitchen. At one point, it was one of the chef's birthday, and they asked everybody to sing happy birthday to him. It's moments like those that makes Mama's feel like a homey and cozy place.

Between the two of us, my friend and I ordered:

1) Farmer's omelette - Smoked Bacon, Baby Spinach, Grilled Leeks and Sonoma Goat Cheese. Goat cheese is definitely an acquired taste, but I personally love it, so it was fantastic. A bit greasy from the bacon, unfortunately. 4/5 

2) Washington Square omelette - Spicy Italian Sausage, Bell Pepper, Tomatoes and Hot Pepper Jack Cheese. My girlfriend ordered this, but I stole a portion and it was good. 5/5

3) French Toaster sampler - Highlight of the meal! I'm not usually a huge fan of sweet brunch items, but after seeing their french toast mentioned in all the other Yelp reviews, we just had to try it. The bread is more of a pouncake-texture and comes with fruit inside (the banana walnut was amazing), and a generous helping of fresh fruit and syrup. 

Thankfully we had squeezed in a 3-mile run in the morning because we demolished everything. #sorrynotsorry

p.s. It makes no sense to me that people rate down Mama's due to the wait. The line is not something within their control; if you choose to wait over an hour, that's of your own volition.
author: Emily Z.

description:
People flocking to this North Beach destination, drawn by its reputation and the coolness factor of waiting in line, be prepared to be disappointed. I wanted to think this place served filling, hearty food like mamma makes. The place is even designed like the breakfast room of someone who's kitchen is more functional than just for show. My Mama's Cristo was 3 slices of bread with a thin slice of deli meat. The French toast didn't seemed battered in anything. The eggs Benedict is exactly the same as I would find anywhere else. 

Give yourself another hour of your life. Go somewhere else and with the time you save, cure world peace.
author: Lams L.

description: Possibly the best breakfast place I've been to. The reason behind the incredibly long lines come from the fact that this restaurant probably only seats around 20-30 people? Which is annoying but I'd recommend coming early to beat the lines. The monte cristo was amazing and surprising. From the outside it looks like french toast but there's ham and cheese inside so you get a mix of savory and sweet. The homemade jam that everyone talks about is rightfully hyped. We also had the north beach Benedict which was perfection! I also loved the homemade OJ. Service is great a waiter kept coming around to refill my dads coffee. Definitely coming back (probably as soon as they open)
author: Hannah C.

description:
My group & I arrived at 10:15 on a Tuesday, hoping that we missed the early morning crowd- we were wrong. Other Yelpers were spot-on about arriving 30 minutes before opening if possible. If I go again when in SF, I'd suck it up and wake up earlier.

Once inside you order at the counter, so figure out what you want when you're in line. We waited close to an hour and a half before snagging a coveted table for four. We were served relatively quickly after that- they have breakfast-making down to a science at Mama's. 

I ordered a Northwest omelette with an apple and peach Bellini, my boyfriend got the famed Monte Cristo and everyone else went with bagels and crumb cake.

The Northwest was good, albeit very simple. I love to cook with smoked salmon and leeks already, and there wasn't any unique spices or the like that I couldn't have duplicated at home, especially at the $14 price point. 

The Bellini was literal perfection and if they weren't $7 a pop, I would've been happily blasted by the end of breakfast.

The Monte Cristo was delicious, mild in flavor but somehow addicting. 

The crumb cake was basic but generous with the crumbs. I personally like a more moist, buttery and sugary crumb cake than Mama's, but that's me. 

Each meal came with crispy, seasoned potato wedges, and mine came with toast to slather in their homemade berry jam, which had the perfect balance of sour and sweet.

I'm glad we got to check it out while in SF and everyone enjoyed themselves. Worth the hour and a half wait? Not so much, but worth repeat (EARLY morning) visits? Probably.
author: Lauren M.

description: Didn't go in. Nothing edible is worth a 2 hour wait. It looks and sounds great but ut uh no way.
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
After months of wanting to stop by, we finally decided to wait in line to see what all the fuss was about. 1.5 hours later (on a Saturday morning), we found out.

This place is worth the wait. The food is fantastic.

Monte Cristo is worth purchasing and SHARING. A little too rich for it to be your only meal.

The French toast sampler was worth the wait alone. The French toast is baked daily and comes in a variety of flavors.

North Beach Benedict was delicious.

We asked the guy at checkout what he thought of our order and he said it was what he would get - he's a cool guy so anyone who was offended by him needs to take it easy!

Everyone was so nice and personable. The uncle, who was working the door, even told us about a second location opening in the fall!

Worth the wait. Go early with some friends and make it an experience.
author: James K.

description:
Fair warning, the line is intense...last Sunday I got there at 11 and didn't sit down to eat until around 1:00!

FYI-You order at the counter, pay and then they bring you your food. They only take Cash or Debit card only but will charge a $1 fee. 

Ordered

South of the Border Omelette (S.O.B.) -Spanish Chorizo, Black Beans, Homemade Salsa and Pepper Jack Cheese ($9.50)

Cranberry-Orange French Toast - House Baked Bread made with Cranberries, Fresh Orange Juice and Walnuts battered in Egg Whites ($9.25)

Monte Cristo - Roasted Turkey Breast, Honey Baked Ham, Cheddar and Gruyere Cheese battered in Egg and grilled, served with Homemade Jam ($10.50)

Also tried a variety of coffee cakes (blueberry, chocolate, plain, and cinnamon walnut).

Omelette-well seasoned, executed right and portion was hearty. I thought the flavors were well balanced and really liked how the eggs were prepared. 

French Toast-flavors were not shy but not overwhelming. Could taste the vibrate freshness of the oranges and cranberries. There house made bread really holds up the dish and sets itself apart from other french toast 

Monte Cristo-a unique variation of a classic. The bread was grilled to golden brown perfection and sealed perfectly along the edges. Tucked inside was a savory pocket of meaty cheesy goodness! Definitely a fan of their jam, it's sweet yet so refreshing 

The only thing I didn't care for were the breakfast potatoes. I found them to be too simple but they were cooked well and seasoned properly. Last but not least, the coffee cakes were definitely dense, the crumble was good but I would pass on the cake bottom. 

Service was fare, no complaints

Overall Thoughts

I would say it was worth waiting to see that Mama's does live up to the hype but I argue that there are other places who do just as well with half the wait time or no wait at all, it's just a matter of looking until you find it
author: Eddie W.

description: Definitely not worth the almost 2 hour wait. Monte cristo is good, and probably best thing we had. We had french toast sampler as eell, which was good, just nothing to write home about. Smiles at the counter, which was nice. Overall food 3 stars, servuce, 2.5, the wait, -5
author: Tommy C.

description:
I showed up just past 11 am yesterday (Saturday), and the line was already partway up the block. Not terrible unexpected - as I'd been warned - but the wait ended up being longer than I expected. I believe it was around 90 minutes before we even made it inside and got close to ordering.

However...if you go understand that there will be a wait, and you're OK with this, then everything else is gravy. As well, WHILE YOU'RE WAITING, you can get coffee and pastries. One of the staff there came out and asked if anyone wanted coffee, and she told us she'd bring us pastries too. So three strangers behind me in line and I shared three items and made new friends! 

Let's talk about the meal itself:
Farmer's omelette - goat cheese, spinach and bacon in a fluffy delicious omelette. I would have liked a little more cheese, but that's the only complaint. Solid potatoes and very very good buttered rye bread.
Lemon blueberry french toast - a special for the day, and special it was. Not gooey or sticky, but a nice crust on one side from its time on the griddle, and sweet and flavorful from the fruity quick bread they used. Much better than soaking up normal day-old bread. When topped with maple syrup and their house raspberry preserves, it was a complete winner.

I actually wasn't terribly impressed with the pastries we got outside - even after they were heated up. The banana nut bread was very dry (I am used to a denser, moister variety), the chocolate crumb cake was fine, and the broiche roll thing with the German sounding name was pretty decent. 

All in all, a long but delicious experience.
author: David B.

description:
Their homemade jam is the best jam I've ever tasted. Food is good too, and portions are generous. 

Be prepared to wait for an hour or two If you don't make it to the line before 8:10.
author: Arianne D.

description:
I hadn't been to Mama's in over 5 years! Still the same! Line out the door (mind you the restaurant only has about 10-12 tables most of which only seats 2 at a time)! I didn't mind waiting today as the day was absolutely beautiful! 

Make sure to take a look at the menu when you get to the front of the line outside! There is a menu posted by the door entrance so that you may be prepared to order especially since most likely you waited at least 30 minutes in line already. 

I went with the crab cake benedict! I finished every single bite that was on my plate. You get 2 crab cakes and a pile of potatoes! DEMOLISHED! My friend didn't even have time to ask for a taste! It was so good! I didn't even come hungry (another reason why I didn't mind waiting hehe)! Crab cake was flavorful and they use real crab of course! It wasn't dry and the hollandaise was just right! It was creamy with good texture and not overpowering like a lot of hollandaise sauce can be. 

My friend had the dungeness crab omelette which he was really happy with! There was a generous helping of crab in an especially good sized omelette! Thanks for starting off my Friday right Mama's!
author: Claire D.

description:
We went here for a special friends birthday.... hmmm 1 1/2 hour wait (yikes!)  Despite the looooooong wait as soon as we ordered, got seated, after the first bite, I definitely forgot about how long I waited hahahha!  Their food is definitely delectable!  

We ordered the:
The Californian-Crispy Bacon, Avocado, and Monterey Jack Cheese
and the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast, both was mouthwatering yum!

We will definitely come back, but maybe come right when they open so we don't have to wait.  

Thanks Mama's and staff, can't wait to taste your yummy food again!
author: Kathy B.

description:
Mama's is the busiest breakfast place inall of San Francisco. If you want to get a table at a reasonable time, show up at 7 or 7:30 and wait until they open until 8. 
If you show up any later that 8 o'clock, be prepared to wait up to 2 hours for a table.
The wait is 100% worth it. The food it absolutely superb, and the service is great. Mama's is a family owned business, so they have the whole family on board which is really nice to see. 
Their food is incredible and you will leave satisfied, guaranteed.
10/10 would recommend to everyone!
author: Serena K.

description:
After seeing my friends check in to Mama's twice, I decided to check yelp for reviews and pictures. I kinda fell in love looking at the photos, especially since I love breakfast/brunch foods.

Visited this past weekend with two dear friends, knowing it would take at least an hour wait, but sadly, we had to wait for two hours before finally entering and ordering our meals. The people working there are incredibly nice and super cool. I had the dungeness crab benedict and it was great (THE CRAB YUM). I tried some of my friend's cranberry orange french toast, and that was amazing.

Food was amazing, but I personally am not much of a long-wait person for my food. If you have an hour or two to spare before eating, then you won't be disappointed coming to Mama's for breakfast or lunch! Dishes definitely didn't disappoint.
author: Sara T.

description:
I LOVE Mama's! My boyfriend took me there for my birthday (on a Sunday) and yes we waited for quite long (8:30am- seated by 10:20am) BUT we made friends with other couples in line, brought our own coffee (and you can get some through the back door of Mama's) and just had fun with it! Everyone knows there's asinine wait times for any place delicious in SF is just the norm- so I try not to let that bother me.

Otherwise- the whole restaurant sang me Happy Birthday! (Though I had hoped for a little birthday mimosa on the house- didn't happen) The food was AMAZING. So delicious, worth the wait. I had the North Beach Benedict (is a large serving) and comes with a side of potatoes. I also had one slice of their cranberry/blueberry lemon bread french toast. . . Goodness. SO delicious all around. 

The owner is at the front door greeting & inviting people in when its time; he's very nice and takes time to explain to you how the setup works (get inside; order food at counter and THEN you sit), and he goes through the fresh breads they make daily which are aplenty and incredible. 

I'd totally go again! :)
author: Erin W.

description:
The line was wrapped out the door and at least a quarter of a block. We were starving! Waited 1 1/2 hours to finally get our orders in. We ordered a quiche, crab cake Benedict, and a vegetable omelette to share. Yes 3 things between 2 people. Don't judge.

My favorite was the crab cake Benedict and the quiche was perfectly made. Outstanding service.

Anyway, was it worth the wait? Yes.
Why?
Because their eggs got me feeling some typa way.
author: Janet L.

description:
The line was an hour and half wait. Was it worth the wait? NOPE. 

They were out of corn beef eggs Benedict so I had to pick something else on the spot and the cashier was not friendly, didn't help much either. 
It was surprising to me that all the other reviews are saying the staffs are friendly. 

I asked for water, THREE times. The last time I asked for it, the waitress told me to wait and didn't seem friendly at all. 

Had to ask for refills after waiting for a long time.
The food was   o k a y. It wasn't bad, but was it worth $13.50 for some scrambled eggs and potatoes ? I don't think so. 

My friend got a plate and a coffee- her total was $17 something. And I got two plates with water- total was $27.

The price was way too much. 
Sooooo disappointed. Will never come back to this place ever again.
author: Kimberly L.

description: This historic restaurant is absolutely worth the wait!  The food is amazing - EVERYTHING is good and fresh.  I've been there many times.  The pancakes are the best.  They also make their own bread for the French toast and homemade jams.  My daughter had an omelette and loved it!
author: Coraetta M.

description:
Finally tried this infamous local hot spot. 
If your lucky the line will form inside at the counter where you order / pay for your food before you are seated. CASH ONLY

We were lucky as the line was short. 
Friends suggest that coming after 1:30pm is when the lines are shortest- they close at 3pm. 

I ordered the Monte Cristo and my guest had the Mama's Breakfast Sandwich and Blueberry Crumble. 

Blueberry Crumble Muffin:  Amazing 
Served warm and the topping was scrumptious. 

Monte Cristo: Very Interesting
Layered bread with cheese, turkey and then grilled to perfection with a little egg. 

Mama's Breakfast Sandwich: So Good
The bun was grilled to perfection with egg, ham, turkey and cheese.  The cheese was what made it so good. I think it was Gouda. 

The lemonade was good. No refills 
Apple & Peach Belini was refreshing. Not sure $7 worthy but it was nice. 

All in all I would come back again but I'm not sure if I would ever stand in line for over an hour or two for breakfast.
author: Donna C.

description:
Obviously this place has crazy yelp reviews so my friend and I decided to give it a try. The whole time we were waiting in line we were thinking about all the yelp reviews we've read about how the wait was not worth it blahblah. We were still optimistic about it in the beginning but yes, we ended up concluding that the wait was not really worth it. We ended up waiting for 1 hour 20 minutes to get our food in total. The food was delicious, it really was. But will I ever come back again and wait 1hour+ for food? Probably not. Maybe if it's a shorter line.

-they only accept cash or debit
-you go in, get in another line to order, and then wait around till you get seated, and then they serve you the food. it's a bit confusing and disorganized
-the place has no AC so it gets really stuffy sometimes
author: Becky M.

description: The 1.5 hour Saturday morning wait was well worth the amazing french toast, smoked salmon eggs Benedict and mimosa! Glad i chose Mama's, out of all the breakfast/brunch restaurants I've been too, this one is on the top of my list.
author: Esther K.

description: Worth the wait! I had the Monte Cristo and it was really good, especially with the jam on it. I also had some silver dollar pancakes and my boyfriend had the Washington Square Omelette. We left very full and happy! Would definitely come back!
author: Audrey H.

description: SOOOOOOOO GOOD!!!! Well worth the line outside. Must try the crumb cake! A little pricey, but everything tastes so amazing you can't even complain.
author: Allie K.

description:
The good is great, huge omelets made with top quality ingredients. I had Mamas Cristo was it the best, unfortunately I can't say it was I've had better.  
 The wait time was a nightmare (waited 2hrs) this is the only reason I drop a star. In a place that has an abundance of stellar food like San francisco  I wouldn't  bother waiting no more then an hr. If you don't mind waiting  then by all means wait the French toast and omelets will not let you down.
author: Crystal V.

description:
So many people ask if it's worth the wait.  Obviously I can't answer for everyone, but here is why Mama's truly does rock...

Family owned & operated since day one.  

The owner actually grows some of the produce & herbs they use in his own backyard.  

They themselves bake some of the dreamiest bread you'll ever have in your life; which you can also have made into french toast.  The kugeluph brioche, the cranberry orange walnut bread, the banana bread...all house made & all heaven.  

The pancakes deserve major attention, too.  If the apple cinnamon pancakes are available as a special, order them.  They're AMAZING.  Trust me.  I'm not usually a fan of apple anything...

...except for the pan dore french toast here.  This dish is totally worth the calories, & a cavity.  Baguette french bread sliced horizontally ever so thin, both sautéed in & then topped w the most amazing lemon, apple, & butter sauce.  You don't even want to know how much butter goes into this dish.  But like I said, it's totally worth it.

The bran muffins.  House made.  These are not your grandma's bran muffins.  They are extraordinary.  They will change your opinion of bran muffins forever.

The house made jam.  Apricot is my favorite, but all of them are great.  Seriously.

The Monte Cristo.  Period.  Dipped in their jam...de-effin-licious. 

Between the dungeness crab omelette & benedict, the salmon benedict, the corned beef hash, the slim joe burger, all the baked goodness, & the pancakes & french toast, what more could you want?  

Go as early as you can.  Preferably before they open.  If you're not there in line already @ 8:00, it's an hour & a half wait...minimum.  Yes, MINIMUM.  Even longer on weekends.  So grab someone you love, a coffee, a paper, & just get comfortable.  I suggest someone you love, because then the wait will go faster.  

There has been a line outside Mama's for decades.  And there's no sign of it going anywhere.  Mama's is a breakfast tradition, a neighborhood tradition, a family tradition, a weekend tradition, a San Francisco tradition.  It's just tradition.  And it happens to be delicious.  Go.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Brunch is always busy in the city...especially at Mama's. After arriving at 1:30 PM (to avoid a humongous line), we finally got seated at 3:00 PM. We started eating at around 3:20 PM and finished what I called our "lunner" (lunch/dinner) at around 4:00 PM. 

*note: there are two lines. one line outside to get in and another line to order your food as you wait for a table. 

I was starving by the time we sat down. My best friend and I ordered the blueberry pancakes, the cranberry and orange french toast, the Monte Cristo, and the classic eggs benedict. Yes, we wanted to make our two hours of waiting in line worth it. 

The pancakes were fluffy and the french toast & the eggs benedict were good. However, our favorite was the Monte Cristo! If you go to Mama's, you have to get the Monte Cristo. It comes with one of the homemade jams and you dip your sandwich into it. It gets a little heavy after two pieces, so I'd suggest sharing this while ordering something else. 

I'm not surprised this place is so popular. The food is good and the staff was really nice. I would have loved to try any one of the omelettes or the smoked salmon scramble but sadly, we already ordered four breakfast dishes and I had no more room in my stomach.

I enjoyed the decor too :) and I would probably come back on a weekday.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
An hour wait to get in but was well worth it. 

We got the Benedicts. Mine was with crab ($$$) while my wife ordered salmon. It wasn't long to get it, thankfully, because that wait in line does make you starve. 

The egg was cooked just right. The crab wasn't as fresh as I expected but this year is hard to find fresh seafood due to El Niño so I didn't expect it be all super fresh. 

One of our all time favorite breakfast places.
author: Ivan M.

description:
Terrible restaurant!!!! 
This is the first time I come here and I won't go there anymore. 
I had to wait for 2 hours ( for line to get in, line to get table and line to have food) but food and service are not good.
Food is too salty and roll. Service is ..... I don't know why I get small cup of water with 3/4 ices in it while other people get bigger cup of water without ice.
 
I feel like they don't like young customer
author: Anna N.

description:
Oh my god. Seriously the best brunch I've ever had and at such a reasonable price too! Friends and I had just finished volunteering during an early morning shift in SF and we were looking for a place to grab breakfast; saw Mama's on Yelp--the comforting name of "mama" wooed us to adventure forth into SF and find out about Mama's!

Parking was definitely a bit difficult since it's SF and all, but there are ample streets all around the place so you're bound to find a place at some point. 

The line is just as bad as the reviews say they are. We got there around 9:30 and got in around 11:15 a.m. Definitely a place you don't want to go to on a busy day--treat Mama's as luxury for leisurely days. The line was insane, but go with a group of friends and time passes by pretty quickly. One slight downside is that once you get in, you wait in yet another line--but that at least gives you the time you need to figure out your orders and pay! By the way, cash only!

We got a total of four dishes and split them for maximum joy. We ordered:

Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast: Heaven. Besides its beautiful presentation--chocolate drizzled on the plate and toast and garnished with fresh fruits, this was the best french toast I've ever had! Super soft and chocolately. They give you some syrup but the flavor is rich enough that you won't need it.

Monte Cristo: Basically a grilled cheese but fancier and with ham embedded. They serve this with a salad--we got a Spring Salad, pretty normal, and their homemade jam! You MUST try their jam! There's a jar on the table so even if you don't get a meal with the jam, definitely give it a shot! It's a strawberry flavor and despite the sweet/salty combo, it compliments the Monte Cristo quite well! Soft and delish. I wouldn't actually be able to eat the whole thing though since it could be overwhelming, so sharing is a great option.

Salmon Smoked Eggs: I will never eat normal scrambled eggs again. Coming from an Asian family, I've always been really picky about my eggs in American dining because they always feel undercooked to me. These eggs were perfectly cooked and had smoked salmon! How can you not like smoked salmon?! Phenomenal. It comes with a bagel and cream cheese, although I'd personally suggest you slather their jam on your bagel instead. :)

Mama's Children's Favorite Omelette: Meh. I'm not an omlette person. Friends got it cause they liked it. I'm an egg person. I can say that the egg is pretty well cooked though? Also comes with a slice of sourdough bread--SLATHER THE JAM. THE JAM IS GREAT!

Mama's Smoothies: Definitely a very healthy smoothie with fresh ingredients. Not exactly worth the five dollars though, but it's decent! Berries, orange juice, yogurt and honey!

Waiters are extremely nice and the decor of the restaurant has this great homey feel.
