They decorate the place with all the awards they've gotten and cute very vintage photos and posters and it honestly does feel like home. Go with friends so you can sample more! The wait is definitely painful, but for a once in awhile brunch place, the wait is definitely worth it!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Terrible
That was terrible
Tastes terrible and service terrible
And i still don't understand why i waited for almost 2hrs for eating that shit 
I was totally disappointed
I didn't want to give any stars but one star is just the manner
author: Jee Hye P.

description:
Although the line was 45 minutes, it's definitely worth it!
The food is great! We ordered the vegetarian eggs Benedic, and chocolate chip pancakes! 
I love it!!! 
The service is wonderful, very quick!

I'll definitely come back!
author: Regina L.

description:
Warning: serious hanger (hunger + anger) may occur from ungodly wait time and parking frustration. Let's begin.

The place itself is very small, probably only about 10 tables inside and half a block of people waiting outside. With that being said, you should definitely order what you need to order at the counter, because the severs totally forget about you once the food is out, but food did come out fairly quick, so I'm okay with that. 

Being visitors of the city, we relied on the hype of the locals and agreed to order the Monte Cristo, it's looks amazing and the concept is unique, but I was disappointed.. More cheese to turkey ratio, it basically tasted like a soggy grilled cheese with powdered sugar, but I still liked it lol.

The North West Benedict was okay.. It's just like your typical Benedict, but my breakfast sandwich was like incredible hehe. I don't think it's on the normal menu but I saw it written on the whiteboard outside. 
The choclate crumble cake and blueberry crumble were awesome!

I probably wouldn't come back just because of the wait time, but I'm definitely going to recommend this for first timers, just be sure to pregame with like a granola bar or something beforehand so you don't end up a hangry camper.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Probably the best brunch of the heavy hitters in SF! I finally got to come here a few Saturdays ago (11/24/12)  after years of living in the city. My two budz and I waited about an hour in line around noon.

The set up is pretty crowded, and you order at the counter before being seated. We had a french toast sampler plate (and as other reviewers have said, the banana nut is the way to go!), the Monte Cristo (my first one ever, and boy was it delectable!) and an omelette and fruit smoothie (pricey at $6 but the quality was well worth it).  Everything tasted amazing and fresh and a decent price for a 5 star brunch! 

The service was attentive, but had an in/out feeling about it, probably due to the line.

I would definitely return, given a shorter line (maybe a rainy day?). Small surcharge for card. Cash would probably be easiest. 

YUMYUMYUMYUM.
author: Angela L.

description: The ordering and seating system is super lame. Luckily it was a slower day and we didn't wait in line. Food is fine. Hadn't been in years, and as a local I likely will not need to come back.
author: Michelle T.

description: Waited 2 hours, food was good but not mind blowing like expected from the wait. Super small restaurant, service was ok. Wish we would've tried the French toast sampler. I had the 2 egg breakfast, my daughter had Eggs Benedict (they were stingy with the potatoes), and we shared pancakes.
author: Lisa T.

description: The best monte cristo sandwich I had so far, very rich in flavor. Also had the dungeons crab Benedict which tasted so fresh. The line was long even in an odd day at an odd hour. Come early!
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Came here at 7:30am on a Thursday morning and there were already about 10-15 people ahead of us. Luckily, we were part of the first group to be seated. You get ushered in to another line where you place your order. Pretty efficient. You can order take-out, too, but who waits in line for that? :) 

My boyfriend and his best friend ordered the famous Dungeness Crab Benedict. Sooo delicious with an über fresh crabby flavor. The egg was poached perfectly and sat on a bed of spinach and a perfect muffin. I ordered the Washington Square omelette as I'm not really a fan of crab being baked INTO my egg, but it was also really yummy. Love the Italian sausage, lots of fresh ingredients filled the insides, and the egg was fluffy. I would say it's on par with my favorite Brooklyn brunch place, Stone Park Cafe. We also got the French toast sampler. Not bad, but not amazing either. Probably because I've never been a huge fan of sweet things for breakfast. But the jam...man, that was heavenly. You scoop it on with a spoon instead of smearing it. Wish I could've brought a jar of that home.

Service was good. We never felt rushed and our friend's coffee was refilled four times (not sure how he was able to function after that). Lots of tourists like myself in there, but if I was a local I would go there all the time, too, if the wait wasn't bad.
author: Margaret F.

description: 1 hour and 15 minute wait but good to try once. The crab benedict was delicious but really expensive ($29). The seating was also uncomfortable because the place is so small. There are plenty of other places in the city for good brunch
author: Kevin H.

description:
So today was the first time we decided to try Mamas as my mother in law recommended it. At first my wife and I were skeptical about the long line outside the door and reading the prior post about waiting 1.5 hours to get seated. All I have to say is, Wow! 

Cons: pretty pricey for a kids size glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. Small dining area.

Pros: quality good food. This place is a true gem in San Francisco. The food is amazing, the staff are friendly and attentive. If your reading this please give them a shot as you will not be disappointed. Enjoy!
author: Daniel D.

description:
I first heard of this place when I saw the line winding around the corner during a weekend run in San Francisco. Because I have a penchant for punishment, the long line made me want to try this place out. After reading the reviews, I concluded that an early 1 hour wait was much better than a later 2 hour one, so my friend and I woke up at the break of dawn and got to Mama's by 7:10. There were already a few people waiting in line, all very merry and talkative despite the freezing weather and painfully early hour. 

The atmosphere is really cozy, and even the people who dine here are friendly. Awards are literally everywhere. You order first and then decide where you want to sit. I got the Monte Cristo, my friend had the California omelet, and we shared the French toast sampler. The omelet was so-so, but I loved the Monte Cristo! The melted gruyere and ham on crunchy bread was perfect, and you could get an additional blast of sweetness by dipping it into the jam. The French toast sampler was made of varying degrees of tastiness. I liked the citrus-flavored toast, but everything else was average. 

Overall, nice experience and atmosphere. Still, I do think this place is overhyped and the food unspectacular. This will probably be the last time I brave the cold morning to try out Mama's.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Came with a friend, waited for an hour and it was worth it 
got a florentine Benedicts it was delicious except the spinach got too spinach at the end lol 
I have to come back for the salmon 
customer service is awesome- the waiters are nice and friendly. they casually chatted with customers and one of the kitchen staff posed when my friend was taking a picture
my friend was struggling to cut the muffin when she was eating and the lady gave us sharper knives before we even think of asking! 
totally worth the wait
author: Tzu-Han H.

description: Loveeee this place! There is usually a wait but go on Sunday! It's not as bad! Everything here is a good so try it ALL - especially the specials! Extremely filling and so yummy! It's a little small inside but brunch is amazing!
author: Beth F.

description: We waited almost an hour and half in line then once we got to the door we waited at the food line to order your food (counter line) for another 10 minutes then once you ordered you wait another 10 minutes for a table once the people get up and table to get clean .. Then we sat and wait for our food for another 15 minutes. Service was okay and the food was alright .  I'll never do this again that's for sure.
author: Kathy W.

description: Great breakfast. After driving for 4 hours to get there it was worth it. Enjoyed the experience and friendly service.
author: Josue H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday. The line was out the door when we arrive at 1:30pm, where we proceeded to wait. We wouldn't get to order until 1.5 hours later, after we ordered we had to wait for a table to get done. I mean if you see a line out the door why would you just take your time and sit there reading hogging up the table and being all hipster like? By the time we sat down and got our food it was already 2:50pm. I ordered the monte cristo which was pretty good it wasn't filling though I was immediately hungry right after. I kinda wish I ordered more after that Long wait. And on top of that long wait to get sat down and our food there was a long wait at the restroom which was located in the back and it was a coed restroom. All in all food was good but not worth that wait.

Ambiance: small and cozy
Service: was decent
Food: was good
Overall: foods good but not worth that wait.
author: Julian T.

description: My husband and I came here for the first time on Valentine's Day for breakfast. Apparently we arrived at the perfect time because we found a park right across the street *SCORE* and there was only about five people in line so the wait was minimal, 20 minutes at best! All the pastries they have look so tempting while you wait to order your food. I went with the carrot cake with cream cheese on top and my hubby got the apple crumb cake both tasted amazing but I'll just speak for myself. The carrot cake was so good, the cream cheese on top almost looked like a stomach ache waiting to happen because there's so much cream on top but when you bite into a piece it's really pretty light almost like it's whipped. If you like carrot cake you won't be disappointed at all! I ordered an Washington Square omelette with avocado and mushrooms. The combination of veggies with the Italian sausage made it pretty flavorful and I loved that they weren't stingy with the cheese or the avocado! My hubby ordered the Monte Cristo which I guess is a fan favorite, he said it was really good but not as good as the one at Disneyland (if you've ever had it). I gotta tell you if you've never been here and you're standing in the long line wondering if it's worth the wait, YES it is. You won't be disappointed and although the seating area seems it fairly small it's not uncomfortable but who focuses on space when their food is ON POINT!!  Before I leave though I do want to mention that the customer service is excellent! There's nothing like good food and GREAT service! Enjoy!
author: Qiana P.

description:
What this establishment needs to do is have a system where one can sign a digital guest list, walk around, and be sent a text when one's table is ready (like some other places). ANY sign up sheet is better than what MAMA'S system currently is. The wait to eat here is unbearable and not worth it AT ALL. TOO overhyped and I felt like a sucker for waiting over an hour to eat mediocre food. 

Don't get me wrong, the food here isn't disgusting but it isn't revolutionary as well. It's one of those typical hipster breakfast spots that people with big wallets who don't appreciate diners go to. But if you still insist on getting this hipster style of cooking, you can EASILY get it at other restaurants in the Bay, such as La Note and Venus, but with better quality and shorter waits. For example, La Note adds garlic to their potatoes which adds great flavor. Not here, nope! Potatoes were not even crispy. For two people, I paid over 40 and this was just for breakfast alone (the French Toast sampler and Eggs Benedict). 

Tldr: The wait here is too long and the food here is DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE WAIT. I will definitely not come back here and wait in that ridiculous line for another second.

You have been warned. If you still decide to wait, prepare to board the overhyped train.
author: Chris K.

description:
Didn't have to wait in line that long as I went on a weekday at about 1pm.

I had the Monte Christo, which - to put it simply- is a sweet ham, bacon and drippy grilled cheese sandwich wrapped in the soaking embrace of egg and grilled French toast style. Divine.
author: Errol T.

description:
First of all, let's get this one fact straight. When you come here, you are gonna wait. Probably 45 minutes to an hour. Doesn't matter how early you get there, although I like to get here around 7AM. Regardless, THE WAIT IS WORTH IT. TRUST ME. 

The best breakfast and one of the best meals of my entire life. Prices aren't the cheapest for a breakfast joint but the few extra dollars are worth spending for the high quality and fresh ingredients. 

My two favourite dishes are the Eggs Benedict Florentine and the Our Famous Monte Cristo. Its hard to choose which one I like better, honestly. Also, while a bit pricey, the freshly squeezed orange juice is TO DIE FOR. The lemonade is pretty fantastic as well. 

As for the staff, they have never been anything but wonderful. They are kind to both the customers and each other. Our waiter, who has been our waiter each time we have went, is absolutely amazing. He is nice, kind, funny, prompt, and even helpful. He suggested eating the jam(which is flippin great, if I may add) with the french toast to our friend. Now, our friend is a big syrup advocate, but, because of this suggestion, ate his entire plate of french toast only with jam and skipped the syrup entirely. He was almost in tears! 

Overall, Mama's is probably one of the best, if not the best, meals I've ever had. I'm always going to go back whenever I'm in The City. I know Mama's is quite famous  and sometimes famous places can be a bit disappointing and overrated. This is NOT the case for Mama's. Mama's is beyond perfection. I love Mama's!
author: Ambur P.

description:
Mama's opens at 8 am, which means you should make your way over by 7:30-7:45 if you don't want to be standing in line for more than half an hour. 

Dishes that I've tried and recommend (in order): the Monte Cristo (especially that jam- YUM), the classic eggs benedict, the smoked salmon scramble, and the Washington Square omelette. I want to rave about the Monte Cristo because it's such a unique and delicious dish that is so central to what makes Mama's.. Mama's! I would describe it as a little sweet tweak to the perfectly warm ham and cheese sandwich. The softness of the bread, the sweet berry taste and texture of the jam, and the savory taste of the ham and cheese create a beautiful harmony. 

This is definitely a breakfast joint to check out in order to "experience" a bit of San Francisco! 

Try not to come in big groups because their seating is limited and you'll likely have to wait for half the restaurant to clear up.
author: Jane S.

description: The wait was long, but so so worth it. The cranberry orange french toast and the dungeness crab benedict were to die for. The service was impeccable. If you need breakfast in San Francisco, this is the place. Don't even worry about the line, they will bring you your coffee while you wait!
author: Veronica S.

description:
What an awesome place!
My friend recommended me this place and I must say it is well worth the wait. It is a bit small with tables very close to each other, but service and food are definitely worth it!

Not normally a French Toast fan, but since this was recommended I had to try it and I definitely wasn't disappointed!
author: Tharsio R.

description: We decided to give it a try. Got in line at 9am on a Sunday. Took 2hrs 15min till we got inside. We decided to try the French toast sampler and Eggs Benedict. Everything was so good. Glad to hear they are opening another location on Stockton street. Was yummy
author: Chris K.

description:
Long wait so definite get there early, but it's worth waking up for. Ended up here for brunch with my cousin. Loved their salmon omelet and berry bread. I even brought some bread home I liked it so much. Definite wish they had a bottomless mimosas/bellinis option though. Can't wait to go back. 
Their system of ordering surprised me, no waiters u order at the counter so make sure you check out the menu ahead of time.
author: Laura B.

description:
I wondered what the hype was all about Mamas and wanted to experience this for myself. Everyone says to get the famous monte cristo and the Dungeness crab omelette and I decided to try the monte cristo because the crab omelette was like 24.99. Really?!

1. Appearance 5/10 - it's like 540 sq ft with only like 6-9 tables this explains the long line (waited close to an hour or more). The tables and chairs are old fashioned and the decoration was terrible no offense. It looked like grandmas house painted yellow. Honestly if your running a business this small. Please consider patio chairs and tables outside or at least benches for customers to sit on.

2. Customer Service 7/10 - The hostess was okay. She didn't smile a lot and wasn't a good talker either. The cashier was friendly he asked me how we found out about the place and where we came from which was also nice. The waitress was ok she greeted us but wasn't really good on conversations. 

3. Food 7/10 - The monte cristo is 2 ham, turkey, egg and cheese toasted sandwich cut into pieces of four and you get a choice of side- salad or like hash browns or something and it comes with a jelly jam dip on the side oh yeah it's sprinkled with powdered sugar. This was okay. The bite of it was very flavorful but honestly I can make this myself. My other half ordered three cheese omelette and I can only taste cheddar in that thing.

Overall the experience wasn't worth waiting an hour worth for, and I think it's overpriced.
author: Ellaine C.

description:
I give Mama's 4 stars for EXCELLENT FOOD!!! 
The Monte Cristo is AMAZING with its mix of sweet and savory flavors and the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast is DEELISH! 

Most of the servers were incredibly friendly and eager to please. With one exception. A woman who was taking orders and working the cash register was dismissive and made us wait in line for 12 minutes without an explanation or an apology. Other than her poor service, everything else was EXCEPTIONAL!
author: Natasha S.

description:
Had their supposedly famous Cranberry-Orange Walnut bread, but didn't find it very impressive. They were nice enough to let us in after they were technically closed at 3:05pm on Saturday (though there were still tables in there finishing their meals), though.

While the bread was soft, and did have a good texture that was moist but not to the point of being spongy and still broke apart just easily enough without being too crumbly, I found its consistency a little oily. I thought the cranberry was just too powerful and tart - it may be just my personal thing that I don't like cranberry too much, but I've had it in other breads where it's more dried and the flavor isn't as intense. In the bread here the cranberry has retained a lot of its moistness and therefore that overwhelmingly tart - no, not tart. SOUR. - flavor.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=a5_rDKJGW8Imt6j8-C2ibg#a5_rDKJGW8Imt6j8-C2ibg
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Had the Northern Italian omelette and my wife had the Crab omelette. Both were delicious, well worth the wait. 
Get there early! We got there at 8, they open at 8 and we didn't get seated till after 9. No complaints though.
author: Chris M.

description:
3 words: brunch on steroids. Mama don't mess around when it comes to the most enjoyable meal during your weekend. Yes, the wait is long. Yes, it's cash only. Yes, your bill will pile up fast. But I guarantee you will leave this place without any regret and with one happy belly. 

If you don't want to wait so long, I'd recommend coming here later in the day during the week. Keep in mind, there's a lot of weekend only menu items you'd miss out on, and they're usually the best ones. My favorite dish has got to be the Dungeness crab omelet with havarti & avocado. Mama sure doesn't skimp on the seafood here. The crab literally spilled out all over my plate as I sliced my omelet in awe of how much was packed in. There's so much more on the menu I'd like to try, but I don't think I can ever steer away from the crab. I can't wait to come back for more!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I really, really wanted this to live up to the hype.  Unfortunately, I feel like it is all hype.  

I waited the insanely long two hours to finally try out their crab eggs bene ... This was even on a Tuesday, but a two hour wait is the norm around here...

When you finally get your turn, it's cramped inside and told (not very politely, I might add) to stand at the counter.  Great, more standing in line.  Though the lady at the cash register reminded us of the Seinfeld episode with the Soup Nazi.  So funny.  After another 15 minutes we ordered our food.  My friend ordered a spinach salad (yes, I made merciful fun of him for the two hour wait that didn't result in anything better than a salad -- if you are reading this Chad, I love you! ;).  I ordered the crab eggs benedict and we decided to get apple crumb cake for dessert.  

Spinach salad:  Normal.  Nothing special.  The apples added was a nice touch though.

Crab Benedict:  the crab was fresh and chunky, which I greatly appreciated.  Where it falls short was the sauce (too lemon-y and thin).  The muffins were too soggy because they spooned too much egg water on to them.  It actually ruined the whole experience.  I decided to just eat the crab and call it a day.  

Apple crumb cake:  Wow!  I'd go back and ask the front door monitor if we could just purchase this alone, without waiting in line.  It was delicious.  Not worth two hours, but amazing nonetheless. 

I will never stand in this line again, but I am glad I finally did to learn this valuable lesson.
author: Melissa P.

description: Don't get discouraged by the wait, seriously, it is worth it. I ordered the monte cristo, south of the border omelette and French toast sampler. All of it was amazing! I have to say I was really impressed by the chorizo inside my omelette. It wasn't too greasy and had a great flavor. Customer service was also great! The guy at the door was friendly and even recommended places for us tourists to visit. If I'm ever in the area, I WILL return.
author: Brianna R.

description: Great food, great service, highly recommend this please to anyone that wants to have the best breakfast in frisco!
author: Danny G.

description:
My favorite brunch place in San Francisco. It's been rated to be one of the "20 SF restaurants you have to try before you die"
For good reason! They provide amazing dishes! People are crazy about this place that every time I go, I wait for at lest 40mins. No compliant for that because it all worth it.

Monte cristo is very popular and it taste really good, thick and rich. Crab benedict, smoke salmon scramble, Washington square omelet with bacon, French toast, mimosas...  How can you say no?
author: Amie Z.

description: Finally writing a review after 2 times here! First off, there will be a wait. Almost 2 hours to be precise. Secondly, the Monte Cristo is a must have. It is so delicious, and served with an amazing homemade jam. (I don't usually even like jam!) I've also tried the french toast sampler and crab benedict. All good choices! The waitress was pretty good at taming the hangry crowd, and she was very attentive and friendly. I'll be back in a year or so.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I would give this place a 4. Let's start out by saying that this place is way way way over hyped. This is my second time coming here because the first time I was just not going to wait in the never ending line, but this time me and my friend decided we were going to wait it out and see what it was that everyone was talking about. Let me add on that we were in line for 2 hours.... Let me repeat 2 hours of standing outside waiting eat brunch. The line really barely moves... So after waiting for 2 hours, it was finally our turn to come in and order food. Whoever was at the cash register was taking her sweet time, packing someone's to go order, talking to her coworkers, and just not really into the whole let me take your order thing. 

We decided that since the wait was so long we had to try multiple things because we weren't going to be coming back here for awhile. So we got the eggs florentine and added sausage, the Washington square omelette, the monte cristo, chocolate crumble cake, lemonade, and berry smoothie. The total for all this was around $55.00. Not bad, but a bit pricey for brunch. 

When we were served the food, they brought us the chocolate crumble cake first and so we tried that first. This was very warm and rich with chocolate. For my taste way to sweet, but pretty tasty. Then we were served the rest of our food. I had the eggs florentine which was the typical eggs Benedict, nothing special at all. My friend had the Washington square omelette, which he also wasn't impressed much with. Then we shared the monte cristo which I liked the most. The thing is the food was good, but it's not something that I couldn't make for myself at home.

Also I tried other brunch places in the city prior to this one such as Kitchen Story and Sweet Maple and I would say I was more impressed with what I ate there. The foods presentation was much better and there was nothing close to the wait that I stood out here. 

Overall the food here was good, just not worth the wait for 2 hours whatsoever. I guess it's all about the history of this place. I tried it once, but I doubt I would want to come back here any time soon.
author: Julia K.

description: Great brunch comfort food! Portions are huge and satisfying. They have all the breakfast food you can think of- all kinds of eggs, pancakes, french toast. Unfortunately despite the quick and amazing service, we still had to wait in line for 45 min outside and another 15-20 min inside. Not sure if it is worth the wait...
author: Joanne K.

description: It was good, but not really worth the wait. There are a ton of other brunch places around that are just as good!
author: Molly M.

description: Just finished lunch at Mama's. To be honest can't figure out the reputation this place got over the years. The line is crazy and the quality of the food doesn't justify the long wait. I had a burger that was nothing but tasteless, the omelette my wife had was plain and tasted like it was made out of egg powder. The seating area is small and unwelcoming and the servers rush you. In a nutshell, stay away!!
author: ben f.

description:
Mama's is good, but I just don't think it's wait in line for 1-2 hours good.

I got sucked into the hype and wanted to try this place out and I just don't know if I was that impressed. 

Me and my boyfriend arrived within 30 minutes of them opening and there was already a line out the door. We were already prepared for the wait though so it wasn't that bad. We reached the front of the line about an hour and fifteen minutes later. I guess it could've been worse. 

Our orders were taken and then we were seated. I ordered the monte cristo and my boyfriend ordered an omelette (I forget which). The monte cristo was good and my boyfriend said his omelette was good too. But was it good enough to be waiting an hour+ in? Not too sure. 

The best part was probably the pomegranate jam. It was delicious and homemade by them!! 

All in all, I probably won't come back anytime soon unless there isn't a wait but I don't think it was a waste to try.
author: Stephanie H.

description: This is hands down one of the best brunch places I've been to. We got there 15 minutes after opening on the Saturday and waited about half hour. They owner at the front door was extremely gracious. He gave my husband  and I a list of to go dining places in the area and sat with us for a few at our table. Also, the carrot cake is a MUST!!! I closed my eyes while eating it. Everything  was super yummy!!
author: Joey J.

description:
1. Crab Cake Eggs Benedict was one of the best eggs benedict I have had. great texture and vibrant flavors with sour cream.
2. there was a 20 min wait at 9:45am weekday. popular place!
3. the famous monte cristo was delicious as well 
4. slightly pricey place for breakfast though, total for two plates approx. $39, but quite worth it
author: See L.

description:
I'd probably give this place a 3.5 if I could due to trying another dish which makes me see the potential. However, with that said, I ordered the huevos rancheros, and not that I am an expert, but I'm guessing this is not their best dish. I don't believe that it was prepared and/or assembled correctly. The tortillas are sort of sticking out the side and are not in the midst of all the ingredients. Also, they didn't seem to be warmed up/browned in a skillet. Plus, I feel like it , though I am not positive as this is a few days later, that it was missing some essential ingredients like cilantro, onions, and maybe the zestiness of a lime or lemon (pico de gallo would have been great on it). Overall, I found it a little bland and not really worth an hour+ wait.

The lady got the Monte Cristo which was definitely better than my dish and the homemade jam was phenomenal. I tried a bite and was wishing I had ordered something else as I could tell other dishes were their forte. I really wish I would have tried the french toast or egg benedict dishes, but I guess I was craving something different. 

Overall, this is a cool place with a very long line, but it is small, a bit pricey, and I'm not sure why it's so popular.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I know . . . I know . . . how could I give this place 3 stars right? 
The food is definitely great! Since I had waited in line for over an hour and 45 minutes, I decided to splurge! I ordered the dungeness crab omelette! It was delicious. The crab was good, and sweet. I loved that there were chunks of dungeness crab, avocado, and fresh tomatoes in my omelette! However, the price tag wasn't so awesome = $26-27!! Ridic. The omelette plate came with potatoes and toast. I didn't get the toast because I am allergic to gluten.  They don't carry gluten free bread here, which meant that I couldn't order any of the french toast which I was totally bummed about! 

My fiance ordered one of the french toast plates. I forgot what it was called, but it had some almonds in it. The portions were quite hearty. He ate the entire plate and was super duper full! He thought it was delicious. 

My god brother had the Monte Cristo, which looked absolutely delicious!!! He ate everything off his plate! I wish I could have tried it. I was hoping they had gluten free bread, but unfortunately they don't. 

My god brother's wife had the dungeness crab benedict on a bed of spinach. The egg looked perfectly poached! That was my second choice, but because of the bread, I opted out and got the omelette instead.  

All of the food was good. The service was fast! But that line is just out of control! I am not sure if I would ever wait that long to eat here again. The food was good, but it wasn't over the top where I would wait that long ever again. The place is so small, the kitchen is small. There's really no room to be more efficient. They do the best they can to keep it moving. 

The food is great, but I had to turn my cheek when I saw that none of the workers were wearing gloves! I was a little grossed out.... but if that's legal then OK. Despite that, the food was still really good! 

If you don't live in the city... good luck finding parking! The parking gods were on my side so I had good parking karma. The parking is metered street parking. I would recommend coming really early, before they open. At that point, it may be worth it to eat here still.
author: Jenn R.

description: The food quality is not worth the time you spend in the line. We waited for 1.5 hours in the line and when we were inside there were empty tables, though we had to wait more inside too because those tables weren't ready. Finally the food arrived, good in visuals but just regular quality, not better than everyone can do at home. Don't waste your time.
author: Acar E.

description:
Since there are already thousands reviews of Mama's, I doubt my review will add much but I would just like to say that I ate there a few months ago and it is worth the wait.

I had the breakfast omlette plus bacon & it was delicious.   Next time that I am in San Francisco,  I will be back.
author: Tom S.

description:
OMG, I want to stab myself with a fork just to stay awake. I'm on this date you see, and though she looks like Nicole Kidman, she's has the intelligence of one of Mama's omelets. The omelet is probably a bit smarter, since it's more complex than my date.

I ordered the Dungeness Crab Benedict in the hopes I would get an allergic reaction, just to have an excuse to leave. I'm technically allergic to shellfish, but it's hit or miss when it comes to getting sick. The Benedict was great though, and I didn't have an allergic reaction, darn.

My date gets the pancakes, probably because the omelet has ingredients she can't spell. She keeps twisting her blond hair every time I ask her a question, as if she's cranking out ideas in that bubble head of hers, but she has nothing to say.
Thank goodness this place is crowded, and the food is a generous portion, so I can focus on that.

Me: "Do you like movies?"

Her: "No really."

Me: "Do you like shopping?"

Her: "Not really."

I wanted to ask her if there was anything in that brain of hers, just to hear her say, "not really" one more time.

I felt like an interrogator, trying to get some sort of answer from her. I'd like to think that I can speak to practically anyone, even babies, but her, no dice. 

All the guys are checking her out, and I'm shaking my head thinking, an audio book is more interesting than her.

Good food, I'll be back...just without her.
author: Jack R.

description:
One of the best places for brunch in San Francisco.  There's always a line, but soo worth the wait.  

Once inside, it's a quaint sunny spot filled with memorabilia including a menu from 1965, and a bustling open kitchen.  

A little on the expensive side, but everything was well-prepared with a sprinkle of whimsical charm.

Mama's is known for their french toast, and it didn't disappoint.  The orange-cranberry french toast was delicious.  

Also had the dungeness crab benedict and the wild mushroom "m'omlette.  

A great way to work off the carb and calorie overload is to walk to Coit tower, which is literally above the neighborhood.  Or take a nap at Washington square which is right across the street.
author: Hieu H.

description:
I waited about 20 min. and honestly wouldn't have waited any longer. The food was good but doesn't live up to the hype. 

Got the veggie omelet which was pretty substantial but nothing out of the ordinary. Also shared the French toast platter - yummy but nothing worth waiting hours for! 

Glad I went but don't think I'd ever wait in long line for it.
author: Karen H.

description: We visited on a Saturday and waited for 90 minutes. Food was great, we bought some of their fruit breads as well which were exquisite. The raspberry jam is to die for. Worth the wait..will come back when we visit SF next.
author: Saloni S.

description: We showed up around 9 am on a Friday morning and waited almost an hour before being seated. The food was awesome!  Between us we had the Californian, the Smoked Salmon Scramble, French Toast Sampler, and the Dungeness Crab Benedict which was by far the best plate of food we ordered ($25) and the most expensive. No regrets other than the standing in line, which is part of the experience unfortunately.  Besides the crab dish, average plate of food with tip is going to be $20-$25.
author: Robert H.

description:
Let's start with the wait time...we arrived here at 9:30 and did not get to order until 11:30 and didn't get to eat till 12 noon. Was anything we had worth the wait?! Absolutely not! The food I would say it's worth 4 stars but because of the wait i decided to give it a 3 stars for the whole experience.

Here is the breakdown of what we ordered:

-The coffee and the latte were pretty bad. Tasteless to say the least. 
-The monte Cristo was really good. Specially with the jam. It just made the sandwich perfect. 
-The crab Benedict was just average or actually might be a little below average for the price (26.75). The actually Benedict sauce was not that good.
-the French toast platter was good but not great. No wow factor at all. 

Service overall was good. The waiter has a good sense of humor and they are very friendly and attentive.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Finally got a chance to visit this gem back in June. It was well worth the walk, wait and my best friend fainting in the heat during our 1.5 hour stance outside in line. Reviewers on Yelp helped us muster up the courage and patience to wait in the infamous long line. We were glad we did! 

Treat yourself to a mimosa and Cranberry-Orange French Toast! You will leave heartbroken just because the meal is over. If you're from out of town, you'll be even more upset because you don't know when Mama's will be in your life again. Regardless, go and savor each bite. 

PS - The atmosphere is very welcoming and cozy. Also, my friend who fainted is ok.
author: Janea B.

description: Everything was great I had Monte Cristo & Banana pancakes they were amazing I have never tried a sandwich like this before it comes with a blueberry dipping sauce of some sort & would of never thought to put the 2 together. The banana pancakes were so fluffy and soft they were so delicious. My kids had the French toast variety platter & they loved it as well. The orange juice tasted fresh squeezed it was very refreshing. The wait time here was terrible but well worth the wait. My recommendation is to get here super early. Loved it!!!
author: Erica L.

description:
The day I went it was raining and there was still a long line. Dedicated fans of mamas are intense! The servers were so attentive and even though they are obviously busy roaming around in such a tight space, they seem to make the experience enjoyable. 

I loved the French toast sampler because you get a little taste of everything (committing to one flavor just seems like too much). The French toast they use is like a poundcake-esque type of bread that is soft and fluffy. I usually like a little crunch, but the flavor and texture make up for it. Mama cristo was also a good dish I ordered. Crab Benedict had fresh crab and perfectly cooked eggs. 

I can't wait to find another excuse to go to sf to eat more!!
author: Sarah L.

description:
I've always heard about Mama's and how amazing their food is. But I've also heard about the ridiculous wait, which kept me from making a visit. 
Decided to finally give it a try and I have to say, I've been missing out! 
Luckily my friend and I came near closing time so we didn't have to wait but it was still a full house.
My friend and I shared the Monte Cristo, Washington Square omelette, and Cranberry-Orange French toast. The French toast was good but I didn't really care for it because I'm not that fond of sweet foods. The omelette was very yummy but the Monte Cristo!!! Omg! Must get! Each bite with the layer of meat and cheese was perfection. You know your meal was good when you wake up the next morning craving it. 
The service was amazing, the workers were friendly and constantly checking on us. 
Will be coming back soon!
author: Joanne L.

description: The breakfast is so nice, but I and my wife wait over 30 minutes. The popular drink is mama's smoothie. The omelette and blueberry pancake is wonderful.If we go to San Francisco again and we will go mama again.
author: Andy C.

description:
Favorite breakfast in San Francisco!  Seriously, this is Disneyland people, the SF version.  You may wait 30-45 minutes, or even an hour.  So, go just a little while before you are starved, and you'll be just fine.  If you want something quick -- this is not for you, so please -- just get out of my way!

The lines are long, it's fun, you meet and chat with people, you make new friends, and with anticipation as you get closer to the entry -- you can start peeking inside at people ordering, eating, and -- let the salivation begin! 

Absolutely picturesque pancakes or french toast with beautiful blueberries and strawberries, baked muffins, omelette's (and an excuse to have home potatoes), weekend specials like Dungeness Crab Benedict.  Special mention of pure bliss: The Monte Cristo.

They also serve lunch with burgers, sandwiches, quiches, salads, and other items -- but I don't have room to eat lunch after their big breakfast!
author: Randy B.

description:
If you find the idea of waiting in line for two hours on a Saturday morning repulsive, avoid. There isn't another way unless you make your friends wait for you and Uber in and eat the food. This happened to me here, but it's not this place's fault. They are nice people.

It's an experience. You should probably do it once. And it's not like the food will disappoint. It will be solid. It is a great environment and the food is delicious. Definitely not 'Best Brunch in SF' stuff, but all very good. Four stars feels perfectly in line with what we got. Five stars would feel like too many. Three would feel mean. Four feels right. Just right.

If you have awesome friends that you are always happy to spend a couple of hours with, stand outside on one of the sunnier Saturdays in SF and take selfies and what not. It will be fun for 15 minutes and then the funniest among you needs to come up with something else to do, which probably isn't your problem b/c you are reading this far into a Yelp review. My Yelp Review! Seriously, I know nothing.

The eggs were solid, they had bacon, fruit was served, the check wasn't crazy. The bathroom was crazy, but that's just SF. Very small, very cute place you should check out if you are open to the wait. If you aren't, I can't help you; I told you this was a 'No' up top!

Should be a yes, though. Or a least a maybe. It's good.
author: Renard M.

description:
The line even at 7:35 AM on a Saturday morning took about 30 minutes just to get in. Once you're in, there is another line to stand passing all the baked goods at eye level - all the apple crumb, chocolate crumb, bundt cakes, breads, carb heaven-- right there so your imagination gets to work.  Its a pretty small place inside but the servers are attentive and pay attention to your coffee level in your cup.  Our food arrived: my BF got the california omelette and I got the Blackstone eggs benedict.  He loved the bacon and avocado the omelette was stuffed with and I loved the piquant tart hollandaise sauce my eggs benedict was topped with.  
We also got an apple crumb to go and a chocolate crumb for him. All in all, well worth the trip and the line!
author: Maria M.

description:
Quality breakfast and brunch (:
Be prepared to wait minimum of an hour.
All ingredients taste fresh.
I would personally recommend getting a special of the day with a glass of fresh orange juice.
author: Tyler W.

description: Had to wait for 1 hr 45 min. System a little about of sorts. They make you wait in line outside then they make you wait inside before you can order. The man taking the orders was very rude about a customer not wanting pork in the omelet they ordered. We had to witness the encounter in the middle of ordering our food. Chocolate coffee cake was mediocre and coffee was watered down. Now for the food...... it was cold and not worth the hype!!  Not worth the wait or money.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
I waited 2 hours in line for this. Was it worth it? That's the ultimate question. Yes and no. Honestly, 2 hours in line is a really long time. Is the food good? Yes, definitely. The service is also good, so that's a plus. But is the food worthy of 2 hours of wait? Ehhh that's debateable.

I think if you've never tried Mama's, you definitely should at least try it. The wait is probably shorter on the weekdays but I can't comment on that since I didn't go on a weekday. I came here for Saturday brunch. I saw a lot of people leave the line but you'll be waiting in line and for your food for about a good 2 hours.

You wait in line to order + pay. Then you wait for a table to clear up and then you get seated.

I tried the famous Monte Cristo, the french toast sampler (look on the daily specials!),and corned beef hash benedict. At first I wanted to try the crab benedict but I didn't think it'll cost $20, so I decided for something more in my price range. I love the food by far. I took a bite of the Monte Cristo, man that was delicious! It's good! I also like the french toast, they use the yummy bread to make it and the jam is such a great addition to it. Now I crave the Monte Cristo here and there, because I don't think I can personally duplicate it and I am not the best cook so it's not worth it.

The food is definitely good. The wait is going to be long. The service is superb.
author: Margaret L.

description: Great breakfast/brunch place.  We had pancakes and the salmon scramble (shared them).  Both were excellent.  Very friend service and lovely atmosphere.  I suggest that if you're in SF for multiple days that you go to Mama's Tuesday thru Friday to avoid the line that always occurs on the weekend.
author: Gregory B.

description: Best French toast ever!!!  This place is well worth any wait you may have. Lucky for me I arrived at 7:45 am and was the fourth in line. Everyone who works here seems so cool. I will definitely be back.
author: Tonia B.

description: Excellent choice for breakfast / brunch in the heart of SF. Enjoyed the service and food. The wait time was not bad ~ 20 mins. Try / Ask for their home made jam / spread for the toast. It was yummy. The portion size was pretty generous and the overall decor of the place was good. Only one downsize - its a cash only place !!!
author: Bhavtosh D.

description: Not as good as all the hype. While visually stunning, the classic eggs Benedict I got had an overly vinegared hollandaise sauce. For the cost and hour long wait? Not worth it. Admittedly, I'm guessing if you're a pancake or waffle person, this place would probably please you. But how do you as screw up a pancake?
author: Brian K.

description:
Best.Carrot.Cake.Ever.

THERE. I'm divulging my favorite treat to the world!!! You'd better appreciate it, especially since the last 3 times I visited, they were always out of Carrot Cake. Why dis? *sniffle* 

Why is this the best Carrot Cake ever? Because it tastes like home. So fresh, so delicious, perfect in every which way. This baby was made with love and I can taste it! Nothing really compares, and believe me, I've tried.

Now, prepare to be mind blown...
3... Get a side of bacon
2... Take a bite of bacon
1... Take a bite of carrot cake
*MUSHROOMCLOUDEXPLOSION*

Everything is pretty legit here, but mostly stuff you can get at other decent brunch joints. Another spectacular item that I always get is the Monte Cristo. Never too greasy, and goes so well with their homemade jam. MAKE SURE you have it with the burgundy colored jam, (I believe it is boysenberry?) and NOT the raspberry jam. Sometimes they do a sneaky switcheroo. HEY!! I SEE YOU. (Haha but probably not on purpose, they were probably running out cause it's ducking felicious.)

Super cute restaurant with lovely service. This is a family run business as far as I know. On most visits, it's the same dude manning the cashier. Apparently his sister is the superbly gifted baker who makes all the sweeties. One time he sent a complimentary chocolate cake crumble to our table. Cashier dude, so sorry I forgot your name, but I want you to know, that day, you made me the happiest girl in the world.

My last visit was in 2012 but I'm still full of fond memories of this place. Good food speaks to your heart. Vast oceans have come between us before but Mama's is always on my mind. Since I've moved to Los Angeles, the only thing that is keeping me from this place is the fact that I'm only in SF on weekends and I can never bring myself to wait in line for 2 hours to eat. I might have to change that policy though..the deliciousness beckons. If only they allowed to-go orders on weekends.

Pro-tip:
On a mild and sunny weekday, order your food to-go, bring a blanket and enjoy your food in Washington Square Park! Perf.
author: Cheryl I.

description: The Eggs Benedict were bomb. The place is popular and there is a bit of a wait. Small and homey, but worth the wait standing in line to get in.
author: Natalie T.

description: Finally decided to try it and luckily there wasn't a long line up outside the restaurant. Waited outside for approximately 20 minutes before we were let inside to wait in another line to order our food. Before I went inside I really wanted to order their freshly baked items however while we were lining up we noticed a bunch of big fruit flies crawling all over the basket of fresh baked items behind the kitchen window. This deterred me from ordering the cranberry orange and the french toast sampler. We ordered the Kugelhopf french toast and the breakfast sandwich. My Kugelhopf came with 3 slices and the taste just didn't wow me. The bread was thin so it didn't have much texture in each bite. I had to use more syrup and butter then I usually would to add more taste. The breakfast sandwich was pretty good. It had Canadian bacon, an over easy egg and melted cheese. Honestly I had high hopes for this place because of the rave reviews and recommendations from yelp and friends. However in my opinion (from what I ordered) this place wasn't anything special compared to other brunch places in SF.
author: Jon T.

description:
Upon arrival I saw a long line out the door. I was hesitant if  it I wanted to wait in that line. But then I read all the great reviews on this place so I knew I wanted to try it. I decided to wait in line and my cousins Uber to Philz coffee in the meantime. Ended only waiting about 45 minutes which wasn't too bad. When you are about to be seated they actually have you order your food in advanced and pay for it as well. So you must have all your parties there or at least know what they want to order for them. Restaurant has very limited seating. 

I ended ordering the french toast sampler. My cousin orderd the Monte crisco. My french toast sampler ending being just ok but the Monte Crisco is to die for! I wish I had ordered that! Next time!
author: Crystal N.

description:
Good things come to those who wait. Guinness stout. Heinz ketchup. A table for weekend brunch at Mama's on Washington Square.

We stood on the sidewalk on a beautiful San Francisco morning in a long line that literally had us facing downhill towards Mama's. AS IF the foodie gods were guiding us towards the entrance!!!! When we finally made it inside after waiting for 30-45 minutes, we were able to check out the menu, order and pay. Then, we waited in the middle of the restaurant and were seated in less than five. 

The food came out fairly quickly considering the place was packed. My dungie crab benny was delicious. The crab meat was sweet, fresh, juicy, tender. I didn't have to add a thing, as it was PERFECT (I wanna fall in love). My friend's food was good, too, but I don't remember clearly what it was, maybe one of the M'Omelettes??

Just get the dungie crab benny! It's sooooo good and in season RIGHT NOW!
author: Liv K.

description:
Even though we had to wait an hour and half to get seated, it was worth it!

I got the monte cristo. My first ever. and it was AMAZING. it's like ham/egg/cheese or something inside of a french toast pocket. 
Then you put some of the homemade jam / preserve on it... wow. the jam is so fresh and delicious. 
All together, the sweet and savory combo. YUM. 

My friend got the dungeness crab benedict, which I tried a little of and that was really good too. lots of crab meat!

Service was very good too. very friendly. 

the price was good too


Overall, if you want a really good brunch and don't mind a little waiting, definitely check this place out.
author: Yong K.

description: Stopped by after a morning run. Only brought $20 and a credit card with me. They only take cash. It's a small place. Waited in line for a while. Ordered a shrimp omelette. The cashier lady probably the 'MaMa' is very unfriendly. She rolled her eyes when I asked for the price of a cake to see if my total is less than 20. The shrimp omelette was ok but doesn't worth the waiting time and price. I don't know why they have a high rating.
author: Anna G.

description: This is a San Francisco landmark. So worth a visit and so worth even waiting in line for your turn. That good!
author: Tom P.

description: Best French toast in the city. Benedicts are great as well but I'll come again for the French toast sampler. Loooong wait, so come after 1pm.
author: Bilal M.

description:
I feel like I am beating a dead horse. But this place was delicious!!

LINE WAS LONG!  It was an unusually hot January day so bring sunscreen, a folding chair and your patience.  Oh ya an umbrella would have been awesome since you stand directly in the sun.   We waited for 1 hour and 15 mins.  Line was much less by the time we walked out which was after 1 so if you sleep in and come for a late breakfast that might work out well.
 
While we were patiently sweating in line.  We finally got close to the front window where they have the menu displayed .... One of the first things that caught my eye was the "SPECIALS" sign.  Naturally, my eyes go directly to the most expensive item on the menu Dungeness King Crab at $22.95. There were several things I wanted to try: The Dungeness King Crab Eggs Benedict or Omelet, the Prosciutto and asparagus omelet, the Monte Cristo, Shrimp Eggs benedict or omelet.  

We decided to split the Dungeness King Crab Omelet, which they packed with huge chunks of delicious crab, avocado and Havarti cheese.  Our second choice was the Monte Cristo that was cooked to perfection!   They make homemade jam and all the baked good in house.  The sourdough bread with jam was amazing!!  Both dishes came with a side of potatoes.

Was the wait worth it?  HELL YA!  

Will I pay $22.95 for an omelet again?  Hell ya but only at Mama's!  

Do I wish we would of gone back the next morning absolutely!

Until we meet again!
author: Venessa V.

description: My friend suggested this place. We said to expect a long wait but it was not too bad 45 min. Its nice that theres a small park nearby so, we went there to hide from the sun while a few friends stayed in line. The place is small and is very old school SF in terms of the interior. But I like it. You order in the front and then the servers help you find seats. My favorite was the Northwest Omelette. Probably one of the best I have had. The egg just melts in your mouth and the smoke salmon was so fresh and capers added a nice flavor. It balanced the salmon for sure. Also, I tried my friends Monte Cristo and 2nd best in my opinion. Its a grilled ham and cheese sandwich and you dip it in their homemade jam. So bomb!.
author: Erville V.

description:
OMG, how did I forget to write a review for this place?

I've been here twice and waited at least 30 min-1 hour each time.  

Get the Monte Cristo and French Toast. MmmmmMmmm

So worth the wait, you won't be disappointed!
author: Linda N.

description: This place is horrible in customer service.  They don't have a waiting list so I had to stick in a line for a whole time.  I had waited for an hour and half but the line did not move because they have only 13 tables.  I don't know how good they are but this line is nonsense.
author: Sunny L.

description: Waited in line for an hour and the line didn't move.  I'll try again next time I'm in town.
author: Jonathan D.

description: We are native San Franciscans and arrived at 11:30 and the line was long.  TWO hours long. I haven't eaten here in almost 10 years and expected some good food. As I said, TWO hour wait and the place was a BIG  DISAPPOINTMENT. The Monte Cristo was Luke warm. One of the most expensive dishes, the crab Benedict had hard boiled poached eggs! The wait staff was attentive. As for the kitchen, they need to brush up on how to prepare food. There were small flies landing on the freshly baked goods and one of the cooks dropped some blueberries and proceeded to pick it up and throw it back in with the "non contaminated" ones. A lot of hype for a long wait, high priced, SF breakfast joint. SF has so many more superior breakfast spots to choose from, no reason to go here or come back.
author: Art J.

description:
Lets start with one thing; if you want to eat here show up before they open or cool your jets and wait 1.5 hour to 2.0 hours when you see the line. TRUST ME WHEN I SAY THIS......ITS WORTH THE WAIT!

Our party of 6 waited 1.5 hours to be seated once we sat down we all ordered mimosas which where all amazing. I ended up ordering the sough dough French toast and I literally though I was in heaven. You cant ever visit San Fran and not go here to eat its just a crime not to eat here. Highly recommend. Price was fair too.
author: David O.

description:
There must be a law somewhere that says any Restaurant that starts with the word "Mama's" in the name has to be amazing!!!

Where to begin:  Okay, lets talk about the LINE first.  It was 2 hours (and they don't take reservations.)  ... So if you don't mind standing outside on a sidewalk waiting in a line that goes halfway up the block, then go to Mama's on Washington Square for Breakfast.  Why?  Because the food is worth it.  Even with 47 people in front of us and the restaurant is so tiny the only have a few tables.

I never imagined breakfast could be so delicious.  I had Shrimp Benedict with Avocado and a spicy bloody mary.  Every ingredient was as fresh as humanly possibly.  The egg was this huge Petaluma farm egg that was bursting all over the crisp avocado and numerous shrimp ... Plus I had country potatoes the size of rubix cubes and homemade link sausage that were about an inch in diameter .... OMG every bite made you close your eyes and chew slow.

And of course, there is CYRUS!!!   Our server who is iconic in that place.  He is from some country near India or something, but more of a SF local than just about anyone I have met in a while.  Cyrus had jokes and personality and was a real joy to be around.  At the end of our meal, he sat and talked to us about the neighborhood, the restaurant's history and Vodka and his favorite Tequila's. By the end of the meal, we were all lifelong friends.

My advice is to go during the week and not Sunday!!  But definitely go. ;)
author: Paul R.

description:
Overrated. NOT worth the wait. Go to other brunch places to save you the wait!

Pros: 
- Good food (but not amazing)

Cons: 
- Long wait (at least an hour) since it's hyped and it's a small restaurant. You wait outside in the cold too
- Very weak alcoholic drinks
- Wrong prices on the menu

WAIT - 45 minutes to get inside. Another 15 to get seated (for a party of 2. If you're a bigger party, wait for a little longer)

FOOD - Ordered Monte Cristo since that's what Yelpers are raving about. From browsing through pictures on this site, it just looked like french toast and fried potatoes, but here's a pic of when I took a bite in it [http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dJ_ZTHjj6dZEKn_PVMd5AQ/l.jpg].  It's basically a french toast sandwich, with turkey, ham, and cheese in between. It is good I won't deny that. But for the wait we had, I expected more.  Bf wanted to get the eggs benedict, but we got so hungry from waiting in line that he got the omelette since it looked bigger. It was yummy but again, not impressed.

DRINKS - After a long wait we wanted a drink. On the menu outside of the door, it said Mimosa for $7.95 and Screwdriver for $6.50. So we ordered the screwdriver and it came in a cute jam can. Now, I don't drink a lot of alcohol, but I tasted no alcohol and it was basically just orange juice! I told our waitress this and she said she can give me a mimosa instead, but that's not what I wanted. I just wanted to drink a bit of something since the wait was so long! Tryna scam me for a more expensive drink? But when we got the bill, we got charged $7 each for our screwdrivers. I told her it was $6.50 on the menu but she said "No all our alcoholic drinks are $7." Uhhh.. well then you should charge me what's written on the menu!

OVERALL - Expectations for this place were not met, so I'm not coming back. I'd recommend going to Lime in the Castro for brunch instead! It's a long wait too, but at least it's worth it.
author: Raquel Y.

description:
Maybe it's because I've had one too many brunches in the city now but I really didn't find anything special about Mama's. The menu choices are largely the same as every other good brunch restaurant in the city but the wait time is at least twice as long. And it's cash only. At least you'll have enough time while waiting in the long lines to run off to an ATM to grab yourself some cash. 

The way Mama's works is that you wait in line outside and they slowly let people into the restaurant where you can see the chefs at work. This is where you can get a look at their specialty menu and order your food but it'll be another 10 minutes before you're seated and yet another 10-15 minutes before you get your food. The entire process of waiting outside, waiting inside, ordering, waiting for food, and digging in took us nearly 2 hours on a Saturday morning. 

I was mighty interested in the crab eggs benedict but the $22 price tag turned me off so I downgraded to the shrimp benedict. Like I said at the beginning of the review, it was pretty good, but in a city of excellent brunch restaurants, did not stand out. I didn't know what they were known for when I went in, but apparently their Monte Cristo is what people get. Another member of our party got that and it just looked like fancy french toast to me. I'll try that next time if I find myself in the mood to wait 1+ hours.
author: Philip W.

description:
One word = overhyped!!!

Came on a Wednesday around 12:30p not expecting any lines since it was a weekday, but unfortunately even on weekdays or weekends, Mama still has long lines. From reading previous reviews on Yelp, I had interpreted that there was only the wait outside & then you're seated right away. Do not be fooled! There's a 4-step waiting process which is a terrible system for them
(1) You wait outside
(2) You wait inside to order your food at the cashier 
(3) You wait for a table to be cleared out which can either be quick if you're lucky or awhile which is what happened for me
(4) You're finally seated at a table, but now, you wait for your food to arrive which w/ the monte cristo, it took the longest to prepare

After all that, it took 2 hrs to get our food (2:30p). I ordered the Famous Monte Cristo & was really excited to try out this dish. Disappointed..skimpy one slice of meats & cheeses between 3 thick battered pieces if bread; I was expecting a lot more. I didn't use the homemade jam b/c berry jams always taste too artificial for me personally, so I ended up using Tobasco which made the meal for me.

Overall, for its hype, it was a letdown. I would not come here again for a 2hr+ wait. However, it's jst one of those places that everyone has to check out one time
author: Trina N.

description: Great place but the wait outside the restaurant is ridiculous. If you want great food just walk around the neighborhood..
author: Owen C.

description: Food was good. But the reason why I give only 1 star is because of the middle aged asian woman who works here. Soo rude.
author: Haein L.

description:
Finally came here for breakfast after years of saying "We'll go when they aren't so busy."

Great breakkie! Got there at 10:30 am on Tuesday- Only 4 people ahead of us, still took about half an hour to be seated. 

We had the Blackstone Eggs Benedict & a Monte Cristo, they were both perfectly prepared. They actually make Hollandaise sauce & it was good. The jam that came with the MC was top notch too. My husband got a bloody Mary, it was passable & I enjoyed The sip I had. 

Very nice waitress! I will come again when I see that the line is short, because it is a great meal. And, served quickly once you get inside. Can't see myself waiting an hour to get in though.
author: Nancy W.

description:
I hope you wear comfortable shoes, because you're going to be standing in line for days. But really, mentally prepare yourself for a solid 1.5 hours in line, even on weekdays. I might recommend waking up early to beat the rush, but from what I hear, the line starts forming around 7:30AM, so there really is no escape.

I got the grilled chicken sandwich, but only because I couldn't get the Monte Cristo. Note: They can't make any substitutions (i.e. taking out ham) from this dish, which is heartbreaking for folks that don't eat ham because this one looked, smelled, and supposedly tasted incredible. But back to what I actually ate, the chicken was more tender than just about any grilled chicken sandwich I've ordered anywhere, so that's a big time plus. The sandwich overall is solid, but the bread is a little too challenging for my liking. 

What puts this place at 5 stars for me is their incredible french toast. I got the french toast sampler platter so that I could get a taste of as many as possible without having to wait in that line weekend after weekend, and man does that dish deliver. They were all excellent, but the Cranberry orange was my personal favorite. So much flavor! Loved it. They actually use fancy and fresh breads as the base, which I haven't seen anywhere else before. The jam that they have on the table is also fantastic, and allowed me to survive my starvation while waiting for the food to arrive.

Check this place out!
author: Madhur B.

description:
I paid a visit to Mama's today with my sister and a few of her friends, with it being a Thursday morning, I thought the wait wouldn't be too bad... but boy was I wrong! I don't think I've ever waited for Mama's breakfast this long before, but regardless of our 2 hour wait, it was all worth it in the end. 

I have tried the Dungeness Crab and Spinach Benedict - probably the best crab benedict I have ever had. Smoked Salmon Benedict - the smoked salmon is so delicious. French Toast Sampler - I would say my favorite of the three options is the banana walnut french toast. The Washington Square M'Omlette - savory and delicious. All of the breakfast options are served with a side of house potatoes and house jam. Honestly everything I've tried on the menu is cooked and crafted to perfection. But overall I think the dish that really wins my heart is the Dungeness Crab and Spinach Benedict. 

They also have a nice selection of breakfast drinks - soju screwdrivers, bellini's, mimosas, and bloody marys.

I don't understand how Mama's does it, they have the ability to make food so delicious that people are willing to wait 2 hours just to have a taste of the food! I waited 2 hours today, and I would be willing to wait again because the food here is just that amazing!
author: Elaine N.

description:
Worth the hype. Stood in line for 20 minutes on a Wednesday outside and then another 15 minutes inside because the foreigners in front of us had no idea how to say "french toast sampler" (disclaimer: they were the same ethnicity as me). Go figure - you stand 40 minutes in line and you don't prepare what you're going to order but joke about iphone texts? Dumb.

The French toast sampler and the Dungeness crab eggs benedict were awesome and worth getting. I have yet to try the Monte Cristo but it looked delish as well.

Hit this place up on the weekdays cuz the weekends are going to be full of tourists and when I mean tourists I mean the ones that can't speak English and joke around for an hour at iphone texts.
author: Julia P.

description:
Went there at 10 A.M. and waited in line for about an hour for a table for two. I can't imagine going with a larger group... The place is just so small. Back to the line... There's going to be a line no matter where you go for a Sunday brunch anyway. Plus, it's part of the experience.

On to the food... I ordered the Swedish cinnamon French toast with berries and a fresh-squeezed orange juice. The juice was good though on the pricey end. The French toast was good but I prefer the French toast at The Butler and the Chef (though also another smaller venue with a wait).

Bring cash. There's a $1 surcharge for debit cards and they don't even take credit cards. You also tip after paying too, so bring cash for that!
author: Charles L.

description: Got the "Famous Monte Cristo" sandwich and it was really good - bread was soft, generous amount of cheese, turkey and ham seasoned just right, and to top it off, the homemade jam was crazy good. Came about 1:45pm and only had to wait a very short while. Service was very friendly~ only gave it 4 stars cuz they gave me grilled potatoes instead of Cole slaw that I ordered.
author: Jiaying G.

description:
Not too sure what all the hype is, to be honest. 

I decided to take my friend from San Diego to this spot in San Francisco because we are both HUGE brunch fans. We came to the restaurant at around 10:30 AM, thinking that it would be worth it to stand in the 2 hour long line because everyone says this is the best brunch spot in all of San Francisco. So we waited.

We ordered the Veggie omelet with goat cheese, peppers, mushrooms; the French Toast Sampler (special) with cranberry, orange, cinnamon nut toasts and fruit; a slice of the carrot cake; a piece of the old-fashioned crumble cake. 

Everything was average at best, though the prices were very affordable and reasonable. The omelet was tasty, but nothing special. The french toast sampler had some hit and some misses-- I loved the cranberry flavors, but the cinnamon and more nuttier bread sample wasn't as tasty. The carrot cake was great but I would have loved it to be a bit warmer and a bit moister/softer. The old-fashioned crumble cake was good, but not the best I've had by any means.

My overall verdict is that it is an extremely average, standard brunch place with a standard menu and standard portion sizes. My issue is that nothing tasted special, unique, or different. My friend and I both agreed that the place was definitely overrated and that we expected a lot more, especially after waiting for 2 hours.
author: Roopa S.

description:
If you are a tourist visiting San Francisco DO NOT BE AN IDIOT AND WASTE YOUR TIME waiting in line to eat breakfast here. It's good but when all is said and done it's just eggs and hot cakes and there's many similar or better spots to get fare like that in SF without wasting 90 minutes of your life waiting in line.  The home made raspberry jam is nice but it won't change your life. 

My beef is with management, specifically Mr. Sanchez who was hosting today.  I am highly insulted that after waiting in your line for 90 minutes you snuck what I can only assume are some dear friends of your family in the back door and sat them next to us (along with the two toddlers they had in tow).   

I waited in line to give you my money so I expect you to manage your wait list with full integrity.  Letting your friends or family cut the line does not make you look good in the eyes of your guests.
author: Steve P.

description:
Personally, I wanted to try this place because it looked good and was popular. I asked my boyfriend if he would be willing to stand in line for 2 hours. He told me to gtfo and said there were other places that served food faster and tasted better. I shook my head and scoffed at him, thinking what does he know? He just consumes food and doesn't taste it.

So beginning of March, I dragged my boyfriend here, promising him that the line won't be long, if we get there early. We came about 10 minutes before the restaurant opened. There was already a long line. It took about an hour and 30 minutes before we came inside. 

I ordered the Monte Cristo, while my boyfriend ordered the banana pancakes. We also ordered fresh squeezed orange juice. We both got our juice and I stared at the cups..... $3 for this small cup with no ice?! I grumbled and drank it, taking the ice cubes from my water cup and dropping it in the oj.

 I was disappointed in the Monte cristo, which tasted like a grilled cheese sandwich with ham to me. Only good part was the jam. The potatoes that came along with it were bland. I forced myself to eat almost of it, since I was hungry from waiting.

Overall, this place was ok. The wait is no fun, and I'm giving this 3 stars for the service and the fact that my boyfriend ate all of his banana pancakes. Next time, I should just listen to the boyfriend.
author: Pretty D.

description: This is a bucket list restaurant when visiting SF.  The best pancakes I've ever had and believe me...I've had a lot of pancakes.  My husband had the Crab Benedict and he really enjoyed it. The wait... Well 1 hr and 22 min! I still can't believe I talked my husband into waiting outside in the rain that long to get a table! Leaving the restaurant... We both agree that it was totally worth the wait!
author: Robyn H.

description:
There's always a wait for Mama's. It doesn't matter what time of day you try to come, there will be at least about a hour wait. It's a very small cafe. The way it works is that you order and pay, then get seated at a open table. But is the wait worth it?

Service:
The service here is so-so. They don't give you a sense of welcome. They didn't smile when they took your order. They didn't even greet you. They honestly just get down to business. They'll take how many people in your party, then take your order, then take your cash. 

The highlight of our service was the busboy. Although, he had broken english, he actually tried to strike up conversation! Loved it! 



Food:
Crab Benedict - Good. But it wasn't amazing. They served it with fresh crab meat on lightly toasted english muffins. The favor profiled meshed well, but it's been done to death by other restaurants as well. 

Monte Cristo - French toast stuffed with cheese and ham. I'm not a big fan of sweet and salty, but I did enjoy this dish. The homemade raspberry jam is a must for this dish. The sweet and the salty blended beautifully. 

Coffee Cake - Better than your average coffee cake. I had the chocolate one and it was delicious. 




Overall:
I honestly do not think the wait is worth it. I feel this is more of a tourist attraction than anything. I would not recommend this place to residents of San Francisco, unless you had friends or relatives who really want to try it.
author: Christina L.

description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS PLACE. Is it good? Yes. Are the people nice? Yes. Is it worth a two hour wait in the sun and the price tag? No. The hype for this place had me excited to go there for a while, but once the food came I was sorely disappointed. Half of my country potatoes were almost raw, my north beach Benedict was sub-par. My 3 other friends echoed my disappointment, saying only the fruit and the baked goods were up to their expectations. It's in a beautiful and convenient part of the city but the juice is simply not worth the squeeze.
author: Laura W.

description:
The food and the Bloody Mary was good, but I don't think I would go there again if there is a long line.
I had one of their egg dishes, and it was good, their homemade jam is also good.
author: Bilal Y.

description:
Ive tried to come to Mamas before on several occasions during brunch time (my bad) and not only was the line unbelievable, but it was also impossible to find parking. But I had to see for myself what the hype was all about.

I love the area but parking is literally a nightmare, even today on a super gloomy, rainy day everywhere is still packed. But I fought through and made my way to Mamas to stand in the (now relatively short indoor) line and wait for my food. I ordered the apple pan dore, which the menu describes as "slices of sourdough baguette (good ol' Boudin) with sautéed apples in lemon butter sauce" for $9.25. Not too hefty for hip brunch in SF, but not cheap either. 

While waiting in line though, you get to watch the cooks and see the delicious baked goods and ingredients they use-which truly look amazing quality and make your mouth water. The place is small, but cozy. The only thing I found I didn't like was how loud it seemed, because everyone was so close together-it was a little irritating. And then....the food arrived. 

Ill let the picture speak for itself. This place is amazing.
author: Anna G.

description: My absolute favorite breakfast place in the world. The line is worth it. Go for the eggs Benedict- try the original before branching out to the other kinds. Mmmmmm...
author: Ashley P.

description:
My friends and I decided to do brunch in San Francisco on a Tuesday and I must say we were troopers for standing in line for an hour and forty-five minutes (you've been warned) for brunch food! I know what you're thinking.., "who stands in line for that long for eggs, bacon, and hash...." (((SHRUGS)))

After the dreadful line outside this popular tiny brunch spot, we were directed to another line to order our food inside! Once we were finally seated, there was also a bit of a wait for the food since they were soooo busy that day! I'd suggest coming here super early to avoid the horrible line, but if you got an hour or two to spare and don't mind waiting then join the club!

FOODS
---------------

- The Norwegian - Everything on their menu looked good, but smoked salmon immediately caught my attention here. the Norwegian was an excellent choice because the smoked salmon on the benedict wasn't super salty! 

- Monte Cristo - I had a couple of bites, but after waiting in line for SOOOOO long and finishing my smoked salmon benedict I couldn't enjoy this as much. But the jam was delicious!

*I'd recommend their corned beef hash. My friend ordered this and it was quite good. Great portion too!*

Our party of four really liked everything we ordered, but waiting in line really killed our appetite and excitement that day. Nothing really amazed us in way to want to come back in the future. We've had the same quality of brunch food elsewhere without the wait. On a good note, Mama's is off our bucket list!

***** 3.5 STARS! *****
author: Glenn L.

description: We waited about 30 minute to get into the restaurant and food came about 10-15 minutes after we sat down. I think they are bit pricey (ordered crab cake benedict,  monte cristo, half caesar salad for 62 ish dollars / they dont give you a receipt so you really never know if the cashier did the right job. haha ) for breakfast and brunch especially when they only accept cash but i thought their foods were great. staffs were friendly.
author: Jiyoung K.

description:
