The Monte Cristo was good, ham and turkey and cheese hidden in french toast, sweet and savory! The homemade jam was great with it!  I'm not sure what french toast I had, but it was like a banana bread type french toast, it was yummy. The Dungeness Crab Benedict was very fresh, but it was missing something for me, a little bland. The carrot cake was also pretty good, but refrigerated. The soju, grapefruit screwdriver was much needed after a 2.5 hour wait. 

This place is pretty good, but not 2 hour + wait good, not sure what all the hype is about. I don't think it is a San Fransisco must because there is great brunch all over the place, but I would eat here again if I walked by and there was no line.
author: Cara H.

description:
Best breakfast I have ever had! My boyfriend and I took a trip to San Francisco and had to go to Mama's! 

We ordered four dishes and they were so accommodating that they even moved us to a larger table for more room! 

We ordered the Washington Omlette, Paisano Benedict, French Toast Sampler, and the Monte Cristo! Everything was amazing! The next day before we left for home (LA), we ordered to go and got the Monte Cristo and the French Toast again! 

Monte Cristo and Cranberry-Orange French Toast are a must get! 
Don't forget to top it off with their delicious jam!

Amazing food, amazing service, amazing place. I would drive back to San Francisco just for Mama's.
author: Cathleen N.

description: Ordered the French toast, Benedict eggs, omelette and monte cristo-Monte Cristo FTW. My boyfriend ordered two sunny side up and he said they taste fresh! I shared my monte cristo with all my friends(five ppl) and they love it!! Just the line is crazy......we wait 2hr on a Saturday morning, 8am wait in line and get sit at 10...
author: Iris L.

description: Before I go into details let me start off by saying Mama's is definitely worth the wait! My friends and I were in town for the weekend and had to make a stop! We were lucky because we only waited for about 30-40 minutes (we had brunch around 1pm on a Saturday afternoon). We all had omelette's (can't ever go wrong with an omelette) the bread and potatoes are AMAZING! I just wish they gave you more potatoes lol! We also shared a French Toast sampler which was topped off with fresh delicious fruit!!! Can't wait to go back!!! One thing that could be better would be to have bottomless mimosas or have a larger glass of mimosas than the current one.
author: Adelina R.

description:
Benedict for breakfast is solid, Mimosa is solider, 1 hour wait is solidest.

Come at 2 pm or prepare to wait.
author: R J.

description:
(Skip to the bottom for my final verdict)

SF takes their brunch seriously, and so do I. That is the only reason I endured circling around the area for 40 min looking for street parking, only to pay to park in a parking lot near chinatown, and then proceed to wait outside Mama's for another hour and 20 minutes. 

After waiting a total of 2 hours, we finally stepped into the quaint cafe furnished with plenty of homey knick knacks that you would find in your grandma's kitchen or living room. I adored the fresh flowers at each table and really appreciated the openness of the cafe. There were large windows that allowed plenty of natural lighting to spill through and light up the restaurant. 

Instead of being seated first, we were directed to order at the window first and then were allowed to pick from any open tables. We ordered the blackstone eggs benedict and the french toast sampler. After doing extensive yelping, it seemed like I'd be missing out on not trying the chocolate cinnamon french toast so I asked them to sub the regular cinnamon brioche for the chocolate cinnamon and they were happy to accommodate at no extra cost :) 

Mama hit my major sweet tooth right on the spot with her delicious french toast. What makes this the best french toast I've ever had is the ridiculously flavorful slices of brioche. Each slice was moist, packed with warm spices, and the cranberry orange and banana nut brioche were studded with walnuts. The shining star of the show had to be the cinnamon french toast. It had the best texture, lightness, and overall flavor. The cinnamon brioche was the best bread for soaking up the french toast egg mixture (in the end the chocolate didn't add much). The banana bread was also delicious but slightly denser. The cranberry orange french toast was my least favorite but still better than any I've tried. 

Dunk the french toast in syrup or do yourself a flavor and slather on a bit of the blackberry jam sitting innocently on your table. It wasn't too sweet and had a very bright berry flavor (I'd imagine it'd go amazing with a meyer lemon scone mmm). If you're not too careful, you could end up chugging the whole jar on the spot. 

The eggs benedict were pretty customary, but too salty for my taste. I'm not much of a savory breakfast person so I'm biased but my friend said they were good, not amazing. We also ordered the old fashioned bar and a slice of carrot cake to go. The carrot cake fell short for me because it wasn't exceptional in any way and didn't have a cream cheese frosting but a rather plain buttercream frosting. The old fashioned was just average for me as well. It had an ok crumb topping but not really worth trying. 

We received excellent and friendly service from everyone including the busboys! I never felt rushed during the meal and our water glasses were always filled. A busser was even kind enough to box my food and pack up some jam for me :) 

The price for breakfast was fairly reasonable, about $10 or so a plate. However, the price for pastries that didn't blow my mind was somewhat stiff. 

Final verdict: 
All you french toast fanatics out there, this will now be our official congregation spot, 10 minutes or 2 hours, rain or shine. Everyone else, not really worth waiting more than 30 minutes in line for! I would also save my money for pastries elsewhere. Heads up, Mama's only takes debit cards, no credit!!!

If Mama's didn't have such a long wait I would come back for brunch every time I was in the city!

P.S. Why is it called Mama's on Washington Square when it's on Stockton?
author: Jenny L.

description:
If you are in the North Beach/ Coit Tower area of San Francisco come here for breakfast or lunch. They don't take ressies and there usually is a line but well worth it. Very locals neighborhood place.
Once inside you get to order next to the kitchen line ,which has all the fresh baked goodies, ripe fruit, cured salmon and ingredients used (window shop your order). 
Once seated they give great service at the table. They noticed our french toast was cut a little thin on one slice so she brought an extra half order!
It's a very pretty homey locals restaurant I would be at all the time if I lived there. Note: This is a CASH ONLY restaurant.
We had the eggs Benedict. The thick ham was like butter and the yolks were huge and yellow (like in Europe).
We also had french toast made with fresh baked cinnamon raisin bread.
Will come back for lunch as they had Monte Cristo sandwiches and burgers looked great!
If you go, across the street is a shop called Liguria bakery that specializes in one thing - Forcasia bread (est. 1915) CASH ONLY and they sell out early.
author: Mary T.

description:
If you're interested in Mama's you already know: be prepared for the line. I have been twice now and the line can be VERY long and it has discouraged me from going many more times than I have actually been. That being said, I am still happy to give Mama's 5 stars. 

The food is some of the best breakfast food I have ever had. This time I had the Dungeness crab/avocado/Havarti cheese special (I believe it was $24. Oomph) and it was incredibly delicious. The crab was great. My partner has the famous Monte Cristo sandwich which wasn't nearly as expensive, or as filling, but was incredibly delicious. 

I encourage you to order one of their pastries with your meal if you are hungry. They will bring it out before your food because it usually takes a while to receive your food once you order. The pastries are fresh and incredibly delicious. I have had the original crumb cake as well as the carrot cake. 

I had a mimosa as well. It was $7 which is a bit steep but is made from freshly squeezed OJ and heavy on the champagne. Very tasty. 

The service at Mama's is very friendly and the food is incredible. My only negatives are the wait (obviously) and the bathroom situation (I drink lots of water so their one tiny stall is usually occupied and you must wait a while for it. . . Only I would write a review with bathroom information o_O) but this place still earns 5 stars from me!
author: Brittany W.

description: This place was excellent! There was a line around the corner, we waited about 1 1/2 hours in line. I ordered the heuvos rancheros & a melon berry smoothie. The tortillas were fresh? Sauce was amazing and most of all the service was fantastic!! Thank you! ;)
author: Alicia M.

description:
Absolutely delicious. Finally made the trip over to Mama's during brunch hours and encountered a reasonable line. The menu is well thought out and the craftsmanship that goes into the food is evident. 

I would not want friends visiting out of town to leave without being formally introduced to Mama's.
author: David G.

description: Breakfast was fantastic!  Vince, one of the owners couldn't have been friendlier. He made us feel very welcome. We will be back!
author: Fred W.

description: Ordinary food. Tourist trap. Line from hell. En route I googled it, saw that it's not busy on Thursday's. Arrive to a 2 hour line. Really bad idea. If you can wait that long for food you're not hungry. Truth. How much do you make an hour at your job? Factor that into the price of the meal, since you just waited in line for 2 hours.
author: Richard V.

description:
Great breakfast menu and wonderful specials! Be warned, the line will take you at least an hour and then it will still take you some time to get your breakfast. Only come here if you get here before they open or if you have plenty of time in the morning!

We ordered the French toast sampler and papa's favorite omelette. The French toast was great! They have delicious pastries and they use their sweet bread as the toast, the omelette was standard and no worth the wait. If you go, order one of their specials or sweet entrees
author: Stella M.

description: Wanted to try some good places to eat around SF and i see this. If you see a long line especially people waiting outside thats how you know its very delicious. So many to choose from so i tried the dungeness benedict! Highly recommend especially if you love seafood. Also tried the crumb cake along with some fresh orange juice so you cant go wrong with that. Wonderful customer service very friendly. I wouldnt mind eating here for a week straight if i had to. Mamas on Washington Square is a must!!! LIT.
author: Chris G.

description:
Maybe all the raving reviews and long waits set me up because I had really high expectations and was actually kind of disappointed with my food. Arrived at 7:30 AM on Saturday and was the second to last party to get seated in the first seating. 

I ordered:
-Coffee Cake: MM delicious! Would order again. Tip: If you're just ordering a pastry to go, you can skip the crazy dine-in line.
-Dungeness Crab Omelette: While there was a good amount of crab, overall flavor was extremely bland. I needed to add ketchup and tabasco to give this more flavor.
-Another egg dish which i don't remember, it was tasty but nothing memorable.

For 2 people, I think the bill came to about $50 which seems very steep for brunch for me. 

I heard the owner talk about opening up a second Mama's in the area of a place that used to be a grocery store, so maybe that will help with the lines. I'll probably come back to try the Monte Cristo since that's what everybody raves about, but only if there's no line.
author: Jennifer W.

description: The wait was far too long, the food was nice but not worth the wait, there needs to be a better system in place for paying customers to wait, perhaps a buzzer so people can sit in the park or take mobile numbers and text when their table is 5 away from being available
author: Domino N.

description:
The myth, the mystery, and the facts are true. Expect to wait 2 hours to get into the place and get seated.

We got here around 8:30 in the morning and the line was mehh not too bad. The first round of people had been seated so ultimately we were waiting for those people to get their food, eat, and get out of there. We waited about 1.5 hours outside the restaurant. The time really flew by, the weather was beautiful, and there are bakeries around (as noted in other reviews) where you can grab some coffee and/or a pastry while waiting in line. The line inside only took us about 10 minutes and you get to sit there and watch the chefs cook.

We got the crab benedict and I opted to try something different than reviews raved about and got the Salmon scramble. It was light, filling, and full of the perfect amount of flavor. The portion sizes were on the smaller side for the pricing, but when you're as big of a tourist trap as this place, I guess you can get away with charging whatever you want. 

It is definitely worth stopping into and trying. I can't say I'd go here ALL the time, but I'm glad we went and had the Mama's experience.

BRING CASH. They charge $1 service charge for card, which is whatever, but we had no way to tip our server. :[
author: Melanie R.

description: Excellent! Food was warm and fast out of the kitchen. Staff is ver friendly. Wife had the French toast with baked Apple's in  lemon sauce. Had traditional bacon and eggs. There is always a line but much easier if you get there 45 min before the8 am opening. Eat later u will wait longer.
author: Steve T.

description:
This is a cute breakfast space and the wait staff is friendly.  I don't know how to review this without pissing off the die-hard fans and still be honest with my reviews, so here it goes. 

Overhyped... Monte Cristo - an exotic name for an odd tasting savory french toast... I don't know why people rave about it.  It contains hammed turkey and cheese (cheddar), then dipped in egg and fried like a french toast.  The cheese was strong and overwhelming.  I think it would have tasted better had they use something else instead of cheddar.  Cheddar is cheap and too strong a flavor.  Their Dungeonous crab egg benedict was good with real crab meat, but it was also $22.. So you really paid for what you get.  Overall, I think this place will continue to do well, simply because of their touristy location and they have a few interesting items.  If you don't believe what I say about the Monte Cristo, then try it for yourself.  Just make sure you order something else as a back up too.

We waited for an hour to get inside.  Once inside, we waited in another line for 15 minutes to order and pre-pay.  Once seated, that was when we got excellent service.  The waitress and the coffee guy were friendly and attentive.  This business does not accept credit cards.  They only accept cash or debit (with a $1 fee).  

NOTE:  Order anything, except the Monte Cristo - unless you like strong flavor cheese  with savory turkey meat and sweet jam.  The strong flavored cheese wrecked my taste pallet for the day. 

I don't hate the place.. I also don't love the place.
author: Duke D.

description: Be ready for a wait here. We waited around 1.5 hours to be seated. We ordered the monte christo and crab eggs benedict. The eggs benedict was my favorite of the two items, it is a must have.
author: Jason K.

description:
Delicious? Yes. Worth the 1 hour wait? Not really. Will I ever wait 1+ hour for Mama's? Probably not.

With a lot of places, the hype is what drives people to wait for food (or anything really). I guess after an hour of waiting and all this hype, I had expected more. However, I do love how the restaurant sticks to its quaint, family owned-style. Unfortunately, the prices do not really stick to its roots...for me, this place was a little more on the plus side, especially for any breakfast items that contains crab. I didn't try any of the dungeness crab benedict, but I saw it and for the amount of crab you're getting and the price you're paying, I didn't think it would be worth it (even though according to others  it is).

1. French toast sampler: I liked how they used different bread for the different french toasts. I thought it was pretty good, but I liked the maple syrup even better. 
2. Washington Square Omelet: Goodness, was this delicious. I usually never like ordering omelets because i feel like it's too much at times, but boy was this one on point. If I come back, I'm definitely trying more of their omelets. 
3. Monte Cristo: Good, but not anything to rave about. However, it could be because I've only tried one monte cristo at one other place before.

However, don't get the wrong idea, I thought that the food was fresh, and delicious, but just not worth the wait!
author: Annie N.

description:
I hate to give a bad review, if you can't say something nice....

Though we live in the South Bay, we spend many weekends in San Francisco.

I was hoping that this would not become another over-rated tourist trap in the city (like Swan OD), but it has. First of all, we got there early and the line wasn't too bad, until all of the people that had others waiting in line FOR them showed up. Thankfully we just made the first seating. We ordered the coffee cake to share, the Blackstone Benedict for me and I don't even remember what J ordered. We drank our coffee. We waited and we waited. We ate the coffee cake.The couple who ordered in front of us finished and we were still waiting. 

Out of coffee, and now out of cake as well.

Finally our waiter delivered our food, and I will say he had that "guilty look". Everything was COLD. The tomato, the english muffin (soggy too from the tomato sitting too long), even the crispy bacon, COLD. The potatoes, the eggs, and worst of all the hollandaise.


Not only was the hollandaise cold, but it was BROKEN! Who serves broken hollandaise???? It was as if it broke, and they tried to fix it by adding more lemon and putting it in a blender. It was much too sour, really gritty and quite frankly, gross.
 
Our waiter was hiding out and did not come back to check on us. By this time,I felt sick to my stomach and just wanted to leave. I ate only two bites of my breakfast and the waiter said NOTHING. Obviously, we had already paid, so we put the tip on the table and left (I will NOT stiff a waiter, EVER, even when they ___).

This was the worst breakfast ever. Thank heavens we made the first seating, if we had waited any longer for that meal, J would have never let me forget it.

DON'T DO IT!!!!!!! NOT WORTH THE WAIT!!!!!
author: Kris M.

description: Long wait and for what? Monte cristo? High reviews are from young folks with time to wait over an hour for mediocre sandwiches.  It's north beach for crying out loud. Go to an Italian restaurant.
author: Susannah K.

description:
Wait time was about 20 minutes on a weekday afternoon.

Hostess/waiter took 10 minutes to seat us, despite an open table right in front of us the whole time.

Monte Cristo was too rich, didn't feel like a brunch meal at all. Do they put lunch meat in this thing? Meat didn't have any flavor and on a whole was unmemorable.

Plus side - Jam was delicious.

Overall, I wouldn't recommend and would definitely avoid if there was a 1+ hour wait time.
author: Kevin C.

description: Warning: 1 hour wait minimum. Opens at 8am get there at least by 7:30am. Ordered the Paisano Benedict which was delish. My boyfriend ordered the Monte Cristo says it's the best Monte Cristo he's had! Is it worth the wait? Yes, if you get there early! I also ordered a Mocha and a side a French toast. Total: $47
author: Angela R.

description:
We came on a Saturday and yes there was a huge line, even our Uber driver wished us good luck. I think in total we waited about a hour a half. Well worth it even though we scarfed everything down in a few mins.

Servers were great and very friendly. Wish I could say that about the service time. You start waiting outside the store and when you finally think you're being seated, you are being let into another line inside to the cashier because you pay first and seat later. Thankfully I think the manager hooked us up with seat first because we only had a party of 2. AWESOME!

Mama's Cristo - =OOOOOOO NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM, oh right words... delicious! I couldn't help drowning it in strawberry jam, don't worry, everyone does this!

Smoked Salmon Benedict - =OOOOOO NOM NOM NOM, so good. I loved the texture and how the egg yolk runs all over my plate, delicious.

I must say their orange juice and orange peels were super fresh and tasty, it's like straight from the farm or something.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
This place is no joke. We thought we were smart coming early on a Friday. By early I mean by 8:30 - big mistake! The line was already out the door when we passed by to find parking. We parked about a block away (street parking) and waiting for about an hour and a half.

Note this: cash only!

I was so torn between eggs benedict, french toast, or the infamous monte cristo. Since I wanted the most expensive benedict (crab) which was $22, and didn't think that french toast would fill my craving, I intelligently opted for the monte cristo.

Not only is it one of their signature dishes, but it includes a lot of different aspects you would want from a breakfast/brunch place - it was like french toast, sandwich, breakfast and lunch all in one. I enjoyed every single bite. It was a french toast sandwich spectacular with homemade dipping jam. The melted cheese will stay in my memory forever!

I want to say it was worth the wait. I won't be rushing back any time soon because it's a special occasion type of place. Service was just ok - it was almost robotic because they get so busy they probably don't have the energy to stay happy all day. And the bathroom was super sketch! One small bathroom, outside, behind the restaurant. But hey, it's not about the bathroom, it's about the food, and the food was great!
author: Junel S.

description:
Not impressed. Long line of an hour or two and the food was pretty average. It is also worth noting that after you wait in line outside, you wait in line AGAIN inside to order from the cash register and then again as you wait for a table to free up. A total of three lines. 

There was nothing that tasted bad but at the same time there was nothing I would crave again. 

The monte cristo is a decent meal but it's very heavy and not very impressive. If you do order one, I highly recommend you share it. 

I also ordered the French toast sampler and it was tasty ! I good way to test a few different French toasts off the menu.

Maybe I need to give this place another shot to know if it's truly worth the lines.. But I definitely won't wait in 3 lines again to prove myself wrong ..
author: M A.

description: This little spot is so delicious! When we return to San Francisco we'll definitely go back for brunch again
author: Aimee S.

description:
One word: FANTASTIC

THE FOOD IS SO GOOD!
but waiting in line for hours is worth it! 
Service is so good the ambiance is fantastic!
author: victorio l.

description: Was walking through the neighborhood and wandered into Mama's. It was 2:30pm on a rainy afternoon so it was very welcoming and cozy. Fortunately, no lines and sat down immediately with several open tables. I enjoyed the Mama's Sampler French Toast. The service was on point and friendly. The only downside was their acceptance of only debit cards and cash; hence, the one star deduction. But otherwise and enjoyable experience.
author: Gene C.

description:
Damn please don't hate me fellow yelpers but I really thought the food here was just A-OK. Definitely not worth waiting 2 plus hours and in the freakin rain!  I got here at 8:25am on a Saturday morning and already the line was up to the middle of the block - thus the 2 hour wait. And they open at 8am!  I think these crazy ppl must line up before they open.  

Ordered the Crab Benedict ($22.50) - presentation looked good, was def made to order w/ fresh crab meat, perfectly oozy poached eggs w/ right amount of hollandaise sauce, BUT overall the dish was quite bland.  Something was missing.  the crab maybe should have been seasoned a little? It had a slight fishy taste. English muffin was standard as well.  At that price, I was expecting it to be WOW.  And they were skimpy on the amount of crab. I've definitely had better benedicts such as Mission Beach Cafe. Extra disappointed as they only serve Crab on the weekends so I was expecting it to be bomb! 

Also ordered their famous Monte Cristo ($10.75) which is a french toast stuffed with a layer of ham & cheese and turkey & cheese. Again this dish was just OK and again BLAND.  I wish it was more eggy. this was just lightly dipped in egg batter because when I sliced into it, you can still see most of the white bread. I guess it is meant to be like this since its a sandwich and not really a french toast? And it was not crispy..at all.  I really think they may have under fried mine. Oh wells. Dish comes with their homemade jam which just makes it sweeter but does not necessarily make it taste better.  Now that i think about it, i should have asked for butter and syrup. 

Apple Peach Bellini ($7.00) - champagne with apple juice and peach puree. Finally something that was simply GOOD.  Loved it but it was so freakin small! I finished it in 3 gulps! Haha
author: Cathy M.

description: Heard and read a lot about mamas and decided to eat breakfast there. Spent an hour and thirty in line just to order and an additional 20 minuets just to be seated. The service was amateur and slow. Over priced for over rated food. 4/10
author: Mathew S.

description:
Mama's did not dissapoint. The wait time wasnt that bad for us (20 mnts) tho if it were raining i probably would have complained a little bit. The service was good. I would have preferred not having to order and pay for everything at once as i would have wish to be able to determine the order in which things would come (example our mimosas came at the same time as our coffees so we had to choose between drinking one cold or one hot) and the pay in advance method discouraged me to order more as my order would be broken down. Minus 1 star for that.
Other than that the food was delicious. I got the famous mama's monte christo and wowza the bread just melted in my mouth, the cheese was goowey  and the jam (tho im not usually a jam fan) took the taste to another level. Yes yes to the monte christo. The north beach benedict was good as well. As sides we had the  baked potatoe and they were ok but nothing in particular.
author: Patricia L.

description: Probably the longest time I ever wait for a brunch (2 hours).  Coming from Orange County, having a brunch on a weekend in the city is rather relaxing.  Parking was hard to find as well.  But the food was really excellent.  Monte Cristo sandwich and the Northern Italian omelet were both really delicious.  I would definitely recommend everyone to try out the Monte Cristo sandwich with their homemade jam!
author: Andrew J.

description: If I could give 4.5 stars I would. I wouldn't take any points off this place for the wait because it was well worth it. It's a small shop with a line out the door, that means it's good so how does that justify taking any points off just because it's small? Anyhow the food was awesome. I went with two friends and we shared the cinnamon chocolate French toast, the eggs Benedict, and an omelet. It was ALL amazing, like really. The only thing I might take a half a star off for is because of the price. Please understand that I have no problem paying extra for quality food! It's just that my amazing French toast (3 pieces) and glass of fresh orange juice was about 20 bucks. Yikes. I would expect to pay about 12-15 tops for that. My friends both spent over 20 for their meals. I get that I'm in San Fran so oh well. I'd do it all again if I could!
author: Michelle S.

description: Best omelet I ever had! I had the farmers omelet with a side of avocado. Long lines even though we arrived before it opened. Others in our group enjoyed the cinnamon French toast. Each plate was a masterpiece.
author: Marianne A.

description:
Service was ok I suppose. Not friendly, but not rude either. Food was average, but personally I wish I ate somewhere else because it wasnt anything special.  However, I do have to say that the jam was really delicious with my monte cristo.

Overall, average food with a not so average wait. The wait was the most unbearable part.
author: Ginah Y.

description:
A little under 1.5 hour wait, including getting our table, on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Not too bad. There was plenty of street parking as well.

You order right when you step into the restaurant, so peruse the Yelp reviews/hanging menus. We had to wait a bit for our table because people don't get the hint and just sat there for an extra 20 minutes chatting away. 

What we ordered:
Washington Square Omelette - doesn't look as glamorous as the other entrees but the Italian Sausage is delicious!

Dungeness Crab Omelette - weekend specials only. definitely worth trying

Smoked Salmon Benedict - wish there was more smoked salmon but if you like smoked salmon this is your plate

French Toast Appetizer - Cinnamon, Banana and Cranberry. Eat this first. our tastebuds got confused after all the other dishes.

Spiked Lemonade & Apple Peach Bellini - great alternatives to mimosas

*cash only
they ask to charge you $1 extra if you want to use debit

Coming back to try more items, but maybe we'll make it out earlier.
author: Jenn Y.

description: Not sure what all the hype is about, maybe after standing in line for two hours people are too embarrassed to admit it was mediocre at best. Went on a Tuesday morning and the line didn't look too bad. The woman in front of us said it's usually 45 min from where we were standing. Thought, ok, we'd give it a shot. Two hours later we were allowed into the restaurant, where we were directed to another line to wait to order food and get a table. Once we got the table we sat for another 25 minutes waiting for our food. Well, I've had better French toast from my own kitchen (so much for a house special) and the omelets were over done and lacking in flavor. So disappointing, and so not worth the half of a day that was wasted to eat.
author: M.J P.

description: I am still dreaming of the monte Cristo sandwich!!!! It's a must!!!!!!   This place has a line before it opens so you must get up early. Be prepared to wait so grab the local news to catch up on some reading while you're in line. Service was amazing and overall very friendly staff. The restaurant itself is super cute and has a homie vibe to it . I am looking forward to coming back to SF and giving this place another visit!
author: Maria C.

description:
For the amount of time one has to wait in line, this place is not worth it.

The food is good and definitely above average, but this is not worth waiting over an hour in line.  

I think with the amount of fan-fare this place has, it may be impossible to meet one's expectations.

If you are coming as a tourist, show up before 7:30 or after 2:30 to avoid the long lines.
author: Flo C.

description: Must try mamas special crab and french toast! Its worth the wait and the pwners attitude. However, the server - Monique is really friendly and helpful. The food is really tasty; I dont know how to doscribe the happymoment when you feel the softness a d sweetness of the crab meat melting in your tounge. Its really nice and cozy atmosphere in the restaurant!
author: Jenny N.

description:
My rating for Mama's might be slightly inflated because of the hangriness (hungry+angry) I experienced that day waiting for the food. It's almost cruel and unusual punishment to wait outside the restaurant, because it forces you to psycho-glare at other people's food inside with crazy googly eyes and honestly, it took a lot of self-restraint from asking to pick at leftovers. Okay, maybe that's just me, because when I reach that point of hangry I get extremely unclassy and ratchet and would have probably fought the pigeons for a scrap of bagel at that point.

By the time we crawled our way to the front and ordered, we sat down with bewildered, malnourished first world people stares, because we were 'STARVING TO DEATH' from ONLY having an almond croissant and a coffee for breakfast earlier, duhh. But the food was delivered to us promptly, and we feasted on:

1. Monte Cristo = 4/5 (Perfect balance of sweet & savory! It came with jam which was new for me)
2. Californian omelette = 4/5 (The whole thing was stuffed with so much bacon it kinda fell apart, but too much bacon never did anyone wrong)
3. Florentine egg benedict = 5/5 (Sauce made of eggs on top of eggs. No words)
4. Crab burger on a brioche bun special thingamjig = 5/5 (It tasted like a big buttery mess...which is a good thing in my book) 

The most important component of all these dishes was LOVE. 

Hahaha... just kidding. It was BUTTER. Thank the Lawd for Butter.

It literally felt like we were at Disneyland, waiting hours in line for a ride that only took 15 seconds. But it was the most exhilarating, artery clogging, food-coma inducing ride ever! Totally worth it.
author: Kandice K.

description: This restaurant is the Washington Square. It is very popular. Lots of people are waiting there. A friend highly recommend it. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. They offer maqny kinds of sandwiches, omelettes, egg Benedicts, French toasts, pancakes, salads and beverages. I ordered mama's Cristo. It is amazing. You can't believe how delicious it is. You should have a try.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Lived in San Francisco ALL MY LIFE, and if you're a real foodie- you know this place! It's true love. 

Went here with my husby, took bart and walked a mile from Montgomery Bart. Got to mamas at 11, and waited two hours! Started eating at 1:30. Be sure to bring a snack and some water, it can be a long time to wait and you'll start giving up. 

Once you get in, you have to wait in another line- to order and pay. Then the servers seat you.

I ordered- 
Corn Beef Hash and Eggs (I know so plain, but if you try the same thing at every breakfast place, you know which is good!) 
Honeybear got the 
Northern Italian (Pancetta (Italian Cured Bacon), Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomatoes and Garlic Jack Cheese)
$10.95
 French Toast Sampler ($12.95)

I KNOW WE DIDN'T GET THE MONTE CRISTO! TOTAL REGRET, we'll be bAAACCCCKKKK! 

The Corn Beef Hash, my last meal on this earth. Comes with tomatoes, and lettuce with corn beef hash and two eggs on top and a choice of toast (I picked sourdough). The corn beef is perfectly cooked, seasoned with amazing spices, the potatoes with the corn beef is perfect. The eggs we're perfectly runny, tasted excellent with my corn beef hash. This would be my last meal on earth.

The Northern Italian is so perfect as well, the eggs are extremely fluffy, potatoes on the side, along with bread. The bacon with mushroom and everything mixes together so perfectly to make the excellent fluffy texture and taste. Honey said he would come back, but not just for an omelette for two hours.

French Toast Sampler, nope nope. A lot of people get it and like it, but mine was so dry and not good at all. 

My advice: Go before 7:45, only 20 minute wait. & Order a shit load off the menu to try. Didn't wait two hours for nothing! LOL :)
author: Crystal C.

description:
Amazing breakfast with best service I've ever had!  Seriously.  The staff was so accommodating and friendly.  We have twin infants so it's a whole thing when we try to eat at a restaurant.  But the team at mama's was super calm and excited to serve us.  

As for the food, we had the apple sourdough French toast, the French toast sampler, and a mama's Frisco sandwich.  Ererything was spectacular.  As sweets hounds we fell in love with the apple dish.  The waiter brought us some fresh raspberry preserves to try with our French toast dishes.  Incredible!  Best jam we've had and perfectly complimented the lemon butter and apples of the sour dough French toast.  My favorite bread from the French toast sampler plate was the orange cranberry bread.

We waited for almost an hour but it was totally worth the wait. Plus the square has a beautiful park to walk around while you wait for your table.
author: Heather E.

description: Long wait but it was worth it. Delicious veggie options and good coffee. Bathroom was in an odd spot outdoors but it was clean. I would go back as there was more I would try! Warning: they go not take credit cards.
author: Amanda A.

description: Get there early! We got in line at 745am and by 8am it was 25 people deep. I got the monte cristo and my gf got the salmon scrambler with a bagel. The monte cristo was a very unique breakfast item especially with the homemade jam.
author: Charles H.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco for school, I remember eating here since I was basically a tourist and didn't know any better.

The lines was ridiculous. The prices were inflated.

Food: TYPICAL DINER FOOD. IT TASTES JUST LIKE ANY DINER. I'M NOT SURE WHERE THE HYPE IS FROM.
author: Leslie M.

description:
Solid breakfast/brunch fare but the food offerings are pretty standard stuff that could easily be replicated at home so you definitely would not find me waiting in line for it on the weekends.  We arrived about an hour before closing in the middle of the week to a nearly empty Mama's (clearly the best time to go if you don't want to wait).  The bright and homely atmosphere is very warming and inviting -- the interior feels like a grandmother's home from a farm in the MidWest.  The friendly service adds to the comforting atmosphere.  

We ordered the kugelhopf (homemade brioche french toast) and the monte cristo.  Both were satisfying, but again nothing I would ever wait in a line for.  I would come back to try other items, but as long as I'm not queueing up.
author: Erich D.

description:
Two words: homemade jam!
Their jam is so delicious. My friend and I ended up pouring it over our entire french toast. (And trying to smuggle some back home)

My friend and I came super excited one Saturday for brunch. We waited somewhere between 45 minutes to an hour which wasn't as bad as it sounds. Also, we were anticipating a longer wait. As soon as you walk in, you see their lovely assortment of breads on display. It really makes you excited to eat. 

We got the dungeness crab benedict, Northern Italian omelet, and the french toast sampler. All three were so delicious and on point. The crab benedict, although a bit pricey, was SO worth it. And everything else was just as delicious as well.
The service was good and the waiters were super friendly and nice. 

If I lived closer to here and the wait were shorter, I would probably be a regular. But I definitely recommend this place if you have friends visiting and don't mind nice conversation while waiting in line!
author: Sarah K.

description:
Decided to come try Mama's for the first time and I am definitely happy that I did.

Got here around Noon, intentionally we were going to come in earlier since we were well aware of the long waits but we were running late as usual so..... we got there and boy were we glad to see that the line wasn't TOO long. We had approx. 4 parties ahead. NOTE: they do not let you inside until your whole party is present. So we had to wait for our friend so we let a few smaller parties ahead of us but it wasn't too much of a problem. We finally got in and waited some more to order... our whole wait time was probably somewhere near about an hour or a bit more.

I definitely felt like I was inside a home and had a mom cooking a hearty big breakfast for me while I was waiting. The aromas filled the place and I was drooling!!

I ordered the infamous dungeness crab eggs Benedict ($18.50)

OMGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG... yes that many G's were needed because it was SOOOOOOO good. Melt in your mouth... I'm drooling right now thinking about it. The spinach went really well with it, the hollandaise sauce is to die for.. literally.. since it's probably a heart attack in a sauce, but boy was it delicious. The only thing that was a BIT overwhelming was the lemon they put on the crab, it was very tart and made it a bit difficult to enjoy fully. But it was definitely worth the money because they load the crab on there.

Can't wait to go again and try out their other items. YUM.
author: Tiff C.

description:
CASH ONLY. They will accept debit with $1.00 surcharge. 

About an hour and a half wait for breakfast. Wait in line to get through the door and then another line to order food and pay. There's also one bathroom that is towards the back and there's a line for that too. Be careful going down the stairs. 

The tables were all quickly cleared, so that the next parties would be able to be seated quickly. My boyfriend ordered the Washington Square for me while I was in line for the bathroom. I was a little disappointed since that was my Plan B if I couldn't order a sandwich. I really wanted the Monte Cristo. He was able to flag down the waitress and she was able to change that order for us. YAY!!!

It was another 20-30 minute wait for food, but it was sooooo worth it! Breakfast here is definitely worth the HYPE and the wait.
author: Anne T.

description:
After trying this place.. I should have listened to other yelpers when they said "NOT WORTH THE WAIT".. My bf and I are in town and we wanted to try good places in SF. We had a few friends recommending the place and so what did I do? I went to my handy dandy Yelp app to help me decide if we should come here or not. Their pictures look really good and their reviews were both good and bad. Being my stubborn self, I wanted to try it for myself and decide on my own.. So.. We did the crazy.. And waited... We waited in line for an hour and a half.. And waited another half to order, be seated and finally get our food.. So took us 2 hours so finally get food in our belly! This didn't bother me though because I did my research and new that there was going to be a wait. 

The food itself.. It was good, but it was like any other "breakfast" places out there. We ended up getting the Monte de Cristo.. Which is a turkey (or ham I can't remember) sandwich.. But instead of sandwich it was dipped and cooked in what was like a pancake type batter.. It also came with potatoes and their special jam (wasn't too crazy on the jam) their potatoes were really good! The sandwich was good but not 2 hours wait type of good. My bf decided to get the organically pancakes with seasonal berries. Not going to lie, their pancakes were really good.. But again, not a 2 hr wait worth type of good. 

Basically, my tip to you.. If you are not on a time crunch where you are only in town for a couple days and have so much more food to try at other raved about places.. Then come try Mama's.. Their food is legit.. But if you are on a time crunch and want to try other places before you have to leave.. Then try the other places! Most likely more worth your time. Me personally, I wouldn't come back to this place because the wait is just too long.
author: Lynn T.

description:
I have been here multiple times over the years and personally I think that the quality is still great but not as great as before. Or it could also just be that I think it's over hyped. We arrived at 9:40 on a tuesday morning and the food came around 12. Yes this was a 2 hour wait. We were beyond hungry then. I feel like if you gave us anything it would have tasted like heaven (okay maybe not everything). The wait is however an expected routine you have to go through but I have to say MAMAs in my opinion was not worth the wait. If it was an hour maybe, but the satisfaction from the food was not worth 2 hours of my time. I love brunch/breakfast so I've been to a lot of places before judging.

Also parking around here is not a pleasure at all!! there are lots of meters but that means killing your wallet to pay and wait in line because we literally spend most of the time waiting in line than eating. 2 hour wait  maybe 30-40 min eating MAX.

I tried multiple plates of food today which includes

Vegetarian Egg Benedict:
Yes vergetarian who would want it right? no meat? well you're wrong! This is amazing!! spinich, tomotal, mushrooms, and avocado may just be one of the BEST benedict I've had here or in general. Even though I said its the best for me, one plate is not satisfying for a 2 hour wait. 

Blackstone Benedict:
It has crispy bacon and tomaton topped with two poached eggs. It was okay... wasn't that good actually. just tasted like bacon egg and tomoato because the ingredients didn't really like blend and more like you taste them individually. If you want bacon I recommend just getting a side of bacon.

Monte Cristo:
I myself am not a fan of it at all. The reason though is probably because I don't like grilled cheese sandwiches and this somewhat tasted like it. There ham and cheese in the middle and it's cooked kind of like a french toast. Yes it's salty not sweet, however they give you homemade jam so that you can dip into it. The jam was delicious and I would recommend getting toast on the side to eat with it. I think it's weird to have salty and sweet together like that so I didn't enjoy the combination, but that's me not you so you should try it still.

Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast:
French Toast has always been a favorite part of my breakfasts. I can't really judge this because my friend had it. She enjoyed it. I however only had a corner of it but I was not impressed. So pleass don't take my judgment on the french toast to direct. By the time I tried the french toast it was a bit soggy, I didn't really taste the chocolate, and it didn't give me that "Surprise" I was expecting to get.

Orange Juice:
Fresh Squeezed orange juice is always yummy, but it's kind of pricey. 4.25 for a cup of OJ.

I've also had other dishes before which are

Salmon Benedict: 
It can get a little messy because the salmon might fall out of place and stuff. This was yummy except the salmon seems to be a bit too salty for my liking and the sauce is slightly heavy. 

Swedish cinnamon French Toast with berries:
I think this is quite similar to the CCFT but maybe the different timing that I ate it at made a difference because I actually thought this was delicious. So I can't really give you my best opinion on the french toast again I encourage trying the french toast.

I think I've had enough of MAMA's for now. Although I like it I don't think I enjoy it enough to want to wait 2 hours.
author: Lisa S.

description: Great breakfasts...my faves are the Monte Cristo w/homemade raspberry preserves and the French Toast Sampler (w/homemade breads!).  There usually is a long wait, so best to go BEFORE they open (like 6:30-7a) to stand in the shortest line.
author: Mitzi A.

description:
Biggie Small's Mama said:
"Baby, look at me, mama love you"...
"And I know you ain't no little boy no more.  But you'll always be my baby"...

"I always taught you that you could have whatever you dream.."
"Hold on to it real tight 'coz the sky's the limit"....
 
Nobody can reach us or talk to us like a Mama can.  It sticks with us for the rest of our lives.  Another thing that Mama's do that we always remember is cooking.

This thought came to mind when I heard of this breakfast eatery called "Mama's".  A lot of buzz about this eatery.  Line is as long as the ipad 2 line at the Apple store.  The people behind me were from France.  People in front of me were from the UK.  So a lot of tourists come here.  

When it was finally time to order, I had a tough decision to make.  Dungeness Crab Omelette or the Mama's sampler french toast or Monte Cristo.  The Sampler with all the fruit looked to good to pass up.  So here's my order:

Mama's Sampler French Toast:  A nice blend of different breads.  The mixed fruits across the top of the french toast was beautiful to look at like a bouquet of colorful flowers.  

Fresh baked fruit muffin:  Best muffin ever ever, ever ever.

Mama's Jam:  In the words of Aaron Hall:  JAM! WHOA! JAM! 
Slap some jam on what ever you order at Mama's.  It's like bacon, makes everything taste better..

Mama's serves up some of the best breakfast in the City.  After a great breakfast and having the rest of my day off work, as Biggie's Mama said: "Sky's the limit".
author: Michael L.

description: There is a reason why this place has tons of reviews, because it is really good! We waited about 40 minutes in line which wasn't so bad. The weather was nice and we had nothing else to do. My boyfriend ordered the Monte Cristo while I had the salmon egg benedict. I normally hate jam (yes, I am weird like that) but this place has definitely proved to me that jam can be delicious. I was so sad that I didn't buy their jam. The jam was raspberry-flavoured which was so rich but not too sweet at the same time. I swear I could just eat it by itself. My dish was also very good. I believe the salmon was smoked and raw (it was light pink) but I loved my fish to be cooked that way. I gobbled down my food pretty quickly. The restaurant is small and seeing the chef prepared the food while waiting in line was cool. Overall, I had a great experience here and I definitely recommend the place!
author: Thy T.

description:
My 1st visit...
DONT WASTE YOUR TIME WAITING IN LINE.  If you can get there right when it opens, sure go for it. But its not worth waiting an hour or longer. Its good, but its not life changing, heaven in your mouth kind of food. Its JUST A SIMPLE BREAKFAST. 
Been there. Done it.  Would i ever go back? I would love to give it a 2nd chance, but because of the line, i will most likely never go back. 
I've had promising breakfasts elsewhere!
It was all for the experience.
author: Adell M.

description:
I may have been delirious from the wait, but damn it was good. How good? Well, I wanted to place the last bite in a time capsule sort of good.

TIP: Everyone suggests it, but no one does it. Get there early. 

Arrived: 8:40am-ish | Wait time: 2hours

This is what I got:
Mama's breakfast sandwich ($16) | It was a bit steep as far as pricing, but it was worth it! Crab to die for, fancy cheese, fresh tomato, and scrambled eggs neatly placed between the softest brioche bun you lips will ever touch.
author: Brian T.

description:
Worth the wait!
I came here with my best friend around 1:30pm and after queuing up for a half hour, we ordered at the register and were seated. I ordered the salmon Benedict which was perfection. Everything was fabulous, perfectly cooked egg, and the salmon was melt in your mouth tasty. Side of the large grapefruit juice.
It's cash only so prepare ahead of time. 
The bathroom is a tricky little thing outside in the side yard with a white door and no handle. Difficult to tell if its occupied. Also, I can imagine it being odd if it were raining. 
Overall, very satisfied. 
The huevos rancheros my buddy got was also yummy and I ate all her rice since she watches carbs. Happily will return.
author: Patricia S.

description: I love this spot for breakfast on the weekends! Definitely expect a line, but absolutely worth it. Everything is fresh and delicious. Their pancakes are the best!
author: Melissa S.

description: The best brunch I've had in SF or possibly anywhere. Line is long but it's worth the wait. The service and food both were both excellent. Put the menu away and order the Monte Cristo it's amazing. Nothing but pure goodness for your mouthpiece.
author: Ty F.

description:
The wait - We arrived at 9:15 Sunday morning. We did not get inside the restaurant until 11.  Then we had to wAit in another line to order and pay for our food. After that waited another 10 mins to be seated. 
The service - the greeter was very sweet. Even brought us all water while we waited. The manager on the other hand was an ASS. Okay so we had a big group.  5 adults and 3 kids. He demanded not pleaded. Not at all apologetic but demanded that we separate in four. To be clear I asked him "you're telling me we won't eat together?" Again. Not one little "I'm sorry miss but our place is too small for a big group"  something like that would go a long way. We are paying for the food and service. And to be honest I can make better food at home. 
Food - That was NOT worth the 2 hours wait. The monte Cristo was dry. Pancakes were delicious. My poached egg whites were pretty runny - not cool. It's nasty. It was whatever. And they don't have waffles.  I'd go somewhere that takes reservations. I'm sure I can find a better breakfast spot.
Piece of advice to the staff. Just because you're busy doesn't give you the right to treat people like crap.  We felt very rushed while at the table. Got stares when we were finished like leave!! when one fam of 5 stayed for over an hour and another family of 7 got to sit together. Ridiculous. Oh and the mimosas. Don't waste your money.
author: Deepika S.

description:
Clearly this place gets good reviews. I tried it, waited in line for an ungodly amount of time with just one person ahead of me. The food was decent but a plate of food and a mimosa put me back $25, so I think it's fair to say this place is over-priced and it is certainly one of the priciest diners in the area. 

The service was ok. I wasn't greeted with a warm welcome after waiting in line, famished. 

Having said that, the desserts looked great and those seemed reasonably priced. Coffee good but expensive. Thank goodness the free coffee refills can sort of justify the cost.
author: Shannon V.

description:
I came here yesterday and the wait was about 45 mins and the food wait was about 15 mins.

The crab Benedict with baby spinach - huge disappointment. For $22 dollars they shouldn't be so cheap with the crab topping. The spinach was not well cooked. Didn't go well with the whole dish actually and I regretted getting it. Not enough sauce.

The blueberry pancakes - delicious, fluffy, amazing! But the taste of baking soda is relevant. I had to drown it in syrup. 

Bacon, avocado, and cheese omelette - possibly the best omelette I've ever had. The bacon was thick and the eggs... So fresh!

The oj - highly recommended. Freshness you can really taste. I felt like I can drink a whole gallon.

The employees were really nice and helpful.

So the wait was alright but if you go and see that the wait is more than 2 hours, the hype won't meet your expectations. Then again when you're waiting that long for your food, of course it's going to taste epic cause you're starved!
author: Emma V.

description:
Two things you need to know and thats about it. 

1)  Theres about a 2-3 hour line.

2) The Monte Cristo is the best breakfast sandwich thingy I ever ate in my life.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Best pancakes ever.
I had the fluffy pancakes. 
The orange juice was not good. Could have just been a bad batch. 
The water tasted like tap.
Eggs benedict with bacon and tomato were amazing.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I agree with Cici & Trina.  We waited over an hour after arriving at 8:10am on a Friday(they open at 8am).  It was good..I had the shrimp bay omelette and my husband had the south of border omelette& shared pancakes.  We felt the food was good/above  average but not worth the wait. I wouldn't return unless the wait was only 10-15 minutes. Like Trina said, it just one of those places you have to try if you're from out of town. 

I would've given it 3 stars based on feeling that food didn't blow me away after such a long wait, but Vince (part owner?) was amazingly helpful in answering our questions about SF & even went out of his way to write his suggestions for things for us to do based on a local's recommendations.  He was also really good about letting people know how long the way was.

If you're from out of town like us... u are comparing breakfast places & willing to stand in line for over an hour & actually enjoy it, come here versus Dottie's.  at least here we enjoyed the food. Dottie's left us feeling really disappointed (read my review).
author: Evelyn G.

description:
There's a line for a reason and I will wait all day.  I have yet to have something here that I have not loved even though I am usually full and ruin my appetite before my food shows up because I snack on all of their pastries... blueberry sour cream something something... whatever that is...  it's heavenly.  

All I have left to say is... MONTE CRISTO. BOOM.
author: Jessica F.

description: Usually love going here but when we walked in today there was a lot of flies all over the food sitting behind the counter. Yuck.
author: Nabil B.

description: O.M.G. Looooved this place! Before my trip to SF I had already found this place on Yelp and decided on all the good reviews to give it a try for breakfast. I looked through their menu beforehand and knew I had to have their Orange Cranberry French Toast! We waited in line for an hour because the place is pretty small, but for me it was worth the wait. That French toast was delicious! Best French toast I've ever had! I only wish it came with eggs though, but you can get some on the side. Try it! Good place for breakfast!
author: Anabel M.

description:
Can't believe there was a line down the block even on a Tuesday morning. Don't people work?! Luckily we only waited about 30-40 minutes though, and it was definitely worth the wait. Not sure if I'd wait more than an hour on the weekend, but it is a really, really good brunch. It's a first come, first serve wait, meaning you don't put your name down but rather wait in line to get in, then wait in line to put in your order, and finally wait by the register until a table is ready for you. Parties of 2 are easiest to seat, I'm sure.

Bf and I shared the northern Italian omelette (Pancetta, Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomato, and Garlic Jack Cheese), smoked salmon benedict, and french toast sampler. It's really hard to say which was the best -- they were all so good! The omelette had great flavor and wasn't dry in the least (a complaint I often have of omelettes), the salmon was super fresh and was truly the star of the benedict dish (though the hollandaise sauce was a tad too tangy/tart/strong), and the banana french toast was my fave of the 3 samplers (came with lots of fresh bananas, strawberries, and blueberries too). Yum yum yum. If it weren't for the wait, this would be my #1 go-to brunch spot in the city.

Note: No credit cards. Debit cards ok, but $1 fee.
author: Kathy L.

description:
hmmmmmmmmm. the line is ridiculous. but my gf who was visiting reallly had her heart set on trying this spot, so we tried showing up early, and standing for about 2.5 hours, and finally got a table for 2. it was ridiculous.  i will task rabbit it next time. honestly.

since we stood in line for so long, the two of us got four things - obviously the monte cristo, a salmon benedict, some chocolate pancakes, and an omelette. it was a CRAZY amount of foood, but we actually finished most of it. lolll we didnt have a lot for dinner...wait, nope, thats a lie :) the monte cristo was definitely my favorite because i love the sweet / salty combo... everything else was kinda just average, which is disappointing - the food doesnt have a lot of flavor or depth.
author: Christina L.

description:
Me and my friends and boyfriend arrived only 20 minutes after opening and we waited a whopping 2 hours !!! 

It was worth it. So worth it.
Don't hold back and get everything your taste buds demand ! 
My favorite part was the potatoes that come with every dish! They were so good !!! 
Best shrimp omelette ever!!!
author: Hao T.

description: The wait is freakishly long but worth the wait. The Monte cristo was essentially french toast in a sandwich form. The eggs were fresh. The French toast platter is perfect for those who can't make up their mind as well. All in all I like it but don't think I can afford to wait that long again for a while.
author: Han Teng W.

description:
Is it a good brunch place in Norcal? YES.
Will I wait 3 hours in line just for brunch from 8-11am again? NO.

I occasionally pass by stockton st and see an extraordinarily long line for this place. It's a petite restaurant with an open kitchen so you can see all that they make. When I arrived on the dot at 8am, the line was already at 75% of the block....apparently the cashier said lining up at 8 was already "late" and that one needs to start lining up at 6ish to be considered "early". Um...ok.

Came here with some friends who have been here before..I am a brunch crusader considering it's my favorite meal...and wanted to see what all the HYPE was about since there aren't that many brunch places in norcal. Maybe it's not a celebrated thing like it is in southern california? 

Anyway, I had the Monte Cristo which is their most talked about dish. It's basically a 3 layered friend toast that's cooked into single 3D triangles with a layer of ham and a layer of cheese...mozzerella maybe? provolone? between each of the layers. Comes with a side of fruit and dusted with powdered sugar. Their jam is jamming and mmmm delish with the toast and all the other breakfasts. I was able to recreated this dish the following week at home.

In conclusion, this place is good but would I go back again to wait 3 hours or wait before 7am? I think not. Maybe I'll come again on a weekday. Someday.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Long lines.. get there really early... waited an hour before opening and still need to wait.... very small...maybe 10 table....

Have a large menu... lots of breakfast choice

Ok price....

Very small place

Ok portion size
author: Kevin J.

description:
OMG....and I don't even talk like that.

Starting with the logistics, yes it is true what everyone says: there is a wait and quite a wait at that. But all these troglodytes that are saying that the wait negates the quality of the cuisine at this restaurants are out of their friggin minds...good things come to those that wait. The Statue of Liberty took 9 years for the French to build, it took Leonardo da Vinci 16 years to paint the Mona Lisa, do you think that the long duration between start to finish, i.e., the entire process of the endeavor, takes away from the artistic beauty or engineering genius that these works possess....no dude...simply no. Quality takes time. If you want fast go to a friggin Denny's.

Anyways, my wife and I were visiting my brother-in-law and we always wanted to try this place, just never got around to it. I had the dungenus crab eggs Benedict and we also got the seasonal fruit French toast for the table to share. First off, if you like crab and you like eggs Benedict, make sure your toungue is ready to have a culinary three-way with crab and hollandaise...wow. The French toast is no slouch either. It is perfectly cooked: light, fluffy, flavorful, and not too sweet. But what really throws the French toast over the top is the amazing jam they have on the table. This stuff is so good, after we were done with the French toast, I literally started to spoon the jam into my mouth...seriously.

Please, do your tastebuds a favor....TRY THIS PLACE!!!!!
author: Toby K.

description:
Five hundred twenty-five thousand six hundred minutes ... that's how long it feels like to wait in line for Mama's food.  A meal at Mama's is by no means a quick endeavor.  Rather, it requires careful coordination and planning, from finding a parking space to finding things to do while you stand in a line as long as Ike's Place and Bi-Rite (though not as fast).  An unprepared diner will suffer a similar fate the first time I ventured out here on 10:00 a.m. on a Saturday morning.  The line was to the end of the block.  Lesson learned.

As far as the food goes, Mama's serves great food, made with the quintessential fresh ingredients we've grown accustomed to here in the Bay Area.  Fruits taste like they were just plucked off the branch, the fresh baked pastries smell and taste wonderful, and yes, the homemade jam is as good as advertised.  Even the apple juice taste like the way it ought to be, more apple and less juice.

I had the Monte Cristo (turkey breast, baked ham, cheddar and havarti cheese bread dipped in egg and grilled).  My only qualm was it should have been served warmer, but it was very good nonetheless, melt-in-your-mouth quality, plus it was hearty - without the greasy feeling.  

I'm glad I finally tried this widely popular spot.  I just wish it does not require so much work just to eat here. This time around, I visited late morning, mid-week and there was still a considerable wait. 

Overall, Mama's popularity is well deserved (though if I have to choose, I still prefer Brenda's).  The line is understandable, it's a small place that serves great food.  Mama's doesn't make it any less stressful to eat there, they just make the stress worth it.
author: Angel S.

description:
One of my favorite breakfast places anywhere!  So much so that whenever I am in town I try to make it a point of getting my arse up early and braving the lines for some seriously good eats.  Due note that i you want to go to Mama's, be ready for at least 45mins to over an hour on the weekends.

THE ORDER

Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict - 6 out of 5 - If there is a perfect egg dish then this is it.  I have to literally force myself to try other things because I almost always default to this.  The dungeness crab is a tough choice for a protein and it is handled with care it's easy to overwhelm with other flavors.  The crab here is chunky, clean and full of beautiful flavor.  The hollandaise sauce adds a nice buttery citrus blast that really makes it shine.  The eggs were poached perfectly .  The potatoes on the side were very nice.  They had a nice crispness to them along with a very herby flavor.  It really doesn't get much better than this!

Chorizo Eggs Benedict - 5 out of 5 - Oh man this is some seriously good chorizo.  It was flavorful, but clean and not greasy.  Its served over tortillas.  The hollandaise was great and really worked with the chorizo, much to my surprise.  I only had it once as it was a special and I haven't seen it in a while, so I hope it comes back soon!

OVERALL

Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and this is in my top 3 places to go.
author: Rob P.

description: I'm taken back at how amazing that was! Me and my friends heard this place usually has a long wait so we arrived 20 minutes early and we're the second group in line. Thanks to previous yelp reviews, I ordered the Monte Cristo & Chocolate French Toast. I definitely recommend stopping by this place if you're ever in town. Also, arrive a little early, it'll save you an hour wait. The inside is a little small and there's only one bathroom in the back, behind the kitchen. But none of that really bothers you once your butt hits the chair and the food touches your lips...mmmm...
author: Joseph G.

description:
Mama's is such a famous restaurant~~~everyone's raving about it, when i'm heading to SF, all my fds told me to go try this place!

The review was absolutely right, we waited for two hours to get into the restaurant, not to mention there's another line inside to order before you get seated.  If you go with a group, I highly suggest you to designate a person to look for seats while you wait in line to order.  

Things we ordered:

French Toast Sampler--I highly recommend this dish, best dish during the whole meal!!! The sampler includes three of their most famous french toast: cranberry-orange, chocolate cinnamon, and banana something.  They were topped with fresh banana and berries.  MUST TRY!

Monte Cristo-another Mama's famous dish, it has ham and turkey between three pieces of toasts and wrapped in egg and grilled.  Their homemade jam is awesome~~~Did I mention their homemade yogurt?? It's so freshly made.

The expensive dishes in the other hand were not that great: Dungeness crab omelet and shrimp eggs.  

The food is great, however, the wait is superrrrr long, I would order to go if I ever visit again.
author: Jannela X.

description:
The key to Mama's is to arrive early- maybe even before they open. 

It's a small joint, 10-12 tables at the most and don't underestimate how many people are willing to line up outside and wait for hours just to eat here.By the time we left the line had extended the whole block. 

Onto the food (since that's what it's all about), we ordered Fench Toast with Berries for the table. A must try with their incredible HOMEMADE JAM. I seriously contemplated taking the container of Jam that was sitting on our table and shoving it in my purse (but my morals got the better of me of course)- but it is darn good. I ordered the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benny (seasonal item) and the Fiance ordered the regualr Eggs Benny, both were great. 

You wait so long to get in that by the time your waiting to order you are drooling over all the baked goods they have on display and the open kitchen where you can see the chef's plating up all that goodness- which means you are 80% more likely to over-order. So be prepared.

Bonus: they even serve mimosa's!
author: Chelsi B.

description:
Oh look!  It's Mama's, that restaurant that always has a ridiculous line (even when it's freaking closed) and is on every to-eat list in San Fracisco.  The question for such a restaurant usually boils down to 'is it worth it', to which I typically say 'probaby not, but let's give it a shot'.  Being the kind of person who actually doesn't mind lines all that much (you're probably with friends if it's a restaurant, right?), it becomes about the charm.  The food, the service, the smiles; oh, how Mama's lacks.

First things first: the line.  Expect it to be apparently over an hour, especially if you don't feel like getting up early.  And then once inside, you line up to order at a register, your butts in some other eater's faces, themselves cramped into a small table in a tiny restaurant. You eat your food as quickly as you can while the employees and customers outside dog you the whole time - comfortable dining experience?  Meh, who cares when it's all about the food!

Mama's Sampler French Toast: Lemon Berry, Banana Nut, Swedish Cinnamon - Covered with Assorted Berries + Bananas 10.95: This dish, meant to be a sampler of the goodness of Mama's, really failed to whet my appetite for future visits.  It looks like a freaking American flag, though there's nothign wrong with that if that was the intention, which I kind of doubt.  And considering the three types of toast are as different as flavor profiles can be, it's odd that three different fruits are dumped on the top of the all of them - acceptable for your mama while at home, but not a restaurant serving alledgedly the best French toast on this coast.  To boot, the toast wasn't all that great; I enjoyed the fruit more.

Northern Italian - Pancetta (Italian Cured Bacon) , Mushrooms, Fresh Basil, Tomatoes, and Garlic Jack Cheese $10.95: Considering everything, this actually wasn't that bad of an omelette, except that the bacon completely ruined the it.  The crispy crunch really doesn't help the consistency or give it an interesting texture, instead distracting you from the rest of the gooey soft goodness, making you think 'who the hell put that in here?'  It'd probably be a decent dish if they used something a bit softer, say, a more stereotypically Italian sausage?  You can evaluate for yourself what the bread and orange were like based on the picture (not great...), the potatoes were, well potatoes.  It's a good portioning for that - enough to make you happy but not enough to be the main course.

So, Mama's.  The prices seem appropriate for San Francisco as far as the food goes, but $7 for a screwdriver at a mom and pop shot seems a tad steep - what goes in here, Kettle One?  I normally feel bad ragging on what might be a family business, but as this one's just raking in publicity and money, I'll just stay what my friends told me before I visited: Mama's is a busy restaurant that's busy only due to hype, and not much more.
author: Christopher P.

description:
Only thing I didn't like: the wait.

Everything else: wonderful! Yes, it is a tourist spot but it lived up to its name.

After 2 hours, I was so hungry. We ordered the 
*monte cristo: oh myyy, looked small but it was enough and so good! The balance of sweet and savory! Perfection! The raspberry jam was to die for too! It was fresh and made of all fruit.

*florentine eggs benedict: so good! Perfectly cooked and the right amount of all ingredients.

*pancetta omelette: good as well! Filled that sucker up.

*the side potatoes! What? I don't usually like potatoes, but these were crispy and addicting!

Mamas, I love you like Miley likes sticking out her tongue.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Loved it.  For my roommate's last morning in San Francisco (before moving to LA), we decided to FINALLY go to Mama's.  We'd expected a pretty long line even though we went on a Wednesday morning because of other reviews and the season (apparently during summer / tourist season, it's just as popular on weekdays as it is on weekends), but the line wasn't too bad.  The line is EASILY avoidable if you wake up early on a regular basis (like if you get up early to run before work), but I get that I can't give that advice to everybody.  I'd rather wake up an hour earlier than wait in line (:

Anyway, this is my favourite type of brunch place because it's so home-y.  I love the yellow interior and the small tables.  I loved all the frames and decorations that were inside as well as the view of Washington Square Park.  I loved that you could watch the cooks make your breakfast... and even see them sneaking in a bite or two ;)

My roommate and I got the french toast sampler, hot chocolate, grapefruit juice, carrot cake, and pancakes.  I'm not sure what pancakes she got, but we both finished our meals.  Of the french toasts that I got in my sampler, I only disliked the "Cranberry-Orange
House Baked Bread made with Cranberries, Fresh Orange Juice and Walnuts battered in Egg White."  The orange flavor just didn't really do it for me.

I'm definitely coming back (:
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Good food and great service but the wait time is killer.  You could pass out from hunger before getting a chance to order ;-)

On my recent late Friday afternoon visit with my daughter we ordered the Northern Italian omelette and the daily special, Crab Eggs Benedict.  Both dishes were very good as well as the side of potatoes.  The coffee not so special.  

I love that you stand in line along a large window overlooking the kitchen while you wait to order and pay.  Oh my!  The French Toast looked heavenly.
author: Donna P.

description:
Mama's has a reputation of being a tourist trap and based on the yelp reviews and travel awards plastered all across its windows, it almost seems true. However, it's not only tourists who are willing to wait in the seemingly never-ending lines for the food. 

The french toast here is made with different types of homemade bread that have fresh fruits baked in rather than the standard brioche or thinly sliced white bread. They also have stellar service which is critical for such a small establishment to provide the necessary turnover to keep the lines moving. 

The highlights of our meal were the dungeness crab benedict (If it's in season, only served on weekends) and the homemade jam. The food was delicious and reasonably priced for SF. I'm not sure if I would wait in the weekend brunch crowd lines again, but if I could find an off-time to dine here, I definitely would. 

Bring cash.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Im giving it 4.5 stars. Got in line around 1145 and waited about an hour and a half. Cash or debit card only and you pay before you get seated. When you get inside, you can see them cook the food and all the fruits and bread are laid out! We got the crab Benedict, Monte Cristo and cinnamon French Toast with berries. 

1. Crab Benedict was good. The crab can be more tasty and seasoned but that's my preference. Hollandaise was good. A bit pricey for $22.50. 

2. Monte Cristo. I'm not a big monte Cristo person but it was good noting that I've only had it twice in my life. The jam though was really good!! 

3. French Toast was thick and fluffy. And the strawberries were sweet. Try it with the jam

The waiters were really nice and came back to the table a couple times. They were the ones who recommended the jam and told us to take some jam home. :)
author: R M.

description:
My favorite breakfast spot in SF!! I've been here twice, and the waits been an hour to two hours. The line is ridiculous, so come early and snag a close spot in line. I love the setup where you can watch the chefs cook and the ingredients are so fresh.
My bf always orders the crab sandwich and I've had the french toast sampler and shrimp Benedict! Everything is just so good, and they don't skimp on the seafood!! Thinking about it makes me droooollll
author: Vy T.

description: If you're ever in the area, you'll see a long line wrapping around the corner of Mama's. Everytime I've waited 1-2 hours. The food is rewarding especially if you're a brunch person. I think the French toast here stood out the most to me but that's probably because I love French toast. I've ordered pancakes and omelettes before as well. Everything tastes fresh and they even give you their own jam with some orders. I love the vibe here - a perfect way to start off a Sunday morning!
author: Catherine L.

description:
BEST. BREAKFAST. EVER.

And I don't even love breakfast food!!! 

AND I waited 2 hours in line, in the damn heat, with zero shade. 

And I'd do it all over again too for that crab egg benedict and cran-orange french toast with seasonal berries, Oh and the jam...that jam!!
author: Kat V.

description:
Be ready to stand in line for two hours. But was it worth it? For me, I tried the Sourdough baguette in apple and lemon creme sauce, and although I could have easily gotten this to go and eaten it at the park across the street, I felt that this was my sweet elegance at the end of a long run. 

The thin slices of the sourdough baguette turned into french toast was beyond delicious, with each piece cut, I would slide it across the creamy lemon and apple creme sauce and drop on a sliced apple before doing the choochoo train into my mouth. Yes, that's the good stuff. 

Next time, I'll do that at the park anyways. But nevertheless, another awesome SF breakfast spot.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Came here with a SF friend a little before 10 hoping to catch brunch here. The line was already really long, going past the apartments. Since I'm only visiting for just the weekend, I better get in line if I want to eat. Neither of us had tried this place, but at the sight of the line, my friend started yelping a back up plan. The girl in front told us that we'll get halfway to the door in a little over an hour. So after what seemed like a long awhile, the line started building up. Then the fun began. Tourists walked up to us to ask, What are you guys in line for? When we told them it was for brunch at Mama's, they replied: "We would NEVER wait 2 hrs for food in Amsterdam muAHahaha."
