[Prosciutto, Asparagus, Tomatoes, Brie Omelette]--weekend special. Ahhh! Amazing! It's more of an open faced omelette, but with all the goodies sprinkled on. The brie really made this even better. And it came with two slices of toast and a side of potatoes. The potatoes are DELICIOUS by the way. Have the toast with their homemade marionberry jam at every table. I am not joking when I say it is ridiculously addicting and yummy. You'll keep reaching for more.

[French Toast Sampler] --three delicious slices of their awesome breads battered and french-toasted. I think the breads we had were lemon raspberry bread, cinnamon apple?, banana something....and they were topped with fresh banana, strawberries, raspberries, and marionberries. Yummy!

Their pastries looked really good too, albeit a bit pricey. I ordered a small glass of fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice and it was also kind of pricey for what I got, but it was refreshing. The inside of the restaurant is TINY, but really cutely decorated.  As my friend said, it's "grandma eclectic" haha...it was decorated for fall when I was there, with garlands of orange leaves and other cutesy, homey decorations. And you can watch the cooks plate and cook all their dishes as you're waiting in line to pay and order. 

Prices are a little bit high if you get the seafood specials, but I think it was worth it and I'd definitely come back!! One of the bestest brunch places I've been to! [Perhaps the Hash House of SF? Well, I'd have to actually make it past the Hash House line some day as well to compare...haha]
author: Jasmine C.

description: It's one of my favorite for breakfast/ brunch. The food is really good. It's a cozy place. I definitely recommend this little spot.
author: Maria L.

description: I arrived at Mama's 40 minutes before it opened on a Sunday morning and almost missed the first wave (the door closed right behind us). Mama's is pretty standard as far as brunch goes, and the food was pretty good, but I don't think it'd be worth the typical 2-3 hour wait. We enjoyed the monte cristo, french toast platter, and dungeness crab omelette with avocado and brie.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Attention all lemmings!  There is absolutely no reason to wait in line to have a mediocre breakfast at this place.  There are many outstanding breakfast spots in San Francisco that serve better breakfasts for the same money or less - and the wait for a table will be far less or there won't be a wait at all.

My girlfriend and I bought into the hype and stood in line for two hours on a Sunday (we got there at 7:30 am).  During that time the people in line were not offered any sort of refreshment or the opportunity to use the bathroom by the Mama's staff.

One would think that the owner would appreciate the huge amount of business he or she is getting on a daily basis and would show a bit of appreciation and common decency by making the wait in line as comfortable as possible.  There were a couple of small benches where people could sit while they waited - but additional benches need to be added so that more people can sit down while they wait.

Finally, be careful when using the bathroom - the toilet seat is loose.  It would literally take five minutes to fix it - but they probably won't take care of it since people might think that they actually respect their clientele if they do.
author: Paul V.

description:
I made it back a third time here! Last time I came it was  raining and I thought there would be no wait but there was! Rain or shine there will be a line ....lol....If you are starving and want to eat right away do not come here unless you want to be HANGRY the whole time until you get in there. But it is totally worth the wait, good quality food takes time!  I had the monte cristo (roasted turkey breast,honey baked ham, cheddar and gruyere cheese battered in egg and grilled to perfection) which was delicious by the way make sure you have it with the homemade jelly. I also tried the mama's french toast sampler which is awesome if you can't decide which bread to have, have them all! The south of the border is really good too! And if you want cake for breakfast the carrot cake is to die for! it's  a very cute and very cozy place to have brunch! The staff is really friendly and make you feel at home which makes sense why it's called "mama's"! I Love this place even if it means waiting 2 hours in line. Once you get to the door you get very excited but then find out there's still a line inside, dont worry the line will go by faster than the first one  since this is a tourist location it's a must if you are visiting San Francisco so you can cross it off your list! You will be a very happy person walking out of mama's with a full tummy for sure!
Note: it's best to pay cash but they also take debit card for a $1.00 charge. No credit cards.

 Enjoy the deliciousness that is waiting for you!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I'd give this place 4.5 stars. 

One of my friends from Australia and Los Angeles came to visit, so I decided that this was the opportunity to try all the good places that my SF friends wouldn't try! Perfect opportunity since I've heard so much about Mama's and how it's also a good tourist spot. My friends and I came to Mama's around 1 pm on a Tuesday. There was already a line and we ended up waiting about 30-45 mins but it felt like forever! After getting inside, there's another small line which you order from. CASH ONLY!!! Since we had to line up, I thought we would be served our food then have to find our own seats but turns out we get seated by the waiters, haha.

My friends & I were a party of five and we were seated in the back corner where the booth/couch chair was, next to the kitchen and exit. Sitting in that area and starving is not a good combination. When the wind blew our way, we could smell the bacon from the kitchen and that just made our stomach growl some more! It wanted that tasty meat, haha. Sitting around, we decided to admire the nice decor on the walls and how small/cozy the place was. After waiting about 10 mins, our food started to slowly but finally arrive! Yay! 

While making my order, I couldn't decide what to get cause everything looked soo good! I decided to be a piggy and order two things cause I was starving -- Monte Cristo ($10.50) and Swedish Cinnamon French Toast with fresh fruit ($7.75 + $2 extra for fresh fruit/berries). The first thing I ate  was the famous Monte Cristo. I didn't know what to expect but it was yummy! I could tell that there was ham and cheese in my meal for sure. Their famous raspberry jam made the meal much more delicious! It goes with just about anything! By the time I was finished with the Monte Cristo, I was too full for the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast with fresh fruit. I wasn't going to let a good meal go to waste, so I finished half of it at least! It tasted amaziiiiing! Soft and fluffy :) 

My friends enjoyed their meal and everyone was just as excited as me to receive their orders. The service was good and everyone was stuffed at the end (ended up being full for the entire day..)!  

Final say: I'll be back .. but only on weekdays to avoid shorter lines :) 
Still a bit unsure if the wait is worth it on weekends...
author: Mandy G.

description:
Another disappointing brunch in SF. Why did I expect anything else?

Let me start by stating the obvious - the line is ridiculous. You have to actually stay and wait in line, in the sun (or cold), on the sidewalk, for TWO HOURS. Isn't it about time to start acting like a restaurant in the modern age and have a wait list or something?

Now, on to the food. The Monte Cristo is as delicious as everyone says, but is it worth waiting 2 hours for? Absolutely NOT. I ordered that dish, the buttermilk pancakes, and a California omelette. Don't get me wrong, the food was good... but it was so ordinary. The pancakes and omelette could've came out of my own kitchen and tasted just as good. 

The portions are small for the price of the dishes, the line is way too long, the food is way too ordinary. Bottom line? If you're looking for brunch food on par with Mama's, you have plenty of other options that you won't have to waste two precious hours of your day for (one including IHOP).
author: Tiffany T.

description: Waited in line for over an hour and the food was definitely not worth the wait. Food tasted mediocre and every employee working there had a sour attitude. Asked for water 3 separate times before actually getting an acknowledgement. Not worth the wait guys. Try something else.
author: Troy C.

description:
I have wanted to try Mama's for years but the long lines (at any time) have always scared me.  We decided to bite the bullet and when this morning a little after it opened and I was surprised that the line wasn't too long.  There is another line once you get inside though which I wasn't aware of.  They definitely have their system down though.  I ordered the Californian omelette and my wife ordered the crab breakfast sandwich.  My was good and packed with lots of bacon and avocado but my wife said her's lacked any really outstanding flavor.

Not a bad breakfast spot at all but there are many others I would enjoy more and not have to wait in line for.
author: Blake B.

description: Great food, prompt and sweet service, nice environment. NOT worth the hour wait however. I've been waiting a year to go here and finally made my way on a rainy day. Hoping the weather would keep people away (it didn't) my family and I braved the cold for an hour as we waited in line. Your order is not taken at a table, but as you walk in you provide it to the person at the register. Everything is paid up front at the register, which I think moves people in and out quickly and doesn't encourage patrons to hang out at their table for long periods of time.  Then you are shown to your table. Food arrives pretty quickly and it is tasty. But nothing that I would wait in line again for. Nothing unique or super "knock your socks off" amazing. Not sure why there is a line here....
author: Meredith A.

description:
The food was good but definitely not good enough for me to wait nearly 1 1/2 hrs for, not to mention that it was a weekday. 

Monte cristo: eh, wasn't that great as people made it seemed to be, I think it's too cheesy

Crab Benedict: pretty good but I didn't think the crab tasted all that fresh. I prefer crab cake Benedict instead 

Italian omelette: my favorite dish of all. Very Flavorful

French toast sampler: nothing special about this special. It was ok. 

Mimosa: very small glass for $7, not worth it.
author: Mimi P.

description:
Finally! I got to try mama's!!!!

Came here on a sunday (never again) and i had to wait about 2+ hours....that is why you only get 4 stars...i dont think anyone should wait more than 2 hours for food...no matter how great it is...unless its like cooked by the Queen...that...i can wait

So you wait outside and they let u in...but u still gotta wait a bit in line to ORDER your food and then wait to be seated.

The service here is great!  They do make sure you are good and well care for during your time there.

The family and I ordered big - Monte Cristo, Crab cake benedict, egg white scramble, blueberry pancakes and northern italian scramble 

My favorite is the monte cristo and mind you, i always thought it's weird when people mix savory and sweet like the mcgriddle...still weird.  But man! this thing is AMAZING!  French toast with Gruyere cheese and ham and ALL MELTY...kiss me i just died!  That cheese i think won me over....it just has a nice richness to cut through the sweetness of the syrup but not overwhelm it.  The french toast was fluffy with a bit of toasty-ness outside..just a bit.  Omgosh my mouth just watered.

The crabcake benedict was expensive! 20+...hmmmmm but o wells.  The crab was nice - not fishy in any way (or crabby) and the holldaise sauce was light enough to taste but not overbear the crab itself.

The italian scramble omelet egg - eh nothing too fancy but definitely they pack it with meat! not really a need for ketchup but i still got some anyways =) but the potatoes...PERFECT...nice bite - just done right.  

Blueberry pancakes.....what can i say...i LOVE pancakes!  Small dollar size like but fluffy..and i mean fluffy! and they packed the blueberries in the middle so it was kinda hard to get some until you eat the middle part....very tarty but good with syrup.

Overall, i like the place but FOR ME, its a place i only want to go once and done because I cant stand the wait.  AND good luck finding parking!
author: Laurie W.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for AGES and I finally came around to it when an old friend and I decided to grab brunch in the city. We came on a Wednesday around 11:30 and waited around 1-1.5 hrs outside the restaurant to finally get inside. While waiting outside, we met a guy visiting SF; he told us that he came Mama's a few years ago and had made sure he made time to come again during his trip this time.

That got us more excited for the food. I guess it's THAT good. Excitement grew as we reached the door. We thought the wait was over and we could finally get seated. 

Boy were we wrong. 

Because of limited seatings inside the restaurant, we had to wait about 10 minutes (which is not too bad) after we had ordered our food to be able to sit down. Luckily we got a pretty nice table. It was very clean with nice table cloth and neatly displayed condiments (AKA AMAZINGGGGG raspberry preserves, milk for coffee, sugar, and salt). Food came in about another 15 minutes or so, and OH. MY. GOSH. It was HEAVENLY.

Both my friend and I ordered the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast topped with fresh berries and banana; it was SO GOOD. Good enough for me to come back another time and probably wait another hour for.

Bottom line, the food is definitely worth the wait. Oh and this place is cash only, so make sure you have enough so you can order all that your heart (and stomach) desires!

PS - I think I'll definitely come back sometime in the future to try the Monte Cristo. It looked amazing!!
author: Selina S.

description:
I love what I had here but just not worth to wait for two hours ish during weekend. 

I thought if I came here early then I don't have to wait for that long because I saw people talked about how long you need to wait. However, due to this is a small place (apparently not  many people mention it ), I assume as long as you're not here just when they open, you still need to be prepared for two hours waiting. 

Like one yelper said, "if you have something to do then follow your schedule first. If you have nothing to do, then you could spend your time enjoy your breakfast or brunch here."

Their breads look pretty good, especially you can see and smell it. Foods are absolutely like what other reviews mention, tasty, fresh, and etc. Services are quick and friendly but to me, it's a tad overrated.  After looking at most reviews, I thought  foods may surprised me but it wasn't, people seem to overrated their food. 

It's good, but not that amazing. 

Anyways, you just need to be ready for a long wait, at least two hours during weekends I think.
author: Jing Y.

description: Get here early (730am) because the secret has been out about this great little restaurant. Had he California omelette, and old fashioned crumb cake , my wife had the buttermilk pancakes and with fresh berries. Make this your go to breakfast in the Bay Area. You can walk of the meal to nearby coit tower and Lombard street afterwards.
author: Matt M.

description:
Mama, don't be mad, but your food is only OK.  

I guess that I can understand what people say when they tell you that a long line outside the door just means.. that there is a long line. I always thought that made perfect sense during dinner in the suburbs. So for a while, I swore SF was an exception. Mama says no.  

The food is very colorful, fresh, and generously portioned. But the tastes are average, which does not rise to the expectations of a place with long lines and $$ pricing. A broken Hollandaise that's too heavy on the lemon, French toast sampler that sounds promising but w/ no major flavor distinctions, and decent pastries. The house jam is tasty, yet not memorable. The service is attentive but their vibe is a young/eat-then-get-out/hating-tourists-makes-me-feel-better-about-myself type of vibe. You pay for the cute atmosphere, neighborhood, and visually refreshing food. But nothing else. 

Put simply, it's a winner if you're visiting or in the area. But there are better french toasts and egg benedicts in this city (e.g. Zazies!).
author: Diane N.

description:
BEST BREAK FAST I'VE EVER HAD. EVER. HANDS DOWN. This place is so worth the wait. Get there early if you want to avoid a wait longer than 2 hours. 

Order the French Toast sampler so you don't have to choose which homemade bread to pick from. 

All staff and workers are very nice & welcoming. Next time I'm back in NorCal I'm definitely going back here :)
author: Gianina D.

description:
Good food!!! 

I tried the monte cristo, pretty good~ especially with the jam~~~ Oh i love their jam!!!

Too bad it was sold out in jars otherwise i'll bring some back to southern cali!

I think it's a lil overhyped which causes the long line of waiting... 

We went there at a weird hour so the waiting wasn't too bad like 30 mins? otherwise i really don't know how long the wait is gonna be

Dining area is pretty small.... looks like they can't sit more than 30 ppl
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
I guess I'm in the minority here, but I didn't think this was anything special.  I've had some excellent breakfasts and brunches at home (in LA), and this didn't stack up to them.  The incredibly cramped interior and somewhat strange method of ordering didn't help.  We didn't have to wait that long - we were advised by an Uber driver to get there early, got there 30-ish mins. before they opened, and still had to wait another 30 mins. or so - but nothing compared to line that was there on our way out.  

Food wasn't anything special and had ANOTHER long wait to receive it.  Friend had French toast, I had an omelet, and neither was exceptional.  The place is very cramped, and another party that had someone with a disability was having trouble a few tables away.  Staff was not particularly friendly or attentive.  We had to flag people down twice simply to get a refill on water.  Maybe this was an off-day, since clearly they have a big following, but I can honestly say I wouldn't go back.  Especially not if I had to wait any longer than I did.  As I said, there's better breakfast places out there (even in SF) and if I'm on vacation, I'm not going waste time in line for a mediocre breakfast.
author: AJ J.

description: This place was truthfully amazing I went during a weekday and it was simply an hour wait!!! It was well worth it. I ordered the monte Cristo a must and also the smoothie which was amazing! Try the Waffle sampler they're all great!! This is truthfully one of the best breakfasts I've had recently and it is freshly made as you wait and order! I recommend coming here early and first thing in the morning!
author: Cristian C.

description:
I thought that coming on a Tuesday would mean avoiding an obscene line...how wrong we were. My friend and I met up at 10:30 waited more than a hour to order. It literally got to the point that I was worried about my 2 hour parking limit...however once inside, it felt totally homey and comfortable. 

As we watched the cooks prep meals, we definitely second guessed our own choices more than a few times but alas, I ended up going with the North Beach Benedict. It featured shredded prosciutto and a nice refreshing tomato slice along with the poached egg. My first benedict was amazing. It was savory, creamy, and melt in your mouth heaven! My second however was overcooked. However, all was made up for by the home fries which were seasoned nicely and not too heavy with the potato.

Be prepared to pay with cash, no credit cards accepted and debit takes a $1 surcharge.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
French toast sampler was amazing, but like they said....the place is small and the wait is long.  
Restroom is kinda ghetto as well.

Worth a try but I doubt I will go back.
author: David W.

description:
Be prepared to wait. And wait. Anddd wait.

It was about 1.5 hours before we got seated (party of 3). Once you get inside, there's still a line to order. You order and pay before you get seated, which I guess is their attempts to be as efficient as possible in a small, high traffic restaurant.

French Toast Sampler: This came with the Swedish Cinnamon, Cranberry-Orange and Banana Nut French Toasts. They were sprinkled with powdered sugar and had a heap of fresh banana slices, blueberries, raspberries and strawberries on top. The french toast here is denser than most places, which made it more rich and filling. The fresh fruit helps out the dish a lot by cutting the sweetness of the bread.

Dungeness Crab Benedict: This came with spinach and Mama's Grilled Potatoes. The potatoes weren't anything special, but the benedict itself was. Not only can you actually see the delicious crab meat, you can taste its freshness. Yummm. My only gripe is that it was a little pricey ($22).

Was this place worth the wait? Hmm... probably not, but it's definitely worth a try if you can get a seat without waiting an eternity.
author: Ava S.

description:
First in line at Mama's!

On Sunday, they open at 8 AM, and we got there right at 7:30, five seconds before the next guy. People started to flow in and a line formed on half the block in no time. What we did not expect when we were let inside was that you order at the counter first and then find a table.

We got the french toast trio, smoked salmon scramble, silver dollar pancakes, and to wash it all down, a screwdriver with soju for breakfast (yeah, a little early...)!

Foods: *****
+  The orange cranberry french toast was bomb dot com.
+  Scramble with cream cheese and bagel was fantastic (bonus points for the capers).
+  Silver dollar pancakes were probably my favorite. Definitely use the berry spread that's on the table, you won't need syrup!

Service: *****
+  The service was great. The head waiter was really nice and friendly, always checking in on us and was very attentive.

They only let a few people in at a time because there's a line at the counter, too, and an even longer wait when there aren't enough tables available. So even when you've made it through the line that's outside, you still have a long wait inside. COME EARLY.

But seriously, even if you have to stand in line for an hour, it's more than worth it. We were so tempted to jump back in line to try the famous Monte Cristo, but that will be for next time.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Came here again recently and I must say, still as amazing and delicious as I remembered!!! The monte cristo is still the best! This time I also ordered the eggs benedict which was heavenly as all their other dishes. Be sure to make this one of your stops if you are visiting SF! 

Tips: 
1.Get here early, BUT they only start serving their lunch menu which the monte cristo is on only from 11AM-3PM and not at 8AM when they open! 
2. CASH ONLY! 
3.Look at the menu and know what you want!!! As you order before you are seated!
author: Carol N.

description:
Be prepared to wait a while. It took us 50 min on the wait line to get into the restaurant and another 45 min to get the food. But the wait is worth it!

We had Monte Cristo and Dungeness Crab Benedict. They were both awesome, but the Monte Cristo...this is the best we've ever had. It's light and fluffy. Amazing goodness!
author: Dee C.

description: Phenomenal!! We had the South Of The Border & Bay Shrimp Omelette's & the Banana Pancakes. Only thing better than the food was the service! Thanks Vince.
author: Roy R.

description: The food was tasty and I liked everything we ordered, but nothing was outstanding, not even the monte cristos. The food certainly wasn't worth the price and two-hour wait. Mama's is a breakfast staple in the heart of the city. Worth a try, but one time is good enough.
author: Wesley C.

description:
If you're looking for delicious french toast...this is the spot! Best french toast I ever had...we got the french toast sampler. Loved the Banana bread french toast. Also, got an omelette too would skip the eggs next time. 

Going for brunch? Be sure to eat a bowl of cereal or snack before you go. Totally worth the wait though!
author: Janelle G.

description:
Visited San Francisco for the first time 2 weeks ago and stayed for a few days. Unfortunately Mama's is closed on Mondays so my friends and I had to make a decision: is it worth it to try Mama's on the Tuesday morning right before our flight back to NYC? We decided yes and though we had to rush to the airport, I am so glad we did because Mama's was great!

When we arrived at 9am, we waited on line for about 15-20 minutes. This is a kind of restaurant whereyou order before you are seated. We ordered:

Dungeness Crab Omelette With Avocado, Tomato and Havarti - 4/5
Mama's French Toast with berries and bananas - 4/5
Norwegian Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict - 5/5 (my favorite; this was delicious)

Service was great and food came out very quickly.

Will definitely want to come back one day when I return to SF.
author: Andy C.

description:
They are not worth the wait.   Really they're not.  I have lived in North Beach for over a decade.   At first,  Mama's did have pretty good food.  But these days, it's gotten as ordinary as it can be.    

I was there Recently and ordered the French toast with three kinds of breads.    It lacked the nice texture and flavor good French toast would have.   My husband ordered papa's omelet.    They were okay, but really nothing to write home about.  We left quite a bit of food on our plates.  That doesn't happen to us normally.

I have also noticed the line isn't as long as it used to be, especially on Wednesdays and Thursday's.
There was no line on Wednesday when I was there.
author: Doris A.

description:
OMFG!

Ferguson and I arrived there 30 minutes after they opened on a foggy Saturday and already a 2 hour wait.  In the words of GWB "not gonna do it."  The only egg worth a two hour wait would be the last one.
author: Tim A.

description: The front cashier possibly manager lady was awful. Worst customer service, attitude I've ever encounter. Older dark Asian woman. We walked in with smiles on our faces very excited to try their breakfast and what we got was nearly a friendly hello. Judgement and yelled at from the start. We ended up canceling our order and walked out. There was a miscommunication with her and our server. She gave us a table that wasn't meant for us and so we said that was fine we had no problem sitting somewhere else. I don't see how that was our fault? So we continued to place our order with the cashier/manager lady and she wouldn't even look at us. Somehow we were the ones that ended up getting the beating for getting sat at the wrong table. Most disrespectful/ worst manager I've ever dealt with.
author: Monique M.

description:
Extremely friendly servers. Good service, great food. Delicious strawberry jam. Monte cristo's the way to go.

And that blueberry crumb...mmm.

Warning - You will wait. Long wait. Always a line. No take out and have to wait there.
author: Dustin Y.

description:
Try Mama's. It's the best! ...they say. 
It's TOTALLY worth the wait!... they say.
You won't regret it! ... they say.

In my opinion, they are ALL wrong. It's not the best and it's totally NOT worth the wait. The only thing they were right about is not regretting it. I don't regret eating there because now I know better. 

I recently moved to San Francisco about 2 months ago, and everyone keeps raving about Mama's on Washington Square. One Friday morning, my roommates and I decided to play hooky and skip class. We were hungry and decided to try Mama's since we've been hearing really good things about it. 

We arrived around 9am, and the line didn't look THAT long. Since it was our first time there, we didn't really know what to expect. Apparently, you wait outside, then you wait inside, you order at the register, you get seated, and a server brings you out your food and gets your drink order.........wait whaaat? Yeah it was confusing. 

The line took an hour of my life that I will never get back, and the food wasn't even that great. I got eggs benedict off the specials menu, and it had two poached eggs, mushrooms, and pancetta on an english muffin with hollandaise sauce. IT WAS SO SALTY that I finished my glass of lemonade a quarter way through my meal. After starving in line for a little over an hour, I was thoroughly disappointed. On top of not-so-great food, the service was mehhhh. My server was awkward... she didn't say much, and she was super slow. How do you not know where the straws are? Umm...yeah.

Meh. I've experienced better, and I would not come back again. It's NOT the best. It's NOT worth the wait.  Maybe it was karma for ditching class... who knows? =X
author: Christine L.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend and his sister on a Sunday morning and of course waited the 2+ hours. I really wasn't overhyping it in my mind due to the wait because I actually like waiting in line with friends for things (you get to chat and hangout and whatnot). We were all excited to try this place out that we ordered 5 items between the three of us. We ordered two dungeness crab omelets, one dungeness crab benedict, one sampler platter of french toast and the Mama's breakfast sandwich special. None of these plates were spectacular in the least. The fruits on the french toast had a funny taste to them. The crab in the dishes did not taste that great either. And the omelets were just okay. 

One of my friends told me I should have ordered another dish. But you should not order a dungeness crab dish (especially while it is "crab season") and feel as though you ordered wrong. My boyfriend's sister was treating us out as a celebratory breakfast for me graduating back in June and I felt so horrible that she paid over 120$ for all mediocre food! 

Sadly I don't think we will give this place another try because the wait is ridiculous and our first experience wasn't that great. That wait really just added insult to injury.
author: Beca P.

description: GREAT food. Hard for me to give any place with fruit flies hanging around more than a 2... The fact that u gave it 4* should tell you how much I enjoyed my Paisano Benedict
author: Patrick L.

description:
I must say, I have been wanting to dine at Mama's for a while now. After waiting 2 hours in line, I must admit that I was very disappointed and Mama's is not worth the wait. While the staff were extremely friendly and hospitable, the food simply does not warrant the two hour wait. 

The breakfast potatoes did not have much flavor, and the omelette I ordered was not satisfying at all.  I hate to say it but Mama's feels like an establishment that is advertised by every hotel in the city as a must-see attraction in San Francisco, and the vast majority of the people in line reflect that criteria. 

The only reason I am giving two stars is solely based on the fact that the staff is extremely friendly. However, based on the food, the two hour wait is simply not worth it.
author: Darrell K.

description: The best breakfast grub can be found here at Mama's. I'm really not much of a breakfast person, but when I'm in the mood, this is the go to place for me. I always try to get there very early because the lines can be ridiculously long - but it's totally worth the wait. Their homemade jam is just savory and delicious - a definite crowd pleaser. The omelets? To die for!! Their French toast?? The bomb!! Waiting in line never had a happier ending than at Mama´s.
author: Gaston B.

description: This restaurant is a big hype.ok so it has a high rating in yelp and as tourist i trusted the reviews.we were in line for two hours.they only have abt 10 tables. I guess in sanfro its cool to fall in line.the monte cristo was good but not worth the 2 hour wait in line.im pretty sure they love seeing the line to boost people's curiosity. What im saying if they really value their customers they will find a way to better serve them like putting tables outside??? I saw other restaurants in the area do that.or maybe provide that device that will alarm when your turns up.the place is too small its not even cozy to have breakfast there. After eating i just want my two hours back!
author: Jufi C.

description:
Great food. 
Delicious. We were there at 0800 am
There was no a lot of ppl
Nice place
author: Alona C.

description:
Don't get me wrong, Mamas is good but not really worth the two hour wait.
Yes, there will always be a wait. Over hype!

The place is quite small,  probably only seats 40 max. It would be much better if they decide to set up an outdoor seating.

I ordered the eggs benedict with a grapefruit mimosa. I should have chosen orange mimosa instead. I enjoyed their eggs benedict and pouched eggs were made just right. 

Service from our female waitress needs to be more inviting and smiling :)
author: Marjorie B.

description:
WOW! I can't believe I use to pass by this place so much and didn't even bother looking in since there were SOOOO many people lining up for it.

Since I am on spring break and have been craving some breakfast food, I asked my best friend (who lives 3 blocks away) to go with me! I called in beforehand to ask how long the line was and the man responds, "there isn't a line outside, but there's about 6 people waiting inside." I thought, "hm... inside? Why not stand outside?"

So me and my best friend ran over there as soon as possible and there were about 4 people lining up to ORDER in front of us. So how it works is: You first order, then once all the people in your party are there, you can be seated. Pretty clever since they're always so busy!

I ordered the Washington Square omelet which came with red potatoes and toast. I LOVE FRENCH TOAST, so obviously, had to get that too :) 

WHO KNEW THE PORTION WOULD BE SO BIG AND FILLING?? The french toast was AMAZING. Thick, cinnamon-y, moist. Normally the ones I have are thin and dry from being overcooked, but mm mmm no, not this one. The syrup gave it an extra kick as well. AMAZING.

The omelet was somethin as well! When I tried to cut it, the cheese just oozed out of it with all the veggies that came with it. The wheat toast was a plus with the jam and the potatoes were amazing as well.

I always wondered why people would line up for this cramped place. And I was always too lazy to read the long descriptions that people had of this place. But damn, as of now, this is THEE place for breakfast. I've been to the usual ihop, dennys, even stacks. NAH, doesn't even compare. I spent $20 total, but it was SOOO worth it. And I was FULL for the rest of the day, no joke. I will definitely test my patience and wait in line next time :)
author: Linda K.

description:
As many of you probably know, I'm a bit slow on the uptake - as evidenced by the fact I just got around to trying out Mama's..... & only after a visit from a London friend shamed me into it 

My main excuse is that I'm not a line waiter & the thought of standing around for hours is NOT appealing but my friend had her heart set on Mama's & who am I to quash a dream... 

Sunday morning 10:30am - total wait time 1 hr 45 min 

But that being said, it wasn't too torturous - the sun was out, it was a beautifully warm day & the crowd was all chatting - we felt we made new friends from the time we all spent together 

And now onto the FOOD.... 
Waiting in line for almost 2 hrs can play havoc on your eyes-bigger-than-your-stomach ratios. We ordered B - I - G 

Friend: Pancakes and Omelet 
Me: Brioche French Toast and Pancakes 

We both agreed the Pancakes were the winner of the lot we ordered. They were cooked just right so they were light, fluffy & still moist.....no dry cakes found here! 

Omelet deemed to be too runny - could have used a bit longer in the pan 

French Toast - sorry to burst all the raving bubbles around here - not really good. The bread was dry & spent *nowhere* near enough time in the eggy mixture. Just a thin coating on top of the bread - not seeping throughout / flavoring the dish.......even huge heaps of butter & syrup couldn't moisten up this bread 

Looking at the other French Toast varieties being delivered to neighboring tables, seemed like they were all the same so it wasn't just my plate.....too bad. I had such high expectations from all the great reviews 

So in the end, pancakes were yummy & worth the visit if there was no line. Would we come back & wait 2 hrs for them?   No
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I've never been here for brunch because of the wait. I've been trained to go early even before they open to make sure I'm at the beginning of the line. However, this time we waited the 2 hrs and it was definitely worth the wait. 

We had to order three things to make sure we had everything covered:
- Monte Cristo - First time having it and yes it was AMAZING!
- Crab Omelette - On the pricer side ($21) but well worth it. I can appreciate the fact that they use tons of real crab meat for this omelette. It also came with avocado and tomatoes. YUM!
- Pan Dore - There's no way I'm not ordering this when I visit!

Overall, still amazing and I will keep coming! 

Friendly note: They only take Cash or Debit with a $1 surcharge.
author: Jess D.

description: I'm not a huge brunch person but I was visiting my bf and he brought me here. I think we waited about an hour. Got the mama cristo and the crab benedict. It was okay but again, went mainly for the experience but it wasn't worth the hour wait
author: Esther L.

description:
As a foodie with minuscule patience, I had always wanted to try Mama's but steered clear because of the infamously dreaded line. The average wait time is ~1.5 to 2 hrs on any given weekend and ~45min to 1 hr on weekdays. 

But after much deliberation, I finally decided to cave into the hype and plug through this painfully long and seemingly ridiculous line. And let me tell you, it was definitely worth the wait but I won't be coming back here all the time. 

We ordered the Eggs Florentine Benedict, Washington Square Omelet, the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast with fresh fruit and of course, mimosas. 

I personally thoroughly enjoyed the french toast for its unique chewy texture, traditional maple syrup and the perfect blend of powdered sugar. It was sweet without being overwhelming and tender without being soggy. 

I was a bit more ambivalent about the Florentine, however. The eggs were definitely decadent and close to the best I've had (organic, cooked with the right amount of detail) but I can't say the same for the potatoes and mushrooms. I'm a fan of crispy, well-cooked potatoes but these were far from crispy and a bit on the mushy, half-cooked side. And the mushrooms lacked any flavor. I judge a dish based on all of its components, not just the main item so this gets an average vote. 

The mimosas and the omelet were definitely tasty but nothing of noteworthy mention.  

All in all, I'm glad I finally gave Mama's a try. But the food wasn't captivating enough to overcome my disdain for long waits.
author: Priya S.

description: Wait was over an hour, but the food was amazing! Banana nut French toast was rich, the veggie omelette was fluffy and had a great portion of veggies. Food portions were ideal, not too much and not too little.
author: Erika R.

description:
"Who is more foolish? The fool or the fool who follows him?"

You would think by the reviews that eating here is a religious experience that is worth a 2-hour wait. No breakfast joint is worth that kind of wait. In fact, I wouldn't wait more than 30 minutes for breakfast.  

Don't get me wrong.  I enjoyed my eggs benedict here and other menu items looked good as well.  Service was very friendly. I was amazed at how they manage to move people along quickly without making them feel like they have to rush. They do quite a lot for a very little space.  This place earned its 4 stars and I would go to it often if I lived in the area and the wait was reasonable.

But frankly, there's really nothing special about this place...and certainly NOT worth waiting 2 hours for.  I've had the same eggs benedict in plenty of other places that were just as good.  Certainly not a life-changing experience by any means.  

I think people gave it 5 stars and wrote about how much of a religious experience it was because if you wait over 2 hours for breakfast, it "has" to be absolutely amazing.  Otherwise, you're just a dope who waited 2 hours for eggs and a piece of ham on an english muffin that you could get anywhere.  I'm sorry folks, the emperor is not wearing any clothes.
author: Fletch ..

description:
Order first and sit later. This place is definitely over-hyped. Some items are over-priced like the fresh fruit, crab benedict, crab omelete... Got the chocolate cinnamon french toast. The french toast was very doughy. The norweigan benedict wasnt great. The english muffin they serve the benedict on was very hard and tough to cut into. It came with very few pieces of the mama's grilled potatoes. I would say about 9 pcs. My first choice was the monte cristo but couldnt get it because they could not make it without the honey ham, which i found very disappointing. Really?! You can't just take out the honey ham? I guess. Their carrot cake, however, was good. Waited 2 hours and overall experience was not worth the wait. Spent $50 including tip for mediocre food. 2 stars for being that popular to stay on my yelp bookmark for over a year. Yelp, u have disappointed us. 

Lastly, the online menu appears $1-$2 cheaper than the actual menu at the restaurant.
author: Ella A.

description: Took my hubby out for a Sundate brunch at Mama's.  The place feels super homey and the set up is adorbs.  We got there at 9:30am and we waited in line for about an hour.  You line up outside and once you get inside you line up to order and pay before being seated. We both ordered Our famous Monte Cristo & a smoothie.  The smoothie was just okay... but the Monte Cristo is bomb.com!  I don't know if we'll go back again though. I think if we do go back we'll go super early to avoid the lines.
author: Shirley W.

description:
Everyone complains about the wait-so you're already warned. Waiting and eating will probably take around 2 hours. You have to wait to get in, order, and sit down waiting for the food. 

We had the Monte Cristo and the dungeneuss crab omelette. Both were good!! The Monte Cristo was a good amount of sweet and savory (more sweet though), but its the jam that makes it amazing. Wish there was more meat so you can taste the saltyness a little more, but it's something you'd have to try while you're there. The omelette was amazing though!! It had crab, avacado, and havarti cheese-super simple but worked perfectly. We were debating between the crabs benedict and the omelette and the owner recommended the omelette because it was simple and you were able to taste the crab more, while the benedict had a more complex taste to it. I'm sure both would be equally amazing. The potatoes that came with the meal on the other hand are not their strong suit. But everything else did not dissapoint, and was worth the wait! 

Also tried their chocolate crumble and that was delicious too!! Would recommend
author: Lauren W.

description:
Mama's you are absolutely amazing!

Came to Mama's on a Thursday noon with my friend. We decided to order a couple of dishes to share. We had the pancakes, the french toast sampler and an omlette (I just remember there being goat cheese and spinach). The pancakes were absolutely heavenly, so fluffy and delicious. The french toast was a nice surprise and we got to try a bunch of different flavors. The omlette was a savory treat that came with home fries. All items that we ordered were delightful. Our server even came around and told us to try a reddish sauce on our pancakes. I'm not sure what they put into that sauce but it was sooo tasty.

My friend and I only waited about 20-25 minutes to eat at Mama's. The entire staff is so friendly. The restaurant is small which is why you have to wait a long time for a table. Its a order first, seat later kind of restaurant. If you haven't tried it already, you definitely should.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Not worth the wait in the cold outside for 30 minutes. This was my third time here and had a complete different experience. The service was lousy and the food was not as fresh or tasty as I had the other times. Not sure what happened or if ownership changed. Ordered hard boiled eggs and was told they don't hard boil eggs. The berries we ordered were old and some had mold. The chicken in the Ceasar salad was dry and the lettuce looked old. Paid $69 for 2 breakfast dishes and a ceasar salad. Food definitely not worth it!
author: Shelly P.

description:
3.5 stars!

I wouldn't say this is the "BEST" brunch place ever, but it's pretty good! For me, I don't think it was worth the 2 hour wait, but I guess I have to do it at least once in my life since I live in SF. The restaurant is pretty small, and probably seats around 30-40 people at a time. Mama's is definitely more for tourists than locals. However, the portions are huge and the prices are reasonable! Would come again if the line wasn't that long...

I purchased a Scoutmob deal for $25, which included the following:

1) 2 Fresh Squeezed Mimosas
Small, but you can definitely taste the alcohol! And it supposedly uses fresh squeezed OJ, but I couldn't really tell the difference, but I'll believe it!

2) Chocolate Crumb Cake
Not a fan of chocolate, but it was indeed very crumbly. 

3) Banana Walnut Bread
Moist and soft, but nothing that spectacular. Had a hint of cinnamon, which I didn't like :( 

4) Buttermilk Pancakes
OMG THIS WAS SO GOOD!!!! The pancakes were light, airy, and fluffy! They almost just melt in your mouth!! Be sure to eat them warm :) I would definitely order this again next time if I do come back!! 

5) Monte Cristo
This dish was pretty tasty as well, but VERY filling! At most, I think I could've just finished half of this. This is basically a french toast sandwich stuffed with ham and cheese. It was just so perfectly soft and delicious! It also comes with house potatoes, which were very flavorful as well. Would recommend getting this dish!! :) 

5) Pasiano Eggs Benedict
Was not a fan of this mainly cause of the hollandaise sauce. By the time I was eating my fair share, the english muffin already soaked up the sauce, which made it really soggy. Probably need to eat this ASAP. 

In addition, we ordered the following:

6) Dungeness Crab Omelette
This was really good! The omelette was filled with fresh? dungeness crab! You can actually see the chunks of crab in each bite. This is on the pricer side though ($22), but it's worth it for the big portion and the amount of crab you get! 

7) Salmon Scramble
This was alright.. basically just eggs scrambled with small pieces of salmon, with house potatoes and a bagel. Nothing too special here. 

Food is definitely better than a lot of the other breakfast places in SF, but I'm not sure if I would say this is the best one. I feel like most people convince themselves it's the "best" brunch food they've ever had because of the long wait? Nonetheless, this is worth a try at least once! :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
What a WAIT! We arrived at 845am and sure enough, an hour later we were allowed to enter the line indoors to order our breakfast. :) It's a thrilling moment when they say, "Come on in!" :D

[[ Our Famous Monte Cristo ]]-- It's a 3-layered French toast sandwich with Turkey, Ham, and cheese wedged in between. I know it's their more popular items but it was NOT my favorite. It was a sandwich, with melted cheesy-ness in every bite. I thought it was OK. Adding the homemade JAM was DEFINITELY better.

[[ 2 Petaluma Farms Eggs- Any Style! ]]-- The boyfriend got 2 eggs over easy. And because he worked up such an appetite he added 2 more eggs on the side! 

[[ Northern Italian Omelette ]]-- Italian bacon, mushroom, basil, tomatoes, garlic jack cheese. MMMMM now THIS is breakfast! Gotta love their omelette with the eggs scrambled and cook JUST RIGHT. This one was super meaty and SOOO delicious! MUST TRY!! 

[[ Swedish Cinnamon French Toast ]]-- You get 3 french toasts and don't forget to add fresh fruits! I'd recommend this option over the sampler because on top of all the food we got. This was a sweet and doughy end to a yummy meal! 


//// STARS Overall ////
   This is my 2nd visit to Mama's and I think if I had gotten the eggs benedict again it'd surely be a 5 stars. But after trying their other menu items, I realize Mama's best quality is their freshness. Their long wait and tiny space made the food expectations even higher and though I am a fan and would recommend trying it at least once. It didn't blow my mind the 2nd time around.
author: Linda D.

description:
I had the lox platter, which came with a bagel and potatoes. Everything was delicious!!! I would have liked the lox to be a bit colder but my meal was still very delicious. 
My mom had an omelet filled with pancetta and other goodies, which came out looking delicious! 
We also got two undeniable pastries....an apple crumb and a chocolate crumb. None of which lasted long, all for good reason.
Would definitely come back and be willing to wait for a seat!
author: Enza R.

description: The food was good but i don't think its worth the wait (3 hours) and one of the servers was so mean. We asked if we can move to a open table after we just sat because we were by the door and it was cold and he said no and that he's busy. But our actual server susan was really nice.
author: Mahima D.

description:
2 hour wait on a Sunday. My friend and I had a granola bar in line to make sure we didn't starve to death while waiting.

I know people rave about the French toast, and it looked really delicious, but we didn't order it because we were splitting food and neither one of us are huge French toast fans.

We wanted to try either the Florentine scramble or the Northern Italian omelet. We went with the latter, and it was SO DELICIOUS. I can easily say it was one of the best omelets I've ever had. It wasn't too heavy and eggy, which is one of the reasons I don't usually order omelets. It had panchetta, basil, and tomatoes. and they were so delicious and flavorful.

The roasted potatoes on the side weren't as flavorful. They were almost bland and completely forgettable. You need to impress a potato-girl if you want to get a five. LOL

They had house-made ollaberry jam. It was a little runny, but it was delicious!!! I wish I had more toast just to eat more jam. (Aunt Mary's Cafe had better jam. Blackberry and we licked the jar clean!!!)

So in terms of the omelet it's a 5, the potatoes were a 2, and the ollaberry jam was a 4.

It wasn't worth the 2 hour wait by any means, but if the wait was shorter, I'd be willing to come back and try other food!
Realistically I won't be back though, because I want to try different brunch spots when I do go visit the bay.
author: Patricia L.

description: Almost necessary to review this brunch blessing. Wonderful wonderful place that any short visit to San Francisco is incomplete without. Mama's is truly a top tier place to go to for a brunch and an icon to the city and North Beach. First thing's first, if you're planning on coming here, plan on a solid wait (30 minutes to an hour, sometimes even more). It's a really small space and they can only fit so many people at once. If you're lucky and show up a tad before closing (3 pm) you might only have a 20ish minute wait, otherwise showing up that late could risk being just short of the cut off. Anyways once you've trekked your way inside, there's another smaller line but then you can use this time to make the ultimatum between two items or take in the homely interior. Mama's also has amazing little pastries, but they only make one batch of each per day so you're gonna have to come a little earlier and pray that they haven't ran out of carrot cake (I've only been lucky enough to have this once throughout my multiple visits). Be sure to also sample some of their freshly squeezed orange juice or grapefruit juice. You'll be seated shortly after ordering by one of the very friendly and conversational servers and you can even spot the owner lurking around on occasion. The entire place just makes you feel like you're in a classic mama's place, so home-like and cozy. The food doesn't take too long to come out but it feels like years after all the collective waiting and it definitely amplifies the taste a little, but it's still the highest of quality regardless. As good as the eggs benedict are, I somehow always end up ordering french toast. The kugelhopf and chocolate cinnamon french toasts are both to die for. So sweet, so soft, and so satiating. It enough to leave you full but still surmountable, you don't have to be a competitive eater to clean your plate here. I think it's almost impossible to leave this place unhappy, honestly a five star plus place.
author: Qasim S.

description:
Let me just echo everyone else and say this place is COMPLETELY WORTH THE HYPE.  But ONLY IF YOU COME BEFORE 7:30AM TO LINE UP (nothing is worth it if you have to wait more than an hour). 

Ordered the most popular items: Monte Cristo and Dungeness Crab Omelette (only avail on weekends) and OH MY GAH this truly was delicious. I now understand why this is considered the best brunch place. 

NOW --here is how you should do it if you decide to come here.

1. Get here BEFORE 7:30AM. I'm not kidding. Just get here at 7:20AM. We arrived at 7:25AM and we were the 3rd party in line (there was a group of 5 and a group of 2 in front of us). By 7:30AM, 5 more parties immediately lined up and by 7:40AM, another 10 showed up. So basically, by the time it was 8AM, there must have easily been at least 40 parties (not people, parties) in line. 
2. The line is super long because they control how you walk in. They take a couple groups at a time. You line up and order at the counter and THEN you sit down. So don't expect them to let in the first 15 parties all at once right at 8AM. At 8AM, they only let in the first 3 parties. They let in the next 3 parties probably around 8:20AM. Now I understand why the line is always so freakin' long. 
3. Order your food, sit down and eagerly await awesomeness.
4. Eat your food and experience utter happiness
5. Leave, don't linger, so you can help out those who are stuck waiting in line.

Tada.
author: Diana Y.

description:
The most amazing meal my boyfriend and I had our entire trip in San Francisco. 
Yes the line is long, we waited out in the rain for almost an hour to get in the door and ended up waiting another 15 minutes before our order was taken.
We ordered a stack of pancakes, their infamous Monte Cristo, and their seasonal Dungeness crab omelette.
Their pancakes were fluffy and delicious. One of the owners of the place told us they make their pancake batter fresh about every 20 minutes throughout the day.
The Monte Cristo is to die for. They are well know for this and it was definitely more amazing than I thought it would be.  
Their seasonal crab omelette was the best omelette I have ever had. The crab was succulent and sweet and it was paired up with Havati cheese and avocado. Never thought all of that would go together but it blended perfectly and it left my boyfriend and I wanting more.
The service was pretty good  the owner was super friendly and the servers were all smiles.
Definitely a place my boyfriend and I will come back to the next time we get the chance to venture back to San Francisco
author: Janelle D.

description:
Before our trip to SF I made CP promise he could handle the lines. I told him over and over again that there were some places I needed to try and that lines were part of the experience. I warned him and warned him but he was still shocked at the 1.5 hr wait for Mama's. Now, we did get there a little bit later then we should have (about 9:30 am) but it was definitely a long line. Try to take it in stride. Bring a book.

After we finally made it inside the ordering and receiving food process was a jiff. You order at the counter and sit down. For this reason I recommend being prepared before you come in. Know what you want! Don't hold up the line.

Coffee and a monte cristo for me; mocha and the chocolate cinnamon french toast for CP. Blueberry sourcream coffeecake for sharing. The guy who took our order told us we were f*ing awesome. We are.

We had only been seated for two minutes when we were able to start hoovering the coffeecake. It was so damn good. I was the happiest lady. I'm very partial to blueberry coffeecakes. This one was sinfully delicious. I want to make it at my house and eat tray after tray of it. gobble gobble.

While my monte cristo was also very enjoyable (and filling! I could only eat half of it), CP's french toast was the star of the meal. The chocolate to cinnamon ratio was exactly right. I couldn't believe it but CP ate everything on his plate down to the last garnish. (CP is not a big eater so this is quite an accomplishment.) 

Even though we were as full as if we had eaten two oompa loompas with all of Willy Wonka's candy, we still had a marvelous time at Mama's.

Yes, it's a wait but boy is it delicious. Besides, it's nice outside. Just chill out, bro.
author: Tai F.

description: This is an update. I love Mama's omelets because they have one of the best omelettes in town. Very light and fluffy. I came here for the fourth time with some girlfriends who wanted to try this place. The wait is excruciatingly long and is mostly compromised of tourists. The best time to go is around 1-2pm, which is an hr before they close. I have to admit the Monte Cristo is the best here. I don't think I would come if I have to wait more than 30mins. It's just not worth it to me. Service was great and food is fast.
author: Rosanna T.

description:
My guy and I ventured to Mama's during our time in SF a couple years back. We heard there would be a wait (and boy, did we wait) but it was so worth it.

I had the weekend benedict special -- delicious, huge pieces of dungeness crab with fresh spinach covered in their hollandaise sauce. -- YUM.

T had the North Beach benedict -- he also cleaned his plate.

Just for fun, we shared the Pan Dore. Now, this plate was so good and it practically melted in your mouth. We might've had to undo the buttons on our pants, but again, so worth it. We topped it all off with fresh juices and coffee.

I'm pretty sure not one word was spoken while we ate -- it's THAT good.

It's been almost two years and I can still smell Mama's amazing food wafting through the air and it's got my mouth watering. If you haven't checked this little corner spot out, what are you waiting for?
author: Manda S.

description: Arrive early!  The owner recommended be there by 7:30am for the first seating. We arrived after 8am and waited about an hour. The French Toast Sampler was a French Toast lovers delight. A sampling of Bananna, cinnamon raisin and cranberry bread French Toast topped with bananas and strawberries. I used the Strawberry jam rather than the maple syrup. Just delicious and worth the wait.
author: Lori R.

description:
Wait was 1 hr 15 min on a Tuesday Non Holiday at 11am 
Paying $1.00 for debit card usage is blatantly rude just up ur prices 50 cents and not charge customers for your business' bank fee.
Food was good but experience overall was Awful and makes people get out of line or never come back
author: Cassondra B.

description:
Crab Benedict ($21.50): This was pretty good. I have to say, it didn't disappoint. My bf really hates hollandaise but didn't mind eating this at all. Had a good balance of spinach, sauce, and crab. 
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_NjfOJp3Cept4vyVM-5JhA/120s.jpg

Mama's French Toast Sampler ($10.95): Also very good. I wanted to try out all of the french toast types they had and this sampler did the job! You get one of each (3 pieces of different types of french toast) and each of them was good, but I like the regular the best. Also, the abundant amount of fruit on top was awesome!
http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/dU_JIRUrVbUCAteMSCvBHg/120s.jpg

Washington Square ($10.95): This was huge and had a lot of meat and fresh veggies. Kinda wish I got this dish, I kept picking at my bf's dish! It was just that good! Add a little ketchup and tobasco and BAM! PERFECT! NOM NOM NOM!!!
http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Leb_x5iE_5pDetrCKMGgiQ/120s.jpg

The service was good and the guys serving us and cleaning our plates were really nice. 

Is it worth waiting 2 hours to finally get to eat?! NO. It is not worth it. I would just get togo and then walk across the street to the park and sit there and enjoy as it would be better than being stuffed up in a small cafe like place. 

You wait in line just to get inside of the restaurant, then you wait in another line to order your food, and then wait around for a table. Just too much waiting.
author: Erica T.

description:
First time at Mama's and loved it. The only negative: had to wait 3 hours. Needless to say that I rated it 5 SOLEY based on the food. Would I come here again? No but everyone should try this place once. 

Items I tried: 
**Old Fashion Buttermilk Pancakes: AMAZING. Best pancakes I ever had. My friend and I debated on getting this or some other fruit pancake. Go with this. so simple yet filled with flavor. Cleared the plate.

Scrambled Florentine: Great. Potatoes were delicious. 

Eggs Benedict: I'm not a huge fan of eggs benedict so I had one bite. Good but not something I would go there for. 

Sampler French toast: Delicious. Three different types of breads (Rasberry, blueberry + banana walnut). Comes with different fruits- would highly recommend getting this if they have this special still out.
author: Jenifer K.

description: The line is long, but it's worth the wait. I LOVED Mama's. I got the SOB omlette, the apple and peach bellini, and the apple coffee cake (to go). The omlette was great and very filling. and the cake was delicious. I was surpised i was able to take it home since I kept nibbling on it at the table. Just a note, go early, and don;t be discouraged by the line. I'll definitely return on a future visit to San Francisco.
author: Dominique C.

description:
One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Two words: monte cristo.

Get there at 7:30 AM and you will likely make it through the door when they open at 8!

Closed on Mondays :(
author: Tim G.

description:
I knew I had to try out Mama's as soon as I heard about it. It was my last few days in the Eastcoast and I couldn't go home without trying it this time. My last trip to Cali we ended up driving by and leaving because the line was out of this world.

This time we went around 1pm and the line was right in front of their window. It was a good 30-45 minutes of waiting but the line was tolerable to me. The environment was so lively with the park across the street. So the waiting around was enjoyable with my bf.

They have a menu outside on the window for you to browse while you're waiting. It's better to decide what you want to order before you head in. Because once you get in you're still in line to get to the register to order. 

I had decided on an omelet but I saw someone with a plate of french toast and fresh berries and changed my mind on the spot. There is not much seating in the restaurant and you're really waiting for people to finish eating and leave. They close fairly early at 3pm and if you're not in the door by 3 then they won't serve you I believe. I was sitting right by the door when someone asked about it and that's the response the hostess told them.

Our brunch was quite costly totaling up to around 40+ but we both got a dish, 2 OJ's, and a baked good. I thought the food was just decent. The portions are a reasonable size but I don't think my bf enjoyed his dish too much. The avocado in his omelet were sliced too thick to enjoy. I didn't enjoy the potato that came with his dish. It was so dry, a bit burnt, and lacked flavor.

I don't think I'll be back again to eat here. It was a one time try thing to experience the hype.
author: Lina T.

description:
Two friends and I went on a weekday to skip the usual brunch crowd. Off peak hours should not be an excuse to slack. We ordered 3 Eggs Benedicts. All 6 of the poached eggs were soft boiled. In fact, the girl's eggs benedict on the table over was also over cooked. Extremely disappointing. This defeats the purpose of Eggs Benedict altogether. The most exhilarating part cutting open the oozing yummy yolk could not be had. 

If I wanted to eat an unsuccessfully poached egg I can do that at home. Hollandaise sauce was ok and the potatoes were not spectacular. So glad I only had to wait 15 minutes to be disappointed...to which we promptly remedied by getting truffles & coffee nearby.

I really hope this is an off day. Unfortunately for Mama's it was my first and last time.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I'm so in love with this breakfast spot! Came here maybe two hours after they opened and of course there's a line. Not so bad actually... My bf and I only waited 30 min. 
The staff were super nice! The cashier found out it as any bday and got the whole place singing happy birthday to me  embarrassing yet surprised! They even have me a free mimosa on the house!! 
The food was delicious! Everything was on point! I would come back here if I end up staying overnight in SF again. 
I suggest you come here when they open because there is already a line... But if you decide to come after they open, be prepared to wait in line.
author: Nancy C.

description: Overrated brunch place in SF. Long wait and the food taste average. Definitely one time visit place.
author: T L.

description:
I think the air was bad that day or maybe I went to a different Mama's or something because I was pretty disappointed with Mama's. Rave reviews, a long line, and a longer wait...all the signs of a great meal in the city, but it ended up like one of those bad Choose-Your-Own-Adventures book endings.

We OVER-ordered so that we could try all the goodness including the Dungeness Crab Benedict, French Toast Sampler, and the Monte Cristo.

Part of how to be a good benedict is the mastery of the poached egg. The egg was overcooked and dry that not even the crab toppings could save this bene. It wasn't just mine either; I looked over the should of my very nearby neighbors and theirs was the exact same. No runnyness. Not worth the ~$20 at all.

From the French Toast Sampler, the only one I liked was the Cinnamon Bread one. The Cranberry and Banana bread ones were very dry compared to the Cinnamon one. They recommended to dip them in the cranberry sauce/syrup, but no thanks. Bad analogy: You can't save a bad hotdog with tons of ketchup.

Monte Cristo was the only thing that kept me from physically frowning and it was only average.

For having to wait 45-60 minutes in line, a $40-50 bill, and a crazy time trying to find parking, I was not satisfied. I just couldn't comprehend the huge discrepancy with great reviews and my own experience.
author: David P.

description: Best brunch in SF! Good food, clean location, but not too many seats. So beware, there shall be a wait! (usually 1-2 hrs) Worth the wait every so often (1-2 times a year). Wished they opened another location or moved to a bigger place!
author: Fatima H.

description: If you time to wait an hour in line. It is well worth having your breakfast here. Good food? Excellent service. You can meet people from all over the world here...(popular tourist spot).  Staff is really friendly and everything is on point. This was my first time and I'm a SF City slicker. Big ups.
author: Mack J.

description:
Monet Cristo is the number seller.  I am the number one buyer.  Stand in line for an hour and half with my chair and I am happy, dancing happy.  I am a tourist on the road or in my town, I don't care.  Some people don't like being a tourist, I do, Yeah!!!!

Five stars for My Mama's On Washington Square
author: Timsamstravelusa S.

description: I came here on a Friday morning about half an hour after it opened. There was already a line and it took me about an hour to get to the front of it. The system here is a little confusing for first timers - basically you stand in line, you don't put your name down or anything. When you get inside there's ANOTHER line but thankfully this one is quicker. You line up by the bakery counter/kitchen and can see pastries there and what's being cooked. By the time you get to the front of that line you order and pay at the counter. Then, somewhat magically, there will be a table open for you. I mean, I assume there will be, unless you have like 8 people in your party. Small parties are better here, it's not that big. I got a slice of their chocolate coffee cake to start - it was fabulous - hot and chocolate-y and melty. Unfortunately though, it was the best part of the meal. My salmon scramble was really unremarkable, fine, but certainly not worth waiting in line for an hour. Service was great, and I loved all the people who worked there. It's a super cute restaurant too (minus the bathroom which is outside and super cold in the winter). Ultimately though, the food wasn't worth the wait.
author: Emily V.

description:
Came here at 10:30am on a Saturday. Waited in line for 2 hours. 2 HOURS!

Had an overall good experience, but I wouldn't wait the 2 hours again. Maybe I have to come at 7:30. Next time.

Service: very nice friendly people, EXCEPT when they want you to leave so other customers can sit. I get it, they are busy, but I waited 2 hours, give me a break.

Food: I had the egg white french toast. So good. Not sure what bread they used. It was more like thick dense cake, which is a fav texture of mine. (Fyi, NOT diet food as they like to sell it, but worth the calories)

Drinks: Bellini, average, nothing spectacular.
author: Wen Y.

description: Ate here today, came at 8am and waited for 45 minutes so not bad at all. It was good but not too over the top that is worth the 2-3 hours wait. I had the Monte Cristo and corned beef egg Benedict to share with a friend, had coffee and tea and came to a total of $34 which was not bad at all! Maybe my expectations were just too high....
author: Anya W.

description: Good food but expect a wait outside and around the corner on weekends.
author: Cory A.

description: One star for waiting in line until my son saw the menu board in the window said no credit cards/no debit cards. So much for that. I was starving.
author: Suzanna H.

description: This Place has the best French Toast! I'm still drooling over them! This place is a must and the Staff is so nice and attentive. You must get there early and be prepared to wait for at least an hour.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
The damage: Dungeness Crab Omelette, Blueberry Pancakes, Monte Cristo, Berry Smoothie, and Carrot Cake. After all... it was for a special treat for our birthday girl AND we waited 1.5 hours in line, mind as well indulge! 

Dungeness Crab Omelette: So worth it. If you see this baby on the menu, you have to order it. Yeah sure, it's a bit on the pricey side, but you just waited over an hour for breakfast. Our birthday girl almost sunk into a heaven-like comatose state after a few bites. :)

Blueberry Pancakes: Eh, they're standard pancakes with fresh blueberries. I prefer Chloe's more for my pancake fix.

Monte Cristo: Didn't get to try, but my friends said they were really good dipped in the provided jam. 

Berry Smoothie: Contained berries, yogurt, and honey. The honey was very prominent. Tasted just like Jamba Juice's Banana Berry but with a lingering honey zing. Twas ok, wouldn't go back for it.

Carrot Cake: IT'S ALL ABOUT THE CREAM CHEESE ZOMG. It was good.

Yeah, the wait was long, but Mama's staff has got an efficient system going, and they're trying to be as accommodating as possible. It was great to finally try Mama's, but I don't think I would be coming back since the wait time is a little ridiculous.
author: Kathleen N.

description: Definitely not only lived up to the hype, but exceeded it!  Friendly service, quick, and very attentive...  My meal, the Washington Square Omelet with Rye toast and homemade Raspberry jam, was absolutely killer!
author: Norman P.

description:
I recently purchased an amazing brunch deal to Mama's through Scoutmob.  I will admit the line down the block on the Friday morning that my friend and I headed to Mama's was freakin' intimidating.  But it was definitely worth the hour wait!  Tip: Go with a friend, drop him and her off to wait in line while you look for parking and grab coffee nearby from La Boulange to hold you over.

For $25, you get:
-one order of pancakes
-two sides (choice of paisano benedict, monte cristo, or slim's burger)
-two orders of bread
-two beverages (fresh squeezed mimosa, beer, soda, or coffee)

My friend and I got:

-Paisano benedict: ZOMG! The best thing we put in our mouths.  The salty bits of Italian bacon provided the perfect texture of this benedict.  You've got to try this!

-Monte cristo: good with jam, even more amazing when dipped in maple syrup.  The french-toasted bread was fluffy and semi-sweet.

-Apple crumb cake: delicious with the homemade jam.  Not too sweet either.

-Banana bread: the crunchy top crust was the best part of the bread!  Again, extra yummy with the homemade jam.

-Pancakes: light, buttery, and fluffy.

Overall, Mama's DEFINITELY lives up to all the hype!
author: Matt S.

description: So, to start, the food is delicious. This place has reasonable prices. The options are plentiful. The staff is fairly friendly. That said, the artificially created line is unbearable. The line can be around the corner, and they can have four open tables of two, but they will not let anyone inside until they seat the party that is at the door regardless of it's size. For instance, we and three other couples sat outside in line, looking in at open tables for 45 mins, while they waited until a party of four left so they could seat the party of four in front of us. They didn't even ask if there were people outside in parties of two. So, in short, if you REALLY want to eat here, it's worth it, but be prepared to endure a potentially frustrating unnecessary wait.
author: Chris S.

description:
A play on the "greasy diner," that can execute well on the food and coffee.

Lined up 20min before they were opened, we were already 10 people deep.  Open at 8am, on a Wed, they were already at a line about 50+ deep.  Amazing for a weekday.

Like I said, executed well.  However, I'm not entirely sure on the attraction to this place.  It's solid food, not exceptional.  Service was prompt, super courteous and friendly.

Would I come back?  Absolutely.  Though, I'm not entirely sure it would be worth a 30min or even 1hr+ wait.

Mental note, they accept debit cards, and cash only.  No credit cards.
author: Mitch N.

description:
I do not have negative things to say about my breakfast experience, but I am definitely not going back. Why? I was expecting a lot more after all the hype and long lines. Now I know that the long lines are mostly tourists choosing this place based on traveling magazines, etc. (which is great for tourists, because it is a reliable location). But being a resident, the price was high and the turn around rate was really high so I felt rush to finish my breakfast. 

Something interesting: the FRENCH TOAST is made of e.g. banana nut bread, blueberry bread, etc. As a result they are not spongy and I could not taste the eggs. I did not really like them, but you might.
author: Marissa P.

description: A definite must see in San Francisco. This is a small restaurant and I would say it's best to arrive 45 min before it opens to get the best place in line. If you come later you on you will be waiting for an hour+. They do not take credit cards but will take a debit card with a $1 fee.  You order at the counter and after they make the food they bring it to your table. We had the Monte Cristo, eggs Benedict and a plain coffee cake. Everything was superb. The raspberry jam for the monte cristo was amazing, and I think it really made the dish. Will definitely be returning here upon my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
It makes me sad that in SD we have nothing that compares to Mama's. This place is totally worth the 1+ hour wait.

French toast sampler was great and the dungeness crab benedict is amazing. They use their own homemade bread loafs which are pretty unique (fruity/nutty combo) and the bennies are toppling over with lump crab meat.
author: Jessalyn C.

description:
I HATE Brunch.

I HATE waking up early.

I HATE paying for something as simple as eggs and bacon that I can make sleepwalking (ok, maybe not).

My Friend: "Let's go to Brunch...at Mama's!"

Me *thinking*: "Are you telling me that in addition to forking out $$, I'll have to wait 1-2 hours at a hyped touron (tourist + moron) spot?!?!?"

Like any obedient Asian girl, I complied as I silently cursed to myself. 

Last Saturday, the stars couldn't have been more perfectly aligned. We had unusually warm flip flop weather in SF. I found non-metered parking in less than 2 minutes. At 10 AM, the wait was just 45 minutes at Mama's! Triple *Woot*. =D

(TIPS: Finding 2-hour residential parking is easiest before 11 AM. The line grows fast so drop off your loved ones/friends while you find parking.)

Featured on numerous TV shows, publications, and even in Time Magazine as a "must visit" while in San Francisco, Mama's did NOT disappoint. Mama's makes everything with love: from their delectable freshly baked goods, fluffy omelets, nostalgic French toast to their gourmet weekend specials like the Dungeness Crab Benedict. Service is equally as excellent as the food; down-home, charming and ohhh so friendly (Cyrus and Francisco, you guys ROCK!) According to the awesome amigos, the best time to come to Mama's is Tuesday and Wednesday for a minimal wait. 

When it comes to food, nothing rings truer than the cliché: "A picture is worth a thousand words":
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=YJFIA3QyDF1DTY344NYCxw

Sink your teeth into decadent French Toast Sampler ($10.75) drizzled with lip-smacking maple syrup. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=6Vper1h1jzhtXZ5NoBy2YQ Tickle your salty, sweet, and savory taste buds with the heavenly Monte Cristo smeared with their homemade mixed berry jam (MUST ORDER - $10.75) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=Hqky4U-uz98M3bKxqVb5sw Get a porky Italian kick from the busting from the seams Washington Square Omelet ($10.25) with strings of melted jack cheese. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=X3quw1ku24LcWjLWGUrsgg. Indulge in the decadent Dungeness Crab Benedict ($21.50) with tangy, sensory awakening hollandaise sauce showering the tender chunks of sweet crab meat *Pop the egg* for that extra drool factor. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=kxVxFXdIiSk-M9RzE0qsVA Get a satisfying crunch from the glorious Smoked Applewood Bacon ($3.50).
