Because there's always room for dessert, inhale; I mean nibble the fluffy moist Carrot Cake ($3) with a delightful cream cheese frosting. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=raTzR9int86HAlfY5Yk2Yw

BEST. BRUNCH. EVER. 

Like I said, I HATE brunch but I'll DO Mama's any day and every day (get your mind of out the gutter, you pervies).
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Second time coming here after a few years.  We arrived around 10am, and waited for 1-1.5 hours, as expected.

The Norwegian (?) eggs benedict was really good, loved the smoked salmon ... but I can't say that the other dishes were as amazing.  Had one of the specials for shrimp, avocado and *somethingelseiforgot eggs benedict, also tried the other daily special for 3 kinds of french toast.  I can't say these last two were worth waiting 1.5 hours, but the smoked salmon eggs benedict was.

I might give this place one more try though!
author: Cal C.

description:
Came here while visiting SF to see what the hype was about. I'm sorry but all this place has is a following.  It wasn't worth the wait. I've definitely had wayyyyy better eggs Benedict and Monte Christo at our neighborhood restaurant back home.

Positives: Good service.  Great baked goods
author: Amanda W.

description:
It's going to be a long wait... Prepare yourself. It doesn't matter if you go right when they open, you'll still be in line for an hour, if not 2. 

It's worth the wait. When you finally get to go inside, it looks like it's buffet style- it's not. You can choose pastries from the counter, and once you reach the register you order your food. Once you've ordered, you'll be seated. Food come quickly.

The food is fresh, local and delicious. It's simple ingredients and wonderful food. 

I'm partial to the pan perdu, it's like a pancakes/crepe but amazing! My husband always goes for the omelette. Honestly- everything is amazing! The crab benedict is delicious and worth the 16$.

On that note, it is a little pricy, more so than going to a cafe. But the price and the wait are worth the amazing food, friendly staff and homey atmosphere.

Enjoy!
author: Taryn R.

description:
I'm not usually willing to wait in an hour-long line for something to eat, but in this case it was absolutely worth it.

The food was delicious, the wait staff was friendly and attentive, and the decor was warm and inviting.

If they have the crab cakes benedict special when you're there I'd highly recommend taking advantage of it!
author: Jas M.

description: The Famous Monte Cristo, homemade jam, potato hash, and fresh squeezed orange juice was so delicious! The bay shrimp omelette was good, but it was nowhere near as good as the MC. Prices were affordable for the amount of food they gave you ($13.95 for the MC & $11.95 for the omelette - only expensive item was the very small cup of orange juice for $3.95), and the servers were very friendly. We waited about 25 minutes to get in and it was totally worth the wait!
author: Brian A.

description:
3.5 stars. I think this was just worth the 1.5 hour wait.  Only just though.

Why am I giving it 3.5 stars? The food was delicious, staff was superbly friendly, but I like to give something 4 solid stars if I think I'd like to come back.  I don't think I'd wait in line for this unless I was showing someone around San Francisco and they insisted on trying Mama's, but honestly, I think there is better brunch elsewhere that doesn't include standing in the sun for 1.5 hours. BF and I thought we might be saving some time by being early birds on a Saturday (wishful thinking, I know), but nooope. Was still 1.5 hours at 8:30am Saturday morning. Perhaps you can tell I am not the biggest fan of waiting... but I think this is an experience everyone should try at least once.
author: Adele Z.

description: Heard about this place from a girlfriend so my boyfriend and I woke up early to check it out.  There was already a line at 7:30am.  The nice thing is that they offered coffee (not free) for those in line.  The food was good not great but good.  It's a family joint that you definitely can feel inside the restaurant.  I like to be able to see the kitchen and how they prep the food. The bathroom was, well, it's outside like an outhouse. I found that disturbing.
author: Rose C.

description:
3 hour wait for brunch on a Saturday. Call us crazy, but there's always a first for everything!

Finally got to try Mama's, but the wait on a Saturday was ridiculous! :( My friends and I were lined up at 7:45AM and the wait was still 3 hours! :( CRAZY. During our wait, we had Sightglass lattes from Beacon Coffee & Pantry. Kept us warm while we chatted. Time actually passed by quite fast though. When we were finally able to order, I had their famous Monte Cristo, which came with roasted turkey breast, honey baked ham, cheddar and gruyere cheese battered in egg served with their homemade jam. The Monte Cristo is kind of like a french toast filled with ham, turkey breast, egg, and cheese. It was really delicious especially dipped into their jams. Light enough to not make you feel gross. Great combination all together! The jam was fresh, fruity, and delicious. I'd definitely get this again if I come back! The staff and service were great. However, just be prepared for the long wait especially on the weekends! Definitely worth at least a try if you're in San Francisco! :)
author: Philana C.

description: Best breakfast I've ever had.  Definitely worth the wait.  Locals still go to this not so hidden gem.  Show up early or the lines will get long!
author: Chad V.

description:
Tourist trap. Doesn't live up to the hype. Average. These words DO NOT describe Mama's. Sure the long is wait and finding parking is a headache but if you come with the right mindset, Mama's is totally worth trying at least once. 

For years, I had been driving past this brunch locale wondering why the line is out the door. Finally, I committed, took the plunge, and waited like the many before me to try their most popular dishes. Yes, you guessed it -- Dungeness Crab Benedict, French Toast Sampler, and the Monte Cristo. Also tacked on the Smoked Salmon Benedict and Eggs Florentine. I figured that starving for an hour equals ordering more worth. Got to make the trip worth it. 

How can anyone not love the Monte Cristo?! Sweetness of the jam paired with the salty turkey breast, baked ham, and Harvarti cheese is already a match made in heaven. Having the entire sandwich dressed up as French Toast send this dish over the top. Dungeness Crab Benedict did not disappointed either. Perfectly poached eggs on top of a nice helping of crab and spinach. Some might think this is blasphemy, but Mama's Crab Benedict rivals Zazie's La Mer. French Toast Sampler was excellent and a great way to try their Banana Nut, Kugelhopf, and Swedish Cinnamon. Fruit was fresh and not doused in syrup, which is always a plus. The other two Benedicts were good but not memorable. 

Now for I passed the boring wait. First, you need a very nice, patient Buddy #1 to drive around looking for parking while you wait in line. Either that or take the bus. Second, you need Buddy #2 to wait in line with you. You can also throw in Buddy #3 to create the perfect even group of four. Once Buddy #1 has found parking, divide up into pairs - one set will stand in line, while the other explores North Beach and Chinatown. Exercise, good conversation, and great food all rolled into one trip to Mama's. 

What I recommend: 

-- Monte Cristo
-- Dungeness Crab Benedict
-- French Toast Sampler
-- Be prepared to stand and wait. 
-- Bring a good parker, preferable one that can park up hills and in tight spaces or take the bus. 
-- Bring cash, unless you want to pay the extra $1 card charge.
author: Andrew W.

description:
Blueberry pancakes? Awesome.

Monte Cristo? Awesome.

Spicy Italian Sausage? Awesome.

Mama's Smoothie? O.K.

45 minute wait? Not bad.

I'm not much of a breakfast/brunch type of person, but this place was really good. I'd still put  Clinton St. Bakery ahead of Mama's though on the blueberry pancakes. I'd come back to Mama's though.
author: Timothy L.

description: French Toast Sampler plus Dungeness Crab Benedict equals thunder thighs...but it's worth it!!!
author: Suany W.

description:
Amazing! Waited a little over two hours for this place. 

The place is small, but there is always a huge line. So, if you want to avoid the 2 hour wait then your best bet is to come before they open or  come around 2 PM. 

I got the Norwegian Benedict and it's a salmon benedict. It was sooooo good! I wasn't expecting much cause breakfast is breakfast...right?! Wrong! I don't know how they make their benedicts taste the way they do...but they're out if this world. Also, the potatoes that came with my Benedict were also spectacular! I just loved how everything was flavored.  Besides their food; their mimosas are good too! A bit pricey ($7) for a small glass. Overall, I'm impressed with this place and would wait another two hours for their yummy bendicts! Easily one of the best breakfast I've ever had.
author: Kathy N.

description: The Monte Cristo is to die for, and the apple lemon French toast will leave you happy as well. Definitely a "must do" in San Francisco.
author: Anna S.

description:
SO WORTH THE WAIT. I do recommend bringing a snack and drink so no one gets too hangry haha

Breakfast food has always been my favorite. I've had kitchen story, sweet maple, Zazie, stacks, & eats in SF- yet none of these places are worth the 1-2.5 hr wait. The Shrimp Benedict was great, but the Monte Cristo is why you wait in that crazy line. 

I would say that if you're short on time and have a lot to see in the city, I would opt out for the other great places mentioned above. If you visit San Francisco often, this should be at the top of your list.

It's small, but the food has a big impact (:
author: Nikki A.

description:
This place better be good bc I just waited an hr plus and then more waiting but hey let's make the best of it.... Ordered the northern light and the blueberry pancakes and I hope it's delicious 
Met the owner while I was in line and dude seems chill, got it all done and had nothin but a smile on his face

I'm ready for my food I'm ready for my food
author: Zeenna K.

description: I would like to say that Mama's is well worth the wait to get in, but I have to say that, while it was incredibly delicious, my french toast was just about the same as any other respectable diner would produce.  It's almost torturous... As you get closer to the register to order, you see all the breads in a basket and the cooks doing their thing... you stare at the menu, trying to figure out what to order to satisfy the hunger that's been building since you stood in line.  Still, it's an institution in a great location.  Definitely a once in a lifetime experience and a must for any foodie visiting SF.
author: Christina G.

description:
Mama's breakfast sandwich was a special, which included scrambled eggs and crab on a toasted brioche bun. Delicious! 
Everything around us looked sooooo good. 

Probably a half hour until we were seated on a Tuesday at  11am. Bring cash, because they don't take credit cards.
author: Brenda C.

description:
We arrived at 7:30AM on a Sunday and there was already a good size line. We waited for about an hour outside and were let in to order at the counter. We ordered and waited to be seated. While we waited the cashier chatted us up and was really friendly, we soon found out he was the Grandson of "Mama" which was fascinating. This truly is a family run business now in its third generation.  We learned that all the breads and pastries are baked in house each morning. This is one hard working family.
We were seated after a few minutes and the rest of our party soon realized why I forced them to wait in this hour line (this being my second visit).  Every breakfast item we ordered was beyond amazing. I am just going to list what we had. I don't think you can go wrong with what you order.
We ordered:
Dungeness Crab Omelet loaded with avocado and crab

French toast sampler if you can't decide which French toast to get this is the way to go

Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast loaded with berries and banana

Cranberry-Orange French Toast with walnut battered egg whites

Monte Christo (which is served all day) turkey ham cheddar and greyer with an amazing raspberry jam for dipping. 

This truly is the best breakfast I have ever had and I have had some good ones. Trust me waiting in line is worth it but get there before they open and bring a snack and coffee for the line.
author: Scott M.

description: The food was amazing.  I had two bellinis, the dungeness crab benedict, and a side of bacon and it was all cooked to perfection. It's just that damn wait that gets you. 90min wait for brunch? I may need a bellini or two in line next time.
author: nancy b.

description:
Right before going on a bike ride on a beautiful Wednesday afternoon, we stopped by Mama's for brunch. It was 11:45am and the line wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. We waited for 15 minutes? The restaurant was so cute! The decor and furniture was classic and old fashioned and the food was delicious! It felt like I was in someone's home.  I wanted to try so many different things from the menu, but after asking the wait staff what their favorite dish was, I had to order the Monte Cristo. They have an array of brunch and lunch items. Pancakes, eggs benedicts, scrambles, sandwiches, salads, and scrumptious breads and cakes on display! I was in food heaven. 

So here's the deal...you wait outside until someone escorts your party inside. You then wait in another line to order. After that, you wait again for an open table. It's super cramped inside so be weary of bringing big parties. The food comes out to your table once you're seated. Portions are large and in charge. Monte Cristo was definitely good, for the first few bites. After that, it was just too cheesy and hearty for my liking. It came with a side of baby greens and an impeccable home made jam. One of my friends had the Shrimp eggs Benedict and it was a winner. 

I'm looking forward to coming back here to try their other dishes.
author: Lynn V.

description:
This place was good, but the 2 hour wait in line made me not appreciate it as much. The service was good, the owner (that greets you at the door) was friendly and the food was pretty tasty.
I was disappointed with the portion size; I ordered the eggs Benedict, and after waiting for 2 hours I was pretty hungry. I left the restaurant still really hungry.
Overall the food and service were good, but it was not worth the 2 hour wait, especially for the price to portion ratio (13 dollars for what would normally be half a meal for me). I will maybe return on a day when the line is shorter.
author: Carson P.

description:
I have tried, and failed; to get in to Mama's on three prior occasions! Finally, success!

And success does taste sweet! A bit savory too, in the form of the Monte Cristo. 

I woke up early, & made it to Mama's around 7:20. I wasn't the first one in line, but I was close enough to the front to get a table in the first seating,

Mama's was everything I had hoped it would be!

I couldn't decide between the monte Cristo, or the French toast made of banana bread. So I ordered both! And both of them were tops.

Thousands of reviewers aren't wrong. Mamas is one of the best breakfast restaurants in the country.
author: Brooke S.

description: LOVE Mama's! Had heard about it from a friend and didn't believe the hype, but I checked it out and it exceeded all expectations. Went during a busy time on Sunday so had to wait a bit, but else it was definitely worth the wait. It's a cute little restaurant with a very "home-y" vibe. Definitely check it out if you're in SF!
author: Gigi S.

description: We were Excited to come to visit Mama's famous restaurant for brunch. After almost two hours of waiting in line, the food was just alright. I expected to be wowed.and it fell short from this. At least we had the experience to check out this place. BTW no credit cards, only cash or debit cards on purchases over 15.00.  Service was good.
author: Maria C.

description:
Mama's, I really wanted to like you. Unfortunately, "not even once" is now my opinion. It's not bad...but it's not good enough. I knew there was going to be a long line, I knew there was going to be a wait, and I knew there was a lot of hype about how good Mama's is. But still, it wasn't worth it, not even once.

I came here early on Sunday morning and ended up standing in line for TWO HOURS before we finally got through the doors. Only to wait in line again about 20-30 min to order our food and be seated (yes, there's another line inside).

The food was average. I had the Washington Square Omelette with a side of chicken turkey sausage. Everyone else ordered the Crab Eggs Benedict (average), the Vegetarian Eggs Benedict with a side of salmon, and the Classic Eggs Benedict. I've had much much better eggs benedict. The best part of our meal was the Mama's Smoothie and the sides of salmon & sausage. 

Even worse, the Classic Eggs Benedict was extremely undercooked:  a good portion of the egg whites were clear, watery and raw. The waitress was very apologetic though and had a new plate prepared and checked up on us 2-3 afterwards to make sure everything was okay.

There are so many other brunch places in SF with better food and, although there will probably be a wait, they allow you to put your name on a list and come back when you can be seated versus standing in line like cattle and wasting 2.5 hours of your day waiting for average food. Very disappointed.
author: Amy G.

description:
Not sure anything is worth making customers wait for over an hour. I was in line since 8:10 & it was after 9:30 before getting in.  I thought, "There's almost no way to impress me now.  Don't bother."  I do wish  Someone could please make a list of places in San Francisco you can get in.
But when you DO get in, the food WILL be delicious and satisfying, and the service pretty prompt and responsive.  I'm glad I went.
author: Heather M.

description:
Great Family owned and run restaurant.  Ordered the French Toast sampler Banana nut, Cranberry orange and Walnut, and some other one.  Also added a single buttermilk pancake. They where awesome!

Wife ordered the Washington park Omellette with bacon, mushroom, and plenty of cheeses.  

Again was great HIGHLY recommend this place. We worth the wait.
author: Curtis W.

description: Wait one hour line, and just had my breakfast for 45 mins. The food was not that good, and not that bad. But i couldn't believes that they need to extra charge me for a cup of hot water.
author: Eva F.

description: Honestly, the best thing you will ever eat, no lie. Worth the 2+ hour wait. It's super cute and tiny and the food is just to die for. You will not be disappointed with anything you order, but my personal favs are the French toast, sampler, the huevos rancheros and the Benedict. But like I said everything here is delish!
author: Jess R.

description:
I'm sorry, what's the big deal with this place again?

Ordered the all-hailed Monte Cristo which was just a big lump of bread with thin slices of ham....... I don't get what the hype is. I feel like my mama can make it at home just as good (or better) except I don't have to wait in line an hour to eat it. My gf thought the Monte Cristo at Disneyland was wayyyy better... 

Also got the lox eggs benedict, which was good but nothing extraordinary... Tasted like any other benedict at any other brunch place.

I would pass on it next time if I had to wait in line an hour--It's just not worth the torture when u're hungry as hail. I don't understand how there's always long lines outside?!?Probably cuz it's so dang small with limited #s of tables. The homemade raspberry jam was good. That was the cherry on top for my friend.. but too much and you can say "hello" to diabetes cuz that thing was wayyy sweet
author: Cat P.

description: Fresh pressed orange juice. The staff is friendly and fun. The only hard part was trying to choose just one dish. We saw other couples sharing three dishes. Delicious and worth the wait.
author: Natalie B.

description: We went on a Friday at 8am and waited an hour before sitting down. It was well worth waiting for especially the monte Christo Sandwich. We figured we had to try their signature dish and ordered one for the table to share in addition to our meals. It did not disappoint, not only was it delicious it was also very unique, not something you could get somewhere else. We also ordered the cinnamon chocolate French toast, again, delicious. The California omelette and the eggs Benedict blackstone. It was all really good. I love my bacon well done and this bacon was perfect. We also ordered coffee cakes to go for later and they were SO good!! If you're trying to decide if the wait is worth it or not, I would say as long as it's an hour or less then yes. While the omelette and eggs Benedict were really good, you can find good omelettes and Benedict in many places, what makes the wait worth it was the monte christo, French toast, and coffee cakes.
author: Ashley M.

description:
It's  not worth waiting in a line to get in

Do not read this do not read this, my name is what my name is what. Yes that's right my name is what. Do not read this.
author: Fares A.

description:
We drove straight here from San Diego, an 8 hour drive and we arrived into the city around 6 AM. I read the amazing reviews this place has, and how you have to get here early in order to not wait in line for 1-2 hours. We were lucky enough to find a parking spot right across the street and just camped out for about an hour. Around 7:20, we saw people already starting to form a line so we jumped right in. We were the third party. We waited until they opened (8 AM), and then walked inside to first order, pay, and then be seated. I've never been to a restaurant with that style but I liked it a lot!
The food....AMAZING. Their raspberry jam...even better. Everything is incredible. I had the chocolate cinnamon French toast topped with berries, alongside a hot chocolate with tons of whip cream, and I seriously couldn't have been more satisfied. I now understand why when we finished and walked out there was a line up the street. It's worth it.
author: Natalia M.

description:
I wish Mama's served fourth meal... because it's 12:30am and I want French Toast!  


In all seriousness, the line can get a little outrageous, but it comes with the "Im in SF and if i don't wait at least an hour in some type of line it just aint worth it" territory. Welcome to the Bay Area, hipsters!  

Hands down, worth it though. there is nothing sweeter than the homemade jam being smothered onto your perfect cooked french toast. The ambiance is really cute too! Once you've entered their doors it's just like you've stepped into a home of an old friend, who makes damn good food.. and loves you. 


Swedish Cinnamon with fresh berries FTW!
author: Chelsea B.

description: I've been here a few times and the wait always out weighs the hype of this place. Stood in line for three hours to get a table and by this point you'll appreciate anything you get here. Although the smoothies are refreshing the breakfast isn't worth the wait. This would be a one time visit of your in SF and that's it.
author: Mariam K.

description:
I've been hearing about this place for years, and their long waits are infamous, (reason why we've never been.)

We were  in the neighborhood about an hour before closing, and decided we'd get in the relatively short line. We still waited about 30 minutes, but compared with the usual 2 hr waits, this was nothing.

I was unsure about what to order, and the guy who took my order steered me away from my original choice,and strongly suggested the monte cristo. I've never had one, but decided to go with his recommendation.

Granted i hadn't eaten all day, and hunger does make everything taste a little better...This was AMAZING. Seriously FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC. Worth every bit of hype, and every calorie.
Perfect portion size, not overly greasy, complete and total brunch perfection. 

My hubby had the corned beef hash, and it was ok.Unfortunately, it wasn't anything special, so I was nice enough to share my delicious sandwich with him.

I still wouldn't wait more than 45 minutes or so, but this was a stellar meal. The staff was pleasant, and the people at the tables on either side were chatty and nice.

If i could come back during the week at about the same time, (hopefully a shorter wait again) I would absolutely return.
author: Amanda G.

description: Get to Monte Cristo! It was delicious and you will be full until lunch. Oh, get there early because this is not a get in get out kind of place.
author: James B.

description:
T-O-U-R-I-S-T T-R-A-P.
Say it with me now.

I hate to rip on this place, because it's definitely not horrible, but over 2000 reviews on yelp will definitely create some hectic traffic.

The two hour wait for this place is not worth it. I made the pilgrimage through the long and winding line expecting greatness. The line actually lasted forever. I watched the season change, I saw birds hatch from their eggs and then start a family of their own before I even got close to getting a table. I was afraid this was some sort of Sisyphus joke, and instead of a carrying a boulder I would be stuck in a never ending line.

The pot of gold at the end of the rainbow didn't seem too golden when I finally got there. 

Was the food good? Sure! Was it the best? Not really. Was it worth spending two hours for? Not a chance. 

The worst part, I don't remember what I ordered. My girlfriend got the Monte Cristo, and it was alright. As for what I ordered, I may never remember.

If you get here early enough before an insanely long line forms, great. Walk right in an enjoy Mama's splendor. I'm sure there is an equal breakfast experience in this vast city that takes less than two hours to get to.
author: Nick A.

description:
Let's just say, be expected to wait, opens at 8. Got there at 750a and still had to wait almost 1.5 hrs , so getting there at 7 is the most , with that being said and out of the way, 

Wow 

The food is completely amazing !! Worth the wait.
Had the Blackwood eggs Benedict's , it was delicious, also had the chocolate french toast, it was the most amazing french toast I have ever had ,
Recommended to take cash, they charge extra (1$) for credit cards,
The mimosa was ok, Preferred the coffee,
Def recommend while waiting in line to grab a coffee somewhere else,
author: Laura A.

description:
Oh Mama's, you never seem to disappoint me. The food is always amazing and the quality of the food is top notch. I must admit that the wait in line could be pretty long but if you make the effort to go early in the morning, it isn't too bad. And did I already say that the food is AMAZING?!! I usually will get the French Toast Sampler or the Northwest Omlette (smoked salmon, capers, creme and leeks). The drinks are very refreshing as well. You can never go wrong with a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice but the alcoholic drinks are nothing less than delicious. The service is great too! 


P.S.
try their homemade jam!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Second time visiting and I had an even better experience than my first. Yes, you probably won't get in until the next round if you get in line after 7:30 AM. But geezus, the wait is so worth it!! 

Everything on their menu is delicious! I decided to be greedy and get the salmon Benedicts (homemade sauce) and the toast sampler (variety of their house made bread- YUM). Both was delicious but what got me was the POTATOES!!!! I don't know what is in them and how it is cooked but DANG- SO DELICIOUS!! 

The service was VERY polite and attentive as well! Waters refilled, requests done quickly, etc. which could get hard especially when you have a full house within the first 30 minutes!
author: Judy N.

description:
One of the top three breakfast places I've ever been to world wide. (Seattle, and Laguna Beach hold the other two). 

There will be a line, however, if you have the time a good buddy to enjoy the time with you will not be disappointed. The only sad thoughts I have regarding Mama's, is that I don't have enough time (or space in my stomach) to taste everything.
author: Matt G.

description:
Was the first person in line on a thursday. Got there at 7. Line really starts forming at 7:30 like clockwork so if u get there before then ur good. Got the pancakes with fresh fruit. amazingggggggg. Orange juice? Freshly squeezed. Definitely some of the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. Both get 5/5.

Didn't think the Dungeness crab eggs Benedict were that amazing. Good tho. Give it a 3.5/5 

French toasts are pretty basic. Stick with the pancakes.
author: Shannon Z.

description: We found this spot from a recommemdation of TEN PLACES YOU MUST GO IN SF in an article of TIME. and its definitely like what they said as MUST GO. me and my friend both enjoy our breakfast here and plus CHOCLATE FRENCH TOAST is highly recommended if you dont avoid sweet food!
author: Ted X.

description:
I've been to this signature breakfast place twice now-- First time was when I moved to the Bay Area six years ago-- and now just recently, over the weekend. The food here was just as good as the last time! 

We arrived as soon as they were open for business at 8am this Sunday and there was already a line-- The line was not too bad, we only ended up waiting 45 minutes,, and watching all the folks in the park across the street doing Tai Chi along with the sun shining down on us, made the wait completely painless. 

We all ordered different items: Vegetarian Benedict, Eggs Benedict, and the Dungess Crab Omelette Special from the counter as soon as we were ushered in the restaurant. Once we paid at the cashier, we were seated and served our breakfast within a short period of time. 

Table was almost completely quiet!-- Food couldn't be any better-- we all agreed that it was well worth the wait!
author: Cassandra E.

description: Mama's is a great breakfast joint located in SF. I was not expecting much here, but they really blew me away with their dishes and portion size. Everything was fresh and cooked properly. The only negative comment I can think of is the wait. There is not much seating inside, so prepare for a long wait. I felt like a chump standing outside for 1 hour, but I figured I mind as well commit since I'm there already. My advice for those who plan on going is to either come early or late in order to avoid the peak hours.
author: Owie N.

description:
I love you Mama!!! You treated me so well and made my taste buds and tummy sooo happy. I can't stop talking about the experience we had visiting you. 

From the moment we walked in our server, greeted us and asked if we knew what we wanted. We said yes so he sat us down and said he would put in our order. Typically you would have to walk up to the counter, order and then wait to be seated. I wish I would asked for his name because he was good. He had this ability to make us feel comfortable in a small crowded restaurant and make us laugh. 
We ordered the monte cristo and the Dungeness crab omelette because of the reviews. I'm happy we went with Yelpers recommendations. 
Those of you that eat monte cristos know that they can be on the greasy or heavy side at times. Mama makes the best, light, fluffy most flavorful monte cristo I've ever had. Perfect balance of sweet and savory. Use the jam....you won't regret it. The crab omelette came out and I honestly didn't think much of it at first. I wouldn't have ordered based off looks alone. Wow, wow, wow!! Filled with real chunks of Dungeness crab, havarti cheese and avocado. Sooooo good. All the sides of home style potatoes and fruit were all good which was to be expected. 
My only gripe would be the hour long wait. It was kind of fun chatting with strangers in line about what they were going to order. I met a couple that went two days in a row. Two days and waiting an hour each time. That's crazy! But after hearing that I was sold and excited to try the food. So I recommend to wait in line, have someone in your party go down the street to grab some coffee, make some friends and get ready to enjoy some great food. Delicious! 

4.5 stars minus .5 for the wait. 

Oh! Go around lunch time if you can wait that long. The line isn't as long.
author: Tony C.

description: It's worth the wait. This place is a food voyeur's paradise and a carb lover's paradise.  Everything looks amazing and it's impossible not to look at everyone else's food as it comes out. The French toast was so good it didn't even need syrup, we sampled three types of crumb cake during our two visits - all delicious, and my daughter ordered the pancakes both times.  Service was friendly and not at all hurried.
author: Julie G.

description:
OK....this is beginning to scare me....another American food place I liked and breakfast food to boot....oh well....

We got here around 7:30 AM and we were the FIRST haha....how do all you guys that have had to wait in line here like that? Muahahahah!!!! I hear that normally you have to be here earlier. I've heard about two hour lines. Actually being in line for Mama's is quite an experience. The people in line were quite friendly and there were people chatting up and down the line. We chatted away with the first people that arrived.

Finally 8 AM arrived and we found out that now you have to order at the register and then sit down. This was not good for my BF since he didn't really know what he wanted and felt he had to make a choice fast since there were soooo many people in line behind us. I already knew what I wanted from the moment he proposed Mama's days earlier. I always order Eggs Florentine at breakfast places. I do not think that the way they have you order here is a good idea since the way from the door to the register is too narrow for them to be doing that. It looks bad too. This is one of the reasons I gave them 4 stars instead of 5.

My Eggs Florentine had the BEST hollandaise sauce EVER!!!! I would have liked more spinach though. I forgot to ask for my eggs over hard. I am not a fan of runny yolk....oh well.... The potatoes that came with the eggs were really good. My double cappuccino was great too.

My BF had Eggs Benedict. It was delicious as well. Nice tasting ham in it.

We shared the French Toast Sampler. The french toast was made of home made bread. Banana, cranberry and cinnamon bread. The cranberry bread was the best and one of the best cranberry breads I have ever had....wow!!!! It was as good as cranberry bread I had tasted in the First Grade which i have never forgotten. Wow....nice sweet and sour cranberries....mmmm!!!! The pieces of bread are pretty small though. However, they do give you a good amount of fruits with the bread. Notably, they serve fresh blueberries and strawberries....mmmm!!!!

The second reason this place does not get 5 stars is because woe is anyone who really needs to go to the bathroom here. There is only one and it is somewhere behind the area where the dishwashers work. I had to wait and wait and wait and WAIT for the person that was in there to finish. All the time I was WAITING I had to dodge customers and waiters and busboys haha! Not fun at all and you begin to feel quite silly just standing there! That's just how narrow this place is. It's a really small and narrow restaurant.

One of the best things about my Mama's experience is that I got a window seat. There is a really cool view of the grassy plaza in front of the restaurant from the seat I chose. If you are lucky you just may get to see groups of people practicing Tai Chi in that park. According to a lady that was reading a newspaper behind us, the day we were here was the same day when DiMaggio tried to wed Monroe in the church that is in front of the plaza. Interesting, though I am a fan of neither. Someone said that the reason we got lucky to be the first in line was likely because people were fearing rain and the morning was particularly cold!
I love the weather here it even scares off locals haha!!!!
author: Miguel R.

description:
The wait is ridiculous! But even so, eating at Mama's is something you have to do at least once.

As you wait in line to order, you have a clear view of the cooks preparing the food with all the fresh, vibrant ingredients. It helped me make my decision on what to order since everything on the menu sounded so good. I went with the North Beach benedict and shared it with my girl who ordered the Blackstone benedict. The North Beach was on the saltier side but still delicious. However, I think I'd prefer the Blackstone with the crunchy, hearty bacon. The poached eggs were perfectly runny and soaked into the store-bought English muffins. The potatoes accompanying the benedicts were hearty, earthy, and very comforting. I'd order both of these again. In addition, I had a taste of the banana nut French toast too. It was a delicious bread with lots of flavor but lacked a crunchy, eggy exterior that characterized French toast as French toast. It was almost as if the banana nut bread wasn't coated in an egg batter at all.

The Monte Cristo seemed to be a crowd favorite, but I really didn't think it was that special. It really needed the homemade jam, which is probably good on everything, for it to taste great. It was a regular sandwich to me.

When I come back, it won't be because I'm craving Mama's, but because it's some sort of an occasion, i.e. catching up with friends I haven't seen in months. I doubt I'd be back on a regular weekend or weekday just for the hell of it. Overall, great food, good atmosphere
author: Angie Y.

description: Classic SF brunch spot in the heart of North Beach. The line can get very very long so bring some people to help entertain you while you're waiting. Or just play a few rounds of "Heads Up" on your iPhone. :) Everything on the menu is delicious, you can't go wrong here.
author: Samara C.

description: We went to mama's for our anniversary brunch and we were not dissapointed at all! The line is long but it's well worth it! You order and then you are seated and you don't have to wait long for your food! many people say they should expand to have it bigger, but I like it just is. Very cozy, you feel like you're home. And it's just right. So keep doing what you're doing mama's cause I will certainly come back again!
author: Rieana M.

description:
Long queue but... what do you expect, it's San Francisco and this place is worth it! Shared the pancakes and eggs benedict plus a glass of fresh orange juice with a friend and all were excellent. 

Highly recommend, just get there super early if you don't want to wait so long to get in.
author: Kate B.

description: Always worth the wait. My parents have never waited an hour and a half to eat anywhere but once we ate they understood why and would go back. Staff is nice also.
author: Sasha V.

description: My 2nd time to Mama's but not as good as the first time. Prepare to wait up to an hour to be seated unless you're right there at opening. Suggest ordering bfast items anytime during the day instead of lunch. Wait staff very nice.
author: WTroy B.

description: We came at noon on a weekday so the wait was minimal.  The classic Eggs Benedict were outstanding!  Eggs perfectly cooked and the hollandaise had a nice little kick.  The chorizo scrambler was also very good.  The fresh pico was a nice touch.  Also tried the chocolate cinnamon French toast.  Would probably try the French toast sampler next time.
author: Keith K.

description:
Got here at 730 Sunday morning. Had a total wait of one hour. Had a group of four, which probably would be near impossible to sit if we weren't in the earlier cohort. 

Overall, while claiming ignorance on its historical aspect, this place is not worth waiting for brunch. The blueberry pancakes were soft but not unique. The omelets good, but similar to Brendas. French Toast is French Toast. 

Method of serving is very impersonal.. Order at the register, loiter around for a seat, get stuffed into an open spot, get brought the food, and then get hovered on by the customers waiting in line, waiting for a table, waiting to order, and the servers. 

As the tour guide who drove by hilariously said... 'Doors open at 8, line open at 630.' and not worth it. By the way, I was told you can order for pick up, and then just eat in the park.
author: Lars B.

description: Why does everyone say it's worth the wait?!! Sorry to be a downer, but truthfully speaking, it's not the best. Even though I only waited half an hour (arrived at 8:30 am, and amazingly WAY shorter than other people's reviews), the food was still only average to me. I had the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast, and my boyfriend had the Monte Cristo. The portions are generous, but there wasn't anything spectacular about the dishes. The atmosphere of the place felt homey, almost like you're really in your mom's kitchen! :) That was the only thing I liked about this place, but I definitely wouldn't wake up early for this again. I simply gave it a try to see what the hype was about, and left a little disappointed in the end.
author: Miranda T.

description: The wait was pretty long but the food was great! A little expensive but definitely delicious.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
You'll NEVER, EVER  find a better place for breakfast.  BEST on planet earth.  Skip any negative reviews here because obviously these people have no taste buds!  SO worth the wait, and if you don't like waiting, get there early so you're in the first seating.  

You like pancakes?  GREAT!!  Blueberry pancakes to die for.  Chocolate cinnamon French toast....AMAZING.  Fresh crab benedicts....it just doesn't get better people.

This is a local favorite for a reason.  GET THERE!
author: Mary L.

description: Seriously it is always worth the wait! Been eating at Mama's for over 20 years, and it's always perfect.  The food is art and made with love.  There's a line for a reason, it's that good.  A meal at Mama's is always on the schedule every time we visit the city.
author: Kim L.

description: Line was too too long on a Wednesday morning ..... food was average at best, a little bet on the prices side.
author: Anthony H.

description: Get there early! We got there at 8 am on a Friday and there was already a line the length of the restaurant.  We made it in by 8:40 and it was worth the wait.  The kitchen is small (like the restaurant) but open, all of the pastries, bread and seafood are out in the front case and you can see the cooks working.  Everything is made to order. I went with a few friends and we each ordered a meal and decided to share the lemon blueberry French toast! I got the huevos rancheros which came with 2 poached eggs, rice, beans, ranchero sauce, avocado, salsa and 3 corn tortillas.  It was amazing! I was so full, but I couldn't stop eating.  Another person got the breakfast sandwich special, which was a fried egg, havarti, cheddar, aioli and avocado, also delicious and the other person got the veggie omelette with sour dough.  There were so many veggies.  This is definitely on my list for when I visit next.
author: Elaine P.

description: Great traditional family American diner. Pancakes were fluffy and French toast had the perfect consistency. Their coffee is average but their homemade jam is superb. We went on a rainy Saturday and had to wait in line for about 40 minutes. Service was great and so was the food, totally worth it.
author: Cristina H.

description:
Long wait time!
We went pretty late on a Sunday and waited about 45 minutes.... The food was good! Not as good as everyone raves and certainly not worth the 1-2 hour wait!
With that said, if you are in the area and can spare the time it is certainly a neat little restaurant!
author: Kimia R.

description: First, don't be intimated by the line. This place is a must and it's worth the wait. It opens at 8am so if you want "first seating," get there no later than 7:30am. The best breakfast we've ever had in fact. My personal favs are the the crab benedict (special menu) and the salmon bene (regular). The Monte Cristo seems to be the house fav but I have yet to try this. Fresh baked breads and original menu make this restaurant worthy of its reputation. Until next time!
author: Angelina N.

description:
I usually don't like breakfast food, but I really liked Mama's!! 

We headed there on a weekday to try to avoid the weekend lines, but still ended up waiting about 30 mins. You order at the counter, where you can see the food being made and all the yummy-looking ingredients! I got the french toast sampler and a mango smoothie, and my bf got the shrimp egg benedict. Both were so good!!! I was using the syrup that came with the french toast at first, but one of the waiters later suggested that I try it with the raspberry jam on the table. Such a good call! 

I really liked the cozy atmosphere, and the waiters were really friendly and attentive! I can't wait to try more of their dishes!
author: Rose Y.

description: Freeeeaaaakin long line, had to wait over an hour (90min) to get in. No txt message services or whatsoever you just have to stand in line. Kinda got annoyed while waiting, thinking whether the food would be worth the wait. And...YES HELLL YESSS!!!!!! Soooooo goood. I'd recommend Egg Benedicts instead of omelettes. Soooooo gooooood. I really do want to go to mama's again, but the long wait is making me hesitate....but in conclusion, its a must go to place (at least for once)!!!
author: Heidi L.

description:
I've been quite lucky (and spoiled) enough to dine at different brunch spots around the Bay, but there was nothing remarkable about Mama's compared to the rest. I know it's an institution and what not, but I think there are other comparable and even better places to eat. 

- French toast sampler: This is the recommended one since you get a slice of each of their special breads. The main problem for me was that the toast wasn't light and airy. It was good, but nothing special. I could find similar toasts at other places.
- North Italian omelette: I really liked the pancetta because it was unique and gave it a distinct flavor. Everything worked well together. What ruined the plate for me was the homefries, which were inconsistent. Some were well-done and some were just soggy and chewy. We actually ordered an extra side of it and regretted it.

The service was great throughout; they were prompt with refilling our water and didn't try and rush us even though there were people waiting. Honestly, I was more annoyed at the guy standing next to us waiting for our seat. I liked Mama's, but there was nothing special that makes me want to return.
author: Allison S.

description:
I love mama's. I remember when I was in grade school when my aunt and uncle pulled me out of school so we could go to Mama's :) The key is to go on a weekday during non-prime hour. If you go on a weekend plan on waiting over 45 min to an hour to get a seat. It's a super small place, and you order at the counter then you get seated. 

I love the eggs benedict. The eggs are cooked perfectly and the hollandise sauce is yummalicious. Don't forget the french toast! 

Hint: if you're waiting in line and it's before noon, and you're hungry, run across the street to the foccacia place. Go get yourself pizza foccacia, hmmmmmm
author: Vanessa K.

description:
After a late night drinking with friends, I woke up early with a serious need for coffee and a big, filling breakfast to fuel my adventures around the city. Mama's was the perfect way to start the day and ignited my serious love affair with San Francisco.

I arrived at Mama's around 7:30 and took my place in the short line that had already begun to form. Make sure to get their early, because the line can grow quite long (even on a Thursday morning). 

Inside, Mama's is a charming cozy cafe with bright tables and accents that offer an instant mood booster (no matter how severe the hangover). The food is simply delicious. I ordered the Washington Square omelet. It was the perfect amount of savory and spicy, not to mention the size of a regulation football. The grilled potatoes were exceptionally seasoned and cooked to perfection. The servers were friendly and constantly check in to see how things were going and to refill my cup with hot coffee. 

Mama's is worth the wait and a wonderful spot to begin a busy day in San Francisco. 

Hit It: 
Washington Square Omelet
author: Colin O.

description:
This came highly recommended to us by a local. We were warned against a long wait, but I really had no idea. We arrived on a Thursday morning at 8:35 a.m., and there was already a line of about 30 people outside the restaurant. The line was moving very slow, too. I started second-guessing the wait, but people came out and were raving about how delicious it was. 

At around 9:30 a.m., we finally made it inside - only to discover ANOTHER line that you wait in to order. Then, you wait again for a table to open up. All in all, we waited an hour and a half just to get our food -- on a Thursday.

I ordered the Californian omelette. It was good - not a more than 15 minute wait good, though. My colleague ordered the french toast sampler. I fear that perhaps I selected the wrong item after trying a bite of her french toast. It was good. Again, I would argue it's not an hour and a half wait good. There's not many food items I would wait an hour and a half for. 

Once we were seated, the service was attentive and good. There's a tiny bathroom outside, which was a little strange. 

Overall, I didn't find the food to be worth the wait. I'd go back if it were only a 15-20 minute wait at most. I imagine you would want to avoid a place like this on a Saturday, as well. It did seem to be mostly tourists.
author: Ashley V.

description:
Ok ok. Never heard of it before my BF mentioned it during our SF trip. Didn't exactly understand what the fuss was about, especially with their 1hr + wait. I was already turned off. However, I stuck it out like a good GF and waited a total of 80 minutes on a sunny SF Saturday afternoon (we arrived at 12:40pm). Once you're finally inside, sorry, its ANOTHER wait in line to order at the counter, then another 8-10min wait till a table is actually cleared.

Started off w/ a carrot cake since we were starving. Deliciously good w/ a not too thick/not too sweet cream cheese frosting. My other half had if I remember correctly, the dungeon crab eggs benedict, might as well go big after all that waiting. He was very pleased.  Went with the yelp reviewer recommendations and got the Monte Cristo. One of the best food decisions of my life. It was like a french toast sandwich (minus the syrup). Mmmm.  The highlight of this Mama's brunch experience that I must mention is their homemade strawberry jam. That shit don't play. Spread a little on your Monte Cristo, and you're in brunch heaven. Wish I could've taken some of that jam to-go.  

We had a peach bellini & red wine punch (sangria) to celebrate making it to our destination inside of Mama's ......and to make up for all the waiting. HAVE FUN WAITING IN LINE EVERYONE !!!!!!!!!!
author: Janine D.

description:
Ok, so I have to rate the venue and the food separately:
Venue: 1 star
Food: 3 stars

So, the food is decent. A friend and I shared a couple of specials: the crab cake benedict and the French toast sampler. The crab cake benedict was ok; kind of a chintzy fried flat crab cake. Not that impressed. The side of potatoes was delicious, and the eggs were perfectly cooked. The French toast platter was AWESOME. Especially the banana bread one. Yum!

I also ordered a Bloody Mary, which tasted kind of weird. Apparently (according to the menu) they make it with soju instead of vodka, so maybe that's why. I couldn't drink more than a quarter of it before I abandoned it.

But the venue. Goodness, what a trainwreck. For some odd reason they do not keep a list of names like a normal restaurant - you are forced to line up outside and wait like you're at the mall on Black Friday. When you finally get to the door and are allowed to enter the restaurant, you still don't get to relax. You have to get in a second line to order your food. After all that, you get to the register... only to find that they do not accept credit cards. Cash and debit cards only. When you're seated, it is cramped.

Additionally, the bathroom setup is really weird. In order to get there, you have to cut through a portion of the kitchen, go outside, down some steps, and into a teeny tiny unisex bathroom. I'm not sure how a disabled patron would use the restroom.

All in all, I'd be willing to give the food another shot, but maybe order takeout if they allow it. The venue is just too inconvenient.
author: Cindy W.

description: Amazing!! Well worth the wait!! I ordered the Monte Cristo and omg delicious (would've posted a picture but ate it so fast lol). The atmosphere was nice, food was sooooo yummy and the servers were so so friendly and happy. Love this place will definitely come back the next time we visit SF and recommended it to everyone!
author: Annie N.

description: Reading other comments about the delicious food and the 30 or 45 min wait can be a very powerful reason to decide to stand in line for almost two hours on a Sunday morning, outside under the hot sun, on a beautiful Spring day. Really... One start. We were told that it was going to take 45 mins... Also, be aware of the $10 bill tip that was "left" on the table when you sit down... It is a "subliminal" message because it travels from table to table to leave a clear message about being generous to the waitresses.
author: Claudia Mar R.

description: It is pretty good here, worth the wait if it's under 30 mins... Over an hour id say no, the staff are nice and helpful. Good Solid food. Comfort food...Homemade jam, potatoes, bread. Grapefruit mimosas, fresh squeezed juice. Food and service are definitely good. The omelettes and French toast are delicious. We are totally stuffed!!
author: Summer C.

description: The queue was insane! We were there since 7.40am, before the restaurant opened at 8am. Queued for a total of 1.5 hours to enter the restaurant, not including queuing to order the food and waiting for the food to be served. Food was nice, waiters and servers were friendly and entertaining, but don't think I'll want to do the queuing again.
author: Lin N.

description:
My boyfriend and I waited nearly 2 hours for this. I was impatient obviously because I had work but whatever. 4 stars because I hate waiting! But don't get me wrong, the food was great. I loved it. My boy friend ordered an omelette (I'm not sure which one it was) and I ordered one of the plainer entrees; scrambled eggs, toast, potatoes, and added bacon for about $1.50. The tiny place felt very comfy as well. 

I wish we had chosen to dine in but I was running late to work so we ordered out.

Oh! And for those that use debit/credit cards like me, BRING CASH!!! They charge you  an extra dollar for any card purchases. 

Overall, I love Mama's and I wouldn't mine going again. :)
author: Cleo C.

description:
We got to Mamas at around 11 on a Saturday morning and didn't get seated until 11:45. I was pretty hungry, and for nearly an hour, all I could do was watch other people eat through the window. Not the way I wanted to spend a cold January morning.
We had to wait in another line for 15 more minutes after getting into the restaurant. That was okay though because it gave me time to figure out what I wanted to order. I tried the florentine benedict and the french toast sampler. The poached eggs in the benedict were at the perfect gooey level, but other than that, the dish did not impress me. The french toast looked fresh coming out of the kitchen, but it was more soggy than I had wished. I have definitely had better french toast at other places in SF. 
I don't regret going here to see what the hype was all about, but I don't think the food was spectacular enough to justify the wait.
author: Alfred L.

description:
Brunch is now my favorite meal of the day thanks to this place!!!

I came here to eat with my boyfriend for my 17th birthday and waited 50 minutes before I was seated. I'm the kind of person that hates waiting more than 10 minutes to be seated, but the food here is WORTH the wait! Staff was on task, very kind and takes good care of the tables theyre serving and the place is very decorated and clean. My first visit was a delight!

I ordered the Northern Italian omelette with bacon, mushrooms, cheese with house potatoes and whole grain toast. I liked my meal although I thought the bacon was a bit too salty and the house potatoes were bland, I loved my toast!!! It was already buttered and the waitress suggested their HOMEMADE jam on bread. THEIR JAM IS 10X BETTER THAN JAM IN JARS. It had a nice consistency, strawberry bits, and just the right amount of sweet!

My partner ordered the Washington Square with spicy Italian sausage, bell peppers, onions,cheese with house potatoes and sourdough baguette. It tasted ALOT like pizza with italian sausage and cheese with bell peppers lol. He also thought the potatoes were bland. He had some of my whole grain bread because the sourdough baguette was too hard to eat, so DO NOT GET THE SOURDOUGH BREAD! Other than the bread, he liked his dish. 

We shared the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast and it was deliciously sweet! The bread was kind of hard to cut, but overall it was good and it made us super full!

I cannot wait to come back again to try more of their godly foods, so I will be back and hopefully it wont be more than an hour wait !
author: Josie D.

description:
3.5 stars

Food's not bad, but definitely not as amazing as I expected for the 1-2 hr wait. I hate waiting for food and if I do, it better be pretty damn good haha. This place has good food, but over hyped for sure. I don't know why they can't let people write down names instead of stand in line.

Will I go back? Maybe...only if someone waits in line for me and I can go in immediately. Otherwise, there are many many brunch places in SF that are just as good if not better. Worth a try if you don't mind waiting, but mm it's just okayyy.
author: Grace H.

description:
Yes I waited almost an hour for this place but it was so worth it. I love breakfast and when I go out of town I love breakfast at a sit down place. 

I got the Dungeness Crab Benedict and an order of pancakes to share with my gf. The crab benedict was good, there were giant chunks of crab and the spinach went well with the entree and didn't make me feel like such a fatty.  The pancake was satisfying I love all the berries you get on your pancake. 

Is it worth the wait... well... hmm... I liked it! I'd be willing to wake up after a long night of partying to come here and wait so my friends wouldn't have to wait in line and then crawl back into bed afterwards. 

I heart breakfast!

By the way the line is deceiving... once u go into the restaurant there is another section of line u need to wait in =/
author: Lindsay C.

description: I will start off my review by saying that I'm not a big breakfast fan. I usually like pretty plain items like scrabbled eggs and bacon. We walked from our hotel to mamas to see a big line. I'm going to guess 30-45 people ahead of us. It took about an hour to get through the line to get inside. Then once inside you get inside, you then stand in another line to order. This next line took about 15 minutes. I ordered a Bloody Mary and classic eggs Benedict. To start, the place is very small so seating is tight. We sat and waited about 15 minutes for the food to come. My Bloody Mary was one of the worst I've had. It was similar to eating straight pepper. I only drank about half of it because it was burning my stomach and I couldn't stomach another sip. The eggs Benedict was nothing special. Poached eggs over ham on an English muffin. I've had better. All in all, it's a lot of hype. I asked my wife what score she would give it. She said 3-3.5 and she loves breakfast. I would give this place another chance if there was no wait, but that doesn't seem like it's going to happen.
author: Taylor R.

description: Good breakfast.  Not great.  I would not wait more than 15 minutes for a table with a city full of good food.
author: Kristin Y.

description:
Monte cristo and eggs benedict with shrimp was super yummy. 
Reached before 8am so that I don't need to line up for too long. 
Line up, order, pay, take a seat, eat and go. 
Service was great. 
Would definitely go back whenever im in San Fran.
author: Ydnew L.

description: Tasting their egg Benedict was a great experience   although it was Tuesday it was still super crowded and long wait
author: Sara K.

description:
Mama's, Mama's, Mama's! You are SO worth waiting in line for.

I came here with my boyfriend for brunch on a Thursday afternoon. There were about 15-20 people in line and the wait was about an hour for two people. Parking wasn't too bad, however, on weekends, it can get a little hectic so be prepared. Don't forget to feed your meter if you don't find a free 2 hour parking spot nearby!

While waiting, I tried so hard not to look like a total creeper by watching the people enjoy their meals, but it was difficult! When you get to the front of the line, there is a menu: check it! They have plenty of breakfast/lunch items to choose from and yes, it may be difficult to make a decision, but you can always come back another day to try another thing on the menu. Once you get to the front of the line, you have to wait in another line to order your food/wait for a table. Here comes the hard part: MAMA'S WILL TEASE YOU! As you are waiting, you will be able to see the cooks prepare other people's meals right in front of you! After you go through that torture, they will direct you to your seats.

Luckily, my boyfriend and I were seated right away because we had a small party. Due to Mama's modest size, they really do their best to sit people together instead of separating their parties. I ordered the french toast sampler and Mama's potatoes while my boyfriend ordered the monte cristo sandwich.

French Toast Sampler: It came with a Cinnamon Swirl French Toast, Banana Nut French Toast, and a Cranberry Walnut French Toast sprinkled with banana slices, strawberries, and blueberries accompanied with syrup. This was probably the best french toast I've ever had. The outside was perfectly crispy, was drenched in smooth butter, and the bread was just phenomenal! The syrup was very good and complemented the french toast slices. The fruit was sweet and fresh, too!

Mama's Potatoes: These were just okay. Unlike Plow, these potatoes were bland and lacked flavor. I'd say the potatoes were forgettable!

Monte Cristo Sandwich: This was so good! Probably one of the best Monte Cristo's I've tasted and I didn't feel like I was going to have a heart attack right after! The Monte Cristo was perfectly fried, the cheese was smooth and creamy, and the ham was thin and flavorful. The berry jam complemented the sandwich and gave it the sweetness factor it lacked.

The total was $30 for 2 people which might be on the pricy side, but worth every penny! I will be back.
author: Joyce E.

description:
I agree with those reviewers who say it's not worth the wait.  Ninety minutes on a Tuesday makes it unlikely that I'll re-visit Mama's anytime soon.  We arrived at 9 AM and joined the line wrapped around the restaurant's outside corner.  Mama's doesn't take reservations and you can't put your name down on a list and return when it's time.  You must have someone waiting in line at all times.  Thankfully there are several coffee shops nearby and you can pick up a coffee while another member of your party holds your place.  

Once you finally get to the front of the line, the host will let you enter.  You'll be ushered to the counter where you, first, order and pay for your food, and then, get shown to your table.

The food was good, but nothing more amazing than other SF brunch spots.  The two of us shared a slice of blueberry bread, one of their eggs benedict specials, and the french toast sampler.  The blueberry bread and eggs benedict were both very good, but the french toast sampler was a disappointment.  The french toast was dry (I think the bread needed to be soaked longer before being cooked) and the different samples tasted more or less the same.  If there is a next time for me, I would try the blueberry pancakes - the table next to us seemed really to be enjoying them. 

Prices were reasonable and the historic value of the location and restaurant were very cool, but the 90-minute wait on a weekday is just too much to make Mama's a go-to spot for me.
author: Kimya P.

description: Five stars plus. Worth every second you have to wait in line.  No trip to SFO in complete without a stop here. I have told 100 people about this place.
author: Steven S.

description:
Did you know that there is a California Egg Commissioner?? Well there is, and i'm guessing this guy is not really good at his job. because seriously poached eggs are not suppose to be cooked to the core.  

so after years and years about hearing just how great Mama's is, my friend and i decided to give it a try.. figuring that it was raining, the line just might be short.. note key word MIGHT.. and no it wasn't short.  it was pretty long. we got there at 12 and didnt'  get in the door until 2. When i mean in the door, i mean you still have to wait after you enter the place. so you actually order while you are in line when you get inside. 

ADVICE- they don't accept credit cards or personal checks and they dont do separate checks for party of 5 or more. So bring Cash and Change 

so we had the french toast sample, washington square, and eggs florentine. the hot chocolate was pretty good and really cute. but when it came to the food. the blueberry crumb cake was the best out of everything we ordered.  the eggs floretine was not good. the eggs were cooked, which shouldn't be.  i was highly dissappointed in the potatoes as well because it was burnt. the french toast was ok, i had better.  and i guess i'm not a huge fan of their washington square, i didn't even feel like touching it after a few bites.  i feel the service is ok, not as good as the other places i've been to. 

if you want better breakfast, go to Zazie in cole valley, you won't regret it!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Wait was terrible... Be here early! Not for late risers.

Order their cakes and coffee while standing in line. Food was healthy for most brunch places. Cash or debit only.. So no credit card points!

Had the Washington omelette with shrimp and rye.
author: Varun D.

description:
Waited in line for 2 HOURS. Was it worth it? NO.

But the food was good. Especially now that I know they do takeout! 

The line is what allured me to be honest. I live 3 spots over from it so I see the line every morning. I had to try it out...and of course I went on the busiest day of the week (Sunday). If you MUST wait in line, go during the week. I know for sure that it's much less crowded.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Absolutely worth the two hours we waited in the rain!  We got there at 8am and weren't seated until 10:15!  

Great service, AMAZING food!  I can't remember what I ordered because I ended up stealing my sister in law's Dungness Crab Benedict.  It was phenomenal (and this is coming from someone who doesn't enjoy seafood!). 

I'm from LA so I can't think of the next time I'll be back to enjoy this again . But I sure dream about those farm fresh eggs and heavenly Dungness Benedict often... 

Do not skip this place simply because you don't want to wait!  Yes, it's worth every minute...  Be patient, go with good company , you definitely won't regret it.
author: Lala M.

description:
Visited last Thursday the 25th of March and WOW! we're sooooooooooooooooooo glad we did!  Sarah was our server and she was very sweet.  Yes, we waited an hour and fifteen minutes....but SO WHAT! You're in one of the busiest cities, suck it up.  Good food is worth waiting for.
My mom and I got Uncle Sy's spicy Bloody Mary; I did not see the word "spicy" on the menu (too excited to eat).  My mom couldn't drink it because it was too spicy, no worries, Sarah came to the rescue with more tomato juice (which I used). My mom returned and they were gracious and gave us our money back in cash.
We ordered the Monte Cristo, Benedict omelette that my husband doctored up, 2 different french toasts and 2 other omelettes (yes, we were hungry).  Wow! All was amazing, especially the Monte Cristo - best I've ever had.
We found out that Uncle Sy and his nephew are the remaining family that run the place and they do it great.  
WE will be back and we've told others about you that live there and haven't tried you yet.  
You WILL be there for 50 more years to come, congrats on being consistent and giving a shit!
It's appreciated from one restaurant owner to another.
Lasinda
author: Lasinda C.

description:
I will say that I enjoyed the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast. It wasn't really as chocolatey as I thought it would be, but it was well cooked and tasted good. The berries and bananas on top were a nice addition and very fresh.

My husband got the French Toast Sampler and wasn't a fan. He said the Banana Nut didn't taste like French Toast at all, it tasted like a basic banana bread. The Cranberry Orange Bread tasted like oranges with egg whites on top. He liked the Cinnamon. 

The thing that got me, was watching the food being prepared. The cooks were not wearing gloves and they were touching every piece of food. Literally. They put chopped herbs on top of the omelettes by sprinkling them and then rubbing them on the top. They took potatoes off the grill and pushed them onto the plate with their hands. They took handfuls of fruit, with their bare hands. What happened to gloves?
author: Sarah Y.

description: Visiting San Francisco I was expecting a really good food considering this was my playground during my teen years. However, after 2 days of bad food we were so happy to find this place. The food is worth the wait, a hour to 2 depending on when you get there. The key is to get there at 7:30 before the restaurant opens you will be in the first seating at 8. The food is really good. We got the sample French toast, shrimp eggs Benedict, and various other dishes to share. It was the best meal I've had in SF during this visit. Service was great. She told us where to find good food.
author: Mary N.

description:
2 years later and this place is still the shiz. My NY girlfriend came to visit me over the holidays, and she only expects the best when it comes to food. We aimed to arrive at 8 (which is when the place opens) on a Sunday because the line gets long. Luckily found parking nearby and got in line by 8:05. The line was pretty long and the place just opened 5 minutes ago. The wait was about an hour but went by pretty quickly if you're chatting it up with friends. 2 of my friends went to La Boulange and grabbed us some hot drinks and macarons to enjoy while we waited. 

I really wanted to have the dungeness crab benedict ($19), but being the broke grad student that I am, I went for the eggs florentine. French toast is usually my default, but have recently fallen in love with poached eggs. Eggs perfectly poached; flavorful hollandaise; and perfect potatoes. Definitely beats any of the $15+ eggs benedicts I've had in NY. 

Here are my tips:

-If you do get the french toast, it's imperative that you add some of their homemade jam to your french toast. It's takes it to a whole nother level. 

-Get in line before the place even opens.
author: Katrina L.

description:
You can tell that everything is prepared with the highest quality at Mama's. The atmosphere is sunny and intimate, and the service was phenomenal. 

I ordered the Monte Cristo because of all of the Yelp hype, and have to say I was slightly disappointed (it's a little too much bread in my opinion). I did try the Salmon Benedict, which was awesome, and loved the homemade jam. Definitely worth waiting in line, at least once!
author: Lauren L.

description:
I know the line is insane. 

And my wait till the food arrived was more like 1hr 30 to 2 hrs then the 1 hr i had expected.. 

***** Take outs have to wait in line on weekends*****

I thought I could've just grabbed and go.. 
but... that didn't happen. 

Plus I had a really bad breakfast in santa cruz the day before. 

But I know Mama's will not disappoint. 

So I just waited in line.. 

Ok back to the food. 


Yes their monte cristo is everything people says . 
Its beyond me how they can make their monte cristo so soft, cheesy, and just pure yum. 
While other people's monte cristos look like they came from those fried twinkie stations at state fairs/ OC Fair/ LA fair.

Please let me know if I can find a good monte cristo similar to mama's any where in socal. 
I'd love to give it a try.


We also ordered the french toast platter... not a fan.. 
It didn't really stand out in any way. Especially compare to the monte cristo

Last time I was here. 
We had a chorizo Benedict, it sucked.... 
It was like they're trying to be creative but  failed.. 

I think we also has a dungeness crab omeltte, i think it had brie and avocado with it. not too sure. 
But It was really fresh! It was like you can taste the freshness of the ingredients .  You don't need any other sauces or spices to mask the flavor in any way.
author: s y.

description:
Not sure if it's worth the wait. But the Monte Cristo is a sure thing. I'm not too fond of ham, but it tasted so good in this sandwich! The french toast sampler was mediocre. And the omelet my friend ordered was not as bad as I thought it would be. But if you really want to come here, I'd say the Monte Cristo is the only thing worth waiting over an hour for. The fresh juice was meh. I ordered a large orange juice and it wasn't really that large. And you can skip out on the Mama's Smoothie. It tastes funny. 

Their kitchen was very clean. As you wait in line to order your food, you can actually see the cooks making everyones food. The staff was also quite warm and welcoming. But this one waiter was kind of weird. I think he was trying too hard to be funny. I asked if I could have a straw and he replied no. Of course he eventually gave it to me but I don't think that was very funny. And he also did it again to my friend when she asked for a box to go. And then it becomes awkward when he says no because honestly, what do you say to that because you know they're going to give it to you?? Weird guy, but friendly. And cute too. Lol. 

When we finished eating, there was no line. So I suggest arriving after 1:30 if you want to skip the long wait.
author: Amy X.

description: went there at Saturday.  Love the food but is it worth to wait in a long line for 2 hrs?
author: Jie Ying H.

description:
AMAZING. totally worth the wait. the food tastes very fresh, even the coffee is great - strong and tasty, none of that light stuff that adds much less than a pep to your step. the food selection is extensive, the service is really outstanding - we had a female waitress who really made us feel cared for and not looked down upon (we were obviously tourists). brought my two year old with me who had yet to get accustomed to the pacific time zone (we're from east coast) and we got absolutely no dirty looks! i had the dungeness crab eggs Benedict. I'm still dreaming about it... 

the wait is substantial. but you're in for a perfectly enjoyable and comfortable eating experience.
author: Jazmin L.

description:
"Aw crap I can't believe I waited an hour and a half for this" was the first thought that came to my head after I took a bite of the crab benedict. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, it just wasn't standing in line for 1.5 hours good. Or $19.50 good. It was mediocre and the sauce was also a little overly sour.

Luckily the crab omelette was amazing and stopped me from thinking that this place is overrated. There was a fairly generous portion of crab in the omelette and it was delicious. It went nicely with the avocado and brie, as they brought out the flavor more, and yet at the same time they also toned the flavor down a little, if that makes any sense.

The french toast sampler was good and nicely decorated with fruits. There was one toast that I didn't care much for, as it tasted like plain white bread. Unfortunately, I forgot which one it was of the three so I'm going to have to get the sampler again.
author: Jeanie F.

description:
Finally tried Mama's. Love their Monte cristo. Monte cristo is really tasty!! The melted cheese, ham and the toast are just perfect combination! And their home-made jam, which made me unable to stop eating it, is amazing!

Actually I really want to give them 5 stars due to the tasty good, but one and half hour wait to get seated is too much. I don't really remember how long was the wait before I got seat. I started waiting in line at 10:30, but the time I really got my food is 13:00. The food is great, but 2.5 hours waiting to get a nice food is still too crazy for me. This place is a must try, but I might not come back since the terribly long wait :P

BTW, my friend ordered a bacon benedict and she probably was not happy with her food because the bacon was too salted. I tried a small piece of the bacon and totally agreed with her.
author: Jia-Ying X.

description:
A nice place to get brunch in the city. When my bf and I first came here, we were slightly confused because you actually have to walk up to the register and order and pay first, then you can sit wherever you like. 

Their french toast was great and the bf enjoyed his omelette. Prices are reasonable. Service is good. We'll definitely be back!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I've wanting to try Mama's forever, we finally made up to the city this past weekend and boy was the line LONG! I heard it was "short" considering it was already 1:15pm when we got in line. 

We finally got in a little over two o'clock, boy were we starving! My boyfriend ordered the 'oh so loved" Monte Cristo (9.95), I had the Dungeness crab omelette with  avocado and creamy brie (special, 19.95), and we also shared the French Toast Sampler (10.95). 

My omelette was delish!! Stuffed with lots of crab, avocado, and cheese. It seriously just MELTED in my mouth. I also really loved the seasoned roasted potatoes that came with it. It was just right, not too firm or mushy!  My boyfriend's Monte Cristo was good but a bit disappointing. It would have been better with a bit more cheese and ham. There was literally ONE piece of ham in the sandwich! A little over rated for us! 

But MY OH MY was the french toast sampler good! I believe there was banana nut, cinnamon, and cranberry. The BANANA nut was SOOO good, probably better than the other two. We were both so stuffed but managed to FINISH EVERYTHING on our plates. 

TIP: Be prepared to wait no matter what time you arrive. But try to arrive early since they close at 3pm. THERE IS NO SIGNUP SHEET! Once you get inside there's a bit more waiting to order and get sit down. (Roughly another 15 mins).  Make sure you park in an area that is 2 hours or more! 

Definitely worth waiting for and trying at least once!
author: Karen L.

description:
