Mama's French Toast Sampler is heavenly. The sampler has 3 slices of french toast using their homemade breads: Cranberry Walnut Bread, Banana Bread, and Cinnamon Bread. How come I never thought of making French Toast using sweetbreads?!? BANANA BREAD FRENCH TOAST is amazing!!! I yearn to go back to try the Fat Free Apple Yogurt Cinnamon Bread (less than 1 gram of fat) dipped in Egg Whites served with Seasonal Berries or Fruit!! (I love how they can make French Toast so healthy! 1 gram of fat. HAha...)

My friend's Northern Italian M'Omelette with pancetta, mushroom, basil, tomato, and garlic jack cheese was large and delicious, tasted like a pizza in omelette form.

And their fresh squeezed orange juice is like sunshine in your mouth.

A seriously tasty brunch I must say!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Is it worth the wait? Well, it depends what you get obviously!

I got the Dungeness crab omelet with avocados and the Monte Cristo. Both are to die for. Literally, it was one of the best brunch meal I've had ever in my life. I'm not sure if they've just laced it with some magical concoction or something, but it was ammmaazing. (Well I was also tipsy from the Bloody Mary, but that just makes me more of a picky eater)

The Monte Cristo has the perfect texture, being perfectly seared on the side and once you bite into it, it's so soft and flaky and cheesy and melty.... mmmm... I hear their jam is homemade which they'll give you on the side (or in the middle) in a separate container for you to choose to dip your Monte Cristo in.

The Crab omelet was amazing too! Even though one bite did have the inner part of the crab shell (not the hard exterior but the thin see-through pieces that's not hard on the teeth), it was simply amazing with cheese, avocados, and tomatoes.

All in all, both of these dishes made my 2-hour wait worth it. Yes. It was 2-hours, but I went there at noon on a Saturday so...


[They only accept debit cards or cash]
author: Alex S.

description:
Huge line...and if you don't like to wait, then this will just get you annoyed. However, the food is fresh and if you can stand the wait, it does taste pretty good.

This is my second time here. Both times, we've had to wait over an hour or two before getting into the place. There aren't many seats, but I did learn that I could just go in and order TO GO to bypass the waiting. At least, that is what the hostess told us...she said to just let the person at the door know. 

So next time, if I feel the urge to get some food here, I'll ask if I can just go in and order to go. They have pastries inside to choose from as well.
author: Katie W.

description:
I've ALWAYS wanted to try this place out but hearing stories about the line was pretty scary. I would never wake up at 7 on a weekend to come to the North Beach (ONLY if I lived near here.. but I don't!)

So I came when I had a random Friday off work, around 1. I was scared there would be a line, but surprisingly, there were only 2 groups ahead of me. The line started AFTER me though, but nothing over a 40 min wait I'd say (on this day, at least)

So, they don't take down names. Just get in line. They call you when you're up and you can go inside to order (another line, kinda.. to order, then to pay). Then you get seated and the food comes pretty fast! :) :)
Efficient service and they don't miss a beat on anything.

SO.. the food. In a nutshell, it TOTALLY LIVES UP TO THE HYPE. Here's what we had:

Northern Italian omelette:
Pancetta, cheese, and some other yummies. Usuallly, I HATE heavy foods in the morning packed with protein, so I was reluctant to try it. Surprisingly, it wasn't heavy at ALL and the flavors were amazing. The house potatoes were toads awesome as well :)

French toast sampler:
Came with 3 kinds of bread: cranberry, cinnamon, banana. Wish I took a bite when it was still fresh but we ate it as "dessert" after we finished our entrees. I think it woulda been pretty damn good and the varieties of bread is great. The fruit on top was really fresh too! They didn't skimp on that either.

Monte Cristo:
UHHHHHHHHHHH SOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD. French toast with cheese and turkey on the inside. Gushy soft, savory goodness mixed with the light, airy, semi-sweet bread was HEAVEN!! I want some now.

Orange juice:
Pretty good but not $3 worth! You can tell it's fresh though. Wish it were more cool but at least you know they made it on the spot and that it wasn't sitting in the fridge.

Spiked lemonade:
Fresh squeezed lemonade with sauvignon blanc and soda. Good balance of wine and lemonade!

PS: the homemade jam is awesome too!!
author: Emily C.

description:
Very solid brunch but not worth the excessive  wait on a weekend morning.  I went on a Sunday morning fully expecting a significant wait but it thoroughly exceeded my expectations.  Arrived around 9:30am  on a Sunday and stood in the lengthy line for about 2 hours.  Thank baby jesus it was a beautiful day outside but once you finally get to the door and  in the restaurant they stick you in another line to wait to order your food...there is not table service, you order from the counter and they bring you your food.  I complain about the wait just as a warning, I realize it is not the Mama's fault that it is extremely popular.  Do NOT head to Mama's hungry expecting to eat soon.

The food was very good, minus the Monte Cristo. We went for my GF's birthday and ordered Monte Cristo (horrible), Veggie Benedict add bacon (excellent), spicy Italian sausage (very good), sourdough toast (excellent), spiked lemonade (excellent), Spicy bloody Mary (very excellent). When we ordered the clerk checked my GF's ID and realized it was her birthday.  He got the entire restaurant to sing happy birthday and comp'd her drink. I have no idea why anyone is raving about the Monte Cristo.  I love Monte Cristo's and this was one of the worst one's I have ever had.  It is very small and has almost no turkey or ham in it; extremely disappointed.  The veggie Benedict was very good, as I imagine all the benedicts are.  Bloody Mary was definitely my highlight.
author: Brooks R.

description:
2hr wait. Seriously?! 

The French toast wasn't worth the wait -- they were dry and not fluffy. 

Pancakes on the other hand were SO freaking fluffy and delicious. Must get.

Crab omelette was good, generous amount of real crab meat, but wasn't mind blowing. 

If I have to wait 2hrs for brunch, I would rather wait for Mission Beach Cafe.
author: Michelle K.

description:
This place is solid. I would give them 3.5, but since that's not an option, I felt they were more deserving of an official 3-star rating. We showed up on a Sunday at about 7:45 and waited in line for about an hour.  I have no qualms about standing in line, as it's indicative of a good restaurant and something we volunteer for. 

1. There were 8 of us, and I know they had to wait a good while to push together tables for us.  I appreciate them keeping us together so we didn't have to sit apart from each other.  The place is incredibly small, so large parties take up about...one-third of the place.

2. The concept of paying then eating is odd, but it works. We got to stand in line and watch the cooks put together all the plates, which was very interesting.  They have everything down to a science and make it look easy!  

3. I swapped dishes with someone else so we ordered 2 dishes and passed them back and forth.  The first dish was their apple pan dore. The sourdough bread was really good and tender, nice and thin, very moist.  I was extremely disappointed in their lemon butter sauce.  There was no citrus at all, and it mostly felt and tasted like a melted butter sauce.  There was no zing and it left the dish lacking.  The sautéed apples were very good, still a good crunch factor but tender and a really pretty presentation with the pink skins still on. They still didn't quite finish the dish.  Halfway through our meal, our server remembered that we were supposed to have their homemade raspberry jam. Admittedly, I forgot to ask, even though the menu states that all dishes come with it.  Once we received this, the dish turned completely different. The sour preserve helped cut the butter of the sauce and paired well with the sweet apples. This should just come with the jam because it's lackluster without it.

4. The other dish was the North Coast Benedict. The prosciutto was amazing.  Tender and shredded, it was salty and piled on high. The English muffins were crisp and buttery. The biggest issue: the poached eggs were BAD. In hindsight, I should've sent them back. But we had been waiting for an hour and the restaurant was clearly busy. We went with it. The eggs were hard-poached. When you broke the yolk, they were completely solid, no runniness at all. How can I saturate my muffin when the yolk is basically hard-boiled? I admire egg poaching, as it's not something I have mastered, but for a breakfast place this was the most disappointing portion of the plate.

5. Most everyone else at the table ordered the corned beef hash or corned beef benedict. The beef was good.  Tender and shredded, but it lacked the typical vivacity of corned beef I know and love. I think the emphasis on all those pickling spices and mustard seeds would've really popped this savory dish. With the egg on top, the meat just lacked life. 

Overall, a good breakfast place. I think the hour long wait is a bit over-hyped but I can safely say I have tried Mama's! If you're willing to wait, it's worth a try for the experience.  

P.S. The bathrooms are extremely inconvenient as you have to go through the kitchen and down some steps in a back patio area.  It's...odd, as people sit out on their porches and watch you, but it's not a deal breaker and something of the charm in this place.
author: Kathryn T.

description: Don't even look at the menu. All you need to know to order here is the Monte Cristo. BEST breakfast dish I have ever eaten! And I've had my fair share of breakfast & brunch spots. This place gets crowded fast and a line starts even before the restaurant opens so come early (30 min to an hour) because it gets pretty long. But the hour+ wait is worth it.. FOR THE MONTE CRISTO!!
author: Madalena T.

description: Easily the worst eggs Benedict I've ever had. The hollandaise sauce didn't have much flavor and actually tastes like it was watered down. The yolks of the poached eggs were overcooked. The potatoes were also dry and bland.
author: Amin S.

description:
I've had Mama's bookmarked forever and I'm so happy I had a chance to eat here this past weekend! I was silly enough to think that arriving at 1PM would mean no wait or no line. Luckily, I found parking across the street so we were able to get right into line. 1.5 hours and a lengthy debate about whether to stay or not later, we were inside! As a tip, you should know what you want to order before you step foot into the restaurant/cafe, because you're basically waiting in line to order and pay at the register. In addition, they accept debit and cash, but not credit cards. 

The weekend specials all looked so delicious, but I finally decided on the Dungeness Crab Benedict while my friend had the Washington Square Omelette. We also decided to share the French Toast Sampler (I mean, we did wait an hour and a half!), a side of spicy Italian sausage, order a slice of carrot cake to-go, and had 2 large glasses of freshly squeezed orange juice. Everything added up because our brunch came out to be a little over $60! 

I have no complaints about the food! Everything was FABULOUS! I thoroughly enjoyed my dungeness crab benedict, especially because it was my first time trying eggs benedict. The dish was filled with tons of fresh crab meat, and not just the shredded kind. I chowed down on some succulent, large pieces of crab meat! My friend's omelette was good too. It was filled with chunks of spicy Italian sausage, peppers, tomatoes, and lots of cheese. The roasted potatoes were also great. The french toast sampler was perfect, accompanied by some delicious maple syrup and fresh fruit. The orange juice was actually freshly squeezed as advertised and delicious. We had their carrot cake the next morning and it was very delicious! 

Service was excellent as well! They're on their toes and bring out your food promptly. I also appreciated the levity they provided to the environment, espeically since everyone was hungry and had waited in line for at least 1-2 hours. Overall, I wouldn't mind waiting in line for another 1.5 hours (but probably not any longer) to eat here again!
author: Stephanie L.

description: The 5 stars are for the food, as there is no service per say. First time here, got there right before opening and we waited for 45 minutes, but it was worth it! My mom and I shared the corned beef hash eggs Benedict and smoked salmon omelet with a baguette. Both were excellent, fresh, full of flavor, and the portions were beyond suitable for sharing. My favorite had to be the homemade raspberry jam. We used every scrap of bread soaking it up:) I will definitely be back, just maybe a little earlier to avoid that line. And be sure to check out the restroom. That was an experience in itself.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Lots of great brunch spots in SF Bay area, maybe I just don't get the hype....or was it what I ordered? Either way, waiting over 1.5 hrs for standard brunch fare is a little much, no? Am I alone on this? I'd hope not. 

We got a seasonal fruit french toast with chocolate and omelete. 

Good standard brunch food but the wait of over 1.5 hrs for 2 people. I'll let you make the decision.
author: Wendy L.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Traveled to San Francisco for the day and really debated standing in line for an hour and a half to eat at this place. But I did and it was totally worth the wait. I recommend the BLACKSTONE EGG BENEDICT!!! So YUMMY! and the FRENCH TOAST SAMPLER (great to share). I love how the line is outside the restaurant so it's calm and not very crowded inside. Feels very homey inside, pleasant environment.

If you go to San Fran, must go to Mama's on Washington Square!
author: Armenui A.

description:
2 hour wait on a Saturday afternoon. Still worth it.

The Monte Cristo sandwich was one of the most unique sandwiches I've ever had. The Jam complimented it perfectly. I recommend ordering it with the spring mix-- a light but flavorful salad to balance out the heavy cheese and bread. 

I'll definitely be back. Don't forget it's CASH ONLY, with a $1 additional charge for debit card use (no credit cards accepted).
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We heard about Mama's through tripadvisor! I absolutely enjoy eating breakfast and have always wanted to try crab cake Benedict. (I research to the point where it annoys most). We arrived straight from the airport and there was a line by the side door. We were new and didn't think the wait would be too long. It was, but was it worth it? Totally! Not only do you have to wait to get to the tiny front half-door, but once you're in, you place your order and hope a seat opens up for you soon. My husband ordered the Monte Cristo and I had the crab cakes Benedict. We decided to split a chocolate cake crumble. It was amazing! 
I'm giving it 4.5/5 stars due to an incident that occurred while at the restaurant. I wish they would've addressed it sooner rather than later. We were sitting at the corner table and there was a couple brunching next to us. They were harassing a gentlemen on their other side. The woman was becoming very belligerent and loud, taking jabs at the man regarding his race. Once the manager and server came by, the harassing couple was about to leave. Once they left, the manager apologized and said they would not be welcomed again. This went on for a good 20 minutes before they came over and asked what the commotion was about. I only wish they would've stopped them and asked them to leave before they ruined everyone's experience. I'm sure the gentleman was very upset.
author: Natalia C.

description:
One of their weekend specials is the Dungeness Crab Egg Benedict w/ spinach! We also got the Northern Italian Omelette. They have a list of drinks by the register. As you wait in line to order at the register, you also pass by a small portion of their grilling station and you can see the mounds of better through the glass panes.

I must say that the Dungeness Crab was excellent! This was my first time having dungeness crab. The eggs were cooked nicely and not too runny or cooked. The potatoes that came w/ the benedict were nicely seasoned and scrumptious. The omelette was also very filling and the fresh basil was a nice touch. The fresh squeezed orange juice was quite refreshing and complemented the denseness of food.

The restaurant is very small and the wait was about 30 min on a Saturday during brunch hours. I hear it can even be longer. They're also CASH ONLY! Be careful when looking for parking!
author: Yumi H.

description:
Waited in line for 1.25 hours. Came in at 9:45AM.

Please don't hate me guys, but to me the food was just okay. Nothing too bad, but I guess it's the price + the insane wait that took away a few stars. It's nothing too stellar, in my opinion. 

Pricing was steep.

We ordered the Blueberry Pancakes which were small for what it was priced for. I know pancakes normally call for baking soda but I could really taste/detect it in the ones we ordered. Drowning them in syrup did the trick, though. *eek*

The Norwegian Eggs Benedict were fine. Nothing stellar but it was okay. I gotta give them props though for having their hollandaise sauce fresh... or at least they tasted fresh. Lol. Unlike in most places where it tastes like it's straight out of the carton. (If they used it out of the carton too, then that's damn good carton hollandaise sauce) 

It was good for a first-time just to see what everybody's been raving about. But it's not something I'd go back for.
author: Angela B.

description: Delicious food and good service. A little small but it made it charming. We were lucky to have missed the extreme lines we saw afterwards. Great overalll
author: Andrea K.

description: Me and my BF came in to visit from Texas & we had heard so much about this place and knew we had to check it out. When we travel we are big on visiting places we can't find at home and eating what the city is known for. When they say there's always a wait I guess it holds true, we ate breakfast at Mama's on a Tuesday morning and there was a line outside the building, the door is kept locked and you can only go in when they let you in, which I thought was super cool bc it almost felt exclusive. I'll keep it simple, IT WAS SOOOOO WORTH THE WAIT! We had the Famous Mama's Cristo & it was heaven in your mouth, the black stone Benedict which was my first ever Benedict breakfast & im so glad it was from here, I left my plate clean! We finished off with the buttermilk pancakes with berries and Jesus I was so sad when it was over! If you visit, trust me the wait is worth it!
author: Eve E.

description:
The food here is pretty good, but it's not worth the wait...

I mean, I guess they can't help that the line is so damn long, but waiting basically an hour+ for just a 'pretty good' breakfast isn't worth it. 

I got the eggs and banana pancakes - the eggs were really good! But the rest of it wasn't anything special.  I expected a lot more.
author: Sean D.

description:
Breakfast heaven!!!!!!! Totally worth the wait (1.5 hours for us). Some random stranger walked by and said " An egg is just an egg" Well sir....I must disagree!

Northern Italian: was deeeelicious. PERFECTLY cooked and well balanced. Portion size was good and the homemade jam was to die for. 

Classic Benedict: Perfectly cooked, decent portion size. Excellent hollandaise sauce.

This was the first breakfast place that I actually LOVE and for an impatient person like me I would  definitely wait again in the long long long line to eat at Mama's.
author: Jules Y.

description: Crab cake Egg Benedicts is the bomb! Like for real! Please do put it on your regular menu. It tasted greaaaaaattt and Im loving it!
author: Olivia J.

description:
This place is as hyped up a place as a place could be.  A minimum of an hour wait (no matter how early you show or how late), this place will reward those who are patient enough to wait.  Once granted entry inside this marvelous corner restaurant, you will immediately be acquainted with an old fashioned decor reminiscent of a classic 90's brunch place.  Instead of being seated immediately, you have to line up and wait to order inside. Once you place your order, you are directed to your reserved seating, where you are served the rest of the meal.  

All three of us ordered the Monte Cristo, with an order of Cinnamon French Toast with a topping of Fresh seasonal berries.  This was my first time having any kind of Monte Cristo, but I have to say I was well pleased.  The French Toast was also delicious.  And the the Home-made jam is amazing!!!

Overall this place has fantastic food at a very reasonable price.  The people are friendly (our waiter joked with us and took several pictures of us and our food without us even having to ask haha). The only knock on it I guess is the wait time to get in, but hey, you can't really blame the place for being so popular. :)
author: Austin R.

description: Waited in line for over two hours, and got a parking ticket for not having a front license plate while at it. The shrimp benedict was well worth all that trouble though !
author: Cee T.

description: This is a good place to eat breakfast providing that you are up to standing in line for 30 minutes or more. There is not a better breakfast place in the area and the line is a perfect indicator of this.
author: Charles B.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch after a morning swim in the bay. Reading all the reviews this place sounded amazing and it was a long wait. good thing we weren't hungry once we got in line because we waited for 2 HOURS!! it is a little shop with about 20 seats inside. well by the time we got to order we were hungry. no wonder people say they love this place they make you stand outside until you are hungry then you eat it all up and you think that it is very good. 

the only thing that i can see is good is their jam. it was perfect not too sweet or anything like that. the choices aren't that spectacular its just the classic breakfast with pancakes, french toast, eggs Benedict and so on. their specials as just regular eggs with crab meat. thats what makes it so special. needless to say it was alright but defiantly not worth the 2 hour wait. i would only come back if i didn't have to wait in line again.
author: Steven N.

description: Mama's in Washington Square is an amazing breakfast spot! There service is great once you get inside the place. There is always a LONG wait for this place because ITS AMAZING so get there early! It usually opens at 8 am and their selection is soooo good! I highly recommend the crab omelette! So delicious and the crab meat is so fresh! Probably the freshest I've ever eaten! The workers are friendly and try to get you your food/drinks out as fast as possible! You gotta try their homemade jam that is made daily! This place is a must try! Worth the wait trust me!!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great Brunch spot. We were in and out. Short wait. I'm picky about Benedict's. Theirs was exceptional. Also we had the tex mex scramble and it was amazing. Highly recommend!
author: Evan D.

description:
Best breakfast in SF.
Totally worth the hour wait.
We had the cinnamon  choc. French toast, amazing!
While waiting in line a waitress/waiter goes around and asks if anyone would like water, tea and or coffee.
The  brother or (host) explained to us how the ordering worked and some of his recommendations on the menu. Very friendly and helpful. Service was awesome .
Will return again and is greatly recommend.
author: Valerie P.

description:
Waited 2 hours in line to get in.  I got the crab cake Benedict which was just average without much flavor and way overpriced.  The French toast sampler was very good and the piece of the chocolate crumb cake was delicious.  The servers were friendly and the food was fresh, but overpriced considering it is breakfast.  I am glad I went but would not wait in line for 2 hours to go back.

When waiting in line, someone walked by and said "it's just pancakes."  Probably should have taken his advice.
author: Steve S.

description:
A lot of people recommended Mama's and since I saw the huge line in front of Mama's every morning I had quite high expectations of it. 

The interior is pretty nice and cozy, but the line waiting inside was too noisy and busy to fully enjoy the atmosphere. Also, waiting inside took a while too, and I wish I were seated instead of waiting another 20min, after having already waited 30min outside. 

I had Eggs Florentine, which where okay. Eggs Florentine are one of my favourite breakfast dish, so I order it quite often. However, these were my least favourite so far. Sadly, the sauce was not delicious at all (too much lemon) and there was too much pepper used in the rest of the dish.

Overall, it was a nice experience, but I have no reason going back there again as the experience is not worth waiting in line for.
author: Henriette K.

description: Just go there. Make sure you either be early on the morning or buy a coffee and pastries to wait about 30-40 minutes. Small and crowded but totally worth it
author: Daniel C.

description:
We came during the busy time and the line was long. This only increases anticipation and expectations. 

It's not very big so you have to wait for a few cycles before you get a table. Close to an hour and a half.

Carrot cake was light, fluffy and moist. Excellent. The frosting was perfect.

We ordered mainly off the specials menu. The dungeness crab benedict, dungeness crab omelette, French toast sampler and the monte cristo. The latter being on the recommendation of fellow yelpers.

Well having devoured the whole lot between us we were not disappointed. Everything was excellent. It was hard to pick a #1. It probably depends on your taste.

So why 4 stars? The wait was overly long which isn't their fault but for future visitors this may be an important factor.
The extra side orders of potatoes were a little burnt.
They also don't accept credit cards which is a shame, it's not like this place is super cheap.

These combined cost it a 5 star from me. But I'd say that the service was friendly and fun. 4.25 stars. :)
author: Nick L.

description: This is the most incredible breakfast place in the whole United States. The two hour line up was worth it with the first bite. Never have I had an omelette that just exploded with flavour from start to finish. Super humble and kind staff (Patti). Amazing atmosphere. I'm still reeling from the experience and the words just not coming to mind to describe how awesome. YOU HAVE GOT TO COME TO MaMa's!!!!
author: Kristopher F.

description: I will never eat a better breakfast. This place lives up to the hype. We had a group of 10. Got in line around 730 and we ordered around 830. Everyone in our party loved their food- farmers omelette, monte cristo, French toast, etc.   the smoked bacon was delicious. Only complaint was my Bloody Mary which was a little stale. Service was friendly. Yum.
author: Liz W.

description:
So, I finally tried Mama's after living about five blocks away for almost a year and a half (I was never up for the wait!). I was prepared for the wait time, and came with a friend so the wait wasn't painful, but it was long, about 1.5 hours early on a Saturday morning. 

Do I think it's worth the wait? Yes. The monte cristo isn't something that I would normally order, but after reading all of the reviews (and keeping in mind that I wouldn't be here too often considering the wait), I had to try it! It did not disappoint... I've definitely considered going back to Mama's just to get another one! However, I would probably only go again if it was an off day or hour... I don't think it's worth waiting that long again.

To summarize, the food is delicious, and it's a fun experience that's worth trying on a lazy Saturday/Sunday/whatever. However, be prepared for the wait!
author: Alison B.

description:
I've never waited in line for an hour to eat at a place, but Mama's is definitely worth it!

My friend recommended this place after seeing her friends mention it on Facebook and seeing great review on yelp. We got there around 11am, and waited an hour to go inside. Once inside, you order and wait for a table. Inside is very cutesy, homey, and kind of small. We ordered the French Toast Sampler and the Monte Cristo. Both DELICIOUS! The French toast was served with fresh fruit, syrup, and really great jam. The Monte Cristo was also really yummy, eaten with jam.

The service was great! Everyone was really friendly, even joked with us. Very attentive, but not pushy or overbearing. My mouth is watering just thinking about the food there! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for great brunch food. Be be prepared for a wait -- so bring an entertaining friend or something to keep you occupied!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Despite the hour long wait, the food was well worth it.

I got the eggs benedict and the boyfriend got the french toast sampler.  I've never had eggs benedict before and it was actually pretty good.  Very yum and I liked how it came with a side of potatoes.  Very filling!!  I tasted the french toast sampler and it was nom nom nom.  I liked the cinnamon one the best then the banana nut.  I didn't really like the third one though, it tasted a little funny but maybe it's because I'm not used to having a citrus flavor in my french toast.  The french toast also had fresh berries on top so that was a nice treat.

All the workers here are very friendly and I love how this place is super quaint even though it's small.  Perfect place to have brunch on a nice day in San Francisco.
author: Criselle O.

description:
Their breakfast food is absolutely delicious, though I'm not sure if it is the result of the wait in line making me more hungry. As with the other reviews, get here early or be prepared to wait. A nice line was already present 10 minutes before opening and if you do not make it through the initial wait, you can stare into the window as those ahead of you are eating. The wait was more than 30 minutes, to get into the diner watching the kitchen do their thing and looking at all the delicious cakes and bread.

You have plenty of time to decide what you want to order as there is a menu posted outside and inside as you wait to get in front of the cash register. Its order & pay first, then you're seated and get food, which probably speeds things up a little bit.

Now to the food - there are too many choices, which is especially hard for an indecisive person - so I settled on their crab omelette special (the specials are not listed on the menu on their website). Portions were generous and filling and I recommend trying their homemade jam - it is absolutely delicious.
author: Jason B.

description:
AMAZING!! I waited an hour and a half and will do it again and again just for the tasty food and great service.

This is my fourth time here and I never get tired of the Benedict's. I've tired a different one every time I came here. Never disappointed... And almost always get the monte cristo which is sooo good..
author: Cel Y.

description:
There's only 7 or so tables in Mama's, so the line for this place could get insane depending on the person. If the food is worth it, I would not mind the wait. Both times I've visited Mama's I had to wait around 40+ minutes to get in; when I mean get in, I mean just to be able to order my food. It took around 20-30 minutes to the food me and my boyfriend ordered. 

Ordered: 
Crabs Benedict: The crab was cooked perfectly and they give you generous portions of crab. The eggs and the hollandaise sauce were also cooked perfectly. The crabs benedict is served with home fries. The home fries were crispy and cooked nicely, well seasoned. This dish had just right portion without leaving you too bloated afterwards.

French toast sampler: The french toast sampler consisted of banana bread, cranberry-orange bread, and a cinnamon bread. I loved how they freshly bake their bread, each one of them tasted delicious on their own without the batter. Each of the french toast were cooked perfectly, it was not at all undercooked and eggy. 

Service: Service is friendly, slightly attentive, but when I saw the kitchen get flustered with orders, the waitresses just stood there in the corner talking to each other. There hasn't been a time where I came to Mama's and it was not busy.

Overall, I would definitely suggest this place to someone visiting SF. My suggestion is to come on a weekday and get in line by 8:30-9am. It also helps to not go in big groups.
author: Jill T.

description:
Mama's was an unforgettable experience that everyone should take part in, regardless if you like breakfast foods or not.

I came here with some friends for "brunch" but didn't get seated till at least 1:15 PM. Not gonna lie, it was painful because it was extremely windy and my stomach kept grumbling at the sight of everyone's delicious food.

*Tip #1: make sure you look at the menu while you're waiting in line because you order before you get seated!*

*Tip #2: BRING CASH-- they don't take credit cards and they have a $1 fee for debit cards*

*Tip #3: Do NOT come on weekends. We ignored this and regretted it.*

*Tip #4: They're closed on MONDAYS*

ATMOSPHERE
The workers were very friendly, until they notice that you're done eating and they'll politely try to usher you out. We wanted to stay and chat some more (mainly to let our stomachs digest everything), but we felt uncomfortable every time the waiter came by to ask if everything was fine.

The decor was very quirky and homey; it definitely felt like I was at a grandma's house. The walls are bright yellow it was very cozy and comfortable.

After eating at Mama's, I can see why there's a perpetual line wrapped around the corner: THE PLACE IS JUST SO DARN SMALL! It's very narrow; as a result, there is extremely limited seating. Luckily you can stare at the food as it's being prepared while you wait in line AGAIN (but this time, indoors).

Finally, the clientele at Mama's is very diverse. I definitely saw a wide range of patrons, from fobs taking self-portraits with their food to local foodies discussing politics-- to students, like my friends and me, celebrating the end of college.

FOOD
The only reason why Mama's gets 4 stars is because the food is really expensive here-- I wasn't expecting such steep prices, especially at a mom and pop diner like this. 

However, the quality of the ingredients and the overall taste of the food made up for the high price tag.

All 3 of us ordered APPLE PEACH BELLINIS, which were $7 a glass (no refills). The presentation was nice and classy: there was a TON of champagne and freshly cut strawberries. 

We ordered:
1. MONTE CRISTO WITH HOME FRIES
-I normally don't like sweet food, but the MC was to die for. It's basically a fancy ham and cheese (2 different cheeses) sandwich dipped in egg and fried. It comes with Mama's famous homemade dipping jam and oranges/strawberries. I was worried that it was going to be soggy, but the texture was just right and it was very fluffy.
-The sandwich comes in 4 and it's extremely filling.
-The home fries were good, but nothing special. 

2. SMOKED SALMON EGGS BENEDICT

3. SHRIMP EGGS BENEDICT WITH GRILLED TOMATOES AND AVOCADO

Both SEAFOOD dishes were tasty. You could tell the ingredients were fresh and the dishes didn't have that "fishy" taste to them. The flavors blended well together and it was a very light, but hearty meal.

As someone who doesn't like brunch or breakfast foods, it means something when I say that I would eat at Mama's every morning-- if only the line wasn't so discouraging!
author: Krystie M.

description: Not worth the 2 hour wait. Food is great but service could be improved much more. There were about 6 empty tables while there was a line to pay at the cashier who was serving water. I feel at this point they actually try to build up the line outside. Several times couples in the line abandoned the wait and left to go eat at Park Tavern just across the road. I won't be back.
author: Jay P.

description:
What do you do when it is cold outside, it is 8am, and it is about to rain?

You stand in line for French toast!  That's right stand in line for French toast. I have always wanted to come here and eat something. My grandfather used to live up the street from here and I would always see people standing in line. This place has been in San Francisco forever and it was one of those places that you say, "I will go next time." 15  years later and here I am standing in line waiting to try the French toast.  

This place is small! You have to order you food first then they find you a table according to how many people are with you. I ordered the French toast sampler: I got to try out Banana Walnut, Swedish Cinnamon and Cranberry Orange Walnut with fresh berries and bananas.   I think the bread was baked fresh and had a light coating of egg. The toast by itself is good but you can always add the maple syrup and homemade jam! 

The food here is great and the service is fast.  I would come back if I can get up early enough to beat the crowds.
author: Kathryn W.

description:
Lines start one hour before opening so get here at 715am (on the weekends) if you want to get in the first wave of customers. food is a top notch but the price and long wait is a -1 star. You pay for what you get though as all the food we had was high quality.

monte cristo
kinda tasted like french toast with meat stuffed in them. A sweet and savory mix. Add their home made jam for extra flavor 3.75/5

Mama's French Toast Sampler
probably the most disappointing dish of the day. French toast was made of homemade? bananna bread so it was different and more flavorful then your typical french toast topped with various fruits. 3.5/5

Crab Benedict
The most expensive thing on their menu. Comes with breakfast potatoes and spinach. They did not skimp on the crab and the poached egg was cooked to perfection. 4.25/5

Overall, the food is the best breakfast food I have eaten in terms of quality but the major negatives to this place is that the waits are ridiculous and the prices are about 33% more than what you pay anywhere else. CASH ONLY
author: Robert Y.

description: Waited in line about 45 minutes. Worth the wait! Great atmosphere. Had the dungeness crab omlet. Delicious.
author: M P.

description:
GO EARLY. I think it's probably safe to arrive an hour before they open. We arrived about 30 minutes before they opened and still had to wait a little less than an hour. 

The Monte Cristo was so good. I think it fell from heaven. On a cloud. A golden cloud. That rained cut diamonds. Or maybe I was just hungry. Nevertheless, it was a great dish. 

Anyone visiting San Francisco should definitely try this place.
author: Jonathan N.

description: We arrived at 7:10am on a Wednesday and there were 2 other people in line already! I ordered the classic corned beef hash and I think it was definitely worth the early morning wait! The corned beef hash was crispy and delicious and I'm sad I live in Orange County now.
author: Rie M.

description:
I finally got to try this place last month after so long! My friend and I waited about an hour and a half on a Sunday afternoon. We finally got seated around 2:30pm or so, right before the doors closed. I ordered the Eggs Benedict, she ordered an omelette, and we shared an order of the French Toast. The eggs benedict definitely hit the spot and the potatoes were delicious! The French toast were soooo good, definitely melts in my mouth. 

I will definitely come back some time and get the Monte Cristo!
author: Cynthia L.

description: Totally worth the wait ! We went there on a Tuesday at 8h00 and wait about an hour. The Monte Cristo is absolutely amazing !! Really nice service as well !! 5 stars
author: Kevin K.

description: This is as good as it gets..seriously!  The wait in line is horrible but the the food..OMG!  We've been here twice and we have already agreed that everytime we're in SF we will come to MaMa's every single time..rain or shine!
author: Joe H.

description:
Cant say enough about this place that hasn't already been said here on Yelp or elsewhere.  One word: Fantastic.
Yes the long lines make it frustrating to wait for that moment where your hunger pains are nourished with the most "fantastic" felt satisfaction.  A place that all visitors and locals must go while they are here in SF.  You will not regret it!
author: Karim A.

description: If you're planing to have a nice weekend breakfast/brunch at Mama's, you better be in here early coz the waiting time is usually pretty long, like 45+ min or so. Once you get in, there is an extra wait time before you "actually" sit down to eat. The entrées here are pretty good. We tried the Egg White Scramble with a French Toast on the side and it was quite stomach full. The service was prompt with a friendly staff. Would love to visit here again if I don't mind the queue that is :)
author: Aritra G.

description:
NOTHIN' LIKE MAMA'S HOME COOKIN'

This place is awesome! It's very "home" style decor and feels like your in one of those television cooking shows. Mama's offers an array of different entries but my favorite is the Momelettes; but due to how small this restaurant is, the line can be VERY long (easily extending halfway across the whole block just to get inside). The food is all fresh to order, delicious, and the staff is very friendly and professional. Worth coming back every time!

The restroom is in the back. Pass the doorway that has the Brie Cheese sign. It's a tiny restroom with the tiniest doorknob.

Helpful Tip: Closed Mondays. I learned the hard way.. twice..
author: Albert L.

description:
We were lucky because we got a table in 10 minutes and as we were leaving the line was long! It was difficult to decide on what to order because as we were lined up next to the kitchen, it seemed like everything they were making looked really good. I had the monte cristo and my wife had the pancakes with berries. Both were awesome. The monte cristo was unique because of the havarti cheese and the boysenberry jam. The sandwich was light and fluffy and not heavy and greasy.

The service was prompt and friendly and I actually like the set up of having to order near the kitchen and paying for the meal before the food came out worked out well. The restaurant is small and was full of people but I didn't feel cramped at all. The decor was charming although I was really focused on the food. I can't wait to come back and try one of the many omelettes they have.
author: Stan W.

description: Huummmm...I don't want to go against the grain...but it's was good, not worth the wait.  I ordered an omelette and it had goat cheese, I have never had goat cheese...so it's my fault for ordering it and not likening the taste!  My twins had the pancakes and they loved them but other than that...just cool to say I came here!!
author: Wendy M.

description:
I've been to Mama's a couple of times but never bothered to write a review.  After my last visit, though, I felt compelled to.

I know everyone and their mom loves Mama's, but the wait really does kill me.  For a place that takes literally 2 hours of waiting time + cooking time, I expect fireworks and magic with every order during every visit.  But no - not the case.

I paid $20 for Dungeness Crab Benedict - which yes - was packed with huge chunks of crabs.  However, the crab meat was on the dry side and the Hollandaise sauce was more tart than creamy/buttery.  Maybe the 1,762 Yelp reviewers prefer this, but I think there should be a happy medium.  Most brunch restaurants in the city manages to do so since I rarely catch myself being bothered by the acidity of Hollandaise sauce. 

Problem number 2 was the french toast.  Again, I'm confused because it sounds like most Yelpers enjoy this dish at Mama's.  I didn't find myself feeling impressed.  It was far too dense and heavy for my liking.  

Mama's IS good, but not good enough to convince me to come here frequently and stand in line forever just to have a bite of it.  Maybe something's wrong with me though?  Since I'm the black sheep on this page of reviews?!
author: Judy C.

description:
Overpriced 'freshly squeezed OJ'
Long waits for tiny crowded seating 
Mini bathroom
Not at all worth the hype and long lines
Don't fall sucker for herd mentality
author: Craig G.

description:
Breakdown: One of few memorable breakfasts I can count on my hands. Long wait, fantastic food, good price. Would come back, avoiding the long wait though.

We jumped in line at about 830 and stayed in line for 2 hours. I didn't enjoy standing in line, but the food was great, I would probably do it again; this time with a book and chair. 
When we ordered our food, the gentleman noticed we were military and offered us a free plate or free drinks. We already ordered extra entrees so we went with the drinks. My wine & lemonade was delicious and was a very nice gesture.
I ordered the french toast sampler and the california omelet and about had a mouth orgasm.
author: Nicholas D.

description: It wasn't a pleasant experience and food was mediocre.  Eggs over medium, mama's potato, I could almost count them there were so few of them, they did taste good.  Bacon was dry and hard and not of very good quality and taste.  I ordered sour dough, I thought it would be sliced not the case, I could barely eat it as it got tighter-harder the longer it took me to eat it "crust".  I asked for jelly she said they didn't have it but had home made "jam" non specific it was blueberry which I don't personally like.  I caught up with someone else asked if there was honey, she gave me honey the coffee wasn't good either.  Service was nothing special.
author: Kathy W.

description:
The food is fantastic.  Just fantastic.  I had the Farmer's Omelet and Papa's Punch, mom had the Dungeness Benedict and the Bellini.  Everything was fresh and delicious, and the homemade jam is amazing!  The only reason for four stars instead of five is the wait.  I know, I know, it's part of the charm, but oof!  

We got there at 8:35 in the morning and waited almost exactly two hours (it was the Fourth of July, so I'm sure that contributed).  Again, it was strangely charming - the people in the line were fun and funny, it was a beautiful morning in Washington Square, and mom and I traded places going and grabbing coffee down the block and watching the elderly Asian ladies doing their fancy dances down in the park.

The restaurant is tiny and the people are really nice.  You order at the counter and are seated as tables become available.  I want to tell them to make the restaurant bigger, since there is obviously a demand for the food, but the food is so good, they obviously know what they're doing!
author: Ramona T.

description:
WORTH THE WAIT.  MONTE CRISTO. CRAB BENEDICT. DONE. That should be the only thing I should have to say about this gem in SF.  

Although this place has basically become a tourist attraction in SF, nothing else compares to the quality of the food Mama's puts out for breakfast and lunch.  Getting here, the line doesn't seem like an hour and a half wait but looks are deceiving.  I'm guessing the only time there really isn't a wait is at opening hours but that's it.  I left the place about 45 minutes from closing and the line was still as long as it was when I was waiting.  

Basically its a two-tiered line to get your food, three-tiers if you wanna use the bathroom too.  Outside line to get in the place, inside line to get to the cash register and place your order, and small line to get to the little one toilet shack of a bathroom. The guy working the cash register has a good sense of humor, guessing he gets pretty bored just sitting there.

On to the food!
MONTE CRISTO
Damn. My taste buds went on a wild ride with this one. Turkey, ham, cheddar, and havarti stacked like a club sandwich and cooked up like french toast. Served with their homemade jam and home fries, it could be a meal for two.  Savory, salty, and sweet. Fireworks in my mouth!

DUNGENESS CRAB BENEDICT
HUGE chunks of crab meat, sauteed spinach, 2 poached egg, and their homemade Hollandaise Sauce, all stacked up high on 2 english muffins. Served with some home fries.  It was delicious but a different kind compared to the Monte Cristo; flavors were not as vibrant but still there.  I had to separate some of the sweet crab meat and eat it by itself because the hollandaise sometimes overwhelmed the delicacy of the crab.  But other than that, definite must.

ORANGE JUICE
hahaha. yea even though it's a bit on the pricier side, it is worth getting, especially after the wait.  Fresh squeezed, or at least it tastes like it, it compliments any dish Mama's serves.

Now, I know people like to enjoy their meals and I respect that, but please, if you ever go here, don't sit there for another half hour sipping on coffee with your party after finished eating.  It's rude and discourteous to those waiting outside.  ALSO, this applies mostly to older asians, DONT STARE IN THE WINDOW AS PEOPLE EAT.  Hella awkward and yea, kinda rude.  I mean, asians do it all the time in typical asian restaurants but come on! A quick glance is all you need!!! I wish I didn't have to bash on my own race, but it must be said.  

P.S. one dollar extra for using debit/credit cards.
author: Justin L.

description:
Mama's you had me at hello. First time in SF and my friends took me to Mama's. At first I was skeptical and wondered how in the world can a breakfast place be that good to the point where the line takes approximately 1-2 hours. Well Mama's is THEEEE place. My best tip for this place is..COME during WEEEEEEEKDAYS. I came on a Friday around 12pm and I thought the line was horrendous but apparently that was considered "shorter" than usual. Come right before it opens because even before it opens there is apparently a line as well. Alright lets talk about the FOOOOOD.

1. Monte Cristo $9.50
[Breast of Turkey, Baked Ham, Cheddar and Havarti Cheese Bread dipped in Egg and grilled, served with Homemade Jam]
-OHHHHHH MYYYYY GODDD. Let me tell you..I am usually not too big of a fan of breakfast but seriously this dish had me at HELLO. The sandwich is cooked to perfection. The cheese melts extremely nicely with the egg dipped cheese bread and ham and not to mention the homemade jammmmm is to die for. Honestly the sandwich is only this orgasmic due to the jam. The jam is called Olallieberry jam. Cannot buy this jam anywhere TRUST. So if you ever stop by mama's buy a jar of their famous homemade jam.

2. Dungeness Crab Omelette Approx $19.00
[with Avocado and sour cream]
-MEHHH I have had better dungeness crab honestly, but the omelette overall was still very delicious. I disliked the fact that you can see a bowl of already peeled dungeness crab sitting at the window display while u are waiting in line to order. It kind of defeats the purpose of "fresh" in my opinion. But it was still very delicious. Yes the omelette is a bit pricy in my opinion but you do get huge chunks of crab in every bite. The omelette and the benedict are the same price but the omelette is much larger in portion and just easier to eat overall. Even though the dungeness was peeled ahead of time and left in the silver bowl in display..the crab still tasted very fresh anyway. The texture of the crab meat was not dull and moldy like dead-unfresh crab.

3. French Toast Sampler $10.75
-EHHHH if this is your first time at Mama's I guess it is worth trying the french toast sampler...but honestly if I were to come again..i would NEVER get the french toast sampler. To me it tasted very average and the variety of toasts did not seem too special. We got a cinnamon bread, chocolate bread, and banana nut bread all dipped in egg via french toast style. Standard fruit and powdered sugar on top. All tasted very average to me. I would spare that 10 dollars and buy another monte cristo if I knew how average the french toast sampler was. 

Overall Mama's is a great breakfast place if you know what to order..haha well that's what yelp is for! Cash only and extremely crowded. Which is why having company is great to pass time with (; After you are done with mama's..head on over to fisherman's warf which is within walking distance away!
author: Lena L.

description: OMG!!! I do love this place.  Most bestest breakfast in all of San Francisco!!!!!!!  Thank you for a great meal and fantastic experience.  The Blue Crab omelet and the French Toast does ROCK!!!!
author: Don T.

description: The wait was super long, but its worth it if you know what to order. The Monte Cristo is to die for! We also had the Crab Bennedict, but the hollandaise sauce was too sour for my taste. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.
author: Kevin C.

description:
You should expect at LEAST an hour wait if you come around 10 or 11. I waited an hour and a half. 

Mama's is very small and once you're done waiting in the line outside, you have to get in the line INSIDE to order and pay. Then you have to wait on the side to be seated. If you're impatient I would not recommend coming here. It also gets super awkward if you're sitting by the window because people would be staring at you the entire time you're eating. 

I ordered the Chocolate Cinnamon french toast, although it looked really pretty it didn't leave me wanting more. My friend ordered the Washington Square omelette and he enjoyed that. Definitely try the benedict!!! We didn't order it, but looking around, a lot of people did and they seemed like they enjoyed it. 

Overall, decent prices and really wonderful service.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Despite a 90 min wait for party of 2, this place is awesome!!! Scrambled Florentine, Shrimp and Avocado Benedict With Grilled Tomatoes, Swedish Cinnamon yum yum yum.

Service is excellent also~
author: Kevin N Edna P.

description:
Is any meal worth waiting an hour for? Probably not. But that's how long you'll wait here. I enjoyed my kids' patience more than the meal. If time is a huge asset for you during a visit to SF, I'm not sure you'll get your best ROI here. This isn't a comment about the food, but rather a more existential remark about how you spend your time.

The food itself? Dungenness crab Benedict was excellent. Pancakes and French toast were quite good. Though how good can those really be? Not the religious experience I was anticipating. 

Anyway, the savory dishes were superb. The sweet ones were only quite good. But when underscored by the crazy wait, I'm not entirely sure a 2nd visit will happen.
author: B Q.

description:
The line is long, as it will be when you visit 75% of the stellar brunch places you'll find in SF.. 

Favorites if you're interested: 
Northwestern omelette (for the salmon lovers)
The Californian or Farmers omelette (for the bacon lovers)
Dungeness crab benedict (unfortunately seasonal)

While the Huevos Rancheros and South of the border omelettes are lovely.. you may save those choices for a brunch outing in the Mission, where it will likely be slightly more authentic and won't require an 1-2 hour wait. 

The one sad thing to note.. Unlike Brenda's which has a Philz right around the corner (so you can fill up on coffee while waiting in line)... Mama's doesn't have a solid coffee option that's particularly close. If you're a coffee lover, it's worth stopping on your way.
author: Tara K.

description: The wait for brunch was over an hour long, finally when we get inside there's another line to get to the register. They only take cash and debit card, that being said... I would recommend this place to anyone who visits SF! Also, the coffee is great, classic dark roast unlike anything you'll find at Peet's.
author: Sallar K.

description:
I am sorry to disappoint the fanbase, but Mama was just good for me. Like most people, we had to wait a good while before we could get in, and when we did, it was packed! It's a rather small place with not a lot of places to sit so we had to wait some more. In the end, we got seated at a small table besides the entrance. 

My companion got a coffee and the crab benedict which she felt was alright, nothing too special. I tried it and I have to agree. I got the strawberry french toast, from what I can remember, and it was tasty, but didn't have anything extraordinary about it. 

Bottom line, it isn't really worth the wait.
author: Bahar A.

description:
The Monte Cristo is to dieeee for! It has the perfect balance of savoriness from the turkey/ham and cheese and sweetness from the homemade berry jam.  Superrrrr delicious! Since I had my heart set on ordering the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast,  I actually shared this dish with my friend; however, next time I will definitely get an order myself and not share. Haha

A server (younger tan male) today accidentally spilled water on my place mat and napkin as he was refilling my cup. Since it wasn't a big deal to me, I told him it was okay and didn't expect anything after that. To my surprise, he came back with a new place mat and napkin! :) Awesome! Sadly, he didn't wipe all the water, so the second place mat got wet as well. haha He then got me another mat, made sure the table was dry, and set the mat & napkin for me.   I already knew the servers here were polite and welcoming; but because of this little incident, the service exceeded my expectations. +1 star! ^___^
author: Kirsten H.

description: There's a reason why there's always a long line to eat at Mama's, the food! That's what you want to see in a restaurant right?! It's a sign that Mama's knows what they are doing with their food. I had the French toast with fresh berries. It was fresh and tasted like it was. There's so many good items on the menu it's hard to choose! The wait may be long to get a seat, but I always look at that as a good thing. An empty restaurant is not a good sign...
author: Roger P.

description: Worth standing in line for. I had the most incredible omelette ever. It was a bay shrimp with asparagus, mushrooms, shrimp and cheeses. They served it with sourdough bread! Yummy! The line is long but oh so worth it.
author: Regina F.

description:
Mama's my all time favourite brunch spot in SF!  Visited many times, bringing friends/relatives visiting the city, to show off the BEST in SF with due pride.  

Location:  Sitting quietly in the corner between touristy Coit Tower and Washington Park  this tiny spot is easy to miss. A beautiful sunny day makes the experience doubly enjoyable as one can leisurely absorb the charm of this place, looking over the low curtained glass windows to view the lively scene of the Washington park while sipping mimosa or hot coffee! MAMA u are the savior to my grumbling tummy every time i climb up the steep hill to Coit tower, Lucky to have you here!

Note : 
- Be ready to wait for at least an hour in line. Once inside, stand in the line to order and pay at the counter first, then wait to be seated as table gets free. 

- They take debit card or cash. NO CREDIT CARD accepted!

MUST ORDER: 

Drinks
Orange juice - Very fresh 
Picnic punch - Red wine with fresh fruits served in an adorable mason jar

Main - 
Salmon Benedict aka Norwegian benedict - Very bery tasty! 
Monte Cristo - Pure bliss in the mouth! What a combination with the marmalade - a MUST TRY!!

Sides -
Chocolate cinnamon toast - delicious, served with fresh berries and banana goodness
Also try their delectable freshly baked "chocolate crumb cake" with hot chocolate drizzled on the top. 

To AVOID from the menu -
Lox Bagel Platter : Very disappointing and not worth the price
Paisano Benedict - spiciness of hot sauce in bell pepper with the benedict was a complete spoiler, the flavors just doesn't get along!! 

Next time I plan to try the French Toast  sampler and Dungeness crab eggs Benedict. 

Simply put, Mama's a " MUST VISIT" in SF. Its charming, great service and above all THE TOP BRUNCH place in the city!
author: Payal B.

description:
Can't believe I never did a review after all these years...so after my umpteenth time, I have to say the food is still consistent, fresh and a San Francisco treat.  Pan Dore is lemon sauced bread and my fav.  The Northern Italian omelet is the best and their multiple pastries are not too sweet; just the way I like it. (Not sure if they make pastry there but everything else is clearly prepared in their open glass off kitchen/prep area).  Everyone I see enjoys the meal and I have never had a bad one.  And I agree with the reviewers about the longg wait... it can be up to 45 minutes, but that's why (as a local) - when I go; I being a collapsible lawn chair, a paper, and either sunglasses or an umbrella.

Great food and family staffing offsets the lack of parking, long line and "cozy" setting (closely spaced chairs). 

A SECRET!!!  - -  they had a partnership with a restaurant in Marin county that failed.  The partnership, NOT the restaurant.... so anyway, although they are no longer affiliated with the San Rafael entity, the menu over there has many of the same items and it tastes really close  (can you say they cloned the recipes)  - so if you don't want to wait in line and don't mind driving and want to the taste of Mama's (more of less); go to the Marin place. There is outdoor seating too and your view is that of the dock of little boats.

But as a courtesy to Mama's if you want to find out where this restaurant is, "Bing" around for it or send me an email. Also I prefer Mama's but when I drive by and the line is past the grey try-plex and people are sitting on the stairway, I keep driving to Marin.
author: Andrea K.

description:
no need to put your name down on a waiting list; JUST hop to the back of the line and WAIT your turn!! the waitresses even accommodated the customers waiting in the long line w/ cups of water & samples of their breads TRY THE BANANA BREAD!!

once you are let into the small homey restaurant, you line up by the open kitchen & tempting bakery display to peruse the menu and decide what you want to order! then head to the register, pay & they'll seat you!

----MONTE CRISTO- a french toast twist on a turkey, ham & cheese sammie.. YUM the dish to get! try it w/ their jam!
----french toast sampler- i LOVE how they use their special breads to make the french toast & top it with fresh berries! I only got to try the banana bread but it was YUMMY, just missing a crunchy crust
----Dungeness crab w/ spinach benedict- my poached eggs were over cooked, which can never fly for a benedict since you need the runny eggs! but I liked the mildness of the hollandaise sauce... side potatoes were average
----smoked salmon scramble- "it is what it is"

perhaps I would have had a better experience if i personally ordered the Monte Cristo or french toast sampler! 

NOTE: try to go when there's not much of a wait, the wait almost over hyped it for me!

PARKING: good luck. haha it's the streets of SF
author: Jenny S.

description:
GASP! Only three stars you say?  Yeah, yeah, yeah.  I get the whole San Francisco breakfast craze.  Having been a Dottie's loyalist for years I understand what it means to wait ninety minutes on foot for my breakfast in one of the most crime ridden and undesirable neighborhoods in the city.  I've seen people shooting up, smoking crack, getting naked and defecating on the sidewalk while I waited and still at Dottie's the only thing I could think was if I will order the whiskey fennel scramble again.  But I digress...

Mama's has great food.  I ordered the eggs benedict and it was hands down one of the best I've experienced.  I complimented it with a side of cranberry orange french toast and two mimosas.  I'm a huge fan of the food.  I'm a HUGE fan of the service.  Everyone who worked here was unbelievabley awesome and the gratuity we left indicated as much.  

I remove two stars because while incredible, it's not the best breakfast in town.  Dottie's is.  It's most definitely not worth the 160 minute wait we endured.  Mama's lacks efficiency.  When a table that accommodates five is available, you yell out for a party of four or five even before seating the two people who are in the front of the line.  Parties of two move a lot faster than parties of five and when the dining room only accommodates twenty eight persons - it's polite to keep it moving.  

Go at least once for the experience.
author: Leah G.

description:
A friend and I came on a Tuesday morning when it was slightly raining...and there was still a 30-40 minute long wait. Gah! I have to admit that try to make it efficient by taking your order before you sit down.

I got the eggs benedict. It was good. The potatoes were really delicious. The waiter was super nice. 

I would give this place a higher rating if the wait justified the food...but it doesn't so I wouldn't bother coming back again.
author: Margaret R.

description: Let me start by saying I'm a Breakfast Connoisseur... Always on the hunt for the best breakfast spot in each city I travel to.  For the last 10 years Mamas delivers time and time again.  Yes, there's a wait, but the wait is well worth it.  By far the best Breakfast in San Francisco.
author: Ty T.

description:
I came with my Mama to Mama's for a brunch date! :D 

The food is great here but i don't know if my sentiments would be the same if i didn't go in famished. It's a clever tactic they got here with the waiting time of 1-2 hours. It's just enough time for tummies to grumble and for anything stuffed into our mouths could be more delicious and tastier than what it actually is or to justify the wait of 2 hours it can be nothing less than delicious. This place didn't disappoint at least! 

My favorite of the things ordered was the orange-cranberry french toast with walnuts and additional seasonal fruit. Usually french toast is too rich for me by the 2nd piece but i didn't find it so with this one, perhaps it was soaked in orange juice and the batter was lighter. I was able to enjoy every bite and gobble it all up. 

The Dungeness Crab Egg's Benedict was good too. The crab meat was light and flavorful and was fresh! Usually the seafood taste can overwhelm a dish but this one complimented the rest of it well. Next time i come i'd like to try dungeness crab in an omelette form! 

The Monte Cristo held good flavor too. I felt the portion size was good because any more than the 4 wedges given could of become too rich. This was best eaten piping hot from the kitchen! 

I absolutely loved the berry jam they had, it wasn't too sweet and i just lathered it onto every dish regardless if it was savory or sweet. 

I would definitely come back here again but maybe at an earlier hour to beat the lines. Word to the wise don't come around 10:00 because thats more of a 2 hr wait in line. 
If you do def make sure you have something to entertain urself with, with you.
author: Sharon Y.

description: THE MONTE CRISTO SANDWICH. There is always a line so naturally we knew this was a good place, the people in front of us in the line had come for breakfast the day before and loved it so much they were back again. I highly recommend the monte cristo sandwich, the sandwich is made then dipped in french toast batter and served with a delicious jam. A bit expensive but worth it.
author: Katie C.

description:
I really don't get what the hype is all about. 
I mean, it is Ooookiiiee at best. 
Luckily, on a Sunday afternoon, three of us stood in line only for about 30 mins or so ---that is to get into the restaurant. Then we went in and stood next to the cash register waiting for people to actually leave so we could be seated = another 15-20 minutes, so yes, the reviews are accurate in that you'll wait at least an hour before being seated. 
One other thing- they no taking credit cards? Really! What century do we live in? After a long wait, you go in and find out they don't take CC's. Imagine how badly you want to punch the person who delivers you that message. 
On to the important part - the food. 
We were rushed into ordering because a couple of the lunch time sandwhiches and the quesadilla we thought we'd order were not on the menu.  Did try the eggs benedict, which was good, but really nothing to write home about. 
I've had far better eggs benedict in places outside the city. Maybe it's because we ordered the veggie one and they specialize in the salmon or crab? I would give it another try to hopefully edit and give this review + one star in the future if that was worth the raving.
Another thing- do yourself a favor and do not order the sandwiches. I could make a better one at home.  The veggie sandwich my friend ordered was half hazardly slapped together with a few slices of avocado, tomatoes and some leafy greens. No spread? Nothing.
One redeeming quality - Their FRENCH TOAST! It is pretty different.  Thick. Almost like a cake and the sampler had a few different berry varieties. It was yum.
Mama's - I'd give you another try, but for now, I will say I am not truly impressed.
author: Kinjal N.

description: The only thing that beets the chicken sandwich or the fresh berry pancakes is the service. I dare you to find nicer staff!
author: Laith A.

description:
What better way to spend your Saturday morning than waiting for mama's cooking!? 

Secretly peeking through the windows, envious of the patrons munching joyfully on their omelets, toasts, and other breakfast goodies, I was contemplating which meal to devour. Don't know what to order?! I'll gladly order for you!! You will be having the MONTE CRISTO today!

Everything you ever wanted for breakfast is embedded within the Monte Cristo! It's like a breakfast steal deal! Turkey, ham, and cheese, synthesized together into a stacked toast sandwich, served with a side of oh so yummy jam! I never had a sandwich like it, so it is definitely worth trying! 

Only downfall of Mama's is the terrible 1.5 hour wait that I had to suffer through as I am guilty of eye-fcuking all the delicious meals through the windows of the restaurant. Other than that, I can always depend on Mama to satisfy my belly!
author: Christine L.

description:
I deliriously walked to this place in the wee hours of the morning to get in line before the rest of you Friscy people. I was still number four in line...dammit!

The minute they opened the doors, my eyes lit up! The cute little chefs, the fresh fruits laid out, the baked goods, the cute tables and textiles. I felt so sparkly inside. It was the cutest breakfast place I'd laid eyes on.

After debating myself on what to have, I chose the french toast platter. FABULOUS! (even though I ended up throwing up later on in the day, I'm not blaming you Mama...I'm blaming me having such sweet goodness early in the morning.)

My friend ordered the eggs benedict. It was a spot on benedict if I may say so myself.

It was a great place, but a little hectic because everyone wanted a piece. I couldn't really enjoy my meal slowly because I felt I was being selfish by taking my time as the line outside grew longer and longer.
author: Maggie K.

description:
Yes the line is long, yes the restaurant is small, yes the wait could be an hour or more, and yes the food is absolutely sssooo worth it. On this cold Friday morning, I stood in line for 45 minutes (while my wife and daughter waited in the car), watched people eat their food though the window, and cheered every time someone walked out the door. As we finally got in, we had to wait another 10 minutes in line to order our food at the front counter and watch the staff prepare these wonderfully appetizing breakfast in front of our eyes. 

Despite the long wait before we finally sat down, Mama's just became one of my favorite breakfast joint in the City. Anyhow, here's what we ordered: 

I ordered the Shrimp and Avocado Benedict. Now when I was younger I dreamt about eating a meal with shrimp in every bite. I think today that dream came true, but like most dreams it was better than reality. The first few bites were really really good, but the more you dig in the shrimp became a little overwhelming. I still like the Shrimp and Avocado Benedict, but I think I'll try something else the next time. 

My wife ordered the French Toast Sampler and thank God my wife shares. Ladies and gentleman, this is the Best French Toast EVER! It came with three different bread, but my favorite was the Banana Nut. What made it the Best Ever is the House Jam. Instead of putting syrup, you can put Mama's Homemade Jam and it was so delicious like you can't believe. Highly recommend this to anyone who has never tried it. 

What makes Mama's so intriguing to me is that they have a lot more in their menu that I really want to try (and I still want to get my own French Toast Sampler). The Dungeness Crab Omelette, Dungeness Crab Benedict, and more from their Weekend Specials. 

So if you're in line right now reading this, don't worry, blissfulness is soon to come. If you're inside Mama's reading this, hurry your @$$ up. For me, line or no line, see y'all at Mama's.
author: Mel B.

description:
I'd been wanting to try mama's for a long time. I knew it was highly reviewed but the thought of waiting in line always turned me off. A couple of my friends called my husband and I to meet up with them. They told us they had been waiting an hour and a half, and were finally close to the front, and we could come join them. We figured it was no or never so we accepted the gracious offer. By the time we got there and were ordering, my friends had waited a total of almost 2 hours, whereas my husband and I waited a total of 10 minutes. They of course wanted to order a variety to justify their wait time.

We shared the eggs benedict, chocolate french toast, and monte cristo. Everyone agreed the monte cristo was pretty good. It was lighter than others; more soft on the outside and not heavily fried. The flavor of the ham and cheese were great and it came with a homemade jam that was tasty. However the french toast and benedict were just okay. We sat there confused as to why this place gets such high ratings and agreed wait or no wait we probably wouldn't go back.
author: Alice J.

description:
The wait for this place is insane! The bf and I waited at over 2.5 hours for bunch here on a Sunday, which eventually turned to lunch because we got in around 3 PM.  But, if you're willing to wait it out, it's definitely worth trying out.

We ordered the monte cristo, northern italian omelette, and the smoothie.  The omelette was good, but monte cristo was the best dish out of the two.  I believe what made the monte cristo so amazingly delicious was the jam.  The discovery of the jam definitely made the long wait worth it all.  It wasn't too sweet and had nice bits of fruit in it.  We were told all their jam is made in-house and you can even order it online from their website!  Definitely a must try in SF.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Ok. After trying to go to Mama's once, I thought I'd give it a go seeing how I'm local and find out what all the hype is about. I went on a friday at 11am, and had to wait 2 hours before even placing my order. We had the Huevos Rancheros and the Mama's special breakfast sandwich, which the cashier said were a couple of the best items on the menu (also they only take cash or debit[$1 additional charge]). The food was fine, nothing special. The sandwich bread was soft and the black beans were cooked well, everything else was pretty standard brunch affair.

Save yourself a lot of time and go to Bottle Cap just across the park - much better food and no wait.

I honestly think this place has simply gone viral and the reviews are totally out of proportion. Also, what food doesn't taste good after waiting 2 hours??? Everyone inside was staring at their smartphone instead of talking to one another, which makes me this these high reviews are simply based off empty internet hype. Basically the experience is just a line ride.
author: Ben G.

description:
Carlos Santana eats here.  I saw him!  

Anyway, hundreds of Yelpers are not wrong-- I had the classic french toast made with home baked cinnamon brioche and let me tell you, it was orgasmic.  The price was good by city standards.  The home made jam was also orgasmic.

What was not orgasmic?
Waiting outside in a line for 1 hour on a Friday morning (why are you people not working?!) Then waiting inside in a line for another 25 minutes.  Then having people stare at me like a pack of starving hyenas for me to finish my food.  

This is an instance where popularity severely negatively impacted my entire experience.  No matter how DELICIOUS the food is, I much rather go somewhere where I can enjoy my hefty brunch calories at a leisurely pace.
author: Susan C.

description:
This place was pretty yummy!! 

The wait was about 45 minutes on a Tuesday at about 1145am. You wait in line, order at the counter and get seated before your food comes. There are about 40 seats in there... it is so small!!!  

I love that the owners last name is Sanchez!! 

We ordered the Northern Italian omelette and it tasted like pizza! Just like the hostess said.

 Also ordered the chocolate cinnamon french toast which was good but not impressive. 

Another thing, order the chocolate crumble cake!! So damn good!!! 

I wouldn't go as far as saying it's the best breakfast ever but it was good!
author: Chante C.

description:
My second time here and still just as good!  Of course the only downfall I have about this place is that it is small and you have to stand in a line outside, but then again, that is smart good business in a way.  I mean, what's more attractive than seeing someplace that has a line out the door, right?

There was some kind of hold up in the ordering line so someone took our order and had us sit already (suprisingly, our table was ready before the cashier was).  I didn't want all the veggies in the lox and salmon platter so she just put me down for a side (which I didn't know you could do) and it came as a sandwich with just cream cheese, salmon, and onions.  It was SOOO good!!!  Bagel was toasted but not hard, cream cheese was plentiful and soft, onions not too overpowering, and there was lots and lots of lox!!!  

And, of course, there was the Monte Cristo... it was like heaven that comes with fruit!!  Soo good how everything ties in together!

Then because we hadn't paid they had offered to take our payment, since it was cash, up to the cashier and was even nice enough to add on AND bring me back three jars of their delicious jam (did I mention that I NEVER eat jam??).  I watched the hispanic busser deal with some difficult customers and he did it graciously and also was very comical about it.  Sort of like, "Geez, guys!" but did it anyway.  Excellent service, excellent food, but small small teeny tiny place.
author: Almalei M.

description:
Third time's the charm! The first two times we were too hungry to queue up but we snacked up the third time and stayed in the queue for an hour and a half. Anything for good food, right?!

I loved the food, the service and everything about the restaurant. I had crab cake benedict, it was divine, I could have 10 more but I did the right thing and went back two days later to have one more ;)
