If it wasn't as far as it is from my place, I would go to this place every weekend for brunch and introduce everyone I know to this place. If you haven't eaten at this place yet, you are really missing on something.
author: Syed A.

description: I give this restaurant the highest possible recommendation.  If i lived in SF i would be a regular.  Outstanding food & staff & everything is presented beautifully. I want to pick the entire location up & bring it home with me.  A "MUST GO" destination without a doubt.
author: Peter M.

description:
If we didn't have to wait 2 entire hours to eat at this place then I would've given this place 5 stars! 

I got the the french toast with fresh fruit and it was bomb.com!  Their homemade jam was pretty on point too!
author: Charlene J.

description: I love brunch and french toast so this place was a must for me and my fiancé to visit during our anniversary celebration in SF. The wait was pretty horrendous but what's a girl to do when she wants to go to the best brunch place? Line up, duh! So we did! Got the Monte Cristo, french toast sampler, and salmon Benedict. My girlfriend got the crab Benedict so we got a bite of that as well. Fiancé loved the benedict he inhaled if like air! A must-visit for people touring SF!
author: Vickie N.

description:
Love the food, but not the wait.

Clean environment. Fresh food. Cheerful staff.

If I'm in SF, I'm stoppin' by Mama's.
author: Phil Y.

description:
There's a reason why there are so many reviews. This was the first place we had breakfast at during our first trip to San Fran and it was delicious. There was a decent wait (about 20 minutes) even at 10am on a Tuesday.

I had the Brickhouse eggs benedict and my wife had the california omelette, both were great and the service was very friendly. I'd love to come back on my next trip here.
author: Michael D.

description:
BEST BRUNCH EVER.

when you incorporate the likes of dungeness crabs, with eggs for BRUNCH...I think you'd be stoked too.  and if you're not a seafood fan, frankly you should be.  to a secondary degree, if you really don't like seafood, they have the best french toast (sampler to try different varieties) with the freshest looking berries and fruit ever.  

The portions?  Pretty astronomical.  I couldn't finish my eggs benedict...but I had to make sure I didn't have any crabs left!  the potatoes left something to be desired...but i had plenty of food anyways.  one minor defeat, worth noting for all you starch fans.

Even at 8:30am on a perfectly Friday morning, there was a small wait.  I liked that wait inside in line to order before getting seated at your table.  It's torture watching all the food but at the same token, truly in awe.  I watched the baker make berry muffins the size of my fist.  Too bad I didn't stick around long enough to watch the final product.  

Definitely coming back to this spot the next time i visit.  Mama's is a brunch spot to be adored by all !
author: Brittany H.

description:
Mama's offers - undisputedly - the best brunch I have ever eaten in San Francisco. From their Dungeness Crab Omelette to the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast (with fresh berries) Mama's menu items evolve brunch into the fourth meal of the day. If you find yourself in the Northbeach/Telegraph Hill area of San Francisco, be sure to visit the city's best kept secret: Mama's. And after you've stuff yourself, expedite digestion by walking up to Coit Tower and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the Bay! 

The following menu items come highly recommended: Dungeness Crab Omelette (with avocado and sour cream), Shrimp and Avocado Benedict (with grilled tomatoes), and the Buttermilk Batter Pancakes (with fresh seasonal fruit).   Always ask for the sourdough baguette and a glass of fresh orange juice, and while you're waiting for your food, be sure to indulge in the fresh homemade jam (it was so good I was tempted to ask if i could take some home!).
author: Moniza M.

description:
Yes, I must add my 2 cents' worth to this conversation of whether Mama's is worth the visit. 

*NO CREDIT CARDS ACCEPTED!! DEBIT CARDS are ACCEPTED but they add a $1.00 charge

For tourists & locals alike :

Best thing to do is make sure you're there before 9am on a weekday ( i know the place opens at 8am, but i'm just being generous - in case you can't wake up that early). Make sure you bring at least $35 per person (dishes are priced between $13 - $24) 

The iced latte is not worth it. Skip. 

The omelettes are so fluffy and delicious - totally worth it! Side of potatoes.... yummy!

French toast - yes yes yes... don't deny yourself this deliciousness...


While I did not try it - I definitely want to go back for the pancakes... they have a heavenly look about them. 


You go in and pay for your meal first, wait for a table inside and then get to eat.  Service is wonderful - raspberry jam is what you want btw - and it's so relaxing.  

Cannot wait to go back!
author: Minnie S.

description:
Dear Mama's,

I love you so.  I have always been intimidated by the line of lovers and loiterers outside the doors on weekend mornings (for hours!).  When faced with a free week day and a parent's visit I thought this was just the place to charm them.  We arrived at 9am and after a fifteen minute wait were able to come inside.
 
 Yes, the food was amazing, but even more so was the service.  The cashier gave us a brief history of the restaurant and informed us that Mama is actually his grandmother (lucky man).  The staff was engaging, thoughtful, considerate and truly lovely.  These aren't the faceless, sweat on their brow servers who re-fill your coffee and could care less if you were run over by a bus or a large Saint Bernard moments later.  Mama's boasts servers with sweat on their brows (it is small and warm in there after all) who treat you with such care you would like to take them home with you.  There is something to be said about eating food made with love!
 
If you are able to come early on a week day morning, you will leave content and certain that Mama's could charm the pants off every tourist or San Francisco resident that gets to walk through the door.
author: Allyson D.

description:
I came here on a Friday morning around 8.30 but the line was impossibly long but because of all the hype I've read about Mama's, I made my way back down the next morning, this time reaching at 7.45 a.m. (it opens at 8). My bf and I were seated at about 9.15 so it was a 1.5 hour wait which was pretty bearable. Small place with a few tables. The atmosphere was quite cosy and had a very honest feel to it. 

French toast sampler - the best of the three french toasts has to be the banana walnut one. super yum and not stingy with the walnuts! 

Monte Cristo - what Mama's is famous for. I thought it was pretty good, my bf really liked it. I know how everyone likes the jam (I did too) but I tried eating it with the maple syrup from the french toast and I liked how the flavors really complemented each other. 

Overall, is it worth the wait? Imho, not really. I think the food was pretty good, but not good enough to justify the wait. I would be back if I wouldn't need to wait more than half an hour though.
author: Olivia P.

description:
God I miss this place. When I lived closer, I would love to introduce visitors to this place and make them wait for hours to eat here, just to prove to them that it was worth the wait. Its a small place, you wait in line, you see the food ,get really hungry, finally get to order, pay and then wait to sit. The fast part is, by the time you sit, the food is ready and you are fed and out of there within a half hour. So in that sense, the turnover is not bad. 

The Banana Nut French Toast. Every time I come, I try to talk myself into trying something new but I always end up getting the banana nut french toast, with a side of sausage. And a tall orange juice. 

So much love for this place, but I've lost the will to wait so long to get in, that now I only try to go on the weekdays at off hours. But I haven't gone in a while. I'm due for a visit.
author: Ping N.

description: Awesome food. We arrived 45 minutes before the place opened and 20 people were already lined up. Thankfully we got in with the first group. The food is great. The place is cash only so keep that in mind before you attempt to order one of everything like me. Know what you want before you arrive...things go fast once you are in line.  Had the chocolate french toast. Very tasty. I would go back at least monthly if Ilived in the area. Everything we had was good from the potatoes to the bacon.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Monte cristo is sooooooo good. My favorite!!! I wish There's no need to wait in line for a hour everytime.
author: Milly K.

description:
The food is amazing so it's 5 stars for the food and the portions are HUGE.
The wait is what it is LONG so be prepared to wait up to 1 hour. and it is expensive for an omelette $15-$20. but everything is over priced in san Francisco
author: August S.

description:
Positive: Delicious food that we thoroughly enjoyed. We had their Famous Monte Cristo. the dish was very tasty and came with a great homemade Raspberry jam - perfect mix of sweet and savory. We also had their special Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict with spinach. I read in other reviews that the crab was too less and too much spinach. I can't agree with that at all. I think the proportions was well done. The French Toast Sampler was great as well. It came with 3 different types of bread and lots of fresh fruit. 

Negative: super long wait times - we came at 8:10 on a Sunday morning and waited for 2.5 hours. The price is on the high side as well. For 3 ppl we spent around $60 just for breakfast. Portion sizes could be slightly bigger.
author: Isa T.

description: Nice food -I had the Cristo... but the line was insane - it's nice food definitely but not mind blowingly delicious to queue for over an hour for- would Noor come again ? Nah ... was nice but not worth the hype
author: Noor A.

description: Mama's is no joke. Come hungry but bring a snack because Mama will have you waiting. It is definitely the spot to be at, and for that expect to wait in line anywhere between 1.5 to 2hrs! It also helps if you decide on what to order while you are waiting in line, because once you've survived the line and actually make it inside the tiny establishment you will order and pay at the counter with who I am assuming is Mama. She hand rings each item on the register and the items add up. We paid over $80 for two of us but we did order 4 items, one of them being the crab eggs benedict special which Mama hustled me on and rung it up for more than the advertised price but after waiting in line for so long that was the least of my worries...I was hangryyyy! Mama's Cristo was probably the best thing we ordered and it was amazing. The jam to dip it in was also amazing. So if you have a couple extra hours to spare head over to Mama's and put on your best smile for all the photo bomb opportunities you will have from the intrigued tourists passing by.
author: Chris D.

description: The wait was reallllllyyyyy long. I get it, the foods good. But it's just a really small place. So you will definitely wait in line for at least an hour. I have been here a few times. There is always a line. Even when I came on a random Tuesday. Parking of course sucks because it's in the city. I would suggest eating something small first or bring a snack for the line. Because chances are you will need to wait for a while. It's definitely GREAT food. But just know that you will most likely have to wait. So dont go there hungry. (Ironic, I know).
author: Kayla A.

description:
I've been pretty lucky the past few times i came to eat at Mama's. Normally the wait is up to 45 minutes or so if not longer. The past 2 times i came here we waited for maybe 15 minutes or so and was seated. This place is really small for the amount of people that come here just for breakfast or brunch. 

I ordered their smoked salmon benedict and the french toast sampler and i felt like i was in heaven! I normally don't eat egg benedict but this one was REALLY GOOD! each bite was full of smoked salmon and juicy egg yolk. The french toast sampler was really good, but was a bit sweet. This is a pretty decent size order so it can be shared if you wanna try something else also. 

The price here is a bit pricey for breakfast, and the line is always long. Don't even try coming on a weekend cause it will be SUPER packed.
author: Jenny G.

description:
I've been passing by this place early in the morning for so many times. The line started to form by 6:30am. From what I heard, you'll have to wait in line for ONE hour until you can have a seat. I normally won't wait that long for food even it's super tasty. This time, I tried, and I'm lucky enough only waited for 30mins.

The wait is well worth. The place is very nice old day decor. You can read back the history of this place. The seat are kinda tight to fit in tho. The waitress are very nice and of course pretty.  I like it you get the first look at how they cook everything from the their open kitchen. You'll have an idea what to eat from there. 

My wife ordered  their egg benedict. I ordered a sandwich, which is a bad idea. We can barely finish both things. I should've order a pancake. The egg benedict was cooked perfect. I don't know anywhere in town cook a better egg benedict than Mama's (please let me know if any). My sandwich also taste good. I also ordered a latte and their berry cake. It's not the best I tried but good enough to enjoy. 

I'll definitely wait in line again.
author: Jason L.

description:
The LINE: I love to meet up here bc there is a line of people.  WHAT??? you must be saying. But for me, you get to visit and talk all the way up to the front door.  We've gone in as a party of 7 so there was alot of catching up to do in THE LINE.  Once inside, you finally have the opportunity to savor what this gem is all about...great breakfasts. Mama's is very accommodating and they really seem to get you seated as quickly as possible. It is very popular with locals and tourists so there is always THE LINE.

Then when you get inside, you stand against the glass partition that separates you from the cooking going on, look up at the menu, decide what you will order and place your order. Then you are given your table.

The pan dore was the first thing I ever ordered here and I've had it many times.  Buttery apples and french toast. Wow! It's really heavenly! My little niece likes its butteriness too and 180s to watch the people doing tai chi in Washington Square Park amongst other things to watch in the park that fascinates a 3 year old. 

Dungeness crab this and that are offered here and their website announces when it
is in season. So head out here for a real SF dungeness treat.

The eggs benedict is a thing here.  Not only do they offer a mash up of them, they are totally great tasting and a must for those of us who love eggs benedict. Choices, choices, choices.

Oh!  yeah yeah yeah...you can get a Dungeness/eggs Benedict here...best of both worlds. Happy for that revelation. Smile.

If only I can start every day here.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Not a unique thought, but I think this place is one of the best places to get brunch in the city, with caveats regarding the wait. Like every other review states, coming here with a party greater than 4 means you will wait a LONG time. Even arriving early here will still entail a large wait. However, once you get in the door (still a short line after that!), you'll be able to enjoy a pretty comprehensive menu with every item on it very good. 

I did notice that they seem to be expanding into a larger store along Columbus, and if that reduces the wait to something more reasonable (less than an hour), I would have to put this place as 5 stars.
author: Oliver Z.

description:
I would just like to put down 5 stars because it's just THAT good! Try everything, eat everything! =)

And all I can complain about is probably just their $1 surcharge on usage of bank cards.
author: Annie H.

description:
Kind of disappointing, considering the other rave reviews strewn about their Yelp page.

We waited about 45-60 minutes, which wasn't too bad since I was mentally prepared to wait twice as long. We decided to order three of the most popular dishes for the two of us (we knew this was gonna be wayyyy too much food....) and my mouth started to salivate in anticipation as we were seated. 

1) Dungeness Crab Benedict - 1/5
I was looking forward to this dish the most. I LOVE crab, and I LOVE eggs benedict, so this one seemed like a no brainer. But I was sorely disappointed. The poached egg was overcooked, and the hollandaise sauce was mediocre. I for one love runny yolk all over the place that I can sop up with some extra bread (or just lick off the plate). The poached eggs here are cooked so that there is none of that delicious, golden, messy yolk. I secretly glanced at the Eggs Benedict that the parties next to us ordered, and their eggs were cooked the same way. Maybe this is the way that Mama's prefers to cook their poached eggs, or maybe the chefs just accidentally cooked the eggs too long, but either way, a big fat thumbs down on this dish. I'd rather take the crab separately and eat it on its own.

2) Monte Cristo - 4/5
The concept behind a Monte Cristo has always seemed so strange to me - sweet and salty mixed together. A cross between a ham/turkey sandwich and french toast. Thus, I have never ordered it before, afraid to be wasting my money and calories on something I wouldn't like. I was pleasantly surprised by this dish! Though this french toast sandwich thing seems to be theoretically so wrong on so many levels, it's actually quite enjoyable. Two opposites put together = perfection. Kind of like Ron and Hermione. (Any Harry Potter fans out there?)

3) French Toast Sampler - 2/5
Decent. Though I've definitely had better french toast elsewhere. It comes with one piece of cranberry, cinnamon, and blueberry french toast, topped with fresh blueberries, strawberries, and bananas. Nothing spectacular. 

This place wouldn't be a bad option for brunch if the lines weren't so horrendous, and if you happened to be in the area. But granted that people wait 1-2 hours on average, and that there are so many better brunch options in wonderful San Francisco, I would skip on going to Mama's.


Sorry Mama's, but I'm not a fan. :(
author: Sally T.

description:
We waited in the chilly sanfran fog for almost an hour...(although they do have an effective system set up for pre-ordering before you are seated....effort has been noted!) I have stopped basing expectations on the length of lineups/popularity...so I found myself seated with no prejudgments. It is a bright and cheery restaurant with an open kitchen and a delicious display of homemade streusels, crumble cakes, breads and brioche. I ordered an egg white omelette with a side of sausage and then thought "how the hell can I possibly review this?" So...I asked 'round the table and here are the responses:

Pasha   "satisfying" eggs benny
Peter     "you know how people talk about licking their plates clean? I 
                really did" eggs benny
Parris    "I'm full and I don't know" eggs benny
Leor       "my meal was well worth the ridiculously long and painful wait" 
                eggs milan
Monica "long line, but worth it with every bite" dungeness crab eggs 
                benny

And there you have it folks. Line bad. Food good.
However, if I ever return I will be eating the french toast sampler...I'm not a huge fan of french toast....but just looking at it made me realize I may be making a grave life mistake. Next mission...befriend french toast.
author: Cin S.

description:
I would rate this five stars if it weren't for the two lines and the weird walk to the outside tiny bathroom.

The long line out front, is the sign of a good place. And it's excellent, but it's oh so deflating when you're in the front of the line then you see the second line and you kinda wanna throw a fit like a child. Lol 

It's worth the wait of course. 
Onto the food I recommend the northbeach omelet (it tastes like pizza ) with baguette toast and if you're dining with an other person get the french toast sampler to share. My favorite French toast is the apple pan dore. Drool worthy! But try it for your self! Eat a piece of fruit before you wait in line so you don't throw a low blood sugar fit like a toddler like I do haha
author: Courtney M.

description:
Sunny days in SF are perfect for brunch. Even if it means waiting for ~2hrs just to get some food in your mouth. 

Definitely worth the wait. A police car even drove by to see what all the fuss was about. 

The place is small, the bathroom is in the back, out the door, and down some green stairs, kind of lulzy. When you (finally) get inside, you order and pay first, and then get seated. 

Highlights:
+ The Bloody Mary comes in a cute jar with a stick of celery
+ Monte Cristo is unlike any triangle-shaped sandwich I've ever had. 
+ The little jar of jam is pretty fucking amazing. Spread it on everything. Repeat. 

I also got to try the pancakes, French toast, omelette, salad, smoothie. Everything was delicious. Expect to pay around ~$10 for each thing. The smoothie was ~$4. I paid about ~$17 total. WORTH. 

Also the decor is really cute so you can pose with your food against a nice backdrop.
author: Connie C.

description: My friends and I waited in line for about 35 minutes, and then another 20 inside to get seated. The eggs were great, not the best I've had but still good. Wouldn't wait that long for those eggs again; however ..... The kugelhopf was what we decided we would share for dessert. Don't make the same mistake, order it for yourself as it is TDF! No seriously, I would go back for that any day of the week. Yum. Yum. Yum.
author: Safa T.

description:
I normally don't like to wait to eat but this can be worth the wait with good company and friendly people in line as was the case on my most
recent visit. A 20min wait on a Tuesday afternoon? Did it anyway. Had the dungenness crab omelet and French toast
sampler. Everyone should get the sampler! If you're in the NB area, could
be worth waiting in line.
author: Linda H.

description:
Mama's epitomizes SF's "oh there's a line? let's wait in it!" syndrome.

I got their veggie benedict with bacon (trust me, it's cheaper this way than the other way around). I'm continually on a quest for the ultimate benedict, and thought it was solid, but not mind blowing. The grilled potatoes were nothing special. 

Overall, the food here is good, but definitely not "wait 1 hour in a line you can't get out of" good. There are many better options for that type of waiting like Plow or Foreign Cinema.

I'm glad to be able to say I've been to Mama's considering all its hype, but I'll likely never go back.
author: Jono L.

description:
The first time I tried coming here was on a Sunday afternoon. I thought I was being smart by coming later, but there was still a long line outside at 2PM. The second time I tried coming here was Monday and it was closed. The 3rd time I came on a weekday at about 2PM and I got seated right away. I guess it's true when they say the 3rd time is the charm.

I have to admit I was a bit overwelmed and couldnt decide what to order. When I decided, I went to the register and swear I stood there for a good 5 minutes while the guy was counting what I believe was the tip jar and didnt even acknowledge me until he was done (even though I was literally in front of his face). Ouch.

Anyhow, food was good but to be honest I wouldnt stand in their ridiculous long line for it.
author: M W.

description:
I drove from Seattle with a bunch of friends and went straight here. (We wanted breakfast and I looked on yelp and decided on this spot because of the reviews!) We got there before opening and there was already a long line. (Good thing I told a friend that lived there to meet us there and she already saved a spot for us!)

IT IS TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT.

I ordered the montecristo sandwich, which is not what I usually order for breakfast but I LOVED IT! It was AMAZING!!!!!!! I want to go there and order it again. The breakfast was amazing. My boyfriend got the crab benedict and that was also delicious. We also got the crumb cake, which was soooo good.

Waiting in line wasn't so bad (since we were in the car for about 13 hours!). It went by really fast. The staff was very friendly. Just get there early!
author: Jazeleene G.

description:
The GF has been "hunting" on Yelp for NEW places and has been wanting to come here. We woke up early, waited in line and ate it all up.

Brief Summary
-- Get here early like 730am
-- Expect to WAIT
-- Their system works (it's so simple it's complicated lol)
-- Research the menu and KNOW what you want so you're ready
-- Great friendly service
-- Mom and Pop status

After much hype, the GF and I made it to Mama's. I was the one lagging and not getting up as soon as I should have. Even still, we got there somewhat early and ended up being the first people to wait for a table.

Their system is simple. You wait in line outside. You wait in line inside and watch them cook other people's food. You order your food, pay and you wait for a table. Once you sit down, your food is basically ready. You eat, leave a tip and the cycle repeats.

What we ordered:

-- Scrambled Florentine
This is what I got. Crispy bacon, spinach, onions and white cheddar. Home fries/potatoes. Orange wedge. Sourdough baguette toasted with butter. There was great balance in my dish. It wasn't the best breakfast I ever ate but it was definitely delicious, fresh and satisfying.

-- French Toast Sampler
Shared this with the GF. We had to try it since everyone and their mother is getting it and putting it on their yelp reviews. There were 3 slices, a bunch of fruit, powdered sugar, an orange wedge and some syrup. I think I liked 2 out of 3. One in particular was a bit too fibrous for me and consistency wasn't very "french toast"-ish.

-- Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict
The GF ordered this. She said it was very filling. It had a lot of crab (explains the $20 price tag) and it was delicious. I'm not a big fan of seafood so I didn't try it. 

Waitstaff was very attentive and friendly. A lot of people seem to know the staff. I really liked the "home" feeling here at Mama's. Definitely enjoyed the breakfast. I think we'll be back to try some other items and get here earlier :)
author: Daniel D.

description:
I would've given it 5 stars but just don't like the damn long line you gotta wait in at freakin 8am in the morning. Like really people are that hungry and active to be waiting since 7am to get some damn breakfast. I have eaten here about 3 times (Yes, I had to get up about 6:45am just to make it there before 8am) The line is pretty quick right when it opens. Just it doesn't move because once seated the people don't want to hurry up and eat and they take they're sweet time w/ unnecessary conversations within their party. So, try to get there within the first wave!

The food I tried: the french toast sampler. I loved it. Also, tried all there freshly made coffee cakes, crumb cakes. Deliciously fresh. The Monte Cristo was my main entree(3 times). Every time I eat this. I fall asleep right when I get back home. This dish puts you to bed. It's just that good. I would come back again just for this dish...lol
author: Jeff C.

description: How have I not reviewed this place?!? I love Mama's. I dream of Mama's Monte Cristo. I arrange trips into the city around Mama's Monte Cristo. Hand's down the best I've had, and fabulous homemade jam. Be prepared to wait in a line. There is always a line here, but there's a reason everyone is willing to wait in it.
author: Goldi J.

description:
People stop reviewing this place!  It only makes the line longer!  ;o)

If you are a fan french style breakfast/brunch items (think croque madam or monsieur), order the Monte Cristo.  It takes longer than other dishes, but it's grand.  The homemade jam has texture and depth of taste.  It's the perfect touch to an already perfect dish.

Bravo Mama's - great food and service.  They cannot keep up with the demand so their line will always be out the door (even before they open).  We got there before they opened on Saturday and there were already 20 people in line.  What the heck!  It's like breakfast Black Friday at Mama's everyday according to the reviews.  Get there early right before opening (they open at 8a) and you'll have free parking before 9a.  You can join or watch the tai chi classes at the park while you're waiting in line.
author: Chris L.

description: Probably best to arrive  around 1-2.  I arrived around 11:30 and waited an hour an half.  The food came out pretty quick.  Ordered the variety French toast and the smoked salmon eggs Benedict.  Both were really good however I though the banana bread French toast was a bit too much.  I like the plain French toast.  Would come back again when it is less busy to try their other menu options.
author: L E.

description: Great service!! The BEST orange juice I've ever had in my life!! It's so fresh and sweet like unreal! Delicious North beach benedicts!
author: Fanny Z.

description: I've been here every day since I've to San Fran and enjoyed everyone of my plates. I had the regular eggs and potatoes with the French toast sampler...yum. I ordered the Monte Cristo and it was delish with the homemade jam....heaven. I also had their fluffy pancakes...yummy. The wait wasn't too long the first couple of times but the last time we arrived at 12pm and waited an hour...yikes. Love the food though. Want to get my fix before I head back to LA.
author: Jafi S.

description: Foods are good, prices are okay, but the service is poor. I waited for 90 minutes and wasn't expecting for this kind of service, that they just directly took away my ketchup without asking me and regardless if I'm still going to use it. A bit disappointed to be honest. BUT the foods are soooo good. Try it if you don't mind the service and the long queue both outside and inside.
author: Yue Z.

description: You should wake up early to get in line before 7:30am if you want a shorter wait time (about a 30 min difference compared to over an hour). The Monte Cristo and Classic Benedict were AMAZING!!! I can't believe how delicious the food was... Everything was so savory... The service was a plus! I loved this place so much!!!
author: Stephanie N.

description: Well worth the hour wait!!! We came all the way from Los Angeles to have a seat at Mamas! If you love eggs Benedict, you'll be in heaven here! Can't tell you what to try because everything looks so good!! I did have the Spanish Benedict w/Spicy chorizo which was simply amazing! Can't wait to comeback soon and try their famous Monti Cristo!!
author: Ralph N.

description:
Two of my friends and I arrived at Mama's fifteen minutes before opening on a Saturday morning and there was already a line of hungry people.  We hopped into our place in line and it continued to grow... and grow... and grow... and by the time we were seated, about 45minutes-1hour later, the line was stretching down the block. 

So that's advise #1: get there early.

A friend got the French Toast with Berries, and another friend and I split the French Toast Sampler and Dungeness Crab Omelet with Brie and Avocado (on the special menu).  Everything was excellent.  The french toast was made with three different types of bread, grilled to perfection.  The omelet was filled to the brim with crab, brie, and avocado.  Yum yum yum!  Don't forget to serve yourself generous servings of the homemade jam placed on each table... it's really good on both plain toast and french toast.   Friends tell me that the Eggs Benedict and the Monte Cristo are both very good too. 

Which leads me to advice #2: if going for the first time go with friends and order different dishes so you can taste everything (it is a bit of a hassle to come here after all, with the long wait and what not.)

But if you come here and find a super long line, and you feel like your stomach is going to eat itself because it's so hungry, and you can't fathom how you are going to wait two hours, fear not!  

Advice #3:  Go across the street and buy focaccia bread from the Liguria Bakery.  I recommend the cinnamon raisin or pizza.  Ask them to cut it up for you.  It's less than $5, decent portion, and the perfect snack to munch on as you wait.

One more advice:  They only take cash/debit, and they charge $1 on all debit card transactions so bring cash!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Here's the thing, Mama's has the best breakfast/brunch food in SF, hands down. 

We didn't want it to be true. We'd heard about the line and thought it was absurd, and that no place could be that good. So we came at 7:50 am on a Thursday. Was there a line? Of course. We didn't make it in on the first seating at 8am, and ended up having to wait close to an hour. Just to recap, we waited for an hour at 8 am on a Thursday....

But the food did not disappoint. We had: 
Northwest Omelet (smoked salmon). The omelet was great, but what was even better was the daily jam on the toast. The jam - some berry I didn't recognize - was delicious.
Cranberry-Orange French Toast with berries (cranberry walnut bread, battered in egg whites) - SO GOOD. Seriously, you might not expect french toast made from cranberry walnut bread to taste good, but it was superb. Plus the bread had come right out of the oven when we got there so we knew it was fresh. 
We also split a piece of coffee cake which was amazing, probably because by the time we got in we were ravenous. 

The food was hands down a 5 but the wait is just absurd and brings down the overall score significantly. So glad we went, but the jury is still out on whether the food is worth a one hour wait on a weekday.
author: Alden Q.

description:
Ok so i had to check out the hype about this place, after walking for about 30 min from my hotel to mamas i arrived about 9:30-10  and i was greeted with a semi long line, so after waiting for about an hour and a half i finally made it in, and ordered the french toast sampler

so the food was delicious and it had a very homemade feeling, but i dont know if it was good enough for the wait.

so was the food good? yes it was
was it fresh? yes
is the service good? yes

is it worth standing in line for hours...? thats up to you, i probably  wont do it again
author: Noel D.

description: Amazing pancakes. I loved the bacon. The sausage was good, but nothing special. The coffee cake was only Ok. But those pancakes....The service was also excellent. I waited an hour in line, but it was worth it.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
My friend was visiting from SoCal and since she took me to a super cute brunch place when I was there, I thought I'd return the favor.

Cute little brunch place located in Washington Square Park! Came here around 2pm on a Thursday and there was no wait! You order/pay first and then get seated for your food. We shared the #2 omelette and the French Toast Sampler, total came out to around $12 each. The omelette came with a small side of potatoes and toast. The French Toast Sampler came with 3 pieces of different french toast - banana, original and cranberry walnut (listed in the order of my preference). Their jam is soooo yummy, you must spread it on your french toast!
author: Christine C.

description: Mama's is very good however... ask yourself.. Do I mind waiting 2 hours for breakfast? Is any egg scrabble worth that? If the answer is yes than go for it. If No than don't.  Being from SF with amazing  breakfast restaurants everywhere  and right around Mama's, It's hard for me to wait in that line.  If you live somewhere without a lot of great places to eat maybe check it out. Tips. Get there at opening time, and be aware once you go through the front door there is another line to wait in before you are seated.
author: Susan S.

description:
This is a perfect example of customer reviews enlarging an "ok" business' ego.  I really don't get why everyone has such fantastically astronomical things to say about this establishment.  It's just ok...if that at all.  

We arrived a bit before 8 and began to wait in line.  For a place that is so popular and has such a following, you would figure they would be thankful to their customers by not making them wait outside in the rain.  It's not like they were even busily preparing anything they were all kind of just standing around looking for something to do.  I mean come on, you can't open your doors 5 minutes early when you see a line full of people waiting in the pouring rain???  That's just ungratefulness for your good luck of returning customers if you ask me.  Not only did they make everyone stand out in the rain, they made us wait 5 minutes after the establishment was supposed to be open.   

So as we were freezing our bun-zo's off, they finally opened their doors.  A normal person would expect cheerfulness and politeness when walking in, but I guess we should have dined somewhere else for that.  We reached the counter to order and the guy taking the orders didn't even look up and acknowledge us.  I get so upset when people in customer service act like you're bothering them.  I just waited in the rain for 20 minutes, the least you could do is pick your head up and smile at me and act like you want my business!!

The waitress, however, was very pleasant.  I would give her 5 stars.  The food, eh, not so great.  Seriously, it would have been just as good at Denny's without dropping 25 bucks for two people.  We had an omelet and french toast with potatoes.  It tasted like french toast that I could have made at home with regular bread.  The best part of our meal was the homemade raspberry jam on toast.  Hard to believe but yes, this was the best part.

I guess what I've learned from this experience is beware of the establishments with raving reviews and lines.  I mean really at some point I guess they convince themselves they don't have to be nice, courteous or of superb quality if there's always a line of people waiting to eat there.  I guess they get in the mentality that they're doing you a favor by selling you food instead of appreciating the fact that they have been fortunate enough to stay in business.  If I had waited 60 minutes like other people, I would have been super upset.  I know, for sure, I will not go back and I will never recommend the establishment to anyone.
author: Victoria R.

description:
Don't be dismayed by the long line to get in!  Of course, I've rarely had to wait the entire time by myself.  I've often traded line-holding duties with friends or family members while we explore the other areas, including running through Washington Square Park with my daughter.  I've never had an average meal here and I've been there early, mid-morning and right during the lunch rush.  

This is not a place to stretch out and sit for hours while you languish over your meal.  There is a continual line from before opening until they close shop.  It feels crowded (and is) and after you stuff yourself you feel a need to get up and walk it off.  During a visit in April 2012, I noticed that George Lucas skipped the line and got in the back door.  He was still sitting in his corner perch when my party was finally seated.  Apparently there are different rules when you produce billion-dollar movies.  

My favorite is still the Monte Cristo sandwich dipped in their homemade jam.  I have learned to convince at least one other person in my group to order it every time so I can branch out and try different items on the menu.  Their baked goods are terrific as well so don't scoff at their muffins, scones, or treats either.
author: Jason M.

description:
Always wanted to check out Mama's and I finally did with some friends on a Tuesday afternoon! Parking sucked, I parked high on a hill, but not too far from Mama's. My friend was already waiting in line, but I think we waited 15 minutes tops which isn't so bad because I've heard there's usually a super long wait! I decided to order a special on the menu that day...the corned beef hash and when it came i was kind of confused about what was on my plate. There were buttered and toasted pieces of bread, some lettuce and sliced tomatoes on the side, eggs, some corned beef and potatoes. Was I supposed to make it into a sandwich or what? I decided not to make a sandwich and nibbled a bit of everything here and there.

My other two friends ordered the Monte Cristo. I was TOLD to order that but I was skeptical because I thought it was just a lame ham and cheese sandwich. But I was wrong -- it was DELICIOUS!! And their blackberry jam was delicious too. Especially with the monte cristo! I started smothering my bread with the jam. Haha :)

I'll definitely have to go back for the Monte Cristo...and maybe the French Toast too.

Oh and I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant! It had a cute, quaint, family breakfast/brunch joint feel to it.:)
author: Andrea F.

description: The wait was extremely long (1.5 hrs) but the food was great.  Loved the homemade jam!
author: Mireya G.

description: Call me old fashioned, but no breakfast is worth waiting 2 hours in line for. Check out Mymy's on California and Larkin. No wait, and the food is killer.
author: I G.

description:
If breakfast and brunch are one of those things you take seriously in life, you need to come here. Definitely the most eye-popping, abundant, and delicious breakfast I've had in the city.

Unfortunately, everyone and their uncle has caught on to that fact and thus you'll have to wait in line to break your fast here.

And I don't mean your average 20-30 minute line. We're talking 40-45 minutes to wait outside the door, 10-20 minutes to wait in the order line indoors, and another 10-20 minutes to get your food.

Even worse, you'll be staring at people's gigantic dishes with jealousy as they chow down right in front of you. By the end of the wait, you'll be so hungry, their menu will look so dreamy, you'll be drooling all the way to the finish.

And what a finish it will be! I have to say, the food here makes every minute of waiting worth it. Highlights:
- The Montecristo sandwich is killer. Made my morning.
- The Just Cheese omelette will rekindle your love for cheese.
- They serve the best jam I've ever had in my life. Hands down. Ollalieberry jam? What endangered berries are they mining to make this?

Distinguishing factor: There's not a plate in the entire restaurant that won't make you drool. Also, the wait makes you feel like you've earned every bite.
author: Nick A.

description:
definitely worth the wait! I advise you to take the bart, don't get lost, don't travel with someone who walks a mile in an hour! :)

We got there around 12pm, and there was a long line, and when we finally got inside, there was another line to pay! Nevertheless, it was worth it! We can tell there were a lot of tourist that lined up by the their conversations and pictures taking:)

I definitely got the french toast sampler, one has nuts and bananas, one has strawberries and blueberries, and one is something else. BUT, i have to say that it was so delicious! the portion was perfect for me, though I didn't finish it because it was lunch time, and i consumed way too many sweets for breakfast:x ( shameless because my sweet tooth is as big as the MOOON!)

My sister got some omelet that has no avocado, but has bacon bits. The potatoes that came with it was cooked perfectly, I managed to steal a few bits to balance all the sweetness from my french toast. 

Overall, it was a fantastic day with excellent food. I also saw many people eating by themselves! cute.

One other thing....right when we were walking in, a guy walked out at the same time and said DEFINITELY WORTH THE WAIT:)

THUS GO TRY IT OUT:)
author: Josie H.

description:
We came here 45 mins before they were going to close. The line was not that long but the wait took awhile because the restaurant is small. This was our first time here so we went with what other yelpers recommended. My bf got the Monte Cristo and he absolutely loved it. He said it was not heavy or greasy at all as I'd the car with most Monte Cristos, it was light and airy and perfectly done. The best one he's ever had. I had the salmon eggs benedict and the egg was perfectly done and creamy.

If you're in the area, it's a must and well worth the wait! Love it!
author: Leslie B.

description:
So good! The food was amazing! 

I came on a Saturday and the line was out the door. It took about 45 minutes to wait.
author: Aimee E.

description:
Visited here recently during my trip to San Fran and it is by far the best breakfast place I've been too. Many fresh choices to choose from and my favorite thing about the restaurant is how the kitchen is in an enclosed glass environment where you can see the chef and people handling your food (you know a restaurant is clean when they actually let you see how your food is being handled). I had the Florentine Egg Benedict and it was delightful! I also loved the sourdough baguette toast that was baked fresh and the homemade jam that was offered at the table! Been craving it ever since I left San Fran! 

DO NOTE THOUGH THAT THERE IS GOING TO BE A WAIT, WE WERE FORTUNATE ENOUGH TO ONLY WAIT FOR AN HOUR AND 15 MINS, TOTALLY WORTH IT THOUGH!
author: Nicole N.

description:
Well worth the wait!! Food is so fresh and amazing ! If you get there at 730 you only have to wait until opening time of 8. If you come after 745 you will have to wait 45 mins or longer. It's also better if you go in a pair. More than that have to wait longer as more tables are for two's 

The must gets are the berry smoothie and the cinnamon chocolate French toast with a side of bacon.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I absolutely agree with Daniel D., cashier is absent, totally in her own unhappy luh-luh land. Her name is Deborah and apparently she is the "boss." This title also allows her to cut in front of the line to the bathroom, in front of the kid, yes, a boy with an upset stomach. How rude! 
Food is good, but there are ton of other great places in the area, that don't have such crazy wait time. The waiters are great too. Very nice, friendly and funny people. The "BOSS", on the other hand, needs some social training.
My review is driven by the feeling I got from Deborah. Food and other staff were great!
author: Xenia K.

description:
We waited two hours on a Sunday. According to the reviews I was expecting orgasmic food, so we endured the wait. Maybe I am too harsh of a judge because of the long wait, but the food wasn't really anything special. 

I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. The rice was over cooked and bland. The eggs were cooked nicely, but the ranchero sauce mundane. The best item on the plate was the avocado.

My wife eggs Benedict black stone. The hollandaise was almost all lemon. She didn't like it. English muffin dry and hard to cut.

Our food came out, no water offered and no real service. 

You have to wait outside for 2 hours, then wait inside in line to order, then wait in a cramped isle to be seated. 

Too expensive, too touristy, too over hyped, too long of a wait. It's worth about a 5 minute wait. 

Joanie's is MUCH better.
author: Tony M.

description: definitely worth the wait, waited an hour and a half, we order the eggs benedict and French toast, were delicious and also the Mimosas
author: Bertha M.

description:
I ordered the Vegetarian Eggs Benedict and my girlfriend had the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast. The Eggs Benedict simply blew my mind! And I've gotta say that they have been the best I've ever had.

In terms of the french toast, they were also very delicious but were nothing to call home about.

Overall though, the food was impressive. The service was impeccable with the waitresses frequently checking to see if everything was up to par.

I would recommend that if you plan on going there for breakfast to plan to arrive at the very least 45 minutes before opening as this place seems to be very popular with both locals and tourists. We arrived 20 minutes before they opened their doors and had to wait about another 30 minutes to order. The wait was obviously well worth it though. We will definitely be coming back here.
author: Ed S.

description:
I went to Mama's with a group of friends after New Year's Eve a few years ago, and I remember enjoying it but honestly, I can't remember it very clearly. I'm going back up to the city in a few weeks with my boyfriend so maybe we'll try it out again and I'll update this.

Til then!
author: AA B.

description:
I had heard a lot of buzz around this place,so I wanted to check it out. The line was incredibly long but they kept the people moving. 

I had the french toast sampler, which came with brioche french toast, a date and nut french toast, and a blueberry french toast. There were strawberries, blueberries, and bananas and powedered sugar on top. All of which were delicious, but my personal favorite was the brioche with a touch of lemon.

My uncle ordered the prosciutto and tomato eggs benedict which was fantatstic as well. Just thinking about it is making me hungry.

Needless to say I want to go back more to try everything on their menu.
author: Laura P.

description: One of the best places i ate at when i went to San Fran over the summer! The line is long granted, but it is worth the wait to get your hands on their homemade french toast sampler. A little pricey but who counts cash when they're on vacation? I regret spending all my cash on the food because I didn't have enough to tip!
author: Jeff W.

description:
After sleeping for only three hours the previous night, I was still determined to eat breakfast at Mama's. I've heard good things and I wasn't about to miss it because I slept in on a Saturday. I guess parking is pretty hard to come by around Washington Square so if you find a meter, bring plenty of coins as the max time is only one hour (however, we got it to go to 1:07, but anything over that is a waste of your quarters, trust me). When we got here a little past 8:30, there was already a long line stretching along the restaurant. I guess this place is popular with both locals and tourists alike so be prepared to rub elbows with rude foreign tourists. The wait was a little more than half an hour to get inside.

When I stepped inside, the first thing I noticed was that this place is TINY. I guess to make things more efficient, you pay for your food first and then you get seated and served. It's nice because you get to see into the kitchen and the side next the register is also lined with pastries and baked goods. We ended up order way too much food and I was stuffed beyond capacity. We got four plates and basically shared everything family-style:

Monte Cristo - This is only on their lunch menu, but when you are a regular, I guess they make exceptions. This sandwich alone gives this place five stars. Whoever invented this is a genius. Ham, turkey, cheddar, Havarti cheese stuffed between three slices of French toast with a side of homemade blackberry jam. Perfect balance of sweet and savory. I think this even trumps the eggs Benedict that I usually get. 

Shrimp and Avocado Benedict with Grilled Tomatoes - Your standard poached egg with Hollandaise sauce but with a generous helping of Bay shrimp and also avocado and a grilled tomato all on top of an English muffin. Delicious.

Smoked Salmon Benedict - Same as above except replace with smoked salmon. It is a bit on the salty side, but goes well with the bland taste of the egg. 

Pan Dore - This was probably not good for me at all. French baguette toasted with slices of sauteed apples drenched in lemon butter sauce. It was more like pure butter. If you have a heart condition, you should probably not eat this. One bite was enough, but anymore than that is a bit much. 

I should note that everything at this place tastes good with the homemade blackberry jam. Potatoes too dry? Dip it in the jam. Pan Dore too buttery? Dip it in the jam. Great place to have breakfast if you can find the time and if you have the patience to wait. I would definitely come just to try the Monte Cristo.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
2 hours waiting on line. Tables not enough for the customer. Due to too long time for waiting,we almost wanna give up. Food is ok, if you know how to cook the simple breakfast. 
The cook are fast, service waiter are not enough, some waiter is slow action. 
Around $80 for share 4 dishes together.
Not will go again cause I don't like to wait so long.
author: Jasmine K.

description:
We met a couple in line this morning from Seattle who never skips Mama's when they are in town. They've been coming for over 20 years! The line is always crazy, but there are always people who keeping coming back for more and I think that is true testimony to how good it is. I love the North Beach Benedict, but there are just too many great things to choose from. 

Mama's is a San Francisco institution. Skipping this is like skipping the Golden Gate. Everyone should try it at least once.
author: Justin Y.

description: After doing some homework prior to traveling to SF and seeing a video of Mama's on the Food Network, my GF and I decided to give it a try. Mama's is a very quaint, charming place to have breakfast in the city. However, if you base it solely on food, it is not worth the wait. My omelette was good but nothing out of this world or better than any other average breakfast joint. French toast was the better plate. 4 or 5 different toasts with various flavors.
author: Robert F.

description:
Food - amazing
Service/flow - these guys have it figured out; friendly & professional
Atmosphere: bright and cheerful w/ original art
Bathroom: clean but very small - out the back, down the stairs but private.
CASH ONLY 

Food.
Huevo Rancheros was top notch.  Crab Benedict was heavenly with 
plenty of big fat chunks of crab.

Service/Flow.
When there is room for you, they will let you in.
Order at the counter and pay.
Follow server to your table; food will be served asap

WILL come again - loved it.
author: Chere F.

description:
I have spent an hour in line for breakfast twice in my life. Once in Nashville at Pancake Pantry and once in NYC at a cute place in SOHO years ago.  Both were well worth it; but when I saw the line in front of Mama's I was skeptical.  The people towards the front mentioned that they had been waiting almost an hour-and-a-half, and advised that we should do the same.  They had been there before and said it was the best breakfast we will ever have.  Now, I am not sure I believed them at the time, but I did like the challenge.  I was pretty hungry, so sitting in this line would be like having some serious control over myself that I usually do not exert.  

When I'm hungry, I gotta eat.   

But I did it.....with the help of a leftover piece of saltwater taffy I had in my backpack from my trip to Sausalito the previous day.   And let me tell you, my friends, it was well worth it.  I hear from other reviews that it depends on what you end up ordering, but from what I saw, every dish looked amazing.  The presentation was impeccable (and I like my food to look good AND taste good - makes a big difference to me, anyway).  When my Chocolate french toast with bananas and strawberries finally made it to my table, my jaw hit the floor.  It was a masterpiece....and I gave it the respect it deserved by eating every....last.......bite.

I have posted a picture of this delight, so please check it out; and let it convince you that the 2 hour wait will be worth every stomach-growling second..
author: Arpana W.

description:
Important: use the jam! Forget the syrup altogether, the jam is amazing and I regret not trying it before I'd eaten most of my pancakes. And this is from a syrup lover. 

First off the bat: is it worth the wait? Mmmmnotreally but kind of. If you've never been, go once. If there's almost no line, go. Otherwise, it's not worth it. 

Don't get me wrong, the food is excellent, the atmosphere charming, and the employees professional and kind. But I waited 96 minutes in the rain for pancakes. That's just not worth it more than once. 

 Tried the blueberry pancakes and they were fluffy, with tons of real blueberries inside and out. They were served hot but with chilled blueberries on top which added a nice contrast and kept it light. I made the mistake of eating most of them with syrup before trying the jam. The jam was wonderful, sweet and tart, and it cuts the heaviness of pancakes wonderfully. Highly recommend it. 

It's a great little spot and if you didn't have to wait so long it would be flat out incredible. I should mention, the wait is purely because of the quantity of people wanting service. Mama's service is lightning fast and works like a well-oiled machine. 

Go if you've never been or if you're lucky enough to arrive when there are 15 or fewer people waiting outside.
author: Michael W.

description:
I waited over an hour today for lunch. The ambience is ok and food was too. I ordered the lunch special lump crab meat omelette with tomatoes and avocado. Coffee was just like a normal cup, nothing special. 

The wait is not worth the food. Note the wait staff was very nice and attentive.
author: Vivian T.

description:
We had to try this place for breakfast on our first morning in San Francisco. It was certainly worth the cab ride and wait time. The morning was beautiful, cool and crisp a big change from our humid Florida mornings so standing outside was a nice change.

We got here somewhat early, around 8:00 am-ish and were quickly schooled in the protocal of wait your turn! :) Upon arriving I noticed a handfull of people standing outside in a group and saw a line of folks standing in line inside the restaurant. Not knowing what to do, I walked right into the place and immediately got scolded nicely in broken English, to wait outside, no problem I thought so I walked back outside and the same waiter/host comes outside and barks orders to everyone to line up along the wall fronting the place......OK, I thought, this is going to be an interesting experience.

After standing there a few minutes and doing my typical observation of what's up, I figured it out. You wait outside until a table or two clears, then your invited inside to stand in line again to order your food. Once your food is ordered your directed to a table by the same dude who barks orders at you outside. Once your food is cooked, its brought to you by a really sweet waitress who makes you forget about the dude who barked at you twenty minutes earlier because your a tourist who does not know the rules.....Oh well!

But wait, there is more! The food is amazing! I got the corned beef with eggs benedict, I know, corned beef and eggs benedict is kind of an oxy-moron but so what, it tasted amazing and the corned beef was by far some of the best I ever tasted. I was so engrossed in my my meal that I forgot what my wife ordered, but whatever it was it must have been good because when I finally came up for air, her plate was nearly empty.

The service is good once you get in the door, the place is quaint and charming, and it is also very clean. It has a huge following among locals and tourists like myself and the entire time we were there, the line which got up to twenty plus at times never let up. I suggest you bring a grande latte and a granola bar to tie you over while waiting in line!.:)

Price is reasonable too and we will certainly come back the next time we are in town and this time, I know the rules! :)
author: Bruce M.

description:
I have to agree with other reviewers that you should arrive early.  We arrived at 7:55 am thinking that we were safe from any lines...  Not...

We lucked out, we were in the first group that got in! 

I love the concept of waiting in line ordering, paying at the cashier.  We ordered the must have Crab omelet with avocado and brie, Northern Italian (pancetta, basil, spicy jack, mushrooms) omelet, orange juice and coffee.   

My dungeness crab omelet was the best!  The best balance of brie, crab and avocado my palate has ever come across!

My husband loved his Northern Italian omelet!  He did not utter a single word during breakfast! Commenting at the very end that his omelet was the best he ever had! 

Potatoes seasoned and cooked to perfection! 

The orange juice was very fresh and a must have!

Our coffee mugs were never empty.  We were greeted with such friendly service from the time we waited outside to our departure. 

Breakfast, not my favorite meal of the day ~ but, have to admit that Mama's is slowly changing my thinking on this...
author: Cathy S.

description:
Okay,
     A friend of mine insisted on taking me to brunch at Mama's for my first trip to San Francisco. Have to say I liked everything from start to finish (sans the LONG wait outside). 
    
     So the wait outside wasn't unbearable. It was a warm January day midday, and the line wasn't more than an hour long for us, but I DID have to grab a bagel from a nearby shop to help pass the time.  Once you get close to the front of the line, you can see the meny and choose what you want before getting inside. Once inside, you have about 5-10 minutes to order your food, and pay before being placed at a table.  This I do like, and their food was good enough, I'm sure they rarely get asked for a refund! After waiting about another 10 minutes, a table was free, and we (4 of us) were seated. 
    
     Brunch drinks are always iffy with me. I'm not a fan of alcohol or wine, and usually any drink I get sits on the table as I strategically take a few  forced sips, just to ensure the drink wasn't a total waste of money.  I ordered the "Apple/Peach Bellini"and I really enjoyed. One friend had the "Papa's Picnic Brunch" and I enjoyed that as well. Nice to know I (with my sensitive to alcohol tongue) can have a fruity alcoholic beverage, and not walk away wishing I hadn't spent the $8+ bucks on a drink that I didn't come close to finishing (fyi, the drink was only $7). 
 
     For my meal, I had the "Dungeness Crab Benedict With Fresh Spinach", which was FRIGGIN' delicious! The crab wasn't imitation, eggs benedict cooked just right, and spinach sauteed lovely! I ate the sucker up, and wished I could have another (maybe the bagel wasn't worth it?!). Can't remember what everyone else ordered, but everyone enjoyed their meals as well, except one friend who ordered the shrimp salad. She felt the dressing made the salad very oily. 

    I also ordered an apple crumb cake from the bakery, which was pretty good. Wish they could've thrown some vanilla icecream on top of that, and THAT would've made my Sunday!

   All in all, this was a more than decent place to have brunch. The decor is very "homey" deserving the name "Mama's" (LoL) and I spent about $35, but I walked away more than satisfied. I wanted to give the place 4 stars because I would absolutely go back, but I'd have to be in a REALLY good mood (and have had to have a small snack beforehand) to wait on that line. I don't do hour long lines on a regular basis! ;-)
author: Janeria S.

description: Overall the food was very good. I had the eggs Benedict and a side of French toast. Get there early definitely not worth waiting an hour plus.
author: Adrian R.

description:
MAMA MIA! What a place. Everyone has already said great things so why don't I go through a more practical view of this restaurant.

First, GO EARLY. They open at 8, go at 7:30am or even earlier. That outside line can be at least an hour wait. And that is only the OUTSIDE line. They hang a menu by the door so you can decide on what you want by the time you get inside. They keep the front door closed so that no one can bunch up on the inside.

Once you get in, you will wait on ANOTHER line, the ordering line. This line moves faster than the one on the outside. However, only the first few people get to order. Until those people move for a table (which is another wait), you have more time to look at the menu.

Once you are seated, the foot comes pretty soon as you had already ordered probably about 10-15 minutes before.

I had the french toast sampler and it was AMAZING. The homemade jam was definitely great for the toast, even better than the syrup. My friend had the breakfast sandwich which was also equally good.

For the bathroom, there will be yet ANOTHER line (yikes). Most tables sit about 2-4. There are two booths that can sit more than that but larger groups may be a bit longer wait.

I loved my experience at Mama's. It felt like such an accomplishment just to be able to get inside the door! I would recommend it to my friends but ONLY if they are willing to spend the whole morning to get some food because that wait is long.
author: John W.

description: Went here on a Thursday at 930a and waited in line for an hour. I had the french toast sampler and it was as delicious as stated. The homemade raspberry jam they have on the tables is also superb. Wasn't impressed by their grilled potatoes, they were dry and not that flavorful. Worth visiting once if you're in SF, but go on a weekday if you can.
author: Sim H.

description:
Food is definitely yummy...and I didn't think breakfast food could be so good. 

Monte Carlo is suprisingly good. I kept looking at it with each bite because I couldn't figure out why ham, cheese, and bread could be so tasty. 

If they offer the mango shake, order it! You won't regret it.

French toast: ok. I probably won't order this next time. It was a good dish but I like my french toast thick and soft in the center. 

Pancakes: good. Try it with the homemade jelly!

Crab Benedict: going to order this one next time because it was that good.

Was it worth the 1.5 hour wait? Probably not...but it was a nice day and I had good company that made time fly. 

Service: really nice!! Staff is great.
author: Logan N.

description:
Get:
Dungeness crab omelet with avocado, tomato, and havarti cheese. Oh so fresh.
Monte Cristo. Nicely sliced into 4 pieces to share with people you like and comes with a delish berry jam.
French toast sampler. Has banana walnut, a berry variety (which specifically I forget), topped with some of the freshest berries I have seen.
Shrimp omelet with avocado. Didn't know I could enjoy seafood omelets so much!

Gripe:
The business is SO good that it's one of those places where the expectation is to vacate your table once all food is consumed. Or else the wait staff will hover. And hover. I don't blame them, for the place is small and the line looks as if Mama's were serving free food. But I love brunch. It's one of those meals that would be best enjoyed with a few minutes of downtime afterward to chat about Buddha's view on the path to enlightenment, or how delicious those pancakes were that you just devoured. 

Bring cash. They accept debit with a $1.00 surcharge.
author: Brandy A.

description:
It's too bad the wait to get seated takes forever. This was the first time I waited an hour just to get inside the restaurant...only to wait in ANOTHER line. I just about wanted to eat my hair by the time we got our menus. The food was delicious though...everything. The french toast, apple pandora, eggs benedict, and omelette are pretty solid choices. I thought it was the best thing in the world, but then again...I was pretty much starving by the time our food came out.

I'm still trying to figure out whether or not the wait was worth it though. Mama's is definitely worth going to during the day at odd times...other than that...I'd probably opt for another diner.
author: Sandra C.

description: I had breakfast at this restaurant and the food was very good. Everything was made fresh and tasted delicious.
author: Philip C.

description:
Incredible. Mama's was the opening to my relaxing San Francisco getaway. The place is a living legend and you know by the number of reviews. The one permanent shortcoming has to be the wait; even first thing in the AM, you will find an eager crowd lined up Washington Street.

My tip would be to wake up super early (how breakfast should be in my world). I was a bit jet lag which helped my case. If you can wake up around 7am, take a stroll through peaceful San Fran and arrive here...at 7:30am things begin to pick up. Get their french toast or any of the omelettes. Fill yourself up and continue explore the awesome city.
author: William H.

description:
wow, wow, wow. i am a HUGE fan of mama's. my sister lives a couple blocks away, but we're never up early enough to brave the lines. that is, until our dad came for a visit. we ended up getting in line 5 minutes before opening (7:55am) and waited exactly 1 hour and 20 minutes until our food arrived. not bad at all, in my opinion. i heard the first guy in line was there at 7:15. 

it's a nifty little process they got down at mama's. you wait outside, but then someone lets you in to another shorter line where you stare down the goods before placing your order. pay and then someone else helps you with seating, which is nice. and considering there's no formal waiter service, no one is ever just standing around wondering what to do. many people will be taking care of you and get you what you need. the atmosphere is really cute too - reminds me of my grandma's house. 

i ordered the french toast sampler and it was DELICIOUS and topped with loads of fresh fruit. i really liked the blueberry/cranberry version and will just order that next time. what i really liked was that the portions aren't humongous so you leave feeling satiated, not sick. i nibbled off everyone's plates and everyone was very happy with their orders. they make their own jam too! :)

i will definitely be back (when i'm up early again, but who knows when that will be).

PSA - they're opening another location on the corner of vallejo and columbus soon!!!!!!! :D
author: Corrina S.

description: Brunch with Family at Mama's on Washington Square. We had Mama's classic Benedict's, Chocolate Cinnamon French Toasts, Petaluma Farm Eggs with Grilled Potatoes and the Famous Monte Cristo.
author: Frankie2 K.

description:
I absolutely adore this place! I am a huge fan of brunch and had heard many greats things about this place.

I finally tried their Northern Italian Omelette's with Pancetta (Italian Cured Bacon), Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomato, and Garlic Jack Cheese and Swedish Cinnamon French Toast.

They were all very delicious. The French Toast glazed with Maple Syrup melted in my mouth like butter. The Omelette consisted the perfect combination with flavorful slices of pancetta. The melted Jack Cheese was stringing along every savory bite. I left Mama's with a big smile and a stuffed tummy. For all you brunch lovers, you must try MAMA's!
author: Sandra W.

description: Not worth it. Delicious but on a random Tuesday from the moment we got in line until our food was served the wait was 2 and a half hours! And the thing is that the line is deceiving! It was only shortly past their second awning. And the fact that you have to stand in line was terrible. Why can't they just take our names and put out a bench for people to sit on and wait. That being said, the food was delicious and you HAVE to get the montecristo and one of the crumb cakes. We had the chocolate one and apple one and they were both heavenly! The omelettes were also to die for but the montecristo was the best. We split it amongst the table and I wish I had my own in addition to the omelette I got! In my opinion no food is worth that wait and I won't ever go back because of it, but if you have time to waste or a whole book to read this is the place to do it!
author: Katie P.

description:
My friend and I came here around 9:30 AM on a Saturday morning, and ended up waiting about 1.5 hours.  The lines don't seem that long, but it sure takes forever to move.  We were starving by the time it was our turn to order, and ordered 3 things between the two of us, just because I wasn't sure if I would ever come back to wait in line again. Here's what we tried:

DUNGENESS CRAB BENEDICT ($12.95): Pretty good egg benedict! The egg was perfectly runny inside, and crab was a nice change from the usual ham.  However, as much as I enjoyed it, it was not particularly outstanding in any way (aka, not worth the 1.5 hour wait).

FRENCH TOAST SWEDISH CINNAMON WITH FRUIT ($9.25) : This was in a lot of reviews, but my friend and I both found it rather dry and again, nothing special about it.  I prefer my french toast to be thicker, softer, and more moist inside.

MONTE CRISTO ($9.50) : This sandwich was the best part of the meal! I love how the cheese was melted with the meat, and it was a nice combination of sweet and savory.  I highly recommend ordering this. From the description I didn't really want to order it, but thanks to all the yelper's reviews, I was able to discover this sandwich.

Overall an okay place, and I would probably come back more often if it weren't for the wait.
author: Jenny H.

description:
Imagine a 3 day weekend, 40 degrees and raining and you've just spent an hour getting to Little Italy and another hour in line, but once you look longingly at the dishes being served it's all worth it. One of the best Breakfast's I've ever had. 

It should be called Eggs Benny or Benny and the Eggs. Eggs Benedict sounds like what we should have done to Benedict Arnold when he betrayed the US, but not this little lovely piece of Heaven. Crab and Shrimp is the pimp to get. The buttery soft eggs melts like butter onto your English muffin and blends the cheese and Hollandaise sauce with the shrimp. It's got the perfect amount of lemon zing to the creamy, but not too thick sauce, but the Monte Cristo is the best seller and for good reason. Soft and Crisp unlike most places that serve hard as a rock triple decked and breaded ninja stars with store bought jam. 

As a good friend and fellow Yelper Dennis B. said, "I'm not a fan of yolk, but this (Eggs Benedict) changed my life"

A superb Mimosa using fresh squeezed to order orange juice and a perfectly dry champagne that compliments so well, alas is not unlimited.

3 egg omelets really are well thought and complete yet unique enough to know it's not your run of the mill café. Cold Smoked Salmon still has white fat rings and the French toast is hand cut to order off huge loafs of cinnamon Bundt bread. 

Prices may scare you, but they are absolutely worth it and the staff is amazing, due to the size of the establishment it's not good for large groups. The bathroom is a bit of a maze to get to.
author: Walter M.

description:
Began waiting in line at 9:12am, finally ordered at 10:30.  The line took forever but went by alright since there was a guitar player jamming on the sidewalk. I guess this time is helpful because it helps build up your appetite!

I ordered the  Prosciutto & Tomato Eggs benedict, so amazing!!!! My friends got Dunganese crab eggs benedict and dunganese crab omlette which they all loved. We also shared the French Toast (3 ways?), which had 3 different toasts - cinnamon, cranberry-walnut, and banana-nut. All were DELICIOUS but my favorites were the cinnamon and cranberry-walnut.  

Service was great too. Be prepared to wait 2 hours, eat for 20 minutes, then grab your things and go. The line never ends!!

Can't wait to return....but will have to come at 6:30am!  Maybe I will do Tai-chi at Washington Square park while I'm at it.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Mama's was an okay, quaint place. We had breakfast here & had to stand in line in the burning sun. The food wasn't spectacular but my honey loved his omelette. I think Mama's is better tasting than this place. This place wasn't rememberable for me.
author: Kas M.

description:
If this place were less expensive and had a shorter line, it would get more stars. While the quality of food is by no means bad, it is by no means amazing. I had a crab avocado omelet and it turned out alright, but it did not blow me away. A friend had the monte cristo, and it was similarly standard. While it is novel to have seafood to centrally focused on a breakfast menu, it did not live up to the hype/line/prices. 

Did I mention the line?? Waiting 1+ hours for this place is considered a short wait, and if you go on a bad day/time, get ready to spend upwards of 2.5 hours sitting in line for a mediocre meal at gourmet prices.

I guess this just goes to show how effective marketing ploys can be... if you have so little seating that people have to stand out in line, the American public will be fooled into thinking that it is worth standing out in line, attracting more people. Then the cycle repeats. Well played Mama's, well played.
author: Nick M.

description:
Long Long Line, but its so worth it! Mama's is the kind of joint I would love to own, kind of place you feel like you are at Mama's home eating her good stuff!
Just prepare to wait for it.
author: Edwardo C.

description:
We waited over an hour in the rain but it was totally worth it! The hubby & I ordered the Florentine scramble with mushrooms, the Banana nut French Toast with fresh banana slices on top, 2 eggs over medium, bacon & potatoes (I know, I know, but he's a creature of habit). Our friends were with us & they ordered the cranberry French toast & the Crab Eggs Benedict with spinach. We all shared this amazing spread. 
    The florentine scramble did not disappoint. It was perfect! It had a little bit of bacon, a little bit of cheese, a little bit of mushrooms & a few slices of red onions. The eggs Benedict was surprisingly wonderful. The banana nut French toast was a perfect sweet satisfier.  The only thing that I didn't care for was the cranberry French toast, but my friend loved her order. The service was great. Everyone was super friendly, helpful & accommodating. Our grand total for 5 entrees & 3 coffees was $78. Pretty good!
   The carrot cake was calling to us, so we got a couple of pieces to go for later when our food went down. It ended up being much later, as we remained stuffed til way after lunch time. It ended up being our after dinner dessert. Very moist! 
  My only regret was not having tasted their homemade jam. I was too full. We will definitely be back there in the summer!
author: Patricia J.

description: My boyfriend and I were up at the crack of dawn to be to be the second in line due to such great reviews. DEFINITELY worth the wait. Next time we're in town, this will be our first stop! I cant remember the name of this pound cake french toast looking concoction but it was the best breakfast I've ever had.
author: Jenn G.

description:
I wanted really badly to find reasons to give this place anything less than 5 stars. I tried hyping it up (so that I'd be disappointed) by reading reviews, seeing it on Time magazine's top 10 things to do, reading stories of how it is deemed 'best breakfast in SF', and finally waited in line for 1.5 hours (in one of the coldest weekends of the year, WHILE it was raining, might I add) on a Sunday morning at 9am. 

But me efforts were futile as I bit into the fluffy pancakes that were perfectly fluffed - not too chewy and not too soft - and as the banana french toast melted in mouth giving it the sweetness it was longing for after eating a bite of the Northern Italian omelette stuffed with bacon-y goodness and mushrooms.

Mama's French toast sampler - has 3 different types of bread (hence the "sampler"), and all of them were absolutely wonderful.
