Tasty crust on each slice - you can still see the egg it was dipped in before being griddled. Pancakes are thick and fluffy, 3 stacked beautifully on top of each other. You can eat them plain without any berries and they'd still be great. Omelette was stuffed FULL of bacon and mushrooms. Very tasty. You got a bit of everything and all it's flavors in each bite. Egg didn't fall apart either. 

Pastries looked amazing as well, but couldn't fit anything else in my stomach after those 3 dishes. Oh wait, except some of their homemade jam!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Very very very delicious! It was worth the 1 hour we waited. I had the Monte Cristo which I noticed is very popular here on Yelp and their reviews are right! Prices aren't bad too, definitely affordable. We walked out of the place content. I will be back soon, probably by next month. I give the restroom a thumbs down only bc it was small and very inconvenient because you have to walk through their kitchen to get to the restroom. But overall this is a great place for brunch! See you soon Mama's!
author: maria danela B.

description: Finally decided to check this place out after all the hype. And the hype wasn't wrong, but not entirely right either. It wasn't phenomenal but I wasn't disappointed either. Came here with my boyfriend on a Wednesday around 1 and there was no wait at all, lucky for us. So you enter and order at the cashier before you get a table. There's probably around 15 tables in the whole place, biggest table sits about 4-5 people. Giving the place a homey feeling. I had the Norwegian Benedict (smoked salmon) and my boyfriend had the corned beef hash Benedict. Both dishes were good but I think my smoked salmon was a little over cooked. Both plates went for about $13.75 each and the wtf moment for me was our small orange juices that went for $3.50 each, I literally finished that thing in 5 gulps! It was like an oversized shot glass. Too pricey if you ask me. Also, wear a sweater if you plan on going here, they have the entrance  doors open as well as multiple fans blowing full speed down on you. It gets chilly and cools the food down pretty quick. All in all, I enjoyed eating here but I don't think it would be worth hours of waiting.
author: Kimmy N.

description:
When I first came here, there was a 2 HOUR WATING LINE OUTSIDE, HELL NO I WASN'T GOING TO WAIT, but then after reading all the amazing reviews, i've obviously had to try it out. The resturant is WAYYY to small, it's about the size of my living room. HOLY SH*T, the Monte Cristo's was like an orgasm in my mouth, and the carrot cake was soo good. Plus the eggs and potatoes were amazing. The waitress was SO HUMOROUS, i loved her! 
Anyways, it was worth the three hour wait. don't care
author: David L.

description:
French Toast was awesome. Crab Benedict was just OK.  Service was fine.  Is it worth the wait?  Well, maybe 15-20 minutes, but not 70+ minutes.  Glad we finally got to check it out, but don't need to go back anytime soon.

If there's NO line, you should go.  But if you don't want to wait, we found other nice restaurants within blocks:
* Caffe Delucchi (Columbus & Green) - Great Crab Cake Benedict!
* Mo's Grill (near Grand) - Tasty omelet!

Back to Mama's:
Got there on a drizzley day without an outside line!  But, still had to wait 20 minutes inside to order.  No prob.  Server said we were lucky because it was a very slow day or we'd probably wait 70+ minutes on a mid-week morning.

French Toast Sampler - 4 stars
* Banana Nut, Regular & Cranberry.  Three different style breads covered in blueberries, strawberries & sliced bananas.  All were good, especially the cranberry.  

Dungeness Crab Benedict - 2 stars ($21.95)
Tasty, but for that price it was pretty darn skimpy on the crab.  Eggs were too wet from poaching and made the bread soggy.  The Hollandaise Sauce was good, but a bit tart and thicker than others.  Home Fried Potatoes were good:  Crispy on outside & tender on inside.  (NOTE: their other Benedicts are about half the Crab price.)

Service - 3 stars
* Efficient & no nonsense.  But, neither very friendly nor engaging.
author: Tony S.

description: The egg benedict, pancakes and orange juice are all the best I've had! Service was also great. Definitely come here if you're in the SF area.
author: Jenny X.

description:
Not bad! Went there on a weekday at around 9:30am - only waited in line for five minutes. YES - DREAM! I know some people go earlier (read: right when it opens) so maybe we just hit the sweet spot? Because by the time we were seated, the line was looong. I do have to say though, there are some tables, maybe five or 6, right by the windows so if you get seated there you might (read: WILL) have people waiting in line staring at your toast and salivating. Hah. Just a heads up. 

Final verdict: Cutely decorated place. Love their egg benedict and their smoothies. IMO a tad overhyped but their food is still very good ;)

PS I do have to stay when my friend walked out with a piece of toast in her mouth everyone in line went all starry eyed as if the toast was the most precious thing they had seen in their lifetime. I think they were just hungry? It made us laugh. For all those  people waiting in line: don't worry it can go by really quickly. Bring a book or talk to a friend. Or do both somehow?
author: Mico G.

description:
Expect to wait. We arrived around 9:30 AM on Saturday and had to wait around 1.5 hours to get in the door to order. 

The food was good as advertised. I got the French Toast Sampler plate and it was amazing! My wife got the Monte Cristo and it was even better! 

Worth the wait if you have time to kill. Definitely a must if you are in San Francisco for the first time or haven't been to Mama's before.
author: John K.

description: Neat little shop. Had to wait about 1.5 hours to get in, but I'd say it is worth it to go at least once. I'll def go again - its great once you get seated - just arrive much earlier. You can order coffee and pastries to eat while you wait in line, so bring cash. Quite an awkward experience eating in line on the street and having to take the obligatory food pics...but fun and tasty (they heat the pastries). The man directing customers when they walk in the door was awesome - very chill and gave great, frank recommendations. Service after that wasn't anything special. Cute little nook in the city though.
author: Em Jay H.

description:
I have been here 3 times. Twice, we had to wait in line for about 40 minutes and 1 time, we got lucky and arrived there at 2:45pm so didn't have to wait at all. As long as you are in line by 3:00pm, you will be okay!

I think they have a really smart system going because they ask you to order first after you are in line inside the restaurant. hence, after seated, the food arrives very quickly.

I believe they are famous for their Monte Cristo ($9.50), which they have every right to be because it is just so tasty! I'm ashamed to say this but I have ordered Monte Cristo three times and I've only been here 3 times! We also had the Slim Joe Burger ($9.50). Wow, this was also very tasty. They seasoned the burger meat really well and I love the choice of using baguette instead of regular burger buns.

I enjoyed my $3.95 (large glass but really? It feels time in my hand!) Fresh Squeezed Grapefruit juice but seriously, it is overpriced! In my opinion, all of the beverages here are overpriced. For the amount of money they charge for the Fresh-Squeezed Mimosas ($9 and the glass is really small; I can finish it in one gulp), I can make one liter and drink it all day long.

Anyway, I promise to try something else the next time I'm here! Until then, I will be dreaming about the Monte Cristo!
author: Alice L.

description:
It has been a while since I have posted a review on YELP, and here I am today October 27th for my fabulous brunch at Mama's.

Cold, foggy, and somewhat windy is what I and many waiting in line would describe as todays weather forecast. Right across the street from Washington Square Park in North Beach, sits Mama's, a rather small establishment known for their "to die for" breakfast. I planned today to brunch with my cousin, and had her wait in line while I Barted in. She wrote me a text, "hurry, where are you, there's no line, oh wait, it was hiding,it is long".

The line wasn't terrible, but the cold weather certainly made it seem like "forever". The longest I have ever waited for food was in New York, SoHo: Dominque Ansel's Cronut - three hours in line was certainly "forever". My cousin and I, as well as other patient guests, stared inside as people ate and we drooled for their food. We came hungry! I arrived at 9:30AM and we were let inside to the warmth at around 11. Be sure to come prepared, because there are no menus at the tables. Upon entering the restaurant, you are directed to the registers, and once you order, you will then be seated. It is very organized! The one let down, which will not be reflected in the star rating, is the unavailability for credit card transactions, which was startling because it is the new age. What's interesting is that, I called ahead to make sure what forms of payments they take, though they take debit cards, credit cards are of another story. I think if an establishment is able to process debit cards, credit cards are no different (maybe with a small fee, but I think it's necessary). Service was prompt, fast, and the servers were accommodating. 

On to the food: I ordered (1) Dungeness Crab Benedict [fresh lump crab meat, poached eggs, spinach, hollandaise, english muffins, and grilled potatoes] - WOW, delicious, well prepared, and with ACTUAL CRAB MEAT, MMMMMMM! (2) Smoked Salmon Benedict [smoked salmon, poached eggs, and english muffins] - my cousin gobbled it up! We shared (3) Kugelhopf French Toast [house made Kugelhopf, dates, almonds, raisins, and maple syrup] - YUM! It was a bit dry, somewhat caky, so make sure you drizzle some maple syrup (drench it!) and it'll taste superb! And (4) Monte Cristo [turkey breast, honey baked ham, cheddar and gruyere cheese, and grilled potatoes] - It was more on the sweet side with the jam, but once you cut into the filling, it's "heaven in bread", simply "delicious". (5) I drank some bubbly - Ruby Grapefruit Mimosa [refreshing!], and my cousin had (6) Mama's Smoothie [bananas, berries, orange juice, yogurt, and honey] - a great combination for a light and delicious drink. 

This restaurant is a "must go" for those who love breakfast, and brunch! It is absolutely "worth the wait".
author: Alex C.

description:
Yay no line !!! Oh Mama thank you for Cooking such a wonderful delicious breakfast. The first bite of the the Dungeness Crab benedict... OOooOoh sooo heavenly. 

The other French toast with berries, with their homemade jam on top was ultimately a drool factor. 

The conversation at the dinner table was repeated several times, because all I can hear is myself say "MMmmM this is sooo tasty"
author: Jay B.

description:
There's a line, no list, first come first serve.  You order, you pay and then they seat you down.  They close at 3 pm.

I got the Washington Square, all spicy...sausage, bell pepper and pepper jack. YUM! Me and my friend shared the chocolate cinnamon toast.  YUM!  And Mimosas mimosas!...what a Saturday brunch it was.  

Everything is good here.  Food, service and ambiance...who wouldn't wanna spend weekend brunch at Mama's?
author: Pam S.

description: Best breakfast in the city. The staff was unbelievably courteous and accommodating. Well worth the short wait in line.
author: Stuart C.

description:
Mama's is like a delicious homecooked meal just like what mom used to make... If your mom could cook. 

Mama's is definitely a great place to go for brunch, my favorite meal of the day. 

I went on a wednesday and the wait wasn't too bad. The restaurant is small so either plan on waiting a while or.. Well there is no other option. 

The one thing i think is a must try would be the monte cristo sandwich. It's deeeelicious turkey grilled cheese sandwich wrapped in french toast, served with homemade jam. 

Everything else is good but not out of the ordinary. 

Overall, i'm excited to finally visit mama's but wont be back for a while since there is always a line.
author: jennifer f.

description:
Food here is pretty solid. I'd certainly recommend this however if you have to wait more than 15 minutes you are probably better off going elsewhere. It's just so touristy that it takes away from the experience of good the food is. I'll come back when there isn't a line around the block...I guess the line speaks for itself tho...

Omelet was good so was the Monte Christo
author: Derek S.

description: Amazing service, long wait (worth it though), & the food was to die for. I was on a trip with my boyfriend for a weekend in SF, and I yelped this spot. we waited 2 hours, but the staff and food made it worth it. Definitely go for the berry pancakes and mimosas!
author: Jessica V.

description:
This review is way over due. I decided to try Mama's after a friend raved about it. Personally, I liked Dottie's more (even though it's in a ghetto area). 

Cute Mom & Pop shop! As fellow Yelpers have stated, the line gets super long if you go w/in 15-30 minutes after opening. If you don't want to have to wait, get there @ 7am so you can be the first in line. The SO and I got there early just so we didn't have to deal w/ waiting in a long line. However, it's not something I would do again to eat here. 

I like the fact that Mama's bakes their own bread/pastries, etc. However, taste wise, I think Dottie's is better. I ordered the Dungeness Crab Benedict, but didn't find it to be AMAZING. Maybe I came on an off day? I don't remember it tasting super good as some have noted.   I don't remember what the bf ordered as it was a while ago. We also ordered the French Toast Sampler to try, which were good. 

I would come back to this little gem again and give them a second try.
author: Candice H.

description:
Really don't get all the hype, but the cozy institution is actually comfortable inside, despite the looks of the real estate from the outside.  

Best time to go: Weekday in the AM, after the early birds and before the lunch rush, so about 10AM, the wait will be roughly 15 minutes.  Arrive at 11AM and you'll be in line for at least 45 minutes.

Service is surprisingly chipper and the food flies out of the kitchen.

The prices for the specials are pretty steep, the crab egg dishes hovering at $19 each.  The three of us easily spent $20+ for breakfast, that's not including tip or drinks.  

I had the shrimp omelette and I was severely depressed after tasting the thawed out bay shrimp and lukewarm fontina cheese.  The potatoes on the side were oily and there was not choice given for the type of bread, I like something healthier, but I was given a heavily buttered baguette.  

Since it's crab season the egg dishes which were highlighted by crab were good, the crab scramble was exceptionally good and had very good crab to egg ratio.  

Would I go back?  No and I would not have a craving for anything in particular, which for me is an indication of winner.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I waited in line for 2 hours for this food. On a weekday. I thought the food was delicious, but I wouldn't wait again in a line like that.

I had the benedict with bacon and tomato and it was great. I'm actually pretty picky about my hollandaise sauce and this was just the right mix of lemon and creaminess. I also had the pancakes and orange juice. The pancakes that come with fresh fruit, I decided to top with the raspberry jam that was on the table. PUT THAT S*** ON EVERYTHING! The juice was equally delicious.

There's a pretty extensive menu and the service was pretty good. I personally just wouldn't wait in line again like that.
author: Elaine J.

description:
Disclaimer: the food was really yummy, and didn't leave me feeling sluggish as most heavy brunch places do. The only reason I give it 3 stars is because I had to wait 1.5 hours despite getting there at 8am. It's great to try, but I don't know that I'd wait for it again.

Definitely Try:
1. Monte Cristo - life-changing - DIP IT IN THIER HOMEMADE JAM
2. French Toast Sampler - though it's only worth it for the unique, cranberry-orange-walnut one, so maybe get this as a full order instead
3. Classic Coffee Cake - DIP IT IN THEIR HOMEMADE JAM

Maybe Try:
1. Crab Cakes Benedict - I've had the same dish at other brunch places
2. The Californian Omelet - nice fluffy omelete, but again I've had similar elsewhere (though the bacon was thick, yet crispy and delicious)
3. Blueberry Pancakes - nice, soft batter

Not the biggest fan:
1. Chocolate Coffee Cake - I didn't really get a good chocolate flavor. Order the plain coffee cake instead.
author: Gia K.

description: Overall this was not worth the wait in line. It took over 2 hours before we got our food, most of that time was spent standing in line. I decided after the wait to try the special, the dungeness crab omelet. It was pretty bland and not worth the high price tag. The one thing I did enjoy was the old fashioned crumb cake. They warmed it up and it was delicious but not worth a 2 hour wait.
author: M L.

description: Absolutely the best breakfast I have ever had! The Classic Benedict is perfect! The Monte Cristo is amazing as well! (be sure to spread the daily homemade jam on) order a bloody mary, fresh glass of orange juice and a piece of crumb cake! Unbutton your pants and go all in! DO IT!
author: Grant G.

description:
Judging by the amount of awards plastered everywhere, this is an extremely well established breakfast/brunch joint in the city. There's even a picture of Mama with James Beard on the wall. So I feel like my review doesn't contribute a whole lot. I'll just talk about the dishes I got.

Monte Cristo - It is a turkey and ham sandwich with havarti and cheddar. Then the sandwich is dunked in egg and grilled up like french toast. Its served with homemade jam and potato fries. I didn't like it too much. It was really really heavy and super cheesy. I love cheese but it was overwhelming. The sweetness of the egg wash was too much. Barely any turkey or ham. I really think I ordered the wrong thing. 

The Northern Italian Omelette - Pancetta, mushroom, basil, tomato, and cheese. Really good. It was a huge portion and the flavors blended perfectly. It wasn't heavy at all. I think the omelettes are the way to go at Mama's. For $10-11, its a huge omelette and its really good.

I really didn't enjoy the Monte Cristo, but my girlfriend ordered the Northern Italian and I liked it. Anyways, I think this place is a three star. She thinks this place is five stars. So fours the average.

P.S. Expect to wait an hour plus to get seating. Cash or debit only.
author: Aron L.

description: Your confused and you don't know what to get. Good thing I'm here. Get the monte cristo and a French toast sampler, then have some Tums and thank me in the morning. Best food in SF.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
If you ever walk by Washington Square and see this long line of people for Mama's and wonder to yourself is it worth it? You probably think it must be if people are willing to wait three hours in line. 

I'm not a huge breakfast fan, so I don't think it's worth waiting three hours. But what I will tell you in this review is what time the lines start to form on a Sunday morning so if you want to be able to try Mama's but not waste 3 hours of your Sunday read on. 

I got up really early on a Sunday and went for a run at about 5:30am. I was first in line at 6 am. Pretty dead in Washington Square just me and a few bums. 
The next person came at 6:30am for him and his aunt 
2nd couple 7:05am 
3rd person with his son 7:13am 
4th person 7:16am 
5th 2 people 7:17am 
6th family of  four 7:19am 
7th 2 people 7:24am 
8th another family of five 7:29am

By 7:35 am the line got really long realy fast. I stopped counting the amount of people and it was well past 60 people which means the people at the end wouldn't make first seating.

Basically if you don't want to wait the three hours most people wait to try Mama's, show up between 7:15am and 7:30am and you should make the first seating and you can judge for yourself if Mama's is worth the wait.
author: Binh D.

description:
Came back again and tried cranberry orange french toast, mama's sandwich and shrimp benedict. I loved the mama's sandwich the most bc I'm a sucker for crab. ^.^
Come early as the line starts before the place opens.  Best to get in during the first round of seating.  Look at the menu and know what you want in advance. Bring CASH!
author: Michelle Y.

description: MAMA'S.....2 Hour wait....Yes - WORTH IT! One and Done. If you live in the city this is something you have to do at least once. Mama's lives up to their reputation! The Crab Benedict  is incomparable to anything else I have ever had. Their french toast is also great! The day I was there they had a special, it was three different slices of french toast. SO GOOD!
author: Natalia H.

description: Great service.  Great food.  Great prices.  There's nothing not to love about Mama's.  We got the French Toast sampler.  I highly recommend it.  Send we also ordered the eggs Benedict on the English muffins.  Tasty.  Big portions.  Enough to share.
author: Felicia L.

description:
Yes it is true At least an hour wait.  The eggs Benedict are good with a very nice hollandaise.  Portions are decent size. 

Overall a lot of hype.  I guess it is the total experience.  Wait in line, line up to order, and wait for food.   Quaint place, seats about 36 people. But very good table service for coffee refills etc. 

Not sure I would go back. The food vs the wait is not worth it.
author: Steve Y.

description: The food here is amazing. I had the crab Benedict with spinach and we also ordered the Swedish French toast with seasonal berries. The crab Benedict was pretty pricey, but the crab tasted fresh, the hollandaise sauce was full of flavor and the poached egg was perfectly cooked, not too runny but saucey enough to compliment all the ingredients. I highly recommend this dish. I almost ordered as second one.
author: Sheree C.

description: I am a Mama's girl! This is my FAVORITE brunch place in all of SF, no matter how long the wait gets! I can't even.
author: Isabele B.

description:
came here early friday morning for some breakfast.  i was expecting it to be not busy because people will be at work, but i was wrong!  there was already a longggg line to the end of building.  wahhh, i didnt beat the rush.  it was a near 1hr wait from 11AM.  

its an order at the counter first basis then you get seated.

i ordered the 2eggs scrambled with sausage links.  the sausage links were really yummy.  

an order of pancakes which were reallyyyyyy yum yum.  it was nice and fluffy!

the other half ordered the special which was the chorizo.  his was really good too.  

oh, and i had a spiked lemonade.  ehh, could barely tell the difference from a reg lemonade.

portion wise was not super generous, but good enough for a feel good full.  not the ughhh i just stuffed myself and now im gonna dieee full.

i would def come back!
author: mong linh n.

description:
We waited for more than an hour outside to eat - I got chocolate French toast and potatoes and my fiance got crab eggs benedict. It for sure was NOT worth the wait (or the massive sunburn I got on my chest and arms.)  We did get to see a huge funeral procession go by though and that was interesting (August 1, 2008)

I honestly think the reason they have so many awards is because the reviewers were starving by the time they got inside after waiting in the hot sun, that their judgment was skewed. 

Best in SF means nothing - it just means the rest of the restaurants are even worse. You can save your money and your skin and make MUCH better French toast at home.

Oh, and the bathroom is crazy. It's through the kitchen, down some stairs and it's like an outhouse on stilts or something.
author: Rachel S.

description:
My friend and I went to Mama's 2 weeks ago. There were so many people in line! 
I hate that but I wanted to eat French toast! We were waiting for 1hour half. When we finally got in we had to wait in another line, but they did take our order. After we ordered the food the waitress gave us our table and the food came 5mins later! It was so quick!!
I like the order system but I still don't like to wait in line that long....
author: Sachi S.

description: Waited 1 hour and 45 mins in line and 30 mins to get my order! Just realized that i dont value my time! Mama's is not worth the wait at all and not worth the hype! Food is just fine though the service was really good. If the wait is less than 30 mins then wait otherwise go to another breakfast spot
author: Faisal A.

description:
Heavenly scrumptious. Delectable, impossible, eyes-roll-back-in-head perfection.

Those are the descriptors coming from a person who usually does not fawn over brunches, but may now have to rethink.

My friends and I came here on a weekday around 1 p.m. and were fortunate to wait for only about 15 minutes to get in. I had heard rave reviews on this restaurant, so I couldn't be more excited to be invited into the place so quickly and was thankful for my lucky stars that day.

So in what sweet and savory goodness did I indulge? First, I shared a sampler platter of thick pillowy French Toast, which included the Banana Nut and two other fruity flavors I cannot remember. They came sprawled on a large white plate topped with freshly cut strawberries, blueberries, and bananas, and were so delicious and spongy soft that I felt they could almost melt in my mouth.

Also, I had a plate of the Blackstone Eggs Benedict, which I savored to very last molecule. This dish could honestly produce an embarrassing reaction of salivation from me at the mere thought of it, any time, any place. The Hollandaise sauce which smothered the layers of crisp cut bacon and thick poached eggs was simply to-die-for (and probably would in large enough quantity!). Each bite sent me into fits of pleasure, as the ingredients blended together perfectly yet still retained enough of their individual flavors to surprise the taste buds every so often. Although the French Toast was gratifying, I much preferred the Eggs Benedict for its more colorful favor and texture. The side dish of well-seasoned potatoes which accompanied the Eggs Benedict were delicious as well.

Overall, this was a wonderful first-time experience with a restaurant whose hype is actually very well earned! Reasonable prices for taste satisfaction beyond compare - who could ask for more?
author: Amy T.

description: Absolutely THE BEST BREAKFAST I have ever had. Sure, I waited in line for 1.5 hours, tip: the earlier you get there the better, BUT it was all worth it. My party and I decided to order as many items from the menu to make the wait worth it from eggs Benedict to the banana pancakes, and all were absolutely delicious. And the jam, well let's just say all 3 jars were empty after we finished. A must when in SF!
author: Nancy R.

description:
Fantastic breakfast. We arrived at around 8:30 on a mid-week morning. The line was not too bad and we decided to wait it out. I was a little worried that my daughters would balk about thirty minutes into the wait, but they hung in there. It helped that everyone in line was happy and excited about breakfast.

We waited about 90 minutes total. The three of us enjoyed a delicious Benedict, pancakes, waffles, toast and jam, a fresh fruit bowl and drinks, including the BEST smoothie my daughter has ever had the pleasure of drinking.

Service was great; on-point, cheerful and solicitous. The girls loved the atmosphere. The woman who took our order was really kind to them and that was appreciated.

Bottom line: Everyone agreed it was worth the wait...and that is saying a lot.
author: Susan C.

description:
Great breakfast, but I'm not sure that it is worth the wait.  

Super popular breakfast joint in San Francisco.  Expect line ups to be 2-3 hours!
author: Adrian W.

description:
Poached egg dish (Mama's benedict) is tasty. Their home-made drinks are good too, for example "screwdrivers".  

 The atmosphere is what you would expect from a city like San Francisco, i.e. crowded, (mangeable) noisy, fun/friendly people (staffs and others guests).

Get ready to get in line which can last up to 1+ hour.
author: Khoa N.

description: Spent my birthday weekend in SF and came to try the famed monte cristo. Thank God that sh*t is amazing because we waited about 2 hours in line on a Saturday morning for it. The staff is super friendly, we got to chit chat with them to pass the time. While we were there, they informed us that they were opening up another location. So hopefully that can lessen the wait time. Anywho back to the food.. After placing our order at the counter, the food came out relatively quick. The monte cristo is just amazing. I THINK it's actually grilled instead of deep fried. It's paired with a homemade jam that was so damn good, I was taking spoonfuls to the face from the jar. We also ordered the Dungeness crab Benedict, French toast sampler and some mimosas which were all hits. They have a variety of pastries behind the glass along the cooks' work station that all looked yummy. Would go another round for the monte cristo if the wait becomes more reasonable. Hope to make it happen!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Got here at 7:30 am on a Saturday and we were the second party in line. They opened at 8, we placed our order right away and had our food by 8:20am or so. By this time the line was ridiculous and the people who came 15 minutes after us still hadn't ordered. So yes, the wait is long unless you plan ahead and get there early.

We got the Monte Cristo and scrambled eggs, potatoes and toast.

The Monte Cristo may have been the most delicious breakfast item I have ever consumed. The other plate tasted great, but wasn't anything super special.

There were both tourists and locals in line, so you know it's worth the wait!
author: Elina K.

description:
I mean what is the hype? I really don't know. It's a brunch place and yes their monte cristo is pretty bomb but any restaurant that makes me wait for over an hour for food should automatically get 2 stars knocked off. 

My review is biased because every time I go the wait is extremely long. But if I had to rate the food alone, I would probably give it an extra star. 

Like I said before the monte cristo is the best on the menu. I love the pancakes because it's extremely fluffy. I see people eat breakfast food vs. lunch so if you go during brunch I would recommend ordering the breakfast. 

Oh, here's a tip. Since the wait is going to be really long you should have your friends wait in line while one of you go across the street to the focaccia bread place to get some bread to snack on while you wait.
author: Keara C.

description: If you're looking for an experience go here! I wouldn't typically wait 2 hours for a meal but I'm not usually in San Francisco either. I don't even like eggs Benedict, runny eggs actually gross me out but I heard they were great here so I decided to take a leap of faith and give the try...it was the best thing I may have ever eaten for breakfast! Mine had pancetta and bell peppers and it was flavor explosion in my mouth! I also enjoyed that you could watch them cooking with all the fresh ingredients when you walk in. Great place!
author: Krista L.

description:
Not worth the wait. Even if we had been able to walk straight in, I would not have been impressed.

I tried the crab benedict, the crab breakfast sandwich, and the french toast sampler.

Crab benedict was about $21. It was fine. Nothing special. Not memorable. (I am an eggs benedict aficionado.) The best eggs ben I've had so far are the lobster eggs benedict at 25 Lusk ($19, polished atmosphere, no wait). The eggs ben at Lynn & Lu's Escapade Cafe in Oakland (~$10, sweet friendly service from cute girls) and Boulevard Cafe in Daly City (~$10) are also high on my list. I know the crab in Mama's raises the price, but... it didn't raise my level of enjoyment.

Crab breakfast sandwich: This was pretty good. The bread was a lot softer and fluffier than I expected. I enjoyed it more than my eggs ben. Not sure how much it cost. 

French toast sampler: Good! You should order this.

Screwdriver: Made with soju. It was really good. The OJ to soju ratio was perfect. It was strong but also had a strong orange flavor.

Service: Lackluster. Not rude, but not really service at all...

Cashier was more focused on the game than the customers. He took our order well but I overheard that he forgot something from another table's order.

Our server didn't really do anything. He brought our drinks and food to our table and never came by or made eye contact with us again. We wanted to tell him about the fly in our drink, but even though he was chatting with someone nearby, we couldn't catch his attention...

There were 2 bus boys that were very sweet and one of them overheard us joking about the fly in the drink and took care of it for us tout de suite.

Bottom line: Overrated. OK if there's no wait. Service is much less than I would expect for their prestige and prices. My recommendation is that you skip this one! There are a few good items on the menu if you find yourself here, but you wouldn't be missing anything if you just kept walking.
author: Rachel Y.

description:
I love love LOVE this place. Breakfast/brunch doesn't get any better than this! I've tried most of their sweet breakfast items - and everything is to die for! Staff is friendly and accommodating too.

Minus one start for the ultra long wait...  :(

There's ALWAYS a line. Average wait time on weekdays (late afternoon) is about 45 mins. I've been meaning to take my friends there on weekends, but I'm too scared to find out how long the line/wait time would be.

Mama's - please open another location!
author: Ariana C.

description: Oh Mama's; my old friend, how I've missed you!  It's been years since we've seen each other, but you still treat me like a long lost relative... After an hour and half wait in line that is.  But once you sit us down and get your food, the service is AWAYS welcoming and your food is ALWAYS top notch!  My fav is of course the famous monte cristo and the hubby got the eggs blackstone ; both absolutely delish and satisfying.  We will definitely try and not neglect our relationship!
author: Dell C.

description:
The food was great! I was very satisfied. Lots of breakfast and lunch options. It was almost hard to choose. Not a very big place. It was clean and had a nice atmosphere, but again its a little cramped in there. I personally wouldn't bring a big group. We ( 2 of us) waited at least an hour to be seated, but judging from the other reviews that might  be the norm for this place. You have to choose your meal before you sit down so I suggest you look at the menu and specials on the window outside when you have the chance if you can be indecisive. The price was decent for the quality of food (around 12-25 for a plate-charge a dollar extra for credit card use).  Food came out fairly quickly (maybe a 7-10min wait) finished in 30 mins. The servers were great as well.  

So overall great  experience. If your are on a timed schedule or dont like to wait, place is probably not for you. 

Favorite part: The jam was really really good...wanted to put it on everything. I will come back for the jam alone.

Worst part: The one bathroom is in the most random place and isn't made for the tall nor large or anyone handicapped. (Obviously it wouldn't stop me from going again since everything else was great but I think its good to know about restroom facilities)

Hope that helps :)
author: OKnicole M.

description:
Yes, it's true. Mama's is one of the best breakfast spots in San Francisco. The monte cristo sandwich and the Parisian eggs benedict were both fantastic, and they have amazing pastries. The portions are pretty big, so you will likely have leftovers unless you have a big appetite. Service is also very friendly, even the cooks in the back were very nice.

The place is pretty crammed and the wait is long (it was an hour before we even got to the counter to order, and this was a weekday), but if you're a brave soul and you can handle it then I definitely recommend Mama's.

I personally am not the type to wait in long lines to dine out, but I had to try Mama's at least once.

It seems the line dies down quite a bit an hr or so before closing (1:00ish) , so if I make my way back over there I will keep that in mind.
author: Katie S.

description:
Three out of the four of us agreed: it was worth the two-hour wait.

The only reason why our fourth didn't agree was because her order (the smoked salmon scramble) wasn't as tasty as what she's had before. And that's totally fair. Totes McGoats.

FOOD
+Northern Italian m'omelette (with pancetta, mushrooms, basil, tomato, and garlic jack cheese). It was scrum-dildly-uptious. The basil made it over-the-top good.

+French toast sampler. Ours came with the banana nut, Swedish cinnamon, and cranberry. Though I didn't expect it to be so: the cranberry one was BY FAR the tastiest. The other two were far too sweet for my palate.

+Blackstone Benedict. Absolutely divine. With crispy bacon and grilled tomato, this Benedict was to die for!

+Coffee cake. Something to tide me over til my food got there. Tasty, crumbly, and delicious.

+Carrot cake. My friend had the same idea: something to bowl her over til her plate arrived. Great, moist cake with golden raisins and an excellent cream cheese icing.


DRINKS
+Mango smoothie. If you're in the mood for mangoes, this is the drink for you. Tasted like pure, unadulterated mangoes. Super tasty.

+Fresh-squeezed OJ. Oh, yeah, the real deal. On your way to the restroom, there's a guy who twisty-twists those oranges into juice; we dubbed him the orange juice man (yeah, we're creative like that). 


TIPS
+Also helpful in waiting two hours: Mama's adorable grandson who walked around the line a few times. Easy on the eyes and sweet to boot--what's wrong with a little wait?

+NO CREDIT CARDS ACCEPTED. (Debit cards are OK though and they deduct a buck for their troubles.)

+The strawberry jam on the table is pure HEAVEN, though it's seasonal. Though they were sold out, they do sell it, so get yourself a jar or three. (They were making some olallieberry jam a few weeks ago, and I'm betting they'll sell out of that, too.)
author: Adena B.

description: Swung by at 11am on a Wednesday morning and it was PACKED. The line was approximately an hour long so if you want to skip the wait, come early. We opted for takeout instead, which was 30 minutes. I got the smoked salmon eggs benedict and my BF got the Californian omelette. I don't know if it's because we got takeout, but the meal was extremely underwhelming. The eggs were completely cooked, which was absurd and the omelette was very salty. Granted that it was to-go, I was more lenient on my expectations but this was just...less than mediocre. From the countless of positive Yelp reviews I read, I was hoping for a lot more, especially after traveling so far from SoCal.
author: Shannon W.

description:
So, I finally broke down and went to visit Mama's. I withstood the absurdly long line, and the nattering of nitwits whose appreciation of this average breakfast place only seemed to increase with each minute they had to waste in line.

The place is laid out in typical cafeteria style-you order up front and they bring the food to you. I had the combination french toast and side of two eggs over easy. I forgot to get bread so the waiter generously got me one without me having to stand in line to pay again. (He did say it would cost one dollar). I also ordered the Uncle Cy's Bloody Mary, which was mercifully delicious.

The combination french toast was a combination because it was three types of french toast: cranberry, brioche and chocolate: one slice of each. The cranberry was absolutely delicious, the brioche was so-so, and the chocolate was inedible. 

The eggs were good, but they were just eggs.

I don't know what all the hubbub about this place it. San Fran has tons of nice breakfast places. This is just one of them.

Also-I made the hike to the bathroom, which looks like a medieval water closet out in the courtyard. I went through the kitchen to get there, and I kid you not, that kitchen is FILTHY. Floor is nasty, food prep everywhere. 

I would not dock them for the wait because it is not their fault that we are all sheep.
author: Vic P.

description: the line was crazy looooooong... but i have to say... it was well worth it!
author: Emily K.

description:
Pros:
Fluffy pancakes--so so fluffy!!! you will feel like you are on clowds
Fresh OJ--taste the orange! and everything beyond it

Cons:
A long a$$ wait, probly 1hr+

Middle:
French Toast isn't that awesome. (my husband said mine was better without me pointing a knife at him) 

Please be aware--TAKE OUT IS ONLY FOR WEEKDAYS, NOT WEEKENDS!
author: Sisi W.

description:
Pros: Delicious pancakes. just order them.

oh and about the line; just don't come starving because you will be waiting over an hour.

Con: They only accept cash.
author: Yas G.

description: Came to mamas around 9/10ish  on a Tuesday morning and only waited for about 30 minutes or so. Standing in line to pay and sit down you are standing in front of all of the yummy looking cakes and breads. (Duh after waiting for awhile you will buy the great looking sweets in front of you) so I started out my meal with a piece of chocolate crumb cake. This was my first time to have crumb cake so I thought it was delicious! I also had the SOB omelette with black beans and sausage. SO much food. I really liked the raspberry jam also!  Good place!
author: Randi F.

description:
Finally got to try Mama's. I was always so skeptical about trying this place out because I know it's a huge tourist spot. Born and raised in the city, I try to stay away from the tourist spots because crowds and long waits are not the business.

Here's how it works at Mama's. You (usually) wait in a pretty long line. You order and pay for your food before you're seated. Then you eat and enjoy. Eating and paying before being seated is okay, too since you're in line for quite some time.

I got the Norwegian Benedict which had smoked salmon. OMG it was so delicious! So juicy and just NOMMMMM. It wasn't heavy and yet it was very filling. I got the grilled potatoes on the side and those were just as good. And of course, I got a mimosa on the side. You can get your mimosa w/ the traditional orange juice or grapefruit juice. I opted for the oj, but would be down to try the grapefruit next time.

Although the waiting time can be tortuous at times, I would definitely come back.
author: Justine O.

description: Waiting! 1/2 hour later waiting 1 hour later waiting 1 1/2 hour later and a large cup of coffee 100$ dollars in change for meter and still waiting I'm going to collect social security waiting lol ok now it's been 2hrs I'm looking at the people eating hoping they'll trow me scrap lol Happy 2014!! ok finally made it in and it was good real good but i have to be honest there is a place in Pismo ca thats called Marge's and their omelets  are just as good and there 10$ cheeper, ok i know its the city and ooh ahh but i think its a little over rated, will it eat there again yes Hey! its the City ooh ahhh lol
author: Ric H.

description:
The food is delish. Worth the one hour wait. 

Bring a friend. Or a book. Whichever is more entertaining : o )
author: Diana V.

description:
Their egg benedict and monte cristo is the truth! I'm seriously drooling just thinking about it..

Plan on arriving early, expect there is going to be a line (my boyfriend and I went around noon and had to wait for an hour and a half, on a weekday) but is totally worth waiting for!
author: Joanna P.

description:
So disappointed...
The food is just OKAY, not bad, definitely not great. The wait is what baffles me. 90-120 minutes standing outside for an average breakfast? Will not be back.
author: CJ W.

description:
Finally! Not only am I excited that I got to eat at Mama's, but now that I have been through this experience...I get to write a review!

I've been waiting to try Mama's forever, and I will say that I am not disappointed at all. Is there usually a long wait? Yes. Is it worth it? Pretty darn close. However, I knew this beforehand so that did not bother me at all. 

A good tip to know is that the waiter service isn't like your typical one. Yes, there are people that bring your food to you, however, you actually pay for your entire meal before you sit down. It does make it a lot easier to just get up and go about your day when you're done because you don't have to wait for someone to bring you your bill and for them to cash you out. 

I really wanted to dungeness crab benedict since I thought it would be super drool worthy. Alas, that did not work out for me since that piece of heaven was about $21.50, and I just couldn't justify spending that much on a benny, especially when they had about 10 other ones to choose from. I ended up getting the smoked salmon benny, which was AHmazing. The salmon was super rich but not heavy, and adding the avocado to it added just the right amount of that something that I was looking for. 

Got a carrot cake to-go for the bf since he was at home, and I knew he would probably want something from Mama's. The cake itself was pretty good, however, at times the texture was a bit off, but the taste was still there. The frosting, though, was absolutely creamy, dreamy, and delicious. I kinda cheated and whilst sharing with him turned into a frosting hog. It was so good that he called me out several times, whoops. :)

To top everything off I got a drink, mimosa to be exact, at brunch, of course. However, I noticed they had two kinds of mimosas, the regular OJ, and another one that I've never seen paired with champagne...grapefruit! Interesting! I had to get it! I asked them to put more champagne than grapefruit, and wow...hit the spot. I seriously loved my grapefruit mimosa. So refreshing. So delicious. So addictive. Trust me, get it. You will love it, and if you don't, then, well different strokes for different folks is all I have for you.
author: Tyree G.

description:
I couldn't resist the urge to check this place out after hearing about it from friends.  Sure enough, there was already a long line that formed outside even before it opened.  There was plenty of time to look over the menu and chit chat with fellow diners.  Still took about an hour to get seated. 

Since hearing so much about Monte Cristo, I had to try it. I must say it was darn good.  Hidden within the toast was turkey and ham with gruyere cheese. Delish!  Their home-made jam is awesome. Blueberry pancakes and Egg Benedict were just as good, although I'm not a big fan of pancakes in general. 

So what's the verdict?  Definitely worth waiting in line once!  But would I do it again?  Only if I have out of town guests...There are just too many other good places to try in the city.
author: J L.

description:
I happened to be over in SF that day and Mama's was just RIGHT around the block. HOW CONVENIENT. We were the 5th ones in line and got to be the first batch served.

Very cool going in and seeing the chefs through the window prepare the pancake batters with all the fresh ingredient lying out around them. First thing you do when you go in is stand in the line to order food, so be ready! They seat you afterwards. The ambiance is very cute! It might be totally a girl or couple thing- but with the sun was streaming in through the windows, bright colored decor, and the smell of breakfast in the air- I couldn't resist smiling.

On to the food!
French toast sampler- AMAZING. I couldn't decide which french toast dish to get so this was perfect since I got to try 3 different ones. You could actually TASTE the fruit in it. No artificial. However, it was a tad on the sweet side. I realize that I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but I felt like I had a million cavities afterwards.

Omelette was good as well but didn't blow my mind. However, great portion size and the potatoes on the side were decent.

The very popular items like the Monte Cristo and eggs benedict seem to do very well- so I'd definitely come back to try them!
author: Sally C.

description: With all the wait, I expected Mama's to be over the top.  I'll admit that I'm not a huge fan of breakfast but I wasn't overly impressed. Service was fine but it's expensive. The lines are long, parking is near impossible and you feel bad if you hang out too long to talk.  The food compares with Black Bear Diner or any other non-chain respectable breakfast place in the city.  I'm thinking that Mama's must just gain alot of business because it has been there for a while and it somehow snuck into every language of the Fodor travel guides that tourists use to canvas the city.
author: Jeff G.

description: Phenomenal chocolate crumb cake!  The best French toast and fresh berries. There is almost always a line and no matter what you might think it is worth the wait
author: Steve W.

description:
Sorry... I'm not a fan yet... stop booing at me! 
Waited for over an hour for a very late brunch. I ditched this place ...twice before... ;P what can I say?! I was too hungry to wait. 
French Toast sampler is ok. Shrimp and Egg Benedict.. ermm not my taste. I need more flavor. My tasted buds is on the numb side. So you need to use tons of spices for me to recognized it. Crab omelet sandwich is okay too. If I don't need to wait... I'll give 4 stars... I don't think I'll be back soon. Sorry...
author: Icey M.

description:
A wait of almost 2 hours sounds ridiculous, right? Well it is. And about 40 people at one time are waiting around the corner from the entrance of Mama's. Everyone is in pretty good spirits, salivating and looking in at the happy people inside the window. There MUST be something good at the end of this madness....

...lo and behold, there's wonderful food just inside the door. But after you get in another line to  order, and then into one more line to wait for a table. During this torturous waiting period and smelling the beautiful brunch smells, I think I actually started to drool. We finally got seated, and it was even more painful! The food took a while to come out, so we just had to watch everyone around us scarf down their food. It was hard to just sit there and not try to steal a bite from our neighboring table. 

FINALLY. The time came. The food has arrived!!! We got the French Toast Sampler, the Monte Cristo and the Eggs Benedict. The Monte wasn't quite my taste and I've definitely had better eggs bennys in my life, but the FRENCH TOAST SAMPLER is to die for. Or, at least worth the wait. Each slice is different and absolutely amazing. That dish alone made me forget about my standing-in-line-for-hours blues. Top it with some of their homemade jam and I feel like I'm in heaven. 

I want to go back especially for the French Toast Sampler, but I need to clear one whole morning in order to go...
author: Christine A.

description: After hearing how popular this place was, we really wanted to check out this spot, especially since we are brunch lovers. We came here Sunday morning and after finally finding parking, we saw how long the line was. Our total wait time was about 1.5 hours until we finally got seated. Unfortunately we got seated by the windows where everyone was standing outside and would clearly stare at you while you eat, hoping you would hurry up so they would be seated. While the place offers many different types of foods ranging from scrambles, omelettes, benedicts, waffles, pancakes, etc, the wait was really not worth it. I felt the flavors although good, were not outstanding and was not distinctive enough from other places to make me want to stay in line again for another 1.5 hours. I felt I could eat the same food with the same quality at other places that are also very good with a much shorter wait. Brunch is a very popular meal, especially in San Francisco so I must say, I have more restaurants in mind to go to more brunch rather than this one. I must highlight that the flavors were great and we did leave satisfied with the quality of the food. However we did not enjoy having to wait so long to be seated and not being able to enjoy our meal and take our time because of the rapid turnover of tables that was needed in order to seat as many parties as possible.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
Early bird gets the worm, still responding to texts from last night, 
cozy with the weather, this the SF life, 
This the spot, hey ma, what's up, let's slide, 
Beacon coffee round the corner, stayin' winning waitin' in line, 
Washington square, ain't no squares here in my circle of winners, 
here with my clique, droolin' through the windows, 
line got mad reputation, like yo mama, 
but this classic, reputation like yo-yo ma, 
Monte Cristo, masterpieces like the count of Monte Cristo, 
H.A.M. straight perfection, defy the status quo, 
homemade JAM with them French Toast, toast to life inside these doors, 
Dungenes crab benedict, freshness got everyone dancin' on their toes, 
inside these walls mouths turntup, Mama throws the best party, 
breakfast reign supreme, know what I'm sayin'
dearly departed with the classic, from Otis, 
you won't regret it, no, no, 
no, girl, they won't forget it
love breakfast, hate mornings,
Mama's here to teach you a lesson
author: Roy C.

description:
While the line can be long, I had breakfast one sunday morning and only waited 40 minutes but got their promptly at 8am.  Wow is all I can say...Their crab benedict is to die for.  Hands down, the very best I have ever had and their carrot cake...Amazing.

While I felt like I was in a food coma after, I wll definitely repeat the next time I am there.  

Also, the staff is super friendly.  Wish we had a place like this in the south bay:)
author: Rob M.

description: I don't do lines but my husband picked this place for brunch on Wednesday and 45 minutes later we were seated. For me personally, it gave me a little anxiety to see people outside still waiting watching me eat inside- that's just my personal issue. This is not a place you can tell them where you want to sit- yes, it is that busy and small. Aside from this - bacon was crispy and done right, pancakes were fluffy and fresh fruit was just that -UBER fresh! I had the Northwest omelette and salmon and that was worth the wait. Food here is good, fresh, and has heart. Go early to escape lines and on sunny days bring a hat, sun screens and a newspaper or magazine. Once inside all is well.
author: G M.

description:
Mama's is absolutely delicious. This could also be because by the time your one and a half hour wait for your table is over, your stomach might have by then shriveled up to the size of a tiny golf ball, then anything would have tasted good. However, I do not think that is the case for a place such as Mama's. 

There is a reason why this place has a line gathered outside its restaurant. I don't understand why people choose to bring down Mama's ratings down because of their own impatience. 

The fruits, juices, meats, breads...... Heck everything! is made fresh and is delicious. If you have a couple hours free and an empty stomach, you must stop by this restaurant.
author: Jessie C.

description:
I've been eating breakfast here while in trips since 2002.  Yes, if you want first seating, you have to be here 45-60 minutes early (7:00 - 7:15). If not, the line will be halfway down the block by opening time. 
Signature dishes - the Monte Cristo, French toast, chocolate cake. Try the Dungeness crab omelet. 
Cash or debit card only.
author: Mark F.

description:
My friends and I drove an hour out to SF, JUST to get brunch here and drive back home right after. Yes, it is THAT amazing.

Montecristo- everyone loves ham&cheese sandwiches, so if you deep fry it, it's obviously going to be sensational to the taste buds! The homemade berry jelly that comes with it looks average, but when you smear that delicious spread on the sandwich, you're basically in food heaven.

Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast- topped with fresh fruit, QUALITY fruit too, not cheap ol' grapes, apples and oranges. Basically a plate full of cinnamon-y/chocolate/mixed berries/banana/syrup galore that you're going to want to finish, no matter how many grams of sugar might be in it :)

Great service, cute atmosphere, and affordable prices.  One entree is honestly enough for two people to leave with a content stomach. Or, you can just eat the whole thing by yourself and not eat for the rest of the day because it was so filling, yet SO good.
author: Emily H.

description:
I had the dungeness crab omelette and it was pretty good, but the wait is RIDICULOUS.  You first have to wait in one line to get into the restaurant for 2 hours, then wait in another line to order while the person taking the orders just sits around doing nothing, then yet another line to be seated - crammed into a tiny area.

Again, the food is good, but it's nothing special.  Really not worth it the wait, I won't be going again.
author: T.J. H.

description:
Vacationed in San Francisco and my local friend took me to Mama's. Saw the line and thought immediately, this place must be good.

Lived up to it's hype. Even their basic coffee is delicious. I ordered their special which gave a sample of three different kinds of french toast. Lightly added some syrup. Then some delicious Olallieberry Jam and bam! stuff was amazing. Great breakfast. Highly recommend.
author: Mike G.

description:
Nice little breakfast nook. Went here on a Sunday. Got in line about 7:30 AM and was seated by about 8:30 AM. I got the regular Eggs Bennie. Really good. The hollandaise sauce has a certain tang to it though....like a citrusy tang....not sure what that is about, but it was good. They have very good jam on the table....house made I think, some kind of blackberry or other. I used half a jar on my sourdough toast. 

Overall, good food. The dining area is small, but I like that. Service was ok. Had to throw the waitress that "look" to get her over to refill the coffee. But she was very friendly. My company asked for water when I was in the bathroom and the busser, from what she told me said " Somebody else will get it".....WTF? How about checking that really quick because that did affect the tip we left.....or lack there of. 

I'll return.
author: Joe B.

description:
I finally made it to Mamas after several years of walking by starring at the rather lengthy line. Well, last Saturday was no exception there a long line when we arrived at 9:15 but alas we were prepared with a coffee in hand and plenty stories from the past weeks work shenanigans. An hour later we were starring at menu trying desperately to figure what to eat.

We settled upon the south of the border omelette, a Washington square omelette and shared the banana pancakes. The omelette were delicious!  My friend really enjoyed the pancakes. I, on the other hand, thought they were a bit tough for my liking.

The service was great even with it being packed. I was however confused as to why some people got to order from their table while others stood in a line to order. Not sure what was going on there.

I'd certainly go back again but will mostly stand in line elsewhere to try the many other SF eateries!
author: Leanne S.

description: Wait is way toooooo long! Only one restroom, kinda small. First time here. I ordered the Swedish cinnamon french toast, added the berries. Also ordered scrambled eggs and bacon. Oh yeah and the old fashioned crumb cake.
author: Foodie S.

description:
Worth the line?

Perhaps.  Actually, yes.  But come patient and hungry. If there wasn't a solid 1-hour wait to get in here, this could be a 5-star place.

Expect fare that you wouldn't find on other breakfast menus.  But let me share some points:

1. Get there early.  There's a line out the door before it opens and it keeps growing by the minute.  
2. On second thought, get there super-early.  Like when the Chinese-Yoga-thing-is-happening-in-the-park early.
3. My little girl (age 4) enjoyed this place.  The diversity in the menu (covered in other reviews) was cool.  I have never had the type of pancakes / french toast that you'd find here.
4. Overall probably the greatest breakfast in San Francisco.

Prices are comparable for the neighborhood breakfast hot spots, so not bad given the popularity of it.

But ugh.  The line.  4-stars y'all.
author: Jason B.

description:
Place is tiny but food was amazing. Prepare yourself for a long wait because there is a line all day long! Had the Salmon Benedict and a berry shake both equally as good! Oh and the sour cream blueberry crumb cake was amazing as well.
 
Service was on point as well!

Worth the wait!
author: Jerry S.

description:
Service -great
Wait- long (1 hr in 32 degrees)

Monti Cristo - pretty darn good. It's much better with the raspberry jam

Benedict - ok. Hard to cut. Tough English muffin and thick ham

It was good but I don't think it was worth an hour wait
author: Tracy W.

description:
Back in San Fran and what's the the first thing you do? Go to Mama's!

We waited an hour and a half in line for our chance to eat here. Even random people were coming up to us asking "This place always has a line, is it really worth it". We all sigh, nod our heads and say "Yup... sadly, it is". Even at the one hour mark I started to lose hope!! But Mama always comes through. 

Naturally, my husband and I had the Monte Cristos with jam preserves with a side of fuit..... how do you describe perfection? It's obvious loading with meat, cheese, bread and battered in egg!

Why haven't you eaten here yet? You don't understand!
author: Roz M.

description:
I heard there's a line here all day, everyday.  My advice is that if you haven't tried it, give it a try because the food is good.  But it's definitely not somewhere you want to visit often unless you like waiting in line.  On a Saturday afternoon around 1pm, I waited about 45 minutes.  There's practically a line until they close.  So there isn't a dead time where you can go and avoid the line. 

Also, you can't order to go either unless you wait in line.  So that kind of sucks.  If there were no line, I would visit Mama's more often because there's awesome breakfast/brunch food! 

Tip: Try to use the bathroom before coming here because to get to the bathroom, you have to go through part of the kitchen, which is kind of awkward.  Then you have to take a flight of stairs outside to an extension part of the building to arrive at a tiny bathroom.
author: Cindy T.

description:
This is on my list of places to bring out of towners so that I can show them what SF has to offer in terms of food. I always get the same reactions: initial skepticism (because of the line) that turns into, "Oh my goodness, this was so worth the wait!"

I've tried a variety of things here, and nothing has ever failed to disappoint. The biggest disappointment I feel whenever I come here (other than the line, of course) is that I wish I could fit more into my stomach!

I think what's so great about Mama's is that there is something for everyone. Whether you are a fan of French toast, omelettes, pancakes, etc, all the food that I've tried here has been done right. All the ingredients are FRESH and PLENTIFUL.

If I had to pick what I love the most about this place, though, it is definitely the Monte Cristo. It is so good that I will give up an egg entree to get it (and my friends know that I love my breakfast eggs!). Thankfully, though, I can usually get the best of all worlds by sharing a variety of dishes :)

Wear your stretchy pants and prepare to be amazed!
author: Angela K.

description:
I really wanted to like this place because I heard so many great things about it. I tried the cranberry-orange French toast and it was good but not
great. This confirms that the best French toast is at Olea in Nob Hill. One of my friends tried the smoked salmon/scramble eggs and that tasted pretty good. Service is good, but the line is terrible. There is a line inside the restaurant once you get in. Make sure to arrive 20 mins before they open on a weekday and 1 hour before on a weekend. This place is good, but not worth the hype and wait in line.
author: Shoua K.

description: Extremely ong wait, but a good spot for brunch
author: Anonymous Z.

description: We went on a Sunday, waited for almost 2 hrs to be seated, the food is higher over rated, not worth the waiting, I'm sure there are lots of people would agree with me. Ive seen some tablet where people left with only half of plates finished, not a great a place to be. I'm sure an average breakfast place can cook what they can offer. On top of that, the waiter served us had some attitude, guess they have too much business, that's why they are rude, as not afraid of lose business.
author: Jay Q.

description:
We waited for like an hour, and circled for parking for half an hour. Of course w/all the yelp reviews we were willing to wait however long it took.

Everyone is super friendly here, and once inside, we had to wait another 10 to 20 minutes to order, and for them to set up our table. The place is super small and that's why the wait is so long...but I don't know if I'd wait again.

The majority of our table ordered the Monte Cristo because it was so hyped on yelp...but I took a bite and wasn't overly impressed with it, or thought that the wait was worth it. Now..the croque madame at bouchon was absolutely heavenly, and that's what I expected of the Monte Cristo (that same feeling), but really, tasted ordinary.

However, you can tell everything here is fresh and the food is served piping hot. The quality is definitely better than your normal brunch place, but I don't think I'd wait over an hour just to try it...prob 20 minutes max.
author: Ellen C.

description:
i don't know what about standing in a line, outside, for breakfast, is appealing. I definitely dislike that they dont have a sign-in list. what a waste of time....

To say that I did not enjoy the food would be a lie. It's obvious that the food is good but i personally don't think it is worth the wait on the weekend. there are plenty of other reasonable and delicious brunch places to hit up.

I wish i knew before i went:
if you get there at 10am on a Saturday you WILL wait  2 1/2 hrs before you eat.
the carrot cake has pineapple in it. yuck.
author: bonnie y.

description:
I took the day off of work today because it's my *birthday*!  :)  But we got up at 6:30 to get ready and grab a taxi over to Mama's!  As it is a Tuesday and we got there 20 minutes before it opened, my bf and I were 9th and 10th in line - not bad, not bad at all!  :) 

They promptly opened their doors at 8AM and we filed in groups of about a dozen at a time so as not to crowd the smallish restaurant and to avoid the hovering over tables while we all enjoyed our breakfasts.  Order up and pay first at the counter and then grab a table.  We picked a table away from the window so as not to be stared at by people in line outside.

My bf ordered the Northern Italian omelette (Pancetta, Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomato, and Garlic Jack Cheese) and I got the Pan Dore french toast (Slices of Sour French Baguette with Sauteed Apples in Lemon Butter Sauce).  We shared our meals, and it was a great combination with the savory Italian flavors of the omelette (yummmm) against the sweetness of the apple french toast (the waiter recommended adding some berry jam - that was a hit combo for me!).  Add two cups of coffee and a large OJ, and we were two happy campers!

The service was so nice, friendly and humorous - props for having a good sense of humor so early in the morning!  You made our morning Mama's venture that much more enjoyable!  

I will definitely return!  Loooooved it!!

Omelette+French Toast+2 coffees+large OJ+tax+tip = $25
author: Maile N.

description: Yes, we waited for over an hour to get in, but we had the time to spend so it was worth it. The Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast I had was so good. I loved the thick french toast, the way it was battered and cooked, the fruit on top, and the delicious raspberry jam.  The presentation of the food was amazing. The staff is so nice, happy, and helpful and they work hard to make sure you have a wonderful experience. They don't take credit cards so bring cash or a debit.  SO impressed!
author: Bryce C.

description: A must eat in SF.. always schedule it in my calendar when coming here. Food is great.. Staff is wonderfull. Worth the wait.. I had the Eggs benedict Paisano and The French Toast sampler... Awesome Awesome..
author: Sneider M.

description:
Not worth the two and a half hour wait. One hour and forty-five minutes to get in the door. Fifteen minutes to order and fifteen minutes to receive order.  With the long line in front of windows at table we rushed and didn't even enjoy our $100 of breakfast for four.

Kitchen is open to view and not clean.  Chef was sweating in the food and no gloves on anyone.

Given the reputation and expecting a 30-45 minute wait (advertised), was prepared for an hour, I expected awesome, received average at best.

Over-hyped, over-priced, wouldn't do it again with a 30 minute wait.
author: Travis S.

description: Prepare yourself for a 2 hour long wait when eating here! The service was so great and the menu was good. I ordered the crab Benedict with potatoes and it was alright.
author: Krystle-Ann L.

description:
First off, too many damn tourists go here. That loses one star. 

My boyfriend and I have only been here twice. The first time was back in 2011, the second time was a few days ago. I remembered why we don't go to Mama's that often and that's because we have to wake up so early just so we could wait in line in the cold 30 minutes before they open except when we got there I felt like we should've gotten there an hour early because their was already so many people in line. After waiting in the cold for an hour because of course we didn't get in right when they opened, we ordered our food, paid, and sat down at an available table. That's how their system works. Before I go into details on the food and service, I just wanted to say that the Asian lady working the register and taking orders was NOT friendly at all. She was kind of a b----. 

Now onto the amazing food. The food here is always delicious and what I love about this place is that they use fresh ingredients. You can even see them making people's food while waiting to order your own. 

Our first visit we tried the Dungeness Crab Benedict, French Toast Sampler, and the Scrambled Florentine. Our second visit we tried the Californian Omelette and Blueberry Pancakes. The Dungeness Crab Benedict had a lot of fresh crab meat, but I remember it wasn't very flavorful. We only enjoyed 2 out of 3 from the French Toast Sampler. The Scrambled Florentine and Californian Omelette were both excellent. You can definitely taste how fresh the eggs are. The Blueberry Pancakes were good, but definitely not the best I've ever had.

The waitstaff was very attentive and friendly, so that definitely made up for the unfriendly rude cashier. All in all, I definitely enjoy this place and the breakfast I eat here every time, but I just don't see myself coming back any time soon because of  how busy this place is.
author: Veronica L.

description:
....what an irresistably adorable little gem of a restaurant! Thinking about our brunch here makes my heart smile (and my tummy growl lol). I heard about this place from a friend when I was asking around about the "must sees" ot SF. She warned me that the wait often exceeds an HOUR yet she guaranteed it was worth it. I was hesitant... are you kidding me....an hour's wait time??!?!?! She CLEARLY must've been exxaggerting right? WRONG. We pretty much spotted the place when we saw a ridiculously long line curving around the block... I mean... this was a line that you expect to see at the opening of a new ride at your favorite amusement park during labor day weekend!!! Luckily I was in great company so waiting an hour and a half wasn't going to be much of a problem. 

We were practically giddy by the time it was our turn to go in. It was almost like we had won the lotto.. ok maybe not the lotto but you get the idea.... You get to to take a look at the menu as you make your way to the register. It's kind of evil... becuase you get to smell all that is cooking and see all the yummy sweets & treats as you make your way to the register. Ofcourse we ended up ordering way more than we intended to. Here's what we got:

2 orders of the eggs benedict: Perfection.

the French Toast sampler: holiday in my mouth

Crab dungeness Omelette: I heard it was "da bomb" lol but I'd never be daring enough to mix my shellfish with eggs. bluagh...

A bowl of fresh fruits: They were SERIOUSLY FRESH and oh SO good. The melons were perfectly ripe and the strawberries sweet and juicy without the mush. Yum! The grapes... exploded with flavor. 

Freshly squeezed OJ: best we've EVER had!

Chocolate crumb cakes: Too good to be legal

The monte Cristo... I wasn't impressed... but interesting concept.

Blueberry poundcake: a little too sweet but no real compaints here!!

I'm giving this place 4 stars (I'd give 4.5 if I could) because the wait time could've been torture if we were really hungry... or in a less than jovial mood... also based on other yelp reviews we had high hopes for the monte cristo and it fell very short of our expectatons. Overall though, it was an amazing brunch and I would definitely go back on my next trip to SF.
author: Kaputachya A.

description: Totally overrated. The line (which we would typically never do) was an hour. Husband said eggs Benedict was sour. I had a mimosa which was delicious and vegetable omelette which was good. The silver dollar pancakes were really very fluffy and were the best part of the meal. That being said, you can't really screw up breakfast. Won't be going back, not worth the wait even though people watching was entertaining.
author: Cap M.

description:
Had a very late brunch at Mama's. It was a warm afternoon, and I was suddenly craving for some good breakfast food. Our timing was just perfect, we got there 5min before they closed up, and there were only two parties left standing outside. The wait wasn't too long, around 15min. This was my first time at Mamas, I've always wanted to try this place, but the hour long waits always made me put it off.
The place is small with cute tables laid out. We ordered the Monte cristo and the salmon egg benedict, and a spiked lemonade (mix of white wine, lemonade and soda). The food was delicious and the portions were large. I really enjoyed how the eggs were cooked, and the salmon was the perfect combination. The lemonade was refreshing and tasty. Service was fast and friendly.
Overall, I like this place a lot but I would definitely choose non peak hours to go, just to avoid the long waits.
author: Helen Y.

description:
I came here on 4th of july sunday. We arrived at around 10am and of course there was a long line. The place itself is TINY, with only about 10 tables. Once you're in you have to order at the counter and wait to be seated. I got the dungeness crab omlette with avocado and havarti cheese. There were generous portions of crab but it was distributed unevenly. I had heaping mouthfuls of crab in the first half of the omlette but barely had any lumps in the second half. I also tried the french toast sampler. That was amazingly delicious. There were three different flavors of french toast made from their freshly baked bread and topped with fruit (strawberry and blueberries). That was seriously a party in my mouth.

I stood in line for about 2 hours just to eat for 30 minutes. Honestly, I felt a bit "rushed" because there was still a long line while i was eating and I felt the need to not sit there for too long as a courtesy to the other patrons. So was the food worth the wait? Not really. I would not wait 2 hours again - maybe one hour max, but then i'd have to show up at 7am (yes, 7! the place opens at 8am, but i heard the line starts forming even before that). I probably won't be back, but it doesn't look like Mama's will be hurting much without my business.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Absolutely fantastic!  Try Eggs Benedict or Mama's French toast samples with orange juice and mimosa!
author: Judy P.

description:
Been here twice with two different groups of friends

We stood in line for 2 hrs+, both times.

Everyone came out and thought it was totally worth it and we would stand in line any day for Mama's breakfast over and over and over again.

Enough said?
author: Summer C.

description:
They open at 8 am, we walked up at 7:55 am to a line around the block. Two hours later we were seated. The ONLY reason we waited that long was because of these reviews and what some locals told us. 

Okay, I don't get it. Really. There's nothing special to this place. The jams aren't "to die for". It's average breakfast food. I guess that translates to SUPER AWESOME SF HIPSTER WANNABE FOODIE MUST TRY.

Whatever.
author: Duane L.

description:
We showed up around 7:40 hoping to beat the crowd, and, although there was a line, we made it in and were sat by 8:10.  It took another 10-15 to get our food, but this was WELL WORTH THE WAIT!  I had the french toast sampler, which I highly recommend.  Also brought home a piece of the crumb cake, which did not disappoint.  

Glad we braved the line for this one.
author: Toni D.

description:
Hunnids, hunnids.  It's my 100th review! I will review Mama's cause this place is special.

A delicious breakfast place that people should try if they haven't yet.  The dungenness crab benedict is amazing (a bit pricey), french toast, mimosas, bloody mary, all are good!

There is a long line out the door even before it's opened.  I came here on a rainy morning and everyone was determined to have a warm breakfast that day.  

Great, cozy place that can fuel your mind, body, and soullll with some of Mama's food.    

Do it.  Try it. You won't regret it.
author: Grace P.

description:
You've been to Disneyland before, right? Then of course you'll remember this... The time you stood in line 30 minutes to get inside the Indiana Jones ride. Once you got inside the Indiana Jones queue, you had to wait another 20 minutes in line until you watched that stupid Indiana Jones safety video. Then once you got past THAT line, then you moved on to THE NEXT LINE which actually got you onto the ride! And after the ride was done- you loved it! The Indiana Jones ride was so much fun, it made all that waiting in line well worth it!  

Welcome to Mama's in San Francisco!

Line upon line, more waiting after more waiting- If you're going to Mama's then you probably already have a good idea what you're getting yourself into. Straight up- Mama's is delicious, and that's the truth. Is it worth spending half of your morning waiting in line for? That's for you to decide...

French toast is so awesome- I recommend trying the 'French Toast Sampler'. The bread is kinda, well, bready- but they fuse the flavors into the bread so well, truly better than any other french toast I've had..
