When eating the French Toast you'll feel like Willy Wonka "The Banana toast tastes like Bananas! The Cinnamon toast tastes like Cinnamon! The Snozberry toast tastes like Snozeberries!"

Also, the Eggs Benedict are made to perfection. Last time I went I ordered the Shrimp Benedict- check it out:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?userid=-4BEUkLvHQntN6qPfKJP2w  Absolutely delicious- so freakin good. The potatoes are kinda dry, but no biggie. Really the only problems with Mama's are the lines(which they can't help) and the prices(which are a little overpriced, imo) Otherwise, Mama's is a hit and totally worth checking out to say you've been there!
author: Greg G.

description:
Weekly Cheat Meal Alert!

Rating: 7

Dish(es): Brunch (Dungeness Crab Benedict and Chocolate Crumble Cake)

Review: 2-hour wait and $22 for the benedict are the major negatives.  Crab benedict was normal size, tasty and fresh.  Had better.  Potatoes were tasty but nothing special.  

Chocolate crumble cake was one of the best cakes ever.  Served warm, and had an amazing taste.  Coffee was good too.

Cheat meal well spent.
author: Athlete W.

description: BEST ADVICE; get there b4 they open and the line won't be too long.  Just spend the 1/2 hour outside with the paper,  rather then the 2 hours in line after it opens.  Everything is good.
author: Jo N.

description:
Waited about an 1hr for Mama's. Definitely worth the wait! Mama's infamous Monte Cristo is BOMB.COM

Also ordered the dungenous crab benedict which is just ok. I recommended going to Zazies for that.  

the good thing about this place is that u order ur food before u get a table
author: Jenn F.

description:
When asked by someone in line if it is worth the wait- yes!  The french toast and the monte cristo are AMAZING!  But I had the dungenuss crab eggs benedict as a parting meal before I moved 200 miles south and my taste buds were sorely disappointed.   The hollandaise was not lemony enough to flavor the bland crab.  Also the sauce was not applied to the crab, but rather dripped off of the egg and onto the plate.  More over the creamed spinach under the crab was so wet that it made my english muffin a soggy sponge which was a super gross texture to be eating with crab.

That being said, I still give them 5 stars because their staff is so friendly in just the right way- I always float away on a cloud after dinning here.  It's like I'm part of the family :)
author: Jes S.

description:
Mama's is such a good breakfast/brunch place. Honestly, I have never ordered anything off the menu that I didn't like. In fact, I've never ordered anything off the menu I haven't been able to finish (and I don't mean because the portions are small)! One of my favorite parts about the restaurant is when you enter (right before you order your food) you get to see the cooks preparing the food you're about to eat. There's also a nice spread of the meat, like dungeoness crab and shrimp, along with fresh vegetables. 

If someone was holding a gun to my head and asked me to pick my favorite main at Mama's I would say the shrimp egg's Benedict. For a side, I would definitely recommend the carrot cake. The food is so damn tasty. 

My only dislike about the restaurant is the price; however, I've decided that some things in life are just worth it. 

A LARGE piece of advice for anyone visiting Mama's would be to arrive before 9AM. I don't care if it's a Wednesday versus a Saturday; If you don't arrive before 9 then expect to wait upwards of 2 hours just to get into the restaurant.
author: Tommy C.

description:
After you wait in line at 8:00 a.m. for almost two hours looking like a clown (or just a leisurely San Franciscan who does this mindless shit all the time), you really want your breakfast to kick ASS.  

Our breakfast didn't really kick ass.  Le sigh.
We came here for my roommate's college graduation breakfast, because it was her special day.  Which means we wanted a special breakfast.  Obviously.  
We ordered the Crab Eggs Benedict, the "Healthy" French Toast, and Mimosas.  It was all pretty average.  We basically ate until we were full and then looked at each other like the big idiots that we were for waiting that long for breakfast that just didn't kick ass, at all.  
Don't get me wrong, it was fresh, prepared well, and pretty to look at!  But the flavors weren't there.  I even heard the couple next to us say "wow, this is average, we're silly."  My thoughts exactly.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Mama's- greatest classic Benny in the US or Canada (my research has been thorough). One bite and you're doing the diner scene from "When Harry Met Sally"...but you're not faking.
author: Johanna S.

description:
If I lived in SF.... i would go here so so often! 

okay the wait is long - especially on a weekend get there early, smaller tables are seated way easier like 2 ppl tables vs. 4 ppl tables.   

What makes it worth it?  HOMEMADE JAM.   okay i got to tell u guys the truth me and my friend were so hungry after the 1.5 hours wait that we ate some while we were waiting for our food.   The jam is made out of fresh berries! 

Eggs Benedict YUMMMY & DELICIOUS 

French toast also delicious.  

It really does make me feel like i am in my mama's ktichen.    The 2nd time i came here, the wait was only 15 minutes, but whooohooo it was a friday morning at 9am and also a lil sprinkly outside :D   

Parking can be challenging and make sure to bring your coins!!!
author: Jamie K.

description: I don't jus hand out 5 star reviews but this place deserves it! I've been here several times and they never disappoint. If you don't beeline me just look at the constant line wrapped around the corner. It's the place to be but expect at least an hour wait!
author: Thebig G.

description: Coming at noon on a Sunday was a bad idea. The line was about a 3 hr wait time, we figured we wouldn't make it before they closed at 3 so we left. Seems like everyone who actually gets in loves it. But be prepared to wait, and if you come hungry, it's hard to stand in line that long. Maybe next time we come to San Fran we'll plan it better.
author: Stacy B.

description:
Such an AWESOME little place.  It was my first time going to SF and saw this place from yelp.  Stood in line outside for 30mins but worth the wait.  
The staff were very friendly and the food were delicious!
author: Darlene G.

description:
Worth the wait! The whole waiting in the queue for 1 hour thing is an experience by itself. You just need to be prepared for it. Don't come already starving or with nothing to entertain you. I brought my reading homework articles to keep me busy. If u don't like being under the sun, bring a hat and sunglasses. Then everything will be fine ;) 
Despite the crowded place, the staff were really nice and attentive! I went there by myself, so I can confirm that the place is solo-traveler friendly. I even got a free pancake from the cashier Mike, in addition to the Monte Cristo and  Dungeness crab benedict I ordered. Imagine people staring at my table. I had a conversation with Mike over the cashier counter, and I think he was pulling a prank on me. It was a nice prank though, as it became a conversation starter with the people on the tables beside mine and suddenly I was not having a meal alone. It was really fun experience and the pancake was really good too. If i have time to go do the queue thing again, I would go back and try another sweet type of french toast, the bread they were using to make it looked so good.

Note:
1) You can ask for take-away box in case you can't finish ur food.
2) They do take-outs on weekdays, but not on weekends.
author: Rose D.

description:
Got to Mama's around 8:15 a.m. Sunday morning and the line was already ridiculous! We thought maybe it was because of Mother's Day, but there weren't that many "mothers" in the crowd. We've heard that the average wait is at least 1 1/2 hours, so we were prepared for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, but we ended up waiting 3 1/2 hours! Our breakfast turned into our lunch. Luckily it was a nice day and the sun was shining. 

We ordered the Mama's French Toast Sampler so we could try a little bit of everything (Banana Nut, Swedish Cinnamon, Orange-Cranberry). It was topped with lots of fresh berries and bananas and a side of maple syrup. My favorite was the banana nut, which was a slice of banana nut bread dipped in the egg bath then grilled to perfection. I took one bite with the maple syrup and the rest with their homemade jam! Next we had the Blackstone Benedict since this place is known for their benedicts. It was quite delicious and they did not hold back on the crispy bacon...MmMm! Our friend ordered the Smoked Salmon Scramble, which came with potatoes and an bagel. He said it was pretty good, but could live without the tomatoes in it. Besides sharing the french toast sampler with my bestie, Alice L., we also go the Southwest Omelete with the habanero sausage (not spicy folks). It was a nice portion and pretty delicious. 

We all enjoyed our meals as well as the service at Mama's. I would love to come back, but I'm not sure I'd be willing to stand in line for that long again.
author: Tracey W.

description: OH MY GOSH, I have died and gone straight to brunch heaven. We have NOTHING like that on the east coast (so sad, so sad). We wait a good 2-3 hours on a Saturday afternoon, but it was worth every minute. The pancakes was fresh. The FRESH fruits (holy crap, I don't think I've ever seen that many FRESH berries on a pancake on the east coast) was amazeballs. The omelette was perfect. I am salivating speaking of this! West coast, you are the best coast because of Mama's.
author: Jenn G.

description:
Lovely, fresh, yummy brunch!
The Salmon benedict is my favorite!
author: Sophia H.

description: Delish Dungeness Crab Cakes and French Toast. The blackberry jam was delightful. Wonderfully fresh fruit; spicy "shrimp cocktail" bloody marry. A must eat quaint breakfast nook off of San Fran's Washington Square.
author: Hailee W.

description: Let's just say.. if Mama's French Toast was a person, I'd marry it on the spot. No hesitation. Obviously I'd have to get through the darn wait outside the door first though....
author: Puka N.

description: If your a tourist in the Bay area, do, and I mean PLEASE DO go to this place for breakfast. The breakfast quality, appearance and taste is out of this world. Best of all, it won't hurt your wallet too much. Expect LONG and I mean long lines in the morning.
author: Walter M.

description:
OMFG. Talk about worth the wait.

Boyfriend had French Toast sampler.  I had the Farmer's Omelet.  And we had mimosa's.

We tried to go in November for his birthday but the line at 8 am was HUGE.  So we woke up naturally early and decided to give it a shot.

Here's what I learned:
1.  The first people in line got there at 7:15 for an 8 am opening.
2.  This place is a well oiled machine.  They want to feed everyone without making anyone rush.
3.  Not only is the food superb but they care about presentation.

I can't wait to accidentally wake up at 6:30 hungry again.
author: Kristin G.

description:
Super f*ing long line. 2 hour wait! I came in about 11am though, prime time brunch hour on a Saturday. 

But... The food was delicious. I had the French toast sampler, the northern Italian, and the crab omelette with havarti cheese. All of it was delicious. The northern had the perfect blend of spices, the pancetta gave this omelette so much flavor. The French toast was made with three different slices if bread, cranberry, banana nut, and cinnamon. Not too sweet, and delicious with the maple syrup and the fresh fruit. Crab omelette was my favorite. Real crab with avocado wrapped in the light and fluffy egg. 

This place is definitely a must try, but be prepared to wait in line.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Came here twice! First time I had the French toast. This had a bunch of fresh fruits on top. The French toast was good but I had better ones. Second time I ordered the monte cristol.. So delicious! It's like a ham and cheese sandwich with French toast as the bread! Yummy! 
Although I really enjoyed my monte cristol, I will not be coming often due to the long wait. First times wait was 1hr+ and the second was 2hr+.. I"d consider ordering take out and eating it across the street at the park :)
author: Roxana L.

description:
The wait on a Sunday is 2 hours, is it worth it? To be realistic, it depends. If the line was not that long, I would come back, but I don't really think I would do it again. However, I talked to other people in the line, and this wasn't their first time coming.

If I come back, I would bring with me some snacks and coffee. There is a la boulange really close by, and many people drank coffee and ate pastries while they were waiting ( good idea! ) I decided to starve myself ( it makes food taste 10x better lol )

Food was REALLY good.  We ( party of 3)  had a Monte Cristo ( french toast with ham and cheese), salmon ( open face) omellete, bacon egg benedict, and banana nut french toast ( this taste more like banana bread). IT WAS DELICIOUS, ALL OF THEM.  The home made raspberry jam goes with everything lol. I wish i could take some home with me! 

We ate it all in 15 min! Literally.  Even the waitress was surprised haha. By the end, were were pleasantly full and satisfied.

We paid about $20 each which is not bad at all! 

Staff also deserves an A+, super friendly and attentive.
author: Mily W.

description:
Just waited 2 long hours with 2 hungry kids.  Came here for breakfast and it became lunch.

Okay.  I was deliriously hungry but... it's the best breakfast ever.

We had their eggs benedict with Dungeness crab.  Awesome!  Combo French toast.  Good  stuff.  

But the best of the meal was... The raspberry jam!  OMG.  

The kids are begging to wait another 2 hours for dinner.  Too bad they don't serve dinner.
author: Roy K.

description:
I have been dying to dine at this restaurant because of all the wonderful reviews I've read on Yelp AND I wanted to satisfy my craving for delicious breakfast food. Much to my surprise, this place met all of my expectations and so much more!

My cousin and I came to this restaurant around 12:30 PM on a Thursday, so there was no line to wait in. After placing our order, we were seated in about 15 minutes. Our food was served to us shortly after we were seated. 

I ordered the Smoked Salmon benedict and my cousin ordered the Monte Cristo. i was absolutely in love with my Smoked Salmon benedict! It came with 2 poached eggs covered with hollandaise sauce and potatoes. I was so close to ordering the eggs florentine but I saw that served a Smoke Salmon Benedict dish. love anything salmon and you can just imagine my excitement when I saw that they had a salmon dish on the menu. I also tried my cousin's Monte Cristo dish. It came with a  breast of turkey, baked ham, cheddar and havarti cheese bread dipped in egg and grilled, served with homemade jam. Not only was it delicious it was really pretty too! I took many pictures of our food.

I would definitely come back to Mama's again. Not only is the food absolutely delicious but the service is amazingly wonderful as well. The ambiance of the restaurant must be commended. I really felt like I was at home and waiting for my mother to bring out my breakfast.

Yummy!!! Definitely a very happy two thumbs up!
author: Viennelyn C.

description:
I came here years ago. YEARS. And I still think about how delicious the food was. 
When I did go, I didn't wait in a line, and I think I got there at like...1ish....
However, after reading all the Yelp reviews, I can see the secret is out because everyone talks about lines. Yeesh. 
A little scared of the prospect of waiting an hour for breakfast, but I can't let go of my love for Mama's.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Oh my goodness!! You have no idea how hard I've been trying to eat somewhere just to write a yelp review!! 

It sucks being a college kid...spaghetti and mcdonalds are the only things you can afford. -_- And maybe a costco hot dog..lol 

Anyway..I went to Mama's last year for the first time because my boyfriend's mom is an avid fan. She will wake up at 6 and get there by 7  just wait a hour before the doors open. I, on the other hand...love sleep. But it WAS completely worth it!

I've been here several times and I've learned a few things. Sunday is the busiest day! Get ready to wait in line for hours! Ouch. Saturday isn't too bad but you probably want to get there 7 30 am latest if you want to be in the first wave of people when they open at 8. 

Everything's homemade! The jam is amazing and so is the crumb cake. And all the breads for the French Toast were made that morning ! :D

There's weekend specials such as the Dungeness Crab Benedict and the Dungeness Crab Omelet. They don't skimp on the crab which is awesome but only get it if you really love crab. 

You pay before you eat and you have to wait till a table opens. It's usually not a problem if you have 2 or 3 people because service is fast but last time we had a group of 6 and we had to wait maybe 20-30 minutes before there was a table big enough to seat us. I think that's the only downfall of such a small place but the atmosphere and having a homemade breakfast is worth it!

If you're eating there for the first time. Get the French Toast Sampler or the Silver Dollar Pancakes. The sampler is made with all the breads available for French Toast so you can say you tried them all and the pancakes ARE SO FLUFFYY!!! 

My favorite is the Monte Cristo. They serve it for breakfast and it's really the best! Just a suggestion!
author: Joy L.

description: The food and service here is absolutely outstanding. The often long and torturous wait to just get in the door makes you wonder if you had any common sense , or why you took someone's advise to dine at Mommas. We visited on a weekday, but it didn't seem to matter. Suggest you wear some very comfortable shoes. But, yes, after what seems to be an endless cue, the blue skies emerge with tasty food galore. I tried the Huevos Rancheros and the wife enjoyed the French Toast sampler. When we exited at 1:45 pm, we noticed that the line had dwindled somewhat-- so that may lessen the wait. Good luck and good eating!
author: Jeff L.

description: Went on a Sunday twenty minutes before opening time. Had to wait an hour and a half, but the French toast was delicious. I had the French toast sampler and Mama's smoothie. The food was great. Long wait, but we expected that.
author: L V.

description:
When I trip into the city for a overnighter I love having a wonderul breakfast here ( and yes "Kevin" its worth the wait, maybe if you tried it you might know why?) The key is to get there early so you don't have to wait too long. We've usually stayed across the street @ The Washington Square inn for a nice weekend getaway. Its very hard to choose because as you line up to order it ALL looks so fresh and tasty! all the wonderul baked goods are on the top shelf right at nose level, and they usually have fresh crab or shrimp for the omelets. I've added a photo of the lox and bagel I had on one excursion and all the veggies ripe and tasty. Red potatoes or fresh fruit on the side have a big appetite because its all good!
(note: clean bathroom but its the size of a postage stamp, through the kitchen out the back and down a little staircase)
author: Susan D.

description:
I'm always hesitant to come here because of the line. Just when you think you're done lining up outside, there's another line in the restaurant to order! The place is small and I would consider it a tourist spot because half the people in the line are probably tourists. I've liked everything I had here so far. I recommend the french toast, monte cristo, and the crabs benedict. Must slather some of their home-made jam on whatever you can slather it onto :] 

For some reason, the french toast I had today just didn't taste quite as good as the first time I've had it here at Mama's.
author: Tina S.

description:
I have to say, I'm a little bit disappointed.

I am trying to make this experience about the food and not about the fact that we waited in line for an hour and a half, with a one-year-old approaching naptime, only to have one person ahead of us save a spot in line for twelve people, with no discouragement from the host or manager...

I got the french toast sampler and my husband got the dungenous crab benedict. The french toast is made with their bread, which is supposedly made fresh daily. The texture of my breads (banana nut, blueberry, and cranberry orange) were more like cake than bread, and I'm still trying to figure out if that texture of bread makes for good french toast. My thought is no, even though the bread was tasty.

My husband said he had better benedicts. I should also note (and forgive my pretense) that their benedict is technically a florentine because it is made with spinach on top of the bread... but I digress. He said that the hollandaise sauce was lacking in flavor, and the eggs didn't have quite the runny texture he wanted.

All in all, it is decent, humble, homey food executed fairly well with great service (unless you're working the line). But I don't think it was worth all of the time we waited. I probably wouldn't wait more than a half hour, and this is coming from a New Yorker!
author: Kimberly T.

description: This place was everything! I posted on Facebook that I was in San Francisco and my sister in law recommended this place and since she is a foodie I trusted her advice. Best decision ever! My boyfriend and I came at about 8:15 a.m. on a Tuesday (they open at 8:00) and there was already a line to get in. The place is small so I was told there is always a line when you come to this place. But let me tell you...so WORTH THE WAIT! I had the original Eggs Benedict and couldn't help myself and also purchased the banana nut french toast! DELICIOUS and definitely recommended! Just be aware that there will be a line so be prepared to wait. We waited about 45 minutes, I can just imagine at other times! :)
author: Oscar R.

description: Came here on a Friday morning from what I heard the wait was longer than usual because it was the end of New Years so we waited 2 hrs. Let me tell you it was worth the wait!!! The monte Cristo sandwich was beyond DELISH!!!! I would come back just for that! We also had the south of the boarder omelet it was good but nothing to brag about, and the orange & walnut French toast super yummy!!! Overall a must try if your in San Francisco!
author: Suzette P.

description:
There are 2000+ reviews, so what can I say?  

About the only thing I can think of is, get here early!  We stayed in the Inn across the street.  We got up at around 7.  Mama's doesn't open until 8 AM on Sunday.  We noticed, however, a line forming at about 7:10AM.  We thought, hey probably just early birds.  But the line kept growing, so we took a hint and rushed down to get in line. Good thing too.  Before they opened, the line was over two blocks long.  But the place is small.  So, to make a long story short, if you arrive at least 30 min before they open, you will get right in.  If not, your in for a long wait. 

When they open, you walk up to a counter, place your order, then find a seat.  My wife had the french toast sampler, and is still raving about it.  Apparently the "sampler" refers to the fact that they use four different breads to prepare the dish.  I had the dungeness crab omlette with havarti.  Oh man, was it good.  Coffee was stellar, and service was awesome.  The atmosphere was sublime.  

The tables are close, so you can't help striking up a conversation with neighboring tables, and by the time we were done, it felt like having a meal with old friends.  If your in the area, do yourself a favor and try this place, just get there early!

Oh, and they only take cash or ATM, and there is a 1$ charge for ATM.
author: Rob B.

description:
Loved the potatoes!
This is probably what made it a 4 star! 
We waited almost 2 hrs in line. That wait with almost amazing food kind of made it just a little disappointing, keeping it from a 5 probably. (Still great though, I don't think I would wait 2 hrs again.)
The French toast sampler was actually also really good. 
Service was great!! Friendly staff.
author: Neesheet P.

description: Waited for 2 hours to get in. But the food is indeed good (or maybe because I was TOO starving). Various choices, fast service. Good for brunch!
author: Q S.

description: One very rainy day I ended up at Mama's and for once, there was no queue, whoop whoop! I'm not a big fan of their out dated Provence-style decoration but their breakfast was ok although the toast was a bit greasy. I wouldn't queue for hours to go here though.
author: Karlijn V.

description: Easy going homey diner with a friendly staff. Breakfast was good. The variety of options my table ordered including Washington Square, crab eggs benedict, French toast sampler was all great! However, I don't think this is a wait in line 2+ hours place. I probably won't be here again only because I won't be willing to wait in line.
author: Raul M.

description: Great food and really good service. The queue is worth the food but can be a pain. We had our breakfast two times there and everything was really nice.
author: Feda M.

description: MUST TRY THE MONTE CRISTO and with homemade jam...oh my. We waited about 45 minutes and it was worth it.  San Francisco is just overflowing with brunch spots and this is one that you must try.  Beautiful location and decadent presentation.  Everything on the menu will be drool worthy but I seriously loved the monte cristo.  fried french toast bread with ham and cheese and with jam it's just a party in your mouth!
author: Christina K.

description:
The best brunch restaurant, hands down.

There's a reason why this restaurant has a wait of over 1.5 hours. I've been here a few times and the longest I've ever waited was about 2 hours. The lines are ridiculously long and I can't believe people actually wake up early in the morning to eat brunch here!

I've tried the Monte Cristo, Dungeness Crab Egg Benedict, and the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast. All are amazing!!! My favorite dish that I've tried here would probably have to be the dungeness crab egg benedict. I just love their poached eggs and how the yolk oozes out onto the dungeness crab. The muffin under the poached eggs are so good too! The Monte Cristo is one of their signature dishes, so you have to try it once here! The chocolate cinnamon french toast is also very delicious, topped with fresh fruits and a side of maple syrup. It can get very sweet, but good nonetheless.

Parking can be a hassle since there's not a lot of parking in North Beach.

You have to try Mama's at least once in San Francisco. You will not be disappointed.
author: Vivian L.

description: Over-hyped. Wait was too long. We ordered omelets and Ihop could have sufficed for the taste. I want to know why a couple was walked right to the front of the line and sat down and their order taken from the table when everyone else had to do the 2 hour wait plus another 30 minutes or so at the table for the food to arrive. Never going back and never recommending it to anyone. For being so busy they would take 5 minutes to bus a table, let 5 minutes go between taking orders.
author: Desiree A.

description: Was placed on hold for 10 mins, no one took my order. Called back 3 hours later, to go order takes 25 minutes. I was able to order to go in the past, and it took way less than 25 mins.
author: linda L.

description: Def a can't miss while in SF. Amazing breakfast food. We got three meals and split it between two so we could try the French toast. Amazing!!
author: Andrew M.

description:
The food is absolutely amazing, but I can't justify the 2 hour wait in line. We split a slice of carrot cake while we were waiting for our food and it was incredible. (We were starving!) The Monte-Cristo I had was to die for. 
The servers were very friendly despite always having to deal with a crazy rush from open to close. I would give this place 5 stars, but the wait is terrible and there's only one extremely tiny bathroom. It's definitely worth the wait at least once, but I don't think I would want to come back.
author: Ashley S.

description: Expect to wait for 1.5 hours, outside. Shade is limited while waiting. There are probably 10-12 tables.. Once you make it in the door you wait in another small line to order and pay and then you're seated once a table opens up. The staff is friendly and like to tease. Their old fashioned crumb cake was miraculous. The apple crumb cake was good but we liked the old fashioned better. Their orange juice is amazing. Also had the berry smoothie and it was good, not amazing. We ordered 2 meals. #6 special which was a sandwich- honey baked ham, fried egg, Gruyere cheese, arugula with aioli on a brioche bun with house potatoes. My husband gives this sandwich 5 stars. I ordered the French toast sampler, also a special. The cinnamon French toast ended up being our favorite compared to the banana bread and cran Orange French bread. It was served with strawberries and bananas on top and syrup on the side. It was delicious. We give our meals, the service and the ambiance 5 stars. The wait, in the sun knocked out overall rating to 4 stars. This is a place that we are glad that we can say that we have tried!
author: Brett S.

description: Great food and great prices but really not worth the wait. The line wraps the building and also you have to wait inside. Yummy though and moderate prices make it so popular.
author: Keith C.

description:
The food was really good, but I'm honestly not sure if it justified a two hour wait. I would NOT recommend going on a Sunday afternoon. If you can, go in pairs, because it seems easier to seat. If you're planning to go in a big group, good luck.

I one of the sandwiches, which tastes pretty good. I would recommend one of the omelets (especially the salmon one) because that's what my cousin got. And it was really good.

This place is good if you're looking for an experience of quality ingredients and a family atmosphere.
author: Shirley Z.

description:
To quote a friend of mine,  "I LOVE the food but I HATE the line." Yes the line is gawd awful indeed. 45 minute wait is an eternity for a traveler on a time crunch. So many places to go in so little time is it worth it? Yes, if you have good company. Once you finally reach the inside, the wait is not over, you get to watch a 15 minute show of a tiny kitchen dishing out solid American breakfasts to a tiny arena of culinary die-hards. The worst torture is that by the time you're ready to order, everything on the menu look so good you want to order $50 worth of food that you can't even stomach. In the end, just look at the picture of Mama shaking hands with James Beard and you know what the hoopla is all about. 

Yay! I'm a fan.
author: My T.

description:
It's 5 stars if the weather is nice and you have time to kill and someone to talk to when waiting on line for half an hour. 

And don't try to beat the system by settling for take-out if it's a weekend (we wanted to kill the wait and take some to-go to enjoy at Washington Square Park).

2 of us shared a fruit blasted pancake. Table jam yummy. Waiters friendly.

However, do try to go to the bathroom someplace else.
author: Eva G.

description: Be prepared to wait in line for at least 45 minutes. People are just so crazy about this place! Got the  famous monte cristo, and it was AMAZIng!, the cheese inside melted the moment you bite on your sandwich. Also got the chocolate crumb cake and pancakes, they were just average. wouldnt give it a two thumbs up! But it was definitely worth the wait though.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Anything you order here is going to taste delicious, but the best I've eaten here was the French toast.  It was made with a slice of freshly-baked banana nut bread and another with cranberry bread. Plan to come on a morning when you are in no rush to be anywhere because you will be standing in a long line.

*Good*
- French Toast
- Eggs Benedict
- Everything is freshly made

Bad
- Long wait time
- Crowded
author: AandE D.

description: I ordered Dungeness crab Benedict and it was epic, but the staff were not welcoming and were not smiling.
author: Jamil A.

description:
Been living here for all 20 years of my life and haven't even tried the most famous breakfast/brunch place in San Francisco. My Mama's virginity was taken away today. Wait, that came out wrong. Anywhooo.....the wait is so fucdfsidofjsoidfijing ridiculous. Stood in line for 2 hours on a freakin' weekday, like who works anymore right? Or maybe these people take entire days off for a nice brunch.

The Monte Cristo with the homemade jam (seemed like boysenberry) was a nice combination of sweet and salty to go with the foolproof egginess of a classic french toast. Unlike anything I've ever tried, that dish itself deserves 5 stars for originality, 3.5 stars for taste.

The North Beach (eggs benedict with prosciutto and grilled tomatoes) was one component short of amazing, and this is what really prevents Mama's from getting that last star. THE POACHED EGGS WERE ALMOST COMPLETELY OVERCOOKED. Poked into them expecting perfectly runny yolks given that this place specializes in breakfast, but sadly, it was almost completely solid. Luckily I'm not the type to completely be turned off by a dish when one thing goes wrong, so overall it still tasted amazing given that nice smokiness of the prosciutto and perfectly grilled tomatoes.

So was it worth the wait? It honestly depends on how much you enjoy a nice brunch. For me, I'd much rather wait that long for dim sum.


TL;DR
One of the best brunches in SF if you're willing to stand in line for 1-2 hours EVEN ON A WEEKDAY.
author: Vincent C.

description:
Crab Benedict or omelette?

Ughhh lines out the door for this place :( Came here for breakfast and was disappointed because I wanted to try the monte cristo but they only had it for lunch BOO! Oh well ended up getting the crab benedict which was super yummy. The lines and wait time are just too crazy so I wouldn't come here especially since it is standard breakfast fare to be honest.

Would only go with one other person to maybe minimize the wait time and if I really wanted breakfast and was in the neighborhood.
author: Christine W.

description:
Wait was an hour and half and I got there around 9:30. I really really want to say this place blew me out of the water but it didn't. I ordered the crab eggs benedict. It was good... but I didn't leave the restaurant thinking ermahgahd best food evaaaaa. 

Basically what I'm saying is come here during a weekday when your wait is minimal or trick one of your friends to go and wait in line for you and show up an hour later. Great to come here at least once, but I'd suggest another place for your weekly brunch dates.
author: Crystal M.

description:
REALLY REALLY want to give this place 4 stars....BUT....it really wasn't THAT good :/

I got the Crab Benedict and a small side of fruit. With tip I spent $26? Hefty sum for one person at breakfast. The english muffin was kinda soggy- didn't eat most of it. Fruit was not very good- some pieces were mealy and mushy. The crab though was delicious and the star of the show.

Line was super long- got there on Sunday at 8am. Best thing about Mama's was spending time with my friends and chatting in the cute restaurant. 

3.5 stars.
author: Angela D.

description:
The food isn't amazing, and we were lucky enough to not wait in the massive line.
That being said, I don't think this place is about the food. Or the hype. I think it's about that massive line, with your friends/loved ones, catching up and laughing and eating some decent breakfast food at a SF institution. 
And that's why it gets 5 stars. 
It isn't everyday that you find a restaurant that creates an atmosphere like this place does.
author: Crystal Z.

description: Mama's is worth the wait. Get there early as the line just continues to grow and grow. I had the crab cake benedict and it was outstanding.
author: JP B.

description:
Mama...you know I love you....I don't know why but whenever I think of this restaurant I am reminded of the Boyz II Men song "mama", a little walk down memory lane for those of you who are old enough to remember that song. 

So finally after living in the city for 1.5 years, we decided to brave our way to Mama's on the morning of new year's eve. My brothers were in town from (sd & la) and one of them really wanted to try this place since he had heard such great things about it from his coworker and wanted a taste for himself. 

5 of us hopped our way over to North Beach where parking is usually treacherous but we were able to find parking 3 blocks down. 

Tips for Mama's: 
*Expect a wait. 1.5 hours to be exact.. If you're terribly hungry or have no patience forget about it, (unless you come during odd hours). The line did seem shorter as we left the place after we finished brunch around 2pm. Mama's is open till 3pm. 

*This place is small and basically is first come first serve. You inch through the line at a snail's pace. Luckily when you get in you can order your food and pay for it before you are seated at a table. 

*What to order: french toast sampler was pretty tasty for those who want something sweet but our favorite was the dungeness crab omelet and the mama's fried egg with sausage (it's one of the specials can't remember the name). The crab omelet is pricey at $18.50 as was the dungeness crab benedict (lots of yummy crab but ultimately a little heavy). 

*Service was surprisingly good! Our waiter was very friendly and recommended the jam over the french toast. 

*Bathroom-teeny tiny. First you walk through the kitchen then outside, walk down a small flight of stairs and you have made it to your way to an outhouse with plumbing! It's actually charming inside but I wouldn't recommend it if you didn't have to. 

Would I wait 1.5 hours for brunch here again? Probably not. Did I enjoy my experience here? Thoroughly =)
author: Betty C.

description:
Cash only. Hyped up, long waits, decent food

Yo have to stay there and wait in line, no choice to give your name and come back. I got there in a group of 3 at 11:30am on a Friday and by the time we got to sit down and get our food it was 1:30pm. There is an additional wait to be seated once you go inside. The food is very tasty but if you are even slightly health conscious you're not gonna like it: everything is drenched in oil. 

I recommend going there if you've got a few hours to kill and are in a small group. Have cash or debit. No credit cards
author: Ryan P.

description: So far I have been waiting in line for 2 hours and spent 6$ on a parking meter . The closer I get to the door the better it smells! The staff is super friendly and cashier wasn't very helpful but servers are great. The food is amazing!  The pancakes alone are worth the 2 hour wait. I have never had pancakes this flavor full!  The Monte Cristo is tasty and I will be back soon to try more of their menu . Long wait is worth it for food this delicious!  Num Num
author: jeremy S.

description: There is over an hour wait on weekends which I think is what trick most of the people. What they have is a really average food.
author: Omid A.

description:
at long last, i finally got to eat at Mama's. This has been in my bookmarks forever! I heard such great things about this place and i have been dying to try it. I was in the area running errands and I jokingly said to my bf - hey let's try Mama's! Didn't know he'd agree and we decided to drive by to see how long the wait was... When we drove by and saw that line we were like O.O ohhellnaaa (1.5-2 hr wait) Don't get me wrong i was STARVING at this point. So we decided to eat in Chinatown....but nothing sounded appealing after the thought of Mama's. So we ended up driving back and the said the wait was about 1- 1.5 hours. SO we waited in line -_____- for what felt like forever but really was about an hour so not too bad. 

I already knew what i wanted. I had been dying to try to Monte Cristo. I was conflicted btwn that and a Benedict because i loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeee Benedicts.. but i knew my bf was going to get a Benedict so Monte Cristo it was! And when it came ... it was so beautiful. How I wished there were more than 4 triangles on the plate. Best choice ever. I had Monte Cristo before at another brunch place but this one does not compare. Their homemade jam definitely added some sweet kick to the sandwich. I'm no cheddar cheese fan and the sandwich had just the perfect amount -not too much but not too little. Words can't really describe how great this sandwich was. If there is another place that makes a better Monte Cristo than Mama's someone better tell me. I also tried my bf's Benedict - i don't remember the name but it had bacon. Not bad - but not really worth that wait time. He also enjoyed my sandwich. I quote - "it's flavorful" (he's a man of little words)

Aside from the yummy food, they also provide excellent customer service. Everyone is super friendly and accommodating. They didn't look annoyed or anything despite the chaos happening inside and outside their restaurant. Love it. I feel like customer services makes your food taste a little better (not sure why). Parking in this area? it's just as bad as the wait for this restaurant. We were a little late for bunch -it was already lunch so parking wasn't as bad for us but if you know this area...you know its baddddddd OH and its basically cash only. They accept debit cards with a $1 surcharge - just a heads up for those who don't like extra charges for no reason there are plenty of banks around the area so don't fret! Oh! and when you leave.. make sure you get a Monte Cristo togo ;)
author: Kristina L.

description:
"With 4 stars after a thousand something reviews, this place must be pretty damn good," I thought.
And yes, it was pretty damn good. 

My boyfriend and I came here twice- once around 2 on a Tuesday and another time around 1 on a Wednesday. There was a short line both times, but after ordering, we didn't have to wait too long to get a table. I had yelped this place beforehand to see what to order, so we had the popular Monte Cristo, Crab Benedict, and French Toast Sampler. 

Before I thought that the food might be really heavy and rich from the pictures I saw on Yelp, but it was actually pretty light. The Monte Cristo was so soft and fluffy, and eating jam with it made it such a nice sweet and salty combination. I didn't think ham and cheese sandwiches could be so tasty!

The Crab Benedict- fluffy, soft bread. Delicious, juicy crab meat. Poached egg on top. Delicious!

French Toast Sampler- Personally, I only liked the Banana Nut flavored french toast. The blueberry and regular one (cinnamon, I think?) were okay. Lots of yummy fruits on top though, plus syrup and jam on the side. 

We also had the dollar pancakes the second time we went. Jeebus those little pancakes are good. Super warm and fluffy...topped with fresh fruit and syrup on the side. I liked this more than the french toast sampler.

Another thing we had the second time was an omelet special that had crab, avocado, tomato and cheese, if I remember correctly. It was perfectly fluffy and bursting with flavor. 

I'm glad I went to see what the hype was all about. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Wendy L.

description:
#amazeballs

Dungeness Crab Benedict (only on weekends) - $20! but you definitely get a good amount of crab, but I'd spring to get something else next time. This does not take away from the fact that it was mouthwateringly delicious. The crab and spinach pairing works well.

French Toast Sampler - 3 different kinds (banana, cinnamon, orange walnut) with fresh berries on top. For a guy that doesn't have a sweet tooth - this sampler was the bomb. 

Carrot (apple) cake - We got this to go and it was so delicious. SO moist and I think the secret is adding some bits of apple to the cake mixture. Of course, frosting was on point.

We came here at 7:30am on a Sunday morning and waited an hour to get through the line. I'm not going to linger on the wait, but yes it sucks. A lot. Putting the wait aside, this is definitely one of the best brunch places in North Beach. I would not take it as far as the best brunch place in SF, but it's up there. I'll be back for one of those M'omlettes!
author: Brian L.

description:
It was good but not worth
The line. I've run into this in the city before. Big line average quality
Of food. Maybe it's a lack of
Options??
author: Ryan D.

description:
One of these places that want people to wait for them so they look hype...

Even with 1.5 hour long line they would keep 3-4 empty tables inside.

If you want to take to-go you will still have to wait in the same line as if you wanted to get a table

Manager incredibly rude

There are definitely lots of other better places on SF
author: Ckara D.

description:
45 mins wait well worth the amazing egg-white fresh crab omelette.  Hands down the best omelette I've ever had! Heads up only order if your splurging cuz the omelette is $22.  

The French toast were average but the coffee was great! 

It's all about the experience!
author: Salim G.

description: The way to do it is order to go and eat breakfast in Washington square park. Much nicer setting and avoid the silly lines. The food is great and the park is always sunny.
author: Diane R.

description: The wait times here are so ridiculous (2 hours on a Tuesday at 9am.. Had to knock a star off for that). But the food is so worth the wait. It's always a good sign if there's a line out the door, right? I forgot what my fiancé ordered. He seemed to love it though. I was too focused on devouring my monte cristo sandwich.. It was the best monte cristo I've ever had! Good service too :)
author: Krizia M.

description:
After a night of partying and destruction of our livers - we were notified that SF currently has "sunny" weather ( this was at 11am Sunday) . We immediately rushed to get ready ( and by immediately i mean after two hours of further napping )  and jump in  our car , picked up our friends and bounced to the city..... 

To our dismay, by the time we reached the bay bridge (2pm) the sky had turned dark and gloomy and then came the thunder and rain... BOO!

after a struggle to find some parking and fighting with the wind and rain we finally managed to reach the outside of Mama's. Thinking that this is the end, i reached for the door - only to to be greeted by a waiter\bouncer dude who asked us to go to the back of the line.... what line - u ask?  ... the line which snakes all the way around the wall and back. 

Looked like people came prepared to wait in line - with big umbrellas ... this little kid had his nintendo and a lawn chair!!  with a umbrella - genius!

but for us it was standing in rain for 30 mins and lots of random chatter about segway  tours , uggs for men versus women, the grenades we saw at the club last night etc.... 

finally , we got our chance and we stroll in - had to order first so i jumped on the Northwest MOMlette!  with smoked salmon and leeks - sounded awesome..(and was!)  my finace for the california (cause she is a california girl!) , our friends got pretty much the same expect one who ordered tea.. (you know who you are! - side story but basically she was a little upset cause they handed her a tea bag and she wanted it to be prepared by the chefs haha)

The food came promptly and the waitress\service was very nice. All of our food awesomely good!  (check the pics) also, we ordered some hot chocolate which definitely made me think of my MAMA - so the name sticks.

There are like 4 other items i wanna try so we are definitely coming back yo!    (with a lawn chair and attached umbrella :)
author: Jay G.

description: Don't get me wrong, Mama's food is solid but it's not freak-out worthy. On a Saturday we waited in line for THREE HOURS. At one point, a car drove by and a guy leaned out and shouted "Not worth it!!!"... Turns out he was right. It's a shame because Mama's is located really close to where I live and it would be a convenient option if there was no wait, but the wait times are outrageous. Perhaps they should take reservations but otherwise I won't be coming back. The food is good, but it's not that good. It's  very pricey depending on what you get. Also, I don't recommend the bloody mary. It's made with soju and it's not very tasty. Benedict WAS good though :)
author: Anna J.

description: I always wondered what the line was always about when I drive past Washington Square. It turns out to be a line to order and eat a restaurant. Seeing the long line outside made me want to give Mama's a try at least one since I have never ate here before even though I am a native San Franciscan. Got here on a Saturday morning at 10AM where it took about two hours to get inside the actual door to order. So I decided to get the Washington Square Omelette which consisted Sausages, Bell Pepper, Lumberjack Cheese, and Tomatoes served with Sourdough Bread and a side if Grilled Potatoes. The Omelette was the bomb, it was super delicious and was cooked to the right fluffy texture. To top it off, I chose their Sourdough Bread which went well with their homemade jam on the table. Their Grilled Potatoes were seasoned very well also very crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Overall a good place to eat but the wait to get inside to order was ridiculously long as it is a very small restaurant. Would return later to try other items on their menu when I have the time to line up again.
author: Peter C.

description: I'm from Houston but every year I travel to SF to see my favorite team The 49ers play a home game.  I'm normally in town for 4-5days and I eat here at least 3 times.  This is my favorite breakfast restaurant hands down!  If you don't get here early you'll be in line for at least 45mins, but it's well worth the wait.  The staff is great and always helpful to newbies.
author: Jeff M.

description: Went here on a Wednesday morning. Thought the line would be shorter than on the weekend but apparently still at least an hour wait on the weekday. My hypothesis is that they make you wait so that you're so hungry, any food will taste good. Their food was decent but I wouldn't wait an hour again. Overloaded with sugar. Price was decent though. I wanted to get the Monte Cristo - I don't eat pork so I asked if they could exclude it or substitute something else. They said they refuse to make any changed to the items on their menu (what if someone is allergic??). I got the French toast sampler and boyfriend got monte cristo. Everything is just filled with sugar to make it taste good - even the things meant to be savory.
author: Japna S.

description:
I am giving this place 1 star for the following story. This place could use some 1-stars anyway.

We finally got into the actual building to wait in another line which didn't take as long. It's just a line to get to the register and pay. We ordered our goods and we were directed towards an empty table. We got to an area where there were 2 empty tables. One table was in direct sunlight and by the entrance. The other table was neither of these. So naturally, we were interested in the better located table. We inquired to the waitress if it was alright if we sit in the better table and she firmly said "NO" without even looking at us. She didn't even say sorry and made sure to give some attitude.
This set a low mood for the rest of the dining experience. Furthermore, after a couple minutes, we think that she even knew she was being rude and she said aloud, towards us, "it'll just be another Yelp review," implying that she knows we'll write something about her. So apparently she knows she is a terrible person and doesn't care. She is in customer service so her life depends on being nice to people. We didn't give any tip because she didn't deserve it. She is probably very unhappy with her job and doesn't make any money and has to take it out on other people. I would be mad too if I made crap money for the rest of my life. Who knows. Either way, she is a terrible person. She said her name is Kim. I hope that you don't get served by her because you might die of rudeness that will ruin your day.

Anyway... You can easily see what to order here from the thousands of other reviews.
All I am going to say is that this joint is overrated for sure.
Don't waste your time waiting more than 1 hour in line--come at a non-busy time if you absolutely must come here.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Mama's is one of those places that really hyped so expect long lines. If you're like me than the hanger will make an appearance and it might make you want to leave the line and go somewhere else. Overall I'd say Mama's is good. The food is good, service is good, and the restaurant has a cute vibe. I tried really hard to not let the hanger impact my opinion on this review. 

First off the line is not a joke. We waited on line for 2 hours! We went for Sunday brunch so obviously that's prime time. They open at 8 am and I hear that people will line up as early as 7am to avoid the ridiculous line. We arrived at 8:30 and had to wait 2 hours so I'd recommend arriving well before they open to trim down your wait time.

The food is good. We ordered the monte crito (one of their most frequently ordered items), the northern m'omlette, and the french toast sampler. No complaints here. The food is very homey and delicious. Will it blow your mind? Probably not but it's definitely a solid meal. You can tell a lot of thought goes into the menu, and they make their own jam in house. A couple interesting things on the menu too.

The service is really good. They do a good job of keeping the people waiting on the line hydrated and will take your drink orders while you wait. Once you get inside the restaurant you have to wait on a shorter line and this is where the manager (?) will talk to you about the specials of the day and really give you an indepth overview of the menu and answer any questions you might have. This was probably my favorite part of my experience.

The restaurant seats about 35 people so it's small but not overly cramped. Overall, I thought Mama's provided good food, and great service. I would absolutely not wait another 2 hours now that I've had the food. I think you'll have a good meal too if you come here, you just have to weigh the cost benefit of the line before doing so. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description:
One of my all-time favorite brunch spots in SF bay... and apparently everyone else's. They have a solid menu... everything is good! Just expect to wait at least an hour to be seated, and allow time to GET hungry instead of coming hungry :)

The staff is nice, albeit hurried. I love the atmosphere (down home comfy cozy) and their menu... I just wish Mama's was bigger!
author: Jo C.

description: We waited an hour and twenty minutes on line and it was not worth it. The fresh orange juice was good. The French toast sampler used breads not really good in texture for French toast and it was barely warm.  My wife had the Dungeness crab Benedict which she enjoyed.
author: Robin T.

description: Came from Hawaii and waited awhile to get in but I have to say the wait wasn't so bad! Meet couple of dogs that were oh so friendly and also the people that we got to talk story too were amazing. Now of course for the food we did the monte crisco, crab benedict and the "adult" lemonade all which were very yummy! It is definitely worth it at least once.
author: Amy R.

description:
After failing to make it here a previous time, I was dying to finally try it out.  I got to SF at 10 AM (my earliest brunch ever...) and had about a 45 minute wait.  The line moves pretty quickly and its surprising how fast the customer turnaround is. 

I have to say, the hype over Mama's kind of ruined it for me.  Everything was good and delicious, but I expected OUT OF THIS WORLD based on the line for this place.  I decided to order both the dungeness crab eggs benedict and french toast sampler b/c I'm a greedy eater.  I appreciated the chunky pieces of crab, but the eggs benedict weren't cooked perfectly...they were a little too overdone & not runny enough.  The french toast sampler was okay..my favorite by far was the cranberry one (the apple had too much cinnamon & sugar).  I also ordered the northern italian omelette, which I enjoyed but it also didn't rock my socks.  

I'm glad to have finally tried this place for myself, but definitely wouldn't wait in line to go back.  It's close to coit tower, so I'd recommend taking a nice after-brunch stroll to get a good view of the city!
author: Chinh T.

description:
This is a definite 4 star restaurant. There's ALWAYS a line rain or shine and this Thursday morning was definitely no exception. 45 minutes for a party of two and of course, I had to run across the street to nosh on some focaccia as I waited. I could hear from the conversations that most of the people in line were locals so I could only imagine what the line would be like on the weekends...(shudder.)

So after a 45 minute wait in the sunshine, my sister and I were finally called up to the coveted spot at the front doors to await the line to finally order food. Luckily, they post their specials on the window adjacent to said door and much like the ritual at the "Soup Nazi's", one should have their order ready and cash out. By the way, this place does NOT take credit cards in case you didn't notice but they will accept ATM debit cards with a slight fee. 

We decided on the french toast sampler with fresh fruit and the Northern Italian with two cups of coffee. Mama's also serves fresh juices and mimosas with orange and grapefruit juice but I reserve alcohol for special occasions so I declined this time. The best part about standing in line forever is the line for the cash register. You're just a mere 6 inches from the actual kitchen and the scent of batter, fresh cake, muffins and sourdough tempt and lure you. Mmmm...I love breakfast.

After ordering and paying (about $30) we were sat at a little 2 top table facing the kitchen and patiently waited for coffee. There's only about 2 servers for the entire dining room so I am forgiving about 4 minutes for a cup of coffee and I take it with a grain of salt. The food arrives hot and gorgeous promptly and it makes up for the almost now hour wait. 

The french toast is made with cranberry-orange, banana, and cinnamon swirl loaf bread. All of this is topped off with strawberries, blueberries and half of a banana and lightly dusted off with powdered sugar. This entire concoction is sweet enough with just the sugar and fruit that you don't need the maple syrup taking up space on the plate. I honestly couldn't remember how my sister's omelette tasted but it must have been good considering how most of it was finished.

A word of warning if you're coming to Mama's to have a nice meal and conversation with a friend: the tables are cramped and you will have no privacy. There is no such thing as "can I have a window seat" or "could we have a booth." Nuh uh. Forget about it. I was within inches of the couples to my left and right and apparently, whatever I was saying offended them enough to stop them in mid-conversation. Don't even ask what I said 'cause I won't tell you but I learned a valuable lesson that day: people eavesdrop.
author: Jessica K.

description: Yes you might wait 45 minutes-1.5 hours to be seated, but it is totally worth it. Be in line when they open at 8 or go around 1 to avoid the biggest crowds.
author: Drew S.

description:
It's NOT worth the wait!  Not, not, not!

There, I said it, and I feel better about life.

However, it is a really good breakfast place.  The wife and kid and I stood online for maybe an hour.  Then we got in, and could watch while others ate.  Then we finally got to sit down and order.  The service was brisk but very friendly.  The food came quickly (gotta keep that line moving!).  And it was very tasty! We had pancakes, eggs, hash browns  and it was all delicious. But it wasn't ohmygodyouhavetoeathere delicious.  If there was no line, I'd eat there all the time, with that line, I might never come back.  There are other good places without lines. (Try Pat's Cafe nearby on Taylor Street.)
author: Carl S.

description:
Not worth the 2 hour wait on a thursday morning 
had a monte christo it. Was okay i reccomend the take out menu so you dont wait that long line
author: Green B.

description:
We came here for brunch last Saturday, expecting the weather to be grand yet the weather was fairly gloomy and the line.. well. The line was long! We waited about an hour, give or take a few minutes, but it was worth it! To be honest, my girlfriend wanted to surprise me so I actually had no idea where we were going or what the place served. Based on a few recommendations, we decided to order 3 things because we couldn't decide what we wanted to eat more! Man the menu items looked so.. so.. tantalizing! Okay, on with the food.

1. Washington Square Omelette. - It was basically your standard omelette with italian sausages, tomato, bell peppers, and pepper jack cheese sprinkled with some garnish. Nothing outrageously special here.. except that it was cooked to perfection! Woo!

2. French Toast Sampler (French toast made out of Swedish Cinnamon bread, Cranberry Orange Walnut bread, and Banana Nut bread) -  Although personally the swedish cinnamon wasn't particularly a favorite of ours and cranberry orange walnut wasn't too strong, the banana nut bread just hit the spot!  It was amazing! None of these are overly sweet, and the french toast is topped off with fresh fruits with maple syrup that is subtly and perfectly sweet and complements the sweetness of the berries and toast very well.  I would strongly recommend getting just the banana nut french toast rather than the sampler, but of course, if you wanna try the various types of french toast they have here, be my guest.

3. Monte Cristo - Golly, the thing everyone seems to talk about, and rightfully so! It's QUITE delectable and so rich and cheesy, I'm craving some right now as I'm writing this review! I don't want to spoil any more, but it's too amazing not to talk about it.  It looks like a boring, fat piece of french toast.  But inside.. seriously.. The perfect combination of turkey, ham, and melted gooey cheddar between two slices of bread with a subtle cheese taste. Once you top it off with their homemade jam, everything just melts in your mouth.

Some ending thoughts: Their homemade jam is absolutely great! I think they sell em too but I forget. I'll be back there soon enough so I'll find out then. Lines are long, especially so with the chilly weather, but summer's coming up soon so that's not a concern woo!.. hopefully. It took us a while to get seated but I think that was simply us being unlucky and some seating arrangements going wrong. Not a huge problem anyway. Restaurant is small, which makes this place really cute, homey, and comfortable.  The decor is nice; overall this place is very quaint.  Portion size is BIG so prepare to get stuffed! The 3 items we ate (sharing everything) had us full for the entire day, even going into dinnertime! Looking forward to coming here again, most definitely!
author: Hanyong C.

description: Horrible service & wait for decent food. Nothing wrong with waiters just the PMS'ing 3rd Generation Asian female working the cash register. I just waited over an hour for your OK nothing too special food, would it hurt to smile? or maybe give us some acknowledgement? If you opened in LA (where I'm from and was passing through SF for 2 days), you'd be run out of business from the finer establishments around here...
author: Jake X.

description:
Worth the wait.

The food is great tasting, classic comfort style breakfast.  if the line is not too long it's definitely worth the wait.  I'd recommend getting there around 1 as the line slims down the closer it gets to 3.  I would advise against large groups. 2-4 is about the right size for this place.  The service is friendly and inviting.  You get the real sense of family here.  The service, the food, the ambiance, is like you're at grandmas and she won't let you leave hungry.
author: Eric L.

description:
1.5 hour wait. But we did it. You see the line stretching out and instantly know where to go. We loved our food and I wish my stomach had been bigger to eat more. We got the sampler french toast, the monte cristo, and a blueberry crumble to take home for later. (That crumble still tasted good even the next night, 36 hours later!)

We made friends with the people behind us and the wait isn't so bad (just be prepared for it, and don't show up hungry). The staff is nice and definitely good at getting you a table, your food, and anything else you need while there.

Don't forget to leave a tip before you leave (you pay at the counter when you order, and then sit, so it's easy for some people to forget because there is no check coming out to you).
author: Aly M.

description:
WARNING: we parked a block away.. Greenwich and grant and our car window was smashed+belongings were stolen while we were at breakfast. Just a FYI to be careful. 

We got there around 7:30 am and we entered the building around 8:15. Food was decent but not he best breakfast in the world. My husband got an omelette+potatoes and I got eggs Benedict over potatoes. Silly that you can't customize your own omelette. Moderately priced with average servings. The food was good but I wouldn't wait 2 hours for it.
author: Christie W.

description:
Wow, that was a damn good brekkie!  I wish my Mama cooked like this! 

I thought I might experience the second coming of Christ as I waited in that horrendous line (-1 star), but at least the sun was out and we were able to get a walk in for the pooch as we cued.

I had a fresh-squeezed OJ, a piece of original crumb cake, the Eggs Blackstone plate, and we split an order of Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast (No, portion control did not exist for this meal, but hey!  Don't judge.  I will probably never wait 90 minutes for this food again).  It was all really good!  And they have their recipes down to a delectable science.  They actually put their own neat spin on everything, so it all tasted like a new take on everyday fare.  My fave was that crumb cake: even Paula Deen would use less butter and sugar than Mama did.

Put this breakfast destination on your bucket list; it's a one-time must-try!
author: Brendan S.

description: It is better for people to come and eat here on weekdays,  weekend is really buay here and you may need to wait up to 2hr to get one meal. But the omelette here is really good and the flavor is various.
author: Chloe C.

description:
Amazing brunch restaurant in SF that will make you wait no matter what day you come. Right after I got off the plane from NYC around 11AM, we came here at around 12:30PM. The line was a lot shorter than that on the weekend but we still waited for about 15 minutes. 

Everything on the menu looks amazing and I ended up getting their Momlettes - with spicy sausage, peppers, Monterey jack cheese with wheat toast and home fries. It is a big plate and I couldn't even finish mine. My cousin got the corn beef with egg benedict and it was really tasty too.

You have to try their homemade jam; it is savory and sweet. 

Overall, I am glad I got in here without too much wait and food definitely impresses me. Will I wait more than 1hr for it? It is a No.
author: Athena C.

description:
I've been here a couple times now and it seems they don't really do anything wrong. 

Though they always have a long line, it moves along pretty quickly. They have do many options so by waiting in line you have time to decide what you want and choose again cause you'll definitely find something else you want to try! I changed my mind about three times while waiting to order, it's hard to make up your mind!

Oh and before I forget to mention how darn cute this place is, let me say it right now. It's right across from a little lawn/park area which was teeming with people, jus nice to be in a nice and lively place in SF. Also on the block with Mama's is a catholic church, in fact a friend told me it's the church were Marilyn Monroe was hitched... well her first wedding. Okay, so Mama's has great locale, but the inside is super adorable too! They're very charming and they have great hospitality. Really makes you feel at home.

This time I visited I got the Washington Square with egg whites and a small glass of fresh squeezed OJ. Ok, their OJ is really from the fruit and you can definitely taste it! You gotta try it! Their omelette was so yummy! It was packed with veggies and meat! Definitely filling for a day full of walking in SF. It's served with a side of toast, my choice was sourdough. Why not when you're in SF?!?!? It was delicious with their house made jam. 

Mama's hit on the mark for me! I'm excited to keep trying new things here, she definitely doesn't let you down!!!
author: Navjot K.

description: I love Mama's. Be ready to wait if you're going on a weekend....oh, but it's so worth it. My fav's, Pan Dore and of course the fabulous Monte Cristo!  If you haven't eaten at Mama's you haven't eaten a breakfast worth waiting in line for 3 hours. Just saying.
author: Sylvia C.

description:
All I can say is, "!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"

Yeah, amazing stuff. Screw all the people who drive by and yell out, "It's not worth the wait!" to the plethora of people waiting in line. IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. Besides, I bet they yell that out so people will leave and then they can take their place in line.
author: Shannon G.

description: Yummy, nothing to complain about. Good choices for breakfast. Only the long wait and parking in north beach is a little annoying. So plan ahead and bring some time.
author: Caroline K.

description:
On a beautiful sunday afternoon, my bf and I decided to go to Coit Tower. On our way there, we decided to stop by Mama's and put our name down. We got there around 1:45pm and we sat down by 2:45. 15 minutes before closing time!

We got the Monte Cristo and the French Toast Sampler.The monte Cristo is definitely something that makes Mama's unique. I would definitley recommend getting it if you are wiling to wait in the long line at a restaurant that only has 9 tables.
author: Sophie S.

description:
In terms of breakfast it was very good. Now if you had to base the mail on people waiting outside to eat rather than stars i would probably rate it a 5 group wait. We were on a 10 group wait (45mins) and when you're in SF and its chilly outside it can be a real test of nerves.

As for the food we went all out for the French Toast sampler, dollar pancakes, cornbeef hash and lots of eggs. I wanted to get the Monte Cristo but its made with a yellow cheese and i only like mine made with white cheeses and they don't take requests for those as i guess the pre-make them. I didn't realy care for the banana nut bread french toast, but everything else tasted great.
author: Johnny C.

description: Although this is a huge tourist trap, as a local SF person - I must admit I still really appreciate the high quality of their omelets and eggs benedicts.  If you can wake up early enough, the only way to go, is get there at 7:30am, and try to get into the first seating or else you'll be waiting for a very looooong time.  Although worth the wait.
author: Edgar C.

description:
I had the Pan Dore. I don't really like french toast or sweet breakfast for that matter, but it was amazing! Perfect combo of sweet and sour. The sausage was just as good.
However, the wait is just ridiculous. And while the food was amazing, I can't think of anything that is worth waiting 90 minutes for.
And to the group with their kids who hogged a table for the full 90 minutes we were in line, the whole time we ate, and for who knows how long after long we left... you suck. Your kids were cute to look at, but they weren't that cute.
author: Alissa M.

description: The Monte Cristo sandwich is delightful! I've been coming here and getting it since 2003 and it's just as good as I remember it being every time. The staff is friendly and they remember me when I come into town. The wait is 1-2 hours long, but I bring a friend and enjoy our time catching up. This is by far my favorite breakfast of all time!
author: Mandy D.

description:
So after years and years of passing by Mama's when I'm around Chinatown, my friend and I finally decided to try it. You know...see what's the whole hype is about. Is it really that good that nobody minds waiting in line for? 

Anyways, we got in line. And as everybody has already stated, the wait can be a drag. And let me tell you what, the wait is more than just a drag. It's like sitting in a three hour night class on a Friday night while all your friends are out at Chucky Cheese having fun. That's exactly how I felt while standing there in the WARM, NICE, SUNNY, San Francisco weather (Sarcasm by the way)

As the time ticked and tocked closer to 3:00, I started to get a little worried if we were going to get in or not. It's kind of like being in line at AT&T park hoping you'd get a bobblehead and that fucker in front of you wouldn't get the last one. Anyways, we got in at 2:55 (IN BEFORE THE LOCK) and was seated by this nice waitress. 

We ordered the Washington Square and the Smoke Salmon Benedict. The portion size is very reasonable for their price. The food tasted good too. I mean, it wasn't an explosion of unicorn blood and fairy dust, but it wasn't bad either. I've noticed that the waiters/waitresses still let customers come in even though it was 5-10 minutes past 3, so that's a plus. Good to know that they aren't some strict Nazis like some other restaurants. 

Anyways, 4 stars for their good service and food. I don't know if it's really worth the wait though...it's just breakfast after all. I'll probably come again to try their other stuff...hopefully at a time where there isn't a line
author: Eric M.

description: Flat out amazing breakfast. Closed on Monday. You have to wait in line for 45-1 hour on weekdays. 1.5+ hours on the weekend. Worth going, but get there early. The pancakes are incredible as is the Monte Crisco.
author: Danny B.

description:
Mama's was preceded by its reputation. I'd seen the giant line formed outside during business hours, and had heard rumblings of greatness. The monte cristo's excellence was even referenced on a podcast I listen to. 

My trip today absolutely met %100 of the lofty expectations I'd developed. Everything coming out of the kitchen looked amazing. And my Northern Italian omelette was very good. The aforementioned monte cristo is one of the tastiest things I've ever shoved down my piehole, all rounding out one of the best breakfasts I've ever attacked. 

The line isn't too bad on weekdays, and it's worth the wait regardless.
author: Mark B.

description: By far one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. The staff was warm and helpful, the ordering/seating process was smooth and the food was WELL WORTH the wait. I can't wait to return to San Francisco so I can visit Mama's again...
author: C C.

description:
The first and only time I've been there the food was really good.

Main course 
Paisano Benedict - Other than the English muffin being completely burned, the benedict was a solid 3/5

Dessert
Normal and Chocolate Crumbcake - These are some of the best desserts I've had. Solid 5/5
____________________________________________________________

Recently, however, I called in about a recently expired Scoutmob coupon(a few days) that they refused to credit what we paid for. Mind you, I wasn't insisting on the full promotional value.

1st call
Manager hung up on me in middle of me after refusing to even credit us with the amount we paid for the coupon. As I was starting my rebuttal(I was about to mention the Credit Card Act of 2009) she cut me off and said "That's not my problem, it's Scoutmob's problem" and hangs up.

2nd call
I called her back to explain how it is federal law, as stated in the Credit Card Act of 2009, that the paid value has to be be honored. This is assuming that 5 years hasn't passed - which it hasn't. The coupon was purchased in July 2012 and expired October 2012. She would have none of it as evidenced by her cutting me off several times to say, " That's not my problem, it's Scoutmob's. No, that law doesn't apply to us. You have to call ScoutMob. They never gave us the full amount of money".....and then hangs up on me....again.

No one is exempt from federal law, not even you Mama's!
author: Luis V.

description:
Hands down one of the best breakfasts I've ever had.  Most breakfast aren't hard to make so I'm usually just satisfied, but this was just great.  We came on a Tuesday morning at 9am and still had to wait the usual 45 minutes or so, so plan accordingly.

My friend and I split the dungeness crab egg's benedict and the french toast sampler.  The dungenss crab egg's benedict was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Salt and succulent crab with the creamy hollandaise sauce was just a perfect balance.  The french toast sample was 3 pieces of bread (I think challa, banana nut and cranberry nut) topped with fresh fruit.  The one thing I would never get sick of in SF is the fresh fruit.  

These items were on the chalkboard so it could be seasonal.  Once seated, service was very fast and prompt.  I would definitely go again and again
author: Byron K.

description: No credit cards, $1 for debit card charge, and food is standard brunch. Nothing made me go wow and the wait was 1 1/2 hours long! Unless you get there early there is nothing worth waiting 1 1/2 hours long! Pass unless you're in the neighborhood and can stand the freezing SF days waiting to get in.
author: Linda L.

description:
Waited for two hours outside then had to wait inside to order/get a table! It's a pretty cruel wait as you're standing in front of the kitchen/baked goods. I almost nabbed a delicious-looking blueberry pastry. 

It's not too expensive; about $10 a dish if you're not trying to go crazy and get a crab benedict ($21). The portions, however, are not large! I didn't enjoy the french toast sampler as much as I had hoped (the cranberry/orange juice was very good, though. Like a muffin with fruit and syrup on top) but the vegetarian eggs benedict and the salmon scrambler were really tasty though not big enough to take home left-overs.
author: Dino R.

description: Mama's is definitely worth the wait. The food was delicious and the restaurant is an SF staple. You at least have to try it once. I recommend getting there at 7:50 though, right before it opens. The line fills up quickly and there's limited seating inside so getting there early is beneficial.
author: Erin S.

description: Came here on a Friday morning at 9:30am knowing very well that there would be a line. We waited 1 hr to get in, but it was definitely worth it. The dungeness crab benedict was my favorite, with a lot of crab meat, perfectly light hollandaise sauce, and yummy sauteed spinach. My friend got the berry smoothie, which was also really great... not too sweet, but you could distinctly taste all the ingredients: berries, bananas, yogurt, honey. I wasn't a huge fan of the crab omelet, but omelets aren't my first choice of breakfast food anyways. Out of the French toast sampler, my favorite was the cranberry orange.
