The homemade jam was delicious, also not overly sweet.
author: Fay L.

description: After two hours in line and very low blood sugar levels, I ate everything and drank everything and everything was good or religious. Would I ever again spend two hours in line for those secret recipe pancakes- no. An hour- yes.
author: Yelena B.

description: A place to go to AGAIN and AGAIN. sure,  the wait sucks, but it is so worth it.  The pancakes are made from heavens angels or something close to that!  YUM
author: Jessica J.

description:
Really a hidden gem!  Great location, very busy on a weekday at 11am and a very interesting way to order your food in a line that half waits outside and the other half waits inside while they try to move people along and out.  With that said, it is not pushy and you don't feel like they want to turn tables over quickly even though they really need to.

As for the food,  my party tried a variety of dishes and I loved the french toast especially when an employee recommended to use the jam spread (boysenberry?) at the table.

I really look forward to coming back, even suffering through the pain in the neck wait.
author: Steven T.

description: Great food. Questionable on if it's worth the wait. If it was a little shorter wait it would for sure be a top place. If you're a visitor, it's a must for breakfast one of the days you visit. Get the montecristo!
author: Kyle G.

description:
Came in on a football sunday with hopes that the line would be subdued, but  no, it was long still. After opening we waited maybe 30min before getting in. 

Kind of an unorthodox way of ordering, once inside, there's a secondary line, albeit shorter, where you actually order off the large menu splayed over the order counter and glass where they cook and have other stuff displayed that you can order. Once to the register we find out it's CASH ONLY. So make sure you have that in hand! Luckily we did have the cash and that crises was averted. Then the seating situation was semi assigned, and semi left for us to fend for ourselves. Luckily a table opened up right away and we sat.

The food was just alright. Standard breakfast and brunch stuff. I don't know what all the fuss was about. I can't say it was Denny's quality, or any low end place, but good food and good quality, but nothing super special out of the ordinary. The portions were pretty big. I usually finish up, but my eggs benedict was too much for me to handle. Very good indeed.

The place was hectic overall. Noisy. People and waiters moving about in tight spaces. Service was good. Line was long. Food was good but nothing super special.

A return visit has yet to be made. Not because it was bad, but because it wasn't anything totally new or different. Not knocking the place as I did like it. 

If you want a breakfast/brunch spot that has good portion, this would be it. But be forewarned of the line, noise, and CASH ONLY.
author: Jay V.

description:
Yummy!! Yummy!! Yummy!!

Heaven on earth!! Had french toast sampler, the bread was amazing and the Fruit on top was amazingly sweet!!
Excellent stop for breakfast my stomach is smiling!
author: Lulu R.

description: waited one and half hour for burned french toast.   cocky cashier and rude face waitress   ; will never come again
author: Johnson L.

description: Nothing special for people with food allergies. Everything is already premade other than the scrambled eggs which were not worth the hour wait. The gluteny/cheesy dishes looked great but again if they are all actually premade then meh...
author: Lizzy H.

description:
WOW!!  Never would I have thought that I'd wait for 1.5 hours before actually eating that I would give ANYTHING 4 stars!  Much less, 5.. what can I say?  Either get there really early before they open OR get there right before they close...but either way,, get there!!  I always tend to try Monte Cristos whenever I can.. the MAMA's version with the apples.. you GOTTA have.. seriously,  hands down BEST Monte Cristo  and maybe one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!! Each bite you just are blown away!!  Also, since we are talking decadence here.. share that side of that bacon!!
It's really cool to see a teeny tiny kitchen make EVERYTHING to order.. I think as I was watching in awe.. that they literally make each table to order.. you can REALLY taste that in the food.. and the people who work there are just a great vibe all around.. IT's REALLY REALLY REALLY worth the wait!
author: Sopla R.

description:
Meeeeeh!
3* for food/price
1* for wait

There is a place in Waikiki, two block from my work, similar to this called Eggs n things.  There are literally 30 people standing in line every morning.  I laugh to myself whenever I pass by, mocking those fools wasting their vacation standing in line for breakfast.  Yet I was one of those fools in SF.  I want to kick myself now!  You have to be kidding to wait for in line for 2hrs for breakfast.

Food was ok and prices were reasonable, but not to warrant the two hour wait.  I had the egg benedict and fench toast.  

Although it was almost double the price in our hotel rest (omni hotel) the food was better (and NO WAIT!)
author: Mike O.

description:
My friend and I are in town for the weekend and pulled this up via Yelp, when we arrived we were taken aback by the 60 minute wait.  When we got inside and got a look at the specials and entire menu it made the decision of what to eat really difficult.  

The restaurant is small, you wait outside and then come in to order at the counter before you're given a table.  The omelettes are divine and the benedicts delicious!  Not to be passed up, the Bloody Mary is spicy and worth the price! 

I am looking forward to our next trip so I can eat at Mamas!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Went here based on my co-workers recommendations.  The wait wasn't too bad, we were there early on a Sunday morning.  You fee like you've won a race once you enter the building and get to order your food.  

So the lack of one star is because: Cash only and small space.

I loved the fresh berries on my french toast.  Very delicious.
author: Michelle M.

description:
We were searching for breakfast in the area, and Yelp led us here. Mama's features standard brunch fare. While the food was very satisfying, I'm not sure if it was worth the 1+ hours we spent waiting in line trying to pacify our growling stomachs. Apparently, there is always a line out the door and around the corner here. This surprises me, I really doubt this is the best place for brunch in a city like San Francisco.

The restaurant is small. Like, really small. That's why they can't turn tables very quickly. It's charming and simplistic though. Don't go to the restroom here unless you can help it - it's not very clean, and it's actually outside of the restaurant. It's an outhouse. To get to it, you go through the kitchen, and down a small flight of stairs.

After we finally made it inside, we ordered the French Toast Sampler, the Monte Cristo, and the Crab Egg Benedict. The Monte Cristo stood our the most. I would've liked a little more filling, but it was fried very well, and the raspberry preserves it was served with was excellent. I'd recommend the French Toast Sampler as well, I was particularly fond of the slice of banana nut french toast. The Crab Egg Benedict was a little disappointing, surprisingly. The delicate flavors of the crab was masked by the rich hollandaise sauce.
author: Grace P.

description: I say its a 3.5 star place.  The wait was forever.  The omelettes were good, nothing out of this world.  The english muffin was crispy which I didn't like.  Juice is also like $5 a cup... wtf?
author: Chloe K.

description:
Can't say much that hasn't been said before, but wow.. What a seriously great little breakfast/lunch spot.

First of all, the notes about the line outside the door are not exaggerated.  We showed up at 11:30am on a Sunday and stood in line for about 90 minutes.  I don't stand in line for much but I was intrigued by this place.. And I will say right now, hands down, yes, it was worth it.

The food was amazing.  We had the Washington Square omelet, which was superb.  The sausage was great!  Also had the monte cristo, which is definitely a must try.  The cheese just oozed out and the sweet meets savory mix was perfect.  We also had the Slim Joe's burger, which was like a patty melt on a sourdough baquette.  SO GOOD!!!  the sides were great, and so was the homemade jam.

But beyond the food, I have to also note.. the service here is beyond amazing.  Everyone - and I do mean everyone - is very friendly.  They take pictures of you sitting and eating, they offer you water while you wait in line, they chat it up with you... I even saw one gentleman plug in a diner's cell phone in the back for her while she ate.

This is the embodiment of a family-owned and operated establishment with absolutely great homemade and unique food.  A+++ all around, and I *will* be back!!
author: Robert K.

description: Breakfast is my favorite meal, and I have pretty high standards for the best brunches in my favorite cities. Mama's is nothing short of 5 stars. The food, atmosphere, location and execution of the food delivery was 5 of 5. Don't let the line fool you we waited 55 minutes and it was worth every minute. We enjoyed how efficient there system was as well. It was also a fun wait, I'd suggest bringing friends to split the wait  if you are impatient or want to see the scenery in this local spot.
author: IT J.

description:
I'm kinda in the 3.5 Stars range...

Took a 1 1/2 trip with a friend to Mama's based on all the reviews. It was a Friday afternoon, the sun was shinin' the sky was a beautiful blue and the birds were chirpin'... Well, maybe no chirping birds, but we did run into a couple of gangsta pigeons as we were walking out of the Montgomery Street BART Station...Then we walked 20 minutes to get to Mama's, saying to ourselves, "this is gonna so great, so worth the trip." 

Got to Mama's. Saw a line. Still telling each other, "this is going to be great.."  I kept telling myself it will be just a few minutes 'til I eating some of Mama's food. I got excited as we neared the door, there was even a menu on the window, so we occupied our time thinking about what to order. We decided on the Dungeness Crab Benedict (#1), Crab Omelette (#4, not #5), and the French Toast Sampler (#10).

We were *finally* granted access into the little cafe. And guess what..?  We had to wait in yet another line! Geez... well can't turn back now since we already survived a 55+ minute wait outside. The line inside was shorter, it was only about 15 minutes. You have to wait in line to order and pay for your food. NOTE: it is CASH or DEBIT only! There's a $1 fee if you use your debit card.  Our bill ended up at $57.20.. The reason for the line is because we're waiting on other diners to get up and free up the tables. Man, I was so upset I saw some peeps who were already done eating, still seating down texting on their cell phones.. Seriously, get up and go so the rest of us can eat some tasty Mama's food. Geez... 

Well, we finally sat down and had to wait again for our food to arrive. I'm sure this time it was only like 5 to 10 minutes, but we were so hungry it felt like forever.. sigh.... Finally, the waiter brings 2 dishes out. The crab benedict and the crab omelette. We immediately split our plate half-and-half. Based on the Yelp review I immediately opted to fork over some crab benedict into my mouth...and it. was. a. little..... disappointing. Don't get me wrong, it was good but not *that* good, definitely not based on all the hooplah I read about on yelp. No worries though, it's still pretty good, just nothing special. Next I tried the crab omelette.. now, that. was. the...... bomb.com!!!! It was sooooooooooooooooooooo gooooooooooooooooooood, like slap yo' Mama good! Yum!!! It's like I couldn't eat it fast enough, hmmmmmm mmmmm mmmmm mmmmm goooood! ; ))  

They kinda skimped on the crab on the benedict, but the omelette was filled with crab, it was so good! I was full and I still wanted more of that omelette. However, some of the homestyle fries were kinda burnt, not good! Next, they brought the french toast sampler. There were 3 types--the Swedish french toast, the banana nut, and the low-fat apple yogurt cinnamon. There were all good. I didn't really care too much for the banana nut bread french toast, it was a little dry for me, but I put the homemade jam on it and it helped! I loved the Swedish cinnamon and the apple yogurt cinnamon, I could hardly believe it was low-fat!

Bottom line, everything was pretty good. I'm glad I went, I think it was worth the wait. I'll be back to try more items on the menu, but if the line isn't so long.


Last TIP:  The cafe closes at 3:00, if you get there like 2:00-ish, there's barely any wait! We left like 2:15PM and there was no wait at all! If only wee had planned our trip better lol! (But then, again it may have just been that one time). I have to come back again to give you a better sense of things. But do believe when I (and a lot of yelpers) say that it is worth the hour wait! Love you Mama! : ))
author: Y. Abigail H.

description: Ok, the wait was insane but we should known better going on Sunday after 8. Try to get there by 7 or 7:30 weekends or plan on long wait-90 +. Great food & service, nice family owned & reminder of what SF still has long time neighborhood institution!
author: Jody L.

description:
The first thing my family and I did on our first trip to SF was eat at Mama's. 

The way we quickly identified the restaurant was by the huge line that had already formed around 8:20 (they open at 8am). Yeah it was unbelievable! But it was great to have the opportunity to have funny conversations and hear great music from a man playing guitar right in front of the restaurant, while waiting in line. 

Once we got in the door we were instantly welcomed with the beautifully inviting yellow walls and witty art hanging on the wall. I ordered the cinnamon french toast :) It was very good! I loved the berries on top and the syrup complimented everything very nicely. I also ordered orange juice, and it was amazing, it was sooo good! My family also seemed to really enjoy their meals. They all ordered the Washington Square
M'Omelette.

Although i really did hate having to wait in line for over an hour, our food came fairly quickly. My recommendation for you is to get there very early to be able to get in there quickly & really be able to take your time and enjoy your food :)
author: Alejandra I.

description:
It is "good", as in "the Beatles are good". Given the numerous other lovely weekend brunch options in the city, there is no reason you should wait 60 minutes at that one.

When the hype dies down, it will be a great place for sure!
author: Anthony M.

description:
"There's a sucker born every minute" said someone, maybe P.T. Barnum or maybe someone less illustrious.

Those people wait in a long-ass line at Mama's for mediocre brekky foods, bitter coffee, and blisters.

I was a sucker once (on my birthday of all days.)  It was a nice summer day, so at least I got a head start on my sunglasses tan while tempting my fate with the Washington Sq pigeons target practicing on my head.

The french toast sampler is dry and nutty. If I'm going to ruin my diet, I want moist gooey goodness melting in my mouth.  Customary million buxx vial of OJ, slapdash service, breakfast here is unremarkable save the nightclub-esque queues.  

In order that brunch not turn into lunch, skip Mama's.  Spend your morning at St. Peter and Paul's next door praying that you'll never be a sucka.
author: Joanna M.

description: We were the first people in line on a Friday so we were let in as soon as they opened. Had the french toast and bacon and eggs. Eggs were cooked perfect and the french toast was nice and light, and not too sweet like french toast typically is. Nice service. Would have loved to try the pastries but didnt have enough room. Will be back for sure. I had been wanting to try this out for years and glad I finally did.
author: Jesus T.

description:
One word: YUM!

Came here on a Thursday at 11:30am.. waited about 40 minutes.  A girl in front of us in line actually fainted from waiting (she probably partied hard the night before and was dehydrated).  But yes, expect a wait.  And yes, expect your taste buds to be thoroughly satisfied.  Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast is out of this world, especially if you enjoy sweet breakfast items.  The bestie had the Monte Cristo, and after taking a bite I almost.. just almost wish I had ordered that instead.  But I love me some chocolate-y goodness for brunch, so I'm glad I had the French Toast.

One star taken off for the wait.  It is quite ridiculous sometimes, and I don't think I'd ever be brave enough to come on a weekend.  But, if I were available on a weekday for brunch, I definitely would not hesitate waiting an hour for this place.  I'd just have to remember to have a light snack beforehand.
author: Jae Z.

description:
I'm only giving 4 stars because of the food. The service was HORRIBLE!! After waiting in line for an hour and a half, my friend and I get through the line to order and this Asian woman decided she was going to start writing checks for the restaurant and consulting with her Sysco guy instead of taking our order. Completely ignoring us for 10 minutes when we could have ordered, been seated (a table was open), and started to relax, I was furious. Finally I broke up their little pow wow and asked for her to take our order. She started giving me a bunch of attitude and told us there wasn't a table available which there was as soon as we walked in and that was the one we ended up sitting at.

We got our food and it was delicious. Too bad the service wasn't as comparable.
author: mikayla r.

description: I really don't think this place is worth the hype. The Monte Cristo was good, but nothing like "omg I can't wait to stand in an hr n a half line again just to have it one more time". Same with the classic egg benidict, but there's better out there. I really think that for the amount of time your standing in line the food should seriously be to die for. Oh and remember to bring cash!!
author: Kat J.

description:
Be prepared to wait. I went on a Tuesday morning and the line was already around the block. It was about an hour to hour and half wait, but I will say it was well worth it. The restaurant only has like 10 or so tables (the reason for the long wait). Be sure to have cash as they do not accept credit cards. 

The food was excellent. I highly recommend getting an egg dish and then ordering a French toast dish and splitting it with the table. You get the best of both worlds esp. if you are only going there once. 

Staff was super friendly. If your only in San Fran once this is one place that is a must see.
author: Sarah F.

description:
4 stars for the food...  but 1 star for the wait.  

First time here with friends for brunch.  I think we must have waited for 1.5 hours.  Hell, not gonna do it again with empty stomach.  What made it worse was the girl standing in line in front of us started smoking...  what the hell was she thinking?  there were at least 3 "no smoking" signs posted...  so, on her 3rd cigarette, i told her to smoke by the curb...   

so, we ordered their french toast and monte cristo.  I gotta say, the monte cristo is awesome!  the cheese and the turkey was a great combination sandwiched in the french toast - it reminded me of McGriddle.  by the way, avoid ordering Mama's spiked lemonade...  it wasn't worth the $7 dollars.   

Gonna go try Brenda's next time!
author: Jimmy H.

description:
I knew I had to try this place twice before making up my mind about it

growing up in sf, even having attend St. Peter and Paul next door, I've never been to mamas before until this month, the line alone scared me

but I finally decided to brave it after trying some really good brunch places in nyc; I wanted to find some in sf.. 

my first visit, the blueberry pancakes..was Ok. taste wise, felt like it came with syrup and butter infused already.. having them drizzled over my pancakes and sat long enough on the counter so by the time it reached me...yep...not impressed. not fluffy, and taste just didn't impress.

today, I went back and tried the monte cristo. I didn't use their jam but just mixed hot sauce with ketchup..also good for the side potatoes

it. is. so. good!!!!!

the staff is friendly both visits. it is a bit weird you wait to go in, then order, and wait to sit but the wait to order ---- (this would be arrow but that isn't allowed?!) wait to sit, isn't long

CASH only, unless you use a debit card with your pin, which is $1 surcharge
author: Whitne Y.

description:
Definitely worth the wait. I've been meaning to try this place ever since I saw it on Check Please! Bay Area because of it's homey feel and obviously the food. 

You know it's good since there is a line wrapping around the block while all the other places around it have no such activity. They serve breakfast/brunch and lunch food, but I think they're mostly known for their breakfast. 

My friends ordered the huevos rancheros dish and I ordered the Northern Italian omelet which had PANCETTA which is one of my favorite meats ever. One of my friends really liked the huevos while my other friend didn't find anything too spectacular about it. My dish was really good and also very filling. The eggs and everything were cooked well, but it may have a been a bit salty. But overall a very good meal. 

What I think is the best are their pastries and their jam. We were eying the crumble cakes while waiting in line and had to buy some and they were definitely as tasty as they looked. Even better warmed up. And the jam tasted super fresh and so fruity and yummy and it was deelishis. 

What I really think stood out for me was the service. All of their waiters and servers were very attentive and polite and accommodating and it made me feel very welcome. The only turn off was obviously the long wait. We waited in line, in the rain for about 30+mins which might prevent me from going back anytime soon. But overall a very tasty meal
author: Dustin H.

description: Quintessential breakfast place!!  get there when it opens or very soon thereafter - the line's no joke.  that being said, they offered coffee (for a charge) to drink while waiting and i got to spend some time talking to my daughter whom i was visiting from out of town, so the time passed easily.  the food is everything everyone's said already - delicious. the service was very friendly.  the bloody mary perfect. i'll definitely be back next time i'm in SF!
author: tracey c.

description:
Visiting SF for the first time I had a LOT to get in in 4 short days!
Mama's was recommended to me by a lot of NON-LOCAL people. Ok, sure, the locals may not like it... but I did :D

The feel of the restaurant is homey and cozy. You wait outside until there is room inside in line. We didnt have to wait long, thankfully. Being able to see them cook, bake, and prepare EVERYTHING was cool. They make everything fresh! All the bread, coffee cakes, etc was fresh :) The Shrimp, crab, salmon, fruits etc were lined up in ice along the window so you could see how fresh they were. Good thinking!

I wish I would have known that you have to order before sitting, or else I would have paid attention to the menu a little more hahaha! My fault.

I got a simple breakfast - Poached Eggs, bacon, taters, and toast. With a pannycake on the side.
My date got the Crab, avo, tom, and Gruyère omelet. 

Yeow! The crab was so sweet and there was a LOT of it!
My eggs could have been boiled with a little less vinegar, but what can you do.. They were the perfect consistency though, thats all I really care about. I cant STAND an over/under cooked egg.

The taters were crisp and fresh, and they had theee best bacon I've ever had. So good! Perfectly crisp but not burnt! My pancake was a smaller, but good size. HELLA thick but still fluffy! Yum!

The service was friendly and very fast! They only have so many tables, and stay full while open, but I didn't feel rushed or like I needed to leave as soon as I was done eating. This was a plus for me.. Cause I was FULL when I was done, and didnt want to move a finger! lol

I will go back next time Im in SF!
author: Stephanie S.

description: This place is amazing went with my husband you have to try there French toast there amazing but if your not into sweat for breakfeast I would go for an omelette they use pancetta instead of bacon in there omeltes it's so delicious! We waitedin line 40 minutes to be seated we almost left but  glad we stayed this place is worth the wait! If you want to beat the line get there early and line up as soon as you get there lol they have mimosas too! If your claustrophobic I wouldn't recommend because it's pretty small that's why it takes awhile to get seated but it is San Fran
author: Stephany T.

description:
After reading about the horrid waiting line that Mama's known for, I decided to come on a Friday morning.  Since I couldn't get myself up that early, I got here around noon and there were only 4 parties in front of me.  I don't remember exactly how long the wait was but I do know we got in and out in an hour (parking meter helps my memory).

Mama's is not the typical place where you get seated and someone takes your order.  Rather, what you're waiting for outside is to get into another line inside to order and pay.  Once you order and pay, you then get your table and wait for your food to arrive.  It's a quaint little cozy restaurant (bigger than Dottie's but smaller than Brenda's) with a restroom that you have to snake through the kitchen and down a set of stairs in order to get to.

Surprisingly, we did not wait too long for our order to arrive.  While I got the Prosciutto and Asparagus Omelet special, my honey got the Monte Cristo (MC).  Normally, he looks at my order and then gets disappointed at his but his MC beat my omelet out of the water (don't tell).  The MC was meaty and cheesy while grilled to perfection on the outside.  My omelet wasn't a complete fail as it had a generous amount of tiny shredded bits of prosciutto.  But it just did not look as appealing as the MC.

Another good thing about Mama's is the jam.  They have strawberry, raspberry, and I believe mixed fruit if you ask for it.  The jam is more like preserves since there are bits of real fruit in there.

Overall:  Maybe it was the omelet or maybe it was death by comparison but I did not think the food was extraordinary enough to give it 5 stars.  Maybe next time I'll get the MC.
author: Linh V.

description: Excellent, after waiting in line for almost two hours I was ready to be underwhelmed by this food, but I wasn't.  It was delicious, the homemade jam was unreal, the french toast was amazing. The mimosas were nothing to write home about but if your wondering whether you should go, the answer is yes.
author: Amaya S.

description:
The line snaking around the block deterred us from having breakfast here as planned, but our single minded stomachs steered us back to Mama's for lunch to discover the line half as long and breakfast still available! Ah yeah! The ordering process is a bit...different. The line you see outside simply gets you into another line inside where your orders are taken. My boyfriend and I, who were visiting from Brooklyn, joked that they really make you earn your food here...no sitting down and having a waitress take your order. Your ass is gonna stand up until it's ready! The cooks, who you can see from the "inside line", don't even get your little slip of paper until a table opens up. We got a kick out of that, but the novelty would probably wear thin if this was our regular spot. 

The food itself was awesome. I got a burger, which was fresh ground beef with caramelized onions in between 2 pieces of toasted sourdough. Me bf ordered the Monte Cristo, and was the picture of confusion when it came covered in powdered sugar and strawberries. But once he bit into it, his face almost exploded from the joy. And after commanding half of his place, I understood why. Definitely get that if you're into the sweet / savory combo as we are. 

I was feeling hefty enough as it was from my "vacation diet" (ie. eating everything and anything I wanted) so I passed on the pastries sitting in the shelves. But if I had to do it over again, they would have left with us. 

So, go. If only once.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Walked 2.5 miles and a little over an hour wait for this. The owner waits in the front and greets you. He educates you on the menu a bit. How awesome the owner interacts with all his customers.
author: Juliet S.

description:
I HAVE NEVER HAD A BAD DISH HERE AND I'VE TRIED ABOUT EVERYTHING ON THE MENU.  This was the first place I ate when I came to live in SF.  I remember reading about it in 7x7 and I knew I had to try the french toast sampler (cranberry orange is the best).  For the next two years after that, I came back repeadetly and always wanted to try something new but kept going back to the french toast because it was just that good and I didn't want to risk trying something I didn't like and having the idea of Mama's being perfect ruined for me and blah blah blah.   I mean, I liked this place so much that I missed college orientation to eat here three days in a row.

Eventually, I tried a spinach omelet.  Verdict: Delish.
Crab Benedict: Delish.
Burger: Delish.

Years later, they still have the same friendly staff working there and the same great quality of food.  Make sure to try the jam they place on each table.  My family also loves this place and we make it a priority to go each time they visit. 

** Be warned, you will likely have to wait in line for about an hour even if you get there right when they open but it is definitely worth every minute.
author: Kash S.

description: You know the food is good when after eating you feel so happy and satisfied.  Had the Paisano Benedict and the eggs were perfect with pillowy egg whites.  The Hollandaise Sauce was a bit sour.  Coffee hit the spot.  The banana walnut bread was dense and just the right sweetness.  I haven't had pancakes for a year, but their fluffy pancake was worth the wait. The homemade jam complimented the bread.  Crumb cake was a bit too sweet.  Another enjoyable and memorable breakfast.
author: Helen L.

description: Came here for brunch the other day. We had to wait in line, but it was calm once we got inside, and we were not rushed. Monte cristo was delicious and the crab cakes benedict were very rich and equally as good.  Service was great, and I enjoyed watching the cooks prepare our food.
author: Deborah K.

description:
It doesn't get any better than Mama's.  I visited Mama's on my first trip to San Francisco almost 10 years ago and it felt like nothing had changed.  When we arrived around 10am on a Sunday, there was a long line wrapped onto the street.  I knew we picked a good place because others were willing to wait in line.  

Our wait was almost 1:15, and was well worth it.  I had a Washington Square omlet (don't remember the exact name) and my wife had an excellent Monte Cristo.  Service was awesome and the staff was attentive and friendly.  

I'll be returning soon - and hopefully before 2022.
author: Abhay S.

description:
Loooong wait...unless you skip inside and get it to go and eat across the street in the park!  Decide what you want to order while waiting, and waiting...

Monte Cristo was wonderfully prepared.  Everything is pretty good.  However, it's not earth-shattering wonderful, but solid food for sure.  I'd definitely go again.
author: Adrian A.

description:
Don't be scared off by the long line outside! There is a reason why that line exists...and that reason is the Monte Cristo. It is so yummy that I refuse to cut it out of my life even though I am a vegetarian now. Unfortunately, they are too busy to be able to take custom orders so I just order the Monte Cristo as is and then peel off all the meat myself. I would also recommend dipping the sandwich in their homemade jam, but my boyfriend prefers it without. So if this is going to be your first time, give the jam a shot - but it may not be your cup of tea. 

I have only had maybe two other things from their menu even though I have been here a billion times. I think that I had some french toast once and an omelette the other. All I really remember when I had those dishes was wishing that I had ordered the Monte Cristo. So now I just save myself the heartache and order the Monte Cristo every time.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Arrived around 10:30 and waited till 12 to be seated. Brunch turned into lunch. I kind of expected the long wait since it was a Sunday. By the time we got inside, we were completely famished. Good thing we looked up the menu while in line.  Service was good and the servers constantly were refilling glasses and asking how we were doing.

We had the Monte Cristo and the buttermilk pancakes with scrambled eggs on the side. The buttermilk pancakes were soft, and fluffy. Add on the homemade raspberry jam and it was very tasty. The eggs were okay, a little under-seasoned but perfectly cooked. I like it. The Monte Cristo was really good too. But it was a little heavy for me to have first thing in the morning.

I'll be back. Earlier in the day though, to try and avoid such a long wait.
author: Jay L.

description:
The best monte christo I have ever had ... And I am now deeply in love with Felicia ... But not sure this is worth the wait and hype ... Adorable vibe inside ....

Go saints!
author: Barry S.

description:
I came here on a Saturday for brunch. We got to the place at around 9:45am and by the time we were seated, it was 12:10 (once you get inside, you wait to order, and wait for a table to open up after you order).  We finished and left the place before 1pm. The line was still down the street when we left. 

The food is good. They have the typical brunch food and also some specials- We ordered omelets, french toast, and monte cristo. All three of them were delicious and reasonably priced.  The place is small, which explains the long wait, but it is very cozy.  I would recommend giving this place a try, yet I doubt if I will go back for a second visit as I don't reside in the city.
author: Ping S.

description:
I live on Mason and Filbert, really close by. Since I was up all night, figured why not go and grab some grub. I get there around 8:10am, and there's already a line. 20 minutes later, I'm shuffled into another line inside to order my food. Inside is very clean and homey and just cool.

But overall it's not worth the wait when there are other places just as good without the line, Egg Benedict was okay, service was terrific, but it's so packed that you feel rushed and you can't really order more food. 

My verdict is, give it a try if you got the time, but otherwise pass, it's a tourist hot spot.
author: Danny V.

description:
This is my second time here. -- The first time we went it took us over an hour to be seated. This time around, I wanted to make sure we didn't have to wait too long. So, the adjust me made was not go on the weekend (It is extremely busy) - Second thing I learned, just be here a little bit early, just as they open!  -- I didn't have to wait the second time around and I went on a Thursday! It was perfect! 

I ordered an eggs Benedict. It was amazing! -- The first time I ordered an omelette, it was good, but the eggs Benedict is definitely the better choice! Same thing as the first time, I came out satisfied!! I will definitely come here again and again! The customer service was awesome!
author: Vanessa W.

description: Simply delicious! Felt it was worth the one hour wait on a Saturday morning. Make sure you check out their "specials" menu. The Spanish Benedict was on there, and the spicy chorizo with the creaminess of the sauce was  a winning combination! French Toast was topped with fresh Sweet fruit! Everything was fresh and tasted great. Great service, quaint decor. Loved it! Will come back!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Yes, I also thought it was crazy that at 2 PM, there was a line of at least 15 people when we arrived at Mama's! But I was visiting SF for the weekend and with such a great reputation for brunch, I just HAD to get in line! To get into the door, we waited exactly an hour! You then place your order at the counter and it took us a good 10-15 minutes to get to the cash register. After paying, we waited another 5 minutes to be seated. Whew!! 

With tired and sore legs, we were excited to try the delicious french toast we had heard so much about! I ordered the French Toast Sampler, which comes with 3 of Mama's special house baked breads. My boyfriend ordered their Fat Free Apple Yogurt Cinnamon Bread (less than 1 gram of fat) dipped in Egg Whites served with Seasonal Berries or Fruit. All I can say is...YUM!!!

Many of the customers ordered their weekend specials, which include Dungeness Crab Benedict, Shrimp and Avocado Benedict and Dungeness Crab Omelette. I can't wait to come back and try one (or all!) of them next time!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
If there's one thing you shouldn't do at Mama's, it's go there on a diet.  Just sayin'!!

So my husband and I who don't want to eat carbs, decide, we're going to try Mama's, while we're on a diet.

It wasn't easy but we made it, I have to admit I was hungry afterwards!

I got the crab omelet, no bread and no potatoes, it was taasty, but too crabby for me.  He got the turkey bacon omelet, it was tasty but again, without potatoes or bread, it ain't that great!

Last time I was there (I was also 20 pounds lighter) I went with my friend and we ordered the amazing pancakes with straberries and whipped cream (we were also hungover) and it was SO good and SO great after the crazy night of partying that we had just done!

So all in all, yeah go ahead, go to Mama's, but be prepared to wait in that ohhhhh so long line and watch other people eat through the window and just stare them down until they leave so the line gets shorter!  Oh but wait you HAVE TO WAIT IN LINE INSIDE WHEN ORDERING TOO! That's the only part that sucks about Mama's, is when you're inside and about to think you're going to eat in 10 minutes, you have to wait another 30-35 minutes while they make the food for you right there...woooooomp wooooomp :-)
author: Yekta A.

description:
After eyeing this place up for the past year, finally came here for breakfast this morning with my family. 
We got there just before 9 and there was about 15 people waiting, which wasn't too bad compared to usual. We waited in line for about 10-15 mins then got called in. Once in, you go immediately to order then are told to wait till a table is ready - a little odd but I guess that system works best for them. We luckily got a table relatively quickly, so didn't have to wait too long.
We got to our seats and our drinks were over pretty quickly. Food arrived within 10 minutes which was great.
My husband and I both had the farmers omelette - I had it with egg whites and substituted mushrooms instead of leeks. I also had fruit instead of the potato.
My mother-in-law had blueberry pancakes with a side of bacon and my father-in-law had scrambled eggs and bacon.
The omelette was so delicious and had a good amount of filling to it. The goats cheese was delicious! They have fresh made raspberry compote on the table which I had on the toast, and that was ridiculously good! My husband says the potatoes were really good - I was going to try one but they were gone before I had a chance!!
The pancakes were super fluffy and tasty and the side of bacon was a really big portion. The scrambled eggs and bacon were also really delicious.
Once finished, they were really efficient with clearing the table. They were also really great at coming round with extra coffee and making sure we were ok. Everybody there seemed really friendly which is always great.
Overall it was a great experience - both food and service were of a very high standard. It's definitely worth the wait in line (which by the way was triple in size by the time we left!)!
author: Elle B.

description:
Mama's a tiny restaurant located in a tourist filled area. It's a really popular brunch location on top of that. The wait time here is an hour plus with lots of people waiting outside for a table. Once you get inside, you actually wait in another line to order food before getting seated. The inside is pretty nice family style looking restaurant.

== Food ==

Smoked Salmon Benedict. Eggs were nicely done! Nice and gooey center. The smoked salmon tasted good, but nothing to write home about. There's a bit too much sauce for my liking. Overall, it was a good 

French toast sampler. Three different pieces of bread with banana, blackberry, and strawberry on top. I don't really like banana bread, but it was really good. Then there's a cranberry bread, which tasted alright. Last piece was a pretty good regular french toast with cinnamon on it.

== Service ==

This place is packed! the server disappeared and never really came back. It's understandable. There was a fly in my mimosa, but it seems they gave me a new one. Great service!

== Overall == 

Delicious brunch food, but the hour plus wait is really hard to justify it. If there wasn't such a long wait, this is a great place to head to.
author: Steven B.

description:
Hands down the best brunch place I have been to.

The line is another story though.. woof. Try to go on a week day or a really rainy day when people aren't out. 

I had the shrimp eggs benedict and part of an amazing french toast.
author: Amber F.

description: I went to this place few months back. It was 9:00 am and we got seated at 10:45 am. The line is usually really long and you will have to wait for an hour or so no matter which day/time u plan to go. We ordered a lot of stuff from the breakfast menu and enjoyed it to the last bite, specifically the homemade raspberry sauce. You can expect spending $50-$70 for two people.
author: Himika R.

description:
Saw this establishment featured on Check Please Bay Area some time ago and it's been on our list to try.. Well, Sunday we gave it a try.. Arrived @ 8:50am and was prepared to wait.. We did wait about an hour and were promptly seated. We met some very nice locals and a couple from NY while waiting, which helped the time pass quickly. 

Our server was wonderful, pleasant and attentive. Actually, all the staff was attentive.. They really work together as a team here, refilling beverages, cleaning dishes, etc..  

The place is very small but very clean which is a huge plus for us.. 

The Food was amazingly good.. We had the Monte Cristo, which is served with their homemade jam and I wouldn't think these two would go good together, however, I was so wrong.. They are a perfect combination!!! We also had the traditional eggs Benedict with potatoes which was just as good and yes we had to try the pancakes with fresh fruit which were amazingly good... 

Looking forward to returning to try some of their other specialty items and maybe a pastry or two..
author: Maria A.

description:
3* for the food, 1* for the wait. This is NOT the best breakfast in San Francisco. Happily, I can cook better than much of what they serve at Mama's. 

After 1 hour 15 minutes waiting in line on a Wednesday starting at 11am, we were finally seated. Our food came about 15 minutes after that, so we had a full hour and a half from when we arrived to when we ate. 

The old fashioned pancakes were good but not amazing: soft, sweat, and slightly chewy. The syrup wasn't very high quality either. 

The dungeness crab eggs benedict was mediocre. We overheard a table next to us complaining about it too! The eggs were cooked just right, but the Hollandaise wasn't particularly flavorful, the potatoes were trash, and the English muffin was a soggy mess. 

The crumb cake was a bit bland and too buttery. I've bought better from Safeway. The pastry chef needs to visit joyofbaking or similar.

The secret to cooking better breakfast than Mama's in your own home is to: learn to cook, buy high quality ingredients (especially the butter!), get good gear, and practice. Once you've done this, you can easily cook AND eat a great breakfast in less time than it'll take to wait in the queue for Mama's.

With numerous other diners and breakfast restaurants in San Francisco, I can't quite tell why people queue here. It was telling that everyone we overheard in line and at tables was visiting from out of town. Perhaps this is just a tourist trap?

Mama's is cash only. No credit cards.
author: Velshin C.

description:
I've been to Mama's twice - once last September when the line was relatively short and this past Memorial Weekend. Let's just say going the Sunday of a holiday weekend was a huge mistake! The total time we spent waiting in line was almost three hours, sadly, and once you order you still have to spend a few minutes waiting until a table opens up.

I will say I enjoyed what I had (the Washington Square and the Shrimp Benedict), but I don't know the wait is truly worth it. Nothing was really spectacular or mind-blowing, so I would suggest this place only if you're dead set on going and willing to wait at least an hour. Otherwise, get brunch at one of the numerous other places in the city.

I also think the atmosphere of the restaurant is super cute and very homey. The entire restaurant gives off a cozy vibe and it almost feels as though you're just eating breakfast at someone's house. That said, they could expand it and/or find a bigger place. The wait is ridiculous!
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
The place makes pretty good food at a reasonable price.

The problem is that is is located in a place where parking is impossible. Parking is enforced 7 days a week if one could find a space. The lines here are out the door and the place is so small that it's full at 30 people. 

If one happened to be around the area and wanted to come here for breakfast or lunch, just get here early and prepare to still wait in line. If one was coming from across town, don't bother..
author: M C.

description:
the battle between mama's and dottie's has been determined today...and the winner is...mama's!  

this unwritten battle between the top 2 breakfast icons in the city seems to go back and forth on yelp...and although mama's wins in my book, i still don't think it's worth waiting over 2 hours for.  the food is definitely fresh...and the menu is full of variety...but as i was eating, i didn't have that wow feeling of wanting more or that antsy feeling of wanting to come back tomorrow.  it was good...but not great.

so you walk in and order from the register...the menu is on the wall.  the attitude from the guy at the register stinks by the way...no customer service skills whatsoever.  but the servers are great...they're all super nice and very attentive.  as soon as you're done ordering, find a seat and the server will be right there with your drinks.

i ordered the washington square omelette which came with italian sausage, tomatoes, bell peppers, and hot pepper jack cheese.  it was served with a side of home fries and a bread of your choice...although i didn't have much of a choice cause the guy at the register never asked!  my omelette was huge...and they weren't skimpy on the filling portions.  it came with a sourdough baguette which was super hard and barely edible. 

wifey had the french toast sampler...3 pieces of their special house baked breads.  today, it came with chocolate cinnamon, swedish cinnamon, and cranberry orange walnut.  all 3 slices were topped with fresh fruit...blueberries, bananas, raspberries, and strawberries.  super yummy stuff!  

worth a 15 minute wait?  heck yeah.  2 hours?  um, i'll just find something else to eat in little italy.
author: Jen W.

description:
I used to live up the street from here. I would run in and eat whenever there wasn't a line. So basically twice :)

Great breakfast food. I will always adore a place who can perfect breakfast. It tastes like home.
author: Tina F.

description:
I gotta say this place is pretty overrated. 
My friend and I waited 2 hours in line and then 1/2 hour for our food. Unfortunately the food was okay as well. Definitely not worth waiting more than an hour for, I'm sorry. We had the dungeness crab omelette and it was not flavorful and just pretty bland. We also ordered the french toast sampler that was pretty good, but nothing to die over. 

I'm sorry, not a fan!
author: Annie C.

description:
Took my parents here, who were visiting from Orange County. We made sure to come early, but yet there was still a line! The good part about it was that it actually went by really fast. Our whole party was about 5 and a half people (my 2-year-old being the half) and they were able to seat us all together without any problems.

While waiting to get seated, my mom struck up a conversation with the guy at the register. Turns out he happens to be the owner's son and was sooo nice. The owner, Mr. Sanchez, ended up introducing himself to us and even gave us complimentary pastry samples just for waiting. It totally helped, since my little one was getting restless and didn't like standing in a crowd of strangers.

Aaaand on to the food: I had the Monte Cristo which was ridiculously good! I can't even describe it, you just have to try it =)
author: Mary S.

description: We just moved to the area and everyone was raving about Mama's. We had a great breakfast place we used to frequent in Philly called Sabrinas so we tried it out today on my husbands birthday to celebrate....not impressed! We didn't like the ordering style, my mocha came out with no whip and my pancakes did not taste very good...had that baking soda taste to them...so disappointed! My husband liked his dish but the potatoes were cold. We will keep looking for a great breakfast place to make our own in a new city :(
author: Michelle S.

description:
Gosh, this place is amazing.  I walked by around lunch time, and the line was down the block.  I had no idea what this place was, but it had to be good with that long of a line.

We and friends were taking photos in the area, and when we came back, the line was considerably shorter.  Why not try it?  We got in line and only waited about 25 minutes.

It was a beautiful day, so it wasn't bad just hanging out and waiting.  I got so hungry though looking in.

The service was very friendly, and the seats were all comfy and close to windows.  The food was amazing, I couldn't decide what I wanted because I wanted everything.

I had the low fat apple yogurt french toast, pretty awesome.  I tried the pancakes, monte cristo sandwich, sausage, and homefries.  All great.

2 hour wait might not be worth it, but 30 or so, totally.  We went at 2:30 before they were closing so the line was short.

I can't wait to go back =)
author: Art C.

description: Loved the service and food!! Definitely try the carrot cake!!
author: Arinum R.

description:
"That food's so good I always eat too much." ...Steve Keller to Mike Stone as they are leaving Mama's in a 1973 episode of Streets of San Francisco. 
Ditto!
author: Johnny O.

description: Really good, usually long waits during breakfast hours, almost not worth it on weekend mornings. Great baked goods selection and good traditional breakfasts. I love the crab cake Benedict. A great place to go then spend some time digesting at Washington park. Once you are ready to eat again, head over to Tonys pizza!
author: chris v.

description: Probably the beat breakfast I've ever had. I was contemplating leaving because the line was outside the door and we had to wait for about an hour to get in and get our food but was glad we stayed. The restaurant is a small but the food more than makes up for it. I ordered a mimosa, pecan and banana French toast to split with my friend, and vegetarian eggs Benedict. Truly satisfied with the taste and quantity. Definitely stop by if you're in San Francisco.
author: Niraj P.

description:
After getting (in Palo Alto) well before dawn to take some sunrise shots of the Golden Gate, we headed straight to Mama's to get in line. Turns out, we were a bit earlier than planned--and so there was no line. But, sure enough, a line did form (did it ever). We entertained ourselves watching the neighborhood wake up, as elderly neighbors did their calisthenics in the park across the street.

So, the food... excellent. The gf had a Monte Cristo (surprisingly awesome for breakfast), I had the French toast sampler (great call), and we both enjoyed fantastic freshly-squeezed OJ. Service was solid, prices weren't bad, and we were outta there by 8:30 with a whole Saturday before us. So, get there early, order some French toast and a Monte Cristo, rinse, and repeat.
author: Chris J.

description:
Another breakfast place in SF with long lines.  Seriously, shouldn't a breakfast place open earlier than 8am?  Definitely more tourists in this line.  Very long.  That's ok, I travel a lot and do the same.  Note-- there is no sign in sheet, so don't walk all the way up to the front and lose your spot-- or at least send the SO up front.  Or go park.  The wait from first in line to actually being seated was about 90 minutes Sun 9am.

It's nice the ?owner is at the front shepherding the masses to the counter to order.  Had the Monte Cristo, smoothie, and some French Toast.  All fairly good, about par in terms of SF prices.  Cash only as many have mentioned.  It would be really nice if there were tables outside so one can take in Washington Park... but I guess that would mean people would sit longer and they can't serve as many.
author: Steven P.

description: The kids and searched for Mama's because it was listed as one of the top three breakfast places in San Francisco. It was worth waiting in line for! The kids wanted to go to IHOP but I made them wait and they understood why, once we got our food. All of our entrees were absolutely delicious!! It was well worth the wait! Definitely a lot more fun that any typical IHOP or diner. Go to Mama's and enjoy really good food!
author: Denise B.

description:
I've forgotten how amazing this place is.  It took years to again gather up the courage and patience to wait in line for more than an hour just to have their precious monte cristo. 

It takes even more courage and patience when the said wait is right after an 8-mile run from Fort Mason, down to the Ballpark, back up and through the little hill on Stockton between Bay St and Washington Sq.  (My two girl friends are uber masochists... I would've settled for Liguria's foccacia).

But we did wait, and after one hour of stretching our soon-to-be sore calf muscles, we were ushered in, ordered, and got seated immediately (they seem to have this awesome system where any groups that are allowed in are guaranteed a table by the time they are done with ordering!).  

We gulped the fresh orange juice in no time - it didn't even last the 10-minute wait for the monte cristo (ham and turkey double decker, fried in butter and egg - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=ok_wgYYS0-T1UcZRSfK9LA), eggs benedict (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=y-aHqSbCvJpIs1G88FvTrg) and french toast sampler (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=ok_wgYYS0-T1UcZRSfK9LA) to appear.  

The food suffered the same fate as we wolfed it down in 15 minutes flat, which must've made us the model customer for Mama's as it encourages faster table turnover!
author: Ange L.

description:
Excellent good and great service!  We went to Mama's since my wife and I were both off from work and my daughter;s school was cancelled due to a flu epidemic.  As usual the food was excellent.  I had the nelson's rancheros. My wife had the club sandwich and my daughter ordered her favorite french toast.  The ranchero was light and delicious with the tortilla and the french toast always hits the spot especially with the homemade jam.  Also, the tall waitress with short hair was wonderful.  She would come around every time she passed by and ask if I wanted more decaf coffee and how we were doing.  I was going to give it a 4 star because of the price but added another star because there was no line which meant no waiting.  Woohoo!  
Thanks again Mama!
author: Poboy U.

description:
I'm quite the fan... minus the super long wait (2 hours even though they told us 1hr15), which qualified for a star deduction. The french toast sampler was amazing. Reading all the reviews here, I couldn't understand how standard french toast could be SO amazing...

Easy: they don't make your run of the mill french toast. The sampler had a slice each of blueberry loaf, cranberry walnut (?) toast, and cinnamon toast. All were delicious. The syrup and homemade jam to put on top were amazing. And they had fruit!! and plenty of it! Raspberry, blueberry, strawberry, and banana... I LOVE FRESH FRUIT ON FRENCH TOAST! 

The waiters were uber friendly. I always love waiters in California, because we're generally friendly people... but the waiters at Mama's were genuinely sweet and friendly. The cashier-- the son of the owners-- was incredibly friendly and welcomed us since it was our first time. I love the fact that you pay first (makes it easy when you go with friends) and then get seated immediately. The waiters were super attentive with water and coffee.

The prices were very decent for San Francisco. $10.95 for a HUGE french toast sampler with homefries and toast on the side = AWESOME. 

The restaurant only seats about 30something... thus the long wait. If you get there any time after 9am, you will wait forever. The baked goods are drool worthy (albeit expensive). 

I wish they would open another store or expand... but I guess that would ruin the charm? Nah, I don't think so. I want my brunch, and I want it now!
author: Stef S.

description:
4 stars for the pastries, 3.5 for the rest of the food.  Honestly, I think breakfast is a little over hyped.  The place is good but there's nothing you couldn't make at home, assuming you had access to an unlimited supply of dungeness crab and shrimp. However, the baked goods are unique and definitely worth trying.

That being said, parking is awful in north beach, the wait is at least an hour long on weekends, and those two factors combined make Mama's a less favorable option for brunch.  

If you're looking for good brunch that's truly UNIQUE in the bay area, and not just something you can get anywhere (or cook at home), try Brenda's Soul Food or Red Door Cafe - now that is def worth a return visit, even if there's a wait.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
First, be prepared to be in the line for at least an hour. The later you go, the longer you'll have to wait as well. So, what you should do is to be there early.

Anyways, once you get in after waiting, it is a bit crowded, since it is a small restaurant. However, their food is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. My friend and I was there during Black Friday after a long morning of shopping, and we ordered egg benedict, french toast, and smoothies. Smoothies are really fresh and sweet, so it is a MUST for starters. Since this restaurant is well-known for egg dishes, order at least a benedict. The egg benedict was so delicious; it was like, melting in my mouth! French toast was great too! With berries on top, they blended well with the taste of the toast with syrup.

Great brunch restaurant. If you are in San Francisco, try it! Long wait really pays off.
author: Paul C.

description:
The line took an hour to get to the door, then an additional hour after we ordered to get our food. While it was very good, it isn't worth the wait! I can't justify a wait THAT long for average sized portions at typically SF city priced food. 
My husband and I ordered a variety of meals to get a feel for the food and honestly only one of the dishes stood out. The monte cristo- VERY good (5/5). Perfect combo of sweet & savory, wish we'd ordered two. We also ordered the French toast sampler (4/5) sweet, good breads but left you wanting sausage or bacon (I'm a big French Toast fan and it didnt wow me), the Northern Italian omelette(4/5) very juicy and a great combination of flavors, and Joe's burger (3/5) just an average burger, good size though. Definitely would recommend the Monte Cristo. My husband and I both agreed it was the best out of everything we ordered and we both wanted more! Really enjoyed the jam that went with it.. Though.. i must admit, i think i could make it at home myself. Omelette second, French toast third and not have ordered the burger. 

We also got a hot chocolate and some sort of berry smoothie. We spent $80 on everything not including tip. They were on it with filling up our waters- no joke. We gave them a good tip.
author: yve v.

description:
Voted by Time Magazine: The best place for breakfast in San Francisco. I have to agree! I made a point to clear a morning to try this wonderful gem! I took the advice, and pass it on to you, GO EARLY! I don't mean at opening. I mean an hour or more before opening. Within 30 minutes of opening, the line was blocks long, and I got to meet a lot of the locals and listen to their complaints. When I got on the trolly toward Washington Square, before the usual tourist-rush, he asked me if I was going to Mama's and he was right! Up to the article being published, it was San Fran's little secret. The locals said they could walk right up and maybe wait 10-15 minutes, and get in and out. Now, they huffed and complained as we waited 2 hours to get an early spot, but the line does move very quickly. So, apparently the longer wait is a result of the article, but I assure you, it is WELL worth the wait! But don't forget, the later you go, the longer the wait, and breakfast will switch to lunch, and you don't want that to happen.

At first it was a little awkward sitting by the door and window, having hundreds of people in line peering in at you to see what you ordered and watch you eat, but once the peach belini arrived, I cared a bit less. I ordered eggs benedict, and it was wonderful. I wanted to go more than once so I could try other items. But dedicating an entire morning more than once wasn't going to work for my short visit, but I did take some baked goods to go.

It was easy to find and easy to get to using public transportation. I opted to walk off breakfast and take alternate transportation to other parts of the city and finished the day with various park tours and was full all day. If you are a local, I feel your pain about losing easy access to your favorite spot, but if you are visiting, please carve a morning or two out to have breakfast at Mama's!

I went on Labor Day weekend in 2013, so I'm not sure how busy it is on a non-holiday weekend. Another plus is the restaurant is in a beautiful old house, so the atmosphere is full of charm.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
I came here because I had seen this place on the food network and there was so much buzz about it. I gotta say I was a bit disappointed. when I went there was a huge line to get in, it was like an hour wait. This cafe is really small with tiny tables. 
 
FYI this place is not a take a seat and ill take your order type of place. As you go in you have to chose what you want to order and pay as well. I ordered the French toast sampler and it was pretty good but very sweet, however I think that people hyped up this place too much.
author: Monica O.

description:
I, like some of the other reviewers have said, am not sure what all of the hype is about.  I am assuming that this must be recommended by every travel guide ever written on San Francisco and the yound clientele interested in anything trendy - and with a long line.  I have lived in the neighborhood a couple months and every time I walked by there was a line.  Finally, one week day morning, I came by and no line at all - actually I had to be the first person to wait outside the door before being allowed in to get in the indoor line at the counter.  The service at the counter is very slow but I think that is done to coordinate the seating inside.  After about 25 minutes I had ordered and paid and then waited another 5-10 minutes to be seated.

The food was good.  I had the orange juice and monte cristo.  At $17.00 it should be good.  The food ordered by other tables all around looked good, high quality and well prepared.  If just rating the food, I would probably give an extra star - although it is just breakfast people!!

The service was good - the staff well trained and they know how the place works.  Seems to be some confusion by the customers but the staff quickly comes to correct them.

Overall, I wouldn't hurry back and I would never wait in the long weekend line.  It's a solid place for breakfast but I just as prefer Cafe Divine or Cafe Hollywood within a couple blocks walk.
author: Ryan O.

description: I really enjoyed having breakfast here, granted I've only been here once! I love the atmosphere, the location, and the FOOD! The only sucky thing about the place is the wait, but when I came I didn't really have to wait too long! I think everyone should give this place a try, omelets are amazing!!! :)
author: Jenny E.

description:
Mama's food was good, but we waited literally 3 hours to get in and be seated. 

Would I do it again next time, definitely not. 

But, I would visit if there was absolutely no wait to get in.
author: Julie R.

description: The eggs benedict was good, but it wasn't worth the wait unfortuately.
author: Ruby K.

description:
I waited an hour to have breakfast at this place last Sunday. That's not normally something I would ever do, but in this case, it was totally worth it. This may be the best breakfast I've ever had. Once you get inside (and finish with the long wait), they actually have a pretty good system for getting diners in and out. And the service is actually excellent - they are quick to refill drinks and don't make you feel rushed at all.

As far as the food goes, I had the South of the Border omelet. It was a perfectly cooked omelet filled with chorizo, black beans, and monterey jack cheese. It came with some delicious potatoes and excellent rye toast.

This place lives up the hype. If you don't mind waiting, you won't be disappointed here. I mean, I got there at 8:10 AM, and still had to wait an hour to get seated. There's a reason why so many people come here...
author: Sean M.

description:
It was quite delicious and quaint, but I'm not sure it lives up to the hype and the 2hr line. I had a basic egg breakfast, shared the variety of French toast and got a slice of cake to bring home. The eggs were nothing to talk about. The French toast was fun mainly because they used things like banana bread and other fun breads as the base. It was very rich. 

Bottom line, I'd say it's something to do once, but I won't be rushing back. There are plenty of equally as good and charming without the long wait in the area.
author: Angela C.

description:
Yum yum yum yum

The usual: 
Monte cristo
Any One of the benidicts
Blueberry sour cream crumble coffee cake
Fresh squeezed oj

Yum yum yum yum
Worth the crazy wait.
Crazy to wait and keep wanting to go back. ;)
author: Sara P.

description: Read their reviews and found out it's rated within top 10 among 3000+ SF restaurants and thought we should give it a try (knowing there'd be a line waiting). We went on a Friday early noon and a line was waiting already. We waited about 30-40 minutes but hey,,, it's just so worth the wait. By time you enter Mama's you'll be attracted to their central kitchen and all the food display and forget about the long wait you just had haha. We had Mimosas, hot coffee, fruit plate along with our Shrimp and Avocado Benedict and Egg White Scramble and two other entries which I couldn't recall haha... But believe me, they were ALL GOOD!!! All ingredients were fresh and the potatoes were just delicious. I loved my benedict! Too bad I didn't have room to try their pancakes but hey I'd be there again FOR SURE!!!
author: Jocelyn S.

description: This place was great. Went there around 11.30am and waited 1 hr to get in.  Once in, I had to wait for another 30min to order and for the food to be delivered.  Ordered the crab Benedict and it was great.  My suggestion is to grab some pastry across the street while you wait.
author: Henry T.

description:
Normally, I wouldn't be happy waiting 1.5 hours in line for food.  However, for Mama's, I'd gladly do it again!  After waiting outside and being serenaded by a homeless man looking for some change, we were let inside the super cute restaurant.  We had to wait a little longer inside, as you order and pay first before being seated.  

We were seated next to the front door that's one of those half-closed, half-open types so on a nice day like today, it was nice to have the fresh air.  Shortly after settling in at the table under the jealous stares of those in line, our hot cocoas came out, with a nice heap of fresh whip cream.  

After waiting so long and feeding our parking meter 3 times, I was starving.  Our food finally came.  There was just 2 of us, and we probably ordered more than we can handle, but we figured, why not go all out after spending all morning standing around.  

We had the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast, the Blackstone Eggs Benedict, and the Dollar Sized Pancakes on the side.  The eggs benedict was my favorite!  The dollar pancakes were light and fluffy; nothing extraordinary, but still delicious nonetheless.  I wish I wore my fat pants today, so I could eat even more!    

Again, be prepared to wait, but its worth it!
author: K C.

description:
OHHHHHHHHHH MAMA! 

Banana nut french toast and olallieberry (house) jam! 
spread it on EVERYTHING!
author: Jessica L.

description: After waiting in line for an hour, we had an amazing experience! The egg benedict, the Monte Carlo and the orange french toast are incredible! The coffee and the blueberry cake are also delicious! I highly recommend the place!
author: Julia G.

description: So good!!! Been there twice!! Bloody Mary and egg Benedict were excellent. Will definitely visit every time we go to the city.
author: Joann J.

description: It was good food. I got the monte cristo and it was something new to me but it wasn't to die for food. I wouldn't wait 2 hrs to go into Mama's again. Once was enough for me.
author: Sheena R.

description:
Seriously, the best brunch in the city. I love brunch and I have visited so many brunch places here. But nothing beats Mama's. Maybe it's the cozy and homey atmosphere of Mama's and the friendly people who work here, always ready with a smile.

You can't go wrong with anything you order here. The homemade pancakes and the french toast are amazing! Try the French Toast Sampler. Three kinds of homemade bread are used (Swedish Cinnamon, Banana Nut and Cranberry Walnut) with fresh berries (blueberries, strawberries and raspberries) and bananas on top and a side of maple syrup. Heaven, I tell ya!

But my absolute favorite dish is the Eggs Florentine. I am a big spinach and mushroom fanatic and the amount of spinach and mushroom they pile on this is just heavenly. 

It's always a good thing that they're situated by Washington Square coz you'll feel the need to walk off all that food you just had.

I have brought almost everyone I know to Mama's. And all of them love it! A trip to San Francisco is not complete trip for them without a trip to Mama's.
author: Jaclyn A.

description:
Every morning on the weekend I pass by Mama's and there is a line stretching around the block. The other day decided to brave it and stand in line to see what the hype is all about. 

The food was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend getting any of their crab dishes. 

The only reason they get 4 stars is the wait. Took us nearly 1.5 hours to get a table. Turns out the place is really tiny inside.
author: Vladimir G.

description: Don't get scared of the long line, its worth it!! Go in and you'll enjoy anything (Monte Cristo is a must try!)  you'll order.
author: Meher S.

description: We got there at 8:15 AM (well, my friend did), and we didn't get into the restaurant until 10:00 AM ish. So, expect long wait! The crabcake benedict was worth the money. The staff was very nice and warm.
author: Justina L.

description: Food was good, waiting in line for over an hour on a Friday at 10:30am, not so much.  If you're willing to wait, I'd highly recommend the Spanish Benedict (was on the Specials menu).  I would love to go back to try the Salmon Benedict, if the line wasn't so long!
author: Wesley W.

description:
For breakfast this is the place to go!  We went there 20min early on a Thursday morning prior to 8 and a line had already started to form.  By 8 the line had already reached back a block.  It gives you plenty of time to look at the menu on your mobile device.

You finally get access to the place and you walk in.  You go up to the counter and place your order.  Larger parties they sometimes sit and provide table service.  After ordering you find a seat and they will bring it all there.  Went with the Bloody Mary to start (spicy with what appears to be a small salad) followed up by the north beach Benedict.  I have to say one of the best breakfasts I have ever had.  The wait staff was extremely pleasant and wonderful.  Me and the misses will be going back there when we come to San Fran again.  Go early to get in early (20-30min prior to opening to save you that hour to hour and one half wait)
author: Jamie B.

description: Extrordinary food and service. Waited in line for a little over an hour on a Wednesday morning. Best breakfast in San Francisco!
author: Jeff F.

description:
French toast was amazing. They use fresh baked bread and
have a selection of many types.

Paisano benedict was delicious with pancetta. 

And their dungeness crab omlette was amazing. The pinnacle of breakfast dishes.

This is the BEST breakfast spot in SF.

Arrive early, before they open to not have to wait too long.
author: Chris K.

description: Incredibly long line but absolutely worth it. Staff is friendly but the food is amazing. I had the French toast sampler. Definitely going again!
author: Steve C.

description:
Very good breakfast. I would give it 4 stars if I hadn't waited almost 2 hours on a Tuesday morning. 

It's worth trying, but I would definitely not wait in line like that again... It's good, but not that good. 

I had Eggs Benedict with prosciutto and grilled tomatoes, it came with potatoes and a few pieces of fruit. Very good, but again, not so sure it was 2 hour line good.

My bf's meal was better-- he got the French toast sampler which came with 3 different types of French toast. His was super yummy, although the potatoes are lackluster.

All in all, a really great meal, but I left feeling underwhelmed after standing outside for 2 hours. I read a review from someone who got the food to-go and went to sit in the park instead of waiting in line. I'd suggest this option. Also, I wish I tried the Monte Cristo because everyone raved about it.
author: Melinda M.

description:
I came here with my coworker friends after indoor rock climbing on Saturday.  We came late in the afternoon after 2:30 and didn't have to wait, which made it a pleasant experience as we were all starved from working out.

We all drank Mama's Spiked Lemonades and ordered a Momelette or other egg dish and shared the buttermilk pancakes and
Swedish cinnamon French toast.  Mickey, Ray, and I liked the pancakes better because they were light and fluffy, but Julie and Will liked the french toast better because it came with berries and was crispetty crunchy cinnamony on the outside and soft and moist on the inside.  

I was very satisfied with my egg white Northern Italian Momelette with no cheese, but I really wish they had waffles.
author: LeAnne H.

description:
Best post-workout meal :)

5 times up and down the steps of Lyon? Uhhmm hell yeah I'm going to reward myself! There's always a line outside because the place is so small. But the wait isn't bad if you're indecisive like I am. There's a menu that you can look at on the glass window of the restaurant. The hostess will let you in depending on the order line moving inside. 

The Northern Italian M'omelette was tasty!  The pancetta and garlic jack cheese was what hooked me!  Yummy little Italy sitting on a plate in front of me. I like to order the favorites of places but this time I took a risk and wanted to try something different. My opinion on the N.Italian, must try! MMMMMMmmm'omelette!

I tried the dungeness crab benedict and it has a whole lot of spinach and crab piled on two ,what seemed small (compared to the pile), english muffins. Definitely yummy. Definitely a must try.

And this is kind of sad but... This is the first time that I've ever tried toast, butter, and jam all together. I was lovin it.... . Why didn't I try this sooner in life? If you never had this, please do.

Mama's got it goin onnnn.
author: Maiden D.

description:
I heart Mama's! 

Here's why you have to go:

1. The experience.  You wait in a long line in a beautiful and bustling area of north beach and finally snake your way through the cozy restaurant that feels like grandmas kitchen. (I suggest grabbing a coffee for the line)

2. Their Eggs Benedict...to die for.

It's so much fun!!
author: Laryssa S.

description: on our third trip to San Francisco I convinced my husband to STAND IN LINE to eat at Mama's.  Worth the long wait????? Have to say it was one of the better breakfasts we had especially the monte cristo - it was unique and delicious see why it is a signature dish.  I had a omelet  with shrimp, asparagus and cheeses which was okay if it wasn't for the monte cristo I would have been upset waiting in line for a hour plus.  Would have loved to go back but not wait in line for that length of time now at least I can say we tried it.....
author: Cathi B.

description: It is a great place! I live in the neigborhood and I always pass by. The line scares me, but I guess even though it was Friday today, the wait was only couple of minutes...so not too bad. I got the salmon eggs Benedict and they were excellent! Great staff and friendly environment! I would love to try everything on the menu.
author: Aleksandra G.

description:
While walking down Stockton St. towards Pier 39 in 2008, I marveled at the long line outside of Mama's but I quickly lost interested since it was my first time in San Francisco in 8 years and I wasn't much of a "foodie" back then. I was more interested in being a tourist and visiting the beautiful landmarks that San Francisco had to offer.  

Two years later, my interest now revolves around eating and some more eating. That being said, I reflected back on the time when I marveled at the long line outside of Mama's and decided to FINALLY try it out. 

The wait is long but it's organized nonetheless. My boyfriend, my brother, our friend, and I waited for about an hour and a half to get in Mama's. We ordered Monte Cristo sandwiches and the French Toast Sampler. The French Toast Sampler came with a Banana Nut, Swedish Cinnamon, and Cranberry-Orange Walnut french toast (the latter not being my favorite but LOVED the Banana Nut). In my opinion, my boyfriend's Monte Cristo was definitely worth the wait. And to our surprised, it's delicious dipped with the homemade jam.
