If I were to come back, I'd skip on the sampler and order the Banana Nut French Toast and the Monte Cristo.
author: Katherine A.

description: We went for our first breakfast of our honeymoon and it did bot disappointed. I love breakfast, it is my favorite meal, and i do my research to find the best eggs benedict for me and the best french toast/sweets for my wife. We were both trilled, everythings was amazing. We arrived at 7:45 and 18 people were already in line before us. So the only thing... Arrive early and remember cash or debit card only. Its a mist try in my opinion and only a short walk away from fisherman warf.
author: Philippe P.

description: This little breakfast joint is really good. The wait for us was 45 minutes but it was worth it. The crab & egg benedict with potatoes was the best I've ever tasted. The egg is made to PERFECTION!!! I kid you not, it's perfect. I never knew that egg can taste so good. I also love crab meat. The combination of egg, crab meat, and potatoes were so good. The plate is a lil' on the pricier side. It was close to $20 for the entree. I don't think breakfast should cost that much but it was all about quality. I'm willing to pay for quality and taste. Mama's, it was my first time there and you scored with me. Oh, the bathroom is a little odd. It's really tiny and it's sort of outside and in the back. It's a one person only kind of toilet. You walk pass the tiny kitchen and down the stairs and you hit straight into the tiny bathroom. It was small but at least it wasn't filthy.
author: Linh N.

description:
Obviously Mama's is tried and true. Why do people still wait 2 hours to get a seat here on the weekends? They do have damn good food. 

I just can't do the wait anymore. One crazy Saturday I woke up at 6am to get over here and start waiting. WHAT WAS I THINKING? That isn't okay. We San Franciscans are crazy. 

That being said, Mama's, your food is great. I am sorry your wait is bringing your rating down but really that means you are making loads of money so I'm sure you will not mind. Some day I would like to see you again, but I just can't drool in line for another two hours before anything hits my belly.
author: Raina B.

description: Wed afternoon, arrived at 1140A, total wait time to be seated 1.5hr. Yup, it's bad, but we got some focaccia across the street to nibble on. Hubs and I ordered corned beef, Monte Cristo, and French Toast sampler - all really good! Although, I wouldn't get the sampler, just regular French Toast. Love the quaint atmosphere - just wished it was a little bigger or had indoor waiting area. Staff was really friendly and attentive. Everything came out to $60, tip included.
author: Freckles H.

description:
This place was quite small, so the lines can get ridiculous if you don't get here early enough. Once you get in, you then have to wait in another line to order food and pay before you're seated.

Anyways, food was pretty good--portion was pretty sizable and they don't skimp on the good stuff, like the crab. I tried the Crab Benedict, Mama's Breakfast Sandwich, and the Toast Sampler. Everything was far from terrible, it's pretty solid food but it's not exactly "party-in-your-mouth" memorable either. If I had to recommend something, it's probably the Breakfast Sandwich. Crab Benedict was good, but not for that price point. To be fair though, I had a mindblowing Eggs Benedict experience elsewhere and haven't recovered from it. 

Service was very minimal in our experience. You order the food, sit down, they bring it to you, and you're pretty much left alone until you're finished. My friend had a fly in his mimosa, and it took a while--and by that I mean, we were already finished with our food by then--to get someone to notice that we were trying to get someone's attention.

All in all, I like the food here but if I think about the wait time and the service, I'd rather go somewhere else.
author: Sylvia S.

description:
Love, LOVE, LOVE this place!!! If you've read any of my other reviews you probably know I am not much of a breakfast gal- however Mama's may have just changed that!!! 
My family and I took a week long vacation out to SF and my cousins who live out there treated us to breakfast at Mama's. Since I generally skip breakfast 5 out of the 7 days of the week I had never had eggs benedict.  I saw the menu for the Dungeness Crab Benedict With Fresh Spinach and decided to try them out, I figured it had seafood so I was bound to like it.  And I LOVED IT!! Cleared my plate!!! Something I don't think I've ever done when it comes to breakfast. Too bad we live in san Diego otherwise I would def be here every weekend. 
My son had th pancakes and they were hands down the BEST pancakes I have ever had!  My hubby had the Blackstone benedicts and it was delish as well.  Everyone at the table was HAPPY!!! Thank you Mama's!!!!!!
Now i am on a mission to try out the breakfast spots in my town to find something similar. I use to HATE eggs and now I love me some eggs benedict. 

The line was about an hour long- but DEF worth it!!! 

QUICK TIP: DEBIT CARDS & CASH ONLY
author: Cel P.

description: The wait is ridiculous and not worth it. Yes, the monte cristo is good, but what everyone fails to mention is that it is TINY. It did not fill me up at all and I was very disappointed. Honestly, it is easy to make at home, just french toast with ham and cheese. The interior is cute and the workers are nice, but no... just no. It's a one time excursion to washington square for me. And to all the tourists out there thinking this is "must" when in San Francisco, DON'T WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME IN LINE! There are so many other good breakfast/brunch places in sf that do not have lines.
author: Liz R.

description:
The food was yummy.   Loved the potatoes.  Crab Benedict was excellent.  The French toast sampler was tasty.  If there was a next time, I'd stick with the cranberry French toast.  The mango smoothie was delicious.  

You already know the wait is ridiculous.  I have to say, as good as the food was, I wouldn't wait another 2 hours to eat there.
author: Aamir Z.

description:
Best breakfast in the city! Favorites on the menu is the monte cristo w/their homemade jam, south of the border omelette w/avocado, and the french toast w/apples..i think it was.

crab & shrimp benedict specials on the weekends only...still haven't tried it.

SO GOOD! it really adds up. just know u better get your ass in line early. i've lived here for 4yrs and probably been here only 5 or 6 times. its way too crazy of a line if u dont get there early. assign someone to wait in line while you park the car. bring a ton of quarters for the meter. and cash coz its cash only.
author: Natassia S.

description:
I took off 2 stars because there's barely any parking and the wait was almost 2 hours so I kept having to go back to add coins to the meter. Also, the French toast was dry. 

I came here on a Tuesday around 11:30am and there was STILL a line! This place is pretty small which is why the wait is so long. Even when you get in to order your food at the register, you still have to wait to be seated. But once seated, the food comes right out. 

  I got the Smoked Salmon Scramble, the Monte Cristo, and the French toast sample. The smoked salmon scramble was amazing and so was the monte cristo. Their homemade jam also made the monte cristo even MORE UH-AMA-ZING! The French toast on the other hand was extremely dry even with the syrup and the extra homemade jam I added. I won't ever get that again.

I can't say anything bad about the service. I just felt a little rushed because of the enormous line outside... People just kept coming. I'd come here again for the monte cristo and only if the line isn't too long.
author: Jonina A.

description: The food here is great. I love their homemade jam. However, the line to get into the restaurant is not so great. Even when you're finally in the restaurant, patrons are forced to crowd around the cashier while awaiting a seat. Additionally, this restaurant is WAY too small. Furthermore, our waiter was super nice, but the cashier seemed incredibly unhappy. If I had to choose between this place and Brenda's for breakfast/brunch, I would choose Brenda's without hesitation.
author: Jolie C.

description: I simply crave their French toast sampler, soooo good. Everything on the menu: omelettes and scrambles are yummy. Don't forget to have a glass of fresh orange juice!
author: Kanwal A.

description: Cash and card accepted. This is a cute and small place on the corner of Stockton and Filbert in North Beach. You can try to find street parking/metered parking in the area, but much like other areas in SF, parking can be difficult to find. I've been here for breakfast twice on two different Saturdays: the first time I waited 2 hours starting at 10:30 am and the second time I waited 3 hours started at 11 am. Both times the food was well worth the wait. (If you know you're going to go to Mama's for breakfast and you don't want to wait as long, get there a little before 8 am) I think everyone should try the crab benedict at least once so I would definitely recommend that. Other tasty items I've had include the Florentine benedict, Swedish cinnamonl french toast, and huevos rancheros. 4 stars for the excellent food and good service despite how busy it is, but minus one star just because the wait is so long.
author: Allyson R.

description:
Tried it. LOVED IT!

I've been to Dottie's, been to Stack's, been to Zazie's, Park Chow, etc. but none of them top Mama's. I was pretty reluctant to go to this 5-star yelp rated spot because every time I try a so-called "5-star" restaurant, I always get disappointed because of the hype. This one, did NOT disappoint (I am HAPPY to say!!).

Got the Monte Cristo everyone's been raving about and the Swedish Cinnamon Toast, blueberry muffin, and 2 coffees. Came here on a Saturday morning with my handsome fiance and lined up at 7:45am to be one of the first 15 in line and in for breakfast. Everything was great from the coffee to the service to the wonderful food! Total was $29.45 for the two of us. (Really was $28.45 but an extra $1 was charged since we used our debit card) 

Service was great and our coffee cups were always filled to the top. The Monte Cristo was scrumptious: soft and crispy, sweet and savory -- each bite of ham & cheesy goodness was TDF (to die for!). The Swedish Cinnamon Toast was awesomeness in every bite, and the fruit to go along with it on the side was chez per-FICK! The coffee was a yummy way to sit back, sip, enjoy the food and scenery while taking it all in. 

*But hurry up as you take it all in... there's a long list of people waiting behind you! But then again... sip slowly since you too, had to wait in that line. =P CHEERS!!
author: Maria C.

description:
Went on a Thursday at 1:30, luckily the line was about a 30 min wait.

Ordered the monte cristo sandwich which has turkey, ham, provolone, and cheddar cheese melted and then finished off like with a French toast like batter and served with their own strawberry preserves. Great combo of salty, sweet, AND the creamy texture of melted cheese. Worth trying out if you're a cheese lover.
author: jeff s.

description: My boyfriend took me to mamas for my birthday. At first I was a little skeptical considering we had to wake up super early to drive 2 hrs just to get there and wait in line. I'll tell you this was THE BEST PART of our whole day in San Francisco! This restaurant is definitely worth the wait! The food was amazing! I haven't had breakfast that good ever! I will for sure be going back.
author: Leah W.

description:
I'm sorry, but this place is over-hyped. Having lived down the street from it for 2 years, I've burned many hours standing in line.

Don't get me wrong, the food is good and the ambiance is really really cute, but you have to physically stand in line for the wait, and can't even put your name down or leave a number to walk around. 

I've had the french toast, pancakes, and many of the omelets. All were good but not memorable. Portions are a bit small and on the pricier side.

If you have time to spare and don't mind a long wait, it's fine. But there are definitely better brunch places in SF.
author: Ruth H.

description:
what a wait. i waited two hours to eat here. but the food is pretty darn good. is it worth the wait? i'm on the fence. if you have good company to talk to, then yes, time passes by quickly. if not, then skip this haha

i ordered the french toast sampler because everyone mentioned it on here but i was really blown away by their pancakes (got the berries). you HAVE to order the pancakes. their washington omelet and smoked salmon benedict were good too. i dont think you would be disappointed with either but you really gotta order the PANCAKES! 

the place is pretty small which would explain the long wait. and it was pretty pricey. we ordered the four mentioned above and two orange juices and one grapefruit juice, a total of $60!
author: Eliza C.

description:
I know, I know...huge line. Although people tend to wait between 45 minutes to over an hour, it was worth it. My boyfriend hates waiting in line, but even he was quite pleased after. After waiting in line, we splurged and started with the chocolate crumb cake (we were hoping to save it for after to take home but we devoured that delicious cake), mimosa (I would skip on this next time...quite small), and bloody mary (yums and perfect for the morning). 

Then we got the crab omelet with havarti cheese and other things (can't remember all of it). That omelet was perfectly cooked and loaded with crab. We also got the french toast sampler and it was like french cake. Perfect mix of sweet and salty. 

Tips: Come early (like right when it opens), know what you are going to order (you order right when you come in and then get seated), WAIT to get seated after you order, leave the tip on the table.
author: Tif L.

description:
Mama's was definitely yummy. I had ordered the smoked salmon omelet added some goat cheese in it too, it was mouth watering yummers. My plate came with roasted potato's (not a fan of them) and a bagel with whipped cream cheese.

They had made homemade jam in the house, raspberry. I think this was my favorite thing in the whole brunch I shared with my cousins. It was amazing and it went really well with my bagel.

It was a group of 7 girls so we got to try a whole bunch of diffrent items. My favorites were obviously the smoked salmon omelet, the chocolate chip crumb cake and the chocolate Cinnamon french toast.

I'd recommend those items. I did also try a french toast with apples and the orange-cranberry french toast, but I was not a fan of those. They did look pretty though.

Cons:
The wait. We waited 2 hours!
The waitress - had like a stick up her butt.
and
They only take cash or debit cards.


Overall I would give it a 3.5 rating... put it as a 4 because its more than a three.

And maybe the waitress was just having a bad day - we all have those. The food was good, I'd go again.
author: Muneera M.

description:
I loved Mama's! We arrived at 8:25am on a Saturday and sat down an hour later.  Which we were told wasn't too bad.  It was worth the wait.  The atmosphere is bright and cute- the food is amazing.

We ate:
Chocolate Crumb Cake
Dungeness Crab Omelet
French Toast Sampler

Delicious! We will be back!
author: Christy L.

description:
haven't been in a while but their monte cristo is delicious with their homemade jam!
the wait is crazy though.
author: Heejin L.

description: Well, let me start off with the fact that we waited in line for 2 hours (exactly 120 minutes, we timed it). We came at 11am hoping for breakfast, and got seated at 1pm ready for lunch. However, we weren't going to let the wait take away from our meal, since people rave that it is the most extraordinary breakfast place in San Francisco. After such a long line, my friend and i decided we needed to try everything, we got the monte cristo, washington square omlette, florentine eggs benedict, chocolate crumble, berry smoothie, and fresh-squeezed lemonade. Was the food good? Yes. Was is the best breakfast of my life? No. Was it something special that I couldn't make at home? No. The monte cristo was the most unique item on the menu, a must try if you haven't had it before (you will be surprised how good turkey goes with sweet), but if you have had it before, then this will be nothing special and actually a little dry. The omlette and benedict where really just that, a simple omlette and benedict with sausage. The berry smoothie was just fresh berries in a blender, and the lemonade tasted like regular lemonade. The chocolate crumble was extremely sweet (and I love sweet!), but this was a bit over-bearing. Overall, decent food, but there is better in the city and with a much shorter/no line.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Mama's...worth the wait?  Hm.  It depends.  We waited 1 hour for breakfast, on a Saturday, during prime breakfast time (late morning).  The food is very good, for sure.  I am not one to wait a long time for meals, though.  I enjoy eating, but as part of my day, not the sole activity.  Grab some coffee at the cafe kitty-corner, across the park, to keep you company while you stand, and stand, and stand.  (When are they going to invent a thing to sit on, in a line?  They could call it a bench!)  Anyway, snottiness aside, I would come back here, yes, I would.  I would arrive at 7:30 and be seated when they open at 8.  (I'd still get coffee to keep me company.)  There is no list, BTW; you just wait.  

Baked goods: yum.  I had a blueberry crumb cake.  Not out-of-this-world, but yummy.  Eggs benedict was most tasty, especially with smoked salmon.  I substituted potatoes for fruit.  Pricey, but good.  The buttermilk pancakes were heavenly -- fluffy and just so perfectly pancakey.  

The atmosphere is sufficiently breakfast-appropriate.  Friendly, squished seating.  You have to squeeze past the line cooks to get to the dinky restroom, but they're very friendly and accommodating.  The only thing is, you are on display for everyone who is in line, waiting and watching you eat.
author: Ollie P.

description:
Mama's has the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. I ordered the Blackstone Eggs Benedict which substituted the Canadian bacon with regular bacon and added tomato. The result is marvelous! The potatoes were also very tasty.We saw many delicious looking pastries while ordering at the register,so I decided to order a slice of carrot cake  to go. We absolutely loved the carrot cake.It was very moist and the cream cheese frosting wasn't too sweet. Every person at our table loved their breakfast and the wait service provided.

1 star deducted for having to stand outside in the rain for over an hour and for having to deal with the crazy bearded homeless man. Boy did he have a foul mouth. Plus he kept yelling out at a member of my party, "Hey you, white boy!" Luckily, my group was laid back about it, but the older couples around us were obviously uncomfortable around him. He said he has a YouTube page, so I guess this is his way of achieving fame?
author: Kat M.

description:
Better than Dotties? hmmmm, I think not but pretty delicious.  We had our monthly work team lunch at Mama's. The wait at 11AM was about an hour! Errrr...long lunch but luckily the boss was with us!

My boss and I actually split the Monte Cristo Sandwich and the French Toast Sampler topped with fresh seasonal berries.I loved the Banana Walnut French Toast the best.  The Monte Cristo was really nice with the home made jam but was pretty much a dessert.  

The consensus among my coworkers was that the food was indeed good but was it worth the wait....eh not really. My quick tip of the day would be go around 1pm. The line was non-existent when we left.

Also...remember to bring cash. They do take debit but they charge a $1 service fee.
author: Debbie C.

description: I was lucky to go there on a rainy friday morning, I have waited for only 1 hour. Typical American brunch, love french toast, the one with fruit and chocolate, and monte cristo. I tried to go there twice after the first time, but there were tooooo many people waiting, I don't think it worth that long time waiting.
author: Pelou G.

description:
Why oh why must your line be so loooongggg? Even right after you open? Literally, 8 minutes post opening your restaurant, and I'm already waiting in line that reaches the sidewalk. It's okay though, the french toast compensated for my time. Most people have to wait longer. That's understandable. Since your food is so darn good. Great job on the decor as well. It feels like a mother's kitchen. 

Note to self: come back here and order the Monte Cristo.
author: Charisma Y.

description: Finally caved in and decided to visit Mama's. The food was good, but not sure I would put myself through that waiting line more than twice a year. There is always a line, but it might be slightly shorter during the week (we went on a Wednesday). Give it a try though, it might just hit the spot for you.
author: V M.

description: Amazing and well worth the wait.  Their Monte Cristo (made with french toast rather than Texas toast) is amazing.  Their strawberries and orange slices are noticeably fresh and tasty.  I recommend this to anyone looking for a local, memorable experience.
author: Joel L.

description: I love their french toast. I also love the idea. Although waiting in line for 1.5 hour plus seems crazy, sometimes it's worth it and this is one of those times.  They take good care of you,  they serve amazing food. I don't think anyone could ask for more. Now I give four stars because maybe,  just maybe,  I could make my own banana french toast and still be happy.  But I honestly believe one visit to this place and you will have a moment of happiness forever in your memories.  I know I do. Yeah,  cheezy, whatever.
author: Larissa M.

description: If you do one breakfast place in San Francisco, this is the place. We waited 90 minutes but it was definitely worth it. The omelettes were fluffy and delicately balanced in flavours. The pancakes were soft, consistent, and also a beautiful balance of sweet and salty. Well presented too.
author: Ash T.

description:
Don't Bother - incredibly underwhelming...

I saw this on a top list to do in San Fran, and after waiting for 2 hours, made it inside, to discover a further 30 minute wait. The food was standard brunch food, and nothing exceptional to warrant the wait. Eggs, bacon, various Benedicts, etc. etc.

Server was completely checked out, and inattentive.

No Credit Cards - in 2013.
author: Michael J.

description:
I love this place, and I think it's worth the wait, but you must be willing to make this your morning activity, so I only go with good friends who appreciate a good breakfast. You will wait 30 min to an hour (on the weekend)-- instead of complaining, just enjoy your time waiting by talking to your friends. The earlier you get here, the better; the line only gets longer.

The line leads you to a counter where you order your food. Upon ordering, you are seated, and you'll receive your food in 10 min or so. I think it's the most efficient a popular place like Mama's can be. Mama's has a very homey feel, which i'm surprised they maintain, considering how busy it gets. 

I LOVE all of their French toast, but I'd recommend getting the French Toast Sampler so you can try 3 different kinds. The Pan Dore (sauteed apples with lemon butter sauce) is pretty damn heavenly.

I also love their eggs benedict, and I've only had one of their Momelettes, but that was pretty solid as well.
author: Saori E.

description:
Wow. 

Whenever I have a great review to write, or a horrible one, I wait at least a day before I do so. The absolute tasty euphoria in my mind's eye that was Mama's has not diminished! 

My wife and I arrived at 8:45a and found a line roughly 20 people deep waiting for us. I estimated that to be a 45 minute wait, but it turned out to be twice as long. That's the only negative I have to say. And that's pretty good if the only complaint a person has for your restaurant is that it's so good and so popular! 

I had the traditional eggs benedict, my wife had the northern italian omelette, and we shared the swedish cinnamon french toast. Each a perfect blend of simple, yet dynamic flavors. Hands down the best hollendaise sauce I've had at a restaurant. I prefer when it's more lemon-y than buttery, and that's what you find here. It gives the illusion that it's healthy! Ha! It clogs the arteries just the same, but it's worth it when it tastes this good. And the ham used was the perfect thickness, not so much that it overwhelms the dish with saltiness, and not so thin that it's for looks only and provides no flavor. And the english muffin, simplest of simple things (yet so often a disappointment at other places) was toasted in just the right way, crispy edges, but not difficult to cut. 

The omelette was the most surprising for me, every ingredient used was bursting with flavor. Italian bacon, basil, tomatoes, garlic jack, it was a shame I only snagged a bite or two - but it was enough to get the point. 

And the french toast was mouth watering - a perfect breakfast dessert to share and finish off our meal. 

This place is worth the wait, and has more than earned it's five star rating from me.
author: Mark D.

description:
The wait. It was long! And the place is super tiny! Good thing the neighborhood had little pastry shops to snack on but really.. The wait! The main reason why we stayed in line is because we were waiting for so long already, I had a snack, and I've been wanting to eat here for awhile.. Along with their cute restaurant name as well! 
When you finally reach the door you would think you finally get to eat! You're wrong.. You have to wait in another line inside to order and to wait even longer for people to leave in order to sit! 
I had the Monte Cristo and it was all worth it in the end! Along with my piggy who got an omelet.. I can't remember what it was called but it was sure tasty! I'd love to eat here again if I only had to wait at least 15 minutes for a table. Overall it was good but hated the wait! 
Also the couple who was in front of us the whole 2 hours.. Get a room.. Like seriously! I took plenty of pictures of you making out the whole time cause I wanted to put y'all on blast for too much PDA! No one needs to be looking at y'all while enjoying their meal.. Barf!
author: Jenn T.

description: When we first went there wasnt a long line to get in, but the second time the line kept getting bigger and bigger! It was worth the wait though! Get the BLT w/ sourdough bread. Best thing ever.
author: Mayra A.

description: No wait on my BDAy, and it's a Wednesday, SCORE! Everything we ordered that day was super tasty, and the staff are super friendly.  Thank you Mama's for making my bday awesome!
author: Tess C.

description: Mama's always impresses everything I visit. The place is famous and it should be because everything on the menu is so delicious I can never decide what I want until the last minute! Such a hard decision but never a bad one. The French toast is obviously famous, the lox platter is something special, and the MonteCristo is always a safe pick. Ugh I'm about to order more food and I just ate here!
author: Enrique M.

description:
Oh Mama's, what am I gonna do if I ever move out of SF? I crave Mama's in my sleep. I dream of Mama's. I've been here a few times, all on Sundays, and the longest I've waited was 2 hours. It goes by fast if you have someone entertaining with you in line. Sometimes I wish Mama's would take names down, so you could spend the hour wait sunbathing in the park. The hardest part is finding PARKING, but it's do-able. My favorite is the french toast, but just about anything and everything is good here. You can't go wrong!

Also, they don't take credit cards. Only cash & debit cards.
author: Lily Z.

description:
I would eat this every single day if I could. If my future husband could cook like the Mama's chefs, I'd die a happy, satisfied, and well fed woman. I seriously cannot get over how good this meal was.

Because we waited about 1.5 hours to get a table, we decided to order 4 entrees for the two of us. (The waiter was all, "That's A LOT of food guys..." but little did she know, we were starving! and we're champs at eating!) We got the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict, the French Toast Sampler (Cinnamon, banana, and cranberry walnut), the apple yogurt dipped french toast, and an omelette. The crab eggs benedict was out of this world, possibly the best one I have ever had in my life. The sauce was so creamy and the chunks of fresh crab meat were HUGE. Love the spinach, love the potatoes on the side. The french toast sampler is my second favorite; I really liked how each of the freshly baked breads (baked in their restaurant!) had different flavors that gave each bite a unique kick. I smothered all three pieces in the homemade jam at the table, which I recommend you do as well.

If you come here, order the specials; don't go for the plain jane stuff you can get at other brunch places. And be prepared to wait at least an hour on a Sunday afternoon. Trust me it is SO worth it though! I polished off all my food!
author: Joyce H.

description:
While on an early morning walk, the line forming outside Mama's door caught my attention so I busted out my cell to check Yelp and see what the wait was all about. Had I not had breakfast an hour prior, I would've jumped on line and personally tested the goodness raved about Mama's. But I instead gave my food baby more digesting time and decided to return a few days after. 

I, based on others' reviews, ordered the French Toast sampler (Kugelhopf, Banana Nut, and Cranberry Orange) and my friend ordered their Monte Cristo. Their Monte Cristo was perfect and I'd place their French Toast close to the top of my list. 

I'd definitely return to Mama's again but on a weekend so I can try their Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict - the dish's name alone conjures food-related daydreams.

I didn't give this delicious-dish-making establishment 5 stars because of the wait line - I hate waiting for anything that I have to pay for.
author: Patricia L.

description:
So this place had a really interesting way of seating/ordering. I really enjoyed this place because there seemed to be a big commotion (enough to have a block-long line in front of it). My mother and I decided to eat here later when the line was considerable shorter. 

When we returned, the crowdedness subsided and we had about a 2 minute wait outside the venue. Then we waited in another line to order, which took another 15 minutes, then lastly, we waited about 10 minutes to be seated (but in this cramped place, 25 minutes feels like torture). THe service was crappy prior to getting a seat. In fact some of the waitresses were outright rude. But after being seated, they lightened up and actually managed to bring a smile to our faces. 

We ordered and split a Health Shake, and the Northwest Omelet. They were both really good. I loved the smoked salmon and how it just combined with the sour cream all enveloped in perfectly cooked eggs. They know their stuff here and that's why they are still here today. The shake was amazing. Thick and creamy, just the way i like it.

TL;DR
Good: Health shake and NW omelet
Bad: crappy service before seating and weird ordering/seating methods.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I really don't understand the hype about this place. My French Toast was dry and the fruit that came with it wasn't ripe. I'll admit that it has been a little while since my visit but if memory serves it didn't come with real maple syrup either so I had to eat my French Toast plain which I would have no qualms about at Plow but here it was not very pleasant. 

My friends seemed to think their dishes were fine but nothing amazing and certainly didn't warrant the 30 - 45 minute, weekday morning wait. 

Overall Mama's is quite mediocre you're much better off going to Plow, Zazie or Mission Beach Cafe.
author: Alasdair S.

description: Friendly staff, great service, OUTSTANDING food! I don't know how they do it. I would recommend showing up no later than 7:30 if you want to be within the first 40 to be sat. We showed up at 7:20 and we were 20th in line on a Sunday.
author: Joseph O.

description:
Uh ditto what most everyone else who's reviewed this place has said - i'm really just reviewing it so I can keep tabs and remember Mama's for brunch next time I'm out towards North Beach since I don't get out that way much.

Definitely the best brunch option in the neighborhood - next time I may have to get the French Toast - had the sampler and they were all delish and I had the California Omlette as my main and the bacon inside was so tasty that next time I'm gonna make sure to get bacon as a side,  just 'cause...
author: Gene X.

description: I went here on Christmas Eve hoping that the lines would be shorter but they weren't.  I waited about 2 hours before I got into the restaurant and another 30 minutes waiting in line at the restaurant to make my order (you order before you get seated).  They make you wait in line in front of the chefs making food.  It was absolute torture!!  It was another 30 minutes to get my food so about 3 hours of waiting total give or take.  I ordered the Monte Cristo which was really good! But maybe my expectations were a little too high after reading all the reviews.  It wasn't jaw droppingly amazing, just good.  This was probably one of the best brunches I've had, but there are definitely other places in the area that can get close to or match it with a shorter wait.  This place is definitely worth trying!  But i don't know if I'd go again anytime soon unless the wait gets shorter.  I'd give it 3.5 stars.  If there wasn't a wait, it would be 5 stars no question but the 3 hours is a bit much
author: Edric K.

description:
Arrived at 7:20am, there was already two parties ahead of me and MAMAS opens at 8am!  

I felt crazy even being awake so early on a Saturday morning.  As time got closer to 8 am,. the line started getting longer and longer, which went up half a block.  MAMAS wasn't even open yet at this time! 

I was just glad that my party and I were one of the first to get seated.  I ordered what most of the yelpers suggested, which was the dungeoness crab omelette and french toast sampler.  Each bite of the omelet had huge chunks of crab meat.  I loved the fact that i didn't have to do the work, just to get that big chunk of meat! $19 for the omelet is a bit pricey, but was worth the experience. 

Had the French Toast Sampler as dessert and shared it with two others.  I like the cinnamon toast the best and also the fresh blueberries! 

If I woke up early in the morning and was the first in line again to dine, I would def come to mamas.  

But if I had to wait hours in line, I will pass.  There is def other breakfast places around that serves similar breakfast food.
author: Chanel L.

description: Glad I went, had a great meal of french toast, but will not be returning due to the line.  It is a little excessive (1.5 hours on a Tuesday afternoon).  Try it once, say you did, and then reevaluate.
author: Isaac R.

description:
TIP 1: Bring a snack to munch on while you wait. It's not nice to glare at people while they eat because YOU didn't get here early enough.

Having seen Mama's featured on multiple TV shows and magazines, I knew to expect a line. It was an hour wait for us even at 9am on a Saturday (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=qUajojEM0TDUOXdGis2kwg). Good thing I had anticipated this and grabbed a custard bun at a Chinese bakery on my way here!

TIP 2: If you are here for the French toast and have a hard time deciding on which type to get, just get one of everything! You get a choice of any 3 if you order the Sampler and can add more for an additional price.

Knowing that we would not likely return due to the wait, my friend and I wanted to cram in 4 dishes (literally) during this visit - 2 x French toast, pancakes, and an omelette. Our server warned us it was a lot of food for two people, (if I had a penny every time I heard that... well, I still wouldn't be rich, but I'd have a lot of pennies!) so we settled on an augmented French toast Sampler, omelette, and a side of buttermilk pancake instead.

For the FRENCH TOAST SAMPLER (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=yvneqNYV2HY6-r_KvZTq9g) we had the standard banana nut, cranberry-orange walnut, and Swedish cinnamon, but we also added the kugelhopf, chocolate cinnamon, and fat-free apple yogurt cinnamon (cause you know, we're watching our figures). The BANANA NUT and CRANBERRY-ORANGE WALNUT were just basically banana bread and cranberry-orange loaf - there wasn't really anything "French toast" about them. The SWEDISH CINNAMON was very nutmeg-y and the APPLE YOGURT CINNAMON wasn't very memorable. My favourites were the KUGELHOPF (the brioche bread makes a big difference and this had the best egg batter "crust") and the CHOCOLATE CINNAMON (great with the side of chocolate sauce). All of them could've been moister though.

We got the Mama's Children's Favorite OMELETTE (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=ns3tMMIpWsZWSS-L7Aa-tw) - mushrooms, green onions, tomatoes, and jack cheese, served with home fries and sourdough toast. The omelette itself was pretty good and the home fries were decent, but my favourite part of the dish was the sourdough toast! Lightly buttered, it was simply scrumptious with the delectable homemade OLLALIEBERRY! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=pAI-DXUoanNioABKH_tDAQ)

The BUTTERMILK PANCAKE was also delicious (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MvAo0hj9FXOeNL5PwBZ0fQ?select=m1eLpd2H-8m6B1laOqZIPw). Incredibly fluffy texture with a nicely browned "crust". There was a hint of saltiness (from the butter?) that went perfectly with the sweetness of the syrup.

As for the service, I was very impressed - fast, efficient, and so friendly (especially considering how busy and hectic this place gets).

Mama's is a place I would go to *once* - I'm glad I can say that I've been here but even gladder that I've tried everything I wanted to so that I'll never have to wait in that line again!
author: Steph L.

description:
YUM-O...oh my word, this place is amazing.  Perfect place for a quaint feel for breakfast/brunch/lunch.  Upon walking towards the restaurant and saw the line formed in front of it, we knew that we had found the right place.  The wait in the rain was well worth for the awesome food.  

Waiting inside to order your food, you were able to see all the fresh ingredients used in every dish and seeing the cooks cook your food was a great joy to see.  I had ordered the Eggs Florentine Benedict...it was AHMAZING!  The presentation of the food made you feel like it came straight from your mama's kitchen with the mama's touch of love to it.   My friends ordered the basic eggs breakfast I believe and the club sandwich.  It all looked amazing!  At each table you find homemade jam which tasted AWESOME.  It wasn't overly sweet or bland, but just right on your toast.

The cute country mama's ambiance throughout the restaurant made you feel comfortable and right at home.  The place definitely gave the cute, quaint, and country feel.  The service was a delight.

Oh mama, I will surely return upon my next visit to NorCal, thank you for being so good to me and my friends.
author: Crystal H.

description:
So you first wait in-line to be able to order.  Once you have placed your order at the counter, then you will be seated if there are seats available.  They try to match it so seats are available as soon as you have completed placing your order.  This doesn't happen everytime though.  

The wait for me was around 50 minutes.  After ordering, the wait for the food was about 15 minutes (getting the theme here?).  I ordered the dungeness crab eggs benedict with spinach, short stack of Kugelhopf frech toasts, and OJ.  The eggs benedict was a huge disappointment.  It was soggy (due to the spinanch not being drained properly), with very little flavor and the crab was blend.  The potatoes were pretty good, with good seasoning, it could have been roasted better though.

The french toast was much better.  It was fluffy and had plenty of raisins and cranberries with it. 

The OJ was the highlight of the meal (sad to say).  It was fresh squeezed OJ, very refreshing. 

I would love to come back and try something else on the menu.  But if you are on a tight schedule, and do not want to wait over an hour to be seated and get your food, try some of the other breakfast/brunch places in SF.
author: Harold S.

description:
We did this place on the last day of our trip to SF and I wish we had done it each morning -- despite the 1-2 hour wait (which was worth it, by the way). The owner, Vince, was really kind. He walked us through the menu options as we were waiting in line. The process of waiting in line was made more comfortable by the servers bringing out water to everyone in line. 

Vince recommended the Dungeness Crab omelette, and it did not disappoint! He also suggested the french toast sampler. I have never had such a variety of unique and amazing french toast options. Basically, you can order anything on their menu and not go wrong. I cannot wait until they open up shop in San Diego!
author: Ehaab Z.

description:
it was good food in a loud atmosphere in "the place to be" for breakfast.  But it's not for me. The lines are horrendous and it's cramped inside.  The food is good, but it was no better than many other places I've had brunch.

Had the french toast and it's a sampler of 3 different kinds of bread, which is kind of fun. I didn't finish it, which is a sign that it wasn't all that it is hyped up to be. But it was good.

Similar to Dottie's, I think it was good food, but this one definitely isn't worth it.  However, I must say that at least it does not require a wait in line in the tenderloin.
author: Traci H.

description: No kidding, the wait is literally 2 hours long. Good thing one of my girlfriends and I were chatting and catching up, otherwise I would not wait to try this place. I ordered the Monte Cristo and it was delicious. I would visit again if the wait wasn't so long. Customer service is great. The eatery is small in size so it's hard for the business to do much about the long wait. Definitely a popular spot, by the long line. If you have the patience to wait, it's worth the wait to give it a try.
author: Fay S.

description:
What sucks about this place is usually there is a line outside the place, and once u get in, there's another line to order food. And simultaneously, u also have to look for open seats to sit down and eat.

Food was good, and they had a sign outside their restaurant saying they were cheap eats out of San francisco, which I would have to disagree with. Hence the minus one star out of 5.
 
So I tried a recommendation that someone stated here on yelp. It was pretty good that I forced myself to eat another dish of something else I wanted to try.  Price was about average, but not cheap at all to me.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Considering the MANY amazing choices in the city.  I found the food to be mediocre and the staff very rude towards my foreign friends.    While I understand the struggles of wait staff we all know that you get "more bees with honey".  To behave in an arrogant manner when you are about to lead me to my seat or "fetch my eggs" is not only hilarious it is also not good for the overall experience nor the business.  Food was okay... will never go back because of the hilariously arrogant staff.  "NO SOUP FOR ME"  I suppose...
author: Marco Z.

description:
Was lucky enough to have crab benedict as a weekday special. Also had their French toast sampler and shrimp scramble.  All were very good.

Great staff but as you know, you can't come here starving since the line is typically an hour+ long.  Had to deduct a star for the crazy wait
author: Will I A m.

description:
Key Points:
- it's worth the 1 hour wait (but if you wanna avoid the line and stroll right in, make sure you go during the week around 2pm-ish for a late lunch/brunch--not applicable on Fridays as there tend to be more tourists in town that day of the week).
- GET THE MONTE CRISTO (your taste buds will worship you later).
- get the french toast sampler - it's a great way to figure out what you like.
- there's a spiked lemonade that comes in a lil' jar that's brunch cocktail deeee-vine.
- it's cosy, it's packed in with people, it's got SF-stories to tell and you can add your own reasons to go as you get in line one visit at a time!

BOOKMARKED FO' LYFE!
author: Anjali V.

description: Warning best time to come is 30 min it opens otherwise your wait will be an hour plus.  Had the eggs Benedict and it was probably the best eggs Benedict I've had to date.  But IMO not a 2 hour wait worth meal.
author: James F.

description:
Two hours of line .... But very awesome breakfast serve, nice staffs and worth it. We ordered the egg benedict there. It's so awesome!  .. Be there with empty stomach so that you'll enjoy it ... And the Monte Cristo! Yummy! 

Their food is awesome!!!  Too many positive words to say cause they're expert in breakfast stuffs,
author: Justin C.

description:
Biked all across town to come to this place, waited close to an hour in line and it was totally worth it!
The sampler french toast was a party in my mouth.
5 different kinds of bread (Swedish cinnamon, cranberry, cinnamon swirl, banana walnut and Challah) topped with mixed berries, home styled maple syrup and their home made berry jam.
The service was impeccable, even though the place was as full as an egg, never got to see the bottom of my coffee mug and the mimosas kept coming.
Will come back without a doubt.
author: Bea L.

description:
Hella awesome!!!!!!!! 5 stars unless you consider the waiting time

I heard about Mama's reputation and it was worth the 1hour 30minutes wait

The restaurant was cozy so only about 20 people could go inside. We were excited to eat brunch for the first time, and we were full of anticipation. We watched people envyingly who were already eating inside 

Customers should order and pay first when you enter the restaurant. while ordering, you could see the decoration of Mama's.  Imagine how this place is old and has long history. It made me hopeful about food and restaurant. And you can see how food is made, it is also interesting and makes people trust Mama's food

I went with another 4 friends and we ordered different kinds of dishes and shared it such as eggs benedict, French toast, omelet, salad and so on. Each dish was really awesome. Also, on every table, there are berry jams made by mama's, you could taste it and it is like real organic with no additional ingredients 

The Server was really beautiful. She looked like a young Brooke Shields and gave us good service, so we were very satisfied with this place!

AWWWWWWESOMEEEEEEEE!
author: Jarmila H.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on a yelp search while deciding where to go for breakfast on our trip to San Fran. Knew the line was going to be 45min-1 hr wait but we decided we would wait, just for the experience and to see  what everyone was raving about. 
The food was good, but it wasn't amazing. We ordered the chocolate cinnamon french toast which comes topped with fresh mixed berries. I guess what makes this place special is that they bake their own breads to use for the french toast. We also had the crab avocado, tomatoe omlette which was tasty because I mean, cmon, it's crab. But it needed like a sauce to give it that wow factor. 

Would  I wait in line to eat here again if I'm ever in town? No. The wait is not worth it. I could've gotten the same experience at another place, without the long wait or cramed elbow room.
author: Krystal b.

description:
I'll make it short.
Parking near here is horrible.
Ridiculously long wait.
Small place.
Great food. I got the crab benedict.
Well worth the trouble for brunch.
author: Albert W.

description:
OK while the food was fine I don't understand the hype about this place. Is it run by a famous chef? No. Is the food out of this world the best you've ever had? No. Is it a relaxing meal to enjoy with your friends/family? No. Then what is it? 
I couldn't believe several tourists were actually taking picures of themselves next to the sign outside. Perhaps this was just something to pass the time while they were waiting well over an hour standing outside in line. 
So even though I showed up 10 minutes before they opened on a weekday, and was about 1/3 back in the line, it still took over an hour to get inside, place my order and sit down. Once you get inside, you stand in line again to order at the cash register, then you stand there and try to stay out of the way while you wait for a table. 
I will say they seem to try their best to accommodate as many people as fast as they can, but this clearly results in you being rushed in and rushed out as fast as they can. So don't come here expecting to have a leisurely meal with your family or think you're going to sit and enjoy reading the newspaper with your coffee. That's not going to happen with the line outside staring at you through the windows willing you to hurry up and leave so they can get inside and have their turn.
I had the french toast with berries, a side of scrambled eggs and fresh squeezed orange juice. Prices are a bit on the high side- something like $4 for my side order of two scrambled eggs. The orange juice tasted freshly squeezed as advertised.

Besides the long wait and fairly standard tasting (but good) food, the other reason I only gave 3 stars is the service. They brought my meal out and never came back to see how I was doing. Service was pretty non-existant. Another guy came and cleared my plates as soon as he spied me taking my last bite, so the overwhelming feeling I had was that they wanted me out of there as soon as humanly possible.
I will say I witnessed a few other servers chatting with people and such, so I'm not saying this was the case with everyone.

Bottom line, either get here an hour before the door opens or expect to wait in line at least an hour to get in the door. While the food was fine I don't have the time to waste nearly 2 hours to have breakfast at a tiny hurried establishment.
author: Jen L.

description: Dungeness Crab Benedict!!! That's all I am going to say. My belly was extremely happy =)
author: Ngoc C.

description: The food might be great but the neighborhood is unfortunately not safe. I parked my car in the next street to Mama's around lunch time. Came back after 30 minutes and the front window was broken and my expensive camera and gear was gone. I don't see any cops in this area and people are shady. If you decide to go here please don't take your car and be careful
author: Sam S.

description: I wanted to love mama's and wanted to give it 5 stars. However, I can't because the food is not worth the incredible wait.  Don't get me wrong; the food was fine. But, after waiting in line for an hour and a half or more, I expected mind-blowing food. I expected something different from the many other brunch spots in San Francisco. Unfortunately, that just didn't happen. Instead, mama's felt like a tourist trap with decent food.
author: Amy L.

description:
it's so popular that on the weekend's there's a huge line that goes almost half a block down around the side of the restaurant. it's a tiny little place but the food is DIVINE. soooooooooooo good and soooooooooooo worth the hour and a half wait. yes, i was starving while waiting in line, but everyone waiting in line is friendly and chatty and all know that the food waiting inside is definitely worth it. 

beware though, there are 3 different lines. 1. the line to get into the restaurant. once they let you in, one party at a time past the dutch doors, you then wait in line 2. where you wait in line to order. as you're in line to order, they tempt you and make you drool with the fresh food and bread being prepared right before your eyes. once you've reached the register you order, pay (no credit cards or personal checks!!!! CASH ONLY - did not know this in advance. luckily had enough cash on me....would've been pissed after an hour and a half wait otherwise!!!) once you've paid you then proceed to line 3. where the waiter/waitress will come and get you once a table big enough for your party opens up. you are only served/seated for your party that is present. can't have a table any bigger for straddlers.

all in all, the lines are long during peak hours, so get there super early, or way late. but the food is amazing.
author: Patty W.

description:
Keeping it real - food is just 3 stars. We came here so I could cross the heavily hyped Mama's off my SF Foodie's bucket list, but I won't be back.

MLP and I went today (Superbowl Sunday), got in line at 8:37am, and had 14 parties (~30 people) in front of us. Didn't get in the door til about 9:45, then waited another 10-15 minutes in the ordering line, and another 5 to be seated.  So from line to food on the table was about 1.5 hours. I think the 8:40ish arrival was our downfall - not early enough to be early, but we hit probably the tail end of 2-3 waves of people. When we left at 10:45ish the line down the block wasn't as bad as when we came in at 8:37. Hmph.

Plus is that food comes out fast once you put your order in and get a seat. We got the weekend special of Shrimp & Avocado bennie (~$11) and Monte Cristo (~$10-11). Bennie was executed fine, but it didn't blow my mind. It came with some (already cooked) shrimp, avocado, tomato on top of english muffin with home fries and slice of orange on the side.  Home fries were just ok, nothing to write home about. Monte cristo (ham and cheese sandwich that gets french toast fried) was really good, with the homemade jam. But was it still worth the wait? No.

Service was fairly efficient: our water was always filled and the guys were smiling and nice. 

Overall: Solid food, but wouldn't come again. There are too many good places in SF that don't have you standing in line that long. But if you do come, CASH ONLY or debit card!
author: Karen S.

description:
Must wait in line every morning... even on a weekday (Friday)!
Amazing KUGELHUPH ($8.71 total...CA$H ONLY!!)
Mmmmmm with olallieberry jam
And savored every bite!
'
Small and yet great place to have breakfast or brunch!

I knew I wanted to come here for breakfast, but I just didn't know what to get. I wasn't feeling like an omelet, but more like a pancake or french toast. I was eyeing the Pan Dore or Kugelhuph. I had read other reviews for the Pan Dore, and it sounded like it was drenched in lemon butter. =\ So I decided to order the Kugelhuph ($7.95 w/o tax). It was really good!! There were some dates inside and slivered almonds outside on the crust and pan fried with their french toast batter!

*~* If it's your first time at Mama's... *~*
- bring CA$H!
- get there early (before they open at 8am)
- once they let you inside, you wait in another line and order at the cash register
- then you sit down at a table
- the server will give you your order at your table
- there is a small jar of olallieberry jam, dab some onto your pancake or french toast
- and enjoy!!
- oh, they sell their olallieberry jams, but you must pre-order them ahead of time!!

So I took the 6:57am Caltrain from Mountain View and I got into SF at 7:48am. Took the 30 Muni towards Washington Square and when I arrived at Mama's, I couldn't believe the line!! What the heck? Must be all tourist... like me! ahahaha So I didn't get seated until a little after 9am. Wow! I guess reviewers weren't kidding when they said there's a line!

Go green take: 30 Muni towards Washington Square
author: CeCe C.

description:
We went to Mama's and waited in line on a saturday morning, which took about an hour, but I did some touristing up to the Coit Tower while my girlfriend valiantly waited in line (thanks?). The food here was awesome, and it damn well better be for an hour wait for breakfast.

They make you pay before you sit, and you pass by all of the fresh fruits, breads, and chefs making all of the awesome omelettes and eggs benedicts. Excellent business strategy, I must say.

We had the French Toast sampler, which I would highly recommend. 3 types of fresh bread, covered in berries, bananas butter and maple syrup. The raspberry jam on the table was also excellent. The highlight of the meal for me was the Dungeoness Crab Benedict, which was hands down the best breakfast item I have ever eaten. Tons of crab ontop of English muffins with homemade hollandaise sauce and sauted spinach. Just too damn good.

Add some fresh squeezed orange juice, great service and this was a 5 star experience for sure.
author: PJ H.

description:
I've loved Momma's for many years. there used to be more locations but this is the only one now. 

when i'm there it's usually for a Slim Joe. One of the best burgers in SF!
author: Zoe G.

description:
You want me to wait 2 hours in line for brunch....say whattttttt!?!?!

I thought I could go to Mama's at 1pm and beat the lunch crowd, but I was soooo wrong. The line was monstrotrous! Even more unbelievable was that after you finally make it through the doors, an hour and a half later, you still have to wait in line to order and be seated!

But even after all that, you know the wait is worth it. Why else would anyone be crazy enough to stand in line that long for breakfast food when the day is HALF OVER!?!

My friend and I devoured our coffee, hot chocolate, crab benedict, and chocolate cinnamon french toast instantly, and I was stuffed. I could barely get up to walk out. It was DELICIOUS :) It definitely tastes as good as it looks in all those pictures you see on yelp beforehand. And if you don't try it at least once, you're definitely missing out.

If only they'd opened a TO-GO section to drop by, hop out, and pick up. *Hint Hint* I would be in breakfast heaven!!!
author: Kristen C.

description:
Service was great but that was where the greatness ended. 

The food was bland, the wait was incredibly long, and the prices were astronomical. $44 pre tip for two dishes that were at best, mediocre is outrageous (we got the crab Benedict and the "undeservingly famous" Monte Christo). 

The best part of the meal was the potato wedges and I've had better for far cheaper without the 2+ hour wait.
author: Pete W.

description: Maybe everyone knows this going in, but the wait was a little ridiculous. More than 2 hours to get inside, then another line inside,  and then we had to wait for our food!  Needless to say, we were starving. And our meal was not worth the wait. My smoked salmon scramble was almost tasteless, and my mom's veggie benedict was cold except for the eggs. Definitely not worth the wait or the price.
author: Anna G.

description: Food was amazing! Generous portions and fair prices. Best home fries ever (crispy on the outside and soft on the inside). And their jam was... Jam-mazing :P
author: Erik L.

description: This is definitely a tourist spot. Long lines to get to the counter and you still have to wait for a table because the place is tiny. Lots of better breakfast places in the city. We got the French toast sampler and the crab Benedict which I was told was the best in the city....not really. Zazies on cole has the best crab Benedict. I wouldn't come back. Hour Long wait for something meh. No thanks.
author: David L.

description: OMG the Monte Cristo is a MUST try!! I live in LA, but can't wait to go back to Frisco just to try the Monte Cristo again! yumm
author: Arevik G.

description:
Mama's on Northbeach...if it weren't for the wait and relatively high price for some breakfast food, I'll give you a 5!

Came here with a couple of friends on a THURSDAY afternoon.  Yes, thats right. THURSDAY.  There was a line, but not as crazy as usual.  I've driven by this place on weekends, and holy hell. Do you people have nothing better to do on a sunday than wait in line for an hour?! I guess not. On this Thursday at 12 noon, we found ourselves in about a 30 minute line.  Another note - on these days, park in the 2 hour parking in the area. Yeesh. But wait, did I mention? After your wait outside, is ANOTHER wait INSIDE for people to leave their tables!  WHAAAT???  

I had myself a Florentine Scramble (plus mushrooms!), a lemon crumb cake and an orange juice. I was hungry after that darn wait.  My friends had a Monte Cristo and a French Toast Sampler (banana nut, Some Raspberry thing and some chocolate thing).  I liked my scramble. But for $11 a pop (9.75 +1.50 for mushrooms), I'd damn well better be having a foodgasm.  Not so much for me, but I appreciated the loaded scramble...with sooo much spinach!  Also got to taste my friend's Monte Cristo (pretty good actually), and the french toast sampler (really, banana nut was least like a french toast).

Not being negative (much) but it was an overall good experience. Our waitress was super nice and friendly and came by to check on us a couple of times.  Food is pricey and wait is long, which is what I got stuck on, but the food itself was pretty decent. I love me some breakfast food!
author: Lily W.

description:
What can I say about Mama's? It's a North Beach institution for darn good reason. My ambition is to work my way through the entire menu! So far I recommend Eggs Blackstone, banana pancakes, Monte Cristo sandwiches, Californian fruit salad, blueberry and cranberry muffins - heck everything! The orange juice is freshly squeezed and refilled as soon as your glass empties, as are the mimosas. Only downside is the long queue that can form at breakfast time, however I have met some interesting people in that queue so even that has an upside!

P.S. Try the homemade jam with your pancakes.
author: Kitten F.

description:
Mama's came highly recommend by several San Francisco locals, and it was clearly the place to be based on the long line outside. They only let you physically inside the building when there is a table ready for you, which is actually a brilliant idea because while the line was long, the inside did not feel crowded or hectic whatsoever. 

The food here was downright amazing. I got the cinnamon French Toast and it was some of the best French Toast I've ever had. They had a huge selection of food and drinks alike, including mimosas and other alcoholic beverages. The selection was huge, and it all looked great.

The atmosphere in the restaurant is amazing, packed with people while still being comfortable and well-decorated. 

The service was superb. You order at the counter and are then helped by a waiter or waitress, both of whom were very helpful and kind. The woman behind the counter made friendly conversation and seemed well composed despite the huge crowd.

I loved everything about this place, and would definitely return. It was undoubtedly worth the long wait.
author: Trey C.

description: My girlfriend and I finally decided to give this place a try. We got there twenty-minutes early and we still had to wait an hour. Once we got inside it was SO worth it. I now understand why people wait hours for this place. I had the french toast sampler which was awesome. Three different types of french toast cooked to perfection. We will be back one day when we muscle up the courage to wait in line again!
author: William H.

description:
We had to wake up at 730 am to get there at 8 am and there was already a line.  We waited about a hour and was seated.
I knew it was going to be good but not this good (like I would prob wait again and that takes a lot)
I got the silver dollar pancakes with fresh mixed berries and my friend got the monte cristo.  
Ive never had a monte cristo in years bc I would never order it but Im glad my friend did so that we got to have sweet and savory.
Oh and their homemade jam, I could just eat that by itself!
author: Lila H.

description: Wonderful food and staff! Very personal staff & food was fresh. Excellent coffee too. Luckily we were there while it was raining so short line! Would definitely go back!
author: Missy W.

description: Food tastes just okay.... Honestly it's way over hyped. I've tasted way better, but the wait staff is amazing! Great service and really funny.
author: Janice C.

description: All hype and no substance. First off, is even the best breakfast food worth a 2 hour wait?  Not in my opinion. So an okay breakfast is definitely not worth waiting that long. The Monte Cristo was small, lukewarm, and tasted meh. I've had so much better. It was very restrained and missing the thick, fried batter bread, ooey gooey cheese, heaps of meat, globs of jam, and other excessiveness. We also got the French toast sampler and an omelette which were both fine but not spectacular. Overall, the food wasn't bad per se but was it worth the wait? Hell no.
author: Judy C.

description:
Say it with me H-E-A-V-E-N

When I saw the long line i must say, thoughts ran through my head screaming "lets get the hell out of here and get something else". Good thing i decided to keep my big mouth shut! 
After the long awaited 2 hour wait we got in. As much as i wanted to get their infamous french toast, i went for an omelet. I had a really good feeling about it. Low and behold, out comes my delicious pepper jack omelet yellow with no sign of brown (from the pan). It came with red potatoes and sourdough bread, with the worlds best fresh, homemade jam. We were truly in heaven. The service was phenomenal.  I am 300 % that NO ONE will be disappointed if they come here. Every city needs a great place like this.  Local mom and pop shops are what we need! GO NOW!!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Eating at Mama's is like having all your friends tell you about this super hot girl who "looks like Megan Fox but not dirty", but when you finally meet her, she ends up looking like an overexhausted Kirsten Dunst. Now Kirsten Dunst is not UGLY per se, but she's damn well not Megan Fox. Not even close.

Okay, with that said, I don't want to spend more time on this review than I have to. Got the Washington Square omelet -- it was decent (much like any other local breakfast diner anywhere in the world). Tried my friend's French Toast w/ berries, it was decent (much like any other local breakfast diner anywhere in the world). Breakfast food is much better at so many other places in SF -- Dottie's, MyMy, Brenda's, you name it.

Yeah that's about it. Moving on with my life.
author: Roy C.

description:
It is Tuesday morning, 9:30 am, and a 45-minute wait still stands.

Now the hype about this place is so intense that... I don't even know what to say.  People make it seem like the mecca of breakfast places.  I would say that the food is pretty good but I hear the weekend wait can even reach 1.5 hours?  In that case, I don't know if it's worth it.  An hour and a half wait for me has to result in something out of this world.

So the routine is you stand in line outside which has its own appeal.  Monkey see monkey do.  Then a man beckons you inside in which you proceed to wait in a much smaller line, standing next to the fresh pastries, watching the cooks prepare the orders, smelling the aromas, and finally you get to the cashier where you can order what your stomach has built up desiring.  They do not take credit cards but they do take debit for an extra $1 charge.

As soon as you order, you wait only a little while more until another man directs you to your table.  I actually think their method is most efficient because while you're in line to order your food, they have time to prepare the tables.  It makes you feel like things are happening and that you're more productive even though they just put you in another line.  And after we sat down, the food only took about 5 minutes?  Impressive.

My smoked salmon benedict tasted as it should and nothing surprised me.  Don't get me wrong, it was good and the smoked salmon was fresh as can be and I knew they would do a good job.  The side of potatoes were cooked to a lovely consistency.  The chocolate cinnamon french toast topped with bananas, strawberries, and berries was intense.  It's so loaded that you can barely see the bread.  What allows the menu-makers to put "chocolate" into the description is that they drizzle chocolate syrup onto it.  I really wish it was incorporated INTO the bread instead... perhaps a chocolate swirl would fare well.  Now there's already powdered sugar and chocolate syrup, but they also give you a side of maple syrup and suggest that you put the tableside jam on it too!!!  And by suggest, I mean I literally saw the waiter go to every table who ordered french toast and told them to add jam to it.  Holy crap, it was a total sugar overload.  Aside from that, I did enjoy the dish!!  The bread was evenly coated in egg and considering how fast they cook things, it was really fluffy and moist.

Mama's should Twitter their wait times so I can decide if I want to come back or not!
author: Shannon L.

description:
I finally was able to get some breakfast here on a Saturday morning! I was so excited when my group of 4 was right outside of the door, we were getting real close.

Details: arrived at Mama's around 8:15am and there was already a huge line, hopped out of the car and took a place in the line while the others parked. Line just kept getting longer. A strange man was also hanging around outside screaming things at the people waiting, not too comforting. We probably didn't get into Mama's until a little after 9. We finished ordering and eating at 10:20.

BF and I shared Monte Cristo (outside menu says available from 11-3 but not true...), Dungeness Crab Omelette with Avocado and Sour Cream, and the French Toast Sampler. The man working the cash register knew what I wanted to order before I did as I was having trouble reading the names.. slightly embarrassing.

Monte Cristo: 5/5
BF and I both LOVED this. The ham .. the cheese .. it was grilled.. Completely delicious. It was sweet yet salty on its own and the jam/preserve/jelly complimented the sandwiches amazingly. I would love to know how to recreate this.

Dungeness Crab Omelette with A&SC: 4/5
This was delicious! Big and chunky pieces of crab, REAL MEAT. Super yum, my tummy was happy with this one. I think it had just a little too much sour cream in places where there wasn't much crab but maybe that's a user error and I don't know how to eat an omelette correctly.

French Toast Sampler: 4/5
Banana Nut wins in this sample, followed by Cinnamon, and Cranberry comes in last place. I didn't enjoy the cranberry so my wonderful bf finished that off for us. 

We ate it all and licked the plates clean. Over all, the meal was $56.15 including tip.
author: Stefanie S.

description: I wasn't too impressed. The prosciutto benedict was ok. The potatoes were pretty bland.  I had to douse mine with ketchup.  The hollandaise sauce wasn't that memorable. The Monte Cristo sandwich was delicious, but again I'm not that impressed. It tasted like a fancy grilled cheese.  I wouldn't wait in that absurdly long line.  I absolutely do not think it's worth the wait.  If there's no line, sure I would go back because the food wasn't bad at all.  I just think that it would be a waste of time to wait two hours in line for mediocre breakfast. My advise is to go during slow days (weekdays, early morning).
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
I'm probably going to shock a lot of fans with the rating but Mama's just wasn't really worth the wait.  It took 2 full hours from when we first stood in line to when the food finally arrived to our table.

Decided at the spur of the moment to come to Mama's on a Sunday at 1pm.  Stood in line at 1pm only to make it to another line inside by about 2:15pm.  After waiting in the second line and getting seated...that took another 15-20 minutes.

I ordered a proscuitto & tomato benedict w/ the hollandaise sauce on the side.  I actually really liked the hollandaise sauce for once.  It was light and quite tangy.  Went really well with the sandwich.  The poached egg was interesting, i usually don't eat the yolk but i let some of the raw yolk dribble onto my sandwich.  Overall i enjoyed my benedict.

My husband got the infamous monte carlo.  Very interesting concept of egg dipped ham & cheese sandwich.  I had a couple bites but if i had ordered it myself i probably wouldn't be able to finish it.  It's a pretty heavy dish.

Also ordered 1 pancake ($4?!) because i love pancakes.  It was cooked a little too dense and i think it was still partly raw.  The restaurant was cracking that day and i don't think the cooks were able to keep up with the orders.  We got most of our food relatively quickly but the pancake took a really long time to come out and i think they half-a$$ed on cooking it.  I actually felt quite nauseated eating the semi-raw pancake.

Service is excellent.  Waitress is very attentive.

I might give this place a second chance if i'm going with out of towners...but this san franciscan is saying no-way to another 2 hour wait.
author: Terry D.

description:
Just got back from here! Finally tried it. The decor is very "home-y" like. My friend and I ordered:

#4 from the French Toast section, which is, Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast with fruits (strawberries, blueberries and bananas). It comes with three pieces of french toast but the bread is super filing. 

#6 From the Momelette section, which is omelette with jack cheese, mushroom, tomatoes, &bell pepper. Comes with a side of country potatoes and two pieces of sourdough bread.

The total was $19.60. I think that this place is only okay; a place that is enjoyable to family and friends. Their ingredients tastes really fresh though. I want to try the "Smoked Salmon Benedict" next time, argh!
author: Vivian L.

description:
Well we got takeaway so probably not the best experience.

I got the paisano eggs benedict which was bit too salty. Takeaway was pretty quick though.
author: Sid R.

description: I love the omelletes and the very good service. Their bread and jams are freshly made each morning. French toast is their specialty. My only complaint is the very long line - we had to wait for almost 2 hours to get a seat on a Sunday morning. On the plus side, my son who is a picky eater - ate all his food and some of his mom's as well.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
The hype about this place was crazy so I had to try this place out myself. If you miss home cooked breakfast this is the place to go! I did not like the fact that they used a orange to hold a recipe on my plate, at least throw it out or give me a new piece -____-. Come early if you want to avoid waiting in line.

Hot coco : Great for after spending about 30min in line, but I must say this simple hot coco is overpriced. 

Chocolate cinnamon french toast : Too sweet I'd give it a 3/5stars

Butter milk pancakes w/ berries : This was my favorite, enough said.

We also ordered a omelet but I forgot the name. Everything is a must try on their menu. You won't leave disappointed.
author: Annie Y.

description: I love the food!!! I had a crab benedicts and my other sister had the crabs omelete. So delicious!! Remember to have a big appetite because they serve in big portions. I love the atmosphere, a bit crowded, but yet expected. Be sure to have good company to chat around with while your in line because it will be quite a wait. We also had the Apple-Peach bessinni.. Yumm yumm. Would i go back, YES..ABSOLUTELY..;-)
author: Mrs. P.

description: Looooong wait outside. Weird way of seating people but the food is really good n so is the service.
author: Loraena J.

description:
No need for a long review! It lives up to the Brunch hype! 

The french toast is RIDICULOUS! Totally worth every carb:-))

The only thing that REALLY SUCKS is the line! Really?! Why?! Just take names and let us stand where we want. On a sunny day, bring sun screen!
author: Gina H.

description:
I know, I know, everyone is crazy about this place. 
I was VERY excited to try it, and went there with a date for brunch. 

My date's meal was great, but I ordered the huevos rancheros, and it honestly was pretty bad. 
They forgot to put the guac on top. It came out looking messy and didn't taste very good. 
I would not recommend ordering this particular dish.
author: dom s.

description:
The line..RIDICULOUS! My friends and I waited almost 2 hours...why? because I haven't seen them in so long, it was perfect for us to catch up while we were in line (minus one star). Would I do that again..absolutely not!
I love french toast, and most of all, I love having variety.  It was definitely good here.
The coffee, not so much. I would never get it again.
author: Nancy H.

description:
We went to Mama's on a Friday morning and it STILL took us an hour to get inside. (And we were only a party of 2!)

I had the Scrambled Florentine (eggs, spinach, bacon, and cheese) and fresh squeezed OJ. Very tasty and fulfilling, but definitely NOT worth the hour wait in line. It actually only took us half an hour after ordering to eat and pay the bill.

Might come here again sometime because a lady in the table next to us got the pancakes with mixed berries which looked AMAZINGLY tasty.
author: Jessica Q.

description:
If there is a line for a restaurant out the door and nearly around the block, the food has to be good right? Right! What I liked about Mama's is that it is a very cozy restaurant. I ordered the Northwest Omelet with delicious smoked salmon, delicious capers and grilled leaks with sour cream. I personally am not a fan of home fries for breakfast, so instead I got sourdough bread (it's San Francisco, of course).

With the crisp November weather the food was great and the coffee was fresh. I will definitely go back the next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Ayesha N.

description:
This place might've tasted better if it wasn't for the ridiculous line. By the time we got our food, I was too upset to enjoy it.. I came here on my birthday and waited an hour in line, for some breakfast!! I've heard people talk about this place and it just didn't live up to my expectations. I'd rather eat at Stacks with no wait and better food! 

I ordered the French Toast Sampler which i thought was mediocre, kind of doughy. 

So.. I probably won't be back.. sorry.
author: Cara N.

description:
I had to drop the rating from 4 to 3 given the 2.5 hour wait on a Sunday at 9:30 am!

The food was incredible. Monte Cristo is the way to go!
author: Ericha F.

description:
I discovered this Mama's only because I was interviewing at a place across the street. (Who says nothing good comes out of an interview). I saw the line that was forming before the interview and thought that I would check it out.

Waited in line and decided, that it was a nice day, so I should see if they do take out. Luckily, they did and I just ordered a Monte Cristo with potato salad. 

I took my meal across the street to the park and sat on the bench. I would recommend this route, so you don't have to wait too long. It only took me 15 minutes to receive my food rather than the wait time in line and food order. 

The Monte christo was so delicious. I usually have it with syrup, but this one came with homemade jam and it was the perfect combination.Would definitely want to make the trek to eat this again.
