In short, food was great. Place is pretty small, so you have to wait awhile for seating. Just order out and take your food to the park
author: Mary K.

description:
I had the chocolate French toast with fresh fruit and the bf had the crab benedict.  He gave me half of his plate and as I'm eating, I notice a small hair in my food.  Made me lose my appetite.

1.  Expensive
2.  Long line = long wait
3.  Small
4.  Mediocre coffee
author: C L.

description:
The tourist breakfast spot of all breakfast spots: is it kind of ridiculous that I waited 2 hours to eat breakfast? Was it worth it? I think so...Why can't Mama's just buy the apartments upstairs to seat more people? Should we get a petition going?

Anyways, aside from the unreasonable wait time, I ordered the Monte Cristo and forgot the pain that I went through from waiting in line for 2 whole hours. The Monte Cristo is this intricate, delicately balanced mix of sweet, sour, and savory. There's soft gooey comfort from the cheese and toast, a meaty bit of ham, and a crispiness on the outside. To top it off, it's drizzled with a sweet and sour balsamic reduction. 

I'm weird and slathered raspberry jam on 1/4th of my Monte Cristro sandwich. I loved it so much that I wondered what this sandwich would be like if I requested them to put it inside before throwing it on the grill?

I would come back pretty darn often if it wasn't for that 2 hour wait.
author: Christine H.

description:
Believe the hype.  Wow.  At first, I didn't believe that we had to get in line at 7:45 AM -- on a Thursday morning to get a seat.  But it was sage advice.

The coffee was top-notch and the omelettes were excellent.  I highly recommend the Californian omelette with fresh avocado.  The wifey had french toast (the yogurt is baked into the bread) and she raved about it all weekend.
author: James S.

description: My favorite breakfast place in SF, coming here like once a month. I don't know why, I just love going here so much(even though I have to wait more than 30mins)!! My favorite Monte Cristo and the best egg benedict I've tried in the city and the modest waiter :D And I'm going again tomorrow yayyyy!!! I'm just so exciting and can't wait until tomorrow so I started yelping right away haha
author: Yanakon D.

description: It's good, not amazing, not worth the wait. My dad loves it though. It's a must, but not for the food. Eggs are good, and French toast is "famous," but it's just okay.
author: Spencer S.

description: So I am tourist visiting San Fran from NYC area so waiting in line for brunch is something I am accustomed to, however waiting an hour an half on Tuesday not so much. I am giving the place a four star because the servers were very nice and accommodating. I ordered two things off the menu because I was starving after the long wait because when I arrived it was breakfast but when I got seated it was closer to one. I got the French toast combo, which was ok I wasn't really blown away I don't feel all bread can be turned into French toast and if you are going to attempt that you should try much softer types of bread. However, since I was starving I ate it. I then ordered the vegetarian eggs Benedict, which I was much happier with and pretty much cleaned my plate. I would say my suggestion is anytime you do a vegetarian option your home fries should be sweet potatoes to add a sweetness to the salty flavor of the mushrooms and tomatoes and also they should lightly toast the bread because it was a little hard to cut my English muffin. Another friendly suggestion that New York has done well is having someone come out and find out your party size it makes things easier in terms of getting people in and out and accommodating those larger and smaller parties. I also recommend you bring cash as there is a $1 surcharge for debit cards and they don't take credit cards.
author: Aja D.

description:
Mmmmm...French toast sampler. 

I usually am not a huge French toast fan but the bread they use here is so cakey and delicious. It's not overly sweet but it's just the right amount. They use 3 types of toast (cranberry walnut, cinnamon & banana bread) & top it with a heap of fresh berries & whipped cream. I think I died and went to heaven. 

I had initially asked my boyfriend if he wanted to split this with me but he was smart enough to order his own entree because I polished off the whole thing with little to no help. 

Yes, it is totally worth the wait in line. Yes, you should make a reservation (and then still be prepared to wait). No, you will not regret it one little bit.
author: Shreya O.

description:
My girlfriend and I are local people, and very into food! We have heard all about Mama's forver, and have always said 'Let's try them.' We had Family and friends say how great it was! Well we walked there, waited in line... And the food was in my opinion: BAD! My English Muffin was even bad! Cold, hard and rubber like! Like it was alraedy toasted from the day before or something. The breakfast fries (potatoes) were the same, rubber like and dry, taste? What taste? The crab omelet was just ok...
I swear I can get better english muffins and home fries at a dive like Denny's or something? This was not a price problem either. It was really not good at all. By the way for $25.00 a piece, it sucked!
author: Kirk M.

description: Best Monte Christo I have ever had! Whenever I see a monte Christo on a menu at a different restaurant, I get it, but It never compares to mamas. After waiting in line for an hour, the food was so worth it. Whenever I come back to San Francisco, I am coming here. Restaurant is really small. Plan on waiting in line for at least an hour. Service was awesome. Can't wait to come back.
author: Kendra P.

description:
The bf and I came here on a Tuesday morning ready for a succulent breakfast.

You come in, and there's a line for you to order your food at the register. After you order, you wait for a table. The place was pretty small so we ended up waiting a couple minutes for a table to clear. The strategy of having us order our meal at the register first makes the wait seem not as long once we're seated.

We ordered the monte cristo to share. SO GOOD. We topped it off with their homemade jam. I'm not a fan of jam but this was yummy.

Can't wait to come back.
author: Jessica V.

description:
Traveling to SFO? Great! Looking for places to go in SFO? Yes! North Beach. Early in the morning, you can start from MAMA'S. 

Have some GREAT breakfast before you start walking around. The breakfast here is awesome. We ordered Dungeness Crab Benedict & their famous Monte Cristo. 

The crab for the benedict is fresh and taste good with spinach. Talking about the Monte Cristo? What is it? oh yeah! is just french toast with ham and cheese in it, serve with their homemade sauce. Trust me you will come back just for this.

Is the best breakfast I ever had if you want me to vote. 

MONTE CRISTO? Must try! Enjoy your breakfast here.
author: Unyo N.

description:
Found this place on Yelp and decided to try it for breakfast while inSan Francisco. Read that the line was long so we showed up early and it was a good thing we did.  Luckily, we were able to be seated during the first seating. 

The line once inside moved very slowly. Not sure if that is on purpose or not. Dishes were plated very nicely and everything look fresh. I ordered the French toast sampler. It was ok, it just wasn't what I was expecting. The fresh squeezed orange juice was great and everyone else in my party liked what they got. 

I don't know if I would return if in the area again, but it's definitely worth trying if you haven't been there before.
author: Alexis S.

description: went here for brunch on a Tuesday morning, and took about an hour and a half to get seated! Ordered the huevos rancheros, a pretty standard dish and have to say it was probably the freshest huevos rancheros, I've ever had! Definitely quality food, but not sure if it's worth the insanely long wait, especially since you have to stand in line vs other restaurant that give you a buzzer etc.
author: Anika A.

description:
I love dungeness crab, so when I heard about Mama's legendary crab breakfast dishes..I knew I needed to come. After the anticipation that got built up from the hour wait, to my dismay, i don't think the food delivered.

Everything on the menu sounds amazing in theory. I chose to order the Dungeness crab "m'omelette" as it sounded like the perfect food-gasmic meal: avocado, havarti cheese, omelette, crab. These are all wonderful things individually, however, when you join it all together, it just becomes...weird, and not in a good way. The filling didn't marry together well, and that problem was heightened by the fact that the omelette itself was pretty stiff and not fluffy as it should be. The home fries on the side, at least, were good.

My friend's dishes were thankfully much better than mine. The hollandaise on the veggie eggs benedict was fantastic. The french toast sampler was huge and seemed overall enjoyable, but they used their flavored loaves as the toast (ie: banana nut bread for banana nut toast). IMO, this made the entire dish very heavy and dense.

I can understand why tourists want to come here. The food all sounds amazing, but is actually just passable overall and not worth the agonizing wait. If you want a good brunch place, I've been told that Brenda's is where it's at right now.

TIPS: 

- If you do plan on eating here, come at around 2p to avoid peak lunch hours. There was literally no wait by then.

- Get the egg's benedict, skip the "m'omelettes."

- Don't get stuck on the hyped menu items, I'm sure you'll find plenty of other tasty under-hyped dishes/
author: Melissa C.

description: Good but not great.  Service is friendly and efficient.  If there is no line, by all means go.  Not special, don't understand the hype
author: Ottis M.

description:
Delicious! 

What a great place to get breakfast! Yes it's small, and yes there is a line you have to wait in to actually eat, but I think the fact that it's so small and quaint is what makes it charming. I love the fact that when you walk in the first thing you see is food! Pastries, bread, fruit, shrimp... everything! 

But normally I must say that small and quaint isn't always the best thing, but this time? It is! Because the food here is AMAZING and just well made all together. I went with two friends today and we all had what I think are their most ordered dishes. I had the buttermilk pancakes with the fresh fruit, which was absolutely divine. The fruit was so fresh and the pancakes were oh so fluffy and delicious. I usually form my opinions on places based on their pancakes, and hands down, these are the best pancakes I have ever had. My friend had the Washington Square "M'Omelette" and that was good too... sausage, bell peppers, hot pepper jack cheese. Such good flavor! And my other friend had the french toast, which also came with some fresh fruit. Just wonderful!

The service here was great, too. Our waitress was so nice and even offered to cover our friend's french toast while we waited for him to come so that it wouldn't get cold. And when he did come, he asked for some whipped cream and she got that for him really quick. Everyone was really friendly, from the lady who took our order to everyone else that was refilling our waters and clearing our plates. 

I cannot wait to come back to eat here!!! I'm literally counting down to the next time I get to go here. Their menu is very, very extensive, so I'm sure I'll have a lot of things to order (especially for lunch!) in the future. 

Oh yeah, and as for the standing in line thing... my friend told me that sometimes the line can go to the end of the block! Yes it's discouraging, but let me just tell you that sometimes there are lulls in the line and at times a whole bunch of people seem to leave at the same time. So if you see the line and you are discouraged, don't be! Just line up, and there will be someone there to warmly greet you and tell you to come on in. 

(But if you're really worried, try a Thursday at around 11:30 because that's when we went and we sat down pretty quick.)
author: Caroline L.

description:
Holy crap - 60+ minute wait!  

Definitely try the French Toast Sampler!  The cranberry loaf was delicious!  

I'm glad to have to have tried it, but I know back in Sacramento, I can find better for cheaper and without the wait.  Sorry city dwellers, but I have all this at home!!
author: Rob R.

description:
The line is long if you get there beyond 15 minutes after opening but prepare yourself by either bringing coffee and a paper or by getting there at 7am.  This place is so worth the wait and all the hype.
I have been a regular here for as long as I can remember.  I order their Monte Cristo sandwich every time and they even tease me and tell me they are out of the Monte Cristo from time to time.  I am addicted to their version of the Monte Cristo for breakfast.  This sandwich is made on brioche, black forest ham, low salt turkey, cheddar, Swiss, and then battered in egg and cooked just like French toast.  Ollalaberry sauce for dipping.  
Granted I need a lot of exercise after this but it is always worth it.
author: D B.

description:
Okay. I don't know why I haven't been to Mama's sooner but now I can't wait to go back! It is worth all the hype and exceeded my expectations. 

My friend and I decided at the last minute to hit up Mama's. it's a Tuesday morning, it shouldn't be so bad. We were wrong. Although I found parking very easily and nearby, the line was already several parties deep (outside that is). Inside the line was already formed as well. We waited about 30 minutes until we were able to order and then another 15 to get seated. I think the wait time (which is beyond their control) was one of the low points for me. The other low point is that they only accept cash or debit card (with a $1 fee). Luckily I had my debit card with me that morning (it was very spontaneous) and could forgive the $1 fee because the food was magnificent. 

My friend and I split the Apple Pan Dore and the Mama's Breakfast Sandwich with crab. My friend has previously been to Mama's and suggested the Pan Dore. It already sounded delicious from the start and it was even more amazing after I took my first bite. It is not a typical french toast as the slices of the baguette are thin and almost resemble blintzes. The apples are thinly sliced and cover the whole middle portion of the plate and the lemon butter was one of the most amazing things I've ever had. It had just the right zing to it and complemented the whole thing so well. And they do not hold back on it. They were practically drowning in the lemon butter, as they should be! I will definitely come back for those!

The Mama's Breakfast Sandwich with crab was also delicious. It is on their specials menu as they have many shrimp and crab items on there at the moment. A lot of the crab options sounded amazing but some were very pricey ($21.50 for an omelet or the benedict) and the sandwich was still pretty pricey ($14.50) but was very good. The crab was fresh (as you can watch them cook while you're in line to order) and they paired it with fluffy scrambled eggs and cheese and put it all on a soft bun. It comes with their yummy home fries. 

I also had their fresh-squeezed orange juice, which was great! Not too sweet or too tangy and I do love fresh-squeezed!

Overall the experience was great. The food was just as amazing as everyone said it would be and I believe in the end it was worth my wait. Only downsides are the wait (which I have been told can be up to an hour) and not accepting credit cards (which is hard when some of the items can be pricey).
author: Tab C.

description:
I've heard about this place from multiple people and seen it in multiple guidebooks. Always wanted to come check it out but scared of the lines. We attempted to try to beat the crowds by coming early, around 8am... of course other people had the same idea so we still had to wait in line for an hour. 

We had the crab Benedict, crab omelet with brie and avocado, the french toast sampler (this comes with the blueberry pound cake, poppy seed pound cake, and the regular bread for french toast), and the dollar pancakes. Everything was pretty good. I loved their syrup and their homemade jam to go with the pancakes and french toasts.

But honestly there wasn't anything that was exceptional where I would stand in an hour line again. I still prefer Olea's custard french toast over any of this stuff any day! 

I'm glad I got that checked off my list tho! Next!
author: Cynthia C.

description: I recently went on a quick trip to San Francisco.  If you haven't eaten here you should because the food is amazing!  The wait was nearly an hour and once inside the menu and food looked divine!  I will make sure I come back to Mama's on my next trip.  The food was so good my friends and I didn't have a chance to snap any photos for yelp/facebook.  We just dove right in and everything was cooked perfectly and the flavors were awesome!  Can't wait to eat here again!
author: Tony K.

description:
The wait really did suck. But it's been 4 years and I still have dreams about this place. We went seriously overboard when we ordered (I think we were cold and excited after a 1.5 hour wait). 

The french toast is off the hook crazy orgasmic good yumminess that you will tell your grandchildren about and they will tell their grandchildren about. We got one of each kind. I have tried to recreate the different variations multiple times and have failed miserably with every endeavor. The sampler is a good way to go. 

The Monte Cristo got eaten cold later (did I mention the french toast?) but was still super tasty. I think the eggy-mixture would have been better had I eaten it warm but def not worth dinging a star off. I'll defer to other comments on this one. I figure if it was awesome 6 hours later, it would have been better then.  

If you're in town for the day or even a morning, grab a coffee at a place nearby and have a cracker, but save your appetite because you'll want to try it all.
author: Ellie R.

description:
Food: 5/5 - Breakfast/brunch here is one of the best in SF, with the french toast and of course the Monte Cristo being tough to beat. 

Service: 2/5 - Given that the waits are so extremely long, I personally think that this is a one-and-done place. The food is great, but it's not worth waiting an hour plus unless you've never been here before.  

Ambiance: 3/5 - Given that a good majority of the seating ends up being near people who are in line/placing orders or even outside waiting in line, I'd say that it's not huge on ambiance here.

Value: 5/5 - Given that everything is under $15, it doesn't get much better than this, and clearly the prices haven't been altered to meet demand.
author: Kevin T.

description: The food was pretty good, the Monte Cristo, the crab+egg, french toast sample... but I wouldn't go back. The wait is sooo long it's just not worth it! And when you're finally seated, it feels like you have to rush because there's so many people waiting outside looking at you eating...
author: Tina D.

description: Theres nothing more to say about this place! I ate here twice during my 5 day stay! sooo good
author: Charity C.

description:
I think my expectations were too high for this place.  

We arrived at 7:35 am on the Wednesday morning before Christmas and there was absolutely no wait.  This allowed me to get some nice pictures of my girlfriend and I in front of Mama's sans line.  There's a nice little park just outside Mama's where lots of elderly Asian ladies do early morning tai chi, so we strolled around the park a little bit and ran back as soon as we saw a line starting to form (around 7:45 am).  Everyone who was there by 8 am made it in the first seating.  But I can imagine that anyone who arrived past 8:15 am might have had a really long wait.  We were in and out by 8:45 am and the line was a block long when we left the place.  How it works is you wait outside for a bit, and then you go inside and wait inside for a bit to order at the counter.  You don't order unless there are actually seats for you.  Obviously, for us there were plenty of seats, but the group who arrived at 8:15 am and just missed the first seating was standing there at the counter watching everyone eat for quite a long time.  How sad.

I ordered the dungeoness crab eggs benedict and my girlfriend had the low fat french toast (she was on a diet).  The eggs were cooked perfectly and the crab blended very well with the spinach and egg, but the hollandaise had a little too much mayo for my taste (and way too much for my girlfriend's taste).  The low fat french toast was good, but sort of underwhelming.  If I walked into my local brunch place and got this eggs benedict and this french toast, I would probably think it was fantastic.  Would I wait 20 minutes in line for this?  Probably.  Well, I guess I did.  But an hour or two?  Probably not.
author: Kenny Y.

description:
Besides the hr and a half wait outside, Mama's is a solid breakfast joint that has some history.  Growing up in SF, I didn't even know about this place, as well as all the other foodie/touristy places, but I was able to try it a few weeks ago after hearing about it from a friend.  

I had no complaints about the food.  It was fresh, made to order, savory, and delicious.  The prices are reasonable.
author: Justin L.

description:
They were once great. Not anymore!
I have been to this place for about 4 times. I did not mind the wait because for me, having a bit of wait for great food is necessary. I usually waited at least 45 minutes and that was fine.

But all I ask is keeping their quality consistent. Last Sunday, I visited this place again, the line was long as usual. I was with my friends from visiting from Paris to eat there and I wanted to give them a good experience. We waited an hour to get in. We were excited and hungry by the time we got in.

I ordered my favorite Florentine Benedict, but... it tasted pretty awful. The Spinach and mushrooms were not well done. I thought I was eating grass. The egg which was made in some boiling water with vinegar, was overly sour  . Terrible. Don't even mention the cold roasted potatoes. Ugh! that's awful!

Good thing is my friends liked their pancakes. I at least felt glad that I did give them a good time!

I hope it was only an individual case! I will still visit this place and if it was good, I will surely review it again and rate what it deserves.
author: Mel C.

description: This is a place I have been going to for about 15 years! I realized this weekend that I have yet to write a review for it. The one thing that changed, unless I just don't remember, is that lines never seemed to be so long! This is a tiny place where everything is fresh, made in front of you, and just absolutely delicious! I could never remember what I ordered the time before but the french toast is out of this world. This time around I ordered the seasonal crab benedict. I must have changed my mind about a thousand times in line and when I walked in and saw the dish in person the decision was easy! Like always, very delicious with lots of flavor and good proportion of all ingredients. The home fries on the side are great even though I am usually not a fan. My only advice is to try to go early or you'll wait!
author: Christopher B.

description: A friend n I decided to come to this place because the reviews were so great. The wait was about a hour long, the wait outside and the line to order and be seated. The menu had my mouth watering the entire time. Food came and it was a work of art. The food is bland for my tasting but nothing salt, pepper, and ketchup couldn't help. Worth the wait yes, something about the whole experience. Also everything is fresh.yumm
author: Andrea B.

description:
This is one of our favorite restaurants in SF!

We tried the "Monte Cristo," "Salmon Benedict," & "French Toast Sampler." I'm so glad we shared cause everything was so good!  What I couldn't get enough of was the Salmon Benedict & I really don't even eat salmon that much.

It's a pretty small, cozy place, so I can see how people would have to wait in line to go in. We were fortunate to order & get seated right away at a nice table by the window.  I think we got special treatment cause the waiter seemed very interested in my brother.  Lol!

Love these little family owned restaurants & there's so many good ones in SF!
author: Lori F.

description: The wait was about an hour, but it was worth it. I had the monte cristo. It was fluffy and so delicious. I want to go back tomorrow morning and have the same thing before I leave SF.
author: Sergio S.

description: Worth the wait! Awesome service and atmosphere! We ordered 2 breakfast entrees each thinking we would just try them all out and we ended up finishing them all! Talk to the staff about there favorites and I'd recommend trying what they suggest.
author: Josh W.

description: If you're extremely hungry, I suggest you come early. The wait is a good 30 minutes to an hour long. But don't let the wait discourage you from staying, there are plenty of delectable dishes to taste from, from the French toast to the omelets! Each dish is perfectly seasoned and the atmosphere makes you feel right at home.
author: Danh N.

description: The absolute best breakfast I've ever had at a restaurant. I ordered The Californian Omellete, and it was awesome! I loved how the bacon was cooked seperately, and how they just folded the eggs and cheese over the bacon and avocado. I also had the Buttermilk Pancakes with  fresh berries. I would have to say that these were the best hot cakes I've ever had. And, as if it couldn't get any better, I spread some of thier home made jam on. WOW! Absolutely addicting! I was a little hesitant because of the prices, and the line, but after trying the food, I am definitely going back. And I'm bringing some new people with me.
author: Ron Z.

description:
NOT WORTH waiting in line for 2 hours.
nice decoration and environment, friendly staff.
regular price, regular good food. nothing different from good breakfast/brunch that you eat in other places. really, nothing special!
if you want to know how long you need to wait in line, this is our experience: 70 ppl were in front of us, we stood in line for 2h 20m ouside the restaurant, 15m inside the restaurant. capacity of restaurant is ~45.
author: Neda M.

description: Came here for the 1st time cuz of the high rating from yelp. We waited in line for almost an hour. Will be our last time waiting here. The food is just ok. Didn't find nothing special. We were very confuse...never been so confuse in my life.
author: Suzie Q.

description:
I don't get this place, but I'm happy for people who do.  Even without a wait on a week day, it's not worth it.  Or with a mild wait on a weekend.  It's just not how I do brunch.  I want to chill, relax.  Not be cramped up, get in line to place my order, then be seated where people continue to walk by and brush against my chair.

If you like the triumphant feeling of eating brunch after waiting an hour, you should eat here.

I've never waited longer than 15 minutes here, so my review is purely based on the food.  It's whatevs.
author: Erika C.

description:
I went to this legendary breakfast spot on an off day hoping to avoid the infamous minimum half hour wait.  It was eight in the morning and I was rudely greeted with people already waiting to get inside.
What is it about this place that has 'em all lined-up all the time?  Or is Mama's a tourist trap?
After waiting only half an hour, I got my answer.

Mama's is kinda touristy but it's not their fault.
So many articles (and Yelp reviews) have been written about this place that they can't help but attract tons of locals and visitors alike.

Overall, it is a nice breakfast spot -- great North Beach location near Saints Peter and Paul Church and food that embodies a bit of its rich Italian history as well as California cooking.
I was particularly digging the pancetta omelet.
The wife, on the other hand, enjoyed her pancakes with fresh berries.

I still don't know if it's worth the wait (maybe one more visit is needed since I didn't taste the pastries) but I'd recommend giving it a try.
If you do go, please please check out the bathroom.  It is an adventure you won't soon forget.
author: Dan B.

description:
I'm not really a breakfast person but this was the BEST breakfast I have ever had. We heard about Mama's through some friends and decided to wait in the hour long line (huge line on a Wednesday at 11, yes on a Wednesday!)

The Monte Cristo was AMAZING! Think French Toast with cheese ham and jam!

We also had the corned beef benedict which was the BEST benedict I've ever had mainly because of the yummy hollandaise sause.

Lastly we had the dollar pancakes. Again - BEST pancakes I've ever had. They were super thick and fluffy and a little crispy on the outside.

Portions were great! Drinks were over priced ($7 for a small mimosa) but the long line was well worth the wait! We will definitely be back!
author: Janelle R.

description: The food was great!  Waiting 3 hours for it made it taste less great.  Let's just say, I wouldn't ever do it again.  Sure, try it once.  But you'd be a fool to wait in that line more than once.
author: Courtney L.

description:
Not good really at all.

Please don't let the line out the door fool you - it's only like that because of the insane ordering setup they have inside - its ridiculous, never seen anything like it. You basically stand in line waiting to order at the counter until a table is available, which makes it look like from outside, that people are clamoring to get in and get some good food - but no such luck.

Went with some friends that heard it was good - NONE of us out of a party of 5 thought it actually was.

The icing on the cake, was that they purposely leave the "tip" from the table before you so when you sit down on the otherwise clean table, you see that money there so you are reminded that, even though you ordered at the counter, that they still expect you to leave a tip. Rude and obnoxious. 

The benedicts were somewhat edible, but not in a good way and that is as far as it goes - semi-raw potatoes (no crisp whatsoever) and terrible, terrible watery coffee. They don't even give you actual half and half, they give you a skimpy little carafe of regular milk. Sorry, NO.

Trust me on one thing, I know good breakfasts - Never going back - the tourists that don't know any better can stand in line instead of me.
author: J D.

description:
Sunday morning, around 10am, more then an hour wait. When you finally get in, you have to wait again to order your food, and wait again for a table. Staff is very friendly. 

I tried to be healthy and get the egg white scramble with mushroom and spinich. It wasn't bad, but nothing special. 

The hubby got the monte cristo! So freaking good! I would come just for that. What I really liked about it was that it was not oily at all. Just full of flavor.
author: Karen H.

description:
I came here for breakfast with boyfriend, sister and OUR mama last weekend on a Sunday around 8:30AM after being disappointed by the long line that we couldn't get into for the free zip-lining they had at the pier because the cut-off point was 500 people. 

I knew we would probably get there only to see another line because they are known for people lining up to get into the restaurant. But at least they wouldn't cut us off, I figured. So I came, and sure enough just as we were coming to it in the car, I told my boyfriend to get out of the car (and my mother did the same with my sister in her car) to get in the line. 

Well, the waiting was worth it:

a.) We were given free samples of their blueberry muffin while we were waiting in line. 

b.) You get to keep changing your mind and take time deciding what to get once you got in the restaurant as you looked at their menu posted outside.

5 stars because:

a.) I would come back again whether it'd be breakfast or lunch (which I have yet to try).

b.) they make their own jam everyday (it is at every table in this square container). And yes, it was very good jam. They even let us take some of it to-go in containers. 

c.) you get to see them make your food, which adds to the fun and excitement 

d.) we got very good seats by the window (which opens) with a view of the park across the street. 

e.) even though you wait in line to get in (and wait in another line to get to the register to order your food), once you get past that step you get to thoroughly enjoy the meal and get great service from friendly people that work there and the size of the place does go along with the cozy atmosphere it has. 

As it was a Sunday, thank goodness we got there at the time we got there at because by the time we got out the line was a lot longer outside for people waiting for their turn to enjoy their Sunday brunch. 

Our order:

My boyfriend and I ordered/shared their French Toast Sampler and the Nelson's Ranchero (2 poached eggs over black beans with a side of potatoes and 3 tortillas). 

Sister and mama ordered their eggs benedict (my sister ordered the shrimp one and my mother the salmon one). They also ordered a Bloody Mary and coffee (which they both liked but I couldn't take probably because I can't take those kinds of drinks in general). 

You can refer to the photos posted. 

The one minus point was the banana bread french toast in the sampler - it was too dry for our taste (which I guess might be great if you drench it in syrup but not everyone does that).
author: Mona Lisa M.

description: Okay, the food is about a 4 and the service is great, but we got there 20 min after they opened on a weekday and waited 2 hours. The food is good, but not 2 hours good.
author: Monica P.

description:
Mama's ! What a wonderful place. Immediately you are greeted with a smile that makes the wait worth it.  This authentic place not only serves wonderful food it takes you back to when people were simple. A time of excuses me's, thanks you's and may I's. Everything here is made with love. 

 We were only in SF for a day and saw the reviews on Yelp and had to try it out. What a welcoming place. Thanks MAMA'S !
author: Valentine K.

description: Dude, is all the waiting necessary? Really? I've heard this place has phenom breakfasts but did not expect the long wait.  North Beach has so many dining options so We could've easily gone elsewhere but look, over 2000 mostly positive reviews can't be ignored so yeah, food was fantastic.
author: Michael L.

description:
I was stuck in between to either rate this a 3 or a 4. too bad i can't add halves because the crab benedict was pretty good. but good enough for a 1.5-2hr long wait? No, at least not for me. I shared the Swedish Cinnamon toast and the crab benedict. the benedict was pretty good. i also ordered a fresh squeezed orange juice.

line wait: 1.5 hrs
food wait: less than 20 mins

crab benedict: good, but not too impressed compared to past experiences

cinnamon french toast: maybe should have gotten the monte cristo or the sampler... definitely was not my favorite. the syrup seemed like it was diluted or something...more similar to a water consistency. instead of using the syrup, i used their home-made jam which was pretty delicious.

the tabasco sauce also seemed kind of runny... had to pour on more than i usually do

i don't think i'd wait this long for mama's ever again, but if i go to a time when the line is max 30 mins, i'd be sure to try out the other foods that are recommended by others
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Mama I'm coming home.... And when I get there, I will wait a whole bunch for your love and attention, but it's totally totally worth it.

Came here for breakfast on a Sunday.  Bring a pre-breakfast snack, or you will just end up eyeing the patrons like a hungry wolverine.  We ended waiting only about 30 minutes outside for a table, and then another 15 to order and get a table.  At some point I considered ordering the entire menu, but my mind was made up once we started in the line to order food.  You overlook the kitchen and all the ingredients, and that's when little shrimpies came into my life, and into my belly.

I had the shrimp benedict with avocado and roasted tomato, which was on special, and my friends had the huevos rancheros.  We all split the chocolate french toast.  Everything was tasty, super fresh, 5 stars.

One star deducted for the following.  A friend ended up in the neighborhood and came in to say hello, when we were about 3/4th of the way done.  She sat down and pretty much got accosted by the bus boy and wait staff, who yelled at her for skipping the line.  She hadn't ordered a single thing - evidently, her mere presence in the restaurant was enough to raise the ire of the entire service team.  Frankly, it was rude.  She did end up ordering, and we spent probably a whole extra 5 minutes at the table.  Next time, be nice.  Mama would want it that way.
author: Katie S.

description: Excellent on a sunny morning. 45 min wait. Walked over to cathederal and checked it  out while friends waited in line. Parking is challenging if your much after 10am.
author: Terry S.

description: Heed the warnings about the WAIT!! I haven't been here in 35 years so I really wanted to come back. I guess it was about reminiscing because it definitely wasn't the food, and I do NOT remember the wait being that long. TWO HOURS JUST IN LINE OUTSIDE. We got in line at 8 when they opened. Sorry, no food is worth that, and Mama's is just okay...nothing special. Super nice busy staff, though, and birthday greetings to everyone!
author: Rose N.

description:
Went here recently on a Tuesday afternoon wait was not to bad about 25 mins. I have been wanting to here for many years but never got around to it. Went ahead and ordered the crab benedict which I had heard so many good things about.

When the food arrived it looked great but once we started eating it seemed to lack seasoning it was very plain and the crab had a very fishy taste to it idk if it was old or had sat out too long, My friend I was with had the crab omelet and expereinced the same taste when eating the crab breakfast cost a little over 50$ which would have been great had the meal been awesome. Maybe they were having an off today. On a bright note the coffee and blueberry sour cream pastry were good.

Hopefully if I decide to give it another shot it will be a diffrent story.
author: Michael W.

description: Undoubtedly one of the best French Toasts ever! Try it with the homemade jam. I would suggest going on a weekday to avoid a long wait.
author: Spandana R.

description: We heard really good things about this place, and we decided to try it for are selfs, and even waiting for 40-45 min on the sidewalk and talking with other people from all over the country the time went by fast, they did have some good food, and their breakfast cake was D-lishes. The only thing  bad about this place is the parking, my advise get up early and find a parking place and/or a parking garage. Good food at great prices, come down a give it a try...
author: Leone G.

description: Not worth a wait, forget two hours.  Food is okay and reasonably priced.   Staff is friendly enough.  Cash or debit card with $1 fee.
author: Z Z.

description: We had the Santa Fe omelette it was huge. French toast is awesome, as well as the potatoes. Well seasoned. Def worth the wait. I would come back and eat here again. I would recommend this to everyone.
author: Karina G.

description:
This place was featured on Rachael Ray's show! 

The lines are usually really long and they only let a certain amount of people inside the restaurant to order because the place is pretty quaint and small. My friends and I ordered the club sandwich, french toast, and the monte cristo! (this is the most popular/really unique dish). The guy at the cash register whose grandma owned this place said his personal favorite was the prosciutto and tomato omelette. He was super friendly too :) my friend who took us here RAVED about their homemade carrot cake with cream cheese frosting and since they didn't have any...the cash register guy sent us 2 desserts on the house :) some chocolate crumble thing and an apple crumble? Both really delicious. Only complaint I have is that it took a really long time to get our meal...but I guess good things come to those who wait.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I always try and find a reason to go to San Francisco and THIS is always one of the main reasons. Yeah there's pretty much always a line but is it worth the wait? Cmon....look at all the reviews...look at all the beautiful vibrant pictures that can't even capture how good their food tastes...isn't it a no brainer?!

Monte Cristo - If you don't know what it is i feel extremely sorry for you. An unbelievably good sandwich that makes no sense at all!! A ham and cheese sandwich fried in batter then eaten with home made jam from heaven?! GENIUS!

Everything else - Is above average and most are exceptional! But FOCUS on the monte cristo and the jam that could even bring a smile on the HULK'S angry face if someone could bait him into eating it...

Seriously go here
author: Andrew D.

description: Been here twice and didn't like the French toast either time.  The baguette French toast was dainty/rich.  The signature French toast just wasn't anything special. Definitely happy to let the tourists take this spot over.
author: Click C.

description:
I did enjoy the food here and I sure love Eggs Benedict!

I only wish the wait wasn't always usually an hour. Although, they are efficient in trying to get the line to move so kudos for Mama's there.

I had the shrimp/avocado eggs benedict special which was really good! I would have tried the dungeness crab one, but it is pricey and I'm not always for the whole crab taste...
The french toast sampler was good too! But I think I'll stick to my eggs, french toast can be a little too sweet/filling for me.

Next time I'll come back here and try the Monte Cristo that everyone keeps talking about...
author: Michelle L.

description:
Yes, the wait was worth it! Probably, one hour from the end of the line to being seated. But it was nice weather and we knew exactly what we were getting into :). Once you get inside, the service is amazing, water glass always filled and coffee refills did not stop coming. There have a lot of choices for breakfast and lunch. 

Thus far, I have tried the prosciutto/tomato eggs benedict served with red potatoes, the Californian--an omelet with avocado, bacon, and monterey jack, served with red potatoes and fresh backed sour dough bread, and the buttermilk pancakes, served with fresh fruit, dusted off with powdered sugar and delicious syrup or their house jam. 

Parking is a bit hectic. There is street parking all around (if you can find a spot), but it is two hours only, also there is metered parking available, but remember there may be an hour wait. Also they DO NOT  take credit cards. CASH or DEBIT only! Over all a great place for breakfast or lunch.
author: Olya S.

description: I absolutely love this place. Expect to wait at least 45 minutes. Everytime I've come I've always waited but the wait is well worth it. I usually get the dungeness crab Benedict. But I also recommend the monte cristo. Mama's French toast sampler is also very tasty. I do recommend coming really early of you don't want to wait but if you do it is well worth it.
author: Clarissa A.

description:
After hearing about this restaurant from all of my friends and after several attempts of trying to come here but being too lazy to, J and I finally were able to make it. We were prepared to wait over an hour. The wait was actually about 25min, which was surprising, considering it was a Friday, and it was freaking beautiful in the city. 

Iced Coffee - good brew, and made just the way I like it. Slightly bitter, and not too creamy, we added sugar to taste and it was just perfect. Strangely, their coffee didn't give me the bubble guts...

Crumb Cake - This was good. Nothing outstanding. Some parts were slightly dry, yet the crumbs were a bit more moist, which was nice. The helping was a good size for two people to split.

Eggs Benedict - Off the record, I absolutely do not like Eggs Benedict or thick cut bacon. I also dislike Hollandaise sauce greatly. That being said, Janette ordered this, and I tried it. Pretty amazing. A perfectly poached egg on top of Hollandaise that was neither overly creamy or overly citrusy. Additionally, their use of thicker cut bacon actually worked better. This place probably cooks the best thick cut bacon. It was still slightly crispy yet had good texture. The tomato added a nice refreshing contrast to the creaminess of the whole dish.

Monte Cristo - Hands down the best breakfast sandwich in the world. the cheeses, ham, turkey, bread, and french toast batter all meld perfectly, and you can eat it as is. However, adding the home made jam creates this culinary orgasmic entity that just encompasses your mind and body into taste bud bliss. This is the freaking sandwich. I refuse to order anything else here because of how much I enjoyed this sandwich... so I'm pretty much now backing on tasting what my friends ordered the next time I come here.

Like my friend Char said, I kind of didn't like the $5 being left on the table as a reminder to leave a tip. I thought that tips are pretty much default at sit down places... that was kind of a turn off and made me dock a star (I don't normally dock stars for stuff like this, but have their servers been shafted that often?). The servers and cashier were all very nice and helpful, and the turnaround at the restaurant for tables is really quick.
author: Marc T.

description:
This place is always good, but you better be an early bird if you don't want to wait forever!  Everytime I have gone I have gotten in line before they open and it never seems to get any shorter no matter what time of day.  

I had the monte cristo,  really tasty.  It was grilled like french toast and served with their amazing raspberry perserves.  All the food is awesome, and its amazing what they turn out in such a small space.
author: Loretta M.

description:
I feel like I should have gotten a shirt after eating here that said "I braved the line at Mama's and all I got was this shirt".

I waited in line for probably an hour and a half.  Was the food worth that long of a wait.  No.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good.  The food is not worth the wait though.  I have eaten at other breakfast places and can't say that there was anything here that stood out more than other places.  They did have good homemade jam though!  The food is fresh which is great.  I'm sure they know that they dont have to offer anything to those waiting in line because they know they will always have a line but a cup of coffee while waiting would have been GREAT customer service.  Maybe some water or something.   

So I can walk away saying I ate at Mama's but I would not stand in that line again.
author: Kari C.

description:
Mama, your food is so YUMMY! 

This was the second time back at Mama's. My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday morning and there was a huge line in front (no surprise). We waited in line for about 2 hours and it was well worth it. 

I decided to order the Prosciutto and Tomato Benedict. (I had the shrimp Benedict last time). My boyfriend got the Monte Cristo, like always, and the Italian sausage patty. Everything was delicious. I love their hollandaise sauce and their Prosciutto was perfect and crispy. My boyfriends Monte Cristo was cooked perfectly. It tasted better to me without the jam. The Sausage patty tasted like the sausage found as a pizza topping but in a good way. 

I'm having Mama withdrawals already! Can't wait to come back!
author: Linda W.

description:
Mama's is such a cute place! We went on a week day a few hours before closing and it was surprisingly not so crowded. You basically stand in line and order your food then stand around and wait to be seated. We had to wait about 10 to 15 minutes before a table was available. Like the majority of places in SF, this place is small and there is limited seating. The staff are all extremely friendly which makes the experience THAT much better!

My friend ordered the salmon eggs benedict with their home fries and a gravy sauce that goes along with it. I had a bite of it and it was delicious! I would definitely recommend it if you love eggs benedict. 

I ordered the monte cristo. It was amazing! It's basically a sandwich with ham, turkey, and cheese that's dipped in eggs and then cooked. It comes with 4 pieces and your choice of home fries or hashbrowns I believe (I got the home fries) and fresh fruit. OH, and it comes with homemade jam. The jam is AMAZING! So good! I placed a good serving on each bite of my sandwich =X

If you are looking for a breakfast/brunch place with excellent customer service and food, this is THE place to go. You won't be disappointed :)
author: Melanie L.

description:
Waiting in line to get my book signed by David Sedaris earlier this year, I stressed and sweated over what I would say to the funniest author alive when it came my turn. You've ALL heard my Tim Lincecum story (and if you haven't yet, I will GLADLY tell it to you), and hell... I was even shy to approach Keane L. to say hi at the first elite event I went to.

Needless to say, I am easily, EASILY star-struck.

So, FUCK YEAH I'M EXCITED I SAW AN OLSEN TWIN AT MAMA'S ON SATURDAY!!!!! An Olsen twin actually EATING something!!! That has to count for at least FIVE star sightings, right?? :)

Anyway, before I spotted one half of everyone's favorite little Tanner on TV in the 90s, we waited 40 minutes (a relatively "short" wait) outside at Mama's. Up until they stop seating people at 3pm, this is what you have to come prepared for... doesn't matter how early or late you arrive, there will always be a line.

There's definitely a bit of mama's cozy sweetness in this little space. The staff is also very friendly. I thought the food was pretty good, but I just wasn't as big of a fan as everyone else seems to be. Kim V. and I split the Northern Italian omelet and the super sweet and sticky Pan Dore (pancake-like bread smothered in apples and lemon butter sauce). The next time I feel like trekking across town via muni and then waiting at least an hour more for food, I'm gonna try one of their scrumptious-looking benedicts. 

Mostly, I will return in hopes of again being able to hide my camera behind a Christmas tree centerpiece paparazzi-style to catch a recording of an I'm-so-cool-and-famous-I-wear-sunglasses-indoors celeb coming out of Mama's bathroom.

I regret reporting I did not photograph her nibbling on her sandwich, but I swear she ate something. It was Ashley, after all.
author: Kate V.

description:
Seriously...one of the longest waits I've had for food. I'm not a fan of waiting really (one hour wait).  Luckily I wasn't starving like hell...well take that back, I wasn't already starving when I got here but I did get hungrier waiting in line.  My friend and I went here today and it was chilly but there was this huge line.  She told me everytime she passes by there's always a long line.  BUT everyone who's been here told her it's worth the wait.  All we were thinking is this so better be 'cuz we were cold and getting hungrier by the minute.  As we were waiting in line we were trying hard not to drool while people inside were eating in front of us.  I did feel better knowing that portions were good when I did take a peek of people eating.  

When we finally got in, there's a menu (if you didn't take a look at the one that was outside) above the kitchen counter and you go to the register and order what you want and pay right there.  OH and it's CASH ONLY...luckily my friend and I made a trip to the BofA down 2 blocks while one of us waited in line.  

I had the crab benedict while my friend had the monte cristo sandwich.  We ended up splitting it with one another and it was both oooooohhhhh so amazing.  Definitely a hearty breakfast/brunch but well deserved after waiting in the cold.  SO GOOD.  Fresh dungenous crab...so sweet and amazing.  And cheesy monte cristo sandwich.  Love in breakfast form.
author: Kim D.

description:
This is how good the food at Mama's is: We saw an Olsen twin during our brunch. She was noshing on a sandwich. Mama's is so amazing, it gets an Olsen twin to eat.

The food here makes Olsen twins return to the city where they got their start (sort of) and wear sunglasses indoors while ingesting carbs. But it's just as amazing for diners of a less rich and famous stripe. And if you come to eat at Mama's on a weekend, there is a likely chance that you'll be in the line outside the tiny restaurant for upwards of half an hour or more. But like any good mama, you'll be pretty darn pleased with the results of your labor. There are omelets crammed with meat and veggie goodies, crumb cakes, and an apple pan dore served under a pool of lemon butter sauce that will have you exclaiming, "Have mercy."

ETA: A couple people have asked if I have photographic proof of the Olsen sighting. So I'm adding this, even if there is no evidence of actual food ingestion: http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/ZrnrWCsZFnxzkWnU-PLWmg/l. 

Come on, NOBODY likes to have their picture taken while eating.
author: Kimberly V.

description:
Went there today with a girlfriend. Got there around 10:15am and had to wait 45 minutes outside with a handful of die-hard locals but mostly a horde of SF-hoodie wearing tourists. 

The place is small and the demand is great and for good reason. Sweet or savory, you will not be disappointed. It was my girlfriend's first time (and my umpteenth), so I let her choose two dishes to share. The way it works is you waitwaitwait, order at the counter (CASH/DEBIT ONLY), then wait to be seated. Based on rave reviews by Yelpers, my friend chose the Monte Cristo (who in @*?! name orders from the lunch menu at Mama's?!?!) and the French Toast Sampler. Oh, and a few pastries to go :)

We were both gravely disappointed with the Monte Cristo but delighted with the French Toast. How can you go wrong with perfectly ripe, fresh berries topping fresh baked goodness? Since the savory selection was a bust, we asked the table busser if we could bypass the long line and order some sort of Benedict. He took the order for us! And then, a server came by to confirm our order and we had poached eggs less than 10 min later!

If you've never been, it's definitely worth trying but I wouldn't make it your go-to brunch spot...that is, unless you eat at home first to help your stomach make it through the wait (the ridiculous wait that will undoubtedly be had no matter when you go) to second breakfast. Mmmm...I heart second breakfast.
author: Jasmyn M.

description:
This place probably deserves 4 stars, but the two hour wait was not worth the food, so therefore it gets three. 

I got the Shrimp Eggs Benedict (I really wanted dungeness crab, but no way am I spending $19.50 on one breakfast dish) and it was just ok. The avocado overpowered the shrimp flavor and my eggs were slightly too vinegary.

I had a slice of the Monte Crisco sandwich and although it was my first and I don't have anything to compare it to, it was quite possibly the most delicious sandwich I've ever had. All the flavors just simply worked together as the entire thing melted in my mouth. Also great with the jam! 

Everyone else really enjoyed what they got: chocolate pancakes and california omelet, so it could have just been that I got the one thing on the menu that was subpar. However, I'm not willing to go back and give it another chance because of the ridiculous wait. 

Pro tip- by the time we got our food it was around 2:30 and the line had gone down considerably. They stop letting people in line around 3, so if you are willing to have a late brunch/early dinner, you'd only have to wait about 45 min

They also only accept debt (and charge you $1) or cash... super lame.
author: Rona Y.

description:
I decided to come on a Thursday afternoon with my boyfriend in order to skip the line. 

Good thing.. because the food turned out not to be as good as we expected.

We both got different versions of the french toast (he got cinnamon and chocolate and i got apple yogurt) and they were GOOD but they weren't AMAZING. 

Our latte and mocha weren't very good either... 

I really really wanted to love this place but I guess our expectations were just too high..

I will be returning to try something else and yelping about it! 
Keep you posted.
author: Allie E.

description: I don't suppose they need another review but here goes. 8:00 am we got in line by 9:26 we were done with breakfast. Very polite service and of course awesome food.
author: Dave L.

description: So freaking good. Line blows (always a damn line) but it's totally worth it.  Food is absolutely amazing.
author: Wesley R.

description:
I literally live a block away from Mamas and ever since elementary through high school, I've walked past here every single morning.  The line has always been long every day!  Maybe because it was so close and since I was still young, I've never thought of trying Mamas. 

Now years later, I finally came here with my boyfriend to try it out yesterday.  It was a rainy morning when we arrived at 10:00am.  Luckily there was no line!  Mamas is so small!  You line up to order at the counter then find yourself a seat to sit while you wait for your food.  The workers here are amazingly nice!  Once you are seated, they come up to you & serve you your beverage and will bring you your food.  Matt ordered the eggs benedict with potatoes and I ordered the trio sampler french toast served with bananas, strawberries, and blueberries.  The food was soooooo good and no wonder there's always a line.  Matt was WOWED by the flavors of his eggs benedict because usually the ham is very salty but not here.  It complemented the poached egg and English muffin very well.  My trio french toast was as amazing served with their homemade raspberry jam.  

I had a hard time ordering because I wanted to try so many things!  The portions are perfect, everyone is able to finish their plate of food.  Such great quality in a smaller portion compared to other breakfast joints.  After about 10 minutes, more and more people came and line was finally formed!  So glad we came right before the line!  

Plenty of metered parking across the street by the park, they only accept cash and atm cards, and the restroom is actually outside by the back door (still kept  neatly!).
author: Lily M.

description: LOVEEEEEEEEE this place. The wait is always incredibly long, but its so worth it. Get the monte cristo, french toast sampler and crab benedict. You won't be disappointed!
author: Heather R.

description:
If your a tourist and you have the 2 hrs to wait for your food, then be my guest- Mama's is your place and SF welcomes you. For the rest of the folks, it really wasn't that good. Another overhyped restaurant.

+ Everything looked really good

+ Smells were good too

+ The cakes and muffins were so very tempting

- Hard to park a car and unless you live around here, tricky to get to

- Long wait, 2 types of lines outside and inside too

- Too many french toast-like items on the menu

- Pricey for what it is

- Uncomfortable seating and table area, stressful at times

- Too rich, too much butter and sugar, left feeling ill
author: Shannon Z.

description: The food is divine but I knocked off a star for the excessive wait time! The French toast sampler is absolutely delicious and the omelettes are superb as well! The atmosphere inside is very homey and the staff treat you like family! If you have time on your hands and you want some delicious breakfast, head to Mamas!
author: Diana F.

description: Have to take this place off my list to visit because I refuse to eat anywhere where I have to pay cash. Credit Cards for safety reasons alone should be accepted everywhere.
author: Christopher W.

description: Got there at 8:15am on a Saturday and waited in line for 1.5 hours to place our order, to-go. (They don't accept to-go orders on weekends). We got the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast, the Monte Cristo, the original crumb cake, and a walnut raspberry pastry.  I forgot to order/add the berries to my french toast, but they were still delicious without it, just added some syrup. Best french toast I've ever had. I tried a few bites of the Monte Cristo and it was really good too! Original crumb cake was better than the walnut raspberry.  I'd definitely go back next time I'm in town if I'm not pressed for time.
author: Grace I.

description:
Wanted to check out this place due to all the hype. Will agree they make a tasty breakfast, but nothing you couldn't find elsewhere in the City (Just For You, Serendipity, Boogaloos, Pork Store, Andalu - to name a few).

The service was SEVERELY lacking. You wait outside in a line to come INSIDE and wait in another line. Then you stand and wait until a table is free. It's also strange because you stand in-line to order, but then you're given wait service???

I feel like Mama is very confused, either be a full service restaurant or be a quick and easy cafe. Don't make your patrons wait in 3 separate lines and then expect a 20% tip for your server(s).

All in all, I was happy to try it once, but the food and confusing service doesn't warrant a return.
author: Rana A.

description: NOT worth the wait.  We were there on a week day at around 10:30.  It was a full 1 hour and 45 minutes' wait before we began eating our food.  We waited in line outside.  We waited in line "inside" to order food at the register.  We waited in line to be seated.  We waited for our food to arrive.  The guy at the register (owner's son) was not welcoming or friendly...clearly enjoying business that comes from a collective thought that the food must be good because the line outside is long.  Or because Mama's is a fixture in the neighborhood, so everyone should try it.  But the food is nothing special, and we all agreed we wouldn't go again.
author: C G.

description:
I *just* finished eating here after several attempts over the last few months, and I have to say that it was a disappointment, although perhaps not for the "right" reasons.

French toast has become my litmus test for good breakfast joints, and while you would think that their French toast sampler, with all the rave reviews, would make this a five-star cafe, it's not what I wanted from my French toast.  Their sampler is made, not from regular bread/toast, but from banana bread and cranberry walnut bread, and another that I didn't take note of.  We all know that banana bread isn't really bread at all, but actually cake.  So the dish is attempting to be a cake version of French toast.  Despite the potential for off-the-chart sweetness, that alone isn't a deal breaker for me.  It's something interesting that I'm willing to try, but it wasn't even really that "French" in the context of French toast.  Rather than really drenching the "toast" in egg batter, which is a must in my book to be good French toast, they just lightly dipped *one side* in the batter.  So it turned out to be cake with an eggy side and syrup.  Just not what I wanted, or could even accept for French toast.  Sorry.

I also got a side of scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese, another one of my favorites.  The eggs were probably perfectly done when they came off of the grill, which means they were just slightly overdone when they were sitting in front of me on the table.  And rather than sprinkle in some grated cheddar cheese, they simply laid a slice of cheddar over the top of the eggs, so it was just barely melted.  They were still fairly good once I mixed them up, but certainly not exceptional.

The English muffin was perfectly done, but cold by the time I got it, the coffee was good, and the fresh squeezed orange juice was also good.  Not good enough to save the meal for me, though.

As for the place itself, it's very quaint and the staff are very friendly and efficient.  I got here at 7:30 and was the eighth person in line, so I had ordered by 8:05 and was eating by 8:15.  Not too bad, if the food was stellar.

I'll probably come once more and try one of their seafood and egg dishes, since they're supposed to be good as well.

Oh, and as others have noted, come with plenty of cash in hand.  My meal was $24 and change and they take debit cards (with a $1 surcharge added), but no credit.
author: Christian D.

description:
Obviously, there's a wait, knowing there's wait, going and then complaining about it seems pointless.

Great food, a little bit on the pricey side, but everything we had was great, loved the monte cristo and benedict, will order the pan dore next time, I was jealously staring down neighboring table's order.
author: Yingjue C.

description:
I Loves Mama's!
Came here countless times, and still can't get enough. Best breakfast & brunch in SF.
author: Jenni C.

description:
This place is.... Amazing!!!!!   We lucked out and there wasn't  much of a wait when we showed up. They were really busy but the cooks and waiters really work fast to get you in (and out!) quickly and comfortably.  The inside is small, so this is why it's always full..... And not to mention the great food!!!  

My mom and I Decided to get one lunch and one breakfast plate and split it. It was delicious!   The florentine omelet was so savory and perfectly cooked. The club sandwich was delicious with the avocado they add on. The bacon served at mamas isn't Denny's grade stuff either. It's really tasty and just perfect.  I would've waited two hours to eat here.  It's just so yummy and you won't be hungry for hours!!    I would definitely go again!
author: Mama G.

description: Got here at 9am on a Friday, seated by 9:45 so it wasn't too awful. Get here by 8:00 and it probably won't be too bad. Definitely skip the French toast, I've had better.  The Dungeness Crab Benedict was really good. I personally haven't tried the monte cristo yet but it seems that every neighboring table of mine loved it so you probably can't go wrong with that. Enjoy =D
author: Adrina W.

description:
It's a monstrosity to not dine at Mama's when you visit SF. Yes, the line is intimatdating, but frankly, nothing no brunch lovin' new yorker hasn't seen.

What struck me most about my trip to SF was just how relaxed the atmosphere was - even though the line was out the door, people were generally friendly and all smiles. Non of the impatient new yorker thing, checking on their table and houding the hostess every 5 seconds. Of course, a bite into their breakfast, it's clear why people were willing to wait for breakfast at Mama's. 

On top of ordering something for ourselves, my two other dining companions and I also opted to share a huge stack of pancakes which came fluffy and warm, and drizzled with fresh fruit. 

The portions are huge, and I'd recommend sharing - to try out a bit of everything.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I had never heard of this place even though I've lived in SF since 1973 because I don't go to North Beach very often unless I have visitors from out of town.  So the day before my sister arrived from Chicago, I got an email from Scoutmob with what sounded like an incredibly good deal.  I bought it and am very glad I did.

For $25 we got one order of buttermilk pancakes, 2 entrees, we had a choice of the Monte Cristo sandwich, Slim Joe burger, or a Paisano Eggs Benedict.  Also 2 specialty baked goods, choice of crumb cake or homemade bread, plus 2 drinks, choice of mimosa, Papa's punch which is made with red wine, or coffee, tea or a soft drink.  I figured this would cost over $50 without the deal.

We got there about noon on Friday and the line wasn't too long, could have been worse from what I've read here, about 45 minutes.  My sister has recently had 2 knee replacements and can not stand for very long.  I asked if we could take a chair out to the line but they wouldn't allow it, but they did allow her to sit on a chair that was just inside the back door while I waited in line.  I'm taking one star off because I thought they could have let us put that chair in the line so we could talk while waiting, we hadn't seen each other in a year.  

Once we got inside you have to wait in another line to order your food and then they direct you to a table.  It's kind of a weird system but I guess it works for them.  It seems more confusing to me.

I'm not sure why they were offering this Scoutmob deal because they obviously don't need to drum up more business, especially at the height of tourist season.  Mama's must be written up in every tourist guidebook because everyone waiting in line with us was a tourist, and all were from other countries.  The woman in front of us was from Mexico and she said her friend had visited here and loved Mama's so much he waited in line twice to eat there.

The food was really good, the pancakes were the best I've ever had, really light and fluffy, melt-in-your mouth variety.  The crumb cakes were absolutely delicious also, I had chocolate which had chocolate baked in and drizzled over the top, my sister had cinnamon walnut.  I had the burger with potato salad and my sister had the Monte Cristo with coleslaw.  All of it was spectacular.  There was so much food we took home half of our sandwiches and sides so we got 4 meals out of this $25 deal, although I left a $10 tip so it really came to $35, but well worth it.

I would come back bit I would come in the winter and I would arrive earlier, I'm not fond of lines even if the food is great.
author: Madeline M.

description:
First, you have to be prepared to wait for 30 minutes to an hour to be seated.  No reservations.  But this is well worth it.  It is breakfast and lunch only.  
Mama's has a system where they allow you in the restaurant, you order in line, are seated and then the food shows up.  The process works incredibly well.
About the food, fabulous!  They have a lot of specials, when I was there it was crab.  The regular menu is extensive.  Our table had the breakfast sandwich special (crab, eggs, cheese on brioche), veggie omelet, cinnamon french toast and cinnamon chocolate french toast.   All of it was very good.  The food is incredibly fresh, prepared well, and quite tasty.  The waitress made a point of having us try their homemade jam on the french toast, it is great!
So looking for a unique experience and willing to wait, try Mama's and have a really wonderful time.
author: Mike A.

description:
Solid 4 for food but the 1 toilet shack thing in the back...eh.... for such a highly visited food icon in SF, you'd think they'd have a better bathroom situation...

PS - the carrot cake? A-MAZING. Get one to go.... no, make that two.
author: Jodie B.

description: if you go to mama's, know what you're getting into. a two hour wait for a super short meal. warning: DO NOT go if you are already super hungry!! but this place is really good. the cranberry orange french toast was my favorite, I highly recommend because you won't find something similar anywhere else
author: Hannah W.

description:
Mama's is my favorite brunch place in the Bay Area. This place is always busy and for good reason. The pancakes, waffles, and french toast are heavenly and the eggs benedicts are spot on. You MUST try the pancakes/waffles/french toast when you are here!

The wait is long, especially on the weekends, but its definitely worth it for the portions and the food.
author: Cindy C.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to get breakfast this morning so we've decided to checked out Mama's.  We live in the area so we knew about the long wait in line.  We often pass by this restaurant and was always curious to see what the hype is all about, so we finally decided to check it out. 

We got there at around 9:00am saturday morning and waited in line until 11:00 am until we finally got inside the door.  By then we were literally starving and couldn't wait to be seated.  To our surprise, there was a second line for which we have to wait in line to order our food.  Basically, you line up for breakfast and you won't be seated until lunch time.  

The bf and I ordered a Washington Square omelet, the shrimp & avocado egg benedict, fresh fruit pancakes and a mango smoothie.  Usually, I am not big on breakfast but the food was actually really good and the portions were big.  However, I am not sure if it is worth waiting 2 hours in line or the $50 we spent on breakfast.
author: Eva E.

description:
This place is so good. It is well worth the wait and the price. 

We came here on a day trip to San francisco from Carmel. We arrived at 8:20 and stood in line for one hour. You must go before 8 to not have to wait as long or at least before 10. After that, the line looked like it got really long. 

Food:

My girlfriend ordered a fresh mango smoothie which was good. I got a hot chocolate which was also  good. Sad no free refills. 

I ordered the dungeness crab Benedict. Delicious! The crab was a little lemony but still good and not any cheap imitation crab either. The home fries were well seasoned. 

My girlfriend got two eggs and bacon. She liked it. 

We split the chocolate French toast. It was pretty good. Not very chocolatey tasting. Although it wasn't that bad where I would knock a star. I would just recommend you try a different French toast. 

Service was kind and attentive especially for the style of restaurant where you order and then sit down. 

Overall it was excellent. I will definitely return and wait in the future.
author: Kevin S.

description: Beware of the wait!! We got there ten minutes after it opened at 8:10 and there was a line down the block. The line moves very slowly because if the way they seat people. You order and then have to wait for a table to open, some one waited for about ten minutes, then the next person can order and wait. Once you get inside it is adorable an feels so homey and nice. I got mamas french toast sampler which consisted of three different types of French toast, banana bread, cinnamon swirl an orange cranberry bread. The banana one just tasted like a normal piece of banana bread but it was still very good. The cinnamon was my favorite it was amazing. Then the cranberry one was not my type but still good. Everything was great the portion size was big and it came decorated with berries and homemade jam. The service was amazing as well and funny great people even in the kitchen people were having a good time
author: Megan K.

description: I'm not even a huge breakfast person, but I LOVED it.  Totally worth the wait.  AMAZING French Toast and pastries.  A little pricey, but it's such a great experience it's worth it.  Make sure you try their home-made jam that they have on the tables.  I totally wouldn't have tried it if the waitress hadn't pointed it out, but I'm so glad I did!!
author: Amanda B.

description:
In the words of Bill Simmons "If you're waiting in line for an hour or more for ANYTHING, there'd better be free sex or free money at the end of that line."

Mama's is good, but there was no free sex or money at the end of the line.  Just a tasty monte cristo.
author: Job E.

description: One of the most popular brunch places in san francisco. .  Mama's. ...  waited 2 hours even though we went there early. ..long long long lines...  well it was ok... so not worth the wait for us...ordered Monte Cristo and french toast sampler.. home made raspberry jam
author: Sam A.

description:
The good:  I ordered the Petaluma eggs with potatoes, sourdough baguette and sausage.  I went with the Bellini.  The eggs were perfectly cooked and the potatoes were alright.

The great:   Hands down the best breakfast sausage I have ever had in my life.  The Bellini trumped my friend's mimosa in flavor by miles.

The bad:  How do f*ck up sourdough in San Francisco?  I could have knocked someone unconscious with the staleness of this bread.  It hurt my teeth.  Please understand that I would have been far more forgiving on imperfections had I not waited 2.5 hours for this meal, had the plummeting blood sugar of a diabetic, been irritated by the ordering system and disgusted by the bathroom ... please see below.

The ugly:  as many other people have mentioned, the line is pretty ridiculous.  What makes it all the more ridiculous is that the wait stems from unnecessary inefficiency going on inside.  The ordering system is all very soup nazi meets cafeteria ... there were other things that I would have remembered to order (i.e. coffee) had there been less pressure.  And after you've just spent hours+ waiting outside, you now wait inside crammed next to the nazi counter, hovering about awkwardly while waiting for a table to open ... I'll rephrase, watching an open table just sit there empty for a longer than necessary period of time considering the sheer number of rumbling bellies in the area.  I wanted to help the staff out just to move things along.  I wanted to remove the big round tables in the back and replace them with diner square tables for space efficiency.  and why aren't there tables outside ... surely mama can afford the license.  Minus one star for unnecessary inefficiency.

The unacceptable:  The bathroom set up at mama's is not ok.  Not only do you have to walk thru some private employees-only usage space, it's merely a dressed up outhouse in the back yard.  The inside, tho tiny, is truly adorable ... but getting to it is a level of awkward that I cannot explain.  There is no room to form a line either ... you're either in a server's way or hovering over people enjoying a meal.  awkward.  I mean seriously, you're going to have people wait in line for hours, you need to rethink your bathroom situation.  Minus one star.

The food is good but not worth the wait outside.  or the awkward hovering wait inside ... for the food or the bathroom.  Mama's just doesn't know what kind of place it wants to be ... does it want to be a sweet little kitchen where people gather for good food and laughs?  or does it want to be a place to get in and get out with time to appreciate a happy belly and a smile once you're walking out the door?    

I won't be going back anytime soon.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Good but not the best!  I decided to take my out-of-town friends here for the first time due to all the Yelp hype...

Yes, the line was loooooong...like 2 hours long...and parking was hard to find.  After a couple of minutes of waiting in line, my friends and I think of a brilliant idea--there's a spot across the street that sells champagne and orange juice...A few mimosas later, we find ourselves saying..."Wow, that line went by fast!!"  

As soon as I got in, I already knew what I wanted to order--the monte cristo and french toast (for my bf).  The monte cristo was yummy (but I like the one at Blue Bayou in Disneyland better) and the french toast was bleh!  I like my french toast plain and simple and theirs just had way too much going on.  I felt like I was just eating a fancy toasted loaf of bread.  No, thank you!

Overall, I probably would come back here for the monte cristo but only if there is no wait or if I have a good 3+ hours to spare.
author: Lisa Marie R.

description:
The wait is ridiculously looong. The staff was very friendly. The food was good. We had the French toast sampler, northern Italian omelet and the smoke salmon scramble.
