 If you have nothing else to do and don't kind waiting close to two hours, I would highly recommend Mama's.
author: Linda W.

description:
banana nut french toast ftw.

Came for a late brunch. 30 min wait to get in, another 15 min wait to order and be seated. 

French toast sampler was heavy. Loved all the fresh fruit on top - strawberries, blueberries, and banana slices. Banana nut, cinnamon swirl, and blueberry .. my fav was definitely the banana nut. The cinnamon swirl was subtle and the blueberry was nice.

Bloody Mary had a nice kick to it, loved the mason jars. 


CASH ONLY + DEBIT CARDS
author: Christina C.

description: This place is just delightful great bistro ambiance,  food is fresh and super delicious, generous portions, the eggs benedict are wooow, also had french toast. They have fresh squeezed orange juice. I Definitely recommend this place. If you are in San Francisco this is the place to have amazing food. Yummy.
author: Erika M.

description: French toast samples plate is great but egg benedicts are just regular. You should keep in mind that you will wait for an hour in the line, no matter when you come...
author: Can H.

description:
This place is really good for breakfast. They seem like experts on all the classic breakfast plates. I just did not enjoy the super long wait time. I feel like breakfast should be served fast because it's during the beginning of the day. 

My friend ordered the eggs benedict. Huge portion size! Had to take it to go. She thought that it was flavorful. This place is also really health conscious because they let you substitute with egg whites. I ordered a not so breakfasty meal, which was beans, sour cream, eggs, and tortillas. I have to say, if you're going to come here, don't even think about deviating from the norm so order french toast. French toast is absolutely beautiful and scrumptious. 

IT'S CASH ONLY! There's an atm near a convenience store, but save yourself the trouble. I wish it wasn't cash only, i'd probably order more. Will probably come back to try more of their more popular dishes, but on a day in which I have 45 minutes of waiting time to spare...
author: Glo Y.

description:
Ooooooh Mama's!  How I love thee.  I used to come here as a kid and their breakfast haunted me into adulthood.  One day while in the city with my mom I decided I wanted to go to Mama's again... to my surprise their was a line waaaaaay down the block.  Figured it was just the wrong day so we said we'd come back another day when it wasn't so busy.  I decided to do some research and then realized that a long wait is to be expected at good ol' Mama's - due to all of the media coverage it's delectable food has received.  So, mostly you'll find tourists waiting in the long line waiting to get a taste of this San Francisco treat.  

For my next venture to Mama's I was a bit more prepared.  My boyfriend and I decided to go on the 4th of July, figuring a weekday wouldn't be as busy... even though it was a holiday.  Luckily we only had to wait about an hour to get inside.  We ordered our food at the counter where you could see the cooks cooking away the scrumdiliumptiousness.  We ordered 4 items off the menu: The French Toast sampler, The Lox Bagel Platter, the Dungeness Crab Benedict, and the Californian Omelette... oh and we ordered their tasty beverages too... Mama's Spiked Lemonade and Fresh Squeezed Mimosas.  

I was a little nervous that it wouldn't be as good as I remembered it to be back when I was a kid - but nope... DEEEEEEEELECTABLE!  I wasn't a fan of all of the french toasts... my favorite was the original, but even the one I wasn't too fond of (the Kugelhopf) was still better than your average french toast you get when ordering out.  The Lox Bagel Platter was SO good.  I'm really picky when it comes to salmon and I couldn't stop eating this thing.  Yum... I want to eat it right now.  The Californian Omelette was delicious and fresh - loved the potatoes that came with them.  And the Dungeness Crab Benedict was tasty too!  After devouring all of that we moved onto the toast and their special homemade jam that's sitting on the table.  OMG... so.good.

Just do yourself a favor and go try Mama's... don't bitch about the hour long wait, because guess what, it's worth it.  And if you don't like it then I'm sorry for your tastebuds, but there's obviously something wrong with them.
author: Carina S.

description:
Seriously. THE. BEST. BREAKFAST. JOINT. EVER

Just moved here from LA and I've been to Zazie's, Dottie's (was a huge fan until the past few years) and other well-known places in SF but I recently went to Mama's.

Everything we had was delicious.  Had the Monte Cristo, French Toast Sampler and the crab benedict.  All were excellent.  Although the line is very long (depending on the day) it is truly worth the wait.

Blu Jam Cafe in LA was my place to take out of towners.  

Mama's is now my place in SF.
author: Sean Y.

description: The monte Cristo was very delicious. It's a sandwich with turkey, ham and cheese and you dip it into a raspberry jam. Delicious! I would not wait in line again though. The monte Cristo is the only delicious and different thing on the menu! Definitely worth a try!
author: Lu F.

description: All in all fairly impressed with this place. Got there right when it opened at 8 AM on Saturday and there was already a line around the block! My boyfriend and I waited about 1.25 hours which was fine since it helped build up our appetite. I don't think this place is worth all the hype or that the food is good enough to wait THAT long (I heard it's sometimes longer). My boyfriend and I had the cinnamon french toast with fruit and the eggs Benedict. The hollandaise sauce is actually unreal and has a really unique kick to it. The French toast wasn't that special. I wouldn't have eaten the French toast without the fruit since that added much more flavor. As well, I'm not really a sweet breakfast person so that might be why I wasn't crazy about it
author: Annaliese B.

description: Finally got to try this place after reading a lot of good reviews on it. And of course that adds to the hype of people visiting SFO to wait in line for it... making the line incredibly  insane! And then you wonder, if it's really the food that makes this place so popular. After 1.5 hours standing in line outside the restaurant (got there before opening) and another 45 minutes in line INSIDE the store, your expectations get higher and higer that they'll serve something really delicious! Then the big let down when you realize you waited in line for this?!... Maybe I didn't order the best on the menu (got the benedict with bacon and the chocolate dessert cake-ish one, which were both normal tasting for me). Will be a while before I go back. IF I ever do. Good enough for one time.
author: Jo P.

description:
This brunch cafe is a true San Francisco gem! Unfortunately one down side is that the wait can be very long so I recommend coming here on a weekday to minimize your wait time so you don't have to start munching on your granola bars while standing in line for three hours.

We came here on a Friday afternoon and the wait time was about 25 minutes when we arrived. The service was excellent, the servers have a sense of humor and seem to know exactly what they are doing. I ordered the eggs benedict and my partner ordered the french toast sampler which was DIVINE! Having tasted both, if it's your first time here I would go with the french toast which is so beautifully decorated with fresh seasonal berries.
author: Marina S.

description: Sublime eggs benedict with asparagus and bacon.  I also love the cinnamon brioche french toast with the fresh raspberry (signature jam).  This spot is iconic for a reason.  Please eat there.  You'll thank me later.
author: Fifi L.

description: The food was excellent here. I had some coffee and the Monte Cristo sandwich. I give the food an easy 5 stars but have to take off a star for the crowd and the very small dining area. I did not like having to stand in line to order either. definitely get here as early as possible to avoid having to wait outside. Also, I don't like people watching me eat while they wait in line.
author: Westwood D.

description:
Upon arrival in San Francisco we were starving & quickly yelped for a place to grab breakfast. The top recommendation was Mama's so we had to check it out. When we walked up to the restaurant we saw the HUGE line that was waiting outside & were thinking about walking away when the couple in front of us turned around & said don't. You won't be sorry. So...we waited, a little over an hour. 

Once we got inside the atmosphere is super cute & relaxed. You stand in line to order & then are escorted to your table. By this time I was ready to for lunch so I ordered the California Veggie sandwich, it was good, but just what you would expect. My boyfriend ordered the Monte Cristo & as our dishes were set down food envy really started to set in! Once I took a bite I was sold. This is possibly one of the best breakfast items I have ever eaten in my entire life. 

I also ended up ordering a slice of carrot cake (all that good Veggie Sandwich, I needed some bad) which was also very tasty. So yes, the line & wait were totally worth it.
author: Rebekah S.

description:
Absolutely adore this place! Great service, amazing decor, and most importantly, the food is well worth the wait. 

My girlfriend had the Eggs Benedict blackstone (crispy bacon in lieu of the ham), and I had, hands down, one of the best Monte Cristo Sandwiches I've ever had-and I've had my fair share of them.

Grilled to perfection, the sandwich had a nice crisp exterior but the second you bit into it, the bread was soft inside, the havarti cheese was gooey. They served the sandwich with homemade strawberry jam and it was truly heavenly. 

The second I get back to SF, I'll be back here, rain or shine, waiting patiently in line for some great breakfast food served in a nice cozy restaurant.
author: Jon R.

description:
It's precious and delicious.  Next time I come here I am going to try to pilfer their homemade jam.

Be smart like me and come on a weekday after 1:30 and suffer a minimal wait.
author: Vi H.

description:
We waited more than half an hour in line and I was expected to be blown away by the food. Sadly, I think this place is a bit overhyped. We got the Monte Cristo, the Smoked Salmon Benedict, and Grapefruit Mimosas. $41 before tip. First major disappointment is that they don't take credit cards...what?!?!?! I would expect this attitude from a taco stand that sells $1 tacos, but when you spend 40 bucks or more I expect them to swallow the 20 cents CC charge and smile back. 

The food was good, but not perfect. The Monte Cristo was tasty, but it was mostly bread. The poached eggs on the benedict were way undercooked. I like runny eggs but these were a mess! All in all the food seemed a bit sloppy for the hype surrounding this place. The grapefruit mimosas were too strong, there was barely any grapefruit taste, it was mostly (cheap) sparkling wine with a touch of grapefruit juice. There was also a piece of hair on my fruit bowl and I had a little struggle trying to get the waitress' attention to come and exchange that for me.

I really really wanted to like this place. I was visiting SF and specifically went to have brunch at Mama's after reading numerous raving reviews. Sadly tho, it didn't deliver on the hype. It was just OK and definitely not worth the long wait.
author: Vlad R.

description:
Nothing--NOTHING-- is worth waiting two hours for, outside in a line. 
C'mon!
It's just bread! It's just eggs! 
Pancakes? 
NOISE? 
RUSH?


Why pride yourself in how long you wait in a long line for basic breakfast food you yourself could prepare in 20 minutes at home, people! 
What's wrong with you?

Yes, the food at Mama's is superlative, but you really set yourself up for disappointment after standing outside ANY foodie establishment long enough to read the WHOLE Sunday Chronicle or your Facebook feed ten times over. By the time you're seated at a table, you're starving and cranky. Waiting forever for basic foodstuffs and nursing over-blown expectations of God's Own Freakin' French Toast to send you over-the-moon and to patch up last night's shortcoming with your girlfriend--is just not fair to the staff. But keep it coming, because without your sheeplike patronage Mama's could not go on.

Oh and hey, don't inhale that bite with powdered sugar...
author: Mac A.

description: couple the 90 minute wait, with the difficulty of finding parking makes this a pass for me. very average food in my opinion. I got the farmers omelet and my wife got the French toast sampler. I recommend you used Yelp to find another breakfast spot.
author: Sean B.

description:
If you're looking for some good breakfast, go to Mama's!
It's this tiny little restaurant, really homey so you know its gonna be good.

Kinda weird how they set up the place, and you order first and wait to be seated but I'll deal because the food is worth the trouble!

My absolute favorite is the Northern Italian Omelette... wow that's a great omelette. But the Kugelhuph french toast is really good too. Mimosas are small but are stiff enough to give a little girl like me a nice buzz!
author: Michelle H.

description:
We probably waited about an hour to get inside this place.  This place is worth the wait.  

The pancakes are really yummy, and my omlet was the best omlet that I have ever had.  The fruit was fresh, and the jam is hand made.

They make really amazing mimosas too.

For the quality and the quantity of food, this place is worth it.  We had breakfast for two for about $40 and I would spend it again in a heart beat.
author: Lily F.

description: We waited 1,5 hours in line and it was completely worth it!!! The Monte Cristo  sandwich is a mast try!! Never had anything like that before.
author: Rem D.

description:
This place is pretty darn good. I came on a Thursday at around 1pm and didn't have to wait long. You get in line outside the restaurant, get in line in the restaurant to order and pay for your food, and then wait to be seated. 

I highly highly highlyyyyyyyyyyy recommend the monte cristo and their orange juice... O GAWD, so good, so so, so so good. :). Try dipping the sandwich in tabasco sauce if you like spicy&sour! The french toast sampler isn't bad either. 

Definitely coming back..
author: Chau T.

description: First time there and what really blew me away was the amazing customer service. Food was delicious and that was expected. As a local, I was slightly worried that staff would be rude or jaded by the sheer popularity of the place, but I was wrong, and couldn't have been more pleased by the graciousness of the team at Mama's. Well done!!
author: JD R.

description:
I feel like breaking out in song:

"Mammmaaaaaaa, OoooOOOOOoohhhh." a la Bohemian Rhapsody. 

So good. If you're willing to wait, Mama's will be worth your while for some quality breakfast food. Be prepared though, you order BEFORE you're seated, which seems totally backwards for the ambiance they were trying to go for (and confused the hell out of me initially), but it worked out because it forces you to be decisive and expedites the wait for everyone else. 

I chose to order the Monte Cristo, based on Yelp reviews. I was skeptical at first, because I've never had one before, but from what I've been told, it can be an oily mess at other places. 

But boy, was I wrong to doubt. 

Mama cooked it to perfection and it was deeeeeeeeeeee - licious. Don't be fooled by the simplicity of it too! It is just a ham and cheese sandwich, dipped in a french toast-like batter and heated on the griddle, but the combination made for an unlikely, yet compatible duo.  Eating it with the jam really topped it off too. When I went it, was a raspberry jam, which tasted homemade  and not overbearingly sweet like some of the jams you buy from grocery stores. The guy sitting next to us got some small takeout cups and took a bunch home with him.  I wanted to give him a high five!
author: Ray W.

description:
The wait was definitely worth it. 

I ordered the Northern Italian omelette and oh, wow, my mouth was so happy. It was so, so good. Everything came together wonderfully and it was just this beautiful explosion in my mouth. I love the garlic jack cheese and the pancetta was delicious without being too salty. I tried their jam even though I'm not a fan of jam and I must say it was pretty good. 


The staff is friendly and service is prompt, which makes sense since they're such a small place and they need to turn tables as quickly as possible without being rude. I never felt rushed through my meal even though there was a line out the door of people waiting to get in. 

Overall, I had a great time at Mama's and I really can't wait to go back again to try everything else on the menu, including the dessert.
author: Christine C.

description: Charming little cafe, delicious, fresh food.  Fun to go with friends as you chat and wait for a table.
author: Mocha G.

description:
Okay this place is great. Food is fresh, they even have crab benedict. But the wait? One hour on a Sunday morning. 

So I went again, two weeks after at 8am, yes I am crazy. BUT THERE WERE CRAZIER PEOPLE THAT LINED UP BEFORE 8AM. 

Love the food, hate the wait. If the weather is not nice, don't think it's worth it.

But I still love the food.
author: Ximeng W.

description:
5-Second Review:
Crazy long line just to get in, awesome 'M'omelettes', tasty food all around.

5-Minute Review:
My friends and I arrived at Mama's at 11:20a and knew we were in for it. Having read good reviews about this place and hearing from locals that we should dine here, I decided to stick out the wait and experience Mama's.

They weren't lying when they say the wait can be at least 1-1/2hr. By the time we actually got into Mama's and started waiting in the 'inside line', it was already 2:00p. 

I got the spinach and mushroom eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was pretty delicious, but the spinach had the worst case of post-spinach chalkiness. I think it's how they cook and/or prepare their spinach, but it was full on horrid. I know that spinach can have a chalkiness to it, but this was overkill. The overall dish was delightful. 

Shanna M. got the smoked salmon eggs benedict which she absolutely devoured. Polus T. got the momelette that had prosciutto, jack cheese, and mushrooms [i believe..] and that tasted absolutely amazing.

We also got the french toast sampler. Although I thought the sampler was tasty, it was a waste of money to me. 3 pieces of french toast for $10+? Not quite worth it to me.

We all got a spoonful of the 'much-raved-about' homemade jam. Yeah, it was pretty good, but overly sweet.

All in all, I thought that Mama's was not bad. I'd give it 3.75, almost 4 stars, but with the wait being as long as it was and with the food being slightly overpriced for what it is, I'm content with giving it a 3. Food is tasty, wait is too long.
author: Andrew F.

description:
The wait can be ridiculously long...BUT the food is ridiculously good. 

Apple Pan Dore
Monte Cristo
Crab Benedict
Smoked Salmon Benedict

GIMMIE!!

I love Mama's and you will too.
Btw, CASH ONLY!

(Photos uploaded)
author: Heidi C.

description:
I have to say I'm not a fan. The food is perfectly acceptable brunch fare but not inspiring enough to brave the lines that inevitablly form. 

Can somebody tell me what is so good here that's it's worth waiting an hour?
author: patrick g.

description: Not worth the wait. It's overly hyped. The food was good but nothing out of the ordinary. We def wouldn't do it again!
author: Gisele L.

description:
Since there are a million reviews for this place, I will keep my review short and sweet. I think Mama's is more of a 3.75 than a 3, but you can't do partial stars on here. 

I found this place with the help of my trusty yelp app one morning while staying in SF. I just had to make the mile trek when I heard about the awesome french toast. I wasn't disappointed, but I expected a little more after waiting in line for an hour and paying $45. I think Bill's is better and its cheaper. Oh well, it was still a damn good meal and the service was pretty good.
author: Gloria T.

description:
I woke up early on a cold Sunday morning, convinced three others to join me, finally managed to find parking, and stood in line for 30 minutes to eat breakfast here.

Was it worth it?

Maybe yes. My friends have already asked if I want to join them again next week because they are planning to make a return trip.

MAKE SURE TO BRING:
Plenty of cash, they do NOT take credit cards
Something to read/interesting people to talk to while waiting in line

The staff here is very friendly, our server enthusiastically suggested my boyfriend use the homemade jam instead of the syrup on his french toast and it turned out to be a great recommendation.

In summary, Mama's has extraordinary pastries (the coffee cake? freakin' gorgeous!) and really good fresh squeezed juice. But coming here is like a damn pilgrimage. Having said that, I may still return again, if someone else drives.

UPDATE:
After returning and ordering the farmers omelette (spinach, leeks, goat cheese and bacon) and sampling the chocolate coffee cake, Mama's gets its fifth star. No breakfast joint I've been to in the city can match the quality of food served at Mama's.
author: Miriam W.

description: Are you kidding me? Mama's is the best ever. It was totally worth the wait. A true dining experience.
author: Tim H.

description:
SWEET. BABY. JESUS.
HOLY MOTHER OF GOD.

My good friend Bryan E. was on a diet (best dine out strategy because you get to eat their food too. THANKS BRYAN FOR THE FRENCH TOAST! =D) So I practically had 2 entrees - that's right you heard right, and I wasn't the only one doing it so don't judge. I have nothing of substance to add to the hundreds of already positive reviews except, yeah the wait freakin' sucks but you won't regret it.

Extra points to the nice woman at the register who smiled patiently as I interrogated her about every pastry and substitution policy. Hey, I had 2 hours to deliberate on my final breakfast choice and I had to be certain. Hm, I should've ordered an extra entree to go....
author: Jess C.

description:
Um where's the 6 star button?! Oh Mama's how you satisfy my taste buds. 

I woke up at 7 am in the morning just so I can come here to avoid the wait. But me and my friend ended up going at 8:45 am. The line wasn't as long as I thought it would've been but we were still standing outside for a good 20 minutes. While we were waiting we were looking at the menu outside. OMG they have mimosas! Who would've thought right?? Too bad it was too early for cocktails but me and my friend decided to order it the next time we come. They also have Bloody Marys and screwdrivers haha. 

Everything on the menu looked so good and I was debating for 15 minutes before I knew what I wanted. The way we ordered was like a cafeteria. We had to line up to place our order with the cashier and then we get seated. I ordered the Swedish Cinnamon French toast with a side of fresh fruits since they looked so good when I was standing in line. My friend ordered their infamous Benedict. Omg I should have ordered the Benedict with spinach and mushroom. Damn that thing looked sooooo good my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The French toast tasted really good with the berries and syrup. I'm glad the waitress told me about the jam that was on the table. I was wondering what it was and she told me it was lolly berry jam. I'm not even sure if it was lolly berry but that's what it sounded like to me. It was so good with the french toast.

I'M COMING BACK! I'M COMING BACK! I CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!

I'm so glad I live 5 minutes away from this place. I love North Beach! Thanks for giving us Mama's!
author: Tracy A.

description:
Positively without a doubt, THE BEST FRENCH TOAST I've ever tasted!' Nuff said. My wife and I came here on Sunday at approximately 9:20 am and we waited in line more than an hour. And yes, it was worth the wait. The moment we entered the restaurant, we were greeted with a warm welcome. While we were waiting outside on a cold January morning, my wife and I looked at the menu which is posted by the door, so the moment we were seated we knew what to order. The restaurant is very busy, full of positive energy, yet the wait staff is very friendly, fast and efficient. The service was awesome and our waitress was always attentive. Most of the tables are very close to one another and it is possible that the couple beside you can hear your conversation. The decibel level can be high because the restaurant is packed. 

I ordered the eggs Benedict and they were just amazing. However, the highlight of my meal was the french toast sampler. As Adam Richman from "Man Vs. Food" would say, 'Oh my goodness, Oh my goodness!' or Guy Fieri from "Diner, Drive-in, & Dives" would say, 'money!' The chocolate cinnamon swirl french toast melts in your mouth and it was awesome, but I suggest the sampler, because you get the best of all. Furthermore, the side of strawberry jam on the table is amazing! The staff @ Mama's know their stuff, baby. 

Here is my advice: Before parking your car, have someone wait in line because it can be very, very long. Parking can be a challenge in North Beach, so I suggest taking public transportation or bring your patience with you (anyway your spouse, significant other, or friend will still be waiting in line when you do find a spot). Before entering the restaurant, browse at the menu outside the door before you enter. The line is extremely long on Sundays, so I suggest dining @ Mama's on weekday's, except on Mondays because they're closed. Just be sure to bring your appetite with you. 

I love this place for many reasons: friendly staff, great service, moderately priced, and most importantly is the food. If you're craving for french toast, go to Mama's. If you never tried french toast, it's because you haven't been to Mama's yet.
author: Albert B.

description: This place is great!  The semi-high prices and standing in line for 30-40 minutes was more than worth it.  I would do it again.  Just grab a coffee elsewhere and drink it while you wait.  It was a great start to our day.
author: Austin M.

description:
Mama's tastes nothing like the breakfast my mama makes. This was an experience I had to try after hearing so much about it. Our most recent visit was on a Wed. morning; the day before thanksgiving. The wait in the cold, outside was about 45mins. Which from what I understand is a shorter than normal wait. 

When we finally got inside, there was yet another line!! I was duped. We waited another 5-10 mins to order our food. The special of the day was dungeons crab omelet, sounded like a good combination. We settled on the omelet and a short stack of pancakes. 

The price for me was a bit high for the omelet. But then again, the portion of crab in the omelet was pretty hefty. The pancake was descent, but I expected something better for a place that has an hour wait. 

The setting was homey and cozy. You really get to know your neighbors because the tables are extremely close to each other. 

Overall, the quality lives up to its name, but just not that party in your mouth experience and may not be worth the one hour of your life wasted in line.
author: Charlie W.

description:
There are people in the world who complain about spending an hour in line for good quality food.  Funny enough, those same people have no problem waiting an hour to get into a club! My advice, skip the club and go to Mama's. (Granted Mama's isn't open at night!)

Yes, there is always a line but if you plan a bit ahead, it will be the highlight of your week! If you don't have an 8-5, M-F job you'll definitely score with trying out Mama's on a weekday morning. If not, plan on arriving by 10am with a cup of coffee in hand for the wait.

Their Eggs Benedict Specials are wonderful and are heavenly covered with a tasty hollandaise blanket.  Other "must-try(s)" are their Fresh Berries French Toast or any one of their Omelettes. Their jam is also a big ticket winner!

Once inside the cozy restaurant with your Mama's plate in front of you, you will completely forget about the insane amount of time you spent getting in. To put it simply, Mama's is Brunch Bliss.
author: Nam N.

description:
I know about the long lines at Mama's in the morning.  One Sunday afternoon, I got to the City shortly after 2:30 pm.  There were 2 small groups ahead of me at the door.  To my surprise, there was another line inside!  To speed up the process, Mama's has you order and pay first and then when a table is available, they seat you.  I would say the wait was about 30 minutes until I was seated.  

I liked the cinnamon chocolate French toast.  The toast was soft and moist.  It was topped with fresh berries and banana. The cinnamon was very apparent.  When I looked over at the next table, I noticed theirs looked a little different.  Ah!  Mine was missing the chocolate syrup.  That was easily fixed after the waitress brought a little side dish of it.  Yum!  The Washington omelet came with seasoned potatoes and a short section of a baguette.  The omelet was also good.  The sausage had a nice flavor with a little kick to it. The bread that came with the omelet was a little hard.

Mama's was definitely good, but I don't know if I would wait more than an hour to eat here.  By the looks of the line in the early morning, I think some of these people must wait close to two hours.
author: Laina T.

description: I had heard a lot about yo Mama's food so I was eager to go. Mama's did not disappoint. Waited in line for only 10 minutes.  It was weird to get into another line once inside but I enjoyed watching the chef and his staff work their stations.  A glass partition separates customers from the kitchen so you can watch the staff at work. All of the stations were very clean and this was mid day so you know cleanliness is a priority.  I had the crab benedict with home fries, sourdough toast and a cappuccino. A little expensive but the crab was fresh and plentiful.  The hollandaise sauce was delicious.  So far one of the best brunch spots in SF.
author: William D.

description: We waited about 45 minutes and it was worth every second. I got the apples Pan Dore (add a little jam that's on the table) and my honey got the Monte Cristo(the jam with this is a must, the sweet and savory are out of this world). They were both unbelievable Add a side of bacon to add to the sweet and savory (dip the bacon in the apple pan dore sauce). The staff is so friendly and everything is so fresh. Very small inside but not cramped.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Mama's is bar none the best spot for breakfast in the bay area (maybe all of California). Mama's is located in San Francisco's North Beach area (little Italy). The first thing you will notice about Mama's is the line to get a table there. Since there is no waiting list you have to wait in line for a table to open up. The line usually goes up the street. 

The food at Mama's is truly amazing. They serve so many different types of French toast that you will go crazy trying to figure out which one to choose. Let me tell you that not matter which ones you order you will not be let down. If you can't choose then try the French toast sampler. It will let you try four different types of the FT. When you order the French toast do not forget to spread on some of the homemade jam that is located at each table. The jam is worth the long wait outside alone. It is really that good. If you're not a French toast fan there is still plenty of other wonderful options for you. I have also had an omelet there that was amazing, If you like salmon they have an out of this world salmon omelet. 

No matter what you are in the mood for Mama's will have you covered. The food is so good that bye the time you leave you will have long forgotten that you had to wait an hour in line for breakfast. It is truly that good.
author: Craig R.

description:
We've been looking for an excellent breakfast/brunch place in the city and decided to try Mama's this morning. At first the estimated 60-90min wait time was a bit of a turn off but it was a beautiful San Francisco morning, we had our coffee, and I was in good company so it moved quickly. 

Once inside the tiny space you're escorted to another line where you can watch the chefs cook up breakfast in their itty bitty space. It's pretty cool! Eventually it's your turn and you can order and pay at the register. Once you order, the food gets delivered to your table lighting fast - 5-10 minutes tops. 

I ordered the french toast sampler and thought it was innovative that they used different kinds of breads (cinnamon swirl, banana nut bread,  and cranberry-orange walnut) and give you a nice helping of fresh fruit on top. It was definitely yummy. 

Tips:
*Cash or debit only!
*Order the orange juice!
*60-90 minute wait outside in a line so dress accordingly!

Bottom line, I'm not sure if it's the best breakfast I've ever had but it's definitely above average. So if you have some time on your hands and want to see what all the hype is about, check it out for yourself!
author: H T.

description:
Been here twice. 
Came with Hubby on Valentines Day, stood in line for TWO hours!
Were from L.A. so we didn't know the protocol. People were eating in line while they wait to go eat some more! We didn't know.
Silly Tourist! 
SO ... I went back this Christmas weekend with my bestie and her hubby. This time I knew better.

YOU SNOOZE YOU LOSE

We were there bright and early. They opened at 8am and we arrived at 8:20 and no surprise, as expected people were already there.

Now to the food..HOLY MOLEY MAMAS hits the spot.

I'm not much of a breakfast person. 
But, this place is delish!
We had Fresh OJ, french toast sampler which is amazing btw, florentine benedict, north beacher, northern italian and the washington square.
 This place is plain and simple the BEST BREAKFAST I have ever had.

Try their Jelly on the table, its amazing.  I wanted to steal it..lol but by the time my group was done with it there was no point!
author: ANGIE H.

description:
Now I have heard of singing for your supper but here be prepared to wait for your breakfast. 

There is generally a line for this counter services/ dining establishment. Let me explain, you first wait in line to order at the counter then you must then wait again to be seated. 

This is due in part to the fact that Mama's has very limited seating because of its quaint size. You might wonder is it worth the wait..... absolutely. 

I had the banana nut french toast which was so delectable and sweet. That I nearly bounced out of there from the sugar high but it was worth the rush! 

Every time I hear of someone traveling to the Bay Area, I always suggest they take the trek and the wait to Mama's.
author: Casie C.

description:
After hearing rave reviews from friends and seeing the lines outside the place for sometime I finally made it here on a early Tuesday afternoon.  No line and we got our food within minutes after we sat down.  Had the crab benedict and the french toast sampler as recommended by fellow yelpers.  The crab benedict was quite delicious but it was $18.50 - I would have been very upset if it was not yummy.  The french toast sampler was good but I think I had higher expectations.  The service was fast and friendly.
Why 3 stars?  Well, I think I was expecting too much - with the reviews I expected brunch food from another planet.  Also I know I lucked out with the whole no-wait thing.  Wait times of over 30 minutes for this place would be too much for me which I know is the norm.  I would only return if I know there'd be no wait.
author: Jean T.

description: Love their monte cristo! Like no where else. First time in the town and really worth the one hour wait. Must arrive early before 8am otherwise you will wait like 2hrs. French toast sampler is nice too!
author: Kristi W.

description: This was our first visit:  we arrived Sunday just after the 8am opening and there was a line of 50 - 75 people.  In the end we waited just over 2 hours to be seated.  We ordered the vegetarian benedict and the kopelhopf french toast, both good.  I'd read the jam was recommended and our waiter did indeed suggest putting it on the french toast rather than the syrup - a great tip.  The service was attentive and friendly.  Overall good, and fine to go once, but for me personally I wouldn't come back for anything more than a 15 min wait.
author: Annie P.

description:
Mama's breakfast and lunch is a little hidden secret in the heart of San Francisco. To get to this little restaurant, it's easier to locate Washington Square! A bit of advice, come about an hour from when you are expecting to eat, because when I say little, I mean very little! The whole restaurant holds about 30 people max, which is very small for a busy place like this! Expect to wait in line, even during random hours. Anyways to get to the food!

I personally ordered the Northern Italian Omelette, which I destroyed off my plate! I've never been a huge breakfast type of guy, expect bacon so saying that I absolutely devoured this omelette is saying something. The egg was cooked evenly and the middle was just the right temperature. Enough to melt the cheese, but not burn your tongue!

Another bonus is the service there! The waitresses were very VERY nice! One of my party members got held up, thus their held onto making his plate til later. When we asked them to reheat the food, they did it gladly!

The reason for the 3 star instead of a 4 is their cleanliness. As my friend was eating his food, he found a hair in his omelette. We knew it was not his because he has very curly and short hair, while the hair he found was a long strand! They apologized and gladly made him a new plate, but that incident made me drop this place 1 star.
author: Anthony C.

description:
How to describe Mama's?

Imagine years of experience in a kitchen, the best ingredients, cooking with love--everything you'd expect from your own mama's breakfast, and you'll kind of get the idea about what breakfast is all about at Mama's, the restaurant.

Breakfast sometimes seems so simple, yet Mama's doesn't fail to inspire. My fave is probably the French Toast. It's rich and buttery, soft, sweet, just amazing.

Omelettes are perfect. We tried the North Beach, and it was amazing.

*for newcomers, you get in line, and then order food. Someone will get you a table, and then you wait for your food. Then eat up your piece of heaven!!
*long line, normally about 45 minutes at least.
*GET THE FRENCH TOAST. JUST DO IT.
*accept CC 

Next time, EGGS BENEDICT. DUNGENESS CRAB.
author: Trang B.

description:
You haven't been to San Francisco if you haven't waited in line at Mama's at 9am in the morning with locals and tourists alike.

I have been here multiple times and had some really good food and some not so good food.  The last time I went, and the one that prompted this review, was not so good.  The hollandaise sauce was a little more bitter and sour than I would have liked.  But all in all a good dining experience.  My guests seemed to enjoy their omelette so it was a good choice after all.
author: John H.

description:
The wait is horrendous but the specials for that Sunday were worth the wait. We shared the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict and the French Toast Sampler. I love Eggs Benedict and love crabs so put the 2 together and I am a happy scout. 

The crabmeat was fresh and paired well with spinach and lovely eggs benedict. This place is a cute brunch place but you do have to get there early and make it before they close at 3 pm.
author: Jamie T.

description: this place never disappoints. got there at 8:20, waited 1.25 hours. ordered monte cristo (awesome), french toast sampler (good, but i prefer the french toasts not included in the sampler), and eggs benedict (excellent). everything was fantastic, great way to start the morning. and honestly, 1hr isnt bad of a wait. when was the last time u went to a popular restaurant and not have to wait at least 30min to 1hr.
author: Kai P.

description: My BF and I arrived here with a short line. Considering all the reviews about how long the line was going to be..... I guess we were lucky. Pancakes were ok....it wasn't as fluffy and light as I wanted it to be. Banana bread French toast was too dense.
author: JAN I.

description: We have been going to Mama's for many many years. I wish we lived closer as the breakfast is the best on earth. Get there early as the wait times can be long but worth ever second for the tummy food!
author: Nancie D.

description:
The key to not having to wait for two hours is 1) wake up early or 2) go just before closing.  My friend and I arrived at 2PM and only waited about twenty minutes before getting a table.  Cause brunch at any time of the day is perfectly fine by me.

I love their eggs benedict (especially with smoked salmon) and they were again perfect this time around.  The only negative was my potatoes, which were way undercooked.  I didn't want to make it a big deal and so ate them anyway, but really, not good.  Still, I really like Mama's and I'm not willing to write them off just yet.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Heard so much hype about this place, been wanting to try it for the longest time...but since I don't live in the city, it's hard to actually make time for a breakfast in the city. Finally got to give Mama's a try this past weekend and boy, I was NOT disappointed. All the hype was worth it. 

I have never been a fan of waiting for seats and yes, the wait was super long. It was raining and freezing on a Saturday morning and my friend and I waited for about an hour in the sucky weather to get in and be seated. The restaurant is indeed very small, but gives you a super cozy and warm feeling. i really like how the kitchen is open for everyone to see and watch the chefs do their magic, so it was well worth it. 

My friend and I decided to first try their famous monte cristo and french  toast sampler. They were seriously both delicious! The monte cristo was toasted to perfection. The cheese and egg just MELTS in your mouth, and the house jam that comes with it was so delicious!! The 3 different flavors of french toast that it comes with were also all very yummy. I remember liking the banana nut the most, and the fruits were all very fresh and sweet as well. And of course the orange juice, omg SO GOOD! I'm usually not a fan of juice but this one is seriously the best OJ i've ever had. It is quite pricey, $2.95 for a small cup of OJ. but seriously it's worth it! 

Even after waiting for so long, I still think it was worth it and there are so many other things on the menu that I want to try. Next time definitely getting one of their eggs benedict dihes, also wanna try the omelettes and even the side biscuit dishes. Everything looks so yummy, I would wait another hour for this for sure :D
author: Louisa L.

description: The food is very good, though neither me or my girlfriend think it's worth a 2 hour wait. I got the monte Cristo and it was very good, especially when you dip it in their home made jam. My girlfriend got the French toast sampler which was pretty good though not awe inspiring. The bacon and OJ were very good. As an FYI we got there at 730 AM and got in easily by opening time.
author: N B.

description:
Wow!  A real hidden gem!  

I heard about this place from a mutual acquaintance and it did not disappoint.  I thought is would just be another breakfast joint, but the food was amazing!  Once of San Francisco's true breakfast destinations!  You're probably going to have to wait in line for a bit, it's absolutely worth it. 

I went with a party of three my first time and we ordered: the Farmers Omelet, Salmon & egg, or the Chocolate Cinnamon French toast.  Needles to say they were all exceptional.  Definitely will be going back here!

P.S. Don't forget to try their incredible homemade jam (usually on every table)!
author: Honeya O.

description: Nothing to write home about. Dottie's blows it out of the water - I can't reproduce Dottie's at home, but for Mama's I could reasonably make half the things they had on the menu here given the very unmemorable taste of everything. They are milking their status as an SF institution. I am certain something that got this famous used to be a lot better.
author: Josh K.

description: Omg. Go here and get the French toast that has apples and butter lemon sauce. No regrets. Also they have amazing soju bloody Mary's. Looong wait but it's worth it. Nice people inside and good food and service. We only waited an hour or so but we got there early.
author: Aubry J.

description:
I had brunch here on Thursday morning and was surprised I still had to wait around 30 minutes just to get in through the front door (at least it wasn't raining and the sun was out).  Once in the door, there was another line to order and a little one to get seated.  All-in-all, a 45 minute wait. I had the Shrimp Benedict (da bomb!) and a large glass of freshly squeezed orange juice...and I mean fresh. When I walked passed the kitchen to use the bathroom I saw one guy squeezing the oranges :)  I also ordered a bar of the Blueberry Sour Cream pastry and another and another and another....I literally left Mama's with 1 bar in my tummy and four in a bag for later...it was that good!

I would deduct a star for the long wait but I would also give it an extra star for the food...so I'm back at five :)
author: Edison D.

description:
I give this place 5 stars because i think the food is great, especially for what you pay. I really really considered giving this place 4 stars because of the wait in line. There is always the dilemma on what to rate a restaurant on. Honestly I think that part of the reason that the wait is so crappy is that when people get a table they feel entitled to take their time because they put so much time into waiting in line... essentially making the situation worse. But lets get away from the annoying ways that people act and to the restaurant.

I decided to stay with 5 stars because:

...as I said you get a great amount of very yummy food for a decent price. If you decide to splurge all of the crab dishes are very very yummy and they don't skimp on the crab either. 

...the service is great. Even though the place is so busy the people working there are always very nice and helpful. Once you put your order in it isn't too long before your food comes out and they are efficient at getting you anything else you might need or want. The speed and quality of service is what leads me to believe that the excessively long wait in line is largely due to people being crappy and inconsiderate. ...that and the fact that the place is tiny, but hey this is San Francisco; restaurants are small here and I don't think it is fair to take away a star because a place is too popular for its size.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
- great service
- lovely ambiance + table setting, makes you want to stay in there for a long time
- you MUST go if you live in SF or come to SF
- the mimosa is good and so are the berry french toasts :)
- everything is fresh!

cons
- long line
author: Sandra L.

description:
I hate adding to reviews of an establishment with already has enough to stand on it's on. You tend not to add anything new, and just hype up your experience that has already been written about. 

GAMECHANGER TIP! If you want to go, wake up early, show up 20-30 minutes before it opens. Tiny line, one of the first customers of the day, get an early start to your day, and you get to gloat when you leave and see everyone else in line
author: Alex M.

description:
Went on a random tuesday afternoon and waltzed right in without a wait- EEEKKK!! My friend and I split the Monte Cristo and another huevos rancherosish or something like it dish. The Monte Cristo was amazing and that jam is the best. I asked our server if they sold it and he said they stopped selling it cause the berries are difficult to get in large quantities. I nearly cried and was seriously tempted to slip him some cash to produce some in a doggy bag- I would pay a pretty penny for it- it's that good. 

Mama's is definitely a place I will bring out of towners to. The food is great and it's conveniently located.
author: Valerie A.

description: Got here little after they opened and yes there was a line.   We waited about an hour and a half on a Sunday morning.   I guess that's about average for this place.  We got the crab benedict, monte cristo, pan dore' (sourdough with lemon butter and apples).  The crab benefit and the monte cristo was delicious.   The pan dore' was ok.  We ended up ordering a variety of coffee cakes to bring home.   Needless to say, we left the restaurant with smiles and happy tummies.  Great breakfast and friendly customer service!  2 thumbs up!
author: Conrad S.

description:
Yes, I've always wondered how clouds would taste like...after all, I love sleeping on clouds! (I pretend that my down-comforter is like clouds since it so white and fluffy).  And I think after waiting in line for about 40 minutes for Mama's, I can say that the taste of the pancakes here is comparable to the taste of clouds-  pure and heavenly.  I've had pancakes at plenty of breakfast/brunch spots before, but the ones here stood out because of the airy, soft and fluffy texture...it didn't feel like you were eating yourself to death with the heavy taste of the batter.  

The Swedish Cinnamon French Toast covered with fresh berries and lightly dusted with powdered sugar was good, but I probably wouldn't get that again the next time, especially with all the omelet options.  

The line stretching out the door on a weekday, before noon, was enough to convince me to see what Mama's was all about.  A genuine homey, authentic feel,   Mama's is truly one of it's kind.  Well worth the splurge and wait.  'T was a perfect way to start off a good day in the city!
author: Lisa C.

description:
This place is pretty amazing...

I've been here twice already for breakfast and although I hate waiting forever in line just to wait in another line inside to order a meal, it is definitely worth the wait. 

I really wanted to try something other than what I tried here the first time, but couldn't. The thought of having eggs benedict after a night out in the city just made my mouth water. It was just before 2pm and I had not eaten a bite all day. I was hoping the line wouldn't be long in the afternoon, but it was. Luckily, not as long as the first time I came here. 

Again, definitely worth the wait! So I ended up ordering the Eggs Benedict again with a Coke. It was amazing, just as I remember it the first time. The staff here are also very nice, they kept making us laugh every time they'd walk by our table. I love this place and can't wait to go back!
author: Veronica L.

description:
From what I read and hear, Mama's can be quite a wait on the weekend for a breakfast or a lunch.  Sometimes an hour seems like the norm.  So since I'm a rocket scientist, I decide to take that information and go on Memorial Day weekend.  So the one hour wait turned into a 1.5 wait and I got there at 9AM in the morning!

Got very friendly with the people standing in line in front and back of me and the appetite really did build up.  Finally once we did arrive in, I settled down with a Northern Italian omelet and shared my dad's chocolate cinnamon french toast with fresh berries.  I didn't think the omelet was worth waiting an hour and a half for but the french toast along with the homemade jam on the table was def a treat.  If I had to go back again, I'd tackle the french toast sampler which features 3 of their signature french toasts.  To think about it, I don't even remember when I've waited this long to get a meal.
author: Albie F.

description:
Infamous and hyped up Mama's, naturally, I had to try it!

Super long line, had to wait 2 hours on a Sunday morning. 

Dungeness Crab Benedict. Two Poached Eggs with Spinach on a Toasted English Muffin served with Home Fries. This was pretty good, I'm not sure it's worth a two hour wait though. But the crab was fresh and the benedict itself was super delish. I liked the overall flavor of it, some places tend to make it too salty. I also love how they didn't burn the potatoes (because I hate that!). I killed the whole thing and was super stuffed afterwards!

Food was worth 4 stars but -1 for the wait. Go with a party of 2, the more people who come with, the longer the wait!
author: Constance C.

description:
oh, Mama's why must you tease me with your amazing food and then force me to wait a million hours to get inside.  Please allow me to compare this place to like a first kiss.  You have to wait so long to have the first one and then, you are hooked for LIFE. 

Everything that I have had here from the benedicts to the omelets to the french toast is made to perfection.  They have never ruined a poached yet and to me, that is a deal breaker. 

Just set some time aside, head to mama's and just enjoy the day in the city. I promise you will be in that line before you know it.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Yumilicious.  I know, I know.  This place is not an unknown (or, for those of you who hate the double negative, a known), but as a fan of that magical hybrid meal called brunch, I wanted to put in my two cents...

Amid much fanfare and excitement, my friend and I went to Mama's at around 12:15 on one of the nicest days we've had all year.  The line didn't look particularly long...but when we were still waiting for our food (albeit inside), it started to feel long.  We waited in line for a long while, and I didn't realize that you then have to wait in another line to order your food.  As you wait in line, you are tortured by the delicious-looking baked goods...and I don't even like sweets!  After you order and pay, then you have to wait for a table.  It seemed odd to me, and it was particularly awkward considering that the place is small, and everybody was essentially crowded in a very small area practically hovering over the other patrons who were still eating (slowly, I might add).

When I finally got my food, it was delicious - I got the special (the crab benedict).  It was tasty, particularly since I don't like my eggs benedict runny.  The crab was tasty and fresh - my first crab benedict ever!  It was a pretty pricey brunch ($25 with an entree, juice and ocffee), though not too terrible.  

While the food was good...I don't think it was good enough for me to wait in that line again...
author: Wendy L.

description:
used to live 4 blocks from here and i would make it a point to bring folks visiting to this staple of north beach.  waiting in line can be a drag, but show up about 30 minutes before you're gonna be hungry (as opposed to waiting at home until you're starving), and by the time you're walking into the double doors, you'll be primed and ready to go. 

i usually go with the crab benedict, but the monte cristo is def a staple worth trying here.  topped off with a bloody mary, or mimosa and you'll be ready to take on the rest of the city by the bay! 

pro tip: call in your order for to go if you don't feel like waiting!
author: omid a.

description:
I heard nothing but wonderful things about this place.  Since we were staying within walking distance we decided to check it out.  The wait was 1 1/2 hours.  We've never waited that long in line to sit down to eat but we had no plans so we just did it.  The staff was very nice and water was brought outside one time for those having to stand in the sun.  It is a very small venue so seating is a premium.  At one time a party of two was sat at a table that could have accommodated 5 - 6.  The couple behind us asked if they could join us as we were sat at a table that could accommodate 4 - 5 and there were just two of us.  

After a long wait outside you are then brought inside and have to wait yet some more to watch them cook the food and to be seated.  We had a delightful experience because of the couple behind us and eventually sitting at our table.  Had it not been for them I doubt the experience would have been so pleasant.  

As we watched the cooks prepare the various meals the main cook was sloppy with what he was cooking, if something dropped in the eggs by mistake i.e. spinach, meat he would just scoop it out and throw it on the floor.   The "fresh fruit" was not fresh as it appeared to be the mix you can buy from a bag at Smart and Final.  Flies were abundant in the cooking area as well landing on the various breads used for the french toast.  

Upon being seated we only had been checked on once by one of the servers.  There was one young man who spent more time going out to the back door to look at the line and eyeball the young ladies.  He walked around and didn't do much from our observation.  

The food was okay.  The potatoes were undercooked.  The South of the Border omelet advertised with chorizo was not chorizo but rather linguica.   It was more of a black bean omelet as there were only five pieces of "chorizo" in the omelet.  My partner's omelet was tasty.  The blueberry pancakes were tasty but only four blueberries in each pancake.  Coffee was good if you can get a second cup.  

This place continues to be a place to go to for locals and tourists but I wouldn't go back again.  I can cross it off my bucket list.
author: Chris S.

description:
I've been to Mama's a few times whenever i felt like bringing a new friend to try out this tiny place.  Usually there would be a massive pile of people waiting outside, its pretty ridiculous. Ok this place has some pretty good egg Benedict. But the french toast with wildberries (sampler) isnt as good as i expected.  the presentation of it is very pretty and appetizing, however just like their omelet, i think i can make better ones.  

its okay to give it a try, but i wouldnt say its from HEAVEN.  forgot to mention, its pretty expensive for breakfast too 

and what was interesting was that i went today with a friend and saw our table and the table next to ours, each has $15 between the bottles of the salt n pepper. so i thought to myself, WOW people tipped $15 bucks?!?! it made me feel bad if i dont tip at least half of that.. until the other table next to ours got up and left, i saw them putting $1 bills, probably no more than $4 underneath a glass of water.  when the waitress was done, i saw another $15 buck between the salt n pepper!!  uh.. this is werid. it made me think that the waitress did that on purpose.  i dont know.. but. i'll be keeping my eyes on each table that leaves next time...
author: Anna W.

description: This place would be great if it had no wait. I got the monte Cristo and my wife got cinnamon French toast. The monte Cristo was good but certainly not deserving of a 1 hour standing wait. The French toast was a huge disappointment as it was plane and far from fantastic. Our kids had a fruit bowl, bagel, bacon and sausage which was all spot on. If you can't resist the hype; and have to eat here, show up at 7:15am and reduce your wait to 45 minutes - they open at 8am so your wait will only be 45 minutes.
author: Steve S.

description:
Wowowow the ham is huge!!

I got the two eggs, ham, with toast and pototoes.  Half the plate was ham!

Bf got some sort of omelette.  It was tooo cheesy for me, but it was a very generous portion.

The orange juice is freshly squeezed.

Came in right around lunch time and there was no line.

The servers are also very kind.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Been here once before on my previous trip to San Francisco, and the second time was even better than what I remembered! 

This place is a MUST eat, must see place during your stay here in SF. Their breakfast is simply out of this world, made with the freshest and finest ingredients. The presentation and the ambiance are second to none.

We had the French Toast Sampler (made with freshly baked breads), Corned Beef & Eggs, and a Short Stack of their famous pancakes (yum) with a side of bacon. Between my girlfriend and I, there was literally nothing left on the plates, and we must have ordered enough for 4. We only come here once a year and we absolutely devoured every last morsel.

Get there early to avoid the big crowds, as the lines can get long (up to 1 hour). But if you call ahead you can ask how long the wait is just to be safe. 

No matter the wait, this place more than makes up for it...just go for it!
author: Sid A.

description: Food is priceless. The food is well worth the wait. Small homemade feeling get their early or else you'll be waiting forever. We had the French toast sampler and northern Italian omelet which is the best I ever had!!!!
author: Sergio L.

description: This place is over-hyped. Honestly, I waited for over an hour and a half in anticipation for what I THOUGHT was going to be one of the most BOMB brunches ever, only to find it to be yummy, but nothing special. Maybe it was because of what I ordered or maybe it was just the day, but honestly I've had better egg benedicts. The cashier guy was nice and friendly, but there wasn't anything special about this place to me. Average price, average service, LONG WAIT. mehh
author: Hannah K.

description:
I got up early because I heard there is a line. We were 4th in line, thank goodness, cuz  once I experienced it I would have been really upset about wasting half my morning in line for the reward. It really is just a touristy thing...I can't imagine locals going here more than once - unless taking out-of-towners who swear they need to go cuz of all they false hype. 

You waste your time in line. Then you get in the door to stand in another line TO ORDER and pay. Then you sit down in barely breathing room from the table next to you, and they bring your THE WORST coffee, actually coffee flavored water, with watery milk to put in it - not even cream or 1/2 and 1/2) I couldn't even drink it. The food is actually "good" but nothing to write home about...nothing special or worth standing in line for. I have had MUCH BETTER and EQUAL breakfasts in San Francisco where I got right in.

I saw my brother the next day and he asked me how I liked it. I said I wasn't impressed and he said he agreed, that there are a lot better places to for breakfast. However, he DID say to go across the street for the focaccia bread. Unfortunately, they were closed. Seriously, don't waste your time standing in line. It's embarrassing to think I fell for they false hype.
author: L Z.

description:
I already wrote a review for Mama's, but I had to write this one. 

And so I was forced to go here again with my girl (because I would never wait 1 and a 1/2 hour for food, I don't care how good it is... if it makes her happy). So yeah, we waited for about a 1 and a 1/2 hour outside with a street performer (playing a guitar, lol... Gotta love Frisco). Got in and ordered. Yes! But only to see some guy in there with his laptop chillin at a table big enough to seat three. WTF...!!! Are you serious dude... you weren't in the front of the line when we got there so you must have been here for a long ass time. You can tell all the waiters/waitresses were upset. They were like, "anything else sir?" and he would respond "no." and then a minute later they would ask again, haha... 

But we ordered the usually that never disappoints. The Monte Cristo and Eggs Benedict. It was delicious... And just a heads up, they only have one single stall closet as a restroom for all to share. So if you catch Mama's on one of those days your stomach is not cooperating with you, I just hope you brought an extra pair of jeans and underwear, haha... 

Oh yeah, we finished in about 30 minutes and the guy was still there... What an idiot! This ain't Starbucks douche...
author: B L.

description: Good food. Worth the wait if you want a quality breakfast. I'm gluten intolerant and didn't get sick. I had the northern Italian omelette that was super good.
author: Danielle C.

description: Be warned, there is ALWAYS a line. But, the wait is so worth it! I love mama's on washington square. The Monte Cristo and Dungeness crab omelette is a must whenever I come here. Counting the days when I can come back again...
author: Stephanie W.

description: The food is soooo good, all of it! The staff is very friendly. The only problem is that this isn't a place to just decide to go to. You need to plan ahead to make the wait time the shortest. Most times its worth the hour+ wait but if they had a bigger place then I think people would come more often.
author: Aakash X.

description:
This place was hyped to no end by a few friends. I finally managed to make it down, and stand in line for an hour just to order my brunch. The omelete I got was actually quite good, the potatoes it came with were underdone, and the bread felt like it was 2-3 days old. 

The savin grace for this place was the OJ. Fresh squeezed, it was blissful.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Mouth watering goodness!!!

Ok, so I don't know if I'll ever wait 2 hours and 45 minutes again but I did enjoy everything.  Mimosas, Eggs Benedict, Monte Cristo, and Omelet.  

So besides the wait, I got the Smoked Salmon Benedict.  The egg was poached perfectly!  I don't know if I enjoyed the Salmon, but the egg and sauce was amazing.   Hollandaise Sauce...

Washington Square omelet...  That Italian Sausage was so delicious!!!  It's got a great flavor to it, spicy/tangy/great texture!  Next time I'm getting the Italian Sausage on the side!

Monte Cristo... ham and cheese fried in egg batter.  The jam is what makes the little pieces of delicacies perfect!  I look forward to go back, just hope the wait isn't as long...  Make sure to bring fold able chairs!
author: Jackie O.

description: Why waste 3 hours waiting in line when there are so many better faster places to go with less attitude? Wait wait wait.. Have fun.
author: David R.

description: I never thought my husband would wait in line for over an hour to eat breakfast and then say it was worth it, but he did and I agree! Delicious crab benedict!
author: Amy B.

description: The best breakfast place in San Francisco. The place is small however the customer service was excellent. I dont recommend going on the weekends because there will be a long wait outside. The French Toast, Pankcakes, and Omlettes are simply phenomonal.
author: Joaquin R.

description:
I know with all thre reviews already written, this one hardly makes a difference but I had to write this one.  This was our third time there and because it was during the holidays, we waited over an hour to get in.  You feel so special when you get to the front and they finally open the door to invite you into the warm cozy place.  It think the anticipation of getting in after waiting so long in the cold windy air is part of the charm and appeal of this place (as annoying as it can be).

Once inside, the place is cramped yet cozy.  You place your order, pay and then are shown to your coveted seat while those in line peer in at you through the window.  Yes, you are now among the priveleged ones with a seat and a hot cup of coffee!  This time we got the classic coffe cake to share (yummy!) and I got the Florentine scramble for my meal.  It is made up of eggs, white cheddar, fresh baby spinach and bacon, all scrambled together.  It was one of the most delicious egg dishes I've ever had!  The rest of my party had the buttermilk pancakes, and french toast sampler, all reliable favorites.  

This place is a must try if you have the time to wait!
author: Charlie M.

description:
I've been wanting to hit this place up for ages.. as it's the #1 most reviewed (highest?) breakfast place on Yelp..but the fact that everyone moans about the long lines has deterred me.  

Luckily I had some time off so I made it out on a Thursday early afternoon.  We got there around 1pm and only had to wait ~20ish minutes before putting in our order.

I think its really cute how the place is set up.. you wait in line and are super anxious to get past that cute little gate... checking out everyone's dishes.  The omlette dishes look SO BOMB with the potatoes...and YES they are delish!

YES!
- their homemade jam
- omlettes
- cinnamon french toast
- soy latte

Monte Cristo - I had a piece of this.. and something just wasn't right.  I think I prefer the Stack's version better?  Was there maybe too much cheese and not enough meat?  Or were my taste buds just off that day?

Without fail I typically ALWAYS get french toast at breakfast joints.  They had a special that day to sample 3 different f-toasts.  Banana bread, cranberry walnut, & cinnamon.  I LOVED the cinnamon but I think realized that I just can't do fruity french toast..just WAY too sweet.

I'd give it 3.5 stars but SINCE YELP DOES NOT HAVE THE HALF STAR OPTION I went with 3.  The place was adorable, the food was good with great presentation.... but I think I can't up to a 4-5 until I go again and try everything else.
author: Melody T.

description: Lox Eggs Benedict was amazing! The potatoes are superbad for you but oh-so-good. I didn't like the french toast sampler, but not a huge fan of french toast. Get there early. There will be a line. Coffee cake was also pretty darn good. Wish I had a bigger stomach to try more! next time!
author: Kayan H.

description:
I think after waiting for more than 30 mins you would be starving to death that anything tastes great!

Okay, the aroma of the food was definitely mesmerizing. We had Brioche French Toast and Dungeon Crab with green union and cheese omelette. The omelette was in huge portion but really, just  typical. If I can make better omelettes than them... maybe I can be the Mama! The brioche, on the other hand, was much better and was mouth-watering. Our server was very nice and courteous.

However, 1 hour before closing, the people who cleaned the table came and told us they had to clean the table! Not too impressed with that.
author: T L.

description:
I can't stop dreaming about Monte Cristos! The sweet homemade jam with savory Ham and Havarti cheese, who are we kidding, this is absolutely amazing!

Everytime a guest comes into town, I make it a point to take them here. After their mind blowing experience, Mama's makes it onto their must grub list for the next time they are in town.

Is it worth the wait? Heck yeah! But make sure to go earlier so that when you are waiting in line you aren't starving. Oh and unfortunately, this really isn't a place to sit a chill after you finish your meal...you'll have a slew of hungry waiting people staring at you. It's common courtesy, hopefully everyone gets this note.
author: Kristina L.

description: Sorry, mama...you're not worth the wait. Two hour wait before you even open your doors?  Anyone can get great crab cake Benedict anywhere in this city. Go to MyMy. It's much better.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Love this place!  Makes me wish I lived in North Beach despite the narrow hallways....

When venturing to go to Mama's for brunch on the weekend there are many factor's against you.  The two main ones are going to be parking and the wait.  Be prepared with sunglasses and sunblock (or umbrella and jacket), something to read or a friend to talk to and a sense of adventure you would normally keep for waiting in lines at Disneyland.

Once you have all of that you're set.  Just a short 2 hours later you'll be ordering what is likely to be one of the more awesome meals you've ever had.

This might change your world, it might not.  For me it was all I could talk about for the rest of the day.

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Vicky C.

description: I thought it was a little bit overrated with the 2 hour wait.  Without the wait, I would give it a higher rating because the food was good.
author: T S.

description:
really, really, really good.
the food was quality.
so good.

i live outside the city, so i didn't know about the line when i arrived to meet some friends who were in town visiting. but the thing is, you know about it when you get there. 

and it was worth it.

i got the cranberry orange french toast, which tasted just like christmas eve to me. 

the service was wonderful, friendly, and even funny. 

the great thing about the outside line is, once you are inside and enjoying your meal, you don't feel rushed or pressured to get out. 

patience is a virtue at mama's and it pays off.
author: Kimberlee G.

description:
We got to Mama's right at 8am and we waited in line for an hour and a half to get breakfast here on our first morning in SF. I had the french toast with seasonal berries and it was amazing. We didn't anticipate such a long wait and had to get to Pier 33 for our Alcatraz cruise, so we only had about 10 minutes to actually sit down and eat. I wish we would have had more time to enjoy our meals because they were really good. 

If I'm ever back in SF, I'll definitely come here again, but will make sure I arrive earlier to ensure I'm at the front of the line and don't have to wait so long. (Note: Mama's doesn't even open until 8am)

I definitely recommend it, but also call out to make sure you plan for enough time to wait in line.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I went to Mama's last week for brunch after my visiting aunt gave it rave reviews and I thought I should try it.  I expected a wait, and in this aspect I was not disappointed.  It was, however, less than an hour, which seems to be the average based on yelp reviews.  

I also give them credit for the efficient system in which they get people in and out.  You order at a counter once you are granted access to the inside of the restaurant, and then are ushered to a table.  It seems to keep things moving, so by the time you are settled at your table with drinks, food is not too far behind.  At the same time, I never felt rushed to leave.

Now to the food... Oh the food.  I am gluten-intolerant, but once I stepped inside and saw the french toast passing by, I could not resist.  I ordered the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast with berries (and a side of bacon for good measure).  I was no a french toast fan, but notice I said "was".  It was amazing! Great flavor and cooked just right!  I managed to polish off my plate, but was stuffed.  The bacon was also well cooked- crispy but not overly so.

Before I round this out, I should also mention the warm comforting decor.  It makes you feel at home, despite being packed!  In sum: Great food, really good prices, good atmosphere and most definitely worth the wait!
author: Christine G.

description: i LOVE Mama's! I come here every time I visit SF. I don't care if I have to wait in line, I do it happily. This last visit I had their special Shrimp Benedict and it was so delicious. My little bro had banana pancakes. I tried them and they were the best pancakes I had ever had. Mama's...until next time!
author: Brigid P.

description:
Went here with some friends not long ago. The food is delicious, but the line is ridiculous. You really need to be there early BEFORE you're hungry if you want to enjoy your meal. Otherwise you'll just be hungry and grumpy for 2-3 hours waiting to be seated.

I had the french toast with a side of hash and sausage. Perfect combo of food that really hit the spot. The french toast sampler is what you want.

Would I come again? Yes, but on an off-weekend where it's raining or something. I can't stand waiting for 3 hours for food.
author: Richard D.

description:
It is listed as a "must" eatery by many articles....I had to experience this place.  

Waited in line for about 30 minutes, this was expected so no surprise here.  I was more than happy to do so.  I ordered the special, Dungeness crab eggs benedict.  My husband ordered banana pancake with side order of bacon.  This place does deserve all the hype, for the taste of the food, ambience, and the great service.  

I had an unfortunate experience, not something I wish upon anyone else.  
In the midst of eating this heavenly breakfast, I found a long strand of hair.  I did not see this coming, but then again when preparing food, it can happen.  I had a mixed emotions, as good as the food was I could not force myself to eat anything else any further.  The servers were on top of the problem, very apologetic, and refunded my money back.  

This was my experience, does not necessarily have to be anyone else's. In the end, mama's food does deserve the praise, but that's about it.
author: S B.

description: Wait outside to get in, wait inside to order, wait to get a table, and then wait for your food. A great place to do some major ketchup. I liked their monte carlo, eggs Benedict (can't go wrong with any), and gave their french toast sampler a try. Some thick slices and not your usual french toast style? Have nothing to do? Kill time by going here.
author: Ange G.

description: Very good eggs Benedict and the best Monte Cristo I have ever had. The Monte Cristo is fried lightly without the grease pooling at the bottom of the plate typically found with other Monte Cristos. Two types of cheese, gruyere and cheddar, awesome.  Jam is delicious. Service somewhat blunt and terse but that's likely from how busy they are!
author: Andy D.

description:
Place is small, food is good. I mean, how good can breakfast food get? I wouldn't wait another 4 hours to grab a dungeness crab eggs benedict. French toast was good, fresh berries. But nothing out of this world. Overpriced mimosas, eh. When are mimosas not overpriced?

Service was meh, they started wiping and cleaning down our table while we were still eating. I waited 4 hours for this food and I'm gonna enjoy it! We all felt rushed getting out of there. I don't think I'll be returning. Maybe if they moved to a better location that could sit more people.
author: Marie T.

description:
I used to live in SF, I still come here often and usually stay in North Beach. Have been aware of Mama's for ages -- hanging around the neighborhood how could you miss it, with those perpetual long lines outside the door?

Well this morning I was up early so thought I'd head over there around opening time and give it a try. Got there at 8, was seated at about 8:35 - not bad.

Food was disappointing. I had the Northern Italian omelet and it was VERY oily. After taking one bite a large pool of oil formed on my plate that was very unappetizing. 

I got an order of Cinnamon French Toast to go for the wife. I was under the impression that this was one of their specialties but it was rather plain, dead-looking, and fairly tasteless. IHOP quality, or maybe worse.

The best thing was the side of apple crumb cake I ordered, it was delicious and tasted like it had been baked 5 minutes earlier -- maybe it had. The other baked goods on display looked really good, too.

Service was excellent and cheerful, no problem there. Prices are reasonable.

But in a food city like this you can do a lot better, without waiting in line. There aren't a lot of true breakfast places in North Beach but lot of the Italian joints and coffee houses serve breakfast of one kind or another, with much better quality than what I had this morning. Not sure why this place is so popular but they've been around a long time, have gathered a loyal following, and I guess a crowd tends to draw a crowd. I would not go back, though.
author: David K.
