description: Good but not great.  I ordered the French Toast special of the day. It was different types of cake coated in French Toast batter and fried. It was just okay.  My boyfriend got the mama cristo which was very good.  Still, not worth the 2 hour.wait.
author: Nick S.

description: Amazing!!!! If you are in a rush and looking to quickly get in, eat , and be out, don't come here. The line is huge, especially on a weekend, and will take about 40 minutes to an hour. But if you are not in a rush, you will not be disappointed after such a long wait. The food is amazing. They have the best egg benedicts I have ever tried, and they have lots of them to choose from. They also have great omelettes and a great selection of pastries for breakfast. The waiters are always really friendly and great. You just have to go and try their heavenly food for yourself to really understand what I'm talking about :)
author: Mariya B.

description:
This place is always my go-to breakfast place when I visit San Francisco. It's totally worth the hour+ wait, in the beating sun, no matter what time you visit (hours of operation of course). 

Don't pass up the Monte Cristo ! It never fails to make my tummy happy.

We've also tried the Eggs Benedict, the French Toast Sampler, and multiple omelets on different occasions. They're all absolutely fab.

The atmosphere is busy, busy, busy. That's SF for you. Service here is always so charming and attentive. This place is also pretty compact, so I hope you don't get claustrophobic ! 

Oh, and there's really no pressure on your wallet. The prices are decent enough, and the portions are definitely sufficient. 

Good eats ! (:
author: Paulina N.

description:
Went here on a Saturday morning. Got up extra early, met my friend at the bus stop, and arrived there at 9:00am. There were about 3 groups of 2's in front of us. Got inside of the restaurant at 9:30am. Got to the table at 9:45am. Got our food at 10:00am. 

Total wait = 1 hour.

Hadn't been to Mama's in a year so figured it was time to go back and relive the orgasm I had. This time I chose the chocolate cinnamon french toast. ORGASMIC! Smothered in a chocolate sauce topped with a plentiful bounty of fruit, I had mutliple "mmms, and omg's" in my seat. 

Yes, the wait is long. Yes, it can be pricy. But YEA, its well worth it!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
The food is good brunch food, but sometimes the lines are a bit too long for me, especially since I hate waiting! 

The service is very good, the servers are friendly and the food comes fast. 

The food comes in a huge proportion size. 

Overall a great place to have lunch with the girls on a weekday morning, when lines aren't long!
author: Helen L.

description:
Maybe I'm spoiled by LA with our numerous tasty brunch spots, but since I went to Mama's with a watered-down expectation of the "best breakfast in SF," I left with, well, a bad taste in my mouth.  

I should disclaim that I don't hand out stars willy-nilly, so my 2-star rating may be someone else's 3 or 4.  Still, I was pretty disappointed with our meal.  We all shared food (since it was our first visit), so I got a sampling of four dishes: eggs florentine (both poached and scrambled), seafood omelette and the french toast sampler.  The poached eggs were very undercooked, with runny white.  Scrambles were okay, not terrible but not good either.  The french toast was dry, though the breads and berries were tasty.  Also disappointing was the lip-pursingly dry blueberry-lemon muffin.  Overall we were very underwhelmed by the food.

While this has no impact on my review, it should be mentioned that we waited in line (outside the restaurant) for 1.5 hours -on a weekday morning.

The one upside was the very competent wait staff. 

Bottom line: massively overhyped, poorly executed menu and completely underwhelming.  Skip it, even if there is no line.
author: Kali M.

description:
This place had a line at the door when we arrived on Friday at 1pm, but I was determined not to give up and settle for next best. The nice host let us inside the narrow cafe after a 15 minutes wait, and the goodness began.

After ordering individually, our group of 7 was promptly seated by a nice window. Here's what we had:
- Washington Square Omelette: fluffy like a yellow cloud, perfectly stuffed w/ good meat to veggie ratio, delicious potatoes, and crispy sourdough toast. Can't forget the tabasco, of course.
- Northern Italian Omelette: pancetta was  bit salty for me, but the mushrooms balanced it out.
- Cinnamon Apple Sourcream CoffeeCake: SO GOOOOOOD and warm.
- Blueberry/Strawberry Pancakes: perfectly fluffly. SO good with the homemade jar of jam on the table
- French Toast: fluffy and num num num
- Mimosas (mandatory!!!!): good, but not worth $7 a pop!

Everything was so tasty, but my reason for not giving is 5 stars is that it's pretty pricey for brunch. Service was quick. I am SO tempted to try the $18.95 omlette that has crab & avocado, but I just can't justify it! I need to find me a sugar daddy so I can roll around in style orderin' $20 omelettes!! (j/k)
author: Gina C.

description:
Highly recommended for breakfast or brunch. See photos. Is your mouth watering yet? There is good reason why this place always has a line out the door, not to mention the 90+ yelp reviews at 4.5 stars! 

'nuff said.
author: CHERiE Y.

description:
So, we were visiting San Francisco  from Wisconsin and we just randomly asked locals what places we absolutely had to go. We repeatedly heard Mama's. We heard it was a busy place and we would have to wait in line... but we also heard the hours wrong and got there a half hour before it opened, so no wait for us. We were only there 15 minutes when the place was suddenly filled with people and there was a line outside wrapping around the block. 

I would have waited in line for this food. It really was that good. Homemade jam was great. I had the best french toast ever. 
I really liked the setup. Service was fantastic. We were not disappointed about a thing! I can definitely see why the locals love it.
author: Cassie H.

description: The food was out of this world delicious. I got French Toast with cinnamon swirl bread, so good. I would totally rate this place 5 stars for the food, but I have to knock it down because of the way it's set up. I waited in line, in the sun, on the side walk for over 2 HOURS (I came at 9am)!! Everyone around me said it was worth it (if they've been there before, it was mainly a lot of tourists). A tour even came by when I was in line telling the folks of this famous place and how people will wait in line. I guess if you come here, come right when they open or even a little before. But, the food was amazing.
author: Annie H.

description: I would give this place 10 stars!!!! Mama's is awesome! We had the french toast combo it was great. I had the pastrami eggs Benedict my wife had the Monte cristo both meals were great! It was worth the 2 hour wait! i definitely recommend Mama's I can't wait to go back!
author: Erik B.

description:
Maybe the only place I tried Monte Cristo breakfast goodness, nut I cant wait to come back again. Looking forward to their move to a bigger place so we don't need to wait in line, hopefully!

Must must try
author: SFlover D.

description: Do not ask me how I have lived in SF my whole life and not tried this place until a few months ago. WOW, what amazing breakfast food. The only complaint is the long wait, but I guess thats what you get for being so popular. PEOPLE: IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. Everything they serve is to die for.
author: Susannah K.

description: OK, I had to knock off one star for the not so fun wait. It was fleet week and I knew there would be crowds but add parking and waiting outside and then waiting inside for a table, it sucks the life out of you. However, the food packed a mighty punch. I had the Washington Square Mamalette and it was packed with Italian sausage, red/green/yellow peppers, onions, and much more. I love the red potatoes on the side and service was pretty friendly. But the cool part was our meal was discounted in a very odd way. I would come back but on a day when I see no lines or rainy day. Great food and great options for breakfast lovers!
author: Danster L.

description: Yes, the epic wait is certainly something of fable-like quality, but it is worth it.  There are only about 8 or so (!) tables inside, and the line this fine Sunday afternoon was well wrapped around the door.  Next time I'll take a tip from the others who were already in line and grab a coffee beforehand, but, the food was amazing.  I ordered the florentine scramble, and it was covered in white cheddar cheese, and had a lot of flavor.  The breakfast potatoes were also savory, and just the right amount of crunch.  The orange juice was also freshly squeezed and delicious.  Great spot.
author: Mel G.

description:
Yum. 

Love it!! And the best thing I had here was the coffee cake even if you don't get eat it there you should take it to go to have later!

Took one star off for the wait. One hour. We knew there would be a wait but I have to say we were hoping that maybe it wouldn't have to been so long.
author: Amiee L.

description:
This is my favorite SF breakfast spot.  If i go with one other person, we always end up ordering 3 dishes.  I have to get the monte cristo everytime and we usually share it (I dont feel like it's enough as a main dish).  

Basically, you can't go wrong with anything here.  Just make sure not to get there around 12 on a weekend.  Wait can be over an hour.  During the week it's only about half an hour.  if the line is past the windows, it's a 1.5 hour wait.
author: jessica a.

description: The food was incredibly delicious and fresh and reasonably priced!  I got the eggs benedict which was great, but my bf's Monte Cristo sandwich was just exceptional!  Although the 1.5hr wait was painful, it was worth it afterall!  :)
author: Mandy C.

description:
Came by on a trip to SF, and it was good.  There was a decently sized line outside, which was misleading since once you get into the building, there's another line at the counter.  All in all, it was an hour and a half from arrival to the restaurant, to the food sitting on the table.  So lines here can be a tad misleading.

As for the food itself, it was great.  Had the northwest omelette, smoked salmon on an omelette.
author: Jeff O.

description: Mama's is my breakfast stop on the way to the airport, arrive early and bring cash since Mama won't accept your corporate card.  The french toast is exemplary, the pancakes are good and everything else is just OK.  I do like the funky vibe and you can always watch the folks in the park doing their morning tai chi exercises if you get stuck in a line.
author: Lance W.

description:
Iiii like Bread and Buttaaa
Iiii like Toast and Jaaam

But I like Monte Cristo best, made with yummy haam.

My Mama took me to this Mama's for my Big Day, I have officially left my Timid Twenties behind, enter the Dirty 30.

No one relishes a line. Thinking that since we were coming on a Thursday, I thought I had outsmarted the General Public. My first lesson of 30; I ain't that smart.

Doesn't matter WHAT day of the week, you are waiting in a line. A  l o o o o n g  long line. Almost an hour and a half went by when we finally stepped up to the red stoop, the bottom half of the double door closed - but all that we could see was plenty alright with me. 

Carrot Cake Squares, Sour Cream Walnut Coffee Cakes, Cranberry Bread, Cinnamon Bread, Banana too, among fresh berries, bowls of shimp and crab, avocados, eggs, baguettes just waiting to be toasted. I could sit for hours (not in the God Forsaken line - at a table, with the aforementioned food, Silly). 

Then I learned that after you are done in line, you get right back in line!!! But we came upon a server who was cute as can be and sweet as pie, she seated us right away and asked what it was we wished. Now, it was past breakfast - but that's what we came for - however lunch sounded grand as well, so what do you do in this circumstance? Well, you get both of course!

The French Toast Sampler and Shrimp Salad was my order of the day and my Wonderful Mama got the Monte Cristo.

The Sampler was of the Cranberry Orange Walnut Bread, Cinnamon and Banana Bread. I didn't even need the syrup. Served with those fresh berries, the dense Cranberry, chewy Cinnamon and moist Banana were perfect on their own. 

Shrimp Salad - a simple robust salad with half an avocado, big slices of tomato, a bit of sliced egg, perfectly toasted baguette and vinagrette on the side is satisfying and clean.

The piece de resistance, of course was that Monte Cristo. My Ma has a knack for ordering THE best thing on any menu, and this, my friend was it. Cut into quarters and THEN dipped in batter, these were individually fried and fabulous. A pot of homemade jam accompanies and there was never a better match. Salty ham, melty cheese, airy brioche, eggy batter and jam. The Perfect Bite.

We didn't stop there, my Mom without my conculting, got the Carrot Cake and Sour Cream Walnut Coffee Cake, as I SURELY would have said no. Well, those were gone before we got home, let me tell you.
The Carrot Cake itself is so moist, it's almost like an English Pudding - a little bland, but this cake still shines because of it's topping. No ordinary heavy cream cheese, this was infused with something lighter and tangy - creme freiche or sour cream perhaps? Heavy cream? I haven't deciphered it yet, but it was the most amazing frosting I have ever let touch these Irish lips.

Sour Cream Walnut Coffee Cake - the piece that I chose was so dry and slightly tough, I was shocked. I did of course eat it - as I am a Glutton, and noticed when we got home that my Ma's untouched piece was moist, brown-sugary walnutty fantastic and Mama's rep was redeemed. 

I MUST mention our terrific waitress, she was friendly, personable, respectful and fun. We felt she was one of us as we left, and we hoped that any time we returned, she would be behind that double door.

Mama, we're comin home!!
author: Katie W.

description:
Mama's is honestly just amazing breakfast food. The wait has been crazy, but the food will blow your mind, and is SO worth it!

The french toast sampler is just to die for. AUGH!
author: Jane D.

description: This place is greattt! The wait sucks (over an hour), but it was definitely worth my visit. I took my bf and cousin visiting from Korea here and we got 3 dishes - eggs benedict, Monte Cristo and one more that I can't remember now...probably goes to show which dishes were the best. The food was incredible! So tasty! You should try this place if you come to SF :)
author: Jordan Y. M.

description:
We were waiting for an hour in line to get into the TINY restaurant, had to wait another 30 minutes in the line inside, and then our "large" party (8 people) didn't even get to sit together. Regardless, the food was very good, only partially because we had been starving in line for 1.5 hours. Still, the food turned out to be somewhat worth the wait.

I recommend the benedict florentine. The hollandaise wasn't too rich and very flavorful. The blueberry french toast was also very good.
author: Akash K.

description: At first the long line put my family of 6 off.  Over a 1 1/2 hour wait at 9am on a Saturday morning is not the way to start a day of touring San Francisco!  But once we agreed to wait it out we saw a lot of happy people coming out of Mama's.  Once inside the smell of fresh breads, herbs and sauces overtook our senses. We all ordered something different so we could try the many interesting items on the menu. We were not disappointed. The French toast made with blueberry bread and the vegetarian Benedict was fabulous!  We had the Washington omelette and the combination of sausage and spice was perfect. The pancakes were fluffy and were delightful when covered with real maple syrup. The fruit was sweet and firm. Overall it is an experience we will all remember. In fact I think we are going to return one more time before we leave!
author: Joe N.

description: When I read that people waited one and a half hours to eat and it  was worth the wait I didn't believe it.  Now having done just that I can honestly say it is worth every minute!   From the homemade coffee cakes  to the homemade raspberry jam on the table, the offerings are delectable, the food is fabulous! We are only in San Francisco for three days and we will be back on line a second time for breakfast, it really is that good!
author: Stacie S.

description:
Long line. Fantastic food.
As everyone has said here, sometimes you have to wait two hours.  Since you know that, why not bring a newspaper?  Or make a friend in line?

Once you get inside, savor every minute.  All of their veggie dishes here are really amazing.  Make sure you order something that you can eat with jam... you need a vehicle to get the delicious homemade berries to your mouth :).  I highly recommend the Nelson's Rancheros and all manners of breakfast cocktail.  We had some delish mimosas here and the punch also looks fantastic.  

Also, service is great... just please do us a favor - eat and run.  I don't really want to wait another hour while you linger over your breakfast.  There's a park right across the street for that.

That's enough.  Mama's is great.
author: Gretchen S.

description: I wanted to try this place cause of all the hype. Waited for about an hour and a half and was finally seated. Food was alright, nothing stood out. I'm glad I tried it to end my curiosity, but it won't be a place I'd be craving to go back to. Service was good and friendly.
author: Tay T.

description:
I'm mixed on this place.  I've only been once because every time I pass by the line is out-the-door.  There is a funky system here whereby one orders her food and pays for it at the counter before getting a table.  The food is then brought out to the table after the person sits down.  I imagine they have this down to a science, and given the modest size of the restaurant, people probably order well before the kitchen is ready to prepare their meal.

On the one recent day that I finally did grace the interiors of Mama's, it was pleasant outside (upper 50s, perhaps) and it appeared that the line out the door wasn't too bad, and much more attractive than what I had witnessed previously.  I was, perhaps, the third or fourth person standing outside.  I didn't realize that there was another line at the counter waiting inside.  And even though the line wasn't so long, I still waited about 45 minutes before I got a table.  That's right, ladies and gentlemen, I waited 45 minutes to sit down and about one hour before I got my omelette.  Was it good?  Sure.  Worth an hour of my life?  No way.  Did I mention that I arrived about 2:30p, just a half hour before closing, hoping to avoid the lunchtime crowds?  And I still had to wait an hour! 

The omelette was good.  It was a vegetarian variety -- spinach, onions, egg whites, etc.  The breakfast potatoes were also pretty good.  I enjoyed the slices of homemade bread that they included on the plate.  But, was it better than Rick & Ann's in Berkeley, where I seldom have to wait more than 10 minutes?  Marginally, if at all.  (When Bette's Oceanview Diner does it right, its omelettes are better, though there is less variety).

It's a pleasant place, and on a nice sunny day, looking out over Washington Square is a delight.  But who wants to wait an hour for eggs?  The whole brunch thing is something that I simply don't get.  People flock to these tiny "quaint" places, wait in grostequely long lines for an interminable amount of time for eggs.

It's too bad.  My girlfriend loves brunch (her running favorite is Bette's Oceanview Diner in Berkeley -- another place that has obscenely long waits; Mama's is worse).  I'd love to introduce her to Mama's to spice up our brunch rotation, but with food that more-or-less runs with the pack, why would I bother?  Why would anyone?

Granted, as a vegetarian, there's a lot on the menu I wouldn't touch.  The person in front of my raved about their Monte Cristo; the person behind me was jonesin' for the Slim Joe Burger.  Perhaps with life-affirming options like those, I could be inspired to waste my life away for a meal at Mama's.  For vegetarians, however, it's the standard brunch alternatives (eggs, pancakes, french toast) or a handful (as in three) of additional vegetarian lunch options (quesadilla, sandwich, quiche).  I'm sure they are all reasonably satisfying, even if the options aren't as varied.

In a perfect world, I might venture out to try the French toast or the pancakes even though as someone who doesn't eat breakfast much I haven't eaten them in over twenty years.  But, alas, this world ain't perfect, and my time is too valuable to spend 90 minutes for a breakfast plate that at most I would acknowledge as good.

I wish Mama well, but there are reasons why I moved out of the house long ago.

Please Note:  CASH ONLY.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description: Worth the wait in line. Grab a coffee and some good company and people watch while you wait. Then you get really great food and a mimosa and just relax in the cozy restaurant.
author: Vickie L.

description:
Honestly, I did not fully embrace the true meaning of the phrase "good things come to those who wait" until dining at Mama's.
We waited for about 40 minutes and almost didn't get in (we arrived a bit late and it was basically 3pm by the time we got to the front of the line), but they kindly let us in and seated us immediately.
My friend and I each ordered Eggs Benedict, but I indulged in the crab special...best decision of my life! We proceeded to add an order of the chocolate and cinnamon french toast after eyeing our neighbors plate, another fantastic and completely necessary decision.
Seriously the best breakfast I have ever had. Every bite was absolute perfection. 
Worth every minute and every penny.
Coming back for sure, for sure ;)
author: Ashley H.

description:
Waited 1 hour 40 mins. The line really tricks you, when you get to the front of the door ONLY to stand in another line inside. You get teased by all the pastries and the cooks cooking and other people sitting happily with their food. *bleh* 

Knowing that I would never ever stand in line again for some breakfast me and my bf decided to go big! I ordered the crab brie omelet YUM*!  My boyfriend ordered a crab something and he really enjoyed his also. We also ordered the french toast which was alright we've had better. 

Although we really enjoyed our dishes.... I would not wait that long for my first meal. 

First and last.
author: Anita L.

description:
Came here with my cousin to grab some lunch because we heard it was one of the best brunch places to go to in the city. As we were heading towards the place, I didn't see a line, but that was because a car was blocking my view. When I reached the end of the block though, that's when I saw it. About 10 people in line. While waiting, we had some entertainment. A team of about 12 people on segways were riding around the city. The wait wasn't that bad. In about 15-20 minutes we were in and ready to order. 

Both of us had our eyes on the Northern Italian omelet with the sourdough baguette. While waiting to order our eyes were fixated on the great ambiance, fresh fruits, and the cooking. It was just a joyful feeling. Right after we ordered we were seated. Tables are small but you don't need a lot of room. 

We got the food shortly and wow, the omelets are HUGE. They came with home fries and bread. The omelets were just filled with panchetta, garlic jack cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms, and basil. Best Omelet I've ever had by far. The panchetta was slightly crispy and the tomatoes added that juicy tangy flavor. Potatoes were crunchy and lightly fried. They weren't over done or anything. Even the bread was amazingly delicious. Long slices and toasted to a perfect golden brown. Most amazing American brunch/lunch ever. 

If I had the money, I would come here once a week for breakfast or lunch. I'm dying to try their french toast. The wait is really worth it. This is a must try if you're in the city.
author: robin w.

description:
The wait here is not for the faint of heart. On my last trip I waited outside for a whopping 1.5 hours...but it was totally worth it. I'm a Mama's believer.

Monte cristo with homemade jam was so delicious. French toast was a-mazing. Blueberry crumble was divine. Everything in the kitchen looked awesome. 

The guys who work there are so sweet. Definitely better to come in small groups (i.e. no more than 2 people) to get a table faster. I've always been able to find street parking within a couple of blocks by circling a couple of times. 

Can't wait to return.
author: Tammi H.

description:
4 stars for food.  

No stars for the line.

I think the line does help though.  By the time you get through it
you've already thought about which person in your party you would eat first.  Anything you eat after this will taste amazing no matter what. Then, once you get in the door you get to stare at all the people eating while you just think "hurry the efff up people, I wanna sit!"

Once you do get in....everything is amazing!  They are famous for the french toast but I am a huge fan of the Egg Benedict.  So good.  Their breakfast cocktails aren't bad either.

Its a good thing I live 2 blocks away, or else my pants might explode.
author: jessica b.

description:
Totally worth the wait and exceeded expectations (which is really hard since its soooo hyped up)! Got there @ 750 and already a line... But was able to get seated in the first round - first people in line said they got there at 735! Ordered and was seated by 820. 

I have to say the fresh squeezed orange juice was AMAZING!!! Like nothing I've had before, when we asked about it they said it was oranges from Texas! Definitely scouring the grocery stores when I get home to try my own :) 

We took yelpers recommendations and got the crab omelets and  cinnamon chocolate French toast. Wow! And we don't even like French toast! 

I went back alone for lunch (weekday) and as expected, still a line (@1245). Was able to skip the line by ordering takeout and enjoyed some more oj while waiting for my food to come out! Monte cristo was unbelievable! And again, not a big fan of them generally.  Can't wait for my next trip to San Francisco so I can come back here!
author: Minju L.

description:
As you line out the door and around the corner waiting for Mama's, you can't help but look into the window and wonder what deliciousness are these people eating...wishing they would hurry up and be your turn!

I have not yet attempted to come here on the weekend seeing that weekdays are just as bad a wait...but well - worth it!

We usually get our own breakfast...and a french toast samplter to share.  Our favorite is the banana nut bread that they dip in their egg batter and griddle to a crisp perfection on the outside, dense and moist inside.

Their eggs benedict or eggs floretine are equally delicious.

Banana pancakes or buttermilk pancakes with strawberries are also a real treat for your pancake lovers!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: I am usually not much of a critic on food but this restaurant is way overrated in my opinion!  Service was good but seemed like it was very slow for the simplicity of the dishes.  Long line waiting even before restaurant opened. We waited an hour to be seated and we were there 30 minutes before opening. The orange juice was delicious and the fruit was great! The seafood appeared to be fresh but the Norwegian hollandaise was definitely not a $25 meal! My friends said their food was pretty good but all in all we all agreed we wouldn't wait that long again for that meal! Maybe midweek would be better but avoid this place on weekends unless you want to wait in line for hours for a mediocre meal.
author: Tara A.

description:
Do not waste your time here. I was a victim of the allure of a long line. I walk by this restaurant often and assumed it must be so good because there is always an extremely long line. No, the food is not beyond compare and actually pales in comparison to many of the other wonderful spots in North Beach. My best guess is that this place was reviewed favorably or put in guide books so that the tourists always come here (that is what the majority of my line seemed to consist of...tourists looking to say they ate there).

I may be overly critical because I had such high expectations, but I truly think the food is mediocre. The place was cute, but the atmosphere was all wrong for a breakfast spot. As you can imagine, such a long line means many customers so this place was loud, packed, and I felt rushed to finish my meal.  You are brought inside to order at a counter and after you order you must wait for your table and there is very little room to wait. I had a group behind me waiting and I was constantly moving to get out of the way of the servers. I feel like they place in view of other diners to rush them out and that is certainly how I felt when eating. Besides being rushed, I was seated in front of one of the many windows with the line on the other side of the glass. I felt like a crowd of people were standing next to me and watching me eat.

Truly, the only redeeming quality of this restaurant was the fact that the food was not terrible. If you are looking for a quick breakfast or a leisurely breakfast, then do not dine here. If you are looking for decent food, a claustrophobic environment with little service, and a ridiculous wait (over an hour...at least!), then dine here.
author: Kara P.

description:
After my mom, grandma and I came back from Paris, all we wanted was a NORMAL, AMERICAN breakfast, none of that sandwich ham, cheese pieces, croissant and hard boiled egg shit. 

We decided to go to Mama's because I had a post-it of their cross streets on my dashboard for months, and still never had a chance to try it because the line is always so loooooong!

We went at 8:30 and still had to wait about 35 minutes, on a weekday!  As we were waiting in line, one of the cooks gave us slices of bread to eat while we are waiting (I can't tell you how they were though because I'm allergic to walnuts).  I got the california omlette which was monterey jack cheese, avocado and bacon. It was so good and huge! I couldn't eat it all. My grandma and I also shared the silver dollar pancakes, they were dusted with powdered sugar and topped with fresh strawberries. 

It was definitely what we needed. 

I seriously could eat here every morning, and I would if the line wasn't so long and it wasn't freezing balls outside. But, if you do decide to wait in line, you won't be disappointed.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Lordy, lordy ... if only MY MAMA made breakfast like this.  I was raised in a household where it was perfectly acceptable to have rice krispy treats for breakfast on the weekends.  But we all have to grow up eventually, right?

When you first go to Mama's ... you are overwhelmed with the shock and awe of the line.  Before the restaurant even opens, the line is 1/2 way down the block.  I mean, it's just breakfast people ... right?

WRONG ... this is THE BREAKFAST SPOT!  Truly a must try.  And if you love french toast like I do, the pan dore is what you have to order.  It's so beyond good, there are no words.   

Yes the wait sucks, but grab the Chronicle (you remember what the newspaper is, right?) ... if not, grab your smart phone and pray for some sun.  While I wish they would let you linger a bit, this place does a good job of churning the tables.
author: Sho O.

description:
Sorry Mama's - I really wanted to like you but after waiting over an hour on a Wednesday morning to get a table, you're food just didn't live up to the hype.

So to rate the food, yes, it was good but after reading all the Yelp reviews about this place, I thought the food would be orgasmic, it's not.  It's just typical breakfast food with a fancy twist.  Nothing worth waiting over an hour for.  To be specific, we got the frech toast sampler and the pancakes with fresh berries.  I can make pancakes at home which are on par with these and of the 3 difference types of french toast, only one was really good, the lemony tasting one.

If Mama's truly appreciated all their customers then wouldn't they develop some sort of reservation or ticket system or something?

So if you do decide to wait in the line, here are a few tips: 1) bring things to do!  We brought out cocktails but they didn't last as long as the line did!  2) When you do finally get in there - order A LOT of food!  After waiting over an hour to eat, you will be hungry and their portion sizes will not satisfy your major starvation!

So in my opinion, there are way better places in the city to go for brunch where the wait is short or you can actually make a reservation!

So Disappointing... :(
author: Carly P.

description: I love you mama!   Yes, it is that good and worth the wait.  Take some good reading material or read some yelp reviews while you wait.  I had the french toast sampler YUM and the hubbie had the crab benedict WOW!  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars was because my coffee was cold and stale.  We were there later but I NEED hot and fresh coffee.  Staff was attentive and help narrow my decision-thank you.  Will definetley be back with my aunt
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I was lucky to have very small line (it was midweek, around 11am) - I'm sure it affects my satisfaction level.
the dollar size pancakes were divine!! - You have to order it!

As for eggs - I love Benedict. We had 7 people - so we tried some.
I had the vegetarian one with the bacon and tomato (basically combined 2 of their menu options) - it was good.
The crab Benedict got the most praises.
A friend had prosciutto and tomato Benedict - wouldn't recommend.

Their OJ is freshly squeezed - big plus for me

Bottom line - good, but All the fuss elevates expectations too high. It's a good food, good place, not 2 hours wait worth imho
author: I B.

description: As Uncle Jesse would say... 'Haaaaavvvve Mercy.' This place is where it's AT. The constant line out the door should NOT deter you from eating here. WAIT, it's more than worth it. I promise. Get ANY of the eggs benedict plates (pancetta one is the best) and thank me later.
author: Max L.

description: Found this place on yelp so the bf and i decided to give it a shot. Sure glad we did!.. We ordered scrambled florentine, the Benedict with bacon, the French toast sampler, a Bloody Mary, and a Bellini. All of it was so good! The French toast was made with different types of bread topped with fresh fruit. The fruit here is so so fresh! I recommend this place to everyone at least to try once, but prepared to wait I swear it's worth it!! Ps the Bloody Mary is spicy!!!
author: Elvira G.

description:
SO AMAZINGLY GOOD!

My friend recommended this place and well, she knows good food so I had to try it out and I LOVE IT! Yes, we had to wait in line but soooo worth the wait.

My favorite is the Farmers omelette and it was everything I could wish for.  Spinach, leeks, goat cheese and bacon, OM MY!

You must try the jam!  Every day it is different and you will not be disappointed.

They don't take credit cards but they do take debit.  Grab some coffee and get in line because it is so worth the wait.
author: Jenni S.

description:
So very delicious and well worth the 1.5 hours wait in line. My date had Dungeness Crab Benedict and I had chocolate chip pancakes with berries and bananas. The guy that took our order made them special for me. He was so nice! I also ordered a berry lemon muffin (it looked to good to resist). Once I added the homemade berry jam to the pancakes AND THE muffin, that was all she wrote! I was in heaven!

Everything was so good and cooked to order. Again, worth the wait. I would definitely go again.
author: LeoMo T.

description:
Only 30min to wait, order & be seated at 9:15am. Not bad.
This time I indulged with Nelson's Rancheros and coffee. The food was worth the wait. And since it is only me eating the price is super great. Only $11ish. 
*Note: They only accept cash and debit cards and if you use a debit card there is a $1 surcharge. 
I say, if you have time then Mama's is worth it. Great fast and friendly service and great food.
author: Rüsh A.

description:
All who yelp and decide to go here be ye warned and prepared to wait 1 to 2 hours in line just to get in. 

Here is the low down. You can find this place simply by looking for a huge line outside the door when you're in the area. 

On weekends only you can get the Dungeness crab specials (i.e. the crab benedict, or the crab omlette). I went with the omlette. 

1) The place sits 40 people max. 
2) You pay before you sit down, I wasn't sure if they are cash only but bring cash just in case.
3) The serivce is down right awesome. I saw a young gal sneak into line and within minutes the servers jumped on her like she was giving away money. They kindly and courteously escorted her out the door and thus made all those individuals waiting in line wait just a little less. They are also on top of getting your food, drinks and refills. I must of had 4 cups of coffee and didn't even ask for 1 refill.

And now down to the food. I went with the Dungeness crab omlette. Each and every bite had crab in it!!! It was a bit pricey 18.50, but well worth it. The omlette itself measured 7 to 8 inches in lenght, 3-4 inches in height and 4-5 inches in width. It was a big and well cooked omlette. On the side are red country potatoes. The potatoes are good and well portioned but as for flavor were ok. What was good was the fresh sliced french bread served with the meal. They slightly butter the bread and grilled it giving a crunchy and golden brown texture. On the table is homemade boysenberry jam. WOW! 

Now was it worth the wait..... Yes.... Will i do it every time i come up to San Fran from LA..... Sure.... As long as i come up once every month....
author: AARON A.

description:
The first time we came to this place we were notified by one of the chefs that it was closed due to the pipes burst. He told us to come back the next day. I literally had my jaws dropped when I saw the sign at the door AND the fact that the chef told us to come back tomorrow. I was still shocked. I was looking forward to eating on that day. Based on reading other yelp reviews, I hear that there are usually long line ups so that's why the bf and I woke up early to get to this place to eat a hearty breakfast.

Anyway, I wasn't going to give up based on a silly snaffoo so the bf and I woke up early the next day to come to this place to eat breakfast. No lineups thank god BUT it was a full-house...jam-packed place! Unbelievable. I think it was only half an hour after the opening hours and the place was packed. 

The bf ordered the Monte Cristo Sandwich french toast sandwich with fries (no salad). I thought it was a sandwich but it was cool that it was like french toast...soft and fluffy. I, on the other hand, had a hard time selecting my food because I was hoping I could get more points on choosing good food since the bf is at 7 points of choosing good restaurants and good food while I only have 3 points. I selected the dungeness crab omelette with avocado and tomatoes with whole wheat toast. It sounded really yummy. I should have kept things simple. The crab meat was rich so that's a bonus but maybe it wasn't the best combination to have egg with it. The avocodo was so mushy that I couldn't find my tomatoes...The bf sensed that I didn't really like my food so he passed me off his plate :) So the bf with 8 points and me still 3 points. 

Just for the first comers, you need to order first before getting a table. You can't get a table, take your jacket off and then order (for some reason). 

3.8 stars out of 5.
author: Polly C.

description:
Ate here while on vacation back in 2007.

One of the, if not THE, best breakfast meals I have ever purchased.  Fresh, fresh ingredients, not overpriced, and redonkulously tasty.

We had an Alcatraz tour that morning, so we took our food "to go."

One of our items was the BLT with Italian Sausage added, which was fabulous, as was the fresh-squeezed OJ.

I recommend this place to everyone I know who travels to SanFran.

As about 1500+ other Yelpers have warned about, there is almost ALWAYS a wait, so be prepared for that - and be prepared to forgive them. :)
author: Larry S.

description:
dont be turned off by the fact youre going to have to wait in line to eat here. its worth it. you'd wait in line for black friday shopping or a ride at disneyland wouldnt you? you'll really understand once you finally get inside and see the menu and food being prepared as you try and figure out what you want to eat. everything is delcious so dont be afraid to get more than you know you can eat (dont kid yourself tho, youre going to want eat all of it anyway)

The monte cristo is like french toast with a hot pocket filling. SHEAR GENIOUS. it taste great, especially with the awesome jam that balances out the salty of the cheese and ham. All of the dishes are awesome and i love how they are all serviced with fresh fruit.

Parking in the area is kinda of difficult, depending on when you go. Be sure to bring quarters for the meter and cash only for your food. Service is pretty fast once you get in and all the servers are extremely friendly.
author: James T.

description: Just very good food. Waited for about one hours but it was all worth it .. I sent over a week in San Francisco and had breakfast all over but this place was the winner. Highly recommend this place, you won't be disappointed
author: Raul G.

description:
Mama's is something we tried back in 2007 when we first visited San Francisco. It was the highlight of our ip (food wise). We just got back from another vacation in the city that we love and were lucky enough to visit Mama's twice. Everything is amazing... Take a piece of the carrot cake home!! 

About the wait.... Get there at 8. You'll get right in. We love Mama's. You will too.
author: Kerri M.

description: This is my third visit here and it's not my go to but they just do things right with good ingredients.  Honestly i'm a hit or miss about this place being worth 45-60 minute wait.  However, i always ordered the omelettes.  This time i ordered the northern italian omelette.  Everything was great except the pancetta wasn't what i had expected.  I wanted that 'cured', salty flavor.  other than that, enjoy yourself to their homemade raspberry jam on any choice of bread you want.  I recommend the sourdough or boudin's bread.
author: Jason L.

description:
Came here about a month ago for breakfast.  It's defintely worth the wait.  Serivce was great, but a bit on the slow side when you're waiting for your food.  

I defintely will be back
author: Shana W.

description: I waited in line, and  waited, and waited. When I made it inside I waited again. The waitress was mean to the family in front of me and that made me upset. The ordering procedure is ineffective. My burger was dry and it was basically cheap ground beef on a french roll. Chicken sandwich was basic nothing special, except for the stale bread roll. It isn't worth the wait. I took my Mama with me and neither one is especially excited to go back... Sorry Mama but the only reason people think your food is good is because after waiting for a over 1.5hrs your taste buds  can't distinguish good food from poor food. Hunger kicks in and the most disgusting thing taste OK... don't fall for the hype!
author: Nico S.

description: FUCKING GOOD PANCAKES MATE! So I'm eating my delicious pancakes with lots of syrup, all of a sudden, I look outside and witness at least 20 old, fat hairy nudists pedaling their bicycles around the park across from the restaurant. Needless to say, thank God I just finished the first pancake, the rest was mind over matter. Damn you nudists!! Actually I really enjoyed them ( pancakes).  Get there early or you'll be queuing for 30-45 minutes.
author: Troy V.

description:
I'll stand in line any day for breakfast at Mama's! This mom and pop isn't joking around when it comes to their meals, it is flipping swedish cinnamon french toast good! On weekends they serve their famous dungeness crab benedict and every bite is a winner. The bountiful lumps of crab meat will have you rolling on the floor giggling after one taste. 

When ordering French toast, remember to thank them very much for the seasonal berries on top. And yes, their homemade jam will rock all the socks off your taste buds.

Forget Disneyland, Mama's is THE happiest place on earth.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Overhyped.  I can't even complain because I didn't have to wait in line but when I got to the restaurant, my friends had seats and they wouldn't even give me a chair even though we easily could've fit one.  The food was okay, I enjoyed the french toast and the scramble with goat cheese and chives.  I think I will have to come back here some other time and not feel so rushed to eat.  Before we had finished our meal, the servers literally came by and started taking away our dishes! 

Overall, I think food is not worth the wait so if you really want it, come early!
author: Rachel L.

description:
I can't give this place four stars yet. Only because I got jipped right as I entered the restaurant. They ran out of the daily Dungeoness Crab Special which I've been wanting to try. So I'll change my review once I get to try it! Thankfully one of the owners told me it's a daily special so that makes it ten times easier to come back again! My friend and I got here at about 11:30am on  Sunday and line was pretty chill. I think we waited maybe 30 minutes? It was quick. We ordered our food, got seated and the food came right out. Toyota would be proud. That's just-in-time right there!

I ordered traditional canadian bacon egg's benedict. Compared to Prolific Oven, it's above average. It didn't blow my mind. I judge the benedict based on their Hollandaise and I wasn't super impressed. It was a satisfying meal and competitively priced with my dinner the night before at a much trendier restaurant. Though you can't compared the two because they're in different classes. But! To be fair, if there's a line out there then it must be good. So i'll give it 4.5 stars and I'll change it to 5 when I go back.
author: Jon H.

description:
I've been to Mama's twice now and I think the appeal is starting to wear off.  The wait is horrrrrrrrrendous - recently we got there at 7:45 and didn't get our food until 9am.  Yes people, it is a good restaurant - but you have to ask yourself if it is worth it.

You must eat the French toast.  The sampler platter is the smartest move if you haven't honed in on your favorite yet.  Do not put jam on it though - are you crazy?  Cake coated with eggs and sugar and topped with maple syrup and fruit DOES NOT require jam.

The savory entries are decent, but not perfect.  I had the dungenous crab eggs benedict and although all the pieces appeared to be there (including too much sauce), the end product just didn't do anything for me.

4.5 star breakfast, 1 star convenience - you do the math.
author: Robin S.

description:
Waited in line for bout 1/2 an hour on Sunday. That's not as bad as I expected. 

Had the californian omelet and french toast. 3/5 It really wasn't as good as I thought it'd be. 

Monte cristo 4/5 A surprising find! my companion who's a regular had that. I really should've had that myself. Really really really good.
author: Ray J.

description: Yummy but only worth the 2-hour wait once. I was lucky to have eggs benedict with crab (during crab season) and the monte cristo. The monte cristo is a must have. Try it!
author: Lynee L.

description: We waited around 1 hour to get into Mama's.  Then we stood in line inside another 15 minutes.  We had a great time and the food was yummy.  This just isn't somewhere we would go out of the way to have again with a long wait.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
OMG. DELICIOUS! I love love love breakfast and I'm so happy I finally came! Every time I come by Mama's, the line is insanely long and I didn't want to wait. 

So finally, on a Tuesday afternoon, Jenny K. and I ventured out here at about 12 or 1pm. The line wasn't too long. We probably waited about 15-20 minutes outside and then another 15 minutes inside (yes, you have to wait again when you get inside). 

How this place works is when you get inside, you get to watch the food preparation (just beware, this may change your mind on what you originally wanted because everything looks soooo good!!) and then finally it's your turn to order. You also pay at the cashier and then you will be seated as soon as a table that can accommodate your party opens up.  It's a short wait from there on for your food. 

Jenny K. got the dungeness crab benedict and I got the swedish cinnamon french toast. OMG. Both were sooooo good and so worth the wait. I really do wish the place was a lot bigger to accommodate more people at a given time since there's ALWAYS a long line. But don't let the long line scare you. The wait is totally worth it!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Mama's is definitely my favorite place for brunch on weekend now.
I ate Egg Florentine and my friend ate shrimp & Avocado Omelet.
Service was very good and medium local. 
Atmosphere was open, friendly, bright, and very comfortable.

There was a line (of course) but it moved pretty fast. It was better that I imagined. I think the system they have...which is order before and pay ahead is real time saving. 

Every body's plate looked really fresh and shining and tasty. It looked real not because I was really hungry already.
My egg Florentine was very good. I definitely try looking cute french toast next time!
author: Green Mango Y.

description: The food here is very delicious! I got the Eggs Benedict w/ Proscuitto & Grilled Tomato. Upon request, I also got some slices of avocado in it too! The portion size was pretty good and I was super stuffed afterwards! I don't know how I managed to walk all the way up to Coit Tower after devouring that meal. But although the food was great, the wait time was ridiculous! I think my friends and I waited about an hour and half. The food was delicious but I don't know if it was really worth the wait. For sure I want to come again but I think I'll try coming earlier next time! Hopefully the wait isn't too crazy.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Hands down, THEE BEST BREAKFAST/BRUNCH FOOD I have ever eaten. The food here is dyyyynamite. Mama's know how to serve their food RIGHT. Big portions, full of flavor, and delectably delicious. All the dishes are served and plated beautifully - it can easily be called food porn.

With so many choices on the menu, it was hard for me to choose but since I love me some french toast, I ordered the fat free apple yogurt cinnamon bread dipped in egg whites served with seasonal berries, (wanted to go for something a little bit more healthier too) while my friend ordered the veggie benedict with a side of home fries.

My dish came out with three thick slices of bread that were sweet, moist, and had a slight crispy crust to it. The berries were fresh and sweet as well. Topped it off with maple syrup and I couldn't have been any happier. My friend raved about his veggie benedict. Two poached eggs served on top of toasted muffins, covered in the most creamy, velvety hollandaise sauce I have ever seen. It tasted like perfection to me.

I wanna go back for more! ...even if there is a one to two hour wait on most days.
author: Annie S.

description: Mama's lives up to the hype and is well worth the wait. The staff are very friendly, making it a great experience. If you park at a meter, make sure to allow plenty of time. The California omelette with avocado was unbeatable and perfectly done. The French toast sampler is also a treat.
author: Troy A.

description: The reason why this place is packed everyday is because other than Denny's there are not many good breakfast places in that part of the city.  I had the dungeoness crab benedict which was very good, the crab was fresh.  Also had the french toast that uses their freshly baked cinamon bread.  It is a little overhyped I have to say because I did have to wait an hour and I can't say this place is better than Stacks or Christie's in Burlingame.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
I saw long lines on weekends and was wondering what was making this restaurant different. So one sunny Saturday, a friend of mine and I decided to give it try...

The wait was long, but food was good. I suggest that you go there on week-days if you can manage it. (Monday is closed.)

I am local, but there are a lot of people coming from else where. I guess it's either word of the mouth, or the yelp review...

I definitely would consider going again -- if the weather is good...hate to wait in line when it is raining!!!
author: Ed W.

description:
The food itself was really good! But oh my that was a killer wait to get the food and once you put some wait time in, you just cant give up! we got there at 10.30am on a Sunday morning (on an usually hot SF Sunday!) and we were melting by the time we got seated (12.15pm)... yes it was that ridiculous a wait! The thing is Mama's is known as a suggested local spot for "tourists" and so many people in  the line were tourists,  that its not that local anymore! 

I also love Washington square park and the neighborhood in general...

We got the fresh orange juice, carrot cake (yumm), Got a benedict that was loaded with toppings (avocado, mushrooms, tomato) and was really good! The husband got a veggie omelet and he loved it too. Our new friends got an omelet with goat cheese, leeks and bacon and another got a meat filled omelet... Everyone was satisfied with the meal!

The best part about waiting for that long was it was a blind couples date (lol). we met a couple who was introduced to us via our common friend who lives in London and we both are very close to! Therefore the long horrendous wait worked out coz we got to know them more! :)
author: Sapna E.

description:
absolutely love this place. Even though the line is quite long on the weekends (usually 1+ hour wait), but i mean.. you gotta be damn good to have this kind of line right? 

Their dungeoness crab m'omlette was.. pretty ridiculous. it's pretty much 80% filled with fresh crab meat. The crab is a very good compliment to the omelette itself. 

Their cranberry jam(?) for the toast is also one of my memorable experience there. gotta get the white toast to try it out. def recommend. 

Not a huge fan of their potatoes but with everything else being superb, it didn't bother me too much and i mean it's not horrible either. 

You do have to order and pay first before they seat you. Also, remember to leave some tips on the table before you leave ;)
author: David C.

description:
Anyone who's known me long enough can attest to the fact that I have an affinity for the damaged, complex, mentally rebellious, unique, and often disturbed. I call it beautiful.... but that beauty often comes with quite a great deal of trouble, whether it's lack of communication, passive-aggressive behavior, jealousy, paranoia, secrecy, stalking, or violent tendencies. In the past, when the situation would escalate to alarming levels, one of my best friends would stage an intervention, breaking the news that we have on our hands an S.O.B. and it was time to let go.

When I went to Mama's for the first time last year, I realized that I'd finally found an S.O.B. that I could admire so without fear of retribution, aside from the weight-inducing calories. It was a hangover-appropriate overwhelming combination of all the things you never thought you'd enjoy in an omelette. Black beans, sour cream, and salsa.. + jalapenos. Yum. My crapulous dining companions took a warm liking to the S.O.B. as well as a few new comforting acquaintances: a beautiful Swedish Cinnamon and the Northwest (smoked salmon, mmm).
author: Asha S.

description: Very good, but all in all not worth the 90+ minute wait to get a table. The food is definitely great and the Monte Cristo and Crab Benedict are must haves. The experiencing of waiting can be charming at first as you socialize with the 50 or so other people in line, but it starts to get old . My recommendation is to BRING A SNACK and bottle water for waiting in line. Also it's CASH ONLY, I repeat CASH ONLY so be prepared.
author: Scotch E.

description:
I went here on a rare weekday off, and I stand behind my rating.

Because I'm rarely in this neighborhood and it's currently a bit of a trek for me, I decided to get the regular eggs benedict to eat there and the monte cristo to go, along with a mimosa of course.

The eggs benedict was very good - I don't think they were knock-your-socks-off, mouthgasm, best benedict EVAR good, but certainly decent.  Definitely better than the spinach/tomato version I had previously.

The mimosa was nice - fresh squeezed OJ and heavy on the champagne, small glass.  I would have had another one, but unfortunately the way in which you order first at the front and then sit down makes it somewhat awkward to order anything else afterwards.  

However, the monte cristo DOES in fact live up to the hype.  Gooey goodness encased in delectable egginess, dipped in homemade jam - I was a bit skeptical of the jam, but I'm glad I tried it because I wouldn't have it any other way.

So, would I go here and brave the lines on some random weekend again?  Sure, but I won't bother with the benedicts.  I'd stick with the monte cristo or the french toasts, and I'd get 2 mimosas.  I'm sure their omelettes and other sandwiches are great, but it doesn't seem like anything you can't get somewhere else in a more convenient neighborhood without the line.  The specials are likely a good way to go as well so if you fancy a dungeness crab, shrimp, or other seafood-version of a benedict and it's on the white board, it's probably a safe bet.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Mama's is The One. The only 5 star food review I have ever given. The best brunch I have ever had. 

Standing 50 feet away from the base of a soaring cathedral, Mama's offers a religious experience for disciples of Sunday brunch. And yes, like heaven, it takes a while to get in. If you count 15 people standing outside, that's a 1 hour wait. 30 people = 2 hour wait. 

Standing in line becomes particularly torturous once you get inside. It seems like it's time to eat.  Oh no. Like Job, your faith will be tested. There is another 15 minutes to stand there watching people eat all around you. Resist the urge to sit down at a recently vacated table and eat their scraps. Your time will come. 

When you finally make it to heaven's gatekeeper, remember that he only takes cash or debit. I usually order approximately 4 dishes for a party of 2. Best bets: omelet (Washington Square), eggs benedict, 2 eggs any style, and any French toast. Their homemade jam is great. Don't be shy. Put it on everything. And I mean EVERYTHING. 

The service is top notch. Mama's treats each customer like one of her children. My waiter once refilled my coffee cup 12 times in an hour. I inadvertently drank about a gallon of coffee that day.
author: Lou S.

description: Waited over an hour for this place and decided to order to-go. Ordered the salmon egg Benedict and French toast sampler. Egg Benedict tasted average. French toast was delish! I think one of them was banana but and the other maybe some sort of berry  French toast. Is it worth the wait? Probably not.
author: K X.

description: The only complaint I have is that the wait was long and that we have to order our food in a line and then sit down to have our food brought out (Might work easier if the waitress took orders).But now on to how great the food and service was. The eggs Benedict are awesome and the Montacristo is amazing. The wait is long but well worth it.
author: Joey H.

description:
Don't be scared of the Disneyland-like line outside - it is all worth the wait! Mama's has quickly become my favorite breakfast place. The average wait time is about 1 hour on a Saturday or Sunday morning at 9am. There is even a wait on weekdays! Be warned though, there is a line outside, but also one inside. The one inside goes quickly and gives you enough time to teeter back and forth on what you're going to order. Waiting in line, check out the focaccia bread store across the street at Liguria Bakery. 

Pan Dore with apples is my favorite, followed by the Monte Cristo. Pancakes are good, and so is the Northern Italian omelet with garlic cheese! Everything is delicious so come hungry. Bring a friend so you can try different things, but the location is small, so parties of 2, but not more than 5 works best. It seems like they seat parties of 4 and 5 at the same size table. 

This is one touristy place that is actually very good and filled with locals alike. Maybe I should not have even shared this review, to decrease my time in line...
author: Rachelle T.

description: Got to the place around 9:35 am on a Tuesday morning. I waited for a little bit less than an hour. Just a quick tip, grab a cup of drink before you wait in line. It was so sunny and hot, and eventually you will need something to drink. After I finally made it into the place, I waited another 10mins to order and wait for a table. The food arrived in 5-10mins. I ordered the salmon Benedict, the French toast, and the omelet. The salmon was a bit too salty for me and I tasted a bit of sour taste. Everything else was great.
author: Livia Z.

description:
3 stars seems just unfair for Mama's, but I was honestly too stuffed by the time I got here. Girlfriend had me gorge on a Kara's passionfruit cupcake on the way over. Thought I'd keep this meal light and ordered a Florentine eggs Benedict which was beautifully prepared on top of an english muffin. The runny eggs were awesome. It was a lack of cheese in the dish that disappointed me. That made me experiment with their homemade berry jam and topped on my English muffin with eggs and all. Wow! That jam really maintained the integrity of the berry it was made of. I even lopped it on my potatoes! 

I will return next time and test the waters with the other dishes they're known for... Betcha the stars will change to 4 after a Monte cristo!
author: Christine L.

description:
Yes, the food is delicious, but I wouldn't wait here every weekend. Moreover, nothing on the menu was especially eye catching. And the items we ordered were tasty, but not crave-able. 

Being our first time there, my bf and I decided I would get out and wait in line first while he parked the car in the neighborhood. It worked out well. I was unsure of the "process" since it was pretty much a line along the sidewalk with no signs of a sign-up sheet or anyone directing the line. I casually asked the girl in front of me how the line worked and from there, we made a small acquaintance, making the 40 minute wait interesting.

Basically we waited outside. Then they moved us inside and we continued to wait in line. They make you think you are getting close, but you end up waiting and waiting in different places. In line, inside the restaurant, we chose to have the dungness crab omelet (their weekend special) and the French toast sampler. 

After we ordered, we waited to be seated. The food came relatively fast once we were seated. The French toast is like a soft, fluffy sponge that soaked up all the butter and syrup on the plate with fresh fruits on top. The crab omelette was fresh.
author: Joyce L.

description: This place has hyped up reviews. The food is really only mediocre; this is coming from someone who knows breakfast believe me! ;) the wait also is usually about 1 hour outside and then the rest of the line is hidden Inside for one more hour while you order in line and they find you a table
author: Tokhme Emam H.

description:
Did not read a review that tells you that the line is outside follows a line inside where you have to order and pay before you get seated. 

Ordered French Toast Sampler and the Prosciutto, Tomato Benedict. French Toast Sampler was great. Gave an idea of what I should get next time. 

Benedict we ordered was saltier than ramen salty. 

Mama's kind of overrated. Should probably try the crab benedict next time as I was so disappointed with my crab benedict at Zazie the last I went. 

Great service.
author: Margaret S.

description:
Best breakfast place in the Bay Area, period.
Lots of places have lines to get in.  The "sucker for brunch" contingent is huge.
Mama's is actually worth the half hour you spend standing in line. 
Let me count the ways:
1. The bake all their own pastries and bread.
2. They make their own delicious jam.
3. The montecristo is the stuff of brunch dreams: sweet, savory, and dusted with sugar powder.
4. Dungeness crab omelette.

Roll out of bed, send a pal to fetch a coupla coffees while you save your spot in line, and make it happen.
author: teray g.

description: Long wait, close to two hours. What is annoying is there is no wait list, so you have to wait in the line till it is your turn. I am glad that the food was good, the Monte Cristo was unbelievable, very unique taste. Loved it! Worth the wait. We also tried the French Toast sampler. It was very different, instead of toast bread, made from cake slices. Worth trying. The pancake was fluffy, warm and good as well. Not impressed with the coffee. Also it is odd that you have to go to the cashier to place your order before sitting at your table.
author: Sasan A.

description: Huge line again to get into Mamas but so worth the wait.  Looking forward to having breakfast with 3 of my most favorite people.
author: Paul J. B.

description:
If you can't find this place, just look for the line of people outside. 

Mama's is on the corner of Washington Street, and well worth the wait. I'm from out of town but every time I'm in the city, I have to make a stop at Mama's. 

I love their french toast- if you don't know what to order, try getting the sampler, you get three different flavors- the Dutch, Apple Berry, and the Banana, comes out to be $12. I also tried the famous Monte Cristo- a ham and cheese sandwich grilled and dipped in Egg- a legitimate french toast sandwich, which comes with their juicy grape jam. And last but not least, you have to try their eggs benedict. We ordered the Smoked Salmon eggs benedict which was definitely a great pair. I have to admit the dungeness crab eggs benedict tops the cake for me!

all together, my all time favorite breakfast place!
author: Amy C.

description:
I went there at 8:15AM and didn't have to wait to get in the door.  However, I did have to wait 15 minutes to order my Monte Cristo and Northern Italian Omelet.  I thought the Omelet was ok and the Monte Cristo Sandwich was also edible.  I don't think I would wait 45 minutes(as other people have on weekends) for them.  I thought the service was abysmal since we were seated right next to the door and would get a blast of cold air whenever the door opens(there was a lot of tables open away from the door).  This is after I offered to be seated with another diner from England which I just met to save them space on tables.  I could see that they just gave us attitude which I felt uncomfortable.  The English guy Stewart is here for MacWorld and was very nice and pleasant, however he didn't eat too much of his omelet or drank his coffee.  In retrospect I could understand why since I felt this place was highly overrated.  We might have just gotten them on a bad day.  All I know is that the coffee here is the worst I have ever tasted, anywhere!  The coffee that I had at work which sits around for hours tasted much better.   I just felt the owner lady(I think) at the cashier was rude(for telling us to sit next to the door) and I really did not enjoyed my dining experience here at all.  I will most likely never be back.  Which I am sure would please people who wait 45 minutes for a plate of average tasting omelet, at this establishment! :-)

I am just amazed that a place which serves such horrible coffee and average omelets could warrant waiting for in SF, and praised as being a GREAT breakfast place.  It just goes to show you that marketing is where it's at, just call your omelets "Northern Italian" and sandwiches "Monte Cristo" and people start thinking it's some wonderful sh*t. :-0

It Ain't!
author: Jim J.

description:
I've passed by this place many times and there has always been a long line outside. A friend was in town, staying at a nearby hotel, so I thought I'd finally try it since it was a weekday. I even called them asking if the lines are usually long on weekdays too and was told that the wait is usually 10-20 minutes on weekdays (except holidays). Yeah, right. 

We waited for 1.25 hours in the hot sun. Hadn't realized how small the place is inside, maybe 11 tables, more or less. Additionally, when you go inside you have to place your order and pay (no credit cards accepted) while in line, before you get seated. 

(The fire dept stopped by during our lunch and we thought they were getting takeout, but they were checking on the health of a young woman. Perhaps she had fainted from hunger &/or waiting in the hot sun, LOL. She seemed fine, walked out of there on her own two feet.)

Food was good but not the best I ever had. Ordered the cobb salad and they were out of blue cheese dressing. Not catastrophic but asked for a vinaigrette dressing with some blue cheese added to the salad. Hard to mess up a cobb salad.

Friend had the grilled chicken sandwich and he loved it, saying it did justify the wait. The bread was very good (I had it with my salad as well). 

All told, the food is good if you don't mind the long wait. I do mind, so probably won't be back again any time soon. 

PS Heard that you can get takeout, but you still have to wait in line to order!
author: D L.

description:
Boy oh boy was there a line.  We got there around 10 am on a Friday and we waited about 45 minutes to get in.  Luckily it was one of those days that I wasn't in a hurry to go anywhere and I had been wanted to try the food here for some time.

The French Toast Sampler was yummy.  I preferred the classic one but the banana bread french toast was surprisingly good considering I hate bananas.  The cornbeef hash and eggs were good and went well with the silver dollar pancakes that we also shared.  I really liked the jam that is on the table and I think I could have put it on anything.  

Once you're inside, it's cozy, service is efficient, and the people are friendly.  They're really good about refilling your coffee and since you pay for your food at the counter, there's no wait for the check.

Would I go back? Not if there's a massive line again.  I'll just have to keep driving by until I see a shorter line.
author: Nina L.

description:
I was pretty skeptical before I visited Mama's.  Two hour wait on the sidewalk, in the cold for breakfast???

First off, they have freshly squeezed juice.  My friends we're giving me a hard time for ordering fresh apple juice, but c'mon?!  Where else am I gonna get fresh apple juice besides the farmers market?

Northern Italian: Pancetta,Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomato, and Garlic Jack Cheese.  One of the better omelettes I've ever had!

French Toast: I'm normally not a big fan, but this dish was insanely good!  The banana nut and Swedish cinnamon we're both superb.  Not too sweet, light and fluffy, and the taste!

We normally try to go super early to beat the line, or go late and avoid the rush, I don't think I've ever had to wait more than 10min using this technique.

Worth the wait?  Wouldn't know haha.  Great food, great service, highly recommended!
author: Anthony L.

description:
COME ON- I don't waiting line for more than 15 minutes unless one of The Beatles came back to life let alone for breakfast. Now they've even raised their prices and every yah hoo in town is told to come here. IT IS NOT KID friendly. How many kids do you know who wait in line for ANY length of time?
I don't care if the food is good-$18 for a piece of french toast is a rip off. If I'm in town I don't want to spend this much time on a breakfast.
Try Pat's or even Golden Coffee Shop!
author: SJ O.

description:
We plotted a Saturday Mother's Day brunch, thinking we'd avoid the Sunday wait. Wrong. You can't avoid the wait. Consider standing in line for about an hour with your fellow San Franciscans as you contemplate the goodness inside as part of the experience.

Mom rocked and loved the shrimp omelet. Bro/sis rocked, loved and shared the egg white scramble (go sourdough baguette on the bread!) and lowfat french toast dipped in egg whites. We have no idea how apple yogurt cinnamon bread can taste that good and be so healthy (less than 1 gram of fat according to the menu), but it was. Statements like "best french toast ever" were shared aloud by the time we got to the last bite.

Loved the free drip coffee refills in our latte glasses, loved the constant smile on the eldery dining neighbor next to use, loved the suggestion by the waiter to top the french toast with the house jam (yes please!), and loved how happy mom looked.

Loved everything.
author: Jason B.

description:
5!  Out of 5!  Ok, so you're not really interested in hearing what I had to eat.  What you're REALLY looking for is how long I waited.

The answer:  1 hour 10 minutes.

The result:  Worth it!  

The destruction: 1 great french toast, 1 meaty big omlet, 1 side of potatoes, a 2-egg scrambled side, a side of blueberries, and orange juice (for two).

The aftermath:  $40 breakfast.  Holla!
author: Steve A.

description:
Fantastic little breakfast joint, but be prepared to wait an hour to get in. And don't forget, once you actually make your way INTO the joint, you still have another 15 minute wait to actually get seated. Good thing here is that they make the line wrap around the kitchen so that you can place your order.

Make sure to get some of the benedict or omelet, as both are made to perfection with light fluffy eggs and fresh ingredients.

As a final meal topper, they have a crazy selection of baked goods that are not limited to the following: "Cranberry-Orange Walnut Loaf, Banana Walnut Loaf, Kugelhopf Brioche filled with golden raisins, dates, and cinnamon sugar, jars of homemade Ollalieberry Jam, Poppyseed Bundt Cake with lemon cream cheese frosting, Carrot Cake with cream cheese frosting, Fudgy Pecan Brownies, and more!" whatever you end up choosing, know that the choices are amazing and the taste is out of this world.
author: Alex D.

description: It seems like everywhere breakfast joint in SF you have to wait in a line before the restaurant even opens. That most likely means it's good. We waited an hour or maybe even longer to be seated. The staff is very friendly and kept updating us with our table status, all while not rushing their customers. I would have to say their service was great. The food was good, but I wouldn't say anything memorable. If we didn't have to wait so long, I would definitely come back, but the food is good. I don't think you would leave disappointed based on taste and presentation.
author: Justin N.

description: Cozy. Long wait. Popular. Great breakfast. Crab Benedict. Bloody Mary. Order at counter. Friendly service. Arrive early. Cash or debit.
author: Paul I.

description: I loved Mama's! It deserves a five star, but unfortunately the ridiculous line and my hour wait for food whilst starving was too big a detriment. That said, it was worth the hour wait. The Northern Italian and Farmer's omelettes are both delicious! The Northern Italian is super savory and filling, but I wish the taste of basil was stronger. The Farmer's omelette has goat cheese, which I usually despise, but the other ingredients and favors balanced out the goat cheese, making it a subtle hint in the entree. The Swedish cinnamon french toast is a must! It's absolutely delicious! And Mama's is seriously one of the cutest places to go: it reminds you of a very happy, sunny, and lazy sunday spent at your grandma's enjoying her home-cooking. Definite win!
author: Jing P.

description:
3.5
Long wait, but the Monte Cristo's pretty good....
author: Veronica C.

description:
Perfectly cooked breakfast/brunch food, creative and different menu with daily specials. The first time I went to Mama's the wait was on ly 30 minutes since it was 10am on a Tuesday morning. I came back for a Sunday brunch and we waited 2.5 hours which, for the food, was 1.5hours too long. I would wait an hour max. 

TIP: come at 2pm if u can spare a late brunch and the line is amazingly short.

I had the infamous Monte Cristo and my mouth was watering from the moment I ordered until my last bite. I love french toast, I love cheese, I love ham, and I love when savory foods (the monte cristo) mix with sweet foods (the homemade jam).  I didn't even want to share one bite! I highly recommend trying this entree.

We also ordered the french toast sampler with 3 different types of french toast. Each was slighty different but each had a distinct taste. We noticed that they ran out and erased the special off the menu as we were enjoying it. 

The portions weren't extremely large or small. We left mama's content with enough energy to walk around the area with a pastry to go.

Mama's overall has great brunch food. If you are willing to devote a good chunk of your morning towards a meal, by all means, try mama's.
author: Nathaniel C.

description: Dungeoness crab omelette did not disappoint! Worth the hour wait. If you love seafood and breakfast, it's a DREAM! I want to try everything here. If only you weren't all the way in SF and you didn't have an hr plus wait every morning. Sigh.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Love the jam
Love the French Toast
Love the fresh squeezed orange juice
Love the lobster benedict
Love the Monte Cristo

We got there around noon and waited a little over an hour, but when the food arrived...it was well worth it!!!  My friend had told me how delicious and fluffy everything was, and it definitely lived up to my expectations.  

Mama's is one of those places where no matter how full I get, I keep wanting to eat more and more.  So not a good place for someone who wants portion control!  It looks and smells THAT good. Ahh, I can taste the french toast.  Everyone should definitely try this at least once, trust me, it's worth the wait!
author: Tina T.

description:
sweet, savory, mmmMMmm Mama's has got it all!

The wait may take a while and the parking is scarce but let me tell you its all worth it!

Usually get pretty happy when I come here b/c amongst two people, we typically eat enough for 3!

French toast sampler is a must try, it is coated in such a delectable batter that isn't too sweet but o so scrumptious! Fresh fruits on top along with their home make jam...you definitely have a combination for success!

Next up the Monte Cristo! it is sweet and savory wrapped up in one! ham and cheese sandwich drenched in french toast batter.  The sandwich is just enclosed in this blanket of sweet goodness, that when you dip it into the home made jam, something amazing just happens inside of your mouth! awesome! 

Savory! get the northern italian! it has all the right combination of salty and savory with the mushrooms and pancetta enclosed with cheese! it comes out fresh and piping hot! it is just sooo good!

you can't go wrong with a trip to mama's!
