fifth star?
wait staff is super nice! thats what the 5th star is for! definitely a good all around restaurant! even fine dining won't get that 5th star if their service is crap!
author: Steph Q.

description: Great crab benedict, and monte christo breakfast.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Food is delicious but not worth waiting in line for 90 minutes. Got there on a Saturday morning 45 minutes before the place opened, and already a long line outside. I am a San Francisco native who wanted to experience Mama's for the first time. I would say that perhaps 50% of people waiting in line are tourists. This place most likely is listed in their tourist brochures. Dont get me wrong. The food is Okay but there are plenty of other restaurants in the City just as good without having to wait. Wont be going back Thanks.
PS: Our server was very good and got a 40% tip.
author: D. W.

description:
Mama's is definitely one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. Judging by the huge line going around the corner every day of the week I'm guessing the word is out. I went at around 10am on a Thursday and found myself about 10 deep in a line of eager diners waiting to get their breakfast on. In addition to breakfast Mama's also serves lunch as well as baked goods. In terms of breakfast, they have all the classics but their claim to fame is their french toast. The way it works here is you wait in line to order and pay, then you're seated and it's pretty much a regular procedure after that.
 
Personally I love french toast but never order it when I go out because I know nothing will ever to compare to my mom's french toast which she makes with homemade cinnamon raisin bread, thickly sliced of course. Mama's has a number of different types of french toast, not all are available everyday due to limited availability but that's one reason to keep coming back. If you're like me and can't decide on what type of french toast to get you can get the variety plate that comes with a thick slice of 3 varieties. The morning I went this included a banana nut bread topped with fresh bananas, a cinnamon, and a lemon berry topped with fresh berries. Each table also has a jar of homemade berry preserves that the waiter suggested I try with the french toast (very good call). I can say with no hesitations that those three pieces of french toast were the best I've ever had. I can't go into detail more than to say that it filled me up, was worth every penny (the prices here are reasonable but not dirt cheap), and that it was nothing less than perfect. Their fresh squeezed orange juice and friendly service really just put them over the top. They don't take credit cards but do take debit cards which saved my ass because there aren't any ATMs on premises or on the block from what I could see. Hands down Mama's is definitely one of the best breakfasts in town.
author: Matt E.

description:
Fantastic breakfast!  I took a walk from Union Square for this one (only about 25 minutes) through China Town.  It was a great experience.  There was about a ten minute wait, so not bad at all.  Got to look at the park nearby & Coit Tower around the corner while I waited.

I had the Classic Benedict and a freshly squeezed orange juice.  It was absolutely fantastic.  The orange juice was the best I've EVER had.  Such a cute little place & really nice employees.  It is definitely worth the trip & I would go again a million times if I could!
author: Sam G.

description:
So you wait... and wait... and wait for the door to open and and allow you to enjoy one amazing meal!!!  My sister, friend, and myself fell in love with this little place.  We are a 6hr drive away but can't wait to go back!
I came here 30mins before the cafe opened and there was already a long line formed. When you walk in you are greeted with beautiful and delicious fresh bread displays, the atmosphere is really warm and cozy.  
The service is fantastic, everyone seems to be in a good mood, and happy to help!  Who wouldn't around all the wonderful smells of fresh breakfast!
The montecristo is truly super.  The eggs benedict are PERFECT.  The chocolate french toast is deliciously topped with fresh raspberries, strawberries, bannana slices and a unique o-lolliberry jam.
I am a coffee addict, and I must say that the coffee isn't the best I have had, but everything is makes up for it and I don't dare give a star less.
So good... I came to breakfast here 2x on my 2 day stay in SF. =)
author: Adriana R.

description: Definitely NOT worth the wait. We had french toast, egg benedict and crumble cake. They were decent but not worth the standing out in the cold for 40 minutes wait. The best part of our meal was the homemade jam, which I was told can only be purchased online.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The monte cristo.  The BOMB! Be prepared for especially long waits, and bring cash/debit card with you.  I can imagine everything on the menu is delicious. First time I came here with a friend and it was quite amazing, the second time was just as  great!  Worth the wait!
author: Don C.

description: Came here last weekend with some friends. Arrived around 9 am. (The parking is horrible here btw.) And the wait was 2 hours. I got the Swedish French toast. My husband got the blueberry pancakes, our friends got the crab omelette and monte cristo. Eh....we all agreed it was not worth the wait and the food was the same as ihop. Might go there instead next time.
author: Rosie L.

description:
I finally tried the famous Mama's for breakfast. I'm glad I did but I doubt I'll be back because this place is just so overhyped! I will not wait in line for 1-2 hours. It's just not going to happen. If you can come on weekday mornings, please do it. I arrived around 9:30am on a Wednesday and still had to wait (though it was only about 15 minutes). 

Bring cash. There is a charge to use your debit card and credit cards are not accepted. You order first, wait to be directed to an available table and the food comes to you. My bf and I had: 

Shrimp and Avocado Eggs Benedict - This was one of the specials of the day. The hollandaise sauce had way too much lemon juice. It was so sour! It ruined the rest of the dish for sure. The shrimp was also pretty small and the avocado, mushy. The eggs were poached nicely though. 

French Toast Sampler - I was very excited to try their different house baked breads french toast style but one bite later I realized I like the traditional french toast made with white bread. The heavy blueberry, cranberry and orange breads were overpowering. It was basically eating breakfast bread and not the fluffy soft french toast that I know and love. 

Maybe I ordered the wrong things or maybe Mama's just isn't that great. I know a few breakfast places that I would rather go to any day. No hard feelings!
author: Julia T.

description:
S good, me and the boyfriend go there every other week! i get the Scramble Florentine Omlette! yumm with fruit on the side yumm! and fresh orange juice yummy!!!

Gotta try it!!!

p.s worth the wait
author: TRINA T.

description: Hands down the best brunch I've had in San Francisco. We had the North Beach Benedict, Monte Cristo and Chocolate Coffee Cake.  Everything was perfect. The wait was an hour and forty five minutes, but truly worth it. I loved the energy in Mama's - the staff were so warm and welcoming. You have to try it!
author: Jacqueline G.

description: Dont turn away because of the long line.  The line actually moves fast.  You pay at the register and someone will seat u.  Side note, they do not take credit cards.  Only debt card and cash.  Just an FYI.  The food is amazing.  The pancakes were so good.  The service was amazing.  Since it was the BF's bday, they gave us a bigger table for the 2 of us.  We first said "no" bc we wanted to give the table to a larger party, but they insisted we sit there, so we did.  I would definitely come here, wait in line, and eat the breakfast again.
author: Mimi S.

description:
WOW!

That was.............THE BEST breakfast I've ever had.

The Northern Italian M'omelette was possibly the best omelette EVER created! I was blown away.

Their French toasts...OMG. I'd seriously never had breakfast this good.

The wait might look super long and intimidating. BUT, it's actually not that bad. The line was really long but we got seated within a half hr. Totally worth the wait.
I'll be dreaming about this place back in the OC for sure.
author: Pam K.

description: We waited over an hour to get in the door, but I thought that the food and overall experience was awesome. I also enjoyed seeing yoga in the park right next to Mama's :)
author: Lisa T.

description:
Rated as one of the best places to have breakfast at, so we decided to give it a try.   Famous for their French toast sampler and eggs Benedict, so we had to try them!  Restaurant is located in North Beach on the corner of Filbert and Stockton.  Wait time was about 30 minutes.  We arrived at 10am on a wednesday with two parties ahead of us.  We waited another five minutes to order our food at the register.  One suggestion is to bring cash.  Don't pay with a credit or debit card.  They charge a surcharge.  Instead of paying the cost themselves (the cost of doing business which is a benefit to them), they pass it on to the customer.  The dungeness crab eggs benedict was excellent.  Their hollandaise sauce has a special zing to it.  One plate can definitely serve two people.  The french toast sampler was nothing out of this world.  Each slice of French toast was hard.  The syrup did not even soak into the toast.  It seemed that they served us old slices of toast.  Service was alright.  We had to get up ourselves to get two clean plates to share the french toast since our server wasn't around.
Would I go to this place again?  No.  Not worth it to me.
author: Leslie S.

description:
I came here on a Saturday morning with my two best friends. The food was amazing! I ordered the Monte Cristo. Guess what? It melts in your mouth like a grilled cheese sandwich but BETTER! The homemade jam complemented it very well. I'd just eat the jam if I wasn't so stuffed! xD

The freshly squeezed orange juice was mMmm good in my mouth. My body will thank me for getting my vitamin C! One of my best friends ordered freshly squeezed grapefruit and she said it was pretty good. I'm going to try that next time. :]

I thought the wait was a bit too long...it took us 1 hr. and 23 min. to enter the restaurant to order our foods. Then it took some more time to wait for the table to be cleared. Next time, I'm going to be smart and avoid coming during rush hours! (maybe around 2pm...)

Side note: the potatoes that came with my dish were too burnt for my liking. It was literally black.
author: Forest T.

description:
Food was excellent, we had the famous monte Cristo, which was excellent, the Dungeness crab benedict, also amazing, a salmon omlette and the french Toast, both of which were above average. 

We also waited 2 and a half hours for brunch. 

Mama's, do it once to say you did and then never again.
author: Michael K.

description: Waited about an hour on Friday brunch. To justify the wait we had to invite a friend and he was able to get their just when we got to the front of the line. I myself ordered three dishes because I wanted to try as much as I could because I knew the man friend wouldn't want to stand in line again for a very long time. Lol. I ordered the crab eggs Benedict, monte cristo sandwich, the toast sampler, chocolate crumb cake, and mango smoothie. I loved the crab Benedict. Mouthwateringly good. Monte cristo wasn't what I was expecting. I'm used to a greasy clog your arteries sandwich. And this wasn't my ideal. The toast sampler was good. I could pass on the mango smoothie as it was bland and chocolate crumb cake was ok. Staff was really friendly.
author: Glessie C.

description:
Oh Mama. The two big questions here are "is it good?" and "is it worth the wait". It is no doubt good, we'll get into the details in just a bit. As for the wait, we got there with a party of four at 9:20am on a Friday. Life is much easier with a party of two or less. The wait to get from the the back of the line, order food, and seat at a table took a total of an hour and a half so we ending up eating at 11am. If your entire party isn't there, you have to wait outside and other people after you get to pass you. Fair enough.

While I ordered, I asked the cashier which she would recommend, the special shrimp or eggs benedict. As this is my first time here, I wanted to try what they were famous for which was the eggs benedict but she gave me a clear answer that the SHRIMP BENEDICT was better. Slightly more expensive $11.95 vs $9.95. My friend got the Monte Cristo despite it being before "Lunch" 11am availability (Lucky us!). My other friend got the smoked salmon benedict. Service was quick and often. EVERYTHING was delicious. The Shrimps scattered around the egg benedicts was alright. I could've done without it. The Monte Cristo was delicious as expected, and the smoked salmon benedict was plenty more worth it than the shirmp. What's also amazing is the great variety in the menu to fit into any person's diet. I feel like this is a place that you can try on the occasion but I don't think the wait was worth it. Perhaps the wait is shorter on Mon. thru Thurs.; it didn't help that I went on Cesar Chavez day which is sort of a holiday.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Whenever I have friends/ family visiting SF, I always bring them to Mama's. There is always, and I mean ALWAYS a line so expect there to be a long wait. I assure you, it's worth it. The place itself is quite small and the seating is limited, but it has a very cozy and relaxed atmosphere. That being said, I've never felt like I needed to rush through my meal to make room for the crowd outside waiting to be seated. The servers are always polite and I've always had a good dining experience there.

Now about the food. There are so many things to choose from on the menu, so even though I've been here many times, I always have something new to try. One of their most popular dishes has got to be the Monte Cristo. They are triangular pieces of bread stuffed with ham, cheese, and turkey, battered in egg, grilled, and served with homemade jam. It's absolutely delicious!

If you're in the mood for something sweet, their french toasts are a great option. They really are very tasty (writing this review is making me crave for them right now)! If it's your first time here, I suggest you try their french toast sampler. This typically includes banana nut, cranberry orange walnut, and Swedish cinnamon french toast, but it depends on what breads they have available that day. The french toast is topped with a generous amount of fresh fruits and dusted off with powdered sugar. It's perfection on a plate.

Their eggs benedicts are delicious as well. They have a dungeness crab benedict on their specialty menu and what I love about it is that they don't skimp on the crab. It's a bit more pricey than the other dishes but you do get what you pay for. I've also tried the Paisano benedict, which has pancetta and grilled peppers in it. Delicious. 

Bottom line: There is always a long line but it really is worth the wait. Mama's is definitely a great place to have brunch - the choices are endless and there is always something for everyone so go and try it at least once!
author: Kristine C.

description:
It is very Rare that my husband and I go here since we have a full household these days. But when we do get the chance to go, Mama's ALWAYS delievers! Always worth the wait. Food is amazing! Can't beat the freshness of everything they put on your plate.

We love Mama's...
author: Michelle B.

description:
Came here when a friend suggested this place. I grew up in SF, but never new about this place. The food was good, but waiting for 2 hours was not fun. Their mimosa was yummy too. It get me happy pretty fast ;]

I would suggest to try it if there isn't that long of a wait. I would come to eat here again if I knew I didn't have to wait too long.

But it's also nice because it's right by Coit Tower. So after breakfast you can take a nice stroll around the area.
author: Chris K.

description:
Hands down one of the best breakfasts in San Fran!

Get the Monte Cristo - it is just incredible! 

The homemade orange-cranberry loaf is also a great treat; so fresh it is still warm when they serve it to you. 

Tip: Lines are long all the time but take out takes 5-10 min on a busy day (1hr+ line). Why not get take out and picnic across the street at Washington Square?

Highly recommended I will be back there again
author: Chris S.

description: One of the best brunch in SF. We ordered pancakes, veggie egg Benedict and carb omelette- tasty. Bloody Mary and grapefruit mimosa are amazing!
author: Sharika S.

description:
As an avid yelper and foodie, I was really excited to go to Mama's after all the rave reviews.  

However, I was pretty disappointed by my visit yesterday.

First of all, we had to wait in line outside for nearly an hour (prob around 50 minutes) just to get inside, where we had to wait in another line to order food, and then after we ordered food, we waited another 10 minutes to get seated.  And then we had to wait another 20 minutes to get our food.  Basically, we got there around 1:30 or 1:40, and didn't get our food until around 3:00PM.

I would consider myself a really patient person.  I don't mind waiting.  But this was so not worth it.

I ordered the Eggs Benedict with a side of bacon.  The bacon was pretty good.  The eggs benedict was just a huge disappointment.  The hollandaise sauce was bland and sour.  I know there's lemon in it, but it should be a hint of lemon.  Ugh, not good at all.  The potatoes were average.  Nothing spectacular about them.

My boyfriend got the Californian omelet (bacon, avocado, jack cheese).  It was a pretty good omelet.  The eggs were fluffy, the bacon was crispy, and the avocado was just the right amount of ripeness.  It was good.  I also had a bite of his french bread with jam.  That was really good.

My roommate got the Monte Cristo.  It was actually really good.  I would say it's probably the best thing I tasted out of our three orders.  It's weird that you eat this sandwich with jam, but for some reason, it's really good.

Anyway,  I'll probably come here again, and order something else next time. 

3 stars for now, because the food was not good enough to justify the wait.  And also, why can't they just take names?  Then instead of standing around waiting in line, we can put our name down, go browse around at shops nearby, and then go back when they're ready to seat us.

This might be good or bad: we were full for the rest of the day.  For dinner that night, I had a few slices of mango around 10PM.  Thus, the portions were pretty generous.

I'm still searching for a great brunch spot in SF that is on par with La Note in Berkeley.  This was totally not.
author: Grace C.

description:
Came to SF with my significant other last month.  Spent 4 days playing tourist and eating great meals.  I love breakfast and have long been a fan of Dottie's and Brenda's, and when I don't want to stand in line, Lori's Diner for their corned beef hash.  I had not tried Mama's before this trip.  Mama's was far and away the best of the bunch!  Is it worth getting up early to stand in line?  You betcha!  My significant other and I bussed from Union Square and walked to Mama's to be the third in line before it opened.  When we got in, we were warmly greeted.  He chose the crabmeat benedict; I chose the shrimp and avocado omelet (I wanted the benedict too, but we like to try different things).  

Mama's is charmingly decorated and sits at the corner of Washington Square.  After we stood in line to place our orders and pay, we seated ourselves and were served steaming mugs of good, strong coffee--just the thing to melt the chill off waiting outside.  As we sat waiting for our breakfasts, the line outside grew longer and longer.  Our coffee was refilled many times--never had to ask.

When the breakfasts arrived, we dug in.  OMG!  My omelet was perfect--fluffy, tasty and filled with the right amount of shrimp, avocado and cheese.  It was generously filled, but not overstuffed  so that the omelet surrounding the goodies inside remained intact.  Yum!  As good as mine was, I had to admit that my companion had the dish of the day.  The crabmeat benedict had generous amounts of dungeness crab over the English muffins with perfectly cooked poached eggs and delectable hollandaise.  My companion knows his seafood (24 years as an owner of a wholesale seafood business and a fisherman for all his life) and he declared that the dungeness crab was amazing.  He was convinced it was not the canned stuff, but fresh.  Pricey?  A bit, but worth every penny.

Can't wait to return to SF and eat here again...Next time I want to try their delectable looking French toast or other baked goods...
author: CJ C.

description:
My very kind cousins took me out for breakfast as I have never been to Mama's.  I was a clueless virgin.
In my three years in the Bay area, having loved North Beach and walked around here on prior visits so many times, looking straight at the green awning next to the Park one would think that the amazing vibes from Mama's would have zeroed in on me but no....  Until this morning.
We aimed for the first tranche of people to get into the restaurant.
People are in line from 7am for the 8am opening.
Staff go in, cooking begins, and the waiting fans are drooling on the sidewalk, especially if they have to describe the specials, the omelets with crab or mushrooms, and the amazing French toast to newcomers.
We met a couple of tourists from Tennessee who were delightful so we had the conversation to keep our minds on their visit and off the fact that we were so excited!
There was a tense moment when the door was closed in front of us, but since my cousins know the staff by name and they were confident about this regulatory process, (people are gently urged to the counter where they could pick their heads up, wipe off their chins, and try to make a reasonable choice in minutes, and then be directed to their particular table)...
The door opened, the owner enchanted us with his plea "I make the best pancakes anywhere, please won't you have some?", and then it started.
I had to ask my cousins "Where is the french toast listed?  Where can I find omelets?"  I fell in love with the description of the home baked brioche with dates, almonds and raisins, but then saw the pancakes and fresh berries, laid my eyes on the coffee cake with strawberry and rhubarb, smelled the coffee, observed the lightness and size of the omelets.
Do you remember the first time you brought home a bag of Halloween candy and spilled it on the floor?  What to try first.
And so we ordered.  The staff never make you feel rushed.  They are competent, fun, kind, and probably already ate before we got in there, so their blood sugars seemed to keep them steady and smiling.
I had the pancakes with fresh berries, tried some fresh fruit, some potatoes, and saw my cousins enjoy chocolate syrup banana french toast and pancakes.  They already knew the crab omelet is a favorite of my cousin, their brother, so I have to try that another time.
The pancakes were light, presentation was beautiful.
Coffee and juice rounded out a perfect breakfast.
Cyrus our waiter could spot a newbie in a New York Minute so he of course tried to tell me my coffee was Decaf, and tried to give me a plate, by swooping it under my nose and tempting me just before my order came.  He was good!
The decor is very sweet but frankly, we could have been eating out on the sidewalk for all I knew.  They accept only cash and debit cards. No credit cards. It is tight inside, so wheelchairs may be possible but it is not easy.  Narrow older house not originally designed for barrier free.
Rest room is behind tiny kitchen, downstairs, and not easy.
For a trip from Oakland at 7am to SF for breakfast this is a great institution and well worth every moment.
Mama's.  All you need to know.  I did ask them to leave me right there.....
author: Ellen O.

description:
So.. uh.. I just woke up after having a huge and delicious breakfast at Mama's. No joke. It's 12:26 in the afternoon on a Sunday following Day Light Savings which means we woke up HELLA early to get to Mama's. 

And MAN was it worth it! HANDS DOWN the BEST breakfast I've had in SF. All the 5 star reviews are so true... so so true! Mama's completely exceeded all my expectations!

My Washington Square M'Omelette was HUGE and so gooood. With Italian sausage, roasted bell peppers and tomatoes (and I added in onions which also came roasted). Ohhhhh... the flavors melded so well together! And the house potatoes - OH! Crispy and moist and UGHhhh.. SO HAPPY to be there! Also had a piece of my friend's baguette that came with her meal and it was basically the best baguette I've ever had. Crispy, buttery, and awesome with my M'Omelette!

The precursor to this amazing meal - the blueberry crumb cake. OMGAAHHHH. Tina Y. ordered it first after reading Yelp reviews and when it came out... it was over in a matter of minutes. Sweet but not too sweet and warm... DAMN! I got another one to share with my friends but basically ended up eating it all myself. Wow. And that one happened to come right out of the oven because it was steaming hot! And was devoured in a matter of seconds. Literally. 

The service was excellent. The waiters were attentive, accommodating, and helpful. They made sure our beverages were full, even ordered extra food items for us without us having to get back in line (awesome! and thank you!), and gave Tina Y. and my friends to-go containers to bring some extra homemade jam home! Those guys were SO AWESOME! Made our experience at Mama's THAT much more memorable and wonderful. 

I just couldn't believe how cheerful everyone was even at that hour of the morning. The guy at the counter, the waiters, the kitchen staff in the back by where we sat, the customers, the people outside, the people in the park. It was just an incredible morning. 

This proves that Mama's is the best. With food. With service. With filling your tummy and making sure you have a great time! 

Some words of advice:
*Wake up early and get in line before 8am.
*Don't eat a big dinner the night before. Heck, DON'T eat dinner the night before - it'll make your meal that much better.
*Study the menu before you go in because everything looks good and you're going to be overwhelmed! The regular menu plus the weekend-only specials are posted in the window. (I had such a difficult time trying to decide what to get but in the end made the perfect choice!)
*Buy some baked goods to take home because you'll regret it if you don't (I DO!)

I think I'm gonna be full for a while!
author: Christine C.

description: Amazing. I've never seafood be a part of breakfast before. We had the crab benedict, shrimp benedict, apple crumble cake---no photo evidence due to the scarfing it all down. Also the spiked lemonade and grapefruit mimosas got me really excited.
author: Desiree R.

description: we got there just at the right time.  As soon as we got seated, the line started forming outside.  food speaks for itself, and the staff is very friendly, PARKING IS NOT.  :(
author: Mike S.

description:
I can certainly see why there's always a line running down the block at breakfast time.  Totally worth the wait!

The large variety of fresh baked breads and cakes tempt you while waiting in the final stretch of the line.  This is so cruel, but a great marketing technique because you WILL over order when you get to the register.  We went with the french toast made with fat free apple yogurt cinnamon bread, egg white scramble, and a side of carrot cake (appetizer!).  First off, the carrot cake is fab.  Large chunks of carrot and walnut along with the best cream cheese frosting ever (not too sweet and extra creamy).  The egg scramble was good and obviously made with fresh veggies, but nothing spectacular.  The french toast on the other hand was amazing.  The thick cut house made bread and table jam to top each piece made the plate.  Yum!  

I was blown away by how nice the staff was.  They kept our drinks full and never hurried us, even though the line was strung down the street.  You feel like family except for the fact that my Mama can't cook breakfast like that.
author: Tripp W.

description:
DAMN!  Monte Cristo - oh my...  slather that baby with the jam it comes with.  Salty sweet savory heaven.  These Yelpers are not exaggerating on this one.  Five stars for this delightful dish.  This sandwich is like none other.

The french toast sampler is pretty good but not as good as the french toast at the Bellagio cafe in Vegas (behind the indoor garden).  Four stars for the French toast.

Service was fabulous -- was offered refills whenever my coffee was at half cup -- three times. 

Will be back after at least 5 spinning classes so that I can do the Monte again.
author: Liz K.

description: Easily the best breakfast I have ever had in my life. Well worth the hour wait in the sun. Fresh ingredients, great daily specials, cute interior and chill atmosphere.
author: Rachel C.

description:
1.5 hour wait on a Tuesday afternoon. Was worth it though. The portions were great and I barely finished. I came with a friend and we both left the place with a food coma. I tried the Northern Italian Omelette while my friend had the Classic Benedict. My dish was perfect, though it looked like my friend had trouble cutting through the bread under the Benedict with his knife. 

The service is awesome. The workers are extremely friendly. They came to check on our table occasionally, which is good because I wouldn't like it if someone constantly stopped by while I ate.
author: Karen L.

description: Hate the long lines, but love the monte cristo and the omelettes.
author: Ro B.

description:
The food is really good.  Really good.  Five-star good.  Definitely five-star good.

I'm dinging Mama's a star, though, because of the line.  Now, all of my fans should be furiously typing, "But, John S., you gave the Pork Store five stars, and there's always a line for that place, and it's on Haight Street!" but fear not, stalkers, I have a good reason for my apparent reviewing unevenness.

As my furiously typing fans have made clear, I don't automatically drop stars for having to wait in line, but the line at Mama's is kind of tricky.  It hugs the eastern wall of the restaurant, so in addition to waiting in line, you can also clearly see everyone inside already enjoying their breakfasts.  When you get to the Dutch door, you think you're that much closer to paydirt, and when the greeter guy unlatches the bottom half of the door for you, you're ready to go inside and . . .

wait some more.  See, the line continues inside.  Distance-wise, it's much shorter inside than outside, but it also moves more slowly.  By the time you get to the register--and that's the second deception; you're ordering at a register--you really know what you want.  They try to make you feel better by having you wait right in front of where the cooks are cooking, but this just makes you hungrier.

Once you've made your order and paid (it's cash only), you wait again, this time for the cashier to tell you when a table is open.

I actually like how you don't get to choose where you sit, and honestly, the whole waiting-in-line process isn't so bad.  But I definitely wouldn't stand in the rain for this place.  OK, maybe I wouldn't stand in the rain for any place, but I would stand (and have stood) in the fog for the Pork Store, and I don't know whether I would do the same for Mama's.

Oh, and once you're seated, there is honest-to-goodness waiter service, and it's decent.
author: John S.

description:
After a hard night of drinking, partying and just plain having fun, Mama's on a Sunday morning really hit the spot. Yes, I was doing the walk of shame in the clothes I wore the previous night, but my peeps in North Beach don't judge. The wait outside is another story. I'm hungover. Tired, Dehydrated. Dizzy. Nauseous. Faint. Hungry. And I waited in that line for over an hour. At one point I just sat down on the hard concrete. Ok, Mama, wherever you are. Why??? 

The food was perfection. THE BEST eggs benedict I've ever had. The eggs were poached perfectly. The Hollandaise sauce was the most flavorful I've ever had. My friend had the Monte Cristo. OMG, almost better than sex. And I like sex. And the homemade jam on that Monte Cristo? We took it home. And don't get me started on the mimosas. But the line. Making people stand outside in a line, with no seats, just concrete? Its just not San Franciscan -like. Put some tables outside, re-arrange the place, something! I love the food, but having to wait in the line for more than an hour is just plain nuts. I understand you have a prime location. But put some benches outside and call peoples names or something. Please?
author: Stephanie W.

description: Yeah, the wait sucks, but the quality of the food is always spot on. Very consistent. The staff are very efficient and good at what they do. The eggs benedict are always perfect! And do try the Apple Pan Dore - the lemon butter sauce is to die!
author: The A.

description:
If you can somehow put up with an hour's wait out on the sidewalk, then you'll be in a for a treat.
Located on Filbert and Stockton, this place could easily be a 5 star if it wasn't for the wait.  My wife and I spent a week in San Francisco, and ventured to Mama's on a Thursday for brunch.  I had the Banana Nut French Toast and my wife had Nelson's Rancheros.  Everything was wonderful, the staff was very courteous.  If I ever come back to San Francisco I would definitely hit this spot again.
That Damn wait though...
Anyway, here are some pics of the place and our wait.

http://tinyurl.com/abvcv3    pw: guavaween


Whoa Mama!
author: Milton P.

description:
Down to two stars due to a rude response from a rude b!atch in the aforementioned review. And based on my review, it's CLEAR that I will NEVER come back, so why would YOU even bother telling me not to come back. 

Idiot.
author: Sandy D.

description:
I'm not sure how I feel about this place.
First off; I visited San Francisco last year and passed by this restaurant many times but never had a chance to go eat. I finally came back a year later and was determined to try it out. I went with my sister and another friend on a Sunday morning around 11am. We obviously knew there was going to be a line because of the time of the day and week. But once we arrived- the line was bigger than we expected. 
I don't know if I'm proud to say this but we basically waited 2 hours in line to just get into this miniature restaurant.
And the wait doesn't end there; once you get past the front door- you need to wait in line to order your food at the cash (yes very unusual- they make you order your food before you get seated). So once you order your food- you need to wait to be seated- once your seated- then you need to wait for your food to arrive.
So we basically took 4 hours of our time for Mama's.
Now; the food.... the food; i hate to admit it; but it was amazing. We all ordered the eggs Benedict  and we were speechless how good it was.
However- my sister found a hair in her plate which she told our waitress- the waitress didn;t even apologize- just gave her a new one ( another wait there). I found that to be rude
In the end; we were satisfied with our breakfast- but I was upset that we wasted 4 hours at Mama's with all the waiting.
I think the food was worth it, but worth my time? I don't think so.
If you have plenty of time on your hands- check it out- but prepared to wait....and wait....and wait. ( We actually went to a bakery while we waited 2 hours in line and ate pastries- then even had time to digest that and be hungry for "brunch")
oh and did I mention you need to wait for the bathroom too? No surprise there
author: Vicki G.

description:
Beyond a doubt, my favorite place for breakfast in the city. I've converted several people over the years into waiting so long in line for the best food ever. 

But really, the reason why I get up after a huge night out with a hang over and stand in line for over an hour in the wind is strictly for the Monte Cristo. It like food of dreams, with a homemade Bosenberry jam for dipping that makes you want to swoon.  I must say that if you come here to order traditonal breakfast, you're wasting your time. Go for the more interesting options! They do have very tasty Benedicts, pancakes and wonderful Old Fashioned Crumb Bread, but I've never ordered anything other than the Monte Cristo since my first time with it. 

And forget all you lame-o people that didn't give it five stars. You wouldn't know a great eggs benedict if it hit you.
author: Alita M.

description: We got a Monte Cristo, Swedish Cinnamon French Toast, and Northern Italian Omelet. Personal favorite was the omelet, but monte cristo was unique as well. French toast didn't blow me away, but worth a try.
author: Gianni C.

description:
11.30 am on a Sunday. 

The wait begins. 

12.02pm. I feel like taking a shit because the boba tea from that Asian store gave me the runs. I get in line to use the bathroom and i thought it was a set from 'little house on the prairie'. NOT FUN. 

12.46PM. I feel like taking another run for the bathroom. This time theres a longer line. An old man comes out of the bathroom and he burped and adjusted his pants. FML... I'm next. 

1.12pm. I'm thinking... WTF???? MAMA'S BETTER BE GOOD!!!!!! 

1.25pm.- "ITS BEEN 2 HOURS!!!!!!!!!!!! AN I'M STILL WAITING IN LINE LIKE A F-ING FATASS TRYING TO EAT BRUNCH' 

1.32PM.... The door.... slowly.... opens and the server lets us in. 

Mama's felt like a club. My expectations after a 2 hour wait were pretty damn high. I was expecting Jesus to bring my food and sprinkle it with his blessing. 

I ordered the french toast with the berries and it was pretty good, but... after a 2 hour wait, it just didnt meet my expectations. The service was great and so was the blueberry pastry we got for free after waiting 2 hours.
author: Aidan V.

description:
I was craving a Monte Cristo sandwich and searched for the term on Yelp and discovered that Mama's had this on their menu. 

So I went. 

It was perfection. I had no problem waiting outside for 20 minutes on a Tuesday afternoon. So 5 stars for the sandwich and perfect homemade jam to go along with it. Less one star for the fact that they don't take credit cards (but they do take debit cards which I luckily had on me).
author: Jen N.

description: this place deserves 6 stars.. it NEVER disappoints!! every time i visit sf, i am always waiting in line to eat here & i do not mind at all! because i know the food is great & comes out always fresh & hot off the grill! the service there is excellent; you really do feel like you're visiting your mama's home & everyone's family. i've waited for at least two hours here before & it is always worth the wait. i've dined here and have ordered two plates of the salmon benedict for myself in one sitting. that's how much i love it. HAHAH. the homemade jam is sooooo good too. i'm drooling. i miss you mama's!!!
author: Aubrey J.

description:
I'm re-rating this place since over the year i visited and experienced more different brunch places in the city.

I am not willing to wait 1hr and half for brunch anymore. Food is good but not the best of the best. Price is a little pricey for regular home style brunch.

I've discover better brunch places with no wait within the city. Yelp more.
author: Jannifer H.

description:
I wonder how I gained an extra size in SF and I blame it ALL on Mamas.  Swedish Cinnamon French toast?  Yes please.  Add on some prosciutto & tomato eggs benedict and some coffee and I'm one bloated, I hate myself for letting myself eat, rolly polly glutton.

I'm committing carb-a-cide to myself, one bite at a time.

But my god, it's so good.  

SUPER TIP:
Best to go at around 2-3PM on Tuesday.  NO LINE WHATSOEVER.
author: Jae H.

description:
Whoa Mama's! I just got home from eating brunch here and i can't stop thinking about how good it was. For a Friday, I thought this place was incredibly busy; but then, I've never been here before so I'm not sure if they're ever not busy. The line was out the door and it took us about 45-50 minutes just to get inside! And not only was there a long wait outside, we were finally welcomed inside (by the "gatekeeper") and had to wait an additional 20 minutes until we could finally order. 

It's a unique setup where you wait in line inside, you figure out what you want to order from the menu that's posted up on the wall. They have great selections for breakfast, brunch and lunch. 

Must Try: (basically everything we ordered)
Hot Chocolate -- great sized portion, topped with whipped cream and cocoa powder.
Buttermilk Pancakes -- I had mine with fresh berries (strawberries and blueberries), powdered sugar, butter and maple syrup.
Blueberry Sour Cream cake -- took a square of this to-go. Needed some sugar for class later this afternoon (like I didn't have enough with the pancakes).
Side of Bacon -- it's bacon. That's all I need to say.
Nelson's Rancheros -- their version of "huevos rancheros." John S. ate them in literally 5 minutes and they were gone before I could even know what was happening. The eggs were poached though, and not fried like they usually are. I guess this serves as a "healthier alternative."

Wait staff were all very friendly, smiling constantly and communicative, which can make a wait go by smoother. Mama's will make you wait, but trust me it's worth it!!

Total: $45.33 for 3 people + tip

TIP: CASH ONLY!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
This place is way overrated. The food is ok, it's nothing special. I thought it would be something like WOW factor but it's nothing better than Denny's. 
The whole wait system is so wrong.
author: Boris J.

description:
So not worth the 2.5 hour wait. After two years of living in SF, I finally decided it was time to go since my sister was in town. I was antsy waiting. So happy to get to the front of the line, until we realized there was a SECOND line inside to order & pay before sitting down. Ugh! Testing my patience here and ability to stand up for that long and not get bratty about it. 

So my sister and I took it as our chance to order everything we possibly could. Banana nut bread, monte cristo sandwich, silver dollar pancakes, lobster benedict. Everything was good but nothing warrants a 2.5 hour wait for breakfast food when you get in line at 10am and don't eat until 1pm. 

Checked off the SF bucket list. Done and some, but never again.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
This is the most famous breakfast place in the city.
I don't know how many times my gf and I walked by here and seeing the ridiculously enormous line and we both go "sigh...."  
And she said, " I don't wait in line for eggs."

I don't think breakfast shouldn't be scheduled.
Breakfast should be spontaneously.
I am not a diplomat or anything, I have no meeting to discuss issues, I have no conference phone calls, I have no formal meetings. I don't talk about business, I am not interested in stock market, i don't read Daily Pacific Builder.

Breakfast is "sexy". 
I think most happy couple having a breakfast together.
I think people don't break up during breakfast.
I think people having a breakfast together because they are happy together.

I think people break-up at lunch time more often.
I think I have seen more arguments between people during having dinner.

I can tell the difference of "did" or "didn't" when I see a couple having a breakfast. The couple "did" the night, usually the female is jumpy and the male is jerky, the couple "didn't", both jerky.

Well,
I got a phone call from my son last Friday. He is here for X'mas break.
"Hey dad, I'll be off to NY tomorrow night. Can we have a brunch at Mama's? Have you been there yet?"

I said, "Brunch at Mama's? Are you FXXXin' kidding me? That's the mission impossible! The line is too long especially weekend. Forget it, ain't happen."

My son said, "Really? That bad? I have been thinking the place for a long time. sigh...."

I said, "Well, we could go there for early like 1st thing in the morning."

He said, "They open 8 am."

I said, " Can you?"

He said, "I am up for that."

So, I went Mama's.
We got there 8:20 am on Saturday morning.
The line was about ....... 12 people front of us.
We waited about 15 minutes, it wasn't too bad.
There was a line inside for order, the menu is big but it's easy to read on the wall. 
You can see the small kitchen right there over the counter with a lot of breakfast pastries.
It was exciting!
I felt like I was in the wonderland.
The menu on the wall is nicely written, fun to lookin' at and it looks like coloring book typo made me stoned. I felt like I was in a miniature golf club house or Wonka's chocolate factory.
Or, Walrus and the carpenter's Oyster bar.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6fs5G1U3yy4&feature=related

I always wondered why the kitchen is that big.

I think I saw a chef looks like Humpty Dumpty wear chef hat.

I was almost missed the special menu right behind the casher.

I had a dungeness crab, leak and cheddar cheese omelet, $18.50
My son had the Washington square omelet, Italian sausage, Tomato, bepp pepper, hot pepper and jack cheese, $10.25

The dinning experience wasn't like mad tea party that I was expecting.
The service was really good. The waitress was so nice, kept checking us for water and coffee. She even remembered that we drink water with no ice.  
The food was ........ WE LOVED IT!
The omelet was really nicely fluffy.
Glad we came.
Worth wait.
I'd love to comin' back here again.

If the Alice come here.
I bet you she'll say, "This is the excellent breakfast I've ever had to all my life."
But, she might say, 'This is a stupid door that hard to close."
Hey Mama, Can you fix the front door?

P.S.,
I got a message from a guy name Mike S sayin' :
" lol great review, just fyi, tuesday-thursday the wait usually never gets beyond 15 0r 20 minutes, and yes we did fix the door the past monday!"

Thank you Mike S. fix the door! I was sitting right by the door and we saw people were having hard time closing it.
author: Nobu K.

description:
ALL OF YOU OUT OF TOWNERS:

1. It is worth the mother effin' wait. Trust me.
2. It is worth the wait if you get the French Toast, the Monte Cristo, or the Eggs Benedict.
3. You will love the service and will tip accordingly. How the waiters, busboys, and cashiers can all be so gracious despite hundreds of grumpy customers is beyond me.

I love you Mama's. You started off my SF vacation right, and whenever I dream of poached eggs, I dream of you. Oh, and whenever I'm craving a perfectly cooked non-soggy Monte Cristo, I also think of you. (This is the first place I've gone to that can cook a Monte Cristo without getting the bread all soggy on the inside)
author: Ana F.

description:
A nice breakfast place. Except for the "weird stuff" on their menu, which is to say the unique and particular items that you can only find here, like some of their Eggs Benedict variations, or their bread... things... that I can't remember properly, except for those, everything is just as good as it is at any other short-order breakfast place with competent cooks and fresh ingredients. And most other short-order breakfast places don't make you wait an hour before you can sit down.

But if you want the "weird stuff", you have no other choice!
author: Nick W.

description: Food was very good. I had the omlette with salmon & my wife the french toast sampler. If you can find room, order the cake for desert. Fun place with a very nice staff. The wait was over an hour - even though we got there 1/2 hour before the place even opened! Only waited because we were on vacation and didn't need to be anywhere at a specific time, and people said we "had" to go there. It was something to do once, but probably not again because of the wait.
author: Barry M.

description:
Yo mama said you need to wake up early in the morning and head to 1701 Stockton St! And if there's a line.. just wait! Patiently wait!! 15 mins pass? Just wait!!! 30 mins? It's nothing!!!!.. Trust me. What's waiting for you inside is worth every single second of your waiting time. Worth every single pain that you put on your legs. Worth every single spit that came out of your mouth from chatting it up while waiting in line.

Their egg benedict with whatever you gonna put, choose: crab, salmon, shrimp, plain, mushroom.. is very awesome! The egg melting in your mouth.. along with the cheese. yummmm~ Go order that! NOW!!! Even though the crab egg benedict cost a little bit more than the regular plain one, its fine! It is worth it.

Also, their monte cristo sandwich. Are you kidding me? You put ham cheese turkey egg all together in a cheese bread and you dipped it into a jam.. Explosive taste. Me? I used Tabasco with it. I don't care. It's oh my god so goodddd.

Indifference take-your-order dude (he doesn't really care if you want to eat there or not.. that was his expression toward everybody..). Insane line... But don't mind those.. for the food itself can give this breakfast/brunch place an easy 5 stars. Don't worry.. the waiters are friendly and attentive.
author: Yohann S.

description: I went there on Wednesday, It was about hour and 45 minutes Waite.  We order Omelet, Benedict  and also French toast. They all was OK. Nothing especial about this place. I think it is over Rate. I'll never come back again and I would not recommend to anyone to wait that much for nothing especial.
author: Reza H.

description:
Food was great, but the hour and 15 min wait was not. That's why minus a star.

Ordered the crab benedict and the french bread sampler. Everything was really good, especially liked the home made jam. Yum, yum.

For parking, go to the parking structure on vallejo. The one that's opposite the police station. $5 for 2 hrs and worth not having to drive around aimlessly. And it's a nice 2 block walk from the restaurant.
author: Betty C.

description: Mama's is definitely worth the wait; just make sure you come before or after the typical breakfast times. I personally love the eggs benedict. Their coffee is on the lighter side in terms of bitterness. Overall a great place for breakfast!
author: Phil C.

description: I went back to Mama's recently and I'm afraid it's lost its appeal.  The apple pan dore, was slopped with gooey lemony sugary sauce - and tasted just sugary and buttery. I would sense my arteries clogging while I ate it.  My friend said her crab benedict was nothing special and didn't care for her home fries (though I thought they were pretty tasty).  The food isn't bad - it's just no longer worth the 2 hour wait.   not sure I have the patience or the urge for it anymore.
author: Theresa N.

description: Breakfast was amazing, saw them on tv and had to try them, took my whole family to this place and sure we did like it, is all fresh, had the egg Benedict and it was flavorful.
author: Gerard A.

description:
I went at 2:30pm on a Sunday and thought the line should be long but I was wrong. There were at least 12 ppl ahead of us but we were able to get seated at around 3. In a restaurant this small, the wait wasn't too bad. 
I had French toast sampler but it's just okay. I'd prefer the regular French toast better. I had high expectation on the banana bread French toast but it wasn't as amazing as I thought it'd be. Monte cristo was good. I'll definitely try egg Benedict next time.
author: D C.

description:
I woke up today with a hankerin for a good, hearty breakfast and a cruise around town, I thought why not North Beach.  It's been a while since I've tread those tourist waters.  I initially just wanted to drink some coffee and read the paper at one of those cafe's I've never been to.  Nothing caught my eye, nor the eye of my wallet for that matter.  Then I came across Mama's. I remember seeing this place on "Check Please Bay Area" and it also popped up when I searched best San Francisco Breakfast.  All rave reviews....I can't really agree with those.

I went on a Wed afternoon at 2:00pm.  No wait, not crowded.  (The infamous hour wait nowhere to be seen...apparently its the place to go when its "the place to be seen")

It took longer for the guy in front of me to stop spitting non-sense at the lady behind the counter than it did for my food to come out once ordered.  Kudos!

Great staff, everyone was smiling and not those "Smile cause you have to" smiles either.  They generally looked happy to be there. Rad!

I ordered the Pan Dore,Slices of Sour French Baguette with Sauteed Apples in Lemon Butter Sauce.  I also got a coffee and a side of their Home Fries.  $15 bucks out the door..... exsqueeze me?  Baking powerder? Hello.....

I know this place is popular and a trendy destination on weekends, which is how they get away with this, but the food was not that great.  There was more butter than lemon in the sauce and more butter lemon sauce on the plate than bread.  The apples were just as they were described, sauteed, in butter... should be called "Butter Soaked Plate with a side of  bread and apple.,,
The star of the show were the home fries.  $2.75 for nine pieces of baby red potatoes crisped up on a well seasoned grill. I dug those!
So three stars for that, nice employees and good home fries....
I would recommend this place if you have the money to blow on mediocre breakfast, the time to waste in line on weekends and a love for melted butter, LOTS OF MELTED BUTTER
author: Casey C.

description:
comfortable breeze, beautiful san francisco sun, friendly tourists, couples and families. makes the waiting actually a unique experience. since you can't experience it else where.  make sure you put on your sunglasses, enough water, and a cap to cover yourself from the sun for the ladies. 

watching the fresh food and the cooks cooking was another thing to enjoy. everything  is made fresh and healthy, not greasy, not salty. the environment is super comfortable,  the lighting, the table cloth, the home decoration, it makes you feel starting your day eating breakfast here is pleasant. 

the servers are very friendly and prompt. they give free refilled coffee.  the white bread toast with homemade berry jam is awesome! even though there is long line waiting, the servers never rush you or even give you body languages to rush you, they made you enjoy your meal comfortably as you can. 

eating breakfast at mama's gives you a feeling of happiness - happy to be alive and healthy.  if you are not in a happy mood, come eat at mama's with your loved ones. it gives you courage to move on to life.
author: Kentaro K.

description: Worth the long wait.  Clever seating system lets you watch the cooking in line before you order the food.  Fresh home cooking with a cheery cafe decor.  So very San Francisco.  A must for any visitor to North Beach!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
"We have to get there early because the wait might be an hour" said the boyfriend. I thought-- really?! for breakkfast?! It better be out of this world. Good thing the wait was actually 25 minutes and the food was delish (and extremely filling).

Iced Cafe Latte- I absolutely need my coffee in the morning and since it was a gorgeous, sunny morning in SF I decided on an iced refreshment. It was strong, but not too bitter. I added a dash of Equal and it tasted perfect to me. Delish.

Old fashioned crumb cake- We started off the day with a little something sweet. It looked like the Starbucks crumb cake, but tasted MUCH better! It wasn't as moist as we hoped, but I enjoyed the generous amount of baked crumbs atop the cake. Amazing with my coffee.
  
Blackstone Eggs Benedict- Bacon makes everything damn good. But what really stood out was the hollandaise sauce and its kick of spice. The eggs were nicely poached (my only gripe was that one egg still had a little runny egg white & that grosses me out). Overall, yummy dish and I would order it again if I was really hungry because it was a huge portion!

Monte Cristo- The boyfriend's dish of choice. I was already getting stuffed from my eggs benedict & potatoes, so I only took a bite of the sandwich. It is definitely for the more adventurous heffer and I liked it; the cheese made it delicious to me. 

I will be back to try an omelette or one of the seafood breakfast items!!
author: Janette H.

description:
Mama's was delicious. The wait was definitely worth it for my shrimp benedict- totally gave me a new outlook on Benedicts. I'm still waiting for a Benedict plate to topple the flavors of the one I got at Mama's- but with no success. Mama's has it down.

The only thing dropping the score is the long wait times. Come hungry and come early. If you're bringing a big group, I'm rooting for you but I would suggest only bringing along a few friends. 

Can't wait to go again and try their king crab benedict.
author: Jerome S.

description:
A-freaking-mazing. Despite the 20 minute wait at 8 A.M., the food was satisfying enough to make me forget about my worries.

Like the reviews say..get the Monte Carlo and/or the Dungeness Crab Benedict.

Service could be a little better, but I understand that they are SUPER busy, so I'm not going to ding them on this.
author: Thomas L.

description:
This place would get a 5-star rating if I had only eaten their amazing Prosciutto benedict.  That thing was incredible.  By far the best eggs benedict I've ever tasted.  Unfortunately, I split that and the Kugelhuph with my partner.  The Kugelhuph was boring and bland, how is this regarded as their specialty?  Don't try it.

Don't think about splitting one plate with someone else as the portions are definitely small enough that one person can handle the whole plate.  Thankfully this breakfast place is open during lunch hours as well--4 of us were able to walk right in on a weekday and be seated without waiting.  The place is adorable inside and in a great location.  Good stuff.
author: Sara C.

description:
Well, let me start with their French Toast. Probably the most authentic french toast you can get outside of France.. yeah, I am French. 

I like almost everything there, their cakes, Omelets, fruit plate. 

Two things I don't like are:
1) The long wait --the sun is right into your face while waiting in line.  Specially if you are going on weekend, no matter how early you get there, there is a line. 
2) Also, I think the prices are a little too high....  but I guess it worth every penny and every minute of wait.... 

The place is too small and I wish they get a bigger place near by or buy their neighbor stores.... the demand is really high.
author: Maria H.

description:
I forgot about the Columbus parade when I got re-routed off my bus and ended up walking around and figured I'd jump into Mama's. I got there around 1:30pm and there was a line. I figured this but I was interested and hungry. I think I waited 30 minutes and I must have caught them on an ON day cause I would wait in line again!

Ordered Eggs Benedict and a cup of coffee. The best coffee and the Eggs Benedict was amazing. 

Had to share a booth with another single but plenty of room and a great chat! She had ordered the Huevos Rancheros and a small bowl of just Strawberries and Raspberries. I asked how it was and she boldly stated it was awesome. She also told me that whenever she is in town from Vancouver she has to eat here. 

A rave review and I concur!
author: J D.

description:
Came here for brunch with our friends.  The line was out the door. But, if you've been here before, you know that's nothing new. 

This was our first time here. Our friends, J and D swear they're the best. Finally we were in the restaurant after waiting outside in the chilly weather for about 30 minutes (minus 1 star). 

I got the Crab Benedict, bf ordered the Dungeness Crab Omelette. What I should have gotten was their Monte Cristo. I got a little bite off my friends and it made me regret ordering my Crab Benedict. The sandwich dipped in their jelly is just pure heaven. 

To top it off, guess who sat next to us? Carlos Santana! We even got a picture with him after we were done eating.
author: Cindy W.

description: The food is good. The ambiance is cool. There's just something about waiting in line at 7:20 in the morning that gets you excited about eating at this place!
author: Ryan N.

description:
This morning I had brunch to celebrate my gal pal, Kerri C's birthday.  

A few things to note:
1) There are very few people for whom I'd actually set an alarm clock for on a Sunday morning.

2) There are even fewer people for whom I'd set an alarm clock for, get myself showered and dressed as well as my 3 yr old up and dressed and out the door before 9am for on a Sunday morning to drive into SF.

3)  I NEVER wait in line, voluntarily, for food.  Unless of course there's a natural disaster and every restaurant and grocery store is closed and government relief workers are handing out rice and cans of chili to live on.  But I digress...

Since we were a large party, someone thankfully got there around 9am.   This person was NOT me.  I got there about 9:20am and the line seemed to grow and grow.  The wait was not unpleasant since there were plenty of entertaining ppl/sights across the street in Washington Sq. LOL but that's for another review.  We finally got in around 10am.

My favorite things about Mama's...the fresh squeezed juice, strong, hot, tasty coffee and this incredible homemade jelly!  

I had the french toast with fresh berries and it was delicious.  For my 3yr old, since they don't have a kids menu, they will let you order a half order of something...so he got the 1/2 order of the dollar sized pancakes with strawberries.  It was a hit!  The eggs and potatoes were also perfect!  The food came out quickly, it was hot and fresh and delicious.  One of our party comes here and orders the Eggs Benedict.  In fact, that's all he ever orders from Mama's...he says it's the best ever.  It certainly looked amazing!  

This place would get 5 stars except for the wait and although the waitstaff was attentive, it wasn't exactly the warmest either with one notable exception.  Maybe it was because I was the only person crazy enough to bring a kiddo here...I certainly didn't see any other kids inside or in line waiting.
author: Angela N.

description:
Wow. We heard about this place from a friend while we were in the city. They did warn us about the line and the no credit card policy. It is well worth it.  While wait inning inside in the line (after a half hour outside) I was able to see the amazing food they were making.  This food gets 5 stars with looks alone.  I almost ordered pancakes and French toast as well as the monte cristo. However, you order while still in line and pay when you order.  I like this idea since you already spend that time in line and you don't have to waste time at the table waiting for the check.  I decided in the 'famous monte cristo' and was not disappointed.  It came with a mixed berry jam that the waitress said was "kinda famous."  The cheese inside and combination of jam was amazing. My friends omelet was perfectly cooked as well. 
I also want to say they don't have cooks, they have artists. The entire staff was really nice.
Advice, think if what you want to order before hand or while in line, be prepared to wait in line for a while, and have cash. They do take debit but charge $1 per transaction. There are no drink refills for soda, it's $2 for a can.
author: Brad C.

description: Worth the wait! We arrived just before opening on a Sunday and waited outside for an hour...totally worth it!  The pancakes were perfect, and at the recommendation of the server we put the raspberry preserves on the table onto the pancakes, wow!  I ordered the cheese omelette with white cheddar, havarti and pepper jack cheese and as boring as that could have been, it was the best omelette I have ever had! My husband ordered and omelette and said his was amazing as well! Staff was friendly and the service was quick.
author: Bethie H.

description:
Lovely meal in sf on a beautiful day.  The staff was so friendly, even at the end of the day, the first day after daylight savings. 

The jam is amazing, the apple juice was yum, and I'm still wishing I had ordered one if those good looking smoothies.  The veggie omelet was delish as well. And, the wait was not bad at all, nothing more than I expected. 

Great meal
author: L F.

description: Bring cash. Wait in line. Go inside. Order. Eat. Die happy.
author: Nicholas C.

description: First they make you wait and then they make you watch as they make the food for everyone else when you get inside! lol!. Waited 1.5 hrs, food was good. I probably wouldn't wait that long again the second time around but would for sure eat back there again.
author: Jessie H.

description:
Excellent service. Long lines but definitely worth the wait. Highly recommend the Washinton Square Omelete (I think that is what it is called). They food was reasonably priced with huge portions and a variety of coffees. Arrive early though to beat the crowds that start lining up before the door even opens.

Omeltes, french toast, seafood breakfast entrees, fresh baked breads, ect all available. Service was outstanding.
author: Pierce B.

description:
This is a typical American style breakfast, and I was surprised that so many people waited in line to eat here!

They are closed on Mondays. So we returned on Tuesday morning and found a big line in front of it. After you are called inside, you then stay in line to order your food and pay for it at the cashier. This was a good system to keep everything moving.

We ordered breakfast 1) ham/eggs/potatoes; 2)lox with bagels 3) french toast with fresh fruits. The ham was actually not a whole piece of meat. It was like spam, which was cheaper. The smoked salmon and french toasts were good and filling, but nothing out of ordinary. 

So overall food was OK, a little better than average, and if you don't mind the wait, it's worth a try.

Coit Tower was just up the road by car maybe 5 minutes.
author: koge v.

description:
I can't believe I'm actually giving 5 stars? This place is fantastic!
Its small, and the wait is a pain. Especially when people cut in front of you. How hard is it to see a line of people on the side of the building?

Then when we finally got in, ordered (note: you have to order first before you sit down so another line) and they finally sit you down well let me tell you. The food makes it worth it. HOME MADE: Jam, and juice makes up for everything. Jam is so perfect, you can't believe its home made every day!

This place is always packed. So make sure you leave early to get here. Believe me its hard to give 5 stars in my opinion. This place passed with flying colors.

Unbelievable magnificent food. I love their breakfast. I have yet to try their lunch but I can't wait to go back. Wow there are so many great things to say about this place.

But seriously to the CUSTOMERS: cut the attitude and stay IN LINE. The staff working at this establishment don't deserve it. It gets busy just like any other place, just be patient.

I applaud the staff for taking the customers so well and keeping their cool. You guys are awesome and deserve over 15% of tips. Keep up the great work.

-SN

PS They don't accept Credit Card. They accept Debit Card but charge for a dollar fee. Go Cash.
author: Nha D.

description:
During our 90 minutes outside on the sidewalk, our genius minds came up with the most fantastic entrepreneurial idea:  we can open little breakfast joints in college towns around america for all the hung over 19 year olds and serve nothing but MAMA'S MONTE CRISTO SANDWICHES!  

I have one everytime I go to SF.  They're sooooooo good I even convinced two tourists in line to get them too.  I got a few trans-restaurant thumbs ups from those guys later!
author: Meredith K.

description:
This is not where u go for every-brunch fix, the wait is just.... !@!$#@%#$^$*&$
But u need to come here and witness the magical power of Mama's, see how thou managed to tame any kind of human being~ 
People will LINE UP, no kidding', u can't even mingle around.
U JUST STAND THERE and wait and wait and wait..... until u get there.
The most torture part of the journey will be when u reach the glass window... still in line, watching ppl enjoying their brunch..
It gets a little annoying when the girl is looking at u, while laughing, while pouring syrup on her french toast.. still with that * HAHAHAH I Got my pancake* look~!
So before u come to Mama's, bring good friends~ cause it's gonna be long.. bring some books n good music if u're alone.
I still wonder why ppl would come here alone.................................

For the food, nothing much to say really, it's good. 
Get the french toast sampler if its ur first time.
Eggs benedict n french toast rule! 
Not so interested with anything else.......
Be good, 
Mama will serve u good food as a reward.
author: Marlis T.

description:
Came in for a birthday breakfast on Sunday. This place opens at 8am. It's small inside, seating capacity perhaps 30 at most. Be prepared to wait in line when its full inside. We got there about 815am driving in from the East Bay. We waited about 50min before ordering and being seated. WORTH THE WAIT!!! 

They have a system, if there's a line, you wait outside, when you get to the front of the line, one of the bussers or waiters lets you in, when the line to order is short. Once you're in, take a look at the menus posted above because once u hit the register, you order. While you're in that inside line, lick your lips as you look at the pastries behind the glass barrier, the cooks will give you some treats to taste..... 

My table ordered Crab omelet with avocado, creamy brie; crab omelet with spinach and tomatoes, and crab benedict. We also wanted something sweet, but no ala carte on french toast or pancakes, so we order a plate of french toast to share..... 

Everything crab was delish....crab meat was plentiful in the omelets and eggs benedict. 

I recommend getting a coffee near Washington Sq park so you have something warm while you wait, that is if you need your caffeine drug ritual in the morning. 

If you haven't tried this place, its a must for all SF and Bay Area foodies!!! 

Make it a day in City as well.
author: Gwen K.

description: Don't understand the hype! Me and my wife left the house at 5am from Yuba City in great anticipation to try Mama's after we noticed the long lines out the door during Fleet Week. We arrived early and were the first in line. We had a hard copy of the menu and made our selections beforehand; especially after reading that you place your order with the cashier before being seated. At 8am sharp the doors were unlocked and we immediately placed our order with the cashier. We ordered the crab benedict, buttermilk pancakes, Washington Square Omelette, a peach bellini, and coffee. The crab benedict was nothing special. The poached eggs were a bit overcooked and not enough hollandaise sauce. There were plenty of crab however. I had much better at  less popular restaurants. The buttermilk pancakes were like any other pancakes I tried; only these were smaller ~6" diameter and only three per order for $8.95. They were not fluffy and light at I've read from other viewers. The omelette was the better of all three. The Italian sausage they used was very flavorful and the eggs were fluffy. Overall, the WOW factor we were looking for just was not there. Needless to say we were a bit disappointed. Anyone that knows me knows I don't mind spending good money on good food, but $58.00 for a mediocre breakfast? But I won't end this review on a sour note. The staff were very friendly and accommodating!
author: Victor H.

description:
Wow.  

I've moved a block away from Mama's about 3 months ago and have wanted to try this place even before living right next to it, but have always been discouraged by the mass of people waiting in line.  Well, discouraged no more.  I would wait in that line anyday and now I understand why so many others do also.

After waiting in line on a Sunday morning for about an hour and a half, we were finally seated.  I ordered the Californian "mom-lette" (an omelette with avocado, bacon and jack cheese) which came with potatoes and sourdough bread.  I also got an apple and peach belini.  My eating partner had 2 eggs with potatoes, sourdough and a bloody mary.  We also shared pancakes.

We received our drinks right away.  The belini was delicious, due to the freshly squeezed apple juice and heavenly peach puree.  His bloody mary, made with soju was very good as well, but needed to be colder.  The food came out shortly after.  My omelette was cooked to perfection and had a pretty good balance of ingredients...maybe a little heavy on the avocado, but nonetheless delicious; fluffy eggs and lots of cheese.  The potatoes were excellent as well as the sourdough bread...I wonder where they get it!!?? Yum.  He enjoyed his meal as well; the over easy eggs were also done perfectly.  The pancakes with berries were amazing!  Soft and fluffy and on the smaller side, which I happen to like.  

My recommendation is get there early and suck it up for the wait.  It's well worth it.  I love you Mama.
author: E G.

description: The food is good, however, I feel like with all of the hype, I was expecting great!  With a two hour wait in line, you are eating for all of 8 minutes before feeling rushed out so the people behind you can eat at your seat.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Breakfast at its best served all day with a variety of omelettes and French toast.  Everything on the menu is simply tasty and sophisticated.  My favorites include the Apple Pan Dore and crab Benedict.  Wait in line to give your appetite time to wake up to the aroma of what I would consider better than mama's cooking at home.
author: Jenny L.

description:
try and go on a weekday (yes, i advocate going to work late and eating instead). There's a long line to get in, but you order and pay and then sit, so once you're at a table to get your food pretty quick.
I love the eggs benedict, monte cristo, and the omlettes. Saw Carlos Santana there once, i think he had an omlette.
author: Nikki M.

description:
what can I say about Mama's that has not already been said. Food - awesome. Prices - so so. Line - SUCKS. Why does everything good come at such a price? I just cannot justify a 1 hour+ wait for breakfast. I have already invested in many a cookbook so I only have to wait for the griddle to heat up in my kitchen.

but the coffee cake is SO good....
author: Holly C.

description:
Please go here if you haven't yet.  It's a true San Francisco treat...err (feast I should say :)
 
Service: Awesome. No matter how many people are packed in that tiny place, they're always nice and especially efficient.

Food: You wont' want to sit here reading a novel about how good breakfast is...just go there.

Place: tiny yet such a homey place. i don't mind the wait nor the compact area :)

Suggestions: The Eggs benedict is awesome. Also the french toast, the florentine scramble (i think that's what it's called) eh, everything is great! You won't go wrong with anything you try there. 

Overall: One of, if not, the best breakfast place in SF, for a price worth paying for (about $10-$15)
author: Quinallison D.

description: My boyfriend and I are in love with breakfast food and we had heard that this place was worth the try. We had read the reviews about the wait so we went early. We arrived around 7ish and the line was already started (place opens at 8am) once we were in, around 8:30 we were ready to eat. I ate the chocolate cinnamon French toast with berries (im a French toast lover!!) and my bf had the banana nut French toast. Not bad. Service was quick and somewhat friendly. The place was busy. Lucky enough we had read the reviews and we were prepared to pay cash. Will we return again?? Sure why not, but its not one of the best. Great place, good food, decent service.  Oh and one more thing, there is this red syrup thing for your French toast/waffles/pancakes. Definitely try it. It made our food tastier. The manager suggested it (which was a good move).
author: Catalina T.

description:
Alright, Sunday  Tania and I get to Mama's and start waiting in line around 12pm. We end up getting inside and ordered around 1:40, and get seated, the food arrives about 2pm.

I ordered the Eggs Benedict again, of course. It was cooked perfectly again. Just the right amount of yolk-ness, the creamy sauce but ever so light, and crisp canadian bacon. Ordered a side of toast just so I could have as much of the jam as possible. 

Tania ordered the Swedish Cinnamon french toast with a side of an over easy egg. The french toast was covered in fresh berries, and the toast was cooked perfectly, with just a tad of sweetness. 

The waitress kept our coffee's warm and full, and we left with a great feeling, great start to a good day. 

In the end, you forget you waited and hour and a half to have breakfast. Its worth it!
author: Jon H.

description:
Mama's is a San Francisco institution that is a bit of an issue for me to rate. On one hand, it is a genuinely excellent breakfast, at a reasonable by San Francisco standard pricing. I've eaten there twice now, and both times the food was fresh and delicious, with first rate ingredients.  The coffee was hot, fresh and they keep your cup full. The wait staff are friendly and maintain and calm demeanor and eye of the storm attitude, as if oblivious to the 75 people in line outside.

The main downsides are, of course, the weekend brunch crowd wait. When I arrived at 10:30 a.m. on a Sunday, there were between 35-40 people ahead of me. Had I arrived 5 minutes later, it would have been closer to 50 people. 

It took 1.25 hours until I and my party were actually inside the restaurant. This is the 2nd downside. You're waiting in line, so you can...wait in line. Once inside the restaurant, you're in a new, cafeteria style line where you can watch them make your food. You order at the cash. Once ordered, you wait, yet again, for a table for your party size to open up. Which is really my 2nd and 3rd complain together, cafeteria style ordering. What if you want more juice, toast, eggs while already seated? Are you supposed to wait in line again?

By the time we left I had been there close to 3 hours. I was very happy with my Monte Cristo sandwich, but was under no illusions that it was not really worth it.
author: Jordan C.

description:
The food here is really great but is it worth 1 hr + wait? Not to me. Unlike say Brenda's French Soul Food which makes something unique Mama's serves up standard breakfast /brunch type food you can get anywhere. Yes it's very well prepared.I had the Italian omelet  platter which was delicious . What stood out as much as the omelet  was the potatoes that  came with it. It didn't taste like it was sitting in steam tray or under a lamp, but like it was freshly made with the omelet. The service was good and the price was fine considering quality of food.
I don't know if this normal but while I sitting there a young couple came in, talked to a male employee and was seated at table  next to me, skipping the line.
