He even took there order like a normal restaurant. Needless to say  after waiting an hour to sit I was a little pissed. Probably not as the pissed as the people who were still standing.
I wouldn't recommend Mama's until they change the wait process.
3.5 stars.
author: James F.

description:
The long lines are worth it!  One bite of the Monte Christo (a french toast/ham and cheese hybrid) and you will know why.  Of equal quality/deliciousness was the shrimp and avocado open face omelet, potatoes, and the fresh boysenberry jam.

A breakfast must for San Francisco.
author: James G.

description:
Came back here with my coworkers for breakfast today. While we got there at 7:45 am, the line wasn't that long. Maybe just 2 parties in front of us not bad! This time, I decided to try something new - instead of savory I went for sweet! 

I ordered the french toast! So good! The waiter told me to try it with their fresh jam instead of the syrup, and it was delicious! The fresh ollieberry jam was so good! I'll know what to get when I come here from now on!
author: Betty S.

description: Egg white scrambler is delicious. Very light and fresh. I am surprised how fresh the vegetables are. Must try the French toast sampler, the raspberries are really really fresh and naturally sweet. Also we ordered the bacon and it was completely over cooked. It was extra extra crispy- not something I really like.The wait to be seated is absolutely ridiculous! We waited for 1 hour and 20 mins in line outside.
author: Asha J.

description:
I absolutely love this place but absolutely hate the line!  As soon as I go in I feel like I need to eat it all! LOL I LOVE they fresh jam! Yum!  

I am a french toast fan here, but if you can... find a time to go when the lines are too crazy... try an ugly rainy day! LOL Oh, if it is sunny... bring sunscreen so you can enjoy your tasty food.
author: Amelia M.

description: The best breakfast ever! Whenever I go to San Francisco a stop at Mama's is a must no matter how long the line outside is. There's not enough good things I can say about this place. Mama's Monte Cristo might be the best meal I've ever had.
author: Josh O.

description:
The Monte Cristo here is deliciouso!!  I've never been a fan of the sweet and savory, but after trying their monte cristo I'm forever a fan.  It's the only thing I order when I come here.  It's that good!

-1 stars when I noticed the servers leaving $5 tips on the table as a reminder to leave a tip.  At first I thought it was for the busser to pick up, but then I noticed they too were intentionally leaving it on the tables!  I understand you're working hard but I don't need a reminder every time I take a bite into my sandwich.  I ALREADY had to wait 1hr. 15 min. in line to sit here.  Thanks.

P.S.:  To make the wait in line a bit easier, grab some Foccacia bread from Liguria Bakery across the street.  You can nibble on some food while you wait.  It's probably the best over the counter italian bread I've ever tasted.  The Pizza flavor is amazzzing ..... their hours of operation are a bit tricky though.  I never know when they'll be open!
author: Char C. B.

description:
Mama's is worth waiting in the long line and waking up early for. we always make sure to have breakfast here on our SF trips. I always order the dungeness crab Benedict and trust me they do not skimp on the crab. My Fiance order the Northern Italian omelet with pancetta, mushrooms and tomatoes. WOW! the pancetta was crunchy and gave the omelet great texture. No matter how much food you've already order, make sure to try one of their baked goods.
Mama's open at 8am but we usually get there around 7:30am to get in the line that's already forming at their front door.
author: KarenandJim W.

description: Monte Christo & Shrimp Benedict it is really good. The line is to long.
author: Larry F.

description:
What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said?!

It is worth every second of every minute of every hour (and a half) that you will wait. 

Not only is their food absolutely amazing, but so are their deserts, and their mimosas made with fresh squeezed oj! 

The location itself is adorable and home like. The area it is in is also  beautiful with a park across the street and a view of coit tower just up above. 

Oh yes, and service is FABULOUS! Wonderful people all around.
author: Brenda D.

description: The Crab and Spinach Eggs Benedict were fantastic!  We waited about 2 hours, which was quite a while, but the ambience, service and food was delicious.  We also had a very nice white wine lemonade and spicy bloody mary which were also great!
author: Zak M.

description:
One Sunday afternoon my bff decided it was a good day to go to Mama's, because you know...no one else will have the same idea. 

We waited for a good hour and a half or more. It felt like 5. Seeing all the happy people (that finally got to get in) eatting their food and SITTING down didn't help the time past any quicker. It was yet another line after the line outside to order. Then yet another wait to be seated. However, I knew what I was getting myself into.

My bff and I got the banana foster french toast and the Northern Itallian to spilt. The wait was WORTH it. Oh. My. Goodness. Remember when you were a kid and wanted to hide out at the toy store until it closed so you could play with all the toys? (Ok, maybe that was just me. ...Well, not really me bcause I was afraid of the dark and being alone, but that's besides the point) I felt like that! I wanted to live there and eat EVERYTHING, EVERYDAY. 

I want to come back, but not on Sundays. Wish they were open on Mondays when I have a weekday off (in hopes of shorter waits and parking).
author: Jeanette P.

description: I had Eggs Benedict for the first time at this place and was rather disappointed. The sauce was too sour for my liking and otherwise nondescript. Wasn't worth the 20 minute wait. Will give it another try and sample other items on the menu. Maybe it was just an off day
author: Alice W.

description:
This place is sooooo good! It's a small shop with a line out the door. We went on a Sat morning right around 12. We didn't get in till about 2, but boy was the food worth the wait! It is definitely one of the best breakfast places in the city! It's really cute and everyone there is really nice. When you make it in the door, you stand in front of the kitchen area like a buffet line and you can watch them make the food. Everything looks and smells wonderful. 

We ended up ordering:

Monte Cristo - OMG this was just sooo delicious! 

French toast sampler - YUM

My friend ordered one of the benedicts but I don't remember which one. I was too engrossed with my food to notice what she was eating... ;)

I would definitely come back again, but I'd try to come earlier to avoid the loong wait. But it was worth it!
author: Jessica L.

description:
--The wait outside of the restaurant in a chilly morning - 1.5 hours

--The wait inside the restaurant once ordered the food - 35 mins

--Service - very friendly

--Anticipation for my salmon benedict - very high

--Once tried salmon benedict -- yuck!!

--Finish the plate? -- of course! 

--3 hours later - on the bathroom floor throwing up, lightheaded, headache, a bit of fever, diarrhea, had to reschedule a flight and crying for mommy. 

--As a result of going to Mama's - taste aversion to diner foods. Can't even watch Denny's or Norm's commercials on TV. 

I'm traumatized for life. :(
author: Parim A.

description:
I get shit from my friend's who call me silly for willing to wait over an hour and a half for brunch. Those friends clearly have never eaten at Mama's. And I feel bad for them, I really do. Because they have no idea of what they're missing out on. The 2 hours of lost sleep on a Sunday morning is paltry after that first bite of Monte Cristo with housemade jam, or their succulent crab and avo benedict.  

My silly friends will just never know. What a shame.
author: Deanna T.

description:
A friend took our group to Mama's for breakfast but ended up being a lunch instead because of the long wait.  We waited for about an hour and a half.  Despite the long wait to get a table our food came out pretty quick. 

When we go in groups we like to share our meals so we get to sample a bit of everything on the menu.  

We had the Monte Cristo - excellent tasting french toast sandwich.
Egg benedict - I was not a fan of the Hollandaise sauce they had.
French toast Sampler - so many wonderful flavord toast
Also a Scramble - Taste healthy so that's always a plus for me.

The waitress was really nice and kept on refilling our drinks.  
Located next to a little park good for a walk after eating.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Not sure why I decided to go again and wait. But did it anyways. After you line up its like you've gone to far and can turn back. Then every 15 mins you reassure yourself and your friends that you will get to the door, because you moved like 5 inches or that you saw a few people leave the restaurant. Just a thought XD 

I had the french toast sampler and by far of the banana nut french toast was the best, it also compliments the house jam very well. Sweet and Savory and a just a bit of tang, but not overwhelming on any of the three. My friend, she had the Monte Cristo, which was also delicious. 

Hrm we'll see if I line up again (but I just might, as much as I hated waiting 1.5 hrs for food).
author: Clifford C.

description:
What's not to love about a restaurant that's been serving SF since before I was born and much the same way.  There's a history to this place and going here makes me feel nostalgic and a part of something San Franciscan.

Things I love about Mama's
 *Pancakes & berries
*Omelets
* Carrot Cake
*Coffee Cake
*Well lit
*Friendly staff 
*I hear the Benedict's are amazing as well
*Location

Things I don't like
*Long wait to get in
*Its cramped inside
*Loud
*Order first then sit down
*Parking is tough

But, if you don't mind waiting you should absolutely go here, but perhaps avoid the weekends.
author: Molly M.

description:
If you love breakfast, you need to make some time for Mama's.  Each time I've gone there, I've waited about 45 minutes to get a table...but the wait goes by quickly as long as you are in good company :)  Trust me, It is well worth the wait!!!  I noticed that by 2pm on Sunday (it closes at 3), there was no line...so I would suggest going later if you can.  

We had the following:

Farmer's Omelette: goat cheese+bacon+leeks= YUMMMMY
Swedish French Toast: not the best I've had, but still great nonetheless...try it with their homemade jam...it's good.
Eggs Florentine (w Canadian Bacon):  this was completely mindblowing goodness.  I almost wanted to cry.

Check out the pics I posted.

I've never been disappointed going to Mama's...it's good to go with hungry, food-loving friends so you can try each others' dishes.   Try it out!!!

----------------
Update 3/10

We went to Mama's again and brought some friends.  They were also blown away by Mama's goodness :)   We arrived a little after 10am on Sunday and we only waited like 20 minutes.  Maybe the shorter wait had to do with people being in church or daylight savings time?  We have a new discovery....the Monte Cristo.  It was ridiculously tasty.   On the outside, these sandwiches look very unassuming.  However, once you bite into it, you will be in heaven.  Dunk it in the jam and you will be crying with joy.
author: Vivian W.

description: Be prepared to test ur patience with the difficult parking around the area and to wait in the long line. Otherwise, food definitely one of the best I've ever had for brunch. Dungeness Crab sandwich and Monte Cristo are da bombs! Can't go wrong with the French Toast Samplers either.. Overall, super pleasant experience with great service from the cool & friendly staff. Would recommend it to any foodie! Worth the wait :)
author: Christina T.

description: I liked their food, albeit a ridiculously long line; my friend and I went there pretty early, I remember even before the restaurant was opened but had to wait for a good hour... I got a chocolate cinnamon french toast with fresh fruit. It was good, but I am not sure if the long wait was worth it though.
author: Eujin L.

description:
we stood in line for 2 hours of the 36 hour trip we took to san francisco. luckily it was a gorgeous day. was it worth it? depends...

i loved how the atmosphere within was so intimate and relaxed despite the long long line outside. once inside, you understand why the line is as long as it is and have to appreciate that they don't rush or seat until it's appropriate.

the monte carlo with jam, oh boy was that good. fluffy french toast loaded with meat and cheese, dusted with powdered sugar with homemade berry jam to smear to your heart's content.

can't say the other foodstuffs was too standout, and the seafood items were expensive! i did take a piece of carrot cake home and even 2 days later after a 9hr flight home, it was a moist and cream-cheesy carroted bit of good baking!

would i do this again. no. not if the wait is as long as it was. will i crave it? maybe.
author: Karen L.

description:
I agree with Phoi B. in that I'm not so much a breakfast person.  But I would definitely jump at any chance to go back to Mama's.  Something about the food- I can't put my finger on it- just tastes so good.  I think it's the homecooked factor :)

I came here with my friend right before 10am.  We jumped in line and waited it out.  If you're coming on a sunny day, it gets pretty intense in the sunlight so dress in layers and wear sunglasses as you wait.  The time it took for us to stand outside and then again in the line inside was probably 30 min in total and the wait to be seated and served had me antsy and hungry.  But it was definitely worth it! I got the Washington Square momelette and my friend got the Scrambled Florentine.  They were equally amazingly flavorful!  I don't even really like eggs but the filling of sausage, bell peppers and cheese made it delicious.  It came with red potatoes and 2 pieces of toast which I enjoyed with the homemade jam.  The jam was probably the best I've ever had- it doesn't have that thick paste consistence of the usual jam but instead had whole pieces of berries and a thin jelly mixed in.  Too me, it was the best part of the meal- two thumbs up.  

Reading the reviews, I originally wanted to try the French Toast Sampler but last minute decided on the Momelette because I wanted something more hearty.  But I am definitely doing to try the sampler next time!!

As we were leaving, I noticed a longer line so I suggest going at the time we went, in between breakfast and lunch to beat the crowd.  I grew up in the neighborhood all my life and I'm glad I finally got to experience it!!  Thanks to TIME's Top 10 Things to Do in San Francisco's list ;)
author: Nicole G.

description:
Amazingly fresh ingredients, food made with skill and love... 
I have a special love for breakfast food and this place has just entered my top ten list of places I would go for my last meal on earth.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Living in the city, you'd think there would be a plethora of fabulous brunch places, right?

Sadly, I am often disappointed with many of the places I try here in SF.  Some are good, some have certain great dishes, but I had yet to really find a GREAT brunch in some time.  But then I went to Mama's and I was honestly blown away.

The quality of food is just staggering.  I went with 3 others and we each got something different to share as well as the French Toast Sampler for all 4 of us to taste.  Everything was wonderful.  The Eggs Florentine I got was delicious!  The eggs were perfectly poached, the breakfast potatoes were crispy in just the right way and the french toast was amazing.  I loved how they used different types of bread for each type of french toast.

The only downfall to this place is the wait.  We waited about 2 hrs to eat although I hear it's usually about an hour.  Probably the best time to go is on a weekday morning but if you go on the weekend, expect a wait of at least an hour.  Luckily for us we kept each other entertained & the weather was nice.  

Mama's will definitely always rate high for me although I don't think it's a regular brunch spot, just because of the wait.  Still, definitely worth checking it out if you haven't had the pleasure!
author: Melanie N.

description: Crab eggs Benedict was decently great as usual but service was beyond disgusting towards us the day we went. If it wasn't for their crab eggs Benedict, it would be 1 star.
author: Amy N.

description:
At first I was a little apprehensive seeing some of the reviews here on yelp. I decided to give this place a shot anyway and totally loved it.

There was no line at all (We arrived at 10:30 am on a Thursday morning) so maybe that helped.We ordered eggs florentine with the six dollar pancakes. Absolutely perfect for the weather in the city on that day (raining and a little cold). They have this homemade jam on each table which I highly recommend with your pancakes or toast. I was in love with the jam so I ordered an extra toast serving! The mini fruit salad that we ordered at the end as also good. Very fresh fruits. 

Apparently the store has been around for 53 years. The place is run by family members of Mama (she passed away a few years back). So it has a homely touch to eat. Only the best at Mama's :)
author: A T.

description:
Come around 2pm..no wait  no line!!!
Very cute and cozy by the park like I'm in another town...like Stars Hollow from Gilmore Girls (except they ate at Luke's diner)
Love how they display the bakery goods were you order. makes you want to eat more than you should.
Anyways had the Northern Italian...it all right, 
LOVE the roasted red potatoes!!!!
author: Lynn T.

description: Worth the wait.. Worth the money.. Great Service and Great Benedicts! i love it love it! Try the crab benedict and the french toast! is totally awesome! the best benedict that i've ever tasted!
author: Bonnie W.

description:
Came here for brunch with my BFF.  We waited about 2 hours - the reviews don't lie, its a line with a very small eating space.  You order at the counter, then take a seat, wait for the food, and enjoy your meal.  

We ordered their Dungeness crab egg benedicts which was AMAZING and the Dungeness crab omelet which was not so much.  We also ordered the french toast but they never got the order - they didn't charge us so no matter.  

We end up spending over $80 just the two of use alone but the dungeness crab egg benedicts are soOoOo worth it.  Not sure if i'll wait 2 hours for it again though - maybe in another 2 years or so when i have regained my patience.
author: Jewelz T.

description:
3.5 stars round up to 4 =)

I agree with some people, the food taste good, but not really good enough for the long wait.

I got there around 9:20 on a Sunday and we were super excited so first we thought the wait was okay. So we waited outside, under the pretty cold San Franciscan weather. Then when we finally got called and allowed into the restaurant it was a little pass 10 already.  Since I woke up @ 7:30AM for this Sunday brunch, I didn't eat anything and was pretty much starving when we were called! So I was like "oh YES! Finally FOOOOD!"

However, we were instructed to go in we had to wait in line to order (I think it was because we had 3 people. those with 2 people were allowed to sit first and got food faster than us even though they came in later)

We ordered the crab egg benedict, an omelet (forgot which one), french toast sampler, and pancake. We also got orange and grapefruit juice. Then we paid, it was about $20/person.

Then we waited to be seated. Then we waited for the food.....

When the food finally came, I was pretty much dying. I have to admit the food looked really good and tasted delicious! I am not a big fan of juice because I always think they don't have as much nutrients but their juice is freshly squeezed! You can taste the freshness of the food and juice.

However, I think this place is so popular is because people were starving when they get the food. so anything would taste good to them! =)

I mean I would still come back, but this wouldn't be my regular breakfast place =)
author: Shirley F.

description: It doesn't live up to the hype and isn't worth the almost two hour wait on weekends! There are a million better brunch places in SF.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I lived in north beach for two years and spent one too many mornings lining up in their long queue. I personally don't think the food is worth the wait; however, i would gladly order to go if they'd let me. They do serve tasty breakfast, just not worth the wait/hype.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Hated waiting in line, as many other people do, but once I had gotten seated and gotten my order, I instantly forgot my troubles! I love their french toast   and bacon, portions were more than sufficient too . The place is small but charming. The staff were semi-friendly, probably because they have to deal with the grumpy people waiting in line for sooo long! Mama's has a great selection in their menu, so I was pleased to have so have many options.
However, if you are thinking about trying this place, please do, but here are some words for the wise: "come early, so you don't have to wait long!". Enjoy!
author: C M.

description:
Worth the hour and a half wait in the sun, YES!
crab Benedict is all i had, so i'm solely rating this place on this plate and did it delivered! break into the egg and juicy yellow yolk smothers your crab adding plentiful of flavor to an already flavorful dish!
18.50 was the price to the plate, a little steep for a breakfast plate but i can't complain when there was so much crab in ever bite!
author: Peter N.

description:
So this place is great!  Don't get me wrong.  But, there are a couple things that we weren't so crazy about.

1. Crab Benedict... much better as an idea than it actually was (crab and spinach don't work so well together, the irony taste of spinach killed the sweetness of the crab)
2. Shell in the CRAB!! ... hella shell (my husband's crab omlett, had SEVERAL pieces of shell)
3. Long wait
4. Watery Bloody Mary (see the picture!)

However, I will go back absolutely.  The mistake was, we ordered things we could make just as good or better at home.  That's always frustrating.

But, after planning on going all week, and then waiting for about an hour.  I had really high expectations.  That were not met properly.


Next time, I will get either pancakes (which look incredible, super duper fluffy) or french toast.  I still stand behind this place, we just need a do over.
author: Sonya C.

description:
At first when I got here I didn't think that the 45min wait was going to be worth it.  But when it was all said and done, it was absolutely worth it.  But I will say that if you're going to come here and endure the wait, don't get something that you'd find at a typical breakfast joint.  You should get something unique like the pancake sampler or their unique version of the Monte Cristo with their homemade Raspberry Jam.  Their jam is so good, you will end up trying to dip whatever you can find into it.  It's that good!

I ended up going with the Shrimp & Avocado Eggs Benedict and though many restaurants may serve this dish, Mama's version is pretty legit.  Overall, I would say to come here with an eclectic group of friends that are willing to share some of their tasty dishes with you so that you can get a taste of everything that Mama's has to offer you.
author: Abe I.

description:
Who's crazy enough to wake up at the crack of dawn the morning of Daylights Savings Time to eat? Oh yea, me and my friends...

Call me crazy but I would do that again for Mama's! Mama's is the way breakfast food should taste! Absolute bliss! 

Yes it's true, upon entering Mama's you are overwhelmed by the menu and have the urge to order everything before finding a seat. Go ahead. Indulge! We certainly did! 

Bowl of fresh fruit-- so juicy, so fresh!
Blueberry sour cream crumb cake-- OMG! So moist and with the perfect balance of sweetness! So good, we ordered another one :)
Dungeness Crab Omelette-- The crab was definitely fresh, definitely amazing. And they didn't overwhelm the omlette with too much cheese. The home fries were moist, perfectly seasoned and CRISPY! 
Washington Square M'Omelette-- *sigh* The Italian sausage was SO good. So many good veggies packed in there too!
French Toast Sampler-- *advice from the waiter: Try it with the jam* Yup he was right! The sampler came with banana nut bread french toast, swedish cinnamon french toast and cranberry walnut french toast. The swedish cinnamon was hands down the best. 

The waiters were so friendly! They kept our cups full, gave great tips AND let us order a few more dishes without having to get in line again! We needed to take some to-go boxes and the waiter gave us extra containers to take home some jam. The jam is made fresh every morning!! DELICIOUS!!!
author: Tina Y.

description:
Are you guys kidding me??? There is NO breakfast place that is worth an hour and a half of wait while standing!

We got there at 11:30 am and we had to line up outside, after about 30 mins, they let you in only to put you in another line. You have to wait in another line to order your food and then stand there until the food is ready and then you get to sit down. 

the food was good and it looked great but it was just breakfast at the end of the day. How many ways can you make french toast better? or sunny side up eggs better? I wouldn't have  minded so much if they let you sit while waiting for your food but standing around that long for a meal I can finish in 15 mins is not the way I'd want to spend my day.
author: Anna T.

description:
Hands down, greatest breakfast I've EVER had!!  This place lives up to the hype and memory time and time again.  I'm as impatient as the next guy, and no doubt, the line is ridiculous (often, well over an hour), so just try to imagine what kind of food sensations it would take to trump that kind of wait. Multiply by ten and you've got Mama's.

You can't go wrong with anything there, but if I were a death-row convict, granted my last meal, I'd go with the Northern Italian omelette, Monte Cristo sandwich, and pancakes w/ berries.  The fresh boysenberry jam at the table is insane!
author: B A.

description:
"Mother always knows best" ... so go to Mama's!!...

I came here on Sunday to see a 90 min wait.. we didn't go 
But I knew I had to come back!
I went there for breakfast this morning (Wed), and loved it! No line around 8:15 am... but when we left there (9:15am ) was a 30 wait.. so GO EARLY! They set up was not what I thought it was going to be. You order at the register with a huge menu hanging on the wall. Then you find a sit to get the food served to you. I think this makes the restaurant have faster turn over rate of customers. Also, their specials WERE offered on weekends, the menu says they don't but they did today, and its not the weekend...

I recommend:
-GO EARLY
-french toast (I got a scramble but the french toast is the way to go)
-crumb cake.. sweet sweet get ready for sweetness but lovely

Don't recommend: 
-going on weekends...

Enjoy!
-JF
author: Jenna F.

description: I shouldn't be writing a review in my condition.  Drunk on prosciutto and hollandaise.  So happy.  Best breakfast in a long time.
author: Brent K.

description: Came here with my friend and we waited in a very long line. Once we got inside, there was still a waiting line to order. We ordered the apple peach bellini and the spiked lemonade, the regular and north beach eggs benedict dishes. The food was solid, but I would not say it was anything out of this world. It's a cute place in north beach, though.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Waited in line for an hour and it was worth every minute!

MUST try the Monte Cristo... it is to die for.
author: Tracy L.

description:
The food was really good, but I've been to other brunch locations such as Mission Beach Cafe that's really good.

I did really enjoy the Crab Benedict. A couple of my friends and I waited in line for about 30 minutes (we came at 12:45pm)

Orange Juice was sweet and tasty.
author: Eric A.

description:
MY ALL TIME FAVORITE BREAKFAST/BRUNCH PLACE!

I would have taken 1 star for the LONG LINES but the WAIT is worth it!
I would suggest to go early if you don't want to wait too long and weekends are the worst times.

FOODWISE:
"Drools" for the MONTE CRISTO!!! Which is ham/cheese baked inside of a french toast YUMMMMS!
Their Egg benedicts are bomb as well "NORTHBEACH"
They have tons of scrambles and omelets as well.
If I were you, I would try the entire menu....
OH and to add, they have lunch menus here as well (SO it's not completely ALL breakfast/brunch)
author: Virginia L.

description: Everything there is absolutely perfect!! The Benedict eggs with bacon and tomato are awesome. Omelet with triple cheese is good. Their cinnamon French toast is also delicious. Highly recommend!! The best brunch restaurant in SF. The only bad thing about this restaurant is that u have to wait for a very long time on line.
author: Hua M.

description: The food was very good. Although the eggs were over cooked on the Benedict. The service was quick and polite. The location is nice and the restaurant is quaint. Overall it was a good experience, but took almost 2 hours from arriving to receiving our food (went on a Saturday morning, about an hour after the restaurant opened). I suggest going on a weekday or getting there as soon as they open. Will go back again, yet not on a weekend day.
author: Matt F.

description:
Who in their right mind waits in a 20-30 minute line for breakfast at 8:30 on a Thursday?  Tourists, that's who.  And every dang person in the line was a tourist, replete with guidebooks and maps and loud conversations about Cleveland.  As tourists ourselves, we had little room to talk, but I think the line strengthened our resolve to seek out neighborhood places, not ones in the guidebooks.

Now, it's not that I'm opposed to waiting in line for good food.  I think there are times when this is a perfectly reasonable thing to do - like when you're trying to get brunch in Chicago, for example.  This might also explain why we rarely find ourselves getting brunch anymore - we wake up hungry, and the idea of standing in line for an hour when we've already delayed breakfast by an hour or two is just unbearable.  We were later told that the line at Mama's can take more than an hour - no way is it worth it.

Once inside, we ordered our breakfasts - a French toast sampler for my husband and a tomato and prosciutto Benedict for me - then settled down for coffee and people-watching.  My Benedict arrived with overdone eggs and the overly salty prosciutto, but the hollandaise was mild and the slices of heirloom tomatoes helped to even it out. The breakfast potatoes were excellent. My husband was less satisfied with his breakfast - the French toast was dense and barely, well, French toasted - but between our two plates, we left full and happy.

I'm not sure what advice I can give you about Mama's.  I'd say come hungry, as the portions are generous, but then you have to stand in line for an hour, by which time you might give up and walk away.  I'd say have a snack before you get in line, but then maybe the line will go too quickly, and you won't be hungry when it's your turn to order!  How about this: roll out of bed and immediately proceed to the Mama's line.  By the time you get to the front, you (and your stomach) should be awake.  That's the best I can do.
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
preparation//
bring LOTS of quarters for street parking and don't be discouraged by the cRAzy line out the door and around the corner...yes even on a boring weekday!  if you can survive the wait, you will be rewarded with delectable food in an adorably quaint place!

ambiance//
once you make it inside the front door, you'll be greeted with the hustle & bustle that makes it mama's...the counter is lined with fresh baked goods and a chalkboard dictates a menu that can already be found online...so after payment, you will be seated accordingly~

service// ***
for a busy and happening place, the servers were quite nice...everyone had a smile and let you relax while you eat...you almost forget how long it took to get to where you are until glancing out the window and you see the *hungry eyes*

ps. one of the guys even instructed us on the 'proper way' to eat their french toast (savor it w/ the special jam)

food// *****
FYI- portions are quite large and perfect for sharing!
we ordered the yummy dungeness omlette & french toast sampler, but hands down my recommendation goes to the

*MUST ORDER* dungeness crab benedict: this is like the holy grail of yummy eggs benedicts! i'm *drooling* just thinking about it! ;p
author: Donna S.

description:
Don't like the hour wait...

Went here Sunday morning at 8am right when they opened and we ate after an hour?!
Didn't see the Monte Cristo on the menu. Is that a secret item?

Did order the french toast with fresh berries.
Bread tasted normal but the blueberries and strawberries were absolutely fresh.
The homemade jam did taste better than the maple syrup like the waiter said.

My cousin who lives in SF said the french toast tasted better at Stacks.
author: Realtor Karl B.

description:
Mama's food is great!! Me and friend went on a saturday morning and was told the wait is insane unless you go on a weekday. I tried the monte cristo (FREAKIN DELICIOUS!!!) and the dungeoness crab beneduct (pretty good). I prefer my hollandaise to be slightly more acidic especially when im eating seafood, but overall it was a good meal.

From the time we got there to the time we sat and ate two hours had passed. Since we waited so long, we kind of lost our appetites and only finished half of our meals. We only spent about 15 min eating. We will be going again, but most likely on a monday or tuesday.
author: Marie C.

description:
I had been wanting to go to this place since I first moved here which was in October 2011. Finally in March 2013 I made it there.  I had tried once before on a Saturday but there line was so long and the boyfriend had hungry eyes so we went elsewhere.  I waited about 45 minutes. Worth the wait? Eh? It was a good breakfast - don't get me wrong - but worth the wait and the travel to North Beach?  I don't think so.  It could have been what I ordered.  I promised a friend I would try to the place again and go with her since she hadn't been.  I heard that most hotels tell their customers to go there so maybe that's why there is a long line and why there is a hype.  Non-locals are amazed and how good this place is which is probably true depending on where they live, but this is San Francisco, the mecca for foodies.  While the normal person may be impressed, this foodie was not impressed.  I am going to try it again.  They could have had an off day, I could have had an off day.  We will see.

Annoyances.  They take debit, not credit.  Come on Mamas - you have a booming business.  Stop pinching pennies and take my credit card. Also with the open door there were flies flying around the food.  Gross!
author: Vagabond V.

description:
Absolutely Incredible Breathless, whatever you want to call it meal. It is true, the wait is 2-2.5 hours if you do not arrive to Mama's at the right time. They have two very small dining rooms with about 15 tables. Getting a table is not a big deal, getting into the restaurant can take hours! We came at 2:30 for lunch (30 mins before closing), and it was about 30 minutes before we had food.

The Eggs Benedict are incredible with the perfect amount of Hollandaise Sauce and a nice kick. I got mine with Shrimp, but they have Bacon,Pancetta,Crab. They also have many other incredible looking sandwiches and breakfast dishes. They are supposedly known for their Monte Cristo sandwhich, but everything is good. They also have a very good banana smoothie.

Do yourself a favor, and try the raspberry jam. It is the best jam I have ever had.

Wonderful experience, and a very reasonable price for high quality food. (70.00 for 4 people)

P.S They only take cash and debit, no credit.
author: Jeremy A.

description: Best 'cheap' brunch in the USA.
author: J. Christopher E.

description: My review is long over due. I visited Mama's last year... But I just joined Yelp. I could not go a second longer without writing about this place. Every time I eat breakfast out at a restaurant I sigh to myself because nothing can compare to Mama's. I am the least patient person I know. I avoid theme parks, concerts, movie openings all because of the waiting crowds and lines. There are exceptions to every rule. I would gladly walk back to San Francisco from Los Angeles and wait another 2.5 hours to eat at this place. Mama's set the bar for breakfast in my mind. Obviously they should be larger and opened longer, but that's part of the allure. I am a Chef and business major. I understand. Nonetheless, I can't wait to get back to Mama's. Benedicts, French Toast, and Mimosas, oh my!
author: Liza S.

description: Go early! We went at 930/10 and waited 45 mins to get in and then waited about 15-20 minutes once inside, but it was so worth it. The food was divine, I had the pancakes and the fruit on top was very fresh and yummy,  the side of bacon was huge and cooked perfectly.  My husband had an omelet and it was overflowing of ingredients.  Since we went late, it basically became our lunch as well as breakfast, but that is fine as the portions were generous (and we wouldn't have been able to eat lunch right after) and so good :)
author: Jennifer G.

description: Ok, Two words, MONTE FUGGIN CRISTO...ok 3 words but whateves...but let me start from the beginning...my wife and I got there at 9 30 am on a Sunday and see a long line but think to ourselves maybe one hour at most...WRONG!!! We waited 2 hours in this cold chilly morning. One of the waitress was kind enough to come outside and serve us cold water...great now I'm even more colder...finally get seated. My waiter brings me my coffee and makes a joke about it being decaf...listen I just waited 2 hours outside JUST GIMMIE MY DAMN COFFEE!!  So me and my wife decided to get the crab cake eggs Benedict, monte Fuggin cristo and French toast sampler. So the sampler and the eggs Benedict came first and I tried it and they were average...the look on my face was EXTREME DISAPPOINTMENT. I was thinking to myself "I waited 2 hours for some average breakfast?! The reviews on yelp warned me that this was food was not worth the wait...but then came the monte friggin cristo. Let me tell you I ate tons of sandwiches/breakfast/brunch type foods in my life time and this sandwich might be the best breakfast sandwhich I have ever ate. IT WAS DELICIOUS, AMAZING, SCRUMPTIOUS, UNBELIEVABLE GOODNESS, AWESOME all in one sandwhich. One bite and I totally forgot I waited outside for 2 long hours.  All it is is a ham egg cheese sandwich but the way they do it is they infused the egg like a french toast. And they give you this raspberry jam that makes it perfection. If you ever decide to visit mama's in Washington square you MUST get the monte cristo. It's the only item on the menu that can make you forget about the unbearable wait. Everything else is irrelevant.
author: Arthur L.

description: Came here based on the 2,230+ excellent reviews I saw on my iphone yelp app. Incredibly delicious food, wont dissapoint, lots of flavor and just enough choices to fit anything you may be looking for!  Cute little restaurant with nice ambiance and enchanting decor! Great place for a date or a nice meeting with a small group of friends.  Dining room is a little small wait can exceed 30mins so don't come here with 25 of your friends or expecting to be fast food service.  Meals are well worth the wait, we will come back here next time we venture to the bay area!
author: Leanne M.

description:
All the reviews will tell you that the line is worth the wait. I won't lie to you, the line is long. Especially the last 15 minutes, where you'll be in front of the window, peering jealously as diners casually finish their meals and sip their coffee. You'll want to shout at them "Move it along, buddy, I've been here 45 minutes already!" But you won't, because your inner voice will remind you that they waited just as long. And look how happy they are now!

The line is worth it. Bring a latte with you and wear comfortable shoes. You will be rewarded. And you might even bump into someone you know, as we did when Carlos Santana sat down right next to us and struck up a conversation. That's San Francisco, and that's Mama's.
author: Peter T.

description:
The food was 5 stars - the monte cristo was great, and their homemade jam really brought it home.  The staff was really friendly too.

However, I just can't give such a high rating to a place that requires you to wait an hour in line to get into.  What's so tough about taking reservations, taking names, or just calling ppl when their table is ready?  Making people wait in line on the sidewalk is rude to the neighbors, pedestrians, and the customers.

Kudos to you if you can make food this good, but imo that's only one aspect of a good restaurant.  Get a bigger space, do take-out, get a permit to put tables on the sidewalk, take reservations, but don't make people wait on the sidewalk.  It's not nice.  I had the same opinion about Ike's sandwiches, back when they were in business... I'm not sure why this place hasn't been closed for the same reason.
author: Mike R.

description:
My bf and I were in San Francisco for my birthday weekend and he had read about all the wonderful reviews on Yelp that raved about a breakfast spot name Mama's. So we decided to give this place a try! We stood in line for an hour on a Friday morning, and it was definitely worth the wait! 

Such a cute, warm, country feel to the place and the food and staff were all amazing! I would definitely recommend this place if you're in town, and for the locals, I am completely jealous of you all!
author: Audrey L.

description: Definitely worth waiting. We've tried the MonteCrissto and the Bay Omelette, and we absolutely fell in love. A must-go breakfast place in SF..!
author: Brianna P.

description:
I finally made it here!!!

Mama's was everything it was cracked up to be.

We ordered three plates for two.  We were hungry!  We ordered an omlette, the plate of sample french toast, and the prosciutto bennedict with cappucino and cocktail.  And. . . ATE IT ALL.

We went on a Tuesday so the line wasn't too long.  It was only about 15 minute wait, maybe 20 tops.   I played word feud and suduko on my phone; time just flew by.  

Once they let you go pass their door, you put your order in and wait for a table.  The service was uber friendly, quick, and attentive.  Although, one of the guys did remind me of the character from No Country For Old Men, which made me felt a little intimidated; totally not his fault.  So when he told me I should finish my plate, I cleaned it up!  (It was a contributing factor on why we ATE IT ALL.)

My only regret is not coming here on a weekend to get their crab bennedict.  Mmmmm. . .Does Friday count as a weekend??? 

B R I N G  C A S H. Each plate cost about $9-12.  Cocktails $6-8.  You can do the math to make sure you have enough.  Or you can accidentally bring only credit card and hope you're partner brought cash to get a free meal ;) ;)
author: Theary K.

description:
OMG - French toas to die for!!!

My sister took me, my bf and his son here cuz she fell in love with their food. Got here around 11a on Sunday. There was a line outside and our wait was about an hour. Once you get inside, you wait in a new line to place your order and get seated. Place is not too big, about 30-35 seats maybe?

We ordered:
French Toast Sampler - 3 different french toasts
Banana Nut French Toast - it's made from Banana Nut bread! topped with sliced banana's and almond (Very sweet).
Chocolate French Toast - Sooo good. Drizzled with choco syrup, topped with berries and whip cream.
Omelette with Smokes Salmon - yum!!

It was all so good. But the wait was sooo long...so its not somewhere i would go on a regular basis...maybe for a nice brunch when me and friends really really want the food.
author: Radha X.

description:
I'm a believer!

With a free afternoon to brunch our little hearts out, what better place to do it at then the notorious Mama's? We figured that since we were arriving an hour before closing & on a weekday, we could saunter on in with no wait. 

Ha! Who were we kidding?? 

As Mama would have it, we had to be patient little kiddies and wait our turns.

Once we were granted permission to squeeze inside, we took a gander at all the glorious goodies surrounding us: french toast sprinkled w/ flawless, ripe berries, benedicts draped in Hollandaise sauce, generously stuffed omelettes & Monte Cristo sandwich triangles standing at attention & begging to be eaten. I'm not gonna lie, I got a little giddy. 

I ended up happily gobbling down the Washington Square Omelette (Italian Sausage, Tomato, Bell Pepper, and Hot Pepper Jack Cheese), which came w/ grilled red potatoes & choice of bread. I went for their sourdough baguette, which unfortunately was hard as a rock. However, this problemo was remedied w/ just a few dabs of the unassuming berry jam nestled by the salt & pepper shakers. Add that magical stuff to any toast you get and you won't regret it.

I was dished out a big bite of Smoked Salmon Benedict and was quite satisfied, but didn't feel inclined to jump on the benedict bandwagon that everyone seems to be on.

I would love to make a trip back here to indulge in their dungeness crab omelette, french toast or banana bread, but I'll obviously need to strategize better to avoid the lengthy wait time.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
We were a group of four meeting here for breakfast on a recent Friday morning.  After having read other Yelp reviews warning about the long line outside, I wasn't surprised that we waited about an hour to be seated.

But the food was killer.  I ordered the Swiss French Toast and the Northern Italy Omelette.  Absolutely delicious.

Oh and the employees were super, super nice and very competent.  It was worth the wait.
author: Anton A.

description:
There's so many good things about this place, but the only thing I come here for is the dungeness crab/avocado/brie cheese omelette. It's so damn good, it'll change your life. Combine the fluffiest egg ever with a boatload of crab and avocado, and you've got a case of "winner winner chicken dinner!" 

When the server lowers the plate in front of you, it's love at first sight, but prepare yourself before you take that first bite...you may end up having a Meg Ryan moment at the table. After you've downed every particle of that deliciousness, you might get the urge to pick up a basketball and slam dunk that thang! 

When Sinead O'Connor wrote "nothing compares 2 u", I never knew she was referring to this omelette at Mama's. After another round last weekend, I can't even look at another omelette from anywhere else because it just won't compare.
author: Gene J.

description: First two days in San Francisco ever for a vacation and found mamas on Google. Pictures are what caught my eye so I decided to go with my wife. And let me tell u their classic Benedict is the best I've had and the silver dollar pancakes are absolutely flawless! Its so good guess where we decided to go again for breakfast instead of going to try another place....nope came back here and now eating it one more time!  Its like a piece of heaven. Come to San Francisco and have to try mamas breakfast before you go!!!
author: Jonathan T.

description: Hands down.....the best breakfast I've EVER had!!! It gets no better than Mama's, and I dont even live in the city! I've been coming here about 4 or 5 years now and Ive waited in line for hours just to get my craving satisfied. The omelettes are big & perfectly packed with fresh ingredients. The monte christo is my fav, especially because of the homemade jam. Oh, and not mention the melt-in-your-mouth french toast & pancakes. Mama's never disappoints :-)
author: Celeste C.

description:
This is the worst overrated place I've been in my life. 1h45 waiting in line outside. 20 minutes of wait inside. I was at least expecting to be blown away by the food. The food is ... MEH! 

Will not recommend this place to my friends.
author: Fred B.

description: This place sure does know whats up. The system they have in place is super efficient. You wait in line (we came on a Wednesday around 11 and waited approximately 45 minutes), once accepted inside for a table you go up to the counter place your order and then you get sat. It really cuts back on time spent at the table, get's people in and out quicker as well as gets you your food faster. We ordered 3 omlettes to share and then the chocolate cinnamon french toast. Everything was amazing! The JAM though that they give you for your toast is absoultely amazing. I could have eaten the entire jar. The ingredients are all fresh and delicious. I have absoultely no complaints. GO stand in line :)
author: Michelle R.

description:
Some friends and I wanted to tackle Mama's and the pretty epic line that went along with it.  Probably wouldn't have been as bad if it wasn't such a gorgeous (and HOT) day.  The wait was long, but they brought out water and samples of the French toast for us.  Pretty nice of them.  I also hadn't seen a lot of the people in our party in a long time, so the long line actually gave us a lot of catch up time.  

I enjoyed the food. My friends and I ordered a lot of dishes so we could do an around-the-table sample.  My favorite was probably the Dungeness Crab and Avocado Omelet.  It's so good and a must try if you come on the weekend.  It is pretty pricey, but I thought it was worth the price.  We also all tried to French toast sampler, which was delicious.  My favorite part of the meal was probably their jam.  I'm pretty sure it'd taste good on everything.  Even the omelets.

I liked the Florentine omelet.  I thought it was good, but there wasn't much about it that made it spectacular in any way and seemed like something that I could have made at home if I had the time to cook (or, more realistically, it seems like something I could have made the boyfriend cook for me).  And I liked the smoked salmon benedict  because I love love love smoked salmon, but I also realized that I don't really like eggs benedict.  Whatever. Judge me if you want.    

I'm still not sure what I thought about their bloody mary.  It's spicy and the first sip was quite a surprise.  The boyfriend described it as all Tabasco and pepper and no alcohol.  I love my Tabasco, so I can't complain about that.  I guess I enjoyed it after the surprise of the first sip. 

In the end, the food was great but I don't know if it was worth the wait.  Okay, maybe that crab omelet was.
author: Alea G.

description:
4 1/2 solid stars

whether you come early or late the food is always good, the staff is also friendly. this lil corner restuarant is in the city next to one of the larger churches maybe less then 2 houses away and across the street from a small park located in the north beach section of sf.

this spot is definitely a hit for residents, yelpers, out of towners, and word of mouthers haha 

the food is homemade you can just taste the difference between here and any other breakfast place only hassles we have here is the wait time, they do not stay open very late last I remember they stay open only til I think it was 2pm on weekends this is strictly a breakfast spot line is usually out the door and wraps around the street but if you can manage the wait then go for it. depending on the day anywhere from 5min to hour wait.

other thing that is very difficult to find here is parking it is the city and in northbeach area so get some good hiking shoes on haha. been here only 2 times and both times food has been to my liking, portion size just rite, flavor good, service excellent

food *****
service *****
price $ 
ambiance **** really small inside

parking = ( non existant bring out your hiking shoes
author: Clarence A.

description:
THIS IS A PLACE FOR EARLY B|RDS!

As everyone has read, there can be long lines. When I'm in SF I always try to make a point to go here. I love the food and I enjoy the brisk morning atmosphere! The only reason I didnt give 5 stars is because it can be difficult to find parking if you dont make it in early..
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Two words. A MAZING. 

I like breakfast. I don't love breakfast. Until I came here. 

When we showed up at 8:15 and had to wait 50 min I thought many times about deep sixing the entire affair and finding somewhere else to eat. I even pulled out the iPhone to check yelp for somewhere else nearby. My friends DON'T. 

When we finally got inside The chef was so friendly, the aromas filled my nose and transported me to another place.  Note that is CASH ONLY. 

I had the French toast sampler. Best repeat BEST I've ever had. I tried the eggs Benedict. Superb.   My coffee cup runneth over despite my fervent attempt to reach the bottom  The fresh homemade jam was outstanding. 

Hit this place before wine country. Even after the hour drive north you'll still be full. 

Next time I'm in San Francisco I will return. 

DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE. Well worth it. Best Breakfast ever.
author: Jay N.

description: Curious to try this place after reading reviews on yelp. Saturday morning Memorial Day Weekend, we got there before they opened, about 60 people were ahead of us, two hours of wait time in line. Waited some more once you got in. Monte Cristo with home made jams was really good! Good food and good service, but I won't come back again cuz I am not willing to wait for two hours.
author: CY L.

description:
I love this place very much. i usually order the french toast sampler and the egg benedict. the waiting was long but it is worth to wait.

CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!
author: Aris L.

description:
All SF restaurants I've been to with a wait like at Mama's have been worth it, with the exception of this visit. 

But I will start with the fact that we were greeted with the warmest welcome I have ever experienced. It was like being given a shot of happiness.

When you go in you order at the register, and then you get assigned to a table. Which is fine, but I just feel like this is slightly awkward if you wanted to order something after.  

We ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict, the French Toast Sampler, and the Marble cake. It was good, just nothing extraordinary. I almost want to say I've had better at just a regular diner. It tasted fresh (except for the cake) and homemade, but next time I'd definitely opt out for one of the other breakfast/brunch options in the city.
author: Barbie L.

description:
I'm not from SF but heard about this place from my cousin so we decided to check it out. I think we got there around 9:30 am on a Saturday. The line out the door didn't seem TOO long..maybe 10-12 people in front of us? But the line moves a lot slower than you would think which is because the seating area is rather small so it takes a while for turnover.  If it turns out to be a sunny day in SF, make sure you put on some suncreen and maybe even a hat cuz the sun hits right where you're standing in line and you can burn after waiting for so long.

The wait was worth it though. An hour and a half later, we were finally seated. Very cute cafe. You order at the counter and it's cash only so be prepared. 

We ordered the omelettes - Farmer's and Mama's Children's Favorite.  Even with egg whites, they were very fluffy and flavorful not to mention huge. Coffee was above average.  I was very tempted to try the french toast but maybe next time. 

Everyone walks out of this place looking happy so I'd definitely recommend this place as long as you expect to wait up to 2 hours.
author: Mona S.

description:
Best Brunch place I've been to!
The first time I came here, it was over 2 hours wait so I decided to leave. The second time I came around 1 PM and the wait was a little bit over an hour. I guess coming here at that time might save you some waiting time since they close at 3 PM. It sucked that we actually have to stand in line the whole time and then there's more waiting when you get into the restaurant. 
The boyfriend ordered French Toast Platter and I got the Prosciutto and Tomato Eggs Benedict. The French toast have 3 or 4 different bread and my favorite would be the cinnamon and banana bread. The fruit on top was really fresh. My Eggs was amazing. I think this really got me into egg benedict. The food was totally worth the wait, but if you plan on coming here, I suggest bring good company or something entertaining to do while in line.
author: Huyen N.

description:
Everything is great!  The line is crazy but it's well worth the wait!
Mama serves everything fresh and they have the most amazing breakfast!  It is difficult for me to pick what I want to eat everytime.  I have not had one bad meal here.  I do have some favorites:
**Crab omelette is amazing!  It's stuffed with crab meat and tons of cheese!
**French Toast served extra fluffy with powder sugar and fresh fruits!  I never feel guilty eating this:)
**MY FAVORITE: Monte Cristo!  I swear you will never have a monte cristo better than this one!  The best sandwich in the world!  It's the way it's prepared.  All fresh ingredients and it's deep fried!  Don't let the deep fried part alarm you.  It's really light and not covered in oil.  They fry it for a second to get that nice crisp on the outside of the sandwich.  They also serve it with home made jelly.  Gotta eat the sandwich with the jelly.  I promise you, its' blissful every single bit:)  Seriously, makes me love life more after eating this sandwich:)
author: Ying F.

description: I went last year and can't wait to go back next week! It's one of the best breakfast places ever. No scratch that. It's THE best!
author: Sue B.

description:
I love this place. It's an absolute MUST whenever I'm in the city. The Orange/citrus french toast ROCKS IT.  YUMM. I'm hungry just thinking about it. Droooooooooool.

P.S. It's Soooo worth the long wait. nomzzz
author: Mayraa E.

description:
Whew! What a crowd.

After searching for the best breakfast joint in the North Beach area, I stumbled across Mama's.  The reviews looked highly promising, so I decided to give it a whirl.

I woke up early on the first morning of my trip to SF, with hopes of beating the masses.  The air was crisp (and rather chilly) on my walk there, so my appetite was at full-strength, to say the least.  I arrived at 7:40ish, but to my dismay, the line was already about half a block long.  Being the persistent type, I decided to wait it out.  An hour later, I was finally at the front door.

The inside is a classic looking breakfast joint (think of your grandma's kitchen).  Once you're in, you'll have to wait in line again to order (it goes much faster though).  This is where the torture starts.  While waiting, you're forced to watch the chefs prepare all the amazing looking breakfast dishes that they offer.  They've also strategically placed the coffee cakes and other goodies in plain view.  Talk about  indecision.  

Ultimately, I went with the Rancheros (the Banana French Toast looked mighty tempting though).  It was delicious, and I'd recommend it to anyone.  The coffee here isn't fantastic, but it's not bad either.

The bottom line:

The service here is friendly, welcoming, and laid back...which seemed to be the case for all the places I visited in San Francisco.  The food tastes great, so get yourself out of bed early and go enjoy.  Just make sure you get there early (I wouldn't arrive any later than 8).
author: Michael C.

description:
Service: phenomenal considering there's always a long line. You pay first before being seated. Fresh ingredients and  friendly staff make this a warm and tasty place worth waiting for. 

Menu: creative drinks and specials that change from time to time. Inventive concoctions from varied types of french toast types a plethora of  omelettes to fill any hungry belly. Freshly squeezed OJ had me humming to a light tune in the morning. Instead of the usual potatoes as a side fresh fruit replaces it unless specified otherwise.
author: Sarah L.

description:
"Mama, mama you know I love you
Oh you know I love you
Mama, mama you're the queen of my heart...
Mama, I just want you to know
Lovin' you is like food to my soul"

I think Boyz II Men summed up my visit succinctly.
author: Sandy H.

description:
COME EARLY (or extremely late).  Goodness, my boyfriend and I had missed several brunch at Mama's due to it's line.  So one day, he just jumped out of bed and dragged me there so we can finally taste Mama's.  It was early.  It was pouring, and I stood under the eaves while he finds parking.  It was around 9 am, and the line is around the corner.  This place is like a breakfast assembly line.  There's a line out the door, and a line to order.  Maximum efficiency, I swear.

But yes, the food is worth it.  the Monte Cristo, the french toast, all of their french toasts are totally worth it.  The omelettes were good too.  I am not an omelette person, but I have to give it to Mama's.  Only my mama can make me eat what I don't like, and so can Mama's!

GO GO GO! it's worth it!
author: Carrie-C N.

description: Yes, you will wait in a LONG line to eat here but it is worth it!  We ate at Mama's on a Sunday this July and we got there right around 8:00 a.m. and we waited in line for at least an hour.  Everyone in our party loved their meal.  The staff is very friendly and they move quick to get food out and tables cleaned.  We had the BEST homemade raspberry jam and put it on everything we could, just as the waitress suggested and we would have all bought a jar if they had been selling it.  You'll wait no matter when you go but I would suggest not waiting too late in the morning or you'll wait a really long time.
author: Shop Girl S.

description: Monte Cristo and Washington omelets were good, but the wait is just unbearable. Wish I could give 3.5 stars. If going just on food, it's four Stars. Whole experience is 3 stars.
author: Soohyun K.

description: I knew there would be a wait, We love food it was hard for my wife to consider waiting over an hour,Seeing many people in front of us and many people behind us as we left everybody was having a good time. I wanted to be blown away with my dining experience especially after waiting over 2 hours 20 minutes to get into the door. We were in line at 8:45 my wife our 12 yr old daughter and myself it was Valentines day. We ordered 1 Crab Ceaser Salad, 1 Cranberry orange french toast, the French toast sampler & the North Beach Benedict so we could at least try the Hollandaise sauce. I just was not blown away with the food, I wanted to convince myself that what i was eating was the best breakfast in the City, all I could think was, is this all? It is good, fresh, the wait staff do their best in such a small place and the owner is very pleasant. My daughter was originally going to order the Monte Cristo but as we entered and about to order she saw the bowl of fresh cooked crab just sitting there waiting to be put into orders so the crab Ceaser was it for her, the Crab was very delicious. The North beach Benedict was very tasty the egg poached perfectly and the Hollandaise sauce was very good I had the french toast sampler, 3 different varieties of bread which seemed too dry, I had to add more jam which is home made and very very good. Then there was my poor wifey, she accepted the fact that at some time we were going to come here and wait, because this is a spot I have had my eye on, half way thru her meal which was the Cranberry Orange French Toast, she starts to get tears in her eyes immediately my heart sank, there was a curly hair inside the bread of her Cranberry french toast and she was disgusted thinking that she had consumed over half her breakfast thinking she had eaten someones hair. My wife immediately without causing a scene got the attention of  a server who came to my wife's side so my wife could show her the problem, My wife is Asain she has No curly hair and is currently a restaurant manager at a popular country club, she was so professional yet very mad about the situation. The server immediately offered to have something else made for my wife, and my wife politely said sorry She could not think about eating anything else. The server within two minutes was putting money on our table to pay for the cranberry french toast, I did not feel good about that at all.on the way out I suggested to the owner about hair nets. I have a hard time believing that this is one of the better Breakfast places in the bay good yes, but not the best. Mamas Royal Cafe in Oakland is just as good in terms of food quality. I put a no for the vote for good for kids, Parents I don't believe you should ever wait over an hour to feed your kids pancakes.
author: Joey C.

description:
Over 900 reviews kind of tells you something about a place.  My cousin recommended this place to me prior to taking my trip to NoCal.  I planned out my trip and I told myself this is going to be one of the stops for sure.  I see a lot of  people giving this place 5 stars and I can't understand why.  I got that French Toast Sampler and thought it was pretty good.

I'll tell you why I am giving this place 3 stars.

1.) This place is tiny 
2.) There's a line outside because there's no waiting area inside.  This is an advantage to the restaurant as people see the line and think WOW, this place must be really good.  If you have to wait more than 30 mintues....leave. .
3.) Once you enter the restaurant, you go to another line to place your order.  I thought I was getting seated when they said to come in...
4.) Once you place your order, you still have to wait for a table (I think most of the time, it will be ready...but the couple in front of us still waited some time before they got seated.
5.) They only take cash and debit
6.) Parking sucks
7.) Overpriced (I spent $30 for two people.  It's breakfast for crying outloud)

Should I go on?
author: Olivia J.

description: Food is good but expensive. Take it to go if  you live in the neighborhood. Otherwise you can skip it. I only order egg benedict and Monte Cristo there... to go.
author: Ricki H.

description: This breakfast spot was SO worth my 2 hour wait in line!  Conveniently located in Washington Square.  Their expresso drinks are quite good and their deserts look really good.  Sadly, I was too full to try one.  I had their apple french toast and their santa fe omelette.  They were delicious!!  They serve large portions so you'll definitely roll out of there, literally.  My girlfriend and I were on foot patrol so it served us well.  The servers were all over the place but super awesome.  Definitely coming back in the future.
author: Roxana K.

description:
I had being dying to try Moma's for awhile now.  On my last several visits to San Fran, I have been too hungry to wait in the hour line.   On this visit we however planned accordingly.  After waiting in line for a little over an hour we were welcomed into Moma's.  We had decided upon the Crab Benedict and but were still deciding between the French Toast Sampler and the Sourdough Apple-Butter French Toast.  We decided to ask the cashier for his vote on the French Toast, FRENCH TOAST SMAPLER he directed us.  

We sat at out table and were brought out Mimosa's (now they tasted good but my mom and I were convinced there was no actual booze in these things as we were both empty stomached and felt nothing).  

When our food arrived it looked yummy, but the meal was already cold when it was delivered to the table.  The Crab Benedict was good, not great but good.  The crab in it was tasty but the hollandaise was just average.  The potatoes however were at the same time slightly burnt and not cooked inside....hhhmmm.  The French Toast sampler was just disappointing.  The cranberry-walnut bread was good, but really didn't notice any egg toasted on it.  The banana bread while flavorful just crumbled when you attempted to eat it and the Cinnamon bread tasted like wonder white bread....very very disappointing  

I have had far far better breakfasts in San Francisco (like All You Knead and Dotties) and elsewhere, I don't get why people wait for hours here.
author: Laura J.

description: Long queue, small and quaint restaurant in North Beach. Service is good, we ordered the dungeness crab eggs benedict with spinach, which was fantastic, hollandaise sauce not too creamy, not too light, although they didn't put much crab meat for $20. We also ordered the apple yogurt french toasts with berries, bread was very cakey and heavy, didn't taste the yogurt, so if you like your french toasts light and fluffy, you should try the cinnamon swirl bread french toasts.
author: Ennie L.

description:
this place was on my list of places to eat for five years.  it's hard to find friends who are willing to get up super early on a saturday morning and to wait in line for breakfast.  luckily i found a partner in crime.  an hour and a half later, we were finally inside to wait by the counter looking into their open kitchen.  the wait was bearable since there were so many delicious carbs to ooooo and ahhh at.  

you order at the counter, pay, and sit when your table is ready.  this process works for me since the food arrives really quickly after you are seated. (yay!)  we shared the monte cristo and the vegetarian eggs benedict.  i really didn't know what the monte cristo was and only got it because the nice gentleman who took our order suggested it.  omg, it was the perfect combination of savory and sweet.  just think of it as a grilled cheese with ham made with french toast.  the jam was amazing but that's already been mentioned a gazillion times by other yelpers.  

with that said, i'm sure this review is sort of unnecessary since this place already has a rep for being rock solid and awesome.  so grab a friend, a cup of coffee to sip while waiting in line, and go start your weekend/day off on a really high note. :)
author: Sally T.

description: Totally worth the wait. We did have to wait over an hour to be seated, but there are a lot of nice coffee places in the area, so we were able to enjoy that while we waited. They have a nice selection of wine based drinks which we tried since we were in CA after all. These were quite good, though a little small. I had a mimosa which was great but tiny. We also had the bloody mary which came in a decent sized mason jar, and was nice and spicy. We ordered the Monte Cristo and the crabs benedict at the recommendation of the host. The monte cristo was huge and had a nice mix of flavors. The crabs benedict were amazing. The fresh made hollandaise sauce was incredible, with a perfect tangyness and spice in it. The crab was also definitely fresh. What else can I say, I loved it. I don't know if I'd go everyday if I lived there, but I'd definitely recommend it to visitors and would probably take any guests we had there first.
author: Tyler L.

description: French toast sampler and Monte Cristo sandwich: best things of my life! Waited an hour and a half on Easter Sunday, but worth it. Super friendly staff, didn't make you feel rushed and really attentive.
author: G F.

description: Went there with my wife and 2 kids for Easter brunch as we did not make reservations anywhere else.  Waited in line for an hour and a half.  Without hesitation, I can say that our breakfast/lunch was worth the wait!  My wife got the "Special" omelet, which was crab/avocado/cheese and she didn't care for it.  The waitress immediately brought us a different one, which my wife loved, and returned the difference in cash to our table.  She also brought my son an extra pancake because he "looked" hungry.  I had the "Blackstone" eggs benedict, the best I have ever had.  My other son had the Paisano, which he absolutely loved.  Because it was Easter, we each had a pastry (carrot cake, crumb cake, chocolate crumb cake, and lemon muffin), all of which were fantastic!  We will probably make this an Easter tradition and brave the long lines.
author: T S.

description:
Mama's never disappoints!  Be sure to get there early -even on weekdays- to get a table.  The line is always out the door, if not around the block.
Try the Dungeness Crab Omelette, so delish!
author: Natalie R.

description: Mama's was one of the best bistro I had ever tasted although the line was awfully long; we had waited for over 45 minutes before ordering our brunch!!!
author: Dawn C.

description:
i just can't have enough of this place. To kick off my Saturday, I decided to drive up to the city and rekindle my mama's bond. After 1 hour of waiting i finally got seated. Everyone in my group really enjoyed it. 
had Northwest momellete 
French toast platter 
dungeons crab omelet 
shrimp omelet 
Though everything was fresh flavorful and delicious, the shrimp omelet with Avocado and Cheese made my day.
author: Hasham Y.

description: Wow what a line! I read that lines can be as long as 2 hours to get in. Luckily, I only waited an hour, but it was still an hour. Was it worth the wait? I'd say yes because I had one of the best french toasts I've ever had. I got the trio platter sampling 3 of their french toasts. Everything is house made even the jam served. I'd go again!
author: Ron B.

description:
It is just as good as everyone says it is! I went with two friends (we were all visiting San Francisco) and we all had amazing dishes. We tried different types of french toast and I don't think I can eat french toast again without comparing it to Mama's. Also, they had this fresh raspberry jam at the table that was out of this world.
The wait is VERY long. We went on a Tuesday and we waited for 90 minutes. Make sure you add that in to your day because it takes awhile. Lots of small children in line were very grumpy- so maybe not the best choice with kids.
author: Katie L.

description:
MUST HAVE THEIR MONTE CRISTO! its probably the best thing they have in there. i would go here for brunch anytime.  Its absolutely delicious, filling and at a reasonable price.
I came here to eat with some friends and the customer service here was great, it was a great day outside and this made it even better.  once you're inside the restaurant, you can totally smell the great breakfast and brunched being cooked, it makes you want to order everything.

You should also try their eggs benedict, i had that a couple of days ago for breakfast.
author: Chris C.

description:
BY THE WAY, PLEASE NOTE THAT THE REVIEWER (me!) IS NOT A TOURIST TO SAN FRANCISCO, I AM A SF RESIDENT FOR OVER A DECADE WHO HAS A LOT OF EXPERIENCE DINING ALL OVER THE BAY AREA. 

WARNING: If you read this you'll be compelled to wage an all-hands campaign to revise, revoke, re-edit and break rank with any guidebook, website, blog or public record of any kind that recommends dining at... Mama's in North Beach. 

This place sucks, and it's not worth the wait AT ALL. Other reviewers refer to the scores who flock to Mama's as lemmings and victims of clever marketing. I couldn't agree more. Once I checked out other single star reviews of this joint, I was further appalled at how Mama's treats customers--"Moldy french toast?" that review was classic. Anyway, here's another outrage to add to Mama's list of spurned customers and embarrassing customer service:

Midweek the wait was still an hour from when I stepped on the line OUTSIDE to sitting down at my table inside. And, what's with the SECOND line inside the restaurant? You place your order with a cashier and PAY (cash only) without even the privilege of sitting down or taking a sip of water. ****What a great way to "trap" customers in the restaurant while you continue to wait standing inside to sit down at your table. And HOW CLEVER that they only take cash and they give you NO RECEIPT showing what you paid for and ordered!

Meanwhile, there I stood at the front of the big inside line with another single diner like neglected livestock in a very crowded high traffic area-- WTF??!! People squeezing past every few seconds. What rocket-scientist thought of this system? It doesn't make anyone feel welcomed or special. You immediately feel like just another tourist, and warm body in the pursuit of profit. It didn't take long for me to figure how their system totally benefits the owners, see **** above.

I repeat...WTF???!!!! 

What's even more sad. With this assembly line dining experience deflects, negates, amputates any poetry from the customer service experience. But, again, I don't think Mama's cares about customer service...

After another 10-15 minutes of standing and waiting, a 'host' approaches me and the other single diner, "Do you two want to share a table?" Again, WTF???!!!! That kind of instant chumminess might work in a more loving atmosphere but as I've now waited ages the last thing I want to do it make awkward conversation with a stranger who is obviously just as frustrated as I. The host is noticeably pissed when I say, no, I'd rather not do that, and once my table is ready he practically yells at me to sit down.

I sit down--more waiting. I even waited for ice water. YET, they have at least 4 people working the floor at a place that can serve only about 40-50 people at a time? Again-- WTF??!! Finally, my omelet arrives, and you know what, I'm so over this place that I don't even want to look at the indifferent host and the tourists who are shoveling food down hoping to justify the ridiculous wait.

"How are you?" said the server smiling sweetly. Too little, too late. I took my food to go and ate in the park. By the way, when they packed up my food, they gave me a small baby fork! Hello??????? And, no jam. WTF????!!! I swear, this fork was like a golf pencil with tiny little tines--how am I supposed to eat a crab omelet with that thing??? WTF???!!! Their response, "We don't have "real forks" right now... "

"I'll give the place 2 stars," I said, "if the food is out of this world." NOT!! The eggs on the omelet were not seasoned at all, too much avocado and not enough cheese inside, potatoes also very little seasoning, tomatoes--even during high tomato season in SF--flavorless&cheap!

Bland, pedestrian, predictable...Read all of the single and double star reviews of this place--they all attest that the food is very, very, very commonplace... similar and better can be found all over the city. They had a Sysco Food Supplier calendar hanging next to the register-- so you do that math. If you want a great brunch try The Butler and the Chef Cafe in South Beach, Foreign Cinema in the Mission, Brenda's French Soul Food in the T-loin--that place always has a line, but their beignets, shrimp and the Hangtown Fry are totally worth every second.

MAMA's in North Beach aka MAMA's on Washington is PURE EVIL... The epitome of old guard tourist traps--high prices, super-long waits (remember! the outside line AND the inside line!), indifferent staff and incredibly mediocre food. Their set-up of ordering off the boards and paying at the register instead of being greeted and served by a waitress-- i.e., PAY FIRST AND EAT MUCH MUCH LATER-- is laughable, horrible, deceptive and shady all at once.
