The kicker? In this age of composing yelp reviews on cell phones, Mamas don't take credit cards. (Yes, I composed this review as I stood in line INSIDE.)

NOT WORTH IT! NEVER AGAIN!!
author: E L.

description:
Unlike so many snarky posters here, I AM local, I live nearby, and yes, it IS worth the wait. I have never had anything less than an amazing experience here, over the years. I wish the tourists hadn't taken over. They have. I deal with it. Locals DO eat here; they are just out-numbered. But the tourists are so nice and grateful, so it's not like they are awful tshirt Fisherman's Wharf tourists. And yes, lots of places are wonderful in SF blah blah blah. But for me, there is only one Mama's.

Having said all that, if the line is more than ten people long, save yourself a headache and eat down the street at Cafe Divine, which has a full bar and delicious brunch food, or at La Boulange across Columbus. Or for my money, brunch at Zuni is terrific, but it's across town. Never go when the line is two hours long. Why torture yourself? 

Our neighborhood is wonderful at 7:45am. Arrive then. Just do it.

Frankly, I'd rather get my kids ready super early and show up at 745am, or come by late in the afternoon Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday. Or when it's raining. Hardly a long wait then.

Nowhere is there a place in SF that has as great a combination of every last thing you know you want for breakfast. Breads, cocktails, benedicts, meats, sweets, eggs....charm, setting, nice people.

In short, Eat at Mama's.
author: Girlie G.

description: I feel lucky to have eaten here based on the reviews and the long wait on a Saturday afternoon. Ordered the eggs benedict with their chocolate cinnamon french toast and everything was delicious, pretty fresh tasting as well. Their food gave me some new breakfast recipe ideas, especially that french toast!
author: Adam C.

description:
Food is 3/4 stars, but the lame wait outside pushes it to a two star rating. I would not wait one hour to eat here. Maybe, 15-20 minutes!

then you got the soup nazi atmosphere inside which kills the high rating. there's a weird vibe in this place. It's like being on a conveyor belt,  you move like a robot from one position to the next. Position 1/ wait outside for one hour, Position 2/make it through the door, Position 3/Another line to wait in, Position 4/Order meal and pay cash (what? no credit cards accepted!) Position 5/Wait for a table to be available, Position 6/Sit down and wait 5 minutes to get coffee, don't ask for coffee, because they will give you a snarky look.  They have a system for distributing coffee.

Hangout Factor: nill
I came with my newspaper, thinking I'll have a nice relaxing breakfast: sipping coffee, eating my breakfast, reading etc. It never occured to me that I would feel pressure to eat with efficiency due to the people outside waiting. They kept staring inside to see the progress on my plate. They should have a sign on the table that says "no lingering allowed, eat quickly"

You also have the people with the cameras. People pose with their meals at this place. 

The whole thing seemed a bit much. 

The food is fabulous, but life is too short for this drama!

 However, I do admit they know how to make the food visually stimulating. So, visually appealing you may want to take a photo.
author: Barbara W.

description: Went with a group, waited 2 hours, tried the monte cristo, crab benedict, and french toast. Pretty good, but totally not worth the 2 hour wait. Cute place, but a bit too much hype for my taste. It would have been worth a 30 minute wait.
author: Caroline D.

description:
After much hype and anticipation, we finally made it to Mama's. To be honest, the homemade Jam was the best thing there. I ordered the Washington Square omelette, which came with potatoes and toast. the portion was normal size, but i had maybe 7 potatoes cubes max, which was a shame because it was better than the omelette itself! I think Original House of Pancakes have better omelette and twice the size.

Overall: Totally NOT worth the wait, skip out on the food and just buy the jam.
author: Tina P.

description: Worth the wait. This is a perfect place for BRUNCH. Service here is so great which makes the food better, too. Definitely come here.
author: Phong N.

description:
I got woken up to come to this place at 7AM, grouchy and not exactly in the best of moods to hunt for parking in Little Italy, I was delighted by Mama's.

We manage to miss the wait heading on to Mama's and even had a decent table away from the freezing cold entry.

I never thought I could love a deep fried sandwich that much. Under my friend's instruction I had the Monte Cristo which was a plethora of cheese and deep fried goodness. My stomach felt like it was going to explode by how many of those things I was putting away.

He also got the french toast sampler which deliciously got eaten up. My favorite is hands down the banana nut french toast. I would stop by just to get baked goods from Mama's, it was definitely quite the treat.

My only big big thing was the selection of coffee and juices. I can't say that the taste of the juices and coffees top my list. They might wanna get a certified barista to start running the drinks. The Latte was extremely strong and bitter with no real bean taste and my orange juice tasted sort of like Minute Maid... 

All in all, I heard the line can be pretty insane, I would say go early and don't expect to have a lot of space. It's a tiny quaint little area with literally 10 tables. That or get there at 8AM. I would definitely come again and BMOB.
author: Winè C.

description:
I am never disappointed by Mama's. Yes, sometimes I'm disappointed by how long I have to wait to experience their amazing French toast but never let down by the experience itself. Granted I do try to avoid this places on weekends and holidays, I don't have the patience to wait an hour plus for breakfast! I did that my first trip to Mama's now I go on weekdays. It's a great place to visit on a random Tuesday! 

Here's the scoop: You have to wait in line to place your order and pay, afterwards you will be seated. The staff is super friendly and so patient even on a jam pack day! This alone impresses me! 

They have a huge variety of breakfast and lunch items. Love the fact that they also serve alcohol. Mimosa anyone? My favorites are the French toast, sour cream blueberry coffee cake and salmon scramble! YUMMY!
author: Marissa P.

description: Not a fan of the long wait, but it was worth it!  The dungeness crab omelette with avocado and Brie was divine, never knew that combination worked so well.  My friends had ordered the Dungeness Crab Benedict, French toast sampler, and the Monte Cristo.  Service was wonderful, no complaints there, but definitely bring cash or else there will be a $1 charge to use a debit card.
author: Calvin T.

description: The food was really great and rich, but a bit pricey considering this is a high end greasy spoon. But I have to say we liked everything.  The wait is annoying.  I'm glad I did it but would never do it again.  They should be savvy and at least sell coffee to the long line of people outside.  I waited for an hour.
author: s s.

description:
We waited for quite a while....

....there was a long line outside....

.....and then we continued to queue when we got inside.

I went for the shrimp and avocado benedict and ate it in our window booth whilst pointing and laughing at the large group of people going past on segways.

Whilst the food was tasty, I would have to say it was not special enough to have me rushing back to wait in line for soooo long. It is very cute and homely inside though, and the yellow decor makes it a sunny and cozy environment.

One plus is that because you order and pay up front, canteen style, it makes it quicker to leave once you have finished eating. Although, what if you suddenly got an important mystery phone call, and had to rush off before the food was served to you, but you had already paid?

Hmmm, I think I will be taking advantage of the other amazing brunch places SF has to offer before I return here...
author: Melanie B.

description:
So, this past weekend, my friend and I realized that we have been trying to go to this restaurant for 5 years.  FIVE YEARS!  Well, 5 years and 1 hour.  We woke up at 8am to eat there and still we had to wait in line.  Only you, Mama's, could drag me out of bed at such an ungodly hour on a Saturday.  

Well worth it, let me tell you.  That Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict is so ridiculously delicious.  The crab, the sauce, the egg.   The EGG.  Omg- perfect consistency yolk.  Slightly runny but mostly firm.  Juicy but not messy.  Uh oh.. I just started drooling.  No joke.  French Toast Sampler- GOOOD. Krughelegh or something was my faaaav.  Had dates, raisins, chocolate, some other deliciousness.  mMMMMM 

GO. Wait in line. And make your belly happyyyy.
author: Dee Dee X.

description:
My gf brought me here, since she had been turned onto it previously. The line outside was to be expected, I was told, and although it was 1/4 of the way up the block, it moved fairly quickly. You're let in only when a table has opened up for you. You wait inside until you get to the cash register, where you order your food/drinks and pay before you're actually seated (of course you tip after your meal). Reading the previous paragraph back to myself, it sounds like a long, tedious wait, but I assure you it's not. They've got an efficient system here, so it doesn't take quite as long as it would seem, and the food is worth a short wait anyways.

My smoked salmon benedict was great, but my gf's monte cristo was simply amazing. Easily the best monte cristo I've ever had anywhere. Next time I eat here, and there will be a next time, that's what I'm ordering. If you're in a time crunch and looking for a quick breakfast, or conversely if you want to read the entire paper while you sip on coffee refills, this is not the place for you. If you don't mind being herded and waiting for a bit, the food here is fantastic, and the constant lines obviously reflect that.
author: Patrick L.

description: best breakfast place i know.... be prepared to queue but i bet yah its worth it.... the place is quite small hence the waiting...but you get all breakfast faves!!!!
author: Myles P.

description:
So it would seem that one or two of you have heard of this place before. 

I had planned a day in The City and asked Angie W if she had any suggestions as to where I could stuff my face - as the weather has been beautiful, and I didn't want to be battling with tourists. 

"Mama's" she tells me, "...and you HAVE to get the Monte Cristo". 

To get the full experience, I arrive late and earn some Mama's stripes doing time (about an hour) in the infamous line. It occurred to me, as my fellow line-mates gawk at the food inside while rubbing their noses against the window like a Labrador in the back seat, certain tables on the inside must have some level of a fish bowl feeling to them. 

We get in, order, pay and sit down. That's right, unique protocol and nuances, right up my alley - loving this already! My Monte Cristo comes out and I'm trying to figure out who ordered the French Toast. I mean it's covered in egg, sprinkled with powdered sugar, and flanked by strawberry and orange slices. I must say this though: If there was ANY resemblance to French Toast, it ended there. Upon digging my teeth into my first bite, I drop my fork, pick up my cell phone, transform into a 14 year old girl, and text Angie W the following: "OMGOMGOMGOMGOMGOMG!!!!!!!!!!!!" 

Are you kidding me?!?! There was this cheesy meatiness that has to be experienced to be believed. Mama's serves a boysenberry jelly with the Monte Cristo that balances the saltiness of the sandwich with the sweetness of the jelly. Be careful here, the jelly is really sweet, so you don't need much. In fact, depending upon your tastes, you may not want any at all. Either way, frickin' delicious!!!!!!!! 

Let me tell you people, I may not have recipe for happiness, but I have no doubt in my mind that, what ever it is, it includes a Monte Cristo. 

I've been taking the pleasures of The City a bit for granted lately. I want to thank you Mama's for reminding me of the error of my ways. Life is too short to eat at IHOP.
author: Manuel S.

description:
Their Monte Cristo FTW! Balance of sweet and savory, perfect combination. Not too greasy, eventho everytime i visit, i need to wait 1-2 hours but i think it worth the wait. Fresh juice, fresh cook food, fresh fruit, no crap foods. Service was pretty good, friendly :)

I'm coming back :)
author: Ferna K.

description:
The wait! Why the wait?!

Well I'd heard about Mama's for years so the fam and I finally decided to brave the wait on a Sunday morning. Waited for 1 hour. Not too bad considering the line was a 1/4 way down the block! What we experienced inside was good, however it was far from spectacular or the best as we had been told. I'm not a huge breakfaster, however I know a really top notch place when I see it, and this was just ok. Definitely above average, but far from outstanding. I did enjoy the quaintness of the place and the staff was very attentive.

Smoothie-Delicious. Although you can't go wrong with bananas, berries, and yogurt all churned together.

Italian Omelette-Well done. Enjoyed the garlic cheese and pancetta stuffed inside. The potatoes were ok. The sourdough baguette toast was alright. I was hoping it had a stronger flavor.

Buttermilk Pancakes-Actually quite good, and I'm not a big pancake fan.

If I have the opportunity to go again I would definitely try the french toast or the eggs benedict, as those dishes looked very good.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
20 bucks for an omelet, waiting in an hour long line, finding a tomato sticker left inside my dish.  You would think this would result in a 2 or 3 star review but NOPE. -1

Mama's is the BOMB.  I did have to send my delicious Provolone, Bay Shrimp, Avocado, and Tomato omelet back.  However that can be forgiven as they quickly made me another one which was even more stuffed then the first.  It's not like it was a hair or anything gross. 

San Franciscans seem to be gluttons for punishment, they have long lines at many of their restaurants.  I arrived at 8:10 AM and there was a line 200 feet down the street, and the restaurant was full!!  Thanks to yelp I knew this would be the case, and I came prepared with coffee in hand.  I suggest you do the same.  "just a note when I left around 9:30 there was a line all the way to the next block!"

My omelet was fabulous easily one of the best i've had on the west coast.  The eggs weren't too oily, and the tomato~avocado slices were ripe, and fresh.  Some places may skimp on the shrimp, not Mama's they stuffed it.  And the melted, stringy, delicate provolone YUM.

Service was great, and the coffee was good.  I'll be back again, next time i'm trying the french toast it looked AMAZING.
author: Ben J.

description: I wish I could go here everyday except Mondays because their closed. I wish there wasn't a line because by the time I get to the front, it has already been 45 minutes, and I want to order more than I can consume. I wish I didn't do that! Or, I wish I didn't  reasoned with myself that I didn't spent 45 minutes in line, and in the sun just to order french toast! I wish people didn't stare at my food or at me eating. I wish my friend stood in line while I chill at the park across the street. I wish someone would remind me to bring cash because they don't take credit card or checks. I wish my friends treat me here every birthday. I wish they didn't stop serving at 3pm. I wish they serve dungeness crab Benedict everyday, and not just the weekend. I wish my stomach didn't give me the runs after eating it. I wish their bathroom was bigger. I wish not to think about that. I wish I dated the guy who made my slim Joe sandwich. I wish one of their dishes was named after me. I wish I knew how to make their banana nut french toast and homemade jam. I wish I could take all my friends there. I wish I was related to Mamas. I wish I owned the restaurant. I wish I didn't have food coma. I wish I could say, "I love you" to my friends Lynn and Meng at all times, and not just after we devoured food at Mamas. I wish this review didn't have run-on sentences. I wish my Mama was alive so I could take her there on Mother's Day. I wish for all of it to come true!
author: Po S.

description:
Decided to finally sign up for a yelp account because of today's amazing breakfast visit to Mama's. Although the wait in line was an hr wait in the rain... So worth it!  The waiters were so attentive to our needs and served our food impeccably fast!  The pancakes were to die for as was the blueberry crumble and their homemade jam. After we left, I noticed that the line was still out the door... Hope those ppl got in considering they close their doors early at 3pm. 

Can't wait to come back and try one of their Omelets!
author: Tiffany B.

description: My friend Diana took me to this place. She told me that we'll have to wait in line for a long time, but it's worth the wait. When we go there, there indeed was a long wait which took us roughly an hour and 45 minutes. We both ordered the Dungeness Crab Benedict and I've got to say it was the best benedict I've had thus far although it was $20.00 it was very good , and I'd go back again to try out their other items. Finding parking was a hassle especially on the weekends.
author: Ron P.

description: Typical story, arrived @ 11:00am, served @ 1:00pm, great food, out in 20 minutes! We had MonteCristo and smoked salmon benedict, both good.  Dont think I'll wait another time for 2 hours, but it was worth it once!
author: Bob L.

description: We've been here quite a few times for breakfast and there's always a line.  If you want to go on a weekend, someone has to get down there and get in line.  By 7 am on Saturday/Sunday morning, there's a line around the street.  The food is definitely 5 stars.  However, the wait can be looooong.  It's a bit pricey for breakfast.  The staff is nice and friendly.  Great location across the street from the park.  Great for kids, my children love it.  The Lalaberry jam alone is worth the wait.
author: t d.

description:
2 f-ing hours... 2 F-ING HOURS!!!

yes the food was delicious and the place is adorbs, but 2 f-ing hours at 830 in the morning on a saturday. c'mon.....the meal should be life changing

I ordered the farmers omelette, chiquita got a benedict, and homeslice got the monte cristo. I probably shouldn't have had so much focaccia from the bakery across the way but I was very happy with my omelette. I love leeks and it had plenty. The benedict was nom nom, hollandaise you make my knees weak and my heart skip a beat... literally, it's not really good for you guys but the best things never are... le sigh. I didn't get a chance to try the monte cristo. I'm afraid of cheese, lactard....

The servers are amazingly nice even though they're constantly busy. I learned a lot about this place while I stood in line for 2 f-ing hours. I think expectations were too high but places like this with waits this long usually are. Maybe one more try and definitely for the coma inducing french toast sampler.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Patience is a virtue...  That I don't have.  
So on a Sunday morning bright and early at 7:45am when I thought to myself, "Oh they open at 8am, I should be fine!" and then saw a line of 20+ people, my heart sank.  
With a cup of coffee in one hand and an umbrella in the other (yes, it was drizzling), me and 20 other chumps waited just a little over an hour to make our way into the small-ish place, watch the chefs cook up omelets, french toast, and benedicts.
We had mimosas, the french toast sample, and the special Dungeness crab benedict.  Everything was delicious, especially since we were starving by the time the food came.  It was good, but I don't know that I'd wait another hour to eat there again.
author: Maxine S.

description:
One word.... Bombbbbb....

Monte Cristo... i'll be dreaming of you until the next time we meet again...

Surprisingly the wait wasn't too bad believe it or not. Got here around 11AM, seated around 11:45. Great service, nice waitresses, cool little spot for breakfast/brunch. Definitely ya'll should believe the hype. I'd be down to drive to SF from LA again for some Mamas... jk, I wouldn't, but really it's bomb.
author: El D.

description: The best breakfast spot in Frisco. Well worth the wait in my opinion (if you're a morning person get there by 7:15). The Monte Cristo is extremely addicting. The home made jelly is what sets it off the top. You will not regret waiting in line for this restaurant.
author: Vik S.

description: Very long wait, great service, fresh quality ingredients.  The crab benedict was excellent, prices were a little high.  "Is it worth the wait?" Everyone asked that question.  Definitely one of the better breakfast spots in town.
author: Carlos S.

description: The food was delicious, but their allergen info was minimal. One waitress hardly knew what gluten was, and the cashier said that the chef who knew about gluten was out so she had no information for me. It was very surprising for such a popular San Francisco restaurant!
author: Missy W.

description:
One of my boyz came up from Arizona and wanted to hang in the city for the day. So we all decided to go to mama's for brunch. I haven't been to Mama's in so long that i was getting the craving.. So off we went on the weekend there is a line and you have to wait.  

So i dropped off my peeps to stay in line while I went to look for parking.  Never again during a weekend.  Looking for a spot  to park is a headache so if you can't find one go to one of the local parking lots.  

Once I got to the line we took turns waiting for our turn then you get through the door and there is still a wait for a table total time waiting 2 hrs. Was it worth it when I got my food it was.  LOL But i'll never stand in line for that long again and i'll go during the weekday.  

Now for the food I got a Slim joe a hamberger on french bread my daughter got a crab benedict in which she enjoyed but she eats anything with crab. My buddy got an omelet which he said made his day and we all shared the different kinds of coffee cakes.  Didn't want to move after a lunch like this.

If you are going go during the week days the weekend is nuts.  Go one time around then go to the parking lots it's a lot easier.  Will i return yup during the week day never again on the weekend.  The minus one is for the parking and the long line 2 hours is a little long. hat's my tip of the day to hang out at mama's
author: Mark G.

description:
Este lugar tiene mas de 1000 reviews! no se si tiene en Espanhol, pero bueno, para los que me entiendan esta BUENISIMO, si vienen entre semana , durante la manhana y en temporada baja entran sin bronca!, yo fui a Sn Fran a principios de Diciembre y entre semana desayune ahi DOS veces de los tres dias que estuve.
Rico, no tan baras pero bien servido! para que les cuento que el menu es amplio! lo que comi y lo que chismee de las otras mesas estaba muy bueno.
Bottom line: come eat here, but during a weekday and on a low tourist season....the food is great, but is more yum when you don't have to wait in line!
author: Gery C.

description: Best breakfast place in San Francisco. Correction: Best breakfast place EVER! I have been going to Mama's for over 20 years and although I get worried about the lines it is always well worth it. Just writing this review my mouth is starting to water. A MUST for every brunch lover. Highly recommend it and think they are why we have five star ratings on YELP.
author: Christoph O.

description: I love french toast and was super excited when I saw they had a french toast sampler. It was delicious, but the only complaint was the bread they used seem slightly old or dry so it could have been better. I did have some of my friend's Italian Omelette and it was excellent.
author: Jess H.

description: Yum! Loved the Apple Pan Dore! Not sure why no one seems to talk about it - but it is a MUST HAVE! Show up at 7:45am - you will still wait, but it is worth it!
author: Alisa S.

description:
There aren't many places that I would stand in line 40 minutes for. I can honestly say, every minute was worth it. This was hands down one of the best breakfast places I've ever been. 

Everything our party of 4 ordered was outstanding. The fresh squeezed orange juice, silver dollar pancakes w/fruit, french toast, m'omelette's, eggs Benedict, sourdough toast, JAM, nice strong coffee. Really, delicious. The omelet w/panchetta, basil, garlic, tomato and mushrooms, just the aroma as it entered my mouth, outstanding. 

I highly recommend Mama's. What a meal. The service was great and efficient. The staff was friendly. We polled the diners at the tables around us and everyone agreed: Fantastic!!! As we exited the back door, people in line asked: was it worth it? We all laughed and replied, Oh yeah!!! 

Had no trouble finding a parking spot on a Wednesday 10am. 

Go to Mama's. You will not regret it and your mouth will thank you!
author: Susan G.

description:
Long lines.....one would think its a good thing.

Maybe I should come here for late lunch......

mmmmm....craving omelettes again......
author: Summit S.

description:
We got here at 9:30am on a Friday in April and the wait was 1 hour! Maybe it's because of the nice weather; it seems half the people were tourists. We came at the same time on a rainy Friday back in December/January and there was no line.

It wasn't our first time here. We usually get the Northern Italian Omelet ($10.95) ... YUM! The pancetta and tomatoes are yummy and juicy. We've also tried the Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict which was really good but nothing too extraordinary. The homemade jam is out of this world, though! 

- Be prepared to spend a chunk of your morning lining up, especially if it's Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. Be aware that the line outside is just to get in. Once you're inside, you have to wait to order and pay, then wait for a seat. 
- Come with cash, though I noticed the last time I was here they took debit
- Tip money from the table before are left on the table so don't be alarmed. It's annoying but they will take it away once they give you your drinks.
- The place is small so it's not a great place to eat for big groups (more than 6 people)
author: Tina T.

description: My husband and I went for a very late breakfast. We arrived about 1:30. Wait was about 30 min. FOOD WAS FABULOUS!! Pancakes heavenly!!  We will definitely go back :)
author: Laura L.

description:
This was definitely an experience for me. Despite the rain and cold, the line BEFORE the line inside was still long. Once inside, the ingredients and chef's preparing foods fascinated me. I finally settled on a choice and then waited to be seated. 

They need a feng shui specialist to to help them manage their line/table situation but the food is totally worth the wait. This place would have gotten 5 stars if I didn't see a few flies hovering over the Cinnamon bread (gross, I know).
author: Morin O.

description:
I absolutely HATE breakfast, especially American Breakfast, no offense to anyone or the meal itself.  But this place has blown me away.  The omelets are delicious but the french toast is something else.  They don't use regular breads but rather breads like banana/blueberry/carrot breads.  It was absolutely superb.  The jam was also a kick in the mouth yum.  I can't recommend this place enough, but I have to warn you, come with patience.  My friend who dragged me to this place :) said sometimes during the weekends you might have to wait an hour or more.  So maybe feed yourself a cup of milk and patience and walk over.  Talk in line, people watch and simply enjoy the experience.
I had:
-smoked salmon and caper omelet (probably other stuff in it too :))
-French Toast Sampler (YUM!)
-Fresh Grapefruit Mimosa
author: John C.

description: Waited for 2 hours, but I would say definitely worth the wait. I had the mango smoothie, crab omelette with leaks and white cheddar and my bf had the crab benedict. Both were delicious and worth the wait. Next time I will be trying their infamous Monte Cristo.
author: Krista B.

description:
I was in San Francisco on a business trip and was looking for a place to have breakfast with my business partner. I came across this place and decided to give it a try. We got there about 9:30 and there was already a line up the block. This place is small and is very popular, so do be prepared to wait. Our wait time was about 45 minutes, but it was worth the wait. 

My business partner got an omelette which was pretty big in size which comes with toast and an a large OJ. I had the Dungeness Crab Eggs Benedict (which I highly recommend when it is crab season) also with a large OJ. I have to say, everything was super good. The jam for the toast is homemade fresh from a variety of berries and was really good. Not too sweet and not tart/sour at all. The OJ was super fresh and not sour either. 

I would definitely put this on a place to eat every time I go up to SF.
author: Steve Y.

description: I had the eggs florentine and it was divine!  The long wait was totally worth it!  Food was so great I almost immediately went into food coma, I lasted for about 1 hour and knocked out on the drive home!  Friends had some great dishes as well, omelet, hybrid of sandwich and french toast ( i think it was called the Monte Cristo), and the breakfast specials.  Very cute small breakfast shop!  We also had the chocolate crumb cake (very yum) and carrot cake.  Hope you enjoy this place as well!
author: Liz T.

description: Excellent breakfast/lunch place. I have been there for at least 10times. I actually dont like to wait at the restaurant. I always choose somewhere else that I dont have to wait. but This place so much worth a try!
author: Cay O.

description:
One word: HYPE.

OK, so I'm aware you have to wait in line. But if I wait in line for more than 30 minutes, I assume the food or overall experience is going to be mind blowing.  Not the case here and let me tell you I arrived 10 minutes before they even opened.  I think that the majority of people in line are tourists, so don't be surprised.

The food was decent, but really overpriced. Once you get into Mama's you get herded like cattle.  Not my idea of a good morning.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I can get a good look at a T-bone by sticking my head up a bull's ass, but I'd rather take a butcher's word for it. 

That's why when it comes to good brunch, trust the other 800+ Yelpers who call it one of the best spots in the city.

Go. now.
author: Alex H.

description:
i've been wanting to hit up this place for over 4 years and i finally did.  was it worth the wait?  not really.  

waited over an hour.  the food, drinks service were all okay but not worth the 1+ hour wait.  it is a very touristy place but heck, i'm a tourist.  

seems like the quality of food has gone down over the years.  there was a lot of exposed, prepared food and there were bugs flying around.  we decided to stay away from the fresh fruit (already cut up).
author: Julie Y.

description: The quality of the food did not at all live up to the length of the wait.  I knew about the wait, brought the paper, enjoyed watching the others in line, etc..  However, for that wait (2 solid hours), I expected to swoon over every bite.  I didn't swoon over one bite.  It was good, no denying.  But it wasn't great.  If it had a normal 30 minutes or less wait, I'd probably give it 3 stars for - not being able to customize orders, ordering at a counter and waiting inside some more, extremely tight seating.  Food itself - pancakes tasted very baking powder-y (though my husband liked them) and the bread on my breakfast sandwich totally overwhelmed all other ingredients.
author: Alia C.

description:
Okay, really?!

This place is way over-hyped. I live about 2 blocks away so I finally decided id suck it up and see what all of the hooplah is about. I am craxy and waited almost 2 hours, once I was in the door my expectations were incredibly high and wow was I ever let down. 

I didn't really love the pay ahead thing, and the waitresses purposely leave their tips on your table from the previous patrons as if to say "hey all I'm doing is running food and being rude but you still gotta tip because its america!".

I had the eggs benedict and a bloody mary. Both were just okay. 

If I ever get the hankering to stand in line for a few hours, I know where ill go. But next time I want good food quickly, ill be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Britney K.

description: I love the breakfast style here, very unique and tasty. Get ready to wait in line for quite a long time :)
author: Suabot J.

description: I don't understand the tourist hype; Mama's was good but not worth waiting outside for forty-five minutes.  Being unable to justify spending $30+ on breakfast, I decided against the dungeness crab benedict or omelet, but the Spanish eggs benedict hit the spot.  The eggs were cooked well and the chorizo, avocado and salsa added a nice touch.  The portion size was okay and the coffee was kinda mediocre, but the service was quick and friendly.  Gotta crank those tourists in and out to make that money.
author: Scott V.

description:
Usually I'm turned off by long lines, especially when you literally have to wait in a line (you don't get to put your name down and walk off).  The wait was definitely worth it.  Mama's and Zazie (Cole Valley) are probably my favorite casual brunch spots.

Everything looked so amazing I didn't know what to get.  I ended up with the dungeness crab benedict and I added avocado and brie (should have left off the brie). My boyfriend's dad ordered the Monte Cristo which is like a cross between french toast and a croque monsieur.  Everything was amazing.  The portion sizes were huge, I could have shared the benedict with my boyfriend, we were both stuff after only getting  half way through.

We're both savory breakfast people but their pancakes with fresh fruit look so good that I may have to go out of my way just to get the pancakes.  I wish they had a sampler plate...

Damn, just thinking about it makes me wish they did brunch for dinner.
author: Becca L.

description: Line up early and fast. Opens at 8 AM, but there was already a line at 7:45 when we arrived. Parking's pretty horrible, too, but it's all worth it. Really enjoyed my spinach, bacon and  egg hash. Homemade jam was a nice touch. Skip the baguette and get another bread type though. It was super hard and I almost hurt myself eating it. Looking back, I would've opted for the whole wheat English muffin. Looked pretty good through the window. Overall, good quality and quantity of food and service above average.
author: Peter D.

description: My favorite breakfast place ever and one of the most bright memories of San Francisco. Their Apple pandora is melting! Perfect light breakfast made my day.  Swedish cinnamon toast is creature of art, very juicy & melt taste!  Thank you guys for your wonderful meal!
author: Elena Wright S.

description: Wait was ridiculous, food was worth it. Monte Cristo was delicious, they didn't complicate the dish and it wasn't sweet. Their home made jam would've been worth the trip alone.
author: Michael D.

description:
Besides the hour wait.. this place has the most amazing fresh squeezed juice and Monte Christo.. along with all sorts of french toast kinds.. 
and the presentation!

It is a San Fran staple for me.
author: Lucie T.

description: Was told that this place was the bestest breakfast place ever, so I had to come check this place out myself. Stood in line to get in this teeny tiny place around 830am and was in awe at how many people continued to line up behind us. Almost had second doubts when cars driving by us repeatedly yelled out "its just pancakes". Haven't had a Monte Cristo since moving out here from the East coast, but the deep fried battered sandwich was delicious! Service was fast and efficient, food was solid. These prices are not your average IHOP prices, but the price is well worth your time, gas and money!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Mama's maybe one of the best breakfast meals I have had. Once I started eating I became a zombie and it was just me and my food I blacked out everyone else that was in the room only bad thing is the line can be long.
author: Kennedy K.

description:
My sister told me and my mom how good this place was supposed to be and insisted that we go.  So we went.  Honestly, I don't get it!  The wait was so long.  Okay, I've waiting in long lines for food in the city before.  But I was expecting pure awesomeness.  It just didn't do it for me.  I ordered some omelet that was meh.  My mom got eggs benedict...they were pretty good.  Better than my omelet!  The best thing on the table was my sister's french toast sampler.  

I'd rather wait in line somewhere else.
author: Shawn Y.

description:
Over-hyped, big style.

So to be fair to Mama's, the food is decent - they make all their own breads etc. and the French toast is yum. I had an omelette there last time and it was fine but decidedly average. My friend hated the coffee, I thought it was drinkable (as I am a caffeine addict) but it wasn't great.

Where Mama's loses stars however is the waiting times and the service. Don't get me wrong, I am happy to wait for good food (especially if said food happens to be at Dottie's!), but here the waits are ridiculous, especially at the weekend. Not worth it IMHO.... Other peeves - our waitress was downright rude, and not quite on it. 
Paying was a hassle as we were seated and had our order taken at our table, then when we asked for the bill were told that 'you already paid.' Err no. Then they rang up our order together and we got a roll of the eyes when we asked to pay separately. Also they charge $1 to use a DEBIT card.... so weird and annoying.

These issues make me not want to waste my time queuing like a lemming here, I'd sooner go to Pat's or La Boulange around Columbus for a does-the-trick breakfast without the lines and the attitude, or schlep to the Tenderloin for some serious breakfast at Dottie's.
author: Ciera M.

description:
Marvelous gem...

Positives:
- food was quick and superb

Negatives:
- parking
- the line was incredibly long (and we were starving!)

All in all: A in food, B in overall experience
author: Ashley J.

description: Quite possibly the best breakfast in America. Get here early & be prepared to queue, Mamas is not large & its strictly first come first serve, We arrived early on got in on the first serving, i had the Crab Omelet which i can still taste, oh boy so good, my wife had the French toast which was also sublime. Even though a huge queue outside we were never rushed by the staff, a great but pricey breakfast.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I wasn't all too impressed.
I understood the wait was going to be at least 45 minutes, so I won't deduct points from it.

Food - I had the dungeness crab benedict and wasn't blown away by it. The amount of crab given was extremely little (No, I didn't expect a whole crab), but it was not worth what I paid for. We also shared the french toast - That however, was much better.

Service - Very nice. Attentive and extremely polite; took plates away when necessary.

Price - Other than the dungeness crab, I felt everything else was reasonably priced.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
They key to Mama's is getting here early. Period. Otherwise don't come in a big group and expect to be seated and eating anytime soon. 

With that said, the food is out of this world delicious and SUPER fresh. I got the french toast sampler, and it blew me away.

First off.... they use BANANA NUT BREAD that is continuously baked throughout the day as needed for their french toast. ALREADY AWESOME

Then they pile on a good helping of fresh berries and a sliced up banana to go along with everything. Top it off with a glass of fresh squeezed OJ, now we're in business

All in all, a very yummy breakfast, and excellent way to start the day!
author: J B.

description: Let me start off my saying this is one the best breakfast's I've ever had and it is probably the best you can find in San Fran. That being said breakfast is a meal that can only be so good, there is a limit. If you are traveling to San Fran don't get stuck in the tourist trap and wait for 2 hours to eat here. No breakfast is worth that-use your time to explore something else instead-I wish I had.
author: Stephen L.

description: French toast sampler and monte crisco yummy!  The best bloody Mary I have ever had!!! Everything is fresh and all there bread is home made.
author: Shaneen O.

description: Oh so tasty! A friend and I decided that we'd show up early to beat the lines but once again we were foiled by loyal, local patrons. We ended up waiting in line for about 45 minutes to get seated. The space is super small but most people don't seem to mind and the line moves along at a reasonable pace. We ended up both ordering the scrambled florentine and shared an order of pancakes with berries on top of that. The scramble wasn't anything out of the ordinary but the pancakes were quite tasty. I'd definitely go back to try some of their other items (looking at you, french toast sampler & monte cristo).
author: Sannie L.

description:
Wow, that wait was long.

Once inside, though, they do a pretty good job of taking your order at the counter first before you sit down. Good expedite strategy.

Crab was really good, special of that day we went. Yum yum.
author: Edward C.

description:
I love this place.  It is delicious!!!  I've had their Florentine omelette and their pancakes.  I believe it was a crab omelette that I've tried before also.  Everything here was yummy, but the long line.... WOW.  HAHAHAH.  It was probably why the food tasted extra delicious, because by the time it was our turn, I was about to die of starvation.  I REALLY like this place, but don't think it's worth the hour wait.  

Ambience: 
Very small and packed place, but they somehow made it all work.  Very cute date spot I would say.  Love the cute swinging picket-fence-like door. =)  There has not been a single time I've seen this place with no line.  That was my reason for waiting so long to try it, because the long line was quite discouraging when I know there are so many good restaurants in the area.

Price: 
about $15 per person including beverage.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Delicious brunch! The Monte Cristo was SO well done... I will go back for that alone. Delicious, fresh jam to go with it.

The French Toast was also really good (I just tried the plain cinnamon.) It wasn't anything insanely innovative or anything, but it was just quality, fresh food.

The line is worth it!
author: K. D.

description:
food: three stars (* * *)
Let me start by saying that the coffee cake was the best I've ever had.  I got the French Toast Sampler and the Northern Italian Omelette.  The french toast came in three flavors: cinnamon, cranberry walnut and banana.  All three were good, but not exceptional.  The omelette was also tasty, with a nice combination of flavors, but nothing I haven't had at other places.  The fresh-squeezed orange juice was delicious, but that can be had anywhere as well.

environment/service: three stars (* * *)
Our servers were courteous, but the wait was obscene.  Though not entirely the fault of the restaurant, the restaurant could certainly expand a bit, as there are only about 10 tables inside.  The restaurant environment itself was pleasant, but not exceptional.

value: three stars (* * *)
The prices for the food were somewhat steep in my opinion.  $4 for an average size of fresh-squeezed orange juice?  $13 for a plate of french toast?  Nothing that would break the bank, but up against comparable breakfast establishments, it was on the higher side.

average of
food: three stars
environment/service: three stars
value: three stars
================
averaged grand total: three stars

estimated price per person (excluding drink):
$8-15

would i recommend it to others?
It's good breakfast food, but not worth the wait.

would i return?
I would not wait an hour and a half again for the food.  For 30 minutes, I think you can have food that is just as good (and often better) at St Francis Fountain.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
French toast sampler = amazing 

Waiting in line for nearly two hours on a Sunday afternoon was painful but so worth it! If you have good company and some iPhone games, the wait isn't so bad :)
author: Meghan B.

description: I don't know what all the fuss is about! I came into SF from SD and this time I just HAD to try Mama's becuase of all the hype. I went on a Friday morning right when it opened, there was a small line, but I got in right away. So you wait in a line while you walk past the "kitchen" and you better know what you want by the time you get to the counter. The place is cute and clean. I didn't appreciate, however, not being able to sit with a menu and make a solid choice. I chose the "light" french toast, which I have read so much about....this was the heaviest, stickiest, most dense piece of "bread" I have ever had...I couldn't even eat it! I was pissed. I did have a few bites of a friends meal which was the eggs benedict with potatoes. It was great. But for $10, I can go elswhere. Best part about this place other than the atmosphere, the fruit.....which I can get anywhere.
author: Amanda H.

description: Decided to try this place after seeing such rave yelp reviews. Was not anticipating at 20 minute wait on a Tuesday afternoon, but that's a testament to the quality of this place. Very cute decor, and the staff truly works hard to get everyone seated and fed as efficiently as possible. I had the shrimp omelette and it was great. Would recommend!
author: Emma A.

description:
About a year ago, we stopped in San Francisco for a couple of days while traveling from Redding, CA to Newport Beach, CA to visit friends and relatives. I found Mama's on Yelp and we decided to give it a try. Since it was the middle of the week, we didn't expect to find the long lines that apparently form on the weekend.

When we arrived the place was packed, but we were able to order and find a table in about ten minutes. My wife talked me into having an egg-white omelet, which I had never had before. Needless to say, it was absolutely fantastic. We each also had a muffin, which were wonderful.

We are going to San Francisco for a couple of days with friends in a few weeks and will definitely have breakfast there. The biggest problem will be deciding what to order, because everything is so good.
author: Gary A.

description: Average breakfast food  (I prefer my own pancakes). The wait doesn't make it better -- it makes it worse. A guy I was dating took me here one morning and I just thought how lame he was to fall for some hype and starve while waiting for average diner food. But hey, if you're someone who thinks the wait makes things better, have fun standing in line. Being almost too hungry and grumpy to even taste the food is a bad thing in my opinion, especially when the food is not anything extraordinary.
author: Veronica L.

description: I was dubious because of the hype, but seriously this breakfast was amazing. The monte cristo was a life-changing experience... it's like the perfect marriage of french toast and grilled cheese. The french toast sampler was also scrumptious. Fresh ingredients, close attention to detail. Highly recommended.
author: Stephan L.

description:
San Francisco Food Fantasy Trip... take two.  Ok... so the Mrs. and I planned a 3 day trip to San Francisco... let's see... what's on the list... Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, the Wharf??? NOPE.. this is a food only trip.  No tourist stuff here.. no time for that.... JUST FOOD, FOOD, and more FOOD... plus 12 hours of sleep to take breaks between the food.

This place is on the best of Yelp's list of SF.. it's also listed as the best breakfast place according to ZAGAT... those kind of marks put a lot of anticipation in my stomach, and my appetite was ready for the challenge. 

The quick summary;
15 minute quick walk from Pier 39 area hotels...
Went on a Friday 10am... 1hour wait in line
FRESH FRESH FRESH
They make their own bread, their own jam, their own pastries...
Strawberries, blueberries, soooo fresh sooo good
They cook like 2 feet away from you.
Pancakes so good.. you actually want more.. even though you cannot move.. you want more.
Orange juice so fresh...
Even the tour buses stop so the people can take pictures of the line out the door....

A must stop if you are in the area... the wait in line might have you thinking =--- do I really want to wait over an hour for some pancakes? YES YOU IDIOT.. IT'S WORTH IT!!!!

The best breakfast I've ever had???  I have to say yes.. I mean I've had better pancakes, better eggs, better potatoes... (not better jam though)... but I've never had all the breakfast items taste so good all at once before.. everything was at least an 8 or a 9.. the jam and OJ are a 10!!!
author: David M.

description: Yum yum yum. My mom and I arrived around 11:30 and waited for about an hour and half in line. Worth the wait? You betcha! My mom got the orange-cranberry french toast with fresh berries and omg, it was super delicious!! I ordered the shrimp omlet and was amazing with the potatoes cooked just right. We also ordered their fresh mango smoothie which was super duper fresh.
author: Christina Y.

description:
I heard from at least 3 San Franciscans that I needed to go to Mama's for breakfast, and so I directed my friend's GPS to take us to the promised land.
After an hour long (and then some) wait, we ordered our breakfast at the counter and paid, then waited a little longer for a table. The food was delicious--I had the californian omelette which was chock full of bacon, avocado, and montery jack cheese. My friends tried the dungeness crab benedict and the neopolitan benedict, which I am told were both delicious. Actually, that's not entirely true, I know the dungeness crab benedict was good because I had a bite of it and swooned with delight. The OJ was fresh squeezed, the service was friendly, but it wasn't a sit down restaurant where you get individual attention from one server. I would say that this place is great and worth going to, but if I were strapped for time, I would rather go somewhere that I could sit down and enjoy a leisurely breakfast that I didn't have to wait for over an hour to eat. The bottom line? Mama's is great, but your time might be better spent exploring the city than waiting in this monster of a line just because Mama's is in the Zagat guide.
author: Winona R.

description: Had vegeterian quiche, very well cooked, service was great. Definitely worth coming
author: Itisha J.

description: best breakfast in SF! I had the chocolate cinnamon french toast and washington sq omelet. the homefries were ok...i think dottie's has better homefries but the rest of the dish was delicious! the omelet didn't need anything else added to it. it was filled with the right flavor! only reason i'd give it 4 stars is the line you have to wait in. it is worth the wait but it isn't a place i'd go to if i was really hungry or in a rush because the wait was about an hour long.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
So today the bf and I decided to leave our isolated oasis in Noe Valley and see what the big deal was about Mama's in North Beach.

From the time we got in line until we received our food was about 1.5 hours.  I ordered the eggs benedict florentine, him the eggs benedict with prosciutto and tomato.  Overall, the food was quite good, but I'm not convinced it merited the arduous quest for parking and the gargantuan line.

PROs: amazing crumb cake, hollandaise sauce has a nice tangy bite to it, poached eggs had a nice runny center

CONs: undercooked home fries, underseasoned spinach/mushrooms on eggs florentine, and I really wish my meal came with some toast for that tasty looking jam they had on my table

I would normally forgive the "cons" listed above, but if I'm waiting 90 minutes for you to give me food, you should be able to spare an extra couple minutes to cook your potatoes completely or to season your veggies more thoroughly.

So far, I feel like I could have gone to Savor or Pomelo in Noe Valley and had an equally good meal with 1/3 the wait time.  

But, Mama's did have a pretty enticing selection of french toasts, so I'll have to return again (on a weekday hopefully) to judge the sweet stuff.
author: Bipasha M.

description:
Hands down the most wonderful, amazing, stupendous, finger-licking, life-changing breakfast I've had in my LIFE! Mama's is SO worth the wait-- I've stood in line for an hour (three times!) to devour their Blackstone Benedict and perfectly concocted Mimosas. 
Don't be afraid of a line out the door, you'll forget about it as soon as the first bite hits your lips. If you are a little more impatient, go on a weekday when the weather is bad, the lines are shorter. Either way, do yourself a favor and GO.
author: Kenzie P.

description:
You know, the first time I had Mama's, I loved it.  I loved it the second and the third, etc. then I stopped going for a long time.  I tried other brunch places.  My bf likes to cook and so he made his own version of a crab omelette.  

Now fast forward to this past weekend.  We wake up at like 7:45 to go to Mama's and hopefully beat the long line.  We get to Mama's by 8:15 and there is a line, but we wait way less than usual.  We order the chocolate french toast, crab omelette with brie and crab eggs benedict.

The food came out and it looked absolutely delicious.  Just like I remembered.  However, unlike what I remembered, it was just okay.  The crab didn't taste as fresh as I would like.  The omelette barely had any cheese.  The french toast was decent, but I can't say it's the best french toast I've ever had.  Definitely nothing to write home about.  It was very sad.   

So I must say, adieu Mama's.  You're no longer worth the wait.
author: Kristine B.

description: It is an extremely popular place obvisly since there was a long line outside. I liked it but not too terribly impressed. Regular breakfast menu.
author: Sophie R.

description:
If you can tolerate the outrageous line, Mama's is quite possibly the best brunch in the City.  

+ Amazing quality and freshness,
+ French Toast is handmade and full of flavor,
+ Mama's makes a Monte Cristo sandwich that's quite possibly -- the best I've ever tasted --  in my entire life.

Give 'em a try and see what all the fuss is about.  Mama's is the real deal in splurging for a decadent Sunday morning brunch.
author: Nate H.

description:
I've been here off and on over the years.  BFF was visiting from LA and we decided to go to Mama's because we grew up in the 'hood and thinking the line would be short since everyone was crazy running the Bay to Breakers in 90 degrees weather and I wanted some foccacia from Liguria Bakery across the street. 

Boy, were we wrong. Arriving at 10:30 AM, we had to wait 1 hr 15 mins for a table for 4.  My feet were killing me from standing in heels for that long.
I tried something different this time, a veggie quiche, which was good, served with a green salad dossed in too much oil, a slice of orange and a whole 4 inch bagette, halved.  Hubs had the burger served in a French roll, it was OK but he thought it was too oily.  BFF thought her cinnamon French toast was wonderful and loaded on top with a ton of berries. Her hubs had an omelet which he liked, but couldn't finish.  The meals came to about $45. Food was nice but NOT worth standing in line for 1 hr 15 mins.  Thank goodness we were not in a hurry anywhere and wanted to catch up before she flew home that afternoon.  Even better, they're painting the building and the scaffold shelterd us from the scorching sun.
It's CASH ONLY.
author: Ry T.

description:
I came here with a friend for a late Sunday brunch. We were the 2nd to last people let in before the cut off the line. Still had to wait awhile though and I'm not sure the wait would be worth it during prime brunch time.

I got the french toast sampler, which was really good. The different benedicts looked very good, especially the one with crab (a bit expensive though). I dunno, there was a lot of hype surrounding this place, but I thought it was just ok. Portions are pretty big and the service was good once we got inside and sat down.
author: Kenny J.

description: Great place for brunch. Unfortunately, you can expect to wait an hour to get seated.  You might have to feed a meter or entertain yourself  while you're in line. Nice to have a park across the street to hang out while you make your friend's "little"brother wait in line for you.
author: MC C.

description:
it's been a while since I've been to mama's... it's not because I don't like it... it's just that I can't wake up early enough to get there on time to not have to wait an hour!  AND, I hate traveling to that area of SF because parking sucks.. and there are no direct bus lines from the inner sunset. =(  SF weather is also unpredictable and can be freezing cold! 

This place lives up to it's hype.  If I were a morning person and lived closer, i would definitely come here.  Their omelets are big and they also have a variety of combos to choose from!  I can't remember exactly what I got, but I remember being blown away by my food... I didn't want to share any of it! =P  

Here's a tip for all you willing to stand in line... look at the menu and decide what you want before hand.  Once you enter the restaurant, you go to the cooking area and order what you want.  No time to sit and decide what to get... Their specials are probably the best thing you can get... crab omelette or salmon?  DAMMN. Can you say YUMMY IN MY TUMMY?!  everything there sounds good... so you'll probably take the entire time standing in line to decide what you want... and then when you get to the counter and see everyone else's food, you'll change your mind =P

Prices can be steep for breakfast... but it's worth it here.  Writing this makes me want to come back soon!!
author: Diane L.

description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place on a Friday afternoon and had no idea what to expect.  We saw a long line, so we assumed the food was good and we were right.  I was impressed with the fresh food and friendly staff.  Both my bf and and I ordered the eggs benedict and they were really good.  The people next to us ordered french toast (which looked really good as well) so we asked our waitress to bring us cinnamon french toast with fresh strawberries, and although I could barley eat three bites, it tasted excellent. If the wait weren't so long I would have given this place 5 stars.  Can't they make it bigger?
author: Steph L.

description: I just don't understand the fascination with this place. The food is good, but I wouldn't wait in line to eat it. I give it the 3 stars because of the line. Do yourself a favor and have brunch somewhere else without the wait.
author: Brad C.

description: Man, this place is over hyped. Had the special crab benedict and the bacon benedict, not worth the $35.00.
author: Mike K.

description:
There are enough reviews here about this. It's a greasy spoon, but done well. Incredibly friendly wait staff. Seriously though, 2 full hours waiting outside (and I got in the line that went around the corner past where Mama's building ends at 8:15 and was actually sitting at a table at 10:15). 

Get up early or pay a bum $10 and a Rogue beer from across the square to stand in line for you starting at 7:30am (they open at 8).
author: Terika B.

description:
It's a long long wait (even on a weekday) in line. It's on the borderline of me not wanting to wait anymore for their food. However, if I was able to forgo the 1+ hour wait, the food would be worth coming back for. The french toast was delicious and the omelettes are huge! 

So 4 stars for the food, but 3 stars with the wait.

Specifically, what's getting me coming back is the Monte Cristo. It has got me tied around its finger. At first I was unsure of it, but the combination of ham/turkey/cheese grilled like a french toast worked so well together. It's like a perfect breakfast taster all in one! 

Maybe I just need to avoid the weekend craze.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Good, but not a amazing experience. Long wait in line, get there when it opens and you may limit your wait to 1/2 hour.
Dungeness crab Benedict would rate 3-4 stars.  Special crab sandwich was ok. Pancakes very good and fluffy, flavorful. Fresh squeezed OJ was very good, but not much to say about that. Coffee not terribly strong and had to ask repeatedly for refills.
Glad I went but a bit overpriced, and service was ok when you finally get a seat.
I would skip the line and order some French toast and/or pancakes to go next time, and binge on a carb-overload. The French toast looked incredible as it slowly and methodically passed by me repeatedly
author: John S.

description: I have ate her many times and it is always worth the wait....  You gotta try the fresh French Toast....   yummy
author: Brent V.

description: FANTASTIC!  The best french toast anywhere!!!  3 different breads that resemble the finest cakes around with wonderful berries, raspberry jam, syrup -- We can't wait to go back!  The special eggs florentine with fresh crab was out of this world too!  Every ingredient including the spinach was fabulous!  This is by far my favorite place for breakfast!!  Plan to wait--we waited about an hour but we left HAPPY, SATISFIED and Eager to return.  We ordered slices of Old Fashioned Crumbled cake and Carrot cake to go--we knew we wanted to wake up to more than the memory of such a fine eatery!
author: Jeff P.

description:
4.5 Stars - - This is one Hot Mama. 

Pros: Consistently high quality breakfasts. I've been here 3 times with groups of 3-5 people, so I've heard direct feedback on 12 or so different menu choices. Invariably, all the people I dined with here said their food was very good to extraordinary. Mama's is a SF breakfast landmark from the past, it's been here for years and you can read some of Mama's history via wall-framed newspaper articles from long ago. North Beach location (on Washington Square near Coit Tower and many other sights) is awesome on a sunny morning, especially if you want to show some out-of-towners a slice of SF magic.  Yes, there really was a Mama, and you know mama knows how to do breakfasts right. This looks like one of those rare places where I think I could order almost anything off the menu and not be disappointed. 

Cons: Seems a bit overpriced, even for the high level of quality. Mama's seems to be on the tourist circuit, thus: If you arrive after 9 on weekdays or 8:15 on weekends, be prepared to stand in a 20 minute to 1+ hour line that extends around the block.  Oh yes, arrive too late and the entire Mama experience changes:  you'll be stuck hangin' on the street in line with a motley & sometimes loud crew (read: don't even go after those times). Very few tables (12 or so), cramped space throughout, the entire place isn't much bigger than a small convenience store. But surprisingly charming ambiance packed into in that small space, and damn good breakfasts. 

Go early, beat the crowds, and enjoy a leisurely breakfast that *gasp* rivals your own mama's best.
author: Jack H.

description: Ok after living here in telegraph hill my punk ass finally went to mama's. After years of laughing at all the losers who wait two hours on a saturday morning for breakfast i decided to go here on a tuesday morning. My initial thought when i walked into mamas was... "what took me so long to step in here." I love the fact that u pay first before u scarf ur food. I ordered 3 pancakes for $7.75 and they were excellent. I didnt even need syrup.. (wait im lying my greedy ass used three lil thangs of syrup) well worth the food and the staff was mad friendly. Even complimented my fake burberry scarf hahhaahah
author: Tareau B.

description:
This is by far the BEST brunch I have ever had.  We got there around 9am and waited in line for about an hour and half, and it was so unbelievably worth it.

My boyfriend ordered the dungeonass crab eggs benedict and I ordered the crab breakfast sandwich (crabmeat, egg, gruyere cheese on brioche bread.  We ordered the french toast platter to split (a plate of banana bread, cranberry walnut bread, and class french toast).  Probably enough food to feed a medium sized family, but we couldn't stop.  It was so amazing.  

The service was immaculate and everyone working there seemed happy despite the hectic chaos of being so busy.  I can't wait to go back again.
author: Samantha K.

description:
Nom nom nom nom nom!
Monte Cristo, omg.
I'd like to give this 4.5 stars as I can't quite do 5.  The hash browns and mimosas were merely good.
author: Emily W.

description:
There are 3 meals in a day.  I could have breakfast for all three.
If there were 9 meals in a day, I probably could have breakfast for all nine meals.  

You get the picture.
 
So when one of my most treasured girlfriends called and said the magic word "BRUNCH"  - I was all over that like white on rice.
 
I have heard of Mama's occasionally, but had never been.  I've basically remained faithful to Pork Store or Yank Sing for brunches, but with a considerable amount of time on my hands on this Thursday morning, we headed to Mama's to wait in line w/ infant in tow (not mine... hers!).  Though it was a pretty hefty line - I have to say that it moved rapidly, especially for such a SMALL restaurant!
 
It's an odd setup.
When they let you into the restaurant, it's to order.  It doesn't necessarily mean there's a table open for you, but somehow, by the time you order and wait around for a little bit, one table opens up.  On this day, we scored a corner booth which was perfect for my friend, the baby, and me.
 
She ordered the "Monte Cristo"?  I tried it, and found it just decent.  If you like Monte Cristo, this is probably very good, but I am not a fan of the dish / concept itself.
I ordered the Farmer's Omelette, and it, too, was just decent.  It was definitely bland, and there was just nothing impressive about this dish except that very fresh ingredients were used.  It needed more of a kick, and the combination of ingredients were a bit of a letdown.  Also - the home fries / potatoes were not all that great.

The Bloody Mary(s) I had, though, were great!
 
Service is excellent - - extremely friendly, and on top of everything!
 
So while I didn't really enjoy the food as much as I do at Pork Store, I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the company.  I would not have a problem coming back here as a regular, but factor in the wait-time, and chances are likely that I'd wait at Pork Store for a good, greasy breakfast over Mama's.

Still, it was as nice meal!
author: Grace K.

description: This place is delish! Went with four of my girlfriends, and we were waiting in line for more than an hour, but we exchanged places while the rest of the gang walked around the neighborhood. Gotta get them sweet pancakes and french toast. Big breakfast, worth the wait. But do yourself a favor, get there earlier, and go through a faster line.
author: Johanna W.

description:
Food:
I got the Dungeness Crab Benedict, which was so nicely balanced.  The crab came in the form of big, plump chunks.  The hollandaise sauce was light.  The baby spinach added a nice bitter flavor. The English muffins were perfectly toasted.  The side of grilled potatoes were cooked just right.  My only criticism of the food was that the eggs were just slightly overcooked.  I like my poached eggs to have runny golden yolk to gently ooze over my plate.  Although the very center of the egg was creamy, it resembled more of a soft-to-medium-boiled egg.
He got the French Toast Sampler, another well balanced dish.  They use 3 different house-baked breads and top them off with bananas and a trio of fresh berries.  One of the staff tipped us off to using the house-made olallieberry (a blackberry-raspberry hybrid) jam that sat on our table, which made a great breakfast plate even more amazing.
There is not much on the menu for vegans, but ovo-lacto vegetarians will rejoice!

Price:
Some things are more expensive than others.  The majority of their breakfast and lunch items are reasonably priced ($7-10).  A few select items are a little on the pricey side, but justifiable.  Substitutions cost extra.

Ambiance:
The interior is kind of small (hence the long waits), but so cute and homey.  I felt like I was in Mama's cozy breakfast nook.  Photographs and newspaper clippings about the establishment decorate the walls. We came on a day where the rare San Francisco sunlight poured into the room, creating a soft, sweet glow.

Restroom:
I wouldn't describe the bathroom as an "outhouse" like another Yelper wrote.  OK, it's not your traditional WC; you have to walk through the kitchen and outside and down a small set of stairs.  There is only one and it is unisex (so it smells a little like sperm).  But it's got a toilet, mirror, soap, and sink... what more do you need?

Parking:
Sucks.  You can drop off your friend(s) to wait in line while you circle around looking for a free parking spot.  Or do what I did:  I walked from my hotel, which was in Union Square (Tenderloin-adjacent).  It was a brisk 30-minute walk.  Just about all of SF is walk-able (that is, IF you are able to walk).  Or take the MUNI (30, 39, 41, 45, 8X).

Overall Review:  
There is a reason why there are over 2000 highly favorable reviews (and counting) on Yelp.  There is a reason why Mama's consistently finds herself on numerous "Best of" lists.  There is a reason why people line up around the block and wait 1-3 hours.  I have waited 4 long years to try this place.  Was it worth the wait?  Yes!  Does it live up to the hype?  Yes!  Will I be back?  Yes!  Is $20+ a bit much to pay for a breakfast plate?  Yes, but I have to take into consideration that they use REAL crab.  They get bonus points for giving back to the community.

Tips:
Go early.  Like, 30-to-45-mins-before-they-open-early.  If you don't want that big of a wait, I would recommend that you also go close to closing time because they do serve breakfast all day, BUT you may run the risk of them running out of certain food items.
Certain dishes are only available on the weekend.  Use that opportunity to try something that you wouldn't be able to get Tuesday-Friday.
Bring cash or your debit card.
author: Cindy K.

description: Long wait, no space to sit..WHO CARES!  I would wait all day to get this breakfast again and sit on the floor.  I ate here a few months ago, just haven't had the time to get this review in.  I had the salmon eggs benedict and pancakes.  We ate here on a Sunday and of course there was a line out the door.  Your wait outside and as soon as you're in you order and they seat you.  Service was great and the atmosphere is sort of like a small cottage.  The portions are huge, no joke!  Those pancakes are to die for!  Got anyone visiting from out of town, you gotta take them here for breakfast!  Just remember, get there early or you'll be waiting for awhile.  The parking may be a bit hard as well, so if you can take,
author: CeeCee W.

description: I am one of the people who have endured the long wait, terrible parking and all the feelings that comes with being impatient. But honestly, there was nothing memorable about their breakfast unless you have 3 hours to wait. I would probably come back during unpeak times to enjoy a plate of French toast.
author: J C.

description: I love the French toast! Great with the home made jam that the waitress recommended. Also had some of the shrimp, tomato, cheese and  avocado omelette. Light and fluffy eggs! Will definitely come back to try the French toast sampler!
author: Samantha S.

description: Had the corned beef hash and eggs.  Not the best corned beef hash ever but it is home made so there's plus for that.  The french toast platter was OK.  Big fan of the cinnamon one but the other two, a berry and a banana nut were just OK.  Sampled my friend's Monte Cristo and that was very good and judging by the reviews and the number of battered goodness on the grill, a very popular item.  Line was about 20 minutes from the back window on a rainy Tuesday at noon.  I hate lines.  Dottie's is worth the line, this... not so much.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Yelp really need to change their grading system from 5 stars to 10 stars. I think this place is 3.5 stars instead of 4, but since I was able to beat the crowd, I'll be nice. 

I came here with one of the manager from work. We were in SF for business and had some time to kill. I remember yelping about this place so I suggested to him that we should have an all American breakfast (manager is from Japan.) The restaurant had a nice cozy feel to it ... well either that or the place is really really small. 

Since I don't eat a lot, I ordered a banana walnut bread and mama's smoothie. He ordered Northern Italian Omelet (or something like that.) The cashier asked him if he wanted small or large. I guess he felt like he was up for the challenge and ordered the large omelet. 

My banana walnut bread was great! I just wished it had more walnuts, but that is just my preference. Smoothie was good too. Now my manager's omelet... The first half of the meal he gave it 4 stars. Then the second half of the meal, the amount of sodium was getting to him and he brought the score down to 3 stars. He couldn't take the salty American food! He has yet to adjust to this life style. 

I would come back to try these omelets so I can put my 2 cent in. If you want a quick and nutritious breakfast, I would recommend the smoothie.
author: Natsuko N.

description:
Yes, it is worth the wait. Yes, it is spectacular. Yes, you should go to Mama's. 

The Banana Nut french toast is out of this world, the homemade jam tastes delicious on anything & everything you order & the whole staff is very nice & attentive. 

5 stars for Mama!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Dear Mama's,

The entire experience took 2.5 hours out of my Sunday, but after it's all said and done...even waiting in line through a light drizzle, it was worth it in order to stuff our faces with that Monte Cristo and Northwest Egg-White Omelet.

I can now always depend on you Mama's.
You are appreciated.
author: Brent N.

description: Love the place! I ordered the crab Benedict and I love it love it love it! Wanna try everything on the menu!
author: Chloe G.

description:
Most diners/breakfast places are the same right?

Hell to the no.

This place is very unique and just incredible.

We showed up at 10:15 on a Wed. It was beautiful outside so waiting on line wasn't a big deal. We waited for about an hour outside before we got in. We didn't know it was order at the counter than wait for a seat. But that was ok.

I had a nice conversation with the woman who took our order and we can see them making the food right there. 

Another 20 min before we got our food we were ready to chow down. 

I got the eggs benedict with grilled tomato and applewood bacon. I'm don't like the sauce so i got it without it. It was nothing short of perfect.

The potatoes that came with it too were outstanding.

On the side i had a short stack of pancakes. Fluffy and very tasty.

The whole place is well run and everyone is friendly. And for a breakfast meal, it was outstanding.
author: Lee L.

description:
I came to mama's last weekend and I have to say i was a big let down. I had read reviews on Yelp and in my Zagat book and it had been given great reviews. It took about 45 minutes to get a table, which didn't upset me since I don't mind waiting for a great meal. But, I ordered the crab, avocado, and brie omelet, and boy, did it disappoint! Not only did I pull a long hair off of my toast, but the omelet had no avocado and had so many shells in it. It felt like each bite I took, I was biting into shells. One would think for a $20 omelet they would be more careful about shells. then, to top off the omelet, i has another hair/long piece of fuzz in my fruit cup.... 

Probably wont go back. will stick to Dotties True Blue Cafe (tenderloin) and Judy's (marina). These places are much more reasonably priced and I have been pleased with their food each time I go.
author: Laura D.

description: This place was amazing. My friends and I waited in line for an hour before getting in, but once in, it was worth the wait. I got a smoked salmon scramble and it was delicious. Then, all three of us shared a trio of French toasts. It is hands down one of the most amazing french toast combinations I've tasted. I especially like the banana bread flavor. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Ellin C.

description:
I've been coming to SF for years and have always seen these crazy lines. So when my Thursday morning was free, I made it a point to get up and eat at Mama's. 

I was shocked/ super happy when we didn't find a line! It was around 9:30am and we just walked in and ordered. However by the time our food arrived, a line had begun to form. 

The food was good, but not 45mins good. I'd eat here again if line permits, but I wouldn't stand outside for 45+ mins.
author: Shad A.

description:
Here's adding another vote on the debate of what is the  best breakfast place in the city.  We've been to most of them, some more than once.  But the one we keep coming back to over and over is Mama's.  It is small and there is usually a wait -- but that's true of most of the others as well.  But Mama's Northern Italian omelet is gold.  The Benedict Blackstone is even better.  The toasted baguette with homemade jam is heaven.
Yes, Dottie's is good (to a point) and there are other very good places -- but they can't hold a candle to Mama's.
author: Dave C.

description:
If you're reading this, you've probably well aware of the the love yelpers have showered on this place. And by being a yelper, you would probably go to great lengths for food and will probably read this review and many many others to see what people say. So I'll focus on some stuff that others might not focus on as much:

THE LOCATION
Mama's is located on a quaint corner in North Beach, right near Washington Park. As you're waiting in line, you can chill out by watching the elderly asian folks start their day with some tai-chi, or walk across the street to get some delicious foccacia bread.  Do bring something to read, and do be prepared to wait.

When my 2 friends and I arrived at Mama's, there were 3 people already standing outside the door waiting for it to open at 8am. By the time the doors opened, the line had grown to 10+ people behind us. After opening hours, the average wait to get in is about 60 min.

THE SERVICE
Be prepared to order right as you get in! Mama's is also a seat-yourself kind of place, but thankfully that doesn't mean that the waitstaff is equally lazy. In fact, everyone seems happy to be there and to refill your water and coffee mugs.

And last but not least, THE FOOD
My friend, Laura B, ordered the pancake sampler and ate them with the tableside jam...and loved them. I'd get those next time around. I had eggs benedict.
