My friend said "I think he's joking"... maybe I would have gotten the joke if I hadn't been so focused on getting my fix. 
Anyway, the omelette was good, the potatoes were good, the latte was good... just not as good as I expected, after months of seeing lines down the street for this place. You can find a better breakfast in San Francisco without this kind of hype.
author: Christine K.

description: LOVE their home made jam!  Food is great and it is definitely a place to show your friends when they visit.  It is in a great location.  Just don't expect to go there and be in and out.  The line can be long.  It moves pretty quick and is worth the wait!  I really like this place!
author: S C.

description:
*sung to the tune of "A Song for Mama" by Boyz II Men 

Mama....Mama you know I love you
Mama, mama  you deserve all the applause
Your food is like
Sent from the gods
Mama, I just want to know
Your brunch is food for my soul.
author: Angela L.

description: OVERRATED! Food is ok.. but definitely not worth the wait. The breakfast at honey honey cafe was much better..
author: Justine P.

description:
pros: good food, good location
cons: waiting time, prices

try the crab omletes, and don't go on a weekend if you can help it
author: Noah P.

description:
How is it that no one else has reviewed this? Does anyone in that line that is always outside use Yelp?

Well - let me just say it is worth the wait. Oh is it good  - grab a yummy baked treat (order when you pay at the counter) as an appetizer while you wait for your meal - not because it takes long to get your food - but because it is a great use of time to eat delicious treats that you make forget otherwise. 

Note it is cash only and be sure to avoid their bathroom - just trust me - no one should have to experience such a horrible water closet at such a lovely eatery.
author: CarOline C.

description:
I don't care that there is always a line that goes down the street....stand on it and WAIT FOR IT because this cozy little spot has some of the best brunch food anywhere.

My boyfriend brought me on Sunday for my birthday as I've been dying to go and he HATES lines...though it looked long, we probably only waited 15 minutes to get inside, and once you can look at the menu, you'll know--you need all the time you can get!  

"What should I have, one of the specials?  I don't know, what about the omelets?  I don't know; they sound awesome but look at that French toast!!!"  

Seriously, we got inside, drooled over what everyone else had ordered while waiting to place our order: he got a special omelet with crab, avocado and sour cream, I ordered the "Northern Italian" with pancetta, mushrooms, tomatoes and garlic Jack cheese, and then we got the dollar size pancakes with fresh berries to share.  Oh yeah, and a coffee and mimosa.  What the hell--it was my birthday!

Um, wait about two minutes then our table was ready, then waited less than five and these plates overflowing with deliciousness came our way.  The waiter was SO nice--told us to use the homemade jam on the pancakes instead of the syrup and had a great sense of humor.  We dug in and--heaven.  I don't know what else to call it.  We didn't know if we should enjoy our own plate, eat off each other's, eat the pancakes....ey.  Crab meat was fluffy and fresh, no brown in the avocado, the cheese in my omelet with the pancetta was the tastiest thing ever...and the pancakes!  Good lord.
Oh, and the mimosa?  Fresh squeezed OJ splashed into champagne.  Yes, it's worth the price.  

Probably the only thing that wasn't remarkable was the coffee, but that's probably because it got cold as I tried to eat as much as possible before I started to feel full.

That's all I can say, really.  Very, very nice staff, probably too many tourists but I don't care--eat here.  Believe me.
author: Emma H.

description:
It's a great breakfast place. We waited outside for about 45 minutes and another 15 minutes inside the restaurant. It's comfort breakfast food cooked to perfection. Omelettes, pancakes, coffee cakes, everything were really good. Coffee was just OK. 

I probably will not return, because of the almost 1 hour wait time on a saturday. But I am still am happy I tried it one time.

Still highly recommended. You decide if it is worth the wait.
author: Roy N.

description: As Rachael Ray would say "YUM-O!" Waited a good 45 minutes to get a table, but once we were in the service was sweet, and the food was scrumptious. If you're into healthier options like I am, the Apple Yogurt Cinnamon French Toast on their low fat breakfast specials is a win. My friend got the Pan Dore and said it was too sweet (his baguette was DROWNING in lemon butter sauce). Others got the seasonal berry pancakes, and an omelette--both of which they enjoyed. Wish the place was bigger, but overall, a cute, quaint brunch spot---just be prepared to wait for Mama.
author: Diane G.

description:
Usually, I visit Mama's at least once every couple visits to the bay and I usually went twice a year for the last decade. 
The food is excellent! Eggs benedict, crab omelet, pancake sampler, and their coffee cakes are AMAZING! 
I've recommended this place to my friends and they love it as well. The only down side is the wait....the incredibly long line that starts before Mama's is open. Usually, I would have a friend wait in line while I try to find parking. By the time I find one, we're usually in the front of the line. Definitely try to go on a weekday and towards closing time.
author: Sherry W.

description: This place totally deserves my 30 minutes standing in line. The benedict always make my weekend.
author: Jj M.

description:
I have lived in the neighborhood for a few years and finally forced myself to wait in the interminable line outside one Sunday morning. 

Was it worth it? I dunno...The eggs benedict with prosciutto was pretty delicious, but 1.5 hours standing outside dulled my enthusiasm. I probably won't do it again.
author: Katy D.

description: This place is deceptive.  Wait in line, get excited to get inside only to have to wait in another line.  When you pay, they tell you as they take your card that they charge an extra dollar to use it.  For a breakfast that's already $10+ per person, that seems ridiculous.  And that fee is not posted anywhere.  I noticed that some people came in while we were eating and were seated immediately.  Their orders were taken by a waitress at the table and they didn't have to wait in line # 2.  Seems unfair.  Overall, food was pretty good but not at all worth the wait or the price.  I likely won't be back.
author: M M.

description:
Saturday, 10:00AM.

Mama's is as charming as its namesake. Wanted to beat the crowd but I woke up late, so we got here as the line was building up. It actually wasn't that bad, we were probably 4 or 5 deep and it took 5-10 minutes to order n' get seated. 

Quickie:
+ Nice and helpful staff
+ Lotsa' menu items and the food is bueno!
+ Cool decor, well kept joint
-  Food took awhile
-  Crammed spacing

Final Call:
If not for accidentally cooking bacon (remnants of a different order prolly) into the veggie omelet, Mama's would've earned 4-5 stars. Since they gave us an extra order or coffee cake for free, we'll be back for them to redeem themselves.

**********
Grubbed on:

1. Nelson's Rancheros
     -  Salsa didn't taste fresh or housemade
2. Veggie omelet
     -  Vegetables were fresh, but there was a piece of bacon in the mix
3. Coffee cake
     ++ Holy crap, this is good: not too sweet and crumbles in your mouth
author: Chuck N.

description:
Its to bad that this has great hangover food becuase it is probably one of the worst places to go hungover what with the wait in line and trying to pay the bill at the front with a big group of people.  

But the food is soooo good.  I like the omelet with the leeks, goat cheese and bacon.
author: b s.

description:
2 hour wait.  Is it worth it? YES

food is great -- nothing too fancy.  the crab omelet had lots of fresh crab meat, the french toast trio was delightfully yummy and the florentine eggs benedict -- what a hollendaise sauce!  and how did we get to try all these treats?  well, as Lark will say -- sharing is caring!

service is faboo -- the wait staff anticipated our needs and were super friendly

grab a coffee before you go and maybe some reading material.
author: Debster C.

description:
the french toast sampler and the smoked salmon benedict are the bomb! lovee! love 'em!
but the waiting in line kind of suck :/
author: Febriana S.

description:
i've been wanting to go here for years!  problem is, me and my boyfriend never wake up on time to get to all the good brunch places in SF that close at 3pm.  stay open later, people!  

anyway, i really wanted to try one of their specialty things...like the french toast or one of the omelettes, but i just wasn't feeling it that day.  so i had the veggie sandwich instead.  it came with some nice mixed greens, and it was a REALLY GOOD VEGGIE SANDWICH.  i need to re-visit when i'm in the mood for an omelette.  i wish they had a scramble menu as big as their omelette menu.
author: Kate W.

description:
This is the BEST thing I ate during my one-week stay in SF. I got a full list of good places to go to, and this beat everything.

Get there disgustingly early. I got there 30 mins after they opened and the line was ridiculous. Probably a 1.25 hour wait. 

PLEASE GET THE MONTE CRISTO. The best thing I ever put in my mouth for breakfast!! I found the recipe for their monte cristo online too so one day I will attempt to re-create it. 

Everyone here is very nice and they are right across from a park, which could be a nice day-event.
author: Holly M.

description: I live across the street and I see so many people waiting in the line and it is just waste of time! Nothing special at all. I ordered the vegetarian omelette. The potatoes that goes with had no taste and in general I can make a better omelette without being a chef.
author: Ilektra R.

description:
Ever been to Disneyland and stood in the loooong lines for a ride that only lasts a minute or so? And then you question, was it worth it?

$18.50 for a dungeness crab omelette with avocado, havarti, and tomatoes: it was fresh, tasty, but not amazing. The potatoes are okay. The dollar pancakes are nice. The "red" mimosa was okay. The crazy long line is lame. The pay-at-the-counter routine is odd, but great, friendly service.

The few people in line I spoke to were visitors to the city, which made me think this was the diner food counterpart to the incredibly overhyped House Of Nanking. I'd still come back on an off day to try other stuff on the menu, but for now: overrated. I've had way better food at Boogaloos (especially the potatoes).
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Arrived a little after 8am, waited in line for about 1.5 hrs. Def grab a hot latte before you get here, you'll need it waiting in line. 

I had the dungeness crab eggs bene and my fiance had the monte cristo. Both were delicious! 

Pros: Very friendly staff and great food. 
Cons: CASH only, long wait, small bathroom. 

I will def go again however I may try getting there at 7:30am or later in the day like noon-ish as one reviewer previously mentioned there is a shorter line at this time.
author: N. T.

description: The food was really good. The only bad thing was the wait. They told us juvenile be a 20 to 25 minute wait and we waited for an hour and a half.
author: Samantha W.

description:
My wife and I have been looking for great breakfast places for over two years and Mama's by far never fails to deliver the punch. To really enjoy the experience, you definitely need patience and a little bit more patience. My suggestion is to meet old friends and make it an event as opposed to just getting breakfast real quick. Before you go to Mama's, have a coffee. Try not to drive since parking just adds to the agony. Don't forget that there is yet another line once you make it in. That's when you hopefully start to work on your appetite. 

Talking about the food, everything that I have had thus far is really delicious. It's probably best to qualify "everything": eggs, eggs and French toast. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and very tasty. Don't order the small since it's really a teaser portion. The pancakes are good. 

If you cannot stand the wait but want to have an equally enjoyable experience, I would recommend Zazies and Chloe's. I have heard a lot about Dottie's but the half hour wait in the loin is just not for me.
author: Ashwin K.

description: My girlfriend wanted to have her birthday brunch here on a Saturday so we got there at around 11am and didn't get to eat until 130. It was a really long wait, but WORTH IT!!! I got the salmon scramble and my boyfriend got the famous monte cristo. I was blown away! I should've gotten the monte cristo because it was JUST that good. I can't wait to come back here and have a whole monte cristo dish to myself! LOL. The service was wonderful and overall a nice experience.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Lucky me- I stumbled onto this place when I was trying to kill time before meeting up with my cousin. Lucky me (again) that I was there on a Friday at 9ish so I didn't wait 2 hrs like I would have had I came on Saturday or Sunday. I still waited an hour so maybe that still makes me a chump.

Regardless, I didn't have the pancake sampler- and I'm a little disappointed in myself for that. I had the dungoness crab omelet with avocado and cheese, boyfriend had the Washington sq. omlet. Service threw me off a bit but I'm definitely a 'go w/ the flow' type of girl so it didn't both me. The customers that took 2 hrs to eat and leave bothered me but not their set up!

Nevertheless, the omelets are a great value. I was beyond stuffed- even for an exercising foodie and I managed to devour everything w/out popping out at the seams (a miracle in itself.) The jam was good but my boyfriend said he could do w/out it (I beg to differ- it did bring some pizazz to the bread).

At the end, IDK if it warrants a 1 hour wait. Dungenuss crab in an omlette is unique but not that special. Don't get me wrong, it's certainly delicious and the service is attentive and friendly (which is why they don't push you to leave even though you're taking up precious time and money) but if you think in terms of 'opportunity cost' you might feel better going elsewhere.
author: D N.

description:
We were visiting SF and i wish i had this place back home... The quality of the food is excellant, everything is fresh!! There was sooo many yummy chioces on the menu I had a hard time deciding what to order.
We arrived at 11a on a Tues and had about a 30 min wait, but def worth it!!! 
FYI, CASH or DEBIT card only!
author: Zora F.

description: This tiny well decorated place was just too cute.  The service was good.  Keep in mind you might want to check out the menu before you go in because you have to order before being seated.  I had a classic club which was good but there was barely any chicken in the sandwich.  The diced potatoes were so so, could be better if it had more seasoning.  Also, I tried the spinach omelet  and it was great.  Can't wait to try  benedicts and french toast!
author: Ann L.

description:
This restaurant accomplishes what most only dream of: They get return customers who are happy and willing to suffer the only flaw this place has...the wait. 
It's a marketing strategy to have customers spread word of mouth advertising. It's not enough to tell your friends that you had a good meal somewhere, but even to tell them you waited in the rain for an hour to have a meal that spawns cartoon-like reactions of satisfaction barely does Mama's justice. The restaurant itself is small and the monthly rent has got to be minuscule in comparison to their profit. So not only are they apparently savvy business minds but they produce dishes that are worth the hype. 

My review is based off of some 6 or so visits. Not bad for someone who lives in Southern California.

Eggs Benedict - Outstanding. Salty, Tangy, Not over done
Eggs Florentine - Outstanding. Hearty and flavorful.
Banana Nut French Toast - Outstanding. Soft and yet crispy. Sweet and heavy.
Buttermilk Batter Pancakes - Outstanding. Sleep inducing goodness.
Northern Italian Omelet - Outstanding. Pancetta and mushrooms and basil...holy crap!

Don't forget to try their Olalla Berry jam. Put it on a muffin, a bagel, a biscuit or your open palm...it's that good. 

A million positive reviews couldn't do this place proud.
author: Nick M.

description:
Overall, this place is pretty good, but the french toast, is to die for! 

I've been here twice so far. I was a little disappointed at my omelet that last time I came. Thank God I also ordered a french toast to share with the whole table. 

Washington Square Omelet: Tasty. Eggs were done just a little runny. The way I like them. Tons of filling, a mouthful in every bite. 

Northern Italian Omelet: Disappointed. Eggs were over done, where it on the dry side. Not enough flavor in the pancetta, nor can I taste the basil in the omelet. 

Dungeness Crab Omelet: My friend substitute it with egg white and it was still full of taste. Yum-O! (but it is a bit on the expensive side). 

Any type of French Toast: Very yummy! Great with the homemade jam. Plenty of fresh fruit for each bite. Can't get enough! 

Warning: Be prepared to stand in line, the wait is usually an hour or so!
author: Maggie L.

description:
The food was AWESOME!  I loved the fact that you can see the chefs cooking the food and it wasn't  being cooked in the back.  I thought the food was very fresh.  

I ate the whole entire plate and I NEVER finish my plate ever!  I thought the jam was super tasty  with the Pan Dore.  

The wait was a tad bit long, but you know a place is good if it has long lines and honestly, it was worth the wait.  I'd definitely go again!
author: Jenny K.

description:
Damn good food!  French Toast w/ fresh berries...Amazing!  Waited in line and definitely learned my lesson, do not go on the weekends, but rather a random day in the middle of the week!  There is no line and you won't be ravenous with hunger by the time you are actually seated.  

I rated it 4 stars in stead of 5 because of the wait staff.  Our own personal waittress was great, but another waitress there was extremely rude to me and it took all my self restraint not to say something to her!  I went to hand her the tip that was left on the table by the previous guest and she mumbled a "your waitress will take it, rolled her eyes at me (directly in front of me!) and walked away!"  WOAH! but other than that one person, good times!
author: Natalie L.

description: Not worth the wait. Took 2 hours to finally get food. Stuck out the wait in line to try out Mamas at least once. Dishes are impressive looking and they offer dishes other nearby eateries don't. Quality can be very good -- French toast with apples was delicious. However, with the constant crowds comes long waits including waiting for your food. This resulted in my eggs benedict being served cold. Although the staff was polite and soon brought me a new hot dish, the whites of the eggs were not cooked through and the hollandaise sauce had way too much lemon. Don't know if this was an isolated instance of poor execution but I suspect that with the great amount of popularity Mamas enjoys also comes lapses in the wake of large crowds. The bottom line is that it doesn't give me confidence to go back again and suffer through a long wait. I recommend avoiding the wait and possible disappointment and go somewhere else where the food is just as tasty but guaranteed fresh and hot.
author: Mike C.

description:
I give Mama's 4 stars because the wait, not the food.  I admit that I have only gone at peak time (Sat. or Sun. around 12-2pm), so I should know better.  You have to wait outside in a line for about 30+ minutes on average at these times....but it's worth it!!

Pastries are excellent,, moist-chewy-sugary- goodness!  The eggs are great and the french toast is amazing (think of taking a piece of  pastry bread and french toasting it...yum).  

Needless to say, I leave feeling like I gained a severe amount of weight but don't care b/c it was too good to be bad!!
author: Valerie D.

description:
Yeh this place is great.  On our short stay in San Fran we went twice for breakfast, even though breakfast was included in the hotel we were staying in.

This is exactly what (as an Englishman) I imagine a classic American Breakfast dinner should be like.  Huge queue out front, the smell of bacon and French toast in the air and a coffee mug that's never allowed to get more than half empty.

Even though the queue to get in (50min @9:15am the first day we went) can be long, once in and seated you don't feel at all rushed and the service is relaxed and friendly.

Between us we had the bacon and eggs, French toast, pancakes and eggs Florentine all of which were devoured along with copious amounts of coffee, OJ and a feeling of contentment.
author: David W.

description:
Brunch was pretty good here.  Sure, the line was long, and there wasn't any outdoor seating (Which is probably a good thing, cause even with an awning there wasn't any shade).

We had a couple of omelets, the dungeness crab omelette had huge, juicy chunks of crab meat (on the list of specials, they're definitely worth checking out), the Northern Italian had a delicate mix of basil and Italian bacon that tasted pretty good.  The homemade berry jam went well on both sourdough and wheat.  The wheat toast was especially tasty, with a robust nutty flavor.  Overall the experience was pretty good.

I said pretty good four times in this review.  I'd say that's worth about 4 stars.  Get here early to avoid the line, and Mama's might actually get be hella good.
author: Tony L.

description: Came here again with a huge appetite!  I basically ordered the same thing I order from last time.  If you check the photos, you'll know what I ordered this time.  Splendid as usual!
author: Limzer L.

description:
This place was good. Home style, friendly staff, delicious food... fresh squeezed OJ. i love it. If only I lived in SF, I can enjoy such things.

Bathroom is kind weird, besides that I would take friends here for sure.
author: B H.

description:
Hands down, THE Best breakfast.  

Tempted to write a bad review to deter some people from coming to this JEWEL.  I always get the northern Italian omelet, and I'm always happy with it.  It is some what difficult to explain the JOY I get from eating here.
author: shaun l.

description: Doesn't look like I need to say much. I was in SF and a friend took me here. We need one of these in LA. If you're from LA and visit NorCal, at least there's one thing to look forward to...Mama's - Better Than Your Mom's Breakfast
author: Lee E.

description: One of the top 2 brunch spots in the city I had tried thus far. I would give it 5 stars but the wait is ridiculous.  My boyfriend and I waited for almost 2 hours but it was well worth it.  This place is super small so the wait is expected as there aren't very many seats and the place my make you feel a tad claustrophobic.  I ordered an omelet and it was a really good portion, which I wasn't able to finish.  I usually eat a lot of a small 5'1", 115 lb female but the omelet won.  It also comes with French baguette and house potatoes which are the best ever!  But the icing on the cake is their famous homemade jam.  Kinda reminded me of a bet tee version of the lignin berry jam from Ikea.  Definitely would go back but maybe a little earlier to avoid the long wait.
author: Roxanne S.

description:
I HATE long lines, thats why i slept in and met my friends there after they waited an hour.  i showed as they were ordering, sweet!!  I got the french toast, gorgeous presentation, generous portions, efficent service, friut was fresh and tasty.  

I would consider waiting in line if i had friends/ family visiting, good time to chat, catch up and try to remeber how you got home last night.

went on a wednesday, short wait salmon scramble was awesome
author: kiki b.

description:
Do you like waiting? If so you will LOVE Mamas. The lines are long  (not Disneyland or DMV long..more like the bank on payday long) and seating is limited so even after you order you might have to stand around and wait for a table to clear out (I'm still uncertain what happens if your food is done before you have a table to eat it at..). On the plus side standing in line (not only just get inside but to actually order) gives you more than enough time to decide what you want. We  ordered the Pan Dore, the crab benedict, coffee cake, and Mimosas. It was enjoyable not over the moon good and definitely on the pricier side. 

Cash Only
author: Natalie G.

description: Come early, stand in line and enjoy the food!  best breakfast HANDS DOWN.....oh, bring lots of cash!
author: Amado R.

description: Outdoor long line...really long line....your hunger grows, your patience dies, the line then inches up 10 minutes later. 30-45 minutes later,  you reach the door, you contiue to wait...wait....you get to the register, order your food and pay - CASH ONLY...and...wait to get seated. Tight seating, loud conversations, abandoned newspapers, overworked waiters and a very cranky tummy...worth the wait? YES. My brother recommended this place and we ordered almost everything on the menu.  TRY EVERYTHING on the menu! Crab Benedict, Pan Dore, Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast, Northern Italian Omelette,  Eggs Florentine to name a few... SOOO GOOOD!! Open til 3pm, but such a cute, cozy place to have a good breakfast that's not heavy at all.
author: Karyn L.

description:
After a few visits to SF over the years and hearing about Mama's, my husband and I decided to finally check this place out. I read the Yelp reviews and tried to figure out the best day and time to go. We decided on a Tuesday morning and we arrived around 7:15AM. Yes, we are crazy, but not that crazy to wait in line for over an hour and waste any of our precious time in SF waiting in a line. There were seven people ahead of us. By the 8AM opening time, the line wasn't too bad. So, we got in with the very first group that morning. We got lucky! Yeah! 
My husband ordered the french toast sampler with berries and he fed me a bite. It was fresh and delicious. I am a cereal gal and not much into pancakes, waffles, french toast, eggs, etc. and I am not hungry so early in the morning so I ordered a fruit cup and sourdough toast. This was definitely some fresh, yummy sourdough bread and not at all hard and chewy. I spread some of their homemade raspberry jam on it and it was delicious. The fruit cup was fresh and flavorful. We also got some baked goods to have for snacks later. All delicious. We both enjoyed our breakfasts while we watched some groups doing line dancing to Chinese music at Washington Square Park across the street. Wonder what happened to the tai chi classes? 
FYI: Make sure to bring your cash. Extra charge applies for debit/credit cards. Menu is posted in the window so you can make ordering decisions quicker. The people waiting to get in will be staring at you and your food. Well, mostly your food! It's not really a place you can linger too long since people are waiting. We were the first one's done and out the door. Also, you can work off the calories by climbing up Filbert to the Coit Tower and back down the other side and go to the Ferry Building in time for the Farmer's Market. More yummy stuff.
All in all, it's a great place to try once, for sure. My husband wants to go back and we'll probably make another trip there on our next visit to SF.
author: Tammy G.

description: We got there around 10am. Waited in line about an hour, placed our orders, and seated soon after. Delicious is all I can say!  We ordered the crab Benedict, Monte cristo, and omelets. Only regret is not trying out the french toasts. Well definitely go again.
author: Ilikefood N.

description:
What's my favorite brunch place? Tough call between Dottie's and Mama's, but Mama's takes the cake.  I've always wanted to go here, but live in Lower Pac Heights and weekend hangovers don't really allow for much travel and waiting time.  My friends and I stopped here after an "urban hike" and, I must say, it was totally worth the 40 minute wait.  I had a dungeness crab omelette which was super tasty! 
The part I liked most about Mama's was the open kitchen and you order at the counter.  So cute!  One important thing to remember is cash!  We were almost to the cashier when we noticed the CASH ONLY sign, so my friend had to book it to the ATM.  It's a bit on the pricey side (ours was $20 a piece), but completely worth it.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've been hearing a lot of good things about this place, and FINALLY, FINALLY we made it a point to head out to North Beach for a late brunch on Saturday.  We had to wait about half hour.. which made me order much more for brunch than I normally do.  

Anyways here's the schpeel... 

Their pastries are super good.  I only had the blueberry coffee cake which came out warm and delicious.  Went perfectly with the coffee. 

I ordered the Farmer's Omelette, egg white.. with leeks, bacon, spinach and cheese.  It was probably one of my favorite omelettes ever.  Came with 1/4 of a home-made baguette, home-made blackberry jam, and scrumptious hash browns..  My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

I went with my fiance and two of our friends and it was almost impossible to find a seat (even at 2pm).  They have about 3-4 tables that can seat over 3 people.  About 5-8 tables for the 2 tops.  If you want to be seated quickly then go with one other.. leave the rest of your friends at home.. or opt to sit separately. 

Service was very friendly.
author: Betina C.

description:
Update

Got there a little after 11am and was very happy to see the line was not too long...thought for sure it'll be LONG since it turned out to be a nice day, not raining!  Anyway, got inside pretty quickly as well.  Decided to try something new - a mistake, should have at least stuck with the monte cristo as originally planned.  

We ordered:
One slice each of the blueberry coffee cake (super moist, full of blueberry - yummy yummy and delicious!) and crumb cake - both are served warm.

Eggs Florentine - 2 poached eggs covered with spinach, mushrooms and Hollandaise sause served on English muffin w/homefries.  Must admit I was underwhelmed. One of the eggs was over cooked and in general it was just ok.  

Eggs Benedict with tomato and prosciutto - both eggs were perfect but still nothing to write home about, not sure what it was but somehow just expected something very savory with prosciutto.

Mama's Sampler French Toast - slice each of cinnamon, banana nut and cranberry orange with fresh berries.  We had wanted the Kugelpuph French Toast - home baked brioche Bread w/nuts, raisins, and cinnamon but they were out - 11:30am only, how's that possible?!?)

Coffee is still great, always piping hot and refilled at the right moment.

Homemade jam is still yummy as usual.  I think we will stick with the monte cristo and omelets if/when we return.
-----------------------------
Folks, we waited a little over an hour in the cold weather and we will go back again!  Crazy, perhaps!  But we are not alone, plenty crazy people in front and behind us.  So, just plan accordingly - bring a favorite book, crossword puzzle, PSP, iPod or whatever...

While waiting outside, I was constantly peeking in to see when tables may become available.  When i see that there are open tables, WTF was flying all over my head and narrowly escaped my mouth...with shit load of people waiting, what dumbass is managing the place?!? Well, turns out they have a different system.  

First of all, the line continues inside.  When you get close to the door, someone will ask you how many in your party then close the door on you.  Once you are inside, you can see the open kitchen, the yummy yummy food and the menu.  When you get close to the register, you order and pay (CASH only) then wait to be led to an available table.  This also explains the cash left behind at the table - it appears the wait staff leave the previous tips behind as a reminder to you before they take it away when your food arrive.  Not a bad idea as a reminder.

We ordered:
Northern Italian omelet ($9.95) with pancetta, mushroom, basil, tomato, and garlic jack cheese - served with home fries and your choice of bread.  This was delicious!   The pancetta was so tasty along w/ the juicy tomato, the nice fragrant of basil and the garlic jack were a perfect combination.  

Monte Cristo ($8.95) - turkey, ham, cheddar and Swiss on white bread-dipped in egg & grilled, served with homemade jam - Heaven!   Just imagine a tasty turkey, ham & cheese sandwich french toast style - the cheese melts but don't spill out...it's freaking clever and damn divine!  It's sprinkled w/ powder sugar and served w/ your choice of home fries, cole slaw, potato salad or greens.  

Each table has a jar of their homemade jam - SO good, I piled it onto each bite of my toast, OINK!

We also had a side order of the crumb cake.  It was brought over warm with our coffee.  The coffee was surprisingly pretty good - it was HOT and the wait staff was very good at refilling the mug at the right time.  

Oh and who do we see waiting in line behind us?  Rob Schneider.  Surprisingly, he is a lot better looking in person than in movies.  He appears to be a regular.

The waitress asked how long we had to wait, when we told her a little over an hour...she asked if it was worth the wait...our answer?!? 

We'll be coming back!
author: Gloria H.

description:
this place is one of my absolute favorite breakfast spots of all time... and in a way raised my level of expectation when going to any other breakfast spot.  i practically grew up eating at this place.

the ingredients are all fresh and the atmosphere is both cozy and friendly.  i always love to start with a freshly squeezed OJ, some fresh berries, possibly one of their fresh baked coffee cakes or something and maybe a slice of their home made kugelhof french toast.  since they have the best hollandaise sauce i have ever had, i usually go with their eggs benedict, which is very traditional, or their crab benedict.. or the one with spinach.  any of them are delicious.  the homefries are fresh and very tasty, they go great with the hollandaise sauce and a smidge of paprika.

if you aren't in the mood for their benedicts, go for an omelet or some french toast/pancakes.  the berries are fresh if you go the french toast route, the kugelhof french toast it amazingly good and after all the years of eating french toast, this place has the best i have ever had.  (sorry chloe's, your croissant french toast is great, this kugelhof would be world renown if more people knew about it).  actually, maybe it is world renown, the line to get into this place is ridiculous, i have literally seen it go around the block.  as in it went down the street, you turn the corner and it went down the entirety of the next street.  needless to say, the weekend is not a great time to go, but if you see a short line, jump in and enjoy the best breakfast you will ever have.

since i haven't hit my 5001 world limit, i will go into how wonderful the omelets and ingredients taste.  since everything is absolutely fresh, there is no mistaking that all of their flavorful omelets are delicious.  from the washington square with fresh panchetta to their south of the border blackbean omelet.  

oh, and they have this thing called an apple pan dore, its french toast with sliced apples in some crazy sweet sauce.  try their bacon or italian sausage with this.  its divine.

as you can tell, i get very excited when thinking about eating at this place, its mouth watering.

lunch... 

slim joe burger
monte cristo

try them, love them, let them show you how food should be prepared.
author: Wayne L.

description:
A friend recommended Mama's during a recent trip to SF.  The brunch was amazing!  Went with a friend and ordered two breakfasts to share:

- Smoked Salmon Benedict: very savory and delish!
- Kugelhuph French Toast: super tasty, especially with the fresh berry jam/jelly thing that's on every table!  

Screwdriver and Ruby Red Mimosa were pretty good too.  Service was friendly, and the staff was very helpful in suggesting the most popular items on the menu.
author: Astra W.

description:
Brunch here, so worth the wait in line out front on the curb. 

It gets a bit stuffy inside, with cramped quarters, but order yourself a crab omelette and pancakes w/ berries on top.

Walk off your feast, around North Beach or Chinatown.
author: Kat C.

description:
Food, Service, noise level, whatever...  It's all great.
The only problem is the line outside.  Be prepared to stand in line for an hour.  Don't arrive hungry.
author: Patrick A.

description: Great Spot!  Very small and charming.  This place is crazy busy.  They open at 8:00 am and we were there at 7:45 in a massive line.  Didn't make 1st seating, but worth the 30 minute wait.  Great value, great food a must go.
author: regina M.

description:
This place is definitely tasty. I'd give it 3 1/2 if I could. 

I woke up early to avoid the line. You should too. I ordered the smoked salmon benedict, an apple crumb cake, and a orange juice. The hollandaise was the best I'd ever had, but the OJ and crumb cake were not. It'd probably help if I didn't have to see my crumb cake go in the microwave before it came to my table.

I'd recommend this place to anyone, though I'd also suggest they ignore the hoopla.
author: Spacmunk E.

description: You know, I have to say, I was a little disappointed.  After reading all of the rave reviews and waiting in line for a couple of hours, I was expecting something out of this world amazing. I got good, and don't get me wrong, it was good, I enjoyed it, but I wanted AMAZING.
author: Kami S.

description: Food was excellent, but definitely a long wait. We heard that we had to visit Mama's, but I doubt we will wait the hour next time around.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Great breakfast spot in North Beach but there are lines at times.  I recommend going Tuesday - Thursday around 8 or 9 am to beat the lines.

If you have to go on the weekends make sure you go early in the a.m.  If you are there past 10 a.m. then you will have deal with blazing early morning sun.

They make really good omlets and french toast.  I recommend the french toast with fresh fruit and coffee.
author: Buddy R.

description:
So after much pussy footing around I finally took my broke ass over to Mama's Sunday for breakfast. I really can't call it breakfast though, cause I ate at 3:00p.m. So we will call it br/un/ner (it mysteriously ended up being the only meal eaten that day). 
Okay technicalities aside. It was frigging good...yummy yummy i had some sweet benedict in my tummy... kinda good. although my elation was ruined by my depressed and wants to depress everyone else friend who went off about hollandaise sitting out all day in a hot kitchen (thanks em) alas i DID NOT get food poisoning so yay for me! and yay for mama's! despite its tastiness, i am docking a star for the over hour wait which just made me sad and watching others eat is not my favorite way to people watch!
author: o. c.

description:
As Flavor Flav and Chuck D use to say... "don't believe the hype" ... so I checked it out myself. Here's what I have to say:

One hour wait standing outside. Once you get inside, you stand in line at the counter facing the little grill/kitchen and watch the food being cooked. This is where you get sucked in, hook, line and sinker. Everything looks and smells great. Menus are on big boards and by the time you get to the front of the line inside, you place your order and pay. Then you wait a little bit longer and then are taken to a table.

This is a small establishment, they have 13 tables and no counter (which explains the long wait). 

Drinks arrive shortly thereafter by friendly staff and then the food comes a bit after that. That actual wait for the food wasn't long. 

The food: exactly as it states on the menu and very very good. Prices are right in line with decent breakfast joints. The french toast is really good. 

The bathroom: it's out back (literally), you walk through a part of the kitchen, outdoors, down some rickety stairs and low and behold, a small 1 stool tiny toilet room. It's like an outhouse but painted orangey/pink to make you feel better. 

We had several staff pop by and make sure everything was good and I really had a good time.  Maybe if you go during the week it might be a bit slower and so less wait time?
author: Jasmin F.

description: First of all, I am a sucker for places like this.  Quaint and very clearly family owned.  Luckily I went there around 9 am on a Thursday, so I didn't have to wait in line at all.  My group had the french toast sampler and the banana pancakes, as well as the smoothies.  All were absolutely delicious!!  The menu looked awesome, so I will certainly be back to try all the other things on the menu :-)
author: Alexandra D.

description:
While eating at Mama's, please abide by the following simple rules:

1.  No talking with food in front of you.  Usual brunch banter should be reserved for outside the establishment.  I'm sure you had plenty of time to catch up while waiting in line.  Acceptable conversation consists of, "Wow, this is great!  You should try some."  Or, "mmmmm."

2.  Chew, chew, swallow.  Repeat.  This is a place to chow on great breakfast food.  Why you need 5minutes between bites is beyond me.  

3.  Please leave when you're done.  There really is no need for you to be there if your plate is empty.  Please enjoy the "atmosphere" in the park.  

I often need my fix for this place, but can't "stand" the lines.  So please, be neighborly, and follow these simple rules.  WWJD?
author: J J.

description: One of the best breakfast places.  I tried the bread sampler and it was awesome.  There seems to always be a line...even at 11am on a weekday...but, it's worth the wait.
author: Al C.

description: This place is totally worth the wait. I ordered the low fat French Toast and my boyfriend got the Italian "Momlet". We also split a cumb cake. Everything was AMAZING! Their jam is so good- homemade- not too sweet. Everything was just perfect. I would go every week if I had the time to wait in line.
author: Crystal M.

description: Ok so this review is long overdue so here it goes! This place totally lived up to the hype! Definitely be prepared to wait in line, but I guarantee you it's worth it. Tried the smoked salmon scramble and the french toast sampler! both were delish!! Next time i visit will definitely try the Monte Cristo!
author: Olga G.

description: Great breakfast and brunch place.  Expect long lines on the weekends.  Small restaurant, order at the counter, line goes out the door along the side of the restaurant.  Great selection of baked goods at the counter.  Longest wait for me has been about an hour.  Some of my favorites are Dungeness Crab Omelette, Dungeness Crab Benedict, and the Washington Square Omelette.  Best to come on weekdays to avoid the long lines.
author: Daisy Y.

description:
We read up on this place and thought it would be as good as Dottie's true blue cafe, which I think is the greatest breakfast ever.  Mama's is good but doesnt measure up to what i thought.  I am glad that I went there and would recommend it to others, but if you want the best breakfast in san fran, and the world in my opinion, go to Dottie's!!

I had the low fat french toast and it was good.  The jam is a delight.
author: Happy Mama M.

description: FANTASTIC. I dream about Mama's french toast every weekend.  I can't wait to go back to San Franzia to experience food that is infused with pure love.
author: Samantha M.

description: There is a line everywhere you go in sf because all the restaurants are small and compact but this place is definitely worth visiting. The monte cristo was good but the dungeoness crab eggs benedict is a must get. The vanilla latte was eh. Don't go in large groups.
author: Leda T.

description:
Mama's  is by far the best breakfast in SF...

We recently went to Mama's , before the St. Patty's parade we got there at 9am and there was a line around the building and down the street.45minute wait! SO BE PREPARE TO WAIT IN LINE.. but the wait is worth it! The serves are so GREAT! All the servers' are  kind and fast considering that there about 10 tables!  Its VERY , VERY  SMALL.... And not good for large parties. 

AS for the FOOD its was AMAZING, Fresh.. And just RITE! A must go for anyone visiting SAN FRANCISCO! 

Price is a lil HIGH but the REALLY Good FOOD!

-As for PARKING well BRING THEM Quarter's.. !!
author: Char K.

description:
Well, we finally went.  We've been in town for a month now and have brunched all over the place, but everywhere we go, people ask us if we've been to Mama's yet.  So... we finally went.

We struck out to the famous Mama's Sunday morning.  We left our house on Nob Hill at 9:42 AM, took the cable car over to North Beach, got in line and sat down at 11:58 AM.  TWO hours in line, so we were hoping, hoping, hoping that the food would be worth it.  TWO hours.  Yes, I said two hours.  

The food was great.  The coffee... that's another matter.  PLEASE, MAMA, GET YOURSELF SOME WONDERFUL COFFEE.  

It's the little things that make a good restaurant a great restaurant.  When your specialty is breakfast, then coffee would be important, right?

The two of us split three entres; the french toast sampler (A++) rocked my breakfast world, a regular Eggs Benedict (A-) , and a Washinton omlette (also an A).  The wait staff was attentive and happy, so that also gets an "A."  

Everything, other than the bitter, spit-it-out-coffee and the line (TWO HOURS???) was wonderful.

We're going back for lunch during the week around 2 PM when everyone is at work.  

Will keep you updated.
author: Karla S.

description: The food was spectacular. French toast sampler was good and the crab omelet was amazing! Five stars for the food even though it might not be worth the hour+ wait. They should at least have benches and/or shade..
author: Steven V.

description:
Oh Mama, how I hoped you would have lived up to the hype. 

I have been on a french toast kick lately, eating it everywhere I go for the last few months. I've tried some good ones (Bill's in the S. Bay, and Cafe W in Berkeley) and unfortunately Mama didn't make the cut. I tried the french toast sampler, and unfortunately if this is a sample of Mama's best, I think Mama should stick to other items. 

The sampler has three types of toast, the cranberry something or other, the banana and the cinnamon. Of the three, the cinnamon was the only one that wasn't unbearably dry, but it was a thin piece, half the height that I usually associate with french toast. (Sure this could be my own deranged psychosis, but I have come to expect french toast to be think, about an inch, but I've been known to like thicker especially if it of the "stuffed" variety). 

Anyway, the best one of the three was the Cinnamon because it wasn't dry and tasted ok. The other two were not horrible, but they more like taking banana bread or cranberry bread and tossing it on the grill. I much prefer my toast to be drenched before grilled and moist even before the syrup goes on. Again, to each their own, your mileage may vary. 

Warning, Pet Peeve Influenced Rant:  I hate it when places burn my food, and Mama went and gone and burnt my dang potatoes.  It really ruins my meal when I have to pay for something I would throw away if I made it at home.  If I want carcinogens I'll go to the neighborhood park and lick the dirty BBQs, please don't burn my potatoes!

Oh and somehow they managed to burn some of the potatoes while one was buried inside that was almost entirely uncooked.

On the plus side, there was no wait at 8AM on a rainy Friday morning and the egg dishes looked good, so I'd be willing to go back and try the benedicts, after all Mama probably can do something right or else this place wouldn't be so popular..... right?  But if I get any more black edged potatoes I'm out.
author: Stephen H.

description: It was a long wait, one hour on a Tuesday.  Then when it was time to go in, there was no welcome by waitress.  She just directed us to stand in line to order.  Felt very rushed when time to order.  Cashier not helpful with menu choices.  Sat down finally and given water.  Again, no introduction or welcome from waitress.  Food came, less my eggs.  So I say,  "I had eggs too".  All I got was yeah they are coming.  Most waitresses would let you know while serving the other food that the eggs were on the way.  Felt like I Inconvenienced her by asking.  My husband ordered an omelet without cheese, but it came with cheese.  We had to send the omelet back.  By the time his new food came my food was cold.  Food was good, but not for the cost or the experience.  Horrible service especially for those on vacation that want to sit and enjoy themselves.
author: Stephanie B.

description: It has been a while since I have been to Mama's, I like the wait but I most say that the pancakes and the bacon, jalapeno scramble made it all worth the wait. I love this place!
author: Robin C.

description:
Sunny: I have heard from my bf that this place is the place to go for breakfast/brunch/lunch so we decided to try it out. It is very apparent from the slow moving line out the door that it is a very popular place. We were already starving when we got in line but by the time we got a table inside this teeny place we had been waiting for 30-40 mins and were ready to devour the table. We ordered: buttermilk pancake, spicy italian sausage, apple crumble, fresh oj, prosciutto eggs benedict. By every table is a jar of fresh homemade berry jam which was DELICIOUS with my pancakes! I totally ignored the maple syrup. 

Overall, the wait is very worth it, because the amazing menu and the food in general was outstanding. 

Nolan:  I had been meaning to try this place for awhile, the gf and I braved the line one morning and I am glad we did!  I am kinda picky with my eggs benny and theirs were definitely up to par.  The apple crumble arrived at the table warm and mysteriously vanished (it was that good).  The spicy italian sausage was also delicious, there was no risk of a piece being left behind.  I am interested to try the just cheese omelet, I don't think you can't go wrong with an omelet that is made with 6 kinds of cheeses.  I worry about submitting this review and the line getting longer ;)
author: SunnyandNolan E.

description:
my friend who is fan of MaMa's crab eggs benedict was determine to take me there and try it. 

When we got there sometime after 10 am in the morning, the weather was bit cold and mist of rain was floating down from the sky. Unlike other yelper who has to waited 2 hours, yesterday morning's line was not too bad at all (4 couples ahead of us). we waited for maybe 15 mins and we are allow to be in already. 

It no wonder why you have to wait so long, this place is tiny! The table are very closer together and even the walking space is so narrow. 

So first timer like me listen up~ here is how it work. After you enter, you kinda of line up again to order your food. Sadly, the crab eggs benedict is only offer Friday, Sat and Sunday. So my friend end up ordering the Monte Cristo Sandwich that many yelpers has mention and I ordered the the prosciutto eggs benedict. 

We are seated in the next available seat by the door. Th server quickly then greated us and gave us the drink we ordered. We have to wait about another 10 minutes for our food. 

I was so surprises when they brought out the Monte Cristo Sandwich. Instead looking like a typical sandwich, it looks more like a thick triangler french toast. Only when you bit into it you realize the cheese and the meat was inside of this french toast taste bread. They also give you a little side of strawberry jam to go w/ your sandwich... so there you go, you got the more salty meat and cheese with bit a strawberry jam for the french toast bread... almost in perfect harmony. 

okie... the prosciutto eggs benedict, the one thing they are well know for, the eggs benedict! I'm sorry, maybe the crab eggs benedict was better, but I got to admit it was good, but not the best I ever had. Honestly the best eggs benedict I ever had was actually on the carnival cruise. 

Over all let just say, I like it, but I was not mesmerised.  Still worth the try!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I think we'll have to go back and try it again, because Mama's has gotten such great reviews from other folks on here (and in Zagat).  We went on a weekday and still had about a 40 minute wait.  If the food had been fantastic, it wouldn't be an issue, but the food we ordered was not great.

I got the chocolate french toast.  Unfortunately, the only chocolate was chocolate sauce (maybe Hershey's?) drizzled on top of it.  Kinda ruined the whole thing.  My date got the crab benedict -- which was only so-so, but which was really pricey.  The best thing we had were the buttermilk pancakes (which were really good).  But I'm not going to wait that long just for some plain pancakes.

I'm sure we'll go again, but it would have to be on another weekday, as I wouldn't dream of waiting even longer considering the food we had.
author: K. H.

description:
Waited in line for 1.5 hours on a Saturday at noon. Got harassed  by another lady on line for eating a cookie while waiting. Ummm sorry lady but I'm not about to starve myself until 2 pm to preserve the alleged sanctity of Mama's brunch. Ordered the dungeness crab omelet with havarti - don't know what all the hype is about. Also got the french toast sampler - enjoyed the cinnamon & banana walnut breads. 
Would return but will bypass if I have to wait another 1.5 hours.
author: ms b.

description: I hate to write a good review about a place that tourists frequent. But I will give it up to Mama's.  Fantastically long wait for a fantastic selection of omelets and scrambles and some pretty damn good french toast.  I use the excuse of "friends in town" to visit as often as I do.  I took a star away b/c it is north beach where parking is a bitch.
author: Kamael S.

description: My NB friend and I happened to walk by around half hour before closing. We hadn't ate yet, so we waited a lil less than 10 minutes to enjoy the french toast sampler. We also split a chicken sandwich. This is one of those places where everything works- the staff is friendly and efficient, the food is tasty and filling, and prices are reasonable. The chicken was perfectly marinated in a bit of pesto and basil while the sampler was F-ing sweet and not too toasty.
author: Thomas L.

description: I was among the last in line for Sunday brunch and had the Monte Cristo -- the initial flavor hit all the right taste buds and lasted through the meal.  I went here on a good tip from a new friend. As many others proclaim, it's worth the wait in line.  Also, if you're in line when they close (at 3:00), you'll still be served.
author: D. A.

description: I went here for brunch with my family on Wednesday and even in the middle of the week there was a line out the door.  That being said, the wait was worth it.  We all ordered something different and tried samples of each others dishes, and everyone cleaned their plates.  The staff was friendly, and even though it was a little small and crowded the atmosphere was delightful.
author: Taylor W.

description:
The food is great. The service is friendly.  The wait is obscene. But you all knew that before you went! Its a fabulous place to brunch but don't expect a lazy afternoon with several rounds of mimosas.  While I wasn't hurried out the door, I felt antsy the whole time.  Perhaps the view of the line snaking around the corner did little to relax me.  

Go and bring a magazine while you wait in a line that may remind you of Disney Land or Six Flags...no ride included.
author: Sarah C.

description:
went on a weekday for late lunch after trying on a weekend for brunch (ha, have fun waiting)..

we sat right away, the sweetest staff was working, I had a daaank monte cristo and all without breaking my measly bank.

go on a week day. just not when I feel like going. ^_^
author: Anne Marie S.

description: I had the eggs Benedict with crab, and my friend had the apple yogurt cinnamon french toast.  we shard a cranberry nut loaf.  it was all to die for. everything melted in your mouth.  The wait isn't bad, its actually kind of fun if you have good friends to chat with and everyone in line is usually friendly too although be prepared to wait. i waited 1.5 hours on new years eve!
author: Linda T.

description: Tooo decadent. Masterfully poached eggs benedict and strong Bloody Marys. Easily an hour wait on weekends and a guaranteed food coma when you finish. My trip to Mama's for Sunday brunch became a whole day ordeal, seeing as I passed out immediately after. Was it worth it? Totally!
author: Irene C.

description: Best hollandaise sauce I've ever tried. As for the waiting in line,....I probably wouldn't do it if I actually lived up in the Bay area...but for someone that was visiting, I didn't mind waiting in line, gazing at the water, and watching everyone cruise by with their dogs...inside, it's cute and really busy...but the food is pretty good...but I guess after waiting in line for almost an hour, almost everything tastes good! I don't remember what my friend ordered, but I do remember us both loving my eggs benedict..
author: Sandy S.

description: Every good breakfast/brunch place I've ever been has a line.  This line is worth the wait.  Every weekend I say I'm going to get up early to go there.  I really want to.  However, as good as it is there, it's not better than sleeping in.  Next weekend for sure...  I mean it this time.
author: Michael R.

description:
After a 40 minute wait on a Tuesday morning, two out of the three of us enjoyed our breakfast.  I had the chocolate French toast, my companions had the shrimp/avocado eggs benedict & huevos rancheros.  The french toast was simply bread with a thin coating of egg.  I expected a more custardy, melt-in-your-mouth version given Mama's rep for same. We had some excellent crumb cake, and my companions said their dishes were great.Debit cards and cash only, order &
pay before you sit down.
author: Jerry G.

description:
Went for Sunday brunch - waited for about an hour which we had expected.  Very honestly, the coffee cake rocked, but our "real" breakfast dishes were average.  I got the special french toast with berries, which probably just as good as any breakfast place.

Don't think it is worth the wait considering there are plenty of decent breakfast places in North Beach and SF, in general.
author: Mamoon H.

description:
ok, let me preface this by saying that i looooooooooooove breakfast foods. and i'm not easily satisfied with breakfast places.
went on a Thursday morning for brunch - and it was crowded! waited about 15 minutes. totally worth it! 

i ordered the shrimp avocado omelette (about $12), a special. i was a bit hesitant to order it, as most places totally skimp on shrimp and avocado. but then i saw another patron going to town on his sa omelette... and it was huge. and packed. with shrimp and avocado. so i took the plunge. it was heavenly! 

i will say that i'm not a big fan of sausage to begin with, but i tried some of the hot italian sausage.. and it was pretty good. a little greasy, but still quite tasty. the baguette toast was delicious - not too hard, and the homemade berry jam is SO GOOD!!!! 

go. stand in line and wait. because it is more than worth it.
author: Aletheia W.

description:
Breakfast is one of life's simple pleasures, and a great breakfast is a wonderful thing.  Mama's, which features a small dining area and a big line, has earned the former by serving up some of the best morning grub in town.

I waited about an hour and a half to try this place out, after having walked by many a time to see a similar line.  Waiting 90 minutes for anything is trying, and the prize better be worth the wait.  At Mama's, the prize was the freshest ingredients lovingly prepared into some of the tastiest AM food I've had.

The omelet we ordered was light and fluffy and packed with just the right amount of fixin's.  The two french toasts we ordered, banana nut and apple, were both fantastic.  Covered in fresh fruit and cooked just right, they were both heavenly.  The blackberry preserves at the table were to die for too.

Overall it was amazing.  The missing star is only because of the wait.
author: Eric M.

description:
Let me tell you why YOU should go down to North Beach and stand in line outside Mama's for a good 20 mins!

BECAUSE IT IS WORTH YOUR TIME!

The food there not only looks amazing but they taste delicious. I would recommend HANDS DOWN, the Monte Cristo (Although, they only serve it on the weekends) and the French Toast. My boyfriend bought me here for brunch during our anniversary. It was a surprise because we love to dine out for dates, but at first I was irritated at how long the line was. It wasn't until we got inside the door that I saw a glimpse of the place. The diner is pretty small - in fact, it looks like a small local diner for breakfast or lunch, preferably. Actually they open early in the morning but close before noon, hence the looooooong line to get a table. It seems as if the customer service was quick but efficient. Everything was fast paced; ordered our food and then pay at the register. Simple as that we found a seat for us. The rest of the time, me and my boyfriend barely talk because we were indulged in our meal. Yummm.

My only criticism is the size of the diner. Due to the fact that there is a high demand of service in this place, they should expand the diner. However, that still doesn't overpower the delicious food I ate ;)
author: Charmaine Marie L.

description:
We must be gluttons for punishment.  We stood for an hour outside, in the hot sun, with a small awning providing only partial relief.  Once inside, the hostess was nice enough to pull us out of line, seat us and put in our order for us, or we would have waited longer.  She didn't do this for anyone else; maybe she felt sorry for my wife, who was five months pregnant.  

Yet, we both agreed the food was worth the wait.  Maybe the best French toast I've ever eaten, and very, very, very good crab eggs Benedict.  Except for the spinach.  That dry mouth spinach effect set in about half-way through an otherwise perfect Benedict experience.  The hollandaise sauce was to die for.  The potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The grapefruit mimosa was delicious, as was the juice alone.  I cleaned my plate and part of my wife's and somehow was able to walk afterwards.

It's just too bad all this quality comes at such a high price: You have to wait on the sidewalk, in the sun. There is little seating on the sidewalk, and little shade. Once inside, you continue to wait, at the counter, where you put in your own order and pay for it, like a fast casual restaurant. What table service we had was very good, but it was only partial table service, and the ambiance, while cute and comfortable, was nothing to write home about.  

And how you will pay.  My crab Benedict, which supposedly is Mama's specialty, was $20.  The plain Benedict was $12 or $13, so it cost an extra $8 just to add a little delicious crab meat?  That's four-star luxury hotel restaurant prices, minus the four-star ambiance and the four-star table service.  Of course it was worth it.  As if to highlight Mama's complete and total power over its customers, they don't accept credit cards and charge $1 fee for a debit card.

Chances are that you go to Mama's for the food, and the food is incredible.  But the long wait outside keeps this from being a five-star experience for me.  Maybe 4.9...
author: Julian H.

description:
Be prepared to wait in line, and there's actually two of them, one outside the restauarant, the other inside inside waiting for them to take your order and be seated. Come armed with good company and morning paper, perhaps your first cup of coffee too.

I loved their Monte Cristo - the idea of battering the entire sandwich and grilling it like a piece of French Toast is awesome, and top that off by dipping it into homemade jam, YUM!
author: Anna L.

description: The Best Brunch Restaurant in Bay area!!
author: James I.

description:
It's a bit crazy, but I actually like knowing that I have a place to eat when I'm ordering food, especially if it's kind of on the fancy side and I'll definitely need a table and silverware to eat it. 

In the case of Mama's, I had no guarantee that a table would be available for me once my food had been purchased, and that made me a little bit antsy. I'd like to think that I'm a cool cat, collective in all situations, but when it comes to me enjoying my food, heck even eating my food, I gots to know the plan, man! 

Thankfully, they obviously have the rotation down at Mama's because we got our table, just before our food came out (the whole ordeal was a bit of a wait), and therefore were able to enjoy our food. The crab benedict was pretty tasty, the pan dore was a pleasant accompaniment, the coffee cake was moist with decent flavor. The prices are somewhat high, and the wait is insane, but I'd go back again to try some different items. Their service was alright. It's hard to get more water, or even someone's attention in the chaos, but the gentleman trying to wrangle his staff was pretty nice. I kind of agree with Alex K., I could make breakfast like this in a much less hectic situation, knowing that I have a table just for me.
author: Shannon F.

description:
The food here is excellent.  I had the salmon scramble, which was absolutely delicious.  Interior decor is nice, and the service was good.

First you wait outside, then they let you line up inside to place your order.  After you place your order you go to a table to wait for it to be brought to you.  From that point on, it's pretty much standard table service.  It usually isn't possible to be picky about your table (even on weekdays), but if possible avoid a table near the line as the crowds of people at you back can make conversation difficult.
author: Peter H.

description:
I love this place for brunch! But yes, the lines are sooo long that sometimes halfway through I think to myself, its early afternoon, I'm starved, and not only am I waiting outside the restaurant, once inside, I have to wait again before ordering and sitting down. But in the end, I still think its worth it, the food is so delicious!

I went a few weekends ago with my boyfriend and after waiting in line for about an hour and a half, we were finally able to order and be seated. I ordered the banana nut french toast and he ordered the Washington Square omelette. My toast was DELICIOUS! Basically, they made french toast with slices of banana bread. It was so decadent and rich! The omelette was also very tasty and succulent (not dry, good ratio of filling to egg). I also had the freshly squeezed orange juice, which is light, sweet, and refreshing.

The wait is a bit of a discouragement, especially since parking is already hard to find in the area. But, the food makes up for it by far!
author: Katherine P.

description:
I had brunch here a while back and would have rated Mama's with a 4 until I read A. T.'s review.  I feel really bad about her horrible service experience compounded by Stu's bad food experience.  A restaurant should know that you must be consistent with all the elements that make a great restaurant - food, presentation, service, atmosphere.

My own experience here was positive.  Granted I was really hungry after the wait, I thoroughly enjoyed my crab and avocado benedict.  It was perfect and I thought Mama's was really cute and solid.  Even with the strange wait around the building, continue waiting while you drool over the food line, feel pressured to make up your mind and order and pay all before you get to sit down and sip your coffee!

I am open to returning but I won't be making any extra efforts to get there.
author: Nicole N.

description:
Hell, I don't know what to say, this place is as great as all the reviews say so, thats all, but if you insist, here is my take on it:

I ordered the Swedish french toast cause we wanted to try something sweet, the man ordered the smoked salmon scramble because we wanted something savory. They were both great and they were perfect proportions, we didn't end up begging to take a nap by the time we both got to work. Mama's is a great way to start the day in the city.

Note: went on a Thursday at about 9am, table for two and didn't wait at all.
author: kate r.

description:
Every time i'm in the area i end up going to Mama's for breakfast. My grandparents and uncles love this place so it's the first place they think of. There is always a line outside, but it is totally worth the wait. Sometimes the line is WAY to long so we will go to Chinatown. So if have the patience to wait and watch people eat for maybe an hour then it would be worth it. 

So when you finally get to the beginning on the line you tell the server how many is in your party. Then you stand in another line to order your food. You can see what's cooking and all the ingredients they use. Then you wait in that line for a table. It's a long process, but you'll get to eat eventually. 

The food is excellent and the service is good too. The last time i went to Mama's i ordered the California omelet and it was delicious. I've also had their pancakes and french toast and it is pretty amazing. It really isn't a huge menu, but you can always find something you want to try. 

You have to get there early though otherwise you'll be the line for quite some time.
author: Garrett L.

description:
I'd give Mama's 3.5 stars if possible. Minus 1 star for the crappy gas-station quality coffee. Minus 1/2 star for the wait, but whatever, if a place is good it's to be expected. I'm a brunch fanatic so I'm aware this usually means long lines.

I came here around 10:00 am on a weekday and figured my friend and I wouldn't have to wait but not so...we waited about 20 minutes just to get in the door and stand in line to order. In the meantime we were standing outside, hungry and salivating at the numerous dishes landing on people's tables, trying to decide which looked better...the egg or bread dishes. My friend got an omelette and swore it was the best one he's ever eaten (apparently that's a big deal).

I got the lowfat apple yogurt french toast with fresh berries. It was good but I wish I'd ordered a side of eggs or something to balance out the large amount of sugar. Again, I was bummed about the coffee.

Do I think this place is amazing? Not really, but it's good ...I'd come back and give the omelettes a try. I'll just have coffee from somewhere else, first.

By the way, I didn't have the eggs benedict but they looked really, really good...
author: Kara M.

description:
Good, but when often put in the same league as Dottie's, a tad overrated.

I've had omelettes and banana walnut french toast here.  Both very good, and I'm really not taking anything away from Mama's at all, but if you're going to go to one of the "wait an hour" breakfast places, Dottie's and Brenda's definitely beat Mama's.

Again, still really good!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Good Quality, Good service, perfect place for family brunch.
Love the lovely attitude of all the waiters, although standing in line in a cold weather is not that interesting lol, but the fresh and delicious food definitely worth the wait!!!
author: Christy Y.

description: I think this has to be one of the best brunches I have ever had! The smoked salmon eggs benedict and french toast are amazing here!
author: Christina B.

description: Best of the bunch! Mamas is THE go to place for breakfast. Order the MONTE CRISTO! with their homemade jam, soooo DELICIOUS! Also definitely try their cinnamon french toast or their smoked salmon eggs benedict. YUM! Ingredients are super fresh. Each order comes with their homefries which are AMAZING and fresh fruits! Cute little place, presentation is always beautiful. A bit of a wait but definitely worth it!
author: Cindy N.

description:
While my friend and I were waiting in line in the cold and breezy morning, we were trying to warm ourselves by imagining what the foods on the menu specials looked like. By the time we were head of the queue, still outside of course, we knew exactly what we wanted after pondering the menu for half an hour.

Once we got to the queue inside, we watched intently as the preparers were chopping up the fresh avocadoes, making a mouth-watering berry parfait, preparing a Dungeness crab omelet, and sprinkling powder sugar on the French toast.  By the time we got the cashier to take our orders, we already changed our minds on our breakfast.  Regardless, anything you try is guaranteed to make you breakfast-happy.  This is especially true in this city where most people skip a hearty breakfast.
author: Cathy H.

description:
Great food, but the food doesn't really justify the wait.  However, if you can get there later on a Sunday, you can usually wait just half an hour or so.  And even if you get nothing but the orange juice, it might be worth the wait.

And during crab season, get a crab omellette, dammit.
author: Monika M.

description:
Mama's. I don't even know where to begin. So I'll start outside on the sidewalk like everyone does. You can read the menu up and down, make up your mind, but by the time you get in front of the counter piled high with breads, rolls, fruit, loaves, and sizzling eggs and bacon, your decision goes out the window. 

The service here is quick and friendly, the atmosphere warm even on the coldest SF day. Everything I've had has looked and tasted delicous. I love their omelettes- Mama's Children's Favorite, or the eggwhite scramble (if you're feeling like not splurging). Of course the Monte Cristo is heavenly too. 

Bad sign: I was flipping through SF Magazine one day. They ran a feature on North Beach, including a pic of the line at Mama's. I was in it. Oooh. Time to stop going to Mamas for awhile.
author: Lynn B.

description:
Very good food.  Probably worth the wait but not at all advised if you're in a hurry.  Took us about an hour to get in, seated, and served, and a quarter of that to eat.  Of that wait, thirty to forty-five minutes were spent outside, queued up, listening to a bearded gentleman of dubious residential status give us extensive and severe warnings about the Kennedy family, their political connections, the nefarious means by which they had stolen ideas for patents from his brain, and the insidious murder of his father, who simply wanted to go home.  Mm, local flavor!

The french toast is light and fluffy, the eggs are to die for, and those are the best home fries you will ever put into your mouth.  Service was excellent, once you get past the initial issues with getting in the door and standing around for ten minutes staring at people willing them to get up and leave so you can finally sit down because seriously, that sucks.  Our server kept our drinks full, advised that I try the (excellent) jam, and was generally very pleasant.  

I would definitely recommend Mama's to my friends... but not if you're in any kind of a hurry.  It'd be an incredible local corner spot, however.  I wish they took credit cards, however.
author: Sid P.

description: Possibly the best breakfast I've ever had.  Girlfriend and I shared the crab Benedict and the French toast sampler.  It's worth the wait.
author: Doug B.

description:
once I got my buttermilk pancakes with fresh fruits placed in front of me....
(silence)


till I was finished.
Yes, it looks pretty, but tastes even better.
Loved it!!! came here on a tues late morning and there was no wait. :)
author: minna p.

description: We went in April 2010. I read the previous reviews and was extremely excited about trying out a different restaurant in SF. The wait wasn't too bad. Although my Niece thought it was too long. Ordering is confusing if you haven't eaten there before. and they only take cash which sucked. The food was okay. It wasn't the best, but it wasn't the worse. We had the 2 egg with ham - Okay; Crab omelet with swiss cheese - Good (Very Pricey); French toast (Just because we had to taste em) - Okay... The prices were very high! Service was okay! I guess I am a little spoiled, because I prefer to eat at home and make my own breakfasts, which includes omelet and/or french toast..
author: Que T.

description:
We had just woken up and re-parking the car so we don't get a ticket and saw a small line outside.  So we walked there and only had to wait 5 minutes max to get in.  I like how the ingredients were displayed and you can see the cooks do their work in front of you.  We saw the muffins still in the oven and a lady checked to see if they were ready by sticking a toothpick in it.  So we had to order 1 as we knew they were fresh out the oven.

We had 2 egg breakfast with Italian sausage.  You can't go wrong with this, you can have it at any restaurant.  But the service was quick, my water was promptly filled if near the bottom.  And the prices were ok.  Good food, fairly warm place = we were happy.
author: James D.

description: For how much  this place was talked up, up, UP by people, I expected a lot more and was really disappointed. Luckily we got there early to avoid the line that started forming up the street, and we only waited for 15 minutes or so. My boyfriend tried the crab eggs Benedict, and I tried the pancetta eggs bennedict. Upon the recommendation of the lady at the counter, we shared some pancakes made from scratch, and a crumb cake. We also got bloody Mary's. Now we love spicy bloody Mary's, but these things were ridiculous. They should give people a warning!!!! The eggs Benedict was alright..... I understand trying to do different spins on it, but they just didn't WOW me!!!!! The small portions of home fried potatoes were burned. The only thing that really impressed me was the yummy gooey crumb cake. For any breakfast lovers who truly want to be WOWED........ Joe's Place in my hometown of Paso Robles,CA has this place beat hands down. And the longest wait is 20 min. Just saying.....  ;)
author: Helen L.

description:
It's been said too well by too many, so I'll just go echo echoooooo.  

Get the cranberry bread. Oh my gawd.
author: Ben S.

description:
This place has nice, cute decor, but it is extremely small so the lines to get seated are fairly long.  One creative way they try to speed things up is to ask for orders and payment before you are seated.  (good idea)

The food is good but not great...and a bit overpriced (average $10 per plate).  I had a northern Italian omelette that was rather bland, but my boyfriend's Swedish cinammon French toast was very good.  Both portions were relatively small compared to other SF diners (Dottie's or Eats) and were served with no/small side dishes.  If you feel like eating here, don't bring a huge appetite and you might have a better experience.

Bon appetit.
author: Anika K.

description:
Great place for breakfast if you don't mind waiting in line!  I can't say that I have had anything bad at this place.
