The monte cristo was weird the first time I ordered it, but now it is a must everytime I go back.  It is pretty painful waiting in line watching people enjoy their food while your hungry-ass drools.  Just remind yourself it is worth it.  

Side note:  The focaccia  bakery place across the street is also thumbs up.  Get there early because once they run out for the day, they close.
author: Jason A.

description:
Getting here from the Inner Sunset is no small task. When I went, it was one of those first-sunny-then-rainy days. I had to take the N Judah and then the super-slow 30 Stockton bus, which crawled through Chinatown. I got damp from waiting outside in the light rain w/o an umbrella. With so many great breakfast places in my own neighborhood, why was I going here?? Simply because I had to.

Overall, with tip, I must've spent $15+ on breakfast. *It was still worth it!*

The food was excellent, and the staff, though hurried, was very efficient. Whether this was born out of necessity or pure genius, I don't care--being able to order and pay before sitting down was a great idea. No waiting for the check or change. As someone wrote before, definitely bring cash--no credit cards accepted. (The last thing you want is to happen is to finally reach the counter to order and then realize you can't pay.)

As I sat down to my swedish cinnamon french toast, my mood and the weather outside improved. I left Mama's very full and content. If this place wasn't so far, I'd come more often.
author: Richie K.

description:
It doesn't matter what day of the week it is,this place  is always Crowded As Hell! That's always a good sign that it's a good place to eat(most of the time atleast). 

This place is very small but cozy at the same time. So fellas, it's a good place to take ladys to, trust me. the service is great and i can't find some thing I don't like on the menu. Their breakfast, their lunch menu, all good. I can't explain anymore. JUST FRIGGIN GO THERE AND CHECK IT OUT AIGHT!!
author: RICKY C.

description:
Pretty damn good. 

I LOVE breakfast/brunch food, so as my weekend trip to SF approached, I began asking local SF'ers where the best spot for a GOOD, hearty breakfast was.  Most of the locals told me that Mama's was a "must-try."  Our party headed out to Mama's on a Friday morning, and we ended up waiting around 30 minutes for our table (not too bad).  All I have to say is that our wait was WORTH IT.  

We each got an omelette, and although all three were good, the Northern Italian was by far the most delectable.  We decided to go "all out" and also order a chocolate brioche french toast (the day's special) for the table.  The berries that covered the brioche were SO fresh, and the toast itself was oh-so yummy!  

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone.  Although the wait can be pretty ridiculous, once you take that first bite, you'll realize that it was well worth the wait.
author: Emily C.

description:
I came here around 11:30 on a Wednesday.  There was a line around the corner of the restaurant.  I took the opportunity to chat with the other people in line.  If you're really bored, you can spend fifty cents on an S.F. Chronicle.  It took fifteen minutes until I was at the front the line.

As I came close to entering the restaurant, the waitress directed me to another line inside the restaurant.  Once I went to the front of this other line, they took my order of Earl Grey Tea, a Small Fruit Bowl and a Northern Italian Omlette (comes with fried potatoes and toast).  The other reviews told me to stay away from the coffee and I did.  

The service that I received was outstanding!  The waitresses were attractive and they always smiled at the customers.  I would come back to this place if I were in the area.
author: Walter C.

description:
The pancakes will make you see God. 

I'm not even a big pancake fan. These are light and amazing. I had no idea pancakes could be this good.

Everything else was at least good, but not necessarily worth a 30 minute wait. The eggs benedict looked amazing as well, but I did not partake. I don't know if I ever will. It will be near impossible to come here again and not get the pancakes.
author: Matt W.

description:
And now, a haiku in honor of my first ever foray to the greatest breakfast spot in town:

Weekday brunch? No line!!!!
Open-faced omelet special
Was out of this world
author: Leela S.

description:
Despite the fact that we were 1) hungover, 2) starving and 3) had walked a mile to get here, the wait outside the door on a Friday morning did not deter us and the food, once served, was everything we'd imagined it could be.  The apple crumb cake I started with was divine and the Washington Square omelette had loads of Italian Sausage, peppers and cheese in it.  The homemade baguette and homemade jam were the icing on the cake.  Totally worth the wait.

ps. It's cash only
author: Lauren L.

description:
One of the best breakfast places I've been to, if not the best.

It's a no-frills, walk up and order style of restaurant with some amzing omelettes and french toast.  

It's a shame I don't live closer to Washington Square :-)
author: Nate H.

description:
THE WAIT:
We waited about an hour around noon on a Saturday.  It was a nice day so the wait wasn't too bad.  There's a line outside to get in.  Then when you get in, there's another line and wait to order and be seated.  

OUR FOOD:
We ordered the crab benedict, the monte christo, and the french toast sampler.

I RECOMMEND:
The crab benedict was really not all that great to me.  It tasted pretty typical and not really any more superior than any other crab benedict I've had.  The potatoes were pretty standard.  

The Monte Christo was excellent.  This was the first I've had a Monte Christo so I don't really have a frame of reference, but it was a great introduction.  The flavors sound weird, especially with the jam, but it worked very well to complement the saltiness of the cheese and meat.  

The french toast sampler was also very good.  I'm a fan of meals with variety, so the choice to have three types of french toasty was definitely my steeze.  All three were very good.  

THE CONCLUSION:
I doubt I'll come back here, only because of the wait.  It's good food, but not worth an hour wait.
author: Per C.

description:
The food is fantastic...but the lines?

I would never, ever stand in line for brunch. 

That said, we got there right at 8 on a Friday and didn't have to wait. The food is absolutely fabulous. Wife had a special apple yogurt french toast dish and i had the northwestern omelette. Both were absolutely delish and the homemade preserves they have on the table can best be described as "crack."  Even the coffee is good.

Again, if you can get here early, and not wait in line...totally 100% worth it. But I would never stand in line (god, for two hours? really?) for it.
author: Dave S.

description:
An adorable breakfast and lunch spot. We went Saturday morning, so there was a line out the door. You can watch the chefs cook as you wait in line when you move up into the diner. We waited almost two hours until we reached the cash register, ordered and got seated. 

I ordered their french toast and it is the most decadent and heavenly french toast one will ever taste. It's not really sweet, but far from bland and no kind of syrup is even necessary. The waiter was so friendly and provided excellent service. He recommended that I enjoy my french toast with their mixed berry compote (which you'll find on each table), rather than the syrup. My oh my... their berry compote was perfect. It wasn't too sweet and it was loaded with berries. Definitely a better substitute than the traditional syrup. I'd love to have this for breakfast every single morning. 

Everyone else said their omelette's and potatoes were good, and so I tried some. It was pretty good, but my french toast was definitely the winner. DING DING DING!
author: Diana C.

description: We came in for brunch on saturday. Took us more than 2.5 hours finding a parking spot and later waiting in the queue to get to the table. We ordered a shrimp benedict and breakfast sandwich with crab. Both the crab and shrimp were very fresh and excellent. Probably one of the best shrimp I have had. The potato on the side was also very good. However am not sure I would ever return. However good the food, its not worth more than 2 hour wait on the road.
author: Santhosh N.

description:
7:55am on a Monday morning..a line forms out side Mama's. I was getting excited..

By 8:20am we were seated inside the adorable restaurant..

By 8:30am our food arrived...

It was good - I wish I could say better but it was just good.  I had the apricot french toast and could not taste the apricots. My mom had the chocolate cinnamon french toast and she could not taste the chocolate.

A little hyped up - but it was definitely worth going once. I wish I had a better experience for paying $30.22 for breakfast!
author: Heidi B.

description: The food is good.  But good enough to justify an hour an a half wait?  Not for me.  It's one of those places that you want to try out because you've heard so many good things.  So you brave the long wait outside on your feet and go in with high expectations.  Like I said - the food is good.  You can get a solid meal with fast, friendly service (once you're inside.)  I just didn't find the experience to be mind-blowing.  I wouldn't feel the need to go back.
author: Julie M.

description:
This place probably doesn't need another 5 star review... but what the heck. This place makes a mean breakfast -- probably the best in the city. The pancakes you can get here are pretty much as close to perfection as you'll find, and the seafood benedicts and omlettes are amazing. Sure the prices are steep, but this isn't the kind of place you'd go to eat breakfast every day (or weekly, for that matter.. even though I'd love to)... because if you did, you'd seriously gain like 20 lbs without even trying. Yes, the wait can be frustrating, but seriously... it's worth it.

Update 12/19/05 - I had brunch here on Friday and tried the Monte Cristo sandwich for the first time.. and I gotta say, it was just crazy good. Highly recommended.
author: Sunny Y.

description:
I used to not be a huge breakfast or sunday brunch fan. This place changed all that. Well, i didn't enjoy standing on the long line for 30 minutes, but I must say: once I got inside I became a true fan. The atmosphere is cheery and quite lovely while also being cozy. The food is incredible. 

The biggest oddity was the outdoor restroom. But much can be forgiven, as I still think fondly of the next time I can go back. Good happy morning vibes to all that go. Extraordinary and "makes you glad to be alive" is the best way I can describe it. The fact that you can finish your meal and then stroll around North Beach after a fabulous breakfast is just amazing.
author: Risa F.

description:
Great brunch spot in the city!  The long line is worth the wait. 
Bring cash, they do not take credit cards.
author: stephanie ..

description:
If this review was purely based on food it would be a solid four stars but sadly Mama's ALWAYS has a huge line stretching down the block AND parking is always hugely difficult in this area. Be forewarned.
The food though is delicious. Their french toast is amazing as is their Monte Cristo. Super cute decor too. If you happen to be in the area and the line's not too long then definitely give it a try.
author: Cathy T.

description:
I love love LOVE Mama's.  It's worth the wait every time.  Everything I've eaten here is fantastic.  It's one of me and my husbands favorite places for breakfast/brunch.

Everything tastes so fresh.  The Pancakes are light and fluffy, nothing is too greasy, and the selection of fresh crab, scallops, and lobster for omelets and whatever other specials they are having is simply mouth watering.

Every time we come here we are eating off of each others plates so that we both get to try something different and share all of the yummy goodness.

The restaurant is small inside and they really pack it in.  It can get loud in there due to the close quarters.  The food is so good though......I honestly can't pay attention to anything else.  My husband and I get into this eating fog where nothing can be heard but our own moans of pleasure as we swallow each bite of food.

When are bellies are full, we're off for a stroll in Washington Park.  I love this city.
author: lea m.

description:
The food here is delicious, but I was put off by the bouncer.  When we  arrived, there was a line.  Not surprising for SF on a Saturday around brunch-time.  Lack of any indication of their seating process, we entered, expecting to find a hostess or a clipboard upon which to register our name, etc.  Instead we were gruffly dismissed by a busboy/bouncer who was guarding the door from the inside.  His only comment before shutting us out was to "wait outside and we'll call you."

Once inside, the ordering and seating process was unclear, to us and just about everyone else in line.  It seemed awkward to order in line then just stand there clogging up the works while waiting to be assigned a table.

I understand the assembly-line flow, but they could do with a little communication to the patrons.

Barring the waiting experience, the food was delicious.  We had French toast with fruit.  They make their own berry jam and it was a wonderful substitute for the maple syrup!
author: Ken B.

description:
I visited this restaurant totally expecting to give it five stars. After all, it's received as much rave reviews as Dottie's (a place I gave four stars to), except it's not in the Tenderloin. In fact, it's in a pleasant neighborhood below Coit Tower. Unfortunately, I didn't think the food lived up to the hype.

It was 9:30 on a weekday, and I ended up totally underestimating the line. When I went to Dottie's, it was a Saturday morning, so the line was obviously ridiculous. But the line here at Mama's was just as bad.

I ordered the Washington Square M'Omelette (Italian sausage, tomato, bell pepper, and jack cheese; $9.95) and a large glass of orange juice ($3.75).

Whenever I order breakfast, the thing I look forward to the most is the potatoes. The grilled red potatoes here didn't do anything for me. It was bland and slightly undercooked. The other major disappointment was the orange juice. I'm used to the small and pricey portions of fruit juice at a restaurant, but the one at Mama's wasn't very good.

No complaints about the omelette -- it's the reason for the four stars. Nice and spicy, with a good serving of meat inside. The other positive point about the restaurant is the staff -- they were all very friendly and polite. Even the cashier lady, who appeared pissed off until she actually started to take people's orders.
author: Ryo M.

description:
Absolutely FREAKIN' amazing food!  Be prepared -- long lines, long lines, long lines. BUT SO worth it!

I like the eggs benedict. I also like... this sandwich. Actually, I love everything this place has to offer. 

So if you were to visit, I advise the following: 
Wear a Northface (or whatever brand) fleece for the wait outside
Don't be in a hurry
Bring an appetite
And if you like to people watch, this place is a fun place to do so! 

Enjoy!!! Bon Appetit!
author: Lisa L.

description:
I found Mama's to be pretty good -- not exceptional -- food-wise. My home fries were pretty unevenly cooked, my wife's crab/avocado/brie/green onion omelet was dry and overcooked.  I kind of liked walking through the kitchen and out the back door, down some stairs and into a tacked-on washroom--similar to Mario's Cigar Store.

Their prices were on the high side, but that's basic supply and demand.  If I ran a restaurant with an hour-long wait in line to be seated, I'm sure my prices would reflect that too.  I do wish we'd tried the French Toast sampler, so we'll probably go back at some point.
author: Matt K.

description:
Pretty darn good!  I had a Dungness Crab Benedict and shared a Cinnamon French Toast with berries with a girlfriend and we finished them!!  My other girlfriend ordered the Italian Omlette and I think that was actually better than my crab benedict...  

It is worth the wait!
author: Karina L.

description:
Mama's is perfection.

It is how you envision breakfast dishes when you read the menu - but at other restaurants you are usually disappointed - at Mama's its better than you imagined. 

The last time I went with my mama and her girlfriend. I had the special which was prosciutto, pear, and Gruyere cheese omelet and my mom had the french toast sampler, her girlfriend had the eggs Benedict. Flawless. Even the garnish (where most restaurants skimp) which is usually a strawberry is sublimely sweet. 

We also bought three pieces of coffee cake - which although delicious, a bad idea because 1)mama's does not have beds in the back where you can take a nap after you dine 2) I have no self control and ate way to much and will probably never be able to wear those jeans again. 

My advice to you: GO! don't even think about the line because you won't even remember the 45 minutes you spent watching everyone eat after you take your first heavenly bite.
author: Rhiana M.

description:
Came here a couple weeks ago.  Totally forgot until right now...not that it was bad...i've been a bit distracted.

BUT this place was so good.  We got there at the perfect time and only had a couple people in line before us...when i first walked up to the line up i was amazed.  fresh fruits, fresh baked breads and muffins, delicious juices, and a most amazing menu.  

I ordered the eggs benedict...duh.  and he ordered i think the denver omlette?  i dunno.  both were amazing!  I got some apple juice, he got some orange.  i liked em both but i'm more of an AJ girl.  the server girl was nice and she even lent me a pen for the crossword.
author: desiree n.

description:
Excellent breakfast food... and that's saying a lot because I don't really like breakfast food that much.  Monte Cristo is awesome.  Who knew jam could be used in that way :)  

Minus 1 star only because the line is so long.
author: John K.

description: This place is decent. Not as great as everyone thinks or as the lines would have you think.  Omelets tasty, love the pancakes. The space is small, hence the long waits.  If there isn't a wait, it's worth stopping by, if there is a line (which there always is), it's not worth it.
author: Ka C.

description: One of the best places for breakfast in SF, a definite must have.  The Monte Cristo is awesome.  My gf and I usually get a short stack.  I also have the crab benedict with lots of fresh crab. Go during a weekday and avoid the line! Otherwise expect up to an hour wait, but its well worth it.
author: ed c.

description: This place is great.  The food is good and the prices are reasonable for what you order.  Only thing is the long wait.   The wait ranges between 45 minutes to an hour and a half.   Get there early and have a light snack before.  Also bring a nice hat to block the sun on hot days while standing in line.  Bring a bottle of water as well.   Again the food is delicious.  You'll love it.
author: Vernon M.

description: Do not come starving or you will end up eating someone while waiting in line but would have to say well worth the wait, which seems to be tradition. Service was good but not excellent  being that efficiency is priority for getting people in & out. Previous tip was left at our table gives you an idea of how fast they try to move tables. The meal was great! Excellent variety of breakfast choices. Crab omelette & pancakes were delicious. Bit pricey but well worth it for the tradition. P.s. meal costs us an extra $55 for parking ticket in area. B/c of long wait make sure to pay for at least 2hrs time.
author: Reggie A.

description: San Francisco loves lines and hype.  The breakfast here was heavy and sickening.  I don't get it but I strangely understand the attraction.
author: Duanne G.

description:
Great location and great food. 

This place is just across from Washington square. You want to look for the small tiny restaurant on the corner with people waiting outside. If you see that's you'll find mama's. This place is SF, an institution in the city. Fresh and really good breakfast, lunch, and brunch. This place is fast, clean, and authentic. People are really nice here. I enjoy the food everytime. You can't go wrong.
author: alfred k.

description:
This is my #1 breakfast restaurant!  Okay, I hate waiting in the line for about 20-35 minutes (rain or shine) just to get inside, and needing to wait in a line to order and use the restroom!  You'll end up waiting for about an hour and spend only 20 minutes eating.  Go to Mama's when you have all morning to wait!  This place is pricey (what isn't pricey in sf?), but you'll understand why when you order my favorites!   First off, don't get too excited about this place cuz you'll be disappointed.  

FYI, do not order their fresh orange juice.  It comes in a small glass and you'll regret it!  Just water, coffee, or ice tea is good enough! 

My guy and I go to Mama's whenever we wake up early enough for brunch on the weekend.  We both order the Shrimp and Avocado Benedict with Grilled Tomatoes.  The shrimp is small...I wish they would put more in their benedict, but the overall serving size is decent.  The eggs and avocado is rich, while the shrimp and tomato is sweet and refreshing. The flavors are really yummy and indescribable best eggs benedict I ever had!  

In addition to the benedict, we usually share the french toast (we've tried different kinds with mixed berries and love them all).  The french toast comes with a sprinkle of powdered sugar and a splash of chocolate syrup on the side.  Mama's makes their own syrup that goes well with their french toast or pancakes.  The best French toast plate is the Sampler plate (and I think we added berries).  Our last sampler plate included Cranberry Orange Walnut, banana nut and original french toast.  The cranberry orange french toast has a nice sweet and citrus flavor stuffed in bread.  The banana nut is also good..and you can't go wrong with the original french toast. 

I'm drooling just thinking about this place!!!!
author: Dee S.

description:
phenomenal. 

best breakfast in the city hands down. 

pancakes: superb
french toast: amazing
omelette: nom nom nom

well worth the wait.
author: Erin C.

description:
Well, we finally did it.  We woke up, walked over and stood out in the rain to see what all the hubbub was about.  I've been hearing about Mama's for years and always looked at those poor people standing out on Stockton Street and wondered "hmmm.... those poor hyped up souls... could it really be worth the wait?  Does it REALLY live up to all this hype?"

Well, yes.  Why, yes it does.

First off, we expected a couple hours of waiting and were seated within 40 minutes... so that helped.  What was really unexpected was how friendly and welcoming the staff is.  I always envisioned some sort of soup-nazi style vibe where you'd better be prepared to order promptly and correctly or you'd have to go to the back of the line.  Turns out, nothing could be further from the truth-- we were showered with smiles and helpfulness and really got the feeling that they were actually glad to have us there.  Who would've thought?

And the food.... oh sweet Jesus, the food!  I left this place so full I was literally shaking (with delight).  That Monte Cristo is just... I don't even know... it's just soooo good!  And with that homemade blackberry jam?  Hell yes.  Just hell yes.  That's really all I can say.  My kid didn't even use the maple syrup they gave him with his French toast sampler, he just went to town with that awesome jam.  

I'm not entirely sure I can stand waiting in this line very often, but even if you do it just once, Mama's is totally worth the wait.
author: Matt L.

description: Sure I waited in line for 1h 45min in the rain! Once we got inside I ordered the pancakes with freshfruit, home fries, bacon and a latte. Everything was delicious and definitely worth the wait. My brother says it was worth getting sick in the rain...lol
author: Laura M.

description: Went to mamas because I heard they had good food but didn't realize how long the line would be ....but it was worth it I got the strawberry banna waffles and the Monte cristo its was scrumptious I would go back for sure only thing i would do different is go early because the line gets pretty long besides that I was more than satisfied with my meal
author: Marcus W.

description: We had to wait in a long line but it was well worth the wait!  I had the dungeness crab eggs benedict and it was the best I had!  I still think about it now when I go to other brunch places.  The restaurant is very small but the atmosphere made you feel like you were at a family friend's house.  Come with an appetite but definitely expect a long wait.
author: Julie D.

description:
Is Mama's worth the wait? I'm not sure. 

My favorite meal of the day is breakfast. When I heard of Mama's, I was excited. I went to Mama's on a Sunday with my sister. We arrived around 8:20. I would advise anyone going to Mamas to arrive early. We waited 45 minutes to get inside. Another 15 minutes to order at the counter and 10 more minutes to get a table. 

I ordered the French Toast sampler with Swedish cinnamon, banana nut, and lemon berry bread. My sister had the 2 eggs scrambled with sausage links and wheat toast. Food was great once I got it. The french toast sampler was one of the best french toast I've had in a long time. 

I don't know if I would ever wait that long again for breakfast. Go early at least once to Mama's and decide yourself.
author: Shelly L.

description:
we came here on a sunday, so the wait was about 45 minutes long. so i had high expectations and was critical as to whether all that was really worth it.

my friend insisted on getting the monte cristo sandwich. it's a ham and cheese sandwich between two pieces of french toast, served with cranberry sauce. yes, it does sound weird, even kind of gross.

it ruled. seriously. ruled my sunday. if brunch were a nobel prize category, the monte cristo would win.
author: Jane P.

description: I love the pancakes, the french toast, the benedicts, and you have to try the Monte Carlo! BUT I had to take one star off for the wait...
author: Helen C.

description: I love food here but kinda pricey. You might have to wait in the line!!
author: Micheal D.

description:
I know a lot of people love mama's, but I think it is more of a north beach locals thing.  There are much better places in San Francisco to have breakfast.

I went one weekday morning with a couple of friends.  The line to get in was long (about 1 hour and 20 minutes) but at the time I figured it was a small price to pay if their food was really that good. So we get in, order and grab a table.  I got the eggs benedict. Meh - I have had way better in the city. Their hollandaise sauce was far too tangy.  My friend got French toast.  She is obsessed with french toast - orders it every time we go out to breakfast (which is quite often). I knew there was a problem when I asked her how it was and she shrugged her shoulders.  Uh-oh.  I tried it - not horrible but not great either. I was sad.  I was hoping to add another great breakfast place to my list of favorite restaurants in the city.  It was not to be.
author: Maya S.

description: it was good, but it was not worth the wait. I think as a restaurant, they could really make the wait better for ppl. start a sign up sheet or something. having to wait in line when you are hungry in the morning for that long just isn't pleasant. there's no seating and you can't go anywhere for at least an hr. I used to work as a hostess at a restaurants that's always jammed packed with customers. My manager would say the longer the ppl wait the more they'd enjoy the food. I beg to differ.
author: Cicie W.

description: I figured out why they called it Mama's!! Every word after every bite of the delicious food makes you say "Oh MAMA!" Seriously delicious. The wait is a bit long, so I suggest arriving before it opens!!
author: Karla R.

description:
Ok by far one of the best breakfast San Francisco has to offer but come on I have to wait outside for an hour only to have to wait inside for 20 minutes to order only wait again for another 10 minutes for a table. Ok So I basically have to wait to wait. But if you can get past that Mamas is actually pretty good. I dont know if we just eat a lot or if the prices are high but my girlfriend and I can't seam to leave this places without spending around $50 to $55 which in my opinion is high for breakfast. Oh and one note. CASH ONLY and parking is a BIOTCH. Your best bet is go during the week wehen there is less of a crowd and always try and arrive early.

For the first timers it goes something like this

1. Arrive and wait in the line outside. Dont even worry about putting your name on a list becasue there isnt one

2. Eventually you make it to the front door and they usher you in only to wait in another line to order. THis can take up to 20 minutes sometimes on top of the already 1 hour outside wait

3. You now reach the register and place your order you pay and then are told to wait again for the next available table to sit at

4. Finally after starring down the family of 6 that are taking 3 tables they get the hint and leave, the wait staff quickly scrambles to divide those tables up so you can sit and enjoy your yummy north beach breakfast

Order the low fat french toast that is dipped in yogurt and apples. I can't see how this is low fat but who cares its Damn Good
author: Gabe G.

description:
#700!

My husband and I decided to head here for breakfast this morning after grabbing a latte over at Cavalli's bookstore.  Total wait time was just under an hour, and was well worth it.  The Northern Italian Omelette was delicious and Eggs Benedict with procsciutto and grilled tomato was to die for good.  The home fries were tasty and the service was great.  Even while waiting in line inside, you get to watch the magic happening in the kitchen.  We'll definitely be back again!
YUM
author: Chrys W.

description: Bette's on 4th St. in Berkeley regularly has more than an hour wait on weekends.  But you sign in and check back from time to time.  You can shop or have a coffee nearby, and when you sit down you get an excellent meal.  Why Mama's can't work with a sign-up system is a mystery.  These are my two favorite Bay Area brunch places in terms of food.  But I'll go back again and again to Bette's and I'm done with Mama's.  It's for young people who don't mind standing in the sun.  Pity.  The wait staff is wonderful.  Adding benches outside helps somewhat, but there is no way the best food in the world could be worth that wait.
author: Alan M.

description: Great American breakfast with lots of selection. Love their Salmon egg benedict. Not an economical meal for a breakfast.
author: Pach P.

description:
Come here hungry but be ready to wait.

The line is only long because the place is so very small but if there were a perfect way to cap off a Saturday night of drunken debauchery than it's by cleansing yourself in the wholesomeness of Mama's on Washington Square!

From the fresh made omelette's, eggs Benedict, fluffiest pancakes in town and the Monte Cristo you can absolutely not go wrong with anything on the menu. 

Order and eat as much as you can because it is worth it!
author: Vincent V.

description:
So I ditched work for an hour this morning and had breakfast here with my mom. The decor is very inviting with its country french atmosphere, it made me feel like I was really in store for some good fresh eats. We waited in line for only 10 minutes and ordered and I must say the food came out fast. Everything was pretty yummy but the coffee was a bit weak. My Mom had the eggs benedict and she said that the texture was very nice but the flavor was a bit mild.
I gave it a four because it was my first time and I can tell it has four potential. The cinnamon french toast will be the next thing I get from this yummy place. And I am just guessing that the coffee strength was a fluke.
author: Shawn P.

description:
There is a reason this place is noted as the best breakfast in SF ---- cus it IS! Only drawback, you snooze, you wait! I have gotten there before at 845am and there was still a 30 minute wait. 

If you get a seat too near the door, and its chilly outside, that could be a potential downer if you aren't dressed well and like your food warm for more than 2.5 minutes.

DO NOT forget to try their homemade boysenberry jam placed on the table, it is absolutely some of the best. I am from the Southeast where homemade jams, jellies and the like reign supreme, and this stuff kicks ass.

Their French Toast is undeniably one of the best dishes there. 

Can't go wrong with Mama's
author: j d.

description:
OK this wowed me. One highlight was when a table cleared, I went to sit down and move the trash that was on the table and wow the busser told me a thing or two! HAHA I am a do-it-yourselfer. Once he cleared the table, he didn't even offer for me to sit... revenge?

The choices are amazing. The french toast is indeed amazing and there are many choices!

Everyone should try this place.  BUT go on a weekday!
author: Aaron W.

description:
Rolled out of bed at 7AM in the East Bay to rush over to SF to...wait in line?  Yeah, the line was already substantial by the time we got there (about 9:45AM on a Saturday morning).  When you enter the building, salvation?  No another line to order food which was almost torture because we were oh so hungry and we got to spend 10 minutes or so staring at the fresh pastries (they looked SOOO good), the cooks cook, and to change our orders about a dozen times in our head.

The wait is almost nuts but the food is very good.  I prefer their omelettes over their sweeter dishes (I found the french toast to be really dry).  Fresh ingredients though!  And yummy sourdough baguettes.  

The staff was really friendly too.  It really takes the stress off of a long wait when everyone around you is so helpful and friendly.

If you haven't been, I'd suggest a visit (especially if you love breakfast food like I do), just be prepared for the wait (bring your sunglasses because the sun will be straight beaming into your eyes) and bring cash!
author: Angela Q.

description:
There is truly no better place for breakfast in San Francisco.  Absolutely everything they serve is delicious.   My favorite item is the prosciutto eggs benedict; merely seeing the dish makes me drool.  Couple that with their fresh squeezed orange juice and you have breakfast heaven!  We always get their pancakes as well, which are superb! Here's a hint, take the jam that's at each table and put that on top of them, you will not find a better jam at any other restaurant.

Now for the negatives.  HORRIBLY long wait.  Now, for the first dozen times I was there, the 30-45 minutes standing in line was not too bad.  But now it's just too much for me to bear.  Breakfast is something I want ASAP since I am hungry when I wake up.  Standing in line for nearly an hour is not worth it to me.  Not only that, but once you get into the restaurant, there is yet another line to get to the cashier.  After you get to the cashier and pay, you have to wait to get seated!  And finally, add the time to find parking.

Basic run down:

Food is great.
Lines are bad.
Parking sucks.
author: Serge S.

description:
So we get to Mama's at about noon on a Sunday very hungry.  Was that a good idea? Definitely not.  We waited and hour and a half (seriously).  I frankly think it's the longest I've ever waited for anywhere in the city.  However, the food was great.  One thing you have to get here... the Orange Juice! I still crave it and I don't know why!  All in all Mama's was delicious.  Fresh breads and pastries, good service, and in general the food was great.

However, one thing I found really annoying was I asked for a piece of bread from the waitress.  We had already paid and she brought be out a separate bill for the bread.  I was really surprised they charged me for a slice of bread and I was even more surprised they didn't say anything about it. 

Well in conclusion I would definitely go back here especially for the orange juice.  Now would I wait another hour and a half? Probably not.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I was debating on whether or not I should give this place 4 or 5 stars. I REALLY enjoyed eating here. The food is so delicious, but I'm not sure if I may be a little biased since I was starved from waiting in line for 45 minutes...and I probably would've enjoyed eating anything at that point.
I definitely don't regret the wait, which I hear is pretty normal for the place. I felt it was worth it, but its not a place you can go if you're strapped for time.
The restaurant is sort of small, so I guess that's why there is always a big line...anyways...if you've got the time come here. They have great omelettes!
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
3 reasons why you should eat here:

1. Monte Cristo Sandwich
2. Homemade Strawberry Jam
3. The yum-ness of their Monte Cristo sandwich when eaten with  their homemade jam

You should not eat here if you are an impatient person or don't have  cash.  I say this because the wait averages about 30-45 minutes, and they literally ONLY accept CASH & it's pricier than most breakfast joints. Service is okay, and I didn't notice the ambiance because I was too fixated on my food.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Have you tried Dottie's?  Darla's?

I have wanted to eat at mama's since I moved to SF 3 years ago, but I was never in North Beach + in the mood to wait in line to eat until last Saturday. 

We were really hungry, but it was a beautiful day, so we headed out to Mama's to make it happen.  The line was less long than usual so we examined the menu and immediately recoiled at the $18.50 shrimp and dungeoness crab omelet options.  

My first thought was "WTF!  Who pays $20 for an omelet?".  

My second thought was "Who wants a seafood omelet!?"  

I learned a terrible lesson in seafood omelets one time at Just For You (Oyster Omelet) and swore I would never go down that road again.  

Seafood omelets don't work.  They are always heavily laden with seafood, (to compensate for the outrageous pricing), and they are often watery and downright fishy, and/or rich and overpowering.  

To top it off, the fact that they would dumb-down precious dungeoness crab by wrapping it in egg and cheese earns them the douchebag award in my book.  That is on par with ordering a Knob Creek bourbon and mixing it with Diet Dr. Pepper.

My boyfriend tried the shrimp omelet and was highly dissatisfied.  (See above said reasons why seafood omelets do not work) He was also expecting prawns and instead the omelet was over-filled with baby sweet shrimp.  

I thought I would keep it safe and order the proscuitto benedict, which was one of the few other items on the menu that is inarguably difficult to fk up.  Well, lo' and behold: the hollandaise was the worst I have ever tasted.  Very salty and bland.  

We finished our meals, nonetheless, and were rushed out of the place as to accommodate the 25 other folks waiting outside in line.  I doubt I will return because it just wasn't that great.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I'm not really a breakfast bread person but the coffee cake drizzled with whatever it was looked delicious and I really wanted a piece but my dining companions and I forgot about the cash-only thing and didn't want to cheat the waitress out of part of her tip because we couldn't A) plan ahead or B) resist temptation. So no coffee cake for me.  Luckily, this place offers a damn fine breakfast and I'll be back -- this time with enough cash money to sample more of what Mama is offerin'. 

And yeah, we waited half an hour for a table, but it was a Saturday morning and it was perfect waitin' weather so who cares? 

Notes for newcomers:

* You wait in line outside until they invite you in to wait in a shorter line inside. Figure out what you want while you're waiting because you won't have the opportunity to sit down and ponder the menu -- you'll need to place your order before you get seated.

* Cash only!

* The bathroom? It's treacherous. Have someone hold your coat and purse before attempting the shimmy out the back door and outside along the building to the airplane-sized bathroom.

The bottom line: Great food, very friendly service, and totally worth the wait. Minus half a star for being cash only, but hey -- all the best places are, it seems, so I'll round back up to 5 stars.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
I'm a huge breakfast guy, and this place really didn't meet my expectations. Maybe I got the wrong thing, but it seems like most people here that gave Mama's a good review enjoyed the Swedish Cinnamon French Toast. It was mediocre at best. It was simply made and really didn't have much flavor either. The presentation was nice though. 

My girlfriend ordered the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast and it was a simple french toast with cinnamon bread drizzled with chocolate. That's it. We didn't have to wait in line that long though mainly because we got there at 830am on Saturday. We only waited for about 15 minutes, max.  Like most places,  the lines usually really start forming after me and my girlfriend get there, weird. 

I like the decor, the wait staff was friendly and it was very quaint. The food just didn't meet expectations. 

Will I ever go back? Sure, I'll give it another shot for lunch one day. My friends raved about the Monte Cristo, which I will try next time around.
author: Calvin L.

description:
The wait and the cash-only policy definitely suck, but goddamn this is the best breakfast food I've ever had and it's worth it.  Bring a book or paper or good company to pass the time that you spend waiting.

I've been here twice, and both times everything that everyone ordered was done just right.  I think the following story illustrates why this is so:

I was standing in line with my girlfriend, we had just finally gotten in the door and were looking over the chalk-written menu.  We see someone place a loaf of blueberry bread, steaming, onto the counter where all the other ingredients and baked goods are sitting.  Then I see someone take down the aforementioned menu and edit the French Toast listing to reflect the fact that they were now using a different type of bread.

That illustrates the freshness of the ingredients, and execution is flawless.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I really like Mama's. It's a great place for breakfast if you can handle the wait. The first time we went to Mama's, we waited about an hour and a half. Believe me, it's well worth the wait though. Why do you think the line is so freakin' long?! Anyway, I had the cinnamon French toast with chocolate the first time and the Washington Square omelet the second time. Both were fantastic! I think what makes this place even more special is the staff. They are so friendly!

The second time around we arrived at 7:45 a.m. (they open at 8 a.m.) on Sunday and got in with the first round of patrons. While waking up early is not a common thing for me on the weekend, it was worth it today! :-)
author: K. F.

description:
Reading the reviews and figuring it would be best to show up early, we made it there at 9:30am on a Sunday morning. Too late: at that point, the wait was already over an hour. While standing near Washington Square on a beautiful sunny Sunday morning isn't the worst thing in life, I can think of other things to do. 

Anyhow, the food was excellent. Started with a piece of carrot cake which was excellent, then had the specials, a dungeness crab omelette with avocado and brie, and another dungeness crab omelette with leeks. At almost $19 each, they were definitely the most expensive omelettes we had ever seen but they did not skimp on the crab meat, stuffing the omelettes to the gills so you do get your money's worth. Will definitely try to go back but at an early hour. While the food is very good, there are many other breakfast places that are equally satisfying and do not require such a long wait.
author: Jan Michael K.

description:
I am no longer a egg's benedict virgin!!  I ordered the salmon benedict and I was in heaven!  I love smaller restaurants  vs larger chains...great first impression

next time, i want to get the crumb cakes and bakery thangs....
author: Jac T.

description:
This place was worth the 30 minutes wait under the nice warm morning sun =)

My boyfriend and I ordered THREE!! dishes: Washington square (eggs w/ ham and sliced bell peppers), Mama's Children Favorite (mushroom, tomatoes, cheese), and a daily special (eggs white on french toast with a variety of berries spread over).  They were all yummy and healthy for a good lazy morning breakfast...

The place is quaint and the color makes it easy on the eyes.  I like the fast service and nice staff.  We wanted to get more food, but we only had enough cash for those dishes (did not know it's only cash!!)

Mama's definitely a delicious place to get breakfast.
author: Chau L.

description:
Best.  Breakfast.  Ever.


Well worth the wait. The french toast is da bomb. The homemade jam is superb. You must eat here.
author: Steven P.

description:
Mama's is HAND'S DOWN the BEST breakfast place I've ever been to!  It's always packed, no reservation, cash only.  If you can't make it out at 8am, be prepared to wait in line for up to 3 hours (on weekends)... but it's worth it just to go once & try it out.  The place is small and the line is out the door, so once you're done eating... you have to immediately leave.

I've had my first Eggs Benedict at Mama's and I don't think I've ever had anything else that could be compared to hers.  I think I will go back to visit her soon :)
author: Tisha Y.

description:
I live half a block up from Mama's so perhaps its easy access detracts from its status as a SF brunch destination hot spot.

But really people - it's not worth the wait! It's not bad food, but there's nothing special about it.And why would you want to wait in line outside, and then wait in line again to order, and then wait in line again to get seated?
author: serena l.

description:
Brunch is the thing to do on the weekend when you want to gossip with your friend, but waiting 3+ hours? Are you serious? Okay, the food was delicious but I don't know. The wait and the food coma it left me in was basically my entire Sunday.

The food:
I had the shrimp, avocado, grilled tomato benedict. It was tasty, though one of my eggs was a bit vinegary. The poached egg was perfect and oozed it's deliciousness all over everything. The grilled home fries were done well. The toast was over toasted and was hard as rocks to eat. Homemade jam was overly sweet but tasty. The bacon had too much fat but it was real thick cut bacon. I had a taste of my friend's french toast sampler. The cran orange was okay, but the swedish french toast was the perfect consistency. In a nutshell, the food was fresh and cooked well.

The staff:
The staff are extremely friendly and upbeat. Seriously, I was impressed by how nice the staff was.

The price:
Reasonable brunch price. My benedict was about $11.75. Side of bacon was about $3 dollars. Side of toast was $1 dollar. Cranberry juice was $2.50. My friend's french toast combo was $10.75. 

I'd definitely come again, but only if the wait was under an hour. Otherwise, there are plenty of brunch places that make delicious eggs benedict and you don't have to wait 3+ hours to finally get a meal.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I recently brunched here on a lazy Sunday afternoon and was surprised to find a line wrapped around the corner. I figured it must be good if people are willing to wait an hour plus. 

The eggs benedict is decent but the chocolate and fruit french toast is delicious! The french toast is drizzled in a warm chocolate sauce and topped with bananas, strawberries and blueberries. 

Avoid coming here with a large group- my party of five slightly annoyed the owner and there are few tables that can accommodate more than four people. Bring cash- Mama's does not accept checks or credit cards.
author: CL S.

description:
It's Sunday morning, and I emerge from those hospital doors free as a bird with my co-worker, and we crave breakfast - real breakfast, not the crap in the cafeteria.  It's 7:30 and it's time to line up at Mama's.  At 10am I'm full off the Apple Pan Dore and a side of home fries.  It's such a bad idea to come here right after working a night shift, and you're all hungry...so hungry that your eyes are hungrier than your stomach.  You stand in line reading the menu and watching people devour their eggs benedict and you are like, "fuck the diet!  what diet? what WEDDING dress?"  My coworker had the shrimp and avocado omelette with a pancake on the side.  Wow.  Let's trade, friend! 

I want to say this place has magical berries, if ever there were such a thing.  I had a bite of the pancake with the syrup and the berries and I wanted to die.  Hands down worth the 30+ minute wait.  Although we were seated at a table and then 5 minutes after our drinks were served the host kindly asked if we would trade tables so he could accommodate a larger party with strollers.  We were like, "Sure, whatever makes your job easier..." so we moved.  But I don't think things panned out his way though, because a minute after he left, another couple was seated next to us and he came back with two high chairs and a confused look on his face.  The table we sat at was right in front of the door, so all the people waiting in line were watching us eat.  Awkward, but entertaining.  

I'm coming back.  I already know what I want to order.  Weekends are for shrimp benedict and a side of fresh berries.  If the fiance can get up in time for a 7:45am tee time, then he can wake his ass up on a Sunday and take me here too.
author: Meesh K.

description:
Wow. WAY overrated, people! I don't even know where to begin. I'm not one to usually complain about things being overrated either. I tend to like going with the majority opinion, but seriously, not worth the hour- long wait. I endured an hourplus-long wait on an early Sunday morning for a 3-star dungeness crab eggs benedict. I don't understand the hype. I'll say that the portion was more than sufficient, the ingredients were fresh, but it was overall, very mediocre! Nothing special. I expected out-of-this-world hollandaise sauce, but I wouldn't even say that it was good. It was too sour. Ok, tops, *maybe* 3.5 stars. 

Where oh Where are the good brunch places in SF??? This place is NOTHING compared to a decent brunch spot in NY or Chicago. And I also tried their french toast. Sure, their flavors of toast were definitely unique and sounded great on the menu, but again, the taste was just mediocre, and the texture of the bread was kinda too rough. I think the best parts of the meal were the nice weather outside and the freshly-squeezed OJ. 

The decor, I guess, was cute, and the staff was friendly enough. Also, I was just super relieved to be off work. So.. the 3 stars I'm giving this place isn't even for the taste of the food. Oh yeah, and just so you know, not only do you have to stand outside forever, the line continues on the inside.
author: Verna L.

description:
Who would have thought that the wait for a Wednesday at 10:30 am would be over an hour long!  Amazingly it was.  I've heard many good things about this place and a friend was in town, so we decided to try.

We waited in line for over an hour in the sun (WOW! 73 degree weather in SF, it was really warm - I even got a tan!).  Here is what we ordered: Cinnamon Chocolate French Toast with berries and bananas, California Omelette and Eggs Benedict.  The French Toast was just as yummy as it sounds.  The other two dishes were OK...my friend didn't like how the bacon was fatty and my poached eggs were a bit too done, not runny at all.

I'd be interested to try this place again, but I would try some of the Pancakes or a special benedict  So, 3 stars until next time.
author: Christine C.

description:
I spent 1.5 hours waiting in line and for my food to arrive, and I have to say that it was worth every minute. Waiting in line to order, your senses are enticed by the sights and smells of the kitchen cooking right before you. Everything sounded delicious, so my friend and I ordered 3 dishes - eggs benedict with crab, the Californian omelette, and the Monte Crisco.

I highly recommend the Monte Crisco - a ham, turkey, and cheese sandwich coated in egg (like french toast). Be sure to dip it in the jam/jelly that is served along with it. 

Service is super-friendly and quick. 

I plan on going back here everytime I go to San Francisco.
author: Will Y.

description:
The last thing you want to do on a sunday afternoon, especially when you are really hungry, is wait for two hours to get a stack of three pancakes. My gf and I decided to stay though, because we made the trip to little italy and wanted to have a good time. Besides, we can just talk the whole time in line right? F$%#! By the end of the line, we had been standing for 1.5 hours, were grouchy as hell, and still didn't have a table to sit down at. The wait really isn't worth it. I don't care how friendly the staff is or how good the food is. It isn't very hard to make a good pancake in the first place anyways. So I think that also makes it a little overrated. I've had better french toast, better pancakes, and a better omelette at other places in the city. This isn't to say that it's not good though! 

The food is great. The omelettes come stuffed with all the goodies that you read on the menu. The pancakes are excellent, filling, and wonderfully topped with fruit. The french toast is plump and topped with good amounts of powdered sugar. Yes this sounds good, yes you can get the same thing at other locations. Don't compare this place to denny's when you are reviewing here. Any breakfast place is better than denny's. There are other places to eat where you don't even have to wait a minute to sit down!

*** insert more complaints here about how long you have to wait.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Amazing brunch, best in the city!  But warning - long long wait.  It's hard to decide what to get, but here are my favorites:
1) Crab benedict 
2) Chocolate cinnamon french toast
author: rose y.

description: so good! Banana pancakes and eggs benedict--definitely worth the 1hr long wait in the rain. The french toast also looks like a complete winner.
author: Brittany H.

description: After waiting in line at opening for about 40 mins, we had to walk away since we had tickets to Alcatraz... came back the next morning, waited another 30, luckily made it in this time...  Ordered the Dungeness crab benedict and French Toast with berries.  The food was very fresh and tasted great..The staff was very friendly, the service was good.
author: FOODude F.

description:
Only one thing comes to mind when I'm thinking about Mama's Oh My Freaking God. People say that you can never go home again, their so wrong. If you have never been to San Fran. stop what you are doing and hop the first thing there. Mama's is the best, fresh food homemade breads and jams. To say one thing is good would be an insult, to the groups of friendly people that stand in line for their tasty goodness. Take my word people once you go, you will never be the same.


Mama's I will be back soon.....
www.dexterharpernovels.com
author: Dexter H.

description:
OH MY STARS!  Mama's was recommended by a neighbor the night before we flew to this wonderful city.  I said, okay, I'll Yelp it and see what those Yelping people have to say about Mama's.  I trust the Yelpers, they have never lead me astray.  We were not disappointed.  We arrived at 9 a.m. on Sunday morning and  we were the fourth party in line outside of the door.  I think there were about 4 parties inside who were ordering. 

Before I walked in I had decided that I would get the crab omelette until we got inside and I saw one of the cooks assembling the french toast that was featured on the specials board. OH MY STARS again!  Yummy-licious french toasted bread with what I think was laced with dried cherries. The toast was topped with a whole sliced banana, fresh rasberries and strawberries, sprinkled with powdered sugar.  Oh and they serve it with a little pitcher of syrup.  My husband ordred the crab and spinach eggs benedict.  Perfection with plenty of crabmeat.  His plate also featured very tasty home fries. The waitstaff was very kind and very attentive.  I asked our server to please compliment the chef and his assistants on their preperation of our food. You have to try this place.  You will not be disappointed!
author: Kate L.

description: So....Mama's huh? Went here on the last day of our weekend-trip to SF. 2.5 hrs wait. Was that wait worth it? Let the stars be the judge of that. I got the Monte Cristo. It was very delicious with the jam they served with it. The frites/potatoes were also delicious and crispy as well. Maybe because I was waiting for such a long time without eating anything before that in that line that made me hungry and think the food was great....i know...run-on-on sentence...but that's to express my point. it was delicious enough that i cannot grasp the words or statement to write it down. Anyway, definitely worth a try if you're in SF to visit. If you are there during the weekdays as well, I suggest going then when people are working...so there hopefully is a shorter wait time. Possibly around 1 or 2ish is went it may be empty? Sorry, I wouldn't know. Don't live in SF :)
author: Jessry H.

description: I came here and waited about 30 min, which was quite a relief. I usually cringe at the thought of waiting half an hour, but for Mama's I consider myself lucky. I had their french toast for the first time rather than going for my usual savory foods - omelettes and eggs benedicts. I found the chocolate cinnamon french toast to be overly sweet and nothing special. Their Kugelhopf tasted like the regular raisin brioche that I bake since I love making french toast with either brioche or challah. The best one out of my sampler was the swedish french toast. Overall, it was underwhelming and overhyped. There are a lot better french toasts in SF, especially in Mission district. I've tasted better at most places from Luna Park to Foreign Cinema to Universal Cafe. Mama's better up their game, especially as the wait is atrocious!
author: Ned C.

description: There is a reason why people line up in the morning and wait for over an hour to get into this little gem. The goods are baked from scratch. Carrot cake is my favorite! The jam is homemade. The food is prepared with love. The staff are family. So, get up early, grab a hot beverage and magazine and stand in line--you will not regret it!
author: Daphne J.

description:
Just make sure you bring a bottle of water and a snack for the 45-60 minutes wait!!! But if you make it, be sure you will be rewarded with a list full of awesome french toasts and omelets to choose from.
I just went there today and waited for around 45-50 minutes and even though I was getting toasted by the sun it was a great experience. It also help that the staff is so friendly and efficient with the service. The long line just show the popularity and the small business character of the place, which makes it even more interesting.

My husband and I shared the french toast sampler and the shrimp and asparagus omelet. Both of them were great but I would say that their french toast is their specialty. It is so yummy and tasty! We had to take home a couple of other pastries like the chocolate crumble cake and the blueberry sour cream cake. They were both very good but I thought they were not as fresh as they could be. SO maybe next time I will just ask when were they baked.
author: Camila E.

description: Pan dore is declicious.  It's a sweet twist on the classic sole dore minus the capers.  Smoked salmon benedict is perfect.
author: Elsie D.

description:
A friend of mine kept talking about how good Mama's really was, and i was curious on how good breakfast food could be...

Portions look a little small, but for some reason they will fill you up!
Prices are fair, service is awesomely attentive... I want to try all of their omelets!
author: Dan N.

description:
After a friend's recommendation, my husband and I ate here while on vacation. We arrived at approximately 8:45am on a Wednesday...and the line was out the door! It moved quickly and after eating the food, we were glad we waited. 

I had the Cranberry Orange Walnut French Toast - no doubt the best french toast I  have ever had. Per the waiter's recommendation, I had it with their homemade jam...delicious! My husband had an omelette - I don't remember what kind, but it was also delicious. 

Note - you order your food at the counter before you are seated. Cash only.
author: Katherine F.

description: Five stars for breakfast and service. Do expect a long wait just to get inside if you are not first in line when they open. For the record the wait is due to the fact that this is a small restaurant and the food is worth the wait hence the long line outside this establishment.  The long wait is not because the service is slow.  Definitely some of the best service and hospitality my wife and I have ever received.  I ordered a local favorite....The Monte Cristo.  If you've never heard of this sandwich it is like the best ham and cheese sandwich you've ever had.  Inside is ham, turkey, cheese then dipped in egg and cooked like French toast.  On the side is some of their homemade jam for dipping.  Read the reviews listed on Yelp.  The Monte Cristo is a favorite and does not disappoint.
author: Todd C.

description: Hands down the best place for breakfast (except maybe my own kitchen)!  This is the place where you want to get up early and be in line at 7:30 AM so that you can be in the first wave to get inside.   Plus it's a great place to chat with other lovers of great food in San Francisco!!  AMAZING food, customer service, atmosphere!!!
author: Patricia L.

description: Best breakfast in the city. They don't try to get you to purchase an ap that costs $3.00 to get on the wait list everytime you use it like Zazzie's either! 5 Stars!!
author: David R.

description:
OK, so I'm going to acknowledge this place has a bit of a wait (1 hour on a Monday holiday).

And yes, I probably would never wait in line for an hour for a plate of eggs you could get anywhere in SF or make yourself...and if I did, I probably would be another haterader on here complaining about how this place is overrated. 

However, I went there solely for the Monte Cristo sandwich, and damn--it was worth it.
author: Alexandra O.

description: You'll have to wait in line for at least an hour any day of the week.  On various I have tried the Panacakes, French Toast, and more recently the Salmon Bagel Plate!! FABULOUS BREAKFAST !!!
author: Mrs. Dawn H.

description: I had to Yelp breakfast places for the hubby and me at 4am.  When I read that people waited in line at Mama's for over 30 mins, I was determined to get us there early to try it out.  We rounded the corner at 10am (way later than I had hoped) and found a loooong line!  One hour later, we were in the door and in another line to order our food.  He got the dungeness crab omelet and I got the dungeness crab benedict.  I was hoping to share a french toast sampler, but he wussed out and wouldn't do it w/ me :-(  We both loved our dishes!  I don't know if it was actually that good or if the 1 hour wait made our food taste better.  Either way, we will probably come back the next time were in SanFran.
author: Thuyanh P.

description: If you can get over waiting an hour or so in line then you definitely need to try this place. I had the french toast sampler and it was awesome.  The line really kills it for me, I'd love to go back but not sure I'm patient enough to wait in line. I showed up at 8:20am (they open at 8am) and it still took me an hour. People must line up before the place opens... crazy.
author: Jamie G.

description: Definitely worth the wait - cute little place with amazing breakfast fare.  My husband had the classic eggs Benedict - perfection.  I had an egg, Monterey Jack cheese, avocado, bacon omlette - kind of bland, but still delicious.  We also shared the cinnamon chocolate French Toast, piled high with fresh fruit - simply amazing!  And to top it off, because we just could not resist, a piece of carrot cake with cream cheese frosting .... soooo good.
author: Cathy R.

description: There was a long line of wait at this place on Sunday morning given that there was a bay to brakers going on. It was no fun waiting in the Sun. To try these wonderful breakfast brunch. Over an hour thirty min of wait (and walking back to the car three time to feed the meter.) We finally got an stand in line again to order our meal. (To many standing around if u ask me.) I order the farmers and the wife order Swedish cinnamon French toast with fresh fruits.  Sounds yummy. Will my wife strawberry's has this onion after taste. (You know when the chef use the same knife to cut the onion an then use that same knife to cut the strawberry's with.) Not good man not good. The french toast was good. Love the bacon so big. and yet the place on the inside is so small. speaking of small thier bathroom is freaken small an its only one person bathroom. Not good, Not good at all. Any how on to my food. The Farmers Omelette now I don't know what kind of eggs they used but mine tasted sour maybe I got one bad egg in my batch. That all I have to say about my omelette. Will i come back maybe for lunch.  "Till next time my food lover.. till next time."
author: Rcd M.

description: OMG. I can't say enough good things about Mama's. We expected a line from what we had heard, but it wasn't too bad. We might have waited about 30 mins but it was so worth it!!! The French toast and French toast sampler (ok fine, AND we got the pancakes) were unbelievable. We barely spoke the whole meal except for the "omg"s and "wow"s. We got a bloody Mary and Bellini with apple juice and peach puree mixed with champagne, and both were incredible. If you are in San Francisco you MUST have breakfast at mamas!
author: Rachel P.

description:
Without a doubt the best breakfast and brunch in the city. A tad pricey but well worth it. A friend of mine took me there a few years ago and every time I get a chance, I take in an amazing plate of Mama's food. Too many things to recommend as everything is great. Parking can be another challenge here but any place downtown has this problem. I have recently got the yelp bug. I have eaten at a couple hundred places around the bay area and I feel it's my time to put my 2 cents in. After all, I come here to find a place so I guess I am counting on others opinions too. Time to do my part. 
P.S. I have been a chef for 30 years so I am a bit of a critic with everything I eat. If it's good, bad or mediocre I'm going to say it!
author: Jonathon T.

description: Worth waiting in the line for nearly 2 hours. Excellent food. Slim jim Burger, omelette, all were very good. Staff was excellent and helped us with the selection.  Naheed from SoCal
author: Tanweer A.

description: I work around there and see that the line is always going out the door, so my coworker and I decided we HAD to try it.  It was YUMMY.  So you stand in line and order your food, then you get seated and food will be delivered to you.  (Lucky us, we only waited 15 minutes).  I had the monte cristo which was like french toast with ham, turkey, cheese, freshed with fresh jam on the side.  It was SO good.  Price is reasonable.  The fresh squeeze OJ was yummy as well.  My co worker had some omelette that had spinach, cheese, and bacon.  Delicious.  Must try it.  I have to go back to try the benedicts soon.  The people next to us had it and that looked yummy too!
author: Chrisy C.

description: Love the Chocolate Cinnamon French Toast and Prosciutto & Tomatoes Benedict!  The wait is usually not so long for a late lunch.  The jelly they have on the tables go very well with french toast.
author: Chris F.

description: I had French Toast today. Last time was egg Benedict. I sat with someone who had French Toast sampler.  They were all amazing.  I will keep going back until I have everything from the menu.  I found new place for my French toast fix. You have to wait in a long line for Sunday branch, but oh it is so worth it. I recommend going during weekdays, since it offers breakfast menu during lunch time, too.
author: A O.

description:
Mama's has everything you might be craving for breakfast. The food is made to perfection but still retains that home-cooked comfort.

We waited about 30-40 minutes for Sunday brunch. Inside it's a little cramped, it's a wonder how things don't get knocked over in there, but the service is very attentive and efficient.

We ordered fresh-squeezed OJ and grapefruit juice, vegetarian eggs benedict, dollar sized pancakes, and the french toast sampler. My only complaint is that their home fries were sort of tough, not soft and fluffy. Otherwise, everything tasted just as good as it looked.
author: S L.

description:
best breakfast in the city.
long wait.
worth it. 
i always order the french toast in addition to my meal!
author: Ktea S.

description: Long wait but great food and service! The place is small so you get a lot of attention from the waitress. French toast is so yummy!
author: Kim B.

description:
After trying out this place once, I have to say that I will never be back.

1) Why should I wait in line for about an hour, to have a breakfast that's no better than something that I would get at Mel's or dozens of other breakfast places in the city, which don't require standing in line?

2) Potatoes weren't properly cooked

3) Waitresses put a little cash on the table prior to arrival of customer (so that it appears that previous customer left a tip), thus implying that customers should leave tips.

Basically, save your time and have breakfast elsewhere !
author: Ilyia K.

description: I thought for sure I already reviewed this, but somehow no.  With so many reviews, little more need be said.  Let's summarize -- long lines, awesome food, especially the baked breads, go on a weekday to avoid the lines, you'll leave full and totally satisfied, cute bright country-style interior.  Oh, ordering is kinda rushed because you first go past the counter and you'd better be ready when you get to the cash reg, and then you sit down and wait to be served.  Worth it, best breakfast.
author: Today Y.

description:
This place was worth the wait (deduct 1 star for waiting).  I live catty-corner to this place, and for 4 months I never went and ate there.  my roommates just took me there for breakfast, and the food was great.  I got the vegetarian eggs benedict, which comes with roasted potatoes.  I appreciate their sign that says they're willing to adjust each order for the customer - there are places that refuse to do so.

update 3/20 - I've eaten there four times now - I've gotten the dungenness crab omelette made with egg whites and spinach (awesome), the shrimp omelette made with egg whites and avocado (awesome) and the egg white scramble (awesome and extremely healthy)  I love that I just walked down there at 8 am on a Tuesday morning and got take out.  Yum...

The breads looked amazing as well.
author: Lindsay T.

description:
I am just back from Mama's and wondering why I only go once a year? It's become tradition for friends and myself to go on New Year's Day morning, but we postponed it this year. Reasonably priced for really good food. The wait outside goes surprisingly quick and there is decent people watching.

I did a good job not over-overeating this time, having a divine crab omelet and splitting the french toast.

The walk over from and back to Nob Hill is the perfect pre- and post-meal exercise.
author: Brad C.

description:
Worth the wait.
I frequent this restaurant and highly recommend it to any of my friends with the one caveat. On weekends, you're going to wait. Why? 'cause it's that good. Bring a paper, a book or friends for good conversation. Just leave the attitude at home and just be prepared for the wait or...get there before they open and avoid the line. 

Best omelets and coffee cake bar-none. Bring cash cause they don't take credit card.
author: June C.

description:
Everything's been said already.

Expect about 30 min - 1 hour wait on weekends. I didn't believe the hype at first, but now I'm a believer!!! Hallelujah Holllaback! I'm not sure what makes their brunch taste so much better than other places. Maybe that's really crack instead of powdered sugar they are using?

This place had the best eggs benedict I've ever had. 

I'm not sure about waiting in the long line though. Perhaps I will brave the line again someday, but not anytime soon. Maybe I'll call in sick on a weekday so I can come here when it's not as packed.
author: Jay W.

description:
My new favorite breakfast place. We trekked up there first thing this morning ready to wait in line and with CASH ONLY in mind.. (very important for those of us credit card and debit card addicts)
Armed with Cash (which is unusual) and hungry bellies.... we waited in line.

This is the best breakfast I have had in a long time. Better than Sears Fine Foods I think.

I got the French Toast Sampler, and the hubby got the Rancheros egg dish. 
100% worth the wait in the line outside as well as the wait in the line inside.

They don't rush you at all. Fill your coffee just when you need it and I love that the line is outside because it makes you not feel guilty that you are enjoying your breakfast rather than trying to scarf it down so someone else can come in.

We will of course return during our 3 month stay here as much as our bodies can handle the calories:)

Huge plus for the fresh fruit with the french toast. The bananas were ripe (I hate when they give you under-ripe bananas) and the berries were delicious!
Cheers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Annie M.

description:
quite possibly the best breakfast/brunch i've ever had!

a cute, charming little place with the most amazing french toast and omelettes. my chocolate cinammon french toast was perfectly fluffy and sweet, with the best, freshest berries on top. sooooo good. and i don't even usually like french toast! my friends and i also split the northern italian omelette, which had the fluffiest eggs, and the greatest smoky flavor. yum.

i'm definitely stopping in here for breakfast again next time i'm up in the bay area!
author: Caroline I.

description:
This place is amazing!
My brother and I got there around 8:30ish and left by 10a, honestly isn't that how long going out to eat lasts anyway?
In a way the long line is not so bad because you can chat and catch up with your friends/family, have some coffee, a lot of people read the newspaper etc.
My boyfriend loves it too but finds it hard to a) wake up this early to eat b) wake up late to eat, but then he's so hungry and has to wait in the huge line

The pastries are to die for
The setting is so comfortable
Everything I've had there tastes amazing! Omelettes, fruit topped french toast and pancakes, coffee, etc

Soooo worth the wait!
author: Kat G.

description:
This place is adorable and the food is yummy.  When you go in, you order and pay and then find an empty table.  

My friend got the monte cristo and I ordered the slim joe burger.  My burger came on a french baguette.  Fancy.  The hash browns were more like hunks of potatoes.  My "burger" was extremely oily, but otherwise, it was good.  Next time, I want to try their brunch food.
author: Diana N.

description:
I could eat the apple pan dore here forever. It is exactly how I like my french toast: on super thin, sourdough bread. It's made even better by the apples and the sour lemon butter. It's so tart, but so savory, and so sweet. It's a perfectly balanced breakfast dish, that's for sure.

I haven't had a single thing here I've disliked. The "mom"lettes are great, the home fries are delicious and I can't even talk about the coffee cake because its so beyond any other coffee cake I've ever had in terms of deliciousness.

Definitely a treat!
author: Stevi C.

description:
Its a quaint little mom and pop type operation. Good food. Good service. Only downside is the wait.  We showed up at 7:40ish and they opened at 8.  We did not get in with the first wave.  :(  But once we got in,  we saw and smelled the food.  We ordered, found a seat. And soon after our food arrived.  Its was good.  I wasn't amazed by it, but it was good.

Worth the wait? I guess. It was so highly recommended I had to see what the hype was about. Dissappointed? Somewhat.

They do accept debit (as well as cash).
author: Phil V.

description:
The best brunch in San Francisco!! There is usually a long line but it's worth the wait. 

I've never had a bad dish here (I'd recommend the North Beach omelette or the French Toast). They also have fresh bread/croissants delivered daily. 

The service is top notch and it has that cozy neighborhood feel.
author: Summer C.

description:
Besides having one of the BEST brunches in the city- the experience is quite unique as well.  It can be touristy and packed on the weekends- so best to go early or really late on weekends or during the week.  Also- keep to small groups- less then 4 people- otherwise will be longer wait.

You stand in line and order first- then they will seat you and serve your food.  Great system to make for better turn over.

The BEST item there is the Monte Cristo - like no other across the NATION!!!!!!  However, both their fresh bakes breads and pancakes are AWESOME, and so are their omelets.

Enjoy!!!
author: Christy H.

description:
Came here for a late breakfast on a Friday afternoon with my friend, her friend, and my boyfriend. There was a line but it wasn't too long. There were probably 4 or 5 small groups of people in front of us. I think we waited a total of 30 minutes. When we finally got in, we went to the counter to order. We stared at the bread and pastry items displayed behind the glass and couldn't stop drooling. At one point, one of the workers was chuckling at us because of that. We each decided to order one thing each plus french toast to share. We ordered the Eggs Benedict, Scrambled Florentine M'omelette, Northern Italian M'omelette (I think), Egg White Scramble, and Banana Nut French Toast, a mocha, an espresso, and an orange juice. 

After we placed our order at the counter, we sat down and waited for our food. The wait time was pretty good... didn't take super long but it didn't come out fast either. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I thought it was OK. It didn't stand out to me. My dish also came with red potatoes which were good because I love potatoes. We tried each others dishes and I have to say the M'omelettes were excellent. I really liked the Florentine M'omelette. 

We saved the French Toast for last and boy was it good. Definitely a stand out. The Banana Bread was soooo good. I'm thinking any of the French Toast items are good and I'd come back just for the French Toast. I also tried my friend's Mocha which was excellent as well and the orange juice was fresh squeezed.
