Service was attentive and came back to check on us several times. I definitely want to come back to try more items and I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good breakfast spot.
author: Ninh L.

description: S.O.B. Whatever great things you've heard about this place...well it is much better. From service, to ambiance to food!!
author: Dima G.

description:
So it was a Sunday morning...
Woke up at a surprisingly early 8am...  "early" considering we got home about 4am that morning..
When you get home at 4, you typically wake up "hungry".. indeed we were and  we wanted a damn good breakfast...  
She said "let's go to Mama's", I said "what's Mama's", she said "This famous breakie place on washington square, it's worth it", I said "okay, let's do it".
We walked to Mamas...  an incredibly bright morning it was, damn, was it ever..
We stood in line for over an hour... omg.. we were taking breaks at standing in line, when my break time came I would lean on the newspaper stand and wish to be recumbent! 
Okay, so we were finally seated....
Om goodness!  The "northwest" omelette was AMAZING!
It was so worth the wait. ... I devoured it all within 15 minutes!!
I am happy to say that I went back home, crawled in bed, and snoozed away the additional 4 hours that  were very much needed!
author: Stacy C.

description: Food is OK to Good, but definitely not worth the wait or the hype.  2 o'clock on a weekday, and the place is packed with tourists thanks to good ol' yelp.  Best try Chloe's for some ridonculous eggs.
author: Risha L.

description:
I really can't believe I haven't yelped this place yet! I guess I figured EVERYBODY and their mother knew of this place, since it's made its way into every SF travel guide on this planet! I say this b/c every time I've been here, more than half of the people in line are tourists, holding these said books...which is annoying cuz the food is really quite delicious. But I guess I shouldn't complain, since I use such books myself...

But I digress...the line on the Sat morning was not that bad. And we took turns getting foccaccia bread across the street (mmmm garlic), so time flew. Ordering was the tough part...so many delicious dishes...not enough mouths? We began with a couple slices of the Cinnamon sour cream bread and the Old fashioned crumb cake. Both were out of this world. Fresh, soft, not too sweet...the crumbs melted in my mouth. For our group of 5, we ordered 4 plates: The Monte Cristo, Mama's french toast sampler, and 2 omlettes (one with italian sausage and the other with pancetta). French toast was superb as always- covered in fresh berries. The omlettes and potatoes spectacular! But the real yum of the day was the Monte...these little sandwiches of ham and cheese were dipped in an egg batter and fried...along with homemade jam, wow all of us couldn't get enough of it. It truly is a must!
So yes, all you tourists from Europe, do come and try the Monte Cristo! We Americans are proud to share!

Service was good as always! Friendly and never pushy...even for such a tiny place.
author: yeana j.

description:
Mama's is wonderful. The only real downside is the line and the wait. But, this weekend was beautiful and my friend from Pittsburgh and I didn't mind the warm sun on us while we were waiting. I think our total time waiting (began at about 10:30 a.m. Saturday morning) was about 45 minutes. One of us held the line while we each checked out La Liguria across the street and my friend ended up returning with a huge and very tasty rosemary foccacia. 

Ordering is a little different, when you get to the front door, they ask you how many are in your party, then they let you in and you wait in line again in front of the glass where you can see the cooks preparing the meal (my friend changed her selection about four times before we actually paid). Then you pay - cash or debit (but they charge $1.00 to use plastic). You wait again until they can seat you. When they do, the food comes out pretty quick. 

We both shared the french toast sampler and the Northern Italian. We were full, but not dying full. The jam that they have on the table is really as good as everyone says it is. The waiters were really nice, they sometimes weren't too available for questions because they were walking around a lot, but there are other guys that are constantly filling up your water and asking you if you're enjoying your food. 

Overall, I'd recommend a visit to Mama's and I'd definitely go back when I have time to wait. There are are tons of fresh choices and really interesting creations for breakfast.
author: Katherine R.

description:
The constant line outside speaks for itself. Waited for just over an hour, but I would do it again, and again. 

The dishes I can speak for are: Washington Square Omelette, Pan Dore french toast, and **smoked salmon benedict**. The hollandaise sauce is excellent. I'd also recommend a fresh-squeezed O.J. or a mimosa.
author: Sara W.

description: On Saturday, taking advantage of the bay bridge closure, my friend and I decided to get in line early, (my friend and I are early birds, so we got in line by exactly 8:05am), and start our day off with a grandiose meal from mama's. Even with a bridge closure, and even at 8am on a Saturday, there was still a bit of a line. When we were allowed to enter, (only a couple people at a time were permitted to enter since the restaurant was already full! It opens @ 8am!), we had to still stand in line to place our orders and pay. After we paid, we had to wait until a table opened up. I'd say we waited in line and ordered within a total of 25 mins. I got the crab eggs benedict and my friend got the french toast. Food came quickly and looked d*lish. Service is wonderful, portions are large, and the line grew longer and longer as we dined. Mama's for breakfast is a great way to kick off your day.
author: Rebecca S.

description: I had the french toast sampler and my friend had the north beacher momelette and both were great. Definitely a good bfast place in the city. You have to try it out. A good after bfast walk is up to coit tower. =)
author: Genaro R.

description: This place is really "Hit or Miss" it is awsome or just terrible.. Take a chance if you can't find parking anywhere else.
author: Steve W.

description: Not sure why this place doesn't have 5 stars. Oh and get the Monte Cristo
author: Cameron S.

description: Food for the Gods. Tried the dungeness crab omelet, with tomatoes,avacado, cheese, mama mia that was good. sourdough bread toast very good. Also had a morning screwdriver with freshly squeezed O.J.. Wife ordered the french toast with fruit, delicious, we shared. Very easy to get to, will be back for sure. Mamas is crowded with locals and tourist from all parts of world. No credit cards, but they do accept debit cards.
author: ALFREDO R.

description: Food is AMAZING! I had the chocolate french toast and can I just say it was the best french toast I've ever had. I also put the homemade jam on my french toast and it tasted fantastic. I really loved that the staff was super friendly and the waiter joked with us as well. All in all it was a great time, NOTE THE LINE IS A KILLER, GET THERE EARLY. I waited 45-1 to eat, but it was so worth it. I can still remember that french toast.
author: Malika B.

description: I had lived in North Beach for 20 years but never had a chance to come as they always had a long line outside the place. For a friend's birthday request I promised to take her here so we waited about 45 mins or longer... once we got inside, still needed to wait until our turn so another 15 mins... so LONG wait. The egg benedict I ordered was just ok, nothing special. I am sure other dishes are better since everyone love this place. I might give it another try but will never want to wait in such a long line....
author: Caroline C.

description: Definitely worth the wait!  We went on a Tuesday morning and it was about a 30-45 minute wait.  Loved the neighborhood, atmosphere, and most importantly the food.  Their homemade jam is worth it all in my opinion.  I was there on vacation with a few friends and did research on the best breakfast in San Fran.  Our top two breakfasts were Mama's and Dotties, and I'll just say that I only gave Dotties a 4-star rating instead of 5!
author: Aaron C.

description: Mama's is incredible!  Yes, there is a long line and yes, you do wait forever to get seated, but once you sit down to freshly squeezed o.j. and hot-out-of-the-oven coffee cake, the wait hardly matters.  I have never tasted anything at Mama's that I wouldn't order again, but of all they have to offer, I would HIGHLY recommend the Monte Cristo sandwich.  My boyfriend ordered it yesterday and I ate half of it from his plate before he had time to complain.  It is that amazing.  In fact, I enjoyed it so much that I actually googled the recipe today and found that it was featured on the Food Network a while back.  The servers aren't overly friendly, but really, who cares when the food is that good??
author: Jessica H.

description: Well ... been here about 4-5 times only had to wait in line once ..I've  had lots of goods on the menu but the Monte cristo definitely stands out along side the french toast mMm ... and hey if the line is to long you can always go right across the street for some great foccacia bread :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
is it crazy to wait in line for an hour, just for breakfast?  at mamas, I THINK NOT!

mamas is home of delicious, amazing, great breakfast.  i've been here at least a dozen times, and ive never been disappointed. 

i recommend any of the french toasts.  the chocolate french toast comes with chocolate sauce, bananas, and berries.  YUM!  the cinnamon, apple, yogurt french toast is also really good, and fat free (I KNOW, RIGHT!?).  also...when you wait in line to order, they line the showing glass with these delicious looking freshly baked pastries (SO GOOD!)...esp. the chocolate crumb cake, and the blueberry cream cheese crumb cake.

i always seem to go home with a full container of their home-made jam, btw.  dip the monte carlo in that jam and you will hear the angels singing above.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Okay, don't get me wrong - the food was great (but was this distorted perception because of the wait?)

We waited for almost an hour, by the time we actually got to sit down the water tasted as if we had just marched through the Serengeti (this psyche could also affect good judgment, especially when it comes to food).

They only get 3 stars though, because for a place with prices as high as these, they SHOULD accept VISA/Mastercard.
author: Anthony B.

description:
To me, this place is only worth waiting in line for if each person in your party gets one of their signature coffee cakes (about $3.50 each).  Otherwise, you'll be completely disgruntled after your second wait in line, a third wait for your table, and your fourth wait for food.  You can just go to Mo's Burgers a few blocks away on Grant.  Their food isn't as pretty, but the pros and cons even out.

One tip... Go midweek during off-season.  There's no wait!
author: rachel r.

description:
Anyone who give this place less than 5 stars is just being cranky. Yes, the lines can be long. And yes it's small. But the food makes up for any flaws and the line actually goes pretty quickly most of the time. And the servers are real pros in keeping things moving.

I've been trying for years to get something from the lunch menu but can't get past my passion for the California Omelet. I've never had a better omelet anywhere. The potatoes that come on the side are divine. The coffee is perfect. 

I live in fear that they will close someday.

Update January 2012 - Ditto.
author: Patsy K.

description:
Yummm, breakfast for lunch is the best!

Do you know why there's always a line outside this place? It's because it's that good.  Yes it is touristy, but I think having french toast with tons of fruit, or a very large omelette with orange juice, just hits the spot on those days when breakfast is the lunch of champions.

It is different since you stand in line, order and then wait to find an open seat.  But it usually workes out that the line moves, people leave, so you eventually get seated.  The owner is pretty funny, he'll bring out your dishes and will tell one of your party a wrong dish and wink at you to see if the person is paying attention!  Oh, and he always says their jam is homemade-- which is really great on your toast or bread.

The tourists are the annoying aspect of this place and the fact they only take cash, but this is one of the better breakfast spots in North Beach by far-- bigger, tastier portions.  If you're willing to wait in line, you won't be disappointed.
author: SF Diner A.

description:
The best breakfast in the city. If you don't like waiting....don't go when its crowded. I have been here plenty of times when it wasn't busy and hardly had to wait at all. I think that its really hard to go wrong when ordering on the menu. You can even stray into the Sandwich/ hamburger section. As scary as it may be it turned out for the best. Even the burgers are good here. Try it at least once. If you dont like crowds try mid afternoon about an hour before they close. There are a lot less people and there shouldn't be a line.

Toothpick - 5/5 the minty kind. Its the best kind.
author: KY L.

description:
How do you review a place that draws a crowd like this?  The crowd itself warrants five stars, but could it be that the surrounding breakfast places just don't compare?

I'll keep it short.  Four stars for the first place in SF to serve me a veggie scramble that wasn't oily.  HATE oily eggs.  Unfortunately that's the norm unless I make 'em myself.  All the other stuff I tried (pancakes, French toast) and didn't try (omelette) looked amazing.  Huge portions.  Decent coffee.  Bring a book - or a full library - 'cause you'll be waitin' awhile.
author: Marina Maven C.

description:
Food is awesome. Wait is atrocious and that's at 2pm on a Sunday. Waited over an hour until we finally sat down.

Had the monte cristo which is basically a french toast sandwich. It was amazing. No idea how they do it. I tried to make the same at home later with disastrous results.
author: Bruce D.

description:
By chance I had to pick up a friend from the airport at six in the morning! I really thought about just leaving her there for a few hours to think about her mistake of scheduling a flight for that time. What to do next? Well I thought I am hungry and I have heard about this place, okay lets check it out. Funny how that early on a Sunday you still can't find parking. So after that good time, we park and are walking to the door, shit they don't open till 8 another forty five minutes. But why are there people already in line??? 

Oh because you have to stand in line to get in the door, so we like the rest of the sheep head to the end of the line, standing there for fifteen minutes I realize there are more and more people behind us, suddenly I feel victorious, like getting here this early is going to win me some great prize. At last the doors open, and suddenly you are greeted by the doorman, I feel like I am at a hip bar, did I wear the right sweatshirt, will I get in? 

At last entry, at 815, then you have to maneuver over head and shoulders to read the menu, while people outside giggle at your acrobatics, laugh it up, your outside and I am about to eat. We order, and yes like all the rest who have posted, it was great. My gf had french toast that she wanted to order more of so she could have it for lunch, odd I know. Eggs Benedict kicked ass, coffee good, coffee cake better. 

But I give this place four stars, mainly because I didn't have to stand in a line for two hours, I did get to experience the stairs of other guests who wanted my table, damn I am done, take the table. For that reason alone I take a stare away, I can't stand it when there is no where to sit and people just stand next to you, watching, waiting. 

Heads up this is a cash only establishment. And its a little overpriced, but still great for breakfast.
author: Jackie L.

description:
Mama's is the best breakfast I've had in SF so far.  It's no secret though, and the line is awesomely long.  But if you're like me, that's half the fun.  Heck, if there was a line to wait in the line, I'd wait.

They make a stellar stack of pancakes here, definitely up there w/ the best.  They've also got some pretty unreal Crab benedicts that cost twice as much as anything else on the menu.  But when you see the giant bowl of all legmeat in the kitchen, you understand why.

Also, bring me some blueberry coffeecake.
author: Aaron K.

description:
Yum, yum and yum. 

Really great pancakes. Bomb eggs benedict. Sweet french toast. Big omelettes. Good coffee and homemade preserves.  Everything is fresh.

The owner who sometimes helps to serve the food, tries to be funny, and usually is. 

I would highly recommend trying this place on a weekday if possible, because as most of us know by now, the wait in line sucks on the weekend.
author: Baby Bear G.

description:
The big question: is it worth the wait? Maybe it's just the built-up anticipation of finally eating that makes everything taste so good, but I think of this place as the ultimate SF Sunday brunch experience. But don't come here ill-prepared. Get your coffee and a newspaper and be prepared to wait about 45 minutes to an hour. Also, don't forget to bring cash.

Once you are granted entrance, enjoy the seafood topped eggs benedict, or maybe something sweet like french toast. Homemade jam on sourdough bread completes the experience.

Afterwards, on a nice day, grab a blanket and take a nap in the park nearby. Perfect way to spend a Sunday. It's not so much the brunch (although they do a good job with it), its the entire experience of spending a sunday sipping coffee, reading the paper, eating seafood, and then lounging in the park.
author: Sabine S.

description:
Great breakfast! Go early on a weekday, though. A long wait in a weekend line might tarnish the experience.

All the ingredients I had were extremely fresh and delicious; from the tomatos in the omelet to the side of smoked salmon. The homemade blueberry preserves were excellent, as well. 

Also, the service was friendly and prompt.
author: Dan F.

description:
Coming here is a delight! They have a ton of breakfast options ranging from French Toasts, to Omelets to old fashioned eggs, and much more. If you come here, be prepared to wait, and wait a long time!

The line was out the door, so you wait there patiently, and eventually (20-30 mins later) you get inside only to stand in line again to order from the cashier. You then wait (~10 mins) to get a table. And once you sit down (you guessed it) wait for your food (10-15 mins). I guess in the meantime you can pass the time by watching others scarf down their appetizing food. 

You would think in all that time waiting that they would be able to cook your food. I'm reminded of Giordano's in Chicago, where you first order, wait to sit, and your food is ready once you sit down. 

So... Despite all the waiting (~1 hr), the food is delicious. Generous servings, and well prepared. I had the Washington Square Omelet that has spicy sausage and bell peppers. 

If you have the time... give it a shot. It's well worth it.
author: David G.

description: I think they are over-rated. The food was good but not worthy for 1-2 hours line. The kitchen is not very clean and organized. Bathroom is tiny...and not clean. I felt rushed while I was eating my brunch + watching the long line out there. I do not think I will go back again.
author: YY L.

description: Best pancakes ever!!!! Be prepared to wait, but you will be richly rewarded for your patience.  The pancakes are just out of this world good.  Like no pancake I've ever had before.
author: Sunny J.

description: The line at this place is definitely a little frustrating, but when you do finally sit down and get your food it is well worth it. I had the egg whites and my friend had the benedict - both were good, but its hard to ruin eggs really. What was amazing was the french toast sampler that we "got for the table", there being only 2 of us this was probably greedy but it was so good we ate the lot. Definitely get the french toast sampler if you go here.
author: Michael R.

description: I've been coming for years here, and I always take out of town guests, especially out of country guests because brunch is a US concept and so are mimosas!  Pancakes are great, as well as french toast.  Many people love the monte cristo sandwich as well.  The homemade jam and fresh squeezed orange juice are amazing.  Staff is great!  You can avoid the long lines by coming later in the day (open until 3pm I think), during the week, not in the summer holiday period
author: Sameer D.

description: A wonderful breakfast spot with tasty entrees, breads and pastries.  Place is really small, so be prepared to wait and squeeze in where you can.
author: Levi S.

description:
imma keep it simple. 

next time your in SF, california, or america you NEED to come by mama's. 

oh my god- by far the BEST PANCAKES on earth. 
worth the wait. great service.
author: Christopher M.

description:
This is one of my top brunch list in the bay area.
The earlier you reach there, the shorter the line and the earlier you get seated. First come first serve basis.
It's a typical French eating house, small sized but well managed. 
Staffs are friendly and nice despite the busy errands going on.

I have been here several times and have tried their french toasts, egg benedict, and their omelet.
If you are an omelet lover, this is a place to die for.
The best omelet ever. No words can describe.
The eggs and its fillings were excellently done and it taste superb.

My second favourite after the omelet is the cinnamon french toast.
It's not a plain toast with cinnamon sprinkles on top, but a REAL cinnamon toast. The toast was originally made of flour and all other things necessary to make a toast + cinnamon. So you'll see that the cinnamon is folded in the french toast.
The texture is heaven. Just the right amount of softness and chewiness.
Not too overly sweet. Really good when you add it with their homemade berry sauce.

I've tried the toast sampler and find it very ordinary and didn't like it at all.
Their egg benedict is average. Los Gatos Cafe has a much better egg benedict than this place.

Their pricey alcoholic drink is good.
Nice sweet chocolate drink.
Fruit juice, averagely good.

I must say, I LOVE MAMA'S.

By the way, I read a mini note framed in MaMa's which stated that the first customer of the day will get a free breakfast.
I personally have never been their first customer, but anyone curious about it, should really give it a thought.

ONE OF THE BEST BRUNCH EVER!
author: Monic S.

description: Love Mama's. Have been coming here forever and still is first in my mind when choosing a breakfast spot with family and friends. The cinammon french toast is the best!! A San Francisco girls San Francisco Classic ;)
author: Sara S.

description:
They say you never forget your first love so its only natural I can't forget the first place I fell in love with when moving to the Bay Area. Who knew the love would last after all these years. 

When I first moved to the Bay Area in 99 a couple of friends wanted to take me to the City and kept raving about a place called Mama's. Now coming from the Midwest I had in mind a soul food place filled with comfort foods that would revert me back to that fat little kid from Indianapolis however when you get there you realize (1) this isn't that type of place and (2) its going to be a loooooong wait to get in.  It's bad enough that parking can be extremely tricky in the Washington Square area however even more discouraging is looking at a long line that brings back memories of my club hopping days. Fortunately for people like me unlike those SF clubs, Mama's welcomes all walks and not just the "best looking/best dressed". From the tourist from France, to the young couple in love, to the pet owner who dresses her dogs in sweaters although its 85, to the guy flying solo who comes only with a word puzzle. 

Once you get up to the window you almost feel like its teasing you... you can see but don't touch as you see happy customers slowly enjoying their food as you watch like young Oliver begging for more. When your ushered in you notice even more how SMALL this place is. Just imagine your dorm room in college and subtract a couple feet. You start to wonder where there going to squeeze you in when your drawn to the cooks using their utensils like artists. You gaze over the fresh made breads, fruits, and omelets just made and think you know what you want until something else is made then you change it again... and again.I've had several amazing items including very delicious  Dungeness Crab Benedict , Nelson's Rancheros, and the
Northern Italian however the one thing I come all the way from San Jose to Mama's for is the same thing over and over... the Monte Crisco Sandwich. I order it so much that guy who I always see there knows what I want and this is even after I had not been there in over a year! Talk about knowing your customers! The Monte Crisco sandwich is the one thing that people will stare and point at you through the window. If you've never had it you MUST try it... a perfect combination of Turkey, Baked Ham, Cheddar and Havarti Cheese Bread dipped in Egg and grilled served with Homemade Raspberry Jam cut in triangles dusted with powdered sugar that will make make you feel like your eating at a 5 star restaurant while sporting flip flops.  First time I was told about it I thought there was no way I eat a sandwich with raspberry dipping sauce but after one bite I was a believer. Wash it down with a cold Mimosa and your day starts off better than anything Tony The Tiger puts out there.

Overall, this is my favorite place for breakfast or brunch in the City. Delicious FRESH foods, nice staff, interesting people to meet in line, and one of the oddest places for a bathroom you'll ever see... trust me just make the trip back there and you'll see. No matter what your taste in food is, you'll find something there to savor. The only cons...  Long days you can stand in line for up to 1 1/2 hours so you might have to run to the meter again and put more money in since parking authority has a cruel sense of humor in SF. Not sure how they could do it in that space but like to see them get a lil bigger so you don't invest 3 hours of your morning just for breakfast, and also like to see Mama's come into the year 2010 and start accepting plastic instead of cash. Mama's though is the type of place you normally see in movies that you wish you could also experience. That one "place" you call your own and create your own special moments... and fortunately for all of us we now have a place to do that... although not sure they would appreciate a recreation of When Harry Met Sally cafe scene.
author: Mike D.

description: This place lived up to its reputation. We went on a weekday to avoid the wait and still ended up waiting 40 min. I probably would never come if i had to wait the usual wait time. It's just not worth all that time in line. I would definitely recommend the Monte cristo. Sooooo good. Also i got the papas picnic punch which was awesome as well. Good luck on the wait if you decide to go on a weekend.
author: Pam C.

description: My sister was adamant about bringing my parents, visiting from socal, here. I would say there are so many better breakfast brunch places in the bay area that are definitely worth the wait (Butler and the Chef). I think the longer you stay in line, the hungrier you get, and when you're hungry, everything tastes absolutely wonderful. Everyone around us was a tourist, so go figure. Plus, we weren't full and content when we left; we just felt fat. But if your visiting friend says Mama's is a "must-go" spot, get the Monte Cristo.
author: Hana J.

description: I had the shrimp and advacado benedict and it was really creamy and yummy and filling! The poached egg was perfectly cooked. The coffee was hot and strong. I had a few bites of the warm crumb cake drizzled with chocolate, WOW! I would go back and try something sweet maybe
author: Karen T.

description: Heard rave reviews about the place and I love breakfast, so thought we'd give it a try. Got there expecting a line and waited about 45mins to get seated, ordered and waited almost another 30 mins for the food. We got the shrimp benedict, shrimp omelet and pancakes. They were good but not great, the benedict sauce had a strong smell to it, the omelet was just okay and the pancakes were not fluffy enough. I would have given this place 4 stars if it did not have the long wait...
author: W W.

description: I'm not local, so the knowledge of arriving 20-30 minutes before they open at 8 was crucial. 5 in a queue at 7:30 AM.  No groups or decide you all can't eat together. The coffee is firm and an eye opener. Great omelet but not 5 stars due to price which is a bit high even for SF. I will certainly go back to sample more of the menu choices.
author: J G.

description:
drove up on a friday morning at 10 am and there was a significant line outside. since none of us were super starving we decided to wait.. i looked up some yelp reviews so i could better know what to expect.

we waited a full hour, and then inside another 10 minutes or so to order, then another 15 minutes to be seated bc we were a large group.

i had the eggs benedict and was a little disappointed, the bechamel sauce was too citrusy for my taste. luckily i had made a deal with my friend to share the monte cristo with me, which was aaaaamazing!!
we also got an order of choc french toast for the table that was simply divine, i couldve had the whole plate myself!!

everyone wiped their plates clean which is clear sign that the food is spectacular as if the line outside wasnt good enough indication.

check it out, wait in line, you wont regret it!!
author: jen r.

description: My favorite breakfast place by far! My fiance ordered the benedict and I ordered the french toast sampler. I hated benedicts until I tried Mama's dungeness crab benedicts! I basically ate my fiance's order plus my order! We also tried the italian sausages (which I am not a fan of) but it was delicious. The mimosas was not worth it. $7 for a SHOT of mimosas?!?! Are you kidding me?! Other then that, the FOOD is a must try! I would definitely make a trip to SF just for Mama's =)
author: Lisa W.

description: After waiting over an hour and a half for a table, my friend and I were happily devouring plates of crab and smoked salmon benedicts. Poached eggs were gooey, runny and perfect. The blueberry sour cream cake was delicious. Bacon came out hot and fresh still dripping with a little grease.  Good solid food, but I can't say I'd wait that long again. There are tons of brunch places in the city just as good, at least for eggs benedict. So why two stars? A note to the manager, if a table has been seated for a good long while, one person has finished their meal, the other two are well halfway through their plates, do not allow their friend rushing in late to order food (especially when she isn't even prepared to order), further holding up the large table when there is a line of people outside of your restaurant who have been waiting for over an hour or more. This is completely unfair to those that have been standing patiently for a spot. I felt really bad for those still standing outside watching this happen. I wish I had said something when I was there, but my friend didn't want me to make a big deal about it. I left with a bad taste in my mouth after that.
author: Sophie P.

description: Arrive at opening and you won't have to wait in line long. I love this place. Fresh fruit, Monte Cristo, Pan Dore french toast, fresh squeezed orange juice, plum roll thingy....all delicious. I go here nearly every time I go to San Francisco.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Was in San Fran for a few days. First time we tried to come here, the line was too long. Second time, it was still too long but I had to try it..so we waited.

It's a nice cute restaurant. We ordered the monte cristo, Pan Dore, and French Toast sampler. The food was good and you will be overwhelmed with figuring what to order since everything does look good.
author: Marcus Z.

description: This place is Grubbin! I got the French toast sampler! Bacon and sausages are so tasty! FYI, I know the goal is to get to through the door, but just know the line still continues inside the cafe!! It was exactly 1.5 hour wait. Bring parking meter change!! Well worth the wait!
author: Jeremiah B.

description: ...so I finally tried this place and woke up at 8:00 am on a Saturday morning and stood in line for one hour and 23 minutes. Is it worth all that trouble? Not at all. I don't understand the hype about this place. I would rather go to The Cliff House and get one of their famous omelettes and popovers, yummmmy! with ocean view too!!!  I've had much better breakfast and atmosphere than Mama's. I gave it 3 stars for the service and "A-OK" food.
author: Lauren R.

description: The first time I came here I was feeling in a healthy mood and ordered the vegetarian omelet. This was nothing to write home about and I was actually a bit disappointed after all the good raving reviews. I finally went a second time to accompany a friend from New York. After waiting 2 hours!!! I had the best french toast ever! We also ordered the crab omlette... next time I'm going to try the crab benedict. I'm taking my mother (very appropriately) here for her birthday. I'll just stand in line an hour ahead of time so she doesn't have to. Was the 2 hour wait worth the best french toast every??? I"m not sure... but I'm coming back for them aren't I?
author: Kathleen T.

description:
WOW!  Best place for breakfast/lunch in San Francisco!!!

Lizzy is the sweetest girl ever, we loved her cheerful service: she was so on top of things it was not even funny.

We will be coming back for the good foor, excellent service, and just to see our girl, Lizzy! :)

Love,

J&T
author: Kicker ..

description:
We were there about 15 minutes before opening, but we still had to stand in line until 20-30 minutes AFTER opening, to order and then be seated. As we were eating, we noticed the long line of people waiting outside, just watching us through the windows and salivating at our plates. 

The food is delicious, but I don't think it's worth the wait or the CHAOTIC atmosphere.
author: J K.

description:
Mama's is a LANDMARK!  You're going to wait PERIOD!  SO, get over it now.  The thing to do is grab a cup of coffee down the street, bring it back, and wait in line.  When that cup is gone, send a friend back for refils.  By the time you finish your second cup, you're almost IN!

I would like Mama's more if they would offer coffee to those that are waiting in their LONG LINES!  IS ANYONE THERE LISTENING?  People are waiting to eat your food.  Least you can do is keep them happy while they wait.  Ever hear of samplers while you wait?   Just a thought!!!

When you finally do get in, order the pancakes and JAM!!  TRY THE JAM!!  SO GOOD!!!  Eggs Flourentine as well. YUM YUM!
author: Noneya B.

description:
I was pretty sure that we waited forever for a table, but the food was very worth it.  And I wish I ordered the Monte Cristo.

The eggs benedict was slightly overcooked and the sauce was a little lemony; that and the wait and I would have given Mama's three stars, but then I had some of their breakfast breads, and that made up for it.  If I were to do it all over again, I would order the Cristo or the french toast and the chocolate coffee cake.  Wow, the coffee cakes were all amazing!

The omelettes were made different than I am used to them (I like my ingredients mixed in with the egg, not served on top), but it still looked yummy. 

And the pancakes also looked fantastic.  Would go back again, and try something different.
author: Chris K.

description:
Only complaint here is the seating capacity. The line stretched halfway up the block, but trust me...it's well worth the wait. 

By far the best brunch I've had. Everything is delicious, fresh, and made with quality ingredients. From waffles, various pancakes, fruits, omelettes, etc.  I ordered Dungeoness Crab Omelette, wow. 

Bring someone here....they will be very impressed.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Jojo L.

description:
An hour wait at least on the weekend.  Took my wife for her birthday.  We boht love it - yum..yum .. Excellent Florentine.  I also had the Cinamon Choc French Toast -  Perfect.

Really worth waiting for.   Next time we will try the Crab Eggs Benedict.
author: JEFFREY R.

description:
Well I've been here twice now and I continue to be impressed. 

My roommate and I started out the day very late - at about 12:30 we decided we were hungry and wanted pancakes. So we started our brunch search. When she suggested Mama's because of all the great reviews I immediately said 'no-way! the line will be out of control!' And it was -- but since it was a lovely day, we waited. And waited. And waited. Over one hour and it was worth it as always.

They definitely manage the crowd very well - and despite the always huge amount of people, they don't hurry you along.

I love the counter-service ordering, but also that they bring the food to the table. Waiting in line and watching the chefs do their magic is part of the fun and anticipation, I think -- and since all of the ingredients are spread on a bed of ice in charming ceramic bowls (behind a large sheet of sneeze-proof glass, of course), it's clear that the food is very fresh. Always a good thing.

Well as it turns out, pancakes we did not get -- An hour in line is a lot of time to think and rethink an order.  But, in keeping with the decadent and lazy Saturday, Cat and I ordered a piece of chocolate drizzled crumb cake as an appetizer, and then split Eggs Florentine and Apple Pan Dore. The Eggs Florentine had excellent flavor and after I finished I wanted more - although the yolk could have been a bit runnier - the egg was soft boiled rather than poached. The Apple Pan Dore was made with sourdough bread sliced so thin and garnished with the most amazing lemon butter that it could be cut with only a fork.

The line is, yes, obnoxious - you have to be die-hard to go here - either get up super early and arrive at 8am or be prepared to wait an hour. Either way, it's worth the wait.

If I had three thumbs, they'd all be up - as it is, my two are pointed skyward.
author: Juls P.

description:
This is as good as it gets for breakfast. The worst part is the line, but it was great. Everything was fresh, people were nice, the food was tasty, a little pricey, but well worth it!

Try it!
author: Katherine F.

description: BEST OMELETTE I've ever had. Hands down. Just perfectly cooked, perfect combination of ingredients....I don't even remember what kind- avocado with bacon and cheese of some sort. We came here and waited in line for some take out, got the french toast sampler and the omelette. The french toast sampler was good- except I pretty much just liked the kind with the cinnamon bread (I am not such a fan of banana bread french toast)...YUMMMM breakfast though- next time I'm in the bay I will definitely be heading back.
author: Amanda B.

description: Seriously, this place is so delicious.  You have to try the eggs benedict as well as the french toast.  But you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu.  It is well worth the wait in line!
author: Aimee P.

description:
Mmmm! Some places are all talk and because of the talk people form long lines. The long line at Mamas is because of the fresh and awesome food + great service. This is one of the few places I can say is definitely worth the wait (I waited about 45 minutes in a beautiful SF day... I think it was Valentines Day, but alas, I digress!)

I got the yummy French toast sampler; my friend ordered the salmon omelet and we shared one pancake (I know.. That's a lot of food). Everything was delicious! I was particularly impressed by the pancake.

I'll be back, but maybe only once every 6 months. Though the ingredients are fresh, the food is decadent. Too many trips here is a guaranteed need for a larger pair of jeans!
author: Ngozi E.

description:
Mama's is great little place with awesome food and perfectly poached eggs.  Man, I love poached eggs.  

Although it was noon, we had breakfast.  After lots of indecision, I got their Ranchero (Mama's version of huevos rancheros), and FRESH SQUEEZED grapefruit juice.  Jesus Christ, that juice was such a treat.  The boyfriend had their Market Omelette with bacon, spinach and chevre.  He said it was good, but a little rich, so he packed some up for later.  I am vegetarian, so I loved all the choices I had to choose from (not so at all places, even in our fair city, read my reviw of O'Rielley's if you don't believe me), and since brunch is my favorite meal to dine out for, I was seriously in Heaven.  Another plus: my Ranchero came with potatoes (most places don't serve potatoes with theier huevos rancheros, so I always have to order a side of them since I passionately love carbohydrates).

Go to Mama's during the week and skip the crowds.  There may be a short to medium line, but don't let that fool you.  The way they have it set up, by the time your ass hits a seat your food is pretty much ready, so you stand and wait instead of sit and wait.  Standing burns more calories anyway, so you're good.  And another nice thing about pre-paying is when you're ready to go, you go, no need to flag down the waitress and wait for change or anything.  Also, as a note, in this kind of place, cash is king, they don't take credit cards (but I think debit is kosher), and besides, a cash tip on the table is a really nice way to say "thanks" to the girls who work that crazy busy little spot.

Overall:  Food off the line is damn tasty, their juice is fresh squeezed, and the pasries by the register are old-school homebaked and look marvelous.  Service is efficient and we never had to ask for water or coffee refills.  I was curious, however, how it would have worked if we wanted another mimosa or glass of juice.  I guess I'll just have to cross that bridge when I get to it.

If the line outside doesn't scare you, but intrigues you as to why people are lining up, there is a good reason, and you should check it out.
author: Amanda B.

description: My third time here, still love it! This time I tried the monte cristo and it's my new fav!!! The only negative is the wait :( It's worth going very early.  Besides yummy food, the staff are very nice, which is unusual for such a busy place.
author: Kelli G.

description:
I'm sure most of you have seen the long line up the piles up down the block from this corner breakfast and brunch place. The wait is long and draining, but it is well worth it! 

I've tried several different items at this popular breakfast place including:

Omelettes: Washington square (italian sausage, peppers, cheese and tomatoes) and Mama's Children's Favourite (tomatoes, mushrooms, peppers, cheese). Both of these omelettes are amazing. They are piled with fillings that are chunky so you have the satisfying bite to your omelette. They are also huge and take up half the plate alongside crispy homefries and your choice of wheat, white, rye or sourdough toast. If you are opting for something savory, definitely go for the omelette and you will be satisfied for hours as the portions are big enough for both breakfast and lunch.

Pancakes: hot, fluffy, perfect and so satisfying! The creamy soft texture with the perfect blend of savory and sweet paired with a warm maple syrup topped with icing sugar is perfect for pancake lovers. The best pancakes I've tasted.

French Toast: Kugelhumph french toast with dates, cinammon and nuts is the perfect wake up medley of sweet syrup and crunchy creamy brioche bread.

Corned Beef Hash: (a special and not always offered everyday) The best in the city! the perfect mix of two over easy eggs, fresh shredded semi-lean corned beef and crispy bite size potatoes. Hit it with some ketchup and tobasco sauce along with an oozing yolk and you've got a plate of caloric goodness that is worth every bite. 

NOW, the sourdough toast is an essential selection in all of the bread options that come with your meal. The crispy yet warm buttery bread paired with the excellent olallieberry jam that is readily available on all tables is one of the main reasons I go to Mama's. Their jam is amazingly the perfect combination of sweet and tart with chunks of olallieberries drowning inside a syrupy concoction. I was tempted to swipe that container of jam into my purse as it is homemade and not available for purchase. 

The baked instore items such as the lemon berry muffin and banana bread is served warm when you order in the store. They also have carrot cake, blueberry crumble cake, apple crumble cake, and other varieties. 

Their coffee is always hot and refilled constantly with the friendly yet efficient service. It is always a mouthwatering 10 minutes when you stand in line observing  the cooks casually cook up a storm behind the glass of baked treats while you decide on your order. 

So go early, bring a jacket and stand in line to wait for a perfect breakfast in San Francisco!
author: Florence T.

description: Delicious!! Ordered the Washington Square and the chicken  caesar salad. A great place to come for brunch. It was a long line but well worth the wait!
author: Brian W.

description: for those of you that do not know what to have for breakfast in the morning.. have no fear !! i have just the place for you !! MAMA's !! it's a nice little breakfast joint located by north beach. the absolute must try when you're there is the monte cristo !! i can almost guarantee you that when you sit down and look side to side.. you'll see that 4 out of 6 tables will have the monte cristo on their table ! it's good to share.. if not.. you can have that all to yourself !! the service there is great !! the wait is not as bad as i thought.. the line looks long.. but it moves at a steady pace. =) try this place out!! you wont regret it !
author: Jeff C.

description: Should have a 5+ stars rating! Waited in line for an hour to get seated but worth every second! The regular French toast with season berries were awesome! The north beach omelet awesome! Even the sides were yum! Staff was super friendly. Oh and u must try one of their poppy seed muffins...yummy. This place was brunch heaven! Didn't get to try the eggs benedict but they looked good! This place was recommended to us by a Lot of the locals. Our only regret was not being able to eat there twice ;/
author: Mary N.

description:
You will not find a better breakfast/brunch place ever! The food is the best I have ever had for breakfast. I love it so much. The service is great. It is worth standing in line for on any given day. My top list is the Choc. french toast with fresh fruit, then there is the amazing eggs benedict and the Monte Cristo, the Californian, and the best pancakes ever. 

Mike also is part owner of Pier 15 in San Rafael, which they make the same excat food. On a nice sunny day you can go and sit on the deck by the marina and enjoy great food in the sun. I have to say it is AMAZING!
author: Shayna M.

description: The line is long, but well worth the wait! The food at Mama's is amazing, whether you're a tourist or not. Enjoy waiting in line inside, where you can watch the chefs whip up delicious meals in the kitchen and face serious indecision about what to order yourself. Yum!
author: Valentina B.

description: Whenever we visit San Francisco, we make a stop into Mama's for breakfast if we can get there before 8am (because we have no patience to wait more than 30-45 minutes, which is usually the case after 8am).  My husband is partial to the pancakes.  I love trying one of the omelette or benefict specials.  If you try to show up after 8, be prepared to wait an hour or longer.
author: Marnie S.

description: Long line to get in, we almost blew it off.  So glad we didn't.  Great coffee, perfect eggs benedict, the freshest delectable baked goods.  great spot on the park. awesome
author: Poem G.

description: Most interesting Turkey sandwich so far! the Monte Carlo is awesome! line is very long though and they close at 3pm.
author: Sophie L.

description: Love it! generous portion with great quality of food! highly recommended to try this restaurant for casual dining with family and friends. We wait for about 10-15 minutes out side since this restaurant has smaller capacity for their fans :) Mine was Dungenesse Crab Omlette with avocado, delicious and cannot believe I could finish it! They have daily special, just ask their friendly waiters for recommedation. They only accept cash or debit card only for payment. Overall experience was great, just a suggestion: come early to avoid long lines.
author: L. B.

description: Best Monte Cristo sandwich I have had. It comes with there home made jam that is ridiculously good. I have had some egg dishes and what not and they are good but the I am now a regular for the sandwich. Line is ridiculous and they price it accordingly to the demand. Still a regular spot for me.
author: Adam M.

description: Went with my sister after reading a review on a blog. There was barely a line when we passed by but by the time we had parked a long line came out of nowhere. But totally worth the wait. so don't run away when you see the line. I'm actually a fan of ordering before sitting down it makes the decision process go by a lot of faster. I ended up getting the swedish french toast and it was AWESOME LIKE A POSSUM! Best french toast I have ever had in my life. it came with fresh fruit on top which was raspberries, blueberries and strawberries. It was heaven! Everything else on the menu looked really good. I plan on coming here often. Possibly replacing good old Stacks with Mama's.
author: Elisa M.

description: Yummy!!  Coming back for a visit in January!!  I read a book while I'm in line.  I'm in the Army, our motto is "Hurry up and wait"...
author: Tracey D.

description:
Came here when the line was the shortest it had been all day.  We still had to wait a hour.  The only reason why there is a line is because the place is super duper tiny.  

I had the french toast sampler and although it was good, I can't say it justifies the 1+ hour  wait.  The service was a bit rude as well.  They really rush you to order.  Ordering is weird.  First, after waiting a hour or two, you are told you can go into the restaurant.  Be careful, don't go in before this, even if the door is open and you see open tables because they're going to just kick you right back out and tell you that you can only come in when you are told to.  Second, once you get in, you go to the counter and stand in line there and look at the menu up above.  Then, they ask if you are ready to order, and if you say no, you keep standing there and the server will roll his eyes and let out a big sigh.  Finally, if you are ready to order, THEN will they seat you and take your order.  Umm yeah... I don't understand how this situation is more efficient than seating people first and giving them menus.
author: Kat E.

description: A lot of locals recommended this but there really wasn't anything special about the meal. Plus it was very very expensive for food  which was just ok. I had the salmon eggs benedict and it arrived on time and hot. Problem was I could have gotten the same meal for 1/2 the price up the street.  I just didn't see waiting almost an hour in line for what I got. The cooks barely looked up and never smiled. Maybe part of the experience? I'll skip it next time.
author: Janet P.

description:
OMG!  Went here for brunch the day of the  North Beach Festival.   Wow!  Really wow!

Bloody Mary - yum.  Dungeness crab benedict - double yum.  Apricot/rasperry crumb cake and blueberry/sour cream crumb cake - I remember just sighing and explaining I needed to be left undisturbed as my mouth was "having an experience".  I don't care what the wait is.  Mama's may be enough reason to make me abandon my 'hood and move over to North Beach.  The problem is I'd have to just pledge myself into indentured servitude to them because I'd be there everyday.  Mouth watering at the very thought of it.

And don't make the mistake of asking if they have coffee.  I did and they didn't let me live it down for the duration of our visit.  Thanks Mikey!
author: Isabel G.

description: The long lines here bum me out because I don't like waiting outside for extended amounts of time to eat. When there isn't a line I mob right on in and always order the Monte Cristo and a coffee, because I like to enjoy life. The Monte Cristo is one of the best I've had. It's hard for me to not order a second one as soon as the last bite is gone. The only thing that stops me is knowing that chicks don't like fatties.
author: Jesse C.

description:
I love places that have personality and therefore...5 stars!  Plus, the best things in life are usually worth the wait and Mama's definitely fits the bill.

- You have to wait in line to even get into the restaurant b/c it's so small and intimate so be sure to bring someone you do actually like...lol
- You have to order at the counter and then you're offered a table.  Little weird but I kinda like it
- Great bloody marys...need I say more
- And lastly, great part of town, the view of the park next door is great

Just be careful, the two of us rang up over a $40 tab for bfast b/c everything looked so amazing at the counter!
author: J T.

description: food was alright and nothing out of ordinary. you can find better place to eat eggs with bacon. the pancakes had way to much backing soda. an overdose. you could really taste bitter soda what should not happen. we arrived to mamas at 8:30 in the morning and the place was already crowded. the personal is stressed and unfriendly. you definitely cannot relax there and therefore not recommanded if you are in a mood for a lazy sunday.
author: Jm J.

description: If my mama could cook like this I probably wouldn't have moved out at 18 never to return.  This place is OMG good.  So worth the two hour wait even with a cranky two year old... well, maybe minus the kid.  But woohoo!  The food is really, really good.  Never a pancake fan before, this place has changed my world.  I've been in search of a better pancake ever since and have yet to find one.  The benedicts are yum too.  Oooie gooey goodness...
author: Maria L.

description:
no matter how short my stay in SF is, I will not leave without catching breakfast at mama's...  yes, parking is ridiculous, prepare to take a roll of quarters with you if you get lucky and find a meter, yes the wait is ridiculous, at LEAST an hour long, but once u get inside, it is so well worth it...  everything is as fresh as can be, the croissants are fantastic, but the one item that always stands out is the french toast...  so what if it will clog your arteries?  it is that frickin good...  

oh, and try not to get a table by the teeny tiny entrance...  they always leave the top half of the door open, so the people standing in line can gawk at what you are inhaling...  it's just weird, to look up as you shovel a mouthful of food into your mouth and see a swarm of people staring in at you, or hovering over your shoulder breathing in the aroma of your food...  it's like the equivalent to taking an overeaters anonymous group to a buffet but making them watch from the outside through a window...  not pretty...
author: Tristan L.

description:
Mama's is an SF institution that should be visited if you're here on a weekday or if you're the type that don't mind getting into a 1 hour + line.

The first time my bf and I came to Mama's was three years ago.  I had woken up uncharacteristically early one morning at 6:30a, strategically woke my bf up for some morning "fun", and we decided to walk to Mama's for breakfast afterwards.  By the time we got there at 8:00a, the line was really long!  It took us 1.5 hours to get through the line out front and to get through the line inside.  I had the french toast and my bf had the Washington square and we both LOVED our food.  I also took my roommate here one morning on a weekday around 10a, there was a line of four people outside so we didn't have to wait too long and we ordered the same thing above and loved it.

So fast forward 3 years...  I had never been able to go back to Mama's because it's just so hard to get up that early and I don't have weekdays off anymore.  But my bf's biggest regret was not getting the crab egg benedict special the first time around, so we made it a point to set our alarm today to wake up in time for Mama's.  We got to Mama's around 7:30 and found several parking spots open right in front! Score! We also saw a line about 20 or so people deep.  No score...  Still, we knew we would get in for the first seating, so we waited in line.  My bf ordered the crab egg benedict and I  ordered the Monte Cristo.  Bf said his egg benedict was okay.  The crab tasted like they had cooked and shelled it the day before and there was something off about it.  I liked the Monte Cristo, but it's not something I would order again.  I thought the OJ tasted diluted.  I would come back here if I got a weekday off and the wait wasn't too long, but I would NOT wake up at 6:30a on a weekend again to come back.

Service has always been great and it is cash only.  There is a picture of "Mama" by the door.  Pay attention to it--she was a gorgeous lady.  :)
author: Trinh N.

description:
How can I put this mildly? I LOVE Mamas. The neighborhood, the decor, and their AMAZING food. The line is a bitch (-1 star) but that's the story with good breakfast place in the city. Try going during the week if you can, as the line can be a killer in weekends. 

The french toast sampler plate is SO freaking good. Try sharing this and another dish with a friend. Suggestion you say? Hello: the Farmers omelet (spinach, leeks, bacon and havarti.) Yum-O! 

Don't skip the jam on the table- unlike Denny's it's one of the best things in the place. The pastries are just as good as the food, so make sure to check out the assortment while in line.

Umm, sounds sooo good I might have to go tomorrow...
author: Thomas S.

description:
I don't want to write a review about a place EVERYONE writes about but just as contrast to the 3 star reviews I've given.

Mama's is a must for anyone who brings family in town.  SF is known as a great spot for food, however, those from NYC always seem to find a reason why SF is 'overrated'.  Don't worry NYkers, I'm not bashing NYC, just defending SF. 
When you take them to Mama's, it's game overs.  Everyone shuts up and stuffs their face here.  Always splurge on the carbs and get the french toast, the fresh baked goods, and anything else that looks great, unlike a lot of places, it lives up to the hype.

Go early, line out the door.  Small place so go with a small party.  No lines on weekdays if you can swing that.
author: peter k.

description:
Lord knows I love me some Sunday brunch. I liked me some Mama's brunch. 

All in all, not really worth it in the end on weekends. I may go back during the week when its not so crowded, because it was alright food, but in this city you can find many other great spots. And if my memory serves me correctly, they really didn't offer anything special on the menu. 

I say go for the conversation of having going, but pass if you think you are going to get an out of this world dish.
author: Ronnie Ray H.

description:
Brunch Good : Line Not So Good (20ft line = around 1 hour wait)

Once you get the past the line outside that can reach 20ft you'll have to wait inside at another one to pre-order / pay for your meal and wait for seating to open up.  Once you are seated your food will come shortly and enjoy!  Go early for large groups and if later in the day you better be a party of two to minimize the wait as parties of two can be seated before larger parties.

*Atmosphere - Outside: depends on the weather bring a book or talk to your friend.  Inside: Quaint cafe with the kitchen in full view.  You can feel like you are at the zoo and you are the attraction.  Nothing like having people outside watch you eat.
*Brunch - Been twice 1st time omelet was Good, 2nd French Toast (I forget the bread, but it had nuts + fruit) w/ berries on top was good
*Service - Friendly and helpful.  Don't be surprised when they leave the tip on the table from the previous customers.  I don't know why they do this.
*Recommend - Yes, try it at least once.
**Hint** If you are in a large group go early, If you do decide to go later a party of two will jump up the line quicker.

Great brunch food + Friendly Service - long wait & another wait inside =  4 Stars
author: Po L.

description:
So when I  was moving to San Fran one of my friends in dc told me that everytime she came to the Bay Area she would go out of her way to come into the city and go to Mama's for brunch even if she had only been in Napa the rest of the time or wherever.  And then when I was in Moscow last month and took a tour of the Kremlin a couple other people on the tour were telling me their favorite part of San Francisco was Mamas- if people who don't even live here hold such an allegiance to this place it was about time i got here-  I finally made it after living here for a year ...and they are obsessed for a good reason!

My friend and I got there at the end of brunch time due to a few delays which is the best time to come if you can hold your stomach off until 230 for brunch becaue the line is short or at least it was for us.  Its kind of like going to the dmv at 430 and getting out at 5.

I got fresh orange juice and the french toast sampler that came with fresh fruit on top. First off- I love fresh orange juice so props for this treat and wow three different kinds of french toast all equally delicious- i didn't know if was possible.  I've been on a bit of a dessert kick lately and this fit right in.  I love brunch- i loved brunch here-I'll be back to try more:-)
author: Maria F.

description:
Great Food.

Monte Cristo is SICK. Omelettes are SICK, too.

The wait is to be expected: the breakfast spot is found in every possible San Francisco critique/tourist listing known to man (hence the 5 stars minus 1).


 I'm not sure I'd make the trek and wait in line after a long night out, but it's great food every time.
author: John Y.

description:
Hands down, our favorite must have breakfast/brunch joint everytime we are up in no cal.  Average wait is about 30-45 mins on weekends, but it doesnt bother me.  Seating is tight, but its convenient enough to sneak a peak at what other customers are eating.  Havent tried the burgers or lunch fare, but anything on the breakfast menu works for me.  So far, i've had the italian or sicilian omelette, crab omelette, pan dore, cranberry bread, and the swedish cinnamon toast.  

If i had to pick at something, it would be the coffee.  Man, if they could spend a few bucks and brew some stronger 'joe'..... that would make this place a bona fide 7 Star joint.
author: Shon T.

description:
Best breakfast in the city and probably for the entire Bay area. Yeah there is a big wait. Don't wine about it you bunch of babies. How can there not be a wait for the most well know breakfast place in the city?

California omlet and french toast sampler are my favorites. Order a few of the cakes from behind the glass to taste with your coffee and bring the rest home for lunch or dinner.
author: Anthony S.

description:
This rating is for weekend brunch time, when the average working person has time to go.  Unless there's a hailstorm, you have to wait an hour to be let in, and then like the batman ride when you enter, you wait in a second line.. damnit, this is brunch, not six flags!  After we ordered, we waited a full 20 min for our eggs benedict and french toast.

Their breakfast food is good but not incredible, and it definitely does not justify a 1.5 hour wait - I've had better benedict, french toast, and fresh jam.  oh and having to pay extra for toast because it doesn't come with the meal - wtf?  If you can, come to this place on a weekday around 10am or so.  If I had to wait only 15 min to order then this place would get four stars.  Maybe five if they stopped charging for toast.
author: Justin S.

description:
OMG!!!

Went here once awhile back ago and wow! There was a long line and if it wasn't for a friend visiting from out of town I wouldn't have driven out to the city to wait in a 30-40 minute line. BUT, it was worth the wait and the hype! When we finally got seated we sat in the front window! The service was great for the type of volume they take. After waiting in line you just want to sit and enjoy. 

The food was good. They had all sorts of seafood and meats in different forms. You get it pretty quick after you order and I must say if the wait wasn't so long I'd come back more often. It was a great treat tho.
author: Jacqueline F.

description: The wait is long but totally worth it.  I ate the Monte Cristo and just about feel out of my seat.  It was so good that the wait didn't matter after that.  Everything was good even the homemade bloodymary mix and Soja.  When in San Francisco go there and enjoy
author: Elise T.

description: Not too bad of a wait, although I did go on a Thursday at about 1pm. The staff was very friendly. Good location. Food was fresh and tasty. The #1 Washington Omelet was great as was the Swedish French Toast. Would definitely recommend.
author: victoria r.

description: woah mama! I know...I know. There's a line. But it goes fast and it gives you some time to wake up. You can go in your PJ's- but jump in a cab or take da bus bc parking in this area....fugetaboutit. Just prepare a to go cup and start dreaming about that french toast! num num num...it's enough to share for sure.
author: Marianne s.

description:
7:30 am... on July 10th

me: babe?

babe: yes?

Me: wanna get breakfast?

babe: sure
me: Mama's

Babe: uhh ok...its early we'll probably won't have to wait long
me: yea they open at 8.. we should be ok..i hope we won't have to wait an hour, i have work at 10... if we fail, its going to be our 4th attempt failing to eat here.

Got there a few minutes before 8am... and we waited 40minutes for a freaking table!! arghhh

I ordered the shrimp, avocado, eggs benedict... the truth was. I did not like it. The shrimp was overcooked and not fresh. Although im sure its 100% frozen, if you know how to cook shrimp, you can make good shrimp out of frozen shrimp.  I didn't like their home fries (potatoes) its bland, dry and hard.

My bf ordered washington square. Its good yet simple but its also easy to make, I can probably make that at home. 

We shared a french toast sampler... mehh its aite. its.. alright. 
Presentation of the food is beautiful but taste matters more. And I'm sorry Mama's your food was alright but definitely NOT worth 40minutes of a wait!
author: A L.

description: Fresh food, fresh ingredients, lots of variety.  I went once right when they opened so I didn't haveto wait in the long line.  I live close by so I see the long lines all the time.  I'll go back again soon, but will try to go early and avoid the line... I don't think I'm addicted enough yet to wait 90 mins for the food :)
author: Shafaq C.

description: We arrived about 9 and waited in line about an hour. I had the french toast sampler with a slice each of cinnamon, banana, and lemon berry bread, topped with berries. Hubby had a Californian omelet, with bacon, avocado, and jack cheese. Both were amazing, and worth the wait. Service was excellent as well.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Mamas was definitely worth the wait.   Food was amazing and definitely unique.   Had the pan dote  . . . French today with apples and lemon made with a sour french baugete and I enjoyed every bite
author: J B.

description:
Well, everything has been said about it. But because it is my favourite restaurant in the bay area, I will add my humble review to the long list. 
I like breakfast and brunch, but originally with croissant, hot chocolate or delicious coffee. Well, Mama's made me love american breakfast!
What I like there:
buttermilk pancakes
french toast
Club sandwich
A plus with their OJ and jam.
Nothing is too greasy... perfect balance. Fresh homemade food classics done right.
I lived in North Beach for a while, and I could not get enough of this place. 
Week days at noon had no line btw, so if you work in the neighboorhood, it's a great spot.
author: Flore L.

description:
Cute place located in North Beach, right by the Coit Tower.  I had breakfast here and then took a walk up Telegraph Hill to hang out with the parrots and, for the first time, I went up Coit Tower and checked out the view of SF.  Yeah, I live in SF, but it's nice to be touristy sometimes.  

So, anyway, I arrived at Mama's on a Sunday morning around 9am-ish.  The wait was 30-40 minutes.  Once I got in, the line continued inside...and then when I arrived at the register I made my order and paid.  I ordered the french toast plate and my b/f ordered the Monte Cristo.  For some reason, he always orders the better plate.  My 3-bread french toast plate was well-presented.  The dish was good and filling and the fruit topping was real fruit! But, I still haven't found a better french toast that beats Sacramento's Cafe Bernardo.  

My b/f's Monte Cristo was yummy.  Check out the recipe on foodnetwork.com.  [http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/saras-secrets/monte-cristo-sandwich-recipe/index.html]  It was a big plate and pretty heavy for me for breakfast/brunch...but it was goood.  It could be a meal for the whole day!

This restaurant is cute.  The service is good.  The price is reasonable.  But, for weekend brunch, I'd choose Brenda's in SF or go to Berkeley for La Note. Now the wait for La Note is so worth it!

Definitely a place to bring family and friends if they are visiting you in SF - just remember to wake up early before the line gets really long!
author: Dylan's Aunt E.

description: The food is delicious BUT I didn't find the food worth the wait (we had the Monte Cristo and French Toast Sampler).  On top of that, it's hard to have an enjoyable time when people are constantly being shuffled  through in an impressively efficient manner. Over all, I'd have a better breakfast experience at many other places in the city (some of which I've reviewed on Yelp).
author: Yum Y.

description: Other than the absurd wait and parking issues, this is one of the best breakfasts in the city. The pastries and breads are divine. Ties with Chloe's on Church for my two faves. Wish I was there now.
author: Rachel T.

description: Great good. Great service. Yes, there's always a wait. Enjoy the fresh air knowing that delicious food awaits.
author: Jason L.

description:
The pancakes were piping hot and super fluffy. I usually get tired of pancakes, but I walloped the lot here. A must try.

Waiting in line. You need to get here early to avoid waiting in line, also, this is not a great place if you are in a group because you have to wait for the big tables, which can take long. The wait staff are friendly and very accommodating at getting you seated, but they have to wait on the diners and with such good food, most people sit around for a while. So come in a party of two if you can to avoid a long wait.

The price was reasonable, and the eggs Benedict were brilliant. Definitely worth a try as well. The french toast looked good while being cooked, wish I'd order some.

Side Note. - Use the bathroom before coming, there is only one bathroom and there can be quite a wait at times.

Overall report - Worth it, good breakfast, would go there again if in SF again.
author: J P.

description: The french toast here is mouth watering.  Sort of a tourist trap but worth the long wait.  There is a focacia place across the street.  I recommend going there first buying some bread and snack on it while      waiting for Mama's.
author: Katherine V.

description: One of my fav breakfast places. Get there early or wait in line outside for over an hour. Incredible food and worth the wait!
author: Matt B.

description:
MONTE CRISTO!  MONTE CRISTO!  MONTE CRISTO!  If heaven were a flavor you would find it in the MONTE CRISTO.  I'm totally serious.  I cannot stop smiling while eating this creation.  

Here's the magical breakdown: Three slices of French Toast alternated with Ham/Cheddar/Turkey/Swiss all fried together and melted and sealed in light, airy goodness.  I cannot stress the "light, airy, goodness" enough.  Served as four separate quarters, they are perfectly sized for dipping into the accompanying berry jam then cramming into your eager mouth.  You can also choose from garden greens or house potatoes as a side.  

The other stuff at Mama's is pretty good too.  I had the Slim Joe Burger last week.  It probably would have been really really good had I eaten it on its own, but I also had the Monte Cristo.
author: Kobe Y.

description:
Awesome breakfast at this place - I had an incredibly tasty omelette and this amazing smoothie which was like a concotion of every fruit you can imagine with some honey thrown in.  Sounds a little vague but the end result was perfect.

Huge selection here as well and a really nice vibe for a breakfast place - will definitely be going there again when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Planet K.

description:
I was there about 4 years ago visiting from the east. Saw a huge line, figured something was up.

My son and I went at 10AM midweek. Just a small wait. Breathtaking food. The banana bread was made by a food goddess. Our waitress was very nice. 

You need to be in the right frame of mind, like anything else in life. If you need jiffy service and lots of elbow room, this is not where to go. If you like great, great food in a busy active atmosphere, surrounded by like minded people, then its 5 stars, baby.....
author: Johnny D.

description:
I LOVE brunch... like I live for it. And this place is hands down the best brunch in the city. Probably the best worldwide. Everything on the menu is just tremendous- no bad orders here. I personally  think the crab benedict is quite possibly the most amazing thing anyone has ever tasted. Everytime I go there I have to be rolled home like the blueberry girl in Willy Wonka because I cant stop myself. They must put crack in the food here... because I just cant get enough of it!

It is totally worth the wait... just prepare yourself to hand outside on beautiful washington square park for a bit. I promise it is a thousand times over worth the wait.
author: Emily S.

description:
Denny's has better coffee!
The food- o.k. but, nothing more than your average decent SF breakfast/lunch place.  Quality but, nothing special.
author: donna m.

description:
Frist off I take one star off because of Parking. I swear if any restuarant has their own parking lot they automatically get 5 stars. Mama's to me seems like a Scorsese film, you know its gonna be good, you can picture what your getting, you could of gotten it a million times before, BUT its like a dream come true to get something so good while your digging into your plate of food. 

If I could give this place an Oscar I would. 

My main problem when I come here is you have to order before you seat and if your like me and picking something to eat is like taking the SAT,  I get nervous and my mind goes blank. Its like that dream where your taking your test in your underwear.  I don't remeber what I wanted, crap. 

The staff is always super cool. There isnt too much space  which makes me wonder why really good restuarants are the size of a tool shed. I know that seating is hard but I wouldnt recommend a seat by the window where people line up. The worst feeling is having people gawk  at you while you eat. I find myself getting self consious when i sit in those seats. Interesting thing is when I'm on the outsite I am that gawker.
author: mark h.

description: Crab Benedict. House mad jam. You can't go wrong.
author: James C.

description:
GREAT BRUNCH. Holy mackerel...

My friend had the Cinnamon French Toast, with fruit and chocolate drizzled on top. OMFG....

There is ALWAYS a line here for wknd brunch, and there is a reason for that. Worth the hour you will undoubtedly wait in line.
Closes early, so keep your eye on the time!
author: S B.

description: Hello French Toast--Come to Mama!!! I am a major connoisseur of the french toast and when I heard that Mama's had one of the best, I had to try it. We came here on a cold January day and stood for an hour outside in the chill, and I will most definitely do it again the next time I come to SF. The b/f had Eggs Benedict I believe with Salmon. He had some sort of dish with salmon, and didn't really enjoy it. Suffice to day, there was some major food envy that day.
author: Noel A.

description: So yea the breakfast is good and everything, but c'mon people! It's breakfast....it's all good. Like sex...even when it's bad it's good, except I don't have to wait in line for an hour and a half for sex.
author: Bryan S.

description: I love that they have multiple versions of eggs benedict.  My mom ordered a shrimp benedict and I ordered the vegetarian benedict. So bomb!! Also love the french toast sampler because they make their own breads.  Like other folks have said - prepare to wait at least 45 minutes. Well worth the wait though...
author: liza g.

description: Leave your credit cards and your hurries and your aversion to crowds on the street and you'll have a fine meal served by terrific people. My wife asked to have her baguette toasted. Our waiter told her, "It IS toasted." The subject was not open for discussion, but his attitude was so good we weren't offended. The "Slim Bob" burger was HUGE and juicy. Food was just great, but the wait was indeed excessive and the interior was very crowded. It's refreshing to find a place as good as it was twenty years ago.
author: Hank T.

description: The food is great, really fresh ingredients, the coffee cakes are amazing and the jam (and I'm not a jam person) is seriously addictive...but I still can't decide if its worth the wait. It can take 1-2 hours on a Saturday or Sunday morning, that's a big chunk of my weekend. If you decide to stand in line, I recommend grabbing a cup of coffee and a newspaper, because you will need a distraction.
author: Rose K.

description: I visited Mamas about 3 weeks ago...based off of the great reviews it received here (thanks yelpers). It was fabulous, there was bit of a wait but my friend was already waiting at the door when I arrived. The food was excellent I had an omelet which was a huge portion, filled with ooey goodness...cheese, mushrooms, tomotoes yummy! My friend had the french toast and that was also scrumpcious!! Even though its a bit of a wait once inside you order right away and are quickly seated which is nice. I had the pleasure of seeing CARLOS SANTANTA on my visit..yes that's right he came through the backdoor quietly, ate and left. Now if this place is good enough for him, surely its good enough for me!!!!!
author: Leslie A.
