Its the same annoying shit at sushi bars.  Don't forget to reward yourself with a trip to Liguria bakery for the foccacia.
author: goldberg d.

description:
Food: Three Stars.  Ordered the crab omelette special and the french toast which was pretty good.

I like the food, however the wait time (over 2 hours) killed my appetite.
I didn't think the food was worth the wait and will look for a place that's not so commercial next time.
author: Lynn K.

description: What can I add that isn't already said below? It's the best brunch in the city (omelet, french toast, monte cristo ... yum!). If you're trying to go on a weekend you should expect a 60-90 minute wait, but it's well worth it. There are only 12 tables but it's that ambiance that makes you forget the wait once you get in. And don't be ashamed ... my friends and I always split an extra order of pancakes in addition to our omelette's.
author: David M.

description: One of the best breakfast's in San Francisco. Be prepared to wait an hour to get in on weekends.
author: Alland B.

description: Well, it is. Mentioned in fiction as well as non-fiction books, Mama's is somewhat of a tourist's landmark when visiting San Francisco. Unfortunately, that means lines. LONG lines. The food's good. Borderline great. If memory serves me correctly, it's cash only. You can bank on a wait of at least 1.5 hours, easily. I say, there's yummier places to be found. Try Dottie's True Blue Cafe. I'm a true FAN.
author: BrasilPo P.

description: "Ain't nothin' like Mama's cookin'!" Ok, that's cheesy, but seriously Mama's Breakfast is just um um good! In a place like San Francisco there just aren't that many great breakfast places that makes fresh and tasty omelettes. The only drawback of course is the long line and maybe the fact that it's a tiny place on the corner of Washington Park. But hey it's all about good grub in the morning right?
author: Jerianne B.

description:
i'd give this place the full 5 stars for its decadent assorted french toast platter and dizzying selection of tasty omlettes... but the minus one is for the line.  i'd be inclined to eat there way more often if the affair didn't involve 45 minutes to an hour of standing in line.  when the line's too intense and i just really can't handle the wait, i just walk over to Cafe Divine and have myself scrambled eggs with goat cheese and spinach, which you can have served with seasonal fruits.  coffee's thumbs up there too.  all in all, mama's is THEE breakfast joint (even the thought of that french toast...), but i'm not a very patient person.

--i'm editing this because i failed to mention the berry preserves on the tables in the plastic containers.  the preserves are home made, pushed onto you by all the servers... and nothing short of AMAZING.  drench your toast and french toast with it.  i have an unhealthy relationship with syrup but if i'm at mama's i'll bypass the syrup altogether for the decadent preserves.  Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...
author: Beccie F.

description: Although the wait is long (the earlier you get there the better), the food was spectacular!  I had read about this place prior our trip to SFO. Perhaps yes, they could and should have a bigger place to accommodate all the patrons....  We had the pancakes, french toast, Californian and Italian omelette.  They all were delicious!
author: Karen M.

description:
Brillant food everything on the menu is delisous-but I recomend the monte cristo -however you have to get there early other wise you could be wait to get in for over 2 hours also don't go on weekends because the ques.The staff are very friendly and the place has a very warming feel to it.
I LOVE MAMAS!
author: Meg C.

description:
eggs. how you can mess them up?

having said that, waiting in line for more than a half an hour (one time it was close to an hour) on a weekend brunch-hour is just plain stupid. ok, bring your sunday paper and read in line or text or check stuff on your iphone. still pretty lame.

again, eggs. bacon. coffee. nothing special here, folks.

here's the secret: it's the anticipation of getting in that's getting you all excited. look it up. plenty of research has been done on this human phenomenon. as long as their eggs, bacon, and coffee doesn't suck balls, you're a happy camper.

so as some would say, i'm "keepin' it real". it's better than denny's and ihop, but that's not saying much.

as for atmosphere, the quaint, small footprint, and location is what makes mama's mama's.

rating: one hot and one cold faucet handle.
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: Pretty tasty breakfast. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because we waited for almost 2 hours. I think they need to put some tables outside.
author: Nick C.

description:
As everyone has mentioned, yes, there is a line. Not only is there a line on weekdays, but once you get inside there is Another Line. 

And it is Way Worth it. I had the Northern Italian. Usually I don't eat bacon or omelets. Perhaps the word pancetta felt pretty on my tongue, or maybe I was feeling the spirit of North Beach. I'm glad I took the risk. But my friend ordered the Monte Cristo, and I know I was stupid not to. I'm still thinking about his breakfast. Next time....
author: Maggie Baggie H.

description: if you don't mind a little wait sometimes, this is a definite must for locals and tourists alike.  Usually try to make it at least every trip to the bay area. Food is great prices reasonable and the staff is excellent. You will also find new friends in line..
author: Yuen M.

description: Fortunately, this great breakfast and lunch spot is only about 2 blocks away from my house.  While there is often a wait, the line tends to go quickly thanks to the efficiency of the staff, and the food is well worth the wait.  Everything is great, but I can never seem to resist the carrot cake, which, unfortunately means I finish very little of whatever else I order.  If there is a line, just grab a coffee and a newspaper and hop into line.  As my husband likes to say, the line is all part of the experience, so just enjoy the experience.
author: Erica G.

description: Probably my favorite breakfast place anywhere, and I love great breakfasts.  The downside is the long and maddeningly slow-moving line at this tiny place (even on a Wednesday morning around 10), including another 10-minute wait once you enter the front door, but in my view, it's all worth it for the luscious omelets, pancakes, and baked goods, along with great coffee.
author: Jim B.

description: People, order the Monte Cristo. I don't care if it sounds weird, or will guarantee you gain 5 pounds in 10 minutes, its worth every bite. I've had a couple things here, and every time I keep eying the bf's Monte Cristo. Everything has been amazing, but the Monte Cristo- oh my god.
author: Noelle Q.

description: For all the hype, Mama's lives up to expectations. Yes, there's a line, well two really. Unless you go on off hours, but it's part of the fun. I guess. Anyway, the staff is always super friendly so you'll soon forget you were standing for 45 minutes for breakfast. But it's worth it. The french toast is great because of the breads they use. The coffee cakes are really good, not overly sweet and you can taste the homemadiness of it. When it's in season, the crab specials are simple and delicious. Last time I had a crab omelette (probably the most expensive omelette I've ordered) that was delicious and worth the price and wait. Don't worry about the line, just go.
author: The Sock S.

description: The food is off the hook but the ridiculous wait times makes me toss this one into the "tourist" bucket. Would recommend coming here for brunch during the week if possible.
author: Sadia J.

description:
I hate the wait!... I HATE THE WAIT!!! .....but, I love the banana pancakes!... I LOVE THE BANANA PANCAKES!!! 

Mama's is nice, friendly, cute. If the weather is gorgeous, Mama's is even better. I always have the toughest time deciding between Banana Pancakes or the Monte Christo. One thing is for sure--this is probably one of the finest breakfast joints in town... 

Business idea: what if Mama's were open late (beginning at 11pm) with advanced reservations required... Now, that would be cool!!!
author: Travel Swagger R.

description: 7 years ago I ate breakfast here. I still dream about it!! I live across the country, but remember it like yesterday. My dad went back recently went back and assured me it was just as good as we remembered. Needless to say next time I am in San Fran I going to Mamas.
author: Ariella G.

description: Awesome french toast (try the kind made with brioche). Awesome eggs benedict (their basic recipe is the best I have EVER had). Long line, but quick service when you get inside, and a great cozy atmosphere.
author: Beth T.

description: The food was amazing..the wait was not. 1 hour outside on a very cool Sunday morning . There were 11 people in our group who all ordered different things and everyone loved what they got -Pancakes were yummy..Loved the different spins on  the Benedict's which were fabulous..my grumpy teen even said that his meal  made the wait seem worthwhile. Would love to have Mama's closer than 1800 miles from my home.
author: Therese M.

description:
To answer the question everybody has in mind: Is it worth the wait?

OHHH YES!

Get yourself a newspaper and a coffee from one of the surrounding cafes and relax in the sun while waiting in this ridiculous long line for a very decadent and oh so delicious breakfast. SO worth it!
author: Sanja U.

description: super long wait, but well worth it.  tried their french toast sampler and dungeness crab eggs benedict - WOWZERS SUPER DELISH and in big portions!!!  loved it!
author: Kae B.

description: Delicious Breakfast!  The eggs benedict are unreal.  The price is a little steep for breakfast but it's well worth it.  Before you go be prepared to wait in line for a while.
author: Vanessa A.

description: I had seen the line on Saturday and Sunday mornings, so I assumed this place had a great brunch.  I was not disappointed.  I had the cinnamon chocolate french toast with berries, which was amazing.  The french toast was perfect - not too eggy at all.  The toppings were splendid and the chocolate was scrumptous.
author: Joanna S.

description: An obvious favorite. Mama's is the breakfast place that always has a line. So, that being said, on most weekend days you are in for an hour wait. Following the wait, however, you will experience an all our assault on your senses. Wonderful smells, a glass case of pastries and fresh fruits, and a view of the chef creating some of the best eggs benedict and french toast around. Mama's is a staple of the San  Francisco experience.
author: Dave M.

description: I refuse to wait in a long line for brunch, but if for any reason I find myself in the vicinity of Washington Square during the week, I find myself compelled to go to Mama's.  Their farmer's omlette, caesar salad, slim joe burger and carrot cake are all worth killing for.  The rest of the menu is just as good.  It also doesn't hurt that my pal Cyrus works the register and he is a total rock star.
author: Robyn H.

description: Gee...the waiting line really drives me nuts. I went to Mama's Sunday 12:00pm. As you know, there was a long long line. I am thinking if the food is not fantastic enough. I will write a bad review on yelp. However, the pancake is really really kills me. Gosh.... the freshness is unforgetable. The food here is really really GOOD~~. I will try to come here off the peak time.
author: Jenny C.

description:
This is Simply the BEST Brunch of San Francisco.
Each time I go there I go crazy and I want to buy everything. The food is fresh and home made.
You'll have to line up for sometime to get in but you wont regret it.
They take cash or debit card only.
They are open only until 3pm.
author: Talia F.

description: you'd think this place served gold by the way people rave about it. It's pretty tasty, but it's just brunch. I prefer to fool around with my girlfriend in the morning.
author: Boyd W.

description: I've been eating at Mama's since 1996. It is substantially the same staff. Hands down, it is some of the best food in San Francisco. The only reason I don't say "the best" is because that sounds hyperbolic and one might not believe me. If I could eat there every day, I would. I love the food, I love the well-lighted dining, and I love the staff. The line is long but it has never not been worth it. One of my lifelong goals is to eat every thing on the menu. When guests visit San Francisco, I always try to get them to try Mama's so they'll have at least one great thing to remember from their visit.
author: Nicolas K.

description:
oooh. mah. gah.

this is my favorite diner ever. EVER. eh. vah. I've eaten at manymanymany diners and this is IT. I feel like Mama's is like that fluke of evolution. Every few millenia something comes along that defies the the slow course of darwinism. Mamas is a new species: dinerus superius maximus.

"But..but...the line is so long!"

You know what, they have a name for whiners like that. They're called losers. Italian sausage omelettes are for winners. If you didn't want to wait you should have taken your ass to Mel's for some grilled cheese. Loser.

Remember... Mama's: Only for WINNERS.
author: Jon S.

description:
"how long you folk have been waiting?" a lovely lady asked.
"two hour"
"40 minutes"
"forget about it,it's not me"
yes...that was the first nightmare began.
second scene........
in front of the cashier..
cashier  :" hi.....(pause....leave cash register .....giggling.....talked with another waiter....)"
us : "  can we have.............(pause.......(WTF.....))
cashier :" hi.....what are you getting?"....(pause ...,leave the cash register again........talked again..lol)"
us : ........????!!!! f@ck 
cashier : " what are you getting?"
us : can we have Monte cristo,Washington square,french toast,coffee............"
cashier: " $40.........."
yes that was second nightmare
" what is the homemade jam taste like?"
" it taste like sugar with little of raspberry"
" don't you have high blood sugar?"
" I don't care, I have to finish this "sugar free" food"
" do you finish you food?"
"thanks God ,no.........."
yes this was third nightmare

well , if you compare this to Dottie's it like heaven and hell..............
I feel more  hell than MAMA"s
author: chris j.

description: i am not a patient person and cannot justify waiting 1 hour for food. so that is the main reason why i haven't eaten again at this quaint brunch place. BUT i am almost due for another visit to mama's for their oh-so-yummy monte cristo!!! words cannot describe how scrumptious and delectable this dish is. the ham, turkey and cheese pairing is like a symphony in your mouth. top each bite off with their homemade jam and it's a home run!
author: Melissa Y.

description: Simply A-MAZING! This place is a favorite of mine for brunch. The food and service is great. My favorite of all has to be the Monte Cristo...just deeeelicious! Definitely worth the long wait in line.
author: Nai P.

description: Waited in line over 2 hours for this place. Was it worth it? Hands down the BEST french toast I've ever tasted in my entire life. Would I do it again? Yes. Why only 4 stars? Quite frankly I think it's ridiculous that they have not expanded their space to accommodate more people... my only disappointment.
author: Andrea Y.

description:
Not worth the wait!
Come on guys it's French toast!!
Anybody can make it!!
I won't go on and on but unless
you live nearby please do not waste
$  on cab to get there!!
It is just your normal breakfast place!!
Realized that everyone in line were just
hungover 20 year olds!!!
Sorry guys but to wait for two hours ugh!!!
author: Judy L.

description: I really don't see why people love this place so much, I hardly think the food is worth the wait and the cash-only policy... My gf lives in the neighborhood so I'll probably go there again, but if I would have to drive (and park) to go there I def won't revisit...
author: Andrew N.

description: Arrived at 8:30 in the freakin' morning on a Sunday and stood in line for over an hour, which is to be expected...I liked the display of fresh fruit, salmon, breads, etc as we walked yet another line to order our breakfast once inside....I ordered the Californian Omelet (bacon, avocado and jack cheese BUT I added green onions to mine as well) and H got the Brioche french toast (I'm going to massacre the name so I ain't gonna try)...both meals were good but worth the hour wait? Probably Not...Will we return?? Probably only if we're craving french toast of some sort...for the Omelet, I think Joann's in SSF beats them...IMO!!
author: Karen B.

description: My mom loves Mama's and insists on breakfasting there daily when she's visiting. For the hungry and impatient, the line is hell on a Saturday or Sunday. Play hookey on a Wednesday and enjoy a leisurely breakfast. The pastries are obscene.
author: Kezia P.

description: So I think this place is totally over rated!  Sorry Mama!  But the wait is ridiculously long and I could totally make a breakfast just as good.  But if its just about they hype, then you might as well check it out.
author: Lauren M.

description: Be prepared to wait, but don't worry, good things come to those who wait.  I ordered (and thoroughly enjoyed) the cinnamon chocolate french toast and a side of potatoes and scrambled eggs.  And though I have no real regrets about having said order, I do wish I ordered the crab omelette.  I tried a bite from my friend's plate - and imagine my surprise when I found that Mama's uses *real* crab (and not imitation crab)!!!
author: Dwigt S.

description: Mmmmm. My FAVORITESTESTESTEST breakfast place in the city.. and probably ever! let me see. .what's good? what ISN'T?! omelettes are huge and muy delicioso, so is french toast or anything sweet. try one of the pastries too.. hell, try everything! don't ask me to pick a favorite because i'll cry. only reason it's not 5 stars is cuz of the wait. i've tried coming all sorts of different times during different days to no avail. i wonder if everything tastes that much better because i waited 45 minutes for it. hmmmm..
author: Mel L.

description:
the MONTE CRISTO SANDWICH!!!!!!! (drools)  =D
*note: can only order after 11am. 

Okay so this is the only place I know where you can have this wonderful savory & sweet entree! Even when I have breakfast elsewhere.. I think to myself.. "Ahhh.. if only they had the Monte Cristo sandwich here". And even if you find it elsewhere... I can pretty much put my money that no one will make it as good as Mama's. 

Warning:
Extremely long wait. Definitely do not come here if you're hungry and want to eat right away. But YOU HAVE TO wait in this line at least once, one of the best and freshest breakfast joints you'll enjoy in the city! 

CASH ONLY!
author: Sue Y.

description: Got to mama's early for a Sunday. Saw the reviews on yelp and thought it can't be that good. Clearly over hyped. The line outside seemed to go straight up the road. We were told 45 to an hour wait. Hmmm. Okay we were game. I didn't realize how small this place was... If I had of known how tiny it was I would have never made the hour wait commitment. But as long as the line was, they kept it moving. Once inside the joint, they line you up and take your order before they clear the next table for you to sit. Very efficient. The guy behind the register was very cool and we waxed all things 49ers before we got our seat. We split our choices. Eggs bennie and French toast w/ fresh fruit. Let me tell you. Worth every minute of the wait!!!!  Go here. Wait. Eat and then tell a friend. The food is so good and they take care in not only the taste but in how they present it. A+. I will be back on my next trip to frisco!
author: Patrick U.

description: i enjoyed mama's but it's by far not my favorite brunch spot in sf and don't really understand the hype.  they have great food (i really like their farmer's omelette and benedict) but there's nothing super special that makes it worth the long wait here.  i'll take a brunch over at dottie's or brenda's anyday over mama's.
author: Helen T.

description: Most definitely, expect a long wait. We had to feed the meters about 3 times to avoid a ticket - since the max time to fill it up is an hour. Airy atmosphere, fresh squeezed OJ, and yummy Eggs Florentine - would love to try the french toast next time!
author: Audrey L.

description: The food was excellent.  The apple walnut crumb cake was rich and gooey, and had the perfect amount of crunch on top.  I loved the interior of the restaurant - homey, and old fashioned and just a slice of nostalgia in the heart of the city.  The only negative was the wait:  One hour in line for a 25 minute meal.  Yes, I would do it again, but next time, I am stopping off to get a coffee so I can spend the time in line and not drool every time I saw the staff bring mugs of coffee to the lucky diners inside!
author: D H.

description:
Love Mama's this was the first breakfast I had when I moved into the city..and it's never disappointed great savory and sweet items....and everything is of the highest quality...(once I just wanted a piece of their cranberry nut bread to go as a snack and they wouldn't sell it to me cause it had been sitting there for like a day..) 

the wait however has gotten pretty ridiculous...you must commit to waiting about an hour and a half for breakfast and most morning I just don't have the patience...soooo if you have a Mama's craving grab some coffee and go across the street for some focaccia and invite some friends to chat with..
author: Joy Y.

description: If you want absolutely insanely great breakfast....go there, wait in line and ENJOY. The cakes, the omelets, everything is so darn tasty. Bring cash - no creditcards accepted.
author: Conny F.

description:
Best breakfast. EVER.

Went to Mama's on Sunday morning and were in line at 7:35 and in right at 8 when they opened. There were only about 5 people in front of us at 7:35 but by 8, the line had grown to about 20-30.

Service was great. Drinks were out within a couple of minutes and food was out within 10 minutes. Cashier was patient with us even though it was our first trip to Mamas, which is a plus since we werent rushed. Dude's cooking behind the glass partion are like machines!

Food was perfect. I ordered the Northern Italian Omellete and gf had the chocolate cinnamon French toast with seasoned berries and bananas. When I say that these are the best french toast in the world, Im not exaggerating. The best. At first taste I thought that the potatoes on my omellete plate lacked salt but as I tasted my omellete, the cheese offset it perfectly. Mimosas are also a pretty good way to start off the day.

Eating here every time Im in Frisco.
author: Erik R.

description: This place is a definite five on weekdays when the wait is bearable and am giving it a four just becasue it is such a long wait on weekends that I wont even go now on Sat or Sunday becasue of this.   The food is great and the workers are very friendly.  I wish they had food to go orders which would be nice sometimes when you do not want to wait in line.  The Washington Square omlette is Fantastic and the cofffee is really good.  I love the jam on the table and the sourdough bread is great with the Washington Square omlette which I strongly suggest.  The sausage in this omlette has some of the best flavor around.  Definetely go here on a weekday whenever you get a chance.
author: Harry E.

description: love it. The proscutto benedict is out of this world. everything is fresh, and you can really tell the food is made with high quality ingrediants. Ahmed and Syrus rock. They always take care of us. (Thanks from your friends up the street!) Everything is good. The only problem is getting in. There is always a line, but you cant knock them for that. Good for them that people are waiting hours to get there.
author: clint e.

description: Best breakfast I've had in the city.  The only down side is you always have to wait for a table.  I try to hit it up on a weekday when the wait isn't too bad.
author: Will H.

description: YES, THE FOOD HERE IS GREAT!  Sooo delicious!  But I had to wait outside in the cold San Francisco weather for 45 minutes.  I would only come here again if I took out a guest from out-of-town or something.  I wouldn't  come here for a casual breakfast.  4 Stars!
author: H. A.

description: The wait was insanely long...1.5hours!!! Thank God it was a nice day! This brunch only place is cute, but it's not worth the wait. I had their crab omelette and was satisfied with what I got and their pastries are not bad either....but I was overly starved by the time we got our food, so I just scarffed down the whole thing.
author: Renee C.

description: Face it, to eat here you have to wait in line. Check out Google Maps, and theres that line of people. So make the best of it. There are interesting  people to talk to,  read the paper or just stand and stare at the sun. Why does everyone wait in this line? Because the food is so damn good.   I love the Apple Pandore. YUMMMMMM ME!
author: John S.

description: This place is damn GOOD.  The monte christo was just perfectly made and I won't ever forget how good it tasted.  The place gets real crowded and it's very tough to find a seat but regardless, you can place your order for food and eat it at the park across the street.  They take cash only so be ready with that.
author: Ben E.

description: Not worth the wait.  Food is average and the wait staff was unpleasant and did not even bring me a refill untill i had asked four times.
author: H.A. ..

description: I love, love, LOVE this place. The wait is spectacular but extremely worth it. Once in, you order at the counter and they seat you. Food comes out pretty quickly and then it's heaven. The wait staff is always courtesy and friendly. When you have to wait as long as you have to for food everything from food to servers better be worth it....and each time, it never fails.
author: Stephanie H.

description: This is the best brunch place in almost the bay area and believe me I've been to the southbay and eastbay too. Never been to northbay so cannot say the whole bay area. Dottie's take second place next to Mama's. I love the Washington omelette, Mama's sampler frenchtoast and the blueberry muffins (still warm, really moist and most importantly not too sweet.) I normally do not order the eggs benedicts because Los Gatos Cafe has the best eggs benedicts. Remember to come in a small group that way you get to order more and sample more. Mama's would have gotten five stars if it wasn't for the no reservation and an hour wait but it is still worth it.
author: Allison H.

description: Food is good, but Not worth standing in line for...seriously, not That great...french toast is ok...omelette is ok. I don't understand the hype. Only tourists would stand out there for 45 mins. Crazy
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
i took the plunge & waited in line, not that bad waited about 50 minutes before got to order. Highlight of waiting in line was a guy on a scooter came by and told us that he was a local and that we shouldn't be waiting in line and go to Mo's for breakfast, which he said was way superior. No one budged from there spot. =) Total was 48 pre-tip. We had the following:
1) Crab Benedict: Good, but benedicts were never my style, and there was crab shells in the mix.
2) Shrimp Asparagus Omelet: I loved this one. Perfect combination. 
3) Chocolate French Toast: Bread was not fluffy, a bit dense. Do not eat with syrup, eat it with the jam that is what makes it taste so good.
4) Blueberry Sour Cream Coffee: Liked it, but not a must order.
5) Tea: Totally should have skipped it, it was just Tazo tea bags.
Overall a good breakfast place and would come here again if there wasn't a line outside. My other gripe is, Why isn't here a cover over the cream pitcher? There was all these weird nasty floating thingies in my cream pitcher.
author: Erica B.

description:
Over the years I've noticed an evolution in what once might have been called "dive" restaurants.  While originally these places were low-cost restaurants with great food but simple surroundings many have evolved to become Yuppie traps: run down or out of date buildings with so-so food and high prices that people with too much money feel it's cool to visit.  It is great marketing, but not a great dining experience.  Mama's is just such a place.

By now it has cult status and the lines and dumpy surroundings (as others note in Yelp) are a part of the experience- again, great marketing (!) if people will put up with it.  Now why they put up with it is another story.  You get average food (some of it very good, but most average), so-so service (usually rushed because of the line) and, to top it all off they only accept cash despite having fairly high prices.  In today's world high prices but no credit cards is really not quaint, it's just bad customer service.

If you can go on a weekday and avoid the line maybe give it a shot- they occasionally have some creative food options. But when all is said and done you could save an hour of time and just go to Moose's across the street. Much better service, not rushed, good food, and the prices are not that different.
author: William H.

description: Putting the wait and the touristy feel aside, Mama's is the real deal.  The food was super fresh and every plate that came out of the kitchen looked amazing.  I had one of the french toast varieties and it was great.  They don't overlook any part of their dishes and the flavors and quality of all the dishes make it easy to see why so many people love this place.  If you aren't hungry when you get here, the sights and smells you experience while waiting in line just an arms length away from people already dinning, will certainly make you hungry by the time you get your seat.
author: Michael R.

description: I went to Mama's today and the food was amazing!  We got there just before close on a Tuesday so there was absolutely no wait.  Walked right up to the counter.  I had the Cinnamon French Toast with berries and my husband had the Monte Crisco and subbed the greens salad with a caesar.  The caesar was one of the best I've had.  Both entrees were unreal!  The homemade raspberry jam was out of this world.  The waitress said that sometimes they have it for sale to take away.  Will have to do that at some point.  I would totally come back!  I don't envy the people who say that have you wait hours.  Yikes.
author: Jo M.

description:
Great assortment of french toast and breakfast food.  My only complaint is the lack of parking and the wait.  Another small nice eatery, too bad they can't seat more people.  

I love the french toast!!!!  yum yum
author: Alex K.

description:
Eat at Mamas! Yes, it's worth the wait!

They have this brunch business figured out. The food is fresh,  delicious, even beautiful.

I wish my mama made me breakfast like this growing up.
author: Alyssa P.

description: I recently went up to the Bay Area to visit with my kids and one of them took me to Mama's.  Unbelievable..........what a fabulous experience.  Don't go there if you are in a hurry and dress appropriately for an outside wait in line.  Once you get inside, you will see all who work there prepare meals of exceptional beauty with love introduced into each and every dish.  Oh, and by the way, the delicious food is delivered by courteous, efficient, and very friendly workers.  We shared a Dungeness Crab, Avocado, and Brie Omelette as well as a Blueberry/Sourcream freshly baked pastry that was nothing short of as good as it gets.
author: Bobby B.

description: I honestly do not understand what the hype is all about.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but the wait was definitely not worth it, since my breakfast, which was actually a late lunch by then, was just average.  I had the Northern Italian omelette, consisting of pancetta, mushrooms, basil, tomato, garlic, and cheese.  There was nothing special about this omlette.  In fact, it was quite bland for having basil, garlic, and pancetta as its ingredients.  The home fries and coffee were average.  My friend had eggs benedict with avocado and she only ate half of it because there was some sort of metallic taste to it.  However, she did enjoy the banana cake, and I had a taste of the chocolate crumb cake and that was good.  Perhaps the baked goods are something to rave about.  There are so many breakfast/brunch joints in this city that are well worth a 2 hour wait, but Mama's just isn't one of them to me.  I am glad that this mom and pop establishment does have many supporters and hope it continues to.
author: Linda P.

description: Just the best place for breakfast in the city.  Go on a weekday or you'll be waiting in a long line.
author: rhiannon g.

description: O god everything here is really wonderful. I have almost finished working my way through the list of omelettes- I got stuck on the Californian for about 8 years, moved on to the Washington Square for a year or two, and am now in a French Toast phase- and I can say with certainty that Mama's never disappoints.  The pastries are amazing and the fruit and orange juice make you remember why you moved to California.   Downsides are that the wait sucks, the bathroom is literally a broom closet and the lack of nearby brunch alternatives means you're committed to staying in that line.  Bring a coffee, sunglasses, and the New York Times and you just might make it to nirvana.
author: Margaret F.

description: So worth any type of wait, I had the cinnamon french toast and some sort of pancetta omelette and it really was as good as I've heard. It was also very satisfying being the last people in line and presumably getting the pleasure of telling others they can't get in line though nobody even tried. I was hoping to shatter some late brunch dreams.
author: Constance C.

description: How good is the MONTE CRISTO here?  SO good that I will gladly wait an hour again to get it and have two monte cristos (their portions are VERY generous btw) on top of a french toast dish.  I'm sure other dishes are great here, too, but the monte cristo is SO good that I've never been able to order anything else. :)
author: Army C.

description: The food quality and customer service have kept me going back.  There is still a long line. I heard a guy wanted to just pay for to-go. The waitstaff told him he had to stay-in line. There is no take-out line. Get in line buddy, there is no shortcut at Mama's!
author: Michael K.

description: This is my favorite breakfast spot, when I have an hour to wait.  However, I've learned the waiting is part of the ritual - especially the wait inside.  I like just watching them prepare the dishes - every plate is beautiful.  The food is prepared from scratch and I can't resist the Monte Cristo sandwich (served w/ their homemade blackberry preserves. ).  It's the best!
author: Kerri L.

description: Loved Mama's.  If you are ever in the North Beach area, visit this small corner spot for a delicious breakfast.  Yes, the line is long especially during the weekend.  Luckily I went my first time on a weekday. =)  After eating at Mama's hop across the street to pick up a nice snack - fresh baked pizza bread.  Go early because they sell out fast!
author: Angie K.

description: Yes, the breakfasts are delicious but please, can't you all find a place to eat brunch in your OWN neighborhood? : )
author: Eric ..

description: LOVE it...bring your paper and be ready to stand in line if you don't get there SUPER early...
author: Teri B.

description: The food at Mama's is superb. I got the eggs benedict and it was great. We went on a Friday around 11 and had to wait about 20 minutes to sit down. That was the only complaint. The food is excellent and the price is reasonable for San Francisco. This place totally killed my hangover. :)
author: Tom C.

description:
oohhhhhh maaaaannnnn! talk about an amazing meal! hungover or sober this place will ALWAYS hit the spot. fatty food that sits in your stomach like your mama's cookin...hence the name. pancakes, waffles, fresh fruit, smoothies, mimosas, sandwiches, cake...you name it they got it! 

only downfall is the wait...both outside and inside. but well worth it in my opinion, just don't go stand in line when you are famished. that's just silly. then you'll end up complaining.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Monte Cristo was perfect, other brunch dishes were just standard. I am just not an advocate for waiting in line for HOURS for mediocre brunch places. Sorry.
author: DANIEL T.

description:
ehh... this place is pretty talked up. im glad i went on a weekday and didnt wait in line for too long. 

the california (m)omelet (bacon, avocado, jack cheese) was not outstanding; roasted potatoes not the best; sourdough bread delicious. 

assorted french toast plate was good but stick to the basic. 

canned soda...
author: terra d.

description: It's okay. Good food and service. Nothing to complaint about. But frankly, I don't think it's worth waiting in line just to get bfast here. Too many other places in the SF bay area without the long wait.
author: George M.

description: Worth the wait in line! I've talked many tourists into staying on the line. It can be daunting, but the pay off is big. Super friendly wait staff. I've been there so much some of them recognize me. Do your best to keep trying new things... 9 times out of 10 I get the Monte Cristo....mmmm. So do as I say not as I do.
author: Nihad P.

description: I went for lunch in the middle of the week and only waited 3 minutes for a table.  Sure, the place is nice and the food is good but I wouldn't want to wait more than half an hour for it.  There's nothing on the menu I couldn't get somewhere else faster.  And I agree with others who say the atmosphere is too hectic to fully relax.
author: Michael L.

description: I'm fairly new to the city and have not hit up all the breakfast spots, but I think I can say that Mama's has the best breaksfast.  You can't go wrong if you order pancakes/waffles or eggs/omelattess.   theres a ling to get in, but that just represents how good it is.
author: Dishar R.

description: Awesome place for brunch with eggs Benedict galore!  The wait is interminable though so find a time to go when you don't have to stand outside for an hour.
author: Susie S.

description: I don't see what the hype is all about.  Waiting in line for 40 mins isn't my thing.  I had the monte cristo which was pretty good, and my gf had the $18.50 crab benedict which was ok in my opinion. I see this place as more of a tourist attraction versus anything else.
author: Robert L.

description: The only thing not to love about Mama's is the long line during peak brunch times.  If you can, drag yourself out of bed a little earlier on the weekend or at least buy a paper to make waiting more tolerable.  Try the cranberry orange walnut french toast with preserves, not syrup.
author: Laura B.

description:
Happiness is Mama's.

I always end up going on off hours during the week - Friday, 8:30 a.m. or Tuesday, 12:30 p.m. and I've never had to wait in the extreme line.  Leave at 9:30 a.m. on a Friday though, I was able to see that line of 20+ already forming.

Side track: What do these people do during their days?  How are they able spend a weekday waiting in line just for a Mamalette?  (I was on a business bfast)  Also, who are those people who lay out on Washington Square all day?  Don't these people have jobs???

Recommendations:
Cinnamon Chocolate French Toast 
French Toast with apples (F-toast plates go for around $9 or under)
Coffee Cake

One of the BEST places for breakfast.

Very FRIENDLY service.

I can't wait to go again!
author: Liz T.

description: I'll keep this short.  It's worth the 2 hour wait in the rain!  Just go prepared to wait in line.
author: Tim L.

description: I LOVE MAMA'S! This is a great place for breakfast & brunch in SF. The wait is usually long, so the earlier you get there the better - but it is well worth it. They move quick, the prices are reasonable and most importantly the food is AWESOME! The servers are very nice, it's a cute restaurant and very clean & bright. I just love this place so if you're looking for some great breakfast and/or brunch try out Mama's just be prepared to wait a while .....
author: Kimberly R.

description: Ive never been to Mama's.  I walked by there every morning on my way to work and laugh.  Why would anyone in their right mind stand outside in the cold to eat breakfast?  I guess it's the thing to do when you read tons of reviews on yelp.  Just wondering if its the whole review/waiting in line/mesmerizing/whatever thing.  I mean c'mon its breakfast.  How much better can it be than eggs and toast?  Maybe I should bring my mom to SF and charge over the top prices and watch you guys stand in line in the cold.  Im sure she'd get a kick out of that.
author: Kevin G.

description: Ok so after reading all the reviews for this place I had to make time to come and try it out. I have to say, the wait is not worth it. We waited outside in a line for 45 minutes, then you have to wait in another line to order your food, where I felt rushed and flustered, bc there wasn't a menu to look at in your hands, just up on the wall, and it was very different than the one on the window out front (there is only one on the window out side to look at, so that was annoying too.) I ordered the vegetarian eggs benedict and a pastry.  The eggs benedict was flavorless, I have had better eggs benedict at IHOP.  The pastry was very good though. I took half of it to go so I could enjoy it later in the day too. The only other amazing thing was the jam on the table. OMG was it tasty, I wish I could have bought a jar of it to go, but they do not sell it.  All in all, this place was more generic than special. I probably wont go back mainly bc of the line out front and the food not being amazing like advertised by the reviews.
author: Nikki P.

description: The longest queue I have ever seen for a breakfast cafe! At least 2-3 hours waiting time!
author: maria b.

description: Long lines........ man.. but so worth it!!!  Everything is great!! i especially love the Monte cristo sandwich !!!!!!!YUMMY!! dip it in the jelly spread....  ooh soooo goood!! drooling just thinking about it!
author: Shirl C.

description: 2 words- MONTE CRISTO try it with the jam.  Everything is great here but you can't beat it. Totally worth the wait for the sweet then salty then yummy taste.  :)
author: Britt B.

description: I give this place three stars mostly because I don't think it is worth the wait.  Arrived at 9:15am and didn't eat until after 11am.  Nothing in my opinion is worth the wait.  The food was good -- I had the eggs benedict with crab, but nothing to write home about.  I have to say though, that they do a good job at making the processes as streamlined as possible to get the line down.
author: Nicole C.

description: I am a big fan of Mana's for breakfast.  I come here every time I have a weekday off.  Love their monte cristo, eggs benedict, french toast sampler, pancakes, and the crab benedict. Everything is made to perfection, and the wait really is like an hour on weekdays if you go early.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The food is good, not great, and definitely not worth the wait in line.
author: Christina B.

description:
if i could only eat one "type" of food for the rest of my life it would be brunch.  unfortunately, EVERY good place in san francisco has a line out the door on the weekends.  mama's has an extra long line for a reason.

tip:  bring quarters to buy a newspaper.  the paper boxes are right at the corner.  be sure not to drop them all over the street like a putz when inserting them in to the machine because there is a super long line full of people with nothing to do but stare and laugh at you.  i know you people are all pleasant on the outside, but jerks on the inside.

seriously, it's a long wait even if you get there "early" so come with people whose company you actually enjoy.

crab benedict.  MMhmm.  soju screwdriver?  damn straight.
author: Steven C.

description: I went to Mama's for the first time last week and I can't stop thinking about the pancakes I had there. We went 2pm on Thursday (just before closing) and there was no wait and several open tables. This I assume has never happened on the weekend. It's the type of place that you provide you with a meal you will chase until you get back there. They are committed to organic and fresh. The sausage and coffee cake were amazing. They take normal breakfast food and show you what it would taste like in heaven.
author: Kerry A.

description: Went here 3 times but turned away because of the rediculous line. Finally came here with my girl and actually waited. The wait was about 40 min. All I have to say is the wait was well worth it. I was in breakfast/brunch heaven once I took that first bite of eggs off of my benedict. Everything I ordered was perfect. But what stood out were the eggs. I don't know why it tastes so good and different then other places. Will wait in line again to eat here. I give this place 4 stars for the food and -1 star for the long rediculous line, but its not their fault that their food is so damn good.
author: Jay S.

description: Yes there is sometimes an hour long line. Parking is not fun. Always WELL worth the wait and maybe even the ticket. Ive gotten in in 10 mins on a Sat morn, and then on a Tuesday it took an hour to seat 2. You just never know when everyone will show up. Bring a friend to stand in line while you circle for parking for 20 mins. OH they serve killer bloody mary's and I dont even like that sorta thing. I have little time and patience but trust me, its worth it here. Ive been finding myself making excuses to go to the city in the mornings just so I can get me some mama's ;)
author: Vanessa A.

description:
Dear dear mama. Breakfast has always been  favorite and Mama's has totally confirmed it! As i walked down the street like a giddy school girl, i detetected the sweet smell of Mamas lingering in the air;I seriously couldnt get there any faster. Unfortunately!! I approached the place and there was a huge line coming out the door which forced me to wait anxiously outside. BOO. 
I swear the lingering smell must be laced with some kind of drug because we waited about 45 minutes just to sit and eat breakfast. Oh my! Oh well, it was great food.
I ordered Nothern Itailian Omelet -bacon, mushroom, spinach and tomatoes ---ingredients alone should spell mmmmmmmm, but if you yearn for some kind of verbal/critic confirmation, i will say it. It was DELISH, only con is that it was a bit salty because o' zee bacon.
The jam on the table is home made i believe and it was a sweet confection when  spread on the toast.
Potatoes are cooked perfectly and Egg's benedict was tasty too. 

The service really topped it off for me. They are extremely kind and prompt. They really make you feel comfortable and unrushed even though they have a line out the door. I can't wait to come back and try the french toast.
author: Kelly S.

description: One of the top-notch, must-eat, places in North Beach for Breakfast!!! The waiting line is crazy man... crazy. Shrimp Omelete is my all-time favorite. Then walk on down to XOX for some truffles!
author: Leroid D.

description: BEWARE: This is a member of downtown SF's Axis of Evil Breakfast Lines (see Dottie's and Sears Fine Foods), so make sure to grab a coffee drink to go from one of North Beach's many cafes before you get in line.  You can keep drinking it when you get to the SECOND LINE inside the cafe (the one for ordering).  If the food wasn't amazing (see other reviews for details), I'd resolve never to come back again.  But I will.
author: Rego S.

description: Made it here for breakfast this morning.  We got there around 8:30am and there was NO ONE inside.  But once we went in, a whole crowd of people jammed in after us.  I think we were there until about 9:30am.  By then, the line was sooo long.  I had the Californian momlette (bacon and avocado!!).  But I tried the crab momlette and it was sooo good!!!  I also had a hot chocolate because I love hot chocolate.  You definitely have to wake up early to eat breakfast here or you'll be waiting in line forever.  I wanted to go to the bakery across the street afterward to get foccacia, but it's closed until January 3rd.  That kind of bummed me out after the yummy breakfast.
author: Kris L.

description: A couple of years ago I went on tour to L.A. with my friend's band Fojimoto. After a night of heavy drinking, we visited the Wilshire Grand Hotel restaurant where I had my first Monte Cristo -- a delectable smoked turkey, ham and cheese french toast sandwich served with jelly. Ever since, I've been obsessed with repeating the experience in my hometown. The closest I've come is Mama's, where the Monte Cristo isn't to die for, but the waffles are the bomb.
author: Katie B.

description: A better breakfast you won't find. Check out the bread varieties for the french toast.
author: Don H.

description: A bit overrated with the huge line it always has out the door, but you can't deny that it has excellent food and variety that destroys all other brunch places out there. I'm lucky to have been there a good couple times now, cuz I don't think I'd make the effort to get there super early again just to secure a parking spot and a place in line. But definitely worth the wait at least once!
author: Christine K.

description: Honestly, this place is so popular because it's in Washington Square and because they have a $18.50 crab benedict.  Everything else is good, not amazing...  The service is SUPER friendly though.
author: Melanie C.

description: Line starts forming at 7:30.  No need to add to the (justified) hyperbole. It's terrific food, friendly people. It deserves seven stars.
author: J J.

description: A great breakfast, but if you want a shorter line, try Dottie's True Blue Cafe.
author: Philip M.

description: To be honest, I might have heard way too much hype about this place, making my expectations somewhere up in the stratosphere.  Went on a Tuesday morning at 9am, and there was no wait.  That was definitely a plus since (like you can see on the other reviews) there always seems to be a line.  I had the California omlet, and my friend had the Farmers.  Both were nice, but I wouldn't say extraordinary.  The potatoes were a little overcooked and tough.  But the service and atmosphere was really nice, so I'd go back again if I find myself looking for a breakfast place on a Tuesday morning...
author: Mark D.

description:
oh
god...
me and my friend had to wait 30 minutes outside in line to get inside this tiny little place and order. 
but let me tell u, this is the kind of food that makes waiting WORTH IT. 
i ordered the apple yogurt french toast with fresh berries and a side of turkey chicken sausage. we also ordered a small slab of the carrot cake which was moist, creamy cream cheese topping perfecttt...
they close pretty early at 3 so if u get in line by 2:25  probably won't make it in. 

mmm, this was my FIRST real meal in SF and it was WELL WORTH IT.
author: Diana C.

description: I think they sprinkle crack on the french toast. Oh lord is it good. I had the crab omlette today with the french toast and the smoothie and did not eat anything the rest of the day. Is that too much food for one person? I don't think so. I had to roll myself out of the place and I can no longer button my jeans but this is hands down the best breakfast in the city.
author: Kristen D.

description: This place is fantastic for Breakfast. While they do enforce the "Southwest Airlines" wait in line style, which sucks, by the time you are done with your eats, you have forgotten about the wait. Being right next to Washington Sq. Park, there is always some interesting sights to see while walking off your breakfast!
author: Kelsey G.

description: 6/13/08: Friday the 13th, hangover brunch at Mama's - not exactly the ideal situation but I still managed to enjoy the meal. I have to admit that I  only picked at parts of my californian omelette - i was still feeling quite nauseous from the previous night.  I did manage to take a couple of bites of the old fashion coffee cake (I think that's what I ordered) and enjoy myself. Only real disappointment was the one hour wait for the table. Food was on par with what one would expect, waiting outside sucked tho.
author: Jesse W.

description: I don't think the food here lives up to the hype.  The line does.  I went on a Wednesday, about 9 am.  Wait was a little over 1 hour.  The apple pan d'or was delicious!!! The benedicts were good, but I can get good Benedicts at Miller's on Polk without the wait. Coffee was bad.  Service was good. I didn't get a good vibe about the place.  It's too crowded and once you sit down you feel rushed to eat so they can cram more people in.
author: Alina C.

description: I go here once a year and it's always after a Halloween party. There's something about dressing up for the night that makes you want to eat a five star winning breakfast.  Mama's is it!  I always go with their Monte Cristo with fresh made jam and potatoes.  It's consistently on point, hitting the spot every time!  The waiters are friendly and the atmosphere is as comforting as they get.  There is always a line for this place.  Always.  But it's worth the wait!
author: R B.

description: OK. I'm the type of dude that schedules my errands specifically to avoid lines, traffic, waiting, or pointless standing. You'll never find me in that line of cars always found outside TJ's, though I shop there weekly. I, also, love breakfast. I went to Mama's today as the host for my out of town friend, for our very first visit. Now, it is 100% feasible that the food is worth the wait, if you have found yourself waiting very long, for almost all of the people who have ever visited. Though, it would have to be a pretty clean entrance-to-exit experience, because that friggin' wait puts the rest of the factors on a tight-rope. Any slip-ups, and the wait won't be worth it. Especially with the food. Our wait was one (1) hour. Everybody was super polite and efficient. I ordered the french-toast sampler and a side of chicken-turkey sausage, she ordered the shrimp benedict special and added crab meat, tomatoes and avocado. We both also ordered small juices. Our bill was $40.04. Ahem. After we were seated, a couple was seated to our right, and then to our left. Both parties received their plates before we did. Ahem, again. Getting wobbly. The sampler arrived with the three headlining FT; cinnamon, something else I can't remember, and the cranberry-orange. I ate the cinnamon and unknown first, one by one, to savor the flavors. Each could be topped by my own unexperienced hand in less than ten minutes in my little kitchen. More gummy than fluffy, and nothing special, even with the wonderful fruit topping. The cranberry-orange, was super-delish and they get major points for that. However, it was sort of cheating cuz it really wasn't bread made into FT by fancy and skilled techniques, it was cake, cooked as FT, so not that impressive in the end. You should try my carrot cake FT.... right? Shrug of my shoulders. Coffee was edible, though I'm a snob. Juice was good. No biggies. My company received her dish, a familiar to her seafood benedict which is her usual out-on-town breakfast order, and I couldn't help but notice her grimly poking at it and tasting-testing the food. She was not feeling safe. I tasted it, it was putrid. PUTRID. There is no way to ever find out if it was the recipe (I doubt it) or if it was the freshness of ingredients (I would be apalled). She very politely explained our taste testing results and the gentleman very politely removed the dish immediately. Not feeling frisky anymore, she asked for the safe bet from my plate - the cran-oj FT. "Pretty-good", she reports, and, "fairly decent". She is not a snob. She would have liked butter. The waitress was very polite and brought over a five dollar bill - the difference between her first dish and replacement dish. Ahem. Better than a kick in the shin, right. But, I don't know, a tricky fish-in-benedict meal that tasted foul.... might be a comp. Am I wrong? She did report a loss of appetite and a queasiness. We waited for an hour, and after that long of a wait, I would have been more comfortable with prices a tick towards reasonable, being served before others sat after my party, safe food, and maybe a fuller gesture towards restitution considering the possibility of foul food.  If there isn't a line - I recommend going at your convenience.
author: Travis L.

description: the french toast sampler was fantastic.  Like everyone else has said, it's a busy place so get there early and get in line.   We went here for breakfast before heading up to Coit tower.  It's a great locals breakfast joint but it's also a nice tourist stop if you're in the area.
author: Paul C.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, I was prepared for the long wait!  I got there around 8:00AM on Sunday and the line was already an hour long.  But it  was well worth the wait.  

I had the Dungeness Crab Benedict and hubby had the french toast sampler.  Both were delicious.  We found ourselves eyeing other people's food for ideas to try for our next visit.  

The servers were efficient and even though the line was at least an hour long until we left at 10:30AM, we didn't feel rushed.
author: D C.

description: This place rocks - awesome food, good portions. Definitely try it out, great place to have breakfast or brunch after a long night out. The wait can get pretty bad though - and there is always a wait.
author: Ossama A.

description: Be prepared for a 20-30 minute line but this place has the best breakfast i've ever had.  Try the crab bennidict.  FYI cash only.
author: rahmin s.

description: There is a shortage of good breakfast in this area, but it is probably because this place is so fantastic it would be hard to compete. Stood in what looked like a long line, but moved very fast.  Sat down and enjoyed a fabulous view of all the fresh ingredients which made it into our meals.  I had the apple yogurt cin french toast with berries.  This was so fantastic.  Tons of fresh berries.  My husband had the omlett with sausage(lots of it!) and peppers and onions.  It was great.  The potatoes were delicious as well as the coffee.  This place has such a cute atmosphere as well. I will definitely go back and will be trying the crab omlett..yum!
author: Jaime C.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! By far one of the best Breakfast/Brunch in town.  The wait is sooo worth it!  Even though the wait ranges from an hour to an hour and 45 minutes and I  must say that I have never gotten in under an hour.  The crab benedict is to die for but you have to go there early or else they will be gone in a flash!  if you're feeling breakfast and after you're all full you can top it off with the 3 pancakes and fresh berries on the top and some powder sugar for dessert and you think pancakes can't be eaten as a dessert! If you're not feeling for breakfast go for the Monte Cristo.  Gosh...I am drooling as I write this review.  I am going to get some next weekend for sure.  I've been away from Mama's way too long =)
author: Kevin L.

description: After hearing so much about this place, I had to try it.  My girlfriend and I waited for at least an hour on Sunday to try this infamous breakfast place on N.B.  While the quality was definitely there, I'm not sure waiting an hour for breakfast is worthwhile. Nevertheless, if you haven't ever tried Mama's, give it a shot. Maybe try to get there a bit earlier to beat the crowd. The place is tiny so the turnover rate is sloooooooooow.  Good luck!
author: Jeannie L.

description: The service is quick, friendly, and cute.  But you have to go on the right time and the right days....weekends are insane.  I give it only three stars b/c i always order omlettes, but  i always end up feeling like it was lacking in some way.  However thier homeade jam on every table can't be beat and thier CRUMB CAKE is to DIE for!
author: Rachel P.

description: Good food - a little pircey. Waaaaarm coffee cake. Does this place need another review telling you that its good? No - I just wanted to say that my co-worker and I went there after an early morning workout and we didn't wait in line at all - BOOYA!!!!!!!!!
author: Mark G.

description:
damn. that wait is long. but do you see the five stars?? yes. it is worth the wait. Had the smoked salmon eggs benedict and the bf had the classic. Our friends enjoyed a short stack, eggs florentine, and northwest omelette. What a greatway to start the day! That was so delicious. Everyone was quiet for a while, enjoying the good eats before raving about how damn tasty everything was! There was homemade ollalaberry (sp?) jam on the table that everyone enjoyed. the bf was ready to drink it out of the jar. the last word? 

yummmmmmmmmmmmm.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
3.5 

went here with friends from out of town .... the food is good, but there are plenty of other great places in the city that don't come with a one hour wait ... had to try this place once, but not sure if I'll ever return .. perhaps I'll leave it to the tourists.

Eggs Florentine: the yolks were overcooked!!! that's unacceptable.

Swedish Cinnamon French Toast: delicious

Banana Nut French Toast: lots of nuts .. tasty if you're into banana nut bread

$ Size Pancakes: fluffy and yummy

Northern Italian Omelette: surprisingly bland

Crab Dungeness Omelette: delicious, no wonder it's ~$20 .. but could they be any skimpier on the crab meat? did we get jipped because it was memorial day weekend and there wasn't enough crab meat to go around? having just eaten at PPQ Dungeness Crab the night before (where a mouth-watering whole crab is $35), I felt like the omelette was a rip-off 

Eggs Benedict with Salmon: a tad salty

Monte Cristo: OMFG (and yes I did say that) ... this blew my mind .. if anything would ever make me want to come back, it would be for this
author: Anvy A.

description: This spot is a little pricey and the meals and sides (that usually would come w/ breakfast meals) are priced separately, so a breakfast for one person could easily be $20. Butttt..I have to admit that the food is pretty damn good, not the best breakfast I've had, but pretty damn good. This is a cash-only account, so be prepared to have cash on you. It can also get packed in here-get here early!
author: Dessa R.

description: The food at this place is DEEEEEEEELICIOUS!!!!!!!!! Got damn!!! so what if i waited in line, THREE TIMES! One to get into the restaurant, one to order, one to sit. The shrimp benedict was awesome! French toast was great! Ooooo...Yes a little pricey , but well worth it!
author: Karen A.

description: So...the bf and I made a 3rd attempt to eat here for brunch.  The 1st and 2nd attempt the lines were ridiculously long!!! It was 2:30p (they close at 3p) there was a rather small line outside but it still took 45 min to finally get seated.  I figured this will probably be my first and last time eating here, so I thought I'd splurge and order the crab omelet with brie $18.95. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, service was good..but the huge line outside weekend after weekend? wtf?? I think the only reason why people have gone here was because the line is always so damn long that passerby's think.."wow that place must be good!!" I mean, it's really not rocket science, yah they bake their own sweet breads so what?
author: Aleli L.

description:
Went to Mama's during a recent business/pleasure trip to SF. I learned about it from the concerierge at the Hilton Financial District, where I was staying.
My girlfriend and I were lucky that we went there for a late breakfast during the week. Otherwise, I hear that it can be very crowded. We stood in line for 5 minutes just to place our order and had to wait an additional 10 minutes for an available table. (We arrived as the last of a small rush. Everyone ahead of us was seated immediately.)
The food was very good and the desserts/pastries were excellent. The only negative was that I when I asked to have my carrot cake microwaved for a few seconds, the cashier (owner??) looked at me like this was the most difficult thing that she had ever heard of and that she couldn't do it because the icing would melt. I wasn't even close to the mood to argue about it so I let it go. (I guess that if you own a really popular restaurant you don't have to worry about customer service. I previously thought that was a NYC thing but I guess that it can happen in SF too!)
I would definitely go again for the food and quaint atmosphere, but I would never wait as long as some as some of the other reviewers have. I mean, come on, it's only breakfast!
author: David F.

description:
Choose your meal time wisely and you shall not suffer the fate of many. Last hour of business is only time to go. 

Scrambled florentine is my favorite. I love coffee, but the coffee at Mama's is not good....oh well. But everything else I've ordered is always plate-licking good.

The staff of Mama's also gets 5 stars for being friendly and attentive.
author: Sam K.

description: Sure my food was cooked right, but was it really worth over an hour wait?! Not in my opinion. Not to be a snob but I've been to better breakfast places with less of a wait. I grant you the prices were a bit higher but I'm willing to pay it to not have to wait more than 10-15 min. in line. I have to say, the man servicing our table was excellent! He came and checked up on us several times, even though the place was packed. I had an omelet and the eggs benedict (don't worry, only ate half of each) and both were really good. Just nothing extraordinary. I thought this place, with its raves and lines, would have something different like creme brulee french toast. That said, the fresh fruit on french toast was beautiful and ripe. Nothing was over or under cooked. No one left unhappy. French linens were a nice touch. Service was unexpectedly great!
author: Sabi M.

description: So amazing...! After reading so many positive yelp review, my bf and I drove 1 hr to try the place on Friday. Have to say, only place people waiting in line to be seated. We waited at least good 20 minutes... I had high hopes for this place.. As recommanded we tried french toast sampler.. Honestly.. it wasn't for us.. only liked the banana nut bread... rest wasn't sure what type of bread it was... The fruits were good.. I had the egg benedict, it was one of the better ones... The service was a bit lacking... To get a glass of water and coffee to sometime.. Not too many around... It was hard to get attention... I get that its open kitchen kind of.. I wonder how santized those cooks behind the stove are? I notice nothing to cover there hair, and open hands.... I am germ freak but I really can't worry about that when I eat.. Which I tried not to.. I am such a breakfast person. I would eat breakfast all meals.. :) The food was goood.. I wouldn't try the sampler but maybe stick with regular french toast...
author: Margaret K.

description: We went around 11AM on weekday to avoid the crowd. Fortunately, there were no lines outside the restaurant (as on weekends), but we did have to wait about 15 minutes inside to get a seat. I can see why the place is so popular. Inside is very cozy and feels homely. Service was prompt and coffee refills were generous. Food is not much different than other American breakfast/brunch places, but the freshness of the ingredients were noticeably better. I had Eggs Benedict and the hollandaise sauce was very good, and the eggs tasted very fresh. It's definitely worth checking out, but probably not if it means standing in line for more than an hour.
author: Min L.

description: So charming inside - well worth the wait. The menu is huge and you can watch the cooks and see the beautiful spread of fruit, pastries, and even smoked salmon while you wait. We got a tip about this place from a cab driver and really felt like it was made just for the locals. The ambience is very cozy and you feel like you're really in Mama's kitchen.
author: Amy J.

description: This is a place that's been on my to do list for a long time so we finally made it here.  I ordered the eggs benedict and it has now become my all time favorite benedict.  My husband ordered the monte cristo and it was great.  We stopped by midweek at about 10:30 and didn't have to wait in line.  Would love to return the next time I have some free time during the week - I won't come back on the weekend though knowing that there is a very long wait.
author: C K.

description: Oh mama!!! The BEST breakfast in the city...if you can brave the line!
author: Sarah D.

description: Sometimes the wait on the weekends is unbearable, but the food is exceptional.  Tasty baked goods and creative egg "Momelettes" - I love the italian sausage one.
author: Max C.

description: No matter if I'm having breakfast, brunch or lunch, the chocolate drizzled coffee cake here is always something I have on the side. It's hard to go wrong with anything here, particularly the smoked salmon scrambles/omelettes. The wait's almost part of what's required to enjoy food here - it makes you want it that much more! I can't think of a better way to kick off a leisurely weekend than strolling out my door to have breakfast here.
author: Marisa L.

description: YUMMY!  Really-this one word says it all....just remember CASH ONLY and there is always a line!  one negative--maybe i'm being picky but--$3.25 for a SMALL (and I do mean small) fruit bowl is a bit much!!
author: Michelle B.

description: Tasty and fresh, overall way better than average.  I wouldn't necessarily wait 2 hours for this if I was hungry, which is what might happen if you show up at the wrong time.  I get the Nelson's Rancheros which are a nice, but basic, version of classic huevos rancheros.  I would suggest going on a weekday if possible, and even then you will have a little wait.
author: Jennie J.

description: Ok Ok Ok....I know there is always a line on the weekends, but hands down, this is the best place for brunch in the city....go hungry!  I went on a friday mornign a few weeks ago, still crowded, but no line.  seriously, the food must be good.
author: Tracy M.

description: Had a great shrimp benedict with some potatoes on the side. The line is ridiculously long and probably not really worth the wait on the weekends. But, I had some friends in town and they appreciated the food. The setup is odd, as you wait outside and then wait inside alongside the kitchen. As you wait inside they gave us a taste of some kind of pastry, which was a nice touch. Then you actually order and pay at the counter before you are seated. Different, but i do think it works...
author: Nicolas H.

description: There were so many rave reviews about Mama's and I finally got to try it last Sunday. I had the prosciutto and tomato eggs benedict with home fries and fresh squeezed orange juice. It was so scrumptious! My best friend (who took me there) had the apple pandore - more for the sweet tooth - also yummy. Mama's definitely lives up to its name and is certainly worth the hour long wait.
author: Iku R.

description: I don't know why I always end up in line at Mama's when I'm hungover from the night before, which makes the hassle of trying to park in North Beach coupled with the long wait in line extra torturous.  Though, once I'm seated with my latte and eggs (anything florentine...scrambled, etc) I am completely in heaven and have forgotten the whole ordeal.  Which is why Mama's gets 5 stars :-)
author: Lisa L.

description: We came here for early breakfast on a rainy morning. The line wasn't too bad. Fortunately we were able to make it in the door while others waited out in the rain. I guess it really is worth the wait. They have a great menu and the omelette I chose was super tasty. The place really needs to be bigger to accomodate the throngs of people that come in to dine. Overall, a good breakfast experience. Just come early.
author: Michelle G.

description:
what a fabulous breakfast. 

so yeah, the whole waiting line deal sucks, but just realize the food is well worth the wait. 

this is one of my favorite destinations for brunch during the work week. you know those days when you don't really want to work, and the office is a little slow, so it's okay to take a long lunch. oh how i heart lunching. 

i've given four stars because michael s. would want me to...i mean, the bathroom is a *huge* part of a review, right? the bathroom needed some tlc. bathrooms should be clean. 'nuf said. 

the food is fantab and the bloody mary action is so delightful. 

superb. brunch.
author: Natalie C.

description:
eggs benedict (with crab) is killer here.  actually everything here is about 2 notches above any other breakfast place.

the sucky part- is the wait and the line is crazy long.
author: Alan N.

description: This is my most favorite breakfast place in SF.  The wait can be annoying but the food is so worth it.  Everything is so fresh and the pastries are staring you down as you approach the register to order ...evil :)
author: Michelle M.

description:
mama's was good.  mama needs a bigger place, though, because it was not good enough to warrant the hour wait.    the bloody mary was decent but i've had better.  

maybe i should have gone a little earlier but who wakes up before 9am on a sunday?  c'mon.
author: Jason S.

description: Worth the wait.  I made good use of the 40 minutes. I stood on line and  decided what to order while salivating over the menu options and other diners foods.  Quite an experience but I couldn't be a regular.  Brunch should be easier and relaxing.
author: Cheryl W.

description:
This is my favorite place to have breakfast. I've tried a variety of food here, but my favorite meal is the Northwest with a cup of hot chocolate. The pancakes here are good too and I'm mentioning this because I don't even like pancakes.

The place is crowded and a bit cramped. What's great is that you can watch the cooks make the food. It's fun and it better guarantees that nothing strange/gross is going on out back.

The downside to Mama's is the wait. I would say that the wait is worth it, but it is almost ridiculously long. Once, I took a photo of how long the line was. Not everyone fit.
author: Aileen P.

description: Breakfast beats dinner and lunch even though I can barely get my ass up for it. I love Mama's. I went there around 2ish and there was no line. I ordered the Monte Cristo, YUM! The homemade jam to dip the egg battered fried mini sandwich is to die for....
author: Anna S.

description: I want to give it five stars but that line you have to go through is killing. The breakfast is good here. Their eggs benedict was so goosd as well as the eggs florentine. One of the best breakfast places in SF.
author: Ghiz S.

description: Yo Dude, Mama's got it going on fo' sho!  Seriously though, totally worth the wait.  The food is great and once you get inside, the service is pretty quick.  Mama is my role model.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Great service and food!  There were 9 of us and were able to sit next to each other which was great.  The food came promptly and the portions were just right.   I wish we had more places like this in Los Angeles.
author: Epiphanie D.

description: The Swedish cinnamon french toast at Mama's is incredible! Super soft cinnamon roll bread, perfectly cooked, and topped with whipped butter. Yummy! Even on a weekday there's a wait, but that's OK since it gives you plenty of time to decide, which isn't easy. The menu has an incredible selection of different egg dishes, tons of different french toasts, and a bunch of different sandwiches. Definitely an awesome spot for brunch!
author: Will A.

description:
monte cristo!!!!!!!!
sooo yummy & sooo clever!!!
i took one bite and fell in love. it was the perfect combination.
the o.j. was great but small so order the large. 
the eggs benedict was made perfectly. 
we went on a fri. around 11 and there was a short line. i dont know if id come here on a weekend, it'd take forever to get seated. but i guess the food is worth the wait. mama's is a must!!!
author: emily p.

description: Their food is AWESOME...try their eggs Benedict and French toast with fresh fruit.... Yummy!
author: Maria E.

description: Great location, friendly atmosphere, decent food. I didn't really mind the wait since I had company. I ordered the crab eggs benedict. 16 bucks, but for the amount of crab you end up with it seems fair. I didn't love it though. Staff was really nice, when I, like a moron forgot to order my eggs scrambled and not poached. The server nicely took my plate and a new one came out within minutes. (The poached eggs looked just like the ones on TV, perfect). Really good coffee and when you ask for cream they give you milk, just like I would make it at home.
author: Jocelyn F.

description: Great food but not worth an hour wait since there are so many other excellent breakfast spots in San Francisco.
author: L M.

description: The long line always made me think Mama's was one of the best places in San Francisco to have breakfast. I went on a Tuesday - and still had to wait 30 minutes in line. I had a cheese omelet (very good, with a good amount of cheese) and hot chocolate (too sweet). Staff wasn't that nice and tipped themselves too much. Not curious about it anymore and probably I won't go back ever again.
author: Augusto A.

description: I LOVE Mama's and have been here many times.  It's well worth the wait to get in, but if you go mid-week you can actually walk right in the door some days.  I've tried just about everything on the menu and all are delicious.  However, my very favorite is their Monte Cristo so this what I usually order.
author: Nancy C.

description: I think that this is the best place to go in the city for breakfast.  I first tried it on a weeday and had a geat omelet.  I had to go back on a weekend for the brunch, where the offerings include Eggs Benedict with shrimp or crabmeat.  Both times that I've gone, it's been crowded.  The business speaks for itself.  It's well worth the wait.
author: Dianne T.

description: went there right before it opened on a thursday morning and there was still a little line.  didn't have to wait too long before we got in and ordered.  food was good (pastrys are awesome, my corned beef benedict was good as well).  cute little breakfast place but you def need to get there early!
author: Sara H.

description: Yummy food and a fun spot for brunch, but, in my opinion, it's not really worth the wait.
author: Lily K.

description: Food & Service amazing. Wait sucked. Best Monte Cristo. Best mimosa. Period. Worth the wait.
author: Tara O.

description: wait was horrendous, looks like choices in SF are somewhat limited, that being said, the brunch was good, ingredients fresh, etc.  but the wait really brings it down in ratings, I'm sure there's better.
author: Monster E.
