description: in theory everything on the menu sounds great, but i was somewhat disappointed with the actual food.  the french toast dishes are extremely rich and heavy and it was very hard to eat much of the Pan Dore that i ordered.   the richness of the butter was overwhelming and it upset my stomach.  the french toast sampler was pretty good, but the banana bread was pretty dry and dense.  i also ordered a piece of the cinnamon walnut and sour cream cake for the road which was extremely dry.  i feel like a leper going against this place, but my experience seems to disagree with much of the reviews.
author: arielle n.

description: really great breakfast/brunch place - great food, nice location, welcoming interior. the dungeoness crab benedict was fabulous and the monte cristo was really good as well. the french toast sampler was a little overrated, but also tasty. the downside is the prohibitively long wait on weekends.
author: lois j.

description: A friend told me I absolutely had to come here... so I did. It was pretty good, super crowded, but pretty worth it. Everything sounded delicious, I ended up with the french toast. Everyone was happy!
author: Hope W.

description:
My bf lives in the neighborhood and, being a huge fan of breakfast time, we're always up to see the long line around Mama's. Of course, we always wanted to try it so finally one day we decided we'd wait in the line. We were some of the first people in that morning so thw wait wasn't SO bad, but definitely not worth it. I dont know if going to Mama's is like, a touristy thing to do or something (i recently moved to SF so not sure about all of the "must do" things around the city) but it's actually not that great. I understand if you've heard of it a bunch and that is why you choose to go, but for a good breakfast it would not be high on my list. 

The food was mediocre and there are so many other delicious places nearby that don't have lines like Cafe Dellucchi, Cafe Divine and Curly's. All within walking distance from Mama's. The food at those places is equally good and filling, as well as similar in pricing, just without the wait. 

Overall verdict: avoid Mama's. It's not worth the wait when so much goodness is right around the corner.
author: Sarah I.

description: If you are hungover, if you arent hungover, get your butt down to this place and pig out! In my opinion, there is no better place in the city for brunch. They offer a wide range of food from french toast with jam, to crab to salmon to whatever you can imagine! There usually are lines to get in so be prepared.
author: Not M.

description: Great breakfast and just a short cab ride or a 10-minute walk from the financial district
author: Nellie L.

description: very good, I love their little mini pancakes..very tasty. They bake their own bread - yummy. Weekends are busy there, be prepared to be in line for long time :)
author: ji k.

description: I may be biased because it's only 2 blocks away, but this place has the best breakfast in the city.  The only problem is that you would be out of your mind to show up at conventional breakfast times on the weekends - the line averages 20-30 minutes, and involves standing out on the sidewalk.  The food overcomes this; the benedicts and omlettes are unbelievable (get crab in either), and all of their baked goods are great.  Cash only, and go during the week or later in the day on the weekends.
author: Matt O.

description: And I don't even like breakfast. I brought an out-of-towner here who was totally skeptical of my raving (especially when we had to wait ....for a while), but after changing his mind on his order 6 times (because everything looked so good -- don't laugh, because this too will happen to you) when we were finally the next in line to order, he says to me "ok, now I'm just really excited". So I win. This place rocks. Highly recomend the coffee cake 1) becuase it's so damn good and 2) becuase after standing in line for 45+ minutes you are tired and famished and this comes immediatly before the other food.
author: Lindsey B.

description: I've never been disappointed. True, the wait is long, but the food is incredibly fresh. The fresh squeezed juices are great and don't go without trying the baked goods. The carrot cake is incredible. Also, they make their own jam which is provided on every table so make sure to give it a whirl. Yum! Cyrus the manager is a real gentleman.
author: Mike B.

description: The absolute BEST place to have brunch in San Francisco. It's a long wait to be seated, but it's totally worth it. I've seen celebrities waiting in line so its always fun to see who's gonna be at Mama's. The peopel who work at Mama's are so nice, its the perfect place to get your weekend started.
author: Kim N.

description: Breakfast is really good here, but I must say that there are other places in the city where you don't have to wait an hour in line to eat a mega delicious waffle.  But I give 5 stars because anyone who's ever been to San Francisco should experience eating at this infamous cafe!
author: Keika L.

description: get someone to stand in line for you, that's what I do. A friend saw an old guy pass out in line as well. I wish they would expand and/or there were more good breakfast places in North Beach! To the restranteurs: start more eateries for breakfast in North Beach! I have guiltily left line and eaten a fine meal at Cafe Divine on the other corner of Wash Park.
author: Anna B.

description: Excellent food and I am typically not a breakfast/brunch person.  Good portions.  Their Eggs Benedict is superb!!!   The place is great for people watching.  The only drawback would be the incredibly long lines on the weekends.
author: Animal K.

description: i literally live right down the block from this place.  there's always been a line.  ALWAYS!!!!  the food is excellent and it's right across from a nice park.  i just wonder if most of these ppl are repeat customers or just tourists who are just visitings. hmm....  but overall... i don't think i would wanna wait in line.  maybe it's because i live soooo close to it. :P hehe.
author: jay c.

description: Best Frikkin place to get breakfast...kickin omelettes, awesome coffee cake, bread, pancakes, everything here is good...lines are long, but it's worth it
author: Joel V.

description:
I used to frequent Mama's once a week, at the height of my obsession I even drove 15 minutes just to grab take out (which they only do on weekends). I would love to have my weekend brunch here every Sunday morning, but the line has become so ridiculous. Even when it's raining- you'd think people wouldn't bear it, but Mama fans do.

The food is amazing though. In my opinion there isn't another place in SF that I've been to that can beat breakfast at Mama's. Their selection of homemade breads is tempting (and I don't even really like bread). My favorite dish to order is the eggs benedict and the pancakes with seasonal berries, with a glass of their fresh squeezed orange juice. 

Mama's is definitely homestyle, from their mismatch tables and chairs, to the floral wallpaper. You'll feel like your at grandma's white picket fence house. Oh and does anyone think the host guy looks like Eric Estrada from Chips?
author: Samantha F.

description:
The breakfast is fantastic.  Beautiful omelettes.  Wonderful selection of French Toasts.  Potatoes are delicious.  Everything is made to perfection.

The line?  The line is insane.  I don't know about you, but when I'm hungry on a weekend morning, I have neither the patience nor the stamina to stand in line for hours.  If I go, I go shortly before closing time when the line is generally more tolerable.

And of course like so many other SF restaurants, they only take cash.  When your restaurant is this popular, I suppose you can do whatever you want, but I still hate cash only!
author: t l.

description: Im not a breakfast person and the wait here is about an hour or so most days. But the food is fantastic and worth the cost and wait. Servers are really nice and the owner is a doll! And you know what the likely hood of you being able to finish your semi expensive breakfast is not great cuz youre just too stuffed but trust me youll try!
author: Farrah S.

description: Oh Mama.  What a cruel mama you are.  What a vicious and tempestuous mama you are!  As if waiting thirty agonizing minutes wasn't enough, you further torture us by putting a huge window between us and your patrons.  Thereby, forcing us to watch in agony and ecstasy as they ate eggs benedict and pancakes.  All we could do was dream that sometime soon their yolk would be our yolk.  Their bacon would be our bacon.  I made like a pigeon and banged my face into the window startling the customers.  My girlfriend had to revive me on the pavement by splashing maple syrup in my face.  And mama, what heavenly maple syrup you have.  I can't wait to be tortured by you again.
author: Joshua B.

description: Perhaps the food is soooo good here b/c the wait is so terribly long! Everything is delicious, especially the Monte Cristo, omelettes, french toast, but especially the fresh squeezed orange juice. They don't take reservations and cash only. If you live in SF, you MUST go here at least once.
author: Betty H.

description: Don't believe the hype. Breakfast was incredibly mediocre, even if you have an hour to kill, save your time & money and pass. An hour wait outside, so by the time you're in the actual restaurant, you order and wait another 15 minutes for a table and then finally one last wait; usually an additional 20 minutes or so, & at that point anything on a plate that resembles breakfast would taste like the next best thing to sliced bread.
author: James G.

description: It's hard to review Mama's, you come here with big expectations (come on 400 reviews, 4.5 stars) and it's easy to feel it;s a little bit too much. Nevertheless the food is good (brunch menu, meaning eggs Benedict, toasts and omelette's), the service is nice and the line is eternal
author: Alex A.

description: Doesn't get much better then this for breakfast.  Well worth the hour long wait for the #2 specia of the day... a crab, avaocado, brie omelette  with a side of potatoes.  Coffee was good.  Would love to go back again on a weekday, hopefully without the long wait.  Thanks Mama!!!
author: Bob F.

description: The wait was about 20 minutes but after getting inside and tasting the food it was definitely worth it...This place definitely knows how to make a good breakfast meal. The orange juice was fresh squeezed...I had eggs with cheese along with pancakes and ham. This is definitely a place I would go back to. It seems like the food was prepared with the freshest ingredients.
author: Shawn M.

description:
I'm not much of a morning person nor a breakfast person (okay, I love Mcd's breakfast... don't judge), but seriously I'd wake up for Mama's anytime. Mama's serves the warmest, tastiest, and most comforting breakfast food. 

My friends and I arrived a little earlier than 8:00am and there already was a line. No big deal though because we were expecting it. When it was our turn to enter, I noticed that the place was tiny, which was bad and good, bad because that accounted for the line and wait, but good because I was wrapped in the mouthwatering aroma of good food like I was still wrapped up in my Snuggie (again, don't judge). 

So we continued to wait in line, while deciding on what to have. The four of us ended up getting a LOT of food: the Northern Italian M'omelette, 2 French Toast samplers, the Chocolate French Toast, the Monte Cristo, and the Silver Dollar Pancakes. We didn't think it was too much until our register guy commented, "Wow you all must be hungry because that's a LOT of food." I guess we were all just super excited. My favorites were the Monte Cristo, and the Cinnamon french toast and Banana Nut french toast from the Sampler. The Monte Cristo was *cue angels' orchestra music* amaaazing. It was perfect--cheesy, savory, and the jam added a kick of sweetness. The homemade jam was really really good. The French Toast sampler was good to try out some of their different flavors, but I ended up only really liking two. But all of them were soft, but chewy enough, moist, sweet, and delectable. YUM. The other dishes we ordered weren't as mind-boggling delicious, but still made for good choices. All in all, I really liked Mama's and would recommend anyone to try it.

Whoever said breakfast was the most important meal of the day for sure had Mama's that morning.
author: Phoi B.

description: I will admit that I was a tourist but after multiple researched reviews decided to try Mama's for breakfast. Showed up late in the morning but only had to wait approx 35-40 minutes (Wed though). Ordered the French Toast sampler -- amazing!! Well worth the wait. The service was great, friendly, and fast. Well worth the wait.
author: Robert P.

description: Mama's is OKay but if I want to by pass the line I just drive to San Rafael Pier 15 ;-) It owned by the same people...  guy and has just as good of B-fast... Curly's is always a good breakfast in North Beach SF.. Quick not usually packed and consistent that's what breakfast is consistency..
author: INzane Z.

description: Just like with people, restaurant first impressions matter. Mamas is what you expect it to be.  Warm, cozy, inviting, and bright.   If you're like me and can eat breakfast/brunch food anytime, anyplace then walk, scooter, bike, Segway (v., Vespa (v.), hop, or skip your way to Mamas.  I think when the taxi dropped me off I literally let out a gasp when I saw the line.  But don't be discouraged!  Besides what are those smart phones for anyway.  You could even bring a book (Wind Up Bird Chronicle for me).  Yes, imagine that a book.  Like a previous reviewer stated, it's irritating waiting in line then to make it inside to find another mini line to order.  Luckily you have glass windows to drool over the display of pastries and breads. I had the eggs benedict and my lovely company had the monte cristo.  Both were fresh and delicious.  I  especially enjoyed the well-seasoned potatoes.  I will and must go back to try their french toast and pastries.
author: Mary Y.

description: It's tiny, yes there is a long line but if you like to eat A LOT then this is the place for you!!  It is nothing fancy what so ever, it is just home-style food.  You order, you eat, you go.  Its a wam, bam and out kind of place.  It fits the saying; Go hungry leave happy.  (fyi-Coffee is BLACK)
author: M B.

description: Went to Mama's with a couple of friends on a Sunday. When you see a line stretching outside a restaurant door its usually a good indication of the quality of food served. We did have to stay in line 2 hrs before we got a chance to enter. However once we did, the food we received was absolutely delicious. If you aren't sure what to get, do get the French Toast sampler. Then again in case you don't want to try them all just go for the Cinnamon French Toast and try it with both jam and maple syrup! At the end of the day no matter what you get from here its bound to be extra delicious.
author: Bentley V.

description:
I'd heard of the hype ... it was time to do something about it and I'm glad that I did. Over Memorial Day weekend we (me, wife, daughter [age 8]) went to Mama's on Saturday and Sunday.

You've read it a million times - believe it! There will be a line. Both days we got there at 7:45 (it opens at 8) and were at least 15-20 people deep in the line. At 8 the door opens about the first 10-12 people are let in the door, where you immediately wait in line again because you order at the counter. As the counter line decreases they let more people in from outside. Of course, if after ordering at the counter there are no tables then you will wait again. Yes, that's right, three lines.

The crowd is a nice mix of locals and tourists (given how much SFO gouges tourists for the hotel tax the tourists ought to get a priority line), young and old, families and singles, couples and friends. Other than a few hungry kids there was virtually no grumbling about the line. We expected it so we didn't mind.

There is not convenient street parking right in front of the restaurant - this is freaking North Beach. Good luck finding parking. We enjoyed our walk from our hotel (Fairmont on Nob Hill). The smart move is to drop someone off to reserve a place in line while you go find a place to park.

This place does not take credit cards or (I think) checks. You've been warned - bring cash!

This place is not cheap, so bring lots of cash. We paid $50 including tip each time (and one of us is only 8 years old). The only reason this place doesn't rate five stars is because the value wasn't there for me.

Plenty has been said about the food so I really don't have anything to add. Suffice to say that we thought it was so good we ate there on back-to-back mornings. What often isn't discussed is the service - it was fantastic. Every server was friendly and efficient. Our waiter from the first day (I wish I knew his name - fantastic service!) recognized us and gave us a very cheery greeting. He remembered that my wife ordered ice tea the previous day so when we were seated there was already an ice tea waiting for her. I just said it but I want to repeat it - the service was outstanding. If I didn't live so far away I would definitely become a regular.

For those who like Mama's you might want to try San Diego's version. It is Kono's - located at the base of Crystal Pier in PB. It is my favorite place to eat breakfast and has many things in common with Mama's: 1) Only open for breakfast and lunch; 2) Cash only; 3) Order at the counter and food is brought to your table; 4) Restaurant isn't very large, but it is bigger than Mama's; 5) Not a huge menu; prefers to focus on doing a smaller number of things very well; 6) Lines, lines, lines!!!!!

Just go to Mama's and see for yourself - you will want to come back again.
author: David J.

description: This may be the best breakfast I ever had!  The small line out front is beyond worth it and the atmosphere is as yummy as the food. We had made plans for a great lunch in Union Square but had to cancel it since breakfast was just so delicious and filling. This is a must go to place in the city!!!
author: Jason L.

description: I've been going to Mama's since '97 and tried many of the other breakfast places in the city, and always return to Mama's after being disappointed with the other places. Mama's is head and shoulders above anywhere else in the city for breakfast. Ingredients are top notch and everything is really, really good. You can't go wrong no matter what you order. It helps that everyone there, except for the wait staff, has been there for years and years. Yes, the line is usually way too long, and it's on the expensive side, but it's worth it.
author: Bruce C.

description: What a great place for brunch, lunch whatever!  When I had a weird job my friend and I would go here on a Monday at 3pm for the best egg plates that satisfy at any time of day.  They serve everything all the time as far as I know.  Weekend can be a big difficult with the line going out the door- but loyal patrons seem to know that you eat and don't dwadle at your table because there are people waiting.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: If there wasn't a line of out of towners snaking around the block every weekend, I *might* come here for breakfast in my 'hood. I went once mid-week and the food is good, but not great. I say leave it to the folks from the Marriott and Sheraton in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: jane t.

description:
just ate here the yesterday. loved it! the place is small but very cute. instead of being seated and  then ordering they asked to order first...at the counter!!! the cool part about this is you have a little time to read the expansive menu and look at what's cooking behind the counter before you order. we went with the french toast and eggs benedict (traditional). we also ordered one plain and one blueberrry sourcream coffee cakes and fresh squeezed oj. 

the oj was awesome! of the two coffee cakes we decided that the plain was better...especially the top, but only because the blueberry, which was also yummy, was a bit more dense than what we were looking for.

the french toast and eggs were delicious. there was a little kick to the eggs and that made them even more tasty.

if we hadn't ventured to another breakfast spot this morning we would have definitely gone back and plan to in the future!

mamas is definitely worth a visit!!!!
author: Rick Y.

description:
it. is. just. so. good.

cali omelette = bomb.
coffee cake = crumbly delicious.
carrot cake = i don't even like carrot cake and it was so yums.

wait shmait.  it's worth it.
author: Adela K.

description: I think the only downside is the wait time, but on a weekday morning it wasn't too bad. I've heard it can be a line down the block. The food was great aside from my spinach not being chopped up in the omelet, but maybe that's just my weird thing. The aesthetic is great as well, how all the food is set up. I also like the chocolate crumbly thing. I don't know what they're called, but they are good. Don't tell my clients I ate the chocolate crumbly thing. It's good.
author: Jordan V.

description:
this yelp review is dedicated to the cigarette i smoked after i ate at mama's cafe.

dear parliament,
the moment i lit you, i was filled to the brim with a beautiful afternoon breakfast. both me and my love one had taken some time off our busy friday to eat at mama's. it was a beautiful day outside. we sat next to the door, and every bite i took of my delicious poached egg salmon thingy, i couldn't wait to go out there and smoke you. i tasted my boyfriend's monte kristo and it was to die for. i wish i had ordered that instead. i realized i wasn't eating pork or beef and just made a no-no by taking a bite of it, but it was worth it. i quickly took a giant sip of my watered down bloody mary to apologize to my body for breaking the rules. 

in comes the check, and we pay with cash. i rush outside and pull out my box of cigarettes and carefully select you outta about 10 that are left. pull out my pink bic lighter, ignoring the disgusted look on my boyfriend's face and flick 3 times to finally light you on this breezy sunny friday in the city. magical. 

i know you are killing me softly and slowly, but we are all going to die one day. and you are the only thing in my life that has never let me down. in good times and bad. (unlike my ex husband who promised me that). so i thank you much by smoking you down to the filter.

love,
ieannac
author: Renae C.

description:
Ok, so breakfast is my favorite meal. I love going out to breakfast. I'd been hearing great things about Mamas for, like, ever. many, many mornings I had walked by the long line of people eagerly awaiting a meal inside. Finally, I decided that it was time to give it a shot. I woke up early and made it to mamas slightly after they opened (they open at 8). My wait in line was brief, but longer than I expected it to be at 8:10 am.
once inside, I got to wait in another line to order. after ordering and paying the woman at the register told us to "wait right here" to be seated. all the tables were full and we had to wait for someone to leave. (which was awkward because there is no room inside for standing around). we finally got to sit at a table and were served our drink orders. the lattes were decent. Not great, but not bad.  Our food arrived after a not long wait. it was ok. not great, but not bad. Certainly not worth getting up early, waiting in two lines and paying $30 for two people.
author: Valerie G.

description: Excellent food.........charming little restaurant..........great area..........There is a line out front pretty often.......but one of the best breakfast places around.
author: tom h.

description:
if you've been...you know.  

friends were visiting from Germany (they used to live here) so we made to sure to pay a visit.  our wait was longer than usual, but then we remembered we used to get up early to go.  we didn't get there til after 9am so we had to enjoy the sidewalk for awhile.

this time around I had dollar size pancakes with berries and a side of bacon.  mmmmmm bacon
author: Mabelle A.

description: A great place to take yo mama.  Unless she would have a huge problem waiting in a line outside.  It is well worth the wait if you ask me.  French toast is killer and the Benedict's are to die for.
author: S M.

description:
Breakfast at Mama's is absolutely scrumptious... worth waiting in the 1/2 hour line outside to get into the 15 minute line inside... 

The blueberry coffee cake was crumbly, moist, perfect. Also enjoyed mama's smoothie, the eggs benedict, and a salty side of bacon.

The restaurant is laid back, homey, and warm. All around excellent.
author: Aden P.

description: Best breakfast in SF... yes, you have to wait in line for a long time but it's worth the wait.. I guess since it's in all the tourist books, people visiting like me all want to check out this place... but, it's great spot for Breakfast.    I love the OJ, Coffee, shrimp & grilled tomato benedict, French toast.. It's a must when you are in the bay area.
author: Michael J.

description: Once again, well worth the 1hr 30min wait from arrival to Mama's to arrival of food in front of me. We had to bring my mom over to this place since she loves brunch. She ordered the Dungeness Crab Omelet, my bf got the Monte Cristo, and i got the Apple Pan Dore (french bread french toast). Everything was amazing melt in your mouth. Especially the monte cristo. It's so a must you have to try it. Seriously. I ate half of my bf's cuz I couldn't get enough. It comes with some type of berry jam and when the sando is dipped it's perfection. The bloody mary's are actually pretty good too.
author: A S.

description: Mama's is a must for breakfast if you're visiting San Francisco for the first time; or your hungry for a delicious breakfast.  Get there early as a line forms quickly.  But don't be deterred, you won't be disappointed.  I had the Swiss Cinnamon French toast with fresh berries and a side of bacon.  "Best French toast ever!". This is the most unique breakfast place I've ever been to; a one of a kind.
author: Brian M.

description: One and half hours that I will never get back.  Oh, let's skip that wonderful breakfast at Bette's Oceanview Diner for Mama's.  Waiting in line, a neighborhood person walks by - "why bother"?  There are many other good breakfast places nearby because this place is not that great.  She was right - it is really not.  Their presentation makes you think it is - the potatoes tasted like Chinese food - from the oil probably - the eggs were just eh - toast was hard and dry (baguette) - nothing special to wait 1 and 1/2 hours for believe me!  Everyone in line was raving but they just must not know well-cooked breakfast.  I asked for crispy bacon - it was limp and anything but crispy!!  Get some pizza focaccia from across the street and be happy.  The cooks were eating as they were cooking - handling everything with their hands - no gloves - then eating some more - it was really more gross than good.  Think twice before spending your whole morning waiting for this meal!!!
author: Julie B.

description: Went here a few weekends ago because I'd heard all the hype and just had to try it. We got there at 8:15 a.m. on a Saturday - it opens at 8 a.m., and there was already a line around the block! We waited in line for about 45 minutes in the freezing cold, but luckily warmed up after drinking a to-go cup of coffee from a nearby cafe. As we waited in line inside to order, we just ooohed and aaaahed over the delicious pastries, fresh fruit and amazing-looking food! We ordered the French toast sampler...incredible. They give you cinnamon, banana-blueberry and banana-walnut French toast topped with fresh fruit & a side of maple syrup. Try putting their homemade raspberry preserves on the french toast - delicious! We were seated at a table right in the center of the restaurant, which was nice since we got to look around at everything. I would go back since the food was so great, but I'd probably get there at 7:45 a.m. before it opens to avoid the line.
author: Keira A.

description: OK- this is the place about 3 years ago that blew me away about breakfast. They took breakfast to a level that I didn't know existed. Mama's set the bar. Well I went back this weekend. It could be the economy, not sure but the crab omelet wasn't as good. Less crab, to much avocado, no sour cream. The magic was gone. The jelly is still great, but I need more than jelly to get me to that special place. Ill be back, but hope they were having an off day.
author: Veronica B.

description:
been here twice and the wait was still an hour.  it's good, but dont know about waiting for an hour.  on top of that, parking in north beach is always atrocious.  

but the food is very solid.  had the crab benedict and french toast sampler this time around and boy was it good.  the benedict had the most perfectly poached eggs and tons of dungeness crab.  the  don't know but their potatoes are always perfectly seasoned and crispy.   also had the mama's punch which is basically their version of sangria. 

would go more often if the wait didn't suck, but there's a reason why people are in line right?
author: shar d.

description: What a lovely brunch. I enjoyed the Pan Dore, and some of my husband's Nelson's Rancheros. The line is long, the food is delicious, and the carrot cake can be ordered to go. Show up early and enjoy one of the loveliest brunches in the city.
author: E J.

description: A really neat experience.  My fiancee and I were the last ones to get a table in the first wave.  It was soo exciting to wait and see if we were going to make it.  Overall the food was wonderful although a bit pricey.  A must taste in San Fran
author: Keith D.

description: I kinda hate giving anything 5 stars because it implies it can't be better, but Mamas really did impress me. We went on a Sunday morning at around 9 and had to wait an hour in line to get in.  It was fun, we ended up talking to people around us and the time went quickly. You order at a counter and then you get seated. I took the recommendation of others on Yelp and ordered the French Toast Sampler. My wife got the Salmon Benedict. The servers are great, they keep your coffee cup filled and a smile on your face while you are waiting. Mine recommended putting the homemade berry jam on the french toast that was already smothered in fresh fruit (mostly strawberries and bannanas). What a great recommendation. The sampler was to die for, especially the cranberry orange piece. Equally good or possibly better ( I can't believe I'm saying that the french toast is so good) was the Salmon Benedict. I just wrote in another review that I don't normally like salmon, I think I'm gonna have to rethink that position. Anyway the food was really good. The line is ridiculous. I went again during the week and walked right in. I had the chorizo benedict, it was really good as well but I was sorry I didn't get the Salmon or the French toast once again.
author: Mark A.

description:
Mama's has amazing breakfast!

I've only been there a few times and each time I've had to wait, but it really is as great as everyone says and totally worth it. The staff is so friendly and you can't help but get into a good mood once you're inside. =) 

My fave: their classic eggs benedict
author: C L.

description: The food is superb. But the wait can be tedious. Don't arrive too late on a Sunday!
author: Roelof B.

description:
OMG!!!  This was the best breakfast I have ever had.  The BEST!

Me and my party got there at 8am on a Friday sharp to avoid the long lines.  Took the advice of the very friendly chef about what to order.  Sat down and waited for the grub,  The waitress was incredibly bubbly and cheerfully brought all of our plates out.  We had a variety of items from fluffy pancakes to eggs benedict.  There was also this wierd apple dish that was out of this world. 

I can not say enough good things about this place.  It was simply awesome.  

Thanks for the temporary big belly Mama!!!
author: James B.

description: One of the few good breakfast places in the city, that don't have you waiting in line just to be seated. The food here is excellent, the bread baked fresh and the assortment of jams homemade. The pancakes to die for and the french toasts just simply out of this world. Whatelse can I say you simply gotta try it out for yourself..... We will return.
author: Raj K.

description: The breakfast is amazing here! Everything is fresh and just so damn tasty! Biggest problem - the wait. Honestly, I am not an early riser so this place is not high on my list when I am really hungry. Too bad they can't expand or something. The crab omlette and the french toast are out of this world. Just be prepared for a long wait.
author: M O.

description: Very good. Very very good! However, no breakfast is worth over an hour wait. If you dont get there early, dont bother going to Mama's. Its no secret to anyone that Mama's has some of the best breakfast in the city
author: Chris P.

description: I wanted to give Mama's 5 stars but due to the fact that it's a cash only joint and I only carry plastic it's getting 4.  If you can get past the fact that you have to stop at the ATM and you have to stand in a 45 minute line with tourists you will see why Mama's has such a high rating. Monte Cristo - Delish! Pancakes with a ****load of berries - OMG! So far everything I have tried has been fantastic and fresh.
author: Panda A.

description: 1 star ding for not taking cc's and the typical wait. Even for a tuesday at 11 am, the 45 minute out- the- door wait was excrutiating but mmm, mmm,mmm love their eggs benedict with spinach, tomato, and avocado. Their freshly squeezed OJ is amazing so don't forget to complete your breakfast with that as well.
author: christine t.

description:
OMG!!!  This is my favorite breakfast place in the whole world!

There's a reason there's a line out the door EVERY DAY of the year that it is open.  It doesn't get much better than Mama's when it comes to breakfast food.

Since I don't live in San Francisco anymore I only get to eat there when I visit and I always try to fit it into my schedule.  That being said I always get the Monte Cristo.  Mmmmmm, Yummmy!  Add in a little fresh OJ, and throw in some coffee and one of those Cinnamon thingies that make your mouth water as you are waiting in line trying to decide what you want, and POOF!  Pure food pleasure.
author: Alexander R.

description: What an experience! I had friends who had gone here before and when I saw their pictures, I knew I had to bring my friend from out of town here. We waited in line for an hour under the sun but it was totally worth it. The restaurant is small, cozy, and has a real old-fashioned homey feel. The cool thing is that you pay for your food first and you get to see the chefs at their best. Once you are seated, you get your food pretty quickly and it's delicious!!! Party in your mouth guaranteed =)
author: Rosa K.

description: To begin, I have a simple statement to make first. Worth the wait. Now, on to the review! Mama's was introduced to me by my wonderful gf. This place has an amazing breakfast/brunch menu. Our personal favorite ever since we've went there was the Monte Cristo. Funny thing is, we actually watched the movie The Count of the Monte Cristo before we even came here! And I was like, I gotta order that! At first, I didn't even look at what was in it and when I read the description I was thinking, "Wait, what? Egg covered toast, cheese, turkey, ham, and HOME MADE BERRY JAM ALL TOGETHER?!?! Are they crazy? or have one of my many dreams finally come true?!" So when we got it, I was just staring at it like, "Wow, this really exists!" *NOM NOM NOM* AAAAAAAAAAA-FREAKIN-MAZING!!!! If I may quote from a great show, The Office: "It tastes so good in my mouth." "That's what she said." Because's that's EXACTLY WHAT MAMA said! Must try if you live or are going to visit SF!! I don't believe I'll ever get tired of ordering the Monte Cristo every time I decide to go to Mama's because that is just how much of a "Must-have" it really is!!
author: Elton N.

description: I heard about this place from some friends so I decided to try it out but I could never find the right time. However, my friend and I came here on an early weekday hoping to avoid the monstrous wait that a lot of people are familiar with. I woke up at 6:30 in the AM to get to the restaurant before it even opened. I never wake up this early, not even for school so you can see how determined I was to eat at this restaurant. We got there at exactly 8AM and there was a wait! It was a frickin' cold morning and I was extremely irritable from waking up so early and when you pair that with the cold weather, I was like RAWR! After half and hour, I finally got to order my chocolate cinnamon french toast while my friend ordered the Californian omelette. We were seated near the door which was unfortunate because whenever someone would leave or enter the restaurant, we would be the ones to feel the cold wind. When the food came I was in a grumpy mood, but with one taste of my french toast, I perked up. I love french toast. I love chocolate. The combination of the two almost killed me. I really liked it and when my friend asked to try some, I wanted to stab her with my knife. However, we decided that we would trade dishes. The omelette was tasty, but I loved my french toast. Apparently she liked it too because she asked our waitress for more chocolate sauce for the french toast. We even struck up a conversation with some french tourists who were seated next to us. This experience was awesome, but having to wait in the cold drove me crazy therefore a star was knocked off.
author: Lauren L.

description: Where else can you get an omelette with a fist size pile of fresh lump crab meat? Absolutley everything we got there was amazing. The line is nothing to cry about. Go across the street and get fresh, warm focaccia and eat it in line while you hang with cool foolks. So, you're a glutton for the morning, walk it off.
author: Ben L.

description: Totally worth the wait!  They were so accommodating to my 6 month old son and our stroller.  They brought him a bowl of avocado to munch on and have some sort of stroller valet.  :o) Just thinking about Mama's makes my mouth water.  You won't be disappointed, no matter what you order.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Well worth the wait. if you're traveling to San Fran this is a must eat place. The food is great and the service is exceptional. Get there early as the wait gets longer and longer as the morning progresses. While your waiting, cross the street and get some of the foccacia at the litlle bakery. It's a great snack for the rest of the day.
author: Allan H.

description: have to get here early if you dont want to wait. i arrived at 830ish and waited 30 min to get a table (not bad). well priced, delicious food. customer service was an A+++ :) I like the fresh fruit with the meals. Buttermilk pancakes, cinnamon french toast, and veggie omelette and potatoes were great :)
author: jenn h.

description:
The lines here are huge...going way down the sidewalk.

But for good reason. The food is GREAT.

So, if you don't mind waiting, you'll be in for a great meal.
author: Nicole R.

description: Mama's is one of my favorite breakfast/brunch places in the city. Remember to bring some cash cuz they dont take credit cards.  Parking can be difficult on a weekend....waiting can take about 45 to an hour, but its worth it! While you wait in line for a seat, theres pre ordering and you can also watch the chefs at work . I would do the pancakes, bacon, and omelettes.....OJ too!
author: stephanie n.

description: Only place I don't mind standing 8 blocks in line for. The Monte' Cristos are the best i've ever eaten. And whatever jam it is they use is mouth watering.  The servers are always attentive and forever smiling. Great atmosphere. A true San Francisco treat!
author: Jonathan R.

description: When I first went to Mama's and saw the line outside the restaurant, I was wondering if the wait would be worth it. Turns out - it totally was. For two people at around noon on a Sunday, it took 1 hr to get seated. Luckily we had enough cash on us to pay for the meal (remember people this is a cash only place!) and the food came out pretty fast given how busy they were. The food was fantastic - totally hit the spot. I got their low fat french toast made with Fat Free Apple Yogurt Cinnamon Bread which was soo good and an egg white scramble - also super yummy. my husband got the chocolate cinnamon french toast which was soo decadent and really good. the ambience reminds you of an old fashioned diner with that home-cooked feel. id totally recommend this place - although it might not be such a good idea for groups over 4 people - it would probably take you 3 hours to get seated!
author: Anjali M.

description: One of the best breakfast experiences I've had in the Bay Area.  I especially like the great service that you get here.  Definitely worth the wait if you're in the mood for homestyle breakfast!
author: Andrew G.

description: Food at its best. Everything is fresh & delicious. The wait is ridiculous...you can spend over an hour waiting in line however, it is TOTALLY worth it. If you can, try going on a week day -- the line can be a bit shorter. I've been here so many times I've lost count and I've never seen it without a line - never. But when they set the food in front of you,whether that be a shrimp omelette or pancakes with fresh berries, all thoughts of the painful hour spent in line disappear. This place is FANTASTIC. (oh, and cash only). Worth every second of the wait!
author: Z L.

description: Had Brunch here with my BF and we both loved it. The wait wasn't long on a Thursday...no more than 40min which isn't bad from what I hear. I ordered the French Toast sampler which satisfied my sweet tooth. He ordered the Proscuitto and Asparagus and it was very tasty. by the end of our meal we were both stuffed and satisfied. Next time I want to try the eggs benedict...they looked yummy.
author: Nmari E.

description:
I hate lines. I hate being a part of them, I hate waiting at the end of them-- I would rather not eat than stand in one. But today was an exception. The night before, I committed myself to waiting in line for Mama's for as long as it took and today, it paid off. 

I arrived around 12:00pm to stand in a 45 minute line. It wasn't one of those lines that you just want to get to the front off though. The people in line were surprisingly relaxed, and not at all impatient, which made the wait more bearable. After being let in the store, I was forced to wait alongside a shelf full of pastries, so that by the time I reached the register, I was dead set on a sweet. The cashier was very friendly and made sure we ordered exactly what we wanted. I ordered the low-fat apple yogurt french toast and, after another 10 minute wait for our food to arrive, it was delicious! I thought it was really good as is and didn't feel the need to add any of the maple syrup they provided. But the waitress did recommend using the raspberry jam provided at every table. (It was a good recommendation) I was super satisfied by the end of the meal and left around 1:30. (there was almost no line outside at that time)

The small space allowed the servers to be very attentive to the customers.

Good service, good food, long wait.
author: Virginia C.

description: I read about mama's review and thought my husband and I would give it a try. Honestly I don't know what all the fuss was about. overprices and we had better. But thats my opinion.
author: aida y.

description: A long wait? Yes, even on a weekday expect to wait 20-30 mins during peak hours. But is it scrumpdillyumptious? That's a hell yes! But would I wait more than an hour for it? No thanks! Don't get me wrong, the food especially the brunch items are exceptionally good but it better be life changing for me to wait 2 hours! The specials are written on a white board outside of the restaurant and the rest of the menu items are on the walls inside. Pick what you like then when it's your turn, give your order, pay cash if you can because they don't take credit cards but they will take debit cards for a fee of $1.00 and wait for a table to clear up. I had the (bay) shrimp benedict with avocado and shared the cinnamon french toast with fresh berries. It was the perfect brunch on a sunny San Francisco day. And that jam on the side made the french toast even better. Place is a little small so tables are placed closely to each other. Also, service is friendly. Get lucky and find street parking but bring quarters just in case for the meters.
author: Neva R.

description: Stood in line for 3 hours for extremely overrated food. It's not horrible, but I have had much better at cheaper restaurants with no wait. Plus it's super crowded and uncomfortable in there. Never again!
author: Frances R.

description: ABSOULUTELY BEST! Truly, you're missing out if you don't eat here at least 6 times, to try everything on their menu. Their french toast are phenomenal...i could go on and on and on about their food but why when you could try it for yourself. Even the location and the decor of the interior just made to perfection.
author: benjamin c.

description:
arrived 1:50-ish on sunny sunday afternoon, queued - 
bring friends to talk with in the line or something to read! - 
ordered around 2:25-ish 15-20minz later seated and eating.

clean cosy location on the edge of the park
good polite service, staff look like they are having fun!
food was fine!
smoothie was excellent!
what was that jam on the table, tastie!

worth the wait, when you aren't in a hurry on a lazy sunday? yes.
author: mof m.

description:
It's so sad that I've lived in San Francisco most of my life but only recently heard of Mama's!  You have got to try their french toast...Swedish or Chocolate...both were WOW.  Good stuff indeed!  

After waiting in line for about an hour, I decided to go all out and try the Dungeness Crab Benedict with fresh Spinach and share the Swedish French Toast with a friend.  We didn't intend to finish everything and planned to take whatever we can't finish togo.  Well...after about 45 minutes, there was NOTHING left to take home!  My plate was nice and clean.

Also, we had a party of 6 and waited only about 5 minutes longer than the smaller parties.
author: Sally Trung N.

description:
I got a to-go order. Yes, a vegetarian Momelet. Omelet was decent, potatoes were average, the jam was the best! Four stars because this jam is that good! Blackberry lusciousness....I could drink it it is that good! I felt bad for all the people waiting in line. The atmosphere is cute and cozy, maybe someday I will take a seat there, but for now, To-Go please! 

Another thing.....why no CCs?
author: Diana D.

description:
I love this place! 

Each time I go there, the line and the wait gets longer, but I definitely think it is worth the wait.

I always get the Monte Cristo and it just melts in your mouth.
author: Jerome M.

description: Been going here for years.  The food of course is absolutely amazing.They have a to-DIE-for Monte Cristo and an absolutely delicious array of french toast and omelets.  As many have said, if you go here on the weekend, you will have quite a long wait in line.  It is worth it, but if you are a local, just go during the week.  No line at all :D
author: Teresa S.

description: The wait is awful.  I waited about an hour.  The food was delicious.  I had the french toast sampler and was not disappointed.  The staff is really nice.  I would only go here again if I didn't have to wait more than 10-15 minutes in line.
author: K D.

description: Soooooo over rated!  The food is really good but its such a touristy place that you have to wait in line for an hour which is a joke.
author: TravelBug W.

description: This place is AMAZING! I go here at least once a month with my boyfriend, I would most definitely try and go more often but I don't live in the heart of the city. My boyfriend and I have a long distant relationship and we see each other twice a month and each time he lands in the morning I pick him up from the airport and we go directly to mamas. This place was recommended to me by a friend and now its a tradition for me and my boyfriend to go to mamas when he is in town. THE LINE IS CRAZY but it is so worth the wait :)
author: Melissa M.

description: Out of towners find this a go-to spot. I find it a place to go-to a few times a year. The wait is always the same. Line doesn't move much, but that's because it doesn't stop at the door. It goes inside. It's well worth the wait, but you need to be prepared with coffee and some sort of entertainment i.e. friends, a book, music, a crisis you need some time to figure out. This place has delicious omeletes, fresh fruits and baked goods and sandwiches and so much more. Portions are quite big and it's cash only. If you like healthy, you'll LOVE Mama's.
author: n b.

description:
We discovered Mama's while in our San Fran hotel reading reviews in a publication.It doesn't get any better than this place for breakfast.We waited in a line for 30 minutes on our first visit and maybe 45 the second time.
The food is simply resplendent and after the first few bites you know this is no ordinary breakfast and worth the wait.We would walk from our union square hotel to help build up a hearty appetite and then after hitting Mama;s we would park ourselfs at the nearest Peets or Starbucks and sit outside and enjoy a large green tea.
author: Randy W.

description:
The line is long.  But the food is great.  The servers are attentive once you get to a table.  

Bring comfy shoes because you will be standing outside for a long time.
author: Karen B.

description: yes it is small and there is a wait- BUT the food is homemade and delicious and good portions- great meal to start the day in SF whether you are a tourist or just a local going to take a nice walk in the citayyy! :)
author: Lisa Z.

description: My suggestion...as hard as it is to do. GO THERE ON A WEEKDAY (except mondays)!  I love this place, have been going there for years.  Although I don't go there as often as I used to, the manager still seems to recognize me and tells me "sorry, we ran out of Monte' Cristo's today".  hahaha...  I'm the guy who brings his 6 friends from out of town and half of us order Monte' Cristo Sandwiches... Dollar Pancakes... and the Carrot Cake!
author: Chrismond R.

description: I am a retired UNITED Airlines flight attendant...and most of my San Francisco layovers were spent at Mama's for breakfast! I/we LOVE this place. Great food and a real down home feel with a little pin ache thrown in for the over all experience. I'm planning on a vacation to SF and I WILL BE having breakfast at Mama's too! David/Chicago
author: David D.

description: Get here early or you will be waiting in line.  That being said, this is one of the best breakfast spots in town.  You will not be disappointed, the French toast, the eggs, the Monte Cristo are all supperb.   The wait is totally worth it.  This is one of those places that you really don't want to write a review for as its already so busy that the thought of more people trying to get in is just absurd.
author: Mike and Nance B.

description: We waited 1 hour and 45 minutes in line, and it was worth the wait this time. If I were to do it again, I will probably go back very early or at 2:30 or so right before they close. I had the Eggs Florentine (2 Poached Eggs with Spinach and Mushrooms covered with Hollandaise Sauce) and it was EXCELLENT! I couldn't inhale it fast enough, however the home fries were bland and not good at all (very disappointing). My Other Half had the Northern Italian (Pancetta (Italian Cured Bacon), Mushroom, Fresh Basil, Tomato, and Garlic Jack Cheese) and she thought it was great! My only small complaint is that the waitress never came back to refill my coffee....I'm guessing it's because they don't want you to stick around because of the long line outside. With that said, maybe you shouldn't expect a refill on your coffee when you come in! We intend on going back and next time we will have to try their pastries/deserts ...their carrot cake looked delicious!
author: Cherish J.

description: sooooooo worth the very long line to get in this place on the weekends. my absolute favorite breakfast is the crab-and-white-chedder omlette. its to die for. get a fresh baked muffin to go too. they're really good.
author: Michelle I.

description: Oh the line, the line. Especially on weekends the line is LONG. Love their breakfast. Been here a couple times before and won't be the last. Must get the coffee cake.. So moist.. so yummy.. For people that are watching there weight, there's a low fat menu option. Well not a whole lotta options but there is some. I had the low fat  french toast made with low fat apple yogurt Cinnamon bread. It definitely did not taste like a low fat meal. If all low fat meals taste like THAT, I would be on a diet for the rest of my life. I've also tried the Washington Square before: Italian sausage (they put a lot of Italian Sausage, tomato bell pepper and jack cheese. Served with crispy potatoes and whatever bread you'd like. Fresh squeeze OJ.. Get yourself up in the morning and come here when they open so you don't have to be one of those that wait outside staring in the window hoping that they were you...
author: Juliane N.

description: Yes, it is a bit ridiculous that you need to bring a snack to go eat breakfast. But, this is what you need to do if you want to eat at Mama's and survive the line.  There is a random focaccia place on the corner right across the street that serves delicious pizza bread. It opens and closes when it wants, so you can't always rely on that for the wait. So, I recommend you bring your own snack. Once you enter Mama's,  though, all the angst and promising that you will never ever stand in line again melt away, and all is forgiven when you eye the delicious breads and coffeecakes in the case. (Carrot Cake is a must try, but a bit pricey at $5 for a square). The line and table seating is quite efficient once you get in, so just hang in there. We always get the crab benedict and pancakes (sans fruit). The waitstaff is always super friendly and encourage you to try the jam on the pancakes. Personally, I like it with just the syrup, but try it for yourself.  Why the 3 stars?  On the last visit, the benedict was a bit disappointing (and the price seemed to have increased), so to wait that long for just pancakes makes it only 3 stars.
author: Mashi M.

description: the line was pretty long made me more hungry lol but seriously they make good Eggs Benedict,and the bomb French Toast!i just hope they'll move to a bigger place.
author: Ces T.

description: The breakfast is fantastic.  Eggs Florentine are awesome as well as the home fries.  Pastries are good.  Jam is fresh and the toast is awesome.  Totally worth the long line to get in.
author: Jason M.

description: after 3 years of walking by this place and witnessing the long lines, i finally had the chance to test this place out. we were seated after 1.5hr wait. we ordered the monte cristo, buttermilk pancakes, french toast sampler, dungeness crab benedict, and the californian omelette. out of everything, i thought only the monte cristo was above average. the hollandaise sauce on the crab benedict was too sour. the pancakes, omelette, and french toast were good but nothing out of the ordinary. it's definately a solid breakfast place but the experience neither lived up to my expectations nor to their high reputation. next time i'm in the mood for breakfast food, i'd rather save myself the time and money and go to squat and gobble.
author: Doris Y.

description: Again, for you who like this place, seriously!?  Grow a pair...of taste buds!  I almost blame myself, i should never order seafood benedicts unless i am sure it will be terrific.  It tasted like old stinky shrimp.  Yucky!  Will never return.
author: ana m.

description: the food here is good- but DAYYYYYYUUUMMM gina.  talk about a long ass line.  i just don't have that kind of patience in the morning.  keep it!  i'll make my own dollar-sized pancakes and bacon.
author: Shanti G.

description: Ok... so I am a VERY picky person and I have to say, after living in the neighborhood for 3 years and being a regular here, it's time to write a review.  I generally go alone with a book for their pancakes on Sundays and if you don't mind the line, which I have noticed has gotten much shorter, this is the BEST place to go!  Prices are reasonable and the staff is extra attentive... plus they have the BEST brunch!  Today I went alone with a book and when I walked through the door the waiter recognized me and asked, "do you know what you want?" before even getting in the second line to order.  I said yes, and he said, "great!  Just go to that table over there and I'll be there in a second."  I have to say, I was impressed!!  Everything was great and SOOO much better than the lame service and food at the expensive places like Absinthe.  I was in the mood for a mimosa and the waiter recognized that I liked it heavy on the champagne, light on the OJ and quickly adapted.  I highly recommend it since the wait is generally as long as you would generally wait for a table and the food to arrive anyway.
author: Laura D.

description:
been there a few times - usually have the eggs florentine, eggs blackstone or their special crab eggs florentine. 

their hollandaise sauce is absolutely to die for.  the service is good.  go during breakfast on weekdays, it is a 2-3 hr wait on weekends starting at 7am.  it is crazy.

american breakfasts.  their french toast is made with artisan bread.  very good.
author: tc h.

description: When my hubby and I decided to take a road trip to San Fran, I had been reading about this place and I knew we had to try it.  Arnold is a huge breakfast fan so I thought since they specialize in breakfast, and baked goods period, this is his kind of place.  Luckily our hotel wasn't too far so we were able to walk there.  This place is like a little old ladies' house that turned into a restaurant/bakery.  It's very small and if you don't get their really early or at a weird hour than you probably will be waiting a while.  I ordered an all egg white omelette with spinach, tomatoes, bacon and I think that's it.  It was delicious!!  I love that everything tasted so fresh and not greasy.  I love it too that I was able to do the egg white thing instead of the egg beater deal.  It also came with some country potatoes and those were quite delectable also.  Everything was so good that Arnold and I decided to come the very next day and try something different.
author: Remy E.

description: "mama!  ooohh ooooh oooooh!  i don't wanna die!"  so said freddie mercury and after eating here you definitely don't wanna die cuz you will want to go here again and again again.  i can go on and on about their french toast for years but like the matrix, one cannot be told how good it is, one must taste it to see how good it is.  like my review for Judy's says, the only thing about this place is the wait.
author: Swarup B.

description:
Okay, so I've been wanting to try Mama's for the past 3 years I've lived here based on the rave reviews I've heard. I had 3 friends in town and decided to brave the line...I'm embarassed for Mama's for we had a few issues:
 First, my friends poached eggs were not only overly vinegary but well over cooked....second her French toast was MOLDY! I think the worst part of that was when we told who I think was the owner/manager he seemed a bit sheepish, but didn't even apologize!!! 
 Wait, there's more.
 We didn't get one of our dishes. It was for my same friends 11 year old daughter. We ordered and paid for 2 French toasts and only received 1. After the 15 min she had to wait to get her food, we were presented with a bill for the second French toast!!  We explained that we had already paid for it, and they proceeded to argue with us in front of the line of people, until we paid again...for our late, moldy, overcooked food.
author: Lindsay W.

description: 1-1/2 hour wait for average brunch food.  so not worth it!  just when you think you're almost done waiting, you've made it past the entry door you've been staring at for so long...  yay!...  only then do you discover that once you order & pay for your food at the counter, you have to wait AGAIN, this time for a table!  (heart sinks, pout) boooo!
author: Lisa W.

description: best breakfast in sf, monte critso, mmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!
author: Aaron I.

description: A must for San Fran visits. The line can be intimidating but goes fast. I have never had a bad meal and, frankly, drip with anticipation of dining here. Get off it, I'm a guy so that comment is nothing sick. My mouth waters...
author: Chris H.

description: Unbelieveable and totally worth waiting out on the street for!  We were totally shocked that there was a line down the block when we arrived, but after only about 40 minutes, we made our way inside and up to the cash register.  The food was amazing and totally worth the wait!  My husband had the salmon benedict and I had the most amazing stack of perfectly perfect buttermilk pancakes (with a side of chicken-apple sausage!).  The homemade lingonberry jam on the table was the most delightful thing I've tasted and at the waitresses suggestion, I slathered it on my pancakes!  YUM!  We would go all the way to SF from Texas just for Mama!
author: Amy K.

description: My friends and I talk and talk and talk so it takes something really good to get us quiet. That for us was a crab omelet, shrimp omelet, and California omelet. Oh and mimosas (though small, they are pretty potent! who doesn't love a tipsy brekkie?). As long as you have a good group to hang, you can bear the wait to get in. Once you wait in thaaaat line (and there's always a line) you get waved to come in and stand in another line. and get tortured by the chefs flipping fluffy pancakes, pouring fruit salad, and adding delicious touches to all sorts of egg dishes. its painful. but its worth it when you had over your cash (CASH ONLY) and wait to get seated to enjoy some of mama's homecooking. Oh and that homemade jellly...I had to steal one of my friend's toast to lather on as much of that raspberry goodness as I could. So many good choices and so many good eats,  just like mama always cooked.
author: Stephanie C.

description: On Thursday around noon time, my friends (from Fresno) and I decided to go to Mama's for brunch. The breakfast place is located at the corner of Stockton St. and Fibert St. right next to the Washington Square. Yep, just like we expected, there's already a line out the door despite the drizzle. The wait outside Mama's was less than 10 minutes; but once stepped inside, we had to wait in the line again before we can order our food. After we paid for our food, we waited for another few minutes before the waiter gave us the table with Papa and Mama Sanchez. Well, I meant we sat right next to a framed photograph of Papa and Mama at our table. But at least we didn't have to wait long for our food to be served. (Thank goodness!) Besides the Eggs Benedict with smoke salmon that I ordered, we also shared a slice of banana bread and 3 coffee cakes (vanilla, carrot & blueberry flavor). The food was very delicious, especially the coffee cakes - they are simply mama-yummy!! And the fresh squeezed orange juice actually tasted Fresh Squeezed! The service was great and the food was definitely worth the wait. I was in a food coma just 30 minutes later. Food and services, 4.5 stars. Ridiculous wait time, 3 stars. But perhaps the long wait is designed to make everything taste so good, ie. if you dont pass out on the street corner from having to wait too long.
author: Alvin L.

description: I've never had such a "!!!" experience of waiting more than 2 hours for having a breakfast!  I do not think that I would ever try that again. We drove to SF early to get to the restaurant but they already had a long waiting line. We thought (not twice but) three time whether we should wait, but why not, because everyone talks about this restaurant.  We waited for 2 hours+. The egg benedict that we tried were tasty.  The restaurant is tiny and so squeezed inside. Good luck for waiting - you have to know that you will end up having lunch after waiting initially for breakfast!
author: Miwa Y.

description:
i had the eggs Benedict it was good very good.  my gf had the northwest omelet.  it was really lacking.  it didn't really tasted like the smoke salmon was fresh i.e.  had a little fishy odor to it.  i also thought the dish was bland.  however i never have fish first thing in the morning, it doesn't really agree with me, so maybe that had something to do with it.  my GF didn't like it and ended up eating some of my Benedict.  
i was really hoping for more and i think I'll go back if I'm in the neighborhood, but to tell you the truth if I'm going to wait 40 minutes for breakfast I'm going to Dottie's.
author: Anthony Y.

description: What can I say about this place. I went at a good time, no lines and seating right away. I came with a gf around one ish and the restaurant was still busy, but not packed. So, be prepared to wait in line if you come at 1100. The food is awesome! I had the Northern Italian M'Omelette- superb! All the veggies were fresh and it was a big portion! My gf had the infamous Monte Cristo. Now when she ordered it, in my head I was thinking turkey, ham and...... jam?  JAM?!? Together? That doesn't sound at all like that would be a good combo. I have this weird thing about savory and sweet mixing. Boy was I wrong. She kept on saying try a piece and I kept on saying no. Then I thought that I would try a teeny tiny piece. Gotta try everything at least once right? If I didn't like it I would spit it out on my napkin when she wasn't looking. Boy was I wrong! That savory and sweet mix went really well together. The one thing that I didn'tlike about this place was that I smelled like food after I left the restaurant, which isn't too pleasing especially if you plan to do a little shopping afterward. I mean not just my clothes , but my hair too. I guess it comes with the territory, it definitely wouldn't stop me from coming here for there delicious food.
author: carebear l.

description:
The food is great here, I love everything the omelette's, benedicts, french toast and pancakes.  The wait is horrible but the place only has 13 tables you cant really blame them for having a killer wait.  The coffee is pretty bad, but hey i don't even drink coffee so what do i care? The food is pretty pricey, but unfortunately for them the people who set their rent are the wonderful men from St. Peter and Pauls church. 
  The first time i went there though it was horrible, but then again i was expecting to have a mouthgasm as soon as i bit into the food.  The mouthgasm unfortunately did not occur, but i was able to realize i was just setting the bar too high.  Every restaurant is different for everybody, but hey the line is killer, my advice to people without unlimited patience (planet earth) Tuesday-Thursday, during non holiday times.  During the summer you can expect it to be busy every frickin day.  Plan ahead is a good idea too, going there on an empty stomach might make you a bit irrational by the time you get the front of the line.  
        I find what mamas does the best is consistency, it consistently has put good food out there for many years.  Oh yea if your really hungry and at the back of the line go across the street to the foccacia place, excellent snack while you wait.
author: Mike S.

description: OMG this place has really good food!  The french toast is awesome!  The crab dish is good toooo!  The line is pretty long so get there early!
author: L N.

description: The only reason I would ever come back here is for the Monte Cristo.  The Mama's version of this delicious creation was the best I have ever tried. Everything else was elemental at best; the huevos rancheros were bland, not to mention with eggs that were undercooked.  My friend's french toast did not blow us away.  I expect greatness after an hour and fifteen minutes of standing around....not found.
author: Jessica K.

description: Okay so those of you that follow my reviews KNOW that I only reserve 5 stars for the BEST so here it is!! I was introduced to Mama's this afternoon by two friends who are locals. I seriously wanted to KISS THEM when we finished eating (I didn't, but I will!) What a treasure this little place is. I don't give two poos how long the wait in line is. Good food is worth the wait people!! You can't rush perfection don't you know that?! And the friendly atmosphere is also worth it. We got inside & I was just floored by all the choices up on the board. I'd finally decide only to then discover another delicious option! I hadn't even totally made up my mind but had a good idea when we got to the register & the guy (who knows my friends & their "usuals" well) finally said to me "And you want the Californian right?" Holy crap!! We were all stunned. We're still not sure if he's psychic or what but he was RIGHT! In addition to that amazing omelette, I had their roasted red potatoes, sourdough baguette and a TO DIE FOR chocolate crumb cake that I'm still dreaming about :) I enjoyed this place so much I'm ready to plan a trip back up from L.A. asap to eat here again. And I'm ready to wait in any size line too :)
author: Lyd A.

description: been here twice and i really didn't see the hype. sure the food is good but nothing to rave about especially if I need to get up at 7:30 am to be able to eat by 9am? that seems a bit senseless.
author: flo t.

description: Not that this place really needs another review but yes they are the best. I dream about their french toast and home made jam. Try and get here early, around 8 or 9 on a week day. I've never waited in a hour long line here because I've never been here later than nine thirty or on the weekend, I know better.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Even when you get to Mama's at 8:15, there is still a 45 minute wait.  Is it worth the wait?  I'd say that it depends.  If you are starving, it isn't.  Even the best food cannot satisfy an impatient stomach and dangerously low glucose level!  That being said, the food is very good, coffee is ok (I like my own lattes brewed with Pete's).  The berry jam on the table is the BOMB!!  I had the crab/brie omelette, servied with toast and potatoes.  Somewhere in the reviews, someone remarked that the potatoes were bad.  I liked them.  They were not peppered with some nasty fake onion/garlic powder seasoning packet that makes me want to hurl.  My omelette was delicious.  My husband had a shrimp omelette and my friend had the crab/cheese omelette.  The service is very good.  You order your food, it is brought to your table.  The crab/brie omelette was $18.  So be prepared to drop some $$ if you want their specials.  I think this is a good place to go if you want a special breakfast or brunch.  I would definitely go back there being aware that there will be a wait.
author: Gigi M.

description:
Friend and I went after services at Peter and Paul Church next store. We had a bit of a "situation" with a fellow diner wrongly assuming that he was next up for a table. After a quick he said she said between fellow diner and my friend and I we relented as I don't argue over brunch tables. The waitress noticed what happened and came over to us to say she was sorry and that that table was in fact ours. When we sat down I have to say the waitress, Sally, went out of her way to make up for the misunderstanding with a genuinely lovely demeanor as well as on the house mimosas and a crumb cake and cookie to take away. The owner, Debbie, even stopped by our table to apologize! As it was my friend's birthday, it wasn't a great start but Sally and Debbie turned it around and that's the real meaning of a small, independently owned business. As everyone has mentioned, they always have a line out the door but that didn't stop them from caring that two patrons had a bad experience and doing whatever they could to turn it around.

In addition - the food was fantastic. I had egg whites with spinach & mushrooms which was bursting with flavor and we also had the french toast sampler which was quite good, as everyone has said.
author: Barbara C.

description: When you see a line in front of a restaurant you can count on amazing food. And Mama's will not disappoint you. Premium ingredients married with professional preparation creates the long line of enthusiastic diners who appreciate fine food. I have eaten at Mama's before and have always been rewarded with unbelieveable food and great conversations with fellow diners in line. If you can't wait in line for great food an enjoyable conversation for an hour or so..go to McDonalds!
author: byron i.

description: its worth the wait!  and if you dont believe me, thats fine... thats one less person that will be in line when i go.
author: Carolyn B.

description: great hole in the wall breakfast joint.  Theres gonna be a line to wait to get in, but the food is worth it.  Everything just taste so homemade, i would definitely go back again.
author: Michael D.

description: Scrumptious! The food here is amazing and well worth the wait outside. Every time I eat here I am overwhelmed with the many incredible choices and have never been disappointed with my yummy brunch.
author: Cali S.

description: Holy Breakfast! Everything looks amazing at this place but I am personally a fan of the jam at each table that tastes delcious on the sourdough baguette. This is the kind of place you wish was in your neighborhood and only you knew about. Problem is all of San Francisco knows about it because on a Friday afternoon at 1pm (doesn't anyone work anymore) there was a 20 min wait so I cant even imagine what the wait is on weekends. Basically heaven so if you havent been get your butt over there!
author: Jeanine M.

description:
didnt live up to the hype...and nobody likes waiting so long for the food.  sure makes a girl grumpy.

but it was good.  really...try it at least once?
author: jozilla w.

description: Several people have told me to go to Mamas and I've attempted several times but never stayed to wait in line.  Today we went around 2pm and the line didn't look too bad, so we decided to try it.  We waited for about 30 minutes and I don't think it's worth the wait (especially not for an hour plus wait like they normally have).  There weren't menus at the table.  Instead we read the menu on the wall at the counter and then sat down to order, which seemed a bit weird and slow.  I had the SOB Omelet and shared the Cinnamon Crumb Bread.  It was ok, but nothing spectacular.  The restaurant was also loud and the tables were packed closely together.
author: Katherine D.

description: Good breakfast/brunch.  Fresh pastries, good egg dishes.  Bright interior.  Long wait in line.  Call me jaded but few if any places in S.F. that serve breakfast are extraordinary.  It's better than a greasy spoon and on par with places like Ella's, Miss Millie's, Cafe for All Seasons, Dottie's, et al.  With a little effort you can probably make something comparable at home and save yourself the time in line.
author: danielle b.

description: My Sunday brunch experience was quite enjoyable.  The homemade brioche french toast was absolutely delicious with fresh fruit and homemade raspberry jam.  I went around 1030am and had to wait outside for about 20 minutes but it was worth it.  The homey feel made it more welcoming for guests to sit and enjoy their weekend breakfast/lunch.  I'm sure everything on the menu is absolutely fantastic.  I will have to make another trip out here again.  Loved it!
author: Tu-Hien L.

description: is it a long wait? yes. is it good? yes. do yourself a favor and go to roma and get yourself a cup of coffee, then head to liguria and get some bread to eat while you wait.
author: karen w.

description: Brunch is my favorite meal, and I love breakfast food.  Mama's surely hit the spot.  Great french toast, decent portions, and good breakfast.  It's such a trendy spot that the wait is pretty ridiculous so I don't go often.
author: Kofi A.

description: Why not add my voice to the many reviews here? I have been eating breakfasts at Mama's since 1989. I have never been less than satisfied, and quite regularly I am ecstatic over what I consider to be the best omelets in the world. They're "Momelets"! You can expect to wait in line, and it is always crowded, so if that isn't your plan, you'd be happier elsewhere. They do great silver dollar pancakes too, but I'd suggest ordering an egg dish as well. Their eggs benedict is to die for. If you like crab, when in season they have a crab, leek and white cheddar cheese omelet that will give you premonitions of paradise. The service is fantastic, and the people there treat you like family (well, I suppose we are considering how long we've been frequenting the place). My only complaint is the coffee. Don't get me wrong, the coffee is drinkable - it's just not great (he never asks for a second cup at home). I honestly think it is brewed too strong. But that is hardly reason enough not to frequent the best breakfast cafe in town.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: Since my family did not want me to go home for xmas because I eat too much, I finally made it to mamas xmas eve morning.  Suffering from jet lag I woke up at 730am and ended up in line around 830am.  There were 2 parties ahead and it still took about 30 minutes.  But it was definitely the shortest line I have seen so far.  The bakery across the street had half of SF waiting to get in.  I think they were selling foccocia or something but their line was ridicuolous.  Anyways, mamas pretty much lives up the hype.  Crab is in season so all the specials have crabs.  The crab "momlette" was freaking amazing!  With fresh, whole meat dungeoness crab soaked in butter it was freaking awesome.  The OJ and the homemade jam was also really good.  I also had some of their french toast.  It was a little too sweet for me so i didnt use syrup.  I just dipped it into the jam (thats what fattys like me do).  It is definitely worth coming to mamas.  Just bring a nice wad of cash since everything is over $10.  They dont take CC or checks.  I will definitley be back if I am able to wake up at 730am ever again.
author: Fatty A.

description: was visiting s.f. for my birthday week and wanted to have a good breakfast and yelp pointed us here. we had an amazing time here, we love this place. the service was great, despite the harassing from Mike about my L.A.
