Dodger shirt. lol. i guess theres a lot of giant fans here. lol. the place is small but thats the charm of this place, we were lucky and missed the lines, but would have waited anyways. the food is amazing here, the first day, she had corned beef eggs benedict, i had the north beach momelette and we shared the french toast sampler. all three dishes were great, so much so we came back the very next day, this time without my dodger gear and still got harassed. lol. this time she had the monte cristo and i had the slim joe burger. was even better then the day before. when we visit s.f. again, we will make sure we come back. hopefully its during baseball season and i'll be wearing my dodger gear! thanks mike
author: Joey H.

description: omg, this place is UNbelievable. i've heard of this place, known for its super awesome brunch and super long lines. so we decided to go to mama's 8am on a random wednesday right before work. turns out to be a good choice, because there was a very short line (2-3 people in front of us), and there was no wait for a table after u paid for your food. this place is SO good. i had the monte cristo, my friend had the eggs and beef hash. insanely good. since i didn't wait a long time in line for this place, and the food was out of this world delicious, this place is 5 stars!
author: Angie K.

description: A friend recommended Mama's as a must stop for us before heading back to Seattle. Now if you would have told me that I was going to stand in the pouring rain for almost two hours after I got to bed at 3am..I would have asked you if you were insane. We made some friends in line so we decided to share a table to move things along. So now it is noon and I am having breakfast...I agree with all the 5 star reviews detailing the food. One thing I felt missing is the mention of the service. I was absolutely blown away how friendly and efficient this crew was. We were not needing anything, when coffee got low they were there with a refill and a smile. When plates were empty they were there to clean up with a smile. Overall, the wait was absolutely worth it, the food (quality and quantity) was superb (and I am still saying that after deciding that the blueberry's tasted moldy but did not look it) and the service was awesome. Now if you would have told me that I would have paid almost $50 for two for breakfast ....again I would have said you were insane but we did and tipped well. Highly recommended.
author: Nicole C.

description: def. go on a weekday to avoid waiting 1 hr. to eat breakfast... but if you must, go on a weekend... well worth the wait, fresh, tasty, and inventive food!
author: Sam P.

description: I have wanted to visit Mama's for a long time, but the thought of the long wait scared me away.  Thanks to our jetlag, my husband and I finally got to visit Mama's for breakfast without waiting in line.  We were there at 8 in the morning, and there was no line.  Although breakfast and the drinks (yummy fresh grapefruit juice) were great I don't want to stand in line for 2 hours to eat it.  If I want to enjoy this again, I will set the alarm clock and get there early...
author: Marijke D.

description: GREAT if you love breakfast.  There's always a line but it's not as bad as it looks.  The problem is choosing what to order before it's your turn.  If you stay on Columbus (or nearby) you can walk here, which is good, because you'll need to walk AFTER the meal.  It's clean, breezy (of course) and who doesn't enjoy a cool breeze during a pleasant meal?  The staff is friendly, which is always a plus for me.  Rude staff turns me away from returning.  It's in WA square where you can sit, rest, and people watch under the trees.  After a meal here, you don't need anything until dinnertime, unless you can't resist the raw oysters, crabs, shrimp and clam chowder down at the wharf.  Yee haaawwww!!!
author: M L.

description: Just ate there today, the french toast...probably the best I've ever had! I will def be back to try the monte cristo!!!
author: Jonathan M.

description: french toast sampler.  i think it's the best breakfast i ever had , and i am not a sweet-breakfast person.  well worth the 45 minute wait.
author: Alyssa W.

description: The wait for this place is very long. I went with a friend and we were in line for about 2 hours total. The people in front of us kept raving about the food and how the wait was well worth it. We had nothing else planned for the day so we stuck it out in the freezing cold and rain. I ordered the eggs florentine benedict. My friend got the french toast sampler. We split the orders. The food was good, but honestly I didn't think it was anything unique. I feel like it tasted just as good as every other place I have had eggs benedict. The french toast was also good, but nothing special. The sampler has different kinds of breads prepared as french toast. The only one I didn't care for was the banana nut bread french toast. My friend didn't care for it either. Mine came with country potatoes. I cannot remember if the french toast included them. If the wait wasn't as long as it was I'd give the place 3 stars, but the food we had really isn't worth a 2 hour wait. My rating is 2 stars!
author: urban r.

description: 188 reviews. speaks for itself how many people love this place. add me to the list.
author: mike l.

description: Very efficient. Yes, there is a line and double whammy if it is raining outside. Average wait time on an early Saturday is about 40 minutes. Once you enter order first by looking at the Sandwich, Specials, Waffles/Pancakes, and Mamalettes Menus just overhead and expect to pay CASH ONLY. I had ten dollars so instead of feeling bad for getting someone to spot me a few dollars, I just got a stack of Banana Pancakes with bananas crowning the golden tower of fluffiness. Everyone else got their french toasts, eggs benedicts, and Northern omelettes, but I could only afford the pancakes for about $9.00. Next time I am bringing a warmer coat, and my umbrella that was sitting in my passenger seat of my car the whole time, silver coins to pay my parking meter periodically during my meal, and a warmer jacket in case I am stuck outside in the bad elements for longer than 10 minutes. All in all, great filling food at a high-value price point with a service staff who operate with that sense of urgency that gets you in and out of a brunch so you can get on with your day. Beautiful. -Matt
author: Matthew C.

description: i must also say that the "cash only" concept here annoys me...c'mon now,  get with the program!
author: Patrick I.

description: I totally agree with dd on this one.  I have lived here 6 years and avoided this place until now because of the lines.  We both had the day off today and thought the line wouldn't be bad on a Tuesday morning.  WRONG.  We decided to brave it anyways, so that I could see if the place lived up to the hype.  My fiance had actually been before and liked it.  So, we waited.  As we waited, my fiance explained to me that we would get to wait in line some more once inside.  Excuse me?  This is a system that I am just not a fan of.  It was seriously just stressful inside.  As dd said, at least once you make it through the line at Dottie's and get seated, you leave it all behind you.  The food at Mama's was good, but it wasn't mind-blowing or so super spectacular that I called everyone I know as soon as I left.  It's just too much of a scene for me.  I can't deal with it.  My mama would never stress me out like this.
author: Squirrel L.

description: finally , i have time to try this restaurant.im planning to try this restaurant since i lived in sf. but never got a chance. so, when my friend mentioned this restaurant was on her list, i don't have to think twice. and i choose monte cristo for my perfect lunch.and it was awesome! very tasty & yummy. the homemade jelly was delicious too.
author: irene s.

description: I can't believe I almost wrote off the opportunity to eat at this delightful and warm breakfast diner. An out-of-town friend heard that Mama's was one of the best places in SF for breakfast. I perfunctorily dismissed this as mere out-of-town speculation, explaining that I know all the hot places to dine in town and since I haven't heard of Mama's, it must not be so hot.     I was grossly mistaken. So apparently, I am not the food maven I thought I was. Hey Damon, is this proof that the Ballyhoo isn't cutting edge?     Mama's. I couldn't think of a better name for this tiny, kitchen-like restaurant that features an open kitchen and home sewn curtains for the windows. It's just like sitting in your mama's sunny kitchen and telling her stories while she bustles around in her apron and whips up the best breakfast you can dream of.  Read more on The Ballyhoo: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=25
author: Baochi N.

description: I love breakfast. I love going out for breakfast. I have to say, I don't love Mama's as much as I thought I would. Maybe it's because of all the hype, but I was expecting REALLY good. I was there for a Thursday brunch and still waited about 40 minutes to be let in the door-quick by their standards. Luckilly for us it was a great day so we didn't mind the wait:) The thing is, the food wasn't anything outstanding. I ordered one of the specials, an omelette with avocado, shrimp, and havarti---good, but not great. My fiance ordered the juevos rancheros and was definitely dissapointed (disclaimer: he is sort of a juevos rancheros freak and has an idea of his "perfect", so his standards are uber high). The old fashioned crumb cake was yummy, yummy, yummy and all the other coffee cakes looked equally great. Overall I had a good breakfast but I'm not itching to go back.
author: Emily R.

description: SO GOOD! totally recommend you to try. I came here the other day, with friends and we waited outside in the rain for 30 minutes, but it was worth it. They make the best Benedict eggs I've ever tried, if you like sears fine foods this is 100 times better. Everything thing else is okay. Service is really good, they treat you like family here. Prices are really good, and they give huge portions.
author: Larry C.

description: I live up the street and haven't been here, yet. SO I finally went during the week to avoid any lines. But, frankly, I don't know what the big hoopla is about this place...I got my fav. breakfast, eggs benedict and it wasn't the best I have ever had - actually I've had better at Momo's! The pig was too salty and the tiny tater portion was mediocre. The $4 OJ tasted like Tang! and I had to go to cafe trieste for more coffee.  Maybe it's b/c I had such high expectations, but I wasn't too impressed. However, I WILL give it another chance sometime - maybe get their french toast and will update later.
author: sarah e.

description: There really is absolutely no reason to write a review of a place with this many reviews, but I'm doing it anyway.  If you are fortunate enough to eat here on a weekday when it's not completely bonkers (like on a Thursday right before you get dental surgery) it may be unclear about how this place works.  First you wait in line outside the door, and then they let you in to wait in line by the counter.  As you wait by the counter, much of the breakfast menu (posted on the wall) will be blocked by hungry bodies, and you should actually be reading this menu and know what you want by the time you get to the register, because you order at the counter, which is a little bit of a pain when some dumbass won't get out of the way so you can see the menu.  After all of this complaining, I must say the eggs benedict was some of the best I've ever had, but i don't think I'd ever wait in line for 2 hours to eat it -- I was much happier waiting for only 25 minutes, all the while unclear about how the place worked.  Would it really be that much trouble to put up a little sign outside that said something like: 1.) wait in line outside, 2.) wait in line inside and figure out what you want to eat so you can order at the counter, 3.) hopefully after you order you can sit down (this isn't always the case), and then wait for your drinks and food.
author: robyn s.

description: excellent grub no question!  i grew up in N.B just a couple of blocks from mama's so i might be a little biased b/c  its a  nostalgic but regardless, they definitely do breakfast/brunch right and for (at least) 35yrs.. there are only two things that are bad; parking is a bitch! and the lines on the weekends are outta control stretching down a block or two- i strongly advice going during the week! if you dont have the flexibility of doing weekday breakfast and if the weekend is your only option? the line is ugly but well worth it! (this coming from someone who does NOT "do" lines EVER...)  it's for sure a north beach institution if not a sf legend! (ok, i might be going a little over board but like i said, it brings me back to my childhood)
author: nicole d.

description: hmmm lets just say best place ever! i know everyone says this but it reallly is! everyone raves about the monte cristo! i was going to get that but i really couldn't decide! everyone at the table got something different so we could try everything! the crab omelet with brie was so good! the banana nut french toast was good with jelly on top of it and the banana pancakes were fluffy and soft! the line is well worth it i waited an hour and a half on a sunday morning and did i care? heck no i didn't!!!! if you don't try this place you will definitely regret it!
author: Jessica W.

description: food is yummy here!  i shared the dungeness crab, avocado and brie omelette and the shrimp and avocado benedict with tomatoes...both very good, but not at the same time.  i think having one or the other would have been fine, but eating half of one dish and then jumping over to the other wasn't the best idea.  i didn't try the pastries, but they look so yummy!  and the french toast looked so delectable too!  yes, the wait is super long, but luckily it was a nice sunny day, so for 6 ppl it only took a little over an hour.  the service is efficient and the food comes out quickly.  It's a great place to go once in a while.
author: Fran H.

description: As if 1500+ rave reviews weren't enough....but this place is worth every bit of hype it receives.  Like everyone before me has said this place is definitely worth the wait.  It's by far the best breakfast I can remember having in a long time, if not ever!  Thank goodness my friend and I went on a weekday, the wait wasn't that bad, less than 30 minutes.  We ordered the french toast scrambler and buttermilk pancakes and shared.  I am obsessed with pancakes, they are pretty much my favorite food and these were some of the best pancakes I've ever had.  The waiter was amazing, his name was Cyrus and he provided the best service, nice, friendly, funny and attentive.  He mentioned that I should try the jam on the table, which I did and it was soooo good.  I would have bought some if they sold jars of it at the restaurant.  You can't go wrong by going to this place, just thinking about it now makes me want to go back right now!
author: Sarah I.

description: holy beans! this place is really unbelievable. try the monte cristo... i've never had a breakfast sandwich that tasted like that and my eggs benedict came out perfectly. as for the pancakes, they might seem simple but good pancakes are damn hard to make and these fellas have mastered the art. regarding the wait -- the line can be long but if you go around 11 or 12, it starts to die down. another bonus -- the guy working the counter looks like benecio del toro. i'd go just for that.
author: monkey l.

description: Met friends from out of town here on a unusually sunny Fall Saturday. Had I known i was going to wait in line for almost an hour I would have applied sunblock all over my body! Lucky for me I had my friends to keep me company - and playing catch up and hearing tales about being mugged in Koreatown, LA made me forget that I was starving and about to choke someone if I didn't eat anytime soon! Once we got inside - look - more waiting! But like I said having the company of friends does ease the hostility you want to invoke on the patrons slurping down their third mimosa or pushing the same piece of potato on their plate for the third time! So when it was time to order I figured, "FUCK IT - I'm going to make people wait too!" So I made sure  I had 3 different types of beverages and a big breakfast! I had the open faced smoked salmon "momlette" - it was delicious and how can you walk away from anything labeled, "open faced?" The food and mimosa was delicious but for this horrendous wait I gave it 3 stars - plus it's cash only so remember to wait in another line beforehand at the ATM!
author: Alexis D.

description: Food is great -- a creative take on standard brunch fare.  But not worth a 90 minute wait ...
author: Tom S.

description: The best breakfast I have had in San Francisco . . .period. There is a reason there is always a line out the door. Right on the corner of Washington Square Park in North Beach this place can give you a meal that may just lead you to a nap in the park across the street. How they make their French toast oh so soft or cover it in such fresh fruit is beyond me. They have their line designed perfectly so before you order you are marched along the window of pastries, muffins and so on as well as view of the cooks putting together their classic dishes. The problem here is your order may change in your head three times before you reach the register . . "look at that omlette!"  . . . "hollandaise sauce on their crab benedict!" . . .but it doesn't matter because everything is incredible here. Bring the dead presidents though because even though they do take you to morning bliss they don't take visa (cash only). I am still waiting for them to announce, "due to the demand, we will no longer be providing change." The sad thing is I would probably still go.
author: Chad B.

description: Mama's is that hyped up place that lives up to the hype. As long as you're ready for the wait, with coffee (from Caffe Roma) in hand, and have fun friends (and cash to pay with), this place is perfect. I love the menu, the staff is great - overall, it's one pretty sweet brunch place to live near. And the jam is, well, orgasmic.
author: Allie H.

description:
this place was good. it's not rock-star good but it's nestled in a super cute area in north beach - right on washington square park. it's always packed... i think thats one of the downsides to this place. i've been here a few times and everything i've ever gotten on the menu is delicious. 

this is probably one of the best places for breakfast in sf.
author: Miss O.

description: You are gonna have to stand in line and wait, but it's worth it.  I ate there twice during my stay in San Francisco.  The eggs benedict and the florentine scramble were my favorites.  Service is excellent and everyone who works there seems happy to be there and they're extremely friendly
author: Frankie H.

description: One of the best places for breakfast in the city!! Come early or the line can pretty long but it's worth the wait.
author: larry l.

description: If you are looking for true breakfast food Mama's is the way to go.  I only go when I can slip in on weekdays but I don't love breakfast enough to wait in an hour long line.  I took my coworkers there yesterday because they were craving a good solid breakfast.  I had the eggs florentine with a side of spicy italian sausage and tomatoes.  I've had the omlettes in the past and they are delicious.  The pancakes with fresh berries are the real winner here and the baked goods.  A real treat.  Next time I'm going with the french toast.  Yumm..
author: Allison M.

description: Yummy, Yummy, Yummy....but now it is a tourist stop which is so sad because now you have to wait and wait and wait before you get seated.   I don't go as often as  I would like to because of the wait.  Even during the weekday when I've taken a day off from work I've had to wait with all the tourist.  The most annoying thing is listening to the tourist say Joe Dimaggio and Marilyn Monroe where married at St. Peter and Paul - THEY WERE NOT MARRIED THERE!  The owners are really nice and once I forgot my wallet and the owner's husband said I could come back another day to pay.   The pancakes are so good there, and the omlettes are excellent.  My sister actually worked here when she was in college back in the early 70s.   They used to have several Mama's in the city, including one in the basement of Macy's.  Another trivia note is that when Micheal Douglas was filming Streets of San Franciso he used to date the owner's daughter.   Great place just wish they would bring back the hotdog sandwich they had in the 70s, and put up a sign that Joe and Marilyn wer NOT married at St. Peter and Paul (they were married at City Hall)
author: P S.

description: this place is a little out of my regular budget range, but jesus christ i'd go again - i would kill for their egg scramble. paired with a solid mimosa, it was a great breakfast date with the guy i was dating at the time. there's also something cheeky and fun about the fact they are ONLY open for breakfast until 3 pm. definitely worth the wait.
author: Jenz y.

description: What is the big deal about this place?  I waited in line for 45 minutes just to have bad service.  The place is so busy that they don't bother to refill your coffee.  They take away your plate once you're done, hand you the check and you're outta there!  I brought my daughter and they didn't even bother to give her a plate.  Did they expect her to eat off their table?!?!  I wouldn't come back, not ever.  Their breakfast is good, but if their service it bad, then why bother going, just to be upset?
author: Bonnie T.

description: I didn't even wade through to see what the locals thought on here tonight because a local recommended this place to us as a MUST EAT.  HOW is this the best breakfast in sf???  We toughed it out for an hour and a half, I got sunburned!  It was good, don't get me wrong, but not an hour and a half's wait worth it by any stretch of the imagination.  We tried a LOT too and it simply didn't bowl me over.  It was a really fun experience though.  I liked the building and our waitress was great.  Try it, but not if you have to wait forever.  I've had far superior brunches in DC for instance for far, far less.
author: h d.

description: Best breakfast I have ever had.  Food is amazing!  Only problem is that the lineup can be really long which sucks when you're starving.  But, that won't stop me from going back again and again!
author: Sarah T.

description: it was a good breakfast, kind of expensive for regular breakfast items, their specialty items looked good but a little pricey. wide variety of french toast options that look delicious and definitely getting them next time in there. if you don't feel like spending a little money on breakfast don't go here but besides that i'd recommend it and i'm coming here again
author: s b.

description: Great omelets!  Must say that their mimosas were a bit overpriced, but will return if I were in the area to try their huge breakfast selection!
author: Sharon H.

description: best breakfast in tonw.  line is always always long.  everything taste so good and you won't regret the wait.
author: Shirl L.

description: By far the best place in SF to have a Saturday morning breakfast. By morning, I mean pre-10am! Short or nonexistent lines, fresh and flavorful food- banana nut french toast is divine! I stumbled upon it it 10 years ago and its still fantastic!
author: Ciao A.

description: Mama's really does breakfast well.  It's a 4 star hangover reliever.  I haven't waited in line for breakfast since the days when there was always a line at Bubby's in Tribeca because people wanted to watch JFK Jr. eat french toast.  I don't mind.
author: Larry T.

description: went there once for Monte Cristo sandwich with co-workers. Very small place. good sandwich but I don't think I would wait too long for it.
author: mark s.

description: Wait on a Saturday morning (like 11:30ish) was an hour and change till the food was on the table. proscuitto benedict was not very good (more like chopped ham, not parma...not for salumi lovers) but omelette with crab, avo, and tomato was fabulous. expensive ($19.95 for breakfast!) but it was really, really good. french toast was also super great - cinnamon with berries. If you are a breakfast lover (not a "breakfast is okay, but I like lunch better" person like me) GO. and bring a book.
author: Lady L.

description: Overrated.  Impressive line outside place around the corner in front of the windows (on a weekday) but food was mediocre.  I love breakfast and I could make most of the entrees and better.  I had the North Beach omelet.  I tried my friends apple butter pancake, first taste of apple was good until you bit into the rubbery pancake.   Good place for tourists and yuppies (people who spend beyond their means) who have lower standards but if you don't want to wait, better to squeeze own juice at home (juicer really not necessary) and learn to cook.
author: Patty J.

description: This place has the best breakfast around. It is busy. You will wait an hour in line on the weekends. I hate to wait, but it is worth it. They close at 3, so get there early. They make their own jam. Yummo. They have fluffy pancakes with fresh fruit. They have huge omletes. They make a great monte cristo. They make all of their own breads. I have no complaints, except for long lnes
author: M D.

description: While visiting SF, I was told this was a MUST for breakfast. So, while my friend was at work, I walked over all by myself and saw the line around the corner. I am a huge breakfast fan so decided to wait. In line, I met lots of people who were all friendly (everyone in SF is friendly) and told me it would be worth it. The nice girls waiting behind me asked me to join them (not sure if it was out of pity since I was by myself...but regardless, it was a nice gesture) so I accepted and we walked into the restaurant together as 3. Unlike the traditional restaurant, you walk along the counter where you see the cooks cooking and order at the register at the end of the counter, pay up, and wait, awkwardly, standing over people who are already sitting and eating, for a table. Soon after we were seated, our waitress took our orders and everything came pretty shortly after. The 'healthy' french toast was amazing - yogurt bread dipped in egg whites instead of the entire egg. It was delish and I couldn't help but notice that I had scarfed my food down way before the company I was with. How embarrassing. But it was so good! I would go back...for sure...maybe trying something else on the menu and during "off peak hours?"
author: Christina K.

description: I'm not into waiting for an hour in line to eat breakfast.  But, if I had to wait an hour anywhere it may be here.  Why not?  You can look out at the park and watch the dogs playing frisbee while a cute group of senior citizens does Tai Chi.  Back to the food.  The service is excellent and friendly,... and when they tell you to try their homemade jam as a topping on almost anything... just do it. You won't regret it.
author: P L.

description: As good as everyone says - but yes, even has a line on weekday mornings.
author: Jay T.

description: Overrated - If there's no line give it a shot otherwise don't waste your time in a line go to any of the other great places in North Beach.
author: Linda C.

description: This is my favorite breakfast place in all of the Bay Area. It's not just the food - but also the atmosphere and neighborhood that make this place unforgettable.  If you've haven't tried it - I'd say go on the first chance you get.
author: Mark M.

description:
I was walking through North Beach with an out of town guest on a weekday and then thought Mama's! I may be able to finally try it without standing in the crazy line that always deters me on the weekend. Well we turn the corner and there it was again. A long line on a Tuesday! The sun was shining and we weren't in a rush so we braved the line. Once inside the decor made me happy. It's so cute and cheerful. Standing at the couter made me so hungry because you watch the food being prepared and everything looks so bright and fresh. We got the vegetarian benedict, monte cristo and a coffee cake type pastry. I didn't love the benedict because the hollandaise was a little too tangy and spicy, but the monte cristo...WOW! I didn't want it to ever end! Each bite was heavenly! I'm in love!
I'll definitely be back to see Mama because there's so much more to try and there's definitely more monte cristos in my future!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: The food here is absolutely incredible.  It is crowded, and their is a long line- but that's a price I am more than willing to pay.  I give them extra points for having a server who is always able to guess my order.  If you want an excellent meal in a place without pretention I would suggest you patronize this place.
author: Celeste F.

description: I had breakfast @ Mama's for the first time.  I am a native and wanted to try this breakfast spot.  It's nice and has charm. Although, everything in the glass casing looked beautiful, the pastry square we had was stale.  My sister wanted to order a BLT @ 11:30 am and was told by the very dry cashier that it wasn't available, while all the ingredients were openly displayed.  She could have at least offered us the time they were going to start serving it or an alternative, instead of a flat out "no!"  I hope she doesn't treat the tourists that way, after waiting in line.  The breakfast was good, but not spectacular.  Although - Thank you to the waiter, he was very nice. Try the breakfast at the Cliff House, if you are in town.
author: ChaCha C.

description:
Thinking that we'd beat the brunch rush we got to Mama's around 1pm on Saturday. There were about 20 people in line huddled under the awnings in the rain and cold.  Luckily we could oogle at the food inside and occasionally smell the yumminess inside when the door opened and closed.
After 45 mins of waiting outside we were let into the warmth to wait in the line inside. By this time we were starving and decided to be pigs and order 4 dishes for the 3 of us.
The cashier woman was a serious ding to this place. She was completely grumpy, didn't make eye contact, and made our long wait almost intolerable cuz it took twice as long to place our order since she wasn't paying attention to us and instead concentrating at how miserable she was.
On the flip side our table server was very nice and funny. We entirely enjoyed our omelettes and my eggs florentine along with our shared cinnamon and chocolate french toast.  Sinfully sweet and delicious.
Their hollandaise was citrusy and yummy without the too heavy feeling that some have. Their homefries were just average.  I wish I could have tried thier blueberry coffeecake but that would've have totally been too piggy.  Their bacon was fantastic!
Great brunch, cozy setting, horrible cashier, and wait was borderline not worth it since on several occasions, tables were open and people were not getting processed fast enough through the ordering line to maximize the turnover.  
Dang I was hungry so every second counted!
author: Kelly G.

description: If you can stave off the hunger for the hour plus that you'll have to wait on a Sunday, the food is reward enough!  Grab a cup of coffee and wear some comfy shoes while you stand in line and imagine the yummy breakfast that you will eventually get to enjoy!  I had a simple breakfast of eggs (which were cooked perfectly) and toast but I also sampled the crab omelet and phenomenal cranberry bread that others had at my table.  Food is fresh and served quickly (once you're in) and the wait staff couldn't have been friendlier or more attentive.  Tasty jam provided at the tables too.
author: Karen L.

description: I was in San Francisco for only 3 days late last month and I saw the line out the front. I had to give it a  try and the wait was definitely worth it.
author: Roland I.

description: Awe. Some. BREAKFAST! Delicious Eggs Florentine and French Toast sampler, and incredible homemade jam. Everyone that works there is accommodating, efficient and attentive. They don't ignore the fact that it is indeed a tight space and that the wait is lengthy. They truly make you feel like a guest not just another customer.
author: carolyn r.

description: it's good food, but curly's on powell between union and green is better, has more items on the meny, is cheaper and there's never a line. I am constantly amazed at the people who stand in line, even in bad weather, to eat eggs, pancakes, french toast and such. nothing could justify that to me, especially when there is a place just as good nearby without the hassle. curly's is where the locals go.
author: john m.

description: yum. delicious french toast sampler. must go back for more monte cristo!
author: caramel c.

description: after reading many wonderful reviews of mama's on yelp, my boyfriend took me here for breakfast on my birthday and we loved it!  well worth the long wait.
author: Greta H.

description: how do i love thee, mama's?  let me count the ways!  seriously, folks, if you can drag your butt out of bed by 7:30 on a saturday morning and get in line by 7:45, you're golden.  you can avoid the ridiculous lines, get in on the first wave at the 8:00 opening, and be reveling in their crab benedict or fluffy pancakes by 8:15.  the food is the thing.  it's fresh and lovely and you can see the quality as you wait at the counter for service.  the shrimp and crab sparkle with freshness, the breads are beautiful, and the housemade coffee cakes are insane!  but the service is what brings us back time and again.  my fiance and i both lived in the hood for a couple years.  we had probably been there twice when the head guy started greeting us and making small talk, asking after our families.   they refill the coffee early and often, and my fiance has been offered his in a to-go cup as we're preparing to walk out.  we've since left the neighborhood, but despite a long absence, our greeting on a recent visit was as warm and familiar as ever.  now that's what i'm talking about!
author: nicole l.

description: i used to live a few blocks from here and i didn't eat here until the last day i lived in san francsico. i never wanted to wait in the line, but i finally dd it and the breakfast was so good! we had eggs benedict + the hollendaise sauce was awesome. we split pancakes (the best i've ever had!) and i had an omelette which was really good too. ingredients were really fresh. next time im in SF i shall definitely come back!
author: angie c.

description: Many a times on the weekend days while walking by Mama's, I have had the terrible craving for their famous French toast and trust me it is not a sin to feel that way even after seeing that huge line cause you have tasted the forbidden toast!  I have been here over the weekends waiting in  line  to get that spot for my friends who conveniently showed up after church or laundry only to find a table and give me a "Thank you". Do I feel used  being out there for an hour on my tired legs to get the table? No, after I get my breakfast I forget all about  it... For locals, go there on a weekday except monday. Yes, I have had that disappointment of finding them closed on a monday. Brunch is at its best and when you have that heavenly French toast, it is unparallel, no word in my vocabulary can match the quality of the French toast. Only minus, besides the long wait, is tables are really too close, so you might not feel very confortable, but trust me no one is listening to you perhaps not even your friends... they all are busy enjoying  brunch. It is one of those places where the tourists and locals converge in their "to-do-list"!
author: Kingshuk g.

description: Holy Overrated Batman!  Seriously, I'd always heard that this place was the best breakfast in town, but everytime I managed to get to the area, it was soooo overcrowded that I bailed on it.  Then I moved a block away and walk by it 5 times a day.  So my girlfriend and I waited for the line to die down one day and went.  First off, we only waited in the inside line and it still took over 30 minutes to sit.  Come on, that's completely ridiculous.  Second of all, BLAND!!!  Ok, I'm exagerating slightly, but really, the food was just good, not great, not excellent.  For a place that regularly boasts what must be a 2-3 hour wait, I expected the food to blow my hair back.  I love breakfast and try to get to new places whenever I can.  It was also a bit on the pricey side for breakfast.  I was excited to be 1 block from this place and now I wouldn't set foot in there even if they didn't have a 2 hour line.  Skip this place and head to Ella's or Kate's Kitchen.  If you're really curious, than go during the week when the line is either short or nill.  It might be worth it then.
author: Your E.

description: This place was crazy good!  My wife, some friends and I went on a Sunday morning.  The whole reason we went was because we read about it on Yelp.  We noticed that they had a ton of reviews and they were highly rated.  This place did not disappoint.  Granted we had to wait for about an hour but it was worth it.  The wait wasn't bad because the area is quite charming.  Watching little old ladies doing Thai Chi and the Macarena in the park across the way was priceless.  Plus, we managed to catch some great weather.  The place itself is small (main reason for the wait) but super friendly and inviting.  When you first walk in you're introduced to the kitchen and you place your order right there.  It sounds bizarre but it's very cool, trust me.  It was a tough decision but I ended up ordering the Banana Nut French toast and my wife had the special...Crab Eggs Benedict.  The B-nut French Toast was really good but the next time we go I'm definitely ordering the Crab Eggs Benedict.  The orange juice was fresh squeezed and soooo good!  We will definitely be back the next time we're in SF.
author: Mike V.
